name: Casa Tatis
description: A reasonably-priced hostel in the Getsemani neighborhood of Cartagena. Has private rooms with AC. Breakfast included.  No parking on-site but there are secured lots nearby.

name: Hotel San Roque
description: The kitchen is very small, but the rooms have AC, are relatively cheap and breakfast is included. They will cut you a deal if you stay three or more nights. Wifi, Cold showers, walking distance to old town, nice owners, a/c. We paid 171.000 for 2 Nights. No parking on-site but there are secured lots nearby.

name: Camping Castillete
description: A (usually) quiet place to camp on the beach in Tayrona. Water is not drinkable, but the restaurant sells simple meals and drinks. Friendly owners. Not safe to swim on the beach most times of the year. Trails to the more popular swimming and snorkeling beaches start nearby, or they can be reached by car in several minutes. A bit pricey considering the park fees on top of the cost to camp. If you are sleeping in your car, note that you cannot drive to the palapa beach area, you'll have to park in the back near the restaurant.  General parking available away from beach area

name: Hotel Villa Esther
description: A nice, quiet place to stay in Taganga. Great kitchen and friendly owner. Rooms with AC available. Nice open courtyard with tables, chairs and fans.

name: La Hosteria Del Viajero
description: A good midway stop between the north coast and central highlands. Restaurant next door serves a decent and cheap breakfast. Rooms with AC available.  Parking available at the car wash next door.  Also a restaurant right next door.

name: Hotel Posada Campestre
description: Looks great on paper - pool with swim up bar, camping next to a river, free coffee, small kitchen, but it's a horrible place to camp, especially on the weekend. Incredibly noisy at night, unresponsive staff and a long uphill walk from the camping area to the parking lot. A terrible place to put tent.

name: No Name Cabanas
description: We moved to these cabins shortly after a sleepless night Hotel Posada Campestre. Nestled between two large river-front hotels, it was a good place to catch up on sleep. The very friendly owner brought us coffee every morning.

name: Renacer Hostel Colombian Highlands
description: This is a fantastic place to stay. Plenty to do, lots of space, great facilities and a quiet camping area. Nice hot and clean showers.  There are several nice grassy areas where you can park if you sleep in your car. Good internet. Free coffee. $18k per person.

name: Finca Monticello
description: A quaint place in a quaint town. As usually, very friendly owner who made us feel right at home. Quiet campgrounds in front or behind the property. Areas for grilling and campfires.

name: La Hacienda Venecia
description:
A very relaxing guesthouse with great camping spots along a river running through a coffee farm. Very helpful management. A great pool with hammock-lined patio for chilling. Restaurant serves set meals for a small fee and coffee, rum and beers are for sale. Espresso machine, coffee roaster and a fresh supply of beans grown on-site are free to guests. Grill available for use outside. The road in can be a bit bumpy, 4x4 required if you come from the south as the road is washed out into the river.  Wifi was ghetto.

UPDATE: The Hacienda now has two places to stay -  the main Casa at 350k COP a night an a Hostal that has been open about a year. There is a third place that was the original coordinates that is being redeveloped. The place to stay in a van is the Hostal (5.037147, - 75.565742). They do a decent lunch there if you want (15k COP).  It is not possible to have lunch at the main Casa and Hostal guests cannot use the pool there either. The Hostal does have a kitchen.

name: La Casa Cafe
description: A simple and cheap hostel to stay at in Cali. Kitchen isn't the best, but the restaurant is decent. Beds are harder than your average patch of dirt and grass. Dorms and private rooms available but no AC.  No parking on-site; street parking is not  recommend.

name: Reserva Ambiental La Castellana
description:
Another top pick on our trip. Friendliest owners on the planet. On the road to Pance there are dozens of places to camp, but you should hold out until the end of the road for this gem. All the facilities including internet. Beautiful property, tons of space to spread out. Areas to grill, watch TV, hang out, go for a swim and fish.  Said to be internet as of August 2015

NOT bigrig friendly. Progressively worse road as you come towards the end.

name: HostelTrail.com
description: A decent hostel, part of a larger network of hostels, in Popayan. All of the facilities you would expect from a downtown hostel in a central location. TV room, good kitchen and a couple common areas for hanging out. Rooms on the street are very noisy.  Two secured parking lots are within blocks.

name: Hotel Kuelap
description: A very simple place at the end of the main parking where the trails lead down to the church, next to the internet cafe. We ended up here because it was cheaper than camping. There are a few other hotels in the area that were cheaper than what we found in Ipiales. A good place to stay before crossing the border as it's only a 15 minute drive to Ecuador.  Parking lot in front is guarded at night.

name: Navy Museum Parking lot
description: Large car park where we parked for a night. Cost: Col 23k. From approx 8pm until 1pm next day. The spaces in the car park itself are quite short but there is room for bigger vehicles by the entrance. 24hr Security. .

name: Regional Park El Vinculo
description:
Hosts Jorge and d.aughter Marianna will make you feel at home.  15.000COP per night for RV as at Sept 2016. Camping is at the Mirador on top of the hill with views across the  sugar-cane fields in the valley to the mountains in the west.  Toilets with cold showers, a kitchen with power and a sink if you ask Jorge to unlock it, 110V power, water and a large bamboo shelter with polished concrete floor, tables and bench seats.
Track up is fairly narrow and there is one sharp bend that may require two goes at it but our rig is 3400mm high and 2400mm wide and provided you watch for any low branches, was no trouble.

Highway traffic is noisy during the day but OK at night.

Intrance to park is just north of the position shown on the map which is the position of the mirador

name: Balneario Pilcuan Viejo
description:
Overnight stay in a wasted balneario close to El Pedregal. Stay there only if no other possibility.

Price:12000 Colombia Peso

name: Club Campestre Miravalle
description:
No longer accepting overlanders (as at September 2023). You can only stay in the rooms/cabins. 

Nice grassy stayground, you can use the hotel's swimming pool included in the price. Cold showers only. Watch for mosquitos. Restaurant offers good food. 

Price:30000 Colombia Peso

name: Hostel We can't remember the name
description:
Nice hostel with no name in the beautiful valley of Rio Pance. We really enjoyed our stay there. The hostel offers hostel-owned walking tracks. 

Price:20000 Colombia Peso

name: Camping at the entrance to Reserva Natural Rio Claro
description:
Parking lot at the entrance of the Reserva Natural. Price for camping includes entrance fee. Facilities are a little bit in a distance. Hot temperatures.
Just naughty and rip off! We arrived at the afternoon and asked if we can stay overnight behind the gate. A badly humored lady said no. No camping from 06 December till 31. March possible. After we show her that a lot of overlanders stood there, she discussed with two other ladies. Than we got the allowance to stay at the eco hotel one km inside the park for 50.000 cop. Because our motorhome has 7 meters we diside to walk the small path to see if it is possible. It was and we disided to stay overnight. As we returned the price was 50.000 PER PERSON. Dirty trick!!!

name: Hotel El Bosque
description:
From San Gil to P.N. Tayrona you may stay one night in Aguachica. We found this hotel by the help of a local hotel broker. Nice hotel with AC rooms and swimming pool.

Price:60000 Colombia Peso

name: Camping Los Angeles
description:
One of the most beautiful places we have ever been! You can stay right in front of the beach under coconut palms. Really romantic place to stay. Watch for mosquitos. The companies offering the Ciudad Perdida trek will pick you up at the hostel.

Price: 40,000 Colombia Peso per Person

name: Hotel Bellavista + Camping
description:
Famous stay for overlanders while waiting or shipping the car to/from Colombia. The hotel is basic but offers all services needed.

 Ugly parking for the night with water, electricity, shower and toilet (dirty). WiFi. On the night traffic noise from the street. U $ 20./Night including electricity. On the promenade in Cartagena

Price:50k Colombia Peso (Camping, toilet dirty not many facilities). 100k Room with Fan. 110k with AC

name: Hotel Chambu
description: Great place to stay before crossing into Ecuador. Price has gone up to 80k/night but the showers were super hot and the beds were comfortable and clean. Fast wifi. Secure parking available under the hotel but anything over 2.6m won't fit.

name: Near Terpel station
description: A Terpel station with some space to park for the night. Chosen because we are on grass instead of concrete like others. Tienda, pumps and bathroom open all night.

name: Rear of Primax Gas Station
description: It's now an Primax gas station. I had to fill up the tank. Noisy.

name: Esso/Mobil oil pit
description: Save for the super-friendly and helpful guy who welcomed us here and made us coffee, there is little good to say about this place. It's in a very dodgy part of town with many shady characters and hookers hanging around. Very noisy with trucks all night. We arrived late and we were tired after a long day so we stayed and felt safe with the guards, but it was the worst night's sleep we've had in a long time. Only come here if you are desperate and self-contained.

name: Hotel Puerta del Oeste (Rm 102 then 204)
description:
Hotel con aparcamiento en la puerta y aire acondicionado, 75.000 p la habitación doble.

Parking available, Wifi, aircon and laundry service (we found it expensive so used the laundry service around the corner)

name: Puerto Velero
description: Long sand Beach. Parking on beach in front of row of Palapas. Absolutely deserted during the week. There are restaurants which I assume are open at the weekend but were closed. Free. Porta-toilets are available.

name: Casa Grande
description:
Beautiful and relaxed beach camping with power, flush toilets, cold showers and big sinks for dishes. Wifi now available (pw: [Password removed by Moderator.]). Palapas, picnic tables and hammocks. Large area available for camping – however sand gets deep towards front. This is right next to Tayrona NP but not in Park. Small restaurant and bar on site. Empty during week and slightly busier at weekends but not too bad. 20,000pp - seems to be a better deal than others along this stretch of sand. 

NOTE: NOV 2022 is now 35k pp!said its been 5 years same price??

name: Terpel Petrol Station, Pelaya
description: Petrol stations just outside a small town. Quiet over night. No Facilities. Free.

name: Hotel Casa Grande
description: C40000 per person per night camping. Water, power (from socket by gate), showers (cold) and nice toilets. Big swimming pool – cool but very refreshing. Owner is father of owner of Casa Grande on coast – very welcoming. Turn from road is not that obvious but is opposite petrol station about 5km South of town – up the hill. Pass over narrow bridge, through mock castle gateway (high clearance – we made it underneath with an inch or two to spare) and down dirt track to Candado. The left turn between the gateway and the bridge on the way out is tight, may not be possible for vehicles much longer than us (25 feet).

name: Camping San Jorge, Villa de Leyva
description:
Beautiful camping with European standards. Very clean bathroom with hot shower. Pet friendly.

En el Camping San Jorge somos PETFRIENDLY y te brindamos una amplia zona para acampar, zona de fogata y bbq, baños con sanitario, lavamanos, ducha con agua caliente, lavadero y lavaplatos, restaurante para desayuno tipo americano y adicionalmente la zona de parqueo esta incluida en la tarifa Vendemos leña para fogata y alquilamos colchonetas, cobijas, almohadas, toallas y juegos Estamos ubicados a 2,2 km de la plaza central de Villa de Leyva, son 7 minutos en carro, 6 minutos en moto o 25 minutos caminando una ubicación perfecta para descansar, conectarse con la naturaleza sin alejase demasiado de la ciudad y poder ver las constelaciones Te ofrecemos un servicio con 25 años de experiencia en el sector siendo el camping más antiguo de Villa Ven y visítanos con tus amigos, pareja, familia o tus mascotas!

name: Terpel Station, Outside Tunja
description: Terpel Station. Free. Good clean toilets in small shop. Free.

name: Secure Parking, Portal 80 Mall
description: Secure Parking next to Portal 80 Mall (excellent mall with on/off free wifi). COP 34k per 24 hours. Transmilenio end of line is just next to mall – can take bus from here straight to Av. Jimenez for La Candelaria region. Bus J24 to town and D70 back from Universidades.

name: Terpel Petrol Station, Fresno
description: Overnight stop. It was late and we didn’t have much choice. Attendant asked for COP 10k for night. Quiet overnight. Very small area and we just managed to squeeze in at back.

name: Bus Parking. Termales de Santa Rosa
description:
Moderator Note: Overnight parking may not be permitted on the weekend.
.....
We were allowed to stay at the bus parking lot. It was during the week and not many people were there. We did the excursion with a nice guide and enjoyed it a lot! Also the thermal pools are nice because the water has a great temperature and the view is amazing.

name: Hebron Restaurant/Hotel, Valle de Cocora
description: COP 12,000 per night. Access to shower and toilet. No Hot water. There is a level area outside the main building to park on. They only let us stay one night as they were hosting a cycling event the next day but said usually it wouldn’t have been a problem for us to stay longer. We moved across the road.

name: Los Palmas Restaurant and Eco-Hotel, Valle de Cocora
description: Cold Shower, toilets (good ones in restaurant and less good ones in camping area) bar and restaurant. Power is available from outside sockets by coffee shop. 25000 COP per person per night (July 2023). The restaurant is really good, they serve some fantastic trout and the owner is very friendly. Parking is in the large parking lot of the camping area. Very quiet overnight.

name: Petromil, El Hogar
description: Petrol station with big area for parking. Showers and toilets. Small garage, restaurant and convenience store. Free.

name: Hostal Hacienda Anacoana
description: Parking on driveway of beautiful hotel in lovely grounds. Toilets. Power with long lead from outside rooms. Water from laundry room – we didn’t fill because it had funny colour. Restaurant for nice meals. Hot shower available on request. Cost: 15,000 COP per night. Hotel can also arrange horse riding in surrounding area.

name: Tayrona Dive Center
description:
*see update on last post*

Finding a place for three vehicles to camp in Taganga was hard, but we camped at the Taganga Dive Shop which had a very friendly owner. A room was opened up so we had toilet and hot shower. They also have rooms. Nice and quiet overnight.  Price: 10

name: Balneario Camp
description: Camped on gravel/grass next to a building so we had shelter when it rained. Power, toilet and cold shower. They had a restaurant we did not use except for coffee.  Price: 10.000 pesos. Big rig friendly. Gps position is correct, there  is a place to park the car on the left when arriving. We ask the people who live in the house, they open the door on the left for us. Quite easy, seems the stuff leave at 7;30pm.

name: Balneario Camp San Gil
description: Camped on a gravel parking lot. Toilet was open all night. People was swimming in the river, did not look to tempting for us and we do not know about showers. No other facilities. There was a few buildings and cafes around and when we arrived there was only on that was open. We paid there, but do not know if that was right according to where we parked.  Price: 6500 pesos (but we are not sure if we paid the right person)

name: El Ganadero Rest Camp
description: Camped in a gravel parking lot a bit away from the road. A room was opened for us so we could use the toilet and hot shower. Quiet overnight.  Price: 3000 pesos to the night guard and we had dinner in the restaurant

name: Cranky Croc Hostal
description:
Good bunk beds with big lockers under the bed with power outlets. The hostel had a kitchen where you could cook your own food and free coffee all day. Big TV for watching movies, WIFI, laundry and hot showers. 

Pricing was on check out different then communicated on check-in. So... make sure you know the price in advanced!

name: Camp Tatacoa Observatory
description: Camped on the gravel parking lot next to the observatory. Toilet was open all night and there were some outdoor showers we did not try. Really quiet at night.  Price: 7500 pesos

name: Camp Villa Claudia
description: Camped on the gravel parking lot of this hotel and balenario, it was on Highway 45. Nice location. The clean toilets (with toilet seats and paper) were open overnight and they had showers, but we did not try them. Huge and good dinner portions that we paid 32.500 pesos for including some beers.  Price: 10.000 pesos

name: Camp Chalet Guamuez
description:
Nice location. 

LOTS OF SPACE for motorhomes.

GREAT GARDEN !!

name: Parking by Volcan Totumo
description: Good overnight place. Otherwise no toilet available infrastructure. Quiet. Free. Mud COP 5,000 (now 10k) per person. -  AParking lotrox. 1 hour north of Cartagena

name: El Rancho Trukerstop
description: Emergency room (street strike). Very loud, lots of lorries all night. No infrastructure.     Free  Carretera 45 near Santa Rosa de Lima

name: NP Los Estoraques
description:
Magnificent place for the night. Toilets and potable water available. Very quiet. 20k pesos per car for the night and 10k p.p. for the hike. The rangers are super friendly and also run a little shop on the site for drinks and snacks.

Drive through the village "Playa de Belen". The town itself is a hidden gem! Super friendly and are very interested in foreign tourists as they hardly visit.

name: Meadow at a tienda
description: Good overnight place with no infrastructure to some extent, quiet, a little music.     Free  about 5 km before Barichara

name: Laberinto El Cusco
description: Great place overlooking the barren desert landscape. Toilets and showers available, otherwise no infrastructure. Price around 8.000 per person (two persons plus RV makes 25000 per night in total).

name: Thermal Aguatibia
description:
Good overnight place as soon as all Colombians go home it is really quiet. Toilets and open showers are available.
35k / p for the day and 70k / night / vehicule or tent. The 70k for the night does not! include pools access for the day after.
About 5 km before the village Coconuco, about 28 km from Popayan

name: Gamcelat
description: Good overnight place, toilets and showers available. Quiet at night. WiFi

name: Hotel El Pedregal Cartagena
description: Nice little hotel in the Getsemani neighborhood. Secure and open space parking lots nearby. Double room costs approx USD 50.--. Very welcoming and helpful owner.

name: DIAN Office Cartagena Vehicle Import
description:
This is the place where you have to do a bunch of customs work to import your vehicle. 

We had to enter the gate on the SW side.  The building you need is in the back....walk under the front building.  At the desk, explain why you are there and they will get the pero for you.

name: Global Shipping Agency
description: If you ship Evergreen, this is the location for the office. This is the first step tiger your vehicle.

name: Sociedad Portuaria (SPRC) (pay container fees)
description: After you meet your agent, come here to pay the fees on your shipping container. Look for the sings for Servicio al Clientes and the sign Atencion al Cliente. You will need a security badge to get into this area. When inside, they speak English and have great info on the import process

name: Contecar Port - vehicle collection
description: This is where we unloaded, inspected and eventually picked up our vehicle. Until it time to pick up, look for the Acceso de Control office. When you are going to pick up the vehicle, head to the main gates (look for signs that say Bascula where all the huge trucks enter and exit the port).

name: Hospedaje El Mirador Minca
description:
Hospedaje above Minca with spectacular views down to Santa Marta, a wonderful garden and a small campground. Much cooler than Santa Marta, often a good breeze. 
Space for 1-2 cars and some more tents. Walking distance to village. 20'000 Pesos n/P.  Friendly owner.

name: Crepes & Waffles
description: Escape the heat here with some cool AC and ice cream!  We got waffles with fruit and two scoops of ice cream (cost was $4).

name: Pizzas Trinidad
description: This is a sidewalk pizza place right near Trinidad plaza that has amazing thin crust pizza. Highly recommend.

name: Hotel Bariloche
description: Nice small hotel with safe parking lot, entrance gate limited to about 3 meters. Very clean.

name: Iguana 4x4
description:
Mechanic shop specialized in 4wd
website: www.iguana4x4.com

name: Finca Barlouento
description: The road up here was pretty insane, but about 20 minutes after we arrived a big 4 wheel drive bus showed up, so apparently it wasn't as rough as I thought. Anyhow, the road up here was pretty messy. Lots of mud and switch backs. Took us about 3 hours to drive from Minca. The finca we stayed at had rooms for rent and a spot for one truck to park. Area around here is beautiful and there are great views to be had.  We learned about this place from Carlos at Iguana 4x4 in Barranquilla. He called ahead to get us permission to stay here. You may want to check with him before making the drive: cmserrano@iguana4x4.com

name: Hostal Palo Alto
description: A nice little place to stay or camp on the road to San Lorenzo. Beautiful views of the surrounding area when it isn't cloudy. Cost was $2 per person per day.

name: Hostal Tinto
description: Very nice Hostal in town, with a great patio, swimming pool. Space to park motorbikes and smaller cars (gate clearance about 2.25). Helpful & very friendly staff. Private room for 2 persons: 70000 COP.

name: Finca Escondia
description: 30,000 per person to park/ camp in back. Tent camping near beach 20,000 per person. Nice place to hang out on beach, bar and restaurant . Clean kept up bathrooms.  You must pay for internet here, 10,000 for all day use.

name: Camp Ramada
description: We bumped into this place while looking for the flamingos at Musichi. Not a bad spot for the night. Quiet and nice breezes. No amenities.

name: Pilon Azucar Beach
description: Free camping with amazing views. Very strong wind! For tent campers the ground is full of lava rocks, might need to move closer to dunes.

name: Bahia Honda Windy Point
description: Beautiful camp site up on the cliffs overlooking Honda bay. Very windy.

name: Pink Dunes Pirate Camp
description: Windy but there are some shrubs you can tuck in behind here. Beautiful pink sand beaches. Enough dry wood for a fire.

name: Punta Gallinas
description:
Northern most point of South America 
very windy and many road blocks to get here, but a small bag of water will get you through most. we bought bags of water for a couple dollars in the last city

name: Shell Graveyard Camp
description: Wild camp on the lakebed tucked into a little nook that stops much of the wind

name: Miguel's Place
description: Beautiful spot on the beach with a ton of seashells. Windy during the day but calmed down at night. Miguel lives in a house nearby. Very friendly guy.

name: Camp Lost Zapatosa
description: Tried to make it to the lake but got lost. Ended up boon docking on the side of the road by a cattle ranch. Spectacular sunset!

name: River Mouth Beach
description:
Drive until the End of the Road and then take a left. you will find a grassy spot under palm trees to park and camp.
Just past the fishing camp is the mouth of the river. The river runs parallel to the ocean separated by a large sand bar for about a 1/4 mile. Warm sweet water on one side and cold ocean on the other. Note trees may restrict vehicle height to about 3 metres.
Price is between 8k and 10k per night

name: Lavanderia
description:
Laundry Service 
Prices: 40,000 pesos for 15 kilos or 4,000 pesos for 1 kilo

name: Hotel Poblado Alejandria
description: Very nice 4 Star hotel in El Poblado. With secure parking, rooftop jaccuzzi, gym etc. We paid USD 81 per night incl breakfast.

name: Juan Curi Parque Ecologico
description:
Very nice place to stay at the entrance of the parque ecologico.
Muddy in rainy season but could park close to the restaurant. Paid 40000 Cop for a rig 2 people including the entrance to the waterfalls.
Very nice  and helpfull people. Could plug electricity. 
Were were on our own during he night, just with the guard.
Of course, very quiet...

name: Restaurant El Tambo
description: Just off Highway 45 (100m). A good place to spend the night driving south. They let you stay next to a guesthouse not visible from the highway. Not very quiet at night (animals and traffic) and on Sunday afternoons. Very friendly owner and staff. Camping was free but we spent money at the bar. and also they hace a swimingpool to cool down and relax

name: Overnight parking Barichara
description: After talked to the Tourism Police at the main Plaza he said we could camp wherever we wanted to, but he recommended us this amazing spot. No amenities but the view is great! Very windy on the evening and some kids came to drink at night (it was weekend) but not too bad... Free.

name: Brio Gas Station - Parking lot
description: Big parking lot between the Brio gas station and the nearby hotel. Toilet available. Not too noisy for a spot next to a highway.

name: Donde JuanB Restaurante. Bosque De Cocora
description: Parking on grass behind the restaurant. Very friendly staff and only a few steps from the start of a great hike to the wax palms. Very cold showers and toilets are ok. Wifi at the restaurant. COP30000 per person per night. Quiet at night and great view. Lots of space for tents.

name: Hotel Y Balneario El Ranchon
description: Good place to spend the night. Quiet during weekdays. No restaurant, but cold drinks can be bought. COP10000 for 2 people without use of the swimming pool.

name: Henry Car
description: Big shop that seems to cover most all of the bases. Super nice owners, let us camp in the shop, offered us a room, shower, bathroom, have a little cafe were they gave us free drinks. All in all the perfect example of Colombian hospitality with a lifetime of mechanical know how.

name: Parque Nacional El Cocuy Office
description: The park is opened again! You can do 3 hikes. Guide is mandatory now as it was one demand from indigenous people to strike a deal with the government to reopen it again. All 3 hikes will take 1 day to do. Highest you can hike with the guide is almost to the snow line. Snow is sacred for the indigenous and thats the reason for that. Hacienda la Esperanza has one guide who speaks English. 100-130thousand COP per day. We are 2 people so don't know what's the max person limit for that kind of price. Spanish only guide is 70-80thousand COP per day. You HAVE TO organize a guide for the hikes before they issue a permit here for the hikes. Permit is 58500 COP per person. Don't matter how long you will be spending time in the park. 1 day or 1 month. Price is still the same. Same office in El Cocuy called Hacienda la Esperanza for us and organized the guide at the site. They need to see your health insurance before they issue the permit. Bring your passport!If don't want to do the hikes then driving the circle from/to El Cocuy to/from Güican trough the park is free and no permits needed.

name: Voladero las Águilas Ruitoque
description: Large parking area next to the paragliding launch site. 20'000 per night/RV. Nice place, nice owners, bathrooms, showers, Internet and cheap paragliding... Great view over Bucaramanga.

name: Hacienda La Esperanza
description:
A traditional Colombian hacienda. The cost is 15k pesos per person per night for camping. You are right at the doorstep of El Cocuy National Park. Stunning views and great place to stay while you visit the park. Flat spot for parking 2-4 rigs with great view. 

Current Whatsapp Contact: 
Flor +57 313 4688440

name: El Cocuy Car Park
description: The altitude wasn't playing nice with Erica so we raced down to El Cocuy and frantically searched for a place to spend the night before the sun set. Good news is that this place feels pretty secure. Bad news is that it isn't level and has no amenities. Still, if you are desperate, it will do. Just knock on the doors down the street from the entrance to the lot. Someone will eventually answer and point you in the right direction. 5k pesos per night.

name: Parque Nacional El Cocuy Office
description: This is the office for El Cocuy park hiking permits

name: La Choza Cascadas Juan Curi - South Side
description:
Nice little family-owned hostal/campground. close to a river. this flat spot has great amenities (toilet, showers, wifi....) and a small tienda/restaurant. 
prices still:
10.000 $/pers/night for camping  
10.000 $/pers/ entrance to the trail (gorgeous falls).

 
contacts WhatsApp
Ramon:   +57 313 8553585
Efigenia: +57 3112687193

name: Large Flat Gravel Lot behind Capilla Santa Barbara
description: At the top of the hill behind the little chapel (take the road on the left hand side and follow it to the right) is a large gravel parking lot. Secluded and quite, will likely give more wind protection than the cliff top option. It is right next to a pool facility that was closed during our stay.

name: Police Station La Pintada
description: Very noisy because it's right next to the street, but it's for free. They offered us to use the toilets and shower, didn't use the 2nd one. Restaurants & shop just opposite the street.There are at least 2 official campgrounds in town, both have a Balneario & other services.

name: Back Country Road Near Guatuavita
description: All the established campgrounds were closed so we drove up so dirt roads and found a mellow place to park with a pretty country view.  A little uneven and muddy so not good for tent campers.

name: Mountain Stream (junction 64 & 55)
description: We took the 64 from San Gil on the way to El Cocuy, beautiful drive. We didn't want to push ourselves so decided to stay half way and found this little spot near a stream in the mountain flats at the top of route 64. There are some houses in sight but in the distance and everybody seems super welcoming up here.

name: FresKpi Ops! Agua Purificada
description: Water purification business located near the town cemetery. Super friendly owner, Luis Arturo Rico! Open everyday 7am - 6pm (closed for lunch)

name: Hotel La Plazuela Popayan
description: Very nice hotel in the centre. Rooms are around two patios. Downstairs rooms are a bit dark. Secure parking is included and just around the corner. Good wifi. We paid USD 60 per night incl breakfast.

name: Cliff Top Quarry
description: The name pretty much sums it up. A quarry off of route 55 with several good sites to choose from. Wanting more distance from the main road we took the lowest track to the furthest site, quite and peaceful. We ran across a few workers and they said we were welcome to camp, "claro". The GPS is for the entrance, there is a large space there but the more secluded ones are down the track to the right once you enter.

name: Termales Del Ruiz
description:
Update 19.8.17. Camping not allowed
They let us park overnight for free with entrance to thermal pools which is 30,000 a person. Hot pools and nice area to relax

name: PNN Los Nevados
description:
This is the visitor center for the park. 
You are just allowed to drive in 5 km with a guide for 2 hours and 38 000 pp. 
Price for foreigners 65000 cop per person composed by entrance, guide and insurance. All obligatory.

name: Hostel Yambolombia
description: Little Hostel with private rooms, dorms & campsites. Peaceful & quiet, about 30 walking minutes out of Salento in a beautiful setting. No access to the property for cars/campervans. Campsite only for tents, no parking lots. Motorbikes/bicycles have access. There is a small "tienda" where they sell on site grown veggies & fruits, and a few other things (e.g. pasta, beer, ...), and they serve homemade pizzas for a reasonable price. Possibility for volunteering in the hostel.

name: Finca Bellavista
description: Nice Finca with private rooms and lots of space to camp in a really nice and quiet location with good vista. There is a beautiful swimming pool with water from a nearby source and they serve really inexpensive meals in a restaurant/bar. Very nice owner and staff. We paid COP 7000,-/pP to camp here.

name: Brunch
description:
A restaurant with lots if international food. Dying for a great burger?  Head over here. 

The best international breakfast varierty, delicious food, average price, fresh everything, staff friendly. Write on the wall and find me!

name: Zona de Camping Laureles
description: Beautiful lake with open grass fields to camp on surrounded by woodlands. Two entries: free, involves a muddy (in dry season) narrow 4x4 track suitable only for smaller high clearance 4x4 vehicles (we did it but were too big) accessed via a good dirt road from Tausa to the north, the other is through the park entrance, ?CP, the road in is about 11 miles south of Tausa on the 45A or 6 miles north of Zipaquira on the 45A.

name: Gas Zipa
description: Cost 42,000 for a 20lb bottle. Open Monday - Friday 8-5, Saturday 8-3.

name: Santafe Guaduales
description: This is a nature reserve and ecological park with rooms for rent, a swimming pool, hiking trails, waterfalls, a kitchen, restaurant, camping area and sauna. Randomly found this place after getting stuck in traffic for two hours. Cost for camping was $20k per person. They provided towels and soap for the sauna and showers. A great spot that is off the highway that's quiet to break up the drive between Bogota and the coffee zone.

name: Calima Kite School
description: There is nice free camping up the road (6k north, public access to the lake), but durin our stay there was a big festival and were told it was too dangerous. The kite surfing school has a big open grass lot, 20k.

name: Casa Blanca Hostel
description: Parked/Camped in their street side parking. Great neighborhood with salsa bars, cheap eats, great huge olympica super market all with in a few blocks, and not too far from down town. Owner a Danish moto overlander, very overland friendly, power, water.. 30k a night.

name: Salto Del Bordones
description:
Second highest waterfall in South America*
Viewpoint and trail at this location. Hotel right here as well. 

*not true, but still very tall!

name: Santuario Las Lajas Parquedero
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: WARNING! Thefts and vandalism reported in this location. Please use caution. 

Parking lot for Santuario. Lots of space and good views, there's now a toilet there.

name: Costeño Beach Surf Camp -eco Lodge
description: Great hostel near to Tayrona National Park. 5US$ per person per night. All the amenities... Right on the beach. Its a small eco hostel with camp site and parking. Veggy friendly. Surf lessons.

name: COMPAS - Seaboard Marine Office
description:
Step 1: Seaboard Marine office to get your paperwork to get the car out of the container. Start here if shipping with Tea or Boris/Seaboard. Small little building not well marked--easiest to ask workers nearby.
Requires passport and temp. Bill of Lading. They will give you a checklist that explains how to proceed. Forget Boris' 21 step list - it’s much easier!

name: Hotel y Balneario, Tobia
description: A good halfway point between Villa de Leyva and the Zona Cafetera on the northern highway. The little town of Tobia is only 5km from the highway and is a growing adventure tourist destination. The balneario is just across the Rio Negro and has a huge flat parking area with some grass right next to the river.

name: 61 Prado
description:
Nice guesthouse in central Medellin.  Not a regular "box" hotel, this place is exudes personality and charm.  Our van was still enroute from Colon to Cartagena, so we seized the opportunity to stay downtown without having to worry about parking for our van.  We paid $40/ night for a suite -- one king bed and two twin beds in separate rooms, plus a private bathroom.

75000 for double with shared bathroom or 90000 for two people in a 'double' with king, twin, private bathroom, and free moto parking

name: Camp Texaco
description: 24 hr Texaco gas station with a small gravel lot on one side. Open 24 hrs so its pretty secure, but also some night noise. There is a good supermarket next door with clean bathrooms. We arrived in Magangue too late to catch the ferry to Mompos, so we crashed here to get the ferry in the morning. Free.

name: Plaza de la Concepcion
description: Nice quiet plaza to boondock, but ther are lots of new lamp posts around the plaza, so a bit bright. Street is wide enough to park. Locals told us it was the safest place to park for the night. Good restaurants at the plaza. Free.

name: Cyclist Rendezvous (ESSO gas station)
description: Parking lot at an Esso gas station. They actually let us park inside one of the maintenance bays for the night for 3k COP. Has a minimart and bathrooms and restaurant across the street. we got caught driving thru Bucaramanga at night and needed a safe spot for the night. Definitely not glamorous. Some small grassy areas for the dogs.

name: Hotel Del Rio Campestre
description: Hotel,with asmall area down by the pool for probably 2 vehicles, gravel,with a bit of grass around the edges. Fairly level. Lots of traffic on the street next to it, but at night the traffic died down and it really didnt bother us much. We stayed here becuase it is walking distance into San Gil, maybe a 10 min walk. Plenty of room for the dogs to roam around. Wifi, cold showers, toilets without toilet seats (why????). 15k cop/person. If you want electricity the price goes up to 20k per person. The girl at the counter was less than friendly. Pool was nice and clean.

name: Finca Los Farallones
description: Large area with lots if good level places to park and a great view. Natural pool made from piping in river water. Long water slide. Very friendly owner with lots of dogs, which were all friendly with us and our dog. Plenty of room for big rigs, but the road into Pance and to this finca is narrow and rough in some parts. The only bad part was the really funky bathrooms. We paid $8000 COP pp/night.

name: Wild Camp South Of Socorro
description: Found this place after driving the scenic dirt road from Barichara.  Basically it is someone's driveway, but we asked permission and all was good.  Free.

name: Finca San Pedro
description:
Very nice and clean finca turned hostal on outskirts of Sogamoso. There is room for a few vehicles on a pretty level grassy area. Free coffee in the morning and kitchen facilities to use. Very clean bathrooms and suicide showers, the right one is better. It was pretty quiet and dark at night. They have 4 friendly, very curious dogs. Owner is friendly and very knowledgeable about the area. 

We just fit thru the arch entrance, we are 2.7 m high and we had a few cm to spare (Jan 2023: our 3m tall Sprinter van was fine). As of Jan 2023 it's 30k pp. May need an extension chord for electricity. Decent wifi and great Claro reception. Juan (owner) let us fill our tank with water.

name: Playa Blanca at Lago de Tota
description:
ADMIN NOTE: No overnight camping allowed, please respect the wishes of the locals. 

Nice big sandy beach with large grassy areas to camp for free. There is a one time entrance fee of 2000-6000 pesos depending on your vehicle, then you can stay here as many nights as you want for free. Restaurant and bathrooms with cold showers. Lots of friendly local dogs.

name: Puente de Boyaca Monument
description: There is a small and fairly level parking lot uphill to the left of the big Bolivar statue between Caseta Don Julio and a restaurant that was closed when we were here. We asked the Policia at the monument and he told us it would be safe to park here for the night. It is just a stones throw away from the police station. Free.

name: Los Pinos Restaurante Parking Lot
description: A nice level, gravel lot at a beautiful open-air restaurant right next to the lake. Only a few minutes drive from Guatavita pueblo. The owners are German heritage but born here in Colombia. Daisy (owner) is very very nice and let us stay in the lot for free. She left open the bathrooms for us to use all night and the large beautiful grassy picnic area is the perfect place to enjoy a hot coffee on a crisp morning! Bathrooms are 5 star! No showers. We only had desert at the restaurant, which was awesome! Very dark at night and fairly quiet except for the early rising rooster. She also offered her water for us to fill our tank, but we were already full.

name: Centro Clínico veterinario
description: Vet gave my dog a free Check-up and lots of brand pet food

name: Manned 24hr Parking Lot
description: cost is 10k per 12 hours. The only catch is that you have to return every 12 hours (or sooner) to pay and start a new bill, or they start charging by the minute after 12 hrs. We just paid at 7 am and 7 pm, so it cost 20k for 24 hrs. It has an open entrance so there is no height limitation and it is within a few blocks walking distance to most of the hostels in La Candelaria.

name: Chimayoy natural park
description: Just off the main road and a great place to stay if you don't fancy going into Pasto. Large car park for car camping and plenty of grassy areas for tent camping. We tent camped just on the right of the large white building in a small garden surrounded by bushes to keep out of he wind. Gates are locked at night and 2 security gaurds were there all night. Toilets open 24hrs. Restaurant there for snacks and drinks. Great view of the Volcano. 10,000 per person per night.

name: Chimayoy National park
description: Great place to stay just off the main road if you don't want to go into Pasto. Large car park big enough for big rigs and plenty of grassy spots for tent camping. We camped to the right of the large white building in a small garden surrounded by bushes to keep out of the wind. Great view of the Volcano. Restaurant available for snacks and drinks. Toilets 24hrs. Gates locked at night with 2 security gaurds all night. 10,000 per person per night.  S 00' 12.1 54'    W 078' 29.370'

name: Park Life
description: 44.000 col pesos privatw room for two shared bathroom very nice

name: Restaurante Mi Tierra
description: Lots of places to park. There is a minimarket and also a Terpel gas station. You can park next to the restaurant with views of the mountains. Bathroom free 24/7 and 4g signal. So beautiful!

name: Casa del Rio
description: Wifi / tv / tourist info / outside shower / paid 15.000 cop per person for a grassy patch behind the main hostel building

name: Hotel Emperador
description: A love hotel with secure, guarded and flat parking.  We rented the cheapest room for COL 30,000 ($15 USD).  Great wify, clean bathrooms. Pretty quiet at night.  Entrance directly across the street from the water tower has no overhead gate.

name: Rosas Plaza
description: Parked on the main plaza opposite the church. Police recommended this location as it is the only level spot. Quiet at night and the police patrol the area at night. Free. No facilities.

name: San Augustin. Fuel Station
description: Parked between some cars and trucks. Free. Toilets and water and cold shower.

name: Restaurante Jardin del Lago
description: We camped in their grassy parking lot which is pretty level. They have a nice dog that got along well with our 3 trouble-maker dogs. It is in a beautiful lolcation overlooking the lake and the big Swiss Chalet hotel-restaurant down the hill. There is a really nice garden in front of the restaurant where we chilled and enjoyed some beverages while the dogs did their thing. Free to camp. Menu del dia for dinner was 14k. Plenty of room in the parking lot. You can also take a boat from here to the island for the same price as in the town Canto. There is a trail that leads down the hill from the garden to the lancha area.

name: Hotel El Refugio
description: 100 meters up from museum entrance. $5000COP per person.  Gravel lot in front of hotel. Cold shower and bathrooms. And there is a pretty nice pool too. Loud party till 1 am

name: Esso Gas Station
description: They had a restaurant but was closed that day, there is also a little hotel, i payed 3000 for parking, dont know about showers or bathroom but i guess they offer it for a few more pesos.

name: Los Lagos Hotel
description: This place is listed as a campsite on PocketEarth, but the sign at the place says that it is a hotel and doesn't mention anything about camping.  We paid 30,000 Colombian pesos to camp.  We used the pool and it was nice and refreshing.   We accepted the proprietor's offer for breakfast and it was good -- 5,000 per person for soup with meat and potatoes, then a plate of eggs, bread, and an arepa, and a cup each of coffee and then hot chocolate.  The bathroom was in decent shape and we had access to a shower if we wanted it but we didn't use it.

name: Old Road Turnout Near Viaduct
description: Bush camp (free).  Ran out of daylight when we found this place.  Still get road noise but at least it is far enough from the highway that there is no danger of getting hit and it is possible to make yourself difficult to see from the road.  Probably if we had gotten here while there was still light enough to see we could've ventured even further away from the highway.

name: The Rock Shelter / Refugio La Roca
description:
Spectacular location overlooking the Chicamocha canyon. It's on the Mesa de Los Santos - on the other side of the canyon from the park. COP 20'000 pp, too expensive given that the camping area is a heavily sloped dirt patch and there's no Wifi. The camping area gets none of the views but some noise from the mining trucks.
The road dead ends at Los Santos. They are geared toward rock climbing and are right next to routes in the canyon. There is space for bad car camping and tent camping. Dorms and private rooms. Prices on their site. Restaurant in high season. Communal kitchen and beautiful, comfortable communal area.  There's even a meditation & yoga room with views of the canyon. Run by a Colombian couple, Richi and Alejandra.

name: Parque Industrial, near Colgas
description: Ask for Julio. COP 6'000 per gallon.[now 12.500 COP, December 2023] Propane. Fixed US tank filled no problem. potable water available for free!

name: Hostel Caracol
description: COP 48'000 for twin bed room. Very clean and quiet. Kitchen available. Great Wifi.y 27000 in 4 bed dorm

name: Aqua Hirviendo
description: Free. Thermal baths are 10.000 per person. Parking lot. Weekends may be not suitable as is party time. Friday night is okay.

name: Bomberos Popayan. Street Parking.
description:
Parking for big motorhome, near center town,  in front of the Bomberos. It is street parking. Kind of exposed. Lots of people traffic and some car traffic but no one bothers us.  12000 pesos 24 hours

The various check-ins for this place are a bit confusing. The marker is inside the bomberos’ area but you’re not allowed inside. After talking to some of the bomberos and they confirmed it is ok, we parked just ouside of their place on the street (as somebody else mentioned it is street parking). 

There is a public parking on the other side of the street but it’s with roofs and I’m not sure how high the roof is. Smaller vans will probably fit. I guess this is the place some users are talking about, when saying sleeping in the car is not allowed and they charge a fee. 

On the street nobody bothered us and we didn’t have to pay. The bomberos knocked at our door in the morning and offered coffee. We got our 20l canister filled with water from them as well. 

From there it is a 1 km walk to the main square.

name: Silvia Side Street
description: Parked in a side street just in town next to the school. Illuminated at night.

name: Esso / El Rancho Argentino
description: Free parked in front of Victor's restaurant next to the big Esso gas station. Just outside Popayan on the road towards Cali. We got the wifi code and he closed the restaurant but left the wifi on for us. Great guy say hi from us. Adventurous greetings, Coen.

name: Side Street Cajamarca
description: A quiet sidestreet of the busy Pan Am between Ibague and Armenia. Twisty mountain roads with little opportunity to camp. Driving in the dark with all thise lit up trucks is only nice for so long. Connected with the locals and got fresh fruit and an offer for a shower.

name: Armenia Side Street Camp
description: Just across the Parque la Vida in Armenia. Free parking in front of a condominio. Very quiet at night and during sunday we had a relaxed day. Few little popular bistros nearby with wifi.

name: Camping by restaurant (on the way to Los Estoraques)
description:
- night caught us on the way to Los Estoraques, so we camped in front of the first restaurant we found
- very nice owner, he let us use the shower (did not ask for any money, we gave him 5.000 COP)
- "parking" on a dirt lot, but we did not complain for the "price", we went straight to bed anyways

name: Balneario Bambu
description:
- ok place to break the drive between Bucaramanga and Santa Marta/Cartagena
- shower or river to bath
- VERY friendly owners invited us for breakfast (huuuge meal)

name: Hotel La Estación
description:
- 20.000 COP for the two of us (probably negotiable, but we were too tired to try)
- HOT shower
- restaurant
- rooms to rent
- spot in a dirt parking lot

name: Tatacoa
description:
- we arrived at night and parked right accross the road from the visitor center of the observatory (no services, free)
- you can arrange to use the bathroom in the visitor center for a cost
- there are many spots where you could park/wild camp here - by the mirador or further down the "desert"
- there is a restaurant in front, 100 meters with a bealtiful view.

name: Tatacoa Desert
description:
- free
- another spot in the Tatacoa
- little traffic
- restaurant with showers and pool close by

name: Somos Llantas
description: A major service center in the heart of the reputations district. Well run and trustworthy company, especially as all other options in the area are pretty seedy. They replaced our suspension and steering bushings, as well as serviced our brakes. EXCELLENT customer service. Samuel Valencia was incredibly helpful and honest, not to mention turned out to be a great friend during our week plus in the area. Not only did the work end up costing less than quoted, Sam advised us to take care of some work elsewhere, recommending specialized mechanics for jobs that would otherwise be more expensive than Somos Llantas.

name: Bomberos Pijao
description: 5000 pesos for the night and 5000 for the day at the fire brigade of Pijao.

name: Vivera Babilon, Génova
description:
It is a campground with a lot of beautiful plants and a bar by the river, not a hostal.
Call Nicolai in advance: +57 313 765 2031, he speaks spanish and franch
Some are elevated wood platforms costs 20k if with own tent. Somewhere else costs 15k if with own tent. If you don't have a tent, 30k per couple.

We stayed at Nicolai's place in Génova for free. It came recommended by a friend. He and his family have tents at a river side for rent as well as a fishing pond.

name: El Sifon
description: Free. Little flat space next to a little restaurant. Maribel runs the place. From here you could walk to the local hot springs. Amazing views of the snow capped mountains nearby if skies are clear in the morning, this is also when horses come together bringing the cows milk.

name: Hostel The Roof / Experience
description: Basic but clean hostel with dorm beds (each with curtain and private locker). ~$12/bed with simple breakfast included (from 8-9am only). There's a nice roof terrance and small kitchen upstairs. Good street food and restaurants nearby.

name: Hotel Playa Brava
description: Clean, good prices, beach front, parking for motorcycles.

name: Rancho Alegre
description: Nice family owner rooms. Good price.

name: Hostal Parque Nariño
description: Good deal, a block from the main square. Full kitchen and nice owners.

name: El Portal
description: Very nice and clean area with swimming pool, natural pools, restaurants. You can be socio for 1 day at the price of 30.000 COP/day/person. Electricity on site. Toilets all night available at restaurant and swimming pool. Wifi.

name: JJR Automotriz
description: Mechanic in northern Cali that specializes in off-road trucks but can do anything. Clean and professional shop. Plenty of space so there would be no height issues with bigger rigs. They worked on our suspension and front-wheel drive as well as a leaking rear seal. The owner is Jhon Jairo Rosero. Very nice and professional. He does not speak English. His cell number is 312 269 1371. Note there is no sign outside the shop. There is a chain link fence gate at the entrance and you will see all the trucks inside.

name: Parking Lot
description: First impression is not very appealing, but quiet during the night and a perfect spot to visit the nice little colonial town

name: Hotel Toledo
description: Good deal, nice clean rooms, very helpful staff and the owner, Toscano,  that can not do enough to make your stay enjoyable. The Hotel is only a couple of blocks away from a Supermercado and similar distance to the Main Plaza.

name: Salegua Tococo Restaurant
description: The flamingo sanctuary is accessible thru this little fishing town. Henry runs a little palapa seafood restaurant and allowed us to park and sleep in front of it for free after we had a delicious shrimp plate. You can take the small fishing sailboats for a two hour tour of the sanctuary. It cost us  $50 CP for the two of us. Don't expect much and you'll be pleasantly surprised here.

name: El Calamar
description: This is a sandy clearing next to a restaurant right on the beach. It's across the police checkpoint in the town and feels quite safe. We had a few beers and the restaurant owner didn't charge us for camping. In fact they helped us cook the lobsters we got on the beach a few miles down at the salt flats. WARNING: During or shortly after the rainy season, avoid using the salinas salt flats road to get here. Take the northern connection. It's December and we got our truck a bit dirty. Otherwise it was splendid.

name: Benjamin and Family
description:
This is a nice place to camp (it is on the way to the Kanawara Cabins)  and get to know locals. We where the first once staying there but the would be more then happy to have more travelers coming through.
They have a little farm and store you can get eggs, beer.
If you you wish they make you diner and breakfast.

name: Marqués de Puntalarga Highest vineyard in the World
description:
A great place to visit. Marco Quijano Rico is the owner of this lovely place. 
You can tast for free white/red wine. Riesling/Pinot Noir. If you buy a bottle of wine you well get also a tour of the vineyard. 

But go and have a look yourself and maybe the owner will surprise you with something. :-)

www.marquesdepuntalarga.com
marquesdepuntalarga1@yahoo.es

name: Petromil Gas Station
description: Overnight parking in the back of the gas station next to a row of trucks. Not nice and quite but free and with 24h police surveillance at least when we parked here. Restrooms, free wifi (there is a sign with the passcode at the pumps) little kiosk with cold drinks and snacks.

name: Camping Casa del Mar
description:
Nice campground directly on the beach of Tolu but a little bit expensive (in high season - January 2015)

2017 comment  -- Not every place that has a shower & a place to park your vehicle is allowed to be called "camping". Call it a grassy parking lot with showers and wifi but dont call it camping because you are way far from being a proper camp site! 15.000 pp after bargaining! The beach is not even close of what are you dreaming about Caribbean! Decent stay! Quiet! By the way, we did not meet any friendly welcoming owner! Only good thing is that Tolu is clean of Gringos! Apparently, the area is not very safe at night. 2 incidents reported so far ;-(

name: Nemocón
description: Free - parked in front of the church near the Salt museum (3.000 per person). 4 blocks away from the other Salt Mine (18.000 per person). Very quiet night.

name: Laguna Suesca
description: Free. A little hidden begin some trees from a small forest. Farmers might stop by for a chat. Asked permission from a farmer who called the owner on his cell.

name: Santa Rosa De Osus
description: Parking lot at the side of the restaurant / hotel just across road from petrol station about 80 kms north of Medellin on highway 25. Super friendly owners, night security guard and wifi in the hotel lobby. Bathrooms, no showers.

name: Hostel Casablanca
description: BEDBUGS!!! Colombia bedroom has bedbugs. Free breakfast? Nope just a raw egg with two slices of bread to make your breakfast in a dirty kitchen with dirty cooking stuff. There is no gym. Horrible place to stay.

name: Tatacoa Wild Camp
description: Off a track from the main road (entrance: N3.22753, W75.13886). Beautiful view of the desert. Some light traffic during the day. Millions of stars at night!

name: Noches De Saturno
description:
Good spot to spend the night! 
15,000 COP/pp to camp. 
They also have cabins (80K for a double room)

Pool is 5.000 COP/pp extra. 

Good showers and restrooms.

name: La Palmera Mechanic parking lot
description: A mechanic's parking lot. Super nice mechanic. Let us stay for free and even had a bathroom with running water. Good place to stay if running out of daylight en route to El Cocuy NNP.

name: Cabanas Campestres
description: This is a beautiful spot overlooking the canyon! Hard to ever leave again. Camping in prime location 10,000pp pn. Great local breakfast for 6000pP. Basic bathroom and shower but stunning view and super friendly owner who speaks English (correction: the person I spoke to didn't). There are some protective dogs. Laundry seems available. The turnoff from the main highway is a sharp uphill dirt road. You need to be careful as the traffic is unforgiving and there is very little room to maneuver. The view from here is better than from inside the park.

name: Balneario Can-Cun
description: This place is weird and magical at the same time. The good thing about this is the natural setting right by a nice river. The owner of the big restaurant allowed us to camp. First they asked for 12000cp then they wanted 25000, we settled on 20000. That was a bit weird and the people seemed rather drunk, but everyone but one guy who lives there left by 7pm. They would have left the bathroom open but we preferred to camp further away by the river. The night was lovely, quiet, and the fields were lit by fireflies. There were a few too many no-see-ums but didn't see mosquitoes at least. The river was nice for a cold dip in the morning.

name: Gran Hotel Yarumal
description: Nice little town, fresh climate, cheap food and accommodation. Banks to cash money.. Safe place to stay overnight, US$ 20/night for a dual room.

name: Mountain Hostels Manizales
description: A friend of mine stayed at the hostel. They let me park in front and use their facilities for free. Nice little place. Hot showers. Free for me. Regular night in the dorm was 24k pesos

name: Grill Across Terpel
description: Stop by this grill packed with locals. Amazing lunch and super friendly owner! It is right across from a Terpel gas station and to right of the butcher. Lunch with double meat and lemonade for 6.000 pesos. Check it out

name: Camping Monteroca
description: This is one of the coolest places you can ever stay. 12 different boutique style accommodations with different themes ranging from tree house, over outer space, to bob marley (the owners favorite for well known reasons). While the "rooms" are not cheap camping is just 15k pesos. Hot showers! Full kitchen, TV, etc. Jorge the owner is a friendly and funny guy with a lot of stories to tell and things to see in his museum...

name: Telephone Towers
description: This is a possible place to sleep when getting stuck on the way between Salento and Ibaque. Quite for the night absolutely no amenities around

name: Termales Machin
description: Roadside rural parking near to the volcano Machin. Hot water flows through a pipe into a several cemented pools.

name: Host El Cacique
description: A great find in the city, very new, and most important for us, safe Moto parking inside. Staff was friendly and the hostel was immaculate. A private room with A/C and bathroom/shower was $30 per night. A small restaurant attached makes tipico meals for less then $3 per plate and good too.

name: Hotel Pueblito Playa in Bocagrande
description: Small friendly budget hotel. One of the owners, Brian, is British. He can accommodate larger vehicles in the guarded car park. Very helpful: he hired a cab and took us to his English speaking vet when our dog took sick. Arranged transportation for us to get paperwork for the dog from the Panamanian Consulate in Barranquilla. Good breakfasts. Wifi, laundry, AC, TV. Recommended.

name: Trebol Hotel
description: Newer hotel only 4 years old. Very clean and the staff are some of the sweetest people yet. A room for the 3 of us was 75000 COP ($30). Moto parking 2 blocks away in a very secure indoor lot for 5000 COP ($2). Central to the nice little town and very safe. Some good eats too.

name: park lot near a closed restaurant
description: parking on the beginning of dirt Rocky Road near a closed restaurant. quiet. coffre possible on the morning . good spot for camping cars.

name: Restaurante Delicias del lago (+ cabana)
description:
a Nice parking in front of à restaurant. the owner is a nice old woman. free- water. 

parking lot in front of restaurant (3 +1). Overlander Nicolas stopped for lunch asked if he could park for the night and I joined him. Family with hearts as big as South America (Armando, Nelly and Eduardo).I asked them if I could include them in IOverlander and here we are. They have one cabana available for 80k breakfast for two included. This would be your typical stop where the people make the place. Sunday is their busy day and they would need the parking lot. We shared our generosity

name: Veterinarian Manrique
description: English speaking vet. Berly Manrique Soto. Excellent service. Knows the correct health certificate needed by ICA.

name: San Francisco Hotel
description: Had to stop on the way down from the north. Nice little hotel with secure parking for big rigs. The owner also let us use his washing machine for our clothes. AC, hot showers, wifi was down while we were here. Ok with dogs after we promised he wouldn't get on the bed. Price: 50,000.00/couple.

name: Auto Lavado Berakhah (and Spa)
description: The car wash that we went to when they said our vehicles were too dirty to go on the ferry. The gas station across the street from the port couldn't do it. These guys are high energy.

name: Hotel Mamydorme
description: Hostel with private rooms and private bath room as well as rooms with shared bath. Kitchen facilities. Wifi.  Located in a safe part of town. Clean. AC is only on from 9:30 until 7:30 am. We paid 18 US dollars for a private room. If you find yourself up here it is a nice place to stay.

name: Posada In Kite Area
description: Decent parking lot and under the roof camping for 5000 per person per day. Just in front of the beach in kite area. Lots of hammocs and some rooms available too.

name: Posada Luz Mila
description: Hostel but there is an option to camp at the front of the water. 10000 per person but we haggled for 15 k for both. Restaurant serving ok meals (15000)

name: Camping Cispata
description:
Friendly staff, a lot of space, near the water and restaurants. Camping under trees. Electricity, WiFi and a freezer (no fridge) provided.  Big rigs will fit easily.  

Next village is famous for burro festival (donkey festival) during Easter. COP 20000 for 2 of us and a tent in high season.

name: Hotel Finca Gordita
description: Small family farm. 80,000 cop per night. Very friendly family. Room is basic. Watch out for Mosquitos. Can use owners kitchen.

name: Texaco Posto
description: Gas station at the end of town past the bridge, if heading North.  Toilets and showers available.

name: Cajas Automaticas Isidoro Gomez
description: Great find in Medellin! Mechanic specializing in automatic gearboxes. Very friendly and cheap! Locals says they are the best in the city! Changed transmission oil, cleaned the filter for a fraction of the price we were quited by Toyota service. Great job! Big thumb up for the mechanic!

name: Hotel Central Plaza
description: Good alternative for juz 54000 pesos for a double room. Ok room. Safe underground parking. Spectacular views over the city specially at night.

name: Hotel El Nogal
description: Nothing fancy but close to the border. Hot shower and simple breakfast. Covered underground parking. 70000 for a double room

name: Hotel Cuarta Avenida Cali
description: Hotel at Avenuda 4 N No. 9N-77. www.hotelcuartavenida.com. Very clean appartement with kitchen and secure parking in garage (max. 2,6m). Paid usd 60 for a double room (2 room appartment) incl. Breakfast. Very hot water in shower and good pressure.

name: Hotel La Posada Del Camino & CAMPING
description: Very nice place  south of sincelojo and 400km north of medelin.  A big hotel with rooms with aire. We parked in their car park medium size which was fine, also gated so very safe . We paid $6 US to camp. There is a pool on site, very nice. Public  showers( cold ) and bathrooms near restraunt. Theres a restaurant on site with delicous food recommend la planta de pechuga.  Wifi available. There are places to sit all over the place. Definnetly recommend!

name: Just Off The Road
description: It was dark when we found the place ,  we tried to camp at the hotel just next to  this  big field next to an abandoned house  but they wouldnt let us,  it was a love motel. no facilities. Surprisingly quiet since its  next to the main road.  Very annoying flies 2hrs east of armenia.

name: Seguros SURA Colombia - Insurance SOAT
description:
Place to buy vehicle insurance. SOAT (required) is only available in the morning! And not valid until the following day beginning at midnight. 

Open Monday - Friday 7.30am-12pm 1.00pm - 5pm.

name: Moto Gangas Del Caribe
description: Motorcycle shop with all types of tires and other parts. Very nice people. Ask for Victor.

name: Hotel La Magdalena
description:
Nice hotel in the district of Gethsemani. It is a five minute walk from the Old Town. Some rooms with no windows and no natural light. TV. Spotlessly clean with daily change of towels and linens. Triple room for 120 000 
Unfortunately no safe deposit in the hotel. Although we had been offered to lock our papers and our money, it turned out later that the things have been stored in an open drawer at the front desk for three days.  (Not including breakfast. Booked via http://www.booking.com)

name: Hotel Stil
description: Nice hotel in the heart of La Matuna. It is also a five minute walk to the old town. We had a large room on the 9th floor with a view to the old town and the sea. Air conditioning, television, refrigerator, large bathroom, cold water shower. In-room safe deposit. As breakfast is included, therefore it was the better deal for us compared to La Magdalena.

name: Restaurant on the road to Barichara
description: Restaurant with fenced parking lot on the road to Barichara. There is a sign for camping at the gate which the new owner had not noticed before. Very friendly people. Toilet and shower in the restaurant. We paid for 5 beers, 2 x Chicken with Arepa de Queso and 2 tea 23,000 COPs. The quality of the food was poor.  (We have previously agreed that we eat in the restaurant)

name: ITP Compleja Agua Termales
description: Night in the parking lot in front of the entrance to the hot springs. We have been asking about permission to stay from the front desk to the office of the management. As our car is small and only took one parking site, it wasn't problem. The next morning we visited the thermal hot springs (12,000 COP / person).

name: Hostal La Floresta
description: Was only an emergency solution for us as we arrived very late in the dark. Parking lot behind the hostel. Very narrow gate (we have a deep scratch down to the cabin wall). When we parked the parking lot was with loose gravel and we could not level the car on soft grounds. Clean bathrooms and hot showers at the hostel. Free WIFI.

name: On the slopes of El Penon de Constantino
description: During the day we stayed in the natural pools of El Penon de Constantino (3000 COP / pers.) And parked then in the evening outside of the area between the trees. Although we felt far from any civilization it was quite busy at night.

name: Hospedaje/Piscina El Portal del Sol
description: Secure camping on the grass next to the swimming pool. The water in the pool was quite dirty. We couldn't use the toilets because of the dirt. Loud barking at night.

name: Parador y Restaurante La Maria Colombia
description: Parking lot behind the restaurant. (Dirt, Free, May be a challenge for tents)There are toilets and showers, but not really clean. We had dinner at the restaurant (chicken with rice, lentils, potato, plantain, beetroot salad). Beverage 18,500 COP for two people.  (We have previously agreed that we eat in the restaurant)

name: Small private parking lot
description: Parking lot in the town center which was locked at night with a gate. Water tab available. First we tried the parquadero Santuario" (N 77.58149 W 0.80737 2,000 COP), where you can stay for the night. The huge parking lot was so full of garbage that we did not feel comfortable there.  From here you can walk to the Sanctuary of Las Lajas.

name: Remanso el Santuario
description: Restaurant that will let you camp n the parking lot. Very quite. On the ocean. Toilets but no running water. Can shower with bucket if water. 10,000 per person

name: Frenos Y Servicios Del Valle
description: Good mechanic. We had some problems with our steering and these guys fixed us right up.

name: Hostel Provencia
description: $33 US dollars for a double. Rooms are very clean. Decent shared kitchen, wifi, laundry. Quite. Secured parking 1 block down the street. Rates seem to vary with size of vehicle.

name: Kite Addict School/Camp
description: Fenced area at kite surfing school across from the beach at the far end of town. Run by Colombian/German couple (English, Spanish and German spoken). Great food! 10,000 pesos for 1 tent and our 2 motorcycles. Bucket sweet water shower. Would be possible to park Sprinter size van within walls. They can also help arrange 4x4 tours to Punta Gallinas.

name: Hotel El Trébol
description: Secure motorcycle parking in courtyard. 30,000 pesos for room w/ fan and 50,000 pesos for room w/ aircon. Decent wifi, clean room and bathroom.

name: Terpel Next To Aguachica
description: We slept in a terpel next to aguachica. Noise but safe

name: Parqueadero Villa Maria
description: It is a parking lot in a small town in front of manizales, called Villa Maria. Is really good located, and two blocks from the cable aereo that gets you to Manizales.

name: Parling Lot In Front Of Police Station
description: You can stay in front of the police station for free. They will look for your car. Not very quiet at night but safe and 2 blocks from downtown

name: parador Rojo/esso Petrol Station
description: Free to camp 24 hour petrol station, restaurant with free wifi and toilets.

name: Hostel Danta
description: Hostel next to the river just outside of Manaure. Festive little place with restaurant, bar, garden, plant nursery, and swimming hole. They let us camp in the secured parking area with access to bathrooms and one shower for 20,000 cop. Wifi in restaurant area. Good spot to stop if you are heading to or coming back from the Perija Mountains.

name: Malibu Hotel
description:
It was late and we were desperate for a place to stay. All the other hotels we saw were VERY basic and 30.000pesos and up.

This place we got recommended by a truck driver and thank god. Some of the best rooms we've had the whole trip for a negotiated 40.000pesos. A/C, big TV, secure gated parking and extremely clean. New hotel that only opened in Jan 2015

name: La Cueva Antigua "The Old Cave"
description: Cool cave in the valley here. Can park on the road and go into the house near these GPS. They will ask for 5.000 pesos or so to use their stairs to the cave, but the cave is public and free for all. Bring lights and enjoy, it's small enough that you can't really get lost, one tight squeeze to crawl through and one semi submerged walk through. We hiked down the valley to the next dirt road (see other GPS point marked)

name: Swimming Hole on River
description: Look for the opening in the fence and hike towards the river. Up the river there is a trail on the right that will take you to a fantastic swimming hole. Ask the locals if you can't find it. There's an 8m jump into it. Fantastic. It was 5m deep when we were there during dry season so plenty safe for jumping.

name: Lavamos Bien
description:
Laundry service. Good job, but closed the other day when we wanted to pick it up. And then closed for weekend.
Not the right place if you wanna have it done quick. We waited 4 days!

name: Parque de los Corales, Isla Barú
description:
amazing camping site, right in front of the beach, there´s police 24/7, a huge parking right outside, camping is free, the parking is about US$5. 

after the bridge take de dirt road with the sign "playa blanca - Parque de los Corales" any car can go to the dirt road.

name: Horse's Tour Chez Marie & Maurizio
description: They have horses and make tours around Villa de Leyva. They work for and with the nature, the elements ! 12$ per hour for the first person and less the next. You can camp with your vehicle to the finca if you book a tour with them and if not, you can also for 20'000 per vehicle. Water, electricity and toilets. A really nice family connected to the nature !

name: Hotel Meson Hondano
description: 120,000 for a triple room. Second night 90,000 for two. Very clean and large room with air con and tv. Large and very clean pool with hangout areas. Restaurant open until 5pm. Easy walk to church area with food choices. Very secure parking for motorcycles and vehicles with night security guard. Might be one spot to camp but we did not inquire. Good halfway spot even though slightly pricey. Staff/owner very friendly.

name: Insurance SOAT - Exito Servicio Al Cliente
description: No longer possible to buy less than one year SOAT here.

name: Iveco EuroTrans Or Navitrans
description: A really good and clean mechanic with all you need for Iveco.

name: ProGas
description: Here it's possible to fil the bottle of gas from USA 42800P per 20lb

name: Hotel Diana (hotel Hotel)
description: 60,000 per night for large double room with remodeled bathroom. Upper floor room 17 with Internet router in front. They have a variety of room types. Secure parking for motorcycles, not larger vehicles. Very clean. Friendly owner.

name: Alkosto Hiper Ahorro
description: Bought SOAT here. $55,000COP for one month for 2006 Ford van. Also has ATMs.

name: El Llanerito
description: Gas station/hotel/restaurant combo. AMAZING smoked and grilled pork. These guys are very proud of what they do and even gave us a sample of the meat before we ate. (They knew that would be a great hook!) We didn't stay here but glad we took the time to pause our drive and eat here! 30,000 COP for 2 full meals of meat, papas and yuca, and drinks. An additional 20,000 for more meat to-go.

name: Autocentro Autoruta
description: To change wheels, they have Michelin agilis 205/75/16

name: Hacienda Guayabal - Chinchina
description:
Nice, quiet, beautiful surroundings with nice views. Inside a working coffee plantation.  Watch for sign on hwy 29.
Space for maybe 15 rigs on level lawns. All the facilities you need - swimming pool, restaurant, power, water, toilets and showers. Attentive staff. Internet is variable and rarely fast. Possible to tour the farm for 35,000COP/pers (2-3h). Camping 25’000pp per night. Laundry can be done but is charged by the item so likely quite expensive.
email Jorge on info@haciendaguayabal.com or phone cell 3147724856

name: camping and RV park Monteroca
description: This is a nice place for tent campers. But limited for car campers. You have to squeeze your car in a simple parking lot where only 2-3 cars fit, where is not level ground and people pass all the time. No wi-fi. 20.000.- p.p. is too much we think.

name: casa miraflores
description:
a little more expensive than a normal hostel (paid 25.000 COP for a bed in a two-bed "dorm") but definitely worth it. great place, very clean, big warm showers, great wifi even in rooms, large amazing community areas. good breakfast, free filtered coffee all day long

could also wash and hang my stuff right inside the hostel, laundry service would be available (and nobody gave me the look when i washed it on my own).

two clean kitchens available for your own cooking

place was vigilated 24/7, had my bike in their very small parking space. it was even o.k. to park the bike at the street outside of the hostel at time of writing.

highly recommended

name: CartaGas S.A.
description:
The most expensive Propane ever is here! We didn't have more choice... was here or drive 100 kms back to Barranquilla...
They refill cilinders "homemade" way, so it'll take about 30-45 minutes and COP$70.000. Yes you read it right... golden propane!
Open till 5pm.

name: Taroa School
description:
We wanted to camp in Punta Gallinas but didn't make it because of the sand on the road. We asked to a local Wayuu family in Taroa where could we camp and they told us outside the school. We gave them some fruit, candies for their 6 children and water as exchange and they were very happy.
There's a beautiful walk to the coast to see the sunset.
*** We didn´t save the GPS coordinates, so I just put Taroa on the map... it's not so big so you won't get lost!

name: Cuerpo de Bomberos Maicao
description: We asked to the "comandante" to park on their very large parking lot for one night before corssing to Venezuela. It's very noisy because it's beside the main road, but safe...

name: San Jeronimo
