description: 110,000 per double room with breakfast and secure parking in garage of hotel. Very convenient and secure parking for motorcycle and vehicles up to 2.3 meters. Easy in and out of garage. Garage is only for hotel guests. Wifi router on each floor. Room 302 was just about across from one so good speed. Clean. Hot water. TV with English channels. Must let water run for like five minutes until hot. Close to center.

name: Finca El Carajo
description: Great campsite close to Bucaramanga, the way up to the camp might be a bit difficult for large campers. The surroundings are great and the staff very friendly (only spanish). There are showers (very cold) and several flat camping areas with electrcity and running water near by. There is also a restaurant service we didn't use. 14000 COP p/p/n

name: Parking lot infront of Capilla Santa Barbara
description: Right infront of Capilla Santa Barbara there is a sort of parking lot surrounded by trees, we were told that parking and camping was allowed there so we did, we had a nice shade from the trees, and infront of the plaza right next to it there was a hostel were we rented the toillets and shower. Nice place and friendly people all over. Another toillet option was paying the 5000 COP p/p to access the nearby swimming pools. The main square of Barichara has free unlimited wifi access.

name: Little Church uphill from Puente de Boyaca
description: We ended up finding this "hideout" since we were told by the police that "camping was not allowed in the monument" which we found strange since lot's of people did told us they camped here. It was late at night so we searched a bit and we found the place. We parked right behind the church and we spent a nice quite night here. Next morning we got a great tour with lots of informations about the bridge from an elder tourist policeman, who also told us that camping was allowed and did a complain to the police officers who missinformed us.

name: Camping area of Desierto de La Tatacoa
description: Camping area right on the edge of de impressive desert of La Tatacoa, views are great from here and you are next to the entrance of the paths to explore the strange formations inside the desert. Services were basic but worked. Modest showers, toillets and hand laundry area. We took our bikes and went to Villavieja and from there we went by boat to Aipe, crossing the Magdalena river, nice and easy little day trip to do. Another tip on getting to La Tatacoa and avoiding two pay tolls when coming from Bogota is taking the dirt road to Pueblo Nuevo after the town of Natagaima. The landscape is great and there is a nice tunel which takes you to a bridge over the Magdalena river with really nice views. You'll arrive directly to Villavieja from where you take the road leading to the desert

name: Police station in Neiva
description:
The cops no longer let overlanders stay at this location. We got asked to leave. 

We came late to Neiva trying to find a workshop to fix our roof rack. This little square next to two restaurants and behind a police station was a nice and a discret place to stay. Police officers were friendly and did took care of us, toiletts and free wifi available from Restaurate Las Guacamayas, and there was a water tap we could use right in the plaza.

name: Cortadora & Dobladora Memo
description: A great welding and metal mechanical workshop whit a great and hard working staff, we came here to rebuilt part or our roof rack and they did a great job. Sr. Guillermo, the owner, allowed us to camp here for the night. They had showers, toillets and a nice little bar were we had a couple of beers. They are able to fabricate 4x4 equipment such as extra fuel tanks, bumpers, roof racks, bring your drwaings and they'll get it done for you! They are very helpful and will be glad to help you finding your way around Neiva.

name: Santuario de Las Lajas
description: We came late to visit so we decided to spend the night here at the parking lot. There are a couple of hotels and restaurants where you can use the toilets. Parking fee for the night was 15,000 COP.

name: Bio Andina
description: Place for tents and one vehicle with access to bathrooms and showers. Showers should have hot water but we did not try. 5,000 cop per person for camping plus 10,000 for entry to the reserve. Reserve set up for captured animals with plans to reintroduce them but you cannot visit the animals. Great paramo habitat and birding. Road is a bit bumpy getting up here.

name: Hostal Padua
description: Hostal Padua is a beautiful place to rest, with all facilities for camping. Big rig-friendly, tent-friendly and pet-friendly. Plenty of space for several house trucks and motorcycle parking. Currently offering a promotion of a free night in the camping zone for bicycle travelers. Electricity, kitchen, warm showers, free WiFi and safe parking zone. 25,000 COP per person for one night in the camping zone and 105,000 COP if you wish to stay in their hostel with 2 pax.

name: El Penon de Constantino
description: nice campground and smal hats for backpackers. the deserview is incredible. we enjoyed the nice pool (costs extra). Enrico the caretaker is very friendly !,  the place is 1,5 km gravelroad away from the main desert road. but no problem to go.

name: Hotel Casa San Roque
description: Nice little hotel with decent wifi, TV, cold showers, a/c, gratis coffee is always available. We parked in a public secure parking lot on the cross street to the North and West where our big rig fit. 80,000 pesos for 2 people.

name: La Huerta Camping
description: Wonderful little place we stumbled on. The staff is super nice. They even brought us homemade herbal tea upon arrival. Hot showers, bathrooms. 9,000 cop per person.

name: Bogota I Sanctuario Monserrate
description: Parking area of cable car and funicular. The mountain is also accessible via a footpath.

name: Parking Plaza Central Guatavita
description: We asked at the police station which is located direct at the main parking. They let us park here for the night, quiet until the traffic began at about 6:00 am, save.

name: Casa Amarilla
description: Beautiful guest house on the river with dorms and private rooms. Dorm bed cost 30k CP (roughly $12). Clean. Free coffee in the morning. No moto parking but the owner hooked me up with a neighbor across the street who let me park for free in his secure lot. Fast wifi, common area, kitchen.

name: Boat launch parking. Laguna de la Cocha
description: In El Puerto, just in front of the " Servicio de Lancha", quiet and free overnight place, a lots of restaurant around

name: Hotel Las Nieves
description: Beautiful old hotel on the main square that is much cheaper than it looks. Large, clean single rooms 46k CP, with bathrooms, wifi, TV, some with balconies. Restaurant has decent selection and reasonable prices. Secure parking for a motorbike or two (you have to walk your bike through the restaurant, deep into the back of the building).

name: Secret Buddha Gastro Retreat
description: A cool little hostel/retreat south of Medellin. It feels a lot like staying in his home. The owner is very welcoming and friendly and will even cook for you. He is in the process of upgrading the hostel but He let us sleep in our van with access to showers etc for $25 dollars. There is only room for one vehicle and the turns are tight but it beats the spot at hostel Casa Blanca. Our 4x4 van fit fine but anybody longer than 20 ft might have problems with the turns. Very nice garden area.  Two large friendly older dogs. You can take the metro from nearby to the city.

name: Patio de Getsemani
description: Good value very helpful hotel good place to stay for the port. secure parking 150mts away you have to pay.

name: Affinity Hotel
description: $58 on Expedia with last minute discount. One bedroom apartment hotel, very nice, in room made to order breakfast (!), secure parking covered and uncovered, great location, nice city view too. Awesome deal.

name: La Piscina Restaurante
description: About 3 hours from Cartagena. Great lunch stop. A big restaurant with some private soaking pools - good size and clean - that go with your own table, plus a shared big and clean swimming pool in the middle of the restaurant. Good food. Bandeja paisa and pollo frito about 15cop each.

name: Citroën Bogota
description: Good and really Professional Service for European Camper based on Citroën Jumper, Fiat Ducato and Peugeot Boxer. They have Parts available, they changed our windshield without waiting time.

name: Water Fall Trail Head
description: Beautiful waterfalls and lagoons in a mountain setting.  Road leading to trail is very poor.  Park at the highway and walk up road, 30 minutes.

name: Hotel Paraiso
description: Fantastic little hotel with pool in Villavieja, 9km from Tatacoa. 25k CP ($10) for private single room with bathroom (20k CP for single without bathroom). Lovely family running it. A couple of blocks from stores where you can stock up on provisions for the desert. Easy secure parking for one or two motorbikes within the gated porch. No wifi.

name: Finca El Mocambo / Villa de Venecia
description:
Calm place to stay, 30k COP for two in a van. Clean toilets, cold shower (warm maybe on request). Pet friendly. Probably Wifi, very good cell service. Offered to make breakfast for you if you like.

Rooms on Hostelworld are still only 15-20$.

name: Estaderos Los Hoyos
description: Campground with cabanas and restaurant on a hill overlooking the desert. Lots of territory for campsites with great views. 6k cp pp for camping. Cabanas 20k pp. swimming pool nearby. Showers at no extra charge. Friendly family. Plenty of room for parking whatever you've got (I camped next to my bike). Bring small bills!

name: Another Tatacoa Wildcamp
description: Location off the main road with nice view. Camped on a small flat outcrop next to a small side road. Very quiet, only two people passed on bikes. Free.

name: Cabanas Kanwara
description: Camping area on grass with great views of the countryside and mountains. Owner Hernando was very friendly and spoke clear, slow Spanish. We paid $10,000 per person per night. They had cabanas available and a restaurant serving meals. Convenient location for the Ritacuba Blanco hike. Suicide showers available.

name: Casa de Francois
description: Beautiful hostel in the hills. Spacious, comfortable beds and a well designed kitchen. Restaurant with fantastic, reasonably priced food. Good motorcycle parking, though situated atop a steep muddy road (doubt big rigs will fit). Really nice place to rest and catch up for a while. Wifi in common area. Hot showers. 20k per dorm bed. Private rooms available too.

name: Cartagena
description: Walked here to ask about prices. Was told the rate for 24 hours is just 2 x the 12 hour rate. The 50.000 peso price doesn’t exist anymore. The sign only lists 1 and 12 hour rates. 1 hour: 5.000 12 hours: 40.000 (So 24 hours: 80.000) Nice spot to watch sunset though.

name: Near Punta Gallinus
description: You could be intrepid and find the way on your own but we are only intrepidfor10minutes so followed one of the tours from Cabo which leaves at 5am (20,000). The tours take a 15 minute boat ride across the bay and are collected by another vehicle on the other side, we took a guide on board from this point (20,000) and drove round the bay (90 minutes). It cost 10,000 per head to camp in vehicle and has hammocks and huts as well. We definitely needed the Landcruiser to get here, some deep sand needed low box + high clearance required in places. Other option is to park at Cabo and take the tour (120,000 per head excluding accom and food, but well worth it if you are not sure of the vehicle. The terrain/roads are a cross between Mongolia and Morocco.

name: Hotel El Dorado
description: Basic rooms for 35k CP and up. Intermittent wifi, off center square. Parking included in price at lot a block away. Clean, with private bathrooms. Hot water available only in the morning from 5-10am, and this place is chilly.

name: Texaco In Taraza
description: A Truckstop with Gasstation, Hotel and Restaurant, next to the "Peaje". We parked in the back, quiet overnight, with Security.The Security man expects a tip.

name: Playa Hobo
description: Its a dead end Road, direct on the Lagoona. There is a restaurant which is open on Sunday's.

name: At the "Airport"
description: Quite overnight place, it is near the "runway" of the pueblo... Cute little town with a lot of space. Grassy ground. It is on 1300mtr. Have a rest after the Tatacoa or before the hot dessert.

name: Do Not Know
description: It is a hotel with pool and Cabanas... Camping is 35.000 yes 35.000 C.Pesos... Per Person. Bargain not possible. The last 5km of the track is quite washed out. High ground clearance necessary. We parked in front of the gate, it was too late to get out of the bush....

name: paraiso De Santa Fe
description: They used to allow camping and said they really don't allow it anymore but we convinced them to let us stay. There is a large grassy lot in back with tons of space but long vehicles will have problems with turns. Charged us 20,000   Nice spot if you don't mind chickens.

name: Hostel El Hangar
description: Hostel next to airport. Clean basic rooms. Cheap. 64,000 per night. Can also leave your car while you travel. Covered parking is available. Parking for nights you stay are free and parking while you are away is 10,000 cop. 24 hour security and airport shuttle.  Restaurant with typical CO food next to hostel.

name: Aire Sonido & Accesorios
description: Awesome English spoken mechanic who fixed our broken air conditioner and repaired our brakes.  Has wifi

name: Restaurant/bar Chambacu
description: Took us 4.5 hours to get here from Villa de Leyva ( heading for Medellin via lesser used roads) amazing scenery but not so amazing roads ((alternating 20 metres of perfect Tarmac followed by 20 metres unpaved. This is a small complex with restaurant and a large, very clean swimming pool with one of those curly slides. Initially they said no camping but agreed once we said we wanted to have a few beers and eat. Go round the left/behind the bar on to the grass. There is also Hotel Alkala opposite but we could not see any secure parking. Clean toilets but no showers.

name: Frente al Batallón de Pamplona
description: Crossing from Venezuela, this was the first option that we found to stop. Talked to the firemen and they had no space, so we talked to the military (Batallón) and they let us camp in front of them, outside the soccer "little stadium". A little noisy at night. Free.

name: Hacienda La Aurora
description:
Beautiful area with lots of shade and space. Nice swimming pool and basic but clean bathrooms.
We payed COP$25.000 for both of us, but initially they asked COP$30.000. Very friendly people, lots of turkeys around and quiet dogs.
To get here from Honda, drive in direction to El Dorado and 80 mts before the bridge there's a fence on your right hand side. There are also small signs of the Hacienda.
The entrance is a little narrow but our truck went through OK.

name: Playa Blanca close to San Antero
description: at the end of the paved road, turn right on the T- junction and follow the beach road.After 300 meters , opposit from the Palapas is a house with a big ground with palm trees.We stayed here for 15000COP/night. On weekens is a little Restaurant " Sofia" open .

name: Terminal de Transportes
description: Camped on a dead end dirt road above the terminal, ask the parking lot attendant. FREE. There are bathrooms in the terminal. Walking distance to the center of town.

name: Top of the world
description: A large flat lot with great views, quiet, clean air and friendly locals.

name: Camping Tataquies Ecoaventura
description: Lovely gras ground, leveled, on the small river, with Horses friendly owner. Internet probably from other roadside (temp. Not working when visited this place ...... Said the owner) over the Bridge next gate right side. 10k CoP p.P.

name: Stahlratte
description: This is the official meeting point to load your motorcycle on to the Stahlratte, a beautiful steel sailing yacht built over 100 years ago, the Stahlratte was a highlight of our trip without a doubt. Sailing between Cartagena and Panama, the Ship offers parking for up to 19 motorcycles to get around the Darien Gap. Amazing food on board, with 3 meals per day for 4 days and snacks being included in the ticket. The ship goes via the San Blas islands, with white sand and clear blue seas, you have a BBQ in the beach of an uninhabited island, swing off the boat into the sea, meet the local Kuna people of the islands and snorkel the reefs (snorkeling equipment aboard the ship). The trip takes four days, and costs about $1000USD. Visit their website for more info.

name: Casa De Nelly
description:
Beautiful location in the hills outside of town, but just a 15 min walk to town. Good wifi, cabanas, reasonable prices. We payed $70 000 for a cabana for two people. Big rigs will not fit through the gate, but there is parking avaliable
BIG AND MID-SIZED RIGS: see our note below (tuckstruck)

name: BMW Motorrad
description: Nice motorrad. BMW large workshop and well equipped. Competent staff.. good service

name: El Ocaso Coffee Farm Tours
description: Can do good coffee tours here.  30,000cop (30,000 in 2022) per person. Tour starts every hour from 9am to 4pm and lasts 90 minutes.  Very popular with tour groups.

name: Hotel Mirador
description: Nice hotel in a small town. Staff very friendly. Paid 35000 pesos for a matrimonial. No breakfast. Parking is a block away. Trustworthy as we left our fully loaded bikes there for 5000 per bike.

name: Area Of Motorcycle Shops
description: Street in Medellín with spares and parts

name: Jahn Cafe
description: Actually best latté I ever had, in 23 countries. 3000 for small latte. Super friendly staff and stupidly fast wifi. What a place!!!

name: Puente De Occidente
description: Warning 3 ton(3,000 kg) weight restriction, plus approx 3 m height. We are 2.8 and they would not let us through ( we are also over 3 ton so did not push it. Park here to avoid having to reverse back up the narrow hill against the (often quite heavy) traffic. Approach from Santa Fe to avoid a long drive back.

name: Charco Corazon Del Rio
description: Area for tent camping.  Superb spot by small waterfall and natural pool for swimming. Restaurant with basic menu.  20 min walk to Jardin or ask owners to call tuk tuk for 5,000.  Camp fee 10,000 pp

name: Kiteboarding School / Pescao School
description: Awesome kiteboarding school on lake Calima which gets wind almost every day of year.  Owner is named fish/pescado, and is a very nice. They let us camp inside their large building/garage for 30 Cop per night for 2pl. Great wifi, bathrooms and kitchen.  Lessons are about $100/hour.

name: Road to Escondia
description: The road to Escondia starts at this point, head north towards beach and the last building will be the hostel. High RVs will have to carefully negotiate through the fruit trees in the hostel grounds and do not park under the coconut trees.

name: Laguna de Suesca, Lagunita
description: Camped near the  lake in a cow pasture. Owner Eusebius is very nice.

name: Truchera / Restaurant Montemar Camping
description: Trout farm and restaurant with tent camping and space for one or two vehicles. Hostess Magdalena is super nice. Camping is 15,000 cop pp per night. Lovely views, wifi, cold shower and bathrooms which are open at night. Short 1 km walk to town.

name: Noahs Arche
description:
A very nice hostel, upper range (almost classy) and very clean. Quiet and beautifully renovated. Brand new kitchen and showers hot as hell. Very nice and helpfull owners. More expensive than classic hostels around there (35k COP per night for a bed, but the comfort is much better), but it has a really big bonus : Right next door you have a 24h guarded and fenced parking lot (13k for 24h, little more if you have a big rig, we payed 16k for our LandCruiser). Not the cheapest option in Bogotá,  but a good deal regarding to what you get...

Definitely worth the extra money.

Last but not least, you can check the parking lot from the dorms !

We loved it ! Cheap food around on kra 3.

Also have private bedrooms, 120k COP.

name: Laguna de Iguaque campsite
description:
Official campsite in the park. 100 m away from the park entrance and parking lot.
The last 3km of dirt road are very bad. 4wd and high clearance necessary, and should be very difficult for the biggest rigs like trucks or RV (our LandCruiser is 5,50m and did well)

You have to carry your camping gear as they wont let you spend the night i your car in the parking lot. We even offered to pay the camping fee and then stay in the car, they still didnt authorized it.
Camping area is nice, not very flat but ok. Batjrooms with flush toilets and warm showers available, clean. Water is potable according to park rangers.
There are also 2 palapas for kitchen and picnic tables that you can use to hide from the rain if necessary.

Quite cold at night.
Good thing : you dont have to wait till the park opening in the morning to begin your hike up to the laguna.

We didnt do it but it seems that it is better to book the camping before by email. Info and contact on park website.

10k per person. 11,5k for parking

name: Parqueadero Para camiones
description: Truck parking next to the Cable Car which is going to city center. 15.000cop per Truck. For 24hr.

name: Piscina La Parroquia
description: Cute little river place to swim. We asked to Camp with the trucks, it was OK for the owner...we paid 5k for one truck and 2persons. It is approx. 100mtr. From the big road.

name: Over The River From Ambalema
description: Big concrete Parking Riverside, opposite from Ambalema... Quite at night. There is ferry service for small Trucks and passengers. Free

name: Piscina
description: It is a outdoor swimming pool complex with a leveled parking.

name: Nat. Parc. Piedra Del Tunjo
description: It is a small NP. Rock paintings and interesting rock formations. The entrance is at the east end. Rigs not higher than 3.65 Mtrs. Absolutely quiet at night. Ask at the gate for Mauricio he is the boss who can allow to stay over night when the park is normally closed for the public. The fee is 3.500cop p.P. Really nice guys.

name: Spanish With Hildebrando Angel
description: Call +57 3115961391.   El finca El Portada in San Augastin.  Señor Hildebrando can teach you Spanish, he speaks some English.   Charges around 20,000 per hour.  He has a WONDERFUL finca, where he can teach.   We throughly enjoyed our classes with him.   Muy Amable.   We stayed nearby at finca el Cielo.

name: Bahia Concha
description:
10 km north of Santa Marta is a Campground direct on a very nice beach, good and safe for swimming. Entrance fee to the park is 30000 COP, and 10000COP per Person on the campground. With bigger trucks you can stay only on the parking lot, tent campers can stay directly at the beach. Toilets and showers are available.
Major issue with mosquitoes and other biting bugs at dusk and during night. Be prepared.

name: Finca El Cielo
description: You can camp on property for 40 pesos a night (2 people) including a generous breakfast. Room for a couple vehicles. Wifi and Bathrooms with cold showers but for an extra 3 pesos they will let you use their hot shower. Extremely accommodating family and beautiful property. Also a hotel with rooms

name: Deutsche Botschaft
description:
On the 11th floor of glass construction

Im 11. Stock des Glasbaus

name: Finca La Aurora
description:
Defunct coffee plantation now being run as a weekend guest house for parties of up to 35. During the week just three generations of the original family living on site. Facilities include pool, kitchen, dining area, electricity and water plus use of the guest house facilities. Immaculate garden  and surrounds, plus plenty of space to hike the surrounding mountains and jungles. Very attentive hosts and the only slight disadvantage, very attentive boofy big dogs a couple of which enjoy a bit of attention and in return they never bark during the day and only at night a couple of times when they forget their manners.

NOTE the GPS coordinates are for the start of the driveway at the main road which is not signed, but there is a long driveway with tall trees lining it. Driveway is paved and steep but plenty of clearance for bigrig.  The coordinates for the place itself are 3.3224, -76.625 but you can't go wrong if you just keep going until you get to level ground.

Mario and Maria are your hosts - phone 318 896 5344 might be advisable especially for a weekend visit. 

Email is fincalaurorapance@gmail.com

Owner has internet, but sorry, you will have to do without.

Price as at August 2015 was 30,000 COP per night for two people.

name: Carulla Pance Supermarket
description:
Very comprehensive supermarket with a selection of imported stuff as well. Nice ambience.

Internet available at cafe inside - free for 30 minutes. 
Good bakery.
ATM - Citibank inside took our cards but have rip-off fees. Two other ATMs adjacent but spat our cards out.

Just one block off the PanAmerican. Watch overhead clearance into the carpark with bigrigs.

name: Parqueadero Al Frente De Vamos Pa'l Monte
description: Quiet parking lot. Bathrooms and water available. We payed 6000 cop/day and 6000 cop/night. Perfect if you want to go climbing in Suesca!

name: Texaco gas station with restaurant
description: Nice gas station with restaurant and a parking lot to stay overnight...safe...the restrooms are clean and they offer free coffee and hot water...internet is available in the restaurant!(without password)

name: Great Place Direct By The Water!!!
description: MODERATOR NOTE: Place removed because camping is illegal here.  Private Property

name: Hotel Villa Nancy
description: The hotel villa Nancy allowed us to spend the night in their grassy car park with access to the swimmingpool, toilets, coffee, outdoor kitchen. The owners are very nice.

name: Parqueadero by Hotel XUE
description:
Good place to stay after visiting Zipaquerá.
Parqueadero by Hotel XUE
Free, quiet.

name: Parador Los Mangos
description:
Roadside restaurant and hotel with large parking area.
We spent the night next to the rear of the restaurant, plugged into the power with the aircon running full blast. Worth the 20,000COP we paid.

Toilet and shower would have been available if we had needed it.

Some truck noise during the night but not too bad. Ripe mangos falling 10 metres onto the roof every couple of hours didn't help a lot with getting a quiet sleep.

name: Villa Mercedes Centro Recreational
description:
Caretaker lives in house to the left of the gate.

Park next to the rotunda. 
Electricity available and there are toilets and cold showers around the back.
Get traffic noise from the adjacent road which is the southbound bypass.
Grounds are used for soccer in the afternoon and band practice in the rotunda in early evening. Swimming pool was opened around 4pm. 
Vehicle Gates are closed during the night, but pedestrian access still available.

Cost was COP 5,000 per person

name: Propane Plant
description: It's not supposed to fill up personal cylinders, just the company's ones, BUT we talked to them and explained that we couldn´t fill up our tank in Neiva, Ibagué or Armenia, and they helped us.Payed COP$25.000 for 20 lbs.  update: try next marked place about 2 km towards Popayan ... Julio will do without problem . These guys sent us there anyways

name: Colombia Rafting Expedition Base
description:
we went to the Colombia Rafting expedition booking office in town for a tour the next day. they told us we could stay at there base of operations, which is here located. flat parking aerial with toilet and shower and electricity. not as loud as we thought becous it is located behind the house.
nice place to stay when you planing a rafting tour with the company. payd 20 000 col/pesos for the night.
restaurant and supermarket are close. access to the river possible where you also can put a tent.

name: Motos Y Servitecas
description: Edgar is a very friendly and competent motorcycle mechanic. Does mainly big bikes, mainly BMWs. Also sells Wunderlich parts. This is the go-to place in all Bogota and surrounding area. For web see www.motosyservitecas.com or gerencia@motoservitecas.com.co or call 311 452 6582

name: Hotel Puerto Nuevo
description:
Parking on the road with hotel.

Estacionamento na estrada com hotel.

name: Parqueadero 70
description:
Estacionamento para motor home. Um pouco caro, mas com ótima localização muito próximo ao metrô .
Parking lot for motorhomes and campers. The price is high (around one dollar per hour, no other deal). Close to subway station.

name: Servicios Ecoturisticos Guaicany
description: Juan Carlos helped us organizing our trekking through la sierra nevada. We also stayed in the cabin of his father with our van. Very friendly people, nice place and good price. High recommend if you want to spend time here around el cocuy. Good alternative to hacienda esperanza.

name: Hotel Manacacias
description: Puerto Gaitan is a lively city and it's the place were you leave asphalt behind when heading to Los Llanos in Colombia. Searching for a place to park we entered this neat looking hotel, and inmediatly got a good 15.000 COP deal for camping in their big parking lot. They had a swimming pool and toillets and showers next to it, no kitchen but they had a restaurant with reasonable prices, Wifi was fast and common areas nice to be at. Their contact info is: 3162981194 / 3152910018 - hotelmanacacias@hotmail.com -

name: Hotel Sindamanoy (NO CAMPING)
description:
29.6.2017: They do not accept overlanders anymore in their lot !

a little muddy if it rains.
Amazing view of the Lake and the little island.
I think this was the first time that they had overlanders.
They let us park and use the bathroom and shower (very very very hot shower!!) of a nice cabin. We also used electricity (you'll need extension cord).

They wanted COP$30.000 for the truck+2 people but we asked for COP$20.000 and they said yes.
It was cold and rainy when we were there and asked to use the fireplace at the cabin which had an additional cost of COP$10.000, totally worth it!

name: La Cabaña Alpina Factory Shop
description: Factory Shop from the Alpina. Everything you need, if you like milk products, from Chees to yoghurt, postres and even some salami and really good swiss-'wienerli' (Brand Killer). there is also a restaurant and a big parking place which will be FULL on weekends. don't go at the weekend

name: School Yard - Road Between Poppy an And Isnos -
description: School Yard - Road Between Popayan And Isnos - Nice Little Site Quiet Place For A Stop Great Views From The Edges. Drive across the first court to area next far building nice and level. Ask Permission From The Principal Across The Road To Camp People Here Are Nice And Friendly As In In All Colombia. There is a bathroom at the end of building open at night. Good for a break from the drive if it is needed.

name: parqueadero
description: 5,000 cop per night. opposite the esso station which looked nicer but they said we could not park for the night.  toilet is available but pretty dirty. but all in all not bad if you need a place near the border

name: Migracion Bogota - also possible online
description: To extend the Visa or related stuff. Can also complete extension online

name: Hosteria Horizontes
description: Fairly new and very clean motel. Excellent beds, clean bathroom with lukewarm shower which is good with these tropical temperatures. Air-conditioning and fan. Car behind guarded gate. Price per night ranges between 130-160.000 including breakfast. Dog-friendly.

name: Several Hotels along the coast
description: During the weekends they are full but during weekdays there is plenty of room. Directly on the beach most of them with safe parking in the yard. Prices may vary quite a bit. From 70.000 COP pp pn to 30.000. Plenty of room for negotiation.

name: DIAN Bogota - Extension For TVIP
description: Here you can get another 90 days permission for your vehicle to remain in Colombia but 90 only and only once. In theory you could leave Colombia and return to get another 90 days and use this newer permit (TVIP) to extend giving you 180 days in total. If you leave your vehicle longer than the permitted time you must return with the vehicle to this office where you will be 'sanctioned' i.e. fined, you could then leave Colombia and continue your trip with another 90 days or, as I understood, whatever time you have on your visa. If the vehicle becomes known to the authorities during the time that it is in the country without the owner it will be confiscated on the spot. If you are caught with the vehicle you have five days from thereon to report to the nearest office and pay the fine. After this the vehicle will be taken from you. The fine per month for an overstay is about 60,000 COL. I don't know if there is a maximum 'fine' or if it just ticks on forever. NOTE - if your vehicle is not worth exporting and you want a neat LEGAL way to be rid of it note the following. It's known as voluntarily abandonment. You can start the process here and it takes around a day to sort out. Afterwards the vehicle is taken and you are given proof of this. Remember importing vehicles into Colombia legally is impossible unless it is brand new or over 25 years old.

name: Corralito de Piedra
description:
Love-hotel for people with means of transport, but without a place to satisfy their urges. Offers cell-like "rooms" with fan, electricity and a shower. Beds are surprisingly flat.It is clean, but all rooms have a rather unpleasent smell.

Although next to the highway, it is quiet (at least when there are no other "guests" as when they show up the owners start to play ranchero), thus it seems a better alternative than hotels inside the town. 

No problems with pets or cooking on the parking.

Price: 20 000 COP per room.

Oh, last but not least: you get the first condom FREE.

name: Camping San Andres
description:
Basic campsite in San Andres. Camping on large grassy lot, secure, basic toilet and cold shower. May be busy at weekends due to being next to a sports court. Better option for us with roof top tent and needing to cook outdoors. Friendly owners in house attached. 5,000 Per vehicle
01/2020: price 5000 COP  pppn

name: CASA PATIO BONTIA
description:
HOSTEL WITH DORMITORY AND PRIVATE ROOMS. COMFORTABLE AND AFFORDABLE WITH GREAT BREAKFAST INCLUDED, AIRCONDITIONED ROOM, CLEAN,WIFI, PARKING.
LARGE PATIO TO RELAX, READ OR GO IN INTERNET. RUN BY A CANADIAN AND COLOMBIAN

name: SOAT INSURANCE Colombia
description:
4 agents side by side here just after border post and 5 minute service is provided. 30, 60 or 90 day insurance is available.

NOTE - nobody to check that you have actually bought it so entirely your responsibility. Aduana did specifically ask if we had SOAT when getting our TIP, but didn't need to see it.

name: Ipiales, Colombia to Tulcan, Ecuador
description:
Colombia > Ecuador 
Border name: Rumichaca

No COVID Protocols. 
Ecuador does not require SOAT/vehicle insurance, and there is nowhere in the country where a foreigner can purchase it.
No copies are needed and nothing to pay for. 

Park along road next to customs (DIAN) office and immigration office
Go to the DIAN office and turn in TIP. You will get an email confirmation of cancellation. 
Go to immigration in the adjacent building to have passports stamped for exit.
Drive to Ecuador. Aduana (customs) and immigration are on your left, park your vehicle.in parking lot on right. 
Next, head to Immigration and get your passport processed.
Go to the aduana office ("importaciones") on the corner of the building. Hand in your title, the drivers passport and your license. They will give you a vehicle permit in return.

name: Maicao, Colombia to Guarero, Venezuala
description:
ADMIN NOTE - as at end of October 2015 all borders between Colombia and Venezuala are closed.
Please read the check-in notes for rough guidance for procedures, but be ready for significant changes to procedures if the border reopens.

name: Secured Parking In El Cucoy
description: 4000 per day,  friendly family lives on-site.   Secured parking lot, Opens early.   Location description on app in an estimate.   It's located two blocks from the square on the way into town.

name: La Posada Del Molina
description: 50,000 for private room and bath.  Clean and comfortable.  Less expensive and better than the place where we stayed on the square.  Perfect place for post-hike recouping.  Restaurant on-site, makes good tipico for 6,000 per person.   Also has movie channels in English

name: Hostal la Finca
description:
Hostal la Finca is the perfect spot to stay. It’s not too easy to find but as always, to find the gems, you have to dig after them. Alexis and Mathilde (the owners) are a Colombian-German family. They are super friendly and helpful and know the area which helps you to get in touch with for example the owner of a untouristy coffee-finca or the best restaurants.
The price is 15k per person, per night. You might be able to get a slightly better deal if you stay for more nights. We camped there with a VW-bus. They told us that they’ll accept campers of the same size and a bit bigger (Pickups for example). If you think your camper might be too big, just contact them and ask.
They offer a clean pool with a view down into the valley. You could also take a private room or a dorm bed there. The showers are the best we’ve seen since leaving the US with hot water and still enough pressure to enjoy.  They have a private natural waterfall close by in which you can cool down after walking in the mountains. There is internet / WIFI but as it’s up in the mountains, it’s not enough to upload photos or videos/ it’s very slow! Their shared kitchen is well equipped and clean so we used it instead of using our own gas. We especially liked the atmosphere in the evening, when everyone gathers around the kitchen. They have a book-exchange too.
As I mentioned, it’s hard to find: Our GPS didn’t know the small road up the hill!
From Medellin follow the road through the tunnel (13000) and drive down until you reach San Jeronimo. There’s an Exito-Supermarket on the right (you might buy some stuff for the days at the finca). Turn right immediately after the Exito and follow the road. Drive left two times until you see the LUXOR Resort. Turn right after the Luxor and follow the dirtroad for approx. 6=7KM’s until you see “Tienda Abraham” take a left here and follow the road until you see the Finca on your left. No 4x4 needed to climb up there.

name: the solution of wild camping in Cartagena
description: As everyone in Cartagena, we were searching for a place to pop the top in the city that was safe and nice at the same time. we were not too happy about all the options on IO so we asked around. While importing our car at Dian, we met a guy from Argentina who said: Don't you know about the Hilton-place? We didn't. It's a small parkin lot next to a bus station 100 metres away from the Hilton Hotel. It's very safe and at a small lake where you can rent little boats in the morning. People from Cartagena and the surrounding skyscrapers come here to walk their dogs or just watch the sky from one of the benches. No toilets or amenities but maybe you can use the washroom of the close-by restaurant!

name: Los Sauzos
description:
Sept 2018 - 10000pp

8000 per Person to camp and use the showers. They opened a cabana for us. No Wifi, just a 2 Minute walk to the famous piscina Erika, a balneario with hot sulphurous thermal water. No Wifi but you can get breakfast from the friendly owner. Recommendation: eat postres at the market of Iza and use the balneario

name: Temporal insurance Sura
description: If you need a new insurance in case you extend the stay

name: Astivolks VW Repair
description: If you are travelling in a VW bus (kombi) and need parts or help, this is the place to be: A whole block full of mechanics and parts dealers. We had our brake pads for the rear drum brake fixed and paid 80000 incl. new material and work. The guys at Castivolks have 30 years of experience in buses and are very helpful and fair. Within 100 metres of this place, you're in VW heaven.

name: Meeting Point Hostel
description:
It's a basic hostel with private rooms and dorms. Good wifi, clean showers and well-equipped kitchen. I paid 28.000 for dorm with AC. there are shops and restaurants nearby. Staff very friendly. 

You can park / sleep on street in front of hostel for 10,000pp - use of all facilities (only paid 20,000 for the car, updated january 2024). Noisy but safe neighbourhood and good location.

name: Raíces de Neusa
description: Campsite and cabanas. Steep hill go get up here. Wasn't allowed into campsites on other side of Lake for unknown reasons.

name: Hotel Paradains
description: Paid COP 19,000 per person. Great place to stop for the night

name: hotel and restaurant at gas station
description:
35000pesos/night for a matrimonial room. 
WiFi, air conditioning, cold shower
Clean hotel

name: El Descanso
description: a small hotel after a gasstation and parkinglot for trucks. 30000 Cop for room or Camping. AC, WIFI and clean.

name: Pull Out From The Road, Close To Onzaga
description: Pull out next to road above a Little Mountain Stream. Good as an emergency stop in Case things took longer or you Run out of daylight. A few km out of onzaga on the Way to soatá or cocuy NP. Only little traffic.

name: Little Hideaway
description: Drive up the dirt road and on your right there is a little pull off nice views and very quiet

name: Hotel Ashalea
description: Really sweet hotel run by a lovely family. 30,000COP. Spotless room, nicely decorated, best pillow I've had in Colombia, yet. Mini fridge, aircon, wifi in common area. Good for motos or big rigs. Two gates enclose parking area at night, and since it is set back a block from the main road, it's very quiet. Laundry services available. You never receive a key; it is kept at reception. Mining town, so there is a fair bit of wealth here. Nice restaurants a 5 minute walk up the main road.

name: La Posada De Robinson
description: This place is no longer allows campers.    Lovely traditional hotel with ample parking for large vehicles and motos. (Door from street is approx. 3.5m high and 4m wide.) Room was spacious and clean and had chairs and a desk. The bathroom had HOT water :) Beds and pillows were extremely firm. Paid 60,000COP for a double. Very close to the central plaza. Common areas available. Enter on foot on Calle 6 and they will open the doors around the corner for you to drive in.

name: Berlin Campground
description: Nice campground good showers and toilets lots and lots of lake front camping area. Good wifi at the restaurant. Few good level areas

name: Mototest
description: Extremely helpful motorcycle shop with great service. Ask for "El Pote" - he's super. All types of bikes can be serviced, diagnosed and fixed here.

name: Hotel Santa Cruz
description: We could stay at the parking lot and use the showers and electricity of a room. Friendly people but unbelievable hot!

name: Restaurante El Chiringuito -  Medellin
description: Great restaurant offering sea food. Small restaurant, run by chef Juliana. Highly recommended.

name: Centro Recreacional Marcelandia
description: Nice place to stay. Various options to park the RV. Electricity and water available. Very friendly people. Near to termas. In the centro can do several activities as horse-riding, fishing, hiking. Only downside: the shower was hot (electric shower head) but dirty... Price: Feb 2017 - 20'000$ per person.

name: Hostal San Nicolas
description:
Away from the road, calm except dogs, very good restaurant, grassy and fairly flat terrain, wifi, games for children 25.000COP

(www.ushulaska.be)A l'écart de la route;calme sauf les chiens;très bon restaurant ;terrain herbeux et assez plat;wifi;jeux pour enfants;25.000COP

name: La Viña Hotel Campestre
description: Lovely hotel just off of the main square. 50,000COP. Pool. Comfortable bed. Security cameras on all parking areas.

name: Cerro Monserrat en Aguadas
description: Aguadas on the top of the Cerro Monserrat you'll find an amazing place in the middle of the sky. Great view, security 24 hrs. César, the security guy is very friendly, like Fernando, the man of the information site in town. They Will help you with anything. Water, Toilets and showers and FREE! Lovely town, the road from Pintada is half grave and half pav, but we made it with a 28feets RV, so any car can drive thru. Very recommended!!! /// En el pueblo de Aguadas, sobre el cerro Monserrat se puede pasar la noche en un lugar increíble en el medio del cielo con vistas geniales! Hay baños y duchas y un cuidador, César, 24 hrs que es súper buena onda. También Fernando, el del centro de información turística en el pueblo es muy amable y te da una mano con lo que sea. El pueblo es muy auténtico y su gente súper amistosa. El camino desde Pintada es mitad pavimentado y mitad de ripio, pero en condiciones transitables. Nosotros lo hicimos con un bus de 8,5mtrs de largo así que cualquier vehículo puede hacerlo. Muy recomendable! Y Gratis!

name: Capilla Real
description: Small, clean, comfortable hotel right on the plaza. After three days camping in Barichara and a long and dusty -yet beautiful drive, a hot shower before heading to Cocuy felt great. WiFi available. A bit noisy at night.

name: Hotel Arturs
description: 30,000 Basic hot shower. Indoor parking for two bikes

name: Yamaha Berlimotos
description: If you need a pre border oil change, this is the place to do it. SUPER nice people, very helpful and it's nice to work with a lift :) Charge 3,000 pesos for their assistance which includes use of a machine that sucks the old oil out of the bike.

name: Police Station
description: If you want to spend a night in Gabriel Garcia Marquez birthplace and visit the museum this is a free option. Parking lot next to police station is safe and quiet.

name: Hidden Trail
description: Hidden behind trees. Awesome landscape with panorama with. I guess noisy during the week, but parkes saturday night.

name: Ave Maria Statue
description: Uphill on the right side you can find a place to rest for the night. Nice view on 3330m.

name: Without Anything
description: It's close to the road so it isn't the quietest place, but will do it. There is a river nearby.

name: El Negro (Adolfo)
description: Very good mechanic. He helped us with breaks and maintenance.

name: Villa Silvania
description: Recreation area with pool's and so on. First he ask for a big rig and two persons 300.000 at the end we agreed on 50.000.The normal daily fee is 36.000 for two persons.

name: Hotel Pradero Del Oriente
description: Big parking lot in the middle of nowhere. A good overnight place for RV or and Hotel, Nice guys and safe parking

name: Finca El Manantial, Vida Campestre Camp
description:
Please contact us in advance of arrival using messages only by  
WhatsApp (57) 315 385 9820
Open from 7.00 am - 5.00 pm 
Monday to Saturday

Prices:
Vehicle (1 o 2 guests)                        $50,000 day/vehicle 
Additional guests & children      $20,000 each person/day
Occasional visitors                          $15,000 per entry
Electrical connection 110v          $15,000 per day
Water connection                            $15,000 per day
Laundry                                                 $25.000 per load
Car parking                                          $40,000 per day

Vida Campestre forms part of a small farm (El Manantial) with a rural hillside location overlooking the Islas del Rosario.  
Slightly cooler and much quieter than Cartagena and its surrounding villages.
Internet available from 9.00 am - 5.00 pm
Abundant running water and grassy camping spaces. 

Reception and check out: 
8.00 AM - 5.00 PM (Monday to Saturday)

We welcome:
Campervans, Cars with trailers, Mobile Homes, Big Rigs, Motorbikes with tents.

name: Natural Bath
description: Quiet beautiful place with a river nearby. Locals come here for picnic and the owner said camping is fine. Free. Music and beer until 7, afterwards i have been alone.

name: La Pradera
description:
The picture shows the first entrance gate from the gravel road (bright green gate). The property itself is behind the second gate. Watch out for the iOverlander sign "Established Campground" at the gate. For any questions, our cell phone and WhatsApp number is (+57) 324 685 9291. We are open 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.  If possible, phone or send a message prior to arrival. Otherwise, ask the neighbors to contact us (our property is behind theirs).

We are a Colombian couple (Gloria and Albeiro) and we are pleased to receive tourists from all over the world. La Pradera is a beautiful farmhouse with large spaces to rest, where you will also have the opportunity to practice and improve your Spanish. It is a green place with six lovely dogs and four friendly cats with which the whole place is shared.

We welcome travelers who wish to camp or who are traveling in campervans, trailers, motorbikes, etc. In La Pradera, you can leave your vehicle for short or long periods. We will also gladly take care of your pet.

From our property, you can reach Cartagena's beaches and historic center in 45 minutes by car, and Playa Blanca in 40 minutes.

Prices:
- $25k COP each person/night
- $15k COP each laundry service
- $20k COP parking service for vehicles without visitors (each night)

name: Hotel Minca
description: Easy access to hotel for small and medium cars campsites close to the centre. 20 000 pesos a very unpleasant nuit direction formally prohibiting access to toilets and sinks, forbidding to take water and recharge a computer into an outlet, refusing to give wifi code but I thought I saw that this one is: Nno interest to stay there too long.

name: Hotel Colombia Real
description: Conveniently located near the Sociedad Portuaria (and the Seaboard Marine office)... A decent hotel that cost us 72.000cop during high season for a couple with A/C and TV. Small restaurants and a mini market right across the street. No secure parking when you get your vehicle back, but they have a small space in front of the hotel with 24h staff in the lobby.

name: Ciénaga EcosTruck Parking
description: Truck drivers come to sleep in their hammocks. We camped on our tents behind The gas station. No showers or toilets, but quiet, calm and secured. There's also a little hotel so we guess it has restaurant and restrooms but the place to camp is nice for one night.

name: Rio Negro
description: Clean and quiet. Big pool. Lots of hammocks and a common area. Tent specific sites. Also do tours and river rafting. Pre-order restaurant, let them know before hand and they'll make something. 18000COP per person. Lots of space!

name: Near Plaza Grande
description: There are no amenities. Security, in front, shopping's guard. There are bathrooms and internet free in shopping until 9 p.m.

name: Parador Fogón Paisa
description: Restaurant, hotel and big parking lot for big trucks. Nice food, open until 9pm. Plenty of space to park. Toilets in the restaurant. The said you can pay 5.000cop to take shower at the hotel.

name: Hacienda normandia
description: Amazing homestay in 150 yr old hacienda. Accommodation from 40,000pesos per person for shared bathroom (beautiful room with private bathroom 170,000). Beautiful sitting room with fire and lots of games. Went riding in the morning for 40,000 for 30 minute ride (can do a 3 hour ride for 100,000), and had fresh delicious milk from the cows. Great breakfast included. Super kind host Camillo.

name: Carvidrios (Auto Glass Shop)
description: Excellent job making custom glass for my VW Vanagon.

name: Varanasi Hotel Boutique Aeropuerto
description: Nice little Hotel, walking distance from airport, all amenities seem to be brand-new. Service people are very friendly and helpful. English speaking. I paid 55 USD/Night including breakfast.

name: Esso fuelstation
description: greval ground with an hotel if you want. nice toilets and free shower. between a few trucks.

name: Talbot / Alejandro Sanchez Land Rover
description: A good man that is able to fix Land Rover. It was indicated for Land Rover group of Colômbia in facebook.

name: Riverside. Rio Guaitara
description:
Free.  I used Google Maps to view the road on the other side of the cathedral and river. A bit of a drive. Continue on the road past Los Lajas. In the tiny town of Potosi, continue straight to a dirt road, then take the first right. Follow the dirt road until you get to a small bridge. Good, quiet spot for the night. 1 minute walk to the overlook. It's also possible to park next to the houses at the overlook. Best views of Las Lajas. Very quiet at night.  No services or bathrooms. 
….
Perfecto para los más aventureros. La iglesia va a quedarte en tu ventana!!!
Si caminas hacia el ángel en la última casa la señora es muy amable y podría prestarte el baño.

name: Antenna site
description: Room for 3 or 4 tents and a few bikes or possibly two trucks. Rough road access 4x4 required. The guy manning the outpost cooked us a meal for 10k and charged us 10k each to camp. Unbelievable views! Worth a look even if not staying the night. There is a tap that has water that is good to drink at the corner of the building. (needs pliers to turn on). If you ask nicely he will let you use his toilet.

name: Calle 11 - Former Home Of The Cartel
description: You want to live like a drug lord? That's the place to be. This mansion was built by the columbian drug cartel and is now turned into a nice hostel with swimming pool, hammocks and roof terrace. They don't have private parking but the area is considered as safe. If you park in front of the hostel, there is 24/7 video surveillance and a guard is watching for your car, too. It's not a typical overlander place but still nice to see. Road is narrow, maybe not suitable for big rigs.

name: Hotel Parquedero
description:
Admin note - could be that the GPS coordinates are wrong and it is 5km to the west. 

A truck stop right on the highway. A very friendly couple (Guillermo and his wife) own this place. They have about 12 small rooms that they rent out to truckers. The rooms are very basic: small bed, toilet, shower and TV. There is also a small pool which was quite dirty on the day we were there. Plenty of space to park your vehicle. If you have a very long cable, you might be able to reach an electricity plug. Guillermo’s wife can prepare you a nice and simple meal for almost nothing. It’s not really a restaurant. Just a counter with 4 chairs. We can use their 2 toilets and 2 showers. No internet.

name: Safe Parking Lot
description: Gated parking lot.  3m high entrance.  Tight turn from street may be difficult for big rigs.  Open 6am to 10pm, so you will be locked in overnight.   No facilities.  5000 per night, and 1300 per hour during the day.

name: Tambo Filandia o Mirador Tambo Filandia
description: The stop is called Tambo Filandia or Mirador Tambo Filandia. A good place for an overnight stop, it has a cafe that closes at 7:00 pm and in front of it there are two restaurants. Additionally it is in front of a police station and has 24 hour security. Keep in mind that it is in the middle of the highway so it can be a bit noisy. ———————————— La parada se llama Tambo Filandia o Mirador Tambo Filandia. Un buen lugar para una parada de una noche, tiene un cafe que cierra a las 7:00 pm y al frente hay dos restaurantes. Adicionalmente se encuentra al frente de una estación de policia y tiene seguridad las 24 hrs. Tener en cuenta que esta en la mitad de la autopista por lo que puede ser un poco ruidoso.

name: Hotel Portada
description: Hostel with rates starting at C$ 30,000 in high season for a single including decent breakfast (eggs, bread, coffees and juice) and communal shower (cold). The restaurant serves fantastic Colombian home cooked food and owners are very friendly! Gated parking for Motos and small vehicles also available. The homemade Icecream is absolutely delicious.

name: Aragon
description: It's an Art Deco style building with good location and nothing's changed since it was built. But the rooms and corridors are airy and privates (shared bathroom) go for 25,000k. Good location and has wifi. As for parking you need to find a private place as the hotel has nothing for neither Motos or cars

name: Diego Motos
description: The best mechanic in all of Columbia!! Come here for a place to work on your bike drink beer and hang out with Diego and his friends! Super friendly and generous people who don't seem to want any money will buy all the beer.

name: Los Pinos
description: Miguel was the guy at the gate. I paid 3.000 COP for access to the road and to camp for the night. There is a group of trees with a good view over town. There are no toilets or water available here. There were a lot of people until it got dark, but I was the only one here at night.

name: Terpel - Posto combustível
description:
Parking with 24h surveillance. 5.000,00PC.

Estacionamento com vigilância 24h. 5.000,00PC. Com borracharia anexa.

name: Estacionamento
description:
Ample parking, in the center of town, fenced in, guarded, unrestricted in size but dusty. No infrastructure. 

Estacionamento amplo, no centro da cidade, cercado, vigiado, sem restrição de tamanho mas, poeirento. Sem infraestrutura.

name: Radiadores San Miguel
description:
Office of radiators. If it is not repaired they can make one. Very attentive staff. Is there Wi-Fi. 

Oficina de radiadores. Se não tiver conserto podem fabricar um. Pessoal muito atencioso. Tem WiFi.

name: Adelaide Hotel
description: Big parking lot. Quiet. $10000 per person. Very sunny and a great pool. They offered us a shady spot by the water but it was still under construction. They also let us shower in a room. Very friendly! Can be noisy on the weekends as local kids come and party at the pool until 3:00AM.

name: Hostal Cabana La Isla
description:
Price February 2023 : $20.000 COP per person (car camping - tent camping). 
Awesome place: beautiful birdwatching (30 species in site!), river for having a bath, completely quiet, and just 10 min drive from town.
Wifi, nice showers, good kitchen and very friendly owners.

name: Hotel Luz Mery
description:
Best hotel we saw in Aguachica. There are tons of hotels in this town, the others we saw on iOverlander either were not at the given GPS coords, or were pretty lacking. We stopped at several others that also weren't very desirable.  

Luz Mery was clean, secure, had good WiFi, was dog friendly, gated parking (good for rigs under about 2.8m). The main strip down Aguachica on which Luz Mery and many other hotels are situated isn't much to look at during the day, although there are several restaurants, grocery and hardware stores nearby. But at night everybody comes out and smaller food vendors set up on the street.  

Paid $55k COP for double with AC and private bath

name: Estacionamento e oficina.
description:
Parking and workshop - back yard. They can provide water and electricity. Very nice owner. 

Estacionamento e oficina - de fundo de quintal. Podem fornecer água e eletricidade. Proprietário muito agradável.

name: Terpel - Posto Combustível
description:
Parking with 24h surveillance. Rubracharia attached. 5k overnight stay. 

Estacionamento com vigilância 24h. Borracharia anexa. 5k pernoite.

name: Manglar de las Garzas - FOE
description: Large, well maintained recreation complex at the beach with swimming pools, restaurant, general room. Place for campers consists of a pebble area surrounded by large, leafy trees. 110V and water at sites. Next to coastal road. COP 48000 for 2 adults and camper.

name: CAI, Chipre policia
description: If you need sleep onde night in Manizales, you can parking here. Near a police station (24h). There are a lot of restaurant around and a minimarket. Bathroon in bars or you can ask with police to use in police station. There is a bealtiful view in "mirador" of Chipre neighborhood.

name: Motorrad
description: This is a professional motorshop with European standard. They have highquality equipment such as gloves,helmets, jackets, shoes and bags. They also offer RAM systems. If you're driving a big motorbike this is the place to get your bike fixed. Staff is super friendly and have a lot of knowlegde on nice offroad tracks as they are also offering tours.

name: UMO Mofles
description: Excellent mufflers builder and repair shop. Focused on big trucks. Gas-Insultated-Welding. They built me a complete new muffler for 100 USD.

name: La Playa de Belén - Football Court
description: Football Yard. Free. Safe. Since Overnight Parking at the National Park Entrance "Los Estoraques" is no longer allowed, this is a good alternative, that is recommended by the park Ranger. People will come, especially children - they are just nosy and curious depending on the vehicle you are driving. The more exotic, the more people *haha* But don't worry - they are extremely friendly and they'll respect your privacy.

name: Parque Ciudad del Rio
description: Noisy on weekends. In front Art Museun there are security guards 24 hours, but you can park only in weekends because is prohibided  during the week.During the week is better park in front "parque". There is bathroon until 6 p.m., free, outside museum. There are some restaurants, sibway in gas station near. Some open WiFi but not fast.

name: Europa Repuestos
description:
This is the shop were you get spare parts for your european car. They even got parts for our Peugeot engine that not even exist in southamerica in only 2 days, its a miracle. Very friendly and helpfull! 
www.europarepuestos.com
whatsapp: 3014124372

name: Taoist Community
description: We just past by but thought a description would be useful to others. This is some sort of Christian/hippy community living in a combination of huts made from plastic sheets and nice houses. There is a guard station at each end but they give no problems. not sure what they do for money. They did seem friendly enough but we did not feel like stopping for the night.

name: Betatown
description: A best place to rest and the best restaurant in Salento

name: Pull out on the road to Toche
description: Small pull out on the road to Toche/Salento. There are not many possibilities to camp along this road. From here it's about an hour drive to Toche and two to Salento.

name: Betatown Bar&Grill
description:
Decent burger for South America. Was a little dry but better than 90% of burgers in SA.

Burgers starts at 11k sans fries.

Fries are 5k more

They add 15% tip on the bill.

name: Valley view on dry conditions
description: Nice grassy area at the road from Toche to Salento. Viewable from the road, but not busy.  Great view over the valley. Very quiet.

name: Hotel near gas station
description: A good place (free) to stay at night in a small city. In front of hotel with a restaurant. Toilets in gás station. Shower in hotel, processo 5000 COP. Quite and safe

name: Susacón (Junction 64, 55)
description: Gravel lot right beside a little school. You can hide behind an advertisement banner. Little traffic, so it is quiet.

name: Budget hotel
description: Great Budget Hotel Clean And Best Par tis Less Than $20,00 Per Night For 2 People. Huge parking space at the back for trucks and big rigs plenty of parking in the front just behind gas station. Paid 30,000pp. Clean, air conditioning, tv , drinking water, coffee and wifi. Good stop on Long drive to Medellin from Cartagena...restaurant  is there but we didn't get to try as we were well stocked.

name: Small Hotel By The Side Of The Road
description: Small hotel with few restaurants and wifi. We paid 32000CP for Two people with private bathroom. Hot showers. Parking across the road, safe and guarded at night. Any size will fit. As close to road you do hear trucks but at night quietens a bit.

name: Autocor ltd., Dealer for mazda, ford and volkswagen VW
description:
Good and professional work, moderate price, friendly, speditive service. Dealer: Mazda, Ford and VW Volkswagen
City Monteira, N8.75054; W75.87908

name: Little Meadow
description: We were coming from San Gil and it took us around 6h on the dirtroad to get here, with stopping to take some pictures and enjoying the beautifull scenery. We ran out of daylight and we took the wrong dirtroad from Onzaga to the other iOverlander places, so we ended up here. Turn left on the road from Onzaga to Road55 into a little dirtroad and follow it a few hundret meters and then turn right into this little meadow. You will notice the meadow cause there is a funny circle in the middle. Close to there are farmers living, which are very welcoming, nice and friendly, they even wanted to invite us for coffee and watch out for white rabbits.

name: Embalse de Tominé
description:
Next to camping La Huerta is a small cafe, restaurant, shop with camping facilities. You can also camp on the other side of the road (follow a smal road opposite the restaurant) where they have several campspots. Beautifull view over the lake. Quit.
We paid k15 for 2 persons.

name: Hotel Plaza Rosa
description: Nice hotel, good place to explore Medellin, we paid $ 60.00 for two person for a night incl. breakfast. They have parkinglots for smaller campers/pick up campers.

name: Serviteca la YE JB
description: its hard to find full synthetic motoroil in colombia, they had it. we made there a big inspection for our mazda pick up, incl. new brake pats. all original parts. they did a good job. fast, cheap and professional.

name: Peaje
description: Near of "peaje". There is toilet and security 24 hours. Noise but safe near of road to Santa Marta. There is water.

name: Sierraventura
description:
We paid 25000 COP for a shared dorm with cold air. Nice pool, bar, fast wi-fi, good kitchen, TV, nice common area. There is a parking area out front with security cam. 

Can park/sleep out front in level (semi-secure) parking area and use all hostel facilities for 15,000pp.

name: Hotel La Artilleria
description: Nice Hotel in the hart of the old town of Cartagena. One of the best options to stay in Cartagena after or before shipping. Really friendly staff, clean and beautiful rooms, AC, Wifi, breakfast included, laundry next door. Price per night approx 60 us$ per room. Not for camping, no space for cars!

name: Hotel Altamar
description: Modern hotel with pool, wifi, free breakfast. Big secure parking lot under the hotel. Used it to clean my moto after the San Blas crossing from Panama. Good friendly staff 84,000colpesos for a double bed room. Laundry service as well but it was expensive.

name: La Toscana
description: Nice small hotel with restaurant in front. Easy to park any size RV inside. Chorisoz are great with drink for a $1 each. We also had dinner which was nice. Good stay after doing the hot springs for a night before heading towards Cali. Locals join you so a little noisy. We also could plug in electricity to our RV for refrigerator.

name: Listo Big Garage
description: I got new tires, new parts and laser measurement for the front suspension, because I had to clean the steering. Super friendly stuff and cheap as well.

name: Hostal Pelican Larry
description: Nice hostel with good wifi, hot shower, equiped kitchen, from 25k in dormis. And there is place to park a few bikes or one van for free. All bikes sellers are within a few blocks, and no difficulty to eat and have a drink in the same area. Recommended.

name: Al Bosque Hostel & Glamping
description:
Great spot in the mountains just outside Medellin & close to Santa Elena. Lots of hiking trails in and around Parque Arvi. 
Public transportation is available to Medellin… Depending on wait time for bus to take you to Parque Arvi and the destination in Medellin, you can get there in 30-45 minutes. 
Place has lots of nice grassy spots to park or camp. There are hot showers, good wifi, pool table, ping pong table, kitchen, large living space with fireplace as it gets chilly at night. Also a double private room with bath and dorms for good prices. Breakfast available (extra cost). Owner David is super helpful and friendly, highly recommend.

From Medellín, have your GPS plot a route to here and then add via point 6.23152, -75.53980 to avoid narrow alleys and 6.22695 -75.51930 as a via point to avoid a pretty steep road.

name: Taller Siferum
description: Felipe is a great mechanic!  Very knowledgeable and does great work! Quick turn around on new piston, rings, valve seals, and shims. If you need work done to your bike in Medellin, this is your spot. He loves touring bikes

name: Mundo Nuevo
description: Very steep and narrow road leading up the mountains from Minca. About 10minute drive out of town, not recommended for large RVs or motorbikes without a very skilled rider. Mundo Nuevo is a Hostal finca with dorm rooms for 20,000colpesos/night. Nice beds, showers, plenty of room to park bikes if you can make if. Fantastic views all the way to the pacific and Santa Marta. 12,000colpesos for each meal, (vegetarian food only) the food comes from the hostals gardens. Fast wifi, 3000colpeso beers. Very environmentally conscious group. Highly recommended if you can make it.

name: Hotel Koala Inn
description: Beautiful hotel in Pasto with big rooms and very private rooms. Just about the only budget option we could find as the other hotels on iOverlander appeared shuttered and everything else seemed pricey.

name: Lavanderia Salento
description: A good lavanderia in the town salento. we paid per clothes pieces, for 12 pieces 8000.00 pesos. wash and dry. fast and fresh!

name: La Cima Restaurant
description: We weren't allowed to enter the park in the evening, so we ran out of daylight and ask these very friendly and helpfull restaurant owners. They let us stay on their parkinglot right next to the street and let us use their bathroom over night. From up there you have an amazing view over the valley, at night with the lights of northern Bogota in the background. It was very quiet in the night and we felt very safe there. You recognize the restaurant on the windows which some are green, orange or blue.

name: Color Hostel
description: Air conditioned dorm rooms, small pool, great hammocks. Parking is for motorcycles only.

name: Auteco_Kawasaki & KTM Parts
description: All kawasaki parts available at the lowest price (Kawa in Calle 10A was fairly more expensive). The shop is called Auteco, with blue walls.

name: MotoBox
description: New workshop opened by Carlos Messa (ex-MotoAngel & Suzuki Moto Service).

name: La Mesa
description: Nice leveld parking lot beside a small restaurant (comedor). Spectacular views. The owners Maria and Pedro are super friendly people. The welcomed me so heart warming. Stayed here for 1 night and they invited me to their nearby home, shared their fruits and showed me their coffee Plantation. If you come here, give them a hug from me and enjoy these incredible people.

name: Las Quinchas
description:
Roadside, Gravel, Quite. I just pulled out because driving this very long dirt road Nr. 60 from Chiquinquirá to Puerto Boyacá killed me today. I expected this road to be paved, but it isn't. All the way with lots of roadwork. The average speed I could go was about 3 ~ 5 km/h. But with my 12 Tons Truck I have to be superslow anyway. Maybe with an SUV you can go faster, but it's really bumpy. The landscape is spectacular. Really nice to see. If it's worth to go this road? Not with the kind of vehicle I run. With Landy or similar - yes. Bthw 4x4 is not necessary. Normal Busses use this road too.
Foto: Showing the road conditions in general, not (!) the place described here. That is much nicer *haha*

name: pescado trinidad
description: Fish restaurant, they let us stay for free. lots of space beside the fishlakes. big rigs friendly. you can fish your own meal. very friendly owners

name: Posada Turistica Dantayaco / Camping
description:
It is a small house with lots of backpackers. They charge 5000 per person to let you sleep in your car next to the house. (2019 note : it's FREE if you sleep in your van) 
Motorcycles are very welcome since the new admin.

name: Clinicars
description: Probably one of the best mechanic for old VW beetles and VW Kombis in Colombia. It's actually an VW club but with a workshop combined. They let us camp there. Nice owner and experienced mechanic.

name: Trampolina del Muerte
description:
It took us 4 hours from San Augustin to Mocoa and from there to Sibundoy another 4-5hours. The road from Mocoa to Sibundoy is a dirtroad but not in a very bad shape but it takes its time. The first rivercrossing, from this direction coming, is the worst one of all of them, it can get rough when its raining a lot, but all the locals pass it as well with their motorbikes and small cars...
Beautifull scenery on this road when the sky is clear!

name: Llantas Estadio
description:
We went to Iguana4x4 with our non-4x4 vehicle. Hernando from Iguana said he did not have the parts for our vehicle and recommended this place. They put in new brake pads, repaired a flat, changed our front tire rods, ball joints and bearings. They don't speak English but took extra time with us to explain and write everything down to make sure we fully understood everything. Good hourly rate, and they charged us less than their estimate.  The mechanic took time to show us and explain what he did on our vehicle. We were quite happy with the service we received here. 
To find the place look for Michelin man over the large yellow and blue shop.

name: Cundur Parking
description: Grassy and flat parking place near the Panam (but very quiet at night!)...good for a night to make a brake driving the up and down road...definetly safe!(Gate closed at night and a guard is there all the time!)official they charge 2'000.- per vehicle...

name: La Casona
description: 70 000 Cop for 2. Nice owners. AC, WIFI. There are a couple of parkings around, 5000 cop per night.

name: Parque Riogrande2
description: It is a Parkinglot near the Lake, at the lower part near the wall they don't let us stay over night, just daytime. It is quite and relaxed, a handful of cars and the milk truck passed. At night no noise at all.

name: Panaderia Peter Pan
description: We could stay in front of the house, use the bathroom and wifi. We got breakfast the next morning (5000COP) and could stay for free with that.

name: Vacant Lot
description: The village is small, plenty of restaurants, police station, friendly people, we asked where to stay and where directed to this vacant lot with flat parking. There are toilets in town. Free

name: Lubricentro
description: Oil exchange - we only had to pay for the oil, work was included. Nice people

name: Tempel
description: After a long drive in the dark through the mountains we had to pull over. There is a night guard, first he wanted nothing and on the next day he asked for 7.000 Pesos. Safe place to get some sleep

name: Enlace Caribe SAS
description:
Ship to and from Panama.
And to all other places all over the world.

ENLACE CARIBE SAS 
Edificio Laguna 46 Centro de Negocios 
El Cabrero, Avenida del Lago Marbella 
Carrera 3 No. 46-51 Oficina 1201 
Tel +57 (5) 664 6145 - 6446022

name: Tatacoa - just another spot
description: Just another wild Camping spot in Tatacoa. Quit, safe and police came just to check if everything is OK. Very friendly. Hidden from the dirt road. Spectacular view into the desert. Very hot. Many mosquitoes, so be prepared.

name: Balneario Juanchito
description: Balneario in the middle of nowhere. Paradise in the desert heat. The pools are clean, well maintained and refreshing. Water is unprocessed natural source. Super friendly owners. They let me park on the well leveld Gravel parking lot in front of the Balneario. Just paid the Balneario entrance fee and had some beer at the bar. They didn't ask for any overnight fee. The people are great and especially the kids are heartwarming, smart and well educated. Give them a hug from me as you see them!

name: In Front Of Fire station " Bomberos "
description: Free parking, free wifi from town . Toilets and running water in sports centre next to parking

name: Camping Rio Tolota
description:
Very basic campsite on the rivercoast. 
Quiet place.
Please ask in the nearby Restaurante El Mezon.
Access for free.

name: Cascada de los caballero
description: Beautiful waterfall about 60m high

name: El Paraiso
description:
23,000 Colombian pesos for 2 people, is a hotelier on the side of the road, has a closed circuit security, are friendly those who attend in place 

23,000 pesos colombianos  por 2 personas, es un hoteliro al lado de la carretera, tiene circuito cerrado de seguridad, son amigables los que atienden en lugar

name: Camping Rio Tolota
description:
Very basic campsite on the rivercoast.
Quiet place.
Please ask in the nearby Restaurante El Mezon.
Access for free

name: Fatto in Casa - Homemade Focaccia
description: They make really good homemade bread and Focaccia. Super lovely people. They also have good pastas and sandwichs.

name: Posada Campesina
description:
15,000 per person, in a room with bathroom, there is a kitchen and it is clean 

15,000 por persona, en habitación con bańo, hay cocina y esta limpio

name: Hotel Relax
description:
Nice, clean place for 40 000 cop/double room. There is a parking lot just in front, 8000 cop per night. 
Got noisy early in the morning, though.

name: DIAN Office
description: To extend the Import Permit of Cars Or Bikes. 2 Floor in the right Hand corner. Them 3. Floor Archiv

name: Hotel Central
description: It's a simple hotel, rooms with bed for 2 people or separated beds for 20.000 - 35.000 COP  p. person depending if there is tv, fan, shared or private bathroom. Simple and cheap, just by the Central Park. No parking lot but there is a 'parqueadero' one block away 2k for motorcycle (I don't know for a car). Very simple place, walls are very thin, located on the second and third floor above a clothes shop and a bakery in the center of Mocoa.

name: Parking lot Guatapé
description: Guarded and no free parking the weekend, but free and non guarded (but safe) from monday to friday. We paid 5000p for the sunday afternoon and it was ok to stay overnight. At 100m from the zocalo and perfect for visiting the village. We finally stay 2 nights. Quiet even if we hear a lot of frogs in the night ! In the morning, 3 horses spent some time near us and then go away, alone !

name: Hotel Paradise
description:
Clean and nice place for stop over, 35 000 for double room. Right next to the train. 
There is a parking lot two blocks away, 9000 per day and 9000 per night, so 18 000 for 24h.

name: Hostal Huaka-Yo
description:
Note - Camping is not permitted.

It's a Finca with Hostal and Restaurant. Beautiful gardens, flowers, coffee. Quite and safe. Restaurant and restrooms are super clean. The buildings are pretty new. Two beautiful and friendly German Shepherds are strolling around. This is a place you can hang out for several days, as I did. Walking distance to the nearby Parque Arqueologico is 500m.
