THIS PLACE IS CLOSED FOR CAMPERS/OVERLANDERS. "HUAKA-YO" IS A HOSTAL/RESTAURANT AND THEREFORE NOT PREPARED TO HOST CAMPERS. BUT ITS STILL HIGHLY RECOMMENDED TO VISIT THIS BEAUTIFUL, PEACEFUL PLACE FOR THOSE WHO ENJOY GOOD FOOD, COFFEE AND TRUE COLOMBIAN HOSPIDALITY.

name: Finca Villa Maria
description:
There is a hotel to stay and they have a small space to park a van, so we spend a night in our van. The parking lot is with inclination but at the bottom there is leveld ground for one or two vans. 
15 000 cop per person. Coffee tour 20 000 per person. They have a swimming pool and a lot of space around. They served us coffee, juice and fried bananas with cheese for free. 
They said they usually don't let people to use kitchen, but since it was just two of us in the whole Finca, there was no problem. They also opened one of the rooms for us to take hot shower. Really nice place.

name: Dundal
description: Small Village in the nowhere... But the old trainway is good for a night. Right in front of the small village is a flat space. Good for Trucks.

name: Hotel El Álamo
description: A bit scruffy around the edges but has a huge car park for motos or cars. There is only hot water between 6 and 9 am. Rooms generally have attached bathrooms and those on the fourth floor are supposed to be the best. Wifi in the lobby and in rooms if you are near the router. Singles from 45.000 COP. I came here because Hotel Solar down the road was full.

name: Cocuy Backroad
description: Not listed on OSM but this road between La Uvita and Chita exists. This road is absolutely fantastic and is well worth the time if you enjoy taking small, remote and lonely mountain roads.

name: El Paraiso De Adriana
description: Nice little hotel that allows camping. Small secure parking for two small campers. Pool, shower (cold), toilets, wifi (fast), hammocks & sitting area, electricity at site, quiet! The owner wanted 50,000 cop and we agreed on 40,000 after some discussing. We were the only guests at the time and the hotel seems to be a bit run down but still worth the money. Only a short walk from the historical centre, but definitely not worth visiting. Very hot after some cool days up in the mountain. Dog friendly!!

name: Hotel Dorado Ferial
description:
Nice and small hotel. Our room was super clean and had a big bathroom. The breakfast was delicious and the stuff was very friendly. Fast WiFi. 100% recommended!
$97'500 for a double room.

name: Oz Hotel
description:
NOTE -  the photos shown are for the BARAHONA hotel whichis located in the next street so please disregard

We had a big and modern double room which was perfectly clean. Great breakfast buffet, fast WiFi, A/C. $220'000

name: hotel Gilvar
description:
Hotel with double rooms with bathroom. Looks new (but isn't on the inside). 40.000 per room including car park. Cold showers only.
.....
Hotel con habitaciones dobles con baño. parece nuevo, 40.000.

Price 11-2023 for one person: 25.000

name: Plantation house
description: just outside of town but walking distance. great hot shower. comfy beds. dogs allowed. other property dogs are nice. parking is 200 meters away at the owners house.

name: Pachamama
description:
Finca with double rooms or up to 4 people with private bathroom and hot water. Breakfast and wifi. Area for camping flat. 50,000 per person including breakfast. To camp 15,000 per person. 5 minutes from the archaeological park. 

Finca con habitaciones dobles o hasta 4 personas con baño privado y agua caliente. desayuno y wifi.  zona para acampar plana. 50.000 por persona incluido desayuno. Para acampar 15.000 por persona. A 5 minutos del parque arqueológico.

name: Refugio In The Road
description: parking lot of the toll, In the border of road! Safe point

name: Romerillo Beach
description:
Parking lying in the lagoon, quiet, safe, no services, friendly people live nearby! Free parking, you can make fire, fish but the dirt and gravel road is a bit difficult. 

Parqueo acostado de la laguna, tranquilo, seguro, sin servicios, personas amables viven cerca! Free parking , se puede hacer fuego, pescar pero el camino de tierra y ripio es un poco difícil.

name: COMPAS
description:
Step 3 : here is the place where you get your vehicule if you use a roro ship from Panama.
(step 1 = get the BL at your compagny office in Cartagena, step 2 = ask for an inspection at DIAN at Manga in Cartagena).
At this place there will be the inspection of your vehicule, you will pay for the inspection and the port and then you could go out with your vehicule

----------------------------------------------

 Hopefully your taxi driver found COMPAS in El Bosque. ( 10°23′45.33″N 75°31′23.93″W ) Go to the reception and have your passport and your ID ready. She will keep the ID and give you a Vistor ID. Enter Compas and turn right to the DocumentsCenter. Get an number and wait to be called. Have the Bill and your passport (copy) ready. A picture from your car can help the here to understand what you want. For me it was fine to have a snapshot on my cell. Pay two bills they gave to you, in total 900.000$col, at the banko right in the same office. After you paid in cash, turn right to the next window and show there, that you have paid both. Go to window 5 and show there also all your papers. Ask them for copys of the bills they are going to keep. You get a form, that allows you to leave the port with your car. You need two copies of this. One is for you, one for the gate, and one for the security guy. Exit Centro de Documento, and go straight to the Centro de Accesso and ask for your vehicle. They wil give you a hv outfit and a helmet. With this you enter the port, and a shuttle bus wil drive you to an office where all your three copies will stamped, you will see your vehicle, and you can drive out. Don't forget to drive to the main entrance, return your sexy outfit and the visitor ID. Interesting facts: -Hopefully YOUR shipping company has also send the keys with the cars. For us, the keys where lost and it took a little bit longer to get the car.. -If you should write your Passport number as reference for the Bill, check with the number called NIT on the Bill. For us, they took a part from some number they found on the passport, but not the one called: Passport No.

name: How to get your vehicle back if shipped with SCLine
description:
First step, find JansMar at 10°23′15.76″N 75°30′39.91″W to get your Bill. This is a white building in the third floor. It is very easy, enter, get the paper, done. They are closed for lunch from 1 to 3pm.
After this, come here. Enter DIAN at the corner Cal26 Cra25, tell the security you need to go to Aduana. You will get a batch. Go straight and turn right, go straight threw the building, to the next building located behind the first. Ask there at the reception for the, '' FORMULARIO DE IMPORTACION TEMPORAL DE VEHICULOS''. Someone needs to see your Bill from Jans, and will give you than a form. With all details filled in this form, you need to exit DIAN again, and on the other corner of the same crossing where you have to return your security batch, you will find an entrance with a small sign: copy. Make one copy from: JansMar Bill, Vehicle Title, your passport page with your foto, your passport page with the entrance stamp from the airport, the customs Formular from panama for the vehicle (not the one you got from the inspection,it is the one you had already while driving threw panama, but they gave you a new version with details of exiting panama) and your driver license. make also two copies of the form you got from DIAN. With all of this you have to return to DIAN where you got your form and let them do their work with those papers.
While waiting for them to return to you, you still should have one more copy of the DIAN form, because you made two and gave only one set and the original to the officer, and you can get your SOAT insurance. It is a 2min walk from DIAN Cal29 Cra26. Enter the yellow building and pay 52.000$col for 30 days. You will need the DIAN form, the title, your passport and the address of your hotel. 
Return to DIAN, and hopefully it is as easy at it was for us, and you get directly the final document with the inspection done.
After this, go to COMPAS in El Bosque. There is the next step: How to get your Vehicle back if you shipped with SCLine - Part 2.

name: La vaca que rie
description:
Parador of dairy and sweets. With surveillance for the car, it is a good option if you touch peak and plate and you have to wait until 19:30 to enter Bogota. 

Parador de lácteos y dulces. Con vigilancia para el coche, es una buena opción si te toca pico y placa y has de esperar hasta las 19:30h para entrar en Bogotá.

name: Gas Station On The Road
description: We found this gas station after visiting the lake, clean toilets, warm shower, very save, b course it's in front of a police control.... Some restaurants next by.... Lots of truckers.....

name: Radiadores Martínez
description:
Radiator repair. Neighborhood workshop but very serious and economic 

reparación de radiadores. taller de barrio pero muy serios y económicos

name: Aires Turca
description:
They fixed the air conditioning of our Toyota. Very competent, explaining at all times what they were doing. Price very good also comparing with other sites that we were quoting. TOTALLY RECOMMENDED! 

Arreglaron el aire acondicionado de nuestro Toyota. muy competentes, explicando en todo momento lo que hacían. Precio muy bueno también comparando con otros sitios que estuvimos cotizando. TOTALMENTE RECOMENDABLE!

name: Playa Rodadero -Salguero
description:
Quiet spot at the beach, near a close restautant. Perfect for a couple of nights.
We felt save, some friendly locals visited us in the morning, and love couples during the night...
No services, but FREE

name: gasan
description:
at the end of a unpaved 
road, on the right. they can fill american cylinder. open later than the other adress.

name: Gas station - Motel - Restaurant
description: At the beginning we just want to overnight (it's ok near the restaurant) and take a shower (it's free near the motel). Finally we do as all truckers : take a room with AC and bathroom with shower. Room with 2 double beds (for 2 adults and 3 childrens) is 35.000. Clean. And we do as all truckers : eat in the restaurant. 12.000 for good meal. Fruits juice are very good. Owners of restaurant and motel friendly.

name: Taller Todo Fibra
description:
it's a specialist to repair bumpers. He works fast and cheap.

spécialiste des réparations de pare-chocs en fibre plastique. Travail rapide et pas cher.

name: hotel restaurant el cacique
description: little restaurant on the side of hotel. very good and cheap. possibility to stay overnight with trucks (big area) close to zeuss gas station. restroom and shower at the restaurant.

name: Gaz station Hotel Restaurant
description: You probably find best area on the way. We stay overnight for free. Safe, but not quiet, and food not so good...

name: Patinodromo de Arcabuco
description:
We stay between the patinodrome and the road to Villa de Leyva. Quiet, flat, nice and big enough for our RV. We ask to police before.
Don't forget to taste local meat : almorabana con queso. It's bread, good cheese and drink looks like tea.

Bivouac simple et sympa. Les enfants peuvent jouer sur le patinodrome. C'est très calme, on a pour seuls voisins les vaches du pré d'à côté à partir de 9h...
Ici, il fait frais et c'est bienvenue !
Ne passez pas à côté de la spécialité du coin, les bons fromages ne sont pas monnaie courante sur ce continent :-)

name: Gaz station
description: Ok to overnight but ask 6000 tips... And ask 6000 more to refill our water tank. Quiet, but nothing else...

name: Gaz Station
description: Not so big and a little bit noisy, but it was ok to overnight. Good small pasteleria around. At 6 o'clock in the morning, I hear a knock knock on our door. The 3 employees went going back and it's seems there waiting for a tips before to go. I give 6k, that was price in another gaz station. It looks like the rigth price...

name: Hotel restaurant El Mirador
description: Big parking lot for trucks. We sleep in the RV for 6000cop: quiet and safe place, with nice view (aside the hotel, not near the trucks !). Free cold shower and restroom 24h. Truckers take one of the 20 rooms (28000cop for double). Very friendly staff. Restaurant is 24h. Coffee, soup and today‘special for 12000 pesos . Simple, plentifull and good. A perfect stop on the road !

name: Hotel Ocasiones
description: Good room for 30.000 with Air Cond, parking in front with watchîng guy 24hours.

name: hotel restaurant for trucks
description: Big parking lot with a guard for the night. 10k for the night.

name: MERAKI, local & cosmo food
description:
After policemen explain us overlanders aren't welcome anymore in all public area of the town (some travelers let their trash everywhere), we meet Jorge, the owner of this restaurant. He's happy to meet overlanders and ask nothing else than time to share expérience of travel. He speaks spanish, english and french (he lived some times in Québec). His restaurant has a big parking lot close for night. We stay here 2 nights in our RV near a couple from Argentina in their van !
Toilets and a shower provided for campers. Wifi 24h.
The food isn't cheap but so good !! If you like crêpes, don't miss it !

 Good place to spend night. Parking free if you eat at the restaurant or 10000 pesos by night. Toilets. Good wifi free. Héctor and Martha very nice. Their daughter Anna-María is the new owner. They speak english and french. We visit an artisanal coffre plantation at 4 km (La Arzacia)

name: Central de Lubricantes CLF
description:
Change oils and filters. Very clean, serious, fast and economical. 

Cambio de aceites y filtros. Muy limpio, serio, rápido y economico.

name: Hotel Villa Paraiso
description:
Different location than the other nearby "Paraiso". Not to be confused. This hotel is pricier but worth the price. Much nicer accommodations if that's what you're looking for. Double room with AC for 85k COP. Singles for 60k COP. without AC for 20k less.

Secure parking, no height restriction at gate, but width limited to maybe 2.5m.

Pet friendly. they have a big black Lab, "Negro" and a cat. no problem staying with our dog. 

They are building a pool. (Already built in July 2022)

No hot water in showers but honestly not necessary in this climate and nobody in town has hot water.

There were tents in the courtyard. Room for overlanders in parking area. we didn't camp but sure it's possible, just ask.

Super friendly and helpful!

name: Terpel truck stop and Hotel
description: Large parking area  next to Terpel truck stop, guard, showers, toilet, sink, restaurant, wifi, every thing is free even the noise. Enjoy ;-)

name: Viewpoint Campspot Behind Restaurant
description: Viewpoint behind restaurant - amazing view over the valley and river. Nice owner (Eduardo). Buy dinner / breakfast to camp. Great views, warm climate, quiet, toilets at restaurant. Big concrete gazebo to cook / park under if it’s raining (at least 2.5m height).

name: Quiet spot near public swimming pool
description: Large grassy terrain next to football field, public swimming pools (open during day) and restaurant. Quiet, nice, easy access, free.

name: Large & Central car park
description:
Car park in the modern 'center' of Bogota. No height restriction! Safe, narrow-ish spots, but okay for cars/vans (Sprinter size would be the largest). Toilet. COP 20.000/24h. (depends on vehicle size) 

Ideal location.

name: Camp at bomberos/firefighters
description: Firefighters allowed me to camp without problems. Got sick and stayed for several days. Good folks, nice captain, toilets, free. As it was an emergency, they allowed me to use their hot shower, too.

name: Open terrain, walking distance to town centre
description: Green space a little outside the centre, very quiet, 5min walk to plaza, free

name: (Laguna Grande) Beach site camp
description:
Great spot right by the beach. Small hut, sun and shade, 5.000/night, nice owner. Lots of nice local kids. Restaurants nearby, a little expensive. Drinking water available for free 500m away at water treatment plant (daily amount rationed). Toilets near restaurants (charge).

READ CAUTION FOR THIS SITE - safe but take precautions

name: Quiet parking lot near police station
description: Quiet and shady parking lot of a centro recreacional, police post right on the spot. Free.

name: Commercial parking lot
description: Comemrcial parking lot right on the border, safe and - at night - quiet. Shops and food stalls nearby. Across the street from DIAN (customs) and Immigrations. COP 10.000/night. Accepts BsF., too.

name: Rodandero Santa Marta/Camping Cantamar
description: Campsite and Hostal owned and operated by Quique, situated between Rodadero and Salguero, with walking access to Playa Salguero. Individual pitches with limited shade. 110v power, WiFi and good 3G celular coverage. Quique charged us $10.000 COP for 2 people, per night...price was lower as he loves old VWs like ours, usually per person, per night. Discounts for longer stays. 2 rooms available for 6 persons. Showers, toilets etc. etc. Logs for sale ($5.000COP) for BBQs etc. Plenty of local shops and restaurants. A pair of large supermarkets (Ara and Rapi98mercar) nearby.

name: ecoparque Pance 1era entrada
description: parking place under trees. 10000/person. pool restaurant bar. shower by the pool. wifi didn't work when we passed.

name: Las Lajas parking of teleférico
description: There is a teleférico going down to sanctuario. You can sleep on the parking for free. Very easy for big RV. Toilets in the station. Guard at night. Good wifi at station even from parking place.

name: Reina del desierto
description: Nice place to stay at Sra. Margareta 's place. Huge parking lot in front of the house. Two rooms for rent, we could use bathroom and cold shower in one of them. 7000pP. Optional (huge) breakfast for 7000.

name: Red shaped Valley
description: From the restaurant is starting a path into the valley. We didn't do it because it was too hot, but there is a nice viewpoint.

name: Observatorio Tatacoa
description: Open daily from 6.45p.m. Small outdoor telescope, a very motivated employee shows you the sights, e.g Jupiter and some star clouds. Entrance 10.000pP.

name: Scenic Route - Tatacoa North or Reverse
description:
From Villavieja to pueblo Nuevo it's a (not too bad) dirt road. The bridge is for 40t (locals said that) and before and afterwards a high tunnel, so big rigs might also pass without problems. 
So from Tatacoa you don't need to go back the whole way to Neiva. Just be aware it takes around 2h.

name: Restaurante Casa Blanca
description:
A real good restaurant for having set menu at very aforable price. 
3 course for lunch at 9.500 COP or diner at 10.500 COP included limonade.

We was recomended by some locals and was positive surprised. Today a very delicios cream as starter, chicken brust with chips, salad and rice.

The best relation quality/price so far!!

name: gas station esso / restaurant parador las acacias
description: parking for trucks between gas station and restaurant. Was free. Was noisy during the night.

name: Hotel Sello Dorado
description: This is a great overnight stop. The hotel is clean, hot water shower is awesome, bed comfortable, staff friendly, wifi fast, and secure parking for motorcycles.

name: Donde Abilio Hotel
description: 28000 One room double bed air con restaurant next door

name: Playa Las Malvinas
description: It's a campground on the beach, with owner on site at all times. There are toilets and electricity. The owners name is Jaume redondo telephone 3126371117 you can just turn up or call first. 15000 cop per person per night. Very quiet clean beach.

name: karluz-light store with solar panels
description: They sell solar panels and inverters

name: Jardines del Caney
description: Box hotel at south end of Cali. Some rooms have kitchens. Gated parking doesn't allow high vehicles (2.3m). Some other covered parking taller, with 24hr guard shack 10m away. A few fast food restaurants and supermarkets walkable. 100,000cop for 2 people with queen beds.

name: La Casa del Agua Purificado
description: $1000 pesos for 5L and $3000 for 19L of purified water. Electronic water stand open 24/7

name: Autoservicio Vw Paredes Palencia
description:
Excellent Mechanical Workshop Volk'sWagen, very nice and helpfull, they repaired our Kombi's alternator and gave us a lot of mechanical and tourism tips.
Muy buen taller mecánico Volkswagen, repararon el alternador de nuestra Combi y nos ayudaron mucho con informacion de Colombia.

#Carrera 26 con Primera de Mayo Sur B Centenario
Luis Paredes fono 3115418239

name: Old hotel
description: You know how it goes. Not the best town, but we had to crash here. Looks like a old colonial-style hotel. We had a private room with airco for three with bunk beds and private bathroom. Paid 90. There is a big court yard to park cars. The facilities are not the best.

name: Naves- Agent WWL
description:
if you ship with WWL from Panama to Colombia. Mandatory to use them.
Really helpful. You pay them the full amount for shipping in COL at Helm Bank
additional Documentation Fee: 98 USD

name: Puerto Bahia
description:
our camper arrived here while shipping with WWL. Both fees both payable at Bank of Bogota
Port Fee: 103 USD
Inspection Fee: 25 USD
Accident/Life insurance needed.
attached is the guideline from WWL, but the part for the puerto is the same with whoever you ship

name: ToyoElite
description:
The best garage for Toyota in Bogotá. Jaime and his team will fix everything you need since they are specialists in this brand. 
We had to change the back transmission of our 4Runner (really hard to find the right one), repair the breaks, change oil and they did a great job.
They knew we were traveling with a budget so they tried to find the cheapest parts.
We really recommend them!

name: Autoservicio Paredes Palencia VW
description:
Best place if you need repair your vw, very very nice and helpfull people.
Excelentes mecánicos, expertos en Vw y muy cordiales.
#Carrera 26 n'22-30 Sur B Centenario, fono #3115418239

name: Pizzeria & Resto Italiano
description:
Really good steaks, pizza and other stuff. 
Very reasonable prices. 

100% recommended.

name: Tenza Sports Field
description: A big Gras area in front of the soccer place. Cute little city. The "road" up here from the Llanos is a bit bumpy but verry nice passing the lake, there are several tunnel and bridges all fine for big rigs. The last 15km are narrow.

name: Plataneral
description: Nice hotel in this dodgy city. Needed to stop to catch boat to Capugana. (found out too late there is a new boat from Necocli) Rooms clean enough, opted for airco. Shower, toilets all worked! double room for 65k. Without airco is cheaper.  No breakfast. Wifi worked well. There is a parking behind 10k per 24 hours. However we found it not very secure, looks like to be used as bus terminal as well, but is suitable for big rigs. We parked in another parking area.

name: Parqueadero next to harbour
description: parked the car here for few days. Close to boat harbour. Covered, small.  Height restriction, but we fitted with rooftop tent. we paid 16k for two days. If you need more space, behind the hotel plataneral (parking entrance on calle 100)

name: Hotel Las Palmas II
description: Cheap and cheerful hotel with a secure car park. If you're going across to Capurganá on the boat (which you can now do from Necoclí) then you'd be able to leave your vehicle here safely for a few days. I paid COP35.000 for a room without ac but with bathroom

name: calle de espumas, colchones y tapiceros
description:
Area of ​​suppliers. We made our mattress there for the car. In the area also have spare parts for cars, plastics, fabrics .... 

zona de proveedores. nosotros hicimos allá nuestro colchón para el auto.  en la zona tienen también recambios de autos, plásticos, telas....

name: esso gas stationi
description: did also a carwash in the morning with high pressure for 7000 cop and got charged for the overnightparking too. 3000 cop. didn't complained because it wasn't much

name: El Patio Cafe
description: We stopped here for dinner, excelent meal for 83000 col pesos for 4 people, very friendly owners, they let us park our big rig at the parking lot. In the morning Olga brought us fresh fruit ( a lot)! Nos detuvimos en este lindo restoran a cenar luego de haber visitado Panaca, la dueña nos permitió pasar la noche en el parqueadero. A la mañana siguiente Olga nos trajo mucha fruta frescapara el desayuno!  La cena para 4 perdonas costo 83000 pesos colombianos.

name: Camping close to Waterfall La Periquera
description: Good and big place, very good viewpoint to Villa de Leyva, quiet but crownded on weekends 5k each p/n

name: Cascada Com Piscina Natural
description:
An incredible small waterfall with natural pool. On the side of the road. Clean water, very good for bathing. 

Una incréible Cascada pequeña con piscina naturales. Al costado de la carretera. Agua limpia, muy bueno para se bañar.

name: Necoclin Beach
description: Adelante de la playa, very Good place!

name: Tambo El Privilegio
description: Rest stop, great for a night. Quiet, clean bathrooms, free wifi. There’s a cafe with amazing views. Spots aren’t level but manageable.

name: gas station
description: they want 5000 for overnight parking

name: 10 steps from the sea - 10 Pasos Del Mar
description: An incredible sea view the shade of beautiful palm trees. 10 steps from the water . perfect to sleep and get in the water. without ...Maisan incredible sea view the shade of beautiful palm trees. 10 steps from the water . perfect to sleep and get in the water. without service

name: SFF Otun Quimbaya
description:
Park with hikes. Only allowed with guides. 56000 COP for 2 persons and 2 hours or group tour for 10500 each. No must see but nice. Camping not allowed.
They said you van camp at Park Ucumari 5km further, but didnt go there. Start for hike to Laguna Otun.

name: Termales San Vincente
description:
Secure parking lot right outside gate of termales. Really nice foggy valley with thermal baths both concrete and natural.  open until 23.00. includes cold showers and a bathroom.

65k pp for a day ticket. $40k for after 4pm. half day ticket from Sunday to Thursday.

name: Gas Station
description:
Gas Station with security guard 24hx
There is small Exito supermarket and nice  restaurant 10 m

name: Gas Station Primax del Rio.
description: We asked to sleep one night in this gas station and after fill up the tank the manager allowed us to pass the night. We felt safe, but there are too much noise from the street. There are usually tuned cars & bikes meetings.

name: Terpel gas station
description: quiet and safe, free..  water and toilets

name: Gas Station
description: We ask for park here to pass the night and the manager suggested another place. We tried the other location, but this was better. We came back and didnt aks If they would allow us to stay. We just stayed... Free location, and looks safe...

name: Cueva del Choco
description: Nice cave with a river. Two entrances.enjoy

name: Restaurant La Veranera del Taller
description:
Restaurant La Veranera of the foundation El Taller artisans. Excellent lunch - 3 courses + juice = 12000 pesos!!! Served on porcelain plate - not a plastic cup or tray to be seen!. Great atmosphere. Upscale food, service and ambience for the price of a roadside almuerzo. 

Resto de la fondation El taller ou se forment des artisans. Excellent plat + limonade + dessert chocolat pour 12000 pesos ! Servi sur assiette porcelaine. Belle ambiance. C'est l'endroit où manger à barrichara.

name: Agua Pura Providencia
description: Agua 20 litros - 3000 pesos (and they clean carafon)

name: Balcones de Venecia
description: Great hotel via a/c, tv, private bathroom,  and terrasse downtown Cartagena. Price is fair, down season we paid 40$/night (including breakfast) with our dog while waiting for our camper.

name: La Cascada
description: Restaurant with ecological approach: recycling, water treatment, protection of Paramo. They are planning to open a hotel in the meantime they permit camping. Great break from the Rocky road to and from Tierradentro.

name: Hotel Casa Virrey
description: Central Hotel with a free secure parking lot, double room with hot water, wifi and 24h reception for 70'000 COP

name: Taganga Paradise Hostal & Diving
description:
Hostel with shared rooms and a private room with air conditioning. (25,000-35,000). They have parking for overlanders (30,000 per couple). Very friendly hosts!. Kitchen and wifi.

Pet friendliness: if you ask nicely they will let you stay with your dog. 

Hostel con habitaciones compartidas y una privada con aire acondicionado. (25.000-35.000). tienen parking para overlanders (30.000 por pareja). los dueños que lo acaban de abrir son muy predispuestos a ayudar. cocina y wifi

name: Motel Hospedaje - secure parking
description:
Motel basic standard. Clean room, AC, shower, tv. On the way to the  coast, good for a night if you dont want to camp free.

30.000 peso for a double room. Secured parking. Nice people which offered to buy food or drinks in town.

name: Good Fly Paragliding
description: the oficial place for flying in Paragliding this amazing region!!!  all adventures in once place.

name: Hotel Fernando Plaza
description: Comfortable hotel with free secure (no height restriction) parking.  We paid 50 US dollars for a night. Wifi a bit slow but acceptable.

name: Hospedaje Restaurant J.J
description: We were looking for a dry place to dry our sleeping bags and tent after a few nights camping in heavy rain and found this gem. Cheapest accommodation we have found yet. 12,000 COP for 1 room, 2 people. Secure locked garage at rear for our motorcycle basic room with fan toilet and running water. Restaurant downstairs serves full typical meal for 7,000 COP pp

name: German Consulate Cali
description: No need

name: Casa Nadia & Cris
description:
Nice air conditioned rooms with private bathrooms (shower & toilet), towels, soap and very clean. Two single beds. Sweet owner. Wifi. About 20 minute walk to the port to get your car back.
50.000 COP per night for two people.

name: Behind Hilton Hotel
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: No overnight camping allowed, please respect the wishes of the locals.

Nice grassy area behind the Hilton Hotel at the lake. Quiet during the night and nice view over the lake. No facilites. Restaurant close by. Not the prettiest place, but pretty good for wild camping in the city.

name: Finca hotel la Florida
description: We were heading towards Embalse las Playas but the roads were smaller and slower than we thought and it was already nearly dark, so we headed back through cute San Roque and back towards the main highway. We followed a sign to  hotel up the steep drive way and found owner Emilio welcome to us parking there for a night. He was super kind and hospitable. There are a few hotel rooms, a tiny little pool and an outdoor seating area with a bathroom, no shower. Beautiful views and nice cool air. Emilio also allowed us to fill up our watertank and it looks like there are a few power sockets outside but we didn't use them. No wifi and only space for 1-2 rigs but the owner says he's open to other overlanders using his property. Nothing spectacular but a good place to stopover if you are coming from or going to Medellin, Guatapé or places closeby. Roads are steep and slow so allow yourself plenty time to get to your destination. We paid 20.000 COP

name: Las Gachas
description:
This spot is the furthest you can drive your vehicle to get to Las Gachas. 
30min walk from here to the river. follow stone path until river. 
Las Gachas is a beautiful river with numerous small circular pools. Beautiful site. A low water stream passes over the beautiful red rock and accumulates in the various pools that are naturally dug out from the rock. The water was above my head in many of these pools but you can walk along the river.
To get here drive from the town of Oiba and head towards Guadalupe. There is a sign for Las Gachas next to the gas station.

name: Pozo Las Glorias
description: Also, if you cross the river and drive up a little ways there's even a better spot with bathrooms and sinks. Families come hang out here during the day, might be busy on weekends, but other than that pretty quiet. Only discovered there was this spot the next morning.

name: Beside Parque ciudad del rio
description: great place to stop, a little bit noisy from Wednesday to Sundays were some foodtrucks offer their food.

name: Balnerio El bambu
description:
Eli and Adriana are the owners of this small site! Very welcoming good for one night! Securise! 10000 pesos per person !!! 

Eli et Adriana sont les propriétaires de ce petit site!Tres accueillant bien pour une nuit!Securise!5000 pesos par personne!!!

name: Road to Punta Gallina
description:
Toll Gate by Indigenas which you can't pass by. They don't let you go through without paying. We don't support begging. So we turned. Locals told us there are forty and more gates on this road and for them it's also a pain.
Edit 02/2017: Still going on, but it's not so bad. It's 6 families that do this, each about 20-30 meters from each other - the rate is 1000 or 2000COP each, as the local guides said us. After this 6 "peajes", there are only some children with ropes, you don't need to stop if you don't want. See my  check-in for more info (weddingtravellers)

name: Fire Station (bomberos)
description: We asked the local fire station if we could camp here and they said yes. very friendly people and town made us feel very welcome. the parking lot has 24/h security for our motos and we were given the upstairs to the fire house to make our place for the night. toilet and cold water shower. Big rigs would also fit in the large parking lot to the rear of the bomberos. Free

name: Waterfall - Salao Blanco
description: Non touristic back way to the waterfall you get a real look at the waterfall from top and bottom . Plus go swimming in an amazing still bit of water just above the drop off .The locals run a primitive guide service, which is kind of nesasary as the way isn't that clear.  this servise is not recomend  for the unfit or those scard of heights. Defiantly a far better view than the touristic lookout.  The guide takes tips only no chargeout. Simply park at the small village on the other side of the valley from the touristic lookout. You have to drive around the top side of the waterfall which is a small road possibly not located on maps.  say you want to see the waterfall to one of the locals . Parking is limited but locals were happy to make room for us. ( ask for Edilmo ph3132603141)

name: 40's Garage
description: This is THE place if you want to fix your Land Cruisers, FJ40, 60 series. Great people, very nice guys they will help you the best they can! Meticulous workers! Son and father passionated about offroading! Many contacts to find what you need! Ring on number 2 at the door or contact them by whatsapp or phone +57 300 2087670

name: Restaurante / Hotel Santa Maria de la Cocha
description: Nice, very big restaurant parking. There is an entrance gate, but pretty high (we are 2,60m high and fit easily, still plenty of space above us). Very quiet. Lovely owners. Very clean bathrooms, open all night! Just asked if we could stay for one night and they said it was no problem! :)

name: Terpel Gas Station
description: Just passed by in the morning, after having trouble finding an overnight spot on the 45 highway. So we just wanted to share this with anyone having the same problem ;) Looked pretty big and flat and there were bathrooms :)

name: Emergency Overnight Stay Next To The Road
description: Emergency overnight spot. We asked at this little shop right next to the road if we could spend the night in our car there. Lovely owners happily agreed. Not very level, but okay for overnight. Quiet at night, getting noisy (trucks) in the morning.

name: La Esperanza Restaurant parking lot
description:
We arrived late and asked the night guard if we could stay. He said it's no problem and he will be there all night. Decent overnight spot before visiting the national park!
Few traffic noises.

name: Garden Hostel
description: Nice hostal with parking place for one car. 20.000 per person. very good internet, nice people.

name: DIAN
description: To extend the car Permit. 2 floor of customs building (DIAN)

name: Hotel Lusitania
description: Nice place in the center of Ibague, with plenty of parking for cars and bikes in an inner courtyard. Simple but clean rooms, your choice of A/C or fan, pool, restaurant and very friendly staff. Good WiFi. Some rooms have a fridge. COP 115,000.

name: El Viajero Hostels
description:
Great Hostel in the middle of Ciudad Amurallada. Great place to stay if you want to know the city walking. Clean and nice with people from all over the world. 
AC in the bedrooms. Breakfast included. 17 usd pp pn. 
Regarding pets we are with a little dog. You should ask case by case.
Highly recomended!!

For the car: Parking in Centro de Convenciones, 5 blocks away, 6usd per 24 hs.

name: Altamira
description: Camping with fantastic view over Ibague. We paid 15'000 per car. Maybe crowded at the weekends. They have a special house for events like weddings. No private showers, only the one next to the pool. There is also a fridge you can use.

name: Taller Grand Prix
description:
The bearring was broken. 
We came in the morning and after 4 hours they changed (get the right sparepart) all was needed. He also fabricated the special tool for our mercedes!
Friendly and very helpful mechanic-mens.

name: Hotel Santa Sofia
description:
Road / Trucker Hotel next to gas station, very friendly staff. Small, clean rooms with hot showers, toilet, double bed and TV. Price per room 25'000 COP. You can park your car in front of your room. Cheep restaurant nearby.
Sleep in your vehicle for 12’500 COP/ 2 people

name: Camp On Basket Ball Cort
description: Couldnt find anywhere to set our tents up on this road until a local showed us this spot . A small shop is located just town the road if your looking for food . Pays to ask a local if it's ok to camp as it is in the middle of a bunch of houses, but all in all a nice quite night .

name: Massy Motors - Mercedes-Benz
description: Authorized Mercedes truck repair shop. Qualified and clean. Able to work on big trucks.

name: Bellamar Hotel
description:
Lo encontramos de casualidad después de un día entero gestionando el envío del coche a Panamá y fue como encontrar un oasis en el desierto. Lo acaban de abrir así que esta todo nuevecito. Nos dieron una habitación con balcón, asique veíamos el coche desde el cuarto. El aire acondicionado enfría enseguida y era silencioso! tienen vigilancia 24 horas y se puede estacionar en la puerta, nosotros no tuvimos ningún problema. Además tanto los dueños como los empleados fueron super atentos y nos ayudaron en todo lo que necesitamos.  Super recomendado tanto si se está en Cartagena para enviar/recibir el vehículo por estar cerca del puerto y de la DIAN como si no, ya que un taxi de aquí al centro son unos 8.000 pesos y el cuarto doble sale por 70.000 pesos (negociable)

We found it by chance after a day managing the car shipping to Panama and was like finding an oasis in the desert. They just so open that everything is brand new. We had a room with a balcony, so here we could see the car from the room. The air conditioner cools quickly and was silent! have surveillance 24 hours and you can park at the door, we had no problems. In addition both owners and employees were super-attentive and helped us in everything we need. Super recommended whether to send / receive the vehicle to be near the harbor and the DIAN as if they are in Cartagena, as a taxi from here to the center are about 8,000 pesos and double room goes for 70,000 pesos (negotiable)

name: Hotel de Normandie
description: We parked our 25ft motorhome in front of Hotel de Normandie. The host Philippe is such a nice person, he loves travellers. He let us park right in front of the hotel and gave us access to shower, toilet and well as wifi. 10,000 pesos. The place is tranquil, just under huge eucalyptus trees. There is a bus that goes into town from down the road.

name: Free Parking
description: We parked our van for 2 nights here (next to the soccer field and church). After the first night a guy washed our van without asking and then wanted money. Paid him 2000 cause we parked there for another night and didn't want to have issues. Reasonable priced sports bar across the street where the soccer players hang out. We didn't sleep in the vehicle but I think it's not an issues especially if you give a little tip (not too sure if that guy was official but he was hanging around there).

name: Station De Servicio
description: Small petrol Station, colosed at night, quiet with toilet. Big flat area

name: Sogamoso Canyon - Free
description: Huge parking area by the Canyon. We asked the owner of the little snack shop if we can camp here for the night and he said no problem. There are washrooms at the snack shop as well as snacks, cold drinks and empanadas. Possibly more food as well but we never asked. Nice view over the Canyon and free.

name: FREE Camping Parking
description: Near to a paid camping and the city centre.

name: San Luis Welder
description: a great sheet metal shop with welding and machining tools. if something's broke and its metal they can fix it here :-)

name: La Cueva Del Nitro
description: 2000 pesos to check out the cave. They do tours which are 12 hours long the lady at the entrance said!

name: San Gil Plaza
description: Plaza with little shops and a supermarket where dogs are allowed inside! Free parking

name: Mina De Sal Nemocón
description: Awesome salt mine to visit. 27,000 with a 90 minute tour. Available in Spanish and English (2022: costs extra now, at least during the week). Our well behaved dog was allowed inside. Free Wifi

name: Opposite From Olympia Supermarket
description: There is a Toilet available at Olympia Supermarket.

name: Car Part Quarter and Mechanics
description: Any kind of parts for cars

name: hotel holanda
description: trucker hotel. very good acomodation and cheap.

name: The Bruitera Club De La Sena
description: Recreational park.  Secure, with swimming pool.  35000 per person per night. WiFi, cold showers and electricity available.   Not exactly designed for camping, but they have a dormitory so are used to overnight visitors.   Gate is wide and about 3m high.  Really big rigs might struggle, or get stuck right next to the road.

name: Zipaquira Salt Cathedral
description: Audio guide is included in every language. Expensive: See check-ins. Extra charge for parking.

name: Clinica veterinaria animal vet
description: Ran by doctor Edna and her husband. We left Helen here while we went to Tayrona NP $25,000 per day. They also gave her, her annual shots 50,000 for the shots. they also bathe Helen, cleaned her ears, brushed her teeth and trimmed her nails!

name: Ingelox Ingeniera Logistics Integral
description: Shipping agent. Located on the second floor above the panaderia.

name: Abandoned Hotel, Museum And Waterfall
description: It is an abandoned Hotel that has since been turned into a Museum  (9000 pp). It has a beautiful view to a waterfall. There is free parking along the road or paid parking at the hotel for 2000. There is also a bunch of stands with food and drinks.

name: Xielo Skydive
description: Awesome place and great people if you wanna jump out of an airplane! They offer great pricing and a well organized dropzone. Tandem for 550.000 and they also are very welcoming to experienced skydivers and offer rental gear. They take credit card! After jumping we were allowed to camp here as well. They have bathrooms, showers and a pool. They do have power here and may allow you to plug in.

name: Maggie's Shapely Banks
description:
Driving north along the Rio Magdalena valley, we found this quiet hidden spot by checking every trail off the main road.
Drive west over the bridge from Cambao, then first right down the track. There are potentially a few sites along the way, the one marked is about 500m in, past a gate and cattle grid, right on the river with a place to swim if you don't mind getting muddy feet.
Gas station in Cambao accepts visa.

Update April 2022: You might get a visit by the police and will be asked to move to the police station. Super friendly guys though. Otherwise a nice spot, but definitely a ton of Moskitos in the rainy season.

name: Las Gachas
description: Beautiful natural swimming holes in the river. 15 minute walk from the cafe marked nearby, or other tracks, ask in Guadalope. Free!

name: Parque Arqueológico Nacional San Agustín
description: Nice park to spend a few hours. Dogs are allowed in the park. 65,000 pp for a passport that allows access to several sites in the area.

name: Gas
description: 30,000 ask for LA Trenza they will transfer gas from one bottle to another

name: Hostal Artepolis
description: Beaitiful hostel with amazing views over the valley and surrounding mountains. Big parking lot. We paid 55.000 for a double room with private bathroom. Good wifi. Cold shower. Great bathroom with open roof so you can have a shower while admiring the views! :) They also have dorms but I don't know the price. Nice French owner who knows the area very well and who can recommend hikes or organise horse rides. Super nice staff. Parking is not levelled at all so we did not even ask to camp.

name: Pueblo Bello Town
description: We parked right next to a community park/plaza. Nice mountain views, and fresh air. We stopped here on our to Nebusimake, which we are trying to arrange transportation with the locals. Movistar cell tower here

name: ElectroGas Armenia
description:
Filled up propane gas bottle (US Standard 1 Gallon). Price 6000 COP per Gallon.
No longer open. You have to call Mario Hernandez to fill it (see other coments)

name: Autolavado CAR RESCUE
description:
Carwash close to the Hotel Bellavista.
Perfect before shippment.

We paid COP 17'000.- to clean the outside (they also clean the interior of your car if you want) of our campervan.

name: La Cábaña Del Gordo
description: Restaurant, hotel, Truck stop, Car wash, súper friendly people. Restrooms and showers available. They even gave us electricity and we only paid for the cars ash 10,000 pesos (12.7.19: 4000 pesos for 2 people in a truck Camper)

name: Nuevo Mundo Camping - Hostel - Cabañas Mocoa
description:
Nice place beside the street a little outside Mocoa, just above the Mocoa River. The owners are really nice and they would love to have other overlanders. You can park on the parking lot in front of the house or drive up to a grassy area for camping. There is a firepit for cooking, an outdoor shower and toilets you can use. Indoors showers and wc. They also have running water (potable) and electricity if you need them. Slow wifi. 
30K per vehicle 
Phone number is you want to contact in advance: +573107515220

name: Tecnomotriz - Professional Auto Shop
description:
Large professional mechanic shop with multiple lifts and equipment. Specialist in 4x4s. Owner is Henry Moller, speaks English, and is also a moto enthusiast.+57 24438112 / +573155554342 whatsapp.

this area also has a lot of car repair and part shops nearby

name: Agua Nevada
description: 4,000 COB to refill the 20 liter jug. 1,200 for 6l bag, 1000 to refill 6l.  50,000 for 140 liters!!

name: Gas del Fonce
description:
New location for Gas del Fonce. Were able to fill up our US tank. The entrance is right next to a Virgin Mary statue.

Best to call ahead to arrange a time. +57.311.482.0123

I needed my own adapter for my small bottle as he doesn't have any.

name: VW Mecanic Fajardo
description:
Great VW shop with very friendly mecanics. Jose looked after my 82 aircooled FI Vanagon. Can help with bugs and Kombis as well. 

318 828 8605 and 316 526 3682

on street 17c.

User reports:Jose did a great job and fixed all mechanical issues we had. We have a Westfalia Vanagon ‘84. Wasn’t expensive at all.

name: Basketball Court
description: Have you ever parked and slept in a basketball court? Well you can park here :) beautiful secluded and very cold place

name: bike mechanic
description: a small shop we had a few jobs done on the klr we didnt have the tools to do ourselves.

name: Enoj's Workshop (forgot its official name)
description: Workshop of VW enthusiast Enoj. He is well connected to the Ibague Volkswagen Club and lots of great VW people happy to help you. All repairs were done well, the price was good, at times I had to wait a few hours. Enoj and his staff are friendly, intelligent guys. Camping in the workshop might be difficult but check with Enoj. Wifi next door at shop.

name: Rest Area
description: Free accomodation. Rest area right afterbefote a toll booth coming from Barranquilla to Cartagena. Includes a restroom area and a small snack kiosk.

name: SEGUROS DEL ESTADO Cali
description: Selling SOAT- Insurance, also just for 1 month (probably you have to insist).

name: MONTAGAS Pitalito
description: Filled up propane gas bottle (US Standard 1 Gallon).

name: Tejumbina hot springs
description: Nice hot springs with multiple pools and showers.  3000cop to enter.  There's also a beautiful waterfall behind it.  It is possible to park vehicle right outside and camp overnight although we did not do this.  No WiFi.  The locals are super friendly and very curious when they see a foreign vehicle.  Really cute mountain town.

name: David Workshop
description: Stopped here coz we had loose wheel bolds and due to this a broken bearing. David solved all in 1 hour.

name: San Cipriano Railway
description:
Here in you will enjoy the african atmosphere of colombia and enter the tropical forest of the San Cipriano Reserve on a motorbike running on the train tracks. You will then refresh yourself in the clear river of the pueblito. 11000 COP pp with return. 
Let your car at the first parquadero (12000 p day). The very friendly owner let us use his shower and bathroom and give us is Wi-Fi :

name: Hotel Calle Real - secure parking
description: 20000 per vehicle (down from 25000), to camp in hotels secure parking lot. Has a pool which has toilets, change room and outdoor shower which we could use. Wifi pword: 10833676. Felt a lot more secure here then in the truck parking lot hotel. Only a small parking lot so only 4WD/van campers would fit here.a

name: Parqueo Los Santos
description: Basic, red dust car park with beautiful views over the chica canyon, right above the rock climbing area. We chose to stay here instead of the hostel as it was 15000 per car instead of per person. It has basic shower and toilet. Quiet at night. Family lives on site in home on one side of car park. We parked up on the raised area for more privacy. Rock climbing site is owned by hostel, pd 2500pp to climb for the day.

name: Suisse Gourmet's
description: absolut delicious food...go for the menu del dia....swiss food in this restaurant run by an swiss cook and butcher...delicious and worth every peso....they also sell best meat and cheese in the Restaurant...

name: Marca Business Center
description:
OFFICE 514
Sura office
we could get the Soat there.
But they told us...you have to take two month....even when one would be enough....paid 124
000 pesos for two month

name: Finca Hostal Bolivar
description:
Actualizado del propietario: 25.12.2023
BIENVENIDOS! WELCOME! WILLKOMMEN!

Finca Hostal Bolivar offers the following:
Secure Parking/Campground for Motorhomes.
The parking offers: 
- clean toilets and HOT showers!!
- kitchen facilities 
- BBQ area
- watertap, electrical outlets 
- fast WIFI
- private access to Minca river
- video surveillance 24h
- common area
- laundry service 
- private sunset viewpoint

Price per car/motorhome (1-2 Pax) is  60'000 COP/night in low season. (additional Person 20'000 COP)

Price per car/motorhome (1-2 Pax) is  75'000 COP/night  IN HIGH SEASON. (additional Person 25'000 COP)
High season starts the 20th of December until 31th of March.

The entrance is 2.7m (edge)/3.3m (center) high and 3.4m wide. It fits only campervans with a length of max 5m!


The Parking/Campground is located at the mainroad to Pozo Azul, 300m from towncenter Minca. Use our telephone reception (yello building) for Check-In and Information.
Tel: +57 322 280 83 42
E-Mail: fincahostalbolivar@gmail.com
Website: bolivarhostelminca.com

name: Rural School Parking Lot
description: It's a 20min drive from the main hwy55. Spot has no amenities other than a great view of the unfolding valley below. Very quiet. School gets out early so it's a comfortable spot to spend the night and continue on the next morning.

name: Cascada El Mortino
description:
Come see this...it's free and visible from the well-maintained gravel road. You can hike to the falls as well.
This is the Cascada El Mortiño if I am not wrong.
There is a waterfall in the area which must be much higher up, I didn't quite get to it.

name: Laguna De Salado
description: Drive on a grave/dirt road for 3kms off of hwy55. When you get to the green gate it is/was unlocked. From there it's 300 mts to a stunning high altitude lake, a waterfall as a backdrop, and wild trout fishing! (Caught small to medium sized Rainbows). Plenty of open flat spaces to camp/boondock. There is another lake above the waterfall called Tambor. Very quiet, no one around. Seems like the place was a failed tourism venture given the two empty houses.

name: Popayan inn
description: Very Nice hôtel, great location, 2 blocks from the plaza. Very clean - nice owner - he gives good info about city and surroundings. 90.000 COP/night for quad room. Secure parking in from for 10.000 COP/night. Possible to order Bfast for 5000 COP - really recommended!

name: Hotel Napoles
description:
A nice clean, quiet hotel with friendly staff, good WIFI and a comfortable bed. The hot water wasn't working when we were there but other than that no complaints. There is secure parking under the hotel included in the price. Our Pathfinder fit in there easily but higher vehicles may not. 

They squeezed us a fresh orange juice in the morning which was a nice touch. Ask for a room towards at the back of the hotel away from the road.

The stated price was 80,000 Pesos but this is negotiable (we paid 50,000).

name: Hotel el Marques de San Rafael
description: Orange front.  secure parking, 4x4s and motos only. 50k per double room. hot water. stable wifi. nice owners.

name: Land Rover Parts
description: Parts shop (lots of Britpart!) for many Land Rover types including Defender. Run by a lovely man called Richard and his son Alex has another Land Rover shop across the road. Mechanic nearby who works on land rovers, toyotas and much more.

name: Tecniautos Fores: Land Rover/Toyota +more
description: Taller/mechanic that will repair land rovers, toyotas and much more. Great service and great work done to our defender. They also have an amazing sticker collection...!

name: Land Rover - Auto-repuestos Europeos
description: Parts shop for Land Rovers: Defender, Discovery, Range Rover, Freelander. Owned by Richard who imports the parts from the UK (lots of Britpart).  Email: arepuestoslandrover@hotmail.com  tel: 3118063 / 3110490 Rochard's son Alex also has a shop across the road and they know a good mechanic nearby who deals with land rovers, toyotas and more.

name: Tecniautos FORES - Land Rover/Toyota +more
description: Taller/mechanic that deals with Land Rovers, Toyotas and much much more. Great service and work on our Defender. Appointments not totally necessary (we just turned up). They also happen to have a great selection of stickers...!

name: Behind Terpel
description: Big gravel area hidden behind terpel gas station. We asked there and they said it's ok to stay there for one night. Very quiet at night. Free

name: al Silencio
description:
Real nice "end of road" Place. With luck you can see the snow capped Tolima. We stayed at the little grassy field in front of a big white advertising sign. Almost leveled, place for two 25 foot rigs. There is a wooden house with banjo service, a lot of animals, cows, horses, etc nearby, or around you.
We done a hike to the Hacienda el Rancho, 2' h round trip. Real nice trail goes down the canon Combeima. We returned, but you can go on....
A group was just starting a 4 day trip up to the 5200m Tolima....
We stayed there middle of the Week....nowone was there. Parking fee would be 5000 p. (sign). Totally quiet and nice stay. 
The last about 14km of the road from Ipaque to here is not paved, a little bit narrow and stoney, but not really a problem. No 4WD needed!

name: Gases De Antioquia
description: Planta de Gas propano. They filled our american tank, 20.700 COP 8kg

name: Pura Guajira Hostel
description: Very nice and clean hostel in Riohacha, runnend by a Colombian/Italian couple: Ricardo and Beatrice. Unfortnially no secured parking, but the neighborhood is concidered as safe. Security during the night in a dead end street. It felt for me safe to park my motorbike on the street in front of the hostel. Well equipped kitchen to cook your own dish, laundry, wifi, hamacs, roofterrace and a good atmosphere.  Lugauge storage for stuff you don't need during your trip to Punto Gallinas. Private room with ac and private bathroom: 125.000 p/n. 8 bed dorm, private bathroom + fan: 29.000p/n. 4 bed dorm, shared bathroom + fan: 32.000 p/n. Ricardo and Beatrice are a good help, knows the do and don't about the north and do everything to help you planning your trip to Punto Gallinas.

name: Mercados Campesinos
description: Small Farmers Market with organic fruits and vegetables, homemade products, small food stalls. Only on Sunday from 08-13 hr

name: 24hr Parking Astorga
description: 24hr Parking in the very nice neighbourhood Poblado with many restaurants and bars nearby. COP 24'000 for 24hrs, price per hour. Very friendly and helpful people. The only downside is that there are hours where you need to stay in your vehicle in order not to trigger off the alarm system. For example FR/SA after 24:00, SU after 17:30, MO-THU after 20:00. They also offer car wash.

name: El Refugio
description: Is a peaceful retreat tucked neatly away in Patia’s richest woodland. It’s a haven filled with lots of the local flora and fauna. You mind is sure to be at peace with the captivating landscape this beautiful place has to offer. May it be taking a plunge in the waters of the tempting pool, unwinding in the placid river or feeling welcomed by the warm Colombian hospitality, this hidden gem is definitely one to be explored.

name: Finca Lindavia
description:
Dog boarding and training.
Guardería y adiestramiento para perros.

name: Finca Lindavia
description:
Dog boarding  and training
Guardería y adiestramiento para perros

name: Residencial Patiño
description: Basic but very economic lodging we paid 16,000 Colombian pesos for the couple. Clean and with garage !! And wifi. The bad thing is that the shower is cold water ... It is so hot that it is bearable :)

name: El Bosque
description: Very nice facilities lined with palm trees, Huge swimming pool, volleyball, soccer, outdoor kitchen,  4000 peso/ day for swimming. Camping 25,000 peso includes all facilities. Showers. Very friendly owner- Henry speaks English.

name: Hacienda Villa Clara
description: Great place to camping by river, showers, wc, electricity, big open area with mountain view. Friendly host David and his family. Actual spot maybe 1 km from these coordinates.

name: Molino del Balcón
description:
ADMIN NOTE:  be aware of the dogs, travelers have been bitten here. 

This place is awesome. The property is 2.5 acres, about 200 meters to the main square and is 449 years old. It's still belongs to the original family. There is a shower, clean bathroom, and lots of chillin areas. There's dogs, sheep/goats all different types of birds and fish, water running in the original water way, it's pimp. They asked the 3 of us to pay 15,000cop each. My dog was free.

name: Santiamen Restaurant
description: This place has really really great food, and there is a bakery attached, owned by other people that is fantastic as well. Lots of parking around and I think you can talk to the owners about parking on there property, or just park out front and chill on there patio. They speak English and have lots of different beers including tons of German beers.

name: JP Multi Servicio
description: Awesome mechanic, found parts that iguana 4x4 couldn't. Told me that they needed a new track bar and some other parts and then when I came back they said they didn't need them, so I saved a few hundred dollars. They are very honest. Also took my truck to a car wash for me and did the best job I've ever seen. (It was the dirtiest it's ever been) His prices were much better than iguana 4x4 too.

name: Cardisch Hospedaje
description: This place is the last hotel before the hot springs. The gym is super chill, he speaks Spanish and English really well and lives in the states a lot of the time. He was cool with us using his kitchen and there is a nice river in the back. Dog friendly and cheap aswell.

name: Motorcycle Insurance (Seguros Del Estado)
description:
Only specific insurance companies sell motorcycle insurance. this is one of them located on the 8th Floor within the 'ComFamiliar' building. There really are not any signs, you might have to ask if you struggle to find it as you enter what appears to be side doors. The insurance company is called Seguros Del Estado, which I was directed to from DINA

paperwork required
1 copy TIP
1 copy title
1 copy license
1 copy passport (no stamp copy needed)

name: mirador del magdalena
description:
Nice view over the rio magdalena valley.   Entry 3000 pesos - if you camp (8000 pesos) you don't have to pay the entrance to the mirador.
Got a free coffee in the morning!

name: EcoGlampling
description:
Mod note -  reported that site is not ready for customers as at early 2017
Owners Andres, Marcela, and William are carving out an Overlanding Paradise in the outskirts of Los Nevados National Park. The site is right in the heart of El Eje Cafetero and 2kms from Santa Rosa Del Cabal hotsprings. It is bordered by two cool water creeks and covered in lush mountain vegetation. The ecoglamping site will have space for rigs, tents, hot/cold water pools, and a bar/restaurant. You will not want to bypass this mountain retreat! At the time of this post, the construction of the camp was scheduled for October and ready to receive overlanders in December.

name: FincaI El Manial Restaurant
description: At the street near Purificación. 30k pN on sandy ground, sorruonded by lots of ducks. Nobody needs warm showers here.

name: Hotel Campestre Luna Roja
description:
This place has to great assets: its elevated location provides beautiful views right the camping spot; and the swimming pool is nice, big and clean. On the downside the caretaker (he is not the owner) is unfriendly and has no service attitude. The toilets are without seats and paper and the showers are truly outdoor and without privacy. It's a bit close to the road and there are fuel trucks all night.
25k pp pn. Expensive but the views at sunset are fantastic.

name: La Sonora
description: Gasstation at the road. But the restaurant is not good.

name: Coomavicure
description: A place with cabañas and a big, clean pool. Toilets and showers are clean too. The people are very friendly. We asked, if we could camp here with our RV and they said yes. They wanted 25k pp and we offered 20k. It was oK. The showers are "cold", but nobody needs hot showers here!

name: Parking lot salt cathedral
description: This place is NOT closed. We had headed for the lower parking lot but it was blocked off and said, “buses” so we drove to this upper lot. The only level spot was at the very end. Free wi fi – no password needed. With antenna it was better. It was so much closer to the entrance than the lower lot. Other campers were parked in lower lot the next day. 14000 for 24 hours

name: Osvarca automotriz
description: Good all round mechanic, fair guy who goes out of his way to help you.

name: Hostal El Portal Fin Del Mundo
description: Very quiet and nice - 45.000/double with use of the kitchen

name: Los Clavellinos
description: Camping was free just bought a few reasonably priced beers and coffees from the store.

name: La Posada
description:
Address: Calle 23 #20-37, Paipa, Boyacá, Colombia

La Posada is in an old colonial building with high ceilings large doors and open courtyards. They allowed us to store our motorcycles in the courtyards. The room was large and clean and has a electric shower with hot water. The room cost 20,000 pesos per person per night and has a queen bed well as a single bed.  The room was extremely clean and comes with a desk, chair and TV.

name: Whater plant next to the river SALENTO
description: Very nice, safe, sound of the river, security 24hs, ligth, whater, full nature... free. Ask to the guard of the whater plant for past the nigth. No problem very gentelman.

name: Hotel imperio
description: VERY AWFULL NOISY hotel downtown. Basic rooms but fast internet, nice pillows and very clean.  They have a very large private garage free of charge. I'm not sure exactly on the size restrictions but it's quite high. 30,000 for a single. 60000 for double. Right at one end of Calle 3 which is the main shopping street pedestrian walkway in Ibague.

name: Motorbike Center
description: Great shop! The own is very nice and they have 8 total shops in Bogota. Speaks English as he lived in the YS for 15 years. Super cool shop.

name: Hotel At Terpel
description: Small hotel at the Terpel station outside of town.  There are no hotels with parking in Mocoa so I search around for this one which has a small garage for motorcycles in the back. It is a bit out of town but actually not far from the night clubs by taxi.  All in all a basic but very cheap hotel, I took the room near the office for 15.000 others are 20.000

name: Fragua De Angelito
description: A forge where you can get your leafsprings reshaped/replaced. Can park safely off the street in enclosed parking lot.

name: Hotel Güicán de la Sierra
description: Hotel in a nice old building on the town square.  There is a dining room at ground level that can hold motorcycles overnight.  Rooms are of recent construction.

name: Mecanico Javier
description: auto repair garage in Villa de Leyva, nice, helpful and competent mechanics

name: Spare Parts Fiat/Iveco - Euro Nipon Repuestos Originales
description:
The Name of the Shop is Euro Nipon Repuesto Originales. This is a spare parts shop for FIAT and IVECO ( same engine) . We found here a new engine ventilator for our FIAT Duacto Camper! The owner speaks a little bit English.
It is not a mechanic garage only a shop to buy the spare parts. Because the Fiat Garage (Mirafiori) not had spare parts for our car.

name: DIAN
description:
They open @ 07:30. Careful: pants and closed shoes required, fill out the forms and follow the procedures described in the posts.


Attention pantalon et chaussures fermées obligatoires, faire remplir le formulaire

name: laguna de la cocha
description:
Whereabouts next to a restaurant. Totally free on the banks of a river that to the few meters ends in the lagoon. From the restaurant we were given water for the motorhome. Super quiet


paradero al lado de un restaurante. totalmente gratis a orillas de un río que a los pocos metros desemboca en la laguna. del restaurante nos dieron agua para el motorhome.  super tranquilo.

name: Immigration - Visa Extension
description:
Located on Avenida Ferrocarril, in between Calle 19 and 20. Big flag and sign out front.

To extend you need a copy of passport and of your entry stamp.

Open Monday > Friday. Hours 8am - 12pm and 2pm - 5pm.

Pour faire tamponner le formulaire bureau à droite en entrant.

name: Calle 8. Popayan
description:
You cannot park in the street near the police, but you can park on Calle 8, which is quiet. This a great place to rest and it is quiet.
.....
No se puede estacionar en la calle donde está la policía, pero si se puede en la calle 8a, que es bastante recta y tranquila.

Es un buen punto para descansar y conocer Popayan.

name: Parque El Vergel
description:
It is a park in Buga with lots of exercise machines and running circuits, very large with two parking lots for free. Pass a river bordering the park that is good for bathing if there is plenty of water. For sleeping it is quieter to park in the parking lot at the end, next to the bicycle park. It has lights all night. Bathrooms are in the beginning parking lot for 500 Cop. The park is amazing, they do a lot of sport and they walk animals. Very good place to stay for several days.


Es un parque en Buga, muy grande  con dos estacionamientos gratis. Pasa un río bordeando el parque que está bueno para bañarse si hay harta agua. Para dormir es más tranquilo estacionar en el estacionamiento del final, al lado del parque de bicicletas. Tiene iluminación toda la noche. Baños hay en el estacionamiento del principio por 500 Cop. El parque es increíble, hacen mucho deporte y pasean animales. Muy buen lugar para estar varios días.

name: Beautiful Grass Patch
description: Nice view quiet by the road, nice view and plenty of firewood

name: Palm Tree Valley
description: Great place to sleep ! 2 vehicles can fit here

name: Yaragua
description: 40,000 for two motorcycles and one tent.  Site is a "natural park" with cabins and some space for camping

name: Hotel Esmeralda
description: We paid 10 cop to park for one night. Close to the road.

name: Rest Hotel and parking
description: Very clean rest, hostel, park. Excelent for rest one nigth.

name: San Carlos Hotel
description: Nice little hotel for 18000cop. Nice view of the mountains. Decent wifi. Little shops and restaurants. We are told there are hot springs near by. 15000cop for shared bathroom.

name: Casa De Campo
description: We pulled in to this place thinking it was a regular hotel. The cost was 25,000COP for a double room including bathroom and parking (great price!). However once we had checked in we realised it was some sort of hotel people go to to have sex, as indicated by the porn channels and room service purchase list of sex toys and lingerie (ha ha). The room was extremely clean and the bed was very comfortable, also 24 hour security. If you don't mind staying in some sort of sex hotel, it's a great bargain.

name: Gasan
description:
Gas tanks can be refilled 


se puede rellenar tanques d gas

name: Carbon/charcoal Place Right Next To Colgas
description: 28k for a 20lb tank. The guy has a hose that will transfer from a cilinder to another. Very kind

name: Mecanizar
description: Very friendly, well staffed and equipped shop. Speak to Wilmar

name: Hotel Brisas del Norte: Cheap and confortable! With large truckstop parking.
description: Hotel on the 2nd floor of the gas station restaurant. Good place to sleep after a long drive and to take a hot shower. A bit noisy when the trucks enter to the station. We pay 35.000 colombian for a double room. Excellent price for this place! There is a security guy in the parking.

name: Hotel San Felipe
description: Nice and cheap Hotel. 1 block from the route. Is ok for sleeping after a long drive. We pay 45000 colombian for a double room.

name: Strategy Seguros Ltd
description: A friendly place to get short term SOAT (less than a year). Apparently there are offices all around Colombia. The address is Calle 87 No. 20 - 42, Oficina 201.

name: Parking Hotel Holanda
description: Parking lot of Hotel Holanda. COP 10'000/vehicle.

name: Secure parking
description: Secure parking for your vehicle while visiting Plaza Botero, only one block away from the statues. Open until 10 PM. We paid 8,000 cop for about 4 hours. Fits any size of vehicle.

name: Cienaga de los franceses
description: Excelent point free. we arribe on this place for locals coment.

name: Tipical beach Colombian Restaurant on the sea.
description: Excelent for past the nigth in the week no weekend. Free if you use the bar. Good peaple.

name: Bomba terpel
description:
Trucks usually stop at the place. We asked to stay the night and they were super friendly. They do not charge anything. there's a hotel. Restaurant or mechanical service. For a night of passage this good.


en el lugar suelen parar camiones. preguntamos para pasar la noche y fueron super amables. no cobran nada. hay un hotel. restaurante u servicio mecánico. para una noche de paso esta bueno.

name: Mompox
description:
Next to the football stadium but not close to the city center we were there for the Mompox jazz festival there were people.

edit: it's pretty close to everything. this town us small


A cote du stade de foot pas de service mais proche du centre ville nous y etions pour le Mompox jazz festival il y avait du monde.

name: El Rancho De Mi Viejo
description: really nice place close to the center. quite all day and night. Ana-lucia is very nice and so helpful. got a small parking lot for 3-4 cars. you can use the washing machine and kitchen. the rooms are simple with TV WiFi and private bathroom for 12500$ /n/p. but if u stay for a least 3 days you can have it for 10000$. to sleep in your it's 6000$

name: El Nomada (& Camping)
description:
The best place to stay in Suesca. There is secure space for camping and sleeping in a van and there is access to a decent common room and kitchen. Check in at the cafe along the main street (2-7pm weekdays, all day weekends) and they will take you there and open the gate for you. 15k COP pppn. Ideal base for climbing in Suesca. 
Internet in the Cafe-Restaurant for free.

name: Alto de las Piedras
description:
Parking at the ruins of Alto de las Piedras. Super quiet.  Left of route to the jump of bordones.
.....
Parqueadero de las ruinas de Alto de las Piedras. super tranquilo. queda de camino al salto de bordones.

name: Majestic Plaza
description: Nice colonial building with high ceilings.  Paid 55,000 per night for a two person room with A/C.  Parked motorcycles in the lobby

name: Villa Norte
description: We took a first floor room. Room was small, no windows and musty smell.

name: Hotel Ibatama
description:
Average hotel with A/C.
We stayed two nights. First night rain a lot and our bedroom flooded. We change bedroom and it was fine.

name: Hotel La Bomba
description: Just a place to spend the night on the road. 26000 COP per room.

name: Hotel Paimaná
description: Good place for 56000 COP for two people. Bedroom had A/C, but at some point during early morning A/C started dropping water and some of our stuff got wet. We parked our motorbikes in the lobby.

name: Grocery Store - Carulla Castillogrande
description: Best store I've yet to find in Cartagena for restock of food and house hold items. Big produce section for the fresh stuff and double the options of storable goods than all the other store around. Better than all the other tiny stores combined. There is also a bank right across the corner with ATMs available all the time. Definitely worth coming down to Boca Grande for the resupply. Larger rigs will want to park down the road a bit as the lot is smaller.

name: La Planada reserve
description: Free camping on large and level parking lot of reserve. Entry to reserve 5000.-/p.p. Two spectacle bears in a poor, caged area, one of the best spots in Colombia for birdwatchers. Accomodation in 4bed rooms and food available. Mirador and 2kms walking trail in the extremely nice cloud forest. Access best with 4x4, no big rigs as road is rough and steep. From main road take turnoff at 1.19098 -77.97280. Take a right turn at little church at 1.18007 -77.96995.

name: plaza de salamina
description:
Parking around the town square.with no services but central.


Parking alrededor de la plaza del pueblo.
sin servicios pero céntrico.

name: La Ultima Lagrima
description:
Small bar for a drink near the cemetery.Pedro the owner of the bar will tell you the authentic history of Salamina like no other.


Pequeño bar para tomar algo cerca del cementerio.
Pedro el propietario del bar les contara la autentica historia de Salamina como ningún otro.

name: Estadero La Quiebra
description:
Ilmar, is the owner of this tiny little bars, where you can not stop drinking the famous "" "KUMIS" "" of Salamina.
delicious to pure cow's milk base.
Right at the entrance there is place to spend the night, very quiet and safe. You can also spend the night totally safe and free.

Ilmar, es el dueño de este pequeñisimo barsito, donde no se puede dejar de tomar el famosísimo """ KUMIS """ de Salamina. 
riquisimo a base d leche pura de vaca. 
Justo en la entrada hay lugar para pasar la noche, muy tranquilo y seguro. además puedes pasar la noche totalmente seguro y gratis.

name: Casa Isla de Manga
description: Nice, clean, newly renovated hotel (still in process of renovation). We paid $80000 cop for 4 person room. There is a sink and stove in the room. There are cheaper hostels in old town to explore Cartagena. But you can't beat the price here when picking up your vehicle. You safe on taxis, 5 min walk to most places for the vehicle process. $6000cop for breakfast, $9000cop for dinner. We cooked ourselves, so didn't try their food.

name: San Martin
description:
We found this little campsite nearby Parque Tayrona.
Basic site with cold shower and restroom. 20.000 each vehicle.
Perfect for one or more nights, especially for big rigs! Need a room with AC? possible too.

name: Hotel Babderas 2
description: This Hotel is next to a gas station on the autopista.you can park your rv between the hotel and the restaurant free wifi, a little stor and toilets for 5000 for the rv, if you want to use the picina, it is 10000 pp.

name: casa torices real
description: Nice hostel, friendly owner, possibility to put your bike inside. ???25000col for a dorm without AC. 2.5km from the center.

name: Hotel in San Vicente
description:
Family run hotel, very friendly, 25.000 for a double room with fan, bathroom & Wifi. They also have bigger rooms & rooms with aircon but 40 to 60K.
Secure parking and they are currently doing our laundry. Good stop if heading to La Macarena from Neiva-Florencia.

name: Drop Bear Hostel
description: Fun hostel, free motorcycle parking behind gate, street parking available for campers. associated business rents out motorbikes (owned by Americans), friendly. 30k COP for a dorm bed, no breakfast included

name: Sams VIP Hostel
description: Nice hostel, centrally located, has a small useless pool. 25k cop if booked on hostelworld, free secure motorcycle parking on site.

name: Entrance fee
description: Arriving on a busy sunday we had to pay 10000.-/p.p. to enter the indigena area south (volcano) and east from here. As well you have to hire a guide (35000.-/day) if you intend to see the sights like lookouts, waterfalls and so on. Either you take the guide into your vehicle or he follows you with his motorbike.
