If you head further east you will enter the Purace NP. On its official website foreigners have to pay 23000.-/p.p. entrance fee. The indigenas told us that we do NOT have to pay this fee. We do not know what is true because we decided to skip this Circus and head back to Popayan. If you tell them that you are heading straight to La Plata in the east without stopping you are excempt from these fees. The indigenas were patroling the area, so chances that you would get seen while visiting the sights (illegally) were high. In our opinion this is just a profitable and easy way to make some money, something we did not want to support.

name: Lavanderia Yola
description:
Here you find the washing at 5.000 per kilo. 

Aquí encuentras el lavado a precio por kilo.
5000 pesos.

name: Canaima Adventure Store
description: A small outdoors store that has a large selection of shoes and backpacks. Nearly all shoes are gortex and vibram bases. there are some trekking poles and clothing option as well. workers are very helpful as well. cheap alternative to north face.

name: Los Navados Approach Road
description: Free camping on a side road with ample space. the road is rarely used and locals said it is no problem. fairly level ground, located a few meters off of the main road. quiet night, except for the local military that came by inspect who was here. very friendly and gave an added level of security. great morning view of the volcano.

name: Sirvicio Honda
description: Honda service center. Able to source parts and perform service, specializes in Honda, but any big bike would be accepted. Saw some Yamaha's, KTM, and BMW's parked.

name: Public Parking Lot
description: We arrived late at night and we decided to sleep here. 1500 pesos the first hour And 500 pesos /hour.  The night we stayed Was ok.

name: Fin del Mundo Waterfall
description: Parking 4000 pesos, 27,000 pesos for several waterfalls. Nice hike, 2-3 hours. Well worth it. Good swimming possibilities. No dogs allowed. Very safe.

name: Hotel Winsor
description: Good hotel, clean, aircondition, secure parking  (near 3 m high). Doubleroom 63800,00 COP. Breakfast not included. Quiet place.

name: Ranger Station. Park Entry
description:
Patch of grass next to ranger station. Toilets and flowing water from a pipe .

I took the backroad from Chinchina to the fork in the road called Las Trillizas. From there I wanted to go to the nevado but i encountered tour guides in lifted toyotas that told me it was not legal in a motorcycle to go there.

So I instead rode down here to the ranger station and they confirmed they would not allow me to go to the end of the road.

So from the ranger station I rode to Villamaria to make a loop.

I would like to add that the road from Chinchina to Las Trillizas is challenging. Mud holes, rocky sections, few stream crossings, steep sections. You definitely need 4x4 and high clearance, too narrow for big rigs. It was a blast on a motorcycle.

The road from here to Villamaria on the other hand is quite easy.

Both had great views.

name: Valle de las Constelaciones
description: A pool in the middel of the desert, with a big gras fieeld wer you can park, basic toiletts and cold shower, a place with shadow wer you can put your chairs.you can buy cold beers.the price pp to use the pool is 5000 we campt for free. To reach the place is a  17km gravelroade from the observatory in the tatacoa desert.the street is not on maps.me pass the observatory turn left at n3°14'13.6"w75°5'36.58", and turn left again at 3°16'00.89"w75°5'31.2" highclearenc recomended

name: Mi Llave Hostel
description: Nice Hostel in Getsemani water front. 32000 pesos per person for a dorm room. Breakfast included. Public parking in front of hostel. 12000 per 12 hours. Close to old town.

name: Jardin botanico Quindio
description:
Parking closed in front of the entrance of the garden. Ask the guard. free. Very quiet even on a Saturday night! No convenience.


parking fermé face à l entrée du jardin. En demandant au gardien. gratuit. Très calme même un samedi soir ! Pas de commodité.

name: Frenos Motos Ltda
description:
great place to get your brakes fixed
they helped us to customize the rear break pads for our VW within a few hours
ask for Diego! tel 2614017

name: Sierra Minca Hostel
description: The place is pretty nice and I was able to camp on the second parking lot from the bottom. I messaged them in advance to ask if I could camp and they said yes. I payed 15,000COP, but keep in mind you will have to either cook your own food that you bring or buy from the hostels restaurant. The hostels restaurant is a bit pricey. The road up is in bad shape. I would say 4x4 is necessary but I guess 2WD with good clearance could make it. Killed one of the shocks on my defender, luckily some of the workers there helped me to weld a temporary fix.

name: Casa Kayam
description: Hostel with enough space in the parking lot for 2 small or medium vehicles and ample space for tents.  About 5 minutes drive and 20 mins walk from Guatape. Looks like a popular backpacker spot. very very noisy at night until 2 am with parties directly at the designated campground. $18,000 cop/pp. Wifi, showers, kitchen, plugin and fireplace.

name: Hotel Torreon Popayan
description:
Double room with private bathroom 40.000 COP/night. Secure car park inside the building for 4-5 cars. Not sure it's big rigs friendly, but there is a bigger private parking lot next door. Clean, cheap and good enough for 1 night.
Single room 25.000 COP/night. 
Plenty of rooms to choose from.

name: villa markram hospedaje
description: nice hostel, hot shower, wifi, breakfast for 30000$ with parking for motobikes.

name: Piscina los Hoyos
description:
Swimming-pool in the desert.
10000 Pesos/person plus 4000 for parking 
There is a little trail close to this place.

name: Hotel / Camping Sinai
description: TWO OPTIONS: 1) open Fri. to Sun.:The former hacienda close to Queremal offers rooms and camping as well. Cars have to park on level parking lot in front of building. Swimming in pool and not so far river (balneario), turkish bath, playground, horse riding, hammocs, large sitting area, pool table.The area is securely fenced off. Nice caretakers. Very quiet, clean. They charge between 10000.- to 15000.- p.p. for car camping. To get there drive in a straight line thru Queremal. At the last quadra (last houses) turn right, slightly up but then down the bumpy trail to the river (ask for the balneario if you cannot find it)  cross the bridge and drive thru gate and thru balneario and head up the track for a couple of hundred meters. Phone 314 6543364 or 317 8902856 . /// OPTION 2): Open everyday: stay at the balneario: toilets, showers, restaurant, price unknown

name: 4x4 jungle / waterfall road
description: On this GPS position you have to drive underneath an impressiv waterfall! This alternativ road from El Queremal to Buenaventura is a fantastic drive thru extremely dense jungle, passing countless waterfalls and tranquil villages. The central part of this 4:30hrs drive is very rough. Tire  damaging rocks, washouts and a very narrow, almost overgrown track make it passable only for 4WDs and smaller trucks. Tree branches make it hard for vehicles higher than 300cm. There is virtually no traffic. It's gravel all the way, so even in wet conditions one should get thru. We recommend to drive downhill (westwards) as you get over the rocky stretches more easy by rolling down. /// the main highway between Cali/Buga and Buenaventura is a UGLY drive with a lot of traffic (we counted 300 trucks per hour on our drive up!!!) /// Bitumen and Panamericana drivers be WARNED: if you like sealed roads and swear about potholes DO NOT DRIVE this track, you will not love it!

name: estacion de servicio biomax
description:
Service station with basic services. free.


estación de servicio con servicios básicos. gratis.

name: Rio Claro La Peña Zona de Camping
description: One of our favourite spots in Colombia! We spent four relaxing days here camping by the river, swimming and reading our books. Cost: 30,000 pesos per night (two people, one tent). Friendly owners. There is a small shop selling drinks and snacks (where you can also charge phones), a clean toilet block and an outdoor shower. Huge, level, grassy area for pitching tents or parking cars/trucks/motos. Some of the Rio Claro rafting tours end here so during the day there are trucks coming and going to pick up boat-loads of tourists, but overall it's a very tranquil spot. Turn-off to the campground from the main road is at: 5.906073, -74.856185. Approx 5km on a gravel road from the turn-off to the site.

name: EcoHotel La Juanita
description:
We are a typical country estate with architecture of the coffee culture. We provide rest and tranquility in a family atmosphere.Each room has a private bathroom with hot water, cable TV, Wi-Fi zone, parking, ecological path and natural pool, where you enjoy the natural properties of water when immersed in this spring . In the camping area you can hear the sound of the birds, enjoy the beautiful sunsets that are only seen in the city of Manizales. We are located 10 minutes from the central area of ​​the city where you will have the possibility to know tourist sites of this.

Somos una finca típica campestre con arquitectura propia de la cultura cafetera. Brindamos descanso y tranquilidad en un ambiente familiar.
Cada habitación posee un baño privado con agua caliente, tv cable, zona wi-fi, parqueadero, sendero ecológico y piscina natural, en donde usted podra disfrutar de las propiedades naturales del agua al sumergirse en este manantial. En la zona de camping podrás escuchar el sonido de los pájaros, disfrutar de los hermosos atardeceres que solo se ven en la ciudad de Manizales. Estamos ubicados a 10 minutos de la zona céntrica de la ciudad donde tendrás la posibilidad de conocer sitios turísticos de esta.

name: Hostal El Portal Fin Del Mundo
description:
We offer guests Shared Kitchen, WIFI, Hamacoterapia, Board Games, Luggage Storage, Green Zones, Footpath, Spa and Beach, Children's Playground (rooms, double and family rooms) And Guarded Parking, all these services are included in the rates.


Es un alojamiento que ofrece hospedaje en habitaciones (dormitorios, matrimoniales y familiares) y camping al aire libre, Ofrecemos a los huéspedes Cocina Compartida, WIFI, Hamacoterapia, Juegos de Mesa, Guarda Equipaje, Zonas Verdes, Sendero, Balneario y Playa, Parque Infantil y Parqueadero Vigilado, todos estos servicios están incluidos en las tarifas.

name: hotel besote
description: The cheapest place I could find in this little village along the highway. They asked 20k but I managed to get it down to 15k if I would eat at their little restaurant. Food was ok, 8k. The room was clean, small and simple. No airco, they have fans.

name: Teleferico Panachi
description:
In the car park of the Mesa de los Santos cable car, beautiful view of the canyon


Sur le parking du téléphérique cote Mesa de los Santos, très belle vue sur le canyon

name: Botanical gardens Alexander von Humboldt
description: On 4,6 hektares there is not much to see. We liked the playground most, plantwise a lot of bamboo, heliconias, grass, a handfull of plant labels, a non working flying fox. Entry 4000.-

name: Zona de Camping
description: A place of a really friendly colombian family in the middle of the city. Flat big grassy area, clean bathrooms, small bar to buy snacks & drinks. We had quite nights, but didn't stay over the weekend. We paid 15.000 COP pp/night (off season) for tent camping.

name: Laundry Laver Matic Express
description: Same day wash and dry service. Fast, efficient, but super expensive.

name: nice waterfall along the road
description: you can swim in the pool next to the road. might be busy with locals.

name: Toyota Garage
description: We just drive in and the did all we need in a short time.we recomend this place for toyotadrivers

name: Panorama Camp Voladero el Tambor
description: Large grassy field (paragliders take off point), level ground, little restaurants (closed in the evening), bombastic view into the valley, very quiet. In few words: one of the extremely rare and nice wild camps in Colombia! Access road for big rigs a bit steep, not recommended.

name: Mi ranchito
description: Clean and basic hotel by the road and next to the river. We paid 20.000 COP for a private bedroom with bathroom. it had a fan and a TV. There's plenty of space for 4 camping cars more or less. Quite noisy because of the road. Very nice owner (Patricia)

name: Hotel Zaracay
description:
Clean, very fast wifi, parking included and very safe, you can park large vehicles, hot water, tv and the people of the hostel very good .. I paid 25 thousand Colombians for a double room


limpio, wifi muy rápido, parqueadero incluido y muy seguro,  se pueden aparcar grandes vehículos,  agua caliente, tv y la gente del hostal muy buena onda..
yo pagué 25 mil colombianos por una habitación matrimonial

name: gran hotel
description:
The room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. The room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. ..bikes can park on the sidewalk or at the front gas station


habitación grande y super cómoda, todo limpio y muy bueno, el personal super amable. 
parada camino a turbo....pague 20 k por una habitación simple, pude dejar la moto en un patio pequeño pero no es recomendable para grandes motos....motos puede parquear en la vereda o en la gasolinera del frente

name: Dian Office
description: You can easily extend your Tip here (after you extend your visa). You will need a photocopy of your passport, visa, SOAT and vehicle registration document. Open 7.30am to 3.30pm. It is likely you will need to go in the next day to pick it up. They were very friendly and helpful.

name: Sura Seguros SOAT
description:
It's not a problem to enter Colombia without SOAT. At the Aduana they told us to buy one in La Hormiga, but it was a holiday and all shops were closed.
Here it was easy to purchase one. Very friendly and fast.
Price: 180'000 Pesos / 90 day / LandRover

name: Cowtry Side
description: Not an easy road but very peaceful spot. 20 min from guatape and 40 min from the rocks. Just the sound of the little river. Wash ourself In the river was perfect after the road.

name: Nobsa
description:
Covered parking lot parking no  service, quiet at night


Parking du terrain de sport couvert pas de service tranquille la nuit

name: Hostal El Portal Fin del Mundo
description:
Camping and Caravan Park, our rates include breakfast and other services offered by the Hostel. Whatsapp 57 3124038407. Camping Rates $ 15,000 with breakfast included


Zona de Camping y Parqueadero de Casas Rodantes, nuestras tarifas incluyen el desayuno y demás servicios que ofrece el Hostal. whatsapp +57 3124038407. Tarifas del Camping $ 15.000 con desayuno incluido

name: DAS - Migracion
description: DAS Migracion, tourist visa renewal. Need to make an online appointment before you show up. Bring photocopies of passport, entry visa. Canadians have to pay 87,000 cop per person. Payment at Banco de Occidente or with credit card in the office. Debit cards will not work.

name: Mirador Villa de Leyva
description: A nice hike from behind the market square to a Mirador overlooking villa de Leyva. Takes approximately 1hr to hike up to the lookout and mini Jesus statue.

name: Mi cocina
description: the restaurant of the culinary academy of Bogota.  A fantastic restaurant in the heart of villa de Leyva, that was recommended to us by locals. it is a bit more expensive than the average colombian restaurant but you get absolutely delicious food that it is money's worth. We can heartily recommend the lomito de trapo, a grilled beef tenderloin for two @48,000 pesos. we also had appetizers that we fantastic.

name: Emerald mining area
description: At this location you will encounter one of the administrativ centers of the many emerald mines around here. Administrador Sr. William Nandar can give you permission to visit Mina Real. We had a short tour, down a 30mts elevator shaft right into the mining shafts where men were digging further shafts into the mountain. Or you just drive thru the area for a look: You can see some mining shaft entrances, extracted rocks from the mines and diggers in the river beds. HOW TO GET THERE: 1) FROM THE NORTHI via Chiquinquira - Maripi - Muzo - river bridge (5.52054 -74.05553) - turn off at 5.53105 -74.14424. We drove it in the wet season and there was no way going without a 4x4: Mud, washouts, some very steep ramps. The most horrible stretch was just west of Maripi. (Do not drive south from Maripi, head west!). Driving time around 4hrs. FROM THE SOUTH: (we describe the route from north to south) From the mines head up the very steep road and then rurn right. The road heads west to Anatena landing strip and to the little town of Quipama. Some streches need definitively a 4x4. At the plaza (5.51936 -74.17861) head south (downhill) respectively right if you drive the other direction. Always follow the main road southwards. At Quatro Caminos (5.33453 -74.18768) head right (resp. left). From here the roads gets much better. Cross the river bridge at 5.30588 -74.19453. Later you will get to Villagimez (5.27570 -74.19585) and after about 4hrs to the iOverlander panorama camp at chapel. Cross river bridge at 5.17834 -74.19315 . From here it is a potholed bitumen road to Pasto (45min) and to the salt church of Zipaquiea (2hrs). Total driving time 6hrs.

name: Panorama camp at chapel
description: Little level spot just beside the road with great views to Villagimez and Quipama. Some traffic. Alternatively camp at the little meadow 70mts south or follow the track westwards for 300mts to a flat saddle where you are completely hidden from everybodys eyes. (Leave space for passing cows and riders). One of the very few spots which is not on privat property where one can stay for a night. From here it is a 4 hrs drive to the emerald mines near Muzo.

name: Parapente Paraiso
description: Fantastic place for paragliding overlooking Lake Tomine. In peak times up to 200 paragliders. Really fancy restaurant all day and evenings open. NIce sunsets. NO CAMPING.

name: Parque Ecologico Pionono
description: Set on top of a mountain chain this seems to be a fantastic camping spot. Walking trains in paramo area, great views. Unfortunately it was closed when we were there (open Wed. to Sun). Entrance 2750.- / camping 10800.-p.p.

name: Cascada De Sueva
description: This is the point on the road where you turn off to drive to the waterfall. Absolutely beautiful. You drive until a hydro electric operation and then take a trail 20-30mins to the base of a waterfall mas o menos 50m tall. Beauty walk through the countryside to get there. Enjoy!

name: Hacienda Napoles
description:
An interesting safari-themed park including safari animals, water parks, and 5 different hotels. Think safari Disneyland of Colombia. 13000 to park, 36000, 50000, or 70000 pesos for different levels of entry. We didn't go in but could be fun. Pablo Escobars old estate apparently. 

UPDATE 2023: Check website for prices: 80-150K for 3 day pass + 24K per day for parking  (it’s totally worth it!)

name: Bosque Llanta
description: Tire shop/repair. All sizes. Clean and great service! Recommended. Air conditioned waiting room with cold water.

name: Parqueadero Autos Diaz
description:
Actual Name Parqueadero Autos Diaz. Left our van here for 2.5 months while working back in the USA. Secure and discrete. Would highly reccomend, especially with the Colombia Laws regarding leaving vehicles in country while away. We parked our high top van deep in the back corner tucked behind a few large trucks. Was able to leave our van and worries behind here. Best long term parking option we found in Bogota after searching around for a half day. William told us to invite all of our friends. Tele: 3138612565 or email quillermom70@gmail.com to work out something. 

9000cop/24h. No hight restrictions.

name: Bogota Escape
description: Running out of daylight and tried to make it to the lakeside. Road split and we ended up here as it got dark. Nice and quiet. Used blocks to level. Not sure who's land but no houses in sight. Road is narrow and steep at times but we made in in a 19 ft 2wd with a 9 ft roof.

name: Donde Edward
description: Traditional cuisine based on meat or fish. Cold buffet of starters and desserts at will for each formula, of medium quality. We took a bottle of California wine from 2012 at 70,000 pesos which was clearly not made to age. The advantage of this restaurant is to be able to choose the cooking of its red meat (in Colombia it is almost impossible to do so). Mention for the beef medallion. Very good quality and "blue" cooking respected. The rates are a bit high. The interior decoration is pretty

name: Restaurante Manga Esquina
description: Simply the cleanest tipico almuerzo spot we've seen in all of Colombia. 8000 por Menu Del Dia. Open air lots of fans. 6 plus options. 3 juices.

name: Hotel Baquero and secure parking also for big rigs
description:
The hotel is basic but staff was friendly, rooms were super clean and the shower super hot. COP 60'000 for a double room. No breakfast. Ask for rooms 208 or 209 (some of the others don't have a window). Only 3 km from the airport. There was surprisingly little air-traffic noise. The place is surrounded by all sorts of car accessory shops and workshops; just ask around.
The hotel does have a secure garage for guest vehicle (max 2.6 m high). 
And just opposite is Alejandro's parqeadero: a very secure, clean and well-organized parking, COP 7000 per night, 14000 for 24 hours. The parking is maybe 30 x 15 m, surrounded by 5-6 m high walls on all sides and with a huge steel gate. No height restrictions. Alejandro and his family live on the premises so the vehicles are truly watched. It would be a safe place to leave your vehicle for weeks or months (COP 160'000 per month). Ask Alejandro if you need parts or services for your truck, he seems to know someone for each and every job.

name: Hotel Del Norte
description:
We stopped here just 70km before Medellin as it got dark, rainy and very foggy.... too dangerous to continue
Clean hotel, warm shower, restaurant next door, paid 100k for a room for 6.

name: DIAN office
description: Very friendly and helpful Dian office where you can extend your TIP. You will need to extend your visa first. You will need a photocopy of that, the front page of your passport, your SOAT (even if expired), your old TIP and your vehicle registration document. We didn't need to give them the letter we had written and had to go back the next day to pick up the new TIP. They are open 8am to 4pm and told us that any DIAN office should be able to extend TIPs.

name: San fransisco
description:
Car park next to the city center no service but quiet

Parking du marche à cote du centre ville pas de service mais tranquille

name: MOMOTO - Black Hole Café
description: a great little cafe in the heart of Guatapé. Excellent locally grown and roasted coffee, loose leaf teas from cali and they also have a selection of muffins and cakes as well as empanadas and paninis.

name: Hotel Nogaro
description: Clean and nice simple hotel. Very friendly staff. We paid $10 for a decent sized double room with private bath. Good WiFi. Includes secure parking in a small garage in the back of the hotel. Great for motorbikes.

name: Hotel Pakandé
description: Clean rooms with private bathroom. Two people for 55.000 pesos.

name: El Holandés Bogota
description: Owned by a Dutch guy who's specialiced in mechanics of enduro bikes. Back in Holland he used to work with professional racing teams! He has his working-area inside the Motorrad shop. He's very knowledgable and uses only high quality parts for reasonable price. For sure a honest price. For us it feels really good to be sure the bikes are maintained by a professional and good enough to drive all the way to the south. Definately a must-visit when you're driving an enduro bike through South-America..

name: Hostal Venecia
description: a Hostal with everything one would expect. hammocks, fruit trees, two kitchens. really hot showers. the downside is the poor area for parking if you want to sleep in your vehicle. price is 22,000 cop p.p for camping/overlanding, 32,000. the guest house, has a much better area for overlanding.

name: organic garden
description:
organic vegetables directly from the garden
a blue house, parking only on the street possible 
fresh vegetables from the garden next to the house low prices

name: Nueva Lengua accomodation and language course
description:
If you don't speak spanish and you're looking for a course this is the place to be. Nice group/private classes and they offer accomodation in the school (which is like a luxurious villa with swimmingpool).They have 1 private room and 5 dorm beds. You can park your motorbikes/vehicle super safely in the garage. 

-kitchen
-pool
-Wi-Fi
-acttivities such as salsa and cooking class
-safe parking
-good location
-good price

name: Clinical Moto
description: Best (only?) shop that works on big bikes in Pasto. Performed a full engine rebuild on my GS in order to repair parts. Took a few days, but all went well.

name: Agua Tibia - Parador & Tourist Info
description: Roadside. Well leveled gravel parking lot next to a little comedor. Fits for one big rig. Check for the large sign saying "El Turista". Its free and save. We paid 10k voluntary for a big rig and two persons. No services at all. At night its quiet. But early at morning the traffic becomesnloud soon. We didn't make it from San Agustin to Popayan in time. So this was a good finding for just overnight stay.

name: Santa Fe
description:
In the dead end along the quiet church at night


Dans l'impasse le long de l'église tranquille la nuit

name: Hostel De La Nueva Baeza
description: It is in the city center and very clean place. It has a kitchen and tables. Also  it's has a small garden and private free undercover parking for only cars and motorcycles. All rooms have private restroom. Internet is average. There is only cold shower and weather is cold in night :( Double room price is 60.000COP. Single room price is 40.000COP. The owner is a bit grumpy but it's okay.

name: El Arca Minca
description:
A great stop on the way to Pozo Azul. They serve juices, organic coffee and delicious small cakes. You can buy organic coffee beans and more organic food like homemade jam, chutneys and salsas as well organic non-food articles from the region.
For Thaï-Massages ask Ana Maria Velez (info@bioterra.co)
For a room ask Paul Ploch (info@elarcaminca.com)
Beside Spanish, English, German,  (Paul), and French speaking (Ana Maria)

name: Gallery Hotel
description: Clean ultra modern hotel with secure parking underground. 80,000 cop for a private double room with hot shower and bathroom. Fast enough wifi, pw is GALLERY* breakfast is included. Parking garage can fit ~8-9 foot tall rig. A bit noisy on a Friday night but just another day in Colombia. Great views from the 5th floor patio/lounge/bar/breakfast area

name: EcoGard
description: 25$pp excelent place...

name: Restaurante y Cabañas las hamacas. Neiva ruta sur
description: CAUTION! problems with paying! really a lot of mosquitoes and Internet does not work. Excelent for past the nigth and rest in the pools. The owenrs are very bizzar but they are very clean good people. They have a farm, cabins, camping, restaurant, and animals. we pay 20.000COP, the original price  30.000COP.

name: Kite Center Tawi
description:
This friendly place lies about 500 m NW and outside the "urban" area of Cabo de la Vela, right on the beach. It's spacious, very quiet at night and there is little traffic during the day, very much unlike all the other iOverlander sites located in the village. The spot can be windy but it's starkly beautiful.
Paula and Etto (yet another Colombian-German couple) provide flushing toilets (but you do the flushing with a bucket) that are cleaned daily, toilet paper and a rustic bucket shower for COP 10.000 pp pd. There is no WLAN (but the Claro signal is very strong), no electricity, no shade, no drinking water and no food. But they do run a surf/kite school and a bar and would like to have more overlanders.
They can organize rough-and-tumble 24-hour trips to Punta Gallinas (all land and sea transportation there and back included, but no food, drinks or accommodation/hammock for COP 120.000, which is not much compared to other agencies; inquire  about exactly what attractions the tour visits and what exactly is included — the operator was trying to cut corners; take enough water for the journey — there's nothing to buy until you get to Punta Gallinas; wear sunscreen — the boats offer no protection from the elements). The scenery is well worth the trip!
They can also organize a guide if you'd rather drive to Punta Gallinas in your own truck, which can be impossible after heavy rain. It would be near impossible to get there by yourself plus you're left to deal with the Wayuu "checkpoints" yourself.

name: Frailejónes
description:
In this area you can find lots of 'Frailejón' plants. 
It is a spectacular road, you drive through different vegetation zones, maybee not for big rigs, sometimes very narrow and windy

name: Tejo In Medellin
description: Play Tejo, the national sport of Colombia where you throw steel stones into a mud pit and try to make gunpowder packets explode! Email Chris at ccajoleas@gmail.com to set up a time. 25,000 COP pp with four drinks included for about 2.5 hours. It's inside the Polideportivo Sur sports complex off Avenida Las Vegas. WhatsApp: +57 310 5927281

name: Mirador de Jericó
description:
On the gondola car park with a great view of the city.
the police and they no longer let us sleep in the main park but they told us that we could come here which is quiet. The place is spacious, the view is beautiful and the place quiet. No baths no water. 


Sur le parking du télécabine avec une super vue sur la ville

name: Mobil Station
description: Secure parking next the station

name: Orlando  Bustillo Jr. M.D.
description: English speaking gynaecologist in Cartagena www.gobustillo.com. Good Doc!

name: Behind motel near Terpel gas station
description:
Behind the motel is a large place with view on the river.
 'tranquilo'☺ 
Paid 4000cop for the night

name: Restaurante Andres
description:
After 8 weeks in Colimbia this was by far the best restaurant. 

A meal cost 25 000 COP. This includes jugo, bread, main dish and home made  fries.

We took steak and it was delicious and huge.

Highly recommended!

name: Casa Pampa
description:
Very nice bamboo house in a valley 1.2km north from San Augustin.

Fiendly owners. They have private rooms with hot showers. You can also camp in the garden. Secure  bike and car parking on property. Breakfast is included.

The owner does horseback riding tours through the area. We did it and it was a great experience. Big strong horses.
Highly recommended

name: Triunfo Hostal
description:
Note - location may not be exact

Beautiful Hostel on the Road to San Augustin. View from the Room down to the Magdalena River. Very Kind Host. Large Parking Area for Cars/Motorbikes.

name: Parqueadero al lado estadio
description:
We slept one night in the main park but at 5am it was full of people coming out to work and it is super noisy. Here the place is super quiet. Almost no cars pass.


dormimos una noche en el parque principal pero a las 5 de la mañana se llena de gente que sale a trabajar y es super ruidoso. acá el lugar es super tranquilo. casi no pasan carros.

name: Parador Turistico Patia
description: Camping, cabanas, hotel, restaurant, swimmingpool. Shady, grassy camping. Easy access for all rigs. Toilet, cold shower, wi-fi . 15k pp (September 2023).

name: Hostal Trifuno
description: On the Road between Pitalito and San Agustin. Just 10 min to S. Agustin with the Motorbike. New Hostel, very friendly owner. Kitchen under construction but almost finished. Lot of Parking Area. Wonderful view from Balcony (River, Sunrise). Quiet place.

name: Hotel Brisas De Rio Sucio
description: Room is sImple. Shower is cold but it is hot here so no problem. Single room with bathroom us 15000 pesos. TV, wifi, secure parking.

name: Baños Los Mangos Camp and pool
description: A beautiful camping place in the mountains, close to Salamina town! There is a few swimming pool and bathroom with showers to. Jairo the owner an his son will help you with everything you need!!

name: Calle lateral
description:
Without services. It is on the street but super quiet and safe. No vehicles pass and the view is very pretty. We stayed 4 days.


sin servicios. es en la calle pero super tranquilo y seguro. no pasan vehículos y la vista es muy linda. estuvimos 4 días.

name: terpel gas station
description: truck parking lot at terpel station. a bit noisy but big. good clean showers and toilets.

name: Parking
description: The Hangar.  Secure covered long term parking next to Cali Airport.  120,000 COP for 12-30 Days, 4,000 per day for every day after 30.

name: Hotel Las Malvinas
description: Clean, cheap hostel. Single room with fan without TV is 12000 pesos, single room with fan and TV is 15000 pesos. Double bed room with fan for one person is 20000 pesos, with ac is 30000 pesos. Friendly staff. Parking is only small motos. During I went to Capurgana my baggage and moto were keep safety for free.

name: Hotel Aristi
description: Clean hostel. Room with fan for one people is 25000 pesos. There is secure parking.

name: Hostel Azalea
description: Back packer hostel. Dorm is 20000 pesos. AC is only night time. Secure parking for motorcycles and small car. There is parking for pay at opposite side of hostel. You can go to center by bus 1400 pesos.

name: El Piramide - Tunnels
description: An archeological site of tunnels hand dug into the rock. You can pay a tip to have lights turned on insude the tunnels. It is located on the back of a property, ask at the house. No information on the history but an incredible spot. The road going up is not very wide. Good for a motorbike. With a small 4x4 you can make it to a basketball court to park and turn around. Otherwise park on the main road on a pullout and walk up. definitely work it.

name: Namasté
description:
Vegan restaurant. Very nice, good food.
.....
Vegan food, muy simpático con une buena comida

name: El Portal
description:
local spot in the walled city with empanadas, chicken and bollos.  We really enjoyed the empanadas con pollo desmechado.  We suggest the pollo desmechado and not the regular pollo which has full chicken pieces with bones in the empanada.

Fidels, the bar next door, is a great spot to grab an ice cold beer and people watch.

name: punta del sol hotel
description: good hotel for 60k pesos per night with pool, wifi, breakfast, big rooms with AC, it's road side hotel but it's big place and the rooms are at the back far from the road plus I could parked my motorcycle close to the room.

name: Hotel Guajira Colonial
description: Cheap hostel. Single room with fan is 25000 pesos. Staff are very kind. Parking is for only motorcycles.

name: parque de santa elena
description: we camped just after the entrance of the park, on the grass. it can be muddy if it rains, but there are also spaces further near the football ground. police is just nearby and it's them who advised us to camp here. very quiet at night, even near the road.

name: Quimpo - alcohol/propano
description: They moved. Still on the Panamericana but 650 meters towards Popayán. Opposite of a pool and a soccer field.

name: Primax Gas
description:
Very large gravel parking to the back of the gas station. Two 24 hour restaurants.
Was suprisingly quiet when we were here.

there is a cheap hostal behind the gas station

name: Street Parking
description:
*Moderator Note: Overnight camping/parking is NOT available at this location.
.....
No amenities but safe, quiet, and free. Police nearby (in viewing distance) and confirmed it's no problem to stay here.

**2023. Parking lot doesn’t exist anymore. There are now apartment buildings. You can still park on the street.

name: Steel Horse Colombia
description:
Fellow overlanders.... after 18 months of travelling around South America on 2 motorcycles, we liked it here so much that we decided not to leave! We have spent everything we have and bought a finca/farm/hacienda in need of repair and love which we moved into on 24/12/2016! We would be delighted if you came to stay with us.

We are a 30-year old British couple from London, and have decided to change our lives completely and renovate a horse farm in need of some love whilst trying to give finca/hostal ownership in Colombia a go based on our experiences of what we think bikers and 4+ wheeled overlanders want such as (but not limited to) a smile when you arrive, a quick tour, visible price list, not "nickel and diming", hot shower, approachable owners and with some hope, doing our best to make it a nice place to stay for a few days before you move on.

Here you will find no workers (except us), a work in progress hostal/hacienda renovation, a comfortable and hopefully welcoming place to stay, home 2.5km from the center of Filandia (all downhill to the finca), 1.5 km from the Mirador of Filandia via 90% paved road and no height restriction.

 We have a stocked bar, 'honesty' beer fridge and some essentials for sale. We have the best 20mb wifi available in rural Colombia, netflix, board games, directv, hammocks, guest kitchen, many animals, toilet seats, a BBQ, secure parking (cul de sac with 2 neighbours), indoor fireplace, 3 hectares you are free to explore with papaya, oranges, lemons, limes and a bamboo "forest".

We also have a 7-month-old very friendly "street" dog we found in the gutter somewhere near Cartagena so of course, well-behaved pets are allowed on the grounds

Single rooms from 55,000 and doubles from 65,000 though bank transfer PayPal(+4% of bill) etc are welcomed forms of payment. group room also available for 2+ beds

4 wheeled vehicle camping is 28,000 per person per night

Please see the photos (it is not a building site!). We have a lot of ideas for the place and welcome your support by staying with us.

The finca (soon to be Steel Horse Colombia) is called "Finca/vereda Santa Rita", on the first gravel road to the right, 100meters before the filandia mirador if coming from filandia"
.... I'm a cowboy.... on a steel horse I ride!
steelhorsecolombia@hotmail.com

name: Finca Hotel Vegas del Sol
description: the boss demands 50,000 per person, we left, poorly maintained place with dirt parking lot, frankly ugly place.

name: Hotel Costa Azul
description: Clean hostel. Single room with ac is 30000 pesos. Cold shower, wifi, TV, secure parking for cars and motos. Staff are very kind and friendly.

name: Hotel Los Almendros
description: Cheap hostel. Double room with ac for one person is 25000 pesos. No wifi. Cold shower, secure parking.

name: hostel Cattleya
description: dorms and private rooms, no kitchen but good included breakfast, secure lock up parking for Moto's and cars, quiet place with friendly family owners, next door to hostel el zorzal

name: Hotel San Rey
description: Clean hostel. No hot shower, wifi, TV, secure parking. Single room is 45000 pesos. There are lot of hotel around here, you can find many type room.

name: Open Beach Camping
description: This is an entrance point to the beach. 4x4 clearance would be helpfulas entrance is steep and uneven . There is a section 30m or so of dirt which might go under water part of the year and possibly boggy. It was dry when we came through. Head 100m further to be on the beach. A few spots to be covered from view along this strip. But not a whole lot of access points that we saw. Right next to highway so can be noisy. Was very windy also. Possibly if there was no wind, the biting insects might come out as there is marshland every now and then. Good bird life. Only stopped for lunch.

name: Muelle Necoclí / Ferry to Capurganá
description:
This is the jetty of Necoclí and the departure point of the speed boat to Capurganá.

The following is a copy of parts of a Lonely Planet "Thorn Tree" note left by ccaron in June 2016; it proved very helpful for us and was still 100% accurate (I omitted some irrelevant bits, marked with […])

Title: Boat from Necocli to Capurgana
Comment: «I recently took the boat from Necocli trying to avoid going through Turbo. Excellent experience altogether. The ride does take 1h30, […]. The boat was in very good condition, we were not packed either. 
Tickets can be bought at the wharf an hour before departure or reservation can be made in adavance at the Panorama Hotel. Ticket costs 60,000 COP + 2,300 COP of port taxes (we did not have to pay this on the way back though). Baggage allowance is 10kg per person, so the charged us 1000 COP pear extra kg. 
We took the boat at 8am, but there seems to be another boat later in the day if enough passengers are found to ﬁll the boat. On Sundays there is a boat going to Sapzurro as well, through Capurgana. We took it on the way back to Necocli and they did not charge us for extra weight. Depending on the weather, we highly recommend to have your backpack put into a big garbage bag (sold for 1500-2000 or so). In case of rain or water coming into the boat, the plastic bag will keep it dry. […] We were told that the sea is pretty at this season (June- Aigust) but it gets much rougher during the dry season Dexember-February and locals tend to stay away from travels to Necocli or Turbo.
[…]»

The Hotel Panorama is the highest white building in the center of town. The receptionist was really helpful and made calls for us to investigate about the availability of accommodation in Capurganá. We were able to purchase the tickets on our Visa card the day before.

The hotel runs a safe parqueadero 100 m away (guard on duty 24 h, CPO 10.000 per 24 h).
Capurganá doesn't have an ATM so take enough cash. And don't miss Josefina's seafood!

name: Hospedaje Tiki Lounge playa and camping
description:
This cool place by the beach caters mostly to Colombian tourists. Doña Carmenza offers rooms and apartments, raised sand platforms for tent camping, food, drinks and cakes. There is space for 1-2 overlander vehicles in partly shaded, flat spots next to the main house. The beach is nice, there is plenty of driftwood for bonfires, the toilet and shower in one of the apartment blocks adjacent to the beach are new and clean (the ones in the thatched hut are so-so). If you are lucky you can spot a rare blue crab on her property.

Carmenza doesn't speak English and is only interested in overlanders willing and able to fit in and communicate with her Colombian guests, many of them long-standing regulars or loosely connected family members.

COP 15.000 pp pn. We were allowed to leave our truck here free of charge during our visit to Capurganá. The transfer to the Necoclí muelle / harbor by motocarro (3 people) was COP 12.000 each way).

To get here follow the dirt road more or less along the shoreline from Necoclí. The entrance to the property is signposted.

name: Secure parking even for big rigs
description:
It's not one of the fine addresses in Medellín but it's solid and secure even if it doesn't evoke this impression at first sight.
The owner, a noble and faith-inspiring man, has run this place for 30 years and the parqueadero / taller is also a social institution providing work for some people who would otherwise life in the streets. One of the two, the owner himself or his right hand, are always on premises. Security cameras are in place. They kept our truck well for three days. 24-hour access. COP 18.000 per 24 hours.
There is space here even for very big rigs.
It's 1.2 km from Hotel 61 Prado (taxi: COP 5.500).

name: Parking Comercial Getsemaní (up to mid-size rigs)
description:
This big parqueadero has 24-hour guards on site as well as video surveillance. Some of the parking spaces are in the shade all day … but the birds living in the trees will "decorate " the vehicle in their very own style … better don't wash your car before your stay in Cartagena.
We stayed in Getsemaní for 10 days and had our truck parked here. The guards actually remembered us when we went back to pick something up from the truck and accompanied us to the vehicle. They all are in radio contact. We made a 10-day contract at their admin office and paid COP 20.000 per day.

name: Wild Camping on Penninsula
description: This is a wild camping spot on a little peninsula of land that crops out into the water. During the day some of the collective buses park here but it's quiet at night. People do come to smoke weed and hang out sometimes  but everyone is nice. All the locals said it was safe. You are in view from the bridge and road during the day but at night it's pretty dark so you won't stick out. 5 mins walk into guatape and it was the only piece of dry land by the water that was accesible when we were here.

name: Monaco Automotriz
description: Specialised in brakes. Can make any brand. We solved here our problem of overheating brakes in the mountain descending roads !  Specialidad : frenos.

name: Hotel Capisol
description: Clean room with bathroom, fan, TV, wifi. Parking is only motorcycles but there is parking for car next door. Double bed room for one person is 15000 pesos.

name: Colombia
description: Owner is mountain guide, there are many photos of mountains at hostel. Room is clean and comfortable bed. Double bed room for one person is 25000 pesos. Parking is only for motorcycles.

name: Gran Hotel Las Palmas
description: Clean hostel. Single room with bathroom is 20000 pesos. wufi, TV, hot shower. Secure parking for only motorcycles.

name: Bikini hostal
description:
The best expatriate who lives on this land has opened a campsite in this small town of Palomino. I strongly advise you to go and visit him. 20,000 pesos per person.


Le meilleur expatrié qui existe sur cette terre a ouvert un Camping dans cette bourgade de Palomino. Je vous conSeil vivement de passer lui rendre visite. 20 000 pesos par personne.

name: Luis Felipe Unimog Colombia
description: Luis Felipe is the Unimog specialist in Colombia. If you have a Unimog or other large Mercedes truck, he can definitely help you out. He even makes house calls to other cities if you want.  This is the location of his home and workshop in Bogota. He is a great guy and has an awesome son and young apprentice who work with him.

name: On the beach
description:
beach camping 
This is an amazing place to stay for a few days. camping right on the beach. very chilled and free. Nothing here so bring everything you need.

name: Museo Santa Clara
description:
This is an ancient church transformed in a very interesting museum where you can visit without any guide because many interactive screens allow you to understand. 
Price 3000 COP and free for people over 60.

name: Handycraft market
description: Nice place to visit even if you don't need to buy.

name: Hotel El Dorado
description:
We checked 4 hotels around this place and no prices under 130000 COP for a double. After more than an nhour driving in La Candelaria district we found this small hotel that offer a double for 60000 COP. 
Very very basic accomodation but the cheapest one we could find in the heart of historical centre. 
If you go there don't accept street side rooms : impossible to sleep because many bars around extremly noisy. 
We had room nbr 306, very small but quiet enough. 
A parking lot is open 100 meters up, in the same street for 8000 COP /24 hours.

name: LAND ROVER BOGOTA
description:
Here is the Land Rover workshop of Bogotà; at about 20 km on north of city. 
We went there to buy motor oil and filters for our Defender. 
We needed Castrol Edge 5W30-C1 but they didn't have this specification; so we bought Castrol Magnatec 5W30-A5 for 16€/liter : twice pricey than in France.

name: Hotel Paraiso
description:
Hotel just in front of the main plaza. 
Paid 45000 COP for a double. 
Clean.

name: Hotel Las Antillas
description:
Coming from Medellin to Cartagena we had a step in this small seaside town frequented by many locals in this period.
A good step : beach, music, drive the water front, kiosks craft....
Many hotels, but be careful with noisy location. 
We chose this one in a street behind water front. It was OK. 
75000 COP for a double (in fact four beds...) with AC, fan, bathroom and secure parking lot a little bit further. 
Breakfast : 7000 COP each.

name: LO BUCAROS.  VALLEDUPAR
description:
HOTEL SIMPLE FOR TRUCKS DRIVERS

HUGH PARKING FOR TRUCKS. 
RV. BIG RIG. 
RESTAURANT.

name: Necocli Free Camp
description: Near the beach or parking lot. A little good wind ! Some restaurants close to the parking lot.

name: Mirador Del Pipinta
description: Nice hotel with big parking lot. Clean rooms with a balcony and view of the river. We negotiated for 80000 cop for two people. No wifi, but definitely a cool place to hang out. We weren't impressed with the restaurant, as it was pretty pricey for what we got.

name: immigration
description:
the place you have to go to stamp in or out your passport
1 minute, easy, friendly...

name: Parqueadero para ir a la dian
description:
Ideal place to park when one is going to do the process to the dian, our motorhme measures 7 meters and we were able to leave it there  and then crossed to the dian to provide the data of the car

Lugar ideal para parquear cuando uno va a hacer el tramite a la dian, nuestro motorhme mide 7 metros y pudimos dejarlo ahi lo mas bien y enseguida se cruzaron de la dian a controlar los datos del carro

name: al costado de la calle
description:
We spent two very quiet days, there is space, not many vehicles and has a nice view of the lake


Pasamos dos dias muy tranquilos, hay espacio, no pasan muchos vehiculos y tiene una linda vista al lago

name: Al rededor del parque
description:
We were 9 nights in the park, the people in the area are super friendly and we were able to sell our products very well !!! Any local has no problem giving you internet


Estuvimos 9 noches en el parque, la gente de la zona es super amable y pudimos vender muy bien nuestros productos!!! Cualquier local no tiene problema en darte internet

name: Hotel Alcayata Colonial
description: Nice hotel with free parking near by (not for real big cars), wifi, brakfast included. 85000 for a double room

name: Unicentro Shopping Mall
description:
Here you can park for 2000$ per day and 50'000$ COP per night. They have wifi, clean bathrooms and a cinema. 
Maximum vehicle hight is 2.10m
Open till 10pm. Short walk to the center of Pasto. Parqueadero for taller cards on the other side of the Panamericana a bit Uphill.

name: nando fishing house
description:
Certainement le meilleur plan du coin...nous sommes reste 2 jours chez nando et sa famille, une cabane de pêcheur isolée au bord de la plage....du poisson et des crevettes fraiches tous les jours....aucun bruit la nuit, la journée dans le hamac.... 

Sure the best plan of the village… we are remainder 2 days at Nando and its family, a hut of fisherman isolated at the edge of the range….fish and shrimps every day….no noise the night, the day in the hammock...

name: Hotel IBIS
description:
185000 COP for a double with garage and breakfast. 
If you don't book via internet breakfast is not included...
Garage works with a lift, so height must be under 2,20 m; but there is an open parking lot just in front where you can park even big rigs. 
If possible choose a room with view on the ocean; mostly when you have to wait many days for crossing the Darien gap. 
Be careful if you check out with foreign a credit card at lobby : they try to charge in € (or USD) using a not advantageous rate.

name: Armed Robbery
description:
Armed robbery using machetes witnessed on beach, resulting in one injury. Police were quick to respond. Locals report that this has been a problem lately. 

We were staying across the street at Casa deal Mar and the staff was very helpful in ushering us inside and locking the gate. 

Beautiful place to visit, but be aware of your surroundings.

name: wild desert
description: In our opinion, the best place to spend night in desert Tatacoa!

name: Hostal Colombia
description: Hostal, closed garage for motorcycle, private room and private bathroom for 70000, breakfast included, clean

name: Hospederia El Ocobo
description: Very friendly owner, good price, safe motorcycle parking, comfy rooms, close to town

name: El Rancho de Salento
description:
Camping with showers and baths. 10 000 per person. There is a restaurant. No electricity. Dueno very friendly.


Camping con duchas y banos. 10 000 por persona. Hay restaurante. No electricidad. Dueno  muy amable.

name: La Cevicheria
description:
Difficult to find a good restaurant in Cartagena; this is one. 
Expensive but good. 
Examples of prices :
- Paella for two : 100000 COP
- Ceviche as starter : 30000 COP
- Small beer : 10000 COP
- Coctails : 20000 COP
In Cartagena the prices on menus don't include taxes and tip; ask before order because the rates are very fluctuating...
-------
Take care also if you order something not written in the menu : the second time we went in this restaurant they charged 28000 COP for one margarita !...

name: Betania Cheese factory
description: SO good! Must stop here and try the pandequeso - have one to yourself. It’s so fluffy I don’t know how they do it! Delicious and clearly popular as there were tons of people eating these when we stopped At 3:30 on a Saturday.

name: al lado de la alcaldía
description:
Very quiet place at night and safe. The police are half a block away. No services but ideal to stay for one night and get to know the village


lugar muy tranquilo de noche y seguro. la policía está a media cuadra. no hay servicios pero ideal para estar por una noche y conocer el pueblo

name: La Aurora Free Camp
description: On the outskirts of the little village you will find this spot close to the football field. Grassy area with a watertap in the north/east corner of the field. People friendly. We had a quiet night. Easy access.

name: Waira Refugio de la Laguna
description:
Here live Jorge, an amazing guy with a true heart of traveller (he used to travel before, by moto or combi). He owns a beautiful house, with direct view on the Laguna. 

He has a homestay. 2 rooms (Double bed in each), with private bathroom, and view on the Laguna. Breakfast include. He has also a cabana for 4 people, completely independent (with your own kitchen, living room, bathroom).

But because he loves travelers, he wants to open his gate to Overlander as well (rigs and tent). He ll charge something for the showers (really really hot shower !!) electricity, wifi, kitchen​, etc, but not sure how much. He loves listen the stories of the travellers. The communal room is a perfect place for chilling: choose the music you want to play, enjoy the view, make a fire, share wine/tea or anything else with him, share a meal, ...

Just contact him beforehand:
vivewaira@gmail.com
312 848 5066

His website: www.waira.co

name: Restaurante Yerbabuena
description:
Gastronomique restaurant , the owner has travelled a lot, also in Europe, and has very tasty menu-card....
Solomillo con camarones 34.000.-
Starting at 18.000.-
We realy apreciated to eat so well, since we are in columbia,

name: Parque Antonio Ricaute
description:
Very quiet place, mostly shady In the morning and safe


lugar muy tranquilo, con sombra sobre todo Por la mañana y seguro

name: D1 Supermarket
description: D1 small grocery chain with unbeatable prices and good quality.

name: 4x4 camp Guadalupe Beach
description: A camp off the touristy area of Palomino. Take turnoff 300mts east of bridge (N 11.24260 W 73.52862) to get there. In the upper area - below the main road - all cars can get to. There are grassy areas, shelters, kitchen, volleyball field and few privat cabanas (35000.-and 50000.-), some road noise. 15000.-/p. /// With a 4x4 you can drive down to three (privately owned) beaches (dry conditions only). 4 min /1.1kms driving. One is a nudist beach. Space for camping is a bit limited. On the westernmost beach is space for some cars, possibility to make a fire and a freshwater river is flowing into the sea. Down here everything is a bit run down, quite a lot of rubbish, no infrastructue but you will spend an undisturbed night right at the beachfront. Without using the upper infrastructure we paid 10000.- each. /// From this western beach a hiking trail leads up to a viewpoint and on to other (nudist) beaches (eastwards). Another trail goes west to a freshwater lagoon, birding platform, into the quiet jungle and (with some luck) to a monkey colony (at the first footbridge) after 6min walk.

name: Finca el Sestillal
description: A good place to stay far from the city, very quiet and safe! They make the good "tinto" black coffee. Very friendly!

name: La Cosecha Parrillada
description:
Excellent place to satisfy any meat cravings. We stopped for lunch. They do a set meal for 12000 and a la carte. Good portions. not cheapest but good value.
BBQ, nice good food , we appreciated it.

name: Hostel Lucernaga
description: Great hostel, very friendly staff. Hostel rms 20,000 up w/70,000 for a private room with private bathroom. No need of a/c or fan, cold enough for very nice blanket and wonderful pillow. Good restaurant on lower level. Great town.

name: Éxito Supermarket & Shopping
description:
Large store and supermarket.  Similar to a superwalmart.  Good selection of everything.  Groceries, clothing, electronics, car section, some tools, cafes, ATMs etc.

Free parking with guards walking around.  No height restriction in upper parking lot, accessed from the north.  

Correction: free for 1h only and north entrance has now height restrictions, for more see check-ins

name: Hospedaje Oriente
description:
Basic and good. 10k for a single bed! You can even sleep at two in a single bed to economise. Patio with sofa. you can park motorbike inside. No wifi.
Didn't try the shower. Clean. Friendly people.

name: Poblado Hotel
description: Really beautiful new hotel with enormous pool, right on the ocean. Perfect if you want somewhere nice to celebrate and splurge a bit.

name: El Tesoro - Volcan de Lodo / Mud Volcano
description: A mud volcano!!! So fun! You absolutely must go and jump in!

name: El silencio next to rio
description:
quiete little village on the bank of a rio. easy free  parking. no noise. lovely kids inreracting with our children. 
possibility to swim in the Rio.  probably better to avoid WE.

name: near stadium
description: A lot of place to park big rig.....quiet, feel safe, the police pass on the night....

name: Next to the Beach in front of the hotel. Street side.
description: In front of the beach in front of the hotel. Quiet.

name: Hotel Cabañas de San Gabriel
description: Nice, basic and cheap double rooms. We bargained the owner Marco down to $40.000COP for the room (after high season - during high season expect to pay $70.000COP). Room had double + single beds, basic ensuite and fan. Cool, relatively clean and cosy.

name: Near River Free Camp
description: When you drive the 62 south-bound, take the track on your right just before the bridge. When you drive to the north take after the bridge the first track at your left. Follow the track approx 250 metres till the end where it widens and where you can turn or find your peacefull spot. Enough space and easy access for all rigs.

name: Casa Surf Mar Azul
description: Small, funky hostel with room to park and camp. Dorms are 15,000COP. Relatively clean, quiet and very relaxed compared to the rest of Palomino. No wifi but small kitchen with most things. Carlos the owner is a very chilled out guy.

name: Seguros del Estado
description: 8th floor. entrance is on Av. Carlos Escallón. 124000 for 3 months.  Minimum purchase is 2 months

name: Street parking
description:
After we had to move on behind the Hilton we came here and stayed one more night. The street is very wide, no buses, little taxis and generally less traffic than at the street next to the Hilton. The beach is just in front, little wind and very quiet during the night. Further to the tip of the road there will be even less traffic and a little park is there as well. Might be interesting for dog owners.
So pick your spot, we liked it better than parking on the street next to the Hilton.

name: Migration Office Colombia
description: Only an exit/entry if you have no vehicle. If you have a vehicle you need to go to the other border post approx 5km away for processing your TIP.

name: DIAN Cucuta
description:
This is the main DIAN office where you'd need to go if you need to renew your TIP. WARNING! ⚠️ We were denied the extension of our TIP because we left Colombia to cross into Venezuela without our truck. We were told they could impound our truck and make us pay a fee but let us go with a warning and advised us to leave Colombia through Ecuador and the re-enter if we wanted to obtain a new TIP. Instead we drove to Bucaramanga where we renew our TIP without issues. The documents you'd need to renew are:
- Original and copy of your current TIP
- Present your original passport with a new (recent) stamp from the migration office.
- Original and copy of your vehicle title.
- Original and copy of current and valid car insurance.

Once the docs are presented you'll be given a form to fill out. This is your official request to extend your TIP. A persons from Aduanas need to take fotos of your vehicle's VIN and license plates. 

The process for us took 2 days as they needed to get confirmation from the DIAN office in Cartagena that they in fact had issued our original TIP.

name: Terpel station
description:
Camping - Big fuel station with restaurant and hotel. We could camp (tent) on the left side of the hotel under the tree. Very large lot.  Access to the toilet with toilet paper and soap (really clean), and showers. The restaurant closes around 10:30pm-11pm. Quiet for a roadside sleep. 

Hotel - Clean double rooms with A/C, TV & WiFi - 35k

Perfect stop between San Agustin - Tatacoa.

name: Centro  Tambo La Manuela
description:
Wifi, electricity, coffee, bathroom!   
Free, but they didn't let us stay after 7 am
Camping and RV not allowed by permit only
No permiten acampar y en casa rodante solo con permiso

name: Hospedaje Villa Amparo
description:
We tried to arrive in Tambo, but there was a landslide and it was not possible! We stoped in other spot, near the hospedaje and met Sr Eduardo the owner! Person very friendly, with a great knowledge of Colômbia! We spent a night with him and his family! 
The place has a wonderful view and is very quiet, perfect to relax... they Offer horse rides, tours around the Finca, with waterfalls... plenty of attractions!!! best place to stay if you are looking for a quiet night or even a week or more in a finca!!!

name: Fruits and veggies shop.
description: Very cheap place to buy your stuff near Neiva.

name: La playa
description:
We slept three nights on the beach. the paid places of the kite schools did not offer any service. super quiet What if there is a lot? wind.
dormimos tres noches a orillas de la playa. los lugares pagos de las escuelas de kite no ofrecían ningún servicio. super tranquilo. lo q si hay mucho. viento.

name: Hotel Monterrey
description: White building connected to the Terpel gas station. We got a room for 25,000 COP.

name: Hotel & Restaurante El Descanso
description: Private room with tv and bathroom. Room is clean and owner is very friendly. Good coffee too.  Owner allows to camping too.

name: Hotel El Faro
description: Brand new hotel. Really cute and modern. We paid 60,000 COP for a double room and 3,000 COP to park our tandem bicycle. It's located on the 3rd floor of a shopping center.

name: Localish restaurant - Mio Oficina
description:
The most local restaurant in this touristy area. 
Breakfasts from 6000cop (eggs, tomato, onion, arepa with juice or coffee etc.) 
Cheap almuerzos 7000cop. 
And cheap snacks from 2000cop. 

There are cheaper restaurants (almuerzos 5000) but it is necessary to walk further into the city or cheap greazy close by (a cheap one at night is just corner of calle 20/carerra 3). But this place is a good alternative close by.

name: Area de servicio
description: Great place for overnight. This place is awaiting a owner since 2 years and half, but the rent is too expensive, so it's just empty! There is electricity and toilet. There is a security guy at night. 2km after this place there are several shop and restaurant. Before setting up your camp, ask at the building nearby. There is a nice lady.

name: Gragos Gas Refill
description: To refill partially empty 10lb bottles, we paid: 17,500COP // June 2022 for 20lbs bottle 21.500 COP.

name: Town center / plaza
description: Parking is 30,000. Very close to old town center. No size or height restrictions. Our RV is 27 ft and it went perfect. The family that manages it is very very kind. They gave us electricity and they also shared their internet with us.

name: batericars
description: servicio para vehículos, llanta, batería, aceite, alineación y balanceo etc... MUY RECOMENDADO, excelente atención!!

name: Dunas de Taroa
description: perfect place to chill for a couple hours. You need a good 4x4 to get here.

name: Delicias Tatys -Simijaca
description: You can camp on a flat grassy parking lot next to the dairy shop. Clean restrooms super friendly owner. (Yubert Gomez) will be happy to talk to you and give some recommendations about the area. Don't forget to get the excellent Yogurt and cheeses! 10,000 per car per night.

name: Gas station Texaco
description: Better than nothing. Noise of the road but we slept.

name: Tyre repair
description: Professional and modern tyre place (think it is called Gulf?), in the corner of the shopping complex.  Fixed a puncture for us quickly for 12,000. They have all the computers and equipment to do a proper rotate and balance, and you can also buy new tires here.  A couple of people speak English here.  Really nice guys.

name: Hotel Balop
description:
A great and cheap small hotel - paid 50 000cop for private matrimonial room for two. Laundry 7000cop per load. Looks like it was recently built or renovated - nice spacious and clean room with a/c, shower with showerhead(one of the first rooms equipped with it we've seen in Colombia..), clean and comfortable bed with towels, nice new kitchen with refrigerator to use for the guests. Filter for potable water.
Parking outside just in front of the hotel with camera pointing there and  neighbourhood seems safe enough. Large exito very close to the hotel.
When we were here, also very fast internet for SA standards - downloading over 1MB per second. Really good deal.

name: Valle de Cocora
description:
They say this area has the densest population of hummingbirds in the world.  The most popular day hike is this loop from the parking lot (5000 or 10,000cop per car depending on lot) to the Finca located at this GPS point.   It's a shame they let the horses on the same trail as the hikers (there is a lot of smelly poo/mud soup to scramble around!).   Bring additional money if doing the longer loop as you cross private property and they charge per person (10,000/person, 6,000/person). Some of the private parks charge $15,000/person but they have props and statues for taking photos. 
The views are lovely, much of the trail is shaded, the gradient not too bad except for one short steep section which becomes extremely slippery in rain, and if you do the additional walk to the Casa de Los Colibris (20 000cop entrance pp) you will be rewarded with a free drink and lots of hummingbirds.  

We took about 4-5 hours at a leisurely pace.  Recommended.

name: Great Wild Camping spot on top of Mountain.
description:
Awesome quiet wild camping place at top of the mountain with gorgeous views. (Free)

From the town of Susa drive up the mountain on the Carmen de Carupa-Susa dirt road. Near the GPS coordinate points you'd need to make a sharp right up the hill. You'll end up at a level, clear, dirt spot protected from the wind with great almost 360° views. Quiet, very cold at night.

Couple of friendly farmers walked by in the morning. 

4x4 may not be needed but high-clearance is recommended.

name: Hospital Mercedes
description:
Flat lot inside the hospital. 
They ask 10k for the night. 
Wifi password:  [passwords are not allowed ]
WC inside building.

name: Entrance to Siecha lake Sector Chingaza NP
description:
Camped literally on the side of the dirt road that leads to the entrance to the NP Chingaza (Siecha Lake) (free) 

10 min walk from the park ranger station where there are restrooms.

Very nice 2-3 hour hike to the lakes. 42,000 COP per person to enter NP

name: Mirador Peñas Blancas
description: Nice wild camping spot on top of the mountain with 360° views. Place is called Mirador Peñas Blancas.

name: Terpel Gas Station
description:
We were allowed to spend the night in the camper and use the bathrooms for 6.000COP,

nos dejaron pasar la noche en la camper y usar los baños por 6.000COP,

name: Trail Head
description: Trail head to a one hour hike around Jardín.  Trail takes you to a river and a mirador through coffee fields.  Beautiful and easy hike.

name: Casa de la cultura - museo del Sombrero
description:
In front of the police station you ll find the  Casa de la cultura. Inside there is the Museo del sombrero, and other stuff of the Colombian history. When you enter go on the right side, where the office is. Ask there to visit the museum. Someone ll guide you. The director is new and wants to make some improvement of the museum. 

Everything is free. There is wifi too at the library (casacultura123456).

name: Hotel del Lago
description: A media cuadra del centro de la ciudad, habitaciones amplías por $60,000 COP

name: Pueblito viejo
description: An attraction of Aguadas. The make a fake old village, like before! Nice place for chilling, and good view on the city. You ll discover all the old stuff of the 19th century. Nice to have a look. There is a small restaurant upstairs.

name: Street parking
description: There are many parking lots either side of the street behind the Metro supermarket. Most of them were empty so we parked our truck alongside. Sunday evening and it got a bit busy at the evening but after 10.30pm everything was calm. Noisy at 6am. Several locals came for a chat. Nice and only 4 minutes from the Malecon per foot.

name: Above the canyon
description: Flat spot around 400 meters above the canyon, left hand side. It's large enough for a big truck. Super quiet and fantastic views.

name: Exito
description:
Last large Exito store on the way to Cabo de la Vela - you can stock up here on basically anything, good choice of meat, veggies, home, car maintenance, clothes and international stuff.
Buy bags or small bottles of water for the locals, especially if you want to go in your own car to Punta Gallinas. Look out for the green sign on the left hand side of the building, the car park is down there and free.

name: Zarzamora Cafe (ex Mazamorra)
description: Cute little side of the road cafe. Good coffee, hot chocolates, freshly made bread and yum sandwiches (pesto plus ingredients for only $7k). Family owned and nice people. Veggie and vegan options available. Super pleasant.

name: Macanas coffee
description: Really cool cafe - colourful decor, plants everywhere, mosaic and tiled tables, amazing coffee and delicious cakes. Wifi didn’t work for us... No seating on the plaza, it’s all out the back. No sign out front, it’s through yellow doorway. More of a modern / hipster cafe than those dotted around the plaza full of cowboy hats.

name: Diesel del pacifico
description:
Diesel mechanics. Large workshop, work very well and are very friendly! 

Mecánica diesel. taller grande, trabajan muy bien y son muy amigables!

name: Etnia Arte & Sabor
description: The best meal I've had in Colombia. The trout and beef menu de día was delicious plus the soup! Oh the soup! The owner/chef is a wonderful lady and has so much to share so go early and sit at the kitchen bar seats to chat. Being a chef myself, she does things very well and most importantly fills it with love. We are here both nights we were in town. She sued to be number 4 on Tripadvisor but they wants her to pay to stay there which she didn't believe in so they bumped her down to 9th.

name: Harold Silva Trailers factory
description: Fantastic place to fix almost every thing. Harold is à great Guy Who makes Trailers and he Will be pleased to help you fixing your RV

name: Balneario Pescaderito
description:
3k for parking or 10k COP to stay overnight per car. Huge area, but very basic. Clean toilets, cold showers. We got offered boiled river water.
We didn't try the restaurant and we don't know their prices. No noise, not even music during the day.

The river curutí itself is free and one can swim or pitch a tent wherever one wants. Many fireplaces testify this. You can hike along the river/canyon for quite a bit. Very nice scenery and clean refreshing water!

Avoid Saturday or Sunday! Otherwise very calm and relaxed atmosphere. 
The village of Curití is restricted to vehicles of 8.5 tons!

name: At the mountain road
description:
Right next to the street, flat parking in front of a property. We asked the old man if we can park there and he agreed instantly. Offered drinking water.
Spot large enough for one truck, very nice view over the mountain and of course it is super quiet.

name: El parque del perro
description:
You can park here, it seems safe to sleep.

se puede parquear, parece seguro para dormir.

name: El Playon, Large Truck Parking
description: Large truckparking. In the back pretty quiet. With restaurant and hospedaje. Only boondocking 10.000 per night.

name: Hostel Nina Kite Riohacha
description: hostel right at the beach. from the rooftop, where they have hammocks you have a view over the beach

name: Panadería Astral
description:
Different kinds of breads and rolls. Variety is changing every day, but that does not matter. One of the best bakeries we found in America.
No sweets, but assorted mermeladas and jams. opens daily at 8.30am

name: La Waffeleria,
description: Good waffles, very good juice, fast WiFi and perfect service in an extraordinary ambience.

name: Oh la la
description: A french chef. Very good meal. The place are in pesos it's quite cheap. A very large choice of plates, Toulouse sausage, campain pate, quiche, ceviche, sopas. ...

name: Hotel Casa Real
description: Nice hotel with swimming pool and bar. Private room with tv, bathroom and fan for $35,000. Clean and new.

name: private parking
description:
Very large private parking. 10 thousand cop the night. There is nothing more than breathtaking views of the valley. Very quiet and lonely at night. Closes everything and nobody is left.

parqueadero privado muy amplio. 10 mil cop la noche. No hay nada más que impresionantes vistas al valle. muy tranquilo y solitario en la noche. cierra todo y no queda nadie.

name: Hipermar fish
description: Really good fish and sushi restaurant. Generous portions :) with affordable prices.

name: Casa La Eliana
description: Really great curries and naan bread.  Also a nice hostel with fast internet and good showers.

name: Ruta 40 - BMW Motorrad dealership
description:
BMW motorcycles dealership and a workshop. Owned by Mauricio, BMW Motorrad off-road instructor and a very nice person! They also sell tires. 
 (Metzeler, Heidenau and Continental). People work very carefully, check the bikes thoroughly and charge a decent price (which is still higher than in US or Europe, but much lower than for example in Chile).
A great place!

name: Cafe Pergamino
description: Fantastic coffee shop in super trendy part of Medellin. Laid back vibe. Indoor and outdoor eating. Light meals and pasteries too. Owner sources the coffee from three local plantations so very ethical. Fast wifi. Power points for charging your devices.

name: Reserva Biologica Caoba
description: Natural Reserve and Eco-Lodge with Restaurant. Confortable accommodations in the tropical forest. Collection of plants and historical site. Animal encounters. Looks more like staying in a botanical Garden in the forest. 11 km from Santa Marta, 8 km dirt road. The last 3 km are the most challenging ones. 4x4 needed.  crossing of a river, but not a big one.

name: Assumar Peter Auchter Mechanic
description:
Workshop with german owner for weldings, works with stainless steal and other metals. He and his crew are very helpful!!! 
Tel. Bogota D.C. 420 6077 or. 420 6099 or. 260 3759 
www.assumarltda.com

name: Pixel gráfica digital
description:
Digital printing of stickers. Very cheap and fast. Excellent place to do the trip traces or plotted for the car. Ask for Cristian


Impresión digital de stickers banderas señalizacion. Muy barato y rápido. excelente lugar para hacer las calcos del viaje o ploteados para el carro. Preguntar por Cristian

name: Nissan - stay away!
description:
We had a small oil leak (first mechanical problem after 50k kilometres, not bad) and a small noise somewhere from a wheel - and because we had some spare time, we decided to go and fix it. We were passing by this authorized Nissan dealership / mechanic and the owner came out to take a picture of our chilean Nissan and asked if we need something done - in my life, I had mostly bad experience with the authorized dealers but I gave in and we had them check it.
They quickly said that some support of the engine is causing the noise and needs to be replaced - and that the oil leak is from some bearing or seal and it needs replacing too. Could not even give us an estimate saying how much it would roughly cost and we had to leave the car there. I told them I don't want anything done until I know how much it would be (always do that btw). They wanted me to sign some paper that they will do an inspection - I didn't sign. When I asked if that's free, they said no... about 80 000 COP. Go figure...
Next morning, we came there and after waiting 3 hours they gave us estimate for about 1.5 million COP (500 usd!) - I almost laughed, looked at the list of things - and saw there changing of timing belt, coolant, the seal and the engine support.
We thanked them (for nothing), left and went to Freddy Toyota. The best part comes now.
The oil leak wasn't caused by any seal, just by some small hole somewhere that they quickly fixed. And the noise was no engine support, just needed to tighten some nuts :) So both problems were diagnosed badly, or they actually lied to us. Freddy fixed it in 1 day and for 200 000COP, so 1/8th of the price.
Keep away from authorized dealers, sorry to say that. If you don't, absolutely _always_ ask for how much it's going to cost before agreeing on doing anything, or signing anything.

name: Hotel Balcones de Oriente
description:
A big truck - stop. Room with private bathroom for two people - 40 000cop. Wifi works fine, restaurant has a very friendly chef, who can also make a nice breakfast.
Parking is a big lot right by the road, but they have space for 3 cars under the roof. It's open, but can be "covered up" with trucks, so won't be visible from the road.
