name: street parking Calle 122
description:
One of the rare occasions where one can park in the street. We were not allowed to park our 8 ton truck at the shopping mall close by, but as in that street are many small shops (for us important the outdoor shops) it's ok to park there. Slept there as well, bit noisy.

Not sure for how many days that would work...

name: Trasladar Express S.A.S.
description: The only place in Hormiga that insures foreign vehicles. We found two other SOAT providers, but they handled domestic vehicles only. Due to a combination of complex procedures and forms, poor quality equipment and an incompetent agent it took from 1 pm to 4:30 pm to complete the whole process.

name: Hotel Avanti
description:
Very clean place with secure parking in underground garage. Paid 70.000 for only me, one night. Private bathroom in the room. Internet is fast.
I drove past this place while I tried to get to another hotel mentioned on iOverlander, but the city was too busy as it was Saturday and there was a market so I just stopped here.
Neighborhood doesn't look too good, there are shops a block away, but the allays were dark. If you need to do some shopping, it's probably better to arrive in the afternoon when it's still light.

name: Hotel Shalom PHE
description: Nice hotel with the garage. Prices about 70000!pesos per two. Nice owners:) the owner's daughter teached me Spanish:)

name: San Pedro, Hotel El Conductor
description: Rooms where you can put your bicicletas in the room. Nice persons. Paid 20.000 COP for one night/one person. There is a gas stadion on the other side maybe it's an option for parking.

name: The Shakira statue
description:
I am speechless... C'mon, seriously guys - how has noone listed the Shakira statue as a point of interest yet?! Barranquilla is the hallowed birthplace of the most famous Colombian sweetheart.  A national treasure, for sure! 

Her words will surely echo through the ages... "lucky that my breasts are small and humble, so you don't confuse them for mountains."

Inspirational stuff.   Lol.

name: Lago Cameguadua
description: MODERATOR NOTE: Place removed because camping is illegal here.  Day Use Only, Signs posted and enforced

name: Freeway Hotel Restaurant
description: Super convenient, on highway, 24hr restaurant. 50k COP for 2

name: Hotel Real Plaza
description: Nice hotel. Our room had a tv, fan, fridge, balcony, and hot shower. I think we paid 50,000 COP. They also have laundry service, which is great as there are no laundromats in Riosucio. There's free coffee too; and they have menus from neighborhood restaurants in the lobby.

name: Hotel Aparta Napoles
description: Simple hotel in a good location. Paid 35.000 COP for a private room w a/c.  Front desk woman was very friendly. Allowed me to park my moto inside at night.

name: Pelaya, Hotel Santoris
description: Paid 30.000 COP for one room/person/night with toillette+shower and a/c + ventilator and tv. No problem to place my bicycle in my room. Several rooms available and mostly with one double bed and an extra bed. There is place for car parking in front of the hotel.

name: Aguachica, Hotel Escocia
description: 25.000 COP for person/night. Clean rooms and calm location. Restaurants, shops, supermarket nearby. Free coffee and wifi!! Enough space for my bicycle in front of the bed. Mattress is super, not as soft as often. No a/c but ventilator. Bathroom is tiny, when you take a shower, mostly everything get wet. No problem for me.

name: Pancho Anca Hotel
description: Trucker hotel, but clean and pleasant. Paid 28,000 COP for a double room with A/C and tv. We were downstairs, so there was a bit of noise, but not too much.

name: NYX hotel
description: Nice place to stay-not so expensive. 80000 per doble. Very very very clean. With swimming pool. Great coffee:)) not many touristvsonsimetimes you have the swimmin pool only for you:) hot water, posible to ask about loundry with dryier.  Own parking, closed gate, nice climate.

name: Mil Mangueras
description: Ask for Carlos Cardenas. His a wonderful guy who will help you with whatever you need to fix in your car. He is a fellow member of Territorio Galeras, a group of over landers!

name: Petromil
description: They let us park behind the gas station. Secure place with toilet and a nice restoran beside.

name: Dadis del centro de salud Fátima
description: Here you can get the yellow fever vaccine for free at the clinic.

name: Finca La Alsacia, tour de cafe con Don Leo
description:
If you're looking for an autenthic experience in a coffee farm, the Finca Dom Leo, with it's "Caficultur" tour, is the best you will find. Dom Leo is the farm owner and, at this little and high town, with the help of Carlos, his Brother in Law, takes you for a great Colombian experience. You can be hosted at the farm if you want to, sleeping and eating like everybody that works there. I really recommend! 
The place in the map is the center or the town - you just need to get there and as for Dom Leo, everybody knows him and the people is helpful and kind. We stay with our big rig in front at the school, the only leveled place to sleep, with a beautiful view.

name: Cactus Forest
description: I turned off here to avoid the tolls that have been reported further up the road. This was fantastic to explore. You start off in a cactus forest. Tracks everywhere. Point your compass in the direction you want to go and have some fun. I travelled solo and never felt threatened. Make sure you have plenty of water. It's very remote. Fun conditions.

name: SOAT - Exito Supermarket
description:
Supermarket "Exito" sells SOAT, we paid 133000 cop for 2 months (VW T3), fast, easy reachable and good place to park.

Only Monday to Friday

name: Restaurante parrilla del campo
description: The owner Ramiro allowed us to stay in the back of his restaurant for free. Very nice guy.

name: Reserva Natural Kasaguadua
description: Kasaguadua is a private nature reserve. The area used to be a coffee farm but is now being restored to original cloud forest. We had an absolutely superb tour, guided by the passionate Carlos, one of the 3 men running the site. Focus was not so much on plant names and their use, but more on the biological aspects: how plants have adapted to an environment with abundant sun and water and without seasons as well as the process of development over time. On site is a small guesthouse as well. Tours start at 9 am, reservations are compulsory and can be made by the accommodations in the environment. Highly recommended!

name: La Mansion de Sam
description:
Sister hostel to Sam's VIP.  Spacious private room for 50000COP. Free parking at Sam's lot (across the park). Staff is friendly.  Good location. Can book activities here. 

One downside: the restaurant in the center of the hotel plays background music while open.

name: Noche de  Saturno
description:
Basic campsite. Swimmingpool at extra cost and closed @ 19.00
Cold showers

name: Parador Coran / Petromil
description: Just a big area to spend the night. Friendly staff and cheap restaurant near by.

name: Residencias Nueva Granada
description: Budget-Hostal! 16.000pesos for a Room with privat bath! Basic but ok! friendly people! its also a house for Students! There is a kitchen, but the tools belong to the students! Quite!

name: Hotel Colonial
description: Very nice and quiet hotel two blocks from the main square. Private room for one person was 25000COP per night. Secure parking for my moto in back, probably could fit a car/ van too.

name: Park in front of police station
description: Local police was very friendly and helpful. Quiet place overnight.

name: Street Parking
description:
Street. Very quiet in front of football training ground. Like all the surrounding area at the river park, the locals come to smoke churros the size of a canyon.
.....
calle cortada muy tranquila frente a campo de entrenamiento de fútbol.  como toda la zona de los alrededores al parque del río, los lugareños vienen a fumar churros del tamaño de un cañon.

name: Hotel Puerto de Manga
description:
Very nice hotel in Manga, the port side of town but still very near the historical center. It's located in a quiet residential neighbourhood. Rooms are clean, ensuite bathrooms, swimming pool, kitchen. 
No parking available, but we parked the car in the street just in front of the hotel and did not have any problems at night.
150k per room, breakfast included. 
2024: 38-60 eur per room, check multiple booking sites

name: Mini Hostel
description: Small hostel in good location. Hippy atmosphere. Parking available for motos (I don't think there is room for a car, but I didn't ask). Kitchen, small courtyard, garden in back. paid 40k for a private room w private bath. Was quoted 30k for private room w shared bath.

name: Terpel
description:
Nice gas station on the side of the road that goes to Tunja. We had to ask the manager and he was OK with us staying here overnight. 
Note : Loads of mosquitoes in Feb.! High altitude/cold-ish!

name: Hotel Mirador - Friendly, safe and private parking
description:
Hotel Mirador, located in the beautiful town of Socorro. If you are traveling by motorcycle, van or camper van their parking is both secure, tall and spacious enough for bigger rigs.

You can access the roof, and see the beautiful view of the town with the mountains in the back.

The owner, Daniel is really helpful and friendly, we shared a meal with him and he told us all about this town. Great Colombian coffee further down the street as well.

Really clean and nice, good wifi. Rooms for up to four persons.

Price: 80.000 for a double room.

name: Rancho Alegre - A special campsite
description:
RANCHO ALEGRE

Apparently, both Google maps and maps.me thinks this dirt road actually leads down to Jordan, a village by the river in the canyon - it doesn't.

Anyhow, if you follow this road to the very last ranch at the end of the road, you'll have a great authentic experience. Recommended to spend the night, so you can enjoy the view in the morning and during sunset.

You'll be greeted by a lovely man who's made cool art all around his house by himself. It's well kept and looks awesome. He sells beer and sodas for 2000 pesos, makes delicious coffee on his outdoor kitchen in the morning and you can camp in his garden with both tents and camper vans. He also has a room for 20.000 a person.

Running water, shower, pet friendly, kitchen and electrical outlets.

The view is amazing, sit down and have a look at the sheeps walking along the cliff, and huge egeals flying by. He also has a lookout point you can walk to (5 minutes, easy) from his house, there you'll have an absolutely stunning view of the whole canyon (and get 4G signal). 

NOTE: When you follow this road, lead by some signs towards Jordan you'll drive down a gravel path only suitable for vehicles with 4x4 or motorcycles. Some short steep parts, but nothing crazy. You'll have to open a three gates to reach this point. Just remember to close them behind you, it's for the sheep not to run off.

You can walk down to Jordan from here along the trail, or maybe pay one of the ranches around here to rent a horse for the day. It's apparently a popular hike.

Anyhow, it's a true treat and I hope many of you will go here.

name: Biker Stock Colombia
description:
You want new tires? Heidenaus with free mounting or any other good tires? Come here. You want the best possible service and WiFi while you wait? Get over here!
They also do repairs, have quality chains, sprockets, MOTUL-products, brake pads and so on.

The mechanics are professional and detailed in their work. Highly recommend!

name: Cesar's house
description: We found in airbnb to rent one room to stay after shipping our car to Panamá! Safe place, family house, very clean and good location, it's possible walk to historical downtown! We paid 35.000 pesos per night! Better call Cesar before +57 (301) 492-3843

name: Pozo Azul
description: This is a waterfall with several pools. It is free, virtually trash free and busy on the weekends. You must park at the road and walk down the hill to the falls. A great place to cool off from the afternoon heat.

name: Terpel gas station with facilities
description:
Very friendly staff - after chatting they offered us coffee. 
Parking is behind the station and blocks half the road noise. Also has toilets and shower separate to the service station (no light) 
Undercover seating area with 6 electric power points separate from the station
And a restaurant across the road. 
Simple auto service available also.

name: Maritrans Shipping RORO Step #1
description:
Shipping Maritrans for RORO Panama to Colombia to get Bill of Lading at Colombia side. 

Jose A. Parra
Regional Manager
MARITRANS S.A.
Centro, Av. Venezuela
Edificio Caja Agraria, Piso 3, Oficina 3-15
Phone:  (5) 664 0071
E-Mail:  jose.parra@maritrans.com.co

name: Centro comercial Premium Plaza - Internet y Electricidad gratis
description:
In the whole shopping center there are groups of armchairs with plugs and tables for the notebook. There is also good quality free wifi. Great for travelers!

En todo el centro comercial hay grupos de sillones con enchufes y mesitas para la notebook. También hay wifi gratis de buena calidad. Excelente para viajeros!

name: Seguros del Estado - SOAT por 2 meses
description: SOAT Insurance office. We could take an insurance for only 2 months, the minimum accepted.

name: Evolusound
description: Electrical mechanic. Professional and friendly staff.

name: Lavanderia Samaria
description: This is very nice laundromat. This is a drop off service, they charge 8000 cop/kilo if you want it done in 3 hours, or 6000 cop/kilo for end of day pick up. They close at 18:00.

name: Altoque Terpel Gas Station
description: Terpel with Altoque Store. Showers, toilets, Wi-Fi and laundry (COP 3000 per load). Noisy since is just by the highway, but convinient and free.

name: Terpel Gas Station south of Contecar
description: After a long day of getting camper from DIAN, Sociedad and Contecar port, boondocked here for night. Safe but noisy.

name: Electronic Center
description: Amazing electronic center. All you need to fix/buy laptops, computers, cell phones, cameras, etc...accessories and much more. Casa Seiko saved our laptop! Good service and fair price!! Restaurants, wifi, money exchange. Close to bus station.

name: Suzuki parts &service
description:
Very small shop but head mechanic is good. Staff is friendly. Younger mechanic is from USA and most of the rest of staff speak English. 

Came in for a tube change in my front tire. we ended up installing new brake pads when we saw how worn they were.  They did a full check: checked oil, lubed chain, lubed clutch lever, etc. all without being asked. Noticed my chain was loose so we adjusted rear axel too. Very thorough.  Highly recommended.

name: Biomax
description: Quiet gas station where we spent the night. They asked 5.000 pesos which seemed fair.

name: Hotel Balnearo Lido
description: Nice place to stay, the owner Hernan likes to much to talk and party the make nice meals for 6000 cop they have rooms since 40000 with access to the pool , camping is possible since 10000cop + 5000cop p/p if you want to use the pool. Big rigs okay .

name: Wild camping with view
description:
Nice spot for staying overnight on your way or back from the little mining town Marmato. Beautiful view into the valley. No amenities. Locals told us it's safe. Little shop in village close by.

Update 1. The land owner came and was pretty interested in us. He didn't have any problems with us staying in his property. 

Update 2. Police came for a visit (of course), asked a couple of questions and checked our passports. After leaving the phone number of the local police station they left with smiling faces.

Update 3. Police came again, two motos in the middle of the night checking on us. Bummer, was in deep sleep already.

Decide for yourself if the "hassle" is worth the good views ;)

name: Getsemani City Parking lot
description: 38000p for 24 hours. Secure. Truck camper fit through gates. No height restriction but there is a width constraint. No sleeping overnight but there is a toilet and sink.

name: En la costanera
description:
The city did not seem safe, the other point that the police gave was not safe since at night there is no one. In this place are all the banks nearby so the police are constantly and on the weekend here we were able to sell our handicrafts !!! 

La ciudad no nos parecio segura, el otro punto que habia la policia dio que no era seguro ya que de noche no hay nadie. EN este lugar estan todos los bancos cerca por lo que la policia esta constantemente y el fin de semana aqui mismo pudimos vender nuestras artesanias!!!

name: juntas river
description:
small parking next to the river "la Perla". very quiet, good scenery.
there is a long trail that follow the canyon.

name: buenavista central place
description: free flat parking in the central place of this nice village.

name: Old Quarry next to the road
description: On our way from Mocoa to Pasto we stopped here. Took us around 5 hours from Mocoa to this spot. You can choose between a big grass patch right next to the road (perfect for big rigs) or drive up a little quarry road, where you are mostly out of sight from the main road. No 4WD needed. Nice view on the valley of Mocoa and very silent after 7 pm. We felt very safe and enjoyed the sunset. A good option if you want to split up the drive on the dirt road in two days (Prädikat: Sahnestück)

name: Frente a la playa
description:
The street ends on the beach and is extremely quiet and safe especially since the spot on the river did not really feel safe. We spent 3 days enjoying the beach 

La calle termina en la playa y es sumamente tranquilo y seguro sobre todo ya que el punto que hay sobre el rio la verdad no nos parecio seguro. Estuvimos 3 dias disfrutando de la playa

name: Parqueadero 2
description: We stayed 5 days, opposite there is a house of security guards. We fixed the price of 5000 per day but we only paid the first day after they let us stay for free. No services but it is super quiet. Ideal to enjoy the beautiful beach since there is no one in the morning and after three in the afternoon all the tourists go and the place is deserted for one

name: King Hostel
description:
Beautiful and modern hostel with good vibes. $35000 pesos with AC in room. Fast wifi. Breakfast included. Clean kitchen! Finally!

I have looked into 10 hostels here and this one was the best bang for the bucks.

name: El Arsenal
description: Wonderful place! Beautiful view on the river with balcony. Paid $49k pesos for a night. Has a cute pool. Really nice professional vibes. We switched here after our terrible experience with King Hostel's owner.

name: Hotel Ruta del Sol
description: Good location between Bogota and Medellin. We had dinner at the restaurant and could sleep in our camper inside the gated parking lot. Good food, not cheap but big plates. Cold showers $5000 pp. Very clean toilets. Nice staff. Wifi.

name: Lago Calima
description:
Parking with view near the lake. Free.
.....
Bel espace herbeux où les enfants peuvent jouer. Belle vue sur le lac. Gratuit.

name: Asturias M/C Repair
description:
If you're having a problem with your ride anywhere within reach of Cali, this is the place to go.

Without a reservation they took my bike in, fixed the melted headlight and had me on the road within minutes. Probably would have gone faster but I was slowing things down by chatting and swapping stickers.

If it's not a warranty repair, go here first.

name: In a curve
description: After a long day driving we came here at 5.30pm. It's a large somehow flat gravel area in a not dangerous curve and you can park several meters from the street. The sparsely traffic settled down around 9.30pm. Very quiet.

name: Paeje east side of toll booth
description: If traveling towards Santa Marta from Barranquilla, large lot on right hand side next to restaurant and hostel just after going through toll booth. Has bathrooms and sink.

name: Spumas Lavandería
description: 8000 pesos per Kilo of clothing, recommendable. Ready within 24 hours.

name: Altoque Terpel
description: Great Altoque store, free wifi, good hot showers COP 1000, good menu COP 10500. Free coffee when you fill up your tank. Safe and very nice staff.

name: Hotel Panorama
description: Clean and secure parking. 40 000 pesos for a double room with private bathroom. Fast wifi. Close to many places to eat.

name: El Jiagüil Santa Bárbara
description: Nice and clean hotel in small town in the middleof the mountain range. Got a private room for one for 35000 COP with private hot shower. No parking but in the small town the car slept just fine in the street in front of the hotel. Check the pic.

name: Along the road
description: Was tired of driving...pulled out here at 19:30. Asked the owner if it was okay to camp. Said yes, no problem. Free. Toilets nearby. Feel safe.

name: Cascada Indians
description: Remote UNEXPLORED PART of Colombia. This place hits the spot on many level. It is everything I wish Guatemala was haha. Safe and quiet. Most local never seen a gringo here before. You might attract a lot of attraction. Many remote villeages around to be explore.

name: Chapinero CQ Hostel
description: Nice little hostel with space for maybe three or four bikes, no cars, but gated parking areas are close. This is not a special or fancy place, but they have a kitchen, hot showers and comfy beds, what else do you need? Oh yes wifi, not the best but its doing the job. The dorms are 20.000 COP the night and a private room with a double bed is 50.000 COP. They gave me three nights in the dorm for 50.000, so I think this might be the cheapest place in Bogota. At least what i found. Staff is really friendly and there are bars, restaurants and supermarkets in walking distance. A bus stop is three minutes away.

name: Migración Colombia
description:
If you need to extend your visa. Free for European (for the touristic visa, 3 months extend). No need of photocopy. You just have to fill a form. 
Open Monday to Friday. 
8:00am-12pm and 2pm-5pm

Transversal 9A # 29-29

name: Parrilla Libanesa
description: Delicious Lebanese food. Having grown up in São Paulo, with a huge Lebanese community, it was like a dream to find this place. Reasonable prices. A nice plate with rice with almonds, tabule, fried quibe, kafta, stuffed grape leaves, stuffed cabbage leaf and stuffed eggplant for 29,000 Colombian pesos.

name: Parabrisas
description: Good place to go if you need windows for your rig !

name: Hotel Parador Opon
description: On drive from Santa Marta to Medellin stopped at this three story hotel for one night. Functioning AC. Small room but clean. 47,000p.

name: Bogota parking near center
description:
Parking. 9000 pesos  for 12 H. You can park in a camper van. If it is full, wait a little. It's great to visit the surrounding museums. Next to the pedestrian-bike path. Supermercado very close. A cinema in front of the entrance. 

Parking. 9000 pesos for 12 H.

On peut s'y garer en camping-car. S'il est plein, attendre un peu. C'est super pour visiter les musées alentours. À côté de la rue piétonne-piste cyclable. Supermercado très près. Un cinéma en face de l'entrée.

name: Another slot next to the road
description: Large and flat, very little traffic after 6pm. Sound of a stream.

name: 10 km despues de Cimitarra
description:
Place on the side of the river, is a small descent, very quiet. There is a house, the people are friendly. The river is ideal for a swim! 

Lugar al costado del río, es una bajada chica, muy tranquilo. Hay una casa, la gente es amable. el río es ideal para un baño!

name: Hotel Centenario Plaza
description: Nice small hotel. Got a private room for 90,000 COP for 2 people (updated 2/23). Car stayed at the Esso gas station for 5000 (? not verified for price increase). Very clean and newly refurnished. Hot water and good wifi.

name: Hotel Nevado
description: Small cheap hotel with rooms for up to 3 people. Hot shower, wifi. Parking 20 m away in a parking lot for busses. If the owners aren't home, ask at the tienda next door.

name: Centro De Lubricación - Técnicentro Automotriz/autolavado
description: From highway it looks like just a plain car was. However, looks can be deceiving here in Latin America. They have a huge workshop in the center with high clearance.          The quality of the work was super good and the price was great and fair. I had them change all my springs and repair a broken axle (which on a Syncro is a huuuge pain in the ass). They charged me $50 and I paid $100 because it took them so much time and energy, and was really done right. If you want a good professional mechanic, not just a hole in the wall like most places, these guys can really help. I don't know how they are with complex stuff but for the basics they were really good and easy to work with. Not sure if they speak English

name: pullout on road to Muesas
description: a flat large pullout on the dirt road to Muesas village. very easy access. very quiet and nice views on surroundind hills. good spot before reaching Ipiales.

name: parque national macuira
description:
Here is the office where you need to register if you want to visit this national park. Guides are mandatory there is an official price (depend on where you want to go and the size of your group).
Dunes really worth a visit!
But this place is very hard to reach: 4WD and high clearance absolutly necessary, and be prepared to ask locals for the way very often!

name: Centro turistico Mulamana
description:
This is THE place to rest if you want to go to the Macuira national park. It's located in the village of Nazareth.
They have cabanas and hammocks to rent and you can pitch your tent. Correct restaurant. Very clean showers and bathrooms. Electricity only from 5pm to 10pm.
We arrived from Punta Gallinas with our own vehicles, locals told us it needs 3 hours drive, but count 4 or 5 !
It's difficult to reach Nazareth, 4WD with high clearance is the minimum obligation. Be prepared for serious off-road drive on rocky, muddy or sandy roads! it's necessary to ask locals for the way many and many times, because road conditions are always changing...
Be careful, after heavy rains, all roads could be undrivable even for the locals and it's common that the village of Nazareth is isolated for days...

name: Restaurant with a kind owner
description: I was too tired to push it to Medellin so i asked if I could park nearby. No problem. The owners are great folks. Bought two beers (3000pesos each) to support them. Safe and quiet spot. No loud music or trucks. There are better spots on this, Santiago is a beautiful town! But I was feeling cheap...so no hotel for me tonight. Just beer.

name: Cargorider Old Location
description:
Recommended by Horizons Unlimited. Air shipping for motos (maybe other vehicles too).

Contact info:Veronica Mosquera
Gerente Comercial
comercial@cargorider.com.co
cell: 311 223 7841
Cra. 81d #25B - 27, Bogotá, Cundinamarca

name: Gabriel Suspension Parts
description: Car Suspension and breaks. Sells parts and changes at the same place.

name: Cocorná Mirador Overlook
description: Pulled off road next to restaurant and next to where they launch hangliders. Can use restaurant facilities. Road noise. But absolutely fantastic views of Cocorná and big Waterfall.

name: Hotel Los Guamas/Resyautante Lolita
description: Simple, clean, friendly hotel. C$25,000/person or C$45,000/double room for 2 people. The internet was great in our room, but not at the restaurant. We don't know how it would be in other rooms. Very nice owner, even let us do some laundry for free.

name: Parqueadero El Uvalito
description: We ended up at this location on accident, meant to go down the road, but pulled in just after the sun went down. We were greeted by the owner, a very nice lady named Anna. From the looks of the property, they host campers on a regular basis; but we think it's also lumber mill. There are 5 or 6 flat tent spots laid out  and 4 flat parking spots. No Wi-Fi, cold showers and decent toilets; they also have 4 very friendly dogs who bark at passers by. They gave us coffee in the morning. 20,000 cop for two people.

name: La Casa del Viajero
description: Nice hostel recommended in lonely planet guidebook, extremely nice people, they allow camping out front  for 15,000 but i got a dorm room with temperamental AC for 30,000. dogs allowed including in dorm room. I asked if it was safe to park on the road outside the hostel and they said yes, but I got a tire spiked in the night and then they told me that happens all the time in this town! So find a parqueo at least for peace of mind.

name: Embragues rey
description:
Sale and repair of all types of clutches and discs. Flyer arrangements 

venta y reparación de todo tipo de embragues y discos. arreglos de volantes

name: BIOMAX estación de servicio
description:
Very wide service station. They have bathrooms with free shower. Recommended for overnight stay. There is a hotel to one side with parking 

estación de servicio muy amplia.  tienen baños con ducha gratis. recomendada para pasar la noche. hay un hotel a un lado con parqueadero

name: Taller de frenos "Vehifrenos"
description:
added: don't go here! they completely messed up our brakes!!

  Specialists in brakes. They work with knowledge and dedication. In case your brakes are not working you can ask a mechanic to approach the place where you are (costs 30,000 COP that service). Especialista
s en frenos. Trabajan con conocimiento y dedicación. En caso de que tus frenos no estén funcionando podes pedir que un mecánico se acerque al lugar en el que te encuentres (cuesta 30.000 COP ese servicio).

name: Hostal Juan Palito
description: Relaxed hostal for every budget; hammocks, dorms, camping spots and tastefull private rooms. Very nice communal kitchen. Very friendly owners and staff. (In our experience way friendlier than staff at the neighbouring 'Refugio la Roca'. Walking distance of the rock climbing park. Possible to rent climbing gear at the hostal.

name: Small parking with bathroom and kitchen
description: we payed 12k for 2 persons and a van to stay overnight, use the bathroom and the kitcen. very friendly woman who lives in a house by the parking.

name: Hotel Don Rafa y Doña Leo
description: Comfortable hotel. Nice rooms with private bathroom, mini fridge, fan, air conditioner, TV, cold shower (but it is HOT here, you won't miss hot water) for 110,000 Colombian pesos, with a double bed and a single bed. A small pool and small parking lot. Don Rafa, the owner, is very nice. Walking distance to juice places and restaurants.

name: Petromil
description:
Fuel station with good prices. Safe and quiet for sleeping, there is restaurant, bathrooms, showers. The personnel is very friendly. 

estación de combustible con buenos precios. Segura y tranquila para dormir, hay restaurante, baños, duchas. El personal es muy amable.

name: Hotel Gran Diamante
description: Hotel behind the Petromil Gas Station. Not nice from the outside, but extremely clean and newly renovated inside. 55000.- cop for a double room with quiet AC and flat screen TV. Friendly staff and fast WiFi.

name: DIAN
description:
If you need to extend the permit of your vehicle, it's here! 
Don't forgot to extend your touristic visa beforehand.

name: SOAT insurance
description:
Sorry, but finally they can't sell insurance to foreigners. They can't put the passport number in their form....

Name of the office: Grupo empresarial cristiano MANEJAR
Adress: carrera 8, n°8-65

name: Seguro SURA soat
description:
The only place we found that accept to insure foreign vehicule in Bucaramanga. 

We paid 69.000 for 3 months extension (for a moto, 200cc).

Adress: Carrera 27, n°36-14 (Centro empresarial suramericana). In front of the shop named "Alfa". 

You have to pay beforehand at the local 108, then you have to go at the 7th floor to have it.

name: Hotel solo suite chia
description: Ok Hotel in a quiet sidestreet. Bargained a double down to 80000 cop. secure parking inside but maybe a little low ( ca. 2,30m)

name: La Esperanza Zona De Camping Y Cabana
description: A small little campground outside of Guatavita. Really nice owners.  The campground is made for mostly tent camping but they have flat spaces for a few vehicles.  No height restrictions but probably not big rig friendly.  They offer breakfast in the morning for 4,000COP and camping was $20,000COP for a night.  Very quiet and beautiful.  No wifi. Clean bathroom but you have to pay extra for a hot shower.

name: Terpel
description: We stop here for the night. They ask us 5000 pesos in the morning. Dirty and a little noisy.

name: mobil panorama
description: Gas station with a beautiful view. Quiet and friendly staff, hose to fill up your watertank. We parked on the left side of the building. At night the trucks park on the other side so we weren't bothered by them.

name: Selva Negra Restaurante - Bar
description:
It's a very good restaurante with delicious german and colombian food (price-performance really good). Friendly stuff, safe parking area, pool and quiet surrounding. Camping not possible. German owner.
www.selvanegrarestaurante.com

name: Aguas Thermales del Gruta
description:
July 2019: paid 25k per person. There are shaded sites for tents, probably nice for (motor-)cyclists and space for a few vans, easy to level. Nice and friendly owner.

The best of them! Only 20k pesos per person, including parking and toilets and hot spring. Wonderful vibes during Semana Santa. Full of young students. The best option around here ! 

Oct 2022: the road is rough and you could attempt with 2wd but need clearance in some spots. some cleared landslides on the way

name: Chocolate hostel
description:
Nice hostel right in lively district of la candelaria. Double 75000, 6 bed for 25.000 Cop incl. small breakfast. Parking next door for 15000/24h (watch out, wierd opening hours!) and 11.000 COP a day for a motorbike. Can't sleep in car at parkinglot (see other post)

Laundry for 4.000COP per 500 g.

Area is not save during the night. But during the day beautiful.

name: Parking Sandy- NO CAMPING
description: Parqueo for 15000cop/24h and 11.000 COP for a bike.

name: Residencias Las Americas
description:
This is a great value. Our price point is very low and we're used to seeing pretty shabby places, but this is one of our cheapest paid nights and everything was in great shape (assuming new renovation) and the cleanliness is about as good as it gets with friendly staff. 
 
It's a standard $25.000 COP for a room for two people with a bath, but it's a paltry $13.000 for a room with a shared bath. Normally the shared bath in cheap places skeezes us out, but as I said, this place is really clean and there are two toilets and two showers for very few rooms, although no hot water. The WiFi worked fine. 

No parking, but it's a tiny village, so no problem on the street. We had enough space to roll our bicycles into our ground floor room fully loaded. There is a little space for motos inside, but you'd probably have to take off your kit to get through the door. 

This is one of the only places in Colombia where we were told not to drink the water. There are a few tiendas around that sell 6L bags.

name: Paqueadero de Mompos
description: Big flat parking area. It is in the center and we visited everything, walking, during the Semana Santa. Very quiet and safe and close to restaurants.

name: Pintos Hostal
description: Lovely Hostal. Approx 71789 COP (£20) for a double room, shared bathrooms. This includes the 19% tax. Great views of Bogota a little down the road, street food, bars, restaurants, supermarket, Hardwear store close by. Cosy and friendly. Paula speaks great English. Gate locked permanently. Need to ring bell to right of gate to get in. Steep climb to car park. Out of view of road. 2 motorbikes easy to park and room for a car, but not big rigs.

name: Terpel de Campo 23
description: We stop here for the night. Quiet place and safe. Bathroom and cold shower.

name: Playa Santa Domingo
description: If you enter the village of Chimichagua you've to take the road to the right. This is the road to a small fishertown. At the end of the road you arrive at the "beach". People are very friendly and helpfull. But They're also very curious. But they just let you doing and the kids loved to play with our kids. Very quiet and safe at night. Beautiful views from the lake. We loved this place :-)

name: Cafe Bernabe Gourmet
description:
Best coffee in town. The service is perfect, the coffee is delicious and you can choose between a lot of ways how they prepare it (Clever, Dripper, V60, Aeropress, French Press). The prices are good as well (3.000 Pesos per cup). The food is incredible, we had the Filet Mignon and loved it (28.000 Pesos) also the carrot cake is so good.
It's a must visit if you aren't Salento :)

name: Hotel Wipama parking lot
description: Right beside the Hotel Wipama. Quiet huge parking lot. On our way to Santa Marta/Tayrona. The lady at the reception was kind enough to give us also the wifi password. 5000 for the night

name: Lago calima berlin
description:
Simple campsite with lots of tent space and gear lake views. Steep drop off to the parking place which can get muddy after rain.
First night 13000 pP and 11000pP every night thereafter

name: Omoki Hostel
description:
Newly opened eco hostel by Amelie and Fredy, hidden in the beautiful quindio valley in between salento and armenia. They have dorm rooms as well as private rooms available and offered us to stay on their parking lot for 15.000 COP pP. No wifi, but one hot shower (in the left dorm room). They just opened and have a lot of ideas of what they want to build and improve so please update my description!

The road down from Salento is very rocky, narrow and busy. The route from Circasia is still steep,  but paved for the most part, so if you have the choice, take that one! It's very hard to find on google maps, but if you get to the very steep curve you see on google maps turn into the small way that goes off the main road.

They are lots of animals here and a lot of hiking options in the surrounding. Great big breakfast with home made bread for 10000 COP.

Definitely go on the coffee tour with Jaime, the night our finca for 30.000 COP. It's a whole day project incl lunch and you will get to participate in the entire coffee making process of a local farmer. He really makes you part of his home.

name: Helena Adentro
description:
Amazing restaurant, very cozy and good food out of the standard Colombian way, but still very affordable 

A great creative & modern take on Colombian food. Fun vibe. The restaurant is in the back and a cafe in the front. Prices are quite reasonable, $20k to $30. A plate can easily be split between two people. We got the $37k plater and the two of us left over stuffed, could have probably fed 3. Our French friends liked this place so much they came back the next day with us!

name: Feijoa Capital of Colombia!
description: This sleepy little town, two minutes from the main road is the Feijoa capital of Colombia. Around the pretty main square you can buy all sorts of Feijoa products- chocolates, arequipe, candies, and even Feijoa wine. We recommend the Feijoa ice cream, the mermelada and of course the fruit itself. We parked our camper and spent the night just off the main square - friendly people and a great stop for Feijoa lovers!

name: Al Bosque PROPANE
description:
This place has been relocated to the premises of the local gas man.
His phone number is +57 3113310526

Bit isolated so phone contact might be best.

If you can't find it then just camp at al Bosque Hostel and they will call him for you

The owners at al Bosque Hostel called a local propane gas man who arrived on his motor scooter and took our 20lb US propane tank for a refill for 30,000p. Brought it back within 2 hours.

name: el rincon frances
description: They make some delicious crepes !! Ricardo, the owner and all the staff are super friendly and generous. Willing to help where possible and guide you.

name: Santa Barbara's cemetery
description:
We parked our van just in front of the cemetery of Santa Barbara. It is located a 100m after the hospital (which is guarded 24/7).
The place is in the street but not that noisy at night, the owner of the shop in front of the parking spot said it was safe to stay there.
The parking spot itself fits one RV or two smaller van and it is flat.
If you have to stay in Santa Barbara, the place is Ok.

name: Panama Exit Requirement
description:
If you are going by plane from Colombia to Panama, the Airline Company will require a proof of your departure from Panama at the time of check in. You must show a ticket purchased by plane, bus or boat, proving that you will leave Panama.

In our case, we shipped our car from Colombia to Panama. Even claiming that we would leave the country by car, the Airline Company demanded us a tiket to way out. The best option we found was the Caribe Shuttle Company. We bought two tickets through the website of the company from Bocas del Toro, Panamá, to Punta Uva, in Costa Rica, for USD66 both. We showed the proof and everything worked out. When we arrived in Panama, we canceled the purchase and paid only USD15 of fee for the Caribe Shuttle. 

I believe that it is the cheapest way to prove the departure of Panama.

name: Brio La Esmelrada 2
description: We stop for the night. Flat area, a little noisy. We heard the TV.

name: La Divisa Organic Finca
description:
Javier runs a small organic coffee and plantain finca just outside Filandia. He is a very passionate guy who could talk the ears off an elephant and will take you on a 3-4 hour your of his property for 50,000. Best to have a decent grasp of Spanish to get the most out of it. Arrive around 10 am. He sells coffee as well, 40000 for 500g. 

Turn right at this location, then go 500m to find his finca on the right side of the road, both are signposted.

name: Hostal Casa Lantana
description: Hostal Casa Lantana (previously Casa Andina). Amazing Hostal, lovely hosts and secure parking for motorbikes. We had 2 but probably room for 4-5 max. Hot springs 4 mins away, cheap food and can be delivered. Double room with shared bathroom 70000 COP per night. Hot showers. Great location. You can hire bicycles and lots of climbing nearby if that's your thing. Breakfast 6500 COP pp. Town short walk.

name: TEXACO GAS STATION
description:
We asked here and they did not mind us spending the night. They have bathrooms. Drinking water and a large parking lot. The owner (mountain biker) is very friendly and enthusiastic about the trips. 

Nos agarró la noche antes de llegar a Zipaquira. Preguntamos aquí y no tuvieron inconveniente en que pasemos la noche. Tienen baños. Agua potable y un gran parqueadero. El dueño (ciclista de montaña) es muy amigable y entusiasta de los viajes.

name: Turispanish Hostel
description: This is an awesome, very friendly home environment type hostel! Rubén the owner speaks great English and is more than friendly! You can park you car or van, truck out front and have a great night sleep at his place!

name: Finca San Luis
description:
The owner Alejandro and his wife opened  their finca "San Luis". They have a cacao plantation and he will give you a tour and explain you the whole process from bean to chocolate. You can camp at the finca with stunning views of the mountains. Just before you enter the town of San Pablo de Borbur ( coming from Villa de Lleyva) you turn right to an offroad ( There's a blue sign with a white leaf). You follow this road for 6 km and then you are at Y junction. The left is " paved" and you take this road and keep right. After 2 km you'll see on your right hand finca San Luis. 
You can contact Alejandro (speaks also fluent english!) on his mobile 315 355 71 70
If you're taking this road we really recommend to stay here!!! 

At N05.65498 W074.06776 is the point where you can turn on to a gravelroad. At N05.69826 W074.05265 you are at the right place.
The couple is incredibly nice and showed us all about chocolate. We camped in the garden with an incredible views. 

If the gate is closed, just walk up to the house and ring the bell.

name: Hotel Colonial
description: nice place to stay for a night. Friendly family with 2 cute dogs. Basic but clean private room with cold showers and a fan. Let me store my bike inside the place behind a locked door. plenty of parking space, can park anything here. wanted 30k COP, agreed on 20k for one person.

name: Camping y Balneario La Cristalina
description:
This is an official campground ca 6km south of San Rafael. You can reach it by simply following the dirt road. Normal cars should be able to do it, pretty flat road, just very graveled. You can chose between two sites, a parquadero on the right and a more green campground next to the river. 

It's 5000 COP per night for parking and 15000 COP for camping. They only charged us 5000 since we are sleeping in our van. Tent camping next to the river is also possible. The bar serves food and drinks, has some hammocks and a ping pong table.

They officially charge 1500 COP for the bathroom and 3000 COP for the shower (cold though). It's a little off track, but it's a very nice place and for the price unbeatable.

name: Balneario La Fortaleza
description: A balneario where you can camp at a secured parkinglot or before the entrance there's also a grassfield where you can camp. very friendly and helpfull staff. It's 10 000 pesos/ vehicle. The entrance for the balneario swimming pool is 5000p/ kid and 8000p/adult.   If you arrive in town of San Pablo de Borbur you turn right just before blue roof building of the sport centre. then go up for 200 meters and you arrive. because the app doesn't take the right Gps coordination .

name: Puerto Velera Aqualand
description: Camped here next to Puerto Valero Aqualand at a restaurant next door. FREE but we bought some drinks at the restaurant behind us. Dinner at this and neighboring restaurants expensive (35.000-100.000COP) and looking at menus, they specialize in seafood. Feels safe, no one around and the whole area is guarded with a police depot nearby. Chose here because we did not want to camp at Volcano Totumo.

name: Aqualand - Puerto Velero
description: Great place to spend the day. We have similar aquaparks in Australia (but cheaper in Australia!). Two hours will set you back 35.000COP. They also have 1hr (25.000COP), 4hr and all day options. We are overlanding with 3 kids so it's a perfect treat for them - especially in this heat!  We also slept in our camper outside the gate in front. Whole area guarded by police and felt very safe.

name: Parqueo
description: Good place for overnight, 40000 cop/24h, Nice guy

name: Hotel Campestre el Pozzo
description: Cheap hotel (we managed to get 2 nights for £44 on booking.com). Double room, private bathroom and good breakfast included. Secure parking, away from centre of town but by no means far to walk. Good free wifi. Rooms downstairs are easy to carry bags to as really close to parking. Room 6 is directly behind the undercover parking area, which is the room we had. Convenient for a couple of days in Villa de Leyva.

name: Art City Hostel
description: Hostel dorm bed special: 22900 includes breakfast and beer. Parking for 2 vehicles (see camping icon too) and camping in vehicle allowed. Nice place, good location, good wifi, dogs allowed in he outside areas. 20,000 COP per night.

name: Hotel Costa Norte
description:
Breezy building, well ventilated, ceiling fans.
Pretty quiet considering it's in the middle of town.
40,000 for 2 people in Twin / Double with ensuite 
27,000 for 1 person 
Secure parking with guard two doors down 
10,000 / day for moto

name: Hotel Almirante Padilla
description: Once a bank, the first bank in #LaGuajira, now a hotel, the first hotel in La Guajira, Colombia. There is history in this town, Riohacha.

name: Paloa Hostel
description:
This place just open 10 days ago. So they are still improving everything! 

We pitch the tent here for 9.000p per person (stayed 3 nights). Clean sanitary block with cold shower (with soap) and toilet (with paper) Access to the comunal kitchen (with a gas stove!). 

Average wifi when it's working! In all the area it's the same, Palomino just grew so fast that the infrastructure didn't follow...so there are problems of water and electricity in all Palomino (not enough for everyone).

There are 3 rooms at the moment (wants to make 2 more). They accept cars (but the big rig ll not fit!). 

Small and friendly place! A lot of mango trees (great for breakfast) and shadow.

name: Estrecho del rio Magdalena
description: Beautiful viewpoint of Rio Magdalena rapids. Small parking lot (3 or 4 vehicles), the road from San Augustin is pretty rough!

name: DIAN office
description: Vehicle import office (aduana). Waited around a few hours waiting for El Jefe, but no trouble importing two bikes, no copies needed, no fee paid, no insurance required (by them, to do the import).

name: Hostel Mariapolis
description: Nice seaside hostel run by sisters, one of whom speaks fluent English. 25,000 for a dorm bed. Mosquito nets, personal fans, fast wifi. Secure parking for bikes, and maybe a small van.

name: Remote Village with excellent Tour
description: You want a unique amazon experience away from the package deals for spoiled tourists. Join Elemir and his family in his remote village in the backcountry of the amazon. We met him as a guide of another tourcompany and we were invited to his house after the end of our trip. This is the real deal! After 45 min of driving through a tiny sidearm of the amazonas you reach elemirs house. He lives there with his beautiful family and is just starting his own tour company. The cabana for vistors was half finished when we came. He is incredibly knowledgeable and will tell you about every plant and animal there is. You will experience one of the last places where people live in the traditional way. Fishing. Hunting. Growing crops. Did I mention he has a n orphan sloth as a free living "pet"?? If you want to get away from it all and meet the best tourguide there is then contact Elemir. Best way is whatsapp. Prices are the same as most of the bigger companies (ca 450$/4 days). His english is improving but at the moment some spanish is required. +57 310 6749200

name: Metro Supermarket - THEY HAVE EVERYTHING
description: Title says it all. A big Metro supermarket which sells all you could wish for.

name: Hostal Isla Senorial
description: Great hostal very close to centre of San Gil but not on the main square so quite quiet at night. They upgraded our room to. Each morning they brought juice and coffee. £15 (about 53000 COP) a night so really cheap. En suite, really good secure private parking undercover, room for multiple motorbikes, small 4x4 but not big rigs. Fan in room. Lots of mechanics close by and supermarket. We also had a balcony which was great as it helped cool the room. There was also a fan in the room. You can wash clothes and staff were lovely but don't expect them to understand English.

name: santa fe  hospedajes
description: The hospedajes is close to the road. It is 20000 with TV is bathroom. calm

name: Loma Linda
description: family Hostel and cabins with parking for campers. 15,000pp. 1 parking with electricity connection. The rest of the parking lots are a little far away next to the Minca viewpoint. bathrooms and kitchen, wifi included in the price. Ivan: +57 315 7386307

name: Toyota Agricola Automotriz
description: Great garage Toyota where we put an alarm. This Toyota was difficult to find it. The website gave a wrong direction.

name: Parque San Pio
description:
Small park Very wooded. With security and police presence. Has free Wifi acceptable. Supermarkets, restaurants, there are "cuidaautos" 

pequeño parque. muy arbolado. con seguridad y presencia policial. tiene Wifi libre aceptable. supermercados, restaurantes, hay trapitos "cuidaautos" a voluntad, muy amables. se retiran a las 18/19hs. se puede parchar sin afán ☺

name: Previsora Seguros
description:
Only place in town that would sell motorcycle insurance (was at 5 different places before).

12/2017 Comment: They do not sell Motorcycle Soat now

name: hotel luisa
description: Hotel tres calme. The room is a 25000 and 20 000 by negotiating. Bathroom, TV wifi

name: Bag/soft pannier repairs
description: A little house with an old chap who reparirs bags and such-like. He repaired my ripped pannier for me for 15000 COP (less than a fiver).

name: Street side parking
description: Great curb side parking in a nice area VERY SAFE!

name: El Refugio
description:
Basic concrete house decorated with love.  Wonderful woman here.  Private rooms with fan (no a/c).  Camping.  Also okay with overlanders parking here.  Inexpensive.

Dogs on property.  

Bucket showers and flush toilet.  Use of kitchen.  Nice garden with a couple of tables and hammocks.

name: Casa Hotel - Villa Del Rio
description:
Nice and clean. Secure courtyard for many motorbikes. Big rigs is a no. Maybe two Landrover sized vehicles will fit if no other customers. Five minute easy walk to centre of the town. Friendly and secure area. Owner is super friendly. I got the room for 30000 as I mentioned this app. Double bed, tv, fan and en suite. No Wi-Fi though. But you can get 4g on your SIM card. 

I tried a few places on the main road and they were pricey. Most wanted around $20 or more.

name: Minga House
description: Lovely guest house, centrally located in downtown Manizales. Angela is very welcoming and friendly. The place has six private rooms and shared bathroom. Strong internet throughout the house, access to kitchen. Only 45.000 pesos per night, which includes breakfast. There is secure parking available as well for a few cars. Phone: +57-312-581-3689

name: Copacabana
description: Hotel close to the road, little quiet but clean room. Non potable water 25000 pesos

name: Rancho Eden
description: We came here after doing TIP extension. great good. WiFi and large parking lot. Menu del dia was 13mil without drink. Bakery is amazing!

name: Hospedaje Las Avispas
description: It's a truck stop with a motel. Room with shower, double bed, fan, tv and Wi-Fi. 25000. A restaurant is on site and the staff have been very friendly. There's no proper secure parking but you can park motorbikes in front of the restaurant as it's manned 24hours.

name: lavanderia lava rapido
description: One of the rare laundry at south america where we got back our clothes without chemical stinky flavour - 2000 p kilo

name: Gas Station hostel
description: Amazing gas station with market, Laundry, showers and rooms! Cheap gas, 25,000 a night perfect little rest recharge station

name: The South Track. TST
description: A Colombian company that develops and produces many accessories for adventure motorcycles. Also a motorcycle rental and guided tours

name: Hotel Parque
description: Nice hotel right next to the church on the square. 32k for a room w/ fans. Very clean, fast wifi, cold shower. Room for bikes inside at night.

name: Predio con múltiples talleres mecánicos
description: Predio con múltiples servicios mecánicos son varios talleres con especialistas en frenos. torno. suspensión. muelles. mecánica en gral. monta llantas. escapes etc etc se puede parquear por la noche pagando 8mil hay un supermercado Justo & Bueno a 50 mts.

name: Cuesta del Indias
description: If anyone is interested in caving this place offers an excellent service with guide and full safety equipment. Cave tour lasts for 1 to 2 hours and 30,000COP pp. Went with family (3kids)

name: chez ronald
description: I met Ronald, who greets travelers at his home, in a spacious room. The house is great, big and bright, the rooms are comfortable with bathroom and TV. Ronald is super attentive. It proposes the room to 25000 pesos and 30000 with the breakfast. I recommend to you, especially that the pasto hotels are expensive. Call on his mobile phone at +57 323 3813610

name: Color Hostal - find on booking.com
description: Good hostal away from main drag with secure parking. About £20 s 76000 cop for a double with air con and breakfast. Nice chap who runs it. 15 min walk from beach. Just off main road so easy to find esp with larger vehicle. Ensuite. Medium rigs prob max but ask. Parking space outside is large.

name: restaurante Robert
description: Good and cheap lunch! 10k for super tasty fish soup, main (we had one of the best marinated fish so far) and agua panela

name: Hotel behind petrol station
description: Hotel hidden behind petrol station. Rooms with fan or A/C . TV and showers. Ok for one night . Far from the road 25 so a bit quiet.

name: El Carmen
description:
At the start/end of the asphalt. Unnamed residencia but everyone will point it out to you. simple but clean. private toilet and shower behind a less private curtain. 25,000 for a double. friendly people.

We are on bicycles and wheeled them into the courtyard, a motorbike or 2 would fit.

name: Church ruins abandoned
description:
Amazing old church ruins destroyed by a mud slide and or earthquake.. 

This is a tourist attraction but it is possibly to camp here overnight.

name: Metro Llantas
description:
Carlos runs a standup operation. Even though the shop is decently big size, he personally overseas each car that is being worked on. We only rotated my tires here, but it was quickly apparent that this place is professional & high quality - enough so to prompt me to write my first iOverlander post ab a mechanic shop in 27,000km. 

Carlos el dueño fue muy amable y professional. Aunque es el dueño, el personalmente supervisa el trabajo de cada carro que entra su taller. 100% recomendado!

name: Los Guaduales Ecoparque
description:
This place was an amazing find on the side of the road. Plenty of secure parking. Big rigs may have a problem with height issues. For us bikers there is ample room and it was put under cover too. It was empty my whole time here and the family invited me in for dinner in the evening in their home as opposed to the restaurant. Pepe and his wife are lovely people and will tell you all about Colombia and further south on the continent. They travel a lot. The food is great. 

I paid 30000 for a double room including a great breakfast sat with them in their home. There is a warm shower and Wi-Fi. It's close to the road but quietens down during the night. Great spot and highly recommend it.

name: Africa Motos
description:
This shop has guys willing to find parts and tires for you, even if they don't already have them on hand (which they may).  Good selection of motorcycle tires here (Pirelli, Continental, Metzeler, Michelin, Kenda).  They obtained moto tires for us that everyone else said were impossible to get in Colombia as well as a difficult to locate sprocket for a Yamaha, master links for a chain, and had them all delivered to their shop within hours.  Andreas and Alejandro helped us the most.  Super friendly and extremely helpful!  They have mechanics here as well.  Cannot recommend this place enough after a vert frustrating time locating these items elsewhere.

They had valve shims for my KLR! amazing service, fully stocked with everything imaginable and the friends wrenchers ive encountered in all latin america.

name: Road from San Gil to Duitama
description: Do not take this road unless you have a strong vehicle and nerves of steel. Narrow roads, steep drops and landslides. Did not have to use 4WD but it is a dirt road 85% of the time. 66km has taken us 7 hours. Spent the night in this spot here because we had enough driving. Very isolated but for a running stream of water.

name: Balneario Erika
description: Thermal hot pools. Great on a cool day...warms the bones up!!  Entrance is 18‘000 COP adults and 9,500COP kids at time of writing. Great pit stop, spent a couple of hours here

name: Restaurante República de Tominé
description:
European restaurant (only open on weekends & holidays) with a very kind colombian-german owner. Great view over the lake, huge garden (pet friendly), nature hiking path, fire pit, area for kids, petting zoo and hammok area.

We did not eat there, because it was Tuesday but we camped for two nights. Don't know about their policy about Campers (we are cyclists), but there is a big safe parking lot with a wide entrance.

name: Gondava Dinosaur Park
description: A great little attraction for aspiring paleontologists!  Kids loved it. Has a life size display of most dinosaurs surrounded by a lovely natural setting. Great family day out. Tour guide will take you around (Spanish only) but we had a great time doing a self tour. $15000Cop adults, $14000 kids and under 8's free.

name: Unicentro
description: Dog-friendly shopping mall with good wifi. Underground parking up to 2.4 meters.

name: Hotel San Carlos
description: Basic hostel paid 35000 for a double room. 650 size will fit through the door but no bmw with panniers gonna fit. Close to lots of eating places and a huge mall if that's your thing.

name: Vista Buena
description:
Inexpensive hotel for the night. Double bed for 30,000 pesos with private bathroom, wifi, tv. 

10,000 to park overnight and use hot showers. 

Restaurant onsite.

name: Montearroyo
description: Beautiful restaurant, quite expensive. Be prepared to pay US$15-US$20 per head including food and drinks. If you want to do it on the cheap, you can fish, $10,000COP per lbs. campground for tents and other adventure things such as slack-lining, kids park, rock climbing, etc.

name: Clean Service Laundry. Medellin
description: Laundry, 7500 cop/kg, drop the clothes on the morning and picked up at 5pm

name: Calla'o el loro guest house
description:
what a hostel!!!!! and what a team. close to the center and plenty of restaurants around. A perfect place to enjoy medellin.
Very Good wifi, kitchen and playroom with TV and PC. All very clean.
Free garage.
Highly recommended !!!

Comment: Tried to sleep here with our kids but the hostel has no permit for kids to stay overnight. But very friendly and helpfull to look for an alternative hostel.

name: JM decoración interior
description: Josue and his son helped us fix the seats of our van for a very reasonable price. He does all types of interior work, welding, and tapestry work. Very good work and very nice, honest guys.

name: LavaSport Lavandería
description:
Very clean and cheap autoservice for laundry & dryer. Friendly stuff and waiting area with Wifi & magazines. Mon-Sat: 9am - 6pm Su: closed.
There is a pay-by-the-hour parking area with no height restriction but quite narrow entrance from road, 20metres before this location.

name: Hostal La Media Luna
description: A beautiful hostel in a quiet area in Palomino, but still close enough to enjoy all of the bars and restaurants, and the beach (15-20min walk). The owner is really lovely and he also speaks english. He has a few friendly resident cats and dogs, and one of the dogs 'Cookie' will probably walk with you to the beach etc. The rooms are nice and they supply mosquito nets. Breakfast is 10000 COP and very good. It has parking (Big rigs unlikely to fit). Highly recommend. Double with private bathroom and fan 60000 COP per night (booking.com).

name: Parqueadero La Amistad
description:
Long-term vehicle parking and storage option.

La Amistad offers about 40 covered parking spaces (high vehicles won't fit) and open field parking in a large, enclosed space.

I stored my truck here for 10 months, under the covered parking for 40.000 pesos per month (Eduardo has increased prices drastically in 2024, tried to charge me 100,000 for uncovered parking, came down to 80,000). 

There is an electrical shop beside the parking lot who were able to give me a jump when I returned to the truck (since nobody would give me a jump in the parking lot).

They have cameras on the premises, and I was very happy to get back to my truck and see that everything was just as I left it, no problems. The parking lot is a short walk from the bus terminal in Ipiales. 

Ipiales is sort of the no-man's land between the borders, so it is possible to turn in your temporary import permit to the DIAN (you do not need to stamp out first), flip a U-Turn back into Ipiales and park for the long-term. You can do the u-turn right before the bridge, after you've gone past the sheltered area for refugees.

We traveled from Cartagena, and turned the paperwork in at the Ipiales border before turning around and parking lot. Upon returning to the truck we will finish the rest of South America.

This strategy works for south-bound travel at the least, but I'm sure you could also make it work for northbound travel. Perhaps by getting the TIP at the border, then going to park the vehicle, and turning in the TIP at the border again. 

Run by Yolanda and Eduardo, Eduardo can be reached at +573154806518

name: Hotel Metropol
description:
Cheap hotel with private parking (big rigs would fit as well). Nothing fancy, but made for a great place as I got my vehicle out of long-term storage nearby. Also right beside the bus terminal.

Restaurant on-site, so you can eat there as well, rather than wander around Ipiales.

25.000 pesos per night for a couple with good wifi, TV, private bath during the weekend, price went down to 20.000 pesos during the weekday.

name: Hotel Wipama parking lot
description: Right beside the Hotel Wipama. Quiet& huge truck stop/ parking lot. On our way to Tayrona/Santa Marta. The lady at the reception gave us the password for the wifi. We paid 5000 for the night.

name: Parking lot in a complex
description: Its a huge parking lot in a brand new complex in the middle of nowhere 10' drive from Curiti. Super quiet, only the river. Nobody came to ask for money. Across of the other spot where other people paid 10.000. No facilities. 2' walk to the bridge/trailhead. There are no signs/ no trash cans nothing, just the parking lot.  The trail along the river states no camping/fires, so I would not pitch a tent along the river.  I suspect the restaurant would let you on their property if you asked.

name: La Miga Panederia
description: Really great self made bread, fresh from the oven! A great change to the overly sweet Colombian bread we had so far. They also have cost spots for sitting there, drinking coffee or a jugo from the Jugeria right next door

name: Hotel Wipama
description: Clean hotel with huge guarded parking lot. Got a room for 2 with AC for 30000COP, private bathroom. Could leave our van for free in the parking. It is in the middle of nowhere, but a clean place for a night

name: Parqueadero 24horas
description:
Parqueadero in the center of Pereira 2000cop/hora from 7am to 7pm and 12000cop for the Night (7pm to 7am).
They allowed us to stay in the car for the night without any questions.

name: Eulises Torres - taller mechanico
description:
Small shop bit super friendly, will help you with everything they can and really fair price. Highly recommended if you have a small repair to do around here.

Address is calle 15 26-05, right behind a tire shop and next to hotel Casa grande

name: Hospedaje Guatape
description: Lovely hospedaje - clean, quiet road, kitchen for cooking your own meals on a balcony overlooking the town and close to the waterfront and main square. We paid $30,000 for a double room on the weekend, however some people who arrived after us paid $50,000. Owners are friendly and helpful. No parking available as it is right on the street.

name: Hotel Berdez
description: Brand new hotel on Hwy. 45 just on outskirts of Neiva. AC and wifi. 80,000p for two with taxes. Plenty of parking for all sizes. Next to Esso Station.

name: AUTOCARS
description:
Mantenimiento preventivo y o correctivo de su carro, especializado en 4x4, toyota especialista igual que land rover.

Motor maintenance garage in North of Cali.  Specialists in 4x4, Toyota,  & Land Rover.

name: Moto Club
description: Super helpful and knowledgeable motorbike mechanic at a very reasonable price.

name: San Alberto Plaza hotel
description: Paid 50,000 for a spotless double room with en-suite and air con. Secure underground parking for cars and motos, you can even keep an eye on your wheels whilst swimming in the pool! Just stopped here for one night en route to Medellin.

name: hotel Portón del Nus
description: Paid 28,000 for a clean double room with air con and en-suite. Motorbike parked just outside the door overnight and it was fine.

name: ivy hostel
description: Really nice hostel! Absolutely spotless, good hot shower, great kitchen, lovely spaces to hang out and a nice atmosphere. Parked our bike in the back yard behind a locked gate. Paid about 25,000 for a dorm bed, including breakfast.

name: No-Name Hospedaje (Mi Barquito)
description: Next to Restaurante Mi Barquito. Only 20k for a nice room with very comfy beds and private washroom with hot water (1 person). Ample parking inside for motos. Big porch to chill on.

name: Restaurante Milenio
description: The first restaurant we've seen between here and Puerto Boyacá,  there is very little along this road! Nice chairs outside, standard colombian menu of chicken, rice, eggs, frijoles.

name: Hostal D'J
description: Hotel next to the Biomax station. Nice rooms with air con or fan, small shop with snacks and drinks. Big space out front to park. We paid 50,000 for a double bed with air con.

name: Gasolinera Terpel
description: Great gas station 24 hs with all services: clean bathrooms, wifi, water, restaurant, plenty of parking space and even showers (2000COP)! We did not stay because it was early but it was very good.

name: Hotel Meyo
description:
Hotel with swimming pool and parking for motos. Not sure a big rig can fit. But town seems pretty safe.

We stayed in a room eith one double and one single bed with private bathroom  and an air conditioner for 40000 cops. Normally it was 45000, we negotiated a bit. 

Town is small but nice, not like the other crazy colombian towns. Worth to stay. Maybe you can stay one night more with the effect of swimming pool :)

name: Hotel Santa Rosa De Osos
description: Great hotel for about 30$ CAD for a modern double room. Friendly staff, very clean, hot shower, good internet and safe parking for our motorcycles (right in front of the office with a guard all night). We can see the motos from our room.  Happy to relax here tonight. Bakery/cafeteria next door. Coffee and filtered water in the lobby. Good solid and safe place to stay. Not a four star hotel but I'm giving it 4 stars for great value. Rooms facing the rear will be quieter than at the front.   24 h cafétéria next door, plenty of restaurants, gas stations and moto mechanics.  Many hotels on main strip and up in the town.

name: Motortek
description:
Eduardo speaks perfect English and is a good guy. He can fix your bike and knows a lot about bikes. 
+57 320 833 4171

name: Parador Rojo
description: This is the hotel next to the boondocking site mentioned in earlier post. The room is spartan, no AC, cold shower only, bed is hard. But for only 30.000cop and with good wifi,  Better to do boondocking.

name: Atmopel
description: Tyres and parts for motorbikes in Medellin. Michelin,

name: Restaurante Del Mar
description: Stopped for dinner here. Owner told us that we were more than welcome to camp. Toilet & shower if we need. Super nice guy. Food was good with generous portions. Didn't stay but would work for sure.

name: Carpenter for shipping
description: Osvaldo Oranco of Muebles Modernos built a wall to bb the back of our van for shipping. The first day he took measurements and we came back the next day to have it installed. Simple but solid. Charged us 140000 pesos for materials, labor, and installation.

name: Tatoo outdoor products
description:
About the best we have seen in Bogota. Stock a bit of everything from MSR to other outdoor products.
Just across the road from Corral restaurant

name: Don't stop motorcycle Products
description: Carlos sells motorcycle adventure products from Klim, Mitas, Giant Loop and many other brands. Him and his wife are very cool people and also speak English. Anything you need he would try and help

name: La Espanola Boutique
description:
A 'home stay' according to booking.com. Double with bathroom, air con and use of kitchen and fridge with seating area/TV. Supermarket close, enclosed housing area (gates with guards). Street parking for 4 wheeled vehicles. Space for 2 bikes on the mini driveway. 70000 per room per night. Close to old town (walking distance). 
The streets are narow and can be a chalenge for wide cars. Not a problem for our 4runner.

We got a small discount by booking directly with the owner : +573006586633 (WhatsApp). Check first the rate in booking.com and negotiate.

name: Mega Motos MOTORCYCLE SHOP
description:
Mega Motorcycle shop. An actual bike shop with parts, brand name tyres and a website. 
There is an attached photo of the website and a WhatsApp #.
Let us do an oil change (bought oil) in parking lot.
Got a Skinko 705. 230,000COP included changing.
Golden boy SR 244. 160,000COP.

name: Hotel la lizama
description:
Nice hotel on the road towards Bucaramanga. Clean rooms all with air con, friendly staff, huge structure (hard to miss!) Cold showers, towels and soap provided. Decent WiFi speed. Lots of parking space. 
Good restaurant opposite for dinner and a couple of snack kiosks here too. Single room for me was 30 000.

name: Hotel at petrol station
description:
Clean and bright hotel at the petrol station on the corner. Big rooms with tv and a fan, a few restaurant options on the street outside. Lots of parking space. 

Little tricky to work out who's in charge, we went to the petrol pumps and they are able to sort out a room for us for 35,000. Rooms had just been renovated when we arrived.

name: hotel senorial
description:
simple but clean hostel with decent Wi-Fi and friendly owners. locked our bicycles in an unused bedroom. plenty of parking downstairs for motorcycles and small rigs. big rigs will not fit. 45k for a double 

Comment: Wrong coordinates n04.26580 w75.93231

name: Dreamers hostel
description:
We booked a 3 days tour to Punta Gallinas in this hostel. They let us sleep in our van the night before the tour and as well we were allowed to let the van parked in the hostel parking during the 3 days and 3 nights of the tour.
The parking lot is guarded.
Usually (if you don't buy them a tour or a room) they don't allow campervans on their parking lot.

name: Hotel Terrazas de la candelaria
description:
Nice hotel with pool, jacuzzi and nice view on the mountains. 
Paid 75,000COP for a double room with fan and private bathroom (2 people), breakfast included.
Very good hotel for the price.
Parking is available but mostly located in very steep streets.

name: Picaflor Artesanal
description: If you are tired of sweet Colombian bread, come here. I bought a big loaf of freshly baked sourdough bread for 4000COP. They also have a variety if desserts and sell coffee. I didn't stay here, but it look like a cute place and the staff was extremely nice and helpful with my broken Spanish

name: Tecni Mofles (VW specialist)
description: Juan Rincon is the boss here, speaks only Spanish but super friendly guy and did great job. A bit more than anticipated, but didn't charge anything extra. Highly recommended if you need work on exhaust done

name: Hotel Terpel Campestre
description: Hotel belongs to Terpel gas station. Small, clean rooms with A/C. We paid 35.000 COP for one room (2 people). WIFI in rooms, but it's pretty slow. There are some restaurants right next to the hotel, also a tiny mini market. The reception for the hotel is in the Terpel administration building at the gas station. Open parking lot that would fit any vehicle, not gated though.

name: Plaza de Mercado minorista Ipiales somos todos
description: Great local market even has food court on site. You can pick up anything you need from the small local vendors here. Great prices, better than supermarket.

name: Hostal El Pauji - Cañón de la Cristalina Trailhead
description:
This is the beginning of a trail to explore a river and its forest, canyons and waterfalls.  Expect to walk through the river a lot (sharp rocks), so think of appropriate footwear.  A lovely family lives at the trailhead.  Camping for one tent cost $15,000 COP.
Little to none Claro Reception, no Wi-Fi. 

Edit January 2023: I also added a "Tourist Attraction" point for more information on the hike through the canyons.
It is Big Rig Friendly but high clearance is a must for the last 2km to the Hostal.

name: Riverside Restaurant
description: Restaurant allows camping. Beside the restaurant, there are some small places for tents beside the tables. There are toilets next to the camping area. River is a bit dirty but if you want you can swim in artificial pools.

name: Hotel Estorake
description: brand new hotel. very nice staff. very relaxing. good for a stop over

name: Tire station
description:
Tire station next to the terpel gas station.
They do tire repair (vulcanization) and replacement.
They took me 15,000COP to repair my damaged tire

name: SOAT - Suramericana
description: In this office of Suramericana you can purchase or renew your vehicle insurance (SOAT) per month or for the time that you want.

name: Gran Hotel El Viajero
description:
Bright, airy and cheap hotel. Lots of plants and a big open space in the centre, free tea and coffee and space to sit. Rooms are relatively basic but still bright, some have ceiling height doors onto the outside (like a small balcony).

We paid 30,000 for a double room, woman was very friendly and helpful, spoke slowly enough for us to understand and was passionate about the local area. No parking space that we could see.

name: Sobre la calle, a una cuadra del mar
description:
Street in a residential neighborhood of Rodadero. 24 hour surveillance, the guard stays all night caring for parked cars, you have to warn them that you will spend the night here. Around the street in a building on Avenida 17 is a tap that can be used to get water.

Es una calle cortada en un barrio residencial de Rodadero, tiene vigilancia las 24 hs, el sereno se queda toda la noche cuidando los carros estacionados, tienen que avisarles que van a pasar la noche allí. A la vuelta de la calle en un edificio sobre la avenida 17 hay una canilla que pueden usar para cargar agua.

name: Moto Llanos
description: Little bike shop. Really helpful guys. Lots of tools/parts. Helped us when one of our bikes wouldn't start.

name: AKT service centre
description: Bike repair shop, parts and Kontrol Llantas tyres with some good off-road options. We just used it for bike battery issues.

name: Central de Lujos
description: Great shop who went out of their way to find parts.

name: Taller Suzuki Super Servicio
description: Great place with excellent customer service. Take all bike docs with you. Great workshop and you can watch what they are doing in the waiting area with a coffee.

name: Motobobinados Lincoln
description: Motorbike electric shop. Sorted our stator. Fast and efficient.

name: Club Marina de Guatavita
description: Great place with a lot of space for any size rig. Bathrooms with cold showers. Restaurant. Safe by night. It is a public Nautic Club, so maybe a little bit crowed on weekends.
