On the km 15 of the road from Sesquile to Guatavita town. $18.000/person. Awesome sunset... port on the Guatavita lake. Small boat rental

name: Gasan Julio Gas
description:
Propane refill station
refill us tanks here. Also for RV fixed propane gas tanks. Looks like an auto mechanic / gas tank distributor. Fenced gate

name: Finca Hotel Salento
description: Entrance is the same for El ranchito de Salento. Continue up the path and follow signs for Finca Hotel. Beautiful views, quiet (aside from the cows), nice restaurant and hotel. Free coffee. We paid 20,000 not sure if it's per person or per vehicle. Restaurant is only open until 2, but you can hang out inside. Bathrooms and the best hot showers at a informal campsite we have had! The owner is so incredible nice!!

name: Di Silvio Trattoria
description: Lovely Italian restaurant with amazing bruschetta and reasonably priced dishes and nice ambiance.

name: Las Mulas hotel (Biomax fuel station)
description: 24000 for the two of us! Super clean, modern A/C, functional flat screen TV, cold showers, perfect really. A number of restaurants nearby. This hotel is on the West side of the road behind the Biomax fuel station. Can accommodate all sized rigs in an unsecured lot directly in front of the hotel. The town of Hobo is 5kms South with all amenities.

name: Small tienda
description: Older couple have opened a small stall here to sell some bread, bananas and coffee. They where really friendly and did not want any money for parking here for overnight. We pushed 5thousand to their hands. The road starts to go down after this towards Ocaña. This place is right next to the road but little to no traffic at night. The road to Playa de Belen is mostly freshly paved and with great views.  Also good to know is that Ocaña has the cheapest fuel what we have seen so far in Colombia. If everywhere diesel is around 7-8,5thous COP per gallon then every gas station in Ocaña was selling diesel for 5,4-5,7thousand COP PER gallon. Arrive with empty tank :)

name: Playa de Belen
description: On the quiet street of Playa de Belen. There are park benches and street lights. Best place to stay for free in this charming little town.

name: Hotel y Restaurante Las Delicias De Mi Tierra
description:
Hotel and Restaurante on the main road through Oiba. Rooms are basic but clean, there is wifi and cold showers. Friendly and family run, the restaurant was packed when we arrived (always a good sign!) and they serve a good selection of colombian food. We paid 30,000 for a double room. 

They have quite a big space out front so it should be possible to park. 5 mins walk to the main square where there's a pretty church, benches and a great ice cream shop.

name: La Casona
description: Great little hotel on the square.  Brand new with private bathroom, good wifi and only 30,000 for two people including parking for motorbike.  They have room for about 4 motorbikes, or two big ones.

name: Montallantas Motos
description: Welder for all things motorcycle. Lovely guy and good at problem solving.

name: BBVA Bank to pay portfees maritrans
description:
here you have to go in Order to pay the portfees After martrans handed you out some paperwork. we waited 20 min at 9:15, quite bussy
After you return with proof of payment, you should make about 3 copies, possible on the otger side of the street im centro UNO, 2nd floor left side of the building

name: Solo automaticos
description:
I still hate automatics -.- 

Drove here with bad automatic shifting and no 4th gear. After Anden mt. descend from north... to ask at Technomoritz for a good automatic technician. He walked us across the street. So far great Job! we are on the road after a 3 day repair; they started right away.

They cleaned every part consciously, checking if it had faults and where before screws were too long etc. they replaced them; even little details. In comparison to Mexico parts and their work were more expensive, but I believe it was better quality all the way.  

They have a big entry and a big hall; big rigs are only restricted by the cars parked in the street. We mesure h-3m, l-7m, w-2,5m and had no issues at all! No English was spoken, and only one guy there slowed his talking speed for me to understand, but i guess at Technomoritz across the street you could ask for translation help. They had a really detailed service  manual for the automatic. They consulted it and followed it perfectly (as far as i can tell). 

I willpPost if we break down but i have a good feeling.

The only only bummer was that they did not give me a price until they finished and even though i stood next to them all thee days (i learned a lot) they did not give me a price of parts they would change. E.g. all of a sudden someone came in a car, with a repair kit (all the discs again, although some were still good from Mexico. However, also in Mexico a complete kit was cheaper than the single two broken disks and the seals) 
He said "good quality, original" in Spanish (what it looked like) Then he drove me to a bank to pay him COP 903.000. 
Made in Mexico by an original Ford parts replacement company with a bigger non metal automatic fluid filter against overheating. I liked that José, the owner,  made clear that he was not changing extra. I payed the external deliverer. but still every time I asked how much he said "We will see, I'll give you a good price when it works."
They had all pieces for an almost identical diesel automatic, which are stronger than the gasoline ones and fitted them, so i think now we are prepared for the Andes; only time will tell.  

I hate automatics,  but there was no other option in Canada for sale. 
We had our automatic taken apart thee times by two different mechanics in Mexico. changed gear discs and some other stuff. I don't know if it was bad work there or if this truck's gearbox is not made to haul a camper (still a ton under the maximum gross weight.

name: Hotel La Estacion
description: Standard hotel, quiet with a place to chill. We paid 20'000 COP for a room for couple, with fan, tv and private bathroom. 30'000 with AC. Wifi but really poor. Place in the room for our big bike.

name: La 12 parrillada
description: Very good Argentinian restaurant. A big burger for 15000 COP, excellent fruit juice. The owner and chef is very nice and cyclist-friendly.

name: Los Almendros
description: Clean and correct hotel with nice owners. A little bit noisy (close to the place). We paid 25'000 COP for a room for two, with tv, fan and cold shower. They have space for our big bicycle.

name: Hotel Colonial Primavera
description:
Charming and cheap hotel in the centre. Wooden floors, sofas and chairs, a little courtyard and a big wooden staircase, this feels like an old colonial house. Rooms are basic but clean, there are shared bathroom or en suite rooms available. Hot showers and strong wifi. 

We paid 30,000 for shared bathroom. No parking available but great for cycle tourers as there's space in the courtyard for bikes. There is a kitchen but it's mainly for staff, we asked to use it and were given permission.

name: Kilele hostel Cali
description: This hostel is brand new. It has a great vibe and its hosts are welcoming and helpful. The place is beautiful, modern and airy. It has a pool, fantastic views and is close to restaurants and trendy nightlife. The rooms are comfortable and very clean and so are the bathrooms. Our two motorcycles are safely parked inside the house. At 71,400COP for two beds, we will certainly be back to stay longer on our way home. By far the best hostel from Mexico to Colombia!!  Highly  recommended!!! Pictures from google are a true reflection of this place.

name: Posada el Cafe
description: Beautiful old wooden house built on 3 sides with established gardens and wooden verandas. The front leads you directly to the main road for shops and restaurants. A covered garage is available at the rear where we parked two motorbikes securely. Double garage would possible take 6 motos with care. Cost COP140,000 on for double onsuite with a very good breakfast. Supper host Maria Elena was extremely welcoming and knowledgeable about the area and trips. Highly recommended.

name: Secure Parking (one of many around)
description: Secure Parking near the centre of town. Not too big, height limit was around 2.5 metres. Pretty tight but no need to leave the keys and the owners are really nice. We paid 12,000 pesos for 24 hours. I believe they close on weekends. There are many parkings around here, just a few metres further there's a bigger one (on the corner of calle 20 and carrera 2), and many others on carrera 2 south from here.

name: AVOID: Frenos/Brake Shop
description: DO NOT GO HERE! A few hours of driving after we had a basic brake service done here, our BRAKES FAILED COMPLETELY ON A STEEP DOWNHILL SECTION. The emergency mechanic diagnosed that the screw used to drain brake fluid was not adjusted properly, so air entered the brake hose. We got away with a big scare, you might not...

name: De la tierra especias
description: Specialty store with bulk spices and grains (amaranth, quinoa), nuts, as well as raw honey, apple cider vinegar, balsamic vinegar, liquor of mora and orange, coffee, etc.

name: Hostal Casa Loma
description: A gorgeous place to stay.  $25,000 per person COP.  Javier is incredibly kind and informative.  Everything in town is walkable from here.  Good enough wifi to watch Netflix.  Secure parking.  A great kitchen to use as well.  Private rooms with bathrooms as well as dorm rooms.

name: Terpel
description: At the terpel gas station there is a water filling station by the restrooms. The workers said it was potable and okay to fill up our water bottles for free.

name: Oromo Coffee Shop
description: Great coffee shop in Popayan. Many different varieties beans from all around Colombia prepared by alternative ways (siphon, chemex, V60...). You will no regret. Lovely staff, good price.

name: Restaurant La Angostura big parking lot
description: After 6 hours drive with our trailer from San Augustin, we found this huge parking. Quite, without trucks, restaurant with menu del dia para 10 000COP. Open from 6a.m. to11p.m. The owner Jorge and him wife are heplful nice peolpe. They offered as shower and toilet. Restaurant has good wifi. They say when we eat in restauran we don't have to pay. Otherwise fees voluntary. Elektricity is possible. Very safe, they have seguritas in the night. We left our trailer there and visited from here mercado in Silvia (every tuesday)58km and the cetrum Popayán 5km.

name: Hospedaje Colonial
description: 15,000 COP per person.  Secure parking.  There was a wi-fi router, but was not working at the time.

name: Immigration office to extend visa.
description: Park at Alta Vista parking garage and walk around the corner. Add passport front page, stamp and moto TIP as one pdf smaller than 1mg to upload  first http://www.migracioncolombia.gov.co

name: la Isleta
description: estacionamiento frente a un boliche que estaba cerrado, justo frente a los bomberos que nos prestaron la ducha. seguro ya que también hay un puesto de policía. No es recomendable si abren nuevamente el boliche pero si no es fin de semana debe estar bien

name: Hotel El Lago
description: Good secure parking, no height restriction. Bar, restaurant, and pool. Room with AC quoted 91000 but they gave it to me for 78000. Just an overnight stop on the way to Guatape.

name: Sura Seguras
description: Extend insurance for vehicles for TIP. And so on and so on.

name: Garagabi hostel & Camping
description: Really cool colourful hostel with a nice garden for tents or smaller 4x4 cars. Rooms are 95000 camping 18000per person. Dorms from 26000 pp. Swimming pool and good wifi. Good for a few days stay or when wanting to extend the TIP.

name: Palchacual
description: This level spot is a municipal land and there's enough room for at least 5 vehicles. Small walking track leads down to the lake. Locals say that there is fish in the lake. I did not catch any. Friendly people around and its a good spot to get acclimatize. Its around 3580 meters and Claro has reception here.

name: Parqueadero 1
description: Boondocking at the end of the road at Playa Blanco; no services but better beach access than parqueadero 2.  10,000 ea for night and day so 20,000. Secure, no Tigo cell reception but there is on the beach.  Most establishments on beach are closed for dinner as most day trippers are gone before 5. Was quiet at night.

name: Helmut in Taganga
description:
Nice cabanas owned by a german who sells good beer. You can get eggs from his chicken farm. Helmut and his friend Anakarolina are very friendly and help you with all the things you need.
Perfect spot to go to Tayrona or just relax  some days.

name: Centro Volkswagen
description:
Volkswagen parts heaven! if senora Nubia can't find, it doesn't exist! superfriendly experts (especially old models) Volkswagen garage Castivolks just around the corner.
tel. 031 313 38658 26

name: Hostal casa Del Japones
description: Brand new looking hostel, very clean rooms (50,000 - private double, shared bathroom). Private room with bathroom is 70,000. Accessible by moto or bicycle (2 or 3 motos would fit within the secure compound). we looked at a couple hostels in town and this is by far the best value. Full kitchen and the fastest WiFi we've had since the US.

name: agua viva
description:
nice cheap sea food with a view over the cienaga. truck stop restaurant
$35,000 for the bigger variety of fish, fried

name: La Colonia Restaurant
description:
Parking lot of restaurant La Colonia. Really nice lady Alicia who loves to take pictures with you! Free parking and use of bathroom with shower. Don't mind if you cook and have a  little store aswell as restaurant. Super sweet people!

Breakfast of eggs, bread and an arepa for $5,000.

name: VW specialist Rafa
description: Really nice mechanic who specializes in VolksWagen. If you have a Kombi this is your guy. He knows what he is doing, 40+ years experience, honest and can get the parts. tel: 301 281 2450

name: SOAT
description:
soat Julio Andrew Lopez Revel
The SOAT in the Supermarket doesn't work.
Big Rig 1 month 70.000

name: Secure Parking
description:
Secure parking. (We just parked. We have a roof top tent so we don't sleep in parking areas). Most parking spots are in shade but you have to fit under not so high roof. Otherwise you can park by the wall. Super secure, big steal gate. Regular rate is 7,000p per day, 7,000p per night. If you stay longer Carlos might give you a deal. No height limit, regular width. If the door is closed, give Carlos a call or whatsapp +57 310 356 5899 or knock on the wooden door across the street and they'll find Carlos (love Latam! Haha) Very nice people. 

Enjoy Mompox! We highly recommend a boat river tour, it's really cheap and it's very nice.
…

name: Hostal Capurgana
description: Great clean and tidy place close to the port with fast wifi.  For a double room with private bathroom 90,000 Colombian.  They speak English, German and Spanish. www.hostalcapurgana.net. They are also on trip advisor and booking.com.  The owner Silvio helped us with transporting a motorbike from Turbo and has contacts locally for transport to Panama.

name: Renew Tip papers
description: Not too busy place to extend your TIP. One thing though they said you can only extend a week or two before leaving the country. They were kind to help us even though we still had a month and a half left

name: El Pulpito del Diablo hiking trail
description: Thats the place where the El Pulpito del Diablo hiking trail starts. NP has a permit control booth here as well. Small level parking lot for overnight stay if you can sleep 4000+meters above sea level. They have "interesting" add dirt kind of industrially made toilet. Day temperatures hover around +5 decrees. Night is a bit colder ;)

name: Level spot with a view
description: Above the old basketball court there is a level spot where to park. Don't block the drive in bath for the house below this spot. Asked from that same house is it ok to park here and friendly guy had only no blocking rule. Some cows and lambs but they have been behaving well. Like everywhere in this area, views are great.

name: Rio Lagunillas
description: Free level parking lot just after you cross the Lagunillas river. There is just enough room for 2 vehicles. In 24 hours here we have seen 10 horseback riders, 2 motorbikes and one small car. Locals are super friendly and curious. This is dead end road and at the end there is a house where it's possible to get something warm to eat.

name: In the Forest
description:
Quiet place in the forest on a side road.

half an hour north of rio sucio. locals told us its ok to camp here. some horses, dogs and friendly locals coming for a chat and a photo. 

see latest checkin for road condition.

name: start for hike to laguna del otun
description:
From here you can walk to laguna del Otun. It took us three days there and back. You can camp at various places: la Pastora (2 hours), El Jordan (6 hours), la Escuela (at el bosque, 7-8 hours, at 3600 m) or the laguna itself (10 hours, at 4000m). We camped the first night at El Jordan, then went to la escuela, left our heavy stuff there and continued to the laguna and back. It's super beautiful,  but come prepared for rain. In the camping places that we mentioned there will be a shelter for cooking (bring your camping stove, fires are not allowed). El Jordan also has a couple of beds if you don't want to carry a tent etc. From there you can also make it to the laguna and back in one day. Just check availability (google?) in holidays. La Pastora is a nice place with beds (many!) only a 2 hour walk from el Cedral and a nice base for some nice short hikes through this amazing dense forest with all its waterfalls. 

We left our car here at el Cedral without problems for 3 days, but you might consider leaving it in la Florida and take the chiva (bus) to el Cedral for the following reasons: 1. the road is bad. You need high clearance and it will take you much longer than the chiva. 2. we slept at el cedral the nighy before we started,  but that was a mistake: loud music all night long ( literally, it was still playing when we left in the morning). When I asked whether they always play their music all night long she said: yes we always have music... So be warned🙂

For the rest, enjoy this hike! It's so beautiful that we don't understand why its not more popular. We met only one other couple. (Perhaps because of the wheather?). Oh, and good to know, you don't have to pay any entrance fee for the national park here, just some small camping fees (6000 at el jordan, the escuela was free, but we don't know whether that's always the case).

name: Darian Gap Crossing
description:
This is the location where to look for a cargo boat. it is located in Turbo port.

The Captain is Christobal Rodrigez:
3147938125

His cargo boat has the name : No hay como dios

The boat goes between Turbo and Capurgana and cost USD100.00 (for a GS1200) bike, panniers, and bags. It took 6 hours.  We left the same day in a fast boat and arrived before the cargo boat to unload the bike.

name: Mi Casa Guatape
description: Beautiful hostel not far from town with parking out the front and restaurants close by. Susie and Sean the owners are super welcoming and helpful and have a wealth of information about the area. The beds are comfy, everything is spotless and there's free coffee! Dorms are 30,000COP and privates 70,000COP. The walk into town isn't far or you can get a bus for 1500 or taxi for 7000. Highly recommend it!

name: Villa Linda
description:
asked to camp in their gardens and charged 8000 per person. place was empty so had hammocks, sink area and table to ourselves. Nice dogs, river at the bottom of the garden. owner was super interested and friendly - ended up giving us our big breakfast and coffee for free, that sort of nice bloke!

my Spanish isn't good enough to ask about camper vans but I'm sure he would do his best to accommodate you.

name: Concepción - very beautiful pueblo!
description: Lovely surprise - tiny cobbled streets, colorful colonial houses, pretty plaza with an interesting church, and wonderfully quiet. big rigs will struggle on some of the streets!

name: Hotel Jhonyky
description: $45k COP Double room.  Can park motorcycles inside the lobby. Friendly staff. Wi-fi.

name: Darian Gap Crossing
description:
Crossing by boat with motorbike (GS1200) from Capurgana to Carti (Panama) in one day on a fast boat.

This is not an office, just a general location where the captain can be found by asking around.

Captains name: Bolo.  Ph number +57 310 8947750 whattsapp, but no English.

Total cost was USD800.00 for the bike, panniers, bags, and two people. It took 8 hours total time, including loading, unloading, three fuel stops, and a long time in customs at Puerto Obaldia.

PM me on Instagram for more info: pedrosglobe

name: Seabord: Olympic Supermarket,  Pay Invoice
description: closest place to Seabord for payment the seabord invoice for handling in Columbia 50 usd in COP cash on seabord account at desk inside and behind supermarket cashiers .get confirmation and go back to seabord to get final Bill of Lading.

name: Home sentry, Mall Plaza "El castillo"
description:
The only place in Cartagena where we found Camping Gaz cartouches! It was not possible to find the Primus/MSR/etc. screwing type, but we're lucky with CampingGaz and an adapter (bought at home).
The Mall Plaza is a bigger Mall where you can find the Home Senty on the 2. level with some camping-/ car-/ kitchen-stuff and the Jumbo market on groundlevel with every kind of food. In front of the mall is a big parking space, so for us it's the place to go to shop when the car arrives by ship.

name: Villamargarita Motorhome Campsite
description: Family site for motorhome parking and camping in San Juan de Pasto Narilño. Contact: Whatsapp +573116995236 or +573135589067. Secure site. wifi connection, separate bathroom for travelers and shower. cabin. laundry. washer service.

name: Ford Mechanic
description:
Ford mechanic. Could not help us with our brake plankets. Ford Transit.
They don't had time and space to look at our brakes because they are so busy with their local cars. The computer said they are no brake plankets for our Ford Transit in Columbia.

name: Las Cabanas y Camping
description: Level camping area with electrical plug-ins, a couple of fire pits, and a view. Flush toilets and electric hot showers. $10k COP per person per night for camping.  They also have cabins for $40k per person.  They will prepare breakfast for you.  Super friendly family!  Briam helped set up a tent in strong rain and brought out chairs to put under a sun/rain shade he had.

name: Campground
description: Sorry, didn't get the name. Large campground next to a river with huge grassy area and a tent camping area as well. Big rigs can camp here but getting in may not be so easy as there is a section of the access road that is pretty dodgy due to erosion. Looks like it's being worked on, however. Charged us 10,000 COP for two people in a truck camper.

name: Small Parking bay
description:
Update: Street parking only! Police nearby.
Small parking bay for cars and RVs, will fit 3 or 4 cars.  It was recommended by a local guy that parks his car and trailer there sometimes.  It's a secure neighborhood close to restaurants and bars and not far away from the city center.

name: Electrofrio - The place to fix appliances in your RV
description: This is the place to fix your appliances in your RV/camper, they know a lot about fridges, air conditioners, electrical equipments and in case they don't know they won't hesitate to try to understand anyway.  I recommend them 100% This guys where able to fix our fridge after a lot of time of non functioning!!!

name: La Manuela Hacienda
description:
Reopened in december 2023. Tour with a very nice guide for 35.000. Its a new owner. I think he will let you stay for a night, there are toilets and small shop. New better road but part is still unpaved but 4x4 not needed. 
----
One of Pablo Escobar's former estates. There is a bar/restaurant allegedly run by Pablo's butler. We asked at the bar if we could camp they said yes. Charged us 15,000 COP each. Expensive considering that there are no facilities to speak of but I couldn't resist staying the night. Road in is quite narrow and in poor condition but only 4km. You can also get here by boat if you just want to have a look around. Buses come down the road so should be ok for big rigs as well, but I wouldn't want to drive it. 3G on Claro reached here.

name: Hotel
description: One of those hotels where you can park your car in a garage and enter the room (love hotel) in the back there another section where we parked our truck camper and got a basic room with good AC and clean sheets for 35,000. Walk to town for a cheep diner, good vibe. Good option if it's getting late driving from the coast to Bucaramanga.

name: Hostel La casa del Mono Cuco
description:
Hostel with single & max. 4 people rooms.

Habitaciones privadas y compartidas.

name: football field
description: free parking in a footboll fild. water to coke and have a shower from a natural sorce (with a top). nice and queit place.

name: Chocolate Santa Rosa
description: Great little chocolate/ coffee store on the road in between contratacion and Guadalupe. They have an organic farm where they grow their own cacao and coffee. They owner is very friendly and more than willing to show you their shop and the pods that his chocolate come from.

name: Mariamina
description: here you can get water in bags to give away up in Guarjira.  we bought a bag of 40 individual bags for 3500COP.

name: Minca Express
description: parking near the road in the center of Minca . Price 10000 day , 10000 night . Wifi from hotel in front . Nice river for swimming or cleaning...

name: Flamingo pond
description: We saw a flock of flamingoes come here to drink on way out and way back.  You'll see a small path that goes up the side of the levy. second time there were spoonbills as well.  Flamingoes are super skittish so approach slowly.

name: Southern entrance - Punta Gallinas
description: We took this way on our way back.  There are "tolls" but no one asked for money, just accepted what we gave them. see our post for Punta Gallinas lighthouse for more details.  This route made trip back about 10 km shorter.

name: Minca, corrupt police department
description: Police officers in office (2) and on motorbikes (2) focussed on foreign cars (overlanders) to charge them for nothing or completely crazy things. Office located before bridge on left side.  You will be stopped not in the village!  They pass by motorbike and stop you somewhere outside on the way down or up. (Before that happend I just turned at the end of pavement in the village. they caught me on the way down) No chance - challenging negotiation. They took 50.000 COP.

name: End of road to volcano Cerro Ruiz
description:
Highest point to go, phantastic view,  ask guard at end of road to stay over night, after little discussion it was ok for free. Last part of road is not possible to drive or walk - only for park rangers.  No facillities.
Park entrance: 1 truck + 1 person 46.000 COP. Trucks: Ask guards at gate to let you in, in first step they say no; after little  discussion (a friend was here last year  with an Unimog). Medium sized tourist buses without 4x4 are also allowed until last steep section.

name: Frenos Los Gemelos
description: specialist in breaks. good place to change your breaks

name: Barù Beach
description:
After an intensive search for a wild camp we discovered this place along the track towards the village of Barù. It is necessary to have a 4x4 as the trail is full of holes, mud. At 10 meters from the sea. Really nice but watch out for pebbles, rocks before bathing. It is a coral beach. Very good for one night!

Après une recherche invétéré d'un Camping ⛺️ wild. Nous découvrons ce lieu le long de la piste en direction du village de Barù. Il est nécessaire d'avoir un 4*4 le sentier est plein de trous, de boue. À 10 mètres de la mer 🌊 certes jolie mais attention ⚠️ aux cailloux, aux rochers avant de se baigner. C'est une plage de corail. Très bien pour une nuit 🌙 !

name: Next to the road
description:
We stood next to a wide road near the center.
It's not really leveled but only 5 minutes to the center by foot and not so lonely during the day

name: vista hermosa
description: Very good amphritiones, Jairo and Vicky. Will soon offer rooms. We stayed in the car and were allowed to use the bathroom and shower with hot water. It has a beautiful view of the lake and there is a pier.

name: Taller Diesel la Montana
description:
Good mechanics here, competents, good men. Correct price, no cheaper, but garanty ok.
Especialized in motor diesel.
Lots of place to park nearly, near the art modern museum.
Big center commercial very closer (Premium Plaza) and metro station too (Industriales)

name: La Deliciosa
description: We had a fantastic lunch here. Choice out of 3 set lunches but a lot better cuisine than your average almuerzo. Cheap, cosy and nice atmosphere, very friendly service. They also serve wraps and fresh juices. Busy so you might have to wait for a table but worth it. Rated top 5 on tripadvisor on town (next to expensive options). They have wifi.

name: Hostal Casa Arrayanes
description: Lovely hotel on the outskirts of Sogamoso. Comfy beds, hot showers, large seating area for relaxing. They have a kitchen you can use, also a patio and garden space. Breakfast included. Though the rooms themselves aren't huge, it felt very spacious and homely. We paid 45,000 for a double room. Space to park out front, although larger rigs might have trouble with the narrow roads.

name: Govindas Veggie Restaurant
description: Delicious vegetarian lunch for 9000 cop.

name: Hospedaje El Mirador de Pueblo Viejo
description: Nice hotel with great views and a large semi-secure parking area. The parking area is surrounded by a wall but it doesn't have a gate that's why I put "semi-secure". We are very anal about where we park our car and we were happy with this place. Clean rooms and bathrooms, all looked recently refurbished, a short walk into the town centre. We paid 120k for a triple room.

name: Reserva Entreaguas
description: Great wild camping spot on a little beach by the river where we had a very quiet night. I would avoid on weekends, looks like a bathing place for locals. There might be better spots furher up the road, at the actual reserve, but it was dark when we got here and the road is in bad shape so we stopped here.

name: CRDiesel
description:
JPMS the other mechanic on iOverlander took us here for our 2007 Dodge Ram 3500 5.9 cummins Diesel. They are the diesel experts in the area. www.crdieselcolombia.com
Calle 63C # 28 - 41. Extremely knowledgeable of all types of diesel vehicles and very professional.

name: Frenar
description: This place is owned by the brother-in-law of the place in Valledupar, Frenos y Servicios del Valle (Hector).  We were in  Valledupar and ordered parts from the US and had them sent here to install as we could still drive while waiting.  Here, Victor's staff received the parts, paid the duty and then we arrived, reimbursed them and they installed them.  Very friendly staff in both businesses.  This place also does electric welding.

name: Parque Aquatico Piscilago
description: Very fun and pretty waterslide park, perfect refresh in this hot part of Colombia. We paid around 35k Cop entrance pp

name: Hotel Boquilla Camping
description: Relatively quite neighborhood. Carcamping in the hotel parking. Locked on both end at night. Shae under palm trees. Hotel pool quite nice beach just a block away. Showers cold and not enclosed! Restaurant available. Hamock camping also possible. Wanted 50t COP, dropped to 40t COP after discussion. It is ok for 1 night but maybe not to spend holydays

name: Suzuki Motor de Colombia
description: Great workshop with superskilled , extremely helpful & fun people! The place where you want to get your bike checked & fixed if needed !

name: Suzuki Super store
description: Friendliest Suzuki store.  A great family owns it.  They sell some gear including helmets, waterproof luggage, boots, gloves, jackets and pants.  They have friendly and helpful mechanics as well.  They also know of places to have gear and clothing repaired, etc.

name: Motor Es (Yamaha motorcycle repair)
description: The owner worked for Yamaha for 19 years.  He has experience on all sorts of Yamaha motorcycles.  The shop also works on Suzuki motors.  Friendly staff.  They allow you to be in the shop with them.

name: Chill Out Hostel
description:
Owners Ivan and Erika are really incredible people ! They know a lot about the area and coffee production and just like to share it. Even if you're not sleeping here you can pop in to have a great chat and drink a good coffee.
They have a small restaurant and can offer double rooms with breakfast for 80.000pesos. They also offer personalized tours in the area to discover the world of coffee and much more.

name: DECATHLON!!
description: Big sports, camping and mountain hiking store.

name: Bogotana Direcciones hidráulicas
description: Very efficients, not too expensive, very friendly people. They changed our hydraulic bump. good place.

name: Hotel Albergue El Refugio
description:
Already entered as an informal campsite however now entering as a hotel for those who want more info about hotel stay (those on motorbikes rather than vans/rigs maybe).
We arrived after dark and a local led us to this place. There are other hostel type places but we were too tired to look around. We paid 80000 COP for a double room. The showers are hot and the room was big and quiet. There is also a TV. Breakfast is 7000COP pp. There is a parking space for motorbikes around the side out of view, so the bikes are nice and safe. They also have a large, clean pool, although quite cold. There are some shops nearby and a small restaurant. The hotel is about 100m up from the archeological park entrance. The park is 25000 cop pp to enter and once you pay you can spend as long as you like exploring (we took 2 days). The tombs and views are amazing and well worth it, but be prepared for some muddy paths and a lot of hills! Enjoy.

Our experience was just about opposite than those of the recent/previous entries. Big grassy camping spot that you share with a couple of horses and some hens/roosters that are not let out until later in the morning! So no crowing early in the morning. No partying or loud music. Pool was just beeing cleaned, so not usable while we were there. Use the nice toilets in the restaurant area, not the ones down by the pool. Stayed for 5 nights.

name: Trepando
description:
wonderful place for staying very close to Bogota. you can walk to la candelaria 50 min. John Patrick is a great host and will do everything to help you. he also offers climbing tours, trekking and there are zip lines on the property. road to get here is a bit rough but doable without 4x4. space for large rigs. 15 COP person. 

Update on roads March 2019: 4x4 definitely required

name: Suramerica Autos
description: Big Service Center. One of the few places in Bogotá, where you get the obligatory insurance SOAT for less than one year. For an german plated, 800ccm motorcycle, one month, we paid 41.650 COP

name: Quiet Street Parking near Discotheque
description: Manizales it's not an easy place to park since you should pay to park in most places and most streets are not leveled.  This place is a little retired from the centre but it's flat and has incredible views.  It's close to a disco so you may find some noise during the weekend but also some people because could be lonely on weekdays.  No facilities, free.

name: Finca Las Mercedes
description: An awesome place to stay and some nice back roads to get there as well (see google maps). Big rooms, big clean pool, plenty of secure parking although not sure if big rigs will fit in terms of width but no height restriction and huge parking area. I think they also allow camping. Quite cheap and not sure if booking.com had a funny 5 minutes but we got it for £2.50!!!! Normally £13ish I think. Very friendly manager and beautiful grounds.

name: Forros Montaya (motorbike seats/upholstery)
description: They can re-foam your motorcycle seat here or make a new one with different cover options, etc.  They also sell new helmets and seats among some other items.

name: KingOcean
description: Shipping agence Cartagena/ Port eveglade Florida n'est to Dian

name: Hotel Casa Quinta Marbella
description: Nice little hotel with secure parking for motorbikes, not sure about cars. Lovely swimming pool, shops etc near by and supermarket. Big rooms with bathroom about 72000cop (booked on booking.com). A good place to enjoy a shower and swim after Tatacoa. Breakfast included (eggs, bread, chocolate) and 'tinto' available all the time. Lovely people working there.

name: Terpel station
description: We were accompanied by the police to this great resort to spend the night 🌙. Secure, clean and quiet. It's free we have access to the toilets. There is no truck or noise during the night.

name: Jumbo
description:
Big grocery store in the mall, good price and gluten-free food!!  

Free parking with locals that show you a parking space and watch your car. Expect to pay a small tip.

name: Hotel Hacienda Santa Clara
description: Great stop on your way to the Termales. Felipe the manager welcomes Overlanders and speaks perfect English. Great food, free potable water. Free camp and parking. Excellent wifi

name: Power Shop - KTM and Bell
description: KTM shop with Bell helmets, neck braces, knee braces, clothing, IXS, Shark, security etc. Sebastien runs it and can speak some English.

name: Lubri Servicios Lava Express - Best car wash jn town!
description: Best car wash. Clean chassis and engine. Full inside and outside for 30,000. Very close to Freddy Toyota. Ask for Luis. Room with AC to wait while cleaning. My car is like new!

name: Sol Motos
description: Mechanic. Can do home / hotel visits. True wheels, parts etc for motorbikes but can also help with cars etc. Great service and good communication.

name: Miligas
description: Fill up our Argentinean gas. they trasvase from one columbian botlle to our botlle. 30k 20 libras.

name: Hotel Engatama
description:
Hotel a few blocks from the center.  Private room for 30k. Nice people running it, one woman speaks English. Actually has hot water. Free parking for motos and cars, in underground lot. Can fit civilian sized vehicles, but no big rigs or extra talls. 

PS, this town is a blessed relief from the nearby tourist land of Villa de whatever.

name: Hostal Villa Ines
description: We stayed at the campsite for 2 days. Upon arrival we ask for the price. 30000 Pesos. I asked the young gentleman if it was as much for the people as it was for the camper. He answered yes. When paying, someone else suddenly wanted 100,000 pesos. We ask why. There are still 20000 pesos per day for the camper. We defended ourselves and said there was false information on his part. She remained in her position, but in the end we paid 80,000 pesos.

name: Martillo Moto Turco
description:
Motorcycle parts guru Martillo probably has exactly what you need if you ride a Japanese motorcycle. Yamaha, Kawasaki, Honda, or Suzuki? He's got it. 

The building is his house. Look for two big white garage doors, or ask around for Martillo. 

He was able to supply literally anything I could ask for for 2007 KLR. Chain, sprockets, monoshocks, clutch assembly, full wiring harness, tires anything. When I asked for a clutch cable, instead of selling me one, he made a minor modification to the bike and set me up to use any bicycle cable for the rest of my life. Also was able to sell me a cheap solution for a pricey GoPro issue.

Great guys. They'll hook you up with a lovely little community of moto resources.

name: Two Wheels Motorcycle Shop
description: Lucho's garage for motorcycles.  Did great work on my Kawasaki 650 and was able to source or fabricate tons of parts that were tough to find elsewhere. They usually open around noon and work pretty late. Very friendly and dedicated.

name: Cascadas de Chicala
description:
These coordinates are for the parking lot from where the trail (500m) to the waterfalls starts. There are 6 waterfalls with natural pools for swimming and jumping from the rocks (deepest pool is 8m). Very pretty place to spend a few hours. 3000 cop entrance pp, plus 4000 cop for parking the car. Might be busy on weekends.
We stayed at a campground nearby, El Cocuy, for 12000 cop (car and 2 people). Nothing fancy but cheap and friendly and they have access to the river as well for a nice bath in the morning.

name: King Hostel Cartagena-Getsemany
description:
This hostel is just a tourist trap. Do not spend any night in there. We were woke up during the night by bed bugs. Please look at the video in the following link : https://youtu.be/AHLDoqJzUOU
Then, we claimed to the owner. This guy didn't care about the situation, and rejected his responsability on booking.com, and said that the bed bugs were from the inside of our backpacks, however, we were not the only persons infected, in the dorm. I do not recomand at all this hostel.

name: G&G impresores
description: Digital and lithographic printing, stationery, pop material, design SPECIAL PRICE FOR TRAVELERS sr, Alejandro González 3186509825

name: Pay parking lot
description: 24 hrs pay parking lot, fits any size of rig no height restriction. Two blocks from centre plaza. Paid 5000 cop for a night. There is flush toilet on site. Hot weather.

name: The Adventure shop
description: Shop sells Arai, Rev it, rok straps, SW Motech plus lots more.

name: Hotel Estadero Padua
description: Clean and simple hotel in the small town of Padua. 20,000 for a double room with bed, television, en suite, wifi and hot showers (but only in the morning before the water runs out!) Rooms on the higher floors are brighter, ground floor has windows but not to the outside. Restaurant next door does standard Colombian food.

name: Esso gas station
description:
Ask to the staff to have water from tap " aqua de pluma" .

Better chance of success if you also full up with fuel.

name: Parking much better then gaz stn
description: Park next to restaurant à bit noise but much better then a gaz stn. Lovely people will come to talk.

name: mobil gaz station
description: Water from tap. Frendly staff.  We hand an hard time to find water in Buca.

name: Hostal Casa Bella
description: Clean quiet hostal. Us 2 guys each had a queen room with ac/fan/tv/private baño. 35000 cop each (didn't haggle). Hammocks and nice courtyard to chill. Parked the van inside their lobby at night (nissan urvan size) for free. Desayuno 7000 cop.

name: Yellow Hotel
description: Roadside hotel with restaurant. Indoor garage, however entry is only 2m high so big rigs would struggle. However, there is a large street parking area outside the hotel too. Wifi and good views. Petrol station and restaurants next door, tiny shop across the street but not much else around.

name: Museo del oro ZENU
description:
nice little museum about the gold production and the Zenu indigenous people. all sign are both in English and Spanish. we recommend the video room about how to make gold jewelry.
entrance is free.

name: El Ganadero Hotel
description:
A bit more expensive than we hoped but very tired so stopped here. Double room, hot shower, lovely swimming pool, plenty of parking, wifi and breakfast included for 80000cop total. Restaurant on site with good food and small shop. 10000 pp for a basic lunch.
On busy road but rooms further back are quieter.

name: Hotel Chicamocha Real
description: Nice hotel with secure parking for bikes, cars and vans down the slope and at back of hotel. We could park our bikes under cover. Hotel very clean, big rooms, ensuite, hot showers, fan and wifi, 60000 per night (2 people double room). Opposite is a supermarket and several cafes etc close by. Friendly owners.

name: San Andres - Free
description: Good place to spend a a quiet night. no one came here past. Flat grassy place.

name: Biomax gaz station
description: The tap is behind the santa-maria statue!!! Enjoy it ;-)

name: Roadside pullout
description: Nice little pullout along the road overlooking part of the valley and river below. I think it's slightly bigger and maybe more level than the spot closer to Onzaga. We didn't sleep here, just stopped for lunch, but would be a decent place to stop for the night in a pinch if you run out of light.

name: Salinas Natural
description: Very nice natural hotsprings with sauna, mud and a waterfall to cool down. Almost no tourists because its 4km way up from the main street. Nice experience 10'000 cop entrencefee

name: Hotel Sawin
description: Small hotel in the centre of Pasto. We paid 20.000COP for a matrimonial with shared bathroom. There is a parqueadora  next door.

name: Hostal El Almanecer De Las Estrellas
description: This is not a hostel, it's a campsite. We paid COP 6000 pppn. Very basic and not much shade for camping. Best spot is behind the house: more shade and close to the bathroom. Close to the road but not too noisy. It's also a restaurant and they sell cold drinks.

name: Chez Gloria
description:
In Toche there is one hotel but the price for what you get is not worth it. It's 20000 for a bed in a dorm, definitely they were gringoing us.
Instead we stayed with Gloria, a tienda oposite the hotel (purple and pink house), where we got a matrimonial with shared bathroom for 25.000cop. No parking but street parking for a car seems safe enough. I parked my bike at the neighbours house.
The village is small but nice to see. Especially in the evening, when everybody is out, we enjoyed being here.

 This is currently the only hotel in Toche, and is the only option if you want a hotel along the road from Salento to Ibagué. They have 3 dorms with numerous bunk beds in threes, rooms are very basic although the beds are sturdy. Dorms are interconnecting so people can (and do) move between them to get to the bathrooms. Towels and thick blankets provided. Cold showers and two toilets, bring your own loo roll. There aren't any restaurants in the town, and although the owner has a big kitchen and cooks for residents, she refused to cook for us, saying she had used up all her food already and could only offer us the burnt rice at the bottom of the pan. Luckily we had food with us, and asked if we could use the kitchen to cook. She agreed but only if we didn't use any of her things, even the gas or firewood - we had to use our own stove on top of hers! One of our party was ill and she forgot twice after we asked for a hot drink for her. She asked for 25,000 per person, which we contested based on the very basic service and how unhelpful she had been! eventually paid 20,000. She offered breakfast for 8,000 each but there is a little cafe to the right of the square that did the same for 4,000.

name: Trailhead to Paramo de Oceta Trail
description:
Incredibly beautiful Place. Breathtaking views. Flat place on grass. The way up is very steep and high ground clearance is recommended. 4x4 when wet. The place is by the start of the trail Paramo de Oceta.
The trail itself, according to local sources, appears to be closed.

name: MotoShop
description:
Great motorcycle shop working on KTMs and others. They would also allow you to work on your own bike in their shop.
Federico Henao (057)3116305801
Motoshopmedellin@yahoo.com

name: Hostel Patio Bonito
description:
We paid 75.000 for a matrimonial with shared bathroom and a fan via booking.com. There's space for one car and maybe a couple of bikes. There's a serious height restriction as there is barb wire hanging over the gate.
The room was ok for the price, especially in this area. All clean but no good vibe, very small kitchen and communal areas need some TLC. We didn't enjoy our stay but a overall a good choice if you're on a budget and really want to be in the area.
BTW: there's always police hanging around here. friends of the family or something...

name: Cafeteria Alcala
description: Really cool cantina also selling Brandy Con Leche. These small town shops are cool and the owner very friendly. Opposite hospedaje Turista

name: Free wifi on village square
description: ok fast wifi and it's free. nice little cafe's and a small supermarket.

name: Hotel Real
description: small hotel in the middle of the city. we payed 30000 for 2 people in one room for the night. also we payed 5000 for parking our 2 motorcycles in the reception. room for one big or 2 Small bikes. secure and guarded all night. ok room but not super clean. very nice people.

name: SD Hotel at Biomax fuel station
description: Hotel. Basic but nice and super clean. Hot showers, loads of parking, ensuite, bar, wifi, easy to find. Shops around (small one opposite). They will order you food if needed if too shattered to go out. 60000cop for a double for 2 on booking.com. 80000cop normally I think.

name: Nice pullout
description: This is a pretty nice gravel pullout with a great view. We used it as an emergency stop because we were exhausted from our Laguna Grande hike but it actually turned out to be pretty nice. The road is super quiet and we've only seen two motos and one truck since last night. It's a little uneven but there are plenty of rocks to level out with.

name: Hospedaje Juntas
description: Simple camping option on the road from Tierradentro to Popayan. The owner is a guide to explore the area. Behind the house is a large gravel place for campers. There are wild bears in the area and a very interesting flora. 6000 COP for 2 people

name: Horseback Riding with "Enrique"
description: We did a two-day horseback riding tour with lovely Enrique. His horses are very well trained and full of energy, it's fun! And Enrique offers the tours cheaper than "Pacho" (Lonely Planet). Cell: +573135898550, he speaks only spanish

name: Lifebreak Finca Hostel and Camping
description:
Take a break from the road and the cities. This is a different kind of hostel. Its quiet and relaxing during the week but fiesta in weekend with both guests and locals.
You are just over 2 miles from the paved road on an old farm in a small farming community. The owners are at the moment working hard to make a fully functional hostel. 
For now they have 2 rooms and there is space for tent camping and there is room for a couple of vans. But I would not try to drive the narrow road in a really big truck. Sprinter size vans will be fine.
The road is gravel. Bikes can easily get there but be careful in a car (we would recommend 4x4), because there is a few bigger rocks. But the locals drive there in all kinds of cars.


Our room and bathroom was very clean. The bed was amazing. From the room balcony we could see Peñón de Guatape and the many green hills.
In the night you see the lights from the other farms and fireflies everywhere.
It is a quick drive to shopping in El Peñón and to Guatape. 
As a guest you can use the kitchen and BBQ. 
Really good wifi. The place is owned by two people from Austria. We had a great time and felt very welcome. 
Price for the room for 3 people with private bathroom is 40.000$
Camping/parking in a van/camper is 10.000$ pr person including an amazing view.
Later there will be dorm rooms also.

name: Hotel Juan Jota
description:
We paid 25000cop for a matrimonial with private bathroom. It really lookes like a fancy hotel and the inside really lookes like it as well. The room itself is small and basic but very clean. Wifi is there but doesn't really work, ok for mail but nothing more. Parking is in front but secure as the hotel is open 24/7 , bikes go inside...
The hotel is close close to the road but the noise in the room wasn't too bad. 
My other half told me to mention that there is no toilet seat but the toilet itself is shaped like a toilet seat so it's not that bad...just a bit cold at Kitty's touchy.
Maybe you can camp on the parking lot but I didn't ask. There's a restaurant next door, 8000cop for a plate.

name: Productos Industriales
description:
This shop have a lots of fittings and pipes for LPG. 

... (or not)...

name: Down by the river
description: A small dirt road leads down to the river where there used to be a bridge. We were afraid it would be a weekend party spot for locals but it ended up being really nice and we didn't see anyone. It's mostly hidden from the road and the road noise is somewhat drowned out by the sound of the river. Not a bad spot to spend the night.

name: Hotel Gran Central
description: Very friendly staff. Hotel with wifi, hot showers, large double room for 2 with ensuite 34000cop. Close to panaderia/shops etc. Lovely town. Parking is secure in garages area and will fit motorcycles, 4x4's and campers but unlikely to fit big rigs.

name: Hospedaje Turistica.
description: Nice small hostel with good wifi buy only parking for small motorcycles not really bmw ktm size. It is a great place to stay for a few days to get a feeling for small town Colombia. The waterfall is walking distance.

name: Parque Natural Chicaque
description: Perfect for when you are in need of nature and fresh air. Nature park with trails through cloud forest to viewpoints, a cave, a small waterfall etc. There is a refugio with restaurant and multiple camp sites (tent only). Open from 8am to 4:30pm, 15000 cop pp

name: Parque Natural Chicaque
description:
ADMIN NOTE: No overnight camping in vehicles. Tent camping only!!

No camping allowed on the parking of the park (only tent camping in the park). Gate closes at 5pm so we camped just outside the gate. It is at the end of a dead end road so quiet and safe.
Restuarant and toilets are available in the park 8am - 5pm

name: Hotel with no name
description:
Motel style place with safe parking in garage to each room. We paid 40000$ for one night (2 people,2bikes)
Not super clean but they sell cold beer.
You can also get dinner but don't know the price.
Very nice people.
Huge parking lot if you have a large truck.

name: Cafe La Casada
description:
Small Cafe about one hour into the hike (3km) and about 30 minutes further up the trail than Bosque de palmas. Located just before the trail gets hard.
Really good coffee, 1000 pesos per cup.

name: Casa de los colibris
description:
Colibris are wild and come to the house due to the trees (if in blossom), water and feeding stations. Definitely prefer this over birds in cages :)

Not exactly what we were expecting. mostly just a place to eat your lunch. entrance is 15000$ and include a hot drink.
There is hummingbirds but mostly at the plastic hummingbird feeder.
But it is a nice hike with lots of cool hanging Indiana Jones style bridges.

name: Truchas cocora
description:
Restaurant and hostal. It is a trout farm with small restaurant. Also you can buy fish to take home and cook. 16000$ pr kg (4 small fish of 250g).
If you want to see the farming of the fish there is a fee. 
The place is a few minutes down the trail towards Casa de la colibris.

name: Terpèl station
description: Parking of terpel station next to an hotel with wifi access (ask to the mini superMarket in the gas station). Secure place to sleep but à bit noisy.

name: Near Raquira
description: The view is fantastic. We spent a quiet night here. The place is like to be out in a little desert. To reach the spot from north you need high clearance and if it’s raining also 4x4.

name: Salazar at the river
description: We had to drive a long time until we could find this place just at the river. It was the only possibility on that road. Calm spot and we could swim in the river. There is space for 2 little cars. In the morning we left early because people arrived and would charge sand on a truck. The were friendly and wait until we had packed up our stuff.

name: The lake hotel and Camping B&B
description: Beautiful and cosy place with amazing views over peñol lake you can actually park your car safely inside the property by the lake, warm shower , amazing host, dog friendly, exquisite food, sepecialky recommed pizza and fish.  The host martha can provide paid boat rides around the lake with amazing views from the lake.

name: Auto Clutch
description: Suspension repair. Very nice and welcoming team Very good work. Possibility to sleep in the garage.

name: leña sazon
description: Parking of the restaurant. The owner is adorable. free. Wifi available with a conso

name: AUTOINYECCION GM
description:
Teníamos un problema mecánico  Andres y Ninfa nos ayudaron para todo. Pudimos quedarnos en el taller de mecánica general  para esperar las piezas de nuestro camper (un Citroën jumper ) que vienen de Bogotá. Es un equipo joven y muy agradable. realmente un buen encuentro.
hay baños, electricidad y agua .

We had a problem with the camper (Citroën jumper) Andres and Ninfa, the boss of the garage help us for anything. It's possible to sleep in the garage for wait the mecanicles pieces who came from Bogotá. 
they are young and very friendly. It's a good meet. they took the time to find any solutions. possibility to water, electricity and restroom.

name: Waterfall
description: Beautiful waterfall! It is a bit of walk down a long staircase. Park at the square pf the town and walk pass and behind the cemetery.

name: JD Bikers
description:
Dairo, a really good guy, has a workshop and he knows especially Suzuki very well since he worked for them before. He did a perfect job on my DR and I saw him disassemble another's DR engine. While he adjusted my valves and steering head I changed the brakepads. After he also let me use the workshop to get other things done. Around the corner are two Suzuki places to get parts if needed. Speaking spanish is of advantage though. 

www.jdbikers.com

name: Steel Horse Finca
description:
****IMPORTANT NOTES*****
1) Do NOT follow google maps to get to us. someone moved our pin. please use ioverlander, maps.me or our website for coordinates 
2) The road to our property has been paved/tarmac/asphalted (hurrah!!!) except the first 100meters 

Steel Horse Finca overlander hostel. Keep on going you are nearly there! The farm is 1km further on down this track from where this pin is!

Feb 2023: 26K pp

name: estacion piscicola el paraiso
description: nice parking at the river. very nice family they have a restaurant and cabanas. possibility to fish and they cook great truchas for 12'000 COP. shower and toiletes available. We paid 5000 per vehicle per night. i can highly recomend this place!!!! there is space for two vehicles at the parking place..verry leveled and there is more space directly at the river...not that leveled...but stillnä nice

name: El rincon del cabrito
description: restaurante, camping, snackshop and rooms. camping is 10000 pr person. did not stay here but it looks super nice with lots of shade.

name: Raquira Silvestre
description: Great place for camping with enough space for trucks or small RVs or tents. Lake for swiming, close to waterfall. Very quiet. Clean.

name: Balneario La Palma
description: They have a nice pool and seating areas. Entrance fee is 4000 Pesos per people. We asked if we could stay for overnight and the owner agreed. There is an outdoor shower and clean toilets. The owners are super friendly.

name: Defences & Bikes
description: Fernando makes racks, brackets, bags and protective parts for any motorcycle.

name: El Portal de Altamira
description: Clean friendly hotel on the edge of Altamira with spacious rooms. Wifi, cold showers, very small shop selling crisps and drinks but not far from the town. Nice seating area outside, lots of space for parking including a large back yard area that would fit big rigs. We paid 30,000 for a double room, friendly owner offered us two big mugs of tinto during our stay.  Great for a stopover between San Agustín and the desert!

name: Tomate
description:
Incredible vegetarian restaurant run by German owner. Friendly, cheap, huge portions and by far the best vegetarian food we've had in 2 months on Colombia! 
Worth a trip, open Thursday to Monday 8-3.
You need to stop in the morning or call by 10 or 11 to save yourself a spot/meal. Folks getting there at noon were told food had been already reserved.

name: Mi Cabana Campestre
description:
Great place to stop. Cabañas and camping, lots of room for many campers any size. Uneven but lots of blocks around to level out. Bathrooms & cold showers. Pool. Electricity at site, water & wifi.

The cabañas are tidy and comfortable. Big beds and private bathroom for 30.000/pp.

Delicious breakfast served (tamal and chocolate) for an extra 7.000.

Petfriendly :)

Very friendly staff!

name: Vehicle intrusion
description:
On a Sunday afternoon, we attempted to get into our vehicle parked on the street when we were at lunch (for about 1 hour), even though the street parking was paying and secured. The man in charged of the security had only 50m of parking to watch, but "he did not see anything" !! He lied to the police and we are certain he was an accomplice with the thugs.
The police told us that happened often during the weekend in Salento.

name: nahe des Nationalparks Chicamocha
description: Nice flat place with view of the park, some traffic noise, somewhat rough short entry track

name: San Alejo
description: Level place beside the road beautiful view of the mountains in the middle of the Frailejones

name: Finca Alejandria (bird watching)
description: Great establishment to do bird watching. Paid 15000 cop per person and you can spend the day here. Not sure if camping is allowed, but there's a big parking lot and toilets. Very beautiful place. There are hundreds and hundreds of hummingbirds flying around the water pots the owner installed all around the property. There are also many other bird species, mainly tanagers (including the "angry birds" red specimen, red-headed barbet). According to the owner Raul, it's good to visit the place when it's raining/rainy, because more birds come to the pots to search for easier food. They also serve desayuno, lunch and other foods. 4km of good dirt road.

name: carlos place
description: Carlos offers different horseriding tours from half a day to multiday tours. He can speak really good English and we enjoyed the tour.price for a one day full day jungle tour is 185.000. half a day will be 150.000.he knows the jungle and treats the horses everytime gentle.

name: Hostal Arianity (ex Hostal Samay)
description:
Beautiful peaceful hostel. Gardens full of herbs and vegetables, fully stocked kitchen with dining space, hammocks, fish ponds and a short walk down to the river.  There is even a man-made pool towards the river with water that flows into it from the stream.

Big bright comfortable dorms with double beds, Private rooms or camping space on a veranda surrounded by pools. Very spacious, clean and friendly. Space for a rig out front, but inside the locked gate. Fast wifi and cold showers.

name: la cascada restaurante
description: a leveled parkingplace next to a restaurant and sportfishing place. nice owner..very friendly stuff. we paid 20'000 the night for the van and they let us use the shower and toilets, fishing is also included. gate closes at night...very secure!! next to the road but not noisy at all...just a lot of sound from the frogs arround the fishlake.

name: Hotel Arizona
description: Hostel with 10 rooms. Opened in 2017. Nice clean rooms. Located 10min from city center. 39k per night.

name: Hotel Casa Real
description: Simple comfortable hotel. Rooms for 20,000 or slightly bigger ones for 25,000 (we found the smaller double big enough for us). Fancy ceiling fans, private bathroom, tv. Hotel itself is quite open but shaded inside so stayed cool at night. Few restaurants in walking distance.

name: Hotel Casa Real
description: Friendly hotel on quieter road in La Hormiga, away from the noisy market streets. Large rooms with private bathroom, fan, wifi, TV. They have a gated parking area and ground floor rooms as well as ones upstairs. Relatively basic but owners very friendly and pleased to help us, and the inside is bright and airy. Restaurant next door does standard Colombia options, didn't see that many more restaurants around nearby but I'm sure they exist! We paid 25,000 for double room.

name: Hotel Alcaravan
description: 52,000 COP or 18 USD per night for couple. Private bathroom. Private parking lot: 2.40 m. Average Wi-Fi. Hot shower. 10 minutes walking from Ayurá metro station.

name: Hospedaje Villa Maria
description: A double room for the two of us was 50,000COP. Cheapest hotel we have seen around. Secure gated parking for any size vehicle. Lots of road noise at night as it’s right next to the highway, so just a stopover spot. Lookout for a blue formal ‘Hotel’ sign 100m beforehand (driving north), as could be slightly tricky getting off this busy highway. Clean room with fan, private bathroom.

name: Autocentro Ltda. Neiva
description: Very good and competent mechanics in the autocentro. We had to overhaul the starter of our Land Rover Defender Td5.

name: Mangle Colora'o
description: We asked if we could camp here and they said it was COP 8000 pp with a tent and a motorcycle. They also have rooms, as it was hot we decided to take a private room: matrimonial with private bathroom and aircon for COP 50.000. It's also a restaurant with nice food but a bit pricey. The friendly lady made us a free tasty lemon juice on arrival. Height restriction about 2m. It's a nice place to hangout and stay. Unfortunately they have roosters.

name: Raul's Horseriding Tours
description:
Raul is a Colombian guide who offers awesome custom tailored horse riding tours. He can take you through the mountains around town or on a trail to visit the museums and swimming holes.

The horses are small (all Colombian horses are) but they're well looked after and he has trained them to respond to his whistle-commands so no experience is necessary. A couple of members of our group had only ridden once before and he had them safely trotting and cantering through the back roads. Experienced riders can also have custom rides planned with more spirited paso fino horses. If you're an experienced rider and like a horse with a lot of 'brio' ask for Margarita - she's an amazing little horse but not for beginners. 

He doesn't have a store front but can bring the horses to you - phone +57 310 7575327 or whatsapp Raul to make a booking. Note: he is not at this place, but he can meet you here.

Costs: 50,000 pp for 2 - 2.5 hours and well worth it!

name: Hospedaje
description: Hospedaje in the small town of Rio Loro, just of the road 45. Simple but clean rooms with bathroom (cold shower) and TV. The owner lives on the first floor of the building. Not much in town, but there are some small shops and on the corner of the main road is a little restaurant. We paid 20k for a double. Place has a small garage for bikes, motorbikes and small cars.

name: Gutapé Lakeside
description: Nice remote place at the end of the road. Directly at the lake. Space for one car. Pure nature. A bit of a bumpy short dirt road.

name: Hotel Campestre Aguas Vivas
description:
A verry nice hotel 2 km away from the main road. they let us park for 15'000 ppn. amazing view with a nice pool...we were totally alone and the owner is really nice. shower and toilets next to the pool.
Update 2023: 50k for 2 people no electricity, 70k with electricity, plus 20k to use the pool

name: Arcabuco
description: A good Place for one Night on the Way to Tunja. On the end from the Town between Gasstation and Hotel. We had ask in the Hotel. They said us. It's no Problem for one Night. It is a big Parking Lot, also for Big Rigs.

name: Tankstelle an der ruta del sol
description:
Accommodation at the gas station with surveillance
--
Übernachtungsplatz an der Tankstelle mit Überwachung

name: Ferme familiale Chez Marcelo et Lorena
description: It's a family farm with the possibility camp , cook , wash the clothes and take a shower..

name: Hotel Sion Real
description: NB. Only for cyclists. Simple budget hotel in the middle of the centre. We paid 35k for a big room, where we could store our bikes. Incl. bathroom, TV, good wifi and fans. Neiva is not the most exciting town.

name: Pullout next to building ruin
description: Level spot with plenty of room to get off the road. We ate lunch here, but would be possible to sleep here also.

name: Hato Chips
description: It is a Restaurant and Shop with Cheese and Joghurts,with a big Parking Lot. We ask if we can stay overnight. No Problem, in the Night patrols the Police. It is a good Place on the Highway 45a on the Way to Bogota. The Restrooms are clean, and open the Night.

name: Hotel LA Cartagena
description: Clean, cheap hotel close to port. 35.000 pesos for a single room with quite AC and wifi-bathroom. They don't have parking but the hotel next door let me park my motorcycle to their secure parking.

name: Hotel Monteverde
description: Basic hotel with a good price! Paid a basic room with AC for 30.000 COP. And they allowed us to put our bikes inside the room! Has wifi and a restaurant beside the hotel.

name: Coliseo lot in Pitalito
description: A large grassy lot between indoor stadium and horse stables - public land. To get in you have to come from the back. Fairly level and quiet, though there is a bar and open air stage. So this place might be noisy on weekends!!! Lots of street lights, too many for our liking...

name: Hotel Diocelina
description: Paid $25.000 COP for a basic room with fan, tv and private bathroom. Got the room in the next building.. wifi couldn't reach to my room, unfortunately.. but the connection is pretty fast in the main building.. and the shower has low pressure. I had to glue to the wall to get the water 😅

name: Taller Mecánico
description: Nice people! We had a problem with our VW and they solved it y a few hours. They repair all kind of vehicles.

name: Vidagas
description: If you are willing to wait and can catch a cylinder delivery truck before they go in the yard. They can take your cylinders in and have them filled. The yard will not sell propane or cylinders to the public directly.   Worked fine for us. 1 hour process. At end of this street.

name: Movil Play
description: A place that can fix iPhone's as well as lots of other stuff. Sorted 2 iPhone cameras for us. Good technician and good value. Also sell drones, speakers etc

name: Photocopy and Laminating plus Internet
description: A great little shop to do photocopying (A4 largest) in colour or black/white. Laminating, computer access, Internet etc. Chap really helpful.

name: hospital, nueva clinica de riohacha
description:
nueva clínica de riohacha
good hospital for tourists ( European standard). you have to pay in advance 200.000.-COP but the treatment was only 40.000.-COP. the rest of the money you get back. the local hospital on the other side of the street seems to be for free. it is very simple... with our children we preferred the private place.

name: Taller Walter Bedoya
description: If you are around Cali in a VW visit this place and ask for Emilio Jimenez at 3116274053. Honest and friendly mechanics whiling to help.

name: Hotel & Restaurant La Gorda
description: Nice and cheap place to stay. Paid for 28.000 COP for economic room. It has TV, private bathroom & warm water. The owner let us put our bikes in the room.

name: al lado del rio
description:
Very good place next to the river to spend the day, very quiet and nice river to bathe.
--
Muy buen lugar al lado del río para pasar el día, muy tranquilo y lindo el río para bañarse.

name: Hotel Dona Tere
description: This place is the cheapest and best accommodation we've found anywhere! It's in the beautiful town of Guayacamas which is full of murals and friendly people. Rooms are 13,000 pp - we thought we had mis-heard but no, that's the price. Rooms are simple and clean with a bathroom as well. We asked to use the kitchen and the lovely owner let us. Parking is on the street, but it's a tiny, safe town and we had no worries parking there. Maybe motos could park inside the courtyard. Best value we've found in all South America

name: Gas Neiva
description: Propane Gas. We paid more or less 30 COP.

name: Desert view
description: Nice flat place on the way from Baraya to constellation valley with great views

name: Hotel La Leticia
description: Nice and cheap hotel for a night. Paid for 30.000 COP for a double bed with private bathroom and TV. Hot shower and wifi available.

name: Salento-Toche
description: This backroad is absolutely great. From here to Toche you will see a lot of wax palms. This is a nice overnight spot in the forest around 100 meters beside the road. Nobody will see you there from the road.

name: Monumento Cristo Rey parking, Belancazar
description:
Parking area just behind and below the monument. Not secure, but out of sight of the road. One entrance has a closed fence, the other is sided by a house. Nobody asked me for parking fees when I entered.  Not quite level.
No facilities, but toilets are at the restaurant at foot of the monument.
The first photo is of the parking area, the second looks up from the area.

After driving 13000 km this road (to and from this carpark), an alternative for road 25, tops my favourite roads. Even though agriculture has changed the original landscape. A windy second gear road all the way up, along the ridge and back down again. Along the ridge great views of the valleys both sides with different shades of green from the pasture fields, coffee and banana trees, other fruit trees broken by colourfull flowers. You can tell that the land owners are doing well by the well maintained good looking houses. Most of which are nicely set in the landscape. To me the road is worth 5 stars. A well paved narrow two lane road.

name: Paloquemao Market
description:
A wonderful local daily market. 
Exotic Fresh fruit, veg, flowers, meat and seafood stalls are great but you are here for the cooked food stalls. 
Soups and tamales, all of the Colombian fried snacks, sweets and juices. 
You must search out the lechona towards the back of the market... just trust us!

name: Pastelería Florida
description: Must get the Dulce de leche. The one with caramel was brilliant.

name: Camping de Nico
description: Nice place on the river. Lots of space. Good swimming and fishing. Friendly owner. Paid 30.000 for 2 persons in a van.

name: Wild camping by river
description: Great place to camp by the river, track is a little bumpy getting here but so worth it. Peaceful, plenty of fire wood around, totally safe!

name: Hostal Girasoles
description:
We parked on their small grassy lot in front of the gate. Paid 10 000 COP per day per car (2 people). Toilet and shower and wifi included. Great view from the terrace in the back. Dog friendly, space for 3-4 vans.
They also dorms and rooms. A small double room with breakfast is 60 000 COP.

name: Parking Lot Salt Cathedral
description: Have to pay for two days Parking Fee. (5000 Peso per Day) for us no Problem. Good for Big Rig. Oiletts avaiable.

name: Nice swimming!
description: Very nice swimming place at the end of the road at kilometro once. The water looks a bit brown, but it is cool and smells fresh. We also camped here one night, on the grassy spot before the last bit of the road turns to the right. No facilities, friendly locals.

name: Gas Pais
description:
Daniel is a mobile propane distributor in Ibague who filled our 11kg propane bottle. This is just a dummy location for the city. You need to call/whatsapp him and he will pick up the bottle and return with the full one (It took him 1-2h). Our bottle has the US connector (i think in the US they call it POL).
For 20lbs he quoted 28 000 COP.
His numbers are:
+573118471673 (whatsapp)
+573167050175
+573112281836
+573507820110

name: Hotel Villalobos
description: The cheapest room in town! Paid 50.000 COP for a room with two beds, tv and private bathroom. The owner is very friendly.

name: In front of a tower signal
description: We start the dirt Road late, so starts to be dark and we decided stop in front of this Tower just next to the road. Has a big flat area, possible for 3 or 4 vehicles. It has a old house on the side of the tower, but not sure if someone is living there. It was ok for pass the night.

name: Hotel La Gaitana
description: A hotel near the main town areas but in a quieter street on the edge of it all so quiet at night. Parking for motorcycles and maybe a car or two. 45000 for a double with shared bathroom, 65000 for double with private bathroom. Hot showers, sitting area with big TV, wifi, laundry for 7000. Lovely owners. No large vehicles will fit.

name: Carulla Food and Delicates Market
description:
Verry good Store with everything you need!
Next to the Terpel Gasstation!
Good for Big Rig to Park.

name: Attempted Robbery and Full Robbery
description:
Just a little heads up for overlanders heading out this way. A few kilometres before we got to the turn off to cabo 2 guys on a motorbike were driving along side us with a gun held up to us. We sped off and tried to get another car to pull over for us but as soon as they did they pulled the gun on them too. At that point both cars turned around and headed back out toward the town. The guys followed for a long time but couldn't keep up with us. I don't want to scare anyone away from this area but maybe it's best to do in convoy. I haven't heard about this happening to anyone else so maybe it was just a once off. The police also said if you're going to drive out this way try to do it early in the morning.

Now the got a Car with Germans, French, Brazilians. See Post below... Convoy highly recommended. Don t stop! Run them over!!

name: Parquedaro la pirámide
description:
secured 24 hour parking lot with a mechanic (did very well some repairs on our van) and carwash
Carlos the nightguard and Julio the owner are very helpful and friendly pepole
quiet at night until 7 in the morning
they offer us a bathroom with shower and runningwater toilett
no problem to overnight in the car
10000 COP per day
dogfriendly

name: Parador Rojo
description: A nice rest stop with food, bathrooms, showers and a place to park for the night. Nothing fancy, but quiet and a descent spot between Cali and the coffee region.

name: mr clean
description:
laundry
they wash and dry . I brought the clothes on Tuesday and picked it up on Thursday​
y

name: Premiere de-lux coffeehouse stop
description: The fastest non wifi in South America! And good coffee

name: Shanti
description: One of the best restaurants we've been to in Colombia. It's a cliche to talk about food made with love, but this is really what you get here. The salads take a while to prepare, but they are super fresh and tasty and a balm for chicharron and Arequipe fuelled bellies. All the ingredients are top quality and you seriously can't get food this healthy and tasty anywhere else. Options with meat and seafood available. 18k - 25k

name: Bella Lago Hotel
description: Stunning hotel run by a biker overlooking Lake Calima. Secure Moto and rig parking. Alan and the staff are extremely friendly and will guide you to the best riding, kite surfing and hiking all around the area. A must stop place for all overlanders.
