I'll Defo be back on my next visit to Colombia. The views from the hotel is simply divine.

name: Hotel Julio Ceaser
description: Basic hotel with cold shower. No food. We ended up staying here as we didn't want to ride at night. No food available. A little shop is present that sells crisps and cold drinks. We paid 22k pesos for a twin room for 2 people. The truckers use this as a sex hotel. We parked the bikes behind the hotel. Not secure though.

name: Headlights polish mechanic
description: Julio Cesar (the mechanic) polished my headlights (were yellowish and scratched) and made them look like new. Price 100.000 COP for both (80.000-90.000 if they can be removed easily). Only took 3 hours to finish. Now I have much increased visibility at nights. Highly recommended!!

name: Old Road
description: Close to the old bridge. No one came here and past so we had a quiet night. OK for one night

name: Finca y café La Victoria
description: Coffee tour (45 min) 15k cop per person with coffee tasting before and after the tour. If you don't make the tour, the coffee costs 2k cop. Very delicious. There's also a bistro with cakes and pies, including coffee flavoured ones (a bit expensive). There is a parking place before getting here. It says "parqueo aqui" in a white sign (free)

name: Calima Windsurf Club
description: Right next to Calima Campground but with a nicer pool and more private car camping. Plus Calima Campground played music all day and this place didn't. 30,000 per vehicle or tent per night. Car camping is in a nice secluded spot (note, secluded aside from weekends when it becomes the car park for visitors!) on the water, tent camping is in cookie cutter plots on the hill. Nice pool and deck side area. Lake is WINDY (duh, this is a kite surf hot spot!!) but actually the wind drops at night and it's lovely :) no bitey bugs either. Wifi in clubhouse, but with our booster it made it to camp spot. Cold showers, bathrooms (moderately clean) and drinking water. Nice spot for a few days

name: Rock climbing Area
description:
There is a Rock climbing Area for Sport climbing in vulcanic rocks 
Good place 
Parking on a parkinglot near street 
If you dont find ask the people

name: parquadero near Villa holandes
description:
Parkinglot close to the street 
Safe place and next to the climbing area 
We payed 5000 cop

name: el rancho texana
description: this is a great parkingplace. big leveled grassarea. we stayed the night for free just had to pay 5000 pp. for using the pool. the owner is very friendly and helpful. he rents also cabanas with 3 beds inside for 200'000 kitchen and pooluse included.

name: Restaurante 1919 Barbacoa
description: Its a nice restaurant. The almuerzos are an average side road price. They let us park in their yard (very levelled) for COP$ 10.000 pp (2022). We could use the pool, showers and toilets for a small fee. Very nice place with a chillout area and tv too. A lot of levelled green space. Very friendly and helpful owner and stuff.

name: el nomad
description: this is a nice little hostel with a grasy parking field. very nice owner and climbingguides. they charged us 15'000 pp p. night. to get there you have to go to the cafe el nomad at the mainstreet and then they will show you the way.

name: mas util tienda
description: parkingplace on the mainroad. opposit of the d1 tienda. very leveled area. very nice owner. super friendly. he has coffe and fresh bred in the morning. also panela con queso. he sells a lot of things in the tienda. its really cheep. we paid 4000 for the night. nice place to rest.

name: restaurant hotel los alpes
description: big flat area to park next to the mainroad a bit noisy at night but ok. we paid 10000 to park and could use the toilets aswell. friendly lady.

name: Buenaventura car parking
description: Closed covered parking for 15k a day. Perfect if you leave to Juanjacko for few days. 24h guard.

name: Entry/exit of Valle de Constellationes
description: This route isn't on open source mapping (yet - Sept '17. 22' update: only the first km available), but it's far nicer than the well-driven Tatacoa route just to the south. This is the access route to the Valle de Constellationes camp site,  but all along here are some amazing wild camp spots. there are a couple of gates to open, but at each one there is a tourist information sign.  You can continue down this track to do a loop onto the main Tatacoa road. Go past the two lodge/campsites to the T-junction at the end, turn right, and it comes out at the eastern end of the Tatacoa desert. We saw one local sedan-car doing this route, but ideally you'd want high clearance. It’s a bit rough in parts, but very beautiful. Well worth the effort for amazing wild camping.

name: Embajada de la coca
description: Indigenouse Café where you can get Coca Tea, buy dried Coca leaves, Maka, Quinoa and other traditional and not so traditional indigenous products.

name: Car fixing part of town
description: there are all sorts of car & bike repair shops and places around here. We found a very helpful place to fix/recharge our aircon  (handy heading into the Tatacoa) at 17:00 on a Friday when they were about to shut up shop.

name: Valle Constellationes Wildcamp Area
description: This was our favourite spot along the route, but there are lots of other good places. Watch for the very sharp cacti if you go into the grass. Some of them are hidden in the grass - dangerous for feet and a bit bad for tyres too.

name: Dian-Aduana dep. Fiscalizacion
description:
If you leave your car in Colombia and fly back home, then this is the place you need to visit after you arrive back. We had 90 permit as we entered trough port of Cartegena. Unfortunately this was not enough and as we needed to go back home we parked our car near here to the safe parking lot. As we arrived back the exit date on TIP where 1,5 months overdue. You come here. Its puerta G5. There is nice security lady who will take your fingerprint and tell that you want to visit Dian dep. Fiscalizacion on 3'rd floor. They will let you in. After you arrive to 3'rd floor turn left. Go trough class doors and turn right. After another class door there is a security desk. Hand then your driving license or some other type of document and tell them that you need a extension for your TIP. You will be given green visitors pass and security will escort youbto the right person. Ask for la jefe Yolanda. Shes the very nice and helpful boss lady. Explain why you have overstayed your TIP. Better have a good reason. Family emergency is good enough. They will need to see the car to make a confiscation paper. This is part of the process. You need to write on plane paper your explanation why you have overstayed. All communication and writings have to be done in Spanish. Nobody speaks English here :) After they look at your vehicle and fill all the needed documents they will issue you a fine. Fine is payable at 1 floor bank. Only in cash. The fine is calculated by month. So if you come back 29 days after the date on your final day whats written on your TIP then the fine is prox 640thousand pesos. If you come here 31 days after then its double from that. Dress nice say crazias a lot and you will be done in one day. Come 8:30
Oh, and you will only get 5 days to leave the country. Ecuadorian border is 1000km away. You can enter Colombia again 10 minutes after you have left the country. Another 90 days :)

name: Hotel El Morichal
description: Nice Little Hotel,  located in Puerto Boyaca. Very affordable price. Close the a big parking lot.

name: Servimotos Suzuki
description: Great mechanic, worked on both our DR650’s. Would recommend.

name: Motoreste Toyota
description:
We were having unexplained problems with our Toyota 4Runner and needed proper diagnostic work done. Like any dealership it was expensive but really professional and very thorough. They charge more per hour (180,000!) for 'extranjero' cars that aren't common in Colombia. 

We had the diagnostic work done and some radiator hoses changed then took our car to Osvarca to get the other repairs done cheaper.... like half the price.

Would recommend if you need extensive computer diagnostics otherwise very pricy. The service was really good and it's a super fancy mechanic.

name: Hotel Nubes Verdes - Ipiales
description: Good option near the border. Clean, TV, internet and really hot shower. Secure parking. We think big rigs can parking in front of the hotel. Col 60k or Col 70k with breakfast

name: Parqueadero and Hotel Ruanos
description:
We stay one night in the parking. Good option before to visit the Laguna Verde and Volcán Azufral. Secure but during the night with
eventually noise of trucks. Col 5.000 car/night.
There is a hotel option but we don't how.
WiFi of hotel (pass hotel2016)

name: Olga's Place
description:
A very cute apartment in a middle class local neighbourhood in Floridablanca. We spent a week here while our car was being fixed and loved it! Everything is very cheap and convenient nearby.

The place is owned by Olga and her husband who are lovely hosts who live downstairs, and they did everything to make our stay awesome, including inviting us to lunch and letting us use their washing machine. 

The apartment has everything you need including a nice terrace to have your coffee, a kitchen with an oven, study, spacious bedroom and lounge area. 

Walking distance to the big shopping mall areas. No parking on site, but Olga can arrange secure parking with a friend for cars and motos (height limit 2.4m) for a small fee. Big rigs would need to park on the street or use a larger parking place nearby.

Best value and a warm welcome! 50,000 Cop - whatsapp Olga on: +57 317 2131876 to book!

name: Finca Carpediem
description: Nice Finca owned by a belgium couple. Here they make their own cafe, serve good food and offer a relaxed stay. They also have two Swimmingpools with very nice views. Close by is a cacao farm and some natural Pools. You could also do some hikes. Take a mototaxi or Jeep to come here and leave your car in the small town 'Bonda'. There is a 24h parking one block before the policestation. We stayed two nights and had a wonderfull stay. Recommended!

name: 24h Parking Bonda
description: 24h Parking lot to leave your car/van going to Finca Carpediem. 10k per day.

name: Hospedaje El Rocio
description: Paid 25,000 COP for a basic room with private bathroom. It’s has warm shower and wifi also. The owner is nice. The room is just next to the main road. So, it’s quite noisy.

name: Terpel Station
description: We stopped here midday for gas and asked about help with our emergency brake.  They were able to help with that and a few other small things but did not finish till dark so we asked about spending the night.  It was safe.  This is a truck stop as well.  Station closed around. 11:00 and it's quiet until about six.  There is a restaurant on site and a small hotel as well.  There are bathrooms with no seats and limited TP in restaurant. They did not charge us for camping.

name: Hotel Maria Bonita
description: Nice clean hotel on the carretera Panamericana. We paid 70000 for a double room. Very helpful owner. He ordered Pizza for us. Safe loked parking just across the road, also for bigger cars. Big Supermaket nearby. There are rooms to back from the road. so also quite quiet.  The Hotel is renovated. They made breakfast for us.

name: Hotel La Pintada
description: Nice and clean room. The room has AC, TV & private bathroom. At first the price was 50,000 COP and the owner decreased to 40,000 COP. She’s allowed us to put our bikes in the room also. I think it’s worth it than stay for 30,000 COP p/p in a camp site nearby

name: Pedregal
description: Beautiful small drive through town with beautiful murals. It is worth drinking a coffee and eat their local fritters and walk the town to see see the murals

name: Tecniautoscharravo
description: We had a engine light issue. Miguel was professional and very helpful.  He has a code reader.  Cell # 318-349-3035.  Seems to offer  a wide variety of services.  Business card in photo below.  Shop has good wifi.  Bay height is not high but they did the work out on the street!

name: Casa San Juan
description:
Cool hostel with only private rooms - 6 rooms in total all with private bathrooms. Some rooms don't have windows but all have icy cold air conditioning. Small kitchen on site and the hostel is in a really cool district close to all the sights.

Parking: secure parking lot around the corner - we left our car out of town though so we didn't see it. Contact Dharma if you need info on it.

Prices: 80,000 per private room.

Contact Dharma: +573166198759 on whatsapp. She speaks English

name: Reserva Rio Blanco
description: This spot is where you meet your guide (or stay in their lodgings) to see the beautiful reserve.  You must book ahead but you pay after the tour.  Email: cerestrepo@aguasdemanizales.com.co.  tel: (6)-887-97700 ext 72185.  we saw many hummingbirds and antipita, a quetzal and more.  Entrance fee 20kpp, Spanish tour half day is 30k for group.  once you reach main gate, buzz to be let in then drive to this spot.

name: Casa Mebi
description:
Very good place to stay in Mompos.
Dorms 25000 COP with A/C
Private rooms with bathroom 30000 COP pp with A/C and TV.
Parking (near hotel) 4000 COP /24h
Can use the kitcheen and living room.
Good Wifi.
The host is very nice and helpfull.
He knows the city very well and has made us know many places.
House is situated 5 mn walk to historic center. 
We spent 10 days and appreciated the quite rythm of the neighborhood.
We recommend.

name: El Playon
description: A clean room next to Terpel gas station. A bit away from the main road and it’s quite. Paid 30,000 COP for a room with double bed, AC, TV and private bathroom... Too bad this place doesn’t have wifi.

name: Hotel Botija
description: The hotel is underneath Llanerito Restaurant. 35,000 COP for small room and 45,000 COP for slightly bigger room with same facilities. Each rooms have TV, private bathroom and AC. Wifi is so slow, barely work...

name: Hotel San Fernando
description: Paid 35,000 COP for a room with private bathroom. A basic room near the center of the town. The most calm rooms in town. Too bad there is no hot shower in here... The shower was freakin cold!

name: Megapartes - Bus / Sprinter Mechanic
description:
Fixed our brakes here. They have a lot of experience with buses. Mercedes!!

The guy who fixed our bus was Chuza. Give him a call 3043447504

name: Hospedaje Union
description:
Hotel / Hostel right infront of the yellow church. Sign is small and hard to see behind some bushes.
Good internet, a kitchen, free water, tv, 20,000 for one person private room!
 I don't know a double price.
 They let me park my motorbike inside the whole time.
 No place to park a car though.
 The family here is all very friendly.

name: San Augustin
description: Large grassy area on the side of the road. It's quiet.  Perfect for sleeping peacefully around San Augustín.

name: Restaurante Maderos de Malvazá
description: Good option of restaurant between Popayán and Tierradentro Archeological Park for a breakfast or dinner. Clean, good atmosphere. We eat cafe with cheese and "arepas", COP 3.000. Very good.

name: cinco tierras
description:
very nice and quiet hotel. they make a fantastic wood oven pizza and they brew their own beer. it is the best I had in Colombia, proper craft beer. it's only opened the weekend. if you call they open the hotel also during the week. the rooms have Turkish sauna. we camped on the parking. nice and quiet.
3107621408/ 3108106133

name: Hotel Kandelabro
description:
Got here late on a Saturday night. Owner was nice.

Cost: 25k per person
Facilities: Secure parking for vehicles and bikes, wifi, warm showers, good beds, towels etc.

Within walking distance of restaurants and food.

name: Hotel / Guesthouse
description:
Started on the gravel a little late and ended up riding about 50km at night. Talked to a few locals who were happy to share there house but didnt want to impose so they directed us to this town:

Puerto Romero, its kind of a guesthouse, no signs, just asked around the town (across from the basketball courts). Room had two separate beds, shower, toilet, cold a/c, towels and they let us park our motorcycles inside the lobby. 

Cost: 30,000 total (15k per person)

Well worth it it you find yourself stuck here at night

name: Hotel Gold Plaza
description:
Nice clean hotel w/ underground secure parking for bikes and cars (clearance for high trucks might be an issue)

Hot showers, good wifi and the staff were really nice.

Paid 80,000 total for three people. The room with a double bed and a single w/ private bathroom

name: Finca Sta. Elena
description: On the way to Cerro Kennedy you arrive at the place on a track in about 90 minutes up from the street. Carlos and his parents are the owners of the Finca. They are really friendly people and organize the trip from Santa Marta with their Jeep. Carlos has his tourism company: wimaketours.

name: Parapente con Carlos
description:
Go paragliding over the beautiful lake Calima. We really enjoyed it! Price was around 150000 for a tandem flight. Contact Carlos, he is a very very nice guy!
phone 3168712905
mail carlosfelipeconcha@gmail.com

name: Terpel gas station Montecristo
description: Big gas station on the Ruta del Sol. Laid out like some of the Copec stations in Chile. Very clean bathrooms and showers (2000 pesos) and small restaurant. A couple of sinks outside and place to refil water. Open 24 hours with security at night. Free. Noisy trucks.

name: Exostos JB
description: An exhaust shop that helped us with a problem removing and replacing an O2 sensor.  Worked quick and Didi what fve other shops could not.  (wnne had the replacement O2 sensor, already.). Cell: 311 583 9626.

name: Street Parking
description: We spent one night in this very quiet place, next to a square with a multi-sports court.

name: Waterfalls
description:
About 8 kms or 35 minutes from the main route. A nice waterfall. 
4000 per person to get to the falls and camp. This place has bathrooms and beer.
 There is a little town up the road that you could buy food.

name: El Oasis Hotel
description:
Basic yet good hotel.
 Small store and restaurant.
 said uaually 25,000. they charged me 20,000.

name: Parque Explora - Science Museum
description:
Nicely done, lots of hands-on experiments, interesting for kids and adults, great place to pass a rainy afternoon.
24'500pp, less for students/elderly

name: Hostel RuizSeñor
description: Great hostel with covered patio for bikes or motors. Small rooms but friendly staff. Very affordable

name: GIT Exportaciones DIAN
description:
In this building the process of Import and export of your vehicle is carried out, it brings the temporary importation papers
---
En este edificio se realiza el proceso de Importación y exportación de tu vehículo, trae los papeles de importación temporal

name: Parking lot across from La Estacion
description: We parked here to go to mall. Charge 2000 per hour.  Then we decided to stay the night and he charged us 20,000 for the entire 18 hours.  There is a soccer field and a paintball place here too. There are restaurants (including a McDonald's with wifi) in the mall and a movie theatre. The Olimpca is in the mall and has a good variety of stuff.

name: Hotel Sol de Oro
description:
Clean hotel, friendly staff.
50'000 for a double with private bathroom and fan, 60'000 with AC. No plastic bedsheets! :) cold shower only, but it's hot down here...
Secure parking available, small roof for motorbikes.
Lots of small restaurants close by, for dinner and breakfast

name: Hostal Monte Quimbaya
description: Hostel 2 km outside of Villamaria. Clean and quiet.

name: Hotel Reina Isabella
description:
Good hotel for overlanders.

Rooms and nice and quaint with good wifi and warm showers. They have a large parking area around the corner from the hotel (has access from within the hotel).

Cost was 50,000COP for 2 people in a room with a private bathroom + parking.

Parking would probably fit big rigs too as its open air but locked and gated with cameras.

It doesnt appear online or on maps.me but look for Hotel Las Vegas and its about 100m after that on the main strip.

name: Hotel Praba
description: Hotel right on the beach a few down from Finca Escondida. Stay in Cabanas. Wifi at the restaurant and pool. I paid 80,000 with simple breakfast -  1 person for a private cabana with 2 beds. Clean and good vibes. Quiet. Ample parking for motos and big rigs at the back.

name: River Camp
description:
ADMIN NOTE: WARNING!!! Muggings, Thefts and vandalism reported in this location. Please use caution. 


Nice Wildcamp hidden from the highway. Directly at the river.

name: Rancho Relaxo
description: Lovely calm and quiet Hostel near the Coast. Parking for motorcycles and a good place to work on the bike. Super helpful staff and Owners as well. 35k for a dorm room incl breakfast. you can also get dinner or Lunch for 15k. they have their own little waterfall with a Pool at the bottom. about 20min walk to the Beach.

name: Viaggio
description:
Nice new Hotel for Staying and waiting for Port Stuff to do. We rent a Room. Parked the Truck for one Night at the secure Parking. 10km to Porto Bahia to bring Truck back Home.
Did all our cleaning Job etc. At the Camping, but stayed here the Nigjt before we took the Truck to the Ferry back Home. We stayed here for doing all the Paperwork, for two other Nights.

name: Amazona Real Hotel
description: Nice clean hotel with secure parking with CCTV. No camping allowed. A perfect option for one night if you are coming or going to Cano Crystales

name: SanNikolas Hotel (Ticket & Tours to CC)
description: This place exept a hotel(no parking though)has also an agency for the tour in Cano Crystales. Individual travel is not permitted so you need to join a group. As most people get here on all inclusive package tours there are not a lot of options for getting permits here. Adriana the owner can help you organize it all.

name: Volcano thermal bath
description: Hot pool, real warm, opened by a local. Admission 20000 COP adults, 10000 COP children.   Drinks, water, shower available.

name: Casa Manati Hostel
description: Nice private owned hostel, very friendly and helpfull, very clean, having dorms and separate rooms. WiFi, kitchen available, showers with cold and hot water, washing machine and dryer. Free garage to put your car overnight if you ask for (but limited in height). Tel +575039452, adress Calle 40a #81a - 52. Email manati.hostel@gmail.com.

name: Turn to Valley of Constellations
description: THIS is where you turn left to go to Valley of Constellations (8km from here).  There is a sign here and a second one at 4km where you turn left again. Road is dirt and may be a challenge in wet conditions.

name: Playa Alta
description: We were send here by locals. This place welcomes overlanders and has all the basic facilities. Wifi is good and there is plenty of space for all type of rigs

name: Estación de Servicio Terpel
description:
Good Gas Station with big parking, security 24h, clean wc. Beside there is option of hotel and restaurant (both were closed). We paid COP 5.000 / car/night. There is shower (COP 3000 pp).
Quiet, perfect for one night.
Edit: now 7.000 p/car/night

name: Casa de Eventos Dary
description: AKA Villa de Isabel. This is outside Florencia on the east side of the highway at km 3.  You will pass a soccer field coming from town and you'll find the entry gate.  No height restriction​ but careful turning in.   Luz and Gentil Mendoza are open to overlanders but prefer we come only during the week as they get pretty busy on weekends and need the space for car parking. They have a big pool on the left and a smaller one for kids out back with fun equipment.  There are semi private showers by the pool and bathrooms as well as bathrooms by the camping which is on the right side of the main building on the grass - could be quite soft after a rain.  There is internet which works best by the pool.  We were able to get power with an extension cord.   Toilets have seats and there's TP.  Cellphone reception is spotty.  We took a cab to the Gran Plaza mall for 5000COP where there are banks and an Exito.  There are no places to eat nearby.  Luz was unsure what to charge so we paid 15,000 pp with power but our friends paid 10,000 pp without.

name: Park by city watch and security building
description: Great little park we were allowed to camp at. It is known by locals as a place to camp. There is ample room for tents and a bathroom wth running water. There are cameras monitoring the park at the police station, and a city watch group that operates out of this place. They want you to feel SAFE, and comfortable. A great free night.also a great view of the mountains!

name: Hotel La Fontana
description:
Nice place to spend the night by the side of the road. Very clean and new hotel. Paid 45k cop for the night on double bed with air co. Private clean bathrooms. Cold shower (very welcome), air co. Cool swimming pool available. Restaurant.
No wifi but had Claro coverage.
Huge watched parking lot with cameras and security. We stayed on the first floor and left our car in front of our room.

name: Hotel El Lago
description: Trucker hotel next to the Terkel petrol station, roadside restaurant, wifi, cop 26000 for a single room with aircon and tv.

name: Hotel Capri
description: Wandered around town to find a good hotel for the night. Paid 30,000 cop for a single room with attached private bathroom. Medium wifi. Safe parking for motorcycles or small 4x4's underground 10 feet from rooms. Hot shower. Super clean.

name: Hotel 3 Banderas
description:
Perfect small affordable Hotel in the old Town. From here you can explore the historic old town.
Good Wifi, nice rooms. Incl. Breakfast
Price/ Room for two is 230'000 Cop.
Of corse, this is a place to be, without a Camper/ Truck or similar.

name: Las Brisas
description:
Parking lot with clean bathrooms with shower on hill across from cafe. Close to the path to Las Gachas. 

Run by lovely family. 30.000 for two people in a van. Great way to be the first on the river in the morning.

name: Estadero rio Nembi
description: beautiful place at the river Nembi.  You can swimm in the clear and clean watter. Doña Gladys and Nancy are friendly. Clean WC and shower .  Perfect place for bird watching. The park place is perfect

name: El Personaje
description:
40,000 pesos colombianos por una habitación y 10,000 por poner la hamaca una noche, la segunda me costo 15,000 poner la hamaca,  pero tenia un café gratis en el desayuno, hay un loco en la playa que pasa vendiendo pizzas a 5,000

Yo puede poner mi moto al lado de la hamaca

La playa preciosa

name: Military checkpoint outside San Vicente del Caguan
description: You have to register here with the military before heading to La Macarena/Caño Critales. Name, Passport # and nationality

name: Hotel Casa Blanca
description: This one of many hotels in this town. The price for a double for two people was quoted at $70,000 COP, and $75,000 COP w/breakfast. We were able to negotiate for $50,000 COP. We were led here by a moto, whom I tipped $5,000 COP. There is no secure parking on site; however there is a secure private 24 hour parking very close (which I also added to iOverlander) with no height restrictions (we're in a low top Sprinter) and the parking fee was included with the price of the room. The room is basic but nice. Fast wifi, air conditioner, tv, private bathroom. Many food options nearby.

name: Teleferico PN Chicamocha
description: This is the middle point of the cable car across the canyon (can't get on/off here but it drops to the canyon floor here). Costs 50,000$ for the return trip. It's a cool ride but no better view than you get from the canyon edge and just driving around this beautiful area. The park on the east side  (main road) is a good stop for kids.  If you are going to Medellin, take the amazing metro-cable between the city and Parque Arvi for just 5,000$ - equally stunning ride a tenth of the price.

name: La Macarena/Cano Cristales
description:
Enroute to La Macarena/Cano Cristales?  Here you decide which road to take.  If you go straight, it's the road that comes up easy on most OSM maps and on maps.me - it goes through El Jardin (@ 2.172272, -74.274522).  We drove this eastbound. It was 138 km from the Terpel station outside San Vicente to La Macarena.

If you go right here, it's the truck/bus route which is harder to find on maps.  We drove this westbound.  It's about 162 km from La Macarena to the aforementioned Terpel.

Both are dirt/gravel mix, both are tricky when wet and, for both, high clearance is needed.

The more challenging is the first route: 4x4 a definite advantage, and a must if wet (it rains here almost year round -  notice how green it is?) so you're bound to hit bad sections and there are steeper grades.  There are at least two dozen small, narrow bridges, (these bridges do not have railings or overheads though), two of which we had to "rebuild" before crossing.  There are two tolls of 7000 and 10,000 COP each.  Keep your receipts for the return trip.

The trucker route is wider in more sections, has no wooden bridges, you pass through larger villages than other route and there are more gravel-less mud sections but still lots of potential for slipping in the rain with soft "shoulders" especially in the second half. --As of Aug 2023 there are 3 tolls of 5K, 10K, and 10K on this route. --

Here are the waypoints for the truck route from this point heading east to assist in taking this route as we had to force our maps to go this way and were assisted by locals enroute to plan it:
- 2.091888, -74.433853
- 2.062654, -74.366702 (town of La Sombra near here)
- 2.061719, -74.248158
- 1.972012, -74.145249 (El Recreo airport nearby which comes up on maps.me but we saw no actual road to it.....)
- 2.077541, -73.974543
- 2.148418, -73.87913
From here you'll hit a right turn up ahead and that road will take you right to La Macarena.  You could now put in coordinates for your destination in town.

Have fun!  We did; we were two rigs and each had to winch out the other on the challenging road at different points! We are 85" wide so JUST made the narrow bridges. There are a few you could go around through the creek as water was not too deep when we were going.

name: Uzaque
description: Recreation area with camping in the grassy parking lot next to the basketball court. Large, very nice swimming pool (separate cost for using the pool), small tienda, restaurant, cold showers, flush toilets. We were told the water is potable but what came out of the outside spigot was brown and silty. 12,000 pesos per person. The parking is close to the highway but there was very little traffic and we didn't here any loud truck brakes. We ate dinner at the restaurant and it was pretty good, prices between 15,000-19,000 for meat (good portion), small salad, and two starches. Tipico breakfast is 7,000.

name: Tecni Mecanica Automotriz
description: There is a small sign high on the office, the address is posted as Transv 29 (Av. Circunvalar) #16-19, look for the large blue garage door. The owner is Henry Patarroyo (tel. 7622212). We were directed here by the owner of a Freightliner/Iveco dealer. This is a busy shop that handles many different vehicles including Ford and Chevy. We had some minor suspension fixes, drive shaft leak repair, and front locking hub adjustment. They moved a few cars around to get us over a pit so they could thoroughly diagnose and inspect our mechanical problems. Spanish only, but very patient and professional.

name: TecnoAires Cali
description:
Automotive Air Conditioning installation & repair

Jhon Jairo Rivera and his team did a great job fixing my Toyota Hilux AC.  I did not know if the compressor, clutch, or a bearing was bad... they tested and found it just needed a new bearing and belt.  Very affordable and honest! I highly recommend them if you have a air conditioning issue.  Thanks Jhon!

Aire Acondicionado para vehículos 

Jhon Jairo Rivera y su equipo hicieron un gran trabajo arreglando mi Toyota Hilux AC. No sabía si el compresor, embrague, o un cojinete era malo ... probaron y encontraron que sólo necesitaba un nuevo cojinete y cinturón. Muy asequible y honesto! Lo recomiendo encarecidamente si tienes un problema de aire acondicionado. Gracias Jhon!

name: R/T Design Car Audio
description:
Richard Andredeans his team installed a rear view camera and an alarm system for my Toyota Hilux.  great price, great job and the work was completed in half the time he quoted me.  Also, he was careful with the dashboard and all parts when performing the work. I  highly recommend him if you need a radio, speakers, alarm, camera, air conditioning, window tint, or accessories.
--
John James

Richard Andredeans su equipo instaló una cámara de visión trasera y un sistema de alarma para mi Toyota Hilux. gran precio, gran trabajo y el trabajo se completó en la mitad del tiempo que me citó. Además, fue cuidadoso con el salpicadero y todas las partes al realizar el trabajo. Lo recomiendo altamente si usted necesita una radio, altavoces, alarma, cámara, aire acondicionado, tinte de la ventana, o accesorios.

name: Cañitania del puerto de Turbo
description: Here I was given the number of one who knows Nelson, representative of some ships. His phone (310) 823-7328

name: La Bahia de Turbo
description: 20,000 pesos a night, clean, fan, shared bathrooms, there is wifi, the attendant helps you to look for parking.

name: Play Tejo (organised by Hostal Macondo)
description: Tejo is really great fun and this is a good opportunity to do it with some tuition. Macondo Hostal organises the game at the local Tejo centre every Tuesday evening). Need to book in advance  (we just popped in to the hostal reception on Tues afternoon to put our names on the list). If you stay at the hostel it's free, otherwise they charge 10,000$. They arrange taxis to the venue and tuition in English. Beers are ridiculously cheap at the venue, but eat before you go as there is no food there. It's great fun and highly recommended. Starts around 20:00 hrs finishes around 22:30ish.

name: Fossils and Local History Museum
description: An excellent and very large collection of huge fossils, a mummified body and lots of local history. Really interesting stuff BUT it's a guided tour museum, only in Spanish. The lady speaks slowly and clearly about the displays, but obviously you need more than a basic tourist command of the language to understand the explanations. 3000$ entry.

name: 24 hour Parquedero
description: Secure parking, no height limit. Can probably handle vehicles up to 25 feet or so. We are in a 19 foot long sprinter. We stayed at nearby Hotel Casa Blanca and the parking fee was included with our stay.

name: Korea House
description: Awesome reasonably priced Korean restaurant. Really tasty Kimchee pancakes, bibimbap and more! They also give a free starter which is a nice touch. Prices between 10,000 - 22,000.

name: Private Parking Estadero El Tambo
description: Flat stony big area, but steep access down. Very quiet and away from the traffic. Front wheel driven heavy vehicles may have problems to climb up again. Have your own look first. 30k COP per night, 2 persons 1 MAN truck. Ask first at the restaurant  Estadero El Tambo, the owner of the place. Police told us, that the 2 official parking lots of the Parque Arwi are closed for the moment. Ask for time schedule for the return with the "teleferico". To us it looked like the last ride up was quit early in the afternoon....Alternatively in the evening there is the  "trenvia", leaving from metro station San Antonio to the final station. From there 2 blocks up the hill, take the bus to Santa Elena. Ask the bus driver where to switch to the second bus that goes to El Tambo, where you parked your vehicle. Unfortunately we do not know when the last bus leaves to El Tambo.

name: Savbora umo y cositas ricas
description: Senor Francisco Murillo build here a new ecoligice Camp. Here  you can stay over night. You can fishing and the owner cooks for you and he makes fresh fruit juice. He has only natural banos. When you come from the north, is it on the left side, befor the new bridge.

name: Büetaré Gourmet Restaurant
description: Nice restaurant. They offer all from western to local food as well as vegetarian. Kind of gourmet style :)

name: Street parking next to park
description: Super close to the old walled city. Police recommended to park here. Some cars go by on a Saturday night, but good to aleep and super safe to leave the car during day and night.

name: Awesome viewpoint - very worth the drive on a clear day
description:
You can drive up to this point without a permit to enter the park; just explain at the checkpoint that you don't want to go up to the glaciers. Spectacular views from here down both sides of the valley and up to the glaciers. Lots of frailejones around. 
The track is drivable well beyond this point, but we didn't follow it up to see where it goes. We understood that it's not allowed to go beyond the corner view-point without a permit and park insurance ( from the park office in either Cocuy or Guican).

name: Los Hermanos Moto Taller
description: Great little motorcycle shop. Had us fixed up in no time. 3 brothers run it.

name: automotriz rvc
description: don't go. friendly but tryed to rip off and finally did. the job was more or less ok but far to expensive. go to Technomotriz very close.

name: Metalicauca
description: This is the shop of Jose Tamayo, a welder.  He refabricated our Jerry can holder on the back of our rig.  Did good work.  Cell # 311 309 8637 or 315 500 6705.  When coming down Calle 73 off the PanAm, it's shortly before the road turns to dirt, on the right.

name: Hotel del Campo
description:
In the middle of the coffee area, on the top of a mountain, surrounded by the most outstanding coffee landscape, is Hotel del Campo. A place where you can find nature and enjoy the best facilities. we offer beautiful rooms that are considered as crafts, restaurant bar, three swimming pools-jacuzzi, football and voleyball courts, camping area and RV (big enough to take your home with you). And you also have the best birds’ sighting and tours of the coffee area.

En mitad de la zona cafetera, en la cima de una montaña, rodeado del más exuberante paisaje cafetero, se encuentra Hotel del Campo. Un lugar donde te podrás encontrar con la naturaleza y disfrutar de las mejores comodidades. Para estos propósitos te ofrecemos unas hermosas habitaciones que han sido consideradas una artesanía como tal, restaurante bar, tres piscinas, jacuzzi, canchas de fútbol, Voleibol, ping pong, camping y carros casa. Además tienes el mejor avistamiento de aves y tours experienciales de la zona cafetera.

name: Gasan Girón - Chimitá
description:
We found this place and awesome helpful people to fill our US LP tank. This is the phone number for Elkin, who's in charge of the trucks +57 320 3123060
You need to call him and he'll coordinate the encounter.
They told us on Fridays they are ALWAYS in San Gil.
For further info you can contact us in 1000codigospostales@gmail.com
PS: We paid COP3394.- for a kilo. 10-25-2017

name: cabanas las palmas
description: A hotel on the edge of town with secure gated parking. we paid 150,000 (cash, prices for cc were higher) which wasn't cheap but the parking was excellent and the room was huge (3 beds, fridge and decent wifi). breakfast for four people was and additional 25,000 total.

name: Gas station
description: A good place for one night. Parking free. Shower 5000 cop. Quiet until 6 am.

name: La Macarena Caño Cristalès
description: Caño cristalès near La Macarena, a very nice place to visit. We have gone there with the agency cano-cristales.com for 3 days and 2 nights. We paid 1328000 cop pp with CB (all including plane hostel restaurant and guide) + 130000 cop pp for the taxes. Second possibility : go to Villavicencio and let your motorhome in a parking. Take plane to go to La Macarena and go to hostel (we stay at La Cascada hostel) and choice an agency . There is one near the hostel or contact (057)-(8) 664 8400 o oriana@ecotourismomacarena.com

name: Meridian Navigation
description:
We are a Shipping company in Colombia with experience in Tourist cars shipping from/to Colombia to overseas.
We can assist you with customs paperworks, terminals forms, insurance, Antinarcotics and all related to importation and exportation of tourists Motorhomes.

name: Anaira Hostel
description: Very nice Hostel in Leticia. You can park the car in front of the hostel on the street. Private 65'000 COP, Dorm 23-27'000 COP. The staff is very helpful for everything you need. Aaand there is a pool in the litle garden and hamacs to relax :)

name: Military Checkpoint
description:
Military checkpoint. Wrote down Passport number and license plate. Let me pass without problems after checking car contents very superficially. 

Nice guys! Say hi from the German guy in the Chilean camioneta

name: Hotel Mio
description:
Nice hotel!

25.000 pP without AC
45.000 pP with AC

Private secure parking

name: Playa Caño Dulce
description: We stay here 3 nights on the beach near Cabañas and the sea (10 mts ). Very good to swimm and secure. Quiet. Wifi gratis (sometimes good sometimes no more !). 10000 cop for the night (2 persons and mothorome)

name: Lavanderia
description:
Open monday - saturday
7000 cop for 12 pieces

name: Hôtel Anaïma
description: Good hotel on the road for Ibagué. Just behind the church and the town center. New hotel. Room very clean and big, beds comfortables with Hot shower, télévision and wifi. Twin bed 70000cop, double bed 60000cop. Cafeteria in the hotel. Its possible to park just in front of the hotel in the street (someone all the night and cameras watching outside) or private parking 5000 COP for the night on the next street.

name: Pull-off next to restaurant
description:
Free but very noisy spot to spend the night. I had dinner at the restaurant so I could use the bathroom and wifi from there. Nice view. Restaurant owner said it's safe. 
WARNING: Only for people with magical sleeping superpowers: Between the dogs, loud truck and motorcycle traffic, trucks and locals stopping and playing music it often is hard to carry a conversation. Only the best sleepers can sleep through that. Supposed to quiet down between midnight till 3am only. Not sure, I was asleep.

name: Balneario a la Maravilla Restaurant & Camping
description:
Big swimming pool with waterfalls on side of rushing creek, with bathrooms, restaurant, grilling, music blasting during day. Popular with locals. 20,000 COP/person/night. The flat sunny (solar) spot are way in the back and a bit more quiet and might be hard to reach for very large rigs (>3m tall). Looked like a great place unless you look for peace and quiet. Didn't stay though as I was passing by early morning. 

Turns out heading south towards San Gil there are several more swimming pools along the same creek, some more might offer camping.

name: Restaurant on side of highway
description: There are a few restaurants along the highway. Happened to pick this one as it has a flat spot and was a bit away from the urban areas. Asked and they were ok with me staying and confirmed safe. Still noisy highway, but I'm a good sleeper. Bathroom but no wifi from restaurant.

name: Parking at gas station
description: big flat lot behind gas station. Asked that it's ok to sleep overnight. bathroom and sinks open at night. The usual noise from highway at night. No wifi and intermittent cell data coverage.

name: Trailhead to Mirador Hike
description: This is the actual trailhead to the Mirador hike. Might be able to stay overnight here too. Hike is 35 min to 1h up, 20 - 45 min down, just 1/2 mile each way. Nice statue and views.

name: Trailhead to radio tower
description:
Nice hike, a little longer than the one to the Mirador. Flattens out to a ranch area at a saddle. There was a fence across which might not always be there. At that point I followed minor routes to the right (away from the house) to the top with the radio antennas. There are plenty minor trails, easy to get mixed up on the way back so maybe keep a GPS track. 

From the top you get nice views down both sides of the mountain. Hiking time might be 45 min to 1 1/2 h each way, distance 2 miles per GPS 2 miles each way.

name: Gas station with wifi, bathroom, shower
description: Somewhat noisy highway, but free, convenient, has bathroom, shower and wifi! Asked and was told it's safe to park on the open area behind gas station. In the morning they all came over to chat, curious about my truck and travels.

name: Las Mulas
description: Cyclists: camp under the roof of an empty house. ask at petrol station. toilets, filtered water. close to the road, so not the most quiet campspot.

name: Señor Titi @calle 5, 7-58
description:
Unmarked beverage store, selling a 5 gallon jug water for 9500 COP. Was helpful filling up the truck. Look for door number 7-58 or ask for Titi. 

If the door happens to be closed, the store literally around the corner at the church plaza sold for 10,000 COP.

name: Mirador Repesa de Britania
description: Real nice viewpoint. Free unless you sit down for some cheap beer and loud music.

name: gas station
description: bathroom with shower. Made a good stop for me on my way from Tierradentro to San Agustín. Closed from midnight to 5am, but was told by the friendly staff it's safe. The rest of the area was told after 11pm is questionable. Did I mention it is free? Town has a fun party Saturday nights at the main square.

name: Hotel Los Amigos
description:
I took the "secenic route" from Las Gachas water holes thinking this way might be paved. Hahaha 4.5hrs for 71kms on my motorbike. It's beautiful and could be done in any vehicle, it's sloooooow going.
 This hotel is nice, 20,000. Wi-Fi, cold shower, tv. Carlos has two hotels and a restaurant. Restaurant in the town center sells "comida rapida" however if you show up around supper time they'll sell you what their cooking. I had soup, delicious!
 Parking for one bike in a little shop around the corner. Nothing for cars, though the town is small and you could just park in front of police station in the center.

name: La Cathedral
description: Pablo Escobar’s self build prison. At the moment is taken over by the church and is converted to a retirement home.

name: Pollo Lucas
description: Restaurant at the parque central of the town on the road 45. Very good and very cheap. 7000 for a complete lunch with soup and lemonade with grilled chicken. 1 lunch enough for 2 persons. You can park at the road just front the restaurant.

name: Next to esso station
description:
On the way to Neiva, just after hotel and esso gas station, there is a huge parking with enough place for many Big rigs.
Free
Better option than Neiva before going to tatacoa

name: Jorge Andres Camping
description:
An horrible camping. We paid 50000 for a tent (negociate at 40000 if we stayed 2 nights but finally wanted to run away after 1!), 20 000 for a hamac. The owners are not friendly, the tents smells the enclosed, place is not maintained. Everything is in disorder and they all spent their days doing nothing. His brother place (Jacobo camping) is worst.
Don pedro is definitely the best one is the lowest price (40000 tent, 15000 o 20000 hamac). A bit far unfortunately, especially that the road was really bad when we went there. But after being in the others one, we wanted to go back there.

name: Mi Granja Ecoaventura
description:
Could stay on the parking of the Restaurant (close to road).
Beautiful view! Really nice peoples!
Ate breakfast as exchange.

name: Hotel J.J.
description: A truck stop on the side of the road next to a restaurant. Booked a room for one person for COP 32k and parked the motorcycle in front of the reception (with the soft side-luggage on) where the guard will keep an eye on it all night. The room is very clean and has private bathroom with hot water (from 8 a.m to midnight) and TV.

name: Hotel Dann Monasterio
description:
Five star hotel at a great price. 
We paid 205.000 cop for two incl. breakfast. We asked directly at the hotel and got a much better price than on booking.com. 

Hotel is very nice and beautiful with large rooms and perfect comfy beds. 

Breakfast is also good, especially for South American standards. Dinner was good as well. 

Internet has an average speed.

Parking very secure without hight restrictions. Big rigs such as MAN, etc might have problems anyway as it is a normal parking lot.

name: Piedra Pintada (Rock paintings)
description:
This petroglyphs rock is directly next to the road. The carvings/paintings have been repainted red by students. Free entry.

The closest is to park at the pullout in the curve on the main road close to the rock (this coordinates) and walk down through a hole in the fence.
Alternatively you can stop at the piedra pinzada" sign and walk a few hundred meters. However the gate at the sign was closed when we where there.

There is also a Restaurant about 5km south where you can park for the night.

name: Jardin de la vida - Amero Guyabal (volcano destroyed city)
description: The main road passes right through the ruins of the old city Armero which was destroyed twice by a nearby volcano. You can wander around the old streets with the remains of destroyed houses. There is also a small "Museum" (interpretative center) - spanish only. Free Entry.

name: Car Frenos M&M
description: Excellent brake specialist, very helpful and reasonably priced, also managed to get a radiator specialist to come and repair our radiator in his workshop while they were working on the brakes. Would definitely recommend!

name: Terpel's Hotel
description: The hotel of the last Terpel gas station in Pitolito on the road towards Mocoa has rooms for 25k and 35k with private bathrooms with cold water. Seems that many other gas stations in this area also have hotels in the back. Parked my motorbike, with soft side luggage, in safety outside the room.

name: Santorini Hotel
description: We stayed here on our way to Villa de Leyva. Hotel with huge parking that allow us to camp in our car. Nothing special. Great for a night.

name: Madre Tierra
description: Beautiful place where you can stay and do some volunteer work. Nice people and very welcoming!

name: Museo El Fósil
description: Big parking lot at the entrance of the fossil museum which was built around the biggest kronausorius juvenil fossil in one piece. 7m wide !! Toilet available during visit hours. Museum 8000 cop per adult and 5000 cop per kid, parking free. Did not sleep there but the guy from the museum said it wouldn't be a problem.

name: Esso Gas Station Hotel
description: Inexpensive (15k) rooms with private bathroom with cold water. There is also a restaurant oferring 10k meals up to 10pm and 6k breakfasts. At the recommendation of the gas attendands, overnight parked my motorcycle with soft side-luggage in the lit area of the gas station that had 24h surveillance cameras.

name: Servi Francés
description:
Great place for all mecanicalproblems! Very helpful and did a good job.

Lots of vehicles here, not just French ones.

name: Convento Monasterio Desierto de la Candelaria
description:
Monastery that dates back to 1604. Today about 5 monchs live here and offer guided tours through the monastery ( 6000 COP per person, 3000 for children). Opening hours 9-12 and 13-17h
A part of the monastery is a Hotel. Follow the road to the parking next to the Church. There you can park for free (also stay overnight). Just walk through the door next to the church and ask for permission.
We found a free WiFi without password on the parking lot. There are restrooms during the tour, not sure if they are available on request.
You can also buy honey and other things from the monastery.
Btw. the desierto (desert) in the name does not refer to the vegetation but the spiritual aspect

name: Meson Ilama Hotel y Cabaña
description:
Stopped here for a couple of days to kitesurf. 

After short negotiations we got a double room for 110.000 Cop. 

Room has a good lake view and is clean. Beds are hard but comfy. We slept very well. 

Suicide shower could have more pressure but it is nice and warm. 

The owner is very welcoming. 

Secure parking incl, no hight restrictions. 

We also recommend the pizza from their wood oven. Really good. 

Kiteschool is in walking distance. 

The my have Wifi but it is not the fastest. Claro works very well so we don't care. 

We recommmend this place.

name: Terpel
description: Good for a night. Big gravel area. Just a gasstation...

name: parador La Magdalena
description: Restaurant at Los Vegas.Price negotiable We paid 6,000 for 2 and they were happy. Fish meal very good

name: Factory Motos de la Costa
description: Great mechanic shop, specialize in Ktm and Kawasaki but also all others. Rolled in sat afternoon and they right away found precious motul oil and did a valve check

name: Terpel
description: Outside of the town. Quiet. Big gravel area. We ask if we could stay here. They were okay.

name: restaurante Melendez
description: great and tasty almuerzo for 13000. all fresh and good stuff. recommended

name: Torres del parque
description: Hotel with clean rooms and secure bike parking. 40000 for a single and 70000 for a triple room. cold showers only

name: Fresh Fish
description: Easy to miss but its a red house with a tiny sign and a nice women selling the family catch of the day. The price is laughably cheap so be generous with her! They also usually have lobster squid and octopus. She dose not speak any English

name: Republica Hostel Bogota
description:
Nice hostel in a good location. You can talk to them ahead of time and they will help you find a place for you vehicle.
Phone: +57 1 7049212

name: L.R. Pelaez Mechanics
description:
One of the larger mechanics yards in the area with space for 20+ cars to be worked on.

Installed a new rear differential on a Dodge for us without any issues. Sure it took a little longer than expected and cost a little more but this is Colombia!

They also let us sleep in the fenced in yard when we had to wait overnight for a part.

name: Museo Casa Gabriel Garcia Marquez
description:
museum house of gabriel garcia marquez
closed on mondays

name: Wild camp with view
description:
Beautiful pleace to stay. Safe as we met all the neighbours and told us to sleep here. Amaizing view of the valley. No servicies. The police Came at 630am to check if we were fine, they said it was ok to stay here. 
Narrow road so not recommended for big rigs

name: Dillancol SA
description: Very good mechanic. Modern and fair prices. They can manage small and big rigs. They fixed our breaks, balanced our tires and greased up all terminals. Highly recommend them, very professional!

name: Hostal 12:12 in Chapinero
description:
Very nice super clean hostal very save neighberhood. Parking for small and medium rigs in front as well as motorbikes and bikes (inside). Nice well equipped kitchen, nice common spaces. Different accomodation possibilities: 
Privat room with shower and toilet: 138000 for 2. 
Room with shared bathroom: 98000 for 2.
Dorms from 35000 pp
A little more expensive than in Candelaria but nothing to do with the surroundings . You can go out at night with no risk. Very good restaurants and everything you need in the close neighbourhood. Laundry service.

name: Petcenter
description:
They have a big selection of dogfood and a veterinary
parkinglot in front of the shop

name: Morobik Hostel
description: brand new hostel, close to the center of Popayan. Diana is a lovely host and the hostel is a old house, remodelled and made to a bar-hostel. at night there may be people out but nothing too loud and until 11:30 anyway. paid 25000 per night. everything is super clean and new. there is no shared kitchen but they let me use both. Beds are rock solid and brand new. there's parking for motorcycles only. maybe 3. wifi is fast and showers are hot(electric). Nice place to chill too.

name: finca la palma
description: is a little farm near to Medellín (30 minutes in car). Is quiet, nice view to Medellín, kind people, private room with hot water, WiFi, good vibes.

name: Hotel Restaurant Villa Camila
description:
Best option in town. 

Clean rooms and bathrooms, nice pool, hammocks, AC(!!), good restaurant, friendly owner. 

Secure parking.

name: Estación Esso - Berlin de Socorro
description:
Gas Station with parking for trucks (and overlanders.  ). Clean barthroons and mini market open until 10pm. Free.
There is hotel option.
Currently price:
Diesel: COP 7.585/galón
Gasoil: COP 8.380/galón
Wifi pass: 24680123

name: El Rincon de Chiamocha
description:
The nicest place to stop along the canyon ridge with gorgeous views.

Excellent BBQ ribs for 14k, fantastic cappuccino for 4k. Easy parking outside.

name: Hostel Vigyan
description:
brand new hostel with all the technology possible. fingerprint scan, securoty cameras everywhere, parking for bikes only in the small verandas. safe neighborhood. all for 15000 per night in 18 beds dorm with breakfast. there are though few glitches in this system. only 1 hot shower (the other 2 are cold only) and only 2 bathrooms which you ll struggle to sit in if you are more than 185cm. also a bloody siren went off 3 times while I was there. not sure if it was the alarm or something else but yeah...not the best thing to hear. kitchen is super small. 
overall it was a nice stay but this is not the best hostel I ve stayed for sure. good deal for the price.

name: Hotel Los Castillos
description: Nice and clean rooms. good wifi, secure parking for motos and cars. paid 60000 for 3 people in a room. asked for 40000 for a single.

name: Cambio
description: Money exchange. Here is the best place to change mone

name: La Juanita Hostal
description:
Beautiful Hostal with safe parking in the street. 
Dormitory: 50 000pp with breakfast
Privat room for 2 pers with bath and terrasse: 100 000 (from Monday to Thursday) 160000 Friday to Sunday

name: Carretera El Coy-Chita
description:
On the road Chita - El Cocuy, pullout flat spot on a ridge with fantastic view to both sides. Very quiet at night.
View of 4 glaciers in the distance (with clear sky) and also incredible night sky.
This is at about 4100m altitude.
The road from Chita to here is rock/gravel which we could do with our 6m Ducato van with sufficient clearance.

name: Washu Washu hostel
description:
Not used to leave bad reviews but this place is not too good. In its defense there s so many people here that maybe this is one of the reason why I didn't enjoy my stay much. regardless it s 15000 per night in 8 beds dorm which has barely any space to walk in. bathrooms were mostly out of service (sink or shower), one door handle came off while trying to lock the door. Not super clean neither. the good things were that wifi was super fast, and netflix on a good TV and chill out area. Parking for 1 or 2 motos. camping allowed for 2-3 small tents. Not much in the area. Free coffee and tea. Small kitchen for the amount of people allowed. 
sorry, i ve stayed in better places but for the same price there are other options for sure.

name: Hotel Belyferwis
description: Nice clean hotel at the Plaza with secure parking. 60000p for 2 persons - breakfast 5000p for two - eggs, bred and coffee

name: Estacion de Servicio Entrada de Timaná
description:
In the station have rooms form rental.

The price individually Is of 20.000 COP.

The rooms have private bathroom and TV cable.

name: Giron Chill out Hotel Boutique
description: Very nice place and rooms! got a room for three people for 110000 after some haggling breakfast included. no parking at hotel itself but secure parking just around corner (8000 for a moto/night)

name: Hostal Casa Nacuma
description: Nice Hostel with private and shared rooms in a 200 year old house, parking available for motorcycles, good breakfast.

name: calliwood
description:
Nice Muséum of technologia of cinema.
Hugo is so nice and friendly, very helpfull

name: villa maría del huerto
description: Delicious menu for 10.000 cop and lovely place. We had frejolada (feijoada) and for desert cheese with goiabada here and It was delicious, reminded us of our home, Brasil.

name: Enjoy fit Market
description:
Good place for vegan'food o Cartagena 
Staff very friendly

name: Las Palmas
description: Nice place to spend some nights. Quiet and safe.

name: Hospedaje  La santa maria de Leyva
description: nice room with balcony, 25000 per person. secure moto parking

name: Leo
description: Leo und Cesar can fix and repair everything. We change the axile boots for 170000 cop, front breaks 80000 cop, paint the front part of our car for 300000 cop etc. They are super friendly and organize everything you need to repair to the local price. Parking over night is no problem wifi and a Toilet in the shop.

name: Casa de Susana
description: Great little posada owned by Pedro and Susan. Private rooms with fan and private bathrooms, cold showers, for 30,000 for 2 people. Thy can also arrange parking for your rig if you do the Camino Real trek. We paid 10000 pesos for 5 days in a covered lot. Just ask around town for Susanna as there’s no sign on the front of her house. Everyone knows her. See the photo of their business card for a telephone number. Highly recommended and Cabrera is a cool little town to stay a night before you trek.

name: Farmhouse Overlooking Lake
description: We got lost looking for the campsite next to the lake. We came in on the wrong dirt road which turned into a single track dirt path. As we waited on the side of the road deliberating where to sleep, a moto passed with a local guy and his wife. We explained our situation - lost, don’t feel safe driving at night, need a place to park our rig and camp for the night - he led us to a vacant farmhouse with a large covered area to park, amazing view overlooking the lake and a water faucet with potable rainwater. There are lots of farmhouses in this area with large grassy fields, many with amazing views. I’m sure anyone you ask in the area would help you find a farmhouse to camp next to for the night. This location listed on ioverlander may not be possible again but ask around and I’m sure you’ll find a local willing to let you camp the night in their or a friend’s lot. One of our favorite spots in Colombia, and free!

name: Toyonorte
description:
Official Toyota service station. They did a very good job fixing our alternator and diagnosing our broken air con, plus an oil change and tire rotation. Probably more expensive than a small mechanic but they have master Toyota machanics. We went to a small mechanic in Cartagena and got a great deal on fixing our AC system but it broke 3 days after leaving the mechanic. 

 In and out in less than 24 hours. Worked on my 2005 Lexus Gx470. Closed Sundays.

I was helped by Javier, the manager. Very friendly and responsive to phone and email.

name: Finca El Maco
description: Swiss owner, very nice place, quiet, kitchen, toilets, shower etc. 15’pp

name: El Maco
description: Very special and nice place with different cottages. Nice people, swiss owner

name: Claro shop with SOAT
description: A small claro shop on a corner that has a SOAT sign out the front as they are not a transport office they only do it for one year which is just under $140 US they only take cash

name: José hostel
description: Brilliant little hostel on the main square of Guadalupe, clean, wifi, super nice staff the owner let me bring my moto in at night for safe keeping I had my own private room with double bed for 20,000 peso’s

name: Family allowing camping
description:
As you go through the town of chimichagua drive towards la playa or the pier where the boats leave for Saloa if you are driving towards the pier the place is almost at the end on the left it’s a big covered area in comparison to the other little houses by day I think it runs as a little bar the family were so generous and kind they let me camp for free but they also offered me a hammock, there is a toilet and the made me dinner at night as well for free so good 

If you are on a moto heading south the boats leave for Saloa at 6am every hour by memory 20000 peso’s but your bike can’t be to big I have a xr250 which would of been ok but it couldn’t fit because of the back box so I had to drive around through El Banco which is like another hour longer

name: Finca San Juan de las Araucarias
description: Nice room with balcony. Owners are very nice. clean, hot showers, secure parking for motos ( space for cars too). 30 000 COP per person

name: autos Sura
description: insurance for foreign vehicles, $57000 for one month. Like 20 USD for a toyota hiace

name: SURA
description:
You cannot buy vehicle insurance here anymore!! Don’t even bother trying. 
Carrara 54, number 40 a 23
Buy a new insurance for your vehicle at the office 407. One or two month possible.

name: Finca La Trampa
description:
Nice finca. Rooms 25000 p.p 
cabana 70000.
Orlando the owner is really nice. got free coffee and could use his kitchen. We also got breakfast with homemade cheese

name: Agencia de Seguros Asesoramos
description: Place to get insurance to enter port. 70k pesos for one week. No sign on outside of building to indicate seguros. Knock on the door to be let in and ask about ‘seguro’....

name: Planeta Rica Parking Area
description: Great Parking Area on the other side of a Restaurant under large trees. 100m away from the street. Calm at night and safe.

name: Camp in Caceres
description:
Small town to which we were the first overlander to arrive. The people were very happy and they received us very well! We slept behind the church but there is a lot of noise during the morning, there is a small boardwalk against the river that seems calmer.
Update: 4/2019 - military present and said it is not safe.

name: Sura Seguros Insurance HQ
description:
Regional headquarters of Sura(mericana) Seguros.  Apparently the only place around here you can extend your vehicle insurance.

Purchased one month extra insurance with minimal fuss (ignoring wild goose chase to get here).

I was within my 90 day limit so they didn't require authorization, but you would probably want to extend your TIP first anyway. 

Ground floor outer corner, Punto Clave (Centro Commercial) , Calle 29 / Carrera 48.

Don't mess about - come here!

name: Farmersmarket
description: Parked our RV for the night on a concrete slab near the Visiters Centre. Check the market days to avoid surprises the next morning. Quiet during the night and no "curious inhabitants". Perfect for one night.

name: Parqueadero San Fernando
description:
Good place for the night. Gravel, leveled parking , but a bit noisy 
$8,000 cop parking w/ toilets (no shower)
Or get a room for $20,000 cop with a full size bed, cold shower, tv and the parking spot. 
Very basic but clean

name: Juancherito
description: Really good restaurant with very reasonable prices. $11000 cop menu ejecutivo. w/ soup, main dish and water

name: Playa Mayapo
description:
Bivouac sur la plage à côté d'un petit hôtel Sheean Womein rustique mais sympathique. 20000 cop pour accéder aux douches avec seau !
chambre pour 60000 cop sans électricité, mais avec moustiquaire.
Beau coucher de soleil,  possibilité de se baigner et même d'acheter du poisson frais le matin.
pas de wifi.
---
Bivouac on the beach next to a small hotel Sheean Womein rustic but friendly. 20000 cop to access the showers with bucket!
room for 60000 cop without electricity, but with mosquito net.
Beautiful sunset, opportunity to swim and even buy fresh fish in the morning.
no wifi.

name: Llantos Mallarino Yokohama tires
description: We bought two new tires here for our Honda Element, probably paid too much, but is a very clean shop with very nice helpful people. They referred us to another place for brake pads and an oil change.

name: Aldauto
description: Oil change and filter our Honda Element here, 120,000 cop. They called another guy to come in and change our back brake pads, 130,000 for 2 sets of pads and we paid the guy 40,000 for the work. Tricky to get to with crazy traffic. They also have tires and other parts. Very quick professional service and clean facility.

name: Monterrey
description: Nice,clean rooms, quiet ac, 4pillows in Queen bed! huge garáže right of main road, super friendly owners and staff, asked 60k went Down to 50k, one room, Two people, two motos,

name: Villa Alegria
description: stayed in private room 4 people, private bathroom 25k COP pp 30k COP private room with bathroom and breakfast, big garden, sheltered secure parking, really nice place, nice owner

name: fuel station
description: not ideal but better then nothing. payed 5000 cop to spend the night. shower and banos

name: ivan Dario, Gomez Tyejos
description: If you got your Soat in La Hormiga, this is where you get your original document. White House on the left, end of the street

name: La Helenita
description:
This generations-old hacienda converted to hosteria is also the site of the Piedras Azules attraction. It is in need of maintenance and updating, and some work was being done on the restaurant while we were there; it was closed because of that.
Otherwise it is a tranquil site (during the week, at least) with friendly owners. Toilets and showers are in barely ok condition, but the staff kept them clean during our stay. They also opened a room for us to use the shower and toilet there.
Big rigs can enter through the gate, but beware of low-hanging cables (about 2.5m) once inside. The owners told us they will keep renovating the site and reroute the cables. 
We did not use the natural water pool, and we did not hike to the waterfall because the trail was in bad shape after the long rainy season.
One issue for us was two dogs kept in a small hut doubling as a kennel. They slept during the day but were barking and howling several times throughout the night.
The hacienda grows and sells coffee and honey, we bought some of both. They have business connection with Nabusimake.

name: Laundry Cafe
description:
best self-wash laundry in town. Hot wash program. Clean machines
12k cop per load, 12k cop per dryer. Good and fast wifi. Coffee

name: El Sombreron - ostreria
description: The best ceviches in town! the location looks a little bit silly but everybody loves this place! when you like ceviche, you will love the sombreron as well.

name: La Consentida
description: Camping and ecotourism lodge. We found this place by accident in maps me. Nice hosts and a simple clean place. They also have rooms but we camped in our car in their huge parking. They can organize trips to the flamingo sanctuary.20000 to camp for 2 people

name: Cueva del Esplendor
description:
This is the place where you hire the tour to Cueva del esplendor. As it is their private property the only way to go is with them. The tour consists on a 4wd ride to a place where you start to walk. The hike has beautiful views, it’s muddy but they will give you proper boots. Then you get to a Finca where they have food prepared for you, and after, you start walking again down to the cave, always with a guide. They say they will only let enter 50 persons a day to the cave in groups up to 8 or maybe 10 people. 

Price is $55000 cop pp. 
and it is definitely worth it 

The lady (owner) is very kind and she even let us park our van inside her garage as a campsite, with cold shower and clean toilets.

name: Hotel el Portal
description:
Good and cheap hotel 
fast Wi-Fi
large parking lot

name: skatin ring
description: an outdoor site, close to the skating rink. It is a beautiful town, the local people are friendly and generous, it is a very safe village and an ideal place to practice paragliding

name: empty lot
description: Nothing special but quiet, free and close to the center. We weren't bothered at all.

name: PASTO LLANTAS
description: Goodyear tire dealer, Michelin, B.F. Goodrich, etc .... for all vehicles and 4x4 vehicles. Efficient, fast, reasonable prices and top service with attentive and competent staff.

name: Calle 16 parking
description: Free public parking (according the visiter centre) on grassy filed, 5 minutes walk from the Plaza Mayor. We stayed with our RV for a week. Felt very safe, friendly people. No facilities, no free wifi. Small supermarkets and fine restaurant close by.

name: Macondo Bar
description: Not only a nice and peaceful place to eat and have a drink, the owner, Helena, and her family are the people to trust in helping you figure out how to ship your motorbike to Turbo. Her oncle owns the cargo boat.

name: Egus
description:
They repaired our cylinderhead.
Speak to jose.

name: Guadualito
description:
What a beautiful place , Amazing botanical garden .  You have to stop here .
Phone number : +57 3208414010
Rgbernalg@gmail.com

name: nuestro sueño
description:
It is a perfect option near Quimbaya and Montenegro, so you can enjoy the "Balsaje por el río la Vieja". It is a beautiful, quiet and very safe place. It has a typical restaurant, swimming pool and a large and quiet green area. Highly recommended. COP$15.000 (us$5)/PP breakfast included

s una perfecta opción cerca a Quimbaya y a Montenegro, así puede disfrutar del "Balsaje por el río la Vieja". Es un sitio hermoso, silencioso y muy seguro. Tiene restaurante típico, piscina y una zona verde amplia y tranquila. Muy recomendado. Cop$15.000 (us$5) por persona desayuno incluído

name: Seguros del Estado
description: Got motorcycle insurance here for my US plated bike. 3 months for 118,000 colombian pesos. Copy of: DIAN, license, passport and title required. We were given an invoice that needed to be paid at a BancoColombia around the corner. Had to return the following day to collect the insurance card as the policy couldn't be written on the spot. All in all a very easy process.

name: Bona Vida
description: Very nice hostel, private rooms with and without private bathroom and multiple dorm rooms with varying number of beds. 3 locations. Kitchen. Price includes a good complete breakfast. Free coffee. Plenty of common areas to relax. We stayed in a private room with shared bath with air con for 89,000. The second night we are staying in 6 person dorm (only us right now) with air con for 33,000 per person, I’ll let you know how that goes. Owners are present, very nice and helpful. No parking but safe secure parking nearby for 5000.

name: Hotel Panorama Sol
description: Think I was the first camper they've had, the manager was very nice and agreed to 10 mill pesos. Hot shower, limited camp space, great for cyclists of all kinds with tents. I had dinner and breakfast for 5 mill each as well. Great views.

name: campsite / pool
description: Restaurant campsite pool. Too basic for the 30k, but it was nice to have a pool and cold shower. Little trees gave some shade

name: Turbo
description:
We fixed our engine here. Luis the owner is really knowledegable.
We could sleep in our bus in the yard.
They can fix everthing.
Safe.
On the left side around 4kk after Chachagüi in directioj Pasto

name: Copa Cargo-Dog Retrieval Post Flight
description: Seems like middle of nowhere in a back alley, but this is where you retrieve dogs post flight & initiate aduana process.

name: Panorama Cafe Hostal
description:
the first hostal in buenavista ;-)
great place with an amazing view
long nice balcony with sofas
clean nice rooms
dormroom with breakfast 30.000 cop 
private room with breakfast 80.000 cop
fast wifi
free coffee the whole day
friendly staff
they have a own garage for motorbikes and small vans
streetside parking is safe

name: La Mina (swimming hole on river)
description:
Really cool spot to take a dip in the river. But be careful when climbing above the rapids, the rock faces are slick. 3 Colombians almost drowned while we were there. A little girl fell in and her mother and a man jumped in after her. They were caught in a hydraulic but the river eventually spat them out. 
We paid 3000 to park and the guy said we could wild camp for free. There are some level spots. We didn’t camp.

name: restaurant
description: You can park nearby the beach but not next to the shop just below. The owner wanted to charge us 50000 for the night afterwards. He said nothing the day before.

name: Terpel/ Al Toque gas station with showers
description: Brand new Terpel gas station twith a small cafeteria, shop, WiFi, super clean toilets and very nice and convenient showers (for 2000 pp). Great for a short stop after some nights of wild camping ;-) enter the Altoque shop for all the facilities.

name: Eco-hotel
description: After taking the Jardin-Riosucio dirt road we arrived here near dark. This is a love hotel so there's traffic coming in and out all night but the room (ask for #10) is clean, nice and has fantastic views. The family is nice and washed our clothes for free. The room was $35.000 ($12 USD) for the night. Love hotels have private parking under the room so makes an ideal stop for an overlander.

name: wild camp
description: nice place to pitch a tent. out of sight from the road. follow the small dry riverbed up about 150 meters. several flat spots.

name: TN Restaurant Bar
description: Para mas Información 311 393 4302 Acevedo Huila Colombia Cupos limitados

name: El buen alimento - Alquimia Vegetariana
description:
nice vegetarian restaurant
they offers daily menues
good quality and reasonable prices (daily menu 11000 COP)
dog friendly
also offer meals to go and frozen vegetarian supplies (i.e. veggie burgers 500g 8000 COP)
open every day

name: Gas país refill
description: As none of the gas companies in the city refilled our tank, a guy from gas pais sent us to this pleace where someone did it. The cost: 50COP for 10k.

name: Via Gas La pintada
description: Gas! We found this place after you pass La Pintada. The first curve exiting the town on your left going south. They filled 2 tanks 20lb each US tanks. Just park at the entrance and call!

name: Hotel La Colina Campestre
description:
Small hotel outside Zipaquira. 
It's a brick house with a parking place on the end of the property on a leveled grass spot. The entrance is a bit tight. Above 2.50 m height won't make it. But there are 3 more hotels in the surroundings. 
The room was $20 cop. but didn't use the beds, we slept inside our van. Hot shower and fast Wi-Fi. 
They have a hose and let us fill our water tanks

name: Pink Flamingos
description:
Good place to see flamingos. It is a NP so you have to enter with a guide. We got in with Samir, young relaxed guy. His telephone is +57 310370 7361
From Pericos,  there is a "gate" where you get the guide, they asked $20 cop pp. But we negotiated to $10. We were 3 in our party. 
He came with us inside our van. The road is a bit rough and one part is sandy. No big rigs as the tree branches are too low. Our van is 2wd and had no trouble. 

There are many pink flamingos and you can get closer by walking on the lagoon (50 cm deep) or rent a small boat for $10 cop. The closer they let you to the flamingos is about 50 meters as they get scared easy and they fly.

name: Lavanderia Autoservicio
description: Found an awesome place to wash our clothes, grab some groceries, and use wifi. Juan Andres took great care of us! The city is modern and very nice. Stop here if you're in the area!
