name: texaco and McDo guarded parking
description:
ADMIN NOTE: Users report, It is not for motor-home, only for car...very small parking! 

guarded parking which allows to sleep in the vehicle
toilets and Wi-Fi in McDonald's
much quieter than we expected
only 10mins walk from the tejo place

name: Hotel Paisanaje
description: Great hotel, very close to the downtown and the Malecón. Also the restaurants are very close (you can go by walking). Is one of the options with garage in the former great port of Colombia

name: Agua Fresh Life
description: Potable water for sale, they will fill your containers.

name: Cataratas del Rio Medina
description: Camping in the large parking lot, we had a nice space next to a small stream. They close the gate around 5:00 so very tranquil after that. We stayed 2 nights for 20,000/ night (included entrance to the falls, parking and camping). Flush toilets no paper, no WiFi, no cell signal for us. No shower, we bathed in the river. No running water, we used the stream. Bring enough potable water for your stay. We really liked it here and the river is fun to swim in. Hiking trail to see the upper falls. (8 pretty well behaved dogs live here, don’t know if they allow your dog)

name: Laguna El Tabacal en la Vega Cundinamarca
description: Laguna el Tabacal, is a beautiful ecological reserve, with camping area showers, with parking area quite large, camping value per person $ 5 dollars, entrance to the lagoon $ 2 dollars. Also to 10 minutes away by car you will find El Moro waterfalls an incredible place to enjoy the natural and clear water.

name: Piscina natural Hotel Mesopotamia
description: The natural pool is amazing, The hotel is the oldest in Colombia

name: Campamento Base
description: Camping in Suesca Cundinamarca, in front of the rocks to climb, an incredible landscape.

name: Fire Station
description: Fire station of the table, they are very friendly let me stay one night in the station. they have bathrooms.

name: La casa de doña Carmen
description: lodging in a wonderful old house in Mompox, a population of 1,500 to enjoy to the fullest, a room with three beds, each one costs $ 30,000 COP. the lady is very friendly and park my truck next door on the street I had no problem.

name: Beach Cholon
description: Cholon beaches on the island of Baru, near Cartagena. Enjoy it on a bike ride.

name: Punta Iguana
description: Punta Iguana, private Club, island Baru in Cartagena de Indias

name: Don Elias coffee tour
description:
Small plantation, really nice coffee tour of about 1 hour. They tell you about the plants and the growing process and then about the production process. And of course you can taste. Price is 10.000 COP per person. 

The tour is in English and Spanish, if you speak Spanish go for that one. The guy is the son of the owner and is much funnier than the one giving the English tour :).

name: Hostal Nómadas
description:
This is a place for travelers from all the world. This is a place to rest, have a beer, listen to good music, meet new friends and have fun

We have shared rooms, camping and hammocks for you

name: Wax palms - Toche/Salento Road.
description: From here heading south 10 of thousands wax palms. Bumpy road and can be muddy but worth while.

name: Tunnel tour with bats
description: Here you can visit a little tunnel and waterfall. Plenty of little bats you can see up close. Nothing spectacular but only 5k pp, 30min tour

name: Parqueadero y residential
description: Safe parking (lots of space) place with also 4 basic rooms to stay. It's simple but very nice people safe and cheap. 15000 for a room for a single person, 20000 as a couple.

name: Plaza/Parque in Barrancas
description: It was late and the police told us we'd be safe parked-up for the night in this square. A flat area and surprisingly  peaceful, we had a good night's sleep but no facilities here.  If you park in the far north-west corner, the police station is in sight, diagonally across on Calle 9. Free.

name: Layby Camping
description:
In a sheltered spot right at the saddle of a 4,000m pass, with incredible views. 

More of a farmer's field driveway than a layby by big enough for a big rig floor several small.  Little or no road traffic at night.

name: Short Hike to Impressive Waterfalls
description:
You can park in Don Lolo Restaurant's car park (polite to ask if he's around) and take the gravel road down the side of the restaurant.

Continue down and across the bamboo bridge across river, then take 2 rights soon after. From there continue up the gorge - at its worst spots its an easy scramble.

Takes about 45 minutes one way. Take your swimming trunks if you fancy a bracing dip (swim out through the narrow channel if water not too scary).

BTW Don Lolo's was recommended to us by a local - big, good food at decent prices (corriente 9k).

name: Cheap Petrol/Gasoline
description:
If you drive the trampoline road east to west you will find the petrol prices are high at around 9,300 until you reach Mocoa, where they drop to 7,500.

Be careful around holidays as on the 1st Jan there was no petrol in this town!

As you come off the west end of the trampoline you will see the same price, and one garage had petrol. If you can make it a little further to Pasto you will find crazy cheap prices around 6,500.

name: Frenos las americas
description: Fixed our breaks quick. Nice job. Really helpful and nice

name: La Terraza de Estella
description: New hostel, very near sea board offices.  60000. it's on airbnb as well. Lovely place, amazing roof terrace!!

name: Texaco Gas Station „El 15“
description: Huge and leveled gravel parking lot in the backyard of the gas station. Clean toilet with free cold shower. No security guard, but therefore no one who expects a tip - so free camping. The answer of the friendly stuff to one of the typical travelers questions was ‘aquí no pasa nada...’. There is a restaurant and there are also rooms to rent. Although there is WiFi, it’s obviously not open for guests or only for office use. Bad Movistar reception.

name: Cabanas Orlando
description: A lovely shaded garden about a block from the beach.  Showers and rudimentary kitchen.  10,000 per night for camping.  Ask for Orlando- his place is next to Casa Blanca just off the soccer field.  He is multi-lingual, charming, and cooks an excellent dinner for 10,000 Cop.

name: Parque La Floresta
description: Square with wifi and free parking around the square. It's safe. There is a biblioteca nearby, with wifi also. In the supermarket, there is a wc available for 500pesos.

name: Hotel San Francisco
description:
Hotel San Francisco: This is a good hotel, with ac, private and secure parking lot, private bathrooms, really clean and comfortable rooms, free breakfast and the staff are super friendly. It’s around 35U$ for a room for 2, in downtown Barranquilla. It’s worth trying if you are passing by and need to spend a night in town. It’s not the most appealing neighborhood, but good enough for its price/quality. 
Ps: parking lot gate it’s not tall enough for the big rigs.

name: Cataratas de Medina
description:
Walk through the jungle, beautiful river with 2 smalls waterfalls and kind of natural swimming pools, also place to picnic and small bar.
4000PCO pp and 3000PCO for parking. 
Maybe overnight possibilities.

name: Antonio, boat driver
description:
Antonio does boat tours to Rosario Islands and pretty much all destinations near Cartagena. Cheaper to book directly with him than through one of the tour companies in town. Super friendly guy. His boat seats about 10. He has a cooler in the boat so you can bring your own food and drink. You can pick up ice at the spot where he fills his gas. He can also get you snorkel gear.

Phone: 3114292380

Our group paid 1,300,000 COP for a full day trip.

name: Hotel Hospedaje Cinco Estrellas, Cajamarca
description: Nice clean hotel just next to the main road in Cajamarca. Rooms with TV, private bathroom (cold water only) and fast wifi. Very friendly staff. Many comedors, panaderias and tiendas around. We've been charged 30.000 COP/night for the room with king bed. They let us take our bicycles to the room.

name: El Posada Alcatraz
description: Very friendly family.Clean rooms. Delicious breakfast. Max is passionate about motorcycles. Great alternative to save money just outside of Cartagena. 60,000 for double shared bathroom Inc breakfast. 8000 for taxi to centre. parking available for motorcycles. parking on road for cars, or they can arrange secure parking nearby in local car wash. whilst we were there the family helped us out finding a doctor. highly recommended!

name: Gasan/Norgas
description: We were able to pick up a new small 4.5kg tank to replace the disposable bottles for our stove. $65k cop for the tank deposit and $21k cop for the propane. They sold us the bottle straight from the yard so we didn't need to wait for a truck.

name: Restaurante y Parador "EL TURISTA"
description: Restaurante y Parador "EL TURISTA" - (Tent Sitio/casa rodente). Food includes a few different type of fishes and then your typical Colombian plates, it was good. For cyclists and possibly Motos, you can camp on the side of the restaurant under a shelter.

name: Hotel with Dorms
description: Hotel Villareal.Dorm room with 3 beds at just 12k COP. Best price I've received since being in Colombia as far as hotels go.

name: Panes Y Tortas Integrales - Name
description: Good place for fresh baked banana bread as well as fruit bread. They also sell different types of cooking/dressing oils, almonds, and yea basically a bakery worth stopping by if your walking around this part of town.

name: Chicharroneria el Mono
description: Off to the East side of the road there is a restaurant with property along the river. I'm not sure if it's public or private but I asked them for general permission to camp with a tent here. They said it's ok. A few locals were also using the river. It's a quiet place with camping along the river on flat and soft land a bit further past the small rocks.

name: Hotel Central
description: Nice hotel with a courtyard to sit outside under a roof. Solo I paid 15,000 for a private room as a cyclist. The rates started around 20,000 up to around 40k for larger rooms. Wifi is good, they just needed to reset it once. The attendants are helpful, not the most talkative but helpful. Fans in the rooms.

name: Restaurante y Hotel
description: On the northern edge of this small town further away from the truck stops/gas station. The double bed room was 15k for me solo. Not a bad spot for the night. Wouldn't say it's a room especial but it works. On a hot day the raspberry juice hit the spot. Service was good be friendly owner. Behind the hotel seems secure me quiet, if you ask I bet you'd be able to sleep in your rig.

name: Hospedaje
description: Palenque is the town that was the first liberated town during Spanish rule of slavery. There is a statue commemorating this as well as a plaza where local musicians and dancers perform - I don't know how often but on a Monday when I arrived there was a music performance. Tuesday's also may something going on. I say Tuesdays because that is a day that a tour agency from Cartagena schedules its visit. The locals here are friendly and the hospedaje owner was a relaxed guy. They have a private available and a two bed room plus another room I didn't see into. For the double bed room they normally charge 15k a bed but without really many guests you may be able to work out a deal. This is the type of town where I just enjoyed chilling in the plaza and simple life.

name: Tres Hammocks Hotel/Restaurant
description: 20k for a single. Also a dorm room option for probably 10k. Loud tv by another guest in the dorm but she gave me the private for just 15k this day. She also has a restaurant and panadería downstairs. It's a nice place to chill out here a bit away from the much busier downtown area.

name: Hostal Rancho de Cleo-Fe
description: a cabin with an excellent view, in the sibundoy valley

name: Antawara Hostal
description:
Really nice place with very friendly owners. Good breakfast and nice, clean rooms. The only thing that's a bit disturbing is the main road in front of the complex, which is a bit noisy.
Laundry is no problem, little pool is at the place too.

name: Casa Encuentro Hostel
description: Super nicely located and made hostel. Many opportunities for activities. Located above the lake. The area is clean and very lovingly decorated. We paid for the triple room 180,000 pesos / night. The very delicious and fresh breakfast is included, coffee and WIFI too.

name: Los Manguitos
description:
It's a restaurant and hotel. But behind the pool they also have a camping area. Can use bathrooms and showers of the pool area. Not the cleanest bathrooms but ok. No toilet seat, no paper. 
Very noisy from the 45 but for a night totally ok. paid 20000COP for the tent. Motorcycle can be parked right next to the tent. Slow WiFi around reception area.

name: Los manguitos
description: Here is a very comfortable, clean and beautiful hotel. Next door Juan's restaurant serves very good beef sancochos and carrot juices. We paid 30'000 for a double.

name: Finca El Temblor
description:
The Finca is abuot 20 km after Paz de Ariporo in Direktion to El Totuma. About 8km after Paz go right after a white fence with blue top. Drive about 9 km than you see on the right side a gate "Beatriz", after about 2km is on the right side a gate white/brown. Open this gate and drive some 100m till you can see the house on the right side. 
The owners, Luis and Teresa are very friendly and helpfull. From Nov. till April there are 126 different typs of birds. Luis and Teresa offer Food. If you want to eat (3 times) ts 50.000 cop incl. camping pP. Without food is 15.000 cop pP. If you want food please call 314 211 2546 Teresa, 312 395 8984 Luis Alberto, or 315 221 5522 Fernando and 321 413 7821 Laura en Bogota. The also do the laundry. A place to relax!
High clearance recommended.

name: Parqueadero 1375 big rig parking
description:
The only parqueo we could find that would let us park our truck camper in the Chapinero district. There were a few (very few) others where it would fit, but they refused due to our size.

Very nice guys and very interested in our story. They showed us our instagram feed when we came to pick up the truck, they were pretty excited about our travels. 

24k cop for 24hours. 

We are 8' tall, 19' long, and a bit under 7' wide. We fit (just barely) into a high top container, for reference. We actually fit here pretty well, but anything bigger would be a pretty tough squeeze. 

We didn't stay in our truck, but if you're looking for an option like I wouldn't be surprised if they'd be ok with it. There is a great little local restaurant on the same lot so I'm sure there are facilities.

name: Roadside waterfall Turnout
description:
Just a small place beside the road, next to a small waterfall. Probably barely worth mentioning, but there are hardly and options along this route. We stopped in at the one nearer Cajamarca, "Pullout on the road to Toche", but it was really too small for our popup truck camper and very hard to level. 

While this one doesn't have the spectacular view, it's protected from the wind and allows you to pull a bit more off the road. It's big enough for one of just about anything, even big rigs.

Locals very friendly, the area feels very safe.

name: BiciCafe
description:
Micro artisan roasters with an awesome handmade breakfast and creative pastry.
High quality coffee and very nice atmosphere. There are cupping sessions and language exchange as well. 

They speak English and German an also have bike tours.

name: Centro vacacional Recrear Gaia - Finca La Arabia
description: Swimming pool, camping spot, a couple of cabins. Great place to spend a couple of days by the pool. Away from any roads. Loads of space for camper vans or tents. Including electricity. Downsides are all-day music and all-night street lamp.

name: el rancho
description: local food. big plates and not expensive

name: restaurant beach parking
description: restaurantes marina has a big parking next to the beach. for 10000 cop you can spend here the night. quiet, friendly people, nice beach. shower on the beach.

name: Nautical Valero. Place to kite
description: Www.Nauticavalero.com. This is a great spot for kite surfing. You can camp in your van but Carlos is not that keen on lots of campers, only wants one or two and charges 40,000COP per night, which is a lot when you can camp in so many beautiful places close by for free or for less at some of the other palapa places     If you do decide to camp they have outside shower, running toilets, no hook up but can use the electricity. Hamaca are 20,000 a night. No WiFi. Restaurant but didn’t use. However, you can turn up, park and kite for free during the day. Or take a kit-surf lesson 120,000 per hour.

name: AIR CARGO PACK  BOG
description:
CROSSING THE ITSMUS  BY CHARGE PLANE   727-200F
A single rate includes all the transport service of the motorcycle, always on time, between  Panamá and Colombia, Daily flights

name: Lubricantes libertad
description: Great place to change oil and filter.  Very friendly staff and attentive.  Would definitely come back through here.

name: Cabañas Púlpito
description: Dorms and double rooms with private bathes. very basic and rustic, not very clean and I suspect the sheets weren’t clean. We were not comfortable but the location is the closest to the Púlpito del Diablo trailhead. We were told there is no longer camping at the trailhead by the park office and the guide. The señora, super nice, serves really good food and will give you breakfast at 0430 so you can be on the trail early. I recommend you start at 0500, it took us 10 hours and kicked our butts. We both had terrible altitude headaches. We used Jorge Puentes as a guide (120,000 cop, same price for all the guides) he was excellent!  The shower in our room trickled hot water, electrifier, maybe better in other rooms?  Price was 35,000 per person to sleep, 15,000 lunch, 12,000 breakfast. As I said really good hearty food. See pictures of the parking, not much space but they do allow camping and your vehicle might fit. Pretty steep drive up but we did it in our Honda Element.

name: Canalendres Waterfall
description:
Beside the nearly unused quiet dirt road to the Canalendres Waterfalls, there is space for 2-3 cars to park or camp. About 1km from the main road the route splits, left down to a hanging bridge, right to the parking space. There is a good spot to set up a tent after crossing the bridge.
The Canalendres waterfall itself is a nice spot to picnic, shower or play in the water. To go there, it's a 10 min walk, which directly turns left (up stream along the river) after crossing the bridge. Or you can walk straight to another waterfall Hornoyaco.

name: Oasis Cali Hostel
description:
Hostel vibe with the class of a hotel. new and clean, great showers, free breakfast, comfy beds, moto parking, street parking for cars though very safe area with two security gaurds either side of the hostel. close to bars and restaurants. australian owner has a 4x4 and klr650, knows a lot about Cali and Colombia, plenty of contacts for mechanics places to go etc.
 relaxing place, bbq jacuzzi, 2 tv rooms, amazing kitchen. also has a dance studio.

name: Free Wifi
description: Free, fast, very unstable. aside soccer field

name: Hostal Restaurante Don Renzo
description:
Hostal has two cabins and 3rooms in the main house. It is also a coffee farm. Price is 35pp including breakfast, which includes coffee picked, toasted and ground from the farm as well as other fruits and bread made here as well. Comes with eggs. Amazing stuff! 

Camping is 10 pp, if you would like breakfast (recommended!!) its 6000 pp. more

Luz Angela is an amazing chef, she prepares lunches and dinners, if you are looking to be spoiled and splurge, depending on the dish its between 18,000-35,000 pp.

There is parking and 2 level spots for rigs. 

Luz Angela undertands italian.

If you are interested in coffee culture, Fernando is more than happy to give a coffee tour. The farm sells coffee as for 12,000 the pound. Luz Angela also sells antipasto. 

We were going to spend a night, ended up staying 4. 

For tourism there is Silvia, indigenous town and market, Coconuco with thermals, and the colonial city of popayan is close.

name: Trucker Stop
description: The classic trucker stop - level gravel parking lot. Next to a hotel. Restaurant on site with wifi which reaches the van. Cold showers available. Plus table tennis and ping pong - overlander oasis. None of the trucks have sleeping cabins but there was a guard here right next to us all night - please give him a propina and / or eat in the restaurant. Best place is next to the restaurant / hotel, in front of the hedge (guard might direct you in). Felt safe and it’s a good option if you’re getting a little desperate on the road.

name: Cafe Europa - Italian
description: Best pizza in 6 months traveling! The pizza griega is wonderfull. Take a small one and take albondigas as a starter. Prices are very good, still the same. Wine for 8000, which is unique in Colombia.

name: Villa Marlen
description: Halfway between main road and beach, charched 20T per night in the parking lot, showers, toilets, no wifi, shade, no high restriction, room for tents in the back.

name: Parking Lot
description: Near entrance of Cathedral, not level but not to bad, quiet at night because not in town. 5000,- per day, so you pay 10000,- per night, let them know you want to spend the night there.

name: Brisas del Rio Hotel/Hospedaje (by the river Ovejas)
description:
We found this place just randomly because the next hotel&restaurant mentioned here on iOverlander don't offer accomodation anymore iand also the staff wasn't very friendly. 

Ok, so this place don't have any sign atm but they plan to name it "Brisas del Rio". Owned by Emilse&Rodrige, very friendly and welcoming couple. Their daughter Marly speaks a bit english. We paid 30.000 for double room with private bathroom, very clean, safe and quiet during the night. Unfortunately no wifi. They can make dinner, breakfast, snack for you. And you should definitely try Emilse's "pandebobo"-typical pastry for this region (rings made from yuca, cornmeal and queso).

name: Nativo Kite
description:
Great kite surfing school. English speaking teachers. 120.000 COP. Per hour. Www.nativokiteschool.com. Also have SUPs for rent, a hobie and if you want you can go out on the paramotors or wakeboard   

They also have accommodation dorm room and privates with/without ac. Www.posadakalea.com. 

Nice beach spot and not far from downtown Cartagena.

name: Hotel Panamericano
description: Budget hotel in the center of Santander de Quilichao. Paid 30.000 COP for double room, private bathroom, TV, fan. Basic but clean, friendly staff. They have a storage room for bicycles, maybe even motorbike should fit there.

name: Hospedaje Alimara
description: Budget hotel right next to Panamericana in the small town La Paila. Paid 25.000 for double room with private bathroom, fan. Safe backyard to leave your bicycle, motorbike. Parking for cars only in a front of building.

name: El Sason de mi pueblo
description: A great family run restaurante in the north of town. Providing breakfast lunch and dinner. Freddie is the chef. We had fish cooked beautifully over hot coals and grilled pork served with rice and beans and salad.  20,000 cop for two including soup and juice and coffee. Well worth a visit. You have to enter down a passage way from Calle de Medio (Carerra 2) just as the road widens out with a central reservation. If you want to order something special in advance, check out the menu or get a delivery ring Freddie on 314 639 9288. Really popular with the locals

name: Toyota OEM parts distributor
description: OEM parts store for Toyota.  They had spark plugs and wire sets in stock for our '98 Toyota 4Runner (Toyota dealership did not stock parts for imports but gave us the recommendation).  $16k cop per OEM plug and $148k for the three wire set ($230 for OEM) with free delivery to our hostel in Poblado.

name: Riverside camp
description: There are several good wild camping spots aside river along Jambaló-Toribío road, this is the one we choosed. It a ~50m long dead side road with a lot of foot pathes down to the river. In theory you can be seen from road, but all pass by without looking into. The road has nearly no traffic at night, but anyway you can't hear it due to the river noise.

name: Cali Zoo
description:
A realy good zoo with at least 100 different animal like lions, tiger, tapier, monkeys, crocodil, birds, ... Most animals have big well looking encolsure. We spend a whole great day here.
Opening 8-18, price 20,8k/p + 7k car park.

name: Centro Turistico Brisas del Rio
description: Turistic Center in Supia, they allow us to park inside, it costs 15 mil cop per vehicle per night, the cost must be settled with the person in charge. The place has all basic facilities and a swiming pool. It has security 24 h, it's a safe place to stay.

name: Ecohotel Pensil
description: Really nice, really clean, hotel/love hotel. Spacious rooms with garage are 40,000 COP, basic room 30,000 COP, sleeping in vehicle was 25,000 COP with access to room for bathroom, TV, etc. You may be able to tent camp or use kitchen. I didn’t ask but they were incredibly accommodating. I highly recommend this place for a stopover if you can’t make it from Medellin to Salento. Coffee included. Allowed dogs, no problem. Let us park in garage to work on vehicle. There were employees patrolling parking lot at night, not gated but very well hidden from road— felt very secure. Other guests were staying here for work and said it was very safe. Only downside is lots of truck traffic on nearby road throughout day and night (highway to Manizales is currently rerouted through here), so bring your earplugs if you’re a light sleeper.

name: Ecohotel Pensil
description: Sleeping in vehicle with full access to a room 25,000 COP. See hotel post for more info.

name: Big fancy hotel
description: Didn’t stay, but looks really nice, awesome drive in from Anserma, multiple hotels in town. Really well kept parks and sidewalks. A lovely detour!

name: Cueva de Uribe-Cave
description: On river. Ask at restaurant, or look up on Facebook for details.

name: Energy Motos
description: Excellent location to buy tires and tune up your motorcycle. Edward is the owner and speaks good English. He was a mechanical engineer so he can fix pretty much anything.

name: Oil-Change at Posto Terpel
description: There is the possibility to change oil and oil filter at the Terpel gas station. 15.000 COP per liter 15W40 from a barrel. Free and good service.

name: SOAT
description: The office is located at the corner of Carrera 20 - Calle 15. Here you can purchase your vehicle insurance for Colombia.

name: beach north of Punta de Canoa
description: A rough dirt track leads down past a couple of farms to a wild, almost deserted, windswept beach. Friendly guy from one of the houses came to check we were ok. Access track ideally needs high-clearance vehicle. 4x4 would probably be required if wet. No facilities. Free.

name: Fatima - free yellow fever vaccine
description: bring passports and get free yellow fever vaccine. open daily

name: Airport gate
description: It is at the dead end of a good totally quiet road in front of the gate of the unused local airport. It has road lights and 24h security at the other side of the fence. At sunrise the local cleaning team had their ~30min daily setup meeting at the road some meters away. The airport stuff let us use the toilet.

name: Cartagena friends hostel
description:
nice new hostel in a quiet neighbourhood. safe parking for the bike or 2 cars. friendly owner. air conditioning and good breakfast included in the morning. 
recommended if you don't mind staying a bit far from the center. still, a pretty quick stroll.

name: Attempted Robery, unsafe neighborhood
description: We had time to kill, so figured we would try and take some public transport to our airbnb while we wait for our van.  It dropped us here.  While trying to get a taxi or an uber, a kid ran up and tried to grab our cell phone.  We chased him off, and some locals helped us to GET OUT.  We were told by police, very bad neighborhood.  Don't drive thru here looking for a camp place. It's not safe.  Stay on the main road.

name: Agua Pura
description: 8,000 COP for 20 liters of potable water. The owners live upstairs and said they are open everyday, you just have to knock on their door around the side of the building and they will help you. Large parking area with easy access. No height restrictions.

name: La Divisa Finca Camping
description:
Beautiful, small coffee finca and "organic, natural, sustainable, biodynamic" farm.  Very friendly, energetic owner Javier and his lovely wife Ana will welcome you with open arms and a cup of coffee.  Javier speaks very clear Spanish and is easy to understand. He says you can camp wherever, but there's plenty of level space for 3 or so rigs right at the entrance. No height restrictions, but narrow road to get there.  No 4x4 required.  Camping was quoted at 10,000 COP p/p.  He does a tour of his finca for 50,000 p/p as well.  His tour is better than visiting any Botanical Garden!  If you do the tour, he might not charge you for camping.  He also sells roasted coffee grown here, 40,000 COP for 500grams.  There is a clean bathroom outside with toilet seat and TP, even soap and a hand towel! Water from the tap (agua de la llave) is not potable, but "boiled you can drink it." Also, the finca has 7 friendly dogs. 
Offers breakfast, if asked day before.

name: Bici Ful
description: Great little bike shop. Henry the owner is super helpful and we managed to get everything we needed for new brake lines, gear cables, inner tubes etc. He is open from 8am everyday except Sunday.

name: Road to Reserva Río Blanco
description: After a lovely bird watching tour we were unable to return to Manizales because of a water main break. The road was torn up and no one could pass so we turned around and found this spot. It is a turn off to the right as you head towards the reserve just past the bend in the road that crosses the river where there is also a foot bridge. We had a very tranquil night camped right on the river. We couldn’t get out  so just camped and don’t know if it’s permitted by the owner, but it does appear others have camped there too and it is a spot where they get sand. A local did tell us it was ok. Private secluded spot just off the road.

name: Near hôtel salto de Bordones.
description:
Bad way on  10km. Sliding by rainy weather. parking possible before the entrance of the hotel "Salto of bordones" on the way flat. beautiful view and Cascade beautiful. Quiet night. 2 hours to go to the waterfall (go and return).
Mauvais chemin sur 10km. glissant par temps de pluie. Stationnement possible avant l'entrée de l'hôtel "salto de Bordones"sur le chemin plat. Superbe vue et cascade magnifique.
Nuit calme.2 heures de marches aller retour pour aller a la cascade.

name: Hotel Atahualpa
description: Budget hotel just four blocks from the center. Big room with king bed, shared bathroom. Clean, nice staff. 20.000 COP/night. Secured storage for bicycles.

name: Mirador Valle de la Samaria (+campground, restaurant, lodging)
description: Sendero, restaurante and with lodging coming. You can camp here for 10k pp pn. 8,000 pp to hike the sendero with Don Luis, 1 hour. We didn’t camp so we’re not sure on the facilities. It’s beautiful up here and the tall palms are way cool.

name: Niko Hotel
description: Good hotel, with large parking area for vans and motorhomes. Good location. Clean. Good wifi. Very hot shower. Friendly staff. 50,000 Col for a single room. Parking lot big enough for big rigs.

name: IVECO Navitrans, Duitama
description: First IVECO dealer since we left Alaska. Asked them to renew one leaf spring bushing (rear) and some other items (own spare materials). With the reinstallation of the leaf spring they ruined the ABS system and installed the leaf backwards (leaf with an eccentric centre bolt !! ). Had no diagnose equipment for European IVECO's. So better drive to IVECO Ecuador for proper service.

name: Casa Gypsy
description: Very cool hostel. Lots of breeze and nice people. not a party hostel but it has a bar on the third floor which is a very nice place to hang out, have a beer and watch the sunset. No parking but it seems very secure also because is far from the main area and the bars. still, just few blocks from the beach. friendly staff, dogs and cats. paid 17000 in a dorm with fan. 20000 for AC. I think it s 35000 for a private. one of the cheapest hostel in town for sure.

name: Quiet dead-end road at Bimbo factory
description: You can drive from the official parking lot at the Bimbo factory into a dead-end road. The road goes along the fence of the factory and is not marked in maps.me. There are huge grass fields on the other side. Very quiet at night, as you are far away from Ruta 50. Best to drive reverse into the road, as there is no possibility to turn. Good for a night, close to Bogota and free.

name: El Pata
description: There is a paved way leading off Ruta 45 to the Magdalena River. Drive about 200 m and turn right into a small flat area just before the second yellow traffic sign. Very quiet during the night, some bugs around. You can pitch your tent well hidden from the road if you just follow a tiny path behind the trees and hills.

name: Casa Beija Flor Villa de Leyva
description:
Alternative Hostel with a good garage for big motorcycles. The rooms and facilites are perfect for rest after a long trip. 
Shared and prívate rooms. 
Owners are very chill and easygoing.

name: Finca Los Pinos, San Francisco
description:
This place has a grassy camping area and mostly level and terraced parking close to bathrooms and kitchen area. Big rigs will fit. We stayed on a Sunday, it was very quiet. There is a small tienda selling beer, etc. Wifi was very good. Adjacent road has little traffic, almost none at night. We paid COP12000 pp.
On weekends, they may host events, so it’s best to call ahead: (+57)312-315-1598
They also have rooms in a separate lot about 100 m away. Large level parking area there as well, but no outside bathrooms. We did not check out this area.

name: Truck Stop - free
description: Not a beautiful place, but the best we could find at night after 3 hours driving out of Cartagena. The carpark is huge and if you park at the most remote end you are alone and have ~300m between you and the noisy road.

name: Biomax fuel station
description:
Spend the night here:
hi friendly, clean, quiet.

name: Kasakolà (hostel)
description: one of the cheapest options in town. far from the main strip but nice enough. you can park your bike inside and pitch your tent for 10k. No wifi!! but in town there's plenty of options to steal from. 15k to sleep on a outdoor mattress with nets. 20k for a dorm. hammocks could be even cheaper.

name: Cerros Bike Tours
description: If you fancy a bike tour of the city, Jorge and Jose will make sure you have an unforgettable time. A tour of the City, a visit to the market, a coffee roaster and a game of Tejo if you’re lucky. A great way to see the city. 40,000 COP pp including bikes and helmets. Ring +57 3012348393.  Or find on line. Have fun.

name: Camino Real
description: Hotel. Pool. If you ask nicely they will give you a place for camp free. The price for pool is 8000

name: Galerazamba Hostal
description:
this new hostal is on the firmer grounds if a company workshop. there's a large walled area with some rooms and the owners house as well as hammocks, tables etc. 

the property is an ideal place to unplug for a few days after shipping in a small secluded and quite bizarre old salt mining town. 

the property has a few ramps where vehicles would have previously been worked on. 

they gave cold showers, toilets, electricity, and a kitchen. I don't think they have ever hosted iverlanders but I recommended they do. 

it's super dog friendly!

name: Pullover road between Yopal and Orocué
description:
Grassy spot under some trees at the front of a finca. We just ask the owners and they say it was ok to stay one night. 
Beautiful road between Yopal and Orocue. Tropical savannah landscape , we saw a lot of animals: many birds, horses, cows, buffaloes, deers, capybara, turtles and caimans. 
Beautiful sunrise!!! 
No facilities. Free.
30 km closer to Orocué there is plenty open space to camp.

name: Waterfall Salto Candelas
description:
Entry and small parking lot behind a house. 1 hour hike to the waterfall. Free. Nice house owner is happy about tips. 
Really big and beautiful waterfall. Also place to take a bath in the river.

name: Wisirare - Crocodiles
description:
Kind of refugee for crocodiles and turtles, they raise them and let them free in the river when they are big enough to survive. Really interesting. 
There is also a natural park where you can drive (aprox 12km) and see lots of birds, turtles and "babillas" (small crocodile), no big rigs recommended, max high 2,7m.

name: maritrans
description: here you will collect Bill of Lading once ship arrives RORO. For me I had to pay an invoice 1st and then come back at 2:00 pm for BOL

name: Nelson’s workshop
description: Good mechanic who worked on my Toyota Tacoma. They were very attentive on for me on my way.  Highly recommended.

name: Finca Coquivacoa
description:
The Finca of Raul is accessible by a way, 4x4 vehicle or propulsion desirable. The way appears very well on google.map's. great lawn or you can Park flat, closed and secure. Located on the height of supia 2,5 km of the country beautiful view. Raul can be contacted at 311-302-7817 or contate Gustavo 320-330-3334( Whatsapp ) and speak only spanish. Possibilty de rental a room with 4 bed. quiet and silencio.
price for a night from 10000 pesos.

La finca de Raul est accessible par un chemin ,  véhicule 4x4 ou propulsion souhaitable . Le chemin apparaît très bien sur google.map's. Grande pelouse ou on peut stationner a plat, fermée et sécurisée.  Situé sur les hauteur de Supia ,a 2,5 km de la ville très belle vue. Endroit calme et silencieux.  Raul est joignable au 311-302-7817 ou son ami Gustavo au 320-330-3334 et parle seulement espagnol. Possibilité de louer une chambre avec 4 lits.
Prix a partir de 10000 pesos.

name: fruit and veg shop
description: nice selection of fruit and veg at cheap price. market is only on Saturdays

name: Airport Gate
description: We stayed aside the small access road to the airport at a nice leveled grass area. At the other side of the fence there is a hardworking 24h guard. The ~50m distanced main road is quiet from 23-4 only, but you can't sleep longer with this tropical hot climate anyway. At least it is quieter and full-secure than other free spots in the town.

name: El Retiro
description: Parking in a quiet street with next to children's playground.

name: Casa Santa Rita
description:
This is and new hostel, and is amazing. Incredible confort beds, great common areas, nice kitchen, swimming pool!!! And a nice roof terrace. 

The owner is an Italian guy, very nice and kind, Elena and Arturo are the staff and they are a lovely couple, she made amazing food.

The most important thing... HAVE PARKING. For a lot of motorcycles or a big car. 
I paid 20.000 for a bed in a dorm for 4 whit air conditioned and private bath. Is not hot shower in dorms, only 1 in a common area, is ok because Cartagena is so hot.

Some dorms have double bed if you are traveling whit your couple. But is a share dorm. 

You can use the kitchen, but if you don’t want cook, Elena sales for 10.000 breakfast, lunches and dinners. Beer, and other stuff for sale. 

Great place!!!

Address: Calle 55 y Carrera 17

name: Mundi Autos
description: General mechanics who seem to know what they’re doing - make sure the patron double checks everything though. They also look at electrics and will do lube changes. Workshop is under cover - height restriction of approx 3.5m. Good cheap lavado next door. Nice guys.

name: restaurante delicias de mi pais
description: menu del dia is now 7.000cop. you can choose a lot of combinations. pretty good-not excellent. fool of locals !

name: La Casa de Dany
description: A nice hotel ta stay. They have wifi (sometimes disappearing but pretty decent), a kitchen, back yard for parking etc. Room with private bath 30000 but we got one with shared bath for 15000. The room comes with TV, towels, soap, toilet paper etc. Probably can also stay in vehicle. They also have a restaurant but since it's a small town, everything is walking distance.

name: Check'in Tour Agency
description: To get into the Barbas Bremen Reserve you need to go with a guide. To hire the guide we came to this agency, they  assigned us a local tour guide name Luis (Lucho) who took us right into the valley. He share with us all his knowledge about the area, plant, animal, history..... A Jeep take us closer to where the hike starts and from there we walk down a big slope between a very dense vegetation. Here we hear the howling of the howler monkey

name: Hacienda Venecia
description:
We stay in our van atthe hostel, here we could use all the facilities at any time. It is very quiet and the stuff is friendly. price is 22.000 / person. Free coffee all day long and  a great pool to chill in the coffee longe. The views are great.  
We spend 4 days /3 night at Hacienda Venecia. The palce is a paradise of peace where we can combine both; relaxation and a wide range of activities.  We did several free hike on its surronding and the coffee tour which make you part of the whole coffee prodution process. It is also a perfect place for birdwhaching; colorful birds fly all over the hacienda.      
wifi works good!         Potable water for free. Electicity included.

name: Multiservicios Villa SAS
description:
Gerardo is a great mechanic that helped us fix a few broken bolts from our pannier racks. He got the bolts out, tapped new threads and turned an alu bushing we lost somewhere in Africa. After having worked on the bikes for over an hour, he refused any payment. A golden mechanic with a golden heart! Welding, turning etc... is all possible here with free entertainment from the locals included! Amalfi itself is actually pretty nice as well.

motomorgana.com

name: Casa del retenedor
description: everything you need for bearings and seals. I bought my water pump seals here for my ktm 1190. cheeeeeap!!

name: Empanadas Aji's
description: wow! if you like spicy sauces and good empanadas...this is a secret gem in bogota. 2000 per empanadas with lots of beautiful handmade sauces.

name: street n°8 quiet.
description:
Street quiet for the night, no traffic. Near office  police .

Rue tranquille pour passer la nuit . Commissariat de police au coin de la rue.

name: Balneario Canahuay
description:
This community pool on the outskirts northwest of Garagoa is run by a friendly, local family. It has tent camping areas near the pool. We parked in front of the main building on level ground. Toilets are basic (no seat, no paper) but cleaned daily. The six showers are simple (a pipe) in a communal shower room; there are private booths for changing. There is a small store for beer and such, but you can order-ahead a lunch, and the friendly staff will cook something for you. The soup and empanadas we ate were homemade and very good.
Being a community pool, it can be busy, especially on weekends. Of course, there is music during the day, but at a tolerable volume when local folks use the pool. During the six days we were here, including a weekend, it was always quiet by 7 pm.
We were the only campers during our off-season stay. We paid 10k Pesos per person per night. We did not use the pool. Electricity is available by extension chord; we didn’t need any.
Garagoa has an immense Ceiba tree in the center in its plaza! There is a local market every day, bigger on Thursdays and biggest on Sundays. Do try the Arepas Boyacenses made fresh daily over a charcoal fire.
We used this small town as a base to visit villages in the area; very authentic, tranquil, and enjoyable. We hired a taxi with local driver for a full day. Ask the pool staff for recommendations.

name: Roadside
description: very quiet at night. perfect to rest after 38 km after ugly dirt road. good leveled, for big riggs even for a bunch oft motorhomes.

name: Tena Plaza - free
description: Tena is a peaceful small village. At the plaza there is a brick building with surprisingly clean toilet and power supply. There is connection to a free slow Wifi network (Unidos…) and locals told us their water is best quality and direct drinkable. A real free parking place can be found 200m away in front of the church with 24h security from school and video surveillance.

name: autofull
description: mechanic with good know how in mechanic, electronic, electricity and maintance

name: SKP Silenciadoras y Exhostos
description: Awesome shop for exhaust systems. The owner Jose was really nice and helpful. Not sure if they speak English. We had a new muffler fabricated in galvanized steel for our VW Vanagon.  Total cost including install was $180,000 COP.

name: Near Oiba
description: Large field near a restaurant and the road quiet night. Nice bathrooms.

name: M.M. Repuestos (LiquiMoly)
description: High quality German products such as Mann, LiquiMoly, KNN.  Awesome lubrication and filters supplier. Not sure if coordinates will work because we aren’t there now so here they are just in case (4.6594962,-74.0720410).

name: Prestigio (Electric Shop)
description: We had our power windows checked and serviced here. The owner Henry is super helpful, honest and gives fair prices. They even helped us look for some other odds and ends around the are.  Buena gente!

name: Wide street near plaza and river
description: Nice wide dead end street that faces the pedestrian walkway and river. No other cars there when we were. Better than the other street near the plaza because curbs are lower so you can get your doors open.

name: Hotel Juanmar
description: Three year old family run hotel right on the beach near the village of Santa Veronica. Hosts Elkin and Maria speak perfect English and run a delightful beach hotel with pool, bar and restaurant. Room to park outside in front of hotel at edge of beach and use all facilities, including shower and toilet. Tents are ok but it might be a bit tight for a super big rig. Very safe, super friendly and a beautiful spot. Highly recommended.

name: Montmartre
description: A great French restaurant that we, as French People, do recommand. The manager has dual nationality, French and Colombia. Ambiance and music are very good. Closed on Monday.

name: Restaurant with camping possibility
description: The drive from Salento to Toche is just breathtaking, but has not a lot of camping possibilities. We arrived in the evening at this restaurant and we were allowed to camp in their garden with amazing views and well hidden from / above the street. 4x4 an advantage, enough space for big rigs (1-2). 15,000 COP for 2 with a Defender. Very friendly owners, nice dogs (no barking at night), quiet and safe.

name: Casa Capital hostel
description:
one of the cheapest options in town. 15000 for a shared dorm. clean, new and comfortable beds.
very friendly owner and volunteering staff. 
good wifi and nice kitchen. feels more like a house than a hostel. there s secure parking for motorcycles.
my favourite neighbourhood too, since it s very very quiet at night.

name: Motorysa Mercedes Freightliner
description: Modern Garage for Mercedes, Freightliner and Fuso. If you travel with a heavy truck and need service or original Mercedes parts, this is your place. Osmar Guarin, head of service, speaks a bit English. If it gets complicated with the communication ask for Javier, Salesmanager. He can help with an excellent English. Everybody is friendly, helpful and organized. Best experience in a Mercedes garage since we left Germany 4 years ago.

name: La Fonda del Pueblo
description: Great night dining at La Fonda del Pueblo. The Nutibara hill, where it is located, offers a beautiful panoramic view of Medellín. The house, converted into a restaurant is very colorful and decorated to the detail, following the purest paisa tradition, which is also reflected in the food and of course, in the treatment of the guys who work there. I would repeat without hesitation. The trout, the salad, the bass and the sangria were great.

name: IVECO Navitrans Bogota
description:
great garage Iveco, great parking. professional. Good job. rate for shock absorbers 3 times cheaper than Costa Rica. 
open Monday to Friday from 8 am to 17:30 and Saturday 8am 14:00.


Grand garage Iveco, grand parking. Professionnel. Bon travail. Tarif pour des amortisseurs 3 fois moins cher qu’au Costa Rica.
Ouvert du lundi au vendredi de 8h à 17h30 et le samedi de 8h 14h00.

name: Piedra del Peñol
description:
Very nice view at the end of the parking 5000cop not to be missed or opportunity to climb to the top of the granite monolith (659 steps) for 18000cop per person.

Très belle vue au bout du parking 5000cop a ne pas rater ou possibilité de grimper en haut du monolithe de granit (659 marches) pour 18000cop par personne.

name: IVECO NAVITRANS
description:
Good garage, less big and less equipment than in Bogota correct price.
Parking near the restaurant very noisy at night but kept 24h

name: Medellin City Services
description: We did a private Tour ( Comuna 13 and Pablo Escobar with this company) They were great, and Manuel Garcés, the local tour guide, took us around the city in his car, telling and showing us for 5 hours all about Escobar, the comuna 13 and much more. It is nice to have a guide we actually lived and experience life back then.

name: Hotel Premium Real
description: The hotel is great, low houses surronding a nice swimmingpool. It is located in El Poblado neighborhood. Very quiet area and parking is included in the price.  2 people in a Double big room for 35€ both of us with breakfast.  Stuff very friendly. Nice place to park and explore the city.

name: Motel
description: Motel on the road. Nothing fancy but do the job. Quite a big garage in the room but don't fit a big rig. We arrived late at night and paid 25 000 kop.

name: Hotel pizzeria opera Tolu
description: The hotel is very quiet,and the sea is a 1 minute to walk,have a internal parking and the pasta and pizza is very delicious,speak  Spanish Italian and English

name: Hôtel Victoria
description:
just a small hotel clean quiet with wifi and just down town. 
the rooms are not big bit get a/c .
safe place to storage bicycle. 
we've paid 30 000 pesos for 2 persons

name: MixClean - KaMaLavar
description: laundromat. 5kg service washing and drying = 30.000 - 90 minutes

name: Hotel/Restaurant
description: Huge parking lot between Biomax station and hotel/restaurant. Restaurant had us park next to restaurant – most level spot. Owner invited us in to eat at his restaurant if we’d like. We did. Very good full course meals for 12,000. Several trucks stopped there for overnight also.

name: Grassy Field next to the road
description:
We stayed 2 very quiet nights here, it is a kind of lookout with a beautiful view over the laguna. Entry is next to the wooden shack, there are no facilities. We asked the neighbors and they were fine with us to stay. 

First they had asked us for 5,000 to spend the night, then the lady arrives to say that it is 20,000 with an bad attitude. she does not provide any service not even a bathroom. the place is neglected and they do not have a real plain where to park the vehicle properly

name: Hotel Brisa Caribe
description: Cheap hotel, good room, with 60,000 col fan for two people. Good location, near Laguito and the beach. There are 24 hour supermarkets and all services nearby. Attentive staff Garage in front of the hotel, suitable for motorhome and mini vans.

name: Mandala Hostel
description: the cheapest and most convenient hostel near the airport. 25000 for shared dorm. very cool spot. fast wifi and 2 nice chill out areas. pods concept for bedding. yoga classes too. No parking.

name: Night Spot - terpel
description: We just looking for some place for night. This is parking area between petrol stadion and bus parking.

name: Primax
description:
Big gas station with car wash, restaurant, bathrooms, showers. They accept credit card. Hotel and Car Wash.
If you need to, you can stay here overnight.

name: Excelent Street Restaurant
description:
Restaurant Su Mercéd. Stop for lunch. We ordered lomo (steak) and fish (both with rice, potatoes and small salad). Meal encluded soup, really big portion and fresh juice with ice. We can chose from maracuya, pineapple, tomatoe or berries.
Absolutelly delicious lunch (really huge portions) and kind people. 
Price was 32.000.

name: Petrobras station
description: A/C gas station with clean toilet. you can buy some small snack here or take a coffee. They accept credit card, but Wi-Fi is not here.

name: Street parking next to park
description:
met Gabriel at the salt mine.  he was an awesome guide who iffered us to park near his parents restaurant/apartment. we had a giant hamburger and then he offered us the use if his hot shower. the restaurant is called Bocados and the family are all super nice. we could use the toilet until 10:00 pm and then in the morning after 8:30. 

Gabriel might move back to Venezuela but his parents will still be here I think. 

gabriels phone number: +57 302 3297398

name: Free WI-FI
description: in the plaza. standard public WiFi deal.

name: Local restaurant Mauritana
description:
Stop for lunch. Restaurant near road, nice shadow area, windy - perfect for us, weather is around 30 degrees.
Menu with soup. We had a fish (with rice, local potatoe and veggies). They have no fresh juice, just bebidas from fridge - not included in total price.
2x Fish with soup (20.000) + coca cola = 38.000 pesos

name: Shopping mall with Wi-Fi
description:
Some km before Cartagena is gas station. This gas station is in area with shops and restaurants. 
Pizzeria has Wi-Fi without password. Toilet available too.

name: Centro commercial getsemani
description: great place for essentials such as photocopying, tailor, paper supplies. lots of small stalls in covered building.

name: free potable water
description: small tap for spring water on the hill bext to salt museum. you can drive close and connect a pipe if you want. you need a 50 foot hose at leastbor just use bottles.

name: Communications tower
description: A side track from the main road runs about 500 metres up to a point with a communications tower. We were greeted by a very friendly watchman who is there full time and actually asked us to camp. Spectacular views in all directions but a bit chilly at 2820 metres!  The side track up is steep but ok and there was room for our 7 metre rig. No facilities at all but we gave the watchman a beer.

name: Mobil Station and SOAT
description: SOAT office closed on weekends, but you can buy or extend car insurance here.

name: Parolaccia Restaurant Parking Lot
description: Large and level lot behind the restaurant. 30k per vehicle for 24hours. Guards are very nice, restaurant owner nicer. We had arranged to come here as the owner is Friend of Santiago from mi Refugio in Villa de Leyva. But it appears that other park overnight here as well, and they didn't mind us being here at all. We were able to use the bathrooms through the night as well. hamburgers in the restaurant are huge and yummy. Free Wifi in the restaurant, large enclosed patio area that you can hang out in during the day. some of our devices could reach the wifi in the far end of the lot as well.

name: Corrupt police
description: This road seems to be famous for corrupt police. We drove down from Santa Marta towards Cartagena. Police stopped us because we crossed a double line - yes we made a mistake. But when they told us how little they earned as policemen, I told them we respect the work they are doing and we are happy to pay a fine, but we are not ok with paying on the spot to these two - meaning no bribery with us, but fine no problem. All in different words and politely, so after short discussions they let us go with a warning. Obey the rules on this road especially!

name: San Juan Church on the road to Medelin
description:
Parking lot on side of the church just near the police station. Free.
Nice place with sport games, trees and flowers.
Street food at night. A bit noisy on the day but calm all night long even on a saturday night.
The police is very nice and told us it is ok to stay and to ask them if we need something. Just park not to close to the police station (police secure area).

name: caucasia center
description: Free parking place in the middle of town. calm all night and secure. very friendly people. highly interested in the RV and trip. free wifi.

name: Facatativa place
description: a nice place in front of a church. ok with local "casa de policia" but on the other side to be out the perimeter of security. no facilities but nice people and quiet at night until 6AM. good for 1 night.

name: El Bony boxer’s restaurant
description:
Owner is olympic champion, in restaurant are his old photoes. Restaurant is on the beach.
This is kind of local restaurant, and the prices are not expensive. 
We had two jugos naturales, ceviche mix (medium size) and two main meals (both sea foods). We paid 57.000 pesos. 
Portions was big and it was really tasty. We can recomended this place.

name: ATM
description: ATM in village, near main square, where is na amazing church. And a lot of shops, restaurants, coffee, etc.

name: Texaco station with shower
description:
Texaco gas station. They accept credit card.
Clean toilet and shower. Cold water, but just for 500 pesos.
And coffee, but just sweet - for 2.000 pesos. 
Near is restaurant Rinch Ric.

name: Shopping Mall with free Wi-Fi
description:
Huge shopping mall - lot of shops, restaurants and thinks for reparing and camping. 
In “Homecetre” is free Wi-Fi.

name: Servicios Integrales para la Movilidad
description:
ADMIN NOTE: User reports:"They overprice the insurance fees a 120%. They are not willing to make corrections of there own mistakes. I made a petition at the insurance main office in the next big town."

SOAT sold to foreign vehicles. I could not find the other place listed. 200k for 2 months for a moto. Process easy and fast. The place is a tiny booth between Emcofunerales and Suzuki store

name: Parking for big trucks
description:
We found this secure parking area near city centre. Perfect for trucks 4,5 m high.
For small car is 1.500 per hour, for bigger 2.000 per hour and for motorbikes is 600 pesos per hour.

name: Ruta 45
description: if you need a good tank of "premium diesel" this place was not much more than the regular diesel. local mechanics directed me here after a clogged fuel filter issue.

name: Hosteria Ambeyma
description: Big room with private bathroom & balcony. It is not the newest but clean and away from main street. With fan 45k, with AC 60k. The down for us were no warm shower either wifi signal in the room. There are one 15m sport pool and a kids pool with kids slide, very nice for a hot day. Warning: if there is an event may get very very noisy. We had one on Sat., fortunately they left 11pm-7am quiet.

name: Mar Azul
description: A basic hotel. A room with a big bed and a ventilator 30,000, with AC 45,000. Rooms small but clean etc. A small motorcycle can be brought inside.

name: Vegas del Farallon
description:
Paid 60,000 COP for two people in a room with double bed. Nice place with a swimming pool. Gated parking. 

Check out is at 8:30am for some reason.

name: Bongo Hotel
description: Hotel next to parking lot. Paid 35k COP for a comfy room with AC. Parking is not gated but you can pull up right next to the hotel.

name: tourist office
description: free english city tour at 2:00 pm daily. only 20 spots so either register or stop by in advance if it’s a busy season.

name: Vis à Vis Posada Campesina
description: Correct name of place: Finca El Manantial. Posada Campesada was fully booked and therefore we ended up at their neighbors. They also offer space for camping (tent and cars) as well as a dorm & room (no idea of the price). We had a level spot and as a courtesy they offered us coffee upon arrival and showed us a YouTube Video about the sights on their big flat screen at the dorm. Everything is very  simple but the owner is very zealous and helpful. Bathroom very clean and shower lukewarm. There is a little covered terrace with chairs, a table and a hammock as well as light and electricity sockets. They also provide a small kitchen (not so clean) with a fridge and cooking stove for use. A big green meadow offers enough space for lots of tents and there is no hight restriction for big rigs. WiFi works well. He asked for COP 10‘000 pp/pn, only recently opened up the business.

name: Tuk Tuk Restaurante Bar
description: Beautiful view. The prices were on the high side (Mains cost 25,000 to 30,000), although the service was excellent. We had the Pad Thai, lots of chicken and shrimp on it, but very saucy and little or no spice. The ingredients seemed very fresh, including the tamarind.

name: Hostel Huitaca
description: Finca / Hostel Huitaca  A organic coffee Finca . Only a 10 minute walk to San Agustin. Very quiet and you can get meals here. I got a beautiful room over looking the farm with private bath and a great porch for 30,000

name: Bunsizanisi
description:
Excellent hotel with nice view on the sea. Recently open (1 year), nice room with air conditionning and very clean swimming pool. We paid 60$ for 4 people (2 adults and 2 kids) with breakfast. Possibility to use kitchen to cook. 
Info@bunsizani.com
Tel: +573008494109

name: Carulla
description: Big Carulla Supermarket with international stuft. And a Parkinglot!

name: Sapzurro to Turbo
description:
Contact Mario - he can sort out getting you and your bike from Sapzurro to Turbo or vice versa. The price is far too much but it was the only option I could find. $150 for motorcycle and $25 for you. It’s a Cargo boat that leaves every Monday or Tuesday early in the AM. I ended up having to pay an additional $40 to the crew for going in between boats to get to the dock at Turbo. They wouldn’t take my bike off the boat until I paid. Make sure you have enough money before arriving in Sapzurro, no ATM’s available and you want to spend as little time in Turbo as possible. 

This location is also Mario’s La Posada and campground, nice grassy place for camping right on the beach with new bathrooms and showers. Can park bike right next to your tent. 

Mario
+57 310 4102245

name: Ferny Logging Road
description:
Rare wild camping opportunity in Columbia.  

The spot is pretty basic and is just a small turnout off a quiet logging road, but there is no one around and it's in the woods.  We camped right in the turnout and were very happy, but from here another small steep road leads down the hill 100m to a very pretty, secluded spot.  It was wet when we were here so decided not to risk it in our 2wd Sprinter, but if you had 4wd it would be no problem.  Recommend that you walk it first.  

There is some road noise from the main highway but it's not too obtrusive.  From what we saw this small road is used for pretty much only for logging.  All traffic was large trucks or motos, no buses or people walking.  Friendly waves all around.  No traffic at night.  Big rigs might have some trouble maneuvering in the tight area and finding a level spot.  

We've found that there are not many true wild camping spots in Colombia so we were excited to find this place.  We ended up staying two nights to get some chores done on the van.

name: Sayta
description:
This lovely little hostel was our home for over a month. We bought our car in Bogotá and converted it in front of the hostel.
Jon has been the most amazing host, friend and supporter. Without him Bogotá wouldn't have been the same. He has a beautiful heart and loves to help and make people laugh. 
Breakfast is included and you are invited to help yourself to coffee the whole day. 

The double room is 60.000COP, try to get the one upstairs, it's much nicer. 
There are secure parking lots all around that cost 12.000COP for 12h during the night.

Give Jon a hug from us, we miss him a lot!

name: Brot
description:
Oh, how we miss their almond croissants!

The bread however was not worth the money.

name: DIJIN
description:
This is the place to get the car you are interested in checked by Interpol if it has any criminal record. 
During the week there is a small bus in front of it where you can pay the cost. Otherwise you have to go to a certain bank (unfortunately forgot which one) to pay the cost there. Of cause there is not a single one close by. So better pay the slightly higher price and safe the time.

name: La Rayuela Hostal y Cabaña
description:
ADMIN NOTE: Please do not add any additional images. Owner email address is incorrect. Please correct. 
.....
Country hostal with 4 rooms with a/c and space for 6 cars. It is 5 minutes from airport, 10 minutes from rodadero. Kitchen, Laundry and a small pool. we want you to feel at home here. Camping area for $ 8 a person , enough space for caravans and motorcycles

tel 3106401965 or 3054399212
.....

Es un hostal campestre que queda a 5 minutoss del aeropuerto, 10 del rodadero y 30 de santa marta. Contamos con habitaciones con aire acondicionado, cocina, lavanderia, parqueadero privado y una refrescante piscina, zona de camping. Especial para viajeros con carros, motos y bicicletas por solo $ 30 mil pesos por persona. Ayudamos  a viajeros con problemas en autos

name: Julios Place
description: Private big nice huts close to the beach with 2 bedrooms, bathroom and kitchen for 40.000 pP. Julio is very nice and likes guests very much.

name: Calypso - Material for wrapping bycile for the boats
description:
FOR CYCLISTS!!
If you go on a boat and you are searching for a plastic to wrap your bycicle - this is the place to go! You can buy it on meters in different sizes and strenght types :)

name: Motorysa - Mercedes Freightliner Workshop
description: Had been here with our Mercedes Atego. Friendly, helpful guys. Had some small things to repair. They can order original Mercedes Parts.

name: seguros del estado
description: easy fast and organized. go here to renew vehicle insurance.

name: Free grassy space in front of gym. Police approved
description:
Grassy space in front of a gymnasium. Very muddy in rainy season, but could sped one night with our 21 feet rig.
No amenities, but quiet for a night. The only place to stay in Mongui.

Petit terrain en herbe devant une salle de basket . une  petite partie plate. 
Une nuit passée ici sans soucis. Je pense que c'est public, sans certitude.
Gros camping car ok.

name: Free wild camp - great view
description: We did not sleep here, but stoped for a lunch break. In our opinion this is the best place on this road. There is a place for one car to park next to a road. Only infrastructure is a nice bench to enjoy the view.

name: Hotel Casa Vieja
description:
Probably the nicest room we’ve stayed in the entire trip, but you wouldn’t know it from the outside. AC, fast wifi, flatscreen, super clean, great shower (cold)/ bathroom and secure parking that will fit larger rigs (maybe not bus size). 40000 for a room for 2.

There is no sign outside, just a big black gate. Knock loudly or ring the bell. The owner’s name is Alfredo. If heading south, turn right before La Piña restaurant (which has typical set plate meals for 10000).

update 2023: its 60k now, you can ask for 50k

name: Truck Stop
description: We didn't stay here but big truck stop with a nice restaurant. Plenty of parking spots.  No shade.

name: Zuasinca Hostal Campestre
description: Established country hostel, 1.5Km from the main town of Barichara. Great place to stay, lovely hosts (Stella & Carlos). Four ample cabañas with own bathroom and availability of shower/bathroom for overland guests. Stella is a fabulous cook! Cost of meals is reasonable and delicious. $25,000 COP per night for vehicles. Large enough to park a couple of medium to large size rigs.

name: Las Cabañas de Pino
description:
We didn’t mean to stay 4 nights but this place is an oasis! We did not camp but it is available for 15,000 cop per person per night (edit: price is 25000). Grassy shady area for one maybe 2 vehicles, probably not appropriate for bigger rigs. There are bathrooms and showers and a kitchen you can use. Just outside of town but a quick walk to centro, maybe 10 minutes. Víctor Manuel is very nice and you may be able to negotiate price. We stayed in a nice cabana for 40,000 cop per person, it had a comfortable bed and a kitchen. Very tranquil at night! The pool is divine. 
———-
Access: 
from road 62 take the northernmost street in Santa Fe by the sports field. Don’t drive through the town as GPS might tell you coming from south. 
Big rigs: 
no problem at all for our Iveco daily 6,30 m long, no height restriction. In our opinion even a 8 m rig or longer would fit here. There is almost no restriction despite the area is occupied by other cars.

name: River cross with small boat
description:
10000 for 2 people and one bike.Small boat, ok for big adv bike like 1200gs. Very easy. ok for motorcycles 13/01/2019
After the boat (going from Villavieja to Aipe), it will only be a small camino, crossing 3 very small bridges, 1 river crossing and riding in the middle of the field with the cows...enjoy !!

name: Makako Chillout Hostel
description: Nice mellow hostel ran by two young local women. Really good location near restaurants and cafes. Space to squeeze in two motorcycles behind the locked front door.  Dorms $13

name: Hotel Madre Laura
description: New Hotel. 35.000 for single (large bed) room with private bathroom. Breakfast included. Nice room. 5 min. Walk from the plaza. Safe underground parking for motorcycles and cars. Amazing hot shower.

name: Guaca parque principal
description: Very good for overnight. We got permission from police station and parked in front of the Church. It is quite at night. Police station is nearby and the town is safe. Little shops, restaurants around. Restroom in small hotel-restaurant for 500 COP.

name: Good and cheap welder
description:
We had a problem with bumper on our Mercedes motorhome. This welder (Soldador in Spanish) was fast and helpfull. He can not speak English and he do not accept credit cards, but he helps us and price was really cheap, only 10.000 pesos for his work. 
He closed his garage on lunch time.

name: Hotel 47
description: Suuuuper fancy hotel with rooftop bar, best showers ever and superclean and comfortable rooms. We paid 17€, about 25 USdollar, for a super luxurious room including breakfast (2 persons, via booking.com). Metro station in short walking distance. They have secured parking for rigs up to about 2.40m high, and there's several parking lots for bigger rigs further in the street. They even have rooms with private jacuzzi's... looked very nice. Highly recommended!

name: La casa del Amortiguador
description: New shock absorbers !!! free review and installation !! Cra. 5 No. 1a - 94 neiva - huila ws 314 421 85 79 Tel. 860 04 57 narlyg@hotmail.es

name: Villa del puente real
description:
A nice moderne hotel.
clean big rooms, just downtown with a safe parking. 
rooms for two around 50 000 pesos

name: hostal Bonaire
description:
As we were in Salento during  « Semana Santa », all the good places on iOverlander were full.
We found this little hostal in the house of the owners. Very friendly, free and very good expresso all day long. We had a double room for 50000.
No parking but I managed to put my Vstrom 650 without the luggage inside the little garden. I think you can put up to 3 motorcycle inside.
Very calm, clean and peaceful place, 5mn by foot from the center.
Hot shower, fast WiFi.

name: Girasoles vegetarian menu
description: Vegetarian meal of the day for 12.900. This includes soup, meal and juice. They accept cards and also have a wifi.

name: Blue Sailing veleros
description:
Para viajar a Panamá, por las Islas San Blas, en velero. 
El trato con el cliente no es el mejor pero pudimos contratar un buen servicio, cuesta 550 dólares por persona, bastante caro pero el servicio en el barco es de los Mejores. 
El viaje dura 5 días, 2 de navegación en mar abierto y 3 paseando por distintas islas de San Blas. 
Viajamos en el velero Koala Sailing, con el capitán Fabián Arcila, excelente viaje. Comida de primera, el trato en el barco es de los mejores, las islas son fabulosas y la tripulación está al servicio de lo que necesites.

name: Donna Josefa
description:
Qute Little Hotel with a huge Parking, the food is excellent and inexpensive. Use of toilets and showers. Direkt on the river als for bathing.
They asked for no fee...

name: Restaurant with a view
description: Not sure about the name of this family run restaurant, but they have delicious food and fresh juices. Perfect stop for lunch on your way to Medellín.

name: Terpel 24h
description: Heading north on Route 45 (which is a good highway) there was this surprise: a top modern Terpel with reasonable fuel prices and ample concrete parking outside of any visible settlement. 24h shop & A/C Bistro with free Wifi, food and coffee (rather expensive). Friendly staff. Modern & clean bathroom including free showers. Overnight stay in a rig should be possible, even in front of illuminated bistro, however we do not know if they have a safety guard during nighttime.

name: Los Hermanos Hostel
description: Another Hostel on the beach. We stayed on the estacionamiento for 20 pppn. Nice place but it ran off water twice. There is a very nice hostel next to it, Las Brisas but don't know if you can overland.

name: Hostal La Casita de Anny
description: cheap and nice place to stay, 15.000 COP per person per night, with garage for cars and motorcycles. tv, fast Wi-Fi and for the price, the place is nice.

name: Rio La Miel
description:
recharge your body and mind with a day tour floating through La Miel River, with a beautiful landscapes of the forest, you can swim and fishing in the river, by the end of the day you will go back to your hotel with a big smile and tired physically.

look up for Amani Tours, the best in the town, friendly and excellent service with a good price

name: La Hacienda San Gil
description:
Cool hostel about 4 miles outside of town with great views of San Gil and surrounding mountains. Right now being ran by Jane, a British woman who is very friendly. There’s a huge concrete slab in front of the hostel where rigs can park and set up camp. Can set up a tent on the grass as well. Nice and clean facilities inside, hot showers, big kitchen, good WiFi. Road up here is a little sketchy on motorcycle if muddy but not a huge problem. Highly recommended.

Dorms: 20,000 COP
Family style Dinner: 15,000 COP

Jane’s # 
tel:+447930367781

name: El Khalifa
description: Very nice restaurant that serves food from the Middle East. It's delicious and a good change if you're a bit tired of rice. Price range from 17'000 to 30'000 COP.

name: vet
description: 20,000 for exit certificate. very thorough check but fast and easy

name: Parking lot.
description: There is a free parking lot at the riverside of the road. You can park 50 meters away. No traffic so it is quiet. The sound of the river only. The spot is big enough for any size of the rig. A very friendly family lives next to spot. You can use their facilities for a donation.

name: lubricentro do merdardo
description: fast easy oil change big bays for large trucks. right on main road. wide selection of oils

name: EcoaventuraX-Suroeste
description:
Small local run hospedaje with large secure grass field area for camping.  Not sure it has an official name, but it’s next door to the Canto de Agua backpackers Hostel.  Asked for 25,000pp.

The owner is friendly, but pretty hands off.  The bathrooms were kept somewhat clean and the very cold showers very refreshing.  Couple of nice dogs on the premises that seemed ok with the dogs of other guests.  There is a kitchen in a small covered area but only had running water, a wood stove and power (didn’t use).  Didn’t seem super functional.  Free plántanos available.  This would be a great place for big rigs.  

We were really happy with this spot, and would recommend it.  It’s an easy, 1km, walk to town.  Nice area and reasonably quiet.  You have a nice view on to a field of peppers and bananas.  Rosters are a bit bad but your in Colombia, get used to it.

name: Residencias Universidad de Caldas
description: Close to the Palo Grande stadium, the University of Caldas male residencies. You can park, ask permission to a student to use the bathroom and kitchen.

name: Pescao Kite Surf (+Hotel+Tourist attraction)
description: Great place to stop and kitesurf. They also provide accommodation (rooms 100,000 COP pn for 2 including breakfast, tents inside 30,000 COP).  We spoke with Pescao and stayed about 250m up the road in our van, very secure and right on the waterfront. Kiting here is 20,000COP per day, they have a boat so very safe (rescues are 20,000 COP). Also provide breakfast and lunch - best cooked trout we’d had and allow use of kitchen in the evening (just ask). Great place. Everyone really friendly. You can rent equipment or take lessons. Contact 311 352 3293 or find them on www.pescaokitesurf.com.

name: Lubricantes la 24
description:
This is a very good place to change oil and filters. They also sell many things for the car. 
The people here was very nice with us and they helped us a lot.

name: Miguel's Casa Espanola
description:
Great apartment-like accommodations in a clean, secure, gated neighborhood. 15 minute walk to old town, 10 minute walk to Castle and mall. Paid 200,000 COP for 3 nights ($23/night) in private room with a/c, private bathroom, shared kitchen & living area with tv & good wifi.  He also has dorm/hostal accommodations for less is new remodeled building. Miguel is great host, speaks English and will help with directions/maps/suggested day trips/food/shopping, etc. Contact him via WhatsApp.     
+57 315 7496032

It's a 14,000 COP Uber ride from airport to the neighborhood. Driver will drop you at front guard gate.  

This is a great safe place to unwind/wait for shipping to/from Panama!  FYI- there is a Ford car dealership across street if you need any auto repairs/help.

name: ecoloasis
description:
truck parking.
very safe.
gardian, water, restaurant, shower etc...

very nice people, ask for Julian

name: Hotel Villa Blanca with free parking
description: New hotel. Very clean and confortable. Double room with hot shower 60.000 cop. Breakfast 5000 cop p.p. Fast wifi. Secure parking with hight restriction. Have space for about 10 cars. Good location. Just need to cross a bridge to center. On booking there are comments about hookers in this area, but we saw none on thursday night, looked empty and calm on the street then we arrived.

name: Hotel La Provincia
description:
New small hotel.
clean, quiet and cheap 50 000 pesos for 2 persons.
