they have a safe storage for bicycles and a private locked parking

name: Sueño Real
description: New hotel. Big underground parking. Not for big rigs I guess. 20.000 COP for a single room with private bathroom. Kitchen facilities in the rooftop with great views over the mountains.

name: Salsa Museum
description: Learn about the history of Cali’s (Columbia’s) greatest salsa band; Grupo Niche and their founder Jario Varela. Catch a show if you are lucky!

name: Museo del Oro
description: Gold museum. Free. Closed Sunday and Monday.

name: Windsurf & Sailing
description: Good spot to rent Windsurf for beginners (50 000 COP for 1h) or Sunfish boat (100 000 COP for 1h). Park at Zazué Plaza mall, it's secured and free. Then go walking to the beach, the club is located in front of the Irotama hotel.

name: La Española Boutique
description:
Great place to stay in Cartagena while waitting to ship the vehicle and to explore the city.
It is a house of 4 levels. Every floor has its private big kictchen a facilities. the are only 3 bedrooms per level, one of them with private bathroom, which mean one bathroom is share between 2 rooms. It is very quiet and is located into a private complex, so can leave the van for a few days if needed for no extra cost. We paid 43$ for 3 noght / 2 people. Recomended.

name: Laundry
description: It is a private house right on the side of the road. The facade is pink and blue. It is also a mechanic garage and the lady in the house do laundry for a very  good price.   2 regular shopping bags 10.000 COL. Clean and Dry. The family is supper nice, very friendly. She also prepar homemade food to take away if you ask.

name: Hôtel Sucre
description:
a nice family hotel. 
downtown but quiet, safe storage for bicycles and kitchen access 
for 60 000 or 50 0000 pesos for 2 persons

name: Hotel EcoMagia di Sole
description: This hotel is very very nice. Owner Laura is very nice person and will arrange everything you need. The small hotel has its own beach. Everything is very clean. Garage for motorcycle and car. Wifi very good. 136 000 COP per double room with TV. Beer cold and at a good price. Very good breakfast included.

name: Darcy Hospedaje
description:
Not luxury but clean and quiet Hospedaje with Wi-Fi for only 20 000 pesos for two. 
Just close to the main square

name: parque nacionale del chicamocha
description: not a national park in the usual sense more of an amusrment park! we paid 38000 per adult and 32000 per kids for access to the park and aquapark. not sure it works for everyone but we have been hauling around with an 8 and 12 year old so was a welcome change. rides in the park cost extra usually 3000 or 5000.

name: hotel familiar chia
description: 150000 for a room for 4 persons. secure parking directly across for around 10000 per night. hot water, rooms at back were quiet, internet didnt work while we were there, they let us use reception wifi but had to sit in hallway to access. neighborhood nice and local with plenty of restaurants and food shops. recommended if you are dodging bogota rush hour like we were!

name: public parking
description: 2,65 height restriction but secure parking for 12000 per day. good for walking to gold museum or around town.

name: Willson mecanica
description: Willson is a mechanic from Popayan. very cool. Helps if someone has a mechanical problem. whatsapp +573113286584

name: Parador El Progreso (+informal campsite)
description: A very good stop to eat something. you can talk with her owner rosita to stay the night. A very quiet place.

name: Hotel international
description: Great hotel! Very clean, quiet, comfy beds, hot water and lovely staff! 45,000 for a double room. A perfect stay.

name: Hotel Primavera
description: Great hotel on the road out to Cocuy. Fantastic view from the top floor room!! Fast internet and very clean! 40000 for a double room! Very secure parking out the back for bikes/motorbikes or cars.A great place to stay

name: Chichamocha Canyon - Free Wild Camping with Canyon Overlook
description: There is a small turn off of the main road. If you go about 100 meters, you’ll find a small flat clearing that can acommodate 1-2 vehicles. While it is not too far from the road, we arrived in the evening and were pretty well hidden with a rooftop tent. Traffic quieted down by 9pm and it was really nice and relaxing. Sunrise over the canyon is awesome too! No facilities.

name: Restaurante Tarapaca
description: We went to the Terpel a little further and it was closed at 7pm. We decided to try the restaurant and they said yes to parking right next to it. They let us plug in the electricity and water. Free if you eat there. It’s also a hotel. We didn’t ask for showers.

name: Hotel La Regata
description:
Hotel basic but clean, quiet, safe storage for bicycles or motorbike. 
Good Wi-Fi.
Rooms around 25 000 pesos

name: Sotelo Hotel
description: Good value for money hotel, not appropiate location. Not a safe neibourhood for walking. Average WiFi signal. Restaurant cheap but not the best one

name: Plus Gas Station
description: Good spot for overnight. Big level area far from the road. Toilets are open and free all night. We paid 3000 (tip) to security guy with shotgun. Small cafe.

name: Road closed
description: It is not possible to use this road, because it is blocked.

name: plaza de la iglesia de la natividad
description: save place to stay. near a little restaurant of crepes

name: Danny's Hotel (Hostal San Valentin)
description: Roadside hotel at 30,000-35,000 for two people. Super friendly and helpful owners. Bikes in rooms and okay with us spending hours cooking with our stoves on the little porch. Seems to have a secure place for motorcycles. 15 minutes walk to the mercado.

name: Hotel Italia
description:
Clean, comfortable hotel on a quiet street. Olimpica supermarket is just down the road. 

25000 COP for a double bed without air con, I think it’s a little more for a room with A/C. Bathrooms are small but clean. 

Fast WiFi.

name: Hotel Y Bioreserva Lagos de Menegua
description: Just 3 hours from Bogotá, on one of the most modern roads in the country, very close to the geographical center of Colombia, stands the Hotel & Bioreserve Lagos de Menegua.

name: MOWA Hotel
description: This site is comfortable, clean and a little expensive but have all the comodities, wifi, tv cable, soft bed and a restaurant inside, we pay 50000COP for a night two persons, and have a secure parking spot for cars, motorbikes and our bikes.

name: Zaperoco Salsa Bar
description: Recommended to us by Marriott Hotel as a good bar to go to see Salsa! It was a great spot, recorded music until midnight then live band. Salsa dancing all night but place really fills up for live music and everyone really gets moving. Enjoy!

name: Hospedaje Mi Casita
description: Paid 50,000 COP for two with air conditioning. Secure parking around the corner for 3000 a night. The A/C stopped working sometime at night but fan was fine, if noisy. No toilet seat sadly. The place was clean.

name: Parqueadero
description:
Parking Lot and Car Wash.
$3,000 CP to park over night.
Didn't see or ask about a shower or toilet.
note: there is barbed wire over the entrance, maybe 10 ft clearance

name: Hotel Prado Country - Secure Parking
description: Stayed here and got two rooms through Booking for $25. Nice, clean, decent WiFi and AC. Very western feel. Great little restaurant downstairs (we only had the breakfast but it was amazing). The power went out during the night, but that’s not their fault. The parking has a big garage door; our rig fit but is only 2.3meters tall. Maybe had 20cm to spare. Could fit a medium sized rig if you can make tight turns. 316.408.8556

name: La Fonda Antioqueña
description: Clean and comfortable hotel and restaurant with open air parking out front.

name: Hotel Posada El Viejo Oticón
description: Hotel Posada El Viejo Oticón/Los frailejones de piña negra. A fabulous hotel in the beautiful town of Socotá. Hot water, good WiFi, very very friendly staff, clean and great bed! 48000 for a double room and (parking for bikes and cars/campers?)! Very very highly recommended!

name: Lucho Arepas
description: In this restaurant you can find very tasty arepas with excellent local ingredients that you can choose. The quality is very good and they are very filling. The restaurant is located in La Floresta park ( Medellin ) and they offer a discount for travellers and overlanders. The park is very safe and I will recommend it 100% so if you stop in Medellin this is a must stop! Also if you want to spent the night in the park. The neighbours are very welcoming and nice! If you stop ask for Lucho the owner of the restaurant !

name: Hotel JC
description:
This hotel is downtown right in front of the big Candelaria church.

We have just arrived in Riosucio after hitchhiking from Jardin. We got a nice, clean, private room for 23k. Kitchen, wi-fi, toilet with hot shower! Right next to the church in the city center :) Great and cheap place to stop for a night. Wi-fi pass: 30411102riosucio.

name: Unused Soccer Field on Road to Jardin
description: Nice flat soccer field just off the road. We had lunch here but were told that we could camp on field if we wanted by locals.

name: Robbery, be careful !
description: We've been robbed in the street, in front of the Electro-Luz shop. We went to drink a coffee and within 5 minutes they opened the car and stolen cameras, computers etc. Don't stop here, there are a lot of robbery here, according to the nice lady from the shop that helped us.

name: Hotel San Alonso
description: A really great hotel! Luis is a great guy and Gambita is a lovely town close to the waterfalls and caves! It’s a new hotel with hot water, large rooms and very clean! 60,000 (updated 2/14) for 2 people! Highly recommend.

name: cea bennis acosta
description: Able to buy SOAT for 1 month here. Took 15min cost 50k for small 4x4

name: Miller House Hotel Boutique
description: Great Hotel in a quiet area run by very friendly people and the owner Frank is great. Parking for a few motos and some decent views of the mountains above Bogotá! And a nice free breakfast and a great social room on the top floor w darts and games. Hot and powerful showers. Has a restaurant opening soon. For a private room for 2 people and breakfast included was 50,000COP which was promo price as normally 55,000 which is still excellent as the place is almost new

name: French Embassy
description:
My passport has been robbed so I went to the embassy to do an emergency passport. Here is what you have to do:

1) Ask via the embassy website an appointment  (not possible to book it directly by phone or at the embassy)

2) Bring with you a copy of the stolen passport, a new photo, the police complaint for the robbery, a proof of address, some cash (you have to pay the equivalent of 45euros in COP for an emergency passport, for a regular passport it's 96euros). Last thing you have to bring is your travel itinerary with a copy of the flight Colombia -> France. In our case we were leaving the country by car so we brought nothing. It was not a problem.

30min later we were out with our emergency passport! Really efficient.

name: jumbo supermarket
description: sour cream! first time in 5 months we found it (and yes, we tried in 7 counties). they have a really good selection of everything, probably Jumbo is the best grocery store in S.A., so stock up here! garage parking, big area to get in/out, right off main road. could probably park big rigs towards the back (outside, loading dock lot) or on side street as it's not busy/no houses, motos go inside

name: Posada 4 que esquinas
description: the best hostel in the area. hot water, wifi, space to park several motorcycles, very friendly people in a very large house, clean and beautiful. 10USD low temporary.

name: Guatape
description:
**This is a temporary spot before we start construction on a new house.** WhatsApp me at +56 9 5664 1729 the day of or day before you want to arrive. 

Space for 2 vehicles to park on private land about 10 min from the village. There are 14 acres to roam around with lake access and amazing views. You’re welcome to pitch a tent anywhere on the property - there are several great spots. You can also use a roof tent or big rig. 

There is a house on the property - if it is rented, camping will not be permitted. However - you are welcome to use the downstairs bathroom (recently remodeled) with electricity and a hot shower. There is also a charcoal grill that can be used. 

I’m not doing this for money - but I ask 30,000 cop for Sonia the housekeeper to grant you access to the property and clean the bathroom. There will be satellite WiFi - however it is expensive. Mobile phones work well. 

If you would like to stay in the house, I will offer it at $50 a night to overlanders only. We paid $100 a night when staying and have furnished it to a higher standard since. Feel free to book direct or ask and I’ll send a special offer. 

https://abnb.me/zwdM5maIqM

Once completion of the bigger house is done we will be opening the property up to more overlanders.

name: Rancho Santana
description: Restaurant with good Angus steak. We had dinner at the recommendation of a local and asked if we could spend the night in the parking lot. No problem just park at side and they have a night watchman (Riccardo) who will keep an eye on us. Staff insisted we use restaurant lounge chairs until we go to bed. Open style restaurant and washroom is available all night. Police will also circle through restaurant parking lot during night and that is normal.

name: Hotel El Balcón
description:
- Overall good place with nice employees
- 25 000 COP / 2 persons : clean and very tiny room with bathroom (for 30 000 COP you can have a bigger room), quiet during the night except for the loud music from the neighbors which started at 5 am and lasted at 6:30 am, good wifi, TV, small bed
- Big covert parking with enough space for our bicycles.
- Non potable water. The shop next door sells a water bag of 5 litres for 2 300 COP.
- Hotel staff operates as well a restaurant in the same building.
- The name of the town is El Remolino, not Cumbitara as it's named on Google maps.

name: Hotel
description:
- Overall good place with nice employees
- 20 000 COP / 2 persons : clean and spacious room with bathroom, very quiet, no wifi, TV, comfortable bed.
- Enough space for our bicycles in the room.
- Commun area with a table and chairs on the roof with an amazing view on the river.
- Non potable water. 
- The town of Irra is 5 minutes by walking with two supermarkets.
- It seems to be a parking but we are not sure if it's big enough for big RVs.
- Hotel staff operates as well a restaurant in the same building but it was closed when we visited.
- Pool

name: Casa de Las Dos Palmas
description:
- Overall good place with nice employees
- 32 000 COP / 1 person : spacious room with bathroom (not so clean - they probably forgot to clean it) with a small outside covered space (only some rooms), quiet, very good wifi, TV, comfortable bed, hot shower.
- Lots of space to park cars (they did not charge us for it) 
- Enough space for bicycles in the room, but also safe outside
- no potable water

name: Motorrad Center Bogota
description: Nice workshop, very good mechanics, special BMW, tire Heidenau, Michelin, Continental, repair any type of motorbike. The people are very helpful for any other problem. I stop a Bogota two times the last two year and i left always this workshop very happy

name: Hotel Preferencial Class
description: In the center of Bucamaranga. Clean, WIFE, safe parking for motorbike and car.  Lots of motorbike shops near be. I paid 50 tausend with breakfast

name: Andres Carne del Res
description:
we had both 300g of excellent meat (lomo), differently prepaired, arepa and additional salad (you can choose various items). we were really satisfied. we paid about 40€ for both of us.
the decoration of the restaurant is great and already worth a visit.
seperate parking area across the road: parking is 7.000cop (weekend night probably 14.000cop) and they allowed us to stay overnight. free fast wifi, toiletts.

name: Camping La Cumbre Del Macizo
description:
"The Camping “La Cumbre del Macizo” is a very nice place, located very close to the different tourist sites of the archaeological zone of San Agustín. It is only 800 meters from the urban center of the small town and 1400 meters from the Archaeological Park. This beautiful and cozy place, ideal for Overlanders by car (motorhome), motorcycle or bicycle, offers you everything so that you can enjoy the greatest comfort during your stays in San Agustín, it consists of a large green area for parking and camping, native forest, WIFI, bathrooms, showers hot water, campfire area with free firewood, fully equipped kitchen for free use (spectacular), parking for small, medium and large camper platforms, very comfortable rooms with private bathroom, excellent service from its owners. COP $40,000 per vehicle (2024). Location phone number +57 3204780261

Additionally, you can hire ATV (quad bikes) tours on horses or in vans to the tourist sites of San Agustín such as La Chaquira, La Pelota, El Purutal, Magdalena Strait, Alto de las Piedras Park, Alto de los Ídolos Park, Salto del Mortiño, Isnos
Very steep road but there is a small detour from Altos de Yerbabuena restaurant.

name: Sloths&Monkeys - Parque el Centenario
description:
We walked through this parc several times until a friend told us, that there are sloths and monkeys living there.
We returned and indeed, there are 2 3-toed-sloths (one even had a baby) and cotton-top tamarins living in this relatively small parc! You might need some time to find them, because nobody seems to care about them. But if you find them, many locals will join you in taking pictures and selfies... ;) There are also many iguanas there.
Not sure how the animals got there and actually we felt pretty sad for them. We assume they have been pets and released there. If you have not seen them in the wild, this is a good spot to see them...

name: Mi Cabaña
description:
a nice hostel in chachagui with a wonderful family with 3 kids. they invited us for coffee, made us try their colada. we felt at home. we paid 25000 for a matrimonial. there is a swimming pool too. wifi is working fine. showers are cold. there is a large inner court where bikes can be stored. 
the village is located 1.3 km further when going to Popayan.

name: Mistica Hostel at Isla Palma
description:
A dream Caribbean island. White sand beaches, restaurant and bar. Access via Berrugas via boat. Boat ride 40,000 COP pp each way. Island has hostel/camping and DiCameron all inclusive hotel. Very private. We stayed at hostel that is very nice for a couple of nights after shipping our van back to US from Cartagena. It was less expensive to rent car from airport than public transit but we did have about 25,000 COP in tolls getting here that we had forgotten about but no big thing. Private zoo at hostel with cayman, flamingos, deer, parrots etc. Also lots of wildlife on island. 

WhatsApp # +57 320 2309103 for hostal

name: HOTEL TAYRONA
description:
A user reported on June 29th 2018: located on the unused dock front( not a river front paradise) across is a noisey pool restaurant overlooking the noisey bridge Motos all night wizzing up and down on the dock at 3am car boom box challenge between 3 cars. pot smoking gangs untill 3am I tried staying on the dock infront of the hotel as the police advised it was safe Left at 3am after my earplugs had enough AVOID
---
Spacious rooms, fans, air conditioning, individual bathroom, tv, cable, wifi, laundry,
--
Habitaciones amplias, ventiladores, aire acondicionado, baño individual, tv, cable, wifi, lavanderia,

name: Zocalo Square Hostel
description: Mariano, he is a really nice guy, is just starting to set up his own hostel in Guatapé. It has three rooms and there is just basic stuff so far: Matresses on the floor, a little kitchen with some pots, pans, silverware and plates. Enough for two people cooking. Hot water for shower is available. No WIFI yet, but at the main square of the town is free WIFI which is a three minutes walk. Good for budget travellers - he charged us 10000 Pesos/Person.

name: Hotel Pacora
description: José is such a selfless and very friendly person. He welcomes everyone with his heart! It happened to us to find this place and he took us right after our arrival on a small tour through the town. Normal price for a double room is 30000 Pesos, but we got it for 25000. There is hot showers, TV, towels and soap. But no breakfast included.

name: Gira el sol
description:
Nice restaurant and lovely owners.
Food was delicious and very tasty: 7500 pesos for big menu or 6000 for small one with soup, main dish and natural juice (we ordered small menu and it was enough for us).

They also make and sell home made pumpkin bread and fig bread (this is occasionally, not all the time.)

name: Motel El Rancho
description: Clean and decent place to for a stop over in or out of Medellin. Double bed bedrooms with AC and private bathroom. Good WiFi, fridge and Cable TV. They have a good parking for big rigs. No height limit. We paid 40k pesos for a room but she started asking 60. Negotiate.

name: On the hill
description: Nice place for the night with view to the mountains. After the challenging, but beautiful drive from the Tatacoa desert, because of the low hanging branches, we are 3,90 m heigh.

name: Country House Hostel
description:
Beautiful place about 15 min walk to Parque Central. Secure parking for 4 cars or more motorcycles. Dorm (5 single beds or 3 bunks for 6) 28'000 COP pp. Really nice double room for 80'000 COP. Very clean. Porch and deck to hang out. 
Mateo and his family are very friendly and extremly welcoming. They made us feel like family, without crowding in. 2 dogs and 2 cats are part of the household.

name: Hotel Posada Don Simon
description: Good clean hotel. Friendly staff. 35,000 COP. Hot shower, TV, good wifi. Close to everything you need in town. Dog friendly! They even let me extend my check out free of charge while my van was getting work done at the mechanic. Great place!

name: Swimming in river, stop
description: Easy place to swim in the river to cool down. Sign says no pas, but locals do it . So did we, very refreshing.

name: Macondo Guest House
description: Macondo Guest House is a new, friendly and modern hostel. Its area area of 400 mts 2 has been designed to receive guests of all ages. Spacious, airy and luminous, it has the privilege of being located in the neighborhood El Poblado, the most exclusive of the city, offering its quietest and safest beautiful Patio area. Macondo Guest House is surrounded by everything you need. From here you can walk through the tree-lined streets to the Metro Poblado Station (800 MTS), currency exchange houses, big supermarkets, bars, restaurants, pubs, discotheques, shopping centers, clinics. This is where families traveling in motorhomes,motorcycles and bicycles. This is where the long-term students of the Spanish language stay, groups of friends, independent travelers who want to share and make friends are staying. Attended by its owners, the accommodation remains open 24h with bilingual staff at the reception with tourist information. Use of Mega lookers for free. All private or shared rooms are hypoallergenic with access to the common area of dressers, toilets, showers with hot water provided and shower gel. For little money Here you will find laundry service (surcharge) and towel rental. Bar service, indoor terrace musicalized via Bluetooth. BBQ, free Wi-fi high speed. Free Parking (book in advance). Well-equipped kitchen shared. Free Hot coffee in the morning. Optional breakfast (surcharge), Tv Lounge with Netflix, International children's channels. Free use of computers with Wi-Fi. We accept children over four years old. Medellin the friendly city that has managed to transform itself in a short time, awaits you with a great offer of guided activities on tour or individual enriching your experiance traveler. Independent comments have given us one of the highest scores in the city. Check in: No time limit. Check out: 13.00 H We do not accept pets. Adress: Transversal 5A nro. 45-104 El Poblado - Medellín - Antioquia Phone:(+ 574) 3525219 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Macondo Guest House es un hostel nuevo, amigable y moderno. Su área de área de 400 mts 2 ha sido diseñada para recibir huéspedes de todas las edades. Espacioso, aireado y luminoso, tiene el privilegio de estar situado en el barrio El Poblado, el más exclusivo de la ciudad, ofreciendo su zona más tranquila y segura Patio Bonito. Macondo Guest House está rodeado de todo lo que necesitas. Desde aquí puedes ir caminando por entre arboladas calles a la estación metro Poblado (800 mts), casas de cambio moneda, supermercados de gran superficie, bares, restaurantes, pubs, discotecas, centros comerciales, clínicas. Aquí es en donde se hospedan las familias que viajan en autocaravanas, motocicletas y bicicletas. Aquí es donde se hospedan los estudiantes de larga temporada del idioma Español, los grupos de amigos, los viajeros independientes que quieren compartir y hacer amigos. Atendido por sus propietarias, el alojamiento permanece abierto 24H con personal bilingüe en su Recepción con Información turística. Uso de Mega lookers gratis. Todas las habitaciones privadas o compartidas son hipoalergénicas con acceso a la zona común de vestiers, sanitarios, duchas con agua caliente siempre y gel de ducha. Por poco dinero aquí encontrarás Servicio de lavandería propia (de pago) y Alquiler de toallas. Servicio de bar, Terraza bajo techo musicalizada a través de bluetooth. BBQ, Wi-fi alta velocidad gratis. Parking propio gratis (reservar con antelación). Cocina bien equipada compartida. Café caliente gratis durante la mañana. Desayuno opcional (de pago), Salón Tv con Netflix, canales internacionales niños. Uso gratuito de ordenadores con Wi-fi. Aceptamos niños mayores de cuatro años. Medellín la ciudad amable que ha sabido transformarse en poco tiempo, te espera con una gran oferta de actividades guiadas en tour o individuales enriqueciendo tu experiancia viajera. Comentarios independientes nos han dado una de las más altas puntuaciones de la ciudad. Check in: sin límite de hora. Check out: 13.00 H No aceptamos mascotas. Dirección: Transversal 5A nro. 45-104 El Poblado - Medellín - Antioquia Teléfono:(+ 574) 3525219

name: estcionamiento publico
description: guarded parking lot, not quiet but save, clean, nice owner. 8.000 vor night. good for overnight.

name: Vet Planet
description: I don't own a pet, just came across this good looking one. Plenty of space in front or in the street around. Safe area as well.

name: K’Piros Hotel & Restaurant
description:
Trucker restaurant and hotel facing the mountains. 20,000 COP for a room with double bed. Rooms are clean and quiet enough given that there are often trucks outside. Cold water but it’s not cold enough here to really need hot water. The owner is a really nice guy named Edilberto but only speaks Spanish. There’s no internet but if you have data on your phone there’s service up here. Llanteria next door so you can get some repairs done while you eat.  

There’s a watchman at night so it’s safe to park both for big rigs and bikes. Everyone around is very friendly.

name: TRUCK SERVICE / IVECO / Navitrans
description: Huge truck service, very knowledgeable professional. Authorized service of IVECO, CASE, INTERNATIONAL, but they can do ANY TRUCK. With their facilities it seems there is nothing they can’t do. They open @ 07:45. Suggest arriving early, so you can have priority.

name: Rua residencial
description:
Residential street near perro park, we park here to sleep because it does not have as much movement, but in the park of the perro is quiet also. There is a person taking care of the street and it is very quiet to sleep and to be during the day.
--
Rua residencial perto do parque do perro, estacionamos aqui para dormir porque não tem tanto movimento, mas no parque do perro é tranquilo também. Tem uma pessoa cuidando da rua e é bem tranquilo para dormir e estar durante o dia.

name: puerto asis port
description: If you want to go by a ship to Brazil even with your motorhome, this is the place, where you can ask the captains.

name: history museum of Cartagena
description: not that good, not worth $20,000pesos. might not even be worth it for free. how this got a star in lonely planet is a mystery as there is not much to see. skip it.

name: Rio night camp
description: crossed the boarder late....found this secure place with military Base protectuon no traffic and NO  music nice river Free

name: Rio Rumiyaco
description: besides the river off the main road.  toilets and water  available behind the river bar who's music could not compete with the river sound , tree shade or not,,,, asked  Policia Patrol all ok and safe to stay overnight, restaurants over the road.

name: Restaurante GironI Armero
description: Smoked Trout Restaurant. The carpark is quiet enough with the sound of a  running river. bought trout and 1 beer, the lady was happy....not many options out on the road heading NORTH  when a storm hits

name: Hostel Diosa Luna
description: A great little hostel/hotel in San Agustin. 50000 for a double with private bathroom, good WiFi and hot water! Nice balcony to sit on and roof terrace. He owner can also arrange a jeep tour of the sights as well as horse riding trip if you want it!

name: Camping Guaimaro
description:
Camping Guaimaro is nestled on a privately owned secluded plateau, just a 10-minute drive away from Barichara and surrounded by panoramic mountain views. Its location is convenient to unwind and to explore the area, with a direct trail to Barichara (35 min.) and another one nearby to Guane (1,5 hours). It´s a place for people who seek nature and tranquility, with plenty of flat space so you can find yourself a nice spot.

After traveling the world, we converted the finca´s old tobacco farmhouse and started several sustainable and regenerative projects. On our site, we have municipal water, free Internet access, a BBQ-fire pit and electricity (110/220). Furthermore, there are solar-heated outdoor showers, a kitchen/communal area, a washing machine (incl. soap nuts) and we also offer freshly baked bread, beer and homemade jam. Please note that toilets with chemicals cannot be emptied here. We speak your language.

Camping: 25.000 pesos pp/pn (from 12 years of age onward). Children 4-11 years old 12.000 pesos and children up to 3 years old are free of charge. Electrical connection to RV 10.000 pesos pn. Tuk-tuk’s between campsite and Barichara COP 9.000. There is no height restriction. WhatsApp/Phone: +57 3124901654 / +57 3108565180

name: Hostal CQ Flamencos
description:
A simple and small place to stay, it is like airbnb or homestay. 15000 for dorm room. Room is clean with fan, facilities are just okay
You can park your motorbike in front of house which is next to police station. So it's safer i think that

name: Hostal Paisaje Andino
description: At the hostal Paisaje Andino (center of town), Carolina welcomes all the overlanders to park in front of the hostel and use the really good hot shower, toilets and WiFi for 10.000 cop. Nice cup of coffee included.

name: Convento del Santo Ecco Homo
description: Nice monastery from 1620. You can visit the area, the chapel and all the other rooms around a beautiful cloister.

name: Hotel Morrocoy
description: Brand new hotel with nice rooms, pool, private/guard gated parking, restaurant, breakfast included in price. More expensive than we wanted $35 USD/night for 2 people (private room w bath, TV, AC) but we showed up late in town and didn’t want to look around any more. Super safe place with nice, friendly staff.

name: Che Parcero
description:
Really nice restaurant with great pizzapans and Argentinian empanadas (from the oven). We didn’t try the empanadas (yet) but the pizzapans were really tasty! And a very good price, 11.000 for a pizzapan and juice (9.000 for only te pizzapan). They also have coffee and some sweets (pie & cookies), but we didn’t try those.
Also, their WiFi connection is good and quite fast.

name: Hotel tropical  Girardot
description: Nice hotel very cheap double bedroom with fan and flatscreen tv bathroom for 25000 COP also free save parking for your motorbike close to the center 600 meter

name: Ana Rodríguez - Shipping Agent
description:
Ana is an excellent agent that helped us to ship our van RORO out of Cartagena to Veracruz.  Ana works with many different shipping lines and can help with container shipping too (and probably flatrack too).  Ana is very sweet and has really shown us that she cares about doing a good job and being helpful. 

Ana does not speak any English. I speak some Spanish and were able to get by using a lot a Google Translate. 
  
Location Data: @ May2024 Ana had just moved offices and this pin does not reflect the new location therefore of visiting the office check with Ana for location.
  
WhatsApp: +57 301 4146464
Email: cortesrodriguez.asesores@gmail.com

name: PKS Automotriz, Mecanica y electricitad Automotriz. Specialist in fuel injection.
description:
pksautomotriz@hotmail.com
cel/whatsapp: +57 314 822 86 82
nice guy tu repair rv, cars.. 
Nice peofessionnal, and good prices.
Ravier give us lots of informations and help us for a Fiat Ducato
To find him, look for Notarià de El Peñol. He's just near

name: Mercedes Sprinter workshop
description: A guy who knows everything about Mercedes, specially Sprinter. I guarantee you'll find the place packed with vans. I had to repair the engine and it was the best work I could ask for.

name: International House Medellin
description: Cheap hostal with hot showers, wifi and comfortable beds. The highlight is definetly the kitchen on the roof and the chillout area

name: Casa Marques del Pedregal
description: really nice place, 6 rooms(double bed per room/bath), nice kitchen, roof top pool (a must), good ac & good wifi. we paid $125,000pesos per night but got a discount cause we stayed longer due to an issue with shipping our motos. Cartagena is expensive but this place is worth it. Carulla grocery store is 12min walk, secure parking is 5min walk, old town in 10min walk. can find on booking.com

name: Buena Vista Shopping Mall
description:
shopping mall and big parking area. high restriction 4 meter, 2.50 wide. 
not allowed to stay overnight.

name: The Lake Hotel Camping and B&B
description:
Great campsite set up by the owners Dennis & Martha of the Lake Hotel. Amazing spot with loads of amazing, stunning, spots on the property with great views of the Lake. They have great spots to relax in the garden. We absolutely enjoyed staying with them. They can offer breakfast, dinners and boatrides and probably more. We payed 40.000 per night / per van for 2 people.
Good location within reach of the Piedra, Guatape and Peñol. They can drive you to the Piedra & pick you up at Guatape with the boat.
The dog, Frida, is a lovely dog and super friendly. Pets are welcome!
Contact them on 311 510 08 56 or 321 316 1042 / thelakehotelguatape@gmail.com or look them up on Facebook & Instagram.

name: Adolfredo Zuñiga & Hijos
description:
Our experience isn't really good but I'll try to remain objective because I don't think the place is actually bad. Our RV (7.3 idi diesel) suddenly had a bad rod and crankshaft, big deal. Luckily, the parts were available from Bogotá, still it took a week to reach. Then they worked slowly on rebuilding the engine (about a week) and re-mounting it(almost a week as well). Then a new problem appeared : a deep cloud of blue smoke coming from the exhaust and other less critical problems too.
One week, the issue isn't yet solved and I decided to leave to Barranquilla at a workshop where they're specialised in diesel.
They're not bad, they're coastal... Their style of working doesn't have any standard, still they are capable to fix plenty of things, but I would avoid expecting big issues to be fixed smoothly here, so be careful. Best is go to Barranquilla that seems to have a much better reputation than cartagena for mechanics.

name: Side road. Freshen up.
description: Uneven place next to the river. If you need a wash or a rest next to a river, this is a good stop. Didn’t camp here but sure you can if needed.

name: Truckers Hotel
description: Simple Hotel, basic, a/c and cold shower. Paid 30k for a double room. Parking safe but outside.

name: El Balcon Hotel
description: Reasonable mid range hotel. Room clean and spacious. Rooms at back are quiet- front rooms might get some road noise. Only cold water in shower but ok. Fan in room but no A/C. Good secure parking inside courtyard with plenty of room for bikes through to mid size campers but big rigs might struggle to get in. Price 30,000 for double with own shower no breakfast.

name: Hotel Neckarsulm
description: Great place with pool and restaurant in the middle of Mariquita. The hotel is run by a lovely couple that too great care of me during my stay. Secure parking inside the premises. Not on Booking.com. Paid 30’000 with ventilator for myself and motorcycle (free parking). 50’000 for 2. Quiet at night.

name: Playa Mayaco
description: Camped for free at Alcides Rodriguez’s spot. He said it was free, just pay if we ate or drank something next day. Very cool and friendly. Some kids came around asking for money, but overall extremely safe and quiet.

name: Veterinarian El Bosque
description:
Before we cross the border to Ecuador we went here to get a health certificate/export certificate. 
The vet was super friendly, but didn’t speak English. The certificate costs 50.000 COP

name: Gran mirador hotel
description:
we paid 75k for a double room including breakfast, owner also made us dinner for 10k each.

very steep road up to hotel, slick in the rain with height restriction but there is a place to park outside of his gate, town is very peaceful

m/c's and smaller rigs will fit, loads of parking space

name: Químicos (Alcohol)
description: Looks a little like a perfume store but it's a chemist who sells 96% alcohol. Right on the corner of Carrera 10 & Calle 9. 5000COP for 500ml. Think they'll fill your own container if you have one, otherwise they have bottles.

name: Petromil
description:
A good and safe place. Had a nice chat with a trucker and was very safe and silent. Bathrooms are clean and have toilet paper and soap. Has a hotel as well, but apparently 50.000 p.p. 
Guess you could put up your tent here as well, it has a big grass field.

name: Aviation museum - Museo aero fenix
description: Museum with nice collection of planes and helicopters. Open from 8am - 4pm. Sundays 9 - 4pm. 20000COP for adults.

name: El Mister
description:
We made a mistake turning on our inverter with the fridge connected on power and automatic mode AND the battery 110 volts charger too! It resulted in a fire in the battery compartment (living cell) and some short circuit in the engine starter. These people came to take down the starter and fix it, all in 2 hours. Now they're changing all my burnt cables in the battery compartment, with the hope that the inverter isn't dead.
They claim to be handling electrical, scanner, all brands, air conditioning, general mechanics. Very friendly and helpful, no boasting like other places.

name: As Altos de Salomé
description:
Very nice hotel with cheap restaurant and great swimming pool. Little pricey at 100k for a double (large) bedroom but worth it.
There's an auto wash right next door.

name: Lavado de Autos
description:
Huge fenced and guarded parking lot across the street. Ask at Lavado Autos, they didn't ask anything yet we gave 5000 to the watchman. Very friendly people. Big nice swimming pool across the street at 12000 per head, restaurant too.
The town is surrounded by 3 important coal mines. For that, it's packed with mechanical workshops. We dealt with 3 of them, all were friendly helpful and cheap. Nice place.

name: Manuel’s House
description: Manuel’s house and parking is down the street where cars can’t pass anymore. He takes care of your car and can offer different tours. He is really friendly and gave us food and chatted about cock-fighting. There’s a basic toilet and shower. It was by donation. We traded stuff with him. Very safe genuine vibe in the village.

name: Rio Claro
description: large picnic/rec area with caretaker . little noise from the road but  safe and free next to the river with the wildlife . Few overnight  options on this road south to the Panam avoiding the tolls

name: dog park no2
description: after checking out the 'closed' dead end road on IO ,parked up in this green park, quiet safe free, ¥ and nobody to aggrevate  as it's a public space gated houses around some with watchmen.

name: repuesto city
description: all the parts you will ever need are here

name: Mister Pollo
description:
In the large parking lot of the restaurant Míster Pollo. After asking permission from the administrator, it is safe, spacious, bathrooms in the restaurant. Good attention. Wifi and plug to charge devices in the restaurant 24 hours

 mister pollo is located in the same rute but 15 minutes after. At the end of Pasto (to Popayan)

name: Ecoturistars Paicol
description: Paicol is a really beautiful and peaceful town and there are lots of things to see! They've got a great cave Caja del Agua. You need to go there with a guide and they give you all equipment. Just talk to Jeison or his team at Ecotiristars at the main square (Just in front of the church). It takes around 1,5 hr and costs 25mil pp. There is also a cool waterfall where you can do rappelling. Locals are really friendly nd they would love to see some foreign tourists in their town. They told us about some camping areas as well. Just talk to Jeison, he will help you with everything! They dont speak English but are really patient so basic Spanish is enough! Dont miss this place and have fun! :)

name: Taller Llantera Luna
description: General mechanic, works mainly on trucks. Fixed a leak we had with the transmission cooler in no time and cheap.

name: Almacén y taller
description: Bikes parts and repair all brands. Just passed by and found it cool that they advertise Moto Guzzi. Didn't need their services though, so check it out.

name: la casa del agua
description: here you can refill bottles at a 24 hour kiosk at just at the back corner of the terpel station. $3k for 19L jug. only accepts 1k coins

name: top of mountain camping
description: Great location with with amazing views when its not foggy. there is water, electricity, cover, and flat spots for any size rig. military showed here to walk the area but were very nice and helped with areas to visit.

name: Finca Villa Gloria (Don Leo)
description:
There is another entry for Don Leo that I think is incorrect. We asked around and everybody said this is the real Don Leo. Indeed he is a really great guy and has a wonderful coffee farm. 

He has a seperate structure where one can stay for 100,000 or you can camp in your vehicle for free if you take the tour. they gave us free breakfast and lunch with the tour too, which was 20k, so awesome awesome value! His number 316 718 5598. email: cafedonleo01@gmail.com 

highly recommended!!!

name: Hotel Palaguas
description: hotel with a pool--it was 99.5F when we rolled in! matrimonial for 80,000 but we negotiated to 70,000. good wi-fi, nice rooms, very clean, exceptionally friendly staff. there is also a YMCA office here and they do swim classes. a little more than we usually spend, but it was well worth it. really good food nearby, or they have a restaurant.

name: serviamortiguadores
description:
family business specialized in suspensions and shock absorbers. they changed the two shock absorbers found in Colombia for Fiat, Peugeot, Citroen ...

Solutions for all brands

very friendly

name: Moto gears & parts
description:
There are a lot of motorbike gears and parts in this area. If you need refresh your stuff, good to come here and have a look, many choices 
*ex: new Michelin Anakee iii: 140/80 R 17, under USD 180

name: Marques de Villa de Leyva
description: Vineyard and winery. two options for tour and tasting. the "valor" option gets you a guided tour and two tastings (red, 2oz. each) with cherries and chocolate for 22,000 pesos. we did this, but if you've been to a winery/vineyard before and know how wine is produced, skip it and go straight to the bodega. for the same price, you can get 2 full glasses of wine and sit in the courtyard enjoying the day. the second tour/tasting option involves more tastings and more food. sorry, don't remember the price. winemaking is new to Colombia, relatively speaking--the tour guide was very knowledgeable about the winery, and wine science. tour was completely in Spanish. they also sell cheeses and meats in the bodega, and vineyard is in a beautiful setting.

name: Salto El Mortiño
description:
We came just to see the waterfall, but it was so nice and they offered dinner and camping. 10,000 for 2 in our camper. 

Entry only is 3000 pp.

name: Museo del Oro
description: FREE small museum with local gold artifacts and jewelry  some info in English .Secure parking. Banos. Not possible to overnight park

name: la Sauces
description: secure parking 24hr and able to sleep in the car for 10k. toilets and Coffee shop on site for breakfast ..quieter /cheaper/and less exposed  than rip off restaurant called MERIKA ...no entry height restrictions

name: Marina Club de Pesca de Cartagena
description:
We got our propane bottle filled at the marina. We have a green German 11 kg bottle with US adapter. We asked the guard at Marina Club de Pesca and he arranged it. He called to a company who fills gas bottles, we had to leave our bottle there and the next day he returned it to us full. price for 5 kg propane (11 kg bottle in total) 40.000 pesos. They were very friendly and helpful, even though we didn't have a boat. 

To reach the place first you have to enter the wall, you first reach a large parking lot, walk to the end, at your right hand site there is the entrance to Marina Club de Pesca. Ask the guard.

name: De Pelicula aparta
description: Beautiful hotel. 156000 COP with breakfast over for a double room. Parking for motorcycles and small cars. Room with kitchenette, wifi, 50 m2, sauna and massage, excellent location in a safe area. Excellent beds, good service.

name: Techo de Paja helping travelers
description:
It's an economic restaurant in the centre of the Encano`s village, at 5 minutes to the Lake La Cocha. The owners Carol and Andres are really lovely people. They really want to help travelers. They can help to find cheap acomodations and job too. They cook really good and cheap meals and they also help to have spiritual and ancestral anwers like to know in which places and with which people meet to have a healing experience.

Es un lugar economico en el centro del pueblo del Encano a 5 minutos de la laguna La Cocha. Los dueños Carol y Andres son personas muy amables. Ellos quieren ayudar a los viajeros. Ayudan a encontrar acomodaciones economicas o por voluntariado ecologico y tambien ayudan a encontrar lo que haga falta. Cocinan platos ricos y economicos. Tambien ayudan a encontrar las personas y los lugares justos adonde tener experiencias de sanacion ancestral.

name: Hotel Palma Real
description:
A great family owned and operated hotel close to ports, shipping offices, and other related businesses. 15 minute taxi to central for 5,000 pesos. Carlos the owner speaks English and was very helpful and friendly. 
Hotel is quiet and very clean with secure parking for motos or cars. I paid 40,000 pesos for nice room with private bath, AC, and fast wifi. Highly recommended.

name: la maison du croissant
description:
excellent French bakery. you'll find what you're looking for: chocolate bread, croissant, apple slippers, crispy baguette ... and succulent quiches or ham croissants. A real treat !

excellente boulangerie française. vous trouverez votre bonheur : pain au chocolat, croissant, chaussons au pomme, baguette croustillante... et de succulentes quiches ou croissants au jambon. Un vrai régal !

name: Ambrozia
description:
The best place to lunch in zapatoca.
Friendly Zapatoca Owner, coffe, cacao and other delicious treats
The owner, Guillermo, is one the living history of the Zapatoca Region, full of knowledge about it.

name: Posada Cartagena Historica
description: Great place a little outside of the old city center (40 minutes walk or 10 minutes taxi). Only a couple of rooms, with shared bathroom, a kitchen and fridge, and a small outside area. Owners are really nice. You can park in front of the posada. Not a secured parking but we felt pretty comfortable leave the truck out there. Great AC in the room!! Very fast WiFi. 10 dollars a night.

name: Posada Sierra Nevada
description:
Beautiful location just below Knwara.  Old hacienda that is being revitalized.  Plenty of flat parking.  Toilet and hot shower.  we did not use the shower, yet they told us it was hot water.  Right at the trailhead for the hike. 
Be sure to get all of your permits, insurance and guide taken care of in Guican or El Cocuy BEFORE you come all the way up here.  Be aware that you must have a permit, insurance and a guide if you want to hike the trails. If you plan on doing more than one hike, secure everything you need in one of the two towns as they are an hour away on dirt track.  No need for 4x4 but road is a bit rough.

name: Ruta 40 old road from new Viaduct
description:
follow the old Road below the new Viaduct park out of sight  and only in this location as there are alot of landslips I explained to the great family in the only house on the road my intentions to sleep they advised me to move here#
NOTE Temporary road closure on 16th for the National Ruta to Toche then onto Salento as they are grading it

name: Terpel Griffo
description:
large flat area with toilets grass lawn and trees looking over mountain range 

night stop possible

name: rough road camp
description: huge gravel levelled parking that you can hide from the road great view

name: Waterfall 3 Chorros
description: Nice waterfall with 3 parallel veils in the jungle. It is a good two hour walk here (one way) from the signpost on the road. The first hour is on a dirt track which would also be possible to drive, it's just a bit bumpy and muddy. Then you have to cross a few cow gutters. After about 1.5 h there is a sign to go to the right. From there it's basically across the field. The signage is not very good, but as long as you don't see another sign, just go straight. There will be an old stable on top of a hill with an arrow painted on the wall, and finally a run down house which says 3 Chorros 2.500. From that house, a path leads another 20 min down into the jungle to the falls.

name: harbour parking
description: a military surplus with bottle Camping Gaz Marylate street

name: Finca La Playa Verde
description:
It is with pleasure that we welcome you to our beautiful organic coffee finca for a "coffee tour", a tasting of our artisanal French cheeses, breads, brioches etc, or simply drink a coffee and talk about travel.
Do not hesitate to contact us and remember to book 2 days before for:
-Breads
- buns etc
+573128980480
fincalaplayaverde@gmail.com
.....
C'est avec plaisir que nous vous accueillerons dans notre magnifique finca de café bio pour un "coffee tour", une dégustation de nos fromages français artisanaux, pains, brioches etc, ou tout simplement boire un café et parler voyages.
N'hésitez pas à nous contacter et pensez à réserver 2 jours avant pour:
- pains
- brioches etc
+573128980480
fincalaplayaverde@gmail.com

name: Casa Agua Vela Hostal
description: Nice and clean hostel located directly at the beach. Big backyard with plenty of space for camping. You can use our following facilities: barbecue area, swimming pool, bathroom and an outside shower. Very safe and friendly spot. 30000 COP for two persons per night. Full breakfast with pancakes or arepas, eggs, fruit salad, cereals, toast, butter, homemade jam and juice, coffee or tea can be purchased for 10000 COP/person.

name: Colina de Lluvia
description: Great hostel, super friendly people, they let us use the shower only for 3000 COP. Hot water, clean bathroom, great experience.

name: Secured Parking lot Hotel Mompox Real
description: Secure shaded parking lot.  We were able to get in with a Dodge Ram 3500 long box with a pop up camper (we are 2.2 metres wide, height is approx. 2.6 metres),but taller rigs would also fit.  8000 COP per 24 hours.  We stayed in a basic hotel room there as well, that they are in the process of developing, for 60,000 COP per night, with air conditioning and TV, wifi to come.  Owner Tico was very helpful.  The lot is guarded until 11pm, when they lock the gates but if you are out late, there is a bell to ring to gain entrance.

name: Steet parking
description: Parking on the street without nothing special , but here there is more life than the another side of the town . A lot of street food ,not the better but cheap. And there is a very fast wifi connexion . The people are very nice

name: El Solar
description:
We went to stay here and they wanted 130,000 COP which seems really excessive for a Colombian small town.

There is a large parking lot that could fit anything, but no lighting and seemed very insecure

We are on two motorcycles and found a better place right on the main plaza

name: Hotel Ursua
description:
This is a large colonial hotel with just a double doorway to the street, inside its HUGE.

We got a room, that had 5 beds in it for 50,000COP, good wifi and warm water

We are on two motorcycles and they let us put them inside, way in the back, if you are on a big bike with hard boxes you will have to remove them, it's a tight fit.

There is secure parking within a few minutes in all directions if you have anything but a motorcycles

name: Hotel Don Corzo
description:
Right on the main square, pretty little friendly town, we are on two motorcycles and they let us ride them inside thru the front door, there is enough space for maybe 20 motorcycles inside

Warm water and average wifi, 45,000COP for a double that had 3 beds in the room

name: Oasis ApartaHotel Taganga
description: Not actually targeting Overlander, but a good location if you look for a place to stay in Taganga, near St. Marta. Somewhat outside and above of village, but only 20min walking to center and beach. Lots of diving centers and boats to nearby beaches & Tayrona NP. Camera surveillance of free parking lot with no hight restriction behind the house. Small, very personal hotel in a quiet,  safe part of the village. Nice pool, shared terrace with lovely views, large modern ensuite rooms with A/C and little kitchenette. Comfortable beds and clean room/bathroom. Stable WiFi and delicious breakfast included. Laundry service at additional, but reasonable price. And the best: Elisa 🇸🇪 & Arturo 🇨🇴 are terrific hosts: helpful above standard and make you feel welcome and comfortable. Check for a good deal on a booking engine or contact them by e-mail for an offer: apartahoteloasis@gmail.com

name: Hotel Sueño Real
description: Another cheap hotel option in this lively little town. This one has WiFi (in/near reception area), although perhaps they all do now. Very small room with fan and cold shower: 20k.

name: Yellow building hotel
description: Good option if you are staying in Tangua. We had a matrimonial with Shared bathroom, hot shower, Nice view from the room for 20k (for 2 pers) we could let our bicycles in the hall, safe. The wifi only works downstairs so you have to stay in the stairs, and is slow... but still a good hotel in the center of the Town ! Probably better option than the hotel at fuel station...

name: Deicer hotel
description:
Nice hotel with a little swimming pool. Nice owners and very clean. Room matrimonial with fan 50k
Good option in villavieja

name: Casa 10 hostel
description: Very Nice and clean hostel ! It is new, only opened one week ago. Dorm bed is 35k in 4 beds room, or private room for 2 is 90k. Best hot shower we had in south America !!! Very good location and friendly owner. There is a kitchen with all necessary, free coffee. Nice patio to chill... hightly recommanded !

name: Las Mirlas
description: Restaurant and Hotel. I paid 18.000 Pesos for a single room and was allowed to store my bicycle inside the restaurant for the night. The owners are really nice. Rooms are clean. The only drawback is that there is no WiFi and only poor cell service (Claro).

name: Hotel Ventura
description: Very nice and new hotel.  Rooms are huge and very comfortable.  shower is amazing.  plenty of space to park any size vehicle.  secure parking underground for smaller rigs, motorcycles or bicycles.  plenty of room inside the rooms for a couple of bicycles as well.  the owner has lived and traveled all over the world and speaks many languages.  staff is extremely attentive and professional.  three restaurants attached that are all good quality and consistent.  solid place to stay in this area.

name: El Rio
description:
Listed as best hostel in Colombia from Hostel World. 

follow the dirt road from the main road to the end. 

really nice place along the river. Dorms, Private rooms, hammocks, and tents. 

Secure parking inside the compound. Big rigs might have to park just outside, but super secure. 

No electricity for rigs. 
Electricity for dorms and rooms.
No wifi, but 4g 

restaurant, bar, river tours. tubing. 

hammocks 25000
beds in dorms 35-45000
privates 130-200000

name: Hotel-Restaurant Ruta del Sol
description: Clean, air-con, no WiFi. The shower was quite warm, but they may just have been sun on the pipes/tank! Not the cheapest - 40 000 for a single ensuite room - but (for cyclists) it's the first hotel southbound from the 45/62 junction.

name: Hotel Cacique
description: nice and clean hotel with friendly owners, private rooms with airco and TV for only 30,000 pesos, safe parking for vehicles of any size, walking distance to the center and shops and restaurants nearby

name: hotel ricksort
description: nice and clean family-run Hotel with private air-conditioned rooms for 35000 a night, motorcycle parking can be arranged if you ask nicely

name: Laundry at Cristoforo Colombo Building
description: 4K a Kilo. Good, low price compared to others. Delivers same day in the afternoon. If you are at the Laguito is just around the corner

name: Hotel San Juan
description: Very nice hostel in the village of San Huan. Parking in front of the hotel or in the backyard. Bicycles in the Room, A double Bed room for 30,000 pesos . HOT SHOWER!!!!

name: Parqueadero Good
description:
Truck stop with hotel, allowed us to park with our roof top tent, cook and even gave us water from a faucet to take an outside improvised shower. Charged us 3K to park and spent 2K extra on each beer. Friendly staff! Good spot to spend the night, next to the road but not too noisy.

Of course, rooms also available at a range from 15 to 30K

name: Sincerin Hotel y Camping
description: nice restaurant with pool, rooms and camping. Price for camping is 30 k per car - very nice and flat area away from the street. 20 k for tent camping. Toilette and shower (cold) at the campground. Palapa for sitting when its raining. campfire place. very clean place with avery helpful owner. Wifi availabe at the restaurant, but Claro is working on the camparea.

name: Hotel and Restaurant Nazareth
description: Decent budget hotel on the way to Pasto. 25,000 for one bed .35,000’for twin room with private bathroom. Cold shower, WiFi. Rooms big and clean (we fit both our bikes in the room). There is a restaurant next door open 7am-9pm. Dinner 15,000pp; breakfast was same as dinner. Very cheap place and not bad! As of June 2024

name: Autopista parking service
description:
Nothing special here ,just a parking service of highway . Loud place but safe and free , good if you have nothing . Toilet  and water , you ask the nice guard if you want refill your water tank of Rv.

aire d'autoroute ,rien de spécial ici . toilettes , eau . Possibilité de remplir reservoir d'eau du camping .
Parking sécurisé par guardes .
Bruyant mais gratis . 
Bien pour dépanner si arrivé tardive .

name: Hotel La Melissa
description: Motel, restaurant, garage and tyre repair place on the edge of town. Quite busy/noisy. 28000 for single with fan, air con for 60000. There is WiFi, but Claro signal here is good so I didn't ask for the password.

name: Restaurant y Estadero "El Mirador"
description:
Roadside cafe/restaurant that has rooms available upstairs. 25k for a room with fan. No WiFi, no air-con and water pressure in shower is not the best.
But the food is excellent and the cheapest I've had so far at roadside stops.

name: Lalavaseco
description:
Washing machines, dry cleaning and steam cleaning.
Very expensive for normal washing: 3500 per underwear/pair of socks, 4000 per pair of shorts/t-shirt!
But, the only place I could find.

name: El Refugio La Loma
description:
Nice place for stay on the parking lot or in the chalet of Camila. Please contact her before, because there is a gate. Mobile Phone: +57 313 4225982. Also via WhatsApp.

The place is 30 km in the north of Bogota. Very calm and peaceful. There is a 1 km way after the gate until reaching the parking area. We stayed there for a home visit for 4 weeks. There is a parking lot for approx. 4-6 vehicles. The gate was ok for us (9,5 m long). Very secure and quiet. Full nature in the middle of green hills, nice garden and flower farms.

The price for long term stay is between 200.000 and 300.000 COP a month depending on the size of the vehicle. One night is around 20.000 COP per person.

Camila rent her house also. This is very beautiful. And she is so nice and lovely.

name: Hotel and Restaurant Casa Blanca
description: Hotel and restaurant in Pedregal. 25,000 - 30,000pn for double room with private bathroom. Cold water. WiFi wasn’t working. We had a room at the back so was quiet. They let us keep our bikes on the balcony. Breakfast for 10,000pp.

name: Sura
description: We were able to easily get a one month extension of our SOAT here.  We needed to show our temporary import document.

name: El Saman
description:
Great overnight spot at restaurant closed to street, however relatively quiet due to wall between the lot and the street. Large flat parking lot. Great steak restaurant with own family cattle business. They ensure the quality "from the farm to the table".

We had one of the best meat in South America. The side dishes are great, too. Especially the different sauces. The service is very good as well. One of the owner Ricardo is very nice and helpful.

name: oasis hostal
description: Great place to stay if u want to sleep in room.Only one space for smaler van or u can park opposite in gas stacion. super friendly owners help with anythink u need. we paid 20 or25 with breackfast very nice. Good wibes....

name: Hotel Las Palmas
description: Nice motel. Relatively quiet. Good WiFi, clean rooms. 25000 for single room. Happy for me to bring bicycle into the room "so long as I didn't mark the white walls"!

name: huge parts store Ford, Mazda, Motorcraft
description: Huge parts store, branded Ford but got others too.

name: Chevroford parts store
description: You can try that one if you need parts for your Chevrolet or Ford. They got me new pistons and all the other engine parts I needed to fix my IDI 7.3 1994.

name: Vesga Asociados Ltd a / have your engine rebuilt!
description:
I couldn't believe my eyes when I saw that! My crankshaft being rebuilt here in Colombia, as well as the entire engine. For peanuts...
If you gotta go through this, then I believe Bucaramanga is the right place people here are serious and extremely professional.

name: Principal Motors & cia. Ltda
description: It's a rather big and well equipped workshop, yet with simple, honest and very competent people. It was recommended on my request by a Ford parts dealer in Bogotá (Henry in Henford), and I'm so happy I found this gem! The owner, Diego Andres is quite a talent, very competent and almost maniac in checking all the details. He's definitely customer-oriented, he made sure that our truck is totally fine before hitting the road again. Besides, Bucaramanga is THE right place to fix a vehicle, it's got thousands of parts stores and specialists for everything and anything. We got our International 7.3 IDI diesel engine fully rebuilt; even the crankshaft was fixed in a specialised workshop (see separate entry I made). Totally amazing what these guys are capable of, and for a fraction of the price it would cost in the west. Best of all is total transparency on the costs and at no time felt being cheated, almost the opposite I would say, because even after spending much more time than planned (2.5 weeks), Diego hardly charged me more. We camped inside the workshop most of this time, there's WiFi, basic toilets and a shower, it's very quiet at night. Contact him in advance if you can, his excellent reputation keeps him quite busy. Phone + WhatsApp : +573124107853.

name: Hotel y restaurant San Onofre
description:
I took a fan room for 1 person whit tv, toilet, its clean and safe, i paid 20'000 Col
It was space for my bike in the room.
It give rooms whit AC.
No WIFI, Open 24, it give à parking whit à gate. Friendly staff
Restaurant : Beer 2'500 Aguila
Soup Chicken whit rice 5'000
The big meal 12'000

name: Cheap hotel near fuel station
description:
I paid 15'000 CoP. for a fan room for 1 person, whit TV, bathroom, clean, friendly staff. It was space for my bike in the room. I think no WIFI
AC 22'000 CoP.

name: Hotel Oro Negro
description: Near Eso station, i paid 20'000 cop for 1 night, 1 person, room is nice, clean, tv, wifi, Privat bathroom. It give a restaurant.

name: Hotel Casa Quinta
description: Nice friendly hotel. 30k for single room with fan. Offered to keep my bicycle in one of the courtyards but had no objection to me taking it into the room. 2 WiFi networks, one has strong signal in the room... but only the other appears to be connected to the internet! Good connection close to reception.

name: Villa Hermosa Tayrona
description:
Nice little Campground, next to the River. Space for Tents and campervans. Big rigs fit in the upper parking lot. Small restaurant. Toilets and shower are basic but clean. Nice cool off in the shallow river. Very quiet at night. Nicely done with wooden tables. Space is clean and well kept.

We didn't have many Moskitos around. Now 30k a night (for 2 people).

name: Motarllantas Engrasa
description:
Truckstop, Car wash, Restaurant, Hotel, Workshop.
Parking lot, were allowed to park there for the night. 
Car wash is 15000 COP for a camper.
Have toilets, and a guard.

name: Cajas Automáticas Direcciones Hidráulicas
description: Workshop specialised in automatic transmission. Gonna report once job is done. If possible, plan in advance they're busy.

name: Buomax
description:
This has been entered as a restaurant but more importantly it's a good night stop Usual truck stop .. space behind trucks on the grass has the best spot
 Security wanted paying at 6am he gave up after 2 times of no reply IT FREE!  
 came here from a bad decision of staying at the river front in Puerto Berro very few spots on this road

name: Road from San Roque to San Rafael
description:
on a road junction flat elivated grassy position with seat shelter VERY quiet at night and safe No much traffic here and patrolled by dam security.
road is rough as hell from San Roque to here ground clearance needed 4x4 would be handy.avoid when wet  low range gears used most of the way to here.
but simply the best vistas

name: Boattour
description: Great tour on the river and into the side arms of the river. You can see a lot of birds and iguanas. You can also have a swim in a lagoon, quite clean. Really nice and worth. 30,000 COP per person for 3 hours. 3 h p.m.

name: Hotel El Eden
description: Nice hotel for 25000 pp. They have a small restaurant with good local plates. Wifi works good and the room was comfortable. Parking for motorcycles in the courtyard.

name: Hotel Gomez
description: Basic hotel in the middle of town. 15000 cop per person. Secure parking for motorcycles, 1 or 2 small vehicles could fit too. Warm showers and slow wifi.

name: Puerto Chuleta
description:
Nice restaurant with good quality food. They let me camp on their yard for 10.000 Pesos. Including a warm
Shower

name: Es La Ye showers
description: fuel station with showers! he just ask money for the coke...

name: Analaüli Restaurant & Hospedaje
description:
Neat little restaurant and hospedaje with a huge fenced parking lot. Super friendly owner. The parking lot would be suitable for big rigs but getting around the tight corner at the entrance gate might be a challenge. Give it a try, turning around is not a  problem. Toilets with buckets are available and bucket showers cost COP 2.000.
We paid COP 10.000 for our car and 2 people. Another group here paid COP 20.000 for their car and 4 people.

How to get there: drive through Cabo towards Punta Gallinas and it is the very last place in town on the right hand side.

Bonus: Excellent restaurant.

name: Hotel Moros
description: Hotel with ground floor access. Indoor courtyard for secure bicycle storage and possibly motorbikes (although might be a squeeze with panniers through the corridor from the street. 30k for a single room, ICE cold SHOWER! WIFI SLOW.

name: Alex Patiño
description: Alex very warm person and the most important very good mechanic, helped me alot with my DR650 (which he have as as well). He got some parts if you need.. can handle with Kawasaki and BMW as well. Fair prices.

name: Lo del Toro
description: El Toro can help with basic mechanics and request a crane if necessary. We spent the night with him while we waited for the crane, he only asked for a collaboration since the problem could not be solved. Very good people.

name: Plaza del caffe
description:
We stay here one night with our rv. It was safe for us and calm. There is game and football and basketball ground . The local say 's ok to stay here...
There is water(no potable) front of the football ground.

name: Citibank - to pay the extra Seaboard bill
description:
RoRo from Colón to Cartagena with Seaboard. Step 2 for us.

Here we had to pay the 50$ bill in COP. After this you can go back to the Seaboard Office to get the BoL.

name: Hotel Real ce
description:
nice and clean family-run hotel, with double rooms with toilet and cold shower for 30000 pesos.
Safe parking is available 100m down the street for 4,000 pesos a night for a motorbike, will fit big rigs

name: Laguna de Solso
description:
A beautiful place at a small lake with lots of birds. Toilette and cold showers. Clean. Paved shelter. Used by groups of students. We were told you have to make a reservation in advance: 3164164628
Camping is free- this year

name: Small dirt road up a hill next to the 25 road
description: There are a few dirt roads next to the 25 road. They lead to a viewof the valley and river. Small place to camp but great spot for the view.

name: Todo Bidrio
description:
Windshield replacement. Hugo is very nice. They replaced my hard to find GMC Van windshield. Decent prices too.
Kind of rough area, but nice people. 
Spanish speaking mainly... but welcome all Overlanders.

name: Laundry Matic Coin Laundry
description: Real self-service washers and dryers you can use yourself! Machines look like they are new and in good condition. 5000/washer and 5000/washer. But she is only open 10-3 (even though sign has different hours).

name: Finca Miradores
description: Friendly American/Colombian couple own this little cilantro farm.  Beautiful views all around!  Still under construction but should have level space for one or two rigs now and parking for 5-6 and rooms to rent in the future. Will need to walk up the hill first for permission even if gate is open. Entrance is marked by two yellow/orange pillers and reddish gate. Parking 10 pesos for week, showers/bathroom 10 pesos/pp per day. NO dumping! Some stray dogs in area. Several nice small restaurants in the village below.

name: Camping Tranquilandia
description: Campsite in the backyard. Great area with clean bathroom, cold shower and community area. Grassy with some shade. Only for small vehicles or tents. 20.000 per person. We really loved it here.

name: hostal mi cielo
description:
small and nice hotel, has safe parking for motorbikes, I got a double room with TV and a shared bathroom for 25,000 per night including breakfast, prices are negotiable, she started at 35000 for the same
good location quiet and with an easy walking distance of the Central Plaza

name: Carvar Soluciónes Energéticas
description: Solar panels, inverters, batteries and more

name: La Vieja Cason’s
description: Great breakfast and lunch. The lunch changes everyday and is 7000 cop for a large meal. We are here 3 times

name: Hostal Rossi
description: Cheap little hostel close to the highway. Paid 18.000 for a night in a single room. Cold shower and slow WiFi. Friendly staff and I was allowed to park my bicycle inside.

name: Hotel Andaluz
description: Cheap clean $30.000 COP for one, $45.000COP (Colombian pesos) for two, parking for car or motorcycle free

name: Kijoru Hostal (and campground)
description:
Little hostal with big fenced parking lot. Big rigs will have no problem. Super friendly elderly lady and excellent seafood. Toilets and showers with running water (not salty). Excellent seafood.
We paid COP 10.000 per person to sleep in our car. Other overlanders also sleeping here paid COP 10.000 in their own tent.

name: Hotel Achalay
description: Clean budget hotel close to city centre.  We paid 179,000 for 2 nights for a room with 2 double beds.  Parking in a large guarded lot with no overhead restrictions included.  Pet friendly.

name: Hotel Casa Aragón
description:
Good hotel, central location, with basic amenities, room with private bathroom and parking included. 

$35,000 single person with fan, $55,000 single person with air conditioning. $60,000 couple with air conditioning. 
--
Buen hotel, lugar céntrico, con las comodidades básicas, habitación con baño privado y parqueadero incluido. 

$35.000 persona sola con ventilador, $55.000 persona sola con aire acondicionado. $60.000 pareja con aire acondicionado.

name: Shopping mall with big supermarket
description: Big mall with exito supermarket and toilets. You can park for free in the garage (2,20m max) or at the parking area on the left side of the building (no height restriction, 1700 pro h)

name: Jpits
description: Really good mechanics for big motorcycles. Highly recommended.

name: Llanteria La Ceiba
description: We would change the wheels from front to back and repair one. Please don‘t go there. They have no clue about truck tires and they are totally uncoordinated.

name: next to the salt mine
description:
It is possible to stay there if you want to visit the salt mine. We asked at the ticket office. Take a tour in the morning  or at the afternoon, we got there at 16:40 took the last tour in English  and were only 4 people.
 It is green, quiet and you have street lamps all night long. Here is also a water well where the locals get their drinking water.
Had a quiet night and felt save.
At the salt mine there is free wifi
Toilets are in the salt mine compound.
second foto is the way to the well

name: Odontologia
description:
a super and efficient dentist following a dental emergency.
tooth removed and very good follow up of the dentist. if necessary do not hesitate

un dentiste super et efficace suite à une urgence dentaire.
dent enlever et très bon suivi du dentiste. si besoin n hésitez pas

name: Villa Angie
description:
Great guest house. Nice backyard for camping. Outside shower and bathroom for people in campervans or rigs. Nice kitchen to use and great common space. Prices could include breakfast or other meals if you want.
Call either for information on costs.
Belinda: +57 304-382-2668
Heriberto: +57 300-762-6462

name: Finca La Playa
description:
ADMIN NOTE: CANNOT DRIVE HERE!!!!!

Really nice campground after a 8 hours hike thru casa de los colibris, estrella de agua, primavera. The path is wonderful but quite muddy. Up here (3700m) you can camp for 10K COP or stay in the hostel for 20k cop. Owners are so friendly and the food is good !! I recommend. From here you hike to laguna el encanto, tolima and termales. Enjoy ! Use maps me for gps but the path is easy to follow

name: Seguros del estado
description:
Here you can buy your SOAT it’s the official insurance! They can sell for foreigners by day, by year, by month 
It’s edificio banco BOGOTA 8 flor

name: Acquaparque El Otoño
description: Parque aquatico termal. 8 very hot swimming pool and 3 big toboggan.

name: Steel Cutting
description:
We all know that things break on the road and in Latin America just about anything can be fixed?

We had a VERY specific metal bracket fail while we were here in Colombia, the closest replacement was in Australia!

We sourced out a metal working facility in Medellin, who reverse engineered the bracket, then laser cut us four new ones (spares) in two days in stainless steel, total cost $22

If you are heading towards Medellin and have known brackets that may fail, this might be a waypoint to save if you need a spare or two

the company is called Steel Cutting 6.153343, -75.609636

name: MOSTAL HOSTEL
description: Great place ! 30 000 COP in dorms. continental breakfast included. very clean and good location. fast Wi-Fi. kitchen available and restaurant.

name: Biomax Gas Station
description: Friendly staff let us camp under a roof for free. There is a restaurant, shower and bathroom.

name: Santiago D.C.
description: Friendly staff and good location for a hostel. Everything went perfect.

name: coffee break hostel
description: has private rooms and dorms, private 25'000 pp, dorm 20'000. all rooms use zhe sharrd bathrooms, has a clean kitchen, chill area with hammocks. easy walk (5 blocks) to the main square, friendly owners, 24/7 reception. electric showers, therefore not very hot. overall clean hostel with enough common space.

name: Hostal Marlin
description:
nothing special as a hostel, overpriced like all in this area (38k dorm, 95k double room w/ fan; 110k aircon) 

Very central location, can walk to all of the old town from here easily. Staff are really friendly. 

Update on comments below - The centre of Cartagena is very very safe now. I’ve left the comment because drugs & prostitution exist in Cartagena & this is within the central bar area, it’s true. But within the walls in very safe. 

I didn't like the area tough, too many people, too many drugs, too much alcohol, sparely illuminated streets, prostitution, begging etc. saw only 2 police men who afterwards left. does not feel too secure. if you want to party hard it's probably the place to be, if not find another place.

name: Terpel station under construction
