description: Excellent situation, very quiet and friendly workers who showed us where to park (away from the road) didn't ask us anything, very quiet with noise of a stream for a perfect night before heading to Ecuador.

name: Parking of a restaurant
description: We paid 10 cop to park for one night. Close to the road. It's was dark and we were tired....

name: ZEUSS
description: truck stop with wifi and armed security   huge  parking lot will fit a family of Unimogs  Usual restaurant /mechanic/ motel /shop water and showers FREE

name: Beach
description: MODERATOR NOTE: Place removed because camping is illegal here.  Private Property

name: Montallantas La Esmeralda
description:
Helpfull and experienced tyre repair man. We arrived after hours because of a puncture on one of our back tires and eventhough he had limited resources helped us straight away. Patched spare tire, checked all others, filled them up properly all for 20.000, very quick. if you are in the area and need help also can call him (Hector) at +57 3132261843
no name outside the store, just look for some tires written Montallantas written outside a yellow/red house

name: lava ya
description: Not so busy laundry place or at least they seem pretty efficient. they were able to do our clothes same day on saturday for 5k a kilo if we were 8kg or more (we were 12kg). Otherwise normally 7kCOP. Well washed and not overly fragrant. Very friendly staff.

name: HOTEL
description: awesome place for a night on the road - super friendly family run hotel and restaurant. Clean room, hot shower (we paid $30k pesos for a double) and some of the best food we have had on the road in 9 months. highly recommended the Vege pasta which comes with a tonne of veg and grilled cheese. we mentioned we were hungry cyclists and for the same price $13 it came with 2 warm arepas,  unlimited delicious croissants and a rico desert. great cheap fruit juice too!

name: Dental Clinic International Smiles
description:
If you need or want a proper teeth cleaning, we highly recommend this place. Both Dr. Rizzo (dentist) and Dr Castro (periodontist) are very nice and speak perfect English. The offices are super clean and comfortable. This is the go-to place for many expat residents. 

It may cost a bit more than other places (we paid 120,000 each for our cleanings, but they start at 80,000), but the care we received was worth the price, plus they were able to fit us in on short notice. My husband is English, and he said this was the best cleaning he ever had. 

We were so pleased with our cleanings that we also had gum graft surgery done here! Dr Castro did an excellent job, and did her best to fit us in for checkups as she knew we were traveling.

Call Adriana for an appointment: +57 4 2686922 or Whatsapp: +57 300 310 8193
You can also search for "International Smiles" on Google or Facebook.

name: wild camping in valle de constellations
description: nice spot when you are doing the roundtrip at tatacoa. on top of a hill. wind going most of the time so no moskitos and nice for cooling off at night. quiet and save.

name: Fish sellers
description: buy your fish straight of the boats here

name: water at terpel
description: Water next to the road, free of charge. Very nice.No need to take gasoil

name: Parqueadero junto al río
description:
Very quiet, surrounded by trees that provide shade. On the other side of the river the police bothered us in a very bad way. We prefer this side, it is more private.
--
Muy tranquilo, rodeado de arboles que dan sombra. Del otro lado del río nos molesto la policía de muy mala manera. Preferimos este lado, es más privado.

name: Giovani vw specialist
description: these guys are specialits on beetle and kombi. they fixed our 1989 t2 brasilia in a morning at a good price. if you have a Kombi this is the place in Cali. there is a small blue vw in the front door

name: Nautica Velero
description: Kitespot with a little Restaurant and 3 Rooms for rent. Carlos, Jose and the boys from the Kiteschool are super friendly and helpfull... we've spent a few nights here camping in the car (40'000COP per car), safe, windy, no insects, shower toillets and even a storage for you watersportequipments...

name: Wild spot close to Colombia family
description: We passed this spot looking for a place to overnight. Next to this spot lives a poor but happy family. We did a talk and they were enyoing how we setup for the evening. Safe free spot with no facility's. The owner offered us fresh water that comes from the mountains. Not sure if it's potable.

name: Centro de Diagnostico Automotor del Putumayo E.U. (CDA del Putumayo)
description:
Issuance of mechanical technical certificate and polluting emissions.
Issuance of preventive reviews.

Google Translated from original:
Expedición de certificado técnico mecánica y de emisiones contaminantes. 
Expedición de revisiones preventivas.

name: Coffee Company Hulia LTDA
description:
Its a coffee company where they buy the coffee beans from the fincas to roast them for export. They have two different kinds for sale: one round in taste for 12000 COP per 500g and one stronger one for 8800 COP per 500g. Good coffee for a small price. We bought 3kg, to get less or more is no problem. Very nice people. We even spent the night in front of the building with a guard watching us for free because we arrived on a holyday afternoon.
 We even got green beans for 30000 COP for 5 kg to roast it ourselfs, even so they usually don't sell that small amounts of green beans. 
Opening hours: Mon -Fri 8am-12pm and 14pm-18pm Sat 8am-12pm
but the guard also sells the coffee just ring the bell.

name: Fresh truchas
description:
Here you can buy fresh truchas for 14000 COP per Kilo. They kill them fresh and take the organs out.
Street from San Augustin is bumpy and took us 4 hours till here.

name: Baterías Batskala
description:
Repair batteries and have new batteries.

My auxiliary battery got punctured and these guys fixed the hole and refilled the empty cell! Super nice and super cheap.

name: El Paisaje Restaurant
description: Restaurant with fantastic view, good food and nice staff. We stranded here because of an accident on the road. Not the badest place to stay for the night! They even have a Finca to rent

name: JREY HOSTEL
description: Residential Unit Aldia University located in the vicinity of the metrolinea portal of the University area near (UIS Industrial University of Santander, UDI University of Research and Development and Santo Tomas). Two towers of 18 and 17 floors next to 9 commercial premises. A social area for the enjoyment of adults and children composed of two swimming pools Adults and children, solarium, BBQ, playgrounds, sauna and Turkish wet areas, gifted gym, double height lobby and social lounge.

name: Terpel
description: Safe gas station to spend the night, open 24 hours with security, restaurant and bathrooms.

name: water
description: Liquid gold ...  WATER.... .A tap is here just on one of the parking spaces next to the apartment block.

name: tigermarket
description: Open FREE wifi seating area and charge points with parking ...coffee shop area behind the Esso grifo

name: El Universo del Lavado
description: Self service or drop off laundry place.  Spotlessly clean. AC waiting area. Nice folks. Parking better around the corner or down the street.  Pikoriko chicken across the street.

name: Taller Mecanico Yovautos (Kombi & Beetle)
description: The only guy in Ipiales I found who could do some small adjustments on my kombi. Everybody else didn't want to do it. The mechanic does work on other cars too. I'd go to him again.

name: Reparautos
description:
Aristel is an excellent mechanic. change of wheel bearings, pads, revision before leaving colombia. Parts quickly available due to the proximity of Cali. multibrand.
whatsapp: +57 3146508060

name: Gases de Antioquia
description:
Fill our fixed American propane tank. 

We stopped by here because we were desperate. Like most places in Colombia, they don't let you enter the factory. So we waited outside for the tankers that fill the big commercial tanks. They are called "carrotanques". The engineer and other factory workers didn't think that the carrotanque hose would fit, but when the carrotanque driver arrived, he looked at our tank and said no problem. He filled 13 kg for 50,000. 

So if you are passing by here, ask when the "carrotanques" will return from their daily route. I'm including the picture of the official receipt for the refill so you can show them if they are confused.

name: Isabel parrilla arte cafe
description: Great little restaurant, beautiful decor and reasonable prices and the food is delicious. recommend the morrilla Isabel, best carne I had in Colombia.

name: Ruben‘s Restaurant
description: Rubens very kindly allowed me to park my car at the back of his restaurant. There is a toilet and shower. He didn‘t want any money and forgot to tell me that apart from the well equipped supermarket he owns the restaurant which specialises in typical food at very reasonable prices and a cafe that takes coffee seriously. There is coffee in many varieties and the chef of the restaurant also makes cakes and sweets. It is a real find: km6 via Mesa de los Santos. Very much your Columbian friendliness which makes the world right again after endless roadworks...

name: Walter’s parqueo
description: A sweet family with secure parking. Perfect if the ferry arrives late. We tried parking near police but they brought us here. Paid $20,000 for night. Electric would not power AC. Water is slow to fill. There is a bathroom on site.

name: Rolando’s camper conversion workshop
description:
Needed some work done on my van (interior work and extra security measures). Rolando has a nice sized workshop where the van can be parked inside to work on. Rolando has his own carpentry company, but he loves working on campervans (he’s done a real nice complete build-in too, he showed me the pictures). I thought he would only be able to do carpentry work, but he does welding too. He helped me out installing extra locks and we went shopping together for parts and he helped me get deals on a car alarm and speakers. I parked my van in the street and slept in it.

It is definitely located further out of the city, but the parts around there are cheaper, and it’s still easy to access. Neighbourhood seemed safe to me.

All in all, I’m posting this message because I was so happy with how much work he did for how little money. And he is a genuine and friendly guy who really thinks along with what you want.

name: Milenium Audio
description:
Nice little shop for having speakers switched out, or new ones installed. The cheap Chinese speakers of the brand ‘better’ in 4’ inch for 105.000 COP installed with cases where they fit in.
Eventually they installed a 6,5 by 9 secondhand one for 140.000 COP. 
Don’t speak much English but very helpful. They also do alarms.

name: Power Audio
description: Had an alarm installed here, a Ultra 4000, with one of those horrible alarm sounds. Diego did it for 180.000 and was helpful explaining everything. Doesn’t talk much English.

name: LavaYa
description: Laundry. Very clean and quick. We paid 20'000 for three bags full.

name: Truck Stop on the way
description: If you need to sleep on the road this is a good place, spacious with security guard all night. Charged us 8000 p/vehicle.

name: Plaza central - La Merced
description:
Parked on a spot around the plaza. Place are not very large so a big rig may not fit. Nice place with palm trees surrounded by local tiendas, cafes and restaurants. There’s free wifi here. Locals where curious and very friendly as there was no other gringos when we where there! Surprisingly it was quiet in the morning so we could even sleep “late”!
Felt very safe overall here - especially “pedro” - a local - stayed here all night around the plaza keeping an eye on the cars...

name: Isla de la Corota
description: What a dissapointment, you pay 40,0000 to get a boat across to nothing and then need to to back in the boat in 20 minutes. A note for those wanting to explore the island, once on the island the walk to the end is 40 minutes and the cost to enter the park is an additional 7000pp, they say the round trip is 1.5 hrs. You need to ensure the boat trip you pay for allows you to explore the island. If you simply get the boat across there is absolutely nothing to see on the otherside and then 20 minutes later you are returning to the main land.

name: Nona‘s Pan
description: Excellent coffee, Tortas, Brownies, fair prices

name: Parqueadero
description: Nice little parking where you can camp for 24h. 15.000 pesos per car. Great views, quiet at night. There's a bathroom and water. Nice little town, perfect for hiking.

name: Parqueadero
description: Parking lot, a few meters away from the main plaza. 10.000 Pesos per night. Gated and safe. You can get the public WiFi from there. Great little town.

name: Museo Parqueador
description: Looking for camping in Sogamoso, 24 hr vigilancia said we could park out front for free. Not sure about toilets as we didn't stay. We made some friends who let us park outside their house. The parquedor was next to a big park so the spot looked great if you needed a place for a night in sogamoso.

name: el palmar de ventanas
description: restaurant hotel and parking. we stayed the night for free. Edier the owner let us stay and we bought some water and chips. toilets are clean. good for an overnight

name: Exito San Nicolas Rionegro
description:
Shopping Food Clothes Shoes
Big Rig friendly parking safe
Water to fill tank ( look for tap in grass)

name: punto palmera
description: little campground behind the restaurant. save and nice. 15000 pesos for each. showers and toilet inclusiv.

name: Sonson Parking Space
description:
Flat level space, big rig friendly
Friendly police
Quiet at night
Cellular Claro good signal and 3G

name: Electri Auto Garcia
description:
Awesome place for having electrics checked out. I went to have my dashboard lights looked at, and we found out wiring was hooked up wrong. Redid that, replaced two fuses, one lightbulb. Then they helped fixing a motor of the automatic lock system and fixed a usb-port on my radio. Paid total of 30.000 COP for about 4 hrs and material.

George (also called flaca) is the one who helped out most. Speak a mini word of English, but language to go is Spanish. Very helpful guys.

name: Termales Tierra Viva
description: These are smaller termales around Manizales. They have two really nice stone pools and hummingbirds around. Entrance is only 13000 COP/person on Tuesdays and Wednesdays (up to 20000 on weekends). We were the only guests for a while. They let us camp on the parking lot. 10000 per vehicle, toilets available all night, very quiet at night, wifi, very friendly staff.

name: Highest Point east of Puente Linda Ruta 56
description:
Scenic route from Sonson to La Dorada
needs time but better invest time here than route 25 construction part.
Paved until Narino.
After tthat Gravel/Dirt road
ONLY IN DRY WEATHER CONDITIONS!!!!!
our 28 feet truckcamper passed
average speed for some parts 10 km/h
Very nice views
Coffee, tomatoes, papaya and much more plantations

name: Esso
description:
A good service station with diesel at 8800$. No water.
......
Pas d’eau ici mais c’est bien une station service avec le diesel à 8800$

name: National Aviation Centre
description:
stayed the night in the  parking space of the National Bird Centre ...nobody here and the barrier was up. very quiet loads of parrots freely flying at sundown.
intended to have breakfast at the open wifi on site restaurant KOKORICO and visit the park .The  restaurant only opens at the weekend and the park entry is 40k but the parking was free and the wifi is on 24hrs

name: Beach camp
description: Park on the beach next to this families restaurant and house (with no music) cool sea break all night safe quiet during the week 5k / vehicle

name: Uveros
description:
searching for a safe place  Found this gem right on the beach on a unused space ...Great kids and families to ask lots of questions but safe as chips all humble enough. This is a resort that hasnt happened yet! the real deal fishing/ mango/platano farmers hide away!  place you fish order and mangos for the next day as you chill on the drift wood beach NO BASURA ! 
stars are unreal and the sea breaze is welcoming 
The adjacent sports field is good to go but not much breeze and sea crashing waves 
 There is a beach parking in the centre next to the holy shrine  but the restaurants are on a music competition as usual 
respectfull and welcoming...  no machetes nor pistol attack here

name: paseo caballo Gloria horse riding
description:
we had a great time with Gloria, visiting several archeologic sites. you can sleep here too, rent rooms.
spanish speaker only but very very friendly
--
pasabamos una linda mañana con Gloria visitando los sitios archeologicos.  tambien puede ofrecer alojamiento sencillo barato.

name: Mirador de los Cedros
description: Nice and clean family-run hotel within easy walking distance of the town, quiet and run by nice people.   No parking available but a parking lot only 50 meters down the road with safe overnight parking. We negotiated a nice double room for about 55, 000 pesos per night, has a nice bathroom with hot water, cable TV and comfortable beds.

name: Restaurant Parking
description: Janete is a lovely lady who is willing to be helpful. She will allow you park just next to the restaurant and spend the night for free. If you are too tired to cook you can have a meal at her restaurant, it is simple food. Showers are available!

name: Wild Camp by River
description: Before the bridge there is a patch of grass. Some locals in the afternoon but we felt safe and the police and locals told us it is fine to stay here. Good place for one night, next to river with possibility to make a bonfire etc.

name: La Ruta de la coca
description:
Experience extraordinary of culture ancestral of Coca organic. The village has 700 inhabitants. Hernei is the coordinator of the road of Coca to Lerma Cauca. It is imperative to call hernei by phone +57 313 618 74 99 before coming in the village. He will then inform the community of your visit and assure you the best home. Hernei will organize visits of fincas, meals and housing. This turn off the beaten path will take you in the heart of the lives of Campesinos in the territory of La Paz. You will discover the Coca medicinal, cultural and spiritual.
Contact the office social of the organization CIMA of Popayan (Comite Integration del Macizo Colombiano) +57 312 296 98 06, email: tiendamacizo@yahoo.es

Experience extraordinaire de la culture ancestrale de la coca organique. Le village comporte 700 habitants. Hernei est le coordinateur de la route du la coca à Lerma Cauca. Il est impératif de prévenir Hernei par téléphone +57 313 618 74 99 avant de venir dans le village. Il pourra alors prévenir la communauté de votre visite et vous garantir le meilleur accueil. Hernei vous organisera les visites des fincas,  les repas et le logement. Ce tour hors des sentiers battus vous emmènera au coeur de la vie des campesinos dans le territoire de La Paz. Vous découvrirez la coca médicinal,  culturelle et spirituelle.

name: Farallones hotel
description:
Clean hotel next to gas station and great restaurant. You could camp in backyard. 
If you take downstair airco room you can walk your bike to your room and even store them there. 45.000 for airco and 2 beds.

name: Restaurante Monte Claro
description: A huge and nice property to spend the night just out of the highway 45 following the next day's trip to Medellin or Bogotá, with restrooms and fast WiFi, all for free! There is showers available, so if you ask nicely you can get one for free too! Despite being a very large property the lady who works in the kitchen told us that the place was not commonly used by truckers which makes the night a lot quieter for overlanders with light sleep ...

name: Mirador
description:
Good for picknick with view over the lake
big rig friendly

name: FreeWay Hotel Restaurant
description: This place is a restaurant but with the possibility of doing free wild camping on its huge propriety. It will probably be the only opportunity to eat a very well cooked meal with quality ingredients still cheap for the standards of Colombia. When we were here, there was not a truck to park with us, but it is likely that it could also be used by trucks

name: Terpel at the river
description:
Best option for the moment. 
Quiet. 
At the river

name: Parking in nice neighbourhood
description: This is a free, guarded parking space in a quiet barrio. The nightguard arrives in the evening and leaves at 7am. In the night all spaces are filled so try to arrive early. The neighbours and guard don't have a problem with you staying there but please be respectful of the residents and try to be as quiet as possible.

name: Cartagena - Mao's Hostel
description:
Cheap and cheerful hostel with private rooms and shared bathrooms. The hostel is on Airbnb and the owners also have another in town close to the DIAN office in Manga. 
We stayed here because we were shipping with Seaboard Marine and it is only a 10min walk away. 
The rooms/hostel are basic but very clean and owners/staff are lovely. We payed approx $40,000 cop per night.

name: Brisas del Amazonas
description: Cheapest place we found in Leticia. Well located and let’s you cook in the room. We paid 30k x double room x night. Parking on the street. Felt safe.

name: Clínica Las Americas
description:
Great care, facilities, and medical staff.  Make sure to ask for a translator.  That person will walk you through every step of the process.  They will be present for your consult and any procedures that may be needed.   Send an email (English or Spanish) to Laura to schedule the appointments you may need.  Or contact me if you have any questions! 

soporteinternacional@lasamericas.com.co

name: Estacionamento no centro de Ipialis
description: Large parking for trucks, practically in the center of the city, with all facilities, fair price, friendly staff and in the area of trade of parts of cars and trucks. It is not very well maintained but offers water and a bathroom which is also not very clean there.

name: Enlace Caribe
description: a agent for overshipping. Give not much informations, but it goes whithout trouble. Works good. When you bring a vehicle into colombia, DON'T LEAVE THE VILLAGE BEVOR YOU GET THE ORIGINAL BILL OF LOADING AND IMPORT PAPERS. You will get problems when exit.

name: Museo de Ciencias Naturales de La Salle
description: Take a taxi or an Uber to this small museum housed on a university campus. You will need to check in at the front gate, they will send you to the museum.  Amazing staff. Well prepared displays with various topics. Really old taxidermy and even a whale skeleton. Two floors, all Spanish, changing exhibits. Good stuff for FREE!! Use this address to research it or get your ride there. I don’t suggest trying to park here, it’s a mess.  Museo de Ciencias Naturales de La Salle, Cl. 54a #301, Medellín, Antioquia

name: Dangerous area
description:
****WARNING FOR COLOMBIA SE of CALI, today 8/16/2018***

Avoid the area 3.05626, -76.34743

We were stopped this afternoon by the military at this waypoint, east of El Palo, on the road north of the river, we were riding west to east.

According to the military - Farc and the Cartels, joined forces setting off a car bomb about 10km east of this point and murdering two people. They are said to be targeting non-locals and richer looking people! They have stated they are not happy with the new President.

We tried to laugh it off telling the military we were told by local riders the area is safe...he then showed us photos of the bodies, bullet holes and all.

The Commandante stated the military or police cannot guarantee anyone's safety in this area - https://goo.gl/maps/PcYoDBfeEFJ2

name: Potential Theft Area
description:
Just got a message from a fellow rider we were having a few beers with, in Filandia a few days ago, he asked me for a track with a little off road but cool views, so I gave him a 200km loop 50/50 around the Cacora Valley...he loved it.

So then he asks me for another heading south, I gave it to him, a route we had ridden just a few days before on one of our many loops in the area.

At this point https://goo.gl/maps/uhHdQvK5U3M2 this is approximately where he stalled in a rut and his meeting happened, two masked guys jumped out of the bushes when he stalled on an uphill climb. They were brandishing shotguns, and faces covered in T-shirts, wearing civvies (is how he described them) they told him to turn around, put their guns on the ground around and helped him point his bike in the opposite direction.

He WAS NOT robbed, just redirected, if he hadn't stalled they most likely would have never met...but again maybe an area to avoid right now. It is approximately 200km north of where my incident was today, so most likely totally unrelated.

When we rode that track we stopped to talk to guys with a logging company who are working the area and they told us it's all safe now, Farc has moved on so, who these guys were is anyone's guess.

name: La Bonanza
description:
The Finca“La Bonanza”(35,000 square meters), previously belonging to one of the majors of the Cali cartel, is located 12 km away from the Panamericana (excellent paved road). 
We are Kika and Anouar. We settled in 2017 with our 3 children Meïssa, Mehdi & Maya after 3 years of visiting South America in our own RV. 
We would be happy to welcome you and share all kinds of overlanding advice amongst many other things. 
We are on a plateau in the middle of the mountains and just 15 minutes from Silvia and its famous Tuesday’s market. 
Buses to Silvia & Piendamo are available every 20/30 min both ways for ~4000 COP per person per trip. 

Amenities & Services 
•	Wi-Fi 
•	Hot showers + toilets
•	Kitchenette
•	Inside and outside dining areas 
•	BBQ place 
•	Dumping station (black and grey waters) 
•	Water refill 

Optional 
•	110 V or 220 V electricity connections for RVs: 15 000 COP per night. 

•	Laundry service up to 18 Kg – 25 000 COP per load

We also offer for sale: beverages, bread, jams and organic eggs. 
You can make bread with Anouar and jam with Kika.

Continental Breakfast and gastronomic lunch/dinner upon request. Ask for our menu. 

Spoken languages: English, French, Spanish

Prices per night (COP) 
*RV or Tent two persons: 45 000 
*RV or Tent one person: 30 000 

Additional person over 7: 15 000 
0-7 years old are free of charge

Looking forward to meeting you!

Whatsapp 
Kika: +57 316 622 6221 
Anouar: +57 317 576 4514 
Instagram: @campground_la_bonanza 
Facebook: Campground La Bonanza
Website: www.campgroundlabonanza.com

name: La Playa Cigarrería
description: Cool foodstuffs and specialties shop, loads of specialty baking supplies, nice chocolates, seeds and nuts that are difficult to find in supermarket, plus large wine and liquor selection, cigars, smoke supplies, gifts, etc.

name: Taxeco gas station
description: There is a big green yard behind the gas station surrounded by the trees. A guard came to meet us in the evening but said we can stay, didn't ask for money. The place is close to the highway, so you hear the road noise, but not so much. Roosters were crying in the morning and a woman was singing :) Apart from this safe, quite clean and you can use facilities of the gas station.

name: Termas Tierras de Promission
description:
Termales municipal. Good place, clean and cheap.
5.000 for entry.
Big parking free for night.
secure and silence.
very hot water.

name: Hostal Los 3 Leones
description: Basic hostel, nice owner, 18 000 via booking in dorm, unfortunately cold shower

name: Guantanamera
description:
Was able to park in a side street next to this hostel. Super close to the beach.

I used their facilities (cold shower, bathroom and WiFi) for 10.000 for one night. Might have been because my fellow travellers were sleeping in their tent/dorms.

They have a restaurant too, but don’t think your able to use their kitchen. 

WiFi code 987654321

Big rigs could be difficult because the streets are small

name: Hotel
description: Clean hotel across from Bank of Colombia. Overlooking town center park. Congested small old Pueblo. Secure parking several blocks away.

name: Animal Lovers Clínica
description: A very friendly woman Vet who can call her husband for English translation.  She did shots and blood tests on the spot. Lab is nearby and fast (one day).  Has basic Meds on hand and also monthlies.  Good prices. Good people.

name: Freno repuestos del sur
description:
This is the new location of John Robert's workshop and spare parts store. They can advice on the maintenance that your vehicle requires in addition of offering a full range of spare parts. 
Review of brakes, batteries, windshield wipers, oil change and filters, maintenance of suspension, alignment, balancing and change of tires. 
Very friendly, helpful and with great knowledge of Colombia so be sure to ask him for some tips on other places as well. Will greet you with cold water and good coffee.

name: Hotel Tierra de Oro
description: These guys love bike and moto tourers but have plenty of space for big rigs in the forecourt too. I'd just been robbed before coming into Santander de Quilichao and the owners Mario and Kate could not have been more helpful. For cyclists, they also own a little bike cafe if you need anything fixed or to do any maintenance. When they heard that I'd been robbed they took me out to dinner, gave me a nights accommodation for free and then drove me all the way to Popayan the next day. Seriously great people.

name: El Encanta
description: Well worth the little mission out here. This place is paradise. Fat fruit hanging from trees, organic dinners made with veggies picked from the garden. An incredibly kind and welcoming three generations of a family living here. Far from the constant din of engines, only birdsong, the river and the occasional bleating of the one sheep that lives on the property. Probably a struggle to get to it in a big rig but bike, motos and 4wd should make the effort for sure!

name: before bikini hostel in the corner with a green rooftop
description: Best place in palomino. We checked some hostels and this was the best option. 10k ppn vehicle-camp. Clean kitchen and shower and toilets. Wifi only during the afternoon but fast. Nice vibe and space for up to 3 - 4 overlanders. No height restriction. They even pluged for us a ventilator cause it was very hot! lovely owner

name: Local Community Outdoor Kitchen
description: At the end of the beach the locals built some benches and a fireplace under the trees. If you ask them nicely they let you park behind (in the alley from the beach to the street) and use their facilities. They have a shower, electricity, the fireplace and water to wash dishes etc. They are great people, we had a wonderful time!

name: Plaza Potosi
description: Next to the central square in front of a school and next to the national police. We talked to the policeman who told us there was no problems. Secure, clean and quiet place the night.

name: Promecanica
description: Father and son business. Both speak perfect English, knowledgeable in all cars (especially 4x4). Can get parts! Big shop (can fit about 10 to 15 cars), overhead spaces and secure overnight. Had great experience, would recommend!

name: Hotel Perla de la Sabana
description: Nice new hotel with secure parking, overlooking town square. Manager needs to open gate to park. Very clean

name: The Greek Connection
description:
WowoW! If you love Lamb and excellent service make your way here....yes loud music but hey who hasn’t heard the overnight local sounds LOL
Worth every single COP!

name: La Casa Del Inyector
description:
Diego and his father run a really clean and professional workshop for injectors (western standard). They've been really helpful and friendly. I doubt there is any other place in S. America which is as professional as they are.
They don't have a garage. I parked my car in front of their shop to remove the injectors, which wasn’t a problem. Anyways, it is probably better to come only with the injectors.

Adresse: Carrera 44 # 27 23, Medellín, Antioquia

Fr 07:30–17:30
Sa08:00–12:00
SuClosed
Mo07:30–17:30
Tu07:30–17:30
We07:30–17:30
Th07:30–17:30

 Phone: (4) 4446578

name: Hotel San Laurent
description: Nice fancy hotel in the south of Cali. Great if you’re on your way out of town and need a good hot shower, a/c and yummy breakfast before heading further south. A bit pricey, but can find a cheaper deal on booking.com. The staff is SUPER nice. Private parking available, no height restrictions. Width restrictions, but not too bad.

name: Permanent Food Trucks
description:
Permanent outdoor food carts. Wide selection (arepas, Lebanese, pizza, sushi, crepes, burgers, much more..), good prices, and trampoline for the kids. Covered seating. Colorful and fun local vibe. We can recommend Rey Moro Lebanese cart, best Falafel since Guanajuato! Open from 5pm. 
Prices vary by cart, starting from 8’000 for a small pizza to 38’000 for a steak. 
Parking accessible via Cra18.

name: FixPhone reparación and soluciones
description: Repair of phones, iPads, computers.  Changed an iPad touch screen for $60usd in 5 hours.  Close to hostels, Vet, éxito and home center

name: Sea view camping
description: still walk-able to old town. this location is great. Sea breeze, great view of boats and Boca Grande buildings. Very safe. Go during early morning or after 5pm to get a spot.

name: playa blanca at the end of the beach road
description: very calm during the week, at the beach, police stopped by to ask if we have everything. during the week all the restaurants are closed, so bring all your stuff from san antero(10 min. away)

name: Happy Laundry Service
description: Located in Hostel Bambú. 3500/kg. Clothes came out very clean, but the folding wasn't too great. We still recommend this for the reasonable price and friendly people. We had 20 kg so they needed a little bit of time; we dropped off and picked up the next day.

name: Bestrong fisioterapia
description: My wife and were travelling  and she developed a sore shoulder. We came to Medellin and had appointments with the Physiotherapists at Bestrong and they were great.  They have a large area with all the required equipment and we were happy with the result and the professionalism of the staff.

name: Casa de Verano
description:
Beautiful hostel that has just opened in January. Super clean and has secure parking for a few motorcycles in the building front.
Hostel has private rooms and dorms. Other facilities include a shared kitchen, pool and relaxation area with hammocks. Owners are super friendly. Would love to stay again.. highly recommended.

name: Hostal Techos Azul
description:
This is not a recommendation. The front desk staff seemed like we were an annoyance when checking in. We booked a cabana because we had a visitor with us and because there’s a kitchen in the cabana. However most of the kitchen ware was either broken or dirty. On top of that the stove was out of gaz and he couldn’t be bothered replacing it, we should use the communal kitchen... Only after we insisted the guy at the front desk could be bothered to replace the gas. The WiFi did only work at the reception and even there it was slow as f... 
the only thing that this place has going for it is that it’s quite and a good ac. 

I am sure Taganga has other, nicer places than this one. Don’t bother coming here. I am also pretty sure that all the 10/10 point reviews in booking.com are fakes.

name: El paraíso de Tuki-Finca La Candelaria
description:
coffee and cacao farm. 25.000 p/p each tour. the area is beautiful and we really recommend the cacao tour. it is more than an hour walking from town to here or you can come in motor bike (15000p/p).
--
finca de café y cacao. 25.000 p/p cada Tour. el área es muy linda y recomendamos el Tour de cacao en el que podės degustar. es una hora o más caminando desde el pueblo hasta aquí. también se puede venir en moto por un costo de 15.000 p/p

name: Hôtel villa mandalas
description: Very clean hôtel. Very Nice staff. Rooms are very clean modern. All is perfect in this place. Breakfast inclued. No expensive. Parking secure no far

name: The Blue Hotel
description: Brandnew, not properly cleaned up yet. On the 62, therefore very noisy. Everything is done on the cheap: the electric shower is still working , though. 30000 for a double room with private bathroom.Very slow WiFi in room. Friendly staff. Restaurant not recommended. You could park on their big car park but it would be very noisy. Didn’t ask their price for sleeping in the car.

name: Jardín de Rocas
description: Amazing. Pay 15000 pesos per adult and saw so many Andes Cock-of-the-Rock.  (As cool to us as the Quetzal.) Walk down from city from 4-6 pm or early early morning. They have a few posters around the city but afternoon hours were incorrect. It’s private property so you must go during their hours.

name: Entrance to Tayrona
description: They no longer allow camper vans into the park at all. They said there have been so many people who came in with their camper van, promising not to spend the night, but then did spend the night. So now they don't allow us in at all because they no longer trust us. You could probably get in with a more discreet car, but not with anything that looks like a camper. (We have a Sportsmobile) The guy said we could take all our stuff out and leave it in a restaurant and that might work. (We didn't try that, we just left!) Also, note he said Playa Cristal cannot be visited unless you arrive early, before 8am, else it reaches capacity.

name: Huge grocery store Sabana Norte
description: Big grocery store. Has an international section for all those foods you've been missing from home! Big outside parking lot with no roof.

name: lavanderia burbujas
description: Very good lavanderia, very clean. the owner very friendly .

name: Hotel Diana Campestre
description: Simple hotel on edge of town. Friendly staff. 35,000 pesos per person. Secure parking right in front of hotel (no height restriction). Can walk to everything. Just a clean hotel room with cold shower but for the parking and staying in town we thought it was worth it. This spot also over looks the river and has swings and a pool table.

name: Coffee Farm Don Gumer - Organic Coffee
description: Here Don Gumer will show you around his beautiful finca de cafe, where he grows his organic coffee, dries it, and roast it using a really fun method (he'll show you) he is very friendly and his coffee is magnific! here you can buy coffee and have a good conversation about the product

name: Agustiniano Coffee
description:
Ok, this place is amazing. Here you'll meet Doña Oliva, she is the owner and she lives here in her finca. She will show you for free how the coffee process works, so you will pick your coffee from the coffee trees, you'll clean it, she'll show you where to dry it and she'll make you roast your own coffee. After that you can buy the coffee that you made or other kinds. You can also taste different kinds of coffee here, with different roasting levels, which is amazing.
She owns an association of women who work with coffee and she is really friendly, definetely our highlight of San Agustin! If you are a coffee lover this is a MUST

name: Polimetria Taller de Cerámica (Ceramic workshop)
description:
Ceramic workshop run by a super friendly young local couple, where you can buy original ceramic pieces, and you can also do a one day workshop where you will create your own piece from the beginning! from filling the molds to applying the varnish, and at the end you'll take your own piece home! Highly recommended!
.
Taller de cerámica que organiza una pareja local super simpática, donde además de poder comprar unas piezas de cerámica realmente originales, puedes realizar un taller de un día donde crearás tu propia pieza de principio a fin! Desde el llenado de moldes a aplicar el barniz, y al final te llevas tú propia pieza a casa! Realmente recomendable!

name: Jerico, Antioquia
description:
A traditional house (casa de campo) a warm welcome by Dona Isabel who will be very caring during your stay.
Cel. 313 791 6211

Finca Hotel Palmeras - Un paraiso a cinco minutos del parque principal por 50000 COP desayuno incluido (agua caliente, wifi, parqueadero...). Una vista espectacular.
Une maison traditionnelle (casa de campo) un accueil chaleureux de la par de Dona Isabel qui sera aux petits soins durant votre séjour.
Cel. 313 791 6211

name: Yunnior
description: Basic hotel with place for bicycles. Quite, clean. We asked if we could use the kitchen and they let us use it. 70.000p for room with two beds. Cold water. Swimming pool.

name: Diesel Especialistas
description: An excellent place for Diesel problems and they also have different mechanics. Absolutely reliable and honest. They fixed my turbo fast and at a very reasonable price. Highly recommended

name: Cocoa farm tour
description:
Great cocoa tour, had great explanations, in Spanish but made an effort to speak slow and clearly. Made our own chocolate, saw the whole process, got a chocolate facial mask and a hot chocolate. 
Really recommend great place, very calm. 
Need high clearance to get here but can stop at the shop and walk up.
On the right, across the river when you are going up.
20000 per person.
Also have massages but didn’t try.

name: Hot water tub and termales
description: Feeling dirty? Stink? Feel newborn after a visit here. COP 7.000 pp for 30 min hot water tub. Not medical clean but ok. Very hot water. Termales next to the tubs, haven't been there.

name: electrogas
description:
gas plant at the edge of the road. filled our 2kg argentine bottle without problem 10000cop

planta de gas envasado al borde de la ruta. cargaron nuestra garrafa de 2kg argentina sin problema x 10000cop
---
We tried fill today our us fixe tank and they told us that they don't have the us connexion.

name: Parque del infierno
description:
park with parking area and police checkpoint 24hs. Safe and quiet, family atmosphere, very friendly and helpful police.

parque con área de estacionamiento y garita de policia 24hs. seguro y tranquilo, ambiente familiar, la policía muy amable y servicial.

name: Finca Versalles
description:
Very Nice finca. Very friendly staff with Eva and Jose. Many places. You can sleep un the finca for 30000 pp or in your car for 20000 pp. you can eat here or prépare your own food in the kitchen. there is a clean swimming pool. You can see the cows, ride horses, hike and go to the river. All is perfect. Hightly recommaded.  
Maria Isabel Recalde or Eva 
Whatsapp 3186605723. 
Cellulaire 3502487525

Turn off the road 25 in Patía, at (2.066408, -77.078536) turn right. From here the road is not in maps.me.

name: Hércules
description: Place to review and fix everything related to your tires. People extremely friendly and helpful. Fair price, great job!

name: La Serviceta
description: Basic service mechanic and car wash. Really nice people. Changed our oil and filter for 10000 cop

name: Pixel Hostel
description: Very cool, brand new  and clean Hostel with a unique dorm concept. 14.000pp for a dorm. Big common areas (also a cool platform outside), kitchen and fast WiFi. There is space for bicycles and parking is just next doors (cars 20k, motorhomes 50k). Super friendly staff as well. Good location in San Antonio.

name: Luxury Pits Motorcycle
description:
Great motorcycle mechanics. I arrived in Medellín with my poor Triumph Tiger 800 well overdue a service. Looked for the local Triumph dealer only to find that they had pulled out of Colombia a couple of years back. 

However chatting to a local guy he told me that he knew where some of the ex Triumph mechanics had set their own workshop and even took me there. 

Andres and the team did an outstanding job on my bike. A full and professional service using top quality parts. Fantastic communication even sending regular photos of progress via WhatsApp.  The bike went in tired and filthy and came out in near showroom condition. 

If you need any work done on your bike in Medellín, go here and talk to Andres and Aracely. Thoroughly recommended.

name: Hotel El Prado
description: Very nice, old Hotel with an enormous parking even for big Campers. Historical downtown near.

name: Roca de Simón Bolivar
description: this is an open place that has the Simón Bolívar stone. We spend the night here, really quiet, although it was Saturday night, there were students drinking but they left at 10PM. Awesome place for spending a night!

name: Techo de Paja
description: Awesome place to park. Outside of the "Techo de paja" restaurant. Its owners Carol and Andrés (Spanish speakers) are great and kind people really helpful with the travelers, we spend a couple of days here sharing with them. They borrow the bathroom, internet and have really cheap and tasty menus.

name: River camp
description: We tried to take the back road north of Villanueva to Zapatoca. There is no bridge crossing Rio Suarez, so we camped just past the small mine workers shack.The road north of Villanueva is a sweet dirt road that leads down into the canyon, 4x4 or bike only, something with clearance. We drove our loaded adventure bike there and back. We saw the mine workers leave across the river via cable cart in the morning, but no one talked to us. I really doubt there would be any issues with camping this far off the beaten path.

name: Los Alpes
description: Nice clean hospedaje / restaurante. Double room with private bath and hot water was 30000cop. There was room in the front of the restaurant for our motorcycle. Other than that it’s street parking

name: Hotel de Lujo
description: Cheap hotel (35 k Col pesos pr night) with secure parking and private bahtrooms - very central location in Bogota.

name: Huge motorbike accerories marked
description: Its a whole block of small motorbike accesories shops. There are literally hundreds of them. Helmets, jackets and pants, gloves, luggage, boots, raingear etc etc. Mostly chinese and colombian stuff but also some european stuff. Also a couple of coffeeshops and restaurants within the block.

name: La Casa De David
description: A small and cheap hostel. 9-10 mil pesos per night. It has parking for a 3-4 motorcycles or one mesium sized car. unfortunately not suitable for most 4wheel Overland vehicles. Its walking distance from good eating joints. Pretty basic but at effectively $3 per person, can't really complain

name: LavaArte - DO NOT USE
description: This place is ridiculously overpriced for laundry. Find others on google about two blocks away.  Charged $25usd for a medium bag of regular wash/dry/fold.  You can do better.

name: Villa del Sol
description:
Hostel and camping next to entrance of the park

Ran by sweet lady called Rosa. There is camping behind the house with enough space for multiple rigs, not easy to find a flat space, but I found one. 
Pay 10,000 for camping
For a room pay 20,000.

Use the kitchen (pay 5000 for gas), hot showers and nice place in general. No WiFi.

name: Piscilodo (mudbath and natural pool)
description:
Super nice pool with a mud bath next to it and a nice opener!

They pump water out of the ground and let it flow into the pool. Great surroundings and beers for 3.500.

You can dip yourself in the mud bath, dry out and rinse yourself and feel like a silky smooth skin newborn baby!

name: Hotel Doña Cande
description: We ended up in Magangué since we arrived too late to take the ferry. A local guy recommended us this place, because of the location and security aspects. Unfortunately we had to park the bike outside of the hotel, but the good thing is that the hotel is guarded by a fierce looking guy all night, so the owners promised us it should be fine. We paid 35000 pesos for a private room with fan (50000 with AC), descent and clean. 5-10 minutes drive to the ferry.

name: Quebrada Anzá
description:
Soccer field with good place in the shade where to park. There is a path that skirts the ravine in which there are two wells for swimming. There are two free municipal pools during the week. The place has a bathroom and shower. Super quiet and cute town. The weekend low many people to play ball and let sell without problem.
---
Cancha de fútbol con buen lugar a la sombra donde estacionar. Hay un sendero que bordea la quebrada en la cual hay dos pozos para nadar. Hay dos piletas municipales gratuitas durante la semana. El lugar cuenta con baño y ducha. Pueblo súper tranquilo y lindo. El fin de semana baja mucha gente a jugar a la pelota y dejan vender sin problema.

name: Hostal mirador la Mojarra
description:
Really nice Hostal/ Campground. Friendly owner, stayed there for one night in our car, paid 25000 for two persons. No height restrictions.

+57 3015369279

name: National Police Museum
description: Tours in English and Spanish at different times of day. Free. A few interesting artifacts. Nice people and good info.

name: Hotel La Vitrina
description: Hotel right on main road so it is quite noisy but many options of rooms to choose from. $25k COP for 2 people in a double with private bathroom, soap towels and blankets provided, huge undercover private parking area, restaurant, pool table. Such a nice family running the place! Would definitely recommend for 1 night, especially since everything in surrounding area is $80k COP and up..

name: Puerto Marino 3
description: One of the nicest Restaurants I ate in Colombia (or maybe even Southamerica - after 11 months on the road). It's not fancy - but a good local restaurant. Prices are reasonable. It's is a fish & marisco place. Also liked the atmosphere. Good service also. Walked a lot around in B/manga and found this most appealing.

name: Brisas del Norte (Gas Station & Hotel)
description:
Gas Station, with restaurant, big parkin, safe and although many trucks parked, it's quiet. Good place for overnight.
.....
Posto de combustível, com restaurante, grande área para estacionar, seguro e apesar de ter muito caminhão parado, é silencioso. Bom lugar pra pernoite.

name: Terpel
description:
A typical "it was late and we were tired" overnight at a gasstation. We felt safe and it was surprisingly quiet. A few trucks left early in the morning. We parked in front of the hotel and asked the owner if it was ok. He was very friendly and even brought us coffee in the morning!
Free.

name: Agro Campo veterinaria supplies
description: Discount store for pet supplies including food, medicine, etc. Huge green and orange building with parking.  Wide selection.  Good prices. No Vet prescription needed for medications.  Another store across street with same.

name: Mirador Buenos Aires
description: Canyon viewpoint. The road from Girón to Zapatoca is an amazing road with beautiful sights on the canyon. The beginning part is a bit rough (sandy) but after a few kilometers it gets really good, perfect twisty paved roads. Totally free visit of the canyon. Ideal for motorcycle riders. We didn't visit the Chicamocha National Parc through the official entrance, so couldn't tell if that's an added value.

name: US tank adaptor
description: At first they say no, but after asking permission to boss they did it. American l.p. tank.

name: Cabañas Peña Blanca
description:
The third place to stay in the area but this one is never closed since they live on the property. Jose and his family are super welcoming. Camping in front of the house is 15k COP per car. Access to a hot shower (suicide type), power and restroom. 
Jose is also a guide for the area. He has good tips for hikes just outside the National Park. Hikes are good for acclimating or a good option for people that want to hike outside of the NP and not bother with the permits.

name: Finca mi Cabaña
description: Small cheap hostel with pool, just a few km from Chachagui. Free secure parking for cars and motorcycles, maybe a big rig can fit here but no sure. $20.000 Colombian Pesos for a double bedroom with private bathroom. Restaurant nextdoor (el Hatillo) or you can ask the staff bring some food from the town.

name: Armed Robbery
description: Got robbed by 3 guys with nifes and machetes around 7pm as we were eating. They toke all the money passports, camera and phones. Don't stay there is not safe

name: parking market san gil
description:
best place to park next to the market- very easy to walk over 

big rigs until max 3m if space is available. 
also carwash possible. very friendly.
 cop2000/h
very nice market! do not miss it

name: Migración
description: This is where you can extend your personal visa. (Not your car TIP, that must be done at DIAN). You can do this online but ours didn't work so we came here. Fairly easy, helpful people, no line when we arrived at 8am.

name: Posto Terpel
description:
Excellent stop for overnight stay. Spacious and safe. It has clean bathrooms. It is quiet.

Excelente parada para pernoite. Espaçoso e seguro. Tem banheiros limpos. É sossegado.

name: Place to go for Kombi parts/mechanic
description: If you're travelling in a kombi this is a good place to find parts or a mechanic. Go to the VW parts store or the bike repair store and ask for Eduardo Amador. He doesn't have a workshop anymore and works mainly here or at his house. Great guy with good connections. Insist that it be him that looks at your kombi!

name: By the river
description: Right before the bridge there is a dirt road that goes down to the river. Side of the river is flat and wide enough to park

name: Pozos Azules
description: Some sulfur lagoons. If you’ve seen others probably not worth the visit. 10.000 COP pp.

name: Casa Terracotta
description: A very artistic house built by an architect. If you like the style of Gaudí it’s worth a visit. 10.000 pp, you also get a tour through the house explaining the building and the art concepts inside.

name: La Joya
description: Nice campground on a green field with trees for shadow. Place for about 4 small rigs, plenty places for tents. Nice swimming pool, 10x15 m. Cabanas also available. 10000 per Person + 5000 for Swimmingpool.

name: Altos de Josue
description:
Very nice place to camp or get with your van, with an amazing view of the valley. You can get a really good rest and also hike on the area. We camped there for 3 nights with our dog, and nobody bother us at all, we were alone. 
There is bathrooom but not really clean (we cleaned one to use) and no hot shower... but if you shower at 2 or 3 pm on a sunny day, the water is really hot! 
They charged 15.000 COL pp (when we were paying they told us 20.000...but a deal is deal and we paid 15.000)

Enjoy!

name: Chakira
description: Ten minute walk to great views of valley, river and waterfalls. Stone carvings at viewpoint. Free entrance, but parking costs 4000. Baños. Drinks. Very last part of road is rough.

name: Suramericana SOAT
description: Successfully purchased an extension on my SOAT here. You need to show your TIP and title of the vehicle. (We had bought it originally in Cartagena when we arrived, then extended our TIP and needed to extend the SOAT too)

name: Rocky Batterias
description: A very extensive battery shop with cheap options and also name brands. Very nice fellow (Andreas) runs it. Decent pricing. Good service.

name: Tuk Tuk Restaurant and bar
description: Very nice restaurant with an amazing view over valley and on the hills. Delicious thai food and cold lemonade (homemade).

name: Appalusa Clínica Veterinaria
description: Fantastic, young vet. No english speaker, but will try. Has much on hand or can get within 24 hours. If doors closed, send note. He lives nearby.

name: Parqueadero Santa Catalina
description: Large, secure parking lot to leave your vehicle for days/weeks/months.  No height restriction.  Plenty of open-air parking, but also several spots under a very high roof on the side for big rig parking mostly protected from the rain.  We searched all over Popayan and this was the best option we could find (our van is 2.5m tall so wouldn't fit in most parking lots).  24 hour security, cameras everywhere (we could see our van on the camera from the office at the front), barbed wire fence all around.  (Will update when we return for our van if all was well!)

name: Reserva Natural Anahuac
description: Large riverside campground for tents or vans or rental cabins.  Lots of space to spread out your stuff.  There is a main entrance where you can park and find an employee to tell them you want to van camp, then they'll have you pull back out to the road and go further up to a different entrance to the camping area.  Clean toilets, icy cold showers, restaurant, a few river-water pools, and several access points to the river.  Very friendly owner Cesar who said he's never had van campers before but would love to have more.  They have wifi but it wasn't working when we were there.  Very quiet on weekdays, I can't speak for weekends.

name: Santa Isabela (Italian)
description: Nice restaurant with good pizzas! They also have pasta/ravioli.

name: Parqueadero Lorena
description: Secure parking with no height restrictions, might even fit big rigs. They have hourly, daily, weekly and monthly rates. We parked here for four weeks while staying in Laureles and visiting a language school.

name: Barrios La Sierra and Buenos Aires
description:
This is the terminal of the tranvia (tram). From here you can either take the cable (cable car) to La Sierra or walk back along the tranvia to Estacion Buenos Aires.

La Sierra is probably most famous for the documentary "La Sierra - Muerte en Medellín" from 2004. It's available on Youtube with english subtitles. Nowadays it's a peaceful barrio with amazing views over Medellín, a nice park and friendly people. People are not used to tourists (yet) but are open and welcoming. If you don't feel secure enough it's also nice to just take the cable car up and down.

Along the tranvia to Buena Vista you can see multiple murals from different artist collectiv, eat in one of the many cafes and restaurants or just stroll around.

name: Sendero Cascada De Bordones
description: The woman of the hotel (hotel Bordones) told us to come here. It's the house of Victor Gonzalo. This very nice guy guides you through his property to discover different levels of the Salto De Bordones. It's really worth to come here! The tip is voluntary. If your car is not bigger than our 4 runner you can park before his house. Otherwise it's better to park in the village nearby. (his phone: 3143735621)

name: Hospedaje Restaurant
description:
Asked for a place to sleep, 20k. Asked for tent, free!
I'm cyclotourist, don't know if works for car but they have a big empty park, the señora is friendly.
I ordered a vegetarian dinner and i found piece of chicken in the soup and ham in the pasta...
Quiet even if is on the main road.
Free wi-fi at the park in front of the church

name: Villa Leito
description: Zona de Campamento y Hospedaje, Finca campestre, zonas amplias de caminata, tranquilidad y descanso.

name: Hotel behind gas station
description:
We found this place at night, and it was just right to sleep (us and our dog) and continue our journey early next day.
The rooms are clean. It has tv, AC and private bathrooom with cold water (believe me, you will thank it's cold).
There is a restaurant for some local food at the gas station and the beach is a few steps from the place. 
The parking is open but behind the gas station, so there is always somebody over there. It felt safe.
We paid 70.000 COL for the room.

name: Viajeros Sin Fronteras
description: One of the best places we had the chance to eat out of the main big cities. We had a vegetarian dish, sautéed vegetables with steamed potatoes (or home made French Frieds). The food that was served was of extreme quality and the service was impractical with nothing to point it out! We highly recommend for those who value a healthy and well cooked food!

name: Mobil 1 super diesel
description: They carry super diesel at the Mobil 1 here

name: Hostal Ciudad de Segorbe - with parking
description:
Very cute and quiet hostal with a large secured parking lot within courtyard.

Cost 45k for a dorm or 90k for a private room and 125k for a private room for two.

Good wifi, free breakast between 7-9am, free coffee all day long. Breakfast well above average. Fruit bowl with 4 types of fruits. Buffet with: 3 different kinds of breads, fruit juice, coffee and tea, cereal and milk, cheese, ham and they also cook you eggs.

Quiet place, colorful deco.  I stayed in a dorm for 4 days had the whole dorm to myself for this period. Comfy beds that are made each day and there are no bunk beds. Tall ceiling, Lockers with locks. Amazing water temperature and pressure.

My only complaint is the couches and patio furniture made from shipping pallets that aren't comfy.

I highly recommend if it fits your budget.

Also the panaderia next door sells amazing and large banana cake pieces for 1,500

name: Route 60
description: Route 60 on the map looks like a proper main road. Between Pauna and San Pablo de Borbur there are currently roadworks which means the road is only open for traffic once an hour and you’ll be asked to wait at the barrier until it re-opens. From Otanche to La Esmeralda the road turns into a a single file dirt track with lots of new landslides and as it is rainy season at the moment a lot of river crossings which can be up to half a meter deep. To drive this road at the moment you would need 4x4 and high clearance (only after heavy rain, check with the locals upfront and You should be fine)...

name: parque EL GALLINERAL
description: This park is very beautiful, we spend nice  moment to walk in. you will see squirrel and koati. The price is 6000 cop by adult free for child. you can go in and out every time you want. the price includes the access at nice swimming pool.

name: water tap
description: we fill our water tank with tap for free. the water is very clear. the tap is behind the bathroom

name: costamatic
description:
Nice Landry service. price /kg
9000 pesos < 5kg
8000 pesos < 10kg
7000 pesos >10kg

name: San Luis de Garceno
description: Town square. Quiet, safe, generally unnoticed.  Ice cream and fast food and a few basic stores nearby.

name: Aguas Calientes
description:
There are three hot springs places in this region of Cundinamarca.  Search google. One is only open weekends. Other has a longer dirt road.This one was great. 10k of passable dirt road manageable by cars, vans or big rigs. Open from 9 to 6. 24,000p to enter and 24,000p for a good meal. NO CAMPING due to insurance. But can camp back along road you came in. 
Showers. Toilets. Warm waterfall area. Turkish baths. Weird oil bubbling out of rocks. Huge hot swimming pool. Great way to spend a day. Then drive out to camp in the valley.

name: Coffee Town Hostel
description:
. Nice place un the city-center
. Cleen Room with wifi, hot water and private bathroom
. Payed 80 000 Cop for a room for 4 people
. Nice terrasse and garden with hamocks
. 1 space for car in a garage, we have fit two side-cars
. free coffre and breakfast for 5 000 Cop

name: Hotel Oviedo Real
description:
. Clean big appartement in an hostel, 100000 cop/pn
. You can find also single or double room.
. Secure Parking for cars or motorbike

name: Seguro del Estado
description:
On the 5th floor of the Plaza Mocawa.

Sold me insurance but they had to scan and send all papers to the Bogota office that took a few hours. This seems to be common practice for them because i was told the stame thing in Cali

They would also force me to buy 3 months of insurance even thou I only needed 1 month. They said they had to follow the end date of the DIAN paper. 

Could pay in cash or with a credit card but somehow they could not get my card to work.

Cost 129k for a 2005 Suzuki Dl650 (3 months)

Security guard allowed me to park my bike in the lot in front of the plaza.

name: Cafe Rituales
description:
Medellin (and Laureles) has tons of good coffee shops, however this one sticks out. 
Obviously they have good coffee but their coffee is from the Barrio La Sierra. La Sierra, like comuna 13, is one of the neighborhoods of Medellin with a very violent history and growing coffee is one of the new ways to earn a living. 
Apart from good coffee, they habe really good sandwiches and drinks, I can highly recommend the Coffee Limonade. 
On top of all that, they are dog friendly and have fast wifi.
Open Mo-Sa from 9am to 9pm, So 10am-9pm

name: Hotel BellaVista
description: Quiet spot just 5 min walk from the city center. Lovely breeze, awesome views, pool, ping pong table. Friendly family running the place. Secure parking lot, and private space for some bicycles. Quoted us for 80,000cp for 2 people, but dropped to 50,000 when I asked.

name: Motorcycle repuesto distric
description: Here is the area with all of the motorcycle parts shops.

name: Hostal Colonial La Batea
description: Clean and nice place. 25k for a single room. Hot showers, wi fi, tv. The owner offered to park my motorbike in his storehouse for free (but there is a place only for one bike)

name: Hotel Nuevo Milenio (love motel)
description:
Has large Secured parking with security guard all day. 

45 for a double bed to check out at noon, 50 if you want to check out at 3pm 

Security allowed me to work on my bike without problems. Motorcycle are has a roof.

No wifi

Otherwise nothing bad really.

name: Cerro Pilon de Azucar
description: Three hours north of Riohacha, on Cape La Vela, is what is known as The Sugar Pylon (el Pilón de Azúcar), a hill whose summit seems far away, but which can be reached on foot in only 15 minutes. The heights of this small mountain, characterized by its strong bracing winds, features altar to the Virgin of Fatima, as well as an impressive view of the Caribbean Sea.

name: Balneario Yoniky
description: Unofficial camp at a pool behind the gates of these friendly owners. With cold shower and bathroom. Payed 10000

name: Parking space
description:
It’s a guarded parking for truckers. You can also rent a room. 
The room is 35000 just Parking is 10.000.
Its direct at the street and family owned.

name: Monte Carmelo
description: Cheap option to spent one night. Close to the road, everything new and clean. They let us park our bikes in their garage. 25.000 Pesos for two in a room with private bathroom. No AC but you don't need one, it's cool enough here.

name: Jardín Botánico del Quindío
description:
The Quindío Botanical Garden was created in 1979 as a non-profit foundation, under the leadership of Alberto Gómez Mejía, with the participation of members of the Oikos Organization, the University of Quindío and the Gardening Club of Armenia. It is structured with three main objectives: ecological conservation, scientific research and environmental education. It is also a recognized center of nature tourism, in which we strive to preserve the beauty of different landscapes. As a botanical garden we have several collections and exhibitions of plants, which you can know in detail on this page and on the occasion of your visit. We want to highlight the National Collection of Palm trees, which brings together almost all the native species of Colombia of this family, so the garden has had a remarkable international recognition.


We believe that nature works in an integral way, in close relationship of living organisms with each other and natural elements such as soil, water and climate, for which we have a beautiful and famous Butterfly Garden, an insect zoo, three birdwatching sites, a museum of Geology and soils, the Museum of the "La Linea" Tunnel, an ethnobotanical museum of palm trees and many other natural attractions. Within our philosophy of access to the community, many educational institutions in the region and the country, participate with their students in academic projects and training in scientific topics.


We are waiting for you.

name: Cheap hotel
description: Don't get stuck in Uribia. If you did, here's the cheapest hotel. I'm sure about it because i've asked the police. 30k for a room, one person. It was 25k for me because tv didn't work. The room is more like a prison cell but works fine for a night. No windows, no wifi, cold shower, ac. Don't know about the parking, my bike  spent a night in a repair shop. It has no sign, just a door with a metal grid in a blue house.

name: River Crossing
description: At least in the rainy season the water from waterfall gets knee deep. There is a pedestrian bridge which works fine for small bikes. The coordinates may be wrong a bit.

name: Hotel Gran Villa
description: Fine place to stay for a night, 50,000 COP for a room with AC. Large parking good for big rigs no height restrictions.

name: Hospedaje de Guatavita
description:
Very nice Hostal with friendly young owners. Rooms from 70 to 130kp depending on view, number of beds and private bathroom.
Place to park bicycle and motos inside yard, cars outside parking but flat.

name: El Dorado Hostel
description:
This Hostel opened just a few month ago. So everything is new and very clean! Also the staff is very friendly and helpful. They have a garage for a couple of motorcycles and they let us do some serious work on the bikes in their garage. They have 1 private double, 1 private room for up to 4 people and a couple of dorm rooms. The area around is safe and quiet. We had no problems walking around at night. It is just a bit hard to find the entrance because it looks like a normal house and has no signs.
We really recommend this place!

name: Pop Art Hotel
description: Nice hotel in city center. A bit expensive at 150,000 Cop for a double bed but worth the niceness and space. Has ample secured parking. Solid wifi.

name: Manaus Hotel
description: 45,000 cop for a nice modern room with nice private bath and unlimited hot water. Secured on site garage parking for cars or motorcycles. Might exercise caution in the neighborhood at night. That said plenty of local restaurants within a block. For the price and quality of the room this place is tough to beat.

name: Of I entro
description: Great professional copy shop, very good for copying your car papers

name: mundo cart diesel iveco
description:
good mecanic 
knows very well iveco can manage complementary wheels battery winch

name: mundo cart diesel iveco
description:
good mecanic 
knows very well iveco can manage complementary wheels battery winch
calle 17 N° 658-06
tel (571) 446 1041
MOBILE AND WHATS APP (57)310 7751 677

name: Decathlon, Viva Envigado
description:
The Decathlon store is located in the Viva Envigado mall. It is a very reasonably priced outdoors and sports store. It has a ton of Quechua gear, cold weather, and camping items.

Situated inside a huge mall

name: Parque Nacional del Chicamocha parking lot
description: It's the parking lot of the park entrance ( East ). We paid 7000 Pesos. Good for one night. Restaurant and toilets available.

name: hotel,camping,restaurant La Playa
description:
very nice place to stay for a few days and lots of things to do.
in this region the grow a lot of coffee, but not touristic as the other places.
the owner has a family coffee farm with you can do a tour, pick your own coffee to let it dry and to take with you. he offers horsback riding and forrest tours as well. the hotel has rooms, but you can stay in your camper as well, next to the pool, showers, toilets. if you book a tour with him you can stay for free on the campground (or for a little tip as we did) breakfast, lunch, dinner are all 8000 per meal, basic, but great and big meals. 
very friendly staff, totaly secure area and campground. easy to get, good roads, all possible for big rigs.
very nice clean swimming pool. 
in the four days we were there we had the place for ourself, good fun. 
contact owner (speak only spanish) Guestava : 
allways welcome, but the best thing is to contact hem first if you want a tour as well. (at night he lives in a place nearby)
caballone@hotmail.com otprovoca@gmail.com
he uses whatsapp as well. +573113210503

name: Hostel Meridiano
description: Fantastic place to stay the night if you’re passing though.  Safe parking in the lobby for several motorcycles and there were hardly any people here when we stayed. 25,000 each for a public room (we had the whole thing to ourselves) or 30,000 for a private room with one bed I think.  Breakfast/coffee is 5000 per person.  Laundry service available.  Parking for one jeep sized vehicle or maybe a small camper in the driveway. Not sure.  Clean place overall.

name: graffiti tour
description:
one of the highlight of medellin. 
we did a tour with this guy. he lives in the place and own a small company with 4guids. you can do english or spanish tours in the morning and afternoon. the photos speak for themself. 
the meetingpoint is at the entrance of the metro station San Javier, so very easy to get. just make sure you make contact a day before, so you don't get disapointed. 
this tour is funded by your contributions of the people who join, very nice way. 
easy way is to send him a mail or text on whatsapp because during the day he gives the tours.
his whatsapp is: +573217653446
storytellersmedellin@gmail.com

name: la casa de agua
description:
place where you get purified drinking water right at petrol station
open 7.30_9  Sunday 8-8
www.thewaterhouse.com.co

name: Prado Lake
description: Giant lake up in the mountains.  This spot is one of the boat launches.  If you can, get a tour of the lake and also look into on of the hostals around the lake.  Absolutely stunning views all accessable by the waterways.

name: Playa Aguja
description:
Nice and quiet beach where you can park close of huge shelters. Water is good to swim (safe) and warm but don’t expect clear water like other part of Caraïbe. The road to reach the place is not in good shape but if you managed to drive till punta gallinas this part is a piece of cake ;-)
This place is probably not quiet during holiday. There are toilets on site but all of them was close at this time.

name: hotel central
description: just near bus station. 30 k doble room with clim, wifi. first, it is for driver but we could stay a night. good when you arrive late by night or go early in the morning.

name: El paraiso
description: This hostel is in the pueblo. 60 000 k private room (we negociate, low Season...). America is nice and you are in the midle of local people. it is not as the others expensives hostels!!

name: Katherine
description:
Nice private house with 2 rooms with double bed. Shared (if second room is booked) bathroom. We payed 50000 COP for 2 p. Breakfast included. Very, very friendly owners, Katherine and Andrés  speak English as well. Rooms, bathroom and kitchen extremely clean. The hosts also own a hacienda , where you can book a horse riding tour, transport to the hacienda is included. Highly recommended. For further questions call 
Katherine: +57 3208509448

Bonita casa privada con 2 habitaciones con cama de matrimonio. Cuarto de baño compartido (si se reserva segunda habitación). Pagamos 50000 COP por 2 p. Desayuno incluido. Los anfitriones son muy, muy amables, Katherine y Andrés hablan inglés también. Habitaciones, baño y cocina extremadamente limpios. Los anfitriones también son propietarios de una hazienda, donde se puede reservar una excursión a caballo, el transporte a la hazienda está incluido. Muy recomendado. Si tienes pregundas communicate Katherine: +57 3208509448

name: Hostal Puerta de Oro
description: 37.5k for an ac dorm room.  Nice owners who let me do my laundry in the basin for free. Parking inside for one or maybe 2 bikes but it’s a safe neighborhood.  6 minutes to walk to the Mercado.  I had the dorm to myself the whole time and saw only one other local here.  WiFi is pretty fast.  Might be able to park a camper on the street and use facilities but definitely not anything big.

name: Ruta 90
description: Nice motel with clean rooms and airconditioning.. Since its a motel you can park in a private garage that is right in front of your room.. We could fit easily with our van (2,20m)

name: Humberto's Parking
description:
An enclosed parking lot off of Carrera 7 (you'd turn left before the street light from the south). Humberto was more than happy to receive us, and charged 8,000 COP for the afternoon and night. 

Seems safe enough as there is a guard all night and the gate is closed around midnight. Although it's right in downtown it wasn't all noisy. a few trucks did arrive at the parking lot during the night but it was pretty calm overall. 

I put one picture inside looking out. 

Here's the street view looking at the door:

https://goo.gl/maps/yDBv3RLR7vE2

name: El Rancho Restaurante
description:
Big but empty restaurant.
There is hospedaje for 20k even if shower is broken
They let me camp in the sheltered area for horse for free and i bought a good but expensive dinner at 10k
Nancy was nice and very interested about my trip by bike, she offer some coffe and guayaba sweetie.
Big park with gate and quiet road by night

name: Milan (main laundry center) Lavandería
description: This is the main place for washing, drying, folding.  The prices are a little cheaper than in town.  Note- as with everywhere in VdL they are closed from 12:30 to 1:30 daily.

name: Parking lot nnnk
description:
place to park, overnight, 24 hours, light, water, big local bus
contact nielson, phone +57 3011809701
----
local para estacionar..pernoitar..24 horas..luz água..grande local p bus
contato nielson..fone +57 3011809701

name: HidrobikeStore
description: Mechanicals motorcicle, laudry, parts of motorcicle, accesorios

name: Tecni Autos Avenida
description: Highly recommended garage for al mechanical problems on your car. We had problems with the Gear Box, our 5th and 6th gear where not working well. so they dismounted the hole gear box and let refurbished some essential parts in it. I also let do some other essential work on the car. After 3 days everything was finished and all work has been done perfectly. Carlos, the owner of this garage was recommended by 'Todos Autos' the other recommended  Mechanic in Pereira. His workplace is clean and organised and fits medium sized rigs easily. He is waiting for more overlanders now :-)

name: Hotel
description: Very basic hotel with minimum facilities (they do have a hot shower though). Essentially it's a bed under the roof. It looks as if they rarely get anyone to stay there, and they have 2-3 rooms max.

name: Aire Extremo & Hechicera Restobar
description:
Beautiful viewpoint. Restaurant and paragliding business; owner is very friendly.
Free for overnight campers & big rigs. 
+573013652337 Restaurant WhatsApp

name: Backpackers & Travelers Hostal Neiva
description: Great place to park with lots of trees and shade. The hostel owner was very friendly and let us park on the street for free. Showers are 5000pp, he also offered access to use the kitchen and WIFI for no extra cost.

name: Fonda Casa Blanca
description:
