A hotel next to the main road. Private parking for a few cars - the gate is closed during the night.  Simple, clean room with hot shower and with fans (no AC) -  20 000COP per person. Helpful staff.
There is also posibility of sleeping in the car and using external bathroom for hotel staff -  20 000COP per car. Average WiFi. In the hotel a small restaurant is run (we didnt check it). There is also another hotel with a restaurant on the opposite side of the road but rooms are significantly more expensive there.

name: Roaring River Roadside Stop
description: This back road follows a river through a deep canyon. The dirt road is passable by buses and delivery trucks And the usual 3-man motorcycle and family sedan. Narrow in a few places and a little bumpy.  Night was falling and we spotted this dug out niche.  Heard the river all night, birds in the morning. A few vehicles passed through the night.  Tents will feel visible, as it is right off the road. But it’s the only wide spot for a few miles. Note- if rainy this may be too muddy for some larger rigs.

name: Mi ranchito Restaurante
description:
Delicious and cheap food.
25k COP for two "menu" (soup, steak, rice, petacon, fries and beer)
The taste is really good and the people is friendly.

name: Portal del Llano
description: Oscar runs this place south of Timbio. There you will eat an excellent "asadero" meat and sancocho at good price. He is happy to welcome travellers and has been of great help when we had gearbox issues. 400 m south there is a garage which is efficient. A good place to refill stomachs on the road between Pasto and Popayán.

name: Iguana Boutique
description: There are 3 separate apartments.  2 with kitchen.  wifi, TV, all with private bathrooms. Close to restaurants and stores.

name: Autotech
description: very good and friendly mechanic for alignment, shocker and mechanical . Diego speaks also english and can help with the tips about Medellín. Good price. whatsapp 3204210955 diego (medellin)

name: Finca del Rio Palomino
description:
Charming and spacious farm located in the quiet and beautiful neighborhood of Palomino, right on the shore of Palomino River
An amazing place for adventure seekers to stay. You’ll have all the space, safety and privacy you need for your Camper. Rooms available. Whatsapp: +32 477261755. Highly recommended. COP 15.000 per person/night. Diomedes is a very nice person always ready to help with tours (tubbing, lost city) and safety recommendations. 10 min walking to the beach. Clean bathrooms

name: Sol y Papaya
description: It looks like it's only a small bar close to the beach, but we had our best food there. the owner, Robinson, is a really warm, welcoming and enthusiastic person. He speaks English and as he told us Italian and Portuguese as well. And he is a fantastic cook who cares about fresh ingredients. We ate fish and lobster fresh from the sea accompanied by coconut rice, fried plantains and salad. Huge portions and so delicious. Next day we returned for breakfast which consisted of a nice fruit plate, fresh juice, scrambled eggs and arepas. He offered coffee or chocolate too. It's a bit pricy - we payed 15.000 each for breakfast, 30.000 for the fish and 50.000 for the lobster - but that's normal on the island. At least here you know you get good food! The bar is situated right by the beautiful Playa Beach as you can see in the pictures.

name: El Astillero
description: Small restaurant by the road, with a large open space for parking. Tiled courtyard with a roof perfect for laying out a sleeping bag or tent, and a clean toilet. No shower. Owner has dogs.

name: Pipecars electricity and automotive electronics
description:
Excellent electrician.
Our 1990 VW combi didn't start, he went where we were 30 minutes after we called and quickly found the problem, got the part that was damaged and changed it. It took about 4 hours for everything (the piece was hard to find because of the model of our combi). He charged us 70k cop.
The next day, we went to his workshop to review electrical problems that we had tried to solve throughout Central America without success, he fix them in 3 hours. Definitly he's a great electrician.
 Here's his cellphone 3217878751. FELIPE.

name: Hector's House
description:
Great place for stay in Capurganà, good vibes.
25k cop for shared room with fan and net but they have also private rooms. Kitchen, cold shower, electricity, wifi (now the router is broken).
Relaxing hammocks at 1st floor with seaview, quiet.
5 min walk to small shop and dock.
Gloria, Hector and Melissa are nice.

name: Freddy's sprinter and crafter mechanic
description: The other listed place for Sprinter mechanics has closed, we were recommended Freddy's. has diagnostic equipment.

name: hotel Puerto Nus
description: Good clean overnight stop with attached restaurant.  Cost 30,000 COP for a room overlooking the river. We'd  stay here again. About 130 km from Medellin.

name: Villagarzon #10
description: Old school with amazing view. A big outdoor place with roof and 2 other indoor places where it's possible to put a tent. Water nearby from the stream or from people.

name: SOAT.  MONEY CHANGE
description:
DO NOT BUY THE SOAT HERE. They could give a fake document.
Buy it in the city IPIALES in EXITO SUPERMARKET, or by Andrés Lopez one block away from the supermarket.

Not recomendable to change money either. They pay you less.
It is better to bring 20 or 50 USD bills They give you more money.
ONLY CHANGE IN THE CENTER OF IPIALES

name: El Bohio (formerly a burger place)
description: Restaurant close to the Hacienda Napoles gate. You can park behind it. Ask the vigilante for permission ( 8pm ). Nice people. We were allowed to fill up our water tanks on the next day. Small playground for kids. Had only coffee and limonada in the restaurant.

name: Grassy parking lot in front of the hotel
description:
This is a grassy parking lot in front of the hotel on the way to the restaurant Del Mar. We didn't want to drive the steep and tight way to the restaurant and we stopped here. We asked at the hotel and they said it was fine. Surprisingly quiet at night even if it's so close to the highway.
 Free, you can reach the WiFi from the hotel but we didn't ask.

name: Marakarita Bed & Breakfast
description: Margarida is a beautiful and friendly woman. Her place is in front of the beach with a nice view and very good vibes. We loved everything, specially her pizzas. Dibulla is the beach to reborn, there you really can relax. She offer hammock, bed and breakfast, Wifi and cocktails.

name: Rincon Dive Center
description:
Stefania and Giovanni, the Italian owners of the Rincon Dive Center are some of the nicest people that we met on our trip. They will answer all your questions about diving and make you feel at home. They go diving around the San Bernardo Archipelago and its beautiful.
They offer: 
Padi Open Water courses: 890'000 COP
Advanced courses:
Fun Dives: 2dives for 230'000COP
Night Dive: 300'000COP

Ask about them at the Chill Octopus Hostel about 5 houses before these coordinates. The location here marks where we camped for 3 nights. Parking spot directly on the beach, free, no facilities. Stefania and her husband are building a dive center very close to this spot and once its done they will offer to use bathroom and showers there. In the meantime you an make a deal with the hostel to use their facilities. 
Rincon del Mar is a very relaxed little town at the beach. Its safe and a great place to visit the San Bernardo islands (60'000COP) or see the fluorescent plancton (50'000COP)

name: Hostal Caño Cristales
description:
Hostel opened at May 2018. A double Room with private Bathroom cost 70.000$. It's clean and has a big community area. The owner offer's also tours to caño cristales and other places. 
Some times the wifi is working slow and sometimes it doesn't work.

name: Caño Piedras
description: A small Caño Cristales. With possibility to swim. 300m down the Rivers the Color are much more intensive! Went there by bicycle on our own. everybody will say it's not possible. try it on your own. it's really easy, only a little bit muddy. it's cost nothing than the bicycles.

name: Hostel y Restaurante La Casona
description: A neat family-friendly program for those who like zoos

name: Hotel Monasterio San Agustín
description: Nice hotel build in a colonial style with own chapel  and 15 nice decorated rooms and restaurant with fireplace and wine celar !

name: Lazy Cat
description: Small cozy restaurant bar and coffee shop. It has fast WiFi , river view terrace.

name: klaus Hergett - Land Rover Shop
description: Excellent well organized Land Rover shop. I didn't have work done here but talked to Klaus and would consider his shop for work. Land Rover work done to a high standard and experience with overlanding.

name: CampersTravelColombiaLtda
description: If you need to repair you camper, or do any camper part this is THE place. The people that work here are extremely passionate about camper and they are trying to bring up the camper culture in Colombia. It is really the place where you can get a quality job from people that know how campers are made. They sell and make campers from different brands (Jayko, Lance and others) and they go to USA to conferences to keep up with all the knowledge. They knew our camper better then us! We went there for a repair and we end up staying one week, making the camper better than when we bought it. They allowed us to stay in the workshop, the use of bathroom ( shower with warm water :) ), electricity, water. They made us feeling at home more then ever, I can just recommend this place.

name: Old market
description:
Big place to put tent or big truck.
Lights, plugs.
No water.
Seems safe, police told us to come here.
Roof to be dry.

name: Casa Burgos
description:
Claudia and Juan are lovely hosts, they speak perfect english so they can help if needed. They have a large parking place with no height restriction except branches at about 3.2 m. Perfect place to stay while shiping or waiting your camper. They are friends with Ana the aduana agent. Room prices are around 80 kp, depending on period and size of room, all have AC. 15 to 20 min walk to the historic centro. Commun kitchen.

Big Rigs up to 8 m is the Max. 3,2m and 4 m high.

name: Camping by the beach
description: We stayed three nights at this place. There is a cold shower and a toilet. Very nice place for a tent. First the owner want 15 000 Pesos per person per night. Later 12 000 Pesos. Nice bay to swim and to snorkel.

name: Entrada villa margarita
description:
José and Diana received us kindly, they are wonderful people and we mark the new coordinates of the entrance to their house, since iOverlander has wrong the way to the house, keep in mind that to arrive by San Fernando you just have to follow the part Straight does not take a steep climb that exists! Keep in touch with them to be able to find the wonderful place where they live 🙌🏽
--
José y Diana nos recibieron amablemente, son unas personas maravillosas y marcamos las nuevas coordenadas de la entrada a su casa, ya que iOverlander tiene erróneo el camino a la casa, tengan en cuenta que para llegar por San Fernando solo tienen que seguir por la parte recta no tomar una subida empinada que existe! Manténgase en contacto con ellos para poder dar con el lugar maravilloso donde viven 🙌🏽

name: Bidea Hostel
description: Without any doubt, the best option to stay in Filandia. Here you can park your vehicle on the street right in front of the Hostel and use all the facilities, sleeping at night in your own house on wheels. We were only asked for a modest sum of COP8,000 per person. Highly recommended! The street facing the entrance door of the Hostel is a bit unleveled but the perpendicular street is almost flat and is also leaning against the hostel building. They even allowed us to bring our dog inside, during all day - not sure if it was an exception.

name: Hospital
description: We arrived on Friday night and it was very noisy everywhere. We found this place next to the hospital, low traffic and no noise from the city and free. Nothing ultimately cool but good for one night.

name: Casa Kolacho graffiti tour
description: This is a hip hop cultural house run by people from comuna 13. They offer an authentic graffiti tour in a part of the city that was very dangerous to visit and now it is one of the main attractions in Medellin. Tours start at 9 and 14, if you get here a bit before that you won't miss the start. Don't leave Medellín without seeing the famous grafitis. Totally worth a visit, 30k pp I'm spanish or 50k in English

name: Dogs Park
description: Quiet street parking at a park where people go walk with their dogs in the morning. Go facilities. Excellent veterinary nearby (orthovet), or dog had an infection because of a tick. We stayed two nights in the park because if this, and it was surprisingly quiet. one of them even was a Friday night. Locals seemed not to care about us. there is a guard in the condominium next to the park who said it's ok for him if we stay.

name: Great Filling Station
description: You can sleep quiet here. It is beside the police station and the people of the town are OK.

name: Mayorca Home-Stay
description:
Stella and her husband have a lovely Home-Stay
In south Medellin across a park. Quiet, clean and super friendly. Up to six bedrooms. Private secured garage for up to three big bikes. Hot shower, WiFi and laundry. Breakfast included. 
From 65000 Pesos per person.

name: Hospedaje de Marta
description:
About 7 very nice A/C, ensuite rooms located above a family home, with a rooftop palapa patio with hammocks. Safe, enclosed parking for 2-4 large motos or maybe a small car. Cleanest rooms we've seen in several weeks! Just 100m from the beach. COP50000 for a double room with excellent bed, bedding, and private amazing bathroom.

The "reception" is at the Drogas Condor pharmacy (family's business) with the blue awning, directly ACROSS the street from the PetroMil gas station along the main road. (NOT the pharmacy within the gas station parking lot.)
Approximate location: 9.401089, -75.681273

3126819349 is the pharmacy phone number; I don't think they speak English but they speak very clear Spanish. The son gave us his number and we could contact him via Whatsapp at any time if we needed anything.

Be sure to eat a cheese-filled 'arepa' from "Mr. Arepa" at his arepa stand just outside the pharmacy each night! BEST we've had in all of Colombia and only COP1500!!!

name: behind the cliffs
description:
Not a great spot, but we were driving in the dark. Pulling off to the left just before a right hand bend (heading east) you can get behind the mountain face and round up onto a level spot by a GPS datum marker. You're hidden at night but by daylight can be seen from the road unless you're in a tent or maybe car. You could also camp on a not level spot before reaching the top. Road noise is there but not insane. Few trucks passing in the night. 

Someone lives nearby but was friendly and came to say hi. 

Epic views.

name: 24h Secured Parking Lot
description: Big Parking lot with security person (and dog) and cameras, the gate is very high (we had no problem being 3,25m). Basic bathroom, no other facilities. Supermarket and fast food near by. Quiet at night but in the morning starting at 6:30 cars started to come and go. We needed to be in the neighborhood for a mechanic repair, safe place for a night. Price : 10000 for one night

name: La Casa de Sebastian
description:
Sebastian welcomes you in his traditionnal wooden house. it has a share kitchen, balconies, hot shower. there is a lovely cat and dog. no wifi but internet available in his computer. the area is super lovely and quiet. Sebastian can show you around and he is extra friendly and thoughtful. paid 60000 for the private room upstairs. Tent or car 20000 per person. best to call him o whatsapp him before hand. he may not be home... +573193205980
If you are on foot, take a bus from medellin to Santa Helena (Barro Blanco). The meeting point is usually at la Tienda Rosario.

name: La naval hotel
description: Cheap hotel 43 dollar for a room for 4 w a/c and private barhroom, good location

name: Restaurante y hotel El viajero
description: Basic hotel with a/c tv and wifi, prívate bathroom with cold shower, we paid 90000 for a triple room. 70000 for a double with one queen and one single bed.Open parking with security and a nice restaurant. We will just stay for the night.

name: Gran Hotel
description:
Really, truly excellent hotel run by a very nice family. Brand new, spotless rooms and excellent, modern bathrooms. Fastest wifi of the 4 places we checked in San Luis, 6.5/0.9 Mbps down/up speeds--not very fast compared to a large city, but this is a tiny town in the mountains.

Get a room on the first floor, by the entrance, if you want fast wifi. I believe their routers/repeaters on the 2nd/3rd floors are improperly set up and have no internet connection. Or better yet, help them set those routers/repeaters up if you're technically inclined.

We paid 40000 for a double room with private bathroom, though it may have actually been 20000 and we may have accidentally paid double (weird story), which we would be more than happy to do because the place was so great and the family was so accommodating.

Little kitchenette in the hallway with an unlimited ozonized water tap.

No on-site parking, but there are cheap, secure parqueaderos close by.

name: Rincon Dive Center
description:
Stefania and Giovanni, the Italian operators of the dive center are some of the nicest people we met on our entire trip. They take you diving around the San Bernardo Islands. They offer:
Fun dives (2 dives): 230'000 COP
Night dive (1 dive): 300'000 COP
Open water certification: 890'000 COP
Advances OW certification: 890'000 COP

Their building a new dive center very close to this spot and will let you use the bathroom and shower facilities once they finish constructions. For now you have to ask about them at the Chill Octopus Hostel a few houses away from this spot where you can also book tours to the San Bernardo Islands (60'000 COP) or a tour to see the fluorescent plancton (50'000 COP). 

The spot we market here is a parking lot right at the beach. We stayed here 3 nights for free. It's safe and the people around super friendly.

name: Cano Piedras
description:
Good swim. Awesome place to spend the day, the stream is nice for swim, but you have to leave after 6pm. No overnight camping. Its private property.
The very nice owner let you sleep next to his house, its nice and quite place, better than town.

name: River bed
description: Nice spot on the river bed, u have to cross couple times to river to get here. regarding the locals its safe, but better always check.

name: En la calle
description:
Good place to park and be a few days. We stayed four days. the neighbors are very friendly, it is a safe and comfortable place. Free.
----
Buen lugar para parquear y estar unos días. Nosotros estuvimos cuatro días.  los vecinos son muy amables, es un lugar seguro y cómodo. Gratis.

name: Casa Manga 24
description:
It is very nice hostel, owned by a Italien/ Colombian couple. They offer 2 privat double bedrooms with toilet and shower. Also 1 room with 4 beds. The price for double room is 95000 pesos for 2 persons. The price for a bed 45000 pesos. Breakfast is included. You have the choice of different types of breakfast. The owner is a perfect Italien cook and offers lunch and dinner too. It varies between 15000 to 18000 pesos/ person.
Everything is very clean and the hosts are extremely friendly and helpful.
The best: This Hostel is very close to Dian, port, Insurance and Compas if you ship to or from Colon in Panama. All distances you may walk. Taxi to the old city starts close to the house. 2300 Pesos/Person or 25 min. walking. 
You can make your reservations over Booking.com, Expedia, hotel.com
You also contact via email: murciaelsa81@gmail.com
or phone +57 3162544057
+57 3186668669

name: Rio Gazaunta / Rio Gazamuno
description: Balneario near the street. We paid 5000 cop for parking and sleeping in the car. Noisy at weekends

name: Casa Quimbaya
description:
Apparently out of the three hostels available in Armenia this is the only one with the possibility of street parking. Because all the others are located on the main street and it is not possible to park on the street. Here you can pay to park right in front of the Hostel, in a quiet street with not to much traffic, and pay to use all the facilities only for COP15,000 per person. The dorms are also cheap by the way, COP20,000 per person and includes breakfast. 

The kitchen is very large and clean. Hot water, just the showers on the reception first level floor. The facilities in general are very nice too! The staff is extremely kind and welcomed! They even allowed us to bring our dog inside, during the day - not sure if it was an exception.

The only thing, or not, is that this space also runs a cafe downstairs so expect some movement from 6:00 pm onwards. And the cafe always has different performances of live music almost every day so expect a bit of noisy environment. But if you like good music, all performers were relatively good, guitar and voice. Try the chocolate cake with passion fruit, it was very good! They have good coffee too!

We recommend it!

name: In the city
description: We stoped here for one night, at the begining of the litle city we swim in the river. Some people said that is safe and some others told us that is dangerous. We finaly decided to stay and everything be quiet and normal. there is trafic here but we slept well. Dont stay next the river in the village it seems more secure.

name: Veterinary Clinic Lasallista
description: University hospital for pets, very professional and welcoming. Locals adviced us to go there. Ww went there for a basic consultancy and we just had to pay the medications (not the visit). They also do surgery and hospitalisation. It's on the steep hill of the city Caldas, but we managed to drive there even with a big pickup camper.

name: Attempted robbery
description: Motorcyclists drove around us and told us we had a flat tire trying to get us to pull over. We waited to pull over a few minutes until we got to a crowded tienda. No flats or anything so guessing they wanted us to stop on the quiet road. Be careful and wait till there’s other people around just in case

name: VERY BAD ROAD
description:
Lots of potholes. You need 5 hours for 40 km !!

Update 1: with a 4x4 it took us 2 hours
Update 2: the bad road is getting shorter everyday so hurry up and enjoy it!!
Update 3: it's around 30 km (May 2024).

name: Valle de cocora
description:
We stay in this street in front of the restaurant, there are cameras and it is very quiet to spend the night.
----
Nos quedamos en esta calle al frente del restaurant, hay cámaras y es muy tranquilo para pasar la noche.

name: Camping Playa Azul
description: From the main road to the lake about 200m. Very windy but little access to the lake and level spot. Bathrooms in construction. They asked for 20.000 cop per car.

name: ATM +1.000.000 COP
description:
Scotiabank ATM on lowest floor shopping mall. We took 1.000.000 COP with 15.000 charge. More than 1.000.000 maybe possible.

Can be nice to withdraw big amounts for shipping!

name: la casa de felisa
description: A family house, very kind people. Yo can use the kitchen.

name: parking publico lorica
description:
It's a simple parking lot, but the very kind man in charge, charged us 5000 pesos, around two dollars. Two blocks from the cathedral, the market and the boardwalk in the historic center of the municipality that is considered a heritage town and worth knowing. parking lot close to the historic center, cathedral and market place. beautiful and historical down town, next the river. 2us

Es un simple estacionamiento, pero el hombre encargado muy amable, nos cobró 5000 pesos, al rededor de dos dolares. A dos cuadras de la catedral, del mercado y del malecón en centro histórico del municipio que es considerado pueblo patrimonio y que vale la pena conocer. parking Lot close to the historic center, cathedral and market place. beautiful and historical down town,  next the river. 2us.

name: Hotel Los Alpes
description: 20000 for two in a double room with private bathroom and fan. The key to room #4 is lost, so we used our own padlock to lock the door. Secure parking for cars and motorcycles, and likely for a huge rig too. Great restaurant too.

name: Finca Venecia
description:
ADMIN NOTE: this post was added by a family member of the owner. Has not been Overlander verified.

My uncle have a Finca near Quipile in a beautifull spot surrounded by nature. He rent rooms or the entire finca and might accommodate you for camping. The place is called Finca Venecia

name: El Mexicano
description: In this area there are not many wild camping spots where you can stay. El Mexican is actually a restaurant with a parking lot away from the main road with a nice view over the coffee farms. The owners name is Oscar and was kind enough to let us stay for free and gived us his Wi-Fi code.

name: Supermarket on the road
description:
If you don't like to go in town with your motorhome to find some food it's perfect.
You have a parking without limit of size to park your truck.
It's just on your right on the turn around
You have also ATM and restaurant....what else..
For big truck you you have place near the motorcycle place and in front of the café place..

name: Hostal La Amatista
description: Eiren built a beautiful house and now is turning into a hostel, he is full of great ideas and the dream has legs to walk. The back of the house faces a beautiful natural waterfall. The house is full of beautiful details. Here you can park the van on the driveway and pay to use all the facilities only for COP11.500 per person. We found this option better of any option in Pasto because it avoids all the typical confusion of a city. There is a 3 hours hike with a beautiful view of the hills that starts on the propriety grounds.

name: Parking Cocora Valley
description:
Hello
If you're with your motorhome, I think it's a realy good idea to park here.
It cost 2000 pesos for one hour for our truck.
After you will have problems to park or make a U turn.
We are 8 meters long, 2.5 large and 3.7 high....and I think it's the maximum size for this road....but you can try...!
If you are alone it cool...but so much people come here...

name: Restaurante Hectorino MTB deporte & aventura
description:
It is a country place on the Central Colombian mountain range. Curiosity causes the name of the GENEVA and COSTA RICA populations.
Hectorino Mtb Restaurant is a country place and very safe. You can enjoy Nature Tourism. Trekking, Cycling, hiking to the Paramo de Las Dominguez, The Bath in the Guabas River, Mtb Bicycle Rental and Bicycles with Racks and Saddlebags.
Only for Travelers special price per night. Camping or Motor Home US $ 5 per Person and US $ 2 per Vehicle (Wifi Zone, Sanitary Batteries, Showers, Potable Water, good Night lighting, Electrical Connection for Vehicles or electronic items at 110v)
Motor Home capacity from 5 to 7 depending on its size.
We guide you in the tourist places of the Region and the Country Colombia. And connection with the Cyclist Houses Network of America from Mexico to Patagonia. Whatsapp +573013220088 HECTORINO

name: Musicology Hotel
description: Cheap hostel with many dormitories (price is 15000). 40000 for a private room without bathroom, or 50000 with it. it's in the middle of the Candelaria. Big washclothes for 10000.

name: Cerro Cristo Rey
description: Magnificent view of Jardin from the white statue. Take a tuktuk for COP 25.000 (one way) up or you can walk up via several path ways: from the Trout farm follow path from the parking lot and After last farm to the right , on the gravel road left. Or from statue straight down

name: Toyota Yokomotors Guayabal
description: Very professional and reliable mechanics, helpful and friendly. Reasonable prices

name: Terpel Gas Station
description:
Small gas station outside the city with a big gravel area. Gas station open from 6am to 10pm. 
Staff said it is safe to stay here for the night. There are several trucks for overnight stay as well. Next police station is 30m away. 

There are bathrooms and showers.

name: finca café Los Angeles
description:
Coffee Tour with lunch 60 000col
coffee tour with refreshment 40 000 col
good equip you can speak english french
+573053363174 Whatsapp


Tour du café con almuerzo 60 000col
tour du café con refresco 40 000 col
buena equipa se puede hablar ingles frances

name: Plaza Minorista
description: Covered market place for vegetables, fruit, meat, kitchen appliances

name: Hostal Oasis de Puente Linda
description:
Small town next to the river Samana. Sonsón Nariño Norcacia Dorada was the old Medellín Bogotá route 36 years ago. Extremely friendly people during the route. 10 km in regular conditions. Good food, showers. Thermal water 4km.
Very scenic route. Ask in town for Luis Garcia nice family!

name: Desert Wild Camp
description:
Spot in the desert. Hidden from the street by many cactuses with more or less level ground. We made a firepit for you. Slow 3G connection. Hot during the day. Almost no shade.

Note: might be private property and Saul from the swimming pool nearby might come by to collect 10.000 to stay for the night.

name: Batericars Ipiales — tires and oil
description:
Full service and super professional tire/oil/battery shop. When we couldn’t find the tires we wanted in the correct size in Peru or Ecuador, we ordered them from neumarket.com at a good price with free delivery and installation at this shop and they were waiting for us when we crossed the border. They also have tires in stock and can order, but we went through neumarket because of a promotional price. 

Wifi, coffee, and tire swings (!) in the waiting area. Next door to the Supermercado Éxito where you can buy SOAT and snacks. 

Their garage doors fit up to 3m (and a few cm more). We’re 3.03m and were ok.

name: Parqueadero Consota
description: Parking lot of the parque Consota, we ask at the security if it's possible to stay for the night (free). Very quiet until 6pm. There is swimming pool, climb wall, fishing place etc ...

name: Restaurante vegetariano Vida Superior
description: Amazing vegetarían restaurant! There is a different menu everyday and over great dishes like the lentils hamburger. You can also buy veggie products and different kind of nuts and flour. I love it !

name: Casa San Nicolás
description:
A country hotel, clean, good breakfast and the place is very nice
--
Un hotel campestre, limpio , el desayuno delicioso y el lugar muy bonito

name: parque in the pueblo
description: we stayed here for one night near the park. everybody told us it's very peacefull here. it's à good spot fore one night free.

name: Restaurant Boyapesca
description: Camping area on the lake. Nice leveled spots on the grass and on gravel. No height restriction and wide gates. Can rent boat and jetski. Restaurant on site (can’t speak for the restaurant as we did not eat) NO WIFI. Cozy fire place while the restaurant is open. Bathroom with hot shower for campers, but you can also use the bathrooms in the restaurant. Original price was 40K per tent, talked it down to 30K. 3 resident dogs Really friendly people, even free coffee in the morning :)

name: Dirt Sunrise Mountain
description: Start at Pescadero, head down to Cepita, up to San Andres, then to this camp spot and on to Cerritos or do this backwards and enjoy what looks like Austria in Colombia. The little towns are beautiful and friendly along the way. This camp site is a flat spot where someone is quarrying rock. Amazing view at well over 12,000 feet in elevation. (couldn't find the name of the mountain so we named it haha!)

name: La Punta de los Remedios
description:
Hotel with restaurant. Rooms with private bathroom. Clean, mosquito Nets provided. Cold shower. Laundry service available.
Close to the beach.

name: Roca Dragón
description:
Very nice camping place, located in nature in the middle of coffee plantations.
Price 10k pesos pp. If you do not have your own tent, they have a few tents set up, that you can use for free.
They also have a bar/restaurant, and place for relaxation/games etc.
For more information, contact Maria-Jose in WhatsApp: +573184786240

name: electricidad automotriz del norte
description: We had electrical issues. They helped us immediatelly for a fair price. I would recommend this place if you have electrical issues.

name: EVI Vet
description: A great Veterinarian if you’re traveling by plane with your dog. It’s right next to the airport and they do a health certificate very quickly.

name: frutos secos
description: it is a very good healthy food shop!!! you will find here à lot of dietetic products

name: dulces de Jardin
description: wonderful place where you can buy arequipe, pastry , cofee  tradicional, honey artisanal wine... everything good quality and beautyfull place inside.

name: Free Walking Tour
description: At the corner each day at 10 am start of free walking tour through old city in english and spanish. Look for the yellow umbrellas

name: Shortcut to San Rafael
description: If you have 4x4 and hight clearance thats your road !!! Nice views

name: Restaurant “herencia de mi tierra”
description:
Very pretty place! Space to park and assemble the tent. Bathrooms, water. Menu at $ 15,000. Very kind owners. Safe and calm Beautiful view of the lagoon.


Muy lindo lugar! Espacio para estacionar y armar la carpa. Baños, agua. Menú a 15.000$. Dueños muy amables. Seguro y tranquilo. Hermosa vista a la Laguna.

name: Río de la vieja
description: This is a camping spot next to the río de la vieja river. It cost 5.000 pr. tent that you have to pay at the shop close to it. Beautiful place very quiet, full of nature and the locals are really friendly.

name: Río Italia
description: this is a camp spot next to the río Italia. we spend the night here and it was really calm and cool. the police pass by asking for passports and check if we were smoking. but it was a really good place to spend a day here.

name: El café de nuestra tierra
description: This is a great coffe shop where the owners are really friendly and love to chat and share with the travellers.

name: Azukz Hasavi spot
description:
Hello
Realy good spot to park your motorhome for one or some nights(all size of big rig are welcome).
When you are arriving on the great parking place on the beach, you forget all the restaurant (and the people who run after your truck to propose you a place for stop for the night and pay !)
You take on your right and go at the end of the beach at around 500 meters(after the road is finish)
You will find some fisherman houses and also an house of association of fisherman.
You can stay in this wild and nice place for free.
We put our truck near the litlle restaurant "Hasavi" for free and eat delicious "salchipapas"(6000 pesos the big part👍)
The people who live here are realy friendly and propose us water for shower or toilets.
Good and safe place to swim with your family.
Realy quiet night (a saturday night....!😉).
During the day a lot of people stay on the other side of this beach so it's a cool place without the famous loud music...!!!!
It's windy so it's not warm and you can have a realy good night in your truck😊
Enjoy and drink a fresh beer...😎

name: Hospedaje
description: Nice hospedaje on the west side of the road, above a small restaurant.  Friendly staff, clean room with 2 beds and a hot shower, $25,000 cop.  They let us bring our bicycles upstairs near the room.

name: Frenos los bogotanos
description:
Expert in brakes, the owner of the workshop is a motorbike traveler and helps travelers in whatever they need!
---
Expertos en frenos, el dueño del taller es moto viajero y ayuda a los viajeros en lo que necesites!

name: Anibal motos y vw
description:
Excellent mechanic his workshop is specialized in motorcycles but Anibal his owner also has knowledge of vw and helped us a lot!
--
Excelente mecánico su taller es especializado en motos pero Anibal su dueño también tiene conocimiento de vw y nos ayudó muchísimo!!!

name: Ecohotel la fortuna
description:
The Eco Hotel la fortuna is a Finca hotel along the river. The place is beautifully and if you are around here you should definitely stay overnight. The price for a room is a bit expensive but nonetheless you can ask for sleep in your car or in tent and use the toilets and shower. the place really worth the trip as the region is beautiful and you can see a lot of animals. 
There is a service restaurant on place and the food is just incredibly delicious. 
La Mona, the owner is really a wonderful person.

name: Language school Wakapinka
description:
Nice, new language school with a fantastic team.
Flexible lesson schedule. Teaching material is adjusted at the level of the student.
Much more attractively priced than schools in the big cities.
Entrance in street opposite restaurant Tomate, second floor.
For more info go to Bicicafé.

name: Hotel La Realeza
description:
Nice new hotel that is run by a friendly and helpful family. Payed 50.000 COP for a double room. The room is small but super clean with a cold but good shower.
The hotel has a safe parking space.
The only downside is that it is a bit noisy, as usual in Colombia.

name: Lavanderia
description: Laundry service. 5000$ for 1kg for cleaning and drying.

name: Jamon Serrano El Aledano
description: If you ever get frustrated with the ham situation in SA, then this is your place. Small factory store with Salamis, Jamons Serrano (Ham) and other stuff

name: Parts vehicle street
description:
Hello
Everythings you dream to find for your car, your truck or bus is here....in this street...😉
Please...don't come here with your motorhome...take a taxi...
Enjoy and I hope you'll find what you need...

name: Hospedaje Castillo Real
description: hotel room with private bathroom. It has private parking.

name: Hospedaje Zarith
description: Very clean hotel with friendly staff adjacent to the central plaza.  Nice balcony overlooking the plaza. $30,000/2 people and $25,000/1 person.  bicycle parking indoors.  Cold shower.

name: Hostal Villabosco
description: Big hostal with dorms, private rooms, camping, restaurant, and swimming pool. Secure parking inside the large gate. Less than 10 minutes from the Cali airport. Staff is friendly and helpful. We paid 10,000 pp for tent camping. I believe the dorms are 30,000. Pretty nice place. The noise from the road is a bit loud, but ok.

name: Mirador Salento parking lot
description:
Quiet place to stay at night, during the day is full of tourist and bathrooms open for 800cop. The view of the valley is just awesome, don't miss it!
The parking is free but there is a very friendly watchman who you can give a small tip.
The owner of 'Dulce Tradición bar' located next to the parking is super cool and helpful, his name is Livardo. He came to talk with me and offered water to fill my bottles and WiFi for free. Also asked me if I had any issue with the car in which he can help me. I told him about iOverlanded and agreed to be mentioned and offered the same for any traveler who stops here. He is planning to start a long trip with a van in 2020 so telling your stories to him is the best way to keep it motivated!!
They make two marmalade which you can see how they produce it and buy, maracuya and dulce de leche, both are so delicious!

name: Extreme Outdoor store
description: Fantastic outdoor, camping, hiking, climbing, equipment store. The only place we've found fuel canisters for Jetboil style stoves! The employees are super nice. A lot of high quality gear.

name: Supermercado Rapimio
description:
Hello
Just a supermercado on the road...
But with a parking and easy access for motorhome.
Good to find a lot of food when you have a big family....and a big truck...!!!!

name: Parking Hotel Naranjal
description: A very good place for camp, we ask to the hotel they say that we can stay for the night as a lot of truck. We stay near the swimming pool (it cost 3000 COL/pp) and the restaurant. But you can swim for free on the river just under.

name: serviteca del caribe
description: got a quick oil change here, 152,000COP for 6.5L 15w40 diesel. was looking for service across at the MOBIL station on map and they sent us here. manager Luís speaks english. they were fast, professional, kind and did the change as good as i would have myself. helped out the tech and they blew out my old air filter as a spare. our experience was great.

name: Beautiful small old town
description: El Cairo Relax farm town. Coffee Land in a colonial place no turistic like salento. Really cheap

name: hacienda el paraiso
description: nice hacienda from 1828 that is now a museum with beautiful garden. big parking where you could possibly stay over night. a wonderful creek where you can swim is right there too and some little vendors of ice cream, food & drinks. worth a visit!

name: Mundo golf VW
description:
It’s true this area is full of auto parts. We found this place and his owner Dario Torres the most helpful person able to find parts. 
The address is calle 67 #27b22. 
You can what up him at +57 3133173478

name: Santa Elena, Planeta Rica
description:
Lodging next to a fuel station. The administrator, Carlos, a very cordial person. It gave us a place to park the motor home, electricity outlet (120v), shh, at no cost.
----------------
Hospedaje junto a una estación de combustible. El administrador, Carlos, una persona muy cordial. Nos brindó un sitio para estacionar el motor home, toma de electricidad (120v), shh, sin costo alguno.

name: Terpel “al toque”
description:
They allow to spend the night in the motor home, they can help you with a 120v power socket. Internet good, bathrooms, mini store. The logical thing is to fill the tank in retribution, because they do not charge you for those services.
-------------

Permiten pasar la noche en la motor home, te pueden ayudar con una tome de corriente 120v. Internet bueno, baños, mini tienda. Lo lógico es llenar el tanque en retribución, pues no te cobran por esos servicios.

name: Piedra Piedra
description:
Piedra Piedra is about 45 min south of Nuquí. You have to take a flight from Medellín to get to Nuquí. They rent nice cabañas with three meals per day. The food is amazing. Elisabeth and her husband are fishing crazy with fishing. They would never buy a fish! 
You can surf, do some hikes, swim and what I really recommend do a “plankton” tour. Ask for it because they don’t offer it automatically. You will make a boat trip in the night to places with illuminating plankton. Wonderful! Breathtaking! Enjoy

name: Street of Police and Fireflighters
description: At night (10pm until 7am) very quiet. During the day, it's difficult to find someplace to park. Better arrive after 6pm. We let the camper and went to the central plaza to eat some snacks - no problem.

name: 24 hour parking in San Alberto
description: 8000 COP for 24 hour and we could sleep in our van. 3 blocks from the main road and quiet at night. Not a nice view but secure and perfect spot for one night after a long drive from the coast (Santa Marta)

name: Hotel Plaza 36
description:
Nice hotel with super friendly staff. Small breakfast included. There is always free coffee at the reception. 
Parking is on the property, fenced and guarded (no high restriction). Fast WiFi.

We payed around 115000cop per night. Ask for the Booking.com price!

name: Jumbo Supermarket
description: Big Jumbo Supermarket, with a big parking lot.

name: Mirachi Hotel
description: Hotel after the cañon right next to a gas station. Very quiet 25 000 COP per person for private room. Chilly climate perfect for a good night of sleep. Parking lot available for guests.

name: Parada de Romero - End of the road
description:
El Cocuy Natural National Park.

I was able to drive until here. The road is in good conditions. 
Superb views along the way.

name: horse riding and more
description:
super nice guy has a Finca in the mountains. quite nice place lots of animals roaming around. we  did a horse riding tour with him 4 hours for 50 without negotiation. the horses are in better shape and the riding has nothing to do with the ridiculous things you see in town. well trained animals, so good for beginners as well as  advanced riders. since it is already 15 minutes in the mountains the landscape is quite nice too. also very close to some of the statues. road is alright for all vehicles. he also offers other tours just ask him about it.
Manuel has WhatsApp 3214373025
he also has a nice hostel with a art, bamboo and coffee wood furniture next door 20 for 3 people.

name: Raquicamp, nice view!
description: Nice camping with an amazing view, the staff is very friendly, there is kitchen with gas & bbc, electrics showers, clean toilets. We paid 17000pp for one night. Contact at +57 3212953412.

name: Hôtel del cafe confort
description: Hotel confortable with underground parking for cars, motos, bikes... It costs 42 000 for private room for 2 persons with bathroom and balcony. Located near a bus station and a supermarket. Just a little bit noisy. Gildardo the owner is very nice and will give you good address to eat typical food if you asking for. Wifi OK.

name: Navitrans International (Iveco, Ford etc.)
description:
If you own a Fortd Super Duty, you might know that Ford buys its engines from International. So they are the ones that can help you with engine issues. Ford was able to read our code but couldn’t help us with anything else. 
The guys here went iver their heads to find the problem with our glow plugs.

name: Public place
description:
Public place not far from village center.
Huge area with children playground, soccer field and gravel roads for to park.
Place enough for every size of vehicle.
Good to stay and quiet at night.
FREE !

name: Santuario las Lajas
description: Very nice church, a must visit when passing Ipiales.

name: La Colina Camping & Restaurant
description:
Granja Ecoturistica La Colina (correct name)

Tranquil, lovely family-owned orchard and hobby farm with camping and beautiful views!! Great spot especially if you have kids.  Very friendly family lives here. Nice break from the heat and humidity - cools off nicely at night. We’re so surprised this has not been listed yet!!! We highly recommend it!

Open spaces for camping, fire pit (be careful and keep the fire small - it’s very dry here), Miradors throughout the property, and lounge seating around the restaurant and house that you can use. 

3 dogs, a horse, goats, sheep, bunnies, friendly curious tortoises, ducks, chickens, fouls, guinea pigs, tropical birds and parrots, and a man-made pond that you can fish for goldfish in if you’d like. 

The family is very friendly and will show you around, allows you to pick fruit (lemons, oranges and mandarins)from the orchard. Also they have a citronella plant - if you need fresh mosquito repellant just ask! 

Clean washrooms; outdoor shower doesn’t offer privacy so you’ll probably want to shower in your swimsuit.

name: Navemar
description: This is where we came to get the bill of lading  after shipping with Evergreen. They gave us directions for paying the invoices. We had to go to a BBVA bank and then back to get the bill of Lading. Others had gone to Global Shipping but we were told we had to come here. A long way back and forth. Took all morning.

name: parqueadero
description: As there were no pretty cheap places in ioverlander at Palomino. I searched and found this place that charged me 5,000 a day per car. A well-wooded parking lot where I've been alone for 4 days. it was a weekday on low season. Neither bathroom nor water available. Good for Big rigs as there is no need to enter the main street. Away from the beach but close to the shops and cheaper markets and restaurants that are located on the main road. Safe by day and safe and quiet at night. There is internet in the pizzeria next door, but do not ask for the password.

name: Hostel Rana
description:
Nice hostel, Nice family that runs this. 20k pp pn. Parking for around 3 Motorcycles. Car/van parking should be OK on the street.
Good kitchen, good bathrooms with really hot water.

Update Jan 2023: 35k pppn, no kitchen

name: Llantas Nuevas & Usadas
description: Good place to repair your tires, even if It has a big hole. They have different technics to fix, with professionals tools who work with hot temperature. They work fast and good, charge us 15k but it will cheaper with a small repair I think. They also sell tires, new and used.

name: Centro de Servicio Automotriz LUBRITAXIS
description: Good place to change oil, filters. They charged us 100k for 4L of oil with air and oil filters. Fast service.

name: Estación de servicio ESSO - La Virgen
description:
Service station, mechanics service, and possibility of parking for overnight.
----
Estación de servicio, servicio de mecánica, y posibilidad de parqueo para pernoctar.

name: Almacenes LA 14
description:
Massive supermarket with everything!! And good prices. And most importantly there is no height restriction for the parking lot and it’s easy access from the 25. 

Gated lot with lots of curious nice guards and a food court outside. We were trying to get to the jumbo (which is next door) but found this place cheaper and very very well stocked.

name: Suesca rock climbing
description:
one of the largest rock climbing areas in Colombia. it has sport, mixed and trad climbing. be prepared for a high first bolt and long run outs. for pure sports climbing la mojarra 4h further north might be a better choice.
the rocks are in a nice landscape and mostly in the shade. 
you can stay in some hostels or the campground already marked on ioverlander.
you can rent gear for expensive in la nomads hostel but just a rope is 65k a day so better to byo. there is a climbing shop which is normally closed in the week but you can call and someone can open it.
on the weekend it gets busy  especially on the easy routes in the week it is quiet.

name: BioMax
description: Driving from the NP Puracé in direction of Plata, this is the only gasoline/diesel station.

name: Malegria gourmet
description: great vegetarian option and more. Delicious. very good atention. :)

name: Servicio especializado volkswagen
description:
Frank is an excellent mechanic. very responsible and good person. I had a problem with my kombi and he solved it perfectly. He also found a problem in a bearing that would have brought me a big headache. super recommended !!!



Frank es un excelente mecánico. muy responsable y buena persona. tuve un problema con mi kombi y me lo solucionó perfectamente. además encontró un problema en un rodamiento que me hubiese traído un gran dolor de cabeza.
super recomendado!!!

name: Amazing tour to do in Pijao
description: Amazing Tour to a wax palm-tree paramo. They take you on a Willy and they they give you lunch at a nice local farm. Contact Kevin wpp +57 (319) 775-0694

name: Ecohotel Kocoluu
description:
After an extensive shipping from Mexico to Cartagena we found this quiet, relaxing place directly at the sea. Perfect food, nice stuff, enough place to park you car secured, nice little huts, very clean. A lot of free space and perfect hammocks. It’s not a typical hotel, it’s more like a open relaxing paradise. Contact information can be found on booking, or AirBnb. Breakfast around 8.000 - 10.000 COP, main dish 15.000 - 28.000 COP. 
Bigger and longer rigs should check in advance, car similar to a Mercedes Sprinter should be fine to get there, because of the smaller little street to the hotel.

name: Mecanica Gabriel Gutierrez
description: We came to this mechanic for recommendation by a friend of Manizales, we needed to adjust valves and attended us very very fast. And we feel that the price was very fair, we found it very honest. Recommend. They work diesel and gasoline. Grabriel The owner is very friendly.

name: Truck parking with no name
description: This was the only spot we could find to spend the night.  It is right on the beach behind a restaurant and gas station.  The parking area it's a bit dusty and it fills with trucks overnight.  The guard charged us 3000 to park.

name: Rio Bado balneario
description: Big parking area of swimming area.  Gate may be locked, if so park on the road and go find the caretaker. Can fit any size rig.  No charge but we gave him 10,000 for the night.  Great swimming area in the river and very quiet at night.

name: Street parking at Balneario Hurtado
description: Quiet spot at night close to police station. Water at the police. Great swimming in the river. Another spot just further past that is a parking lot.  We are 7 meters long.

name: Casa Nativo
description: It is a place to rest, here you can be calm and spend a relaxed night or day. There are several viewpoints to see the beach and take the breeze. To get there you must enter Puerto Colombia and follow the GPS to where a small mountain starts. There you walk 3 minutes towards the mountain following the path.

name: Todo car.za
description: Stopped here because car was losing power. Wilfer was great with diagnostics and scanner. Very helpful. nice guy.

name: Cacao & cacao
description: Here you will find a pretty shop of chocolate and it is also possible to ask for a work shop for children with chocolate. the price is 35000 pp and the childrens will be very happy. It's in spanish and they speak a little english to. the phone number to organize the lessons is 3013924006

name: Parqueadero - Parking
description: parking near to scuare. cheap, there are batroom, people friendly

name: Rosas
description: Big flat spot behind the playground. Green and gravel. Pass the hospital, follow 100m on the gravel road. It’s at the end. We ask for water in the kinder garden and they said town is quiet and safe. We arrive at 4 pm and left following morning. See nobody. Enjoyed the view and the sunset. Free. No facilities. Suit big rigs or tends.

name: Chalet San Luis
description:
Contact Gloria Patricia: +57 3104147774
It's a perfect place close to Manizales to relax in a quiet garden with birds and beautiful mountain views. The bathrooms are clean. There is potable water to fill your tank and Electricity to plug in. There is fast Wifi available. Patricia also rents out two nice little rooms which can be booked via Airbnb. There is enough leveled space for several vehicles. Dogs are welcome. This place was made with lots of love.
Update May 2023: the road to this location is about 1km from Villapilar and becomes gravel about 500m from the house. For vehicles longer than 7m, higher than 3.1m and broader than 2.2m it might be a challenge. The entrance to her house is opposite a big advertising sign on the left-hand side of the gravel road. If you miss the entrance turning around is difficult. Maps.me and Overlander showed it correctly, Waze, normally a good app for Colombia, did not.

.....C'est un endroit parfait près de Manizales pour se détendre dans un jardin calme avec des oiseaux et de belles vues sur la montagne. Les salles de bain sont propres. Il y a de l'eau potable pour remplir votre réservoir et de l'électricité à brancher. Il y a une connexion Wi-Fi rapide disponible. Patricia loue également deux jolies petites chambres qui peuvent être réservées via Airbnb. Il y a suffisamment d'espace nivelé pour plusieurs véhicules. Les chiens sont les bienvenus. Cet endroit a été fait avec beaucoup d'amour.
Mise à jour mai 2023 : la route menant à cet endroit est à environ 1 km de Villapilar et devient gravillonnée à environ 500 m de la maison. Pour les véhicules de plus de 7 m, de plus de 3,1 m et de plus de 2,2 m de large, cela peut être un défi. L'entrée de sa maison se trouve en face d'un grand panneau publicitaire sur le côté gauche de la route de gravier. Si vous manquez l'entrée, il est difficile de faire demi-tour. Maps.me et Overlander l'ont montré correctement, Waze, normalement une bonne application pour la Colombie, ne l'a pas fait.

.....Es un lugar perfecto cerca de Manizales para relajarse en un tranquilo jardín con pájaros y hermosas vistas a la montaña. Los baños están limpios. Hay agua potable para llenar su tanque y electricidad para enchufar. Hay wifi rápido disponible. Patricia también alquila dos bonitas habitaciones pequeñas que se pueden reservar a través de Airbnb. Hay suficiente espacio nivelado para varios vehículos. Los perros son bienvenidos. Este lugar fue hecho con mucho amor.
Actualización de mayo de 2023: el camino a este lugar está a aproximadamente 1 km de Villapilar y se convierte en grava a unos 500 m de la casa. Para vehículos de más de 7 m, más altos de 3,1 m y más anchos de 2,2 m, puede ser un desafío. La entrada a su casa está frente a un gran cartel publicitario en el lado izquierdo del camino de grava. Si se pierde la entrada, dar la vuelta es difícil. Maps.me y Overlander lo mostraron correctamente, Waze, normalmente una buena aplicación para Colombia, no lo hizo.

name: Molino Dorado Café
description:
Very nice café that just opened. Café is
 delicious. Owners very friendly. Don't miss it!

name: Camping Guaduales De La Floresta
description:
Great, peaceful place to camp in town! Large property bordered on 3 sides by creek & trees. Very quiet at night. Family owned, very friendly. Diego speaks great English and he and his brother do horseback riding tours every day. Very nice terraced lawn for tents surrounded by a stream, trees, and lots of birds. Multiple flat areas that can accommodate 4+ medium to large sized rigs. Power hookup possible; you may need a longer extension depending where you park. Horse stables on the property; horses go elsewhere to pasture at night. Good, but rustic kitchen setup. No fridge. Hand wash laundry facilities. Very clean washrooms and hot showers!  20,000 cop per person. Also have doorm rooms (unsure of price).

If no one is there, they’re off on horseback riding tours, so just set yourself up and you’ll see them eventually.

5-10 minute walk to main part of town. We enjoyed our stay very much here.

Tel: 3146006353 or 3105224141

https://www.facebook.com/pages/category/Campground/Camping-Guaduales-De-La-Floresta-731936306981198/

name: Land Rover & 4x4 mecanic "Taller Santana"
description:
Diego and his colleages run this highly recommended mecanic. Mainly Land Rovers (new and old) but also other brands. They also sell new and 2nd hand parts
A local from the Land Rover Club recommended this place. There are a few more LaRo specialists in Pereira and Cali, but they are more expensive.
Locals from Bogota come all the way here because he is well known in the LaRo-world.
We had problems with our gearbox and they worked for 3,5 days on it. We payed 350.000 pesos on working hours. 
We could "camp" in the workshop and use shower, electricity, water etc. Very safe and quiet place.
Very knowledgeable and friendly people. Highly recommended.
 
Address: Carrera 10 no 1-33 Pereira Risaralda (Frailes)
Tel. 331 5575  Cell.phone: 321 815 9090 / 321 576 6264 / 316 831 9148

name: Road Jardin Riosucio
description: The road north of Jardin is good and paved but the "road" To Riosucio is not and very very rocky and boy very large. Difficult but ok with a 2wd van. but High clearance needed. maybe more difficult from Riosucio To Jardin. 3 or 3,5 hour needed for the 50km.

name: Las Olas Planeta Hotel
description: There is a big parking place in grava next to the hotel used mainly by truck's to pass the night. They charge 11k for parking the car and 3k for person to use the restrooms. There are also some nice rooms for rent at the hotel at good price.

name: Hostel Parking lot
description: Hostel owner let us stay for free in the parking lot. He also rents rooms from 25,000 Colombians with air conditioning. Highly recommended people are very supportive and pleasant.

name: villa lolita
description:
We offer camping area and car parking for people who want to enjoy a quiet area outside the city of Popayán.
 Our place is near the Panamerican highway that connects the city of Popayán whit the city of Cali.
The spot is located in the path Calibio, a rural, quiet place where you can go hiking.
 In our place you can enjoy a beautiful view and warmth of the people.
We offer camping and campers service.
If you are interested, contact us (+57) 3112337078 or (+57) 3105335951.

name: NAKU TIERRA
description:
Very relaxing small town with nice people around. 
 The place is an apartment with four doble beds, living room, small kitchen and a hot shower and toilet. We pay 60.000 a day for everything.
 Shops near by.The owner is building several apartments to rent out. We ended up staying four days here. There is a famous market on tuesday early mornings you shouldn’t miss. Great WiFi.

Call Camilo Torres on +57 310 249 8910 or +57 301 211 0089

name: Camping Monterredondo PN Chingaza
description:
Official camping if you want to stay a few days in the the National Park. To reserve you need to ask to "Corpochingaza" company. Also you need to pay a insurance to enter NP. Camping $25000 COP p/p, insurance $5500 COP per day and entrance to the NP $51000 COP p/p + $14000 COP for the car. 

Review the website of the national parks Colombia to know all that you can do, like price to enter, camping allowed, how to get, etc....

You must to pay the camping before to arrive in the National Park. We did a deposit in the bank. 

Contact Corpochingaza: ecoturismocorpochingaza@gmail.com / tel: 3508044199

name: The high point of the view of the city
description: It’s a small church on the top of the city where you can have a amazing view of the whole valley and the surrounding area. Free and joyful.

name: Camino Viejo
description: Some cabanas, rooms are already ready but to finish a project they need more time, probably one year. It will have swimming pool, sauna. Cabana costs 35k pesos per person/night. It is possible to camp here, cost 10k pesos per person. Some parking lots are leveled, not all. No height restrictions. Toilets and shower available. No wifi. Small restaurant on site. We didn't stay here, just stopped for tinto. Manegers, Victor and Esteban, are very friendly, they showed us all lots. Nice to stop for a chat at least. Nice views.

name: Siscomtec Gas Station
description:
Quiet place. Bathrooms men and women. Clean and new. Large place to camp or to park your Motorhome, rooftent or Camper Van.
Water and electricity.

name: Nueva Granada
description: Small hotel in this tiny town offers a few rooms with private bathroom. Room is clean with Aircon. Sheets are clean but worn. Towels included.

name: Hotel Danny
description:
Hotel Danny has 18 rooms with private facilities. Double room 20.000 COP pp excluding breakfast.
It also is a restaurant with very good meals.

name: Leña & Carbon
description:
Quiet and safe place. Near a little river. Has 2 swimming pools lots of trees. Clean bathrooms and showers.
Restaurant an open bar service. U$3,50 per person to camp and use all facilities.

name: Hotel San José
description: Nice hotel near of the city bus terminal, very good price.

name: Hotel Isla Capri
description: Recommended for overlanders with big rigs. Hotel on main strip, about 100m from Bella Vista Hotel & Camping. A little more expensive (165k/night for 2 adults) but price includes an excellent buffet breakfast. Aircon, good showers, small pool, clean rooms with comfortable beds, good wifi, secure/gated parking with no height size or restrictions. Staff were all very attentive and friendly. We suggest room #305 or #306.

name: Vet red/ green building
description: Wow. Super awesome vet we were needing a health certificate to Peru for our dog. We came from the states to Colombia and speak little Spanish but they were super helpful!!!

name: entrance to los estoraques
description: here is the unofficial entrance to the park. pay 8000p/p at the tienda. no Guide needed it's a very small park and probably impossible to get lost. there are some parts blocked where there are additional fences but you can just go around like most people seem to do. the roads up here are good to very good but slow since there are many trucks.

name: scenic road trough the mountains
description:
if you want to go to Belen or ocana it is possible to do this drive on a motorbike (I guess also on  a 4wd) using some back roads. using maps.me I went from ocana via Gonzalez and otare to the highway.  generally I is a good gravel road except between  otare to Gonzales where the road is small and rugged but also quite beautiful. with a car  it is probably better to continue straight to Rio de oro on the better maintained gravel road instead of turning off to otare. you will find very nice landscapes and villages in the style of playa de belen on the way. also there is little traffic. however it is possible to be stopped and searched by the military as the region around conception is supposedly narco trafficking area. also there where 3 ropes where people wanted cash but apart from that people where mostly happy to see foreigners.
took around 5 hours between Ayacucho and ocana on a heavy bike. i liked the drive!

name: Ecolodge Guacaica
description: If you want a real nice place for a break of   your RV go to this place. We had a appartment with 3 chambers.With excellent view to the valley. They also have a restaurant with tasty  meat. Good value for money. About 70 euro for 2 of us, all meals included.you can park your rv in front of the restaurant.  Secure.

name: Tu Casa Natura
description: Nice and quiet place. Clean an confortable. Adriana the manager is cute and friendly. Hot showers. Clean and equiped kitchen. Good and fresh rooms. TV, wifi.

name: LA CASITA SAN JERONIMO
description: The house in San Jeronimo is a magical, super country and spectacular place with a swimming pool, bird watching; where its owners, Mr Gonzalo and Mrs Martha make you feel like family .... super super recommended !!! wasapp for reservation 3148935151

name: La Fuente Village Square
description: We found ourselves here at dusk on our way to Baricharra from Zapatoca. The drive is incredibly beautiful, but The roads are slow going (unpaved) so it took us 3x as long as expected. La Fuente is a welcoming and safe town and we quite enjoyed it. We spoke to the police and the towns people and everyone said it was very safe. We found a family that lives at the town square that was happy to have us as guests - we used their washroom/shower and parked outside their home and slept in their truck. They let us plug in and use their electricity. They even offered us food and for us to sleep in their home. They didn’t want money but we left them with some to at least cover the electricity. It was clear the town doesn’t see a lot of tourists; but it was full of friendly and curious people. We made lots of new friends durning our short visit and felt completely safe. There is a heavy police presence here and they patrol the square at night and let me use their washroom at 3am (the family locked their house of course). I wouldn’t hesitate to stop in for the night if need be, and it was one of our most memorable nights in Colombia!!!

name: El Saturia Cafeteria
description:
Place where one can have a good coffee or buy to take away! They toast and grind the coffee bean in the area and you can see the whole process in the same place. Highly recommended!
----
Lugar en el que uno puede tomarse un buen café o comprar para llevar! Tuestan y muelen el grano de café de la zona y se puede ver en el mismo lugar todo el proceso. Muy recomendable!

name: Parking with no height restriction
description:
This is a big (really) parking lot for Popayan, with no height restriction. But Enter in the parking should be difficult for big rigs due to the small street. The number of cars in the town (and in alls parkings) is crazy !!! Prefers come by bus or taxi if possible.
Nice owner and very helpful.

name: house Pitagorax
description: place near a wetland offers wifi services laundry potable water mechanical care cars family environment water and electric current

name: Hotel Betania
description:
Only decent place in town! Started from 25k pp pn, negotiated to 20k. Let me bring the bike inside in the night.
Other places are really overpriced for what they offer. Try visiting some if you want a good laugh!

name: La Panaderia Modou
description:
Bakery with very good breads, "French baguette", sourdough bread, pastry...  A good place to find good and tasty bread and pastry in Colombia!! Not so easy to found!
And the owners are very lovely!!!

name: Banco Pinchincha
description: at this ATM, you can withdraw 1 million pesos without a charge! Very good for withdrawing a lot of money for the shipping or the sailing:)

name: Ecoland
description:
Large green space with toilet and shower service on the outskirts of Jericho. With beautiful views and the possibility of jumping in paragliding. Very clean bathrooms!
2024: 25k pppn

Gran espacio verde con servicio de baño y ducha en las afueras de Jericó. Con vistas hermosas y la posibilidad de tirarse en parapente. Baños muy limpios!

name: Villa de Marquez
description: Campground and Cabañas with swimming pool. They have rooms with private bathroom for 2 or more, until 7 persons. They have rooms like tipis without private bathroom. We stay with our van at 20k/night. Cold shower and toilets.

name: Bogota Brewing Co
description: All breweries with draft beer should be on Overlander! 11,000 for a pint of good beer. Thank me later.

name: Muelle Turistico San Bernardo del Viento
description:
Nice place. We asked a woman named Etilza that owns a very simple place near the pier to park our car.
She said that was OK and so we camped with our Rooftent in the rear of her propertie, under some trees.
Perferct. Quiet at night. Safe and this woman offered us to use toillet and bath with a bowl.
In summer wery hot despite the wind, but a wonderfull place to stay.

name: Parque Sabaneta
description:
We stayed 7 weeks at Al Bosque and travelled into Medellin many times.
We found this area whilst we stayed at the nearby Mercedes Benz dealer. 
We both agreed that it was our best experience of the various areas of Medellin. Relaxed and locals. Think we were the only gringos.

name: The Rotonda
description: Hotel clean, basic but modern. Huge secured parking but not to high. Unfortunately low wifi or fake! 40000 pp room with fan. 60000 with AC

name: Minimercado M&F
description:
Here in San Luis you can buy your groceries (fruits, vegetables, pasta, rice, water, beer, ...) in little shops before heading to Guatapé.
The way up to here is good.

name: Big empty parking lot
description: Much better than the gas station across the street.  Big tree to park under for shade.  Free.  Some trucks park near at night,  but lots of space.

name: Supermarket
description: This is a new Supermarket, meat and veggie market that has parking for large vehicles.

name: Parqueadero LA Cumbra & Panaderia
description:
Didn't stay on this parking lot which doesn't belong to the bakery but to a couple on top of the parking lot; They asked us 12 000 cop, so we prefered staying next door on the parking of the hotel attached to the petrol station.
We asked permission and were just asked a 5000 cop propina for the night guard of the hotel. The place is much cleaner and quiet at night.

name: Restaurante MIRADOR 2
description: Great restaurant overlooking Playa Blanca. For the price of two trout dinners we were able to park on their parking lot.  It is small, but during the week we had no problem parking our 7.4 mt long camper.  They also have camping for shorter rigs in a second location. Can walk down hill to the beach.

name: Gas station
description: This is a new gas station that we stopped at on the way into the city from the port.  They allowed us to fill up with water.  In a pinch, you could spend the night as they have a huge parking lot.

name: Los Tronquitos
description: Nothing special but has safe parking, paid 30k as single including motorbike parking, no WiFi, not really clean but acceptable for one night, less acceptable was missing water in the morning to take a shower, whyever they turn it off over night

name: Hotel El Paraiso
description: Very friendly owner/manager. Bright and spotless clean hotel one block from central plaza. Very quiet. Secure, covered parking for motos in courtyard next to rooms. Parking access would be bit tricky for bigger motos. Good wifi. We paid 50,000 for double room with private bath and hot shower. Highly recommend.

name: 2 hour stretch without fuel station
description: Only 80 miles but around 2 hours from Terpel in Bruselas (it's off the main road so you might miss it like we did) and the next fuel station. Had to turn back to fill up.

name: DIAN
description:
In this place you can renew for 90 days more the stay of your vehicle in Colombia, the renewal has no cost but you have to bring the vehicle and the paper of renewal of your days in Colombia which is done in immigration.

En este lugar se puede renovar por 90 días más la estadía de tu vehículo en Colombia, la renovación no tiene ningún costo pero tienes que traer el vehículo y el papel de renovación de tus días en Colombia el cual se realiza en migraciones y tiene un costo de 99.000 col por persona.

name: Rancho LA Parrillada
description: Small Finca with two cabins and food on the weekend.  Camping on grass and space for one large vehicle. If gate is locked just walk up to the house.  Owners also run the restaurant of the same name that is one kilometer from the laguna where O/N are no longer allowed.  Small vehicles may be able to stay there.  Paid 30,000 for the night. Very quiet.

name: El Arriero. Hotel
description: Campamento esta un pueblo muy Chimba !   Un típico pueblo de caballeros con gente amable .   La caratera para ir esta de tierra al fin pero esta facil.     El patrón del hôtel y su hilo Javier son muy simpaticos ! El hôtel esta al frente de la plaza centrale hermosa. Ningún problemas con nos motos en la plaza durante 2 noches. Esta un pueblo tranquilo.   Hay un bar en el hotel para encontrar la poblacón, es posible de comer.

name: Alemautos La Estrella
description:
Mercedes Benz dealer for truck and van repairs.
When we arrived with our overheating problem they admitted that they had never worked on such an old vehicle but it didn't phase them.
We went for a full service as well as sorting out the heating issue.
They allowed us to sleep in our truck whilst we were here. Toilet, water and electricity. Although, we had an 8 o'clock curfew which is when the security dogs come out.
Sabaneta centre is about 10 minutes walk away where you can get all your supplies. 2 large supermarkets and loads of places to eat and drink, relatively cheaply. No tourists either but a busy and relaxed atmosphere.
Metro station is 3 or 4 minutes walk.
We have been here for 9 days so far. Tomorrow is our big test. We're either fixed or not.
The staff here have been so helpful. No English but Google translate works perfectly.
If you're going to be stuck anywhere in Medellin with mechanical issues then this is the place to be.

name: Reserva Natural Cauquitá
description:
Is a place where you can to do trekking (has trails) and enjoy of nature near from town Pereira. Also enjoy other services of nature therapy like massage and sweat therapy 

Prices included entrance to Nature Reserve(trails), Wifi, kitchen, electricity 110v, dry bathroom (without water), cold shower and a space to cook. Very nice place. 

Prices:
Cabin: $50000 COP per person per night. 
Camping: 45000 COP per persona per night

To get there you don't need follow instructions of google maps. In the picture appears instructions. Also to reserve you must write to Johana +57 313 7320688

If you want to visit for day the price is $20000 COP per person 


Es un buen lugar para hacer trekking y disfrutar de la naturaleza cerca de la ciudad de Pereira. Además disfrutar de otros servicios de terapia natural como masajes y baños a vapor. 
Precios incluyen entrada a la reserva( hacer los senderos), wifi, electricidad 110V, cocina, baños secos limpios, dichas y espacios para cocinar. Lugar agradables
Precios: 50000 COP la cabaña p/p por noche; camping (en auto o carpa) 45000 COP p/p por noche

Para llegar no tienes que seguir las instrucciones de Google maps. En las fotos aparece cómo hacerlo. Es necesario reservar con Johana al +57 313 7320688

Si quieres visitar solo por el día el precio es $20000 COP por persona.

name: (Unknown name) restaurant
description:
Nice little local place. 8k for the lunch menu. Good portion and tasty food. And nice staff. For me, the best I had in Taganga!

It's opposite some sort of medical centre and there is only one restaurant there.

name: Agua Termales Villa Maria (warm springs)
description: This is a lovely blend of rocky/concrete pools with warm springs flowing in.  The facilities are rustic and accessed by a short hike uphill.  (See parking pin). Bathrooms, dressing area, shower, benches.   It says no dogs, but the nice man just laughed when I asked.  It cost $1,000cop per person.  Caution it is NOT a hot springs.

name: Agua Termales Villa Maria (parking)
description: This is the wide spot in the road to park for the walk to the pools.  Even our wide rig could scoot over enough to allow passage of others. Could spend the night here.  Possible to level.

name: Parqueadero Oasis Medellín
description: Good place to Park for Day. 13000 col. People very nice. Good also for big rigs. Near center.

name: Biomax gasstation
description:
Gasstation with guard and leveled parking. They charged us 5000 cop for staying the night. For us the much nicer option than the Ecoasis place nearby!
Toilets available and watertabs.
There us some grass for a tent, but i don't know if they let you.

name: Kawabonga
description: The hostal kawabonga was à perfect place to spend our two last weeks whith our camper truck. We paid 20000 for two adults and two childrens. Whith electricity, shower, swimmingpool and toilets. there is hamock,  bar cocktail (try de piña colada from Omar)  and really friendly staff. the gerant is a swiss girl who's name is Melissa. They also sell delicious home made ice cream..  we stayed outside whith à big rig and it was perfect.  It's 300m from the sea. just enjoy!!!

name: Motos Dakar M&S
description: Great mechanic named Sebastian, fair prices will help you out with parking if needed would highly recommend to anyone needing some work down on Moto's in Bogota.

name: Pizza Napoli la Plazzita
description: If you've just spent a long day at the port and DIAN trying to get your home back, and are now starving, this place is perfect!  Crispy thin crust, lots of options, and good prices.  And beer.  And they are fast.  We walked about 20 minutes from the Sociedad Portuaria to get there.

name: Droguería la gran quince - nicest pharmacy EVER!!!
description: Óscar AND his family/staff here are EXTREMELY helpful and very nice.  He helped us track down a difficult-to-find drug.

name: Rio Canoas pull-off
