description: This is a good roadside camp spot in case you need a break from the windy mountain roads.  You can get down to the river result from here for a bath (although the water is really cold).  There is some traffic on this road but it was quiet at night.

name: Hotel Riviera Confort
description: Nice little Hotel in Pasto. Ok to stay one night when heading north. Paid 30.000 COP for 2 person, matrimonial and private bathroom. We could park our 2 motobikes secure in the garage. Little shops, restaurants and hardware stores are in walking distance.

name: Auto frenos
description: Had front break pads replaced here. No English spoken but very friendly service.

name: Hotel Royal Class
description:
Perfect Hotel to rest after crossing the border to Columbia. Supermarkets and ATM are in walking distance. Also, you can walk in 10min. to several motorbike stores and to the big supermarket Exito. There you can buy SOAT for your motobike (41.000 COP for 4 weeks). 
We could park our 2 motobikes secured. Paid 55.000 COP for matrimonial with private bathroom.

name: High Theft Area - Popayan
description: Don't let your motorbikes alone on public street. Within 5 minutes my mirror was stolen! Furthermore everyone is looking and touching your bike! We don't have a good feeling and parked, after being robbed, in a parqueadero.

name: Waterfall
description: We came here to go to the cascada del amor, but as it was dry due to a lack of rain a local directed us to this waterfall. To get here you park your car right across from the road that turns left to go towards the embalse from the main road coming out of Prado. There you cross into the field and follow the path all the way down. As it is not very frequented, you have to pay close attention and there will be thorns you'll have to kick out of the way. After about half an hour and a lot of sweating you'll get there, and it's all worth it. I've been here twice now and both times we were the only people there. If you want to ask locals, it's called "cascada salta del ...." I believe it's Salta de María/Ángel or something similar.

name: Patch of grass next to road
description: After taking the back road into Jericó we arrived here very late. There's no services and it's really just a patch of grass next to the road, but the road is very calm at night.

name: Parque Archeological Nacional de Tierradentro
description:
The purchase price (65.000 (nov 2023) per person) includes admission for two days, two museums and 6 tomb locations that are accessed by trails. You can see one, a few or all in two days.  Each has a guard, guide and some print materials in English and Spanish.  Take water, good shoes, a flashlight, umbrella and camera.  Non-flash photos are okay.  And as a special treat, dogs are welcome on the trails and can wait in the shade while you climb into each tomb.  
This place is hard to get to, tough to find parking for big rigs. (Tip: you need clearance for the messy highway under constant construction and if your rig is too tall for the marked spots, there are some roadside spots to park, or the church park in Inza is level)

name: Police parking lot
description:
This lot is next to the police station and just 2 blocks from the main square.  It is also along the river and only 1 block from the old bridges.  

We did not stay there though we felt we could access it with our 7.4m long camper.  There were many spots available when we found this,  though it was on a Saturday - mid week might be different.

name: No name event center with pond
description: We found this wonderful place after being beat up traveling on the terrible road to Tierradentro. We couldn't make it to the town and this place just appeared.  The caretakers had no problem offering is a place to park right next to the pond.  Great birding there. Though we probably overpaid in the morning,  we gave them 20,000 for the night.  We felt it was worth it.

name: Terpel gas station near Mutatá
description:
We spend the  night in the fuel station under a big tree. They have a big parking lot beside the road. The allowed us to stay for free. Bathroom in the fuel station. We didn't ask for wifi, there is an open net but you need a pin, maybe they have it. 

Pasamos la noche en esta Terpel que tiene un gran estacionamiento, bajo un árbol muy grande que está al fondo. Es gratis y se puede usar el baño de la estación de servicio (gasolinera).

name: Alta Mar hotel playa blanca
description:
This is a hotel with cabins that provides a space to park also for a motorhome and even put a tent down a little roof. You have bathroom and shower facilities. Right in front of the beach!! Not good for big rigs, small entrance. Wifi avaliable. We paid the two of us and the van 15000 cops in low season. Pet friendly. Cabin prices from 60000 to 100000 cops, with all services. 


Hotel de cabañas Altamar, muy buena gente. Hay un parqueadero donde quedarse aunque, por ser la entrada angosta, no entran trailers grandes. Se puede poner carpa. Ducha y baño, wifi. Justo frente al mar!!!
Nosotros dos y la furgo pagamos 15000 cops la noche en temporada baja. Tienen gatitos y aceptan mascotas. Los precios de las cabañas van de 60000 a 100000 cops.

name: Lavado
description:
Couldn’t find any place to refill our water tank. Tried here at the “lavado” and could refill our fix water tank (~250liters) for 2’000 COP.
Clean water with good pressure.
(They offer to wash your vehicle for 20’000COP)

name: Combi hostal
description:
Semiprivate bunkbeds for your safety. kitchen, hot shower, lockers, private and dorm (30k). secure parking for a couple of small bikes.
.....
Camarotes semiprivados para tu seguridad, los mejores del pueblo.

name: Parking Hotel Utuane
description:
They let us park outside the hotel and use the bath and shower by the pool. We spent here 3 nights that were very quiet. You can see monkeys in the parking.

Nos dejaron estacionar afuera del hotel y usar el baño y la ducha de la piscina. Estuvimos 3 noche que fueron muy tranquilas. Puedes ver monos en el estacionamiento .

name: Esso fuel station
description: Water available here as you head south out of Medellin. Tap is located on the side of the building next to the toilets.

name: Donde Muncho
description:
Guy running a small hostel or homestay up here. there are some nice views. very expensive though with 50 for the night and 20 for a basic  meal. If I would have  known that I definitely would have camped. 
he also offers camping don't know how much that is.

name: Connecting Borders
description: We work as agents for temporary import/export of tourist vehicles. We handle all process according your need (import/export). We are specialists and manage the tramits quick, safe and warranted. We have some ways for manage your cargo, it could be container or RORO. Contact us: +573182379037. Email: infoconnectingborders@gmail.com

name: Meditation & Yoga Retreat Center
description:
We stayed here for a 3 day meditation and yoga retreat. they happily let us Camp instead of paying for accomodation. food is vegan & amazing.  

for bookings: 
www.bookyogaretreats.com 
www.retirosdelamontana.com
whatsapp: +57 310 559 6307
info@retirosdelamontana.com

juan Carlos & Clara lucia are wonderful and will make you feel at home. 

No campground; only go there if you are taking part of a retreat. individual program & dates possible.  highly recommended! dog friendly.

name: termales el volcan, ciénaga
description:
this is the parking to the thermal bath. we arrived late. we took the small road from cienaga- not recommended. bad road, hardly enough space for our sprinter camper van. we had to pay 25.000cop for the night. entrance mud bath 20.000 and mud application for the whole body are additional 10.000pp. its hot here, no wind at night, many biting insects!
they closed the gate at night, and a guard is around. train near, cutting of the lawn early morning= noisy.

name: casa viejas
description:
nice hostel in the middle o la Victoria coffee farm. good place to relax no party people here. 
it books out often but they have hammocks in case you turn up here and it's full. dorm 40 hammock 20. 
small bar with rather expensive craft beer for 10. community style dinner 25 breakfast 10-15. 
you can drive up here on a motorcycle no worries. I dunno if they have car parking spaces though. 
perfect place to kick back. no kitchen, no wifi. they have a computer with internet though. hot showers, yes, you have read that correctly.

name: Swimming Pool El Eden
description:
nice 25m pool with a slide for kids and good views. Also a restaurant and wifi.  6000 Cop pp
was open at 9am on a Monday - no people at all!

name: Free Walking Tour Meeting Point
description: In front of informacion touristica at main plaza. Twice a day at 10am and 4pm. Takes around 2h.

name: Mariposario Andoke - Butterfly Garden
description: Really beautiful site! They give you a very informative tour showing also the breeding processes and are very knowledgeable! 20k cop pp. the house alone is impressive and the property is quite big. The road is a bit bumpy on the last 200m but doable with any vehicle. But very big rigs might have problems as it has some narrow passages. they have a website www.andoke.com.co - I do not think that you need to make a reservation. We went on a Tuesday, no one else around. Not too many parking possibilities. Recommended

name: SLS Holding
description: If you need SLS Holding to put your car in contener. We do with Wave logistics and SLS Holding

name: Altos de Yerbabuena
description:
Best restaurant in town
Everything freshly cooked, tasty meat, fish, pasta and veggies option as well. Vegetables from the garden are delicious
A bit pricey (about 30k for a meal) but really worth it especially if you are fed up with the almuerzos...

name: Señora Carmen
description:
We were cycling down from Fabrica de Arepas Buena Vista towards Charala. As the “road” consists of stones and sand and we are riding regular hybrid bicycles with luggage we could not cover the distance before dark.
We were advised that Senora Carmen rents out a room (shared bathroom with the family). She also made us a very nice dinner and breakfast the next morning. Total costs cop 70:000. Very warm welcome.

name: Claudia y Juans Place
description:
This nice Columbien couple lived twenty years in the states, return and bild this hostel with Possibilitys for stay with a big Rig.
They just start with 8 rooms and place for Max. 3 Trucks. They don't have any high restricten only if you are more then 9 m you will have some problems to enter. The Hostel is in a nice colonial building 100m from the waterfront and near to Marina and the Containerport. If you have a nice and quiet dog they allowed it. Juan organize everything you need this couple is obsolutly fantastic. 
From here you need 15 min to walk into the historic Center.
A lot of nice restaurant are really near by. They charge between 80'000-95'000 for a doubleroom with aircondition and a own very clean bathroom.

name: Colmazda - Disel
description:
Best Diesel Mechanic in Bogota. Bosch official and Common rail specialists.

We had trouble starting our Peugeot Boxer 2.2 HDi and had the luck to find Colmazda. So professional, so eficient, couldn’t have had a better experience.

We fixed our injectors, start module, door...all in 2 days. We couldn’t find the replacement for the injector so they fixed it. Great job and fair product!! Real Diesel specialists.

Ask for Ramon!

name: Rancho de Occidente
description: An excellent place for: eating, spend the night, take coffee or just visit. This place is a huge parking lot, restaurant and has hotel. Bathrooms very clean, and people are super nice, the food is good and very economical. We spent the night, it was very quiet, the very friendly people with us. Very safe. Recommended 100%. Free of charge.

name: Tiendas D1 market place
description: Affordable supermarket open till 9pm on your way to the campsites and hostel around the area

name: Sitio Arqueológico La Pelota y El Purutal
description: There are 7 sculptures of San Agustín. The entrance ticket is $5000.  Interesting and cheaper if you are not so interested in San Agustín site but want to see something. The kind man in the site gave us a lot of information! Here are the only two sculptures with color.

name: El Tablón
description: 5 statues for free! 300 m from the road. Just pass!

name: Parador Paisa
description: Parador near the peaje. Bathrooms and security all the night. excellent place! During the day there is a little restaurant. Also they provided us water. Very kind people!! FREE

name: Bomba
description: Good place for a night between Coveñas and Cartagena. There's no other safe place to sleep.

name: Puerto de Manzanillo
description: Here is the port were you are going to board your car.

name: Casa El Recuerdo
description:
Finca, hostel and Campground, Nice place to stay in the Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta. Nice forest and hike possibility. many animals : monkey and tucan.

There is a camping area, we slept here for 15k pp. inc. breakfast. You can negotiate the price if you don't want the breakfast. 

There is also dormitorio for 25k pp and hamac for 20k, private room for 40k pp.

Need a high ground clearance car to get here, nothing too big, pick ups with cabins could probably go through no worries.

name: Notario
description: very helpful notario who helped us with the poder (selling our car). super friendly,  super kompetent! Ask for Señor Juan Antonio villamizar trujillo.

name: Mercado de las pulgas "fleamarket"
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner

Flea market yard sale garage sale this is the place to come if you want to buy sell and trade any item in particular here you can find gadgets tools survival gear clothing shoes antiques toys souvenirs smoking papers we accept US dollar currency Colombian pesos it's a friendly place to visit

note: here you can get food 24 hours 7 days a week you just call in and order
breakfast from 6 a.m. to 9 a.m. lunch time from 12 2 p.m. and dinner time from 6:30 p.m. 2 2 a.m. in the morning everyday you can give us a call (310)810-6635

name: Casa Centenario
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: This place was added by the owner. It has not been overlander verified.

Casa Centenario is your Boutique Hotel in Cartagena. A space surrounded by history that gives you the same comfort and freedom of a home. With 6 luxury rooms, it offers its guests travel experiences that combine rest and confidence, giving you the opportunity to enjoy the walled city, its history and the Getsemaní neighborhood, which vibrates between the urban and the traditional.

Casa Centenario also has a private terrace that combines a gastronomic offer typical of the region and the best attention of qualified and committed personnel who wait to serve you as you deserve.
---
Casa Centenario es tu Hotel Boutique en Cartagena. Un espacio rodeado de historia que te brinda la misma comodidad y libertad de un hogar. Con 6 habitaciones de lujo ofrece a sus huéspedes experiencias de viaje que combinan descanso y confianza brindándote la oportunidad de que disfrutes al máximo la ciudad amurallada, su historia y el  barrio Getsemaní, que vibra entre lo urbano y lo tradicional.

Casa Centenario cuenta, además, con una terraza privada que combina una oferta gastronómica típica de la región y la mejor atención de personal calificado y comprometido que esperan por atenderte como lo mereces.

name: Simple spot to eat and drink
description: As a cyclist, I thought there would be nothing on this section, but there's actually a little place to buy some cold drinks.

name: Quinini 2 biomax petrol station
description: Before bogota coming from San Agustin , it is a better option than Tercel 15km south. Higher so cooler and a breeze, and no flies eating you. You have a big parking lot , flat, next to the petrol station but belonging to the hotel on the opposite side of the road. We were charged 5000 COP for the vehicle to stay for the night. You are next to the highway so yes it is a bit noisy ... just a safe place to overnight enroute !

name: Laguna Lomalinda
description: Municipality Eco park with big laguna - swimmable, palm trees, pontoon and small beach. Toilets - were closed - and barbecue area. Big flat parking area. Nobody there when we came but should be busy on week ends. Walking trails around the lagoon . Very nice and peaceful . From the main road about 3 km on a good dirt road.

name: Ciudad de piedre
description: You can only visit with a guide . Really nice rock formation

name: El Jacuzzi
description: Nice spot to swim in, enjoy the birds around

name: Entry point to tunnel
description: This is the car park when you want to visit los tuneles and el jacuzzi . Better to use a guide a the path is not marked !

name: Puentes natural
description: Possibility to camp. Big flat area next to restaurant. Entry accès point to the puente natural . Small natural swimming pool - really nice place to relax! They ask 10 000 pp,

name: Piédra Alta
description:
A finca , small lodge,
Pool and restaurant, and possibility of camping. Very nice walk in the forest  and rocks, they have natural pool on their property and you can even do horse ride too. Really nice place !

name: Terpel - San Jose del aboard
description: Ask Gilberto the administrator and you will be able to stay overnight. We left our vehicle with them for a few days while on tour with Geotour. Could even plug electricity and refill with water. They asked us 5000 per night but paid more as they were really great and helpful

name: Bruselas
description: Free parking between Terpel and a football field. Toilet available. Very quiet.

name: Free Soul Camp in Palomino
description: This is a great place to stay! Its owners Paula and Franco are very good people, friendly and ready to help in everything. Very clean and good bathroom and beautifull outdoor kitchen and a small bar. Good wifi all day. They open the place three months ago so are planing to make it bigger adding some cabins, but it's great so far for tents and trailers. Big rigs also. They have two dogs and pets are welcome.

name: la victoria caffee plantagion
description:
you can 
-take part of tours for 15.000cop pp about 45 mins for the coffee platacion included coffee tasting,
- buy coffee beans or grounded for 250 gr for 12.000 or 500gr for 20.000 cop. no discount if you buy more. 
we were allowed to stay overnight, walk around except the house when closed. natural water, wifi.  brewery only sells beer por 30 bottles each 300ml for 117.000cop and 24.000cop deposit. baños at the cafeteria. very pleasant surrounding. quiet at night except wild life. no claro reception. the parking itself has space for big rigs, but the road up to here is not recommendable at the moment.

name: Hostel musinga
description: Nice place to stay calm quiet wifi and hot water available drinkable water and kitchen too  single and shared rooms

name: Llanteria
description: Efficient tire shop. Friendly and sincere.

name: Hostal Casa Caribe
description: Wonderful place to stay with nice host, clean room with AC, patio at 10 min walk from the old town. You can use the kitchen and really feel home (and you would like this place to be your home!!!). They have a laundry service too. You can book on booking too for about 18 USD a night for two. Highly recommended!

name: Lava Autos Danny
description: Changed oil here. Just drove up. Had our own filter. Very nice guys.

name: Kurakas
description: Natural water swimming pool and restaurant. Walk here from the entrance  to the waterfall. Turn right, after the bridge, and follow path along the river. 5000.00 cop pp. nice on hot day.

name: SOAT SEGUROS MUNDIAL
description:
Good attention to get SOAT extention or buy for first time. In the neighbor have a lot of SOAT offices. 
Surely you must tell them to call the main office to get autorization to sell SOAT for less than a year, but is possible.

name: Museo Casa de la Memoria
description: Unbelievable this has no check-in yet! Really informative museum about the (violent) history of Colombia and Medellin! It's free! Bring your phone and headphones - you can download a free app with audioguide!! also free wifi!

name: Restaurant and Big Car Lot w/electricity and wifi!
description: Definitely the best place on the Colombian side of the border by far of anything marked on ioverlander as of this date. Electricity hook up and wifi for FREE. Lots of truckers but surprisingly quiet. Bathroom but not sure on shower as we didn’t ask but I’m betting they do. Decent looking restaurant but we didn’t need dinner. Friendly staff.

name: Centro Automotor de la Sabana
description:
Our RV back axis broke on the road in the middle of the night and the truck crane dropped us here as the driver recommended it.
Great place! very knowledgeable although you need to bargain prices with them. Lots of space even for huge RVs or buses. WiFi at the office and toilet. The place is secured with a fence and 24h security. 
They also helped us finding a carpenter for the inside broken pieces

name: Carpenter / Carpintería
description:
Álvaro and his assistant Luis helped us repairing the door and some of the wooden internal structure of our damaged RV. Not sure if they speak English but always try to bargain the price!
Álvaro y su ayudante Luis repararon nuestra puerta y partes de la estructura interior de madera de nuestra Camper después de un accidente que tuvimos.

name: Alcaldia municipal
description:
On the central square, there is the city hall. inside the building there is a small pure water tank that you can use to refill your water. (please ask before to help yourself)
Lots of nice locals, they even offered us a free (and really suggary) coffee.

name: Los Tanques
description:
It is an open field for public use, there is a tank that supplies water to the sidewalks of the sector, you can camp without any problems, there are no dangers and it is 2 km from the town , the view from the tank is impressive, on clear mornings you can see the Nevado del Huila



Es un campo abierto de uso público, allí se encuentra un tanque que abastece de agua a las veredas del sector, se puede acampar sin ningún problema, no hay peligros y está a 2 Km del pueblo, la vista que hay desde el tanque es impresionante, en mañanas despejadas de puede ver el Nevado del Huila

name: Balneario las Gloria
description:
small recreation site near the river, with toilet and sink. It is the point mention in the  other nearby spot : you have to cross the river (very easy) to reach this point.

we find this spot better than the previus where it is writing no parking and no camping. Here we ask the familly from a little tienda and they said no problem to camp here.

this is swim spot with a natural pool and waterfall

there is also a BBQ area.

FREE

name: Mirador El Roble.
description: Very friendly family where you can enjoy camping and a lot of bird watching. Guided trails through the forest. Very calm and safe

name: gas station
description: gas station in palomino where we were able to stay for the night after arriving late in Palomino. For 10000pesos we could plug in for electricity. Felt safe and the gas station is closed after 9 pm so fairly quiet in the night. There is a guard for the night.

name: Hotel amarillo
description: Very nice, quiet, clean and cheap hotel. 30.000 COP a room for 2 people with flat TV. A/C and private bathroom

name: Restaurant y Hospedaje San Vicente
description:
restaurant/hotel on the road. meal at 7000 for normal, 12000 for fish.
we ask owner to rest on the little parking lot for sleeping in the car. no problem, a few passing cars/trucks during night but nearly nothing. beautiful spot for stars

name: Hostal Bogota Real
description: The best hostel par excellence in Bogota

name: Ribera Río Tetuán
description: The place is the riverside of the Tetuán River, via the path of Calarma, there is a beach of sand and stone, also, a field to do the camping, you can make fire, however, it is better to have a stove to avoid fires, around of the place there are houses of the inhabitants of the path.

name: Laguna Encantada
description: Place to camp outdoors, can be reached by the path El Cural belonging to San Antonio or the path Calarma belonging to Chaparral, the place has a historical value for the indigenous Pijaos.

name: Hospedaje Camioneros
description:
Basic hotel, small rooms with WiFi, fan, private bathroom and satellite tv. 
A room is 30.000 per night, not negotiable.
Our bicycles did fit in the room.

If there is no one at the reception ask at the gas station,  same owner.

It also has a big fenced parking lot where truckers stay overnight for 8.000. Probably if you have a rig you can stay there as well.

The restaurant close by has good meals including soup, main course and drinks for 11.000 each.

name: Hotel El Portal del Valle
description:
Clean basic hotel. Rooms with double bed, fan, tv and private bathroom for 40,000 per night.,

For our bicycles there was enough space to park them in the fenced garage. Motorbikes should fit as well. For cars only street parking I guess.

name: Cargorider New Location
description:
Cargo Rider is shipping Motorbikes and other Vehicles.
Veronica Mosquera
Cel.   57 3112237841

name: Villacelina
description: It is a place on the shores of the Momil lagoon, safe and comfortable. It is surrounded by a beautiful lagoon with beautiful sunsets. The owner is called Don Carmelo

name: La Mojana
description: It is a country house, it is practically a wild camp, but with the hospitality and security of good peasants. There are many animals and you can learn from cows. The name of the manager is Rigoberto

name: Embalse Neusa
description: Just nice, the perfect place to rest in the wild. Beautiful

name: Brisas del Nowen
description: To get to this site, you have to pass the bridge over the Guaviare River in the way to San José (6 kms) Once the bridge ends, turn left and pass below the bridge in the direction "Cerro Azul". It is an ideal place to rest before going to the hill or back. It is safe, clean and Vilma are generous and very good hosts. Beautiful pool is available.

name: Cedro Macho
description: It is a comfortable place near Lejanías with attractions such as the Guejar swimming pools, recommended. It has enough space to park, it is clean and safe. It has restaurant, pool. Ask about Mary

name: Ecoparque la Motilona
description: It is a large place with a beautiful waterfall called La Motilona, ​​one of the most beautiful. It has restaurant, wifi, cold beer. Highly recommended, especially for the beauty of waterfall, very close to the restaurant. It is preferable to arrive during the week, on Sundays it is full of locals.

name: Villa Beatriz
description: It is a place in Sibundoy out of the urban area 5 minutes, which makes it silent to rest. He has cabins as well as a botanical garden with medicinal plants. Brayan is a guide to observe of birds and knowledgeable of traditions "Chamanicas". It has a beautiful view on Sibundoy. There are ecological trails and Orchids

name: parking next to picnic area
description:
parking at the street. asked police, no prob. quiet and safe.  parking allowed only after 6 pm on weekends.
  bathrooms and potable water.  FREE

name: Finca el Porfin
description:
This place is the perfect place for a coffee tour. Perfect place for overlander. Ana María answer you in Whsp (photo attached). The price is cheap and they give you breakfast. Lunch. And all the explanation of all the fruits and vegetables of all the finca 
(Whsp - 3218741764)

name: Bike & Dive Hostel
description:
Modern hostel with pool, rooftop bar, hammocks. capsule style beds in the dorms. 35000 cop for the cheapest bed, breakfast included. 24h reception.
Space for about four motorcycles behind the gate, street parking for cars seems to be secure in this area.

name: Hospedaje
description:
Simpel hotel along the Pan-Am.
Room with double bed, fan, tv and private bathroom is 35000.
They have a secure indoor parking for bicycles and motorbikes.

name: Camping Via Vereda Tiquiza
description: I was stay in there for a night, a person from Chia we guide to this site, bet the field is a property of a family, so I get the permission talk with they

name: Small River very quiet
description: Street with illumination end on small river. Very quiet place, perfect to spend the night. No recommended yo big rigs, no space yo turn back, only cars, bikes and vans

name: Paradero Los Micos
description: Parqueadero de la cafetería, los dueños muy amables y humildes. Tienen comida deliciosa a un excelente precio. Llegamos acá cuando nos sorprendió la noche y mucha neblina. Cenamos y desayunamos acá, no nos cobraron camping.

name: Finca a bordo de carretera
description: A family's house, the owners are grandparents, we spent one night there, all night was raining but was good the climate.

name: Casa de Don Ricardo
description: Don Ricardo is an man who loves ride by mountain bike and he helped me to passed the night in Borbosa... He isn't a host or Couchsurfer (nothing) however, maybe he's able to help the other riders how he did with me, you can arrive to there and talk with him, maybe, your a lucky man.

name: Mum tillant as
description: Stock of Michelin agilis. They mount it on big size vehicle , balance and alignment quickly done!

name: BocaGrande Shopping Center
description:
Good, clear and modern shopping center to made office. Recommend Juan Valdez Café at 3rd floor, to the north side. You have a lot of energy outlets to connect your devices.

Prices a little bit high, but is not neccesary to consume.

name: the church
description: After driving almost around the entire lake looking for a nice, free, by the lake wildcamp, we ended up talking to a local who directed us this way. This is a church (marked on maps me) that only opens the first Sunday of every month. Right by the lake, nice big flat area, awesome views. Clean bucket flush toilet and small hostel. Boat rides available from sweet caretaker family

name: River Ambiance
description: Small grassy parking spot right off the road with very  little local traffic. The river is just a few meters off, which is a great spot to have a fire and drink some beers. Beautiful views all around.

name: El Solar de la Casilla
description:
Food court style restaurant. There’s a central courtyard where you sit, but you can order from any one of the 4 restaurants; burgers, Italian, crepes, or local. 

We were there on a Saturday night with live music, friendly staff and a nice vibe. 

(Hamburguesa de la casa is a must!)

Entrance is just off of the main square.

name: Gas station Mobil
description:
We parked here for the night free of charge. 
They have fast food until 10:30pm. Wifi available.

name: La Victoria
description: You can get fuel at this small gas station in La Victoria town.

name: Backpacker's Inn
description: Perfect hostel. 20k and 25k dorms. Parking for a few motorcycles. Safe neighborhood. Great atmosphere and the family which works here is so nice!

name: Juanpamotos
description: Carlos is an excellent mechanic and an overall nice guy. Been already 2 times, once for a friend's bike, once for mine. Excellent service. His contact is: +57 312 7669144

name: Restaurant El Paradero
description: I thought it's better to make a separate post for the restaurant. Excellent lunch menu for 8k pesos. Nice staff, they even shared the WiFi password while I had lunch

name: Tamauka Camping
description:
This is a perfect stop for people traveling to Bogota from the north. It is difficult to make the trip all the way to Bogota in one day. Tamauka is a good stopping point to take a break before entering the chaos of Bogota. It also allows for day trips to nearby national parks and smaller villages on the outskirts of Bogota. We have done a great deal of camping in South America and have never before found a more beautiful, organized camping area. The common kitchen is huge and well equipped. The bathrooms are clean and the shower is hot. There is a large flat area for parking and/or tents. Plenty of beautiful space to hang out, be together or alone and enjoy the outdoors. There are horses, sheep, chickens and a garden. You can have laundry done for a small fee. My Claro chip worked well here. The farm is located within a gated, private community with security. Before you arrive at the main gate, call Patricia at WhatsApp +573164485126.

We highly recommend this spot. 15,000 Colombian pesos per person.

name: Casa Grande
description:
a beautiful restaurant with amazing people working there. 
we had a delicious menu del dia for 12cop/pp with soup, mailn dish and lemonade (big portion!) and lovelly conversations with amazing people.

name: Horseriding / Cabbalos
description:
We meet in the town very nice and kind guy who made for us 3-4hours horse ridding tour (visit: Estrecho Magdalena, Pelota, Chaquira, Laguna de Magdalena). It was beautifull tour around San Augustin. We payed 35.000 COP /pers. (additional pay, not included: insurance 3000 COP/pers. and entrance to Pelota 5000 COP/pers.) Horses was „tranquilo”. Another guy try to sell us the same excursion 120.000 COP / couple (he told us that we must pay also for guide). 

Contact: Argemiro Argote Astudillo
Cel: +57 3134605062 , +57 3124451315

name: La Mulata
description: Recommended by experienced local guide: a treasure. Excellent food at very reasonable prices. I‘ll definitely return.

name: Hotel Las Vegas
description: Nice hotel with friendly owners. 40,000 for good sized matrimonial room with comfy bed, private bathroom, warm shower, good WiFi (Dropped put during storm) and covered parking inside for bicycles and motos. Quiet over night (on a Tuesday), one block from main square and opposite D1 supermarket. San Roque is a really nice little town with lovely plaza and locals drinking in the bars around the plaza in the evening and typical Colombian restaurants. Was another hotel on plaza, looked nice but lady was really unfriendly.

name: Villa Dalia
description: 5 nice rooms with ensuite showers. we were a group of 10 bikers and there was pleanty of space. lovely views of Sevilla. swimming pool

name: Technical Bikes - Pote
description: Moto mechanic Pote. specialist in larger cc bikes. had some work done with him including a seat cut to size. he pointed out some unrelated things I had not noticed. nice guy and fair price. @technicalbikes on Instagram for more info.

name: Los colores
description: Restaurant, hostel and parking. Friendly owners. Is a good place for eat and sleep. 5.000 for parking, free shower

name: El Puente Guatape
description: A great restaurant and an art bar in the evening.  For 12 000 pp we got a soup , veggi  / carnivore meal,  homemade lemonade and homemade bread.  Everything was just delicious, fresh and made with love. The stuff is incredible nice! We highly recommend.

name: Hostal Las Flores
description:
Very pretty and clean accommodation with access to kitchen. Wifi available. Outside there are sofas, hammocks to relax. The owner Ruby is very kind and friendly. They also organize horse riding tours. 
We paid 50000COP per night for a big room.
(25000COP per person)
5-minute walk to the main plaza so it's calm at night.

name: Hotel Scandy
description: Hotel on the Main Street of Vegachi, supermarket next door and street food right outside. it’s on the second floor but it’s up a wide set of stairs and they have a huge patio with some cover for bicycles (no other parking). It’s nice to have some outside space and a room with natural light. Beds are comfy, only cold shower (No shower head) in private bathroom and WiFi works well enough closer to reception (not in the rooms on the patio, but they are quieter because they’re at the back and brighter). It’s a really nice place, finished really nicely and the lady that runs it is lovely. 35,000 for matrimonial, with fan and tv.

name: Hotel El Tricolor
description: Pretty basic place but it’s clean, safe and quiet. 30k for fan, 35k for a/c, both matrimonial room. Cold shower but it’s ok as the temperate in Zaragoza is really hot! WiFi works best near reception, doesn’t reach rooms at the back, but is still poor. The owner let us put our bicycles in her house which is below the hotel, secure behind two doors, there were also some motos in there. It’s down quite a narrow corridor though so might be too tight for most. Reasonable place for a night, few restaurants and street food carts open at night in Zaragoza town by the church.

name: Truck overnight - Hostel
description: At the gasstation marked on the IO they refused us, so we found this close place. It is a big parking for trucks, they have some rooms avaible for 30000 per room (1 big bad). We didn't stay in the room but found a place to pull our tents, hidden behind one of the trucks (but there is also a place between the woods on their territory). You can use bathroom and shower for tips.  We tipped them 10000 for 4 persons. Nice and helpful owner. It was close to the road but road was quiet that night. The trucks were loud in the morning  :) We felt safe, we saw the owner watching out the place in the evening  (probably in the night too).

name: Wild camp by the river
description: Driving all the way to the end of a local road. The road is dirt. At the end is a large turn around area right by the water. There is also a suspension bridge that the local use to cross the river. Very quiet night. The locals arrived at 7am to start work but no one over night. One of the only spots to wild camp around here.

name: Parquadero near Exito
description:
This is a parking, cost Is 1000 for one hour but you can stay overnight. Is not a place very closed, so if you are scared about stay in open place is not for you, but for us seems to be safe. 
we are really near a big shopping centre with an Exito supermarket. we have to say that here we have found the faster internet connection since long time (8 megabit upload on youtube). there is also a coworking area here. on the centre there is also a shop with some article for mac users.

name: Wild camping - Playa Blanca
description: A perfect wild camping outside of the crowded beach. Take to the right while entering the beach and walk until you find a free area. We shared the place with another 10 tents of local and international backpackers. Quiet night and an amazing view.  Police officer came twice during the day,  telling us that it's allowed to build the tent from 6pm but it has to be removed during the day. So officially it's not prohibited to camp here. Only accessible by walking. Enjoy!

name: Casa Playa - Camping Bernabé
description:
We enjoyed staying here so much, for over 3 weeks. it is very quiet, except for  birds and waves. very clean, very friendly owner and workers. 
you can walk to the river to the north at the beach (and to Palomino) or to Capo San Augustin. 
very clean toilets and showers (water is warm), kitchen, electricity 110v and 220v, washing machine, no wifi, but 4g-internet Claro reception. hammocks 15.000 and rooms 60.000cop/night are available as well. motorhome (2 persons): 50.000/ night. If you stay longer, you may ask for a reduction.
ilsis is the owner: tel 3187542712 (whats app).

name: dian (dirección de impuestos y aduanas nacionales)
description: we went here to get an extension for another 90 days for our camper (after  we were at the migracion for 90 more days in passports). lunchbreak 12.00-2.00. we were sent to 4th floor, were a very nice lady wrote a letter for us that we want to stay longer, she made copies of car document, passport and you need soat copy. all was attached and stamped (very important) on the 3rd floor than we had to go to the dian at the port (walking distance). look at our entry there.

name: Patio Querido
description: Great restaurant owned by Jeremy and his brother (french owner). They search for small quality producer and offer a tasteful menu. The menu change every week and is original. Great cheese, delicatessen, homemade bread and pastry! Their sangria was perfect as well  all that in a refreshing and beautiful place! For a cocktail or a dinner it’s worth passing by!

name: Hospedaje Economico
description: Cheapest hostel we could find in town. Very short walk to the city center. Very friendly owner, clean rooms, and a kitchen to cook with all the essentials. $20,000 pesos per person for a two person dorm, $55,000 for a matrimonial, and $15,000 to put a tent. They have a small space for it. Also a laundry service is available. The place is a little hard to find but you should see signs in Spanish saying rooms for rent. If you pass the music shop you have gone too far.

name: La Cabaña de Don Luis
description:
Campground with plenty of grassy area, cold showers, toilets. It has a small glamping area and some rooms. A safe place for overlanders to park and camp as well as offering a good hearty breakfast that is included in the price. The place is not very leveled. We paid 20kCOP per night. 
The owner, Rafael is very nice. We arrived during the season for hormigas culonas and he and his family roasted them and he offered us some. We couldn't refuse! They were surprisingly tasty! stay at this place when passing through Guadalupe and the Gachas.
Raphael is the owner and his Whatsapp phone number is +57 316 4816003

name: quiet street near firefigthers
description: Quiet and near police and fire station.  Asked neighbors and it was OK.  Stayed for 3 nights and  was all good

name: botanical garden
description:
although our guide book did not recommend to come here we enjoyed the visit to this botanical garden very much. it took us about 90 mins to do the circuit. big trees give enough shadow and there was a nice breeze. open: tuesday to sunday8-16. closed on monday. entrance fee 18.000cop p. p. 
guided tours at 8.00/ 9.30/ 11.00/1.00/2.30

name: Amazonas
description:
Very nice restaurant with very good menu. Very tasty vegetarians burgers, patacones, arepas... Nice staff and quite cheap: 5'000 - 9'000 p. burger / 1'500 - 4'000 p. arepas. Very recomandable! 

Lindo y rico restaurante, muy bien ambiante!

name: Guatape to Alejandria
description: Coming from Guatapé to Alejandria. The first 2.5km is asphalt but then it’s ripio. It is in very rough condition. It had been raining for some time leading up to now though so may have made the road worse. We didn’t need 4wd but only averaged 15km/hr. Wouldn’t recommend this way if you can avoid it.

name: In front of supermarket Justo y Bueno
description: Somebody broke into our car right in front of the supermarket. As they found the guy we now know that it was a group that is specialized on car robberies of tourist cars. So be aware

name: DDS Clínica de Rehabilitacion Dental
description: We popped in to check on an appointment and they got us right in.  Some staff and dentists speak English. All are very friendly. Prices were reasonable.  The X-ray machine is automatic and panoramic, very modern. Also do implants, cosmetic and children’s.  Normal sized parking garage nearby. No big rig parking in this area.

name: Veterinaria El Virrey - Dra. Maria
description: Doctora Maria is amazing.  Good prices, good staff, passionate care.  She helped us through numerous issues.  She can prepare travel certificate. Vaccinations. And can arrange xrays and ultrasound. Also bathing and grooming. The clinic is chaos with happy dogs all over.  Near a beautiful park to relax in and some parking nearby although big rigs could be a challenge.  WhatsApp at +57 310 2222112 anytime. She speaks only Spanish.

name: Paprika (cheese and restaurant)
description: Do miss hard, aged, delicious cheese? Do you need some Swiss fondue and traditional dishes? This is your place. Vegetarian items and great cheeses for sale.  Fresh yogurt, Brie, gruyere, raclette, provolone, ementaler and much more.  A little hard to find, but worth it. We were able to park our big rig in there and turn it, but if you’re large you should check before pulling in.

name: suesca square
description: nice quiet street parking on the northern street of the square, no amenities but freeee and super safe

name: Street parking
description: We stay one night here only to sleep, quiet place near the center

name: ARMED ROBBERY
description: We stayed second night on this playa. Beutifull, next to the city. All local people told as there is super safe (tranqillo). Unfortunately when we was sitting next to our campervan (8pm) one guy suprise as and first touch my pockets and told that only what money for eat. I gave him 5000 COP and covered rest of money from wallet to guide books in front of the car. This man thanks us for money, told us that is safe place and after he went away. We immedietly start preparing stuff to leave this place but after two minutes this guy come back with matchet, he was running to us, my wife started sceraming („help”- „ayudar”), I used pepper gas and this guy only robbed guide books (he knew exactly where they are so we think that another person was hiddenn standing before on another side of our car, looking where we are keeping our money) and he runned away. I don’t know if gas helped because it was dark. Next we went to police station 2km from there and police start patroling along the cost. No injury. We lost 100$. Actually we lost fun and didn’t feel safty to the rest of the trip. U still have to be really careful being here in Colombia and U have to forget about staying anywhere alone. Always stay near another people.

name: Tatacoa wild camp
description: Easy access spot, flat with great views and lots of hiking

name: Good vegan almuerzo
description:
We asked the nice ladies if they could cook a 
 veggie-almuerzo for us. First they were a little irritated & didn‘t know what to cook without meat, but then they brought us a delicious  peas soup, a fresh mixed salad & plates filled with rice & yummy plantain chips. If you‘re craving for a rich & healthy colombia style almuerzo, go here!
Coming from south it is the first of the two restaurants next to each other.
We paid 8000 each.

name: Forbiden Campsite due to petrol extraction
description:
We took the wrong road to go for the Tatacoa desert (ruta 45) and ended up staying for the night somewhere along these little nice road with great view over the mountains. 
But at 11pm we ended up surrounded by armed men that asked us to go out slowly out he vehicle... Fortunately it was the army that was as scared as us, and ended up very friendly. BUT the place is dangerous because of gas/petrol extraction and used to be controlled by the guerilla. There is no signs that mention it. So do yourself a favour and don't stay overnight here. 
(we slept on a gas station after all...)

name: Small ground along the small road, 100 m away from noisy thermales
description: After a day in the thermales, we spent the night on these small field that is more peaceful than the parkings (the thermales can be opened until midnight with lot of music...)

name: Summit/POV close to Mirador Samaria
description:
After leaving the car at the Mirador Valle de Samara, I was quite disappointed by the view... So I went up the nearby summit, and had a stunning view over the valley. Can see probably up to 50/60 km around from there and at 360°. 
The walk is about 1h30 to get to the top, and need good condition.
Worth to be at the top for the sunset over the mountains and the palm trees!

name: Cycle Motors - Bike Boxes
description:
This shop, Cycle Motors, has boxes if you are flying with a bicycle. We got in touch with them through Facebook a few days in advance and made sure they had some, then we arranged when to collect them. They did have to go and get them for us from their stock room ~10km away (but they got them to us within the hour) and it cost 50,000 for the two boxes with some packaging. They were large 29” specialized boxes that hadn’t been flat packed so were super strong. Cycles Benotto also had boxes but said they would charge a “small value” for them (they didn’t say what) and they were already rolled up. As it was going to be ~35k for a taxi to there and back, 50k and we didn’t have to do anything seemed like a better deal. 
This road also has supermarkets to get smaller cardboard boxes from for free, ferreterías for tape and general stores for laundry bags to take the rest of your stuff on the plane in. Any more info send us a message from our website and we’ll be happy to help!

name: The mango tree hostel
description: laidback, basic, with kitchen, lockers, AC / fan dorm, double.. fan dorm is 25k.. in the patio you can park one or two motos..

name: Analizar - Laboratorio Clínico
description: Basic blood analysis lab.  You can walk in and order your own blood tests. No doctors orders needed.  Opens early (6am) closes at 5.   Fast, clean service. Reasonable prices. Bring passport or photo of it.

name: Quiet and beautiful night pull out
description: Only an emergency pull out because it became dark...but really ok as nobody passes in the night (two slow motos) We did not want to sleep/get roasted between 3 mobile technology towers (mentioned more south on iOverlander) and a generator vibrating in your stomache. There are more pull outs before and after this place.

name: Boquia l Tyre repair/change
description: Repairs and changes tyres...had fixed ours (for a camion) here. Good job, reasonable prices.

name: Calm wild tent camp on the trail next to farms
description: Great wild camp spot. When on the gravel road you will see a trail to your right “sendero de [something]”. Enter by the small opening and walk 100m up the hill. Once it flattens, the trail will fork. Take the small one on the right, along the fence. There will be spots for putting a tent. Not for cars though. Lots of birds around. Really peaceful.

name: El Nido with Camping
description:
A new hostel which is run by a young German couple who immediately made me feel at home. It is not completely finished but the facilities are good:
1. a dormitory with 7 beds(30000)
2. an area for camping( 25000)
3. smallish vans  can stay in the yard, big gate locked at night. Near the road but I wasn’t disturbed by traffic during the night(25000)
3. the kitchen can be used 
4. Washing  machine is available
Prices are slightly negotiable.
The place is amazing: 15 minutes up from Minca, or collective for 5000. they have their own ( free) entrance to Pozo Crystal, a natural swimming pool .A beautiful path leads down to it. 
Dinner can be served by Boris who is a professional cook. The price will depend on what is offered. Wishes can be expressed.
I really recommend the place although work is in progress.

name: Tejo @ Cafe Danubio
description: There’s a tejo pitch (national game of Columbia) downstairs from this cafe / bar. Just ask inside or head downstairs. It’s only 2000cop pp, per game. Whatever you drink is extra. There are rules written in English, so you can play without a guide. Great fun!

name: Taller Fasce
description:
this place was recommended to us for volkswagen treatment by the guys at mantallanta. 
eduardo, the boss of the place is a jewel!!! he found a problem we had been carrying around for almost a year now, severeal mechanics on the way tried to find the reason why our kombi had so little strength and real problems to get uphill. eduardo did and we are so happy!!!
we came by quite late in the day, actually just to change the diesel filter and he ended up spending his whole evening with us and finally solving the big trouble we had had with the kombi.
he and his guys are so friendly and patient extremely helpful.
100% recommended!!!

name: Robbers at parking lot
description:
Don’t park here. We parked here for 30min (on a bank holiday) while we had a coffee and came back to find our car damaged. Someone tried to enter and forced our front keyhole. 
While we came back to get our car a girl was discussing with the parking guy since they robbed her bag and money while she was parked here.

name: Petrobras
description: There is a parking lot for trucks. You can take a shower (cold)  but its ok. Potable water, we refill our tank (190 l). All is free. Ok for one night.

name: Pueblo Rico
description: Very quiet and flat  parking lot  in front of the church. There is the unique parking in Pueblo Rico. Free and very nice views. No facilities. Local people are friendly! Ok for one night!

name: Camping/Balneario Las Mercedes
description:
Campground at route 60, about 10 km from Reserva Rio Clara.
 Restroom and shower available, but very basic. Electricity also, but only with long extension. Restaurant serves local food for economic prices.
We stayed 3 nights in the parking lot for 5000 COP a night. 
When you lucky a family of little monkeys will pass through the trees, while you have dinner under them, like we had or while you take a cool refreshing bath in the crystal clear water of the adjoining creek Las Mercedes.

name: nice hot showers
description: hot showers for 5k for two filthy travelers.  after walking around town and getting rejected by all the other hotels/ posadas, we had the nicest shower in days.  hostel balcon de anita.

name: Botanic
description: Beautiful place minutes from La Piedra la Penol and Guatapé that is on the lake with a sweet jacuzi. Not for the budget traveler as you can find cheaper but the price is fair and the place is really nice. Parking for any size vehicle. The owner, Jordan, can be reached at jsyankow3699@gmail.com.

name: Hostal La Laguna
description: Rural Hostel with restaurant and campground

name: trailhead to awesome hike
description: this is were you can start an awesome hike it takes around 6 hours, you can start here and end in Villa de Leiva. or the other way around. I think it's better this direction because there is a really sketchy part to reach the waterfall, that it would be much harder hiking down.  the whole trail is marked on maps me. ps you have to cross the river before going up the sketchy part.  follow maps.me

name: 51 Sky Bar
description:
A Bar on the 51st floor!
highest building in Cartagena with an outdoor seating area! Absolutely recommend for everyone who likes to look down on people! jeje! 
I searched quite a bit and got rewarded with this! now I just need a parachute!

name: Parquedero 1A usados
description:
Large parking lot at Carrera 70, just in front of the Clinica Las Americas.
24/7 Guarded, very friendly and helpful staff. 
Very good bus connection to the nearest metro station.
Several supermarkets and restaurants on walking distance.

name: Rio claro wild camp
description: Small walking track used by locals to access the river. There is a tiny clearing to set up a tent. Good for bikes and motos. Close to the road but won’t be seen at night. There is a mine down the end of the road so large trucks pass by from 0645. Hopefully the birds will wake you up first.

name: Street Parking
description:
After being refused permission to park at Parque Consotà we drove around and found this quiet spot outside a gated community.
Security greeted us in the morning with a smile.

name: Swimming pool (+ reforestation project)
description:
Swimming pool behind the church
Nice public pool - other overlanders mentioned it in other wildcamp pins, but thought it deserves an extra pin, because we were actually looking for a pool to cool off. 5000 cop for adult, 3000 for kids. Also a jumping tower and an outdoor shower. Opens 8.30am and closes 6pm

name: Hostal Family
description:
It is new location of the Casa de David. It is simple family house, they have some rooms you can sleep in (2+1, 3x1). Bathroom shared, warm (not hot) water. We paid 25 000 pesos for matrimonial. Breakfast (bread, eggs, coffee) available for 3000 pp. You can also cook, they have kitchen but it's small and for the whole family to use. All generations are very friendly. 
Covered patio/kitchen fits max 4 big bikes, all other vehicles need to park on the street. But it seems (and they claim it is) really safe. Short walk to the main street. 
David +57 320 910 0350. He understands a little English.

name: Mirador del Lago
description:
Beautiful spot, very basic campground.
Bathrooms, cold showers, no electricity except on weekends.
25,000 COP pppn. Restaurant only when busy

name: Restaurant Rosita and Hotel
description: Restaurant on the side of the road with an Hotel. We park close to the rooms or cabins. There is an entry with a big red hotel sign painted on a white wall. The room are away from the road so it was not noisy. We paid COL5000 and had dinner at the restaurant. Rustic and basic. Menu was good and cheap. COL10.000 for the menu soup and juice included. Nice place.

name: Jalrey Insurance Office for SOAT / SURA
description:
i was looking to do the whole tip extension close to la candelaria so i came here. 
enter the building 1639, big sign saying seguros bolivar.
at the reception, tell them you are looking to buy a soat for you vehicle. after registering you they will send you to office number 1405 to the jalrey office.
i was helped by a very nice man, was offered coffee and got the password for the wifi while i was waiting. 
the 
soat only sold 1 year extensions, but via sura you can extend for as many months as you like, but only for as long as your tip is valid.
cost: about 60000 COP per month.
recommended.

name: Kite addict
description:
This is where the kite school ‘kite addict’ from Riohacha have there lesson done.
The team is very friendly and they told us to stay in their car park, it is a perfect spot on the beach with shadow.

name: Parqueadero en La Laguna
description:
Truck parking lot in the middle of the tiny town. Very quiet at night! Only 2 other trucks, not much movement at night. Slept like a baby. 

5000 cop. They have a restaurant and toilets, also there is free wifi close to the school. Nice stop, very cheap vegetables and cheese.

Gets cold at night!!

name: Notaria 36
description: Notary where you can make a poder. It took us 1hour (incl. Typing the document ourselves) , great service!

name: Petrobras
description: Good stop for one night. Very friendly staff. Shop 24 hours open. Clean bathrooms. Wifi.  Felt very safe. Free! Toilets are in the shop that closes at 830.

name: Beach Parking
description: Next to Edificio Costa Brava. Secure beach parking with lighting and video surveilance. Easy beach access, access roads aren't too poor. Local stop is open 07:00 to 22:00 and has everthing you need. Adjacent Cafetería has toilets. Pretty beach, few people at the weekend.

name: Hostel Casona Tulcan
description: Very nice place. Has small Appartment aside. With kitchen, Tv , good wifi. 20$ Garage for motorcycle only

name: Tostaky café restaurant
description: Good place to spend time in the barrio san Antonio, good fresh juices, good food, good music, good vibes! The place to be in Cali!

name: Donde El Profe
description: After you drop your bike off at technical bikes, stop here for lunch. Amazing smoked pork for lunch!

name: Police Checkpoint
description: They will ask about fore extinguisher and safety cones/triangles. I had mine and my paperwork was in order, so they let me go. My buddy drove through here a few days prior and had to pay a 150000 peso “fine” for not having an extinguisher.

name: Hostal Mama Tayrona
description: Fabián and her son (Danny) have recently aquired the land and built themselves this lovely hostel next to Quebrada Calabazo. We can't comment on the rooms as we parked up and slept in our van, for which they charged us $10.000 COP per night. One night we ate in the restaurant and for this Danny waived our camping fee. Showers and services in general are of a high standard. WiFi works fine but is limited to the restaurant area. A quick walk down to Río Piedra is definitely worth it. Natural swimming pool is refreshing. The local village has most things you need. No ATMs, as usual.

name: Taller Tabares mecánica gral y soldadura
description:
Excellent attention and honesty on the part of Mr. Jaime, who was very kind and predisposed to solve our problem.

Excelente atención y honestidad por parte del sr. Jaime, que fue muy amable y predispuesto a solucionar nuestro problema

name: Villa Lisseth
description: Nice rural hotel with few rooms, swimming pool and campsite.

name: Montallantas Willy
description: Had to repair a tire that I busted deep in the "llanos". This place is small but decently equiped with new air compressor and tire mounting machine.

name: La Mamona
description:
If you want to taste the real "llanera" style food, this is the place to be in Yopal. Great food with a nice atmosphere, if you get lucky you will catch live local music. Servings are abundant and prices low.

Parking is available on site.

name: Claro de luna
description: Camprgroud near river, with pool and restaurant, friendly owners, fireplace. 25ooo per person.

name: uveros 2
description: as the other indicated spot did not work for us, but we liked the village we found this spot. curious children are here, too. locals told us it is safe. be aware of the current in the ocean.

name: Plaza del pueblo Salto de Bordones
description: Square opposite the church. Very quiet and safe.

name: Pueblito Boyacense
description: Very nice antisan market, colorful place to walk, take pictures and buy local arts and crafts. Open on weekends.

name: Hostel Vista Hermosa
description: This is a nice family run hostel with rooms or a 5-bed dorm. It has a great kitchen, dining table, couch and comfortable beds. Wifi is decent and the shower is hot. It’s 20,000 for a bed in the dorm.

name: Cabo Playa Rancheria-Hotel
description: It's a very large property with a nice endless beach 16k South of Cabo de la Vela a few sleeping options from hammocks through dorms to private rooms. Flushing toilets and showers. The water are salty since they pump it from the ground so close to the sea. The manager was happy to accept us for camping 10000 COP pn. If you're driving a big rig you can enter from an opening in the north side of the fence. We parked at the north part of the property and could use the near by toilets. You'll have to bring with you drinking water since they don't always have it for sale. You can buy very fresh fish and Lobsters from the local indigenous fishermen a long the beach. This a a place to stay if you want tobe on your own when Cabo de la Vela is getting crowded for the weekend. We had a very good big fish with rice for 25k cop.

name: Las Vegas Campsite
description: there is a level pull out at a hairpin turn that has space for a couple of two person tents or one van/truck.

name: Puente El Buey
description: Large gravel pullout on the side of the road that you could park a camper on or tent

name: Calamar & currency exchange
description: Super market and currency exchange service.

name: Les Balcons Hostel, Popayan, Columbia.
description: Delightful, well kept hostel. very clean. Reception staff all bilingual and very helpful. Single rooms and dorms. From $25000 for 6 bed dorm up to $80000 for private deluxe. Simple breakfast included. Centrally located. hot showers. Fast internet. Cycles can be stored inside.  Strongly recommend.

name: Hotel Paraiso
description: Basic but very clean comfortable hotel with good sized rooms. (cold) showers. Right on the main street on Rt. going south. Motorcycles and cycles can be stored securely.

name: Camping Villa Verde
description: It's a very nice camping ground! You have a beautiful atmosphere here. Quiet, a pool, 2 kitchens (a open one outside, one inside), nice showers and toilets, the beach is just 3 min walk away, also 2 supermarkets and a vegan restaurant! The city centre is 25 minutes away with the bus, 15 min with a taxi. Highly recommended! It's also very cheap compared with the Hostels and hotels in the city!

name: Parqueadero
description:
Parqueadero, Hostal and Camping! Not a nice place,  but good location. safe and cheap! 
Basically a yard with a wall and a big metal gate! paid 15000 pesos for a day including power! toilets are new and seem ok! the habitaciones are new as well, more I can't say! Wifi does not work these days! water is in short supply so fill your tanks! bars and restaurants are around the corner and nice, but noisy till midnight!

name: M and R logistics
description:
This is where you go to STaRT the process to get your vehicle back.   Start early like the day after you get to colombia.  Process takes a long time with lots of forms.     This is Caesar if you ship with WWL.    Be aware.   It takes at least 1 day to get paperwork initiated before you can even think of getting your vehicle from the port.   So as soon as you get to Cartagena, start the process and be prepared to wait 

Add on to original post: we fired Cesar after two days as he was absolutely no help at all. We went with in Enlace Caribe and they took such great care of us that we didn’t have to worry for the rest of our import process. If you use WWL, do not use Cesar or for that matter just don’t use them at all

name: ATM
description: Currency exchange 2900. of course to Colombian currency or other.

name: café tour finca los naranjos
description:
Super tour for learn  all on cafe with don Diego and his family. hightly recommanted .
contact Caroline the daugther Whatsapp +573125185076.

super tour pour découvrir le café. très intéressant. vue superbe sur le village. contacter sa fille sur Whatsapp avant de venir.

name: to print TODO QUE QUIERES
description:
gallery of shops with at least 20 different shops for cards, postales, stickers etc
muuuy barato. 31.000 x 100 postales good quality. entrance from the bar in picture.

name: parking Hotel El Gordo
description: super safe and friendly place. this I ps a parking lot near the hotel, the staff is really friendly. we played 10.000 for one night for our (real) big rig. the city is beautifull and also the beach, not touristic at all can be lovely. we drove the road from turbo to here and is super nice and in good conditions.

name: Camper designer
description:
If you want to make some changes to your camper fittings, or add items such as an awning,Gustavo can help you. He works with wood and with iron. He is a specialist in campers. Space for big rigs.

3104454828 is his phone



Gustavo hace los arreglos que necesites para el vehículo, diseña y arma los muebles, hace portaequipajes, toldos, instala paneles solares etc. Trabaja con maderas, con hierro, hace soldaduras... Es especialista en campers y tiene lugar para vehículos grandes.

name: NO WILDCAMPING in San Andrés
description: NO WILDCAMPING HERE!! It's super dangerous. Friends get robbed and a girl nearly raped!!! Don't stay here trough the night. Take care, and ask the locals about what is possible and what is dangerous.

name: Finca San Rafael Minca
description: Traditional coffe & cacao farm outside Minca (15 min. By car on private road) very quiet pure nature good road only 4 rooms with private bathroom natural water swimming pool lot of birds.

name: Fibreglass Repair Shop
description:
we had some damage of the floor of our shower cabin. 
we asked here and they repaired it immediately (friday 5pm) for 50.000cop. 
we asked the boss: they can help with any damage with glass fiber (german = gfk/ spanish = fibra de vidrio). tel 300 627 07 36. 
we were allowed to park in front of the repair shop overnight.

name: Coffee Tour - La Arzacia
description: Excellent coffee tour 100 percent organic.  ask for nassir. great guide. you can take a Willys jeep from and to Salento 10k pp for the tour. 3k for the jeep ride.  great option

name: pablo escobar‘s tomb
description: you can drive into this cementry/cementerio. there is a big parking with enough space on sunday afternoon. just ask here (chapell) where the toomb is- just round the corner. we walked here from the little parc in sabaneta/parque sabaneta (don‘t miss the church there with „maria auxiliadora“).

name: San Luis to El Choco
description: From San Luis to El Choco is a rocky and steep unpaved road, you will need 4x4 or a motorcycle to come this way. This is not the regular route to Guatape if Google or a GPS suggests it. 20kms of hard rocky road in bad condition.

name: piscina 2000$
description:
I'm bicycle traveler. I just stopped here because I can jump into the pool! just 2000$ it's really cheap! and I asked to put a tent. they accepted!! they are really friend, kind, and awesome also, they're doing a restaurant and shop ( I didn't see it... just they said)
I paid 15000$, they gave me big amount plate with fish. it is really nice ( you can negotiate food what you want)  I really recommend this place for cyclist

name: Nueva Posada Alemana Campground.
description:
I'm touring a bicycle. This place is a merger between restaurant and hotel ( looks like expensive)
I asked to put tent, and then they told me 35000$ first. but I negotiated...10000$
It has big and beautiful grass. And it has washroom and shower (they said hot, but I didn't use), also  Wi-Fi ! it's good deal. I cycled around here...almost nothing! I couldn't find any place to put a tent...if you are like my situation, I recommend that stay to ask a tent. bye bye.

name: playa Blanca Cispatá
description: very good place, super quiet and safe. 15 meters from the beach. there is to stock up on food and beverages

name: Small and quiet park
description: Small and quiet park. We were here 5 nights. Seems pretty safe. Nice and friendly neighbours. They didnt complain about us staying there. 20 min walk to centro historico. Close to minimarkets, bike shops, vegetables and fruits shops... Good location.

name: Electrico Montoya
description: Helped me fix an ongoing electric issue. was able to sleep in my van outside the shop. nice people and a safe place.

name: How To: Access Parque Nacional Natural Los Nevados
description:
You have several options to reach Potosí, the gateway to the Parque Nacional Natural Los Nevados from Manizales. 

The obvious ones - 
- book a guided tour with one of the several tourist agencies in town (e. g. Ecosistemas), 
- go on your own and contract a 4x4 for up to eight people (COP 350,000) or for up to three people (COP 280,000) with one of the several transport agencies in town (e. g. Destinos & Rutas), 
- drive to Potosí with your own 4x4, bicycle or motorcycle. It's a very scenic three to four hours drive, but due to the road conditions high clearance is strongly advised. 

The not so obvious one - 
Get in touch with Señor Serafín, a friendly "lechero" driving from the Cruzero Villamaría (leaving at 4.30am) to El Bosque (a 45 minutes walk from Potosí) several times a week in order to collect milk from the various fincas along the way. 
I believe Serafín could fit up to two people in his truck and charges COP 20,000 per person. The very scenic drive takes approximately three to four hours, depending on the road conditions.
As he not only takes tourists with him, but occasionally also people living in the fincas, it's advised to reserve a seat in his truck with a few days anticipation. Serafín only speaks Spanish. 
Phone/WhatsApp: +57 310 8367873

At Potosí you will need to pay the entrance fee to the national park (COP 37,500 for foreigners). From here you can hike to the Laguna del Otún in the Valle del Cóndor where you will find a ranger station to camp and stay at for the night. You could also do a round trip to the lagoon and spend the night camping or in the cabañas in Potosí and try to arrange a transport back to Manizales from there. 
The ambitious should look into the very extensive, yet a bit confusing trail system of the Parque Los Nevados and consider crossing the national park on a (depending on your route) four to five day long trek. MAPS.ME seems to have all of the official and various unofficial trails listed. 
As always, it's advised to go in dry season, but it's not impossible to do the treks in the rainy months neither. Happy trails!

name: R&M Motos Yamaha
description:
My Tenere could not have asked for better attention! They are young but very knowledgeable and enthusiastic.
Changed chain kit, brake fluids and he also checked my rear rim axis and warned me about a potential problem I might face with it in the future.
Miguel the mechanic went even above and beyond, when I told him that someone stole my fishnet for the luggage the day I was leaving, he went and bought me a new one!

all the staff are very kind, friendly and communicative. The prices also are very good!

I'd totally recommend this place to anyone that needs a good care of their bike. Gracias Miguel y todos!

p.s if you come tell him that the "greek Vasilis" has recommended you. we are friends now.

name: El hornada de Aldita
description: A small restaurant inside of a market. There are 2 different chicharron (fried pig) places.  They have the entire pig on display and dig inside to fill your plate. The portion price depends on the size your want. I got one for 8000. It came with potato and corn. Very tasty

name: Taller BM
description: Small mechanic shop. These men can basically fix anything, and will do it for a fair price. I went here various times for things such as brakes and suspension, but they also do engine work and other things. Please be aware that there is a height restriction. I got in with my Mitsubishi Montero, so vehicles in that range (think RAV4, LC, etc.) will be able to get in but anything higher will not.

name: Balneario La Vega
description:
Only 3 minutes from Carolina's central park, but really quiet and dark at night. During the day the restaurant does play music constantly, but not too loud. 
They charge COP $10.000 for camping in a tent, but we could stay at the parking lot for half the price and still use the facilities. Some people swim at the river, but I heard water is not so clean.

name: ice cream: amor-acuyá
description:
ice cream: pver 20 delicious flavours. 
4.500cop for one flavour
6.600 two flavours
12.500 three flavours
21.500 one liter (you can get different flavours).
they won prices for their icecream. 1st place in 2016 all over america, 3rd place 2017 all over the world! 
it is definately worth coming, but not recomended with your rig.

name: Tres Trigos Bakery
description:
here you get bread with sourdough, centeno, multigrano....
just great taste. but do not try to park your rig here during noon. next to the icecream parlor.

name: Parque central de San Clemente
description:
Quiet, safe and level spot in central square of San Clemente. Free wifi (it works). At the church entrance and in front of police station. Would be a good idea to present yourselves to te police.
---
Lugar silencioso, seguro y nivelado en el Parque central de San Clemente. Wifi gratis (funciona). Delante de la puerta de la iglesia y enfrente de la estación de policía. Es conveniente presentarse ante la policía.

name: Coffee Tour Finca Buenos Aires
description:
Great coffee tour at a traditional farm.  They just started offering coffee tours and they are doing a great job!
The tour is interactive, you plant, harvest and process the beans. It's a nice and informative walk through the plantation. They serve a snack and a drink and at the end you get a fresh brewed coffee. 
The easiest way to get there is to take one of the jeeps at the plaza. (The road leading to the farm is very narrow and steep and there is not a lot of space to park) The tour is 2 hours, with the drive there and back it will take about 3 hours. The price for the tour is 20000 COP ppn plus the transport (4000 COP ppn one way).
The tour is in English or Spanish.
Our guide David speaks very good English.

name: Street Parking by River
description: We parked on the road right next to the small bridge on Calle 29. Super tranquilo but with enough passers by to reassure you that you're not alone. Right under the street light and on the edge of the historic centre. Plenty of people were curious about our van and our journey and were able to offer plenty of advice on places to visit. Numerous offers too to use their showers, toilets etc.

name: Street parking in Medellin
description: A good place coming from the south at the beginning of Medellin. In a parallel street, a little bit noisy, but safe according to the guy at the fuel station nearby. Well lit in the night. We came from the south and were happy to find this spot without having to drive into the city in the late afternoon. Had a calm night. No facilities.

name: Sibundoy Plaza
description:
We stayed one night on the main place of the town after crossing the Trempolin de la muerte. Police told us that it’s a quiet village.
It was quiet and safe, good for one night.

name: Chunuu hostal & Glamping
description:
Everything to make your stay great and relaxing. also run by a kind Colombian family.

Parking, (very) hot water, breakfast included, crazily clean (like it opened yesterday), Jacuzzi, pool table, tree-house with hummingbirds are some features.

I paid 40k for a dorm. They also have tents and cabanas.

Also there is a natural pool that you can dive in. Being empty works well in relaxation but this place for me was a gem!

name: Desierto de Tatacoita
description: Little canyon with fun walk, similar to Canyonlands. Cop 10,000 pp. no sign at the entrance just « Finga tras el alto », owner will be onsite or will come to open the gate.

name: Velodrome Parking
description:
This place is really nice and quiet.
You Can stay parked for a long Time. 

There is no facility at all, you will be close to the River and 5 to 7 minutes to 2 subways station.

You have shadow under trees so you won't suffer from heat! Enjoy your stay.

name: Metro Frenos Medellin - Brakes service for all cars
description: We were looking for new brake pads for our Fiat based rv and we found Metro Frenos by a recommendation from the Fiat / Iveco shop in town. They took out the old ones to look up the part numbers (a pain with Fiat) and they found the right ones in stock! We just bought them to keep them for the future for a reasonable price comparable to Germany. While we were there we saw some awesome cars which got serviced. AMG 63, Porsche, others. So they have a good name as it seems. Very big garage, every big rig will fit in. Very friendly service and absolutely competent. If you need some service or brakes fixed have a look.

name: Parking Réplica antiguo Peñol
description:
Only a parking. No facilities, but quiet, safe, flat and with nice panorama. Perfect for one night. Free
Solamente un parking. Sin servicios, pero silencioso, seguro y plano y con bonitas vistas. Perfecto para una noche.  Gratis

name: Ford Service-Col
description:
Came to this shop as we were refferenced by other posts. Diego, the top mechanic helped us repair our fuel pump (which needed replacement) and our leaking refrigerant comparment.
Even though they specialize in Ford they do any sort of vehicles (ours was a Ram 2500)
Diego’s number 312 410 7853

name: Cascada La Chorrera
description:
Highest waterfall in Colombia. 
Here is the parking to start the hike, it’s worthwhile ! 
15000cop pp the entrance + 5000cop for the parking.

name: Paramo de Oceta
description:
We went on a trek along the Paramo de Ocetta. 
It's a 6 to 8 hours long walk in weird scenery. Absolutely worth it. 
One major problem though, the upper top of the Paramo is currently guarded by an old man that won't let anybody pass, even with a guide.
