That means that the Ciudad Perdida, and the view over the Lago Negro isn't possible currently. But the situation is really new (end of 2018) and might evolve quickly.

We do not normally use a guide, but it's now an obligation. We didn't regret it, as our was really nice, taught us many things, and made us pass by caves and weird shaped rocks that you can't see from the track. Orlando is not an official guide but a friend of the owner of our Camping. Local, intelligent, funny and passionated! Please call him! +57 3103102968 We were 3 persons and it was 30k COP pp. (with a medical insurance included) probably the cheapest deal in town.

name: Street Parking
description: A good place in the street, behind the center.

name: in Front off the church
description: a good place in the center of Silvia, in the park central

name: In front of the « Parque de la vida » entrance
description: We parked on the right side of the street in front of the park entrance (you will see other cars parked there as well). Very safe, free and quite. The park is beautiful by the way. ok to spend a night.

name: Restaurante el mono
description: Place next to the river for lunch. Had a nice fried fish. You can get catfish and other fish. Was good and seemed like a normal local place to eat.

name: Hotel Aratoca
description: Hotel ("cabañas"=kind of small flat with 2 rooms, a kitchen and a bathroom) close to the main road. 30 000 COP per person. Green place (less noisy than to stay in the hotel next to the petrol station).

name: SUPERGAS
description: We were able to refill our two Canadian bottles. The staff is very friendly. The total price Was 58200 COP.

name: Punta del Cielo
description: Nice up-market coffee place. Good WiFi & charging points. Very friendly & close to the ioverlander spot. 2000peso for a coffee but it’s good and comes with a mini taster biscuit.

name: el carmen de viboral/ next to the river
description: el carmen de viboral is a pottery town- worth a visit. as a rock concert took place at the central plaza it took us a while to find a secure and quiet overnight place. here it is. but please talk to the people living here, they are very nice. the houses exist about 5 years- it is a good living area: peaceful and quiet and as not many of the parking spots are occupied there is space for us. no facilities.

name: ceramic factory
description: in this town in this street are many different ceramic factorys. here you can get a tour through the whole production process from 10am-2pm. its free and very informative.

name: Hotel Gran Via Mutata
description: Clean, newly built hotel 2 blocks off of the main road. Paid 30k pesos for a single room- for 40k pesos you can have one with air conditioning. Great Wi-Fi, really really clean, fluffy towels & they let me store my bike in the interior coridoor. No hot water in the showers- not a problem with 35C temps. There are probably 6 or 7 other hotels in town to choose from- most are on the main road.

name: Hotel Retiro Cabanas y Camping
description: Amazing spot! They offer hotel accomodation (maybe 10 rooms total), a few cabins, and camping. The grounds are beautifully manicured facing the ocean with beach access. They also have a nice pool, covered space for cooking, Wi-Fi (inside the hotel building). I checked 4 or 5 other hostel places in town and this one was clearly the best. It's a bit of a walk into town, 15mins or so, but there's a little kiosko across the street with basics, i.e. beer and chips. Staff, including 2 talking parrots, were super friendly & let me store my bike in the laundry room and let me use their kitchen. Not sure on camping price but rooms range from 40k-60k COP some with AC. They told me it's usually busy on the weekends- I was the only one here for the two nights I stayed midweek. Go to the mud volcano while you're in town!

name: Hotel Kalidad
description: Good option if are you traveling on motorcycle and need sleep, clean room, private bathroom, very safe parking for max 3 motorcycles. But on bad neighborhood. Just for sleep. Payed 20k pesos.

name: Carni Pan
description: The assistant at the bakery/ restaurant is one of the rudest I have encountered. Avoid.

name: JF Ford Automotriz
description:
We have been in this place that was recommended by Diego (Colgas). 
John checked our ford e-350 2004 with its diagnostic computer and helped us to fix a couple of small things after the van was making weird noises.
They also change tyres, do electronics, electric, transmissions, engines, suspensions, etc they are used to both automatic and manual vehicles. 
they like travelers :)
normal price for diagnostic is 120.000 pesos but in the end they didn't charge us for anything :)
contacts in pictures
Whatsapp 316 622 5892, 316 405 0526
Phone 832 3226

name: Noches de Saturno
description:
This location also offers private rooms as well as tents and hammocks, space to set up your own tent as well. 70,000 for a private room. Pool is 5000 extra for those using campsites and hammocks. Kitchen and restaurant on site. No WiFi, you can only use charging ports from 11am to 2pm, 7pm-9pm. Fan in room
Only from 6pm-7am. Bathroom in the private rooms is basically part of the room, not closed off at all.

name: Public space
description: We sleep one night here with our big rig, free because it's a public park. No facilities but quiet at night.

name: Isla de Las Palmas Hotel y Restaurant
description: Standard restaurant hotel combo with the bonus of a pool. I paid 25k cop as a single person. All the rooms have air conditioning. Room was very clean and big enough to squeeze my bicycle into. Parking is secure. Seems like a big family oriented place because they have so many pools and were blasting music in the afternoon. Quiet in the evenings. No Wi-Fi :(

name: Natural whirlpool near La Fuente
description:
Here is a natural whirlpool with lots of bubbles. free. refreshing cold water in the heat. leave the car in the village!
Walk on the left side of the cemetery. pass through private ground. follow the dirt track down, then turn left on a small path right at another gate. this track leads you down to the hanging bridge. cross it and merge to the
 right upstream. You will find a kind of open space, where you have access to the water. It is also possible to camp here. enjoy it!
 Walking time about 15 min from the central plaza. Further 15-20 min is another pool like that (someone told us).

name: Galán plaza
description: We came from Giron to Zapatoca. this road is partly asfalted. from there it is only a firm dirt road. with our sprinter camper van 15km/h: great views! do a stop in La Fuente (we made an entry to the natural whirlpool). then you come to galán, which is bigger than la fuente. all villages/towns are enchanting. here police told us that we can park overnight at the side to the church (from top of the churchtower we had a brilliant view). its a safe countryside here. water at the plaza. baños at municipio. free wifi.

name: Guane: mirador
description: In guane you can find many spots to stay overnight. here we had a lovely view and our sprinter camper van was level. very quiet place, no infrastructur. museum closed on wednesday.

name: Awalayuu Kite School
description:
Difficult to describe how awesome these guys are! After staying in another hostal in the area I came here and they were so welcoming! 

They let me pitch my tent in their school. as a return I booked some more surfing lessons. and I learned from the best. literally. Beto and Nelson, the two waayou brothers that run the school, are currently the champions in free style kite surfing. having first place in many international competitions. So this is the place if you want to give this sport a go.

They allowed me to use all the facilities and helped me for everything i needed e.g found cheap gas for me, found some tools I needed for my bike. I really can't be more grateful to them.

there are other people here volunteering and this way they can sleep for free too e.g English classes to the local children or yoga lessons. any skill would be appreciated here!

Cabo de la Vela has a huge problem with running water but these guys make sure there is always sweet water for the basic needs. you can use their kitchen and hammocks too.

especially Beto, he would love to see more motorcyclists here! just come here and say hi and see if you can work something out. they will Welcome you as friends.

name: Meridian Navigation
description:
Admin Note: Information supplied by Vendor

We are a Shipping Agency with really good seafreight tariff from Cartagena to Panama, Mexico, USA and Europe in Ro-Ro vessels.
We offer services to all tourists with families and motorhomes.

name: El Patio
description: Really nice little hostel in a sea of hostels. We stayed in a double for 50 with towels, a fan and a comfy double bed plus plenty of hanging space etc. Lovely couple running it. Nice kitchen, hot shower in a proper bathroom, free coffee all day. Has an indoor courtyard that could take bikes.

name: Gas station
description:
Big parking place for trucks near gas station, 
I ask to overnight here, people was friendly Toilet and shower for free, 
Quite during the night, movement of trucks starts on the morning, safe

name: Parador Mandiva
description: A roadside restaurant with clean swimming pool and clean(ish) toilets/shower. They lock the gates at night so a good option for rigs of all sizes if the service stations nearby are very busy. Food was cheap and good. They have grassy area for tents and cabañas available as well. No height restrictions on entrance gate.

name: paper fabric: fundación san lorenzo
description:
here they produce paper from different plants. 8.00-1.00 and 3.00-6.00 every day 
a tour is 4.000cop pp. you learn a lot. there is a shop to sell paper products aswell.

name: Street Parking - Football Pitch
description: As it says, quiet street parking on a small residential development on the outskirts of the beautiful village of Monguí. Next to the yet unfinished football stadium. We'd spent the previous night in the main square of the village (too noisy) and the local constabulary (although happy for us to be there) suggested this place may be better. We parked on a spot outside some cottages, next to a grass verge with a small hard standing, in front of the stadium. About 100m from a bar that opens at 08:00am and has basic bathroom facilities. Made a load of friends in the bar and enjoyed watching Colombia wipe the floor with Argentina (2-0) in the Copa América. Good mobile data coverage.

name: taller mecánico jair
description: Mechanic workshop specially for electric issues.

name: clean xpress
description: Wonderful self service laundromat, 40 min washer, 40 minutes dryer. 12.000 each. Clean, good products lots of machines, they give you everything you need. The machines are big, I washed 10 lbs of clothes and there were still room left

name: Parqueadero big rigs
description: Cheap parking, 5K the night, 4K the day. Big rigs allowed. Owner really nice and good security

name: Remote Terpel Gas Station
description: Flat, quiet, no facilities that we’re aware of but a nice place to break up hwy 62 on the way to Medellin.

name: Bababuy Hostel
description: Great accommodation if you need to be close to the airport as it's only about 2km to walk to the terminal from here. Brand new hostel, modern furnishings all throughout, a nice vibe and common area. We paid 65,000 pesos for the 2 of us in a private room with breakfast included. 60,000 without breakfast. There's dorms here too, I think they were 35,000 pesos.

name: Monserrate Funicular & Teleferico
description:
Departure of Telerifoco and Funicular to Monserrate. 
Both are same price. It’s cheaper on Sunday $6 500 per person on Sunday. 
Otherwise you can walk up to the top for free. The trail is 50 meters from there. 
Amazing view on Bogota

name: Rogitama Biodiversidad
description:
This is a private nature reserve that you can visit and stay at in double rooms with private bathroom.
Roberto has bought this land in 1982 and has made a huge effort of restoration and reforestation. The result is incredible, large diversity of plants and of birds. a lot of hummingbirds to see, very closely as they come and feed from nectar feeders at the house. Several endemic birds. if you are into nature and birdwatching, this is an amazing place to be, or even if you just need some quiet and tranquility.
It's well indicated from the main road but note that the driveway to the reserve can be rough and muddy. No space for big rigs, but smaller vehicles could get there, I think, I was on a motorcycle so it's easy enough despite a deep puddle to go through. Parking is small though.
Beware that there is no WiFi and reception is patchy at best (with Claro), so you will be largely disconnected here. which is a good thing!
Highly recommend this place. Roberto and his wife Ginette are very friendly and kind.

Access to reserve is 20,000 COP, visit with a guide 60,000 COP. 
Double room with private bathroom 35,000 COP
Breakfast 10,000 COP
I guess the kitchen can be used for cooking but they cooked for me, 2 lunches and 2 diners for 36,000 COP in total

The money they get from visitors and tourists go towards conservation efforts as they don't get much in public funding and grants. 

I'd also recommend hiking along the main track that goes up the mountain and back down the other side, superb views!

name: Peregrinos hostal
description: Clean and decent place , we paid 130000 pesos =40 dollars for a room with 4 beds and private bathroom price include breakfast we are 2 dults and two kids.

name: Bike shop
description: Small bike shop with bike spare parts. I don’t know how they work

name: Hotel (Colonial) San Felipe
description: Really nice, comfortable and economical hotel in Giron.  I've stayed twice. Giron gets seriously bad traffic along the tiny one way streets but this place is on a quiet cobbled street.   Place inside for a couple of motorbikes but only one under cover.  Street parking is difficult.

name: Cristales hotel
description: Nice off the map hotel next to the cristales hotel. We payed 60,000 for a room. He let us park our motorcycles in the hotel cristales right next door. There plenty of parking places near by for vehicle. WiFi was fast, place is secure, dude is nice.

name: Agua potable
description: C3.000 for cleaning and filling our 20litre water tank, in supermarket its C11.000

name: Hotel Rivera
description: Hotel right along the river close to the bridge. We pay 50,000 for a room 2 people one bed. There’s WiFi but didn’t reach our room, it’s fast as long as your within reach. There a pool, room has a/c. Warm ish shower. They are painting and cleaning up the place, maybe new owners? Parking for both our bikes inside gated entrance, room for maybe a small car.

name: Casa en el Agua
description: Probably the most idyllic party hostel you will ever go to! It’s packed with backpackers everyday, you need to book weeks in advance. Basically a wooden house on stilts in the middle of the ocean near the San Bernardos islands. You can get a private room, dorm or hammock - it’s pretty pricey though, we paid $25 per night for a hammock. Jump right off the hostel decking into the bright blue ocean. They run tours like snorkelling and night time tours to see the bioluminescence (best I’ve ever seen!). Lunch and dinner is freshly caught seafood - the fisherman sails up to the hostel every morning with his catches! Very much a party hostel vibe at night, don’t come here expecting to get an early night! You can get a 2h boat from Cartagena for 100k per person, but we drove to Rincon del Mar and joined on a snorkel tour for 50k each which dropped us at the hostel.

name: Dos Aguas Lodge
description: Super nice eco-lodge run by a really lovely Italian/Colombian couple. Right on the beach with the rooms looking into a nice garden and views to the mangroves out the back. Everything is so nicely done - loved the dorms and the bathrooms. Great WiFi, really chilled location (Rincon is not super touristy just yet!), heard there was good diving nearby. The hostel helped us arrange a boat to Casa en el Agua. They kindly let our dog stay but their cat hates dogs so I’m not sure they would always allow it. Great food too, one meal on offer which changes every day. Maybe it’s because they’re Italian but the best pizza I’ve had in such a long time! Highly recommend coming to a Rincon just for a few days relaxing here!

name: Laboratorio Angel - lab for walk-in bloodwork
description: This is a chain of labs in Colombia where you don't need insurance and can just walk-in.  A previous doctor's order is not required.  You just need to tell them which blood tests you want.  It was really easy here and we had most of the results back within a few hours!  They will send them via email as well.

name: Yokomotor - Toyota Oficial
description: Really friendly Toyota experts. They did an overall check on my car for free and answered a few questions I had. Really professional team

name: Tyre repair - Llanteria
description: a simple but very attentive llanteria. family run. I had another flat tyre 3 days ago so they checked my tyre very surgically and found the cause.

name: Interfrenos
description: A very professional specialist for brakes. He charged a fair price for excellent work.

name: Playaca Beach Club
description: Dream spot on a quiet private beach away from Taganga loud night life. There are no facilities but the place is beautiful and this is the only place around where large rigs would fit. Restaurant open during national vacations and week-ends. Francisco the owner is super welcoming and friendly. On low season, I paid 10k COP for 1 pers in a 25' rig. The family of four who stayed one night in a 23' rig paid 15k. You can set the price with Francisco ahead of coming (+573116940936). Highly recommended.

name: Sunlight Lavandería
description: Service of washing, drying, folding your clothes. 9 kg for 28.000. Takes up to 12 hours to be ready.

name: Villa Holandesa
description: Enjoy your own private waterfall at this cozy spot in Villa María on the Volcano Galeras. The restaurant is open only for weekends, and the owner Jean Paul is caring and nice. 20.000 per vehicle or tent. You have access to water, kitchen (weekdays) and bathrooms. There's a store around the corner and lots if hiking and rock climbing opportunities in the area. We ended up staying six nights here, thanks to a very fríendly climbing community. Highly recommend!!  Call owner beforehand as he is sometimes in Pasto : 316.698.1964.

name: sajaal- villa de los caballeros
description:
here is a parqueadero.
it's a secure and guarded car park. there is some places for motorhome.
8000clp for the night.
very next to the pueblito.
very friendly and helpful owner
the only negative thing : the noise !!

name: 20k Outside Cartagena Thiefs
description: I was stopped (while on my bicycle) by two guys on a motorcycle with a machete and they stole my phone. I didn't get the feeling they hang out waiting for this kind of thing, but have heard of other cyclists having similar problems in this general area. Be Careful! Travel in groups!

name: Gasolinera Chinulito
description: Arrived at 8pm and asked if I can spent the night. Gas station closes at 9pm but still no problem - parked close to the house! Felt very save and quiet!

name: swimming pool/ piscina de chima
description:
we stayed here for free for 4 nights. entrance to the pool 1.500cop pp/day. 
the water in the pool is from the nearby river and not clear. water temperature 23-24 degrees Celsius. every Thursday they empty the pool and clean it completely. 4g claro reception, no wifi, clean toilets, no shower. there are 3 different more or less level spaces to park your camper. 
the road from socorro to simacota is paved. after the 1 st bridge behind simacota its a dust road and gets very bumpy. we managed without difficulties with our 2x4 sprinter camper van but no more than 8km/h.
chima is 4km further away.
beautiful landscapes. great views.

name: Porto Vento Hotel
description: A new place In Necocli town, small but well served by kind people. Safe parking, it have a big entry (not to bigger trucks) don’t have access to the beach but has a small pool, air conditioned rooms and independent toilets and shower. The distance to town noise is good to avoid noise and rest well. Average prices: ~$25 usd

name: Cabanas Guacari
description: Small cabana house with several rooms. Super cute and new. Cool wood designs. We paid 50,000 cop for a room with a bed. Has WiFi and pretty fast and hot/warm showers. Possible to camp if not rainy season for 10,000 per person.

name: Overnight with amazing view
description:
Take the road to Puracé (there is bad section on the 24 just after exiting the 20, but after that the road is paved until Puracé). Once you get to Puracé, you must drive another 10km on a dirt road (no 4x4 needed) , until you reach the big sign announcing the start of the park. (If you check maps.me it is called El cruce de la mina). Then turn right and keep going until you reach the gps point. There is a pull out on the side of the road with almost flat ground and space for a big rig. Stunning view of the sky, mountains, fields and of Popayan, super quiet.

To note: 
The PNN Puracé is open to public, however if you look on Colombian government website you will see it as closed. this is because the park is no longer managed by the gov't , but management has been handed over to the indigenous in the area. Hikers are surely allowed in the park, however for some of the longer hikes (ie- volcan Puracé) they will require you to take a local guide (35000). We were able to do a smaller loop without a guide, however we asked permission from the administrator at the entrance first. 
Cost of entrance (foreigners) = 40000 during week & 50000 on weekends (including holidays). 

Despite all of this, the people of Puracé are incredibly welcoming and kind, and enjoy having people coming to their park. it is well worth a visit- stunning paramo, waterfalls, sulfur mines, hot springs, and if you are lucky you might see the Andean Condor! :)

name: Jugo de uva
description: You have to try this delicious home made grapes juice, people is very nice and you can share some stories.

name: Esso gas station
description:
You can park at the far end of the road. The staff told us that there were cameras and that it was safe. On the other hand he told us after that it paid off. He was kindly told that we had refueled here, so he did not ask us anything. Amazingly very quiet at night

On peut se garer au fond loin de la route. Le staff nous a dit qu'il y avait des caméras et que c'était safe . Par contre il nous a dit après que c'était payant. On lui a dit gentiment qu'on avait fait le plein d'essence ici , du coup il ne nous a rien demandé. Étonnamment très calme la nuit

name: Hotel Casa Bonita
description:
Very nice place, parking for big campers, WiFi regulars speed, security cameras, tv, ac, clean rooms, good for one night.

40.000 Cop for 2 persons in a room.

Recommended.

name: Parking lot close to Termales
description: Flat and big parking lot. 12.000col per vehicle. Water available. Locals drink it. We stayed here 2 nights. Felt safe. Good for big rigs and cheaper than Tierra Viva. The caretaker lives in the house above the parking lot.

name: contratación : next to sportsarea
description:
in case you are interested in leprosy (hansen’s desease) and the history of this disease you should come to this village. if you don‘t feel comfortable shaking hands or cuddling with people with this illness we do not recommend to visit the sanatorio. 
the local police accompanied us here to this place to stay overnight. safe, no infrastructure. nice, very clean hotels and good restaurants are available, too.

name: Free Haircut
description: It’s a haircut academy and they’ll do it for free. It was pretty full now but I talked to some people here and they trust them

name: Hotel Beyonda
description:
At the foothills of the Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta you and your wheels will be welcomed by four motorbike enthusiast owner operators, speaking Spanish, English and French.

You can ride right in, park under cover, hose down the bike (and then you in a hot shower) hang up your boots and rest your helmet on specially made hooks. Eat hearty food, stretch your body in the 22metre swimming pool, swap stories and route plan in the evening. The four owners have done extensive biking around Colombia and down to Bolivia over the last 7 years so are more than willing to share their highlights and tips.

With these tips you can spend days with minimal gear exploring the mountains around you or head down to the beach. Or even leave the bikes for a day and head out on foot...or boat!

Working together with Dirt Roads Colombia and Adrenaline Addicts you can have access to even more tips and some of the best mechanics in Colombia.

With spacious rooms, naturally ventilated you can rest without triping over your gear! Even have laundry done while getting a massage, and repack like you wanted to heading on your way 100% rejuvenated!

name: Casa Jardín
description:
Double rooms available in this family house with several shared bathrooms (no one was in the second room so had the bathroom for myself). Fans and towels included, it was hot but not uncomfortably so. I paid 35,000 COP per night.
There is secure parking in their garage, I could park my moto there, possibly space for a (large) car, to check with owners, but limited height so not for vans or big rig. could potentially park on the street, area is safe. Can use the kitchen. Tap water is potable and they have a filter if you prefer (drank water from the tap with no problem). Very safe area, restaurants and shops within walking distance as well as several parks.
Maribel and her family are very nice, friendly and helpful, I felt very comfortable and at home with them, despite my poor Spanish! they also have 2 lovely cats, including a very cuddly one. Highly recommend them if you need a stopover in Bucaramanga.
Address is 46-61 #38A, ring through the gate.
Maribel's WhatsApp is +57 317 3651646

name: Parking 24h
description: Paid monitored parking negotiated at 15000 pesos or 10000 if you go on the previous parking. For 24h.

name: Juan Carlos Home
description: Juan Carlos works in the “Extremo” shop, super friendly offered me to stay overnight in his place, just over the extremo shop. You can sleep  in your car and he will offer you a priceless shower. He knows a lot about local climbing and he can give you good advice and planning local trips to the local areas. He has a climbing wall in his wall!!!!

name: Puerto Araujo Texaco
description: Overnight stop under trees, with electricity 110v, banos (basic) and water for free...nice people, 24/24h with cameras so should be secure. No more no less, when you need to stop before night after a bad day....

name: Hostel Bidea
description: You can wash and dry your clothes up to 17 kg, per $10.000 to wash and $10.000 to dry. Very nice people. You can also get a hot shower per $ 5.000.

name: Robbery in guarded parking on the street
description: left our car in a parking space on the street for the day (which we paid in order for someone to watch our car). When we came back later in the evening, the mirror on the passenger side of the car had been stolen. The women watching the parking spaces said she hadn't seen anything.. very annoying.

name: Fran (chapista)
description: Fran is a very very nice person and help us with our VW Bus Kombi. He repaired the parts of our car that were oxidized. Good prices.

name: Nice “Mirador” overlooking The Valley
description: I could even work to spend a night if needed. Great place for a morning coffee on this beautiful road!

name: Parking Amani Hydrodam
description:
At the end of the road to the ferry on the Amani / La Miel lake, there’s a quiet level parking spot. There a trash can but no toilets. The shore is just 100m away. It’s in the middle of a rainforest with lots of birds and insects. 
The boatmen will even help you get a breakfast delivered to your rig for USD3 p. P. 
From here you can make day trips or longer stays at the 3 lodges around the lake.

name: Vereda la Mina - colonial Bridge
description: A winding Spanish colonial track brings you down to a cristal clear river (la Honda) that flows into the Moniquira river. The last 800m are for small an Medium 4x4 vehicles only. Check by foot first. Small level spot overlooking both rivers, beside a colonial bridge.

name: Makrollantas
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager.  

Tires, auto parts, maintenance and prevention services for all types of vehicles. complete advice to find suitable solutions in the care and maintenance. Our services: alignment, balancing, mechanics, brakes, oil change and more.

name: Balneario bambú
description:
Placed opposite the Bamboo spa. Has toilets and a store to buy food and drinks. You can camp for free and use the barbecues if you consume something from the bar.

family atmosphereestá enfrente al balneario bambú , tiene baños y un almacén para conprar comida y bebidas . se puede acampar gratis y usar los parrilleros si consumimos algo del bar.
ambiente familiar .

name: Hosteria Damasco
description:
Nice hostel with green courtyard (patio) inside. Good location (2 blocks from main square). Friendly owner eager to help.
Paid 30 000COP for a room with 2 single beds (with private bathroom).
Good Wi-Fi and cold shower.

name: Immigration
description:
They don’t extend visas anymore in the office but will help you navigate the online process or take care of other issues (DIAN is not here).

Update 2021: appointment only..must make appointment via website...

name: Las Americas - neighborhood for spare car parts
description: This area of Pasto has a lot of stores for spare parts you may need. One of the gas shocks that lifts our bed platform went out, and we found a replacement here that was the right size, as well as a stronger LED dome light replacement. Good area to stop in as there is free and ample side street parking (at least today) and much less chaotic than Medellín.

name: Casaburalgo Tires
description: We ordered new tires here ahead of time and had them put on at their Pasto location.  (There is also one in Ipiales that does the aligent for heavier rigs). We contacted them through their FB page, and they were very helpful with the ordering process as well as communication.  Staff at the shop were very nice and straightforward.

name: waterfall// catarata manto de la virgen
description: here is the parking for visiting the nice waterfalls. we had to pay 10.000cop each to visit them. there is a 5 min trail or 40 min uphill trail (very nice views). we were allowed to stay with our sprinter camper for free. they locked the gate at 4pm and told to return from gámbita at 8.30 am, however they arrived at 10am. toilets (also they promissed not to lock they did when they left), natural water, no claro reception. the way vado real to gámbita is paved (with holes), from gámbita it is rough dirt road (with busses and small lorries).

name: Parking by River
description: Nice wide and easily accesible parking spot just next to the main plaza, by the river. Well light and there's access to a "natural public swimming pool" which we didn't try and that also has bathrooms, which they may let you use. Street food vendors turn up at about 18:00 and stay until 22:30. Just like anywhere in this village, we felt secure. Good 3G data connection where we parked. Enough space to cook outside your van as we did.

name: Free public wifi
description: Free wifi in the main square of Filandia

name: In the street
description:
Small street, quiet, safe and close to the marina for diving.
The place is just in front of a very nice family.
The owner of the hotel is nice as well! Maybe he could give you water.

name: Language Home
description: Spanish school in Salento (And english school for the local kids), highly recommend, personalized lessons for all levels from patient and kind English speaking teachers. July 2019 30.000/h or 25.000 if you take more than 3 hours. Salento is a great place to releax and take lessons for a few days.

name: Café La Tertulia
description: Great little cafe in the centre square. Good for people watching, also found a fair few people watching us - feels like they don’t get a huge amount of travellers. Not loads to do in this town. Just grab a coffee & enjoy.

name: Hospedaje La Paisa
description:
Good place for one night, WiFi, clean room, tv, fan, 20.000! Cop for 2 person and 1 dog :)
.....
Buen lugar para 1 noche, wifi, habitación limpia, TV, ventilador, 20.000 por noche para 2 personas y un perro :) 
En el pueblo Santander encontraras desde 35.000 cop.

name: Tambo El Edén (travelers stop)
description:
There are 4 “Tambos” along the autopistas del café. Are sports provided for the company where you can park and spend the day and night there. They have clean toilets, free WiFi, water, plugs 110v and security during the night
El Tambo is small but confortable,the staff very friendly. We spent 2 nights
Check www.autopistasdelcafe.com , sección “Tambos”

Los Tambos son lugares que la empresa Autopistas del café provee para los viajeros. Cuentan con Baños limpios,wifi gratis,agua,médicos y seguridad a la noche. Puedes parar y quedarte el tiempo que quieras en forma gratis.
Nosotros pasamos 2 noches en Tambo El Edén, el personal muy amable.
Hay 4 Tambos a los largo de la autopista con todos los mismos servicios, consulta en www.autopistasdelcafe.com , sección Tambos

name: Horse riding tour fantastic in coffee vallee
description:
Such an amazing tour with Jaime in coffee vallee. Horses are nice and Jaime so helpfull and gentle even if you have never done horseriding before. Jaime and his wife owns a Finca and can also explain you the coffee fabrication. Highly recommended !!
You can also sleep in the Finca.
Please noted that you need to have a 4weel drive or take a Jeep to come here or ask Jaime (+57 314 7804070)

name: Finca Del Alto
description: Jaime is a super friendly host which can provide you horseriding tour or coffee process tour. The Finca is so nice and the view is just wonderful

name: La Roca Hotel
description: Nice hotel, quaint lively local tiny town one hour from Guatape. Spotless, a/c, English tv is a treat if you haven’t had a movie in a while. Pet friendly. Balconies with view of centro square. Bit pricey at about $38/nt but a nice weekend splurge. Lots of river swimming areas and several waterfalls close by.

name: Repair, wash and welding for trucks and cars in Fresno
description:
It is a truck and car repair, wash and welding. Chespirito and Raul are very good mechanics. Antonio and Fernando are welding everything.
We stopped here because we had problems with our clutch. Chespirito organized a new clutch master cylinder for our german truck within 3 days and renewed our clutch lining. 
There is also an old mechanic, but instead of repairing our master cylinder he broke something inside because he used too much pressure.

name: MONTAÑA Parrilla Burger
description: Very good grill. Hearty dishes, so much so that we bought only one to share. It's not cheap but it's worth it. The meat is delicious, and the salad, the cassava fried with the sauces, and the natural juices. Highly recommended. We came several times.

name: Naked Sport
description: Motor bike mechanic. Very experienced and well maintained workshop. Jorge was very helpfull he started work on my bike straight away to get me back on the road. Authorized Suzuki mechanic but works on all brands BMW KTM Honda.

name: La casa de la Campana
description:
The brakes of our Ford Transit ('94) were completely down. Organized new discs even there are no Ford Transits in Colombia.
Helped us a lot in any brake issue. 

Ask for Oscar, its his shop.

name: Ondas café hostel
description:
Laundry service. 17000 cop for a small bag lower than about 5kg and 24000 cop the bag about 5-6kg.
---
Service de lavanderia. 17000 cop le petit sac inférieur à 5kg environ et 24000 cop le sac de 5-6kg environ.

name: Nube Extrema
description:
Nice place to camp. There are bathrooms, water and Internet, and the view is impressive. The cost is COP 10,000 per person. (2024: 20k pppn) Paragliding flights are made.
---
Lindo lugar para acampar. Hay baños, agua e Internet, y la vista es impresionante. El costo es de 10.000 COP por persona. Se hacen vuelos en parapente.

name: ATM Banco Agrario de Colombia
description:
You can withdraw up to 780.000 COP with foreign CARDS. 
---
Se puede retirar hasta 780.000 COP con tarjetas extranjeras.

name: Parqueadero El Condado
description:
We found this place by chance. It is at the end of a street next to the hill that goes to Las Nubes, so it is very quiet, and a few blocks from downtown. The owner is Carlos, who lives next door. We pay 20,000 COP per day, negotiable based on how many days you stay. Carlos's phone number is +57 301 715 5852. 
The neighborhood is very nice, and the people are very friendly. They like to talk with you! We spent 4 very quiet nights here. 
Another neighbor is Alberto, who is a tour guide, and he can wash your car if you want. 
On the corner is Montaña Parrilla Burger restaurant, very good meat and very abundant dishes. We got lunch several times. Recommend it.

Encontramos de casualidad este lugar. Está al final de una calle al lado del cerro que va a Las Nubes, por lo cual es muy tranquilo, y a pocas cuadras del centro. El dueño es Carlos, que vive al lado. Pagamos 20.000 COP por día, negociable según cuántos días. El teléfono de Carlos es +57 301 715 5852. 
El vecindario es muy lindo, y las personas muy amables y simpáticas. A ellos les gusta conversar contigo! Pasamos 4 noches muy tranquilas acá. 
Otro vecino es Alberto, que es guía de turismo, y además te puede lavar el carro si lo necesitas.
En la esquina está el restaurante Montaña Parrilla Burger, muy buena carne y platos muy abundantes. Almorzamos ahí varias veces. Muy recomendable.

name: Cumaná bistro food
description:
Very nice little restaurant! Owned by 3 Venezuelian's friends who know about good cooking! They have typical Venezuelian's food but also other fusions food, everything is very tasty and nice served! Vegetarians options.
Plates between 15 000 and 25 000 COP.
Highly recommended! Maybe the best restaurant in Salento...

name: Hotel San Miguel
description:
Great hotel just two blocks from the main square but really quiet. They only have private rooms  with private showers but really comfortable and cheap. 20000pp alone. If you are two the room is 25000. 
The owner- Miguel and his family are really nice and welcoming (speaks Spanish) good place to stay if you are on your way to Jordan/Guane. 
There is a parking near by also for big rigs free of charge. No kitchen but food in this village is so cheap and good :)

name: Hotel y Camping Calicanto Real
description:
Really nice spot near the river and next to the famous Calicanto bridge. The hotel runs by a really nice family that will take care for everything you ask for. The place is a two floors house decorated in old beautiful style. Double bed room 100peso (50pp) part with small balcony to the bridge. The women says that if you come as a group you can get it lower. Anyway in low season you might bargain a little. Very clean, private shower, hot water and breakfast included. There is a parking area as well (at least for car and moto). No kitchen available but the women let me use their kitchen. 
Camping cost 15pp, no roof, cold shower, wifi.

name: Family Host Hostel
description:
Charming little family hostel run by a very nice woman named Amy who helps and flexes everything you needs. The hostel is clean, hot water, shared kitchen and Netflix for movies, average Wi-Fi and excellent location - only five minutes from bus station and supermarkets in town, 10 min from main square. An excellent and very cheap option for backpacks compared to all other places in Villa de Leyva. Single tent  17000cop pp/ 19000 with breakfest. The tent already exists with a thick mattress and blankets. Dorms 21000/25000 with/without breakfast.Double room with shared bathroom 55000cop/ 75000cop with private. (Prices of low season. You can find them online). 
The Hostel gives a sense of home, great volunteers who help keep the place, shared evenings of music, movies and hanging out. Stayed here first for 3 nights and came back after a month. 
Ask for David and the tour for Cascada Periquera - he has a lot of knowledge about the place and the history - worth it. Pet friendly. 
The only drawback is the lack of parking inside the hostel - it is possible on the street though and it is safe in the village.

name: Iglesia de Tópaga
description: Worth a detour. The only church in Colombia with a figure of devil inside. It is in the middle of the archbow before the altar. To the left side of the church is an altar to judas tadeus, the saint of the "mineros“. The church is 366 years old.

name: Petroglifos de Usamena
description: As they were hard to find, here are their coordinates. We could drive with our Sprinter camper van very close. The petroglifos were done by Muisca 500-800 ac.

name: Near petroglifos
description: Having found the petroglifos de Usamena we just went uphill to discover this overnight place in just nature with view to both sides. A fox came by to wish us a good night which we had. No infrastructure, good claro reception (4g).

name: Parking for Comuna 13
description: Place where you can leave your car and walk to the Escalator in district 13.

name: DIAN
description:
Extend your TIP here. Entrance is in what looks like the back of the building, up a ramp. Explain to the guards that you need to extend you vehicle importation. Hand over a drivers license and they will direct you to 4th floor.  On fourth floor, turn left and head all the way back.  

Will need to fill out a form explaining why you want the extension.  Also need copies of Original TIP, Title, passport photo, original entry stamp, and SOAT.

Will need to drop all this off then return next day...they will call you to assign time for inspection of your vehicle.

English spoken....

name: Hostel Nirvana San Gil
description: Clean hostel which has parking lot with a gate. Parking lot is small, only 1 or 2 car is available. Not for big rig. Mine is 4runner, had no problem. Not too far from Centro. San Gil is small town. 80 000 cop for 2 person. Hot shower is available here!

name: El Tizón De César
description:
One of these typical food stalls where you can eat set meals inkl. fresh juice at lunch time for COP 11‘000 (or choose something else, more expensive from the menu). Friendly staff, decent quality of food. Gets busy from noon until 2pm. 
If you happen to travel with a dirty car: There‘s a car wash just next to the restaurant (COP 30’000 for a outer wash of our RV, 6.5m long). If you drop your vehicle before eating at the restaurant they might have  finished until you‘re done.

name: End of the road between beachhouses
description:
End of the sandy road between the beachhouses.
A lots of fishermans at day and many familys enjoyed the the beach here. you can also have dinner or lunch. they offers tours.
In the night was very quite. Only the police gomes to check if its all ok.
Safe and lovely bueblito.
Dont stay here on Sunday night. They have every sunday party until 4 am.
Free. Toilet in the hous next of the place for 1000 P. we didnt ask for shower. maybe you can use it also?

name: mirador
description:
very nice View point over the city!
go before sunset and you will love it!

name: GAS Filling Place (Mr. Yong)
description:
We were sent to this place from Gasan-Empresa, who couldn't fill our US-tank. 

You find the house in a small dirt road next to the trail rails, it's a private house (Mr Yong). There are some gas bottles visible from the outside. Doesn't look official or professional at all, but worked.

Took us about 20 minutes. Price quite expensive with 70.000 Pesos, does not seem to be negotiable, the locals who where before us paid the same.

name: Hospedaje
description: Little family run Hospedaje next to the Cable Car. We paid 30.000 for a room with two beds, might be able to negotiate a bit more. Also has single rooms. We could park our two motorbikes here. Easy access to the center with cable car and cheaper here than what we could find in center. Basic place but excellent for a night!

name: Parking with Bathroom
description: Secured and gated parking lot, owned by a very nice couple. 4000 Pesos/car/night, you can stay in your vehicle and use the bathroom. No height restriction. Best place we found in the area, highly recommended to spend a night.

name: International airport
description: Modern airport, used to shiping bicycles, just show up and pay the 400.000 fee. Open 24h, taxi's have fixed rates (75.000 from, 65.000 to airport on July 2019) On my way to Panama they accepted my bike as proof of onward travel at Copa airlines. way cheaper that the cartagena-panama boat.

name: PKS Automotriz
description:
Automotive electrical and general mechanics. Very friendly with good prices. Recommended.

Mecánica en general eléctrico automotriz. Muy amable con buenos precios. Recomendado.

name: Tamales Place
description:
This place sells big, full tamales for 4.500pesos.  It’s sizeable, I’d call it a full meal & whilst it’s no fine dining I think it tastes pretty good too. 

Good it you’re on a budget or fancy eating what the locals eat.

name: Water tap in front of the station
description:
Water in front of the station (in the station)

Water en frente de la estacion (en la estacion)

name: Homme Center - construction - materiaux
description:
if you need wood or materials to make a separation in your motor home or to crafts.

si vs avez besoin de bois ou matériaux pour faire une séparation de votre cc pour le shopping c'est un gente de Leroy Merlin

name: Lavanderia SOS
description: Same day service possibel, COP 9000/kg (COP 7‘500/kg if more than 10kg in total). Friendly staff. Open monday through sunday.

name: Hotel La Pista
description: Nice, cheap and comfortable hotel with plenty space to park RV, next to a gas station.

name: Centro de Alineación 3D
description: 3D Alignment Center inside the parking lot. Big rigs ok (ours is 3.2 m tall and 7.2 m long). Price 38000 cop. Recommended.

name: robertico// sutmarchan
description: we got the recommendation to eat here from a german living for ages in this region. the picada para dos (mixed for 2) is 28.000 cop. we liked the taste of the sausages better than at asadero las vegas. they have their own parking next and behind the restaurant.

name: taller tagua// artesanias  nuts de tagua palmas
description: mr juan césar bonilla gonzáles makes very nice thinks out if the nuts if this special palms. he will demonstrate his work to you. he makes the smallest chess sets of the world (120.000cop). just pass by.

name: monasterio candelaria
description:
we asked and were allowed to stay overnight at their parking. very quiet, church at 6 pm, slow wifi, water, toilets during opening hours. 
open: 8am - 5 pm
we had a great tour! as much time as we wanted, explained even all our questions in a clear spanish. 
6.000cop adults, seniors only 4.000cop. worth the visit and great overnight place. just ask!

name: cheese colfrance
description: they sell cheese and it is a restaurant aswell. they have many diary products, sausages and more. we liked gouda ahumado and camenbert best. the owner claude louise picaud is french. open every day 7am - 8 pm.

name: Professional Car - Centro de Servicio
description: Very helpful and friendly mechanics. They checked our Chevrolet Silverado 1995 with the computer and found the problem. It was the temperature sensor of the motor. They quickly drove away with the motorbike and bought a new one for 50.000 COP. They replaced it and in total we paid 150.000 COP (45 US$). Car works again :-)

name: Hotel Sol Costeño
description: Nice cheap hotel just by the market. 45k pesos double room with air-conditioning, ceiling fan and private bathroom, 30k pesos single. No parking by the hotel, either on the street or paying a private parking nearby. As for bicycles they can be parked inside in a safe area. Owners are very friendly.

name: Lubricantes Carolina
description: Grease and protect the chassis is a must before crossing a desert on the sea side (which is the case if you go to Cabo de la vela or Punta Gallinas). Here' a good place to do so. 15'000COP for my 25' motorhome. fits high trucks (I'm 3.40m).

name: Lavadero La Guaca
description:
One of these multi-purpose precious spots. Here, provided with the fact you ask gently, the very nice dueña (Juli) will offer you the following services: 1- wash your vehicle and protect (grafitear) your chassis from salt and sand (20'000COP), 2- leave your vehicle in a secured place if you take a company tour in the desert (10'000Cop per night) 3- sleep onsite in your vehicle (basic toilets and shower, electricity, no drinkable water for 10'000COP per night), Stickers and window polarization with Andre, prize on demand. All of these foxes are super nice. keep in mind this is NOT a campsite. It's just a favor they happily do to the travellers passing by. No height restriction.

Additional service possibility. Señor Ubaldo Diaz is a "todero". The guy handles wood, metal, pipes and basically can handle any kind of job you may have to be done on your vehicle. We did two projects with him, friends needed a metal roof cover, I needed metal parts protections for my windows. ended we've all been over satisfied about the result and the cost. You can join him on phone or Whatsapp: +57 300 2511673

name: Hotel Valladolid
description: Nice place with big parking lot. It has a pool, bathroom, water ,electricity. Paid 40,000 pesos for 2 adults and 2 kids .

name: Parcero Publicidad
description: We made new stickers here. Attentive staff and very good quality! recommend!

name: Bao Bao hostel
description:
Very nice hostel in Palomino, with a lovely pool and rooms for rent. The gate is at around 2.5m so big rigs won’t fit inside. But in Palomino you’ll have problems anyway. 

The owners charged us 30 000 pesos for two adults and two kids, for camping, including the use of the pool.

Very clean toilets. 5mins of the beach. No WiFi.

name: Glasstec Nelson Zapata
description: I fix my windshield here. Very professional work. Big rigs can park here. Took only one hour. Call Nelson +57 (315) 515-6533. He is the owner. 17 years of experience doing only car windows repair. You can also find this place on google maps.

name: La cabana del Chorizo
description:
Good alternative to other good spot as they also ask 15k per children 
Here it s 10k pp and Free for kids
Toilets and shower and quiet at night

name: Hospedaje Bellavista
description:
It is a lodging with shared and private rooms. It has a hot shower, with shampoo, soap and towels.
It also has laundry service and homemade food.
Mrs. Eugenia is extremely kind and gladly helps you with whatever you need.

For the use of kitchen a small fee is charged for maintenance of gas and napkins, etc.

If you come with a pet, you cannot enter the rooms but you can sleep in your Canil.
----
Es un hospedaje con habitaciones compartidas y privadas. Tiene ducha de agua caliente, con shampoo, jabón y toallas.
Además tiene servicio de lavandería y comida casera.
La señora Eugenia es extremadamente amable y con gusto te ayuda a lo que necesites. 

Para el uso de cocina se cobra una pequeña cuota para mantenimiento de gas y servilletas, etc.

Si vienen con mascota, no puede ingresar a las habitaciones pero puede dormir en su Canil.

name: Pet Aduana at the Airport
description: Here you can get your dog papers for entry to Colombia. After that paperwork and (electronic) payment of 47.000 COP/12,xxUS$ we got a new document.

name: Parqueadero for big rigs
description: So we came here after the other parking on iOverlander was not for us. We have a Toyota Land Cruiser and stayed for 8 nights. We paid 90 k COP for 15 days (package price). The gate is big (No high limit) and the place has some parking with roof (we didn’t fit). Only place that we could find to store the car for that time without having to move it. Very safe since people stay here at night and gate is locked.

name: glass mekanix/ windscreen garage
description:
we needed help with our windscreen: we had 2 cracks 8 month ago and one of it became  larger now. 
this garage is specialized in car glass. 
monday-friday 8.30- 17.30. 
if your car is to big they work under the roof of their neighbour. they helped us instantly. we payed 40.000 each crack.

name: silvania: coliseo municipal
description: we asked at the police where we can stay safe overnight and were told to go here. we talked to the neighbors and were welcomed. we were offered a privat parking aswell but we had done enough talking and stayed here. you hear the highway, no infrastrukture, but fine for one night.

name: Finca El Recuerdo Coffee Tour
description: A local suggested us to visit this familial and authentic coffee farm. We were welcomed by Juan who gave us an interesting tour of 1h30 in english. The tour was about the coffee culture, and process, but also about medicinal herbs, history of the coffee farm, fruits that are growing on the farm (orange trees, pineapple, avocado, banana, etc.). The tour finished with a coffee cup. We really recommend it. 30'000 CLP / person. We took a Jeep at the main place to go there.

name: Aduana / DIAN
description:
Border is open! No test is required but they did check for vaccine certificate and also CheckMig Ecuador wants you to fill out a health form that you acquire on the bridge in a small tent. 

Copy of Passport pic and stamps, car title, int’l drivers license. Straight forward procedure after Colombian immigration. Copies for $0,15 on the other side of the road towards Ecuador (In the hotel or a little but further down).

Crossed with our two motorbikes, process took about an hour and a half. We arrived here at 9am. After getting your passport stamped for Colombia you’ll head to aduana. They wanted copies of the following: bike registration, drivers license, chassis number, picture of bike showing license plate number, and passport with Colombia entry stamp. We had all these docs ready which is why it didn’t take long, without of course the entry stamp. Went down the street and across for photo copies. Took about 10 mins then headed back to aduana to complete the process.


No Soat for sale anymore at the Exito in Ipiales.

name: Street parking with access to Hostal facilities
description: Parked up on the street right outside Mountain Hostels Manizales and were charged $10.000 per person per night to have unlimited use of the Hostel's facilities i.e. bathroom, kitchen, garden etc. WiFi in all areas and was accessible from our Bus parked up across the road. Beatriz on reception was super friendly and was more than happy to have us there. We were the first to not sleep there but use the facilities, so the price was agreed with her. Other staff weren't quite as friendly and one even seemed a little put out that we weren't "proper" guests and clearly was not happy with our presence.

name: Playa Inka Inka
description:
Good place for park, very near of rodadero, a cabin at day works for restaurant, at night you can park, very friendly people just talk with them, they let us stay 4 days, very safe the police always pass to check if you are ok

Buen lugar para parquear, cerca al rodadero, hay una cabaña que es restaurante en el día, la gente del lugar es amable, al hablar con ellos, nos dieron permiso para permanecer 4 días, es una playa segura y tranquila, permanece Policia en el mirador pendiente...

name: la casa del pandeyuca tolimense
description: great side road restaurant. whole chicken leg very tasty plus rice, beans and salad for 10,000 COP. declined the soup because too hot. they also sell some types of small breads. Good pit stop

name: Alto de la Montaña
description:
The spot 100m further was closed, so we asked if we could stay on the "parking" of the hostel and they will let other vans stay here.
It's cheap (10'000COP per van per night), quiet and the view from the terrace is great. They have a cheap restaurant and a private path to go to a small river just for you (not like the crowded pozo azul). 
You're parked next to the road but it's safe and really quiet at night. The road to go there is bad- be careful with high clearance. There's just one more or less flat place for a van of 6m or less long. 
They let us use the electricity. 
The day, we used the bathroom of the terrace. There's a shower inside, ask if you can use it. Not clear how/if we could use.

name: Vidrios/ Glass and Windows
description: A very good place to change a Glass or a window on a car or a campervan... Francisco prepares it to your own dimensions...it tooks for us 4 days to fabric and 2 hours to install... Good job and honest staff...

name: Kachikine Hostel
description:
Super chill hostel outside of Capurgana with monkeys, lizards and other jungle animals just next by. We stayed here some days and just relaxed. There are two beaches in walking distance. One is really good for swimming and scuba diving. The workers are super friendly and it’s a nice family feeling. Dogs included as well.
Kitchen is basic but good. 
We payed 15.000 pp for camping but after the first night we changed to hammocks because of the heat. Also 15.000 for that. Both outdoor options without breakfast. They also have dorms and private rooms.(with breakfast) Don’t know how much it’s.->Check Booking. 
We bought some basic products for some days back in Necocli and fruits In Capurgana. You can also by everything in Capurgana. It’s not this more expensive. 
From Capurgana to the hostel it’s about 1 hour walking. You can also take a boot for 10k pp that brings you to the “playa aquacate”. From there it’s just 4min walking to the hostel. 
Sometimes the owner has to go to town, than he takes you for free. 
Highly recommend this paradise.

name: Parqueadero 24 hs "La 46"
description:
Parking for the night in Barranquilla. We were told that only to sleep and leave before 8 am, but I guess you can talk. We pay 15,000 COP. You can fill your water tank. 

Parqueadero para pasar la noche en Barranquilla. Nos dijeron que solamente para dormir e irse antes de las 8 am, pero supongo que se podrá conversar. Pagamos 15.000 COP. Se puede llenar el tanque de agua.

name: Parqueadero Brisas del Campo
description:
We found this parking lot looking for a place to sleep, waiting to enter Tayrona Park early in the morning, to go to Playa Cristal. Beautiful shade of mango trees, which at this time fall to the ground! There are bathrooms with showers, place to eat, and water to fill the tank. We pay 20,000 COP for 24 hours. Sandra's cell phone +573022735225.

Encontramos este parqueadero buscando un lugar para dormir, esperando ingresar al Parque  Tayrona temprano en la mañana, para ir a Playa Cristal. Hermosa sombra de árboles de mango, cuyos frutos en este momento están cayendo al suelo! Hay baños con duchas, lugar para comer y agua para llenar el tanque. Pagamos 20,000 COP por 24 horas. 
El celular de Sandra es  +573022735225.

name: Mendihuaca Surf Hostel
description:
We found the hostel on Booking and stayed some days there and really liked it. It’s probably the only hostel at Costeño Beach that has a kitchen and more fair prices for the nights. 
The Kitchen is really well equipped and can be used all day after breakfast. 
The hostel is small and has space for 4 people in dorm; 4 people in hammocks and two people in a privat double room. Makes it a really familiar atmosphere. Also there is probably on leveled place for a Camper. 
The owners of the hostel are really warm and welcoming and know a lot about the surroundings. 
The hostel itself is located on a little hill surrounded by a lot of Mango-Trees. It’s not directly at the beach but we just walked 3 min to it. 
Also you can rent bikes for 15k per day and can explore the area, like we did. There are a lot of lonely beaches along this part of coast that you can reach good by bicycle. 
You can also have surfe her or take some lessons. The owners also have a surf school. 
Prices for a camper pp are 25k like a hammock. So you can decide where you want to sleep. 
If you want to cook something you should bring everything because the next shop is 10km away. You can also have breakfast and lunch in the hostel.

name: Hotel Valle
description: Simple but nice hotel off the main road. 2 parking places right in front (not gated). Gated parking for motorbikes. Paid 20k COP for a room with private bathroom. The room pictured is a 25k option. Hot shower and WiFi. I did laundry here. At first they asked 1k a piece, but once I said no, came down to 5k a load.

name: airport parking
description: Long term parking allowed is to camp overnight. $12.000/cop per 24 hrs. Staff was extremely friendly. Restaurants and restrooms in domestic terminal.  Long term lot is on the left side as you come through the parking lot section.

name: Affordable Dentist
description:
Very fast and easy to make an appointment. We had Maria Margarita as our dentist and she was very focused on my concerns but also the aesthetics of the smile. Cleaned teeth however it wasn’t the most thorough cleaning. 

Cleaning: 120k COP
Filling: 120k COP

name: Delicious, affordable meals by gas station
description: We stopped here on the long drive from Cartagena and enjoyed the best meal!! Everything was fresh, flavorful, and definitely hit the spot. The staff was also incredibly sweet. There are bathrooms, no WiFi, and gas station is only efectivo. Meal of the day was $10k COP rice, lentils, chicken, salad, yucca and soup.

name: Hôtel Prado
description: Very clean hotel with ac and restaurant and closed parking. We paid 110.000 for a family room with 4 beds. Good place for one night on the way to the coast!

name: Terpel Dabeiba
description:
Terpel gas station. Free bathrooms, a quiet noise but like mostly gas station. It’s ok for one night. 
We parked in front of restaurant, nice people.

name: Restaurant Mekatos
description:
Simple restaurant with good and tasty food.
It’s possible to camp here if you want. Place for even big rigs. Almuerzos for 8000 cop.

name: Donation based spring water at a convent
description: There's a pipe outside of a convent with water from a spring. Several locals said it was better than tap water. Donation based.

name: Cafe San Alberto
description: Very good quality coffee. Best one in Cartagena. Small place that serves a great coffee, cakes, savory pastries and seeets.

name: Termales Espíritu Santo
description: Free camping area with space for cars and tents, fireplace/bbq area. Just up the road are the hot springs (12k/pp) and hotel and restaurant (14k/pp menu). No facilities in the camping area itself, toilets etc available at the hotel approx 500m away. Next to a nice river.

name: Picnic area near river
description: A large grassy area with picnic tables and fireplaces, just down from the road, easy access for all. Some areas hidden from the road, but the place feels safe. Popular during the day for locals to come for swimming, lunch etc. No toilet facilities, only the river for water.

name: Coffee tour and Comuna 13 tourwith Andres
description:
We stayed in a hotel in El Poblado and booked the coffee tour. Best experience. They picked us up at 8 and we returned at noon. The farm is about 30-45 min drive so you spend a good amount of time there. Andres speaks fluent Spanish and English as he lived in London. We were the only group on the farm and they only work with Andres. The owner were super friendly, Andres' knowledge is amazing, we picked coffee and saw the whole process. We got 4 different brew style coffee, 1 coffee tea and a little local bite. It was amazing! We paid 44 USD pp. 
We decided to go for the Comuna 13 tour afterwards and it was also amazing!! This tour includes the pick up and drop off, a visit at the market for fruit tasting, a cable car ride with a good view and lot of Insider Infos and the comuna 13. He knows so much and can explain a lot of things. This tour was 24€ pp. 
Contact Andres on WhatsApp +573196090366

name: Mirador Filandia
description:
Entrance is 8.000COP pp. Very nice bathrooms, clean, toilet paper and soap.
Free WiFi.
You get a great view over the valley and mountains but we didn't find it too special.

name: El Migrante
description: Really good food, vegetarian friendly. Probably one of the best meals we had in Colombia. It is a little more expensive, but it’s worth it. Prices are between 18-40. We had the burrata pasta (31) and piri piri chicken (29) juices (4). Street parking in front.

name: Bomberos Santa Rosa de Oso
description: Fire brigade - Bomberos station of Santa Rosa de Oso. Super friendly and with a big parking lot. They let us camp under the roof, use the bathroom and have a hot shower. The parking area is big and can accommodate big rig. There's a very cheap supermarket few steps away and some cheap restaurant. Although it's in the urban area, it's very quiet.

name: Finca Pavo real
description:
Camping in a nice family farm and quiet, full of fruit trees, has a bathroom, bbq area and parking.
 Attended by Mrs. Oliva and Mr. Gabino, a nice couple of very helpful grandparents.  The weather is delicious, you can rest in the hammocks and play with the puppies.  They also have chickens and they can sell you the eggs.
--
Camping en una linda finca familiar y tranquila, llena de frutales, tiene baño, zona de bbq y parquedero. 
Atendida por la Sra Oliva y el Señor Gabino, una linda pareja de abuelitos muy serviciales. El clima es delicioso , puedes descansar en las hamacas y jugar con los perritos. También tienen gallinas y te pueden vender los huevos. 
Antes de llegar pueden llamar a los teléfonos: Whatsapp: 3115100856 . Llamar: 3132116366 y al 3504823629. Ellos solo hablan español. Valor camping $ 12.000.

name: Taller Autoreyes
description:
We hit a tree and broke the front glass and side mirror of our sprinter. We got quotes from two mechanics and Gonzalo offered the best deal! It was a little complicated trying to pay at the bank but it all worked out. Also the family is incredibly kind and let us stay overnight the two nights while we waited for $20k per night with shower and water. And the young girl Madeleine is super sweet and eager to learn English if you have the time :) 
Window: $360k + 72k (Delivery) 
Mirror: $400k + 41k (Delivery) 
Work: $90k

name: Hotel Suyusama
description: Nice hotel located right off the highway and close the supermarket Exito, where you can buy SOAT. Close to the Exito you will also find ATM’s and a few places to eat. We paid 80k (24 USD) for a double room for two people. There is a secured parking garage in the hotel that can fit about four cars or several motos. The rooms are nice and clean and have a tv with some spanish channels. Tea and coffee provided in the lobby. The staff is very friendly. Probably cheaper hotels in the area but we were drawn to the convenient location and secure parking.

name: Restaurant Los Tibayes
description:
Really nice little coffee place that sells coffee from a local finca.
Current menu:
Malteada 4000
Granizado 4000
Cappuccino 4000
Latte 3000
Aromática 2000

We only had Malteada and Granizado which were really good. Perhaps someone else can try the cappuccino?

name: Octano Gas Station
description:
Relatively new gas station with clean toilets (no paper), open 24/7. It's next to the main road so quite busy at all times. 
Ok for a night.

name: Las Camelias Eco Hostel
description: Hostel with all amenities and parking for up to 2 rigs. 10000 COP/person/night. Same when you bring your tent. They also rent tents for 21000 COP. Rooms available too. They main entrance is not very high but you can enter from the backside just a bit further down the road. Nice, safe and quiet spot, very close to the town.

name: La Merced Restaurantes
description: Good restaurant with a wide variety of foods including vegetarian options, coffees, and desserts. Prices range from 10k ($3 usd) to 40k ($12 usd) Portions are big and you could easily split a plate. Free WiFi. Parking in front of the restaurant.

name: Tl Casa Blanca Hotel Boutique
description: Brand new hotel with gated parking lot. Parking lot has no height limit and big enough for any vehicle. Double room is 60k. Perfect room condition and fast wi-fi, hot shower. Everything is super new and clean.Strongly recommend after driving a long dirt road.

name: Hospedaje
description: Little hospedaje in the house of two old persons. There is a little sign you can see from the road. Very basic but nice people. 20 000 pesos for two in a room of three beds.

name: Mirador Alta Vista
description:
Awesome Mirador! 
Some local friends took me here on Motorcycles at night! Save to get here - as well by car! Has self service bbq and drinks! lots of jung folks and musik at night!
Great photo option!! 
came a second time by myself with camera equipment!! Do it!

name: Parqueadero restaurante BORA BORA
description:
Restaurant and bar on Mayapo beach. Finally green water and white sand! We stayed in the parking lot, very quiet. We pay 10,000 pp, with the right to bath, showers and use of amenities. The food is not cheap but worth it. They have no mains water and must buy it, so they also charge it. You can also sleep in a hammock or mattress with breakfast included for 40,000.
Cel. +57 3107953357
www.boraborabeachmayapo.com

name: Balneario Painima
description: Lovely spot to spend the night right on the river and it's deep enough and big enough for a swim. Coordinates aren't 100% correct, continue down dirt track some 300m more. Access is easy even for our lowered bus. Absolutely zero celular reception. Private household seem to "run" the place and thus you feel safe knowing that you're not totally alone. Don't let them charge you, it's a public area. Probably best to avoid at weekends.

name: El Portal Restaurant Campestre
description:
Campsite with a very good restaurant where you can have breakfast, lunch or dinner in a quiet area of downtown Playa de Belen.
Edwin and Lina (the owners) are very kind and you can eat an awesome trout dinner with rice, salad, fries for 20.000 cp. They serve burgers and other things. They have electricity, water, wifi, bathroom and external showers. Very close to Los Estoraques natural park (5 min walking distance).

name: Belmira Cemetery
description: We spent a couple of days in front of the cemetery. Just a couple of blocks from the town's main plaza. The place is quiet and spacious, but bus drivers might park here and play music occasionally, (it didn't happen during our stay). Be aware of unexpected but friendly two and four legged visitor. This town has beautiful landscapes, low pace lifestyle, and you can even book a guided visit to Bilmira's moorland (Páramo).

name: Casa de Campo con hermosa vista a los Farallones
description: A magical place, with all the culture of the region and a spectacular view towards the mountains, you will see from the window the two imposing cliffs above the valley that crosses the Cauca River. On the road to Pereira - Armenia - Manizales, you can go from here to Jardín, Ciudad Bolivar, La Pintada or Damascus. A breakfast with arepa, eggs, cheese and avocado for a chocolate or coffee? A fruit salad with mango, papaya and watermelon? A walk among the untouched nature? Come and find out! COP69.000 USD$20 Cel 3117013470 - 3206943784

name: Hotel Euros
description: Nice hotel for one night right on the highway in the town of El Bordo. Right in the center of all the action, close to places to eat, bakery, liquor store etc. Secure parking in the hotel, big enough for plenty of vehicles. Rooms are very clean, mattress was hard (seems to be a thing around here), cold shower, tv with spanish channels, mini fridge in room with beverages and snacks for purchase. Filtered water in the lobby. 30k pp for a room with a fan, 40k pp for a room with air conditioning.

name: Unico Shopping Mall
description:
Big shopping mall with everything you need. Secure parking. No height restrictions. 
Lots of ATMs.

name: Truchera San José
description: They offer the service of camping in tent with breakfast included for COP $20.000 p/p. And it's also good for overlanders, they charged us $10.000 p/p with the right to use their bathroom and shower but without breakfast. The place is quiet, beautiful and safe, but it can get crowded on Sundays. You can go fishing here, or they can sell you freezed trout.

name: Las delicias del coco
description: Nice restaurant to eat local and cheap food (5000 pesos). The owner, Carlos,  IS really nice and friendly. He help us to find everythinks on the town.

name: Frenos John
description: Brake mechanic. Replaced our park break here (new cable) for 100.000 COP. Seem to be nice guys.

name: Hotel Casa del Colibrí
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: This place was added by the owner or manager. It has not been overlander verified.

Hotel Casa del Colibrí, the attention of the staff is very kind and friendly.
It is a colonial type house with spacious and very comfortable rooms. The restaurant is in the middle of a very nice garden where hummingbirds arrive.
---

Hotel Casa del Colibrí, la atención del personal es muy amable y amigable. 
Es una casa tipo colonial con habitaciones amplias y muy cómodas. El restaurante está en medio de un jardín muy bonito donde llegan los colibríes. 

Servicios: 
Guías turísticos 
Hospedaje 
Restaurante 
Transporte 
Parqueadero 
y mucho más.

name: museo naval del caribe
description: Really interesting museum about the history of Cartagena and the pirates and corsairs attacks. the second floor is dedicated to the colombian naval army history. There are a lot to read (in spanish) thus we prefered to hire a guide to have the explanations in english (there are all students and the tip is voluntary). 16'000 COP/ pers for the entrance.

name: Restaurante Mi Tia
description: Very good local restaurant. Prices varies from 7-15k

name: Solar panels
description:
Little shop sells panels and other parts for solar. They can also test a panel
150watt panel is 330.000 cop

name: Meraki
description:
Great place to be visited. Great food. Lovely staff.
they are traveler-friendly.

name: Hotel Puerto Príncipe
description: Cheap hotel in la paila, 18000 pesos for matrimonial, they let us park the bike inside the restaurant over night

name: Next to a playground
description: We parked at the street, next to a playground, a couple of blocks from the main plaza, and one block from the bus terminal. Quiet at night.

name: World Parceros Hostel
description: A nice small hostel with private and bunk beds. Cool rooftop terrace with an overview of the city, well equipped Kitchen, washing machine and most importantly super friendly owners who live there and help with tips, every evening they organise some activities. Definitely recommend to stay here.

name: Cerro Kennedy wildcamp
description:
Beautiful wildcamp 1km before the entrance of the military base.
Militaries know this place and they helped me giving me a bottle of water. There is a small fireplace. When you are installed, just go to stay hello to the militaries so they know that you stay there for the night.
There is nothing: no water, no food, then be prepared! Nights are cold so have an adequate equipment. 
Enjoy the incredibly beautiful sunset and the quietness of this place! :-)

name: Parque principal de Pijao
description:
We slept one night at this point. People are curious and very friendly, if you are not interested in talking about your trip or wanting to see your car, this is not the place to park.
You can sell handicrafts with prior permission requested by the mayor's secretary, we were charged $ 10,000 COP.
In the corner there is a cafe, you can go for a drink and ask for the WiFi password.
There are public toilets in the sports center, but it is approximately 700m from the park. There you can also take a free cold shower during the day, with prior authorization from the lady who manages the sports center pool, she lives in the house next to the pool.
Around the park there are restaurants, markets, veterinary, drug stores, hardware store and electronic equipment store.
To sleep at this point it is better to announce beforehand with the police and clarify if something is going to be sold or not.

name: Rest area
description: Brand new rest area with amenities. Free Showers, bathrooms and, in the future, restaurante. Security guard, cameras and you can overnight but not stay many days.

name: Mirador - 4x4 low range short wheel base
description:
Nice view of The Valley. Beware this is for short 4x4 only. The Defender did fine, but used 1st low a couple of times. Too narrow for bigger rigs.
According to the guard it is possible to stay the night here. They got water, so I guess you could fill your tank. There’s level grass and small paved area.

name: migration office
description: place where to extend your visa in Valledupar.  open monday to friday, 8.00 to 12.00 y 14.00 to 17.00. Smooth and efficient process. 30mn total.

name: Glorieta Don Diego
description:
Behind the gas station there are two fields, one of football and another of Microphone with large green areas, there is a mini-market nearby where you are given water and there is also a pizzeria, it is next to a Catholic church and the place is very very quiet .

Detrás de la estacion de gasolina hay dos canchas, una de fútbol y otra de Micrófono con amplias zonas verdes, hay un minimarquet cerca donde te regalan agua y también hay una pizzería, esta al lado de una iglesia católica y el lugar es muy muy tranquilo.

name: Abandoned police station - Camping for cyclists
description: Because we were late, we asked the guys here, if they have a place to camp. We were allowed to sleep inside their building, use their shower and bathroom. They said there are many cyclists staying here. Very nice and friendly people. There is also a restaurant very close.

name: Parqueadero
description: Parking in the center town, close to Migration and DIAN offices. No height restriction to get in and enough room inside to park my 25' motor home. Ran by a nice Venezuelan family. 10k per night. super hot weather. No services.

name: DIAN
description: Aduanas office for TIP extension. 9th floor. ask for señor Julio Mindiola. My TIP delivery took 3 days. Subject to change according to cosmic forces....

name: Patagonia Hostal
description:
Beautiful place where the owner, Colombio, will do anything so you feel confortable. He has a beautiful life story, with his walk from Medellin to Patagony without any money ! He spent 15 years in USA then speaks perfectly english.
The price is 35000 COP / night for 1 person, breakfast included. 
Vegetarian restaurant : 15000 COP
It is a little bit expansive but you may not find something cheaper and that nice in Guane.
