To stay there is not only to spend one night in a casual hostal, it is as well a human experience, and you will make a new beatiful friend !
Enjoy ! :-)

name: Hotel/Hostel La Plaza
description: Cute, old house turned into a hotel/hostel right on the plaza. If you get the front rooms it’s a bit noisy, but you get multiple balconies looking on to the main plaza. If it’s the weekend you might want a room further back if you want to sleep. We stayed mid week and it was quiet from 10-6. We paid 90,000 COP a night for two people, but we took the best room. You can even leave your big RV parked out front and it’s very safe with lots of lights and police cameras around. Pijao is not as cute or well preserved as other coffee towns in Colombia, but the atmosphere is much nicer.

name: La Mano del Gigante
description:
This new attraction outside of Gigante with a beautiful view of the city. $10kCOP pp to enter and you pay at the bottom of the hill. You can drive or walk up. We drove up in a 2wd sprinter van without any issues. Once you’re up there you can park and stay for the night. We stayed for two nights, no extra charge. There’s a delicious coffee bar and you can order meals at the restaurant or they can order from town for delivery. 
They are still building and are going to have lots of amenities for retreats (pool, cabanas, camping, etc). The workers and staff are incredibly kind and interested in stories of travels, and offer suggestions too! 
Right now they have toilets, cold showers, and slow WiFi.

name: Aero Hostal
description: La casa en el aire. Amazing hostal hanging under the rock. Great views and super friendly staff. You can stay in 3 different hostal type accommodations ranging from COP 68,000-120,000. They even have a private cabin for couples. Make sure you bring all you need (eat and drink) and just enjoy the AMAZING views.

name: RavoGas
description: For refilling gas this was the most helpful place we found. They couldn’t refill our bottle despite their greatest efforts - unscrewing the metal neck fitting of our existing bottle and attempting to fit a Colombian adapter. They were however able to find an odd sized bottle to fit our space and gave very good advice about where we could use the two bottles we now have.  They also offered to return our deposit if we come back to Colombia. They really were super helpful.

name: Hotel Casa del Colibri
description: At the edge of Güicán town. Easy parking in alley right next to entrance. Sweet, easy going hostel with comfortable beds and hot showers. We had a double room with private bath at 70000cop per night for two. Full use of kitchen facilities. There is a lovely flower filled courtyard in the middle. Guides for hiking el Cocuy can be arranged here. There are hot springs nearby and a hike to La Pena de la Gloria o Pena de los Muertos.

name: Unimotos - Custom brake discs
description: We had our brake discs made here, they create discs and customise it to fit any bike! for a disc we spent between 180000 and 280000 pesos but depend on each bike. Mauricio, who works there, speaks a good English and he's super nice and helpful!

name: by the beach
description:
We parked just off the beach on this point. There was one other traveler here. Restaurants are close by and the police patroled the area overnight. We felt safe.

There are toilets on the beach nearby, however, they closed at 6pm and didn't open before we left at 11am.

name: Bend on side road
description: Nothing special, just a flat area next to a side road to stay for a night. Safe and quiet in the evening, but lots of motos in the early morning. Place to make fire, but can be windy here.

name: Armed robbery - Near club de suboficiales
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: WARNING!!! Thefts and vandalism reported in this location. Please use caution.

We were robbed by a man with a knife. We were staying in an Airbnb nearby and the small hotel near us had guests robbed at gunpoint in the pool the next day. Be careful in the area of Cielo Mar.

name: Jordan Bridge Wild Camp
description:
Nice place to install a tent. The inhabitants recommanded me to set me up here. It is safe and nice, I spent two nights here. There is a house just in front of the spot where there are shower and toilets, just ask to the woman if you can use it, and there is no problem. They also sell lunch for 8000 COP. 
There are two small shops in the center where you can buy water and small stuffs to eat.
Enjoy !

name: Finca SAN Luis cacao tour in superb landscape
description: What a wonderful place. The scenery is amazing. One of the most beautiful in Colombia. The cacao tour is excellent as well. The owners Vivian and Alejandro are very passionate and really make the best out of it. The tour takes half a day. It’s very interactive and hands on with, of course, the tasting at the end. Yummie! More comments from others, you can read under the campsite logo Finca SAN Luis.

name: Servicio Diagn Automitriz
description:
We had problems with our generator on our campervan...nobody found before... Jorge has a lot of ideas and found a solution !!! A magician...
WhatsApp : + 57 316883 3771

name: Hostel
description: Good hostel for spend a few days in Cartagena. The rooms and toilets are clean, nice staff and very cheap! We pay 18.000col pp. The hostel doesnt have name yet because is new.

name: Camping Villabosco
description: Nice grassy compound, big entrance without height limit, pool, wifi, power!

name: Venta de naranjas zona refrescante
description:
Oranges are sold here in Lima Grande Rosas. The family is lovely and helps you in whatever you need. We are invited to the river, and to share above all! Super recommendable 
--
Lugar de venta de naranjas en Lima Grande Rosas. La familia es encantadora y te ayuda en lo que necesites. Nos invitan al río, y a compartir sobre todo! Súper recomendable

name: Hotel Los Tobogones
description:
Hotel / Camping / Recreational Center.
Paid 20k pp to stay in the car. They have rooms for 150k. Nice and safe place. Has pool, , grassy area and gate are big, but there’s a narrow driveway (pictured) that gives access to the grass. Busy during weekends. I guess if your rig is too big, you can park in front of the hotel (weekdays).
No  WiFi. Cold showers. Clean bathrooms.
Paid 10k for one load of laundry washed and dried.

name: By the two rivers
description:
Super lovely woman, Gladis, who owns a small home/tienda. Quiet place just next to the cool river. She has super flat space to camp in tents or in a car/camper. We fit with no problem with a 6 meter vehicle. She also sells fresh fish, chicken and eggs. We paid 10,000cop for the night with use of shower and toilet in her house. Dirt road in is in great shape, no 4x4 needed. 
Gladis Blanco: +57 3168898442

name: El Español
description: Great little restaurant. Local food options, lunch ~10k, breakfast ~6k including drinks. Always busy with locals & the guy who runs it is lovely. Not much parking round here but if you’re in the area check it out.

name: Cabañas Dugalucurtiti
description:
Very cosy Cabañas with absolutely lovely owners.
Secure and very big parking also for big rigs right next to your bungalow.
2 Room Bungalow (Entrance with Table, Sleeping Room)
Only cold showers- but with hot temperatures it's ok.
Bathtowels provided, best breakfast so far (for 5‘000).
Cabañas for 60‘000

name: Trapiches Ecopark
description: Tent camping under a palapa (possibility for parking your campervan), showers (cold), toilets, water for drinking, can use the kitchen - wood stove. Beautiful place!! 15 000 COP/pp. Restaurant by the road but we didn't eat there.

name: Parking with no height restrictions
description: Open 24h, 4100COP for 12h, clean free  bathroom, buses enter here so it shouldn't be a problem for big rigs. Sleep in is NOT possible.

name: Autolavado
description: Carwash just before shipping from Cartagena. Good access for any size of rig. we paid 25000cop for a big rig

name: House in Virolin
description:
In this house they sell "almuerzos" for 7000 COP.
It is not an official restaurant and there are no signs, then enter and ask if they can sell you one! :-)

name: Magic Wild camp
description:
One of my favorite wild camp these last days. It is just near the river then you can wash and fill on your tanks (with a purifier because the water has a weird colour).
It is very calm, absolutely beautiful, great energy. The floor is perfect to anchor a tent!
Anyway, the truth is that there is nothing that special but I loved it. 
There are a lot of places around to set a camp. But I liked this one because it is not a private property. It is near the road, but there is nobody on this road! I have seen one car, one motorbike and one shepherd with his cows.

name: Laguna El Palmar
description: A lot of space to install a tent. Beautiful and wild. Very very calm. But... there is no water!! Which is strange for a lake. Maybe that I came when it was dry and that some part of the year it is filled in... It is possible to make fire. There is a little bit of water down in the "lake" but it is very dirty and needs to be filtered and purified.

name: Hospedaje El Sol
description:
Basic rooms, double bed, good wifi and private bathroom for 15.000COP pp.
The owner is a very nice woman.

name: Hostal Calle del Rosario
description: Comfortable hostel at this nice little town. Good view of the mountains from the balcony. Fast WiFi. Cold shower, but the weather is good... Street parking even for big rigs. Feels way safe.

name: Café La Finca
description: Great coffee, arepas and agua de panela con queso to eat right after you finish the 14 K hike around the Cocora Valley. Or eat at anytime!

name: Pozo Cristal
description: A small and beautiful waterfall. Its on private property and $1,000 COP per person. There is a small sign for it but it is barely visible. We were the only ones there and had it all to ourselves! We hiked all the way to the back and spent 1.5 hours here. If you're into the smaller spots, less touristy, then this is for you.

name: Mirador Los Pinos
description: Mirador with views of Santa Marta and the Caribbean ocean. Beautiful. It was cloudy on the day we visited but still worthwhile. The hike from Minca took us 3 hours just to the top and it was steep all the way. We are in good shape and were quite sore the next day. You can also take a moto there, if you'd like. Recommended.

name: Casa Grande Riohacha
description: One of the only places we found with secure parking (the first place we tried was full). All rooms have air conditioning, weak WiFi which is stronger in the lobby, swimming pool, breakfast included (coffee, eggs, flavorless arepa). 80k for one person, 100k for two people. More than we wanted to pay but we don’t feel comfortable leaving our motos in a paid lot off site, which is what most hotels here have. Also felt amazing to take a dip in the pool after riding in this heat all day.

name: Police Check-Point
description: Drove by at 8:00am. Police were selecting vehicles to pull over. Drivers were seen providing paperwork. We did not get stopped but FYI.

name: Buga Hostel
description: This is a really nice spot. I am on a old mbike and there was cheap supervised car park around the corner. This place is very well run, there is a cool restaurant and small bar as the main business. Not a party place but nice and chilled ideal location to use as a base to tour the area... Nearby lake Kalima is worth a look. Tell them Ken from Ireland sent you.

name: Bahia Motors
description: This is the absolutely best place to have your vehicle worked on in Colombia in our experience. Huge and safe compound will take any size rig. Richard Frost trained in the UK and the US, speaks fluent English and although his speciality is modern European cars (Porsche, Mercedes, BMW etc), he is a 4 wheel drive enthusiast and he worked happily and competently on our Land Rover - mechanical problem, electrical, welding and body work. He can order parts for you from overseas too. He ran us around helping us look for local parts and was generally just fantastic. He is well known and respected in the motor trade here and if what you need is in the country he will find it.  He charges local rates too and doesn’t add ‘tourist tax’! Cannot recommend him and his team highly enough. Call or WhatsApp +57300525769

name: Abandoned house
description:
On the way from Gámbita to Sotaquirá, nice spot at the Middle of the trek to stay with your tent. Do not use the abandoned house, there is no space to stay under with a tent. 
If you walk a little bit down (near eucalyptus trees), there is a small river to fill in your water bottles)
Enjoy the night  sky full of stars by night is beautiful !

name: Estadero la Circasia
description: Recommendable place for a typical “bandeja paisa” and other Colombian food, clean place and friendly lady, she let us fill the water tanks before leaving. 22k the big dish we shared in 2 people and drinks included. Good WiFi.

name: Potenza High Performance (workshop)
description: Workshop for KTM, Husqvarna, Kawasaki, etc. They sell good quality oil (such as full synthetic Motorex 10W50). Just got an oil change done here, but looks like a professional workshop! Friendly guys.

name: Restaurant La Avenida Central
description:
Nice people (Flor and Henrique) with delicious homemade food.
Took a shower for free... Simple but perfect. Slept in the plaza. Super safe.

name: Jungle Joe tours
description: Different Tours to explore the region. I did and loved the birding tour with the biologist & ornithologist Tony Martin, every day from 6 to 9 AM. 40,000 pp. The walk is 5 km, the track goes up and down. Saw toucan, ara, eagle, owl, woodpeckers and many beautiful little birds.

name: BBVA bank without charges
description: Could take money with credit card from the cajero automatico without commission

name: El Zaíno (Main Entrance to Tayrona NP)
description: Low season price of $53,600COP per person plus $3,000COP of mandatory insurance. Once you pay, you have the option to walk to the trailhead or take a colectivo there for $3,000 per person. TAKE THE COLECTIVO. It will save you more than an hour of walking on the side of the road. We didn't bring our van to avoid paying the vehicle entrance and parking fees. We stayed at Casa Grande and the colectivo dropped us off at the park for $2,000COP per person. This is the start point that will take you to Arrecifes, Piscina, and Cabo San Juan de Guía, and further to the nudist beach. We loved this trail and saw birds, monkeys, crabs, lizards, and lots of beautiful scenery. To Cabo San Juan and back it took us about 6 hours. We enjoyed our time here! Bring a lot of water, sunscreen and your own snacks.

name: Terpel gas station
description: Huge parking lot next to Terpel gas station. Workers told us we could stay for free. Open all night, therefore a bit noisy as trucks seem to not have any driving hours restrictions and some of them stopped to sleep in the middle of the night. We preferred to sleep here anyway instead of center of the city, with a roof tent on a campervan this location looks more quiet and safer.

name: second best spot in ipiales
description:
OK so obviously the teleférico is the place to be
But! It closes at 7 so if you're too late try this spot. It's a simple but large dugout/turnout on a secluded dirt road. Nobody around to bother you, space for big rigs, and protection from the wind. Room for doggos to wander without worrying. So if you miss the cutoff for the teleferico head this way!

name: Hotel y Restaurante el Parqueadero
description: At night, we found this place to sleep... 20k by van to sleep in the parking lot or the same price for a room with a/c.. we took the room! Clean and good shower. Little diner next door, cool for the evening.

name: Restaurante San Pablin
description: Really good restaurant for chicken! we bought a whole chicken for 18000 with potatoes.

name: Routa du Cactus
description: This road goes via a beautiful canyon. Feels like the wild wild west... enormoes cactus every where and a lot of different species! Beautiful!

name: Restaurante El Mirador Zambrano Bol
description: They were happy to let us camp here for the night. The owner said we could for free but we left $10,000COP for the guy that stayed the night on-site to watch the property and our van. Clean toilets available. So friendly and so welcoming. They let us set up a spot to cook (despite having a restaurant here) and also allowed us to use their sink to wash our kitchenware. We recommend. FYI, they only spoke Spanish.

name: Panaderia y Pasteleria
description: Small bakery on side of minor street serving lots of savoury and sweet items. Coffee isn’t fantastic but it’s a nice quiet spot just outside of town.

name: Las Cordobas
description: Awesome little place serving traditional Vallecaucano BBQ food. The owner speaks a little English and is very friendly. The deserts are also traditional and delicious!

name: The Camping Zone
description: Small, quiet and basic campsite in safe location. Simple facilities, private toilet, shower and use of the kitchen in the owner’s house if you like. 20,000cop per person. Supermarket at the end of the road, walking distance to beach, near the airport. It was extremely quiet at night. Given the lack of decent campsites in Santa Marta I recommend this as a reasonable spot. Great for bikers as the owner is a keen ADV rider.

name: Hôtel Costa Linda
description: Nice hotel parking with swimming pool and nice beach. Good food & cocktails.Very calm as in a dead end road. Wood bridge on the road so camping cars and big rigs won’t access. Vans and 4x4 with rtt ok. 30000 for 1 van (2 people).

name: Caio Bella Pizzeria
description:
I would say this is the best pizza I’ve had in South America. 

Granted, it’s not faced much serious competition, but still well worth checking out if you’re in the area. starting at 25mil per pizza. (07/2023)

name: Aprisco la española
description: Ask at the Plaza for the correct location. The best restaurant in colombia! you need to call before (3122115323). We had an almuerzo with delicious salad, soup, meat with rice, patatoes, yuca and desert and great goat cheese. (~20‘000 cop/pP.) They also have rooms. Highly recommend!

name: Riverside
description: I was on my way to Laguna el Palma to camp, but couldn't pass due to road works. Too late to approach the lake from the other side, so I found this spot. It's not much, just enough space to put a tent between the road and the river. It's a dead end road going to a cattle grazing area, so no traffic. I asked the family living at the other side of the river, they said "no problem at all". Access to the river for water. Maybe possible to park a small van or car next in the same spot, but no rooftop tent due to overhanging trees.

name: Lavandería "The Perfect Clean"
description: It took some time for me to find a lavandería (per kilo) in this area (all the ones in Google maps simply didn't seem to exist), so I'm adding it here. Quick service, dropped off at noon, collected by 6pm. 8,000 pesos per kilo. Friendly staff, happy with their service!

name: La Jagua downtown
description: Very cute little town of La Jagua where we stayed overnight by the main square, in front of the church. Very safe place with friendly and curious locals. Has some restaurants, a coffee place and a panaderia.

name: Centro Vacacional Bellohorizonte
description: It is a good place, with a peak and a large green area for camping, at the entrance to Cartago, Valle del Cauca.

name: La Estrella de mar
description:
TAKE CARE!  These are NOT honest people.

When we arrived, we asked if we could stay overnight next to the restaurant, just park there with our truckcamper.  The lady asked us 20.000 COP.  We refused.  Then she lowered the price to 10.000 COP.  We left and visited the village.  1 hour later we returned and wanted to pay, but the lady told us we could stay for free.
When we wanted to leave early the next morning, we were surrounded by some men, who told us the lady asked 20.000 COP again.  We refused.  They put wooden blocks before our wheels, started to ask for 30.000 COP.
We went to the police office.  The officer came with us, but he could not do anything because it is on private property.  After a long discussion, the police officer said paying is the only solution, he asked us 10.000 COP.  What we did not know at that moment is that the police officer would pay the other 10.000 COP.  Once back at the police office, we paid the man the 10.000 COP back, what he refused.  So, this is our first time we put money in the pocket of an officer. We explained to him that we in fact didn’t want to pay the lady, because she is not honest and besides she would think that she can treat every future guest like that!

It is the parking lot at the beach side, owned by the restaurant La Estrella de mar next to it, also the same owner of 7 Mares at the opposite.
So please, don’t park over there and look around for another restaurant.  There are plenty of them.

name: Carwash Parking Lot
description: We could not find a spot for the night.  We asked a police officer in the street for a safe place.  He called 2 colleagues who escorted us to this place.  It is a carwash with a large parking lot.  We got free music until late night.  They asked us 8.000 COP for the night.   The police men were very friendly and helpful.  We invited them to enter the truckcamper.  They were very surprised, they never saw such a small house with a kitchen and bathroom.  Funny experience.

name: Observatorio Astronómico Astrosur
description:
This is the other observatory in town run by Javier.  Talks start at 7 and go until 9.  I can’t speak towards the other observatory, but this one was great.  He sets up 6 or so big telescopes to look through.  We got to see Jupiter and it’s moons, Saturn, several different star clusters, and an unbelievable close up of the moon. After looking through the telescopes, he talks about the constellations and the history of astronomy for an hour or so.  Highly recommend, but please note it’s all in Spanish.  Cost is 10k Colombian pesos per person.

Javier’s number is 3104656765. You can call earlier in the day to ask about conditions.

name: Lá Gata Parrilha
description:
Very good restaurant with good music and a great food. We had a Trout fish and Pork Ribs both very well prepared + a great price!
The bad news is that they are only open from Friday to Monday.

name: Obando Arqueologic Site
description:
Interesting tombs where you can go 5 meters down 5 and acess some of the graveyards.
3000pp

Also the cheapest place to buy artesanias made of banana leaves, straight from the artesanos.

name: South turn-off to Cabo de la Vela
description: Looks promising, but tarmac last just first two kilometers, then becomes hard sand. Passing on Thursday late afternoon I've seen two ropes on the ground and nobody to collect. Road in maps.me seems to be accurate.

name: Villa Cacao
description: Chocolate Cafe, a place to enjoy and discover colombian cacao, chocolate and coffee. Chocolate tastings. Handcrafted chocolate, macarons, chocolate bars and compliments.

name: Rough Road
description: This is one of the more rough roads we’ve taken on our trip. It’s intermittently better and worse but part of what makes it so bad is its length. Over 140 km from La Plata to Popayan. This route was recommended to us as the route from Tierradentro to Popayan is closed. Can’t speak to what the road is like to San Agustin but I have to assume it’s better than this. You don’t need a 4x4, we have a 2WD sprinter and it’s passable, just rough. Loads of potholes and really rocky, some parts worse than others. Took about 5 hours from Tierradentro to this marked point, going through La Plata. Google says another 2.5 to Popayan from here for a total of 7.5 hours to Popayan (if google is accurate). Locals in Tierradentro told us it was 4 hours to San Agustin and 4 hours from San Agustin to Popayan for a total of 8 hours so essentially equivocal. Just be aware!

name: Tejidos Patricia Saenz
description: Artisan crafts, beautiful handmade fabrics, bags, crochet, souvenirs and a really good service.

name: Don Emilio / Coconut Gabriel
description:
This is not really an hostel (it used to be a long Time ago). But Gabriel likes receive people and share. He is making delicious hamburgers, cake, grilled coconut..
José Gabriel is a very nice and interested person, with a Crazy life story! He travelled a lot and makes cool art. He is living here with his mum, and they we welcome you with pleasure, if you are a nice and easy traveller ! Do not expect a hotel service. It is more like to arrive in a friend house. There is some showers with hot water. The colonial house is just incredible, and as well very hold.
You can use the kitchen, and Gabriel and his mum will ne happy sometimes to share the breakfast or the lunch with you.
Regarding the price, it is natural ans simple, but there is not a fixed price. I offered some bears to Gabriel, he offered me some food, and I gave 50 000 COP for 3 nights.
The kind of place where you plan to stay one night and you finally stay 1 Month ! :-)
Enjoy you stay there and give a hug to Gabriel for me (Tibo, el francés !)

if you do not find, just ask for José Gabriel in the village, Everybody knows him

name: Parking Lot below sports center
description:
Safe parking lot next to the street with security cameras. Not totally quiet but less road noise than at the gas station a few meters away. Free bathrooms at the gas station. If you enter the parqueadero from the gas station there is the stairs to the sports center above, where they have showers in the bathrooms - when we werde there unfortunately without water.
Supermarket across the street.
Big rigs could fit here occupying several parking lots but not really recomended.

name: Villa Salenco
description:
6 blocks from the main street. It is a beautiful villa with an adorable family that allowed us to park our motorhome and we rented a room at a more than affordable price. With kitchen and bathroom included. It also has the hammock area and the possibility of camping.

A 6 cuadras de la calle principal. Es una hermosa villa con una adorable familia que nos permitió parquear nuestro motorhome y nos rento una habitación a un precio más que accesible. Con cocina y baño incluida. También cuenta con la zona de hamacas y con posibilidad de acampar.

name: Ruta 10
description:
Good place to stop, quiet and quite spacious. Water availability in a waterfall a few meters. Route 10 after San Francisco is no longer paved and is in poor condition and, although Mocoa is not more than 100 km away, it takes you many hours of driving. It is a mountain road with a lot of truck traffic and in many sectors it is quite narrow.


Buen lugar para parar, tranquilo y bastante espacioso. Disponibilidad de agua en una cascada a unos pocos metros. La ruta 10 después de San Francisco ya no es asfaltada y se encuentra en mal estado y, si bien hasta Mocoa no son más de 100 km, te lleva muchas horas de manejo. Es un camino de montaña con bastante tránsito de camiones y en muchos sectores se angosta bastante.

name: Pablo Escobar Tour
description:
Real Pablo Escobar tour. 150.000 Cob/p
Very interesting.

name: Govinda Vege Restaurant
description: Reasonably priced food (I'm usually a stinge). Good view and you can refill water bottles here.

name: La Merced
description:
Very good quality food with lots of options on pasta, pizza, fish, meat and coffee. The range of prices is wide as well so you can pick what is best for your pocket. Recommended!
But if you are just ok with the cheapest and best almuerzo,, you should try the Tayrona restaurant on the same road just a 20 meter down in direction of the Koala Inn :)

name: Guatape Motos
description:
Guatape Motos is a small motorcycle rental business, run by an international crew (German, Colombian, Polish...).
They are very welcoming and can provide overlanders with free and accurate information about the region. 
If needed, there is a good English/Spanish/German speaking motorcycle mechanic on hand.

name: Near hospital on the beach
description:
As the site behind the Hilton Hotel seems to be closed this is the new place to be in Cartagena.
No amenities but free, many travelers.
Directly on the beach, some trees give shadow.

name: Parqueadero 9A
description: If you are in Pasto go into a safe parking, but not this one. Toilet is extremely dirty and you need a key. They even complain about 10 liters of water and will charge a completely overpriced value for water and electricity if you need it. In front of the entrance armed robberies and crack dealing. Not safe after dark.

name: Lanteria
description: Nice small place in town of Cabo de la Vela to repair your tires!! Small leakage costs 15000. The man has good skills!

name: Truckers parking lot
description: I parked behind a small restaurant in the parking lot of the smaller hotel. The restaurant closes and there’s toilet and water to be used. There’s a vigilant all night (I guess as he was not here in the morning). Felt safe. Vigilant asked for a tip in the morning, but wasn’t here at 8 to receive it...

name: Secure Parking
description:
swimming pools and big place to spend the night. we stopped here for lunch time, our children enjoyed the clean and big swimming pools( with tobbogan!) and the nice owner proposed for us to stay for the night in the closed and secure park. 
everything for 16000 pesos for 5 persons... 
really nice place.

name: Shower
description: Esso Station. Just stopped wen we saw a sign with shower... sharing!

name: Hotel Suites Inn Económicas
description: Little hostel in a safe and quiet district, COP 75'000/night for double room with private bathroom, hot water, basic breakfast but most interesting : very safe private parking included (no height limitation but may be too narrow for big rigs). 10-15min to the center with a cab. Personal very helpful.

name: Jordan Main Plaza
description: Parked in front of the plaza, facing the bridge. No facilities. There’s WiFi from the bar across the street, until it closes. Super safe.

name: La Posada del Caminante
description: I wild camped in front of this posada, but added it here in case you need some structure.

name: Police Checkpoint
description: We drove by at 11:00am and were pulled over. The police reviewed driver license, vehicle permit, and vehicle insurance. Friendly and courteous officer. Less than 5 minutes and we were on our way to Bucaramanga.

name: Parrilla Bufalo Senta'o
description: Stopped here because it was packed with truckers. Most of the menu is burgers and they were delicious! One of the best I have had in all of our travels and it was buffalo meat. Moderate prices (15 to 18K COP) for a full meal (burger, fries, and drink). Great service and atmosphere. Recommended!

name: Estadero Mis Ojitos
description:
Parking lot used for vans with tourists when visit Pozo Azul. There is a family living there that is very friendly. They allowed us to park for 5000 COP a day and 5000 COP a night. There is a kiosko for drinks and snacks, and toilets for 1000 COP. The house had electricity, but we didn't ask to use it. There are a lot of tourist during the morning visiting Pozo Azul, but we were alone and place is very quiet during the night. Cheaper than others parking lots in town. 
--- 
Estacionamiento usado por los transportes de turistas hacia el Pozo Azul.  La familia que vive allí es muy acogedora. Ellos cobran 5000 COP por el parqueo durante el día y otros 5000 COP para pasar la noche. Atienden también un kiosko donde venden bebidas y snaks. La casa tiene electricidad, pero no consultamos si era posible utilizarla. Durante la mañana llegan muchísimos turistas para ir a visitar el pozo azul, pero durante la noche quedamos solos y el lugar es muy tranquilo. Es mas barato que los estacionamiento en el pueblo.

name: El Palmar
description: It is actually a hotel, but they offer cheap camping options with toilets and shower. Safe inside.

name: Campsite on the way to Villadeleyva from Arcabuco
description:
Very nice place to stay one night. The owners of the field are the owners of the small shop just nearby, in the corner. Ask them if you can stay here with your tent and there is no problem. You can give them 2000 or 3000 COP for the principle, or buy some food in their shop.
Beautiful view and very quiet spot!

name: Camping Pozo de la Vieja
description:
Free camping near a nice pozo where it is very nice to swim and refresh. 
I did not stay here for the night but the camping seems to be free. there a showers and bathroom. there are fireplaces to do barbecues.
Beatiful spot!
Edit: it is not free. If closed you have to ask at a house nearby.

name: Carsuluma
description: Nice and cheap campsite, very safe and close to the town. It has several camping spots on a hill with an awesome view of Tabio.

name: Zapatoca Plaza
description: Spent the night at this plaza. Very nice town with even nicer people. The mirador they have 4km away from here is simply the best you’ll find period. Espetacular!

name: Mirador Zapatoca - Stunning!!
description: Simply the best mirador in the region. Great to wild camp also. No services. There’s a restaurant that works on weekends, and I bet it’s busy, by its size and the incredible view. A must...

name: El Patio
description:
Delicious lunch - usually 3 options including a vegetarian option for menu del día $13,500 includes fruit, fresh juice, main course with salad. 
Service was also great!  
Free parking out front. 
Definitely recommend for healthy, delicious and well prepared option in Neiva. We were told there is also live music at night.

name: SOMEVI Pizza
description: Very good place for food and drinks, we had pizza, hamburgers and lasagne and all of it was very good, fresh and with high quality ingredients. prices are very good for the quality of the food. Check out the cocos-lemonade! Went here twice!

name: Side street to the park
description: I felt even safer here, in front of buildings 46-23 and 46-27, as their cameras are at least on... Good for one night. Slow WiFi from the plaza.

name: Tremenda vista!
description:
Beautiful place to stop, free and with a spectacular view. About 200 meters from where the food shops start and very close to the observatory.
--
Hermoso lugar para parar, gratis y con una vista espectacular. A unos 200 metros de donde empiezan los locales de comida y muy cerca del observatorio.

name: Embarcation to Uramba Bahia Málaga Park
description:
Here is the place to take boats for destinations along the Pacific coast (even until Nuqui if you want!). We paid 75k/person for the roundtrip to Juanchaco, 15 days available. 3 departures/day. We took the boat at 1pm, you need to be 30minutes before for the registration. They want to sell you whales tours, but you can find it at Juanchaco, where all the tours are starting.  Juanchaco has nothing fancy. Better to go to Ladrilleros or La Barra. 
Ask to your hostel with who to go for whales watching because there's a "mafia" and not all the tours are well made. We 30000 COP for one tour.

name: Terpel
description: A small mechanics and car wash next to Terpel gas station. Not sure what the deal is but they're probably employed by Terpel as we got our car washed + tires checked for free! The guy seemed to know what he's doing. There were a couple trucks being repaired also so they may do more than just tires. Just give them a tip when they're done. There's also a small shop, a restaurant and a hotel is opening soon.

name: Chapman Mall
description: Little new shopping mall with a big parking lot. Located in an quiet safe neighborhood! Night guard! French bakery for breakfast! Wifi from Pizzeria...

name: Vía Pietra
description: Nice restaurant with pizzas, pastas and reasonable prices. The pesto and the red sauce tasted fresh and homemade. Very attentive service. Pizzas are 8K and pastas range from 10k to 15k. Had the house wine which was only 4K and delicious. Plenty vegetarian options available. We ended up coming here three out of the four nights we were in Popayán. Good cocktails across the street.

name: flatspot next to cementerio
description: Flat spot overlooking Mongui. spectacular view. super quiet and discreet neighbors! No facilities.

name: La escuela
description:
Incredible quiet ans beautiful place. It is a small school, for 5 peoples who come from the montain around!
You will enjoy the nature and the nice and simple owners. 
A common step when you are doing the trek Juntas --> Termales del Cañon. 
Lunch : 12000 COP
Rooms : 25000 pp
Tent : 12000 pp
Dinner and Breakfast : possible but I do not know the price because I did not take it.
 you can hire a horse to bring yourself or your packages up to the termales : 70000COP/horse
Enjoy!

name: La finca las Nieves
description:
Nice refuge. Nice view. Very simple but you will be happy to install your tent under a good roof. 
There is a pipe with natural water nearby. 
If you Carry on the direction to the termales del Cañon, la escuela, 1h30 from there, is a better place to stay, but not for free.

name: Flotadores and waterfall guided hikes
description:
When you get to San Cipriano you'll have to pay a 5,000 cop pp entrance as it is a natural reserve. Along this 4 or 5 blocks town, you'll be offered
flotadores to swim down the river and hikes to a waterfall. 

The flotadores are great fun and they cost 10k all day (negotiable). Walk to the last permitted charco (where the 2 rivers merge), jump on the flotador and let the current do it's job. It took us about an hour and a half to swim down the river and back to the town. Some parts are super quick and exciting! some others are just relaxing pools. 

The guided hike to the beautiful waterfall is also a worthy experience. It costs around 30k (negotiable). It is recommended to do it with a guide since you need to walk through the jungle,  cross the river, streams and you could easily get lost or find undesirable animals. Once you get to the waterfall, after walking through the wet jungle for 30min, climb the rocky wall and dive into this refreshing natural pool!

Tip 1: Wear comfy clothes and shoes, it's muddy and you'll get soaking wet. We wore swimsuits and crocs and it was the best choice due to the mud and to swim in the river.
Tip 2: Take a waterproof bag
Tip 3: Take a gopro or a waterproof camera
Tip 4: Choose low season

name: Mercado Campesino La Mesa de Los Santos
description: A farmers market with a twist. Come here to taste local food, drink local beer and coffee. Don't leave the place without eating "arepas de choclo" @ "La Natural"...the best you will find in the area. If you need to re-stock your fridge with fresh fruits and produce this is also a great place to do so. The market works every day of the week, but it comes alive on weekends.

name: Terpel Parking Lot
description: We stayed here for free. Clean toilet and sink available. We parked on the other side of the hotel. Friendly staff. They only sell drinks but you can find some food across the street or next door. Other truckers parked next to us overnight so you'll need ear plugs; however, it was quiet from 11:00pm - 5:00am. Recommended for 1 night.

name: Museo del Oro
description: An incredible museum! It is $4,000 COP per person (an additional $8,000 COP if you want the audio-guide) and a must if you come to Bogota. It is one of the most visited and contains more than 55,000 pieces of gold and other materials from Colombia's major pre-hispanic cultures. The descriptions are in Spanish and English. Highly recommended!

name: Aerosur
description:
Place where we picked up our motorbikes after sending them in the airplane from Bogota. More info about shipping in the post called Aerosur next to airport in Bogota.

The location is approximate, it's outside of terminal building, on the right side while walking towards the town.

name: Aerosur
description: We were brought here by the guy from Cargorider and send from here our motorbikes to Leticia. Price was 3800 pesos per kg. Because of the bulk of the bikes each was considered as 300 kg. We had to wrap them to plastic bubble material and tape, with which the Cargorider guy helped quite substantially. Payment is possible only in cash, there are ATMs at the airport.

name: Tienda universidad popular
description: That friendly lady of the small shop next to the university entrance, allowed us to stay overnight behind her shop, for a tip. We gave her 10.000 COP, she was very happy. Shady spot, under a big tree. Perfect place to park our 7,6 m long, 3,4 m high, 2,5 m wide, truckcamper.  Very quiet.

name: Norma’s
description: Propane bottles filling station. They don’t have the right adapter to fill US bottles. But if you have one, they are very friendly and willing to help.

name: Reycol
description: We tried to get our US propane bottles filled, but didn’t find any supplier that had the right adapter. Even those who did fill US bottles previously, as mentioned on I-Overlander, couldn’t help us anymore. After searching several days, on several locations, we decided to buy an adapter. But ... also not easy to find. Finally found a store that made a solution for us, a kind of adapter, with which we can now have filled our propane on any propane plant in Colombia (Most probably also in other South American Countries), where they fill local bottles. Strange shop, but they have all kind of small mechanical material, that you don’t find at Homecenter. Not a very safe neighbourhood, park your car in front of the shop. If the shop looks closed, knock on the yellow door at the right side, they like to sell behind closed doors.

name: Parque Nacional Chingaza (southern entry)
description: This is the location where NP Chingaza starts. No entry for motorcycles allowed. Permit to be requested through the website of NP's Colombia. No checkpoint here though, just a sign along the road. There is supposed to be a checkpoint at the northern entry.

name: Parque Principal
description: There are flat parking spots and the fiscalis are in front. The military told us that the place is save and later the police checked our documents and told us that they watch this area at night. It was very quiet, but very very hot! Almost coudn’t sleep.

name: Electro Estufas
description: We had problems with our gas-kitchen and in the store before they told us that we should buy a new one. But Jose Luis repaired it in 15 min and it works better than before. He seems to know a lot about ovens (electric and gas). And he did it even for free.

name: Hospedaje Balcon de Oro
description: We stayed here for one night. The rooms are very basic, but they are clean and have ac. We paid 20’000 cop for two people and the parking slot was just in front of our room.

name: Colombian immigration
description:
That is a place where you can do your immigration papers after flying in from Bogota, before leaving to Brazil. Guy here was really nice and efficient.

There is no immigration office at the actual border. Just a lady from DIAN (customs) sitting under umbrella and she should collect your TIP  and photocopy of the passport and the page with exit stamp.

name: parking
description:
Miguel the super friendly owner you have to pay the price, is closed very central. We had to stop urgently in salento better stop in Finland


Miguel el dueño super amable le tienes q peliar el precio, es cerrado muy céntrico. Tuvimos q para de urgencia en salento mejor parar en Finlandia

name: Printer - stickers maker
description: With help of locals we made our proper sticker here, very cheap and good work.

name: Playa Isaashi Restaurant y Hospedaje
description: Nice service provided by this people in a very nice and quiet beach. I had spent 25 in beer, and another 25 in food, and then asked if there was a place to stay in the car around here, and was offered to stay and use toilets and 2 buckets of potable water for shower for 10k COP for 2 people.

name: Parque
description:
Park located in a residential neighborhood.
 It has security at night. We slept two very quiet nights. Super silent!

name: Hoyo del aire
description: Beautiful canyon hole of probably more than 100mts, a couple of condors and lovely landsacape. Any car can enter very close to the canyon, follow the signs.

name: Old Textile Factory Ruins
description: These are the ruins of of the first textile factory in colombia, great for taking pictures and there is an small museum close by with a huge green space. might accept Campers but we did not ask

name: Esso gas station
description: We were here the 1st day of the month when the whole town or even region, don’t have any more diesel and just some petrol... but at least they let us fill our water tanks

name: Termales San Juan
description:
Termales San Juan/mini Yellowstone. 
Open from 10 am-3 pm.

After a 1.1km walk from the ranger station, there's walk around small blue geysers, yellow sulfur rivers and green foam. It costs 20,000 COP/person, unique, wonderful and there's nobody during the week. It really deserves a stop, that's why we add a new point.

name: Mall (buy SIM cards and lots more)
description: Large, typical shopping mall. We bought SIM cards from Claro. 3,000COP per SIM, then 20,000 for 15 days unlimited calls and texts, 2GB data, and free Facebook, WhatsApp, Twitter. Took nearly an hour. Just need a passport for each SIM.

name: Primax
description: We stopped to fuel up and asked if they had water, they brought us behind the station where there was a hose to fill up our water tanks. They did not ask for anything for the water. Nice guys

name: Overdrive - transmition mechanics
description:
Really helpful mechanics that specialise in transmissions. Worked on my dodge b350. 
The owner speaks English well

name: Polimetria taller de cerámica
description:
This is the new location of the ceramic place. They have really beautiful items and they give one day workshops. 


Esta es la nueva ubicación del taller de cerámica. Muy recomendable!!! Tienen piezas muy hermosas y también dan talleres del proceso.

name: Suites Hotel
description: Perfect place to stay in Medellin. Very clean apartment with kitchen, amazing view on Medellin and very modern look. Secure gated parking for cars up to about 2,5 meters. We booked on booking.com, not cheap, but worth it.

name: DIAN Lady
description:
Table and umbrella where sits DIAN lady. You can leave here your TIP when exiting Colombia. Just bring copy of the TIP, your passport and page with exit stamp from Colombia.

To enter Colombia you would probably have to go to the office in the town.

name: DIAN (customs) office
description: We were sent here by DIAN lady to ask about exit procedure. Probably the place where you get your TIP when entering Colombia.

name: hostal gaston
description: This a brand new hostel. They offer 3000$ warm showers and also laundry services to travelers. The showers are super clean and the place is really neat.

name: Hotel La Batea
description: Had to stop here as it got late on our way to Medellín. Really nice hotel with a restaurant that serves fresh fish. 30.000 Cop for two people. Very clean, good WiFi, gated parking, nice owners. Fan only which is really sufficient as it is quite high up the mountains.

name: Hotel Panorama
description: Clean Hotel on the way between Medellin and Cartagena. Secure parking, 3 meters high garage. Hotel is on booking.com...best price there

name: Flat/free street parking
description: We spent 2 nights here no problem. They do not charge for parking on this side of town. Safe, free and 2 blocks from the town center.

name: Hospedaje  Mi Casa
description: Basic  trucker Hotel ... room for two , A/C, clean bed and bathrooom, tv, restaurant on premises. 35 mil for two. Plenty of parking. Easy access for Big Rigs!

name: Gas Station Mobil (Parking)
description: We didn‘t want to stay in Medellin, but were too tired to continue driving. The guy at the gas station said that we could stay there. There are cameras and a guard is there the whole night. We slept surprisingly well, it wasn‘t even that noisy. There are toilets, a shop and a restaurant (which we didn‘t try). Not the best place, but not the worst either.

name: Inti Ande hotel
description:
Very good and economic place.
30000 COP with shared bathroom
40000COP with private bathroom 
very clean and confortable
You have more economic in Tuquerres (17000 COP) but very bad.. so I really recommend this place Which is very correct

name: Minkalab Organic Farm
description:
*Before coming here, please contact us: +57 3204157666

Minkalab is a combination of an organic farm, nature reserve, and community meeting space. We have private rooms and space for camping with all that you need.  We also host a variety of workshops each month and serve as a regional point of encounter for environmental awareness, art, traditional ritual, holistic medicine, birding, hiking and more.
We are very close to many points of interest including two hot springs, waterfalls, the snow-capped peak of Santa Isabel, laguna Otun and the towns/cities Pereira, Manizales, Salento, Filandia, and Armenia.
We have organic products for sale such as coffee, medicinal oils, and honey among others. We also offer tours of the coffee farm, bird watching, bio-construction, and organic agriculture.
With your visit fees, we finance the agro-ecological project Minkalab and our natural reserve.

name: Almojabanas de cuajada y queso
description: A very typical food in Colombia ALMOJABANAS (best ones ore the ones made of Cuajada) order them with Agua de panela  and queso Pera. (Warm sugar cane tea and cheese). Quick and delicious treat for the road. You may have this somewhere else in  Colombia but you can trust us - these ones are the better. We are Colombians so we know ;) perfect for cold weather or quick breakfast.

name: Masala Place Vegan Restaurant
description:
There's a new vegan place opened here. The service is very slow but the food is good. 

When Tomate (down the road) inevitably runs out of food this could be an alternative. Not tried Tomate but hard to believe its better than here!

name: Filandia Quindío
description: We spent a night here. Was free, safe and quiet. Two blocks away from the main square and most importantly, flat!!!

name: Carmina
description:
One of the best restaurant I have been in Colombia 
mane plates for around 16000 COP.
Italian food
very good cheese
very tasty sangria 
deserts are awesome !

name: Cristal Autos
description: Best place to repair or have any type of glass custom made. Windsheilds, wibdows, etc. No gringo tax here

name: Peaje - Don't pay again
description:
If you are driving from Cartagena you only have to pay toll in 2 stations. 
You have to save the 2nd ticket for free pass in this toll.

name: Diesel del Oriente
description: Workshop specialized in diesel vehicles. Great service. Excellent know how and equipment. We made a maintenance and repair of injectors. Highly recommended.

name: Neighbourhood parkinglot
description:
Quiet and safe parkinglot in the middle of neighborhood. Very nice and friendly people. Free. 
Bus (Metrolínea) to Bucaramanga costs 2450$.

name: Ropa para mascotas, Pet's clothes
description:
A Lot of Beautiful clothes for all sizes, and the best: super cheap! There are really beautiful and stilish things, very good Quality. Is a familiar store, the owners  (Gladys and ver daughters) are amazing and they love Sharing  with travelers.
Telephone number: +573134132492 (she uses Whatsapp) and Instagram is @copiglas

Hermosas prendas para todos los talles, y lo mejor: muy baratas! Son realmente hermosas, de buena calidad. Es una empresa familiar, de una familia realmente hermosa (Gladys y sus hijas) que les encanta compartir con viajeros!!

name: Quédate aqui Hotel y Restaurante
description:
Beautiful hotel, warm and stylish. The art gallery is amazing. Located near central park. 
The rooms have Cañon views! Private bathroom, delicious breakfast, kitchen available, wifi, tv, solar heater. 
Martha, the host, is nice and very helpful, she will give you good tips about Barichara and surroundings.
Special prices for overlanders!
Contact Katherina the manager: quedateaquibarichara@gmail.com, Telephone number and Whatsapp: ±573173103863 or ±573185565634 , Instagram: @quedateaquibarichara

name: El Totumo (Espacio para niños)
description:
Playgroup for kids from 3 to 7 years old. 
Playing, reading, music, ecology, creativity in the middle of nature. Amazing! We wanted to stay for 2 days in Barichara and our kid enjoyed here two months.
 Rodrigo and Milena are the owners and fathers of two kids in this beautiful space. They are very kind and interesting people, as the rest of  the other parents.
Telephone: +57 3104850711 (Rodrigo) +57 3105593704(Ana Milena- Whatsapp-)

name: Paso del Angel
description:
Little parking lot near Paso del ángel Trail and the road. Super quiet. Free. 
 Enter to the trail cost 3k pp.

name: Casa Lumo
description:
Excellent place to rest for a few days, in the middle of nature, near to the beautiful and interesting Barichara (you can go in Mototaxi) and even closer to Villanueva (good for eating typical food and shopping, because it is much cheaper than Barichara)
 We planned to stay 2 or 3 days and stayed for two months there!
 It is a good place to park, very safe, with incredible views.

  Bathroom, water, wifi, washing machine, electricity if you need it.
 Viviana, the owner, is very nice. She built her house in an eco-sustainable way, with rainwater collection. She can also advise very well on how to spend some beautiful days in the area (activities, walks, yoga, workshops)

 She works designing and sewing clothes, if you need new clothes with style and not expensive talk to her.
 Children are very welcome!
Please contact her by Whatsapp or call her before going: +57 315 5170543

name: Automatic
description:
Specialized whorkshop in automatic trasmission. 
Also general mechanics.

name: Biblioteca y espacios de juego niños y adultos
description:
Comfaboy Library is a public and free place. Also there are table games, puzzles, playground and ball's pool, everything in  very good condition.
Beautiful place for family time and be covered in rainny days.

name: Spot by the river
description:
Great place near the river. Plenty of space with shade and grass. Three block from market and main square. Super quiet and safe. Opposite there is a sport field with playground and bathroom (only open during the evening).
Easy to come and exit for any vehicle.  Free.

name: Morada Dulce de caña hostal
description:
Hostel in the beautiful town of Ingenio. Good place to stop on the Galeras road. Very quiet and friendly people. 
It has space to park and sleep in your vehicle.
Many possibilities for trekking from here, very good trails to the river and waterfalls.
Juan Manuel, is a very good guide of the area. Highly recommended!!!!

name: Parking
description: Secured parking, we paid 6000 COP for the night for our camper van. No height limit, OK for big rigs. They close the gate between 22h and 5h. Nice family running the place

name: Shalá Cafe restaurant
description: Very good food for good prices. Best carbonara I've had in a while, not the usual scrambled egg crap. Carbonara 17k cop, nice burger and chips 13k, decent selection on the menu.

name: Restaurant Crepes Pizza
description: Excellent thin crust pizza. Range from 36000-56000 for a large pizza (it’s even bigger than it looks on their sign). Delicious, filling for 2 hungry people, and nice service. (Sorry didn’t take a photo until after we finished!).

name: Taller Leo Motos
description: Got a few things welded up here and did a couple of modifications. Nice guys and they work fast. They do just about anything you need

name: Garage -no name
description: We were staying at the paragliding place when we saw a screw in a tire. A guy called for us the garage which reopened for us. He repaired our tire for 14000 Cop. Really nice guy.

name: Food Market in Barrio Bolivar Gallery
description: Fantastic food that has won culinary awards. Multiple food stalls and probably the best market food I've had in all of South America. the San Cocho was delicious.

name: Hotel La Vía
description: Affordable pet friendly motel close to puerto Baru. Pool, restaurante, little store, truck wash , and tires.  Large secure parking for big rigs. Stayed here while waiting to ship north to Veracruz . Little less than 20$ US per night. Rooms A/C  TV  cold shower , clean, and restaurant is good and affordable. May be possible to stay in parking area for a fee! Did not ask.

name: Café Bar Universal
description:
Here's another place for all you foodies out there.
Unassuming from the outside but once inside you will experience some amazing dishes full of flavour.
Again not for overlanders on a tight budget but definitely worth the expense.
Even if you don't have room for dessert we would recommend marinated lulo, 100%, not to be missed.
Great food and staff.

name: Davivienda ATM
description: 2’000’000pesos withdrawn without any fee!!

name: Taller Carlos Rubio - Cerrajeria
description: We went there on the advice of Leo (a garage owner just near the place and on ioverlander). The lock of our camper did not worked anymore so he put a new big lock (see photos). Good job for 100 000 Cop. Nice guy. His business card is in the photos.

name: Street parking
description:
It’s supposed to be the safest area in metropolitan Medellin, or so the people who control from 8h to 24h will tell you. We found this kind of quiet street and stayed for the night, noisy above all in the morning. If you stay here you pay 3’200pesos/h from 8h to 24h... so from 10 to 10 (12h) we paid 12’800 pesos which seems cheaper than other places + your just next to the streets where you have plenty of nice bars and restaurants.
If you’ re a big rig like us, try to find a box at the end of a row (or beginning) so you occupy only one space. Otherwise you might be charged the double for occupying 2 boxes...

name: SuperGas
description: The only place in Pasto that would fill our gas bottle. It’s from Bogota but non standard so the other two places refused. Very helpful and did the refill on a Saturday afternoon.

name: Mekatos
description: This little restaurant offers simple but good almuerzo for 6000 COP. The owner is very friendly. All the local bus drivers come here to eat. There are not many restaurants heading South.

name: Jacaranda
description:
This is a newly opened family business with multiple sleeping options. It is located on the edge of Mocoa next to the road but submerged in forest. Frank and Martha are lively, relaxed  hosts with a wealth of knowledge, they love to share their warm company with guests. There are multiple different sleeping options for all budgets. 

Facilities:
- Pool
- Dining area/ lounge
- Laundry (5k per load in large washing machine)
- Parking
- Natural pools
- Wildlife (monkeys frequently visit) 
- Iowaska and Galé (prepared by a local Shaman)

Sleeping options: 
- Tent/Car  5k pppn. (use of pool 2k and kitchen 5k, electricity 5k per car)
- Hammock 10k pppn. (with mosquito netting)
- Dorm room 20k pppn. 
- Single bed 20k pppn. 
- Double room with ensuite 40k pppn. 

The kitchen and pool are free for all sleeping options apart from camping. 

We thoroughly enjoyed staying here, all they care about is making you feel comfortable and love to share local  knowledge. The quirky place is scattered in antiques such as film machines, typewriters etc. They plan to develop the lodge to create treehouses and a further lounge/bar/disco area but are always open to more suggestions.

The gates are usually locked so if you are interested in staying it might be a good idea to contact Martha on WhatsApp, her number is +573114781219. Or if you are in town and ask for Martha Gomez I have been assured that they will point you in the right direction.

name: Catedral de Barranquilla
description:
It's a medium Parking lot infront of Barranquilla's Church, is very safe the Police Station It's very near the peopple is very friendly and is a nice neighborhood.

Es un estacionamiento mediano enfrente de la Catedral de Barranquilla, la estación de policía está muy cerca, las personas son muy amigables y es un bonito vecindario.

name: Alto del Aguila
description:
incredible place!!! 15-20min from town, in the jungle, after the school, you'll find this hostel for 25.000ps a night per person. clean cabins, clean bathroom with cold showers, no breakfast but coffee and free fresh drinking water! free canoe to go to the tarapoto lake, big Mirador and hamocs to chill and most of all, monkeys and parrots that are part of the family!!!

best place on Earth

name: Finca Los Planes
description: Located two hours from Neiva, this is a place to connect with nature and live the life of the countryside, in a house high up where you can rest.

name: El Establo Restaurant
description: Nice restaurant serving mainly meat steak and pork also chicken and delicious burgers. Highly recommended if you are heading north or south the panamericanos highway, good food quality, clean and good price probably the best around this area.

name: Hostel La Rosa Nautica
description: Great hostel to chill out. Beautiful rooftop with hammocks and pool tables. secure parking with no height limit. 68000 for a private room with ensuite bathroom. No hot shower but the weather is *just* warm enough for it

name: Terpel + water
description: We did a couple of gas stations in this neighborhood (Texaco & Esso) and didn’t want to give us more than a bucket of water...! Here they were kind enough to let us fill our tank, but they asked how much we needed before... since our gauge stopped working couldn’t say exactly but seems they have controls about giving out water, at least in this part of town...

name: ice cream / smoothies / natural juices
description: Delicious natural juices, ice creams, smoothies and refreshing stuff. Lovely family!!

name: El Raizon
description: Delicious dishes, nice and clean place. wifi. they might let you park for the night here. 12000 cop for a chicken menu with delicious fish soup and juice. lots of options including fish and bbq ribs.

name: Gaz Pais
description: Gaz plant on the road to Jardin, just before arriving to Hispania coming from Bolombolo. After discussing with the guard, he accepted to refill our 2 argentine tanks which were both half empty. 40.000 pesos, seems the fair price. No invoice.

name: Hispania in front of Terpel station
description: We stopped there in our way to Jardín, it is at the entrance of Hispania coming from the north. There is space to park a camper along the road on the left in front of Terpel station, near the barrier of the finca. In the hostel in front of us we could take a shower (10.000$ for the 4 of us). At night, not so much trafic, quite quiet for a road stop.

name: Parking
description:
Parking in this city is a beach. This was the cheapest i found. 5k / 12h for a Moto.

enter through the long tunnel from calle 7.

Big rigs will probably struggle.

name: Mobil Gas Station
description: 24h gas station. let me park on the side... no problems!

name: Hoteles C 2
description:
Small hotel very close to airport. Pet friendly, comfy rooms with AC. About $20 usd per night, residential neighborhood away from tourist crowd thing downtown. Tiendas and restaurants within walking or short taxi ride. There is no sign on the gate but this coordinate is correct (it looks like a regular house). Security cameras all over so just stand at the gate lol
Good WiFi and breakfast included. Street parking only for big rigs, room for motos inside the gate.

name: Folatun hostal
description: We are in Rincón del Mar, a beautiful town 2 hours from Cartagena, just 20 meters from the beach. To get to where we are, you have to take a bus from the Cartagena bus terminal (or from another city) to San Onofre (20,000 pesos); from San Onofre take a mototaxi to Rincón del Mar (from 8,000 to 10,000 pesos); The hostel is located in the Boca area, in the building that used to be the police station, behind the María Mulata library. The entrance is a large wooden door.

name: Maxiricuras bakery and restaurant
description:
Just beside the road, in the corner there is a really good bakery. The owner is really nice and the juices are amazing (and cheap)!
They also have almuerzos.

name: Taller de frenos
description:
In front of Terpel gas station. On the right hand side coming from Ipiales. Green doors. 
In a huge parking lot, on the right hand side. 
Specialized in brakes. 
Controlled our master cylinder and did a complete check of our braking system. Also fixed our parking brake. Very nice team.

name: La Floresta
description: This is the cafe to check out here in Pijao. Family run, the owners here own and operate the coffee plantation where this specialty coffee comes from, roast, and package it. They have specialty washed, honey, and natural coffees. They have several brewing methods. The coffee is out of this world. They've won multiple awards. Highly highly recommend this place if you want to try some of the best coffee Colombia has to offer.

name: Bakery Delicious homemade bread
description: Nice treat in the middle of the jungle. This lady serves fresh bread everyday: chocolate, guava, cheese, arequipe and many more. They are really good always out of the oven. Really really good. Highly recommended.

name: Rincon Payanes
description: We stayed one night and felt safe, it’s a free parking. One or two restaurants open till midnight and some people talking in the parking but pretty quiet for a Saturday night. Police came one or two times during nighttime to check. Nice place for one or two nights. Public free WiFi doesn’t work :/

name: Avoid closed road & road works
description: If you want to avoid the road works and the closed road from here to Manizales, you can  cross the river here and pass by La Felisa - Filadelfia - Valdivia - Moravia and then Manizales. The road is very good and there is no trucks, there's only 10km of bad road between Filadelfia and Valdivia, but you can do it with a normal car. Not sure for RVs but I'd say yes. We have a camper van and did it in 3 hours, but we're slow so it can be done faster.

name: Hotel Vieja Aduana
description: Nice little hotel. 28k for a dorm. Possible to take motos in, certainly if they're small. The owners are very friendly and have travelled by Moto before. Slightly mental and very playful dog

name: Baldío frente al mar
description:
It's a bit of a dirty terrain, but it's got access to the sea. One can stick the van/car to the sand and forget about the place. We have to arrange with Mr. Manuel who is the care of the place and there is no fixed amount to pay him, but asks for a collaboration. 
--
Es un terreno un poco sucio pero tiene salida al mar. Uno puede pegar la camioneta/auto a la arena y se olvida del lugar. Hay que arreglar con el Sr. Manuel que es el que cuida el lugar y no hay monto fijo para pagarle, si no que te pide  una colaboración.

name: Hostel Palohe Taganga
description: Great hostel very close to the sea front. Free parking outside the hostel which is monitored by cctv, and vehicles can be seen easily through the hostel front door and windows in the first dorm as you enter. We had no problems what so ever with our van. We have a 4x4 van and it fit easily down the street and fit within the cctv range. The road is not paved. They have great rooms, doubles and dorms available with aircon 8pm-8am (dorms 25,000 COP each a night, we were the only ones in our room but we visited out of season) a swimming pool and outside area with rows of hammocks and a lovely sitting area, upstairs terrace with shaded beds to chill on, very well equipt kitchen, tv with Netflix, cheap and very fast laundry service, free coffee, cold showers (very much needed as its very hot here!) and great deals for diving with Under Pressure Diving Centre. We did our PADI Open Water that comes with a fun dive FREE (2 dives with a short snack break in-between) at the end of your course (850,000 COP and a FREE night stay at this hostel!!!!!) and Advanced Open Water (730,000 you get an 80,000 COP discount if you do this straight after the open water course) we did 11 dives over 7 days. Our instructor was Omar. This hostel was great choice for doing this sort of activity. Highly recommended. We booked on Hostel World and found it easy to get beds, but we were out of season so I would recommend booking through this service in advance if possible.

name: Ranchería Punta Gallina
description: Lovely family with the real wauyu culture, they can set up dances, dresses exhibitions, and everything regarding their culture, if you ask you can also stay here for one night or several days and share with them doing the many activities they have. Ask for Emilio +310 6677157 different experience to the “most modern type of hostels” worth a try they are really lovely the kids dance and you can share food with them and immerse.

name: Hotel
description:
25k for the night, no breakfast or WiFi, or mobile signal. En suite. There's (just about) a kitchen but no more than that.

Would almost certainly let you sleep in the car/camp.

name: Police check point
description: They asked for money, I got a video showing the officers name and a Google translate saying "100 now or 300 later" and said I would pay at the station. After some debate they let me go.

name: Claro Store - to buy SIM
description:
This is the store where you can actually buy a SIM. You can’t from most of the usual agents / tiendas.
At the time of writing:
2GB prepaid 1 month : 43,000 col
2GB prepaid 15 day: 20,000 col
SIM was 3,000 col

name: Hotel Marbella traditional
description: Pet friendly cheap hotel across street from beach. Looks pretty shabby on the outside but inside is much nicer! Clean air conditioned rooms, beds are comfortable. 340 mil for four nights. About 95$ US for two people and 60 lb. dog. Restaurant downstairs good cheap Colombian food.

name: Crespo veteranía clinic
description: Very helpful vet. Can do all paper work for international travel. He even walked over with us to get our emotional support dog on our flight! We were having problems with LATAM air. Full service clinic and pet supplies. Great to do business with!

name: Dorfkneipe - El Burro Bar
description: Great little bar with great beer and music. Possibility to watch sports/football games in HD. Very nice owner, Santiago. Highly recommended!

name: Casa Mazal
description: A very nice and cheap hotel/hostel. The common area is nicely decorated and there is lots of space to hang out. There is also a kitchen available. We paid 45.000 for a private room for two in the low season without AC (AC is available but it costs a more). There is an option to have breakfast for 8.000. The place is a bit hard to find as it doesn't have a sign with a name. It is the building almost opposite of the school.

name: Happy Monkey
description:
Great little restaurant, everything is fresh and comes from a huerto. Local cuisine mixed from the travel experiences of the owner who’s a lawyer and after 3 years traveling decided to come back and open his restaurant!
Highly recommended!

name: Foresta Hotel
description:
Great little hotel with friendly staff and secure parking with no height restriction. Not suitable for big rigs due to the tight turn down a slope and the smallish parking lot. Absolutely no issue for our Landcruiser or similar. We paid 35 euro per night including breakfast (through booking.com). 

If arriving from Carrera 25 be aware that google maps thinks the hotel is on the higher road, whereas it’s only a accessibility from the lower road. Just before Carrera 25 crosses over Calle 10, there is a turn-off on the left going down. We missed it the first time and there is no easy way back. Took as another good 20 minutes to circle back to this spot.

name: Parking 24h
description:
In Zaragoza there is the other access to San Cipriano with the brujitas. 

Follow the parking signs and you will arrive to a big parking lot. In the final of this parking there is a path downhill that take you to other little parqueaderos with roof (town children will show you and ask for money...).

Here downhill we negotiate the whole day and sleep in the van for 15000 pesos. 
Really nice old woman, access to bathroom and just beside the bridge that take you to the brujitas, quite noisy because is just beside the main road.

They have space for tents and they are building some rooms for guests.

name: MotoArias.
description: Awesome mechanic referred to me by a fellow rider in Bogota. After buying a lemon of a Honda Tornado Jorge fixed all of the problems with the motor and transmission and prepared me for trip around South America free of problems. Also I returned to his shop to fix the little things it lacked after the trip so I could sell it free of problems. Both times he gave me excellent prices, thorough work and help navigating all the little things come with being a foreigner conducting business in Colombia. I highly recommend his shop for getting your bike back on the road and finding parts at a fair price!

name: Fonda La Terraza
description: Many restaurants right at the main plaza. This one had a really good menu del dia for 11‘000 COP. Potato soup and fried fish with rice, salad and platano.

name: Jardin Botanico
description: Very nice garden with fish ponds and bridges and little trails you can walk along. The best is, it is totally free. Open 6am until 6pm.

name: Warning - Armed robbery
description:
Just adding as warning the important  comment of PAN-AMERICA-PREVOT-TOUR on 6/16/2019, once not everybody read all the comments in iOverlander.
*****************************************
PAN-AMERICA-PREVOT-TOUR on 6/16/2019: 

Try to avoid this place, it can be dangerous at night! We wanted to sleep at telepherico, but we arrived late and gate was closed, so we went to this car park. Few cars was going in and out with loud music, around 11 PM a girl knocked our door, she was crying and shouting very loud, she explained that some guys stolen the car of her boyfriend with a gun  on the other side of the car park. (50m away from us!) They were really scared, so we drove them to the police station and went to another place for the night.

name: Brujitas to San Cipriano
description:
This is other spot you can go to San Cipriano with the funny brujitas!

There are  parqueaderos nearby and the ticket is 12000 pesos per person going and come back.

This "station" is closer than the Cordoba one if you come from the east and this route has two tunnels!

name: Finca Hotel La Dorada
description:
Moderator Note: This description is provided by the owner/manager and has not been verified by an overlander.

Finca Hotel LA DORADA is a place to rest with your family or friends, the aesthetic is purely of Colombian coffee fields and we are located just 8 kilometers from the coffee park (Quindío) 
It has services of Restaurant, Recreation for children, Pool and Jacuzzi, Board Games, Wi-Fi, DTT TV, Bicycle rental and more attractive for your comfort.

name: Beachside
description:
Zion Beach Hostal is closed to camping so we stayed on the beach literally 10m away from the old camp spot for free. You can still use their restaurant. Quiet night. Music was on until 10pm then quiet (it was a Friday). On flight path, last plane was around 10pm, first one 6am but very few planes.

Cell service average.

name: Shopping mall Llanogrande
description: Interesting shopping mall, with a lot of shops, restaurants and a large supermarket. The Carulla supermarket has a wide range of products, and offers good quality fresh food. There is also an EURO supermarket. The mall has two parts, separated by the road. Large vehicles can easily park at a guarded grassy field at the opposite corner of the street at the right side of the building (in front of the bank), it’s their overflow parking lot. Close to the Medellin international airport and colonial village El Retiro.

name: Planta Chichina
description:
They don't refill bottles anymore, just bottles from the company, ours was a Canadian bottle. 
Small gas plant, where they filled our US propane bottle. The friendly man at the gate asked permission for us to enter, we walked down with our empty bottle. It must have been the first time they filled an US type cylinder, they had to study how to do so. We gave our adapters, probably they used one, we don’t know. Paid 38.000 COP for a 20 lbs cylinder. Coming from the town of Chinchiná, it’s 300 m before the toll booth, at the right side of the road. Park at the roadside. Take care, leave the entrance free for the gas vehicles that have to pass.

name: Taller de Mecanica
description: We lost power on the toll road 10km up from here and the free recovery guys collected us (we just waited for them), we slept in their yard near the toll booth (we didn't really have a choice haha), and they called these mechanics in the morning. Our alternator had packed it in and they fitted a new one the same day. They drove to Barranquilla to get a new alternator for us as ours is larger than the standard. We paid 450,000 COP for the part, 100,000 for their labour, and 100,000 petrol for them to collect the part and bring it back.

name: Terpel
description: Overnight site at gas station. Good stop coming from the north heading to Zipaquira. But gas station is on highway going north so if coming from the north you will have go past it and use retorno a couple of kms south and head north. Free wifi. Showers 2,000COP. Clean bathrooms. Restaurant. Water tap to fill tank.

name: David VW mechanic
description:
David Barrios is a young mechanic. He is really good and especialist un VW. He owns a Green "vocho". He world on front of his House. He help us a lot reparing and finding parts for our VW T2 combi.
better you call him before you go, cause he has another job too.
cel phone: +573002003010

name: ATMs
description: Here are two ATMs, one Banco Colombia and the other Daviendia. Right next to the Buses and Mototaxis.

name: Distribuidora Mi Guajira
description: Can get water here...we pumped directly from 20L jugs to fill our tank.  5000cop per 20l

name: Las Palmas
description: Delicious, clean, nice, very good attention, WiFi, cheap, parking. 8000 cop soup + main + lemonade . away from the cities.

name: Ventanas de Tisquizoque
description:
Breathtaking! Entrance to a short trail that takes you through an amazing cavern to the Ventanas de Tisquizoque. Only half-an-hour round trip, but bring a beverage and plan to take in the view for a while. There is a river that runs through this cave and turrns into a huge waterfall. You can stand 2 mt from the mouth of this waterfall and get a great view of Florian town. 
You can also see the waterfall from the town. this place has lots of natural places to visit. Just talk to the villagers.

name: Cueva del Molino
description:
Incredible deep cave with many paths! Don't miss this place! You can contact Francesco (+573142477369) and he will guide you inside for a tip. He lives right next to the wild camping near the Hoyo del Aire. Absolutely recommendable!
