These are the coordinates of the entrance to cave. you can park on the main road and then walk down to this point. Take a torch and enjoy!

name: Hoyo del Aire
description:
Very close to the Hoyo del Aire.  We parked here where there is a semi-flat spot in front of Francesco's house. He is a very curious and kind man and also a great guide since he grew up in this small town and knows every corner. He will not ask you for money for camping but you can give him a tip to show you around.
He took us to a lovely viewpoint, Tres Torres, (we wouldn't have found the trail since the vegetation has erased it). Then he took us to a cave called la Cueva del Molino, which was really exciting. Take a torch or headlamp and enjoy these incredible underground paths. The cave is not so hard to find but is recommendable to go with someone who knows it inside, like Francesco.
You can also visit Pozo Azul but unfortunately at this time of the year the water level is dangerous.
+573142477369

name: Near Cimitarra
description: Platano and avocado stall. We stopped to buy some platanos and the lovely ladies offered us to park there, have a shower and take us to a quebrada to collect fresh pure water. Unfortunately we were on a rush and couldn't stay but some other overlanders might be lucky.

name: Gas
description: We have an Argentinean bottle and although in all the other places they say they can't refill because of the adaptor, the size, whatever.. We finally found this place where there were trucks from different plants and one of them helped us and refilled ours with a hose. (20 cop 3 lt)  He told us that in most plants they don't wanna do it so they make up excuses. Hope you're lucky too!

name: Patio of Witches
description: Cool place with "witch" history and kind of "ancient" observatory and sun watch. If you camp close by it is worth a visit (see picture).

name: Tyres
description: Tyre place behind Terpel and to the left of the Terpel tyre/mechanics. Nice guys fixed our punctured tyre for 30,000 COP. Cafe not far for a good coffee while we waited.

name: Teleférico Santuario De Las Lajas
description:
If you have time to spare, this cable car brings you down to the Santuario de las Lajas (20min each way). Large parking lot, free overnight camping possible.
Price 01/20: 12.000 COP per adult one way. Promo-price 10.000 COP. 
By the way: it’s the slowest cable car in the world.

name: Hotel y restaurant Monaco
description: Nice hotel with rooms for 100,000 and restaurant across the street.

name: ,Restaurant Y Hospedaje Monaco
description: Camping right on the beach in front of or between restaurant and palapa/dining area.  Across the street, there is is large establishment with rooms for rent with private bathrooms, a two-story structure for hammocks and a communal bath house with showers and toilets.  They run off solar panels during day, and after about 8pm, electricity is available from a generator serving the establishment. Internet is coming soon...no idea how fast.  If you have a screw-in plug thingie, you can camp closer to the beach and run a cable to the palapa, otherwise connect at the restaurant. Super nice people and a great restaurant (lobster in season).  Kiteboarders race up and down the beach right in front, clean water, and great for swimming.  Camping 40000 COP and worth it in our opinion as there's not much out in Cabo de la Vela and everything has to be brought in.  Rooms with private bath 100000, hammock space 25000 cop.

name: Football field
description:
There is a nice football field here. Only suitable for cyclists, walkers and eventually motorcyclists. The field is away from the road and traffic noise wasn't a problem. I camped at the far end of the field and could see the country side. There was also a shelter/small hut just in case it rains really heavy. A power outlet was in the shelter. I asked a local for permission and it was ok to camp there. 

Only suitable for cyclists, walkers and eventually motorcyclists. No access for cars.

name: Bar Social
description: In the main square of Pijao, next to the Plaza Hostal (street number 4-21) there is this very typical, old-fashioned social café. The peculiarity of it is its 110-year Italian coffee machine. The owner was happy and super kind to show us how the machine works. If you speak Spanish and want to meet friendly people, I would recommend to come to this café, have a chat with the owner and have a coffee. Please, though, remember to be friendly!!!! People here are very welcoming!!

name: Inti vegetarian menu 12900
description:
Vegetarian menu for 12900, banana chips as entrance, soup, main course, small chocolate cake and a natural lemonade. Big portions! We had a vegetable soup and stir fried vegetables with rice (lots of champignons). See pictures
Excellent service and a nice view over the small plaza.
Also had non vegetarian options like ceviche and more.
with wifi.

name: villa juliana
description: hotel villa juliana, cuenta con cabañas y zona de camping. un sitio agradable

name: Yala
description:
Really good arabic restaurant in San Antonio. Service is perfect! It felt good too taste this tastes after a long trip in america del sur.
I recomande!

name: quiet spot plaza menor
description:
Buen lugar en la ciudad. Tranquilo. Seguro. Al fundo de la plaza menor. Gran espacio plano. Limpio. 

Nice spot, quiet at night. at the end of the place. Large and flat area. In front of the beautiful entrance of the hostería de la plaza menor. No trafic. Safe. Clean

name: costarepuestos in
description:
Super shop. Very nice people and helpful. All brands.
Muy buena tienda. Todas marcas. Gente super amable y ayudante.
Tel +57 3126671185

name: casa zaida
description:
Super place to stay! With very nice people.
3 cars could fit there. 15pppn using shower, toilets, wifi. (20pppn including breakfast). 
No kitchen at the moment but in process to build it! 😉
Natasha and her mother Zaida are very very nice. Yoga classes on Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday afternoon. We shared very nice moments together and we really liked our stay there!!
They also have nice rooms with AC (85000)or fan (75000), including breakfast. Very comfortable beds. 

En la calle 12A (con cra 15) , número 22, en frente del Parque bolívar. 
El hostal casa zaida en Ríohacha es un súper lugar! Con gente tan amable! 
Tiene espacio por 3 vehículos. pueden dormir en el carro por 15pp, utilizando baños, ducha, WiFi. (o 20pp con el desayuno) 
Todavía no hay pero quieren instalar una cocina afuera. 
Natasha y su mamá zaida son tan cariñosas! 
Es una familia de artistas, pintura, bordado,... Cada martes miércoles jueves hay actividades de yoga! También tienen 3 habitaciones muy cómodas con buenas camas. (75 con desayuno o 85 con AC y desayuno.)
Patio muy agradable y fresco. Tranquilo y silencioso. Buena ubicación. 
Me encanto quedar en este lugar! Lo recomiendo mucho!

name: FINCA La Comandancia
description: FINCA along the 90   We asked the man if we could stay for one night and he agreed. Far from the road , so quiet.We are with our bicycles and a tent.

name: FIRE STATION CHOCONTA
description: IS A VERY GOOD PLACE, THE FIREMAN'S ARE FRIENDLY, THE STATION IS LOCATED TO SIDE OF POPULAR MARKET .

name: ROBBERS!!! DON'T LEAVE THE CAR ALONE!!!!
description: We left our car without supervision during few minutes while went to shower in the gas station. Someone open the back door (Defender 110), stilled our camera and computer and left. They close the door and didn't messy anything. DON'T NEVER LEAVE THE CAR ALONE IN THE GAS STATIONS OF COLOMBIA. After what happend to us, we heard many similar cases.

name: Hotel Sol y Mar
description:
Calle 10.
Very nice place with flat secure parking.
People are so nice here! We spent a very nice time! 25 000 cop for the van with 2 people. Access to toilets, shower, wifi. They offered us coffee.
Very nice and safe stop on the road from the coast to Bucaramanga.

name: Football field
description:
Concrete football field next to the school. Suitable for cyclist mostly. It was in the shadow as opposed to other field closer to the city. 

Access for a car too. In the morning started the classes and the kids went interested :)

No electricity outside. (You can ask at school in the morning.) No water (You can ask people nearby). Traffic very low in the night but you are completely hidden from it. Good spot if you don't want to pay in the city :)

name: Concrete football field
description:
There is a nice football field. But we asked for permission and we were admitted to the library room in the school building nearby. (Whitxj turned out to be just an empty room with roof, light and electricity :)

Oh, and there is an restaurant nearby :)

name: Termas El Sifon
description: 30 minute walk from the shop at the top of the hill. We went down on our bikes (250s with knobblies). So beautiful. Hot water. Worth a visit.

name: Parking Area
description:
Parking area for about 30 cars.
Not for really big rigs - max. length may be 6m. No height restriction.
16000 for 24 hours

name: Water at Terpel gas station
description: Clean water offered when fueling up. Very friendly staff

name: wild camping next to a river
description:
Nice spot on the way Toche-Salento/ Salento-Toche.
Coming from Toche to Salento, on the right hand after the bridge you will see a flat and nice place to pitch your tent. You will have to cross the small river but it's OK. 
Not super easy to find places like this on this route.

name: Pereira Plaza SOAT Sura
description: We came here because the other Sura you find on iOverlander in Pereira told us that they cannot extend SOAT for foreigners anymore. Here in the Mall they have another office where it is possible. First floor.

name: Under Pressure Diving Centre Taganga
description: Great diving centre for those looking to do a discovery dive, fun dive, start their PADI course or continue a course. We did our PADI Open Water and PADI Advance Open Water courses over 5 days. We paid 850,000 COP for the Open Water course that came with a FREE fun dive at the end (2 dives in one morning) and 730,000 COP for the Advanced Open Water. We were given an 80,000 COP discount on the Advanced as we did both courses combined. The normal cost of the Advanced is 810,000 COP. We were staying at Hostel Palohe and were given a FREE night there for doing the Open Water course. Our instructor was Omar, he was amazing. We'd never dived before and he made us feel calm, safe and taught us very well. We had lots of fun on our dives and saw some incredible fish and coral. We couldn't recommended this establishment and him as a teacher enough. We did a total of 11 dives over 6 days. They speak English, Spanish, French and German. Cesar took us on our fun dives and we had an amazing time. first dive 47 minutes and second fun dive was 52 minutes. Fugg yeahhh.

name: Exhostos y mofles
description:
We drove straight in and they quoted us 30,000 pesos upfront to tighten the exhaust support brackets and replace the rear rubber sling as it was knackered.

In and out in under an hour with the rattling noise gone. Friendly owners who loved chatting to us about our van and Overlanding experience in Colombia. Would recommend.

name: Madecentro
description: They made a wooden wall to block an entry for our shipping. They installed everything which they usually don’t do... very friendly! Charged us 20’000, probably could have gone to 15’000, but they were very helpful!

name: Doña Cecilia Plata
description:
Great lady, super friendly washes the clothes very carefully by hand so it takes 2 days (there are also some water restrictions in Barichara so that’s why it takes longer) but everything was perfectly folded and clean. She gives you the price after the job but for 2 big bags (8-9kg) with bed linen she asked for 30’000 pesos. She has Whatsapp and you can contact her on this number +57 315 384 24 17 or go straight to her place. 

We spent more than 2 weeks in Barichara and there’s no washing machine available... there’s another lady who does the laundry by hand but stayed with Cecilia! :-)

name: Hotel Mansion Campestre
description:
Budget hotel. $30,000 cop per night 1 person. It is not clean... dirty floor and the room looks dirty. Air conditioning and parking included. 
--
Hotel economico. $30.000 cop por noche 1 persona. No es limpio... piso sucio y el cuarto aparenta suciedad. Aire acondicionado y parqueadero incluido.

name: Alto de los Idolos
description:
This is the place for the  other site near San Augustin. 

But beware because it's temporarily closed for maintenance!! For a year!

name: La Casa del Agua
description:
Place to fill up purified water.
19L for 3‘000 COP
5L for 1‘000 COP
Rinse is 200 COP
It‘s an automatic filling machine, so check if your container fits in it.

name: Escapes Taller
description:
Miguel is a a good mechanic, recommended to us by a former Dakar driver and by Carlos 4x4 (mechanic in Lima, Peru who is also mentioned in this app). We only did a check up of our car: he seemed prepared, very honest and surely very nice. He has already worked for other overlanders. 
Phone: +573147219457

name: Casa Aparte Hostal
description: An incredible place to stay in Santa Marta air-conditioned rooms, private bathroom and has a terrace towards the city center

name: la fritanga de pipe
description:
very good restaurant in Buga
there is no menue, you can choose between beef or pork, it's comes on a hot stone with fries, rice and same avocado dip.... very tasty

name: Hotel Rumar
description: Little hotel with secured parking. Bathroom and room in general very clean. We got a double room with aircon and TV for 30.000 Colombian Pesos.

name: Donkey Sunrise Guesthouse and Campground
description:
Hostel with private rooms, shared rooms, tents and camping space for adventure lovers with a pool, restaurant and bar. Amazing as a long-term homebase for travelers, or a rest-stop for overlanders as well. Motorcycle rentals are available too

We are two motorbike enthusiasts (Dutch and Colombian/American) opening a hostel for like-minded adventurers. We offer a wide range of exciting tours and activities to give you an unforgettable Colombian experience.

Check our FB and Instagram @donkeysunrise

name: Laundry at the restaurant
description: It‘s a restaurant but they do as well laundry for COP 6‘000/kg. A lot of laundrys at this street but they were the cheapest.

name: Hotel el Gran Bachue
description: Is a Hotel and restaurant, the room is clean and the food is good. The people is friendly. I paid 30.000 for night in a private room whit AC. The parking is included and safe.

name: Santa Coa restaurant/bar
description: A really nice restaurant and by nice we meant food and atmosphere!!! We had a delicious fresh sea food pasta and some river fish (Bagre/Catfish) with a couple of cocktails and a jar of sangria. Fair prices and excellent quality, my wife loved the inside decoration!!! Give it a try, won’t regret it.

name: Fundacion Salud Integral
description:
The Fundacion’s farm is run by a wonderful family. I got there by talking to the Santuario Los Colorados’ park rangers. They welcome visitor and have a place to camp or if available, to rent out rooms. Very comfortable and perfect for nature lovers. They do ask to not have music or any type of disturbing activities apart from relaxing and enjoying nature. If you are looking for a somewhat party or socially active place, this is not it. 
They serve food, but with their promotion of a healthy lifestyle, the food is only vegetarian. I am not vegetarian and was very pleasantly surprise on how good these home cooked meals were.
All in all this place was great for us and would highly recommend it if you are looking for place to stop and relax.
Given there is no cellphone signal up there, Dabar (Man who runs it) would prefer to be contacted first through whatsapp if you can.

+57 317 4136633
Dabar Charry
Manager

name: Restaurant Couco
description: Nice little Italian cafe run by owner and chef from Trastevere, where he used to have a restaurant. Very cute spot with four tables in the dining room and others in the courtyard.  Opposite to the cemetery and associated park.  Delicious fettuccine with homemade sausage.

name: Meraki - Mexican Style Restaurant
description:
This Restaurant is a 'must visit' in Suesca. Awesome homemade mexican food. 
Good prices: Big burritos for 7000 COP, fresh made juices for 2000 COP
Try the vegetarian burrito!

name: Listo Frenos
description:
Really nice site to fix your brakes. Very good people and professionals. 
Help us a lot with our van (VW Kombi 89)!

name: Steak House
description: Great little steak house, owner chef Andreas very nice guy, very welcoming, speaks English (which he taught himself. ) Just around corner from Hotel Las Vegas.  Great thin, crisp patacones with sour cream.  Baked potatoes!  Offering more than the standard fare you get at most typical restaurants.  Great smoked pork ribs and a nice lettuce and mango salad.

name: Hotel Tarbela
description: Basic and clean hotel near the center town . Very friendly and helpful owner . We paid 20 000 pesos per person. Perfect to visit the center of Aguadas. The supermarket is 350 meters from the hotel.

name: Hotel Guymaral
description: Basic  Hotel, doesn’t have parking, i got a double room with TV and shared bathroom for $60.000 COP (approx $4,5 USD) per night without breakfast.

name: Along river
description: A short dirt road leads down to the river. It was quiet during the night. The spot is lower than the road. River was brown so bring your own water. There is one curve in the track going down which might be a bit tight for cars like a Sprinter.

name: Hotel Sanguitama
description:
Hotel in the center town . We had a huge room with 2 beds, TV  , sofa .
Basic but clean .
There's a swimming pool
We paid 40 000 pesos for one night, the cheapest in Salamina .

name: Omaria's house
description:
Omaria's words:
Si encuentran otros amigos me recomiendad pero les dicen que cobro 10.000 pesos por descansar en la posada.

So we do! We were cycling and she caught us on the street and invited us home! She lives alone with her 2 dogs.

This is her number: +57 314 8540000. 
She lives in San Francisco but works in Mocoa , so You can meet with her there during the day and she can show you her house. 
There you can cook and feel like home :)

name: Hotel Valle de Pubenza
description: Hotel on a main artery of town with large, clean rooms, decent WiFi, hot water, secure parking garage (no oversized vehicles). Bed is hard but we’ve definitely had much worse in Colombia. There is a lot of noise due to traffic on a busy street. We got a double room with private bath for COP 75,000.

name: Hostal El Zorzal
description: Great hostel with large, clean rooms, very hot water, fast WiFi, gated outdoor parking, breakfast is included. We paid COP 73,000 for a double room with private bath. Located on the edge of town, it was very quiet. The bed was not overly comfortable but I still got a decent night’s sleep and I loved everything else about our stay. We woke to the sound of birds chirping in the morning. Easy 5 minute walk to town.

name: Hotel Colinas
description:
Nice hotel in town with a parking inside. Hot showers , wifi, kitchen , TV ....
Very friendly staff
We paid 50 000 pesos for 2 persons.

name: Villa Juliana
description:
Camping inside the property. $25.000 per person including breakfast. Showers, Toilets, parking, pool, playing area and restaurant. Nice place close to La Unión.

---

zona de camping dentro de la propiedad. cop. $25.000 por persona con desayuno. cuenta con duchas, sanitario, parking, piscina, zona de juegos y restaurante. excelente lugar. muy cerca de la Unión valle.

name: Casa de los Almendros
description:
Casa de los Almendros is a space for travelers ran by Fernando and Juliana, it is located in the traditional neighborhood of Manga. Has four private rooms (max 2 people), kitchen, bathroom and common areas are fully equipped, high speed wifi. Huge locked patio to park vans and campers without hight restrictions. Prices go from $10- 20 dollars/night. Port is in a walking distance, also the walled City and touristic areas. Please contact them in advanced via instagram: @lacasatamarindo or whatsapp: 
+573143810498, it's on air bnb as well! We've had a nice and uncomplicated stay in Juliana's place- recommended!!!

name: Paragliding
description:
Beautiful spot to jump into the void, either solo or with a tandem pilot. Conveniently, this place is part of Ecoland camping and is well maintained.
The drop is approx 1300m. Three tandem routes are available:
- 130k COP, flight time 8-12min
- 155k COP, flight time 12-16min
- 180k COP, flight time 16-25 min
The use of their GoPro camera costs an additional 20k COP.

name: El mejor Electricista
description:
Ernando helped us connect the alternator to the auxiliary battery of our pickup truck... very honest and good people! Well-known mechanics!
tel: +573127172694 /+573218768768

Ernando nos ayudó a conectar el alternador a la batería auxiliar de nuestra camioneta... muy honesto y buena gente! tiene mecánicos conocidos!
tel: +573127172694 /+573218768768

name: Restaurant Los Peregollos
description: Nice fish restaurant for a lunch stop. Rich and delicious trout menus for 20.000-22.000 COP.

name: PLUS DIGITAL - Print amazing stickers for overlanders!!!
description:
It is a place were you can print cool stickers for your car and trip! The owners are very friendly and also overlanders! We left Brazil and didn't have time to print stickers for the car and we managed to do it here and really recommend it! You can park in front of the place and watch your car while they are printing. You can contact before go:
Rafael +57 300 7816092

name: Ruta 25
description:
Big public parking area. It's very noisy because it is just in front of the principal road but it's safe.
No facilities. Wifi in the restaurant and toilets for pay

name: Terpel Gas Station
description: Behind the Terpel is a hotel. They allowed us to stay near the tienda for 2k p/p with bathroom use and 3 k p/p for a shower. Good spot if you are hitting dark.

name: Reserva Natural Boquemonte
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager.   
----
In the Nature Reserve Boquemonte we offer beautiful and comfortable green areas to organize your camp, shower service, bathrooms, restaurant, ecological walk (trails) parking. Excellent family and friends plan.
High, medium and low zone.

Recommendations:
altitude: 2650
humidity: 90%
temperature: 12-16 ° C

Visitors for hiking should wear UV (ultraviolet) sun protection with Sun Protection Factor SPF30 or higher, cap.

Considering that the weather conditions are constantly changing, it is recommended that visitors wear a waterproof cape, cold weather clothing, and waterproof hiking boots.

Sharps and / or firearms are NOT allowed in the Reserve.
NO intoxicated people are allowed on the ecological trails.

HUNTING and / or manipulation of wild flora and fauna is PROHIBITED within the Boquemonte Natural Reserve. If any visitor is found in illegal activities that threaten the Reserve's biodiversity, they will be immediately removed and the Environmental and Ecological Police will be notified.

It is NOT allowed to enter any type of food in packaging (glass, styrofoam, or any other contaminating element) to the ecological trails.

name: Hotel Monterrey
description:
Super clean, decent-sized rooms with firm mattresses (in accordance with local customs, it seems!). Really friendly staff. COP$25k with fan or 50k with ac. Bicycle allowed in room. Private parking available for motorbikes and small vehicles. 

Price 50k cop for 2 people in twin room June 2024

name: Parqueadero
description: 24 hour parking close to the central plaza. No high restriction. We could sleep in our truck camper. 2000 pesos/hour. We paid 20'000 for the night.

name: Road to the mirador
description: At the moment this is the only access road to the viewpoint. The official signed entry is under construction. The road is a single line dirt track all the way and a little bumpy but people manage with normal cars. Could be slippery when wet though.

name: Vascafé - coffee tour
description:
Alejandro Vásquez Giraldo is an agricultural engineer, who runs a 20,000 m² farm with 6,000+ coffee plants (and 1,200 banana, some avocado trees and some sugar cane). The farm also has (2.5) cows and goats and some fowl.

The entire process of coffee growing is shown: from seed to small plants in a pot to harvesting the fruits on a full grown plant, (mechanically) peeling them, drying, (manually) sorting etc. Any question is welcome (including technical ones): about biologically circular systems to what fertilizer is used. Or about the 'why' for the plastic bags around the bananas.

Once the beans are peeled, dried and selected, they are sold (most through a 'cooperativa' to Nestlé), but the tour does not stop there: you get to roast beans in a pan, 'casera' style, grind them and make coffee (using 'aguapanella' if you'd like). And then drink coffee 'grown here, harvested here, roasted here, brewn here', part of which you participated in. (Another part of the harvest is available, professionally roasted and ground, in local stores (and this farm), under the name 'Valcafé'.)

We found this small scale farm a great place to learn about the process and the individual nature of the tour (we were only two, and Alejandro) made that we had all of our questions answered.

Alejandro speaks Spanish, but adapts to foreigners  (in the sense that he knows to speak slowly and explain again using other words). Appointments can be made through WhatsApp: +57 311 370 3682.

name: Mecanica Mastercars - Giovanni
description: nice mechanic. could be the only one in Ipiales that knows about VW Kombis. helped us with our small issues after one other mechanic messed it up cause he didn't know anything about this vehicle. if you have a kombi, always go to people that know about this car, especially if you have enigne issues!

name: Parking lot
description:
It is a large park where you can park, Gabi is the man who takes care of it, very good man! 
There is water and electricity available and above all ... it's FREE.

name: Junto al río
description:
Quiet place to park in front of the river. The locals are very friendly. The entrance from the route is unconventional Just after the mark of this same river on the route. But then you take an asphalt road but very narrow. There is no river signage. You have to pay attention when you see games for children in that corner where there are also a couple of stores bends to the left and then there is the place. It will be about ten kilometers that one deviates from the main road. There is no cell signal. There is light but you have to connect some cables to make it work. The same is a very quiet town during the week. On weekends I feel it is full of people.

Tranquilo lugar para estacionar frente al río. Los lugareños son muy amables. La entrada desde la ruta es poco convencional Justo después de la marca de este mismo río en la ruta. Pero enseguida se toma un camino asfaltado pero muy angosto. No hay señalización del Río. Hay que prestar atención cuando vean juegos para niños en esa esquina dónde hay también un par de almacenes se dobla a la izquierda y enseguida se encuentra el lugar. Serán unos diez kilómetros que se desvía uno de la carretera principal.  No hay señal de celular. Hay luz pero hay que unir unos cables para que funcione. Igual es un pueblo muy tranquilo entre semana. Los fines de semana presiento que se llena de gente.

name: Renault sanautos
description:
Very profesional team. Prices a bit higher than basic garage but the quality and the service are there
They checked our car and fixed what we had to.
We recommend.
They even wash it at the end!!
You can wait there in a room with water, coffee, wifi!
Very nice team also

name: Balneario Brisas del Rio
description:
Price is now (Oct. 22) 15000 cop p.p.n

Big area to camp right next to the river. We paid 15,000 for a couple in a truck camper. Same for our friends in a kombi.  Toilets were super clean. River was nice and cool. No power, plenty of tree shade. 
No Claro / No Tigo / 1 Mbs Movistar

name: Ceiba Ram Fiat Jeep
description: Dealer and service for RAM and other fiat Chrysler vehicles.  Excellent service for alignment, brake check, etc.  Muy profesional as you would expect from a factory dealer.

name: Hotel Gran Palacio
description:
Hotel near the municipal park and near the bakery, the supermarket....
Very friendly owner.
Rooms are spacious with A/C , TV and cold shower.
WiFi is available.
We paid 50 000 pesos for a room with 2 double beds.

name: El mejor Ajiaco del Mundo (traditional food)
description: Ajiaco is a traditional dish of Bogota and here the restaurant had to even changed the name (Old name Santafe) because they are famous to have the best one. Really delicious!!!!! Don't miss this place! Price was 26.000 CP pp. Recommended by locals.

name: Vibe Restaurante&Bar
description: Nice, traditional restaurant with very reasonable prices. Casuela de mariscos grande with rice, Platane, salad - is easily enough for two for 20.5k - was very good. Comidas for 10k, etc. Is next to Hotel Balcones Venecia, probably show on wrong side of road.

name: Valley view
description: We tried to drive to the Raquira wild camping spot from Villa de Leyva but close to here the road to go there is cut by a landslide. We discovered a side track (not on maps me) and followed only for 100 m and found this nice leveled spot next to the road and spent a very quiet night. Great views on mountain and valley. Don’t follow the track further down, it’s a dead end. We came here without 4x4 (dry) and you also don’t need high clearance.

name: La Laguna Bikepark
description:
https://www.facebook.com/lalagunabikepark/
tel: 3118725236 
Opening hours: Saturday, Sunday and Festivos. (Maybe other days too in the future, check with them) 
8am-16pm
10.000 cop pP. So worth it!

Camping 10.000 pP, only toilets and sink, unfortunately no shower. If you want to camp Friday to Saturday it is possible if you let them know in advance that you are coming. There is a restaurant and kiosk during opening hours. 

We were really surprised to arrive at this little mountainbike paradise. The bikepark is more like a trailpark using natural obstacles but with lots of built jumps, gaps, drops and wallrides. Many different trails for Enduro, Downhill and Cross Country! You have to ride up yourself or push the bike uphill. ;-) Height difference around 120 m to 180m. (From 2890 till 3020msnm). Sounds short in theory but the trails are definitely a long enough ride each time. All in the forrest with lots of shade! 
We stayed both days and had the whole park to ourselves on a Saturday as people apparently mainly come sunday! Our dog could join us on the trails too! (They have 3 friendly male dogs) 
We have our own bikes but Diego (the owner) said he has a couple of Cross Country Bikes for rent. Worth to ask, it’s a great park!

name: Roadside camping
description: This place is 30m from the main road just outside Pijao on the road to Buenavista. Quiet and with a great view to the Quindío Valley.

name: Soñarte
description: Soñarte is a hostel that allows you to stay in the open space in front of the main house. Patricia is the heart and soul of this agricultural and conservationist project. You can stay in your van or book a room with a great view. Call her beforehand: +573122885246. Cost per rig per night COP 30.000

name: San Marino JKL
description: Brand new hotel in El Bordo. The rooms are spacious and clean. It’s $40,000 pp pn including a garage spot. It’s a bit away from the main road and quiet. Great place for a stop between Cali and the border.

name: Terpel Gas Station with shower
description: Simple facilities of a Terpel Gas station, but clean toilet and cold shower. Few trucks arrived to park for overnight after 22:00 and leave around 05:00. Friendly staff. All surrounded by trees and not a lot of noise from the road. We slept one night and felt safe. Restaurant in the other side of the road, but we cooked our own food.

name: Taller Hare Automotriz
description: Went here for an oil change with a 1990 Vanagon and it cost 100,000 COP / $28 USD with a new filter. they specialize in VW. phone number: 312-765-2143. The clearance for their shop is not very high and so they conducted the oil change outside on the street because my rooftop rack would not clear. I inspected everything afterwards to ensure no leaks.

name: Los Papayos: Fonda De Pesca
description: A simple mountain side restaurant with rooms to rent. It's right next to a man made reservoir which is popular for fishing. My room was only 15,000 Pesos. I also order fresh Tilapia for dinner for only 9,000 pesos. The road here is extremely rocky and only 4x4, motorcycles or bicycles are able pass. Two rooms have 4 bunk beds in each bedroom. There is also a private queen size bedroom available. Bring your fishing poles!!!

name: Métro Booster
description:
Very good mechanic. Specializing in brakes, suppension, rotulas and bearing.
We had to change our vw t4 front wheels bushing and rotules.
Very nice guy and fare price.
Close to metro exposiciones.
Avi: +57 314 63568 59

name: Hotel G
description: new hotel in town , everything is perfect , the place to stay in Altamira . We paid 40000 pesos for a double room with fan .

name: El Peñol Hostel y glamping
description:
Incredible place to disconnect and rest. It has a camping area and both private and large rooms. A great view. Access to the river. Bicycle and kayaks for rent. A huge dining kitchen. Recreation room. Volley court. A nightclub for tertulias. Garden. And organize different recreational activities. Neither talking about the attention and the good atmosphere. We spent a wonderful day here.

Increíble lugar para desconectarse y descansar. Tiene zona de campings y habitaciones tanto privadas como para grandes grupos. Una gran vista. Salida al río. Alquiler  de bicicletas y kaiyas. Una enorme cocina comedor. Sala de recreación.  Cancha de voley. Una discoteca para tertulias.  Huerta. Y organizan diferentes actividades recreativas.  Ni hablar de la atención y el buen ambiente. Pasamos unos días maravillosos aquí.

name: Hostal Finca La Violeta
description:
Amazing colonial farm with cabins and wide open spaces for camping and RV’s just outside of town. Constanza is a great host and went out of her way to make us feel comfortable. Plenty of firewood around for bbq’s, we grilled and watched the beautiful moon rise above us.
The cabins include a small kitchen, clean bathrooms and hot water. We highly recommend this place.

name: El herbario vegan restaurant
description:
We had a great vegan menu del día here. Fresh and tasty ingredients. 
18.000 Cop
Very quiet and relaxing place. 
Open until 4.30pm

https://www.facebook.com/herbolariocasa/

name: Hotel Boutique Markes
description:
Sensational deal at 70,000 COP ( Hotels.com ) for a contemporary room, breakfast included, super fast wifi, and hot shower. Right between the airport and the main bus station so convenient for connections. On street parking available and the area is secure as there is a police station across the street. A 3 minute walk to the restaurant area and just beyond that the nightlife zone. Area is far enough away from the nightlife zone to be quiet and lots of small shops nearby. Seems very new, like it was just completely remodeled. No A/C but not needed in Bogotá. We stayed before flying home for a break from our Overlanding and will stay again when we return. Staff are very helpful.

They have the rooms without windows. I went there with my motorcycle, after i emptied all of my stuff from the bike, they asked me 120 pesos for the night. I reloaded my stuff on my motorcycle and went to a different motel. Be careful with the price.

name: Don Jaime
description: 10 meters next to Bici Pasto Camping site is this neighbor who helps vans and rigs of travellers. very handy mister. solved our water pomp wich had our mercedes benz 608 overheating.

name: Serviauto Diesel
description:
Awesome mechanic in Neiva. Very professional. Our pop-up camper was having some issues with the floor, so they let us use their hoist to pull the camper off our truck and called in a camper expert to help us fix the problem. They also took our camper winder to a machinery shop in town as it was getting worn. Whilst our camper was off our truck they also gave our car a service including new brake pads, rotate tires, rear axel seal, electronics and CV boot. Our casa was in the shop overnight so they hooked us up with a cheap hotel across the road (pet friendly). There are also a few cheap places to eat nearby. If you need anything, these guys will get it done at a very reasonable price.  All of the mechanics and the owner are very well experienced and are very passionate about their jobs.

Alberto (the owner) number 3152352862

name: Guía en la selva
description: Victor is native of this region, he and his father Gilberto, work as a guide. You can contact him directly and jump the prices of the agency. He is very smart and helpful. Don’t speak English... +57 (321) 460-8206

name: Hospivet
description:
We had a blood count and stool test made and the dog claws cut here. Dr. Liliana Góngora seems to know English (we talked Spanish but she translated some words directly into good English). She seems to be one of the more professional vets (we have visited several in Colombia and Ecuador lately because our dog was sick so could compare). If we wouldn't have had our health certificate for international travel made by another vet before we would've done it here too.

adress: Cra 53 No. 104 B-28 Tel.:6100935

name: Autoamérica Toyota
description:
Yet another official Toyota dealer with a professional workshop. Came in (on appointment - waited the week-end) for scheduled maintenance for a Land Cruiser 100 with an 1HD-FTE diesel engine. I keep track of the maintenance schedule myself and I have the shop manual with me (on a laptop).

Four mechanics do the work in parallel - which makes it difficult to keep an eye on them. Management eventually came out to ask me to leave the shop, which I refused. (I may have spoilt it for the next stubborn customer.)

Should you have the same car: no need to go to an official dealer, because most parts for diesel versions are not available here anyway. So, no hope for original bushings. Original filters were available.

Reasonable prices.

name: Auto Faro
description: These people repair the plastic of broken head and tail lights, as well as broken side mirrors. The place is very small and their name is hidden under an awning. (And there are many similar shops here.) They were recommended to me by the shop manager of the nearby Toyota dealer.

name: Hotel Santa Veronica
description: Nice hotel with a friendly owner. A double room with AC for 170.000 with breakfast. There is a restaurant downstairs.

name: Hotel San Francisco
description: Hotel right in downtown Bogota with free breakfast and free parking (lot directly across the street with no height restrictions. Could not have been happier with this choice for my stay. Booked for $20/night for 3 nights but price my fluctuate. This was a deal on Booking.com. The tram stop is just outside the door on the other side from the parking lot. Hotel is clean and nice.

name: Charco Corazon Day Park
description: Just across the bridge angle left on little pathway to a nice spot by the river.  Stonework has created a little swimming pool in the side of the hill with little cascades from one level to the next.  Steps into the pool so it’s nice for kids, but watch the drop to the creek for the wee ones.

name: Plaza Central
description:
I had a peaceful night. there is level space to park a vehicle. People of the village are very friendly. Restaurant with reasonably priced menu nearby and markets.
...
Tuve una noche tranquila, hay donde estacionar el vehículo en un lugar plano. La gente del pueblo muy amable. Hay restaurante con menú económico cerca y mercados.

name: Behind the church
description: We stayed one night behind the church with our tent. Only for cyclists or backpackers. Very quiet and safe . Water available . Free and great view on the mountains

name: Villa Zambu
description: It's the restaurant of the hotel (villa Zambu). It has an economic menu for breakfast, lunch and dinner, it cost around 7.000~14.000 CP. Toilets are very clean and it also have good wifi. You can park in front and watch the car.

name: Hacienda San José
description: Hacienda with pool, campsite and restaurant. We paid 20'000 COP ppn.

name: Soñarte mountain campground
description: This is the mountain campground of Soñarte in Cordoba, Quindío. The road leads to the left behind the local hospital. The last part is very steep. The view is fantastic.

name: Santadupar - Restaurant, Wifi and Laundry!
description: It is a restaurant that has economic menus around 6.000~8.000 CP all day. The wifi is good, we even download Netflix movies very fast, and we asked if we could do laundry and they offer the service, we washed two big bags, around 11 kg for 20.000 CP, the service was good and fast, around 4 hours. The restaurant has camera in front, so we also parked for the night, it was flat, quiet and felt safe.

name: Hotel Casa Boutique Villa de Leyva
description: Natalia and Julian manage a newly renovated boutique hotel in a old colonial building close to the plaza mayor. All rooms are tastfully furnished, prices range around 140k COP. +57 3134077132.

name: National Library
description: Huge library. Good place to hang out. Free toilet, good free wifi.

name: Hotel Baranoa Plaza
description: Clean hotel in Baranoa. We paid 50.000 for a double room with AC. It was no problem to take our bicycles inside the building. The bed was rock hard though. Breakfast is 16.000 pesos.

name: Hotel y restaurante niña
description: A cheap place to stay. The room was quite primitive and a toilet without a seat or a door was not the most comfortable. But the people were really friendly and we payed only 20.000 for two. There was plenty of space to leave our bicycles for the night.

name: Tamales Traditional
description: It is a house that for years sell the traditional Tamal of Socorro, made with turkey and pork, the big is 7.000 each (it is the recommended one!!!). It was recommended by a local from the area. If you are in this zone, dont miss those Tamals, you can also freeze and consume later.

name: Chiflas Restaurant
description:
The guy from the national park didn't allow us to stay overnight. we then drove back a couple of kilometers to land here which is to my eyes much better:  stunning view, nice staff, water point, Wi-Fi services....

Very good restaurant, with fantastic view of Chicamocha valley. Close to parapente fly one. Visited from early morning till late at night by many Colombians. Good food at reasonable prices. Coffee 800 pesos. Easy parking for any size rig. We even got the favor to spend the night in their gated area, because we were caught by dark. Very safe, but noisy because of all truck traffic.

name: Casa Hospedaje La Bohemia
description:
Located downtown, surrounded by restaurants, supermarkets, bars and very easy access to public transport. Casa Hospedaje La Bohemia  is a peaceful country house that offers a beautiful view of the city and the mountains. It offers 6 comfortable bedrooms with 15 beds in total, free WiFi, shared kitchen and 4 shared bathrooms with hot shower. Ideal for backpackers from all around the world who want to rest for a while ! We speak French, Spanish and English.
Private parking for motorcycles just down the house... Only 4000 pesos for the night.

name: Toche free wifi and tent spot
description:
You can put your tent behind that open air gim. No roof but you can choose grass or concrete. 

Very calm in the night nobody bothered us. 

For water ask neighbors. Free wifi reach here :)

name: Tapias - free alcaldia wifi
description:
Free wifi nice working enjoy!

There is simple restaurant in the Pueblo and some football field with roof so I think wildcamp available!

name: Mall money exchange
description: You can change your money here if you didn’t do it at the border or the airport

name: Cepita Plaza
description: We slept one night in the main plaza. It is not very flat, but ok. They were constructing something near buy, so noise earlier morning! We asked the police station and they said that the little town is very safe and we could chose anyplace to spend the night. I think we didn't chose good, but at least we could spend some time in the park and watch the people. Don't miss the road to get here, it is one of the most beautiful roads we took in South America, you get really  inside to the Cañon de Chicamocha. The town is very small and pretty, little shops nearby the plaza. Not really touristic place, more authentic!

name: Camping Los Corales
description:
Large shady campground with two sanitary blocks, electricity, cold water, wifi. Grocery store a couple of minutes walk from campground and really nice beach within a 15 minute walk. Friendly and helpful owner Raphael. We paid 17,000 COP per person with our truck camper.
Good place to spent a few days. Lots of Iguanas in the trees. No loud music allowed - quiet, just perfect. Raphael lets you use his industrial gas stove for 2k COP. Possibility to have your laundry made. Bus 2k/person COP or Taxi 20k COP to Santa Marta center, both hailed at the road just outside the campground. Large clean beaches, 15min to walk.

Update June 2022: 40k per night camping, 20k per night parking. Does not appear that the industrial stove is available to rent any more. 

Update october 2022: new price 25000 cop p.p.n.

name: 5km Tunnel to Medellin
description:
Warning!
Cyclists are not allowed through this 5kms Tunnel! I tried and the man said I couldn't go through.The only other option is a very long hard trek over the mountains at San Sebastian de Palmistas the old 62 road,4 kms back down the road and up and over.I asked the Policia if they could get me a lift and within a few minutes they got me a lift with  construction 4x4 pickup.They dropped me off on the other side 10 mins later and It was a nice easy down hill all the way to Medellin.I think it's worth riding up to the entrance  and asking for a lift as they're loads of empty trucks and pick ups
 going through.But it's up to you.Good Luck!

name: Temporary checkpoint
description: Look out not to overtake in this area, a bit north of the little town a couple corrupt police wanted some money cause we overtook a big truck with the continuous line. It was indeed our fault but they ask how much money we had instead of the fine... After speaking with the one officer a bit they let us go without fine nor paying a cent.

name: local backyard
description:
Nice local backyard were you can camp. Very simple but nice and relax. We had access to bucket toilet and shower. Not running water for now.
Chicken, dog and pig around, but that the part of the local lifestyle.
Two families live here. The children are very curious and nice.
We stayed 6 nights and payed 10 000 COP for both of us and our camper van / night.
Rincon as a great vibe. It's a small fisherman village, not to much touristic, and very "tranquilo". Nice beach and close to the San Bernardo Island. It's the perfect place to chill a few days.

name: Camping area next to river and bridge
description: It was getting late when I rode down here and it looked liked the perfect place to camp by the river.There's a house which looks like a business/restaurant of some sort.Also sign with entrance fees too..I didn't pay anything.I just asked the friendly woman if I could sleep by the river(which doesn't look like her property) and she said no problem.I can't imagine she owns the area by the river but maybe on weekends or something people come to picnic and colllects small fees?There's evidence of little camp fires etc..She has cold drinks too.Dogs bark but are friendly.I had a very quiet night,no bugs,a wash in the river etc.Loads of space for RV's I'd say of any size.Lovely spot off the highway.

name: Hotel Imperial
description: hotel malibu was fully booked, so we came here. nice receptionist, clean room, safe parking with no height restrictions across the street, ac, wifi. 40.000 for a double room

name: Lubrirepuestos de la Costa
description:
Contact Hugo for all kinds of repairs.
He took me to a place to fix my thermoswitch, then he had someone work on my brakes.
+57 300 3039734
He's a very nice 4x4 guy who was recommended to me by Mauro from 40s Garage in Chía (near Bogota) and he works with all shops in the area that he trusts.

name: Encosta. Suspensions and brakes
description:
Very helpful mechanic. Got some huge problems with ours shocks.
They take time to explain us with we got a problem. Spend the day to find the perfect shocks ( old dodge ram van)
A bit long but when you want something good. It s worth it.
Recommand this place for brakes Shocks.
They have made in japon, usa and colombia!!
Good staff, coffee and watet for custumers.

name: AMAZING ROAD INSIDE CAÑON CHICAMOCHA!!!
description: It was recommended by a Colombian friend who lives in the area of Santander. The GPS is of the entrance of the road. This road is amazing and head to Cepita, a very little town with colonial style. You drive inside the Cañón de Chicamocha and after can sleep in the town. It was one of the most beautiful roads that we saw in south America, it is a must go! Don't miss this place!

name: D1 Supermarket
description: It is your last supermarket option before go to Refugio de la Roca. It is not so big, but has some variety. Next door you will find the Mercado Campesino, there you can find more options of vegetables, fruits and also fresh meat.

name: Al Alma - Coffee Roasters
description: Nice place, close to the Hostel Area. Good Coffee, nice chill Vibe, good varieties of food for Vegetarians but also for meat eater.

name: Cumbre - Nice cafe on the corner
description: Really lovely new cafe run by two brothers. Great coffee, great sandwiches, great juice and cookies. Really awesome place. Definitely worth a pop in.

name: Casa Castle Hotel
description: If you fancy a tad of luxury before/after getting your vehicle at a reasonable price. This place is it. Rooms can be between 150 (ok price) to 195 (expensive) depending on any deals you can get face to face or on booking.com. Normally we don't put hotels on ioverlander, especially in this price range. But we stayed in 5 hostels\hotels\airbnbs in cartagena and this was by far the best value for money, in a great location near DIAN (customs) and one of the ports. Not far from old town either. Has swimming pool, roof terrace, usable kitchen (breakfast included) and onsite masseuse (if you really want to mess with  your budget because you are upset your vehicle is late!). Rooms all have aircon and cable (English shows can be changed bk to English). Has limited parking out the front, spaces reserved on request, can fit a small van but street parking available for anything bigger. Safe part of town. Hammocks in communal area. This place is by far the least overland thing we have done, but at 150 a night for a king bed as a treat was amazing.

name: Waterfall near Bridge
description:
No access for anything bigger than a motorcycle. 
The mettalic bridge was built to replace the old road going along a massive waterfall. You can camp on the old road and bathe at the waterfall. it is located north of the bridge and you must access it by the west side of the bridge, there is a little path that leads to it. You camp on asphalt but it's hard to find wood for fire.

name: Dulce Minimal café, bread, & sweets
description: Such a nice atmosphere, amazing local owners who will give you advice/good conversation, and delicious coffee, sweets, bread, and smoothies. Great place to relax and to connect to locals. Can not recommend this place enough. Also they have WiFi and bathrooms

name: Batericars tire shop
description: Super easy tire balance.  Got me right in on a Saturday. Lift couldnt handle more than 2000kg though.

name: local restaurant - carne y pollo
description:
A very delicious local meal!
There are a few of this style of restaurant around (meat, salad, rice, lentils - can start with a mixed-bone both soup). I ate lunch here but the sign says breakfast, lunch and supper. This has been one of my favorites!...and I've tried a crass some waiting for an error with our container. Dog friendly.

name: Terpel Gas station
description: You can fill up your tanks for free at the same time you take gasoline or diesel.

name: Outdoor Parqueo for the Mall
description: if your vehicle is over 2.1 meters this parking lot is a good option. it cost 5,000 mil for overnight parking although there isn't really overnight parking. they let me stay anyway and I pulled forward to be right in front of the mall where the security guards were standing all night.

name: Delicias Naturales
description: Very good vegetarian restaurant. For a full meal (they offer one per day): milk rice, sopa or cremita, plate with rice and 2 vegetable sides and 2 different salads, a vegetable arepa (very good) and a mango/banana drink - we paid 6k COP! It tasted really great - what a deal.

name: Aguaviva
description:
4 nights in this quiet place in a motorhome, showers, toilets for only 20k for 2 people. Same price for a tent. There are also collective or individual rooms. There is also a tent available for 2 people at 20k. A kitchen for 3k. Ideal for holidays. 

Note: there's no longer a height restriction as the cross beam at the entrance has been removed.

name: Native Cafe Tourismo
description: Tour of a local artesenal coffee finca with a guided hike (steep but short) to the famous double waterfall.  Jairo speaks very good English and explains how his family cultivates and processes high quality beans.  Roasting and tasting (and sales) in town at these coordinates.  Contact Jairo who can arrange jeep transport to the Finca and back.  +573226490332.  Price depends on number of people...

name: Macondo Hostel
description: Good hostel with a jacuzzi, kitchen, and outdoor social space. You can organise all types of activities from here, including paragliding Chicamocha Canyon (COP 180,000) and rafting Rio Suarez (COP 130,000). Parking one block further down the street, secure, large and covered (24h for COP 18,000). Don't park in the streets, apparently break-ins are very common in San Gil.

name: Purple Monkey Hostel
description:
Awesome hostel, with great social vibes. Super comfortable, well furnished, with a bar and kitchen. They let me park my car in front of the hostel on the sidewalk for free (stayed for a week). Felt totally safe, and the reception is 24 hours anyway. Parking around here is very expensive otherwise. Note there's a clearance of about 2.5 meters because of the porch. Couple points to note:
- Curfew is at 11pm after which point it's quiet (everyone goes out).
- No private rooms, just dorms.
- Street burrito stand across the street is legit.

name: next to a river
description:
we found that little spot close to a river. it's not possible to come to the water. but amazing view. someone called the police, but they were really friendly and allowed us to sleep there for a night. 
really quiet

name: beach parking
description:
we liked this place more then playa Blanca. the way is a bit more difficult. there is a dirt road, but it is possible even without a 4x4. 

turn on the T junction to the right. On the end a old man LEO has his small bar, we could park directly next to that.  
just some locals here, very quiet and the beach is super nice. 
We could use Leos Toilet behind his bar. and there is a place close to here. 3000 pesos for a shower

name: Near Refugio La Roca
description: If you are coming from the Refugio la Roca turn right here and go down ~100m. It is a free spot that we found to park for free and hide from the road. Maybe high clearance recommended. It is not leveled, so you can level your car with the many stones available around. Few locals use this route to go up from the town, but in 2 weeks sleeping here, we met around 5 people. Felt safe and we could open the roof tent. During the day we parked at the Refugio La Roca (for free if you climb) and after climb we come here for sleeping. It was the most economic option for us. We could get shower for free at the Mercado Campesino and one time at the Refugio La Roca. Nice view from the canyon and Claro signal available.

name: Parking
description: If you came to La Mojarra to climb, you can park your car inside the Refugio La Roca for free. We also bought our climbing tickets with them. New prices are: 10.000 pdpp, or a 8 days entrance ticket for 70.000, or a year entrance ticket for 150.000 and in this one you get 10 "invitation" entrances.

name: VISA extension
description: Here you can extend your VISA in Colombia. You don't need to bring any copies, they do all here. South Americans pay 99.000, EU citizens don't need to pay, just bring passport and Car documents.

name: Hotel Ibis Budget
description: Newly constructed clean and modern hotel in very convenient location right next to the metro station Itaqui and main bus stops. Shopping center with restaurants also very close by. Big outdoor free parking lot with 24h security, suitable for larger campers as well. No height restriction. Rooms are air conditioned. Efficient and friendly staff. Not a particularly attractive area and restaurants other than in the mall are limited but the convenience of the location and the parking space make this hotel ideal. We paid 117,000 for a double room with two twin beds, private bathroom and breakfast.

name: Bocagrande Llaves
description: This man cloned me a key for my Tundra truck without the master. The dealership said it was impossible and wanted $2k USD. This guy charged $82 USD.

name: Automotriz de Lima
description: This is an expert shop that deals in high performance imports as well as other cars. Romero and his team completely resolved all of the issues I had. Even the issues the mechanics in Santa Marta created. I would not consider taking my vehicle to any other  mechanics in Colombia. These are experts that went over my vehicle with a fine tooth comb and resolved all my issues on time and affordably.

name: La Gruta (2nd floor)
description: This restaurant was a recommendation from a local guide and we were very happy with it. Delicious local food for a bargain. Nice ambient, friendly stuff, not so touristic as the restaurants at the plaza. Manager/chef speaks fluently English.

name: hôtel Aloha
description: Very nice hotel. All is new. Room for 30000 COP with aircon.

name: Hotel Maret
description: Quiet, clean hotel. Looks like it was recently remodeled. I asked for a room away from the street side and it was a nice place to rest quietly for the night. TV, Wall Fan, and Wi-Fi. All worked really well. The hotel is located on the side of a roundabout and there is a Parquedero next door. I was able to park my Moto in the hotels personal garage for free. I paid 30,000 COP. Nice place to stay if you need to spend the night in Cartago.

name: Armed robbery by 2 men
description:
Warning especially for cyclists who are travelling alone: 
Two men in their late 20s (walking), armed with a gun, managed to stop one of us and stole one phone at "km 34". They also tried to steel more, including the entire bicycle at one point, but ran off into the field when they saw more and more cars approaching. The entire thing was super fast and we obviously did not resist due to the gun. Luckily no one got hurt, but please be aware and try to travel in groups if possible (we were 2 and that didn't stop them). Stay safe everyone!

name: Restaurante Brisas del Oriente
description:
The restaurant is connected to a hotel, it's a place where all the truck drivers park their trucks outside and stay till the morning. There was a guy helping the trucks with parking, asked him if I can stay in front of the restaurant for one night because it was lighted and I felt safe about it. He did let me sleep there in my van, didn't charge me anything, even though I asked him.
He was there the whole night, helping there with the trucks, so safe place to stay for one night if you are on the road.

name: Stone Campsite/Hostel (TOP)
description:
This is one of the most special places in San Gil. On site river, natural water pools and the Afrondita waterfall set in amongst a wooded Creek. Protected from the noises of the town and nearby roads.

30k for our camper at high season, but I'm told a different price can be negotiated at low season. 

The Tree of Life hostel has a shared agreement we a hotel near by, where anyone staying there has free rein of the hotels grounds as well, including swimming pool and caged football and basketball pitch. But don't worry, your view at Tree of Life is only nature. The waterfall has a tasteful bar build into a natural cave underneath it!

Restaurant, bar and cafe available on site. 

The hostel is ran by Brendon (a Scott) and Josey (an Argentinian) who both speak great in English if your still learning Spainish.
Activities available include: hiking, yoga, massage, rafting, dance classes and crossfit. But if you have something else in mind they'll arrange it for you :)

name: Cuatro Vias
description: On the other side of the police compound (officers sent us there and told us, that they are at the lookout all night), at the road to Uribia. Small sandy strip with trees and some rubbish, but good for one night. Traffic dies down after dark. Small snack bars  nearby. There must be toilets and water, but we had no need.

name: Restaurant Maraune Beach
description:
A small complex, the manaure beach restaurant allowed us to park our motorhome close to their main building. By 10m cable, we got weak electricity out of their kitchen and could have used their toilet or bucket shower. Busy during the day, quiet during the night. Decent food, cold drinks. Possibility to visit one of the largest salinas of colombia or watch flamingos in a nearby park.
The roads from Uribia to Manaure/Manaure to Riohacha are mostly paved.

name: Gabinos
description: Good fast place to get your brakes done place is right next store to a car wash. Does air con and brakes had the rear brakes done cost $100 on ford e350. Not much english but decent

name: Yolombó, Antioquia
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: This place was added by the owner or manager. It has not been overlander verified. 
----
An excellent place to stay rather in your big rig or using the hotel rooms.
Our facilities have comfortable rooms with breakfast included.
Our parking lot can accommodate big trucks and the hotel staff will be glad to serve you.
They will offer you the local tour for the coffee bean plantation or sugarcane panela

name: finca Bacatá
description:
a beautiful space where Yolanda serves you as a family. Three minutes from some hot springs that are very good too (18,000) the room is perfect for a group or couple (70,000) for two people. there is an orchard, two cute dogs and the beautiful place.


un espacio lindísimo donde Yolanda te atiende como familia. a tres minutos de unas aguas termales que están muy bien también (18000) la habitación es perfecta para un grupo o pareja (70.000) por dos personas.
hay un huerto, dos perros lindos y el lugar hermoso.

name: Camping Perezoso
description:
Informal camping on a family's house yard, nearby
 to to the town 1km.

name: Fuel Shortages
description:
Couple things to note when traveling East of Santa Marta towards Riohacha and La Guajira (current situation):
1) The gasoline here comes from Venezuela, which is causing a lot of supply problems.
2) There are shortages in Riohacha. We had to queue for 3.5 hours today for "Corriente" gasoline. Similar situation reported on previous days.
3) Wasn't able to find any "Extra" gasoline anywhere East of Santa Marta.

name: Outstanding viewpoint
description: A big flat parking area next to this road side shrine. Amazing views. Very quiet at night, no traffic at all. Locals were friendly. 3G claro.

name: My Parents House
description: It's a nice little hostel, located in a suburban area. It's a family business, the family lives there as well, they are really nice people. They have a dorm for 8 people and a seperate little apartment with 4 beds and it's own bathroom. If you use the dorm, you share the bathroom with the family. AC in the dorm aswell as in the apartment. I paid 45k for one night in the dorm (at new years eve, prices are crazy high for all the hostels in cartagena at this time of the year, I'm sure its way lower during off season), including really good breakfast made by the wife of the owner, she cooks something else every morning for all the guests. They also have 2 cats and 2 dogs living there so I guess it's a good place if you bring a pet yourself. All in all a good experience, nice and helpful owners and good food. You can park in front of the house on the street, the owner said he always parks there and never something happened. I parked my vehicle in a secure parking lot in the city though, the area can be a bit shady during nights.

name: El Argentino restorente
description:
This place, is a restaurant, a hostel and a camping. It is very close to the paragliding schools, Parapente Colombia and Los Aguilas. We camp here with our van for 5 days while taking paragliding lessons. If you don't have a van you can sleep in the dormitory.
A mama Colombiana, will take good care of you and cook the best meal.
It's not easy to find a flat spot, but the good vibe will make you feel comfortable.
Fully recommended!

name: El Viejo Molino
description: Beautiful restaurant with old structure and delicious local food, a little pricey but we'll worth it (32000/plate).

name: la casa de lucas
description:
quiet and spacious, nice clean rooms. $17US for a couple. Camping also possible and small vans.   Mindfulness workshops available.  Great family with a Great Dane dog very good natured.

es un espacio privilegiado, tranquilo y muy espacioso. las habitaciones son limpias, amplias y bonitas. $17 usd por una pareja. reciben también gente par acampar y pequeñas Vans.
muy buena conversación, dan talleres de mindfulness y respiración conciente. Lucas y su familia son increíbles anfitriones. tienen una gran danés inmensa y muy tranquila y amorosa. el teléfono de Lucas es +543163958173

name: Carulla Poblado
description: If you want to buy good, varied and not too expensive food, this is the place to be.  There is very good bread, very good cheese, several wines, good yogurt in glass bottles.  For me it's the best place to shop and cook well

name: Paragliding school
description:
Here you can find 2 great paragliding schools: Las Aguilas and Parapente Colombia.
Did a 5 days course with Parapente Colombia. It was great. Got over 10 solo flights. The team is very nice and helpful.
It is 300,000 per day or 3,000,000 for a 10-day certification.
The place is great to learn. 360 flying days per year! Thermic in the morning and dynamic in the evening.
You can contact Ritchie at (+57)312-432 6266.
Cheap tandem flights as well.

name: Overlook just Outside of Town
description:
A big flat area on the outskirts of town with a nice view. The landowner lives in the cream and blue place just over the road next to the tienda. He wanted a very pricey 20,000 for camping with no amenities (but claimed there was water although we didn’t look). We needed to start work so stayed. 

Nice views, any size rig can fit. Toilets free at the Terpel gas station just over the road. There is also a restaurant over the road. It is safe and would have been quiet were it not for the event in town. It's expensive. But, if you like the location it’s good.

No Tigo / Slow Movistar / Great Claro (15Mbs)

name: Town Center
description: Front of the police station you can camp and you can use their toilet. Also this small town has 2 restaurant one of them has very nice empanadas.

name: Los Abuelos (Traditional Cousine)
description: One of those 'well-worth-it' food stops!!! Traditional Colombian food restaurant with superb quality and service, parking space for any car. Children's playground and farm with some animals. But what we really loved was the food. We were starving for breakfast and this place is open early from 6am serving all sorts of delicious Colombian food ( calentado, caldo, arepa, huevos, chorizos, jugos etc) really recommend it. Enjoy. The restaurant is in the Bogota-Villeta direction.

name: Lavandy Café
description: Selfservice Laundry. COP 26.000 per load for washer and dryer. Have a coffee while you wait. Friendly staff and strong WiFi. Open daily from 8:00am - 9:00pm.

name: family restaurant
description: Nice family run restaurant and the son does great tours to the wax palms or waterfalls, or birds or the Paramo.  The restaurant serves good typical Colombian food.  I loved their lentils and vegetables.

name: Camino Real
description: Right next to the Royal Class Hotel. Spacious and clean doubleroom with private bath for 50000 cop. Electrical shower. Wifi ok. Quiet at night. Secured outside parking lot, although we didn't feel so safe to leave our bicycles out there, so we finally could take them into our room in the first floor.

name: Hospedaje, Restaurante & Piscinas
description:
Restaurant, swimming pool and hospedaje next to the old Panamericana. Great stop for cyclists going north if you dont want to do the whole climb in a day or during the afternoon heat! 
Very lovely owners, plenty of space to park motos or bicycles (we took our bicycles inside the room, although the tiny village seems to be very safe and everyone we met there was super friendly). 
20.000 COP for a room with two matresses on the floor & private bathroom with cold water. Very basic but still great value. Clean pool, lovely owners, beautiful garden with hammocks.There are many fruit trees (Orange, Mango, Avocado, Banana...) behind the house and you can pick as much as you like. 
There are some small shops with basic supplies in the village (Rosa Florida), about 5 min walk away.
Restaurant serves a daily dish and even prepared something vegetarian for me upon request.

name: Hotel Rumichaca
description:
Arrived to Ipiales on new years, the Hotel on the other side of the street was closed and we didnt want to spend much time looking for a cheaper place cause everyone was partying outside.
60.000 COP for a matrimonoial with private bathroom. Warm shower, decent wifi. Very clean. No parking but we were allowed to put our two bicycles in the lobby for the night.

name: Free and quiet with a view
description:
This is a smooth but unpaved road next to the vivero with a nice view of the next town on the other side of the valley. Very quiet (just a couple of friendly old guys wandered by so far - one of who works in the ‘vivero’ opposite). We haven’t heard another vehicle pass yet, peaceful with the usual couple of dog yaps and distant rooster alarm call in the morning. Maybe my previous two nights of poor sleep are clouding my judgment but for a ‘road in town’ it doesn’t get much better than this. Safe, quiet, nice view, friendly old locals and seemingly ignored by other drivers! We decided to stay another day and soak up some chilled Colombian pueblo vibes. Vivero guys said a tip for local coffee was ‘Mi Tierra’ from supermercado in town.

Cell: Seemingly best reception in town according to our tests with decent-ish Claro 3G (up to 2Mbs). Movistar was sane speed but less reliable. Tigo linking to Movistar.

name: abya  yala
description: We've eaten delicious food, a menu, the place is next to the very cheap and excellent laundry service. We absolutely recommend this wonderful restaurant. We paid 8000cop for a soup + meat etc + dessert + drinks. The waiters are so nice! Ans so is the place! Enjoy it!!!

name: puesta de sol sobre cafeto
description: On the side of a children's center with a magnificent view of the coffee plantations and the mountains. Quiet and secure. Flat and isolated. Super sun set. Ideal with dogs. 10 min from the plaza.

name: XJ Racing Garage
description: Mechanic shop where you can fix your vehicles by yourself. Also they have mechanic experts with large experience in big rigs and 4x4 vehicles who also can repair your damage. You can buy and replace parts. Whapp +57 3132844713

name: El Balcones de el Carrizal
description:
We were told about this place in town by Man 1 who called the owner and took us to him in town. He then told us where to go and find his guest house / hotel. So, it seems they are friendly and open to having overlanders stay. 

It’s a wonderful location with great views of the valley and glaciers (look for moonrise over the glacier!). Big rigs should be fine to get through The gate and driveway (lined by pines but wide enough). They want to develop this field into a camping area. Pay was voluntary but we paid 15,000 for both and 7,500 each for a breakfast. There are rooms with showers so may be possible to use. There is a clean toilet with sink and water is also available. 

Cell Reception:
Claro is 3 bars of 4G with a speed of 5Mbs when tested.
Movistar and Tigo not tested.

name: Glorious Meadow Camping with View
description:
A stunning free spot with a great view. No amenities. A local farm lady was roaming the fields in the morning and said it was fine to camp and that there is not really an owner. It really is a great spot.

Cell: Claro 4 bars of 4G and very fast (40mbs)

name: Hotel Ribai
description:
This hotel is large, has 4 floors, but has no elevator.  It is located in a commercial area very close to the market, this is a point against it, since there is quite a lot of noise in the day.  The nights are quiet. The rooms are comfy and the beds are OK. The night it’s around 30USD.


Este hotel es grande, posee 4 pisos, pero no tiene ascensor. Está ubicado en un área comercial muy cerca al mercado, esto es un punto en contra, ya que en el día hay bastante ruido. las noches son tranquilas.

name: Dentitown Dentist
description:
Very nice modern dentist surgery. The dentist Dr Alejandra is very kind and accommodating, she speaks perfect English. I am certain that if you ring her in pain she would see you immediately. This is a general dentist. I am sure if you wanted implants etc she would refer you to a colleague. 
I had a filling, it has been perfect and the treatment was first class. Definitely recommended. Tel/ whatsapp +573172328959.  info@dentitown.com. 
Calle 8 7-20.

name: Barberia Pochiman
description: Nice guy who makes you a nice haircut and can cut also a beard. Carefully and ask twice if he is unsure. Only Spanish but he's improving. Bit expensive 20k for haircut and 10k for beard. Was my fault, because I didn't ask before he started to cut.

name: Ecolavado Jardin
description: We are the owners of this self service laundry, we wash and dry your clothes, we open from 8 am to 5 pm every day of the year, the charge for load is $8.000 pesos for wash, and $8.000 pesos for dry, the capacity of our machines are 10 kilograms per load, or the clothing volume. We are located Carrera 5 N. 15-52 in Jardin - Antioquia - Colombia. whatsapp 3006129156

name: Esso
description: Camped the night in the parking lot. did not get robbed.

name: Hospedaje mi finquita
description:
Nice little hostel, located in the suburbs of cartagena. Managed by a family, they have secure parking, 4 spots for normal cars and one spot for a bigger vehicle. Also the owner cooks for you if you like to. Breakfast 9000cop and dinner 11000cop, good food. I payed 30000cop per night for a single room with a bathroom (warm water) and ac, parking is included.
They have a dog so I guess pets are welcome. Spanish speaking only but really patient and helpful.

name: La Posada
description: Very nice family run hotel. A lot of plants decorating the patio. 80.000 cop for a double room with private bath. Inside parking of bicycles, motorbikes and normal cars. There are cheaper hostal options in the village, but for sure not as nice.

name: Not touristic cabalgata
description:
The owner of the camping Sylvestre Raquira also offers really nice horse rides. It is 50 000 COP per person for a 2 hours tour in the surrounding mountains.
Small groups (only 2 of us) and tallored to your level.
The camping is also very nice.
Fully recommend.

name: Campo Karst
description:
Camping Zone in Zapatoca, Santander.
With restrooms and showers, electricity.
Campfire area, hammock area, track and bike rental, shop and geological exhibition.
wood stove.
Rental of tents and mats

name: The Stepping Stone - coffee, veggie & vegan brunch etc.
description: This is a very chill and hipster place. There's plenty of space inside but still, it was almost full. They offer vegetarian and vegan options for coffee, salads, brunches. I had the avocado-egg-feta-bread (20k) and a cappuccino (5.5k). Both were very good but I was really hungry so I wouldn't have minded if the portion was twice as big! Check the image for the menu and prices.

name: La playita camping
description: Gorgeous spot by the river where you can park up under the shade of the bamboo. The owners are english and french, both speak spanish and are super friendly. Tons of beautful sites to visit nearby and they have the best bathrooms in the carribean. Oh and a dump station!!!

name: Peage
description:
0.0000 pp car.(free)
truck 22.900
From Pasto to Cali

name: Auto Master
description: that's a place where you can find parte for VW for a good price. the owner knows a lot about mechanic.

name: Hotel La Gloria
description: On-site covered/ secure parking (sufficient headroom for RVs). Biker friendly. swimming pool and gardens- great place to relax.

name: Posada Carlota
description: Nice little hospedaje right on the town square. Small handwritten sign advertising habitaciones outside. Ample secure parking. 50,000 COP for a double with air conditioning, 30,000 COP without. Dorms also available.

name: Hotel Campestre
description: A very decent hotel in the center of Amagá. We played 50.000 for a room for two which was nice and clean. They have a kind of garden where we could safely leave our bicycles. A tent could fit there in case all the rooms are full, but I didn't ask if they would allow it.

name: Hotel cerro bravo
description: Very decent hotel with an amazing view from the hallway. We paid 70.000 for a room for two. We could leave our bicycles in the hallway.

name: El patio de Toño (Pizza)
description: We met Toño via Albeiro and Gloria (owners of La Pradera), he gave us a ride into the city for a very reasonable price (70 COP), later we figured out that Toño also has a small backyard pizzeria. It results the pizza is actually very good! If you’re around I’d definitely try it out...plus Toño is just an amazing guy!

name: Embalse El Hato Camping
description:
One of our favorite camping spots near Bogotá. Embalse el Hato is an artificial lagoon run by CAR, a Colombian environmental institution so facilities are well maintained.
