Services include : Toilets with warm showers (at our last visit, only the ladies shower worked) there are several grills. Price for camping is a flat tariff of $30.000 per person for up to 3 nights. We spent four nights so $5.000 per night, fairly cheap considering the various services. A recent addition is free bike rental. So you can make the 10kms nice ride along the lake. You can buy wood for the night or also rent a kayak. Plenty of garbage bins, so please use them. During weekdays, the place is almost empty.  This is the best time for camping and relaxing before going into Bogota or north towards Villa de Leyva, Tunja Or Bucaramanga. There are several camping entrances along the lake so choose your favorites. Toilets are only in the main camping area which is nice as it has a big flat area. 24hrs Safety. Park rangers are really nice. let them know if you need something. In the corner before the lake, there is a small store at the top of the hill selling various items, also food and drinks. If you come to visit the old colonial Hacienda located 2kms past the lake, a 200-yr Building from the ancient landlord of this land is being restored. Here they provide also Cabin rentals if you wish to stay warmer. Enjoy and take care of the place. 

Drive here via Ubate to avoid bad road. From Ubate it’s just fine. Mostly paved about 4km good dirt road.

name: Camping Los Farallones
description: A very modern camping ground with a water park. The camping is 17.000 per person and includes entrance to the pool. The toilets are acceptable but there are no toilet seats. The restaurant is a bit expensive and not that good. Hanging out in the pool after a long hot day of cycling was a very welcome change. Recommended!

name: Cucunuba (Colonial and Handcrafts town)
description: Nice little Town with many little stores selling wool products. Look for the store in front of the main cathedral, They Have unique designs from Alpaca.

name: Colina de Los Azulejos
description:
Nice Hostal with cabanas, small pool, nice kitchen hang out area and place to park overland vehicles (no camping) Contact Leonidas Torres +57 3183730092.  Cabinas between 4and 6 so accommodates families.  

Video of the facilities:

https://www.facebook.com/watch/?v=1169325056563125

Video of Guadalupe and las Gachas

https://youtu.be/8Vgp5fIfpD4

name: VIPizza
description: Don't go here. The pizza was not special for 40.000 for two persons. But on top of that we spent the entire night and the next day over the toilet puking it out again.

name: Playa de la Boquilla
description:
We arrived to the beach and we stayed close to a Palm Tree. Just ask for Luz Mila, close to the cemetery. She charges 50.000 per day and night.

-------------------------------------------------------------------

hemos llegado por la playa y nos hemos quedado en la playa cerca de una palmera. pregunta a mamita luz mila , la mua . es cerca del cementerio. cobra 50000 dia y noche.

name: Finca Los Robles
description: Super beautiful finca just outside the town of Corralejas, Anolaima, Cundinamarca, where the owner (Mike) allows folks to park their vans and/or tent camp for COP $50.000 per night. He can be reached by phone/WhatsApp at +57 321 4667055.

name: Valle de Cocora
description: Do not follow the Waterfall sign!!! Three days ago,  two women were held up and tied up for six hours as the goons took money from their credit card and then released them.

name: Hotel Rocas Lindas
description:
A beautiful sixty year old hotel, right on the water at Lago de Tota ( The largest natural lake in Colombia)
It is starting to receive campers.
Very friendly staff, great food at the restaurant if you don’t feel like cooking.
You can rent a boat to go around the lake or fishing.
To reserve,  contact Luisa at +57 3144453891
Located quite close to Aquitania, where you can shop for food, etc.
Not so far away you can find beautiful colonial towns like Iza and Monguí, and the majestic Páramo de Siscunsí.

name: Overnight Spot Mountains Road
description:
This is a good overnight spot on alternative mountain route from Pasto to Popayán. We had a quiet night and felt safe, the spot it's like an abandoned soccer field far enough from the main road, flat and have a plenty space for big rigs.
  The route passes through the village Buesaco, La Union, Mercaderes and some more. It seemed to us a good alternative of the busy PanAmericana passing through beautiful valleys and mountains and interesting villages. The road have a lot of up and down hills (not very high, about 2500 meters), but is completely paved and possibble to do with any vehicle (some parts are narrowed,  could be difficult for Big Rigs)

name: CEA (Centro Experimental Amazonico)
description: this is a zoo and botanical garden.  open 9am- 3.30pm. entrance fee 12.000cop pp for foreigners. you have to go with a guide (included in the entrance fee). it took us around 2hours and we enjoyed it.

name: Reserva San José Villamargarita
description: Ecological reserve -  natural trailer - hilking - SPORT fishing - mountaineering - food typical - wild life - Bird watching - kayak river  camping

name: GHL Relax
description: Large hotel with large pool, private beach, very large breakfast, large air conditioned rooms, fantastic WiFi. Great for a few days R&R. Approx $50 per night Inc Breakfast.

name: Gran Estacion Parking
description: Not suitable for big rigs. You will be given a card to validate after you have shopped. Parking outside next to mall but secure.

name: Seguros Mundial - 3 Month Available
description:
Address is:
Cl. 33 #6b - 24, Bogotá, Cundinamarca, Colombia

This location gave us a 3 month insurance when other places would not.

name: Tecni renos
description:
Great mechanic shop
They were very friendly.
Spent 3 days there getting bushings changed, shell bearings tightened, broken screws replaced and various other little things which other mechanic had not spotted or had the will to repair well.

name: Mano de Dios restaurant/ beach shack
description:
Small boy came running up to car and said we could camp for free if we eat something.
Fish was between 25 and 35 thousand depending on size.
Spent a nice night chatting with them. Toilet available and you can park in front of their shack or hire a hammock. 

This section of beach is covered in kiosks selling food during day. So you are not alone on a beach but nice place for a night . Tree at entrance would block a tall rig.

name: Hotel Marruecos
description:
A tip for bicycle travellers who don't want to descend the super steep roads into town just to push everything uphill again the next day :) 
Small basic rooms incl. clean private bathrooms with cold showers, TV, fan and WIFI. We paid 47,000 COP for a double room, and asked for a room in the back/ away from the road. The walls were however quite thin, so be prepared for a noisy night. Our 2 bikes fit in the room as well, so good enough for us!
From here, you can easily head down the road to the town's very charming main square for a delicious lunch (menu for 11,000 COP), passing plenty of different small shops along the way.
The hotel has around 20 rooms in total, so probably no need to make reservations. However, just in case you do have questions etc, here is their phone number: 847 19 99

FYI: We also passed 2 other hostels in the same road, probably with similar prices. The towns narrow and steep roads aren't big rig friendly, but maybe there are other options along the main road.

name: Primax Gás Station
description: Nice and clean shower (cold, but in a hot day was very nice). We didn't sleep here, but looked a good place for overnight.

name: Hostel Villa Tere
description:
It is a hostel where you can park and sleep in your car. We paid 10.000 for parking with toilet and WiFi (two and the car).  And + 3.000 each for hot shower.
The area is not so flat, you need to make it flat and is also noisy early morning. We felt safe and is a small walk to town, just cross the bridge. We slept 2 nights here.

name: Volkswagen Corautos
description:
Huge Volkswagen/Fenton/Ford Dealership with workshop.
Would not work on our 1991 VW Vanagon syncro Diesel. 
But vehicles build after 2010 should be fine

name: Donkey Sunrise Adventure activities
description: These guys hire and organize activities including motorbike off and on road rides, mountain biking, paragliding and horse back riding.

name: Cancha Obando
description: As it started pouring with rain when we visted the arqueological parque (3.000cop pp : tombs and museum) locals recommended us to stay at the cancha (rootball ground). The village is quiet and safe, small shops. Claro reception.

name: El Sol - Restaurante y Panaderia
description: Great place to have a cheap, 6000 Cop, but copious lunch which include a soup, a main meal and a drink (almuerzo corriente). Maybe just enough if you are a hungry cyclist ;) Food is good and owners are nicelittle ladies. Closes around 2pm and opens around 7am.

name: Finca las cascadas
description:
Very Good place to stay a few days. 
crystal river with some waterfalls. 
friendly people

name: Cascada Lajon and Jacusi
description:
Amazing waterfall, crystal river. 
very recomended. 7000 all circuit pp

name: Canion Güejar and poço Azul and Piscinas
description:
circuit the waterfalls, pools and crystal river. 
trekking in la Florida, 
amazing 
all circuit 7.000 pp 
recomended

name: Portal del Güejar
description:
Crystal river and circuit with waterfalls, in total five "Fincas" little farms, along the way crystal river. 7.000 pp COP. 
very recomended.

name: Gas Station
description:
Great place to stay. friendly people  
recomended

name: Cascata Azufre
description:
Trekking to the river and waterfall with sulful. 
28.000 pp with lunch. 
28.000 for cuple without lunch. 
we did't go was expensive for us and told wrong price the beginning

name: Finca ecoturistica
description:
tour in the river. have lunch. 
we don't now the price. Because don't entry. but is Option.

name: place near to restaurant La Vaca Original
description:
Four parking spaces next to the restaurant "La Vaca Original". It is quiet and monitored by cameras. You must ask the restaurant before parking and then buy a dessert to be able to sleep on site. There is electricity on the ground to a hole to the right of the restaurant.
---
quatre places bien situées, au calme et surveillées par les cameras à côté du restaurant «La Vaca Original»
il faut demander au restaurant avant de stationner puis lui acheter un dessert pour pouvoir dormir sur place.
il y a de l'électricité au sol vers un trou à droite de la vache.

name: Tienda y Laguna de Venados
description: Parked on a basketball court next to an abandoned school.  Friendly lady running the little Tienda.  They sell gas to passing motos and had cases of beer stacked to the ceiling.  Pretty little lake but a far more bit of garbage strewn about.   Comfortable, quiet night listening to the natural sounds of frogs and ducks.  Felt safe.  Stayed here so we could descend to the llanos in the am free of clouds.  Some nice frailejones on the spur road leading south from the intersection. No facilities but ok for one night en transit to los llanos.

name: Parking Lot 24h
description: Small parking lot that is 24h. They have toilets and a cold shower. We slept one night, was really quit. Nice people!

name: Frenos Barranquilla
description: Mechanic shop specialized in brake systems. They also do regular maintenance work, alignment/balancing, tyres, etc. Very clean, indoors, professional. Recommended.

name: Hotel San Fermin
description: Small old hotel with cheap rooms and camping on the grassy field. Will open a room for campers to use facilities.

name: hôtel mojarras
description: clean and very cheap. 25000 COP for a double room.

name: La Posada
description: clean hôtel, very cheap. 25 000 COP for a double room.

name: Volkswagen Auto Berlin
description: Volkswagen garage and shop. We changed oil and got a new battery.

name: El Cacharrito
description:
Nice burger place, prices are relatively expensive (10-17 thousand COP), but burgers taste really good, and they also have 3 kind of veggie burgers too, which was a big plus for us

7/22 update: prices are 18-22 COP

name: Crossing for La Habana Rio de La Miel
description: Here is where you can cross to go to La Habana Rio de La Miel. We paid 6.000 CP for the car. They work from 05:00 am to 09:00 pm.

name: Piedra Balancín
description: Big rocks like a pendulum, amazing place to see the Orinoco river with the red sunset, best moment to visit it’s in “summer”

name: Mi Vichada
description: Beautiful place to sleep, near to the Orinoco river, perfect place to star your trip to national park El Tuparro

name: Coliseum room :)
description: Ask in the municipality if you can sleep in the Coliseum they will let you sleep in the dressing room with some beds and with bathroom

name: Police Checkpoint
description: Driving through on a Friday evening. We passed some slow trucks and the police pulled us over. The official had a translator and tried to get us to pay the minimum salary of an average worker. We explained there were broken lines in the road where we passed the trucks. He said we’d have to pay the fine when we exited the country. Will update if that’s the case in a few weeks...

name: Super Medellin Tours
description: We were parked at this location in the Parque de Floresta. This tour company picked us up from our vehicle and took us on a city cultural and community tour. Luis and Carolina both speak excellent English. The tour was fantastic and well worth it. Luis was patient and very considerate. He knew his stuff. I know that they can pick you up in their luxury car from anywhere in the city. There are lots of tour companies in town but I don't think you will find a better one. Excellent Service and 100%recommended.  tel/whatsapp  +57 3126525270  www.supertoursmedellin.com

name: Casa de Ciclistas y Observacion de Aves
description: Just next to the road you will see house lower to the road. There is a wooden sign with the name. Family offers place for two tents under their house. They have also tent if you don't have your own. Shower is cold. No other facilities. Price flexible, you give how much you want.

name: Hostal Las Flores
description: Good and cheap Hostal: 25K in dorm, 12K hamak, use of the kitchen 10K per day. Little shop near. Perfect compared to the pricesin the island... (Food mini 25K !!!)

name: Candileja Hostel
description:
Nice hostel, very clean, run by two lovely metalheads. Beautiful garden and common area with hammocs, sofa & well equipped kitchen. Dorm bed (with comfy matress) for 23.000 pP including a better breakfast than in most places where we stayed (arepa with cheese, scrambled egg, fresh juice, good coffee and different types of fruit). Shower is hot, wifi fast. They also have private rooms (with private or shared bathroom) and rent 3 tents (with matresses) in the garden (not sure if there would be enough space to put up your own tent as well), didnt ask for the price though because we had the dorm to ourselves while we stayed here (off season, during the week). Doesnt have a sign outside, address is Carrera 6, #7-37.
You can park your bicycles (maybe also motorcycles) in the garden behind the house.

name: Pita Wok Arabe Restaurant
description: Nice little restaurant close to the Museo del Oro. Absolutely delicious arabe style meals! The girls running the place are very sweet! They offer free lemonade and soup along with your meal from 12:00 to 15:00! meals around 15.000 COP, vegetarians will be very happy with the mixed vegetarian plate! We loved it!

name: School Parking Lot
description: We didn't find the other spot called camping on top of the mountain  but in the other side of the road we found this way up to a small school. We spoke with Rubi, a friendly lady who lives here and take care of the school, she let us park for the night. It is not very flat, but works!

name: Posada Las Palmas
description:
The Lopez family awaits you in the Prado.  They have a hotel called Las Palmas where if you want you can camp for free under the roof on the terrace or if not another option is to pay a room that I do not think are very expensive.  The owner's name is Hernan and he is friendly and helpful.  He wants to help all travelers. 
phone 3212584391 - 3153275764

name: San Francisco sportsfield
description: after visiting la piramida and the 2tunnels we went here. having asked the locals they advised as to park at the corner of their sportfsield. free, quiet at night, safe, Claro reception.

name: CandE Hostel
description: Simple little hostel owned by a family. You can sleep in dorm for 20 000 pesos. Little shop in front of the hostel.

name: Parque Observatorio de Chripre
description: Park with nice views as well as free city WiFi (WIFI UNE GRATIS ALCADIA DE MZLS). There are also outlets to charge devices located on the posts of the upper observatory area. WiFi isn't the fastest but it does the trick.

name: La Riviera
description: Excellent hotel, very clean and comfy. The service it’s very nice, good people

name: Bucaramanga Central Market!
description:
Wonderful display of totally fresh produce, meats, herbs, and all sorts of local products packed in a bustling 4-story building!! Really pure experience, we didn’t see any tourists here. 

On the streets leading to the market there’s tons of fruit and fish being sold in the streets. Then you enter the market building and it’s full of giant veggies on the 1st floor, fruits on the 2nd, fish and meat on the 3rd, and restaurants and herbs and candles etc on the 4th.

One of the best public markets we’ve seen so far, and we’ve been visiting these big markets all along our way South from America.

name: Hotel balcon colonial
description:
Clean room with a small balcony to a lively street for 40000 cop/night. Private bathroom with hot electrical shower. The recepcionist was a bit helpless about where to store our bicycles, but when we suggested to leave it in the corridor, that was fine. Note that you have to carry your  stuff up a narrow stair. 

There are a least three other hotels along the same road between the two plazas, which we didn't check.

name: el hato: antique stone bowl & crocodile
description: leave your car at the main road and follow the path 2.556237, -76.038098 towards the river (ullucos). under red roof at 2.554182, -76.037778 is the ancient stone bowl. continue to 2.553473, -76.038056 and you will see the next red roof down a slope. at this coordinates 2.553143, -76.037931 is the ancient stone cocodrilo. no one here.

name: parking citara
description:
ENGLISH
covered parking with water and electricity.
10000pesos for 24h

FRANCAIS
parking avec emplacement couvert avec l'eau et l'électricité.
10000pesos pour 24h

name: Centro ParkTool Pasto
description:
Bicycle mechanics workshop, with professional staff and specialized tools ParkTool, Fox, Rock Shox, Unior, Bosch, suspension specialist, carbon repairs, pleasant atmosphere, always clean and excellent.

Taller de mecánica para bicicletas, con personal profesional y herramientas especializadas ParkTool, Fox, Rock Shox, Unior, Bosch, especialista en suspensiones, reparaciones en carbón, agradable ambiente, siempre limpio y excelente.

Atelier de mécanique de vélo, avec du personnel professionnel et des outils spécialisés ParkTool, Fox, Rock Shox, Unior, Bosch, spécialiste de la suspension, réparations de carbone, atmosphère agréable, toujours propre et excellent.

name: El Sarape (Mexican)
description: Seriously good mexican food in a cosy reataurant! Very friendly and patient staff, fast service :) Many vegetarian options as well. Delicious tacos and burritos! They also have margaritas.

name: waterfalls and natural pools bella vista
description: you can walk up here from the main square  in paicol. there are several waterfalls. just follow the stairs uphill. there you can take a refreshing bath. it is crowded at weekends. free.

name: Supermarket Éxito
description: A big supermarket with parking to motorhomes. It's close to Biomax gas station.

name: Eco Finca El Edén
description:
This is a family-run place with camping, rooms, restaurant (with wood-fired oven for pizza, which we didn't try though) and pool which opened a few months ago. Lots of space for parking and tents. Cold showers, toilets and even a sauna are available. Secure place, nice view and a perfect stop close to Bogotá. We arrived on a sunday evening and were alone, but there may be lots of visitors for pool and restaurant during the weekend. 
Costs for camping: 20.000 per person; sauna (in addition): 20.000 per person.
You find the Whatsapp contact on one of the pictures.

name: Street parking in front of Camino Real
description: We passed three nights here, flat enough for vans, quiet and some steps to the main square. Also we got the internet from Camino Real and we had a hot shower for COP 5000 at Real Hostel next door.

name: Routine Police Checkpoint
description: Briefly stopped, asked to see passport, title, license, and SOAT. Nice guy, sent us on our way within 5min.

name: Taller VW de Gustavo
description:
We have recommended this place to several travelers and Luanda deserves it. I helped to dismantle the wheel from the front, I went to the back so that it would start again (I had the damaged screw) and in the afternoon I would have it mounted in just one hour. He explained everything step-by-step and helped me solve problems. I love to support travelers!  Whatsapp+57 317 2811771
....
Nos lo habían recomendado varios viajeros y desde luego lo merece.
En un ratito por la mañana me ayudó a desmontar el eje de la rueda delantera derecha, me acompaño al tornero para que me hiciera nuevo hilo (tenía la rosca dañada) y en la tarde me lo volvió a montar en apenas una hora. Y lo hubiera hecho en menos, pero tuvo que limar la pieza para que los rodamientos quedaran bien. Me explico paso por paso y me ayudó a resolver dudas.
Nos cobro la voluntad!!! le encanta apoyar a los viajeros!
Ahora me arrepiento de no haber venido a revisar los frenos y otras partes de la dirección con el. whatsapp +57 317 2811771

name: Cafetin
description: Hand made and organic food. Includes vegeterian menu. Bakery, Coffee Shop and restaurant. Serves pizza, sandwich and desserts. It is a very cozy place, hosts are able to speak english, french, portuguese and chinese. They are very helpful and the attention is excellent. Highly reccommended.

name: Hospedaje Hilton's
description:
Lovely clean friendly place to stay.Lots of various priced rooms.I had a nice room for 15,000COP.
Restaurant downstairs too.
Inside moto and bicycle parking.Room can be a bit hot a night  but minor issue for me.

name: La Recebera entrance to Pozos
description: This is the official entrance to the Pozos Naturales, about a km past the yellow gate entry and sign which has now been closed by the tourist control.  5000 COP per person.  The walk to the Pozos about 20 minutes.  There’s a cascade on the right fork about five minutes from the start, but the main section of swimming holes is following the path to the left. Bring trekking shoes as rocks are rough. Super nice even in low water summer season (which here is Jan-March). Only saw one bonbon stick, one bottle cap, and one cig butt, so this has las Gachas of Guadalupe beat by a few hundred of each.  Algae and red colors only are visible June through Dec.

name: Luna de Miel
description:
A lovely resort in the hills above town. Some signage may say Luna de Miel but it has recently changed its name to Eco Parque Aqua Jungla.

Plenty of flat camping on nearly mown lawn with views of the town below. 

Pool, wifi, toilets, showers, restaurant, zip line etc etc etc

name: Aldea Plaza Hotel
description:
It was too hot for camping, we parked our rig in front of the hotel.
For a couple we paid 80.000 COP/night & wifi & AC & own bathroom. It looks modern and simple. Good!
Restaurants next door.

name: Hotel Granada
description: Nice little practical cheap hotel in central Libano.Rooms start at 15,000 -20,000.Space for a bicycle.Got wifi.Friendly girl running it.Place to hand wash clothes.Perfect for the price.

name: Suplimed vaccination center
description:
Vaccination center where we were finally able to get post-exposure rabies shots ("Verorab"). These shots are particularly hard to get at the hospital emergency rooms that you're usually sent to (other travellers sometimes even left the country just to get this vaccination in time).
The vaccination center at Las Americanas hospital recommended SupliMed as they themselves do not offer anti-rabies shots. Legal, secure, child friendly, no waiting time, the entire thing took us 10minutes, the 2 verorab shots cost 220.000COP in total.

Contact details:
Fixed line: 4144930 and 4144939
Mobile: 3116640391 and 3117336033
Homepage: www.suplimed.com.co
Opening hours: normal working hours during the week; saturdays from 8am-1pm.

name: Laguna Negra
description: Entrance is at the coordinates marked.  Here you pay entry fee 2000 cop per person for access to the lake, through the locked gate.  Camping down the lane on the shore of the lake.  Cold beer available, and some possibility they could prepare a meal with some notice. Buggy at dusk so bring repellent.  Additional 5000cop camping fee per person.   Livardo Cano contact. 3193046987

name: La Recebera camping
description: After visiting the pozos (see other entry as tourist attraction), we were told that you can camp here by the restaurant.  Have to drive across a little stream if you want to connect to electrical (passable with regular 2wd).  Bathrooms with cold shower.  Nice pool for swimming, but pets not allowed in pool.

name: Receba Pozos Naturales camping
description: Can camp here after spending the day at the Pozos.  Electricity available if you park next to the restaurant (not the bar area).  Showers, toilets, cold beer for sale.  Super nice people.

name: Over Cauca River
description: Beautiful bridge, breathtaking views of the river cauca between the mountains.

name: Centro de lubricacion Lubriyar
description: We rotate wheels and change some electrical stuff from our grand caravan. Great attention and professional place.

name: Gas station Terpel
description: Nice petrol station. We sleep here two nights, got average toilets and not busy area during the night so was easy to sleep. There is a burguer king also in the same parking lot.

name: Jimmy’s Auto Repair
description: Jimmy specializes in brakes suspension and transmission and is a very friendly and competent mechanic that can help with most anything. He had our transmission out to replace seals and had us back on the road in a just a few hours. Very fair prices

name: Piscinas Juncal
description: Swimming pool, toboganes, camping, hotel. Busy at weekends. price per person for swimming pool is 15000. Opening Hours 10a.m. -5p.m.

name: Cafeteria
description: Excellent comida corriente! 8k cop for the works! Soup, juice, and the full meal. Delicious !

name: Eco parque las margaritas
description:
its a safe place near to the principal park. the owner is very friendly. toilets availables.
$15.000 per night

name: neiva: next to a small park
description: it is in the street of the hostal. local told us it is safe. at night some noise from the backpackers- otherwise quiet. no services, claro 4g reception. if you need more ask and pay at the hostal

name: Finca el Diamante
description:
Great local to view waterfalls and drink coffee. 
Is possible to buy organic coffee, produce  in this farm. we pay 10.000 Cop./Lb.
friendly Family. 
Sr. Dario

name: Botalón del Abuelo
description:
Camping with swimming pool. Good local to relax. 
Camping 8.000 Cop. pp. 
Cabanas 40. 000 Cop. pp
16.000 Cop. with you rent a tent.

name: Cascada Arenales
description:
Beautiful waterfall with caves. 
It's necessary guide, very easy to get lost. 
You can looking for Guide in de small city "Poboado del Argentina" 
Guide: 50.000 Col. 
Waterfall: 5.000 Col. pp
.

very recomended. 
.
Trekking arrived = 1:25 hrs 
Trekking go out =

name: Vereda la Argentina
description:
It's possible to camp in the garden of the school.
No facilities.

name: Boca de sansas
description:
River to stay all day. 
the waterfall stay about 3 hrs the trekking to Salto Domingo (more easy to La Argentina).
many restaurants. 
a lot of mosquitos. 
recomended don't go weekend, a lot off people.

name: Cascada Esmeralda
description:
Beautiful crystal Waterfall. 
recomended during week. 
3.000 Col. pp
river crystal

name: Parqueadero la Esmeralda
description: Good and Save place, near waterfall.

name: Piedra Alta
description:
This location was previously entered as “one tent” business.  It is in fact a full service campground but also with cabanas for rent.  iOverlander doesn’t seem to allow recategorization, so am adding this as a separate entry.  

Full bar and you can park next to it with a cable you have electricity.  Pool is man made but in a way that it takes advantage of the cool rocks.  Super nice people. Cool cabanas for rent as well.  Cheapest for 2 people is 100,000., 7 person midsized for 200,000, large for 11 persons 350,000. Camping a bare 10.000 cop per vehicle per night plus 5.000 per person pool charge.  Pool table, too!

name: Finca Chontaduro
description: Former coca paste processing lab.  They give tours and explain the growing and production of coca paste.  Also a petting zoo with capybara, macaw, other jungle animals. 7.000 cop per person, can also provide breakfast or other meal.

name: Terpel Gas station
description: Here you can fill up your fuel tank but  also your water tank! They have a tap that you can use.

name: La Peña
description: La Peña is a beautiful ecoadventure park, mostly for rock climbers. It offers ample parking and camping spaces, as well as shared hostel rooms and private cabins. There is a shared kitchen, showers and bathrooms. It is pet friendly, and about 2.5 hours away from Medellin, with a 20km off-road. 4x4 is recommended for the last 500m, it is rocky and very steep. More info can be found at www.lapenaabejorral.com or with Luisa at +57 (314) 577-5670‬, via call or whatsapp.

name: Michelin
description:
Good mecanical with all things. change Oil, macanic parts ... good price. 

alineacion y balanceo 50.000 col
cambio de aceite (change oil) 15w40 (7L) 100.000 col.

name: Santuario Scout
description: Free lil hot (warm) spring next to the memorial for the scouts. Follow the trail up to a secluded natural spot next to a waterfall. Small shallow man made pool with multiple pipes feeding thermal water. We camped at the santuario. Octavio lives in the little cabin across the way they sell agua panela and arepas and can probably park vehicles there. We traveled by bicycle.

name: piscilodo: mudbath & natural pool
description: there is an entry to this location from 09.2018. you can stay overnight here. it has a big parking under trees with shadow. some branches are low. we managed with our sprinter camper van (2.80m high). entry fee to piscina is 8.000cop pp, 20.000cop pn (= 2 people + sprinter camper van) for bathing and staying overnight. slow claro reception. clean baños and showers. cold drinks are sold.

name: ferry ambalema
description: at the moment (Feb 2020) the ferry is broken down. only lancha for pedestrians, bikes or motos. 1.500cop pp one way. from 6am to 6pm

name: La Peña - Hostal / Cabins / Camping / Climbing
description:
4x4 very likely required for steep loose driveway. Big rigs ok but expect to push past some bushes on the way up. I machete’d a little and barely touched much stuff in our camper. Amazing place to stay for a few days with some great climbing for all levels from 5.6 grade and up.  

Bathrooms, kitchen, living area. Bring your own food, the currently sell soft drink, water, beer and a few packet snacks / biscuits.

Some levelling required (about 10” on one back wheel) if camping near the hostel (see camper in pics). There is also a flatter parking area about 20m further if you turn right at the top of the driveway, which may be a better option if allowed. 

3G and 4G Claro can be a bit hit and miss, usually marginally slow-ish and cuts out occasionally. Fine for low data users. Hostal Wi-Fi is around 2.0Mbs upload and download.

name: Hotel Monaco
description: Modern, newly renovated hotel near the Plaza. Covered  & secured parking, good for cars and motorcycles, not big rigs (2.2 m clearance). We stayed in a double bedroom (comfy), smallish but has a wardrobe, tv, fan and a small desk for 50k. AC rooms at 60k, but it's cool in the evening, not worth it for us. The shower is amazing, actually has a showerhead, both hot and cold water and it has water pressure! Best shower in months. We needed to do maintenance on the motorbikes, no problem in their parking, in shade with some breeze, just perfect. We were able to check at 10 am, but even if not, we could have worked on the bikes until check-in time at 2 pm. One of the best hotels in our 5 months in Latin American countries. Highly recommend.

name: Hotel Magistral
description:
Simple hotel run by a *very* nice family. 45000 COP for two people. No parking on-site but they let us roll our motorcycles in the lobby. Paid parking available across the street. Hot shower and OK wifi.

Hotel Shalom across the street was double the price.

name: Hostal Casa de los Taitas
description: Nice clean hostel close to the town center but far enough away to be quiet.  They have two big driveways with a locking gate and a fenced property.  It is great for motorcycles and probably good for a big rig (if you can turn off the street into their gate) or several smaller truck/campers. I got a room in a 5 person dorm for 22,000. They have a nice shared kitchen and big wrap around porches.

name: Trail to Waterfall
description: Here starts the trail to the waterfall at a small farm where the owners change 5000 cop per person to hike. It takes around 30 minutes to get there. Amazing views when you are getting closer, nice trekking, great swimming in the pool if there isn't much water flowing. If you have 4x4, you can drive down, there is a small parking spot marked. The road down is extremely steep, you can also park in town and walk all the way down. Owners of the farm also have beautiful cabanas to rent. No camping.

name: Gas Station with shower
description: gas station with shower and tap water goooooooood

name: Gas station free
description:
parked one night by the gas station where we filled up diesel, friendly guys. free water, toilets.
you can also park but more up by the motel for 5000 the night.

name: Paradise shooting range
description: Nice quiet place, hidden and with great overview. we climbed up the spot with our VW T4 2WD and drove through the flat river.

name: Restaurant in the beautiful mountains
description:
Beautiful place, the street is magical.
Good food 8000 menu pescado.

name: Nice wild camping by the river
description: Here is the entrance to two wild camping places that we used. If you cross the river and turn left just after, you have space for one or tow cars to sleep next to the bridge. We slept two nights there and the problem is a bit noise with the people and motorcycles crossing the bridge. It is a good option if the river is high or is raining and you afraid that river goes up (it was our case in these 2 nights). The second wild spot is THE BEST option, we spent two weeks there, you turn left following the river and drive few meters to a open rock area (see pictures), it has much more space and privacy, the bridge crossing will not be a problem anymore. Water of the river is not good for drinking according to locals. River never went up in these two weeks there, just 3-5 cm one day after the rain. Enjoy!!!!!!

name: Finca el Peniel
description:
Nice Finca for camping, camper-van or cabañas. Very beautiful garden with terrace for chill and relax and a small river with a natural pool.
Owners are very friendly and will be happy to receive more iOverlanders.
Not really leveled for more than one vehicles but they can help you fix it.
Electricity, toilets, hot shower and WiFi available.
Price is 13.000 per person per night.

name: Park & field
description: Unused soccer field (it looks like a Savannah) and basketball courts where you can camp or park your cars. There’s a night guard to look after the construction machines so we felt safe. Beautiful view of the mountains. The bomberos don’t host cyclists so we came here

name: Park in front of Bomberos
description: Such a beautiful, artistic park in front of the volunteer firestation. Large place with a roof to camp under (shaped like a giant ship). Firefighters were gone when we came on a late Sunday but I’m sure they’d be willing to let you shower and give you some water. Very cute town. We felt safe. I don’t think there is space for cars.

name: Bomberoooos
description: Wonderful firefighter station that lets us camp in their gym. Everyone was extremely friendly. Shower, kitchen, WiFi, chill area. Couldn’t ask for more. We’re traveling by bike, but it seems like you could park a vehicle here as it’s such a big space

name: Street for autoparts
description: Youll find almost everything you need on carerra 12 and calle 24. All the repuestos shops are here

name: Pulawala
description: Reservation Pulawala's entry, we spend a nigth there, was quiet and very cold in the morning, there was a open kitchen where the animals stolen our food

name: Brío gasolinera
description: gas station. super quiet place to spend the night. clean bathroom. There is no shower. It has a restaurant with great arepas!!

name: El Viajero - Very good menu
description: We were looking for a restaurant that had truck drivers, normally are the best! We found this one. Very good menu for 9.5~12.000 CP. Many options available and big portion!!!

name: Mariluna
description: This is a family's house but you can stay in a hammock or set up your tent. They have enough room you could also park your truck here.  I paid 10k for a hammock and a friend paid 7k to pitch his tent.  They have a nice bathroom with shower, toilet, and sink.  We also bought simple meals from the family.  The best part is that their property is right next to the Observatory.  We walked over to do some stargazing in the evening.  The family had a dog and several cats.  I assume they would welcome pets as well.

name: Circe
description: Delicious food, cozy atmosphere and friendly people. Recommened!

name: Servicio Automotriz
description:
We were sent here by a local. 
Very good mechanics about 12 men working there. Started working on our van right away and gave us free coffee while we waited.

name: Lucho
description: Don't go there! He works on cars there in his lot. Came there with engine problems. He "diagnosed" that my gas pump is broken and I need to order a new one (350$). Since he was working on my car, my display which shows the amount of gasoline in my car, doesn't work anymore. Went to another mechanic, who found the problems, it were the spark plugs, and fixed it in 30 minutes. Again, stay away from this place, it's a ripoff!

name: Humos Bar-Parrila
description: Very nice restaurant on our way from Turbo to Medellín. Area is quite and nice to sit outside. Cool hip relaxed vibe. Good food. The owner even gave us a bowl of fruit after for free.

name: Hotel Turistico La Casona
description: Right on the main square.  Convenient location but VERY noisy.  The owner was here and he speaks English, Spanish, French, and Italian.  Rooms are big and the place is nice.  I paid 30k for a private room with fan and cold water only.  The owner wanted 50k for a room with AC.  Breakfast is not included.  They let me park my motorcycle inside the courtyard. They also have a pool if you want to cool off.

name: Terpel
description: just a trepel has station for free we stayed at after talking with the attendant. alot of road noise bit didnt have much choice as it was very late.

name: parrilla y vinos Juan Esteban
description: Great restaurants Whit good food prices are ok not to expensive ..and good to have a stop here ..ate lomo mushrooms sauce with sides. 30cop..I recommend it.. The have artisanal beer BBC next door..

name: Parque Santander
description: all the square is safe and available to stay all the time you want. free WiFi. no services

name: Farm Raquira
description: This place is safe. The owners are friendly.

name: Magdalena River Ferry
description: A car and truck ferry from 45 to 45A, so you can go to El Desierto de Tatacoma from the North without the detour via Neiva. The capacity is two trucks at once.

name: Manzanares
description:
Manzanares is a town built on a hill- so steep streets. we found three leveled places 
3. here, where we stayed, after having talked to a few neighbors. 
we had a quiet night. no infrastructure. free. claro 4g reception.

name: Marulanda
description:
we drove from manzanares to marulanda 15km/h on a gravel- and dirt road. you can see waxpalms on the way. marulanda is 2850 m high, very nice and colorful houses. we asked at the police-station at the plaza to stay here with the wonderful view. do not miss to visit la cooperativa ovina at the plaza (5.284498, -75.260531). you can buy your poncho there. the machines they use are over 130 years old. 
no infrastructure. 4g claro reception.

name: San Félix
description:
Quiet idyllic mountain village. Overlanders are welcome. Comfortable climatic conditions. There are many opportunities for hiking. The infrastructure of the village offers various grocery stores (cheese, bakery, supermarket), various bars and restaurants. We can confirm the previous entries.
this nice pueblo is worth a visit. we stayed a few days at the main plaza near the police station. there are 2 different factorys for milk products (good quality, pricelist as foto), a few restaurants and coffees, visit to the nearby waxpalms mirador. claro 4g reception

name: Portón Urbana Hotel
description: Cyclist only - the owner of this hotel is a cyclist, runs a cycle club, and therefore allows cycle tourists to camp at the top of the hotel under a nice large roof for free.  Big tables, hammocks, shower, wifi.  Hard to go wrong!

name: Hospedaje before the village
description:
First hospedaje when you arrived from Mocoa. 
A nice lady is in charge of the Hospedaje, she has a restaurant too. The lunch was good and not soo expensive.
We stayed two nights there. 
The room was clean with private bathroom. 
15000 cop for two people the first night and she made a discount on her own for the second night.
Calm and clean I recommend.

name: Parador
description:
Parador Los amigos, great place to stay with tent between the basketball playgrounds and the church. 
The people are friendly. It’s a safe place. We stayed with bicycle without problems. 
Little shops and restaurant are available. 
Then you will find water too. 
Nice place ! 

Parador “Los amigos”, petit coin tranquille pour rester une nuit, les habitants sont sympathiques et accueillant. 
Vous pouvez poser la tente entre le terrain de basket et l’église (ou sur le terrain de basket). 
En face quelques tiendas et restaurants où vous trouverez de tout. 
Les gérants des restaurants laissent accéder au lavabo extérieur pour avoir de l’eau où se laver un peu. 
Je recommande en toute tranquillité

name: DOBLACORT - Aluminium and electrostatic painting
description: It is a place where you can buy aluminium and also do electrostatic painting. They can also do projects, like cut and bend the aluminium.

name: Medellin Backpacker Hostel
description: Our hostel offers our visitors an authentic local experience, full of comfort and relaxation in a central location. You will be able to enjoy one of the city’s most lively and vibrant parts of town, with nearby attractions within walking distance, such as The Botanical Garden, Explorer Park, Park of the Wishes, The University of Antioquia and the Center of Business Innovation (Ruta N). Additionally, we are minutes away from two shopping centers and a state-of-the-art gym. We have private parking convenient and secure spots near to us, as well as nearby public transportation (Metro-rail and Metro-bus).

name: Parque ecoturístico Yaguaré
description:
Park is a perfect place to spend the night.  It is a safe and quiet place very close to the county of Juntas right in the combeima canyon.  They must speak with the owner, Juan Carlos, to reach an agreement on the price of the night.


El parque es un lugar perfecto para pasar la noche. Es un lugar seguro y tranquilo muy cerca del corregimiento de Juntas justo en el cañón del combeima. Deben hablar con el dueño, Juan Carlos, para llegar a un acuerdo sobre el precio de la noche.

name: Hotel Borbón
description: Great, clean and cheap hotel, near to The central Park o Paicol. Wifi, Cable, hot water and lovely owners.

name: Metal and Paint Shop
description:
Milton Cordoba fixed our jeep door after it was bent to hell by a truck passing  to close when we were outside of the  car with the door open. Milton is fair and honest and honestly worked magic. Did an amazing job straightening and hammering it out. He was even able to get the mfg  paint and everything! I highly recommend coming here to fix any metal work, paint or dents! fixed it all for 300000cp!

phone/ telefono : +573228051284

name: museum free WiFi and bathroom
description: great place. it has a lot of information. and free WiFi and bathrooms

name: ship to Puerto Asis
description:
from here you take the ship to Puerto asis.
you will have to talk with the captain of the ship in place at the moment

name: aguadas parque central
description:
we stayed the 2nd night here at the plaza. sn. fernando and sna. mona from the tourist office adviced us not to stay at monte monserrate at the moment, as there is no official “vigilante”. you can buy very good coffee (2,5kg for 55.000cop) or hats. 
we had a pretty quiet night. clean toilets and shower at the tourist office.

name: museo josé tomás uribe abad
description: here is a museum donated to Jerico. he was born here 1920 and died in Medellin in 2014. entrance fee 3.000cop. open 8.00 - 12.00am and 2-5pm. weekends 9am -5am. it contains many furniture from Europe and lamps from his own factory.

name: Plaza principal Villa vieja
description:
We stayed a couple of nights before and after going to the desert. The police suggested the place and it was quiet enough.

Estuvimos un par de noches. Antes y luego de ir al desierto. la policía nos sugirió el lugar y resultó ser bastante tranquilo.

name: diego broster
description:
delicius and cheap empanadas de carne 3.500 col 
patacones con tudo 9.000 col. 
big meal. 
recomended

name: parking street between apartments
description:
quiet safe street 
friendly neighbors, some of them offer showers and wifi, also refill bottles of water
there are guards and good shade and a little business to buy eggs milk and beer (basic important stuff)

name: Water  - Bomberos
description: We fill up all bottle of water. Very friendly people

name: Hotel campestre Parking
description: hotel parking  5k cop, clean bathrooms and very kind person, offered to use the hotel shower. recommended not to drive at night!

name: Sofias Hostel
description:
Great place to stay, very clean. 
prices $ 10 - 13 pp with breakfast. pp
air conditioning.

name: Maria Isabela
description:
Not sure what this place is but it has a lovely spot for camping 600m down hill from Santandercito
Says a hotel on google.They may have rooms but looks run down.Seems like there are families living here.Friendly place too.10,000 for camp.Not much facilities but enough for me.There's a pond with a stream coming out where showered.It was nice even though pond water.You can use the families baños.
Ask to charge electronics.

name: Hostel David
description: Acceptable hostel with a restaurant. We paid 25.000 per person for a 4/8 person dorm (4 double beds). The restaurant is also good, 14.000 for menu del dia. They have a common area and some hammocks.

name: Meson de las Flores
description:
I advice to stay here. Really quiet and nice room. 
Staff are really great and helpful :)  Hot water and really good meal. 
Good location on the town.   Enjoy ! 

Super hôtel pour rester à Armenia.
Nuits calmes !  Chambres propres et très confortables. 
Douche avec eau chaude.  Personnel très accueillant et serviable.
Je recommande vivement cet hôtel proche de toutes comoditiés. 
Les repas sont délicieux.

name: El punto del sabor
description: Restaurant buffet where you get a lot of food for only 6.000pesos. Sopa, juice and a plate full of what you choose.

name: Street Parking behind Hotel Berdez
description: We decided not to stay in the big parking lot by the gas station as it is noisy with traffic. Behind the hotel there is a little side street and you are protected from road noise by the hotel. We had a quiet night. There is CCTV at the back of the hotel. We used the toilet in the hotel. We had dinner at their restaurant, I would not recommend it, it was one of the worst meals we’ve had in Colombia. There is also a Justo y Bueno in the parking lot and a panadería. OK for one night

name: Gulf Service Station
description: 24 hr open. Asked guard who asked superior. Biggish area. Expect traffic noise. Cold showers a blessing. Clean facilities.

name: Big Off Road Area
description: Good flat area if you get caught here in dark. Soggy moss underfoot but looks firm.

name: Medellin- Community13
description:
Good option to visit the Communidad13 with people who live there. Simon is a swiss-colombian boy trying to help with the social issue in the Communidad13. The tour is made by young people and very interesting. It cost 45000 pesos pp for a tour of  4h including breakfast or meal with the habitant. Totally recommended! 
The agency name is Alternatour you can find it on facebook ! The meeting point is just in front of the church named « iglesia del 20 de Julio.
From the Parque de la Floresta it will cost 9000 pesos by taxi to go to the Community13.

name: FERLAND - The best parking for Overlanders
description: After days sleeping in the park and struggling to make the adjustments that we needed, we found this place and it is definitely the best place for overlanders in Bogotá! Fernando is a very friendly guy who manage this place and are very welcome with overlanders. Here you will find parking + shower (cold) + toilet + use the kitchen for 15.000 CP 24H. If you only use the parking or make jobs there, you can negotiate the price with Fernando. In the place there is a workshop, you can do upgrades in the car for a fair price. We prepared our car (Defender 110 Land Rover) to go to Amazonia here, we installed some reinforces, snorkel and did some welding jobs. We saw that they also make aluminium boxes, roof tent, rain covers, and all 4x4 projects... Come here and you will fix everything you need in the car! Rafa is his mechanic, he is also very friendly and very knowledgeable. There is no high limit and the place is well located, you can find everything you need, there is Sodimac (homecenter), supermarket (D1), etc... We really recomend this placeWhatsApp +573118313725

name: Biomax Gas Station
description: Quiet and safe night, other side of the road. Guy came ask for money in the morning, but staff said it was free. Clean toilets.

name: Windshields
description: Manufactures windshields of all kinds. Owner very attentive and is also a traveler. Hosts travelers near the airport at another ioverlander point.

name: Hotel Borbon Lavanderia
description: The hotel was already marked but for those not looking for a hotel I added a lavanderia icon. I dropped off at 11am and they said ready for 3pm.

name: Soldadura
description: Small welding workshop. They made us a metal box in a few hours. I guess they can do any weld or metal work.

name: Specialized Bike shop
description: Specialized bike shop in Garzon with a lot of (expensive) Specialized bicycles but also a lot of Shimano spare parts and professional mechanics.

name: Mechanic Mario
description:
A very reasonably priced mechanic and super friendly! Mario and his whole family helped out in fixing our tail light. Somebody rear ended us on the road and Mario fixed the frame and installed the new tail light for a very reasonable price. 

We have a VW van 82 and there are no replacement tail lights in Pasto for Kombis.. but we found a similar one for now and Mario installed it. 

Fully recommend Mario! He also works with motors.

name: Metro big supermarket
description: Big supermarket where you can find all kind of food. No parking for big cars but you can let it in the street in front of the entrance next to the taxi station.

name: Another port to Leticia
description: Here is another place where the boats come before they go to Leticia. You can also try to find someone that could take your car around here.

name: Montallanta
description:
Great Lubricant!

Really friendly and helpful owner. They help with a lot of small problems on our 4x4 for free and changed a tire for a fair price. 

Also have recommendations about mechanics and cheap gasoline around.

name: Parqueadero seguro
description:
It is a safe parking lot. The one in charge of taking care of the cars is called Pacho and a very kind man is in the place 24 hours. Medium and small cars can be parked since the width of the entrance is a little limited, there is no height limit. the value is 12000 Cop (day and night). With a voluntary contribution, Don Pacho provided us with water and electricity. It is a good place in Cali where you find cheap shops, laundry and places to eat.

Es un parqueadero  seguro el encargado de cuidar los carros se llama Pacho y está en el lugar 24 horas un señor muy amable. se pueden estacionar carros medianos y pequeños ya que el ancho de  la entrada es un poco limitada,no hay límite de altura.
el valor es de 12000 Cop( día y noche).
con aporte voluntario don Pacho nos prestó servicio de agua y Luz.
es un buen lugar de Cali donde encuentras tiendas, lavandería y lugares para comer económicos.

name: IP - Camino Manizales
description:
*Overnight parking/camping is NOT permitted at this location.
.....
Abandoned building with enough space inside to set up a tent. Great in bad weather. View pretty good when clear.

name: Cumbechay / Refugio @ Volcano Cumbal (Nariño)
description:
Great place!!!! 
- Free campsite
- rooms available
- small scale farm
- trout farming
- meals available 
- lovely family
- very helpful
- great hikes (Volcano, crater, Paramo, ...)

name: Mecánica Rápida
description: Great spot! Changed the front brake pads on our 97 Toyota Tacoma in less than thirty minutes. Cost 75,000COP.

name: Laguna Cumbal / Laguna de la bolsa
description:
Great place!!!!
- informal campsite (directly next to the lake)
- toilet available
- meals available in a small restaurant next by
- friendly people around
- very helpful
- great view to the volcano cumbal

name: ecostar hotel
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: This place was added by the owner or manager. It has not been overlander verified. 
----
This hotel has a special deal for Overlanders  60% discount
the owner is an overlander himself 
feel free to call him for advice
if you only need to park we can help

name: Marypau. Casanare
description:
Wild camping, nice and nature environment, for real adventurers, away from city, kind people, perfect astronomic nights, typical food offered, horse and bike riding.

MODERATOR NOTE: This place was added by the owner or manager. It has not been overlander verified.

name: Hotel el Conductor
description: Very clean rooms, A/C, nice hostess, warm showers but don’t need them here.  Parking in front is safe as gas station open all night. Very comfortable and a good stop on the way to/from the coast.

name: estadero aguablanca
description: This place is very good, the owner of business is very friendly. The experience is amazing, the people is friendly and the security in the zone is very good.

name: SALTAREN CAMPESTRE
description: is the place amazing, enjoy the nature and view the stars in the night

name: Finca El juncal
description: this place is very good, the farmers are friendly, they authorized put my tent under mangos trees.

name: Texaco gas station
description:
A good place to park-up a camper for the night. There's a mini-market and drugstore in the service station. Clean water.

Es un buen lugar para parquear la camper y pasar la noche, hay un minimercado con droguería dentro de la estación de servicio. 
agua limpia

name: The Glamper Camper
description:
ADMIN NOTE: this is entered as an established campground but with no facilities at all. Please could next person here clarify the nature of the site.

Campground suitable for small campervans. No services, must be self-sufficient.

campamento apto para campervan pequeñas, no hay servicios se debe tener todo

name: Nohorita's place
description:
ADMIN NOTE: it is not clear from this entry whether the family is happy to receive repeat overlanding guests. Please could the next person confirm the status of this location.

Family owned, gated farm with wi-fi and English speaking host

name: Cocora
description: 10k day / 15k night now without services. Beautiful views and closest to the entrance of the park. Can hear the birds and river here. No amenities.

name: Tarqui Crossroad
description: The place is very good, near to houses, near to main roàd from ALTAMIRA to TIMANA, Huila Department.

name: Night camping
description: this place is very good, between the little houses, the people are friendly.

name: Ritacuba hotel
description:
A nice new hotel, rooms with different themes, Friendly helpful reception staff, reasonable prices. No problem to park motorhomes out-front.

es un nuevo y bonito hotel, las habitaciones tienen diferentes temáticas ligadas a la cultura y paisajes de la costa. tienen una amable y amigable recepción. los precios son favorables y puedes parquear tu motor Home frente al hotel sin ningún problema

name: viewpoint
description: Free spot where you can park with very nice view of the lake. it is a bit narrow the place to park but it is ok to spend an evening. Also safe in the night. you can access the lake. Strong cell signal with Claro.

name: San Miguel Veterinaria
description: Highly recommended and only full service vet in town. They can do EKG’s and ultrasounds. Whatever you need. Also sell food.

name: Pizzas Isabella
description: Good place to eat, delicious pizza and other. Very friendly staff. Good value for money

name: Hotel Campestre El Cielo
description:
Nice hotel by the La Valdivia creek; mountains and forests are the surrounding scenery.
Aprox 4 km from town; tuk-tuk to town if needed. Can accomodate vans, big rigs or roof top tents, talking with the owner, and not in weekends or high season.
Quiet, nice

name: Curiti Main Square
description: At the main square just in front of the church. Public WiFi (60min a day), electricity and tap water. We spent two nights during the weekend and was super relaxing, nice neighborhood, safe and completely silent after 10pm.

name: Mrm Accesorios
description: Well known 4x4 shop; they have been in the business for long time. Experience in outfitting cars for 4x4 adventures, or long-distance travel, overlanding and related. Mauro the owner is very knowledgeable and helpful.

name: La Rueda Pizza y Pasta
description: Delicious Pizzas, lovely nice place with private parking. The owners are very helpful and friendly. Good value for money!

name: Centro comercial Viva
description: Good location to park overnight! We stayed 2 nights here with the permission of the head of security of viva. Ronny was super nice and let us stay. Next to the parking spot there is a car wash they give us water and WiFi. You’ll find everything you need in the shopping mall.

name: Puente de occidente
description: A huge and old bridge that crosses the Cauca River. You can reach this Place perfectly with a medium van and park. But you can't cross the bridge with the van. only walking or moto. Beautiful views also.

name: La Hacienda Del Pienta
description: Nice, newly built hotel with super clean rooms and terraces. Wifi only in the main lobby. I paid 120,000 COP for the night. Breakfast included (it better be good, hah). Super helpful staff. There's a restaurant here but it is only open on weekends. I'm the only guest at the moment (Monday).

name: Donde Fercho V
description: Simple traveller’s hostal in Pueblo Nuevo, near Nilo. Perfect for cyclists who have to detour to avoid the Sumapaz tunnel. Call or WhatsApp don Fernando before arriving to make sure he’s there to let you in +573214517757

name: paisaje cultural cafetero
description:
a place with super friendly people,
all kinds of vehicles arrive.
They provide laundry service, restaurant and hiking through beautiful landscapes.
Edwin Castillo is the person in charge to guide you in the area 3103784290

un lugar con gente súper amable,
llega todo tipo de vehículo.
prestan servicio de lavandería, restaurante  y senderismo por unos paisajes hermosos.
Edwin castillo es la persona encargada para que los guíe en la zona 3103784290

name: FREE TRAVELERS
description:
A Nice furnished studio apartment for the comfort of the guests, close to the tourist sites of the municipality.

Un lindo aparta estudio amoblado para la comodidad de los huespedes, cerca a los sitios turisticos del municipio

name: Gears and clutches - Expertos en palancas de cambios y clutch
description:
Mechanical workshop specialized in gear levers, gouges, clutch system, accelerators. We had a problem in the gouges of our sprinter and they made the broken piece. Very good vibe all the employees, they even bought handicrafts for us. 

Taller mecánico especializado en palancas de cambios, guayas, sistema de clutch, aceleradores. tuvimos un problema en las guayas de nuestra sprinter y fabricaron la pieza rota. muy buena onda todos los empleados, hasta nos compraron artesanías.

name: Exito Supermarket
description:
Supermarket with everything in it :
- food (way cheaper than Ecuador)
- sim card at the cashier
- SOAT at the servicios

name: Meson Ilama Parking Lot
description:
The parking of a hotel, next to the road but it’s mainly unused so it’s quite quiet at night. No facilities but you can ask the owners for their WiFi and bathrooms (for an extra charge)
No charge, good for a one-night stop. 
There are some protective guard dogs, but they’re very well trained. There are swings for children, and a green space to play. 

El estacionamiento de un hotel, junto a la calle pero no es muy usada entonces es bastante silencioso en la noche. No hay instalaciones, pero puedes pedir a los dueños por internet y baños
Gratis, bueno por una parada de una noche. 
Hay unos perros guardianes, pero están entrenados bien. Hay columpios para niños y un pequeño jardín para jugar.

name: HOTEL Y RESTAURANTE
description: This place is very comfortable, the bedroom is clear and the attention own is friendly. it's have restaurant, tv, shower.

name: Caseteja
description: Delicious desserts, cappuccinos, kumis, cheese... Lovely outdoor seating area, plenty of parking. The cappuccino was so good I bought some ground coffee to go (220gr for 16,000 COP)

name: San Antonio del Rio
description:
We spent two nights in this place, a quiet place, they offer restaurant service and cabins, the parking lot is wide. 
We were not charged for parking.

pasamos dos noches en este lugar, un lugar tranquilo, ofrecen servicio de restaurante y cabañas,el parqueadero es amplio.
llega tipo de vehículo.
a nosotros no nos cobraron por estacionarnos.

name: maryluna
description:
quiet place to spend the night. night value 5000C0P PP.
there are showers, toilets, restaurant.
Alvaro the owner very helpful.

lugar tranquilo para pasar la noche. valor de la noche 5000C0P PP.
hay duchas, baños, restaurante.
Alvaro el dueño muy servicial.

name: Parque principal Yaguara
description:
We spent one night.
Parking is free.
They give you water.
Very friendly people.
You can contact Mrs. Olga for whatever you need in town.

Pasamos una noche.
el estacionamiento es Gratis.
te regalan agua.
Gente muy amable.
pueden contactar a la señora Olga Para lo Que necesiten en el pueblo.

3132945507
Jairo 3183866706

name: Centro de vet and zoo university ces
description: This is a state of the art animal hospital. They are open 24 hours and have specialists and state of the art equipment. It is not cheap compared to other Colombian places but it is one of the very best in the world

name: Tough road
description:
Before engaging in this road, you need to know some things.
it's doable with any vehicle 
BUT from Boavita to Cocuy, it's steep, muddy, sinuous and barely asphalted.
We did it with a 7m campervan, but it took us 1h for driving 10km, so just imagine the ride.
The setting is nice but you just need to know that it's not an easy road.

name: Plaza, peaceful spot
description:
Leveled place near the church 
Free WiFi 
No noise 
Lovely locals 
Surprisingly nice spot

name: Los hornitos de don chepe
description: delicious barbecue meat!!! very good marinated pig (for 2 days) and cooked 5h. very good service and nice people.

name: las cascadas la periquera
description:
campsite next to the entrance of the waterfalls.
price: 12000 Colombian pesos per person.
.....
camping junto a la entrada de las cascadas la periquera.
precio 12000 pesos colombianos por persona

name: Parque Ricaurte
description:
Very quiet and beautiful place 3 blocks from the main square, the park has cameras. It is very safe at night.

lugar muy tranquilo y bonito a 3 cuadras de la plaza principal, el parque tiene camaras.
es muy seguro en las noches.

name: Villa Liliana
description: Lovely little Hacienda with private rooms with private bathrooms and family cabins, as well as a parking area for big rigs. There is an outdoor kitchen but I recommend checking to see if you can use it for your stay. The owners are extremely kind. I paid 70,000 COP (without breakfast but with morning coffee) per night for a weekend stay while rock climbing at La Mojarra.

name: Hotel Centenario Albanés
description:
Simple clean hotel with good wifi and no parking. This is a very small town so we parked our bikes on the street without worry. 

Fairly noisy because of the dogs barking all the time, and the walls between the rooms don't go up to the ceiling so you can hear the neighbors clearly (if any). Paid 30000 per night for two.

name: hotel Don David
description: Really happy to find this peaceful hotel with very clean rooms, all new, with secure parking and cameras. 50,000 Pesos per night with breakfast. Big parking area, narrow turn into it off the side street. Perfect for visiting the wildlife reserve, Cabildo Verde.

name: Cabildo Verde
description:
Really wonderful wildlife reserve where the animals have been rescued from wildlife trafficking. Many are rehabilitated and can be released, but some are too imprinted or injured to be set free... So they live here! Your visit helps care for them and others who need help. Lots of interaction with the free roaming capybara, parrots, ducks, turtles, and other strange birds around. The jaguar is in a very large, beautiful enclosure.
Contact them (in Spanish) to visit.

(I would give them more stars but the app doesn't let me change it from the set 2.5)



 +57 315 3705040

name: very good ice cream
description:
Nevao is a super good ice cream shop
1 scp : 4500
2 scp : 8000
3 scp : 1200
real good taste!
we recommend hazelnut, lemon basil, yogurt, pistachio and mora

name: Calanoa Lodge
description: An amazing place with some beautiful individual huts overlooking the river. Breakfast, lunch, dinner and events included. We had three great days here. The food is excellent too. Great sunsets.

name: Niko's Sea Food
description: Nice And cosy sea food restaurant with a lovely pier with marvelous views to the sea. But most importantly food is delicious and not extremely expensive for good and fresh sea food. We had the all shellfish grilled dish with herbs sauce plus the traditional Ceviche de camarones and everything was so tasty and fresh. Don’t mistake this traditional ceviche with the Peruvian one, this one is very Colombian with a red spicy sauce. Here is very well prepared as the sauce is home made. Enjoy really recommend it. Also the cerveza mi helada is awesome, good mixture of salt and lemon. Delicious :)

name: lago Sochagota
description: nice place next to pier. close to police station

name: Jarillon del lago Sochagota
description:
Excellent place, quiet and secure. It's close to a lookout of the lake. Super recommended.
.....
excelente lugar, tranquilo y seguro.
está muy cerca a un mirador del lago super recomendado.

name: close to police station
description:
quiet and safe place next to the police station. 
in front of the supermarket

name: Neusa Camping Pachamama de la Montaña
description:
Beautiful place from where you can see the entire Neusa dam. Very quiet during the week. On weekends and holidays the locals go and it can be noisy. Ask about Myriam and her children John and Santiago. Very helpful. Easy to access, we got into a Volkswagen T5 2x4 without problems. We pay 15 thousand COP per night for two people and a dog.
It has biosafety protocols.

name: Magic Garden
description: A very nice place to stay just across the path to Capilla de San Antonio (at the moment no sign, next to the pizzeria). Beautifull garden with open terrace overlooking Cali where you enjoy your breakfast with coffee „illimitado“. Superfast WiFi. Hostel is very tasteful decorated, run by the loveley couple Jamie and Mathias, who both are fluent in english, polish and probably more. Ev is perfectly taken care of. Rooms with window to the balcony/garden. We are very glad to have run into this place.

name: Los Hoyos
description: Wide open grassy place. Any size vehicle. There are many places like this one. Officially allowed if not fenced or forbidden by sign.

name: Near River
description:
A quiet and safe place. Beside the River Tejar. Excellent site to stay for several days.
.....
lugar muy tranquilo y seguro, al lado del río tejar 
excelente sitio para estar varios dias.

name: Salento - Toche - Ibague
description: A small shelter with the roof on the side of the dirt road Salento - Toche - Ibague. Enough place for two tents or a tent with a motorbike. Quiet, no traffic at night.

name: Roadside
description: A small spot for a tent and a motorbike a bit over the road from Barichara to Villanueva. Quiet at night. Not private property. Locals were easygoing.

name: estación de servicio
description:
A place to park. The people are very friendly.
.....
un lugar para estacionar.las personas son muy amables

name: Police station
description: Police officers allowed to us to pitch a tent in front of the police station. A bit noisy, but ok to pass the night.

name: Tavolandia Glamping, no campground
description:
This place is amazing, one of the most amazing views of town. This place offers restaurant, swimming pool, and excellent accommodation in glamping style. 
They offer no more parking space for Overlanders.

name: El Rodeo
description: EL RODEOmg is a horse ranch with more than 20 horses. Riding classes are available and other activities like, trails for walking and mountain bike, butterfly and Kolibri experience. Very beautiful flat campground (grass). Hot showers, toilets, indoor seating area with coffee and drinking water. This nice family provides also meals. It is already our second time here. A short escape from Bogota (45min) with very beautiful views and nice trails for walking. A must stay for camping addicts when you pass Bogota. Any size of Car/Camper can access. Contact Claudia +57 313 2619867. Camping 35‘000 per person per night. 3 meals a day is 65‘000. Horse riding classes 35‘000.

name: Tree at the desert
description: Good shadow to spend a hot day in Tatacoa Desert

name: La Melissa Parking
description:
Hotel Parking cost 6000/night 6000/day 
We didn’t stay. A lot of trucks

name: Terpel Gas Station
description: Free Shower at new Terpel Gas Station. We also filled up our water tanque. We didn't stay overnight, but looks a good place.

name: Canopy
description: Very nice place to do canopy. only 15000COP for go and return. 500m with very nice view and adenaline.

name: Parque infantil maní Casanare
description:
Beautiful and quiet place, with lots of nature and birds.
supermarkets and commerce in general nearby.
The cops told us it was safe to spend the night.
.....
Hermoso y tranquilo sitio, con mucha naturaleza y aves.
supermercados y comercio en general cerca.
los policías nos dijeron que era seguro para pasar la noche.

name: una esquina al lado del rio
description:
spectacular place, very quiet we stayed 6 days.
the climate and the Cusiana river are beautiful.
the very friendly neighbors let us stay close to their houses. 

espectacular lugar, muy tranquilo nosotros estuvimos 6 dias.
el clima y el río Cusiana son hermosos.
los vecinos muy amables nos dejaron quedar cerca a sus casas.

name: Aluna Hostel B&b
description: Located in Santa Marta's Historic Center neighborhood, Aluna Hostel B&B is in the city center and near the beach.  Rooms with internet wi-fi, private bathroom, breakfast.  Air condition or fan.

name: Coffee tree boutique hostel
description:
Hello fellow overlanders, my name is Eddie and I'm the owner of Coffee Tree Boutique Hostel and fellow overlander.  I've done quite a bit of traveling and my last trip took me from Colombia to Ushuaia and back.  I would like to give back to the community by offering our services and giving a 10% discount on direct bookings. (via whatsapp) , just mention the ioverlander app. 

Here at Coffee Tree Boutique  Hostel we can offer overlanders a great private room or shared dorm, and of course a nice hot shower, and a great breakfast
 But most valuable is the information on the different roads around the area and the must see places that can only be accessible via private vechilce.  Even if you don't stay with us come by for a chat and a coffee or for any information you may need. 

Ps: we have gated parking for motorbikes but cars must park on the street.

name: La Mesa Redonda
description: Glamping, hobbit houses, private cabañas, restaurant, artisanal beer by Medieval, playground, swimming pool, volleyball, zip lines, quad atv track, tennis, basketball, fire pit at night, massages, very kind owners with great staff. They also have a shop called Pavo Real where they sell artesanias to help the indigenous communities who make them. Breakfast included, and a range of prices.

name: Gases de Antioquia
description: Very friendly I change regulates cost $20000 and they help me to install it

name: Fonda Mar
description:
One of the best fresh restaurants in Arboletes, highly recommended. 
Local woman chefs and fresh sea food. 
Really good

name: Cold shower
description:
Nice cold shower - 2.000 COP at a Mobil Gas station
clean toilets

name: Hidrosogamoso embalse topocoro
description: Beautiful embalse water view in the bridge

name: Puerto la Cruz
description: You can swim, fish, and practice with your cayac in embalse topocoro. To arrive I have to use an old street damaged by geological faults... a little wild... but is possible to arrive and find more cars and people down there enjoying the water.

name: Ambrosía Taller de Pan
description:
Please confirm that this bakery is open.
.....
Five-star Bakery for Colombia, with fantastic sweet and savory options. One of the most tasty and amazing chocolatine, or chocolate stuffed bread, we've ever had! More than half its weight in chocolate. We were here 4 days, got 3 out of 4 just because they were closed that one day! A balm on a French (from Québec) soul!

name: Especialista en Sprinter el mejor de colombia
description:
Camilo welcomed us into his workshop, he is recommended by all the drivers of the bus terminal. charged us a reasonable amount. we recommend it. call 573136118792 only works with sprinter.
--
Camilo nos recibió en su taller, nos lo recomendaron todos los choferes de la terminal de autobuses. nos arreglo un problema en la caja de cambios en poco tiempo, nos cobro un valor mas que razonable. lo súper recomendamos. llamar al 573136118792 solo trabaja con sprinter.

name: Zoológico de aves
description: Zoo with maaaaany birds, beautiful gardens and ecological decorations. Ring the bell when you arrive

name: Free WiFi
description: Free wifi from Alcaldía Pasto near the church in this neighborhood.

name: shower at parking
description: good place to parking and take a shower - 5000 cop, warm

name: Agreste 4x4
description:
4x4 shop specializing in tires, balancing, brakes, suspension, alignment, spare parts, oil changes, accessories, lights, etc. Excellent service and several English speaking staff.

+57 323 2213453 on Whatsapp

name: Pueblito Laguna
description:
We parked in front of the Church. Very friendly village. Quiet night.
Good option if you need do something in Pasto next day.

name: Carrera 39 calle 46
description: I ask to the guards in the buildings in front and in the store on a side and the area seems ok to park over night, in front of abandoned building, along another’s cars, people walk with their pets, police patrol, and I took the phone from the guards in case of need, bought toast and tuna to thank him.

name: Parque La Iguana
description:
It is a beautiful and quiet park close to the river, we were 10 days, it has 24 hour surveillance, the staff is very friendly. the facilities are very clean
......
Es un parque hermoso y tranquilo cerca al rio, nosotros estuvimos 10 dias, cuenta con vigilancia 24 horas, el personal es muy amable las instalaciones son muy limpias

name: Marsella - calle cerrada
description:
A very quiet closed street next to the school. It is close to the main park. the neighbors are very friendly. we stayed four nights.
.....
Es un lugar en una calle cerrada muy tranquilo al lado de la escuela. Es cerca al parque principal perfecto para pasar la noche. los vecinos son muy amables. nos quedamos cuatro noches.

name: Colpark Parqueadero
description:
I left my motorhome one week 15000/night. Big parking space with open roof, cameras during night. 
Colpark Parqueadero de summit y almacén +x-

name: Parqueadero del Ecoparque El Santísimo
description:
It was closed when I arrive at 6pm fortunately after I asked if I can spend the night inside. Sr Juan allow me to stay and to use power. 15000/night. Big parking with a family living inside. Very friendly. 
They have Cows.

name: Parqueadero teleférico el Santísimo
description: They allowed me to refill water  without charge extra, 8000 parking per vehicle

name: Charco azul (el morro Casanare)
description:
Bahía a la entrada del charco azul, lugar muy tranquilo y seguro en la noche.
precio de la entrada a charco azul es de 2000 pesos colombianos, 
el camino de acceso no está pavimentado.

name: Rio tocaría
description:
Estuvimos 3 días, lugar al lado del río tocaría, es un sitio muy fresco con mucha brisa, parqueamos cerca a un puesto de vigilancia nocturno de máquinas retroexcavadoras que trabajan en el rio. El guarda de seguridad muy amable.
