Small but clean and decent hotel above the D1 supermarket. Free potable water, fast internet and a fridge. Streetside parking only. We could store our bicycles upstairs in the hall.
50.000 for a double room with AC (with tree beds).
They also have a restaurant just down the street, Restaurante Central, with decent meals for 10.000. They do deliver the food to your room if you want.

name: Terra Nostra/local comedor
description:
This is a wonderful place. They serve local Colombian food (so lots of meat) and also have burgers and things like that. We are a vegan and a vegetarian and we were blown away by the food here too, they gave us vegetarian options and have a nice variety of local, national beers and fruit juices as well as hot drinks (tea, tinto).

We ordered a menu de día and asked to Jade it “vegetariano, sin carnet” so extra beans/salad/plantains or an egg instead. The menu came with a jugo and a soup (plantain soup! 

If you are adventurous try the beverage named *Claro* is very typical of Medellin. It’s served cold and is made with corn and milk. The quite unique thing is that you drink it while you take small bites from *bocadillo de guayaba* (sugary guava paste). Love it

name: Rotam bike shop and mechanic
description:
Small bike shops with bibs, bike shorts, a nice arrangement of jerseys, sun glasses, buff-like neck warmers, bottles, and other bike parts. 

They also have a few used and new bikes for sale (specialized and local GW brand). Their mechanic is good.

name: MAJA - Art and anthropology museum
description: Beautiful museum full of very interesting art and ancient artifacts. The museum has different exhibits and the inside is gorgeous. Very colorful place! Entrance is 3,000 ($0.75 USD)

name: Minca, Pozo Azul, Amazilia
description:
beautyful place next to the river. privat access with a nice walk to a little waterfall. Need 4x4 ! especially when it is wett (humido). Big rigs wont fit, but I guess medium will be all right. 
Luis Manuel is a very kind man. He has a small cafetería (streetrestaurant). He intend to put internet in the next month.

name: Panaderia Santa Masa
description: Brand new bakery with all kinds of French style bread for a decent price. Ranging from dark bread and baguettes to chocolate and almond croissants.

name: Hotel Bahio
description: 30,000 ($7) per person. Very nice rooms with hot water, tv, private bathroom and comfy beds.

name: Small tiendas with snacks and drinks
description: Very small town with a parque and church. This shop had arepas with queso and tinto. We stopped here for a snack and then kept pedaling to Jardín.

name: Estadero El Limón
description:
It is a place next to the Guejar river and next to the El Limón bridge, it has areas for campers and camper, also with rooms, owner and bathroom, restaurant service of typical food and drinks, it has river beaches, starting point for rafting or canoeing on the Guejar river to Sanjuan de Arama, attended by Don Álvaro and his family, very attentive and helpful people. 
Es un lugar al lado del río Guejar y al lado del puente El Limón, cuenta con zonas para campistas y camperistas, además con  habitaciones, dueña y baño, servicio de restaurante de comidas típicas y bebidas, cuenta con playas del río, punto de salida para rafting o canotaje por el río Guejar hasta Sanjuan de Arama, atendido por Don Álvaro y su familia, personas muy atentas y serviciales.

name: Bomba Primax coexisto
description: This is a safe service station where you can use the Parking for free. There are bathrooms and a green area to be with children or pets (please pick up any mess).

name: Restaurante parrilla (veg options too!)
description: Stopped here for lunch. It’s small but they were so kind! They have lots of meat options. For the veg/vegan friends they can serve you a big platter w beans, rice, salad, potatoes, fried plantains and egg. Lots of juices and tinto, of course :)

name: mirador mangos park chichimene
description:
Restaurant with a nice view, enormous carpark where they let us spend the night. The owner is very friendly, we recommend buying food or drink there.
 
Es un restaurante con una vista muy hermosa, un parqueadero enorme donde nos dejaron pasar la noche. El dueño del lugar es muy amable. Recomendamos hacer un consumo de bebidas o alimentos.

name: La Posada Hotel
description:
Very nice and clean hotel. We paid $50,000 for a private room with tv, hot water, bathroom/shower, and a very comfy bed. We are ok bikes and this was a perfect stop. Left the bikes in the hotel’s gated parking lot that’s in the lower floor. 

They have 30,000 rooms for two people, cheaper bc it has no private shower/toilet.

name: restaurante Mary
description: excellent home restaurant, located within the town of besos, ending the road, the cost is 10,000 Colombian pesos, kitchen made in firewood

name: Alameda parque caño hondo
description:
It is a very quiet park with a good bay to park. There is nature around.

ESPANOL
Es un parque lineal muy tranquilo con una buena bahía para estacionar. Hay naturaleza al rededor.

name: El Kiozko
description: This is a wonderful stop along your way to Medillin. We had the typical chorizo plate, with chicken soup, 2 chocolate crossiants, fresh juices, teas, all for 32000 pesos. Clean, adorable plates, happy to support them!

name: Hospedaje Real
description:
Decent and clean hotel. At the time we arrived late friday afternoon they only had a big room with three beds and private bathroom left for 60k. I don't know the prices of the other rooms. 
They can offer meals for lunch. The owners also own the bar next door which serves fastfood from 6PM onwards.
No streetparking possible because of inclined street.

name: Hike to Laguna de las Calles
description:
Beautifull hike through unique paramo (mountain wetland) type of landscape. At the lake there is total silence. 
From Vetas it is about 2,5 hours walking one-way. From this point (start of the official trail) it is about 20 minutes. The trail is well marked with stones and small wooden bridges. The trail is on finca property and they ask an entry fee of 20k per person. You can either call beforehand or just show up and they will see you walking.

name: Roadside
description: Spent one night here. Right in town. Pretty quiet except for some roosters. On a dirt side road so not much traffic. For 8,000 COP you can use the municipal pool up the hill to swim and shower. Enjoy!

name: Ciclaramanga (bycicle rent and NGO)
description:
Local run NGO who promotes cycling in Bucaramanga. They organize critical mass cycling events and workshops related to cycling. 

They are also a driving force behind the sundaymorning closure of the main street carrera 27 to use it for cycling and other sports. That's when they rent out all kinds of bicycles like tandems, MTBs and lowriders. They do that from the crossing of Carrera 27 and Calle 40A. 
They can be reached via +57 314 3901264 and they are on facebook and instagram.

name: Flor de Loto
description: Simply an excellent vegetarian local restaurant. It is very popular by locals for their lunch menu. For 13k you get a starter, main, dessert, lemonade and tea. Very fast and friendly service. You can be in and out in 30 minutes.

name: El Cucharito Camping
description:
This site is away from the weekend traffic at the Mesa de Los Santos. There is no height restriction, any vehicle will fit. The parking/camping area is a large meadow slanting south; rigs will need to be leveled. For campers, there is a basic bathroom and cold shower (plastic pipe). The water gets warm in the afternoon when the sun shines on the black tanks.
There also is a 4-burner stove, which works well, and a dish washing sink. A clothes washing sink and a washing machine are at Esther’s house.
There are two glamping huts, and Esther also rents two rooms; the rooms and the glamping share one bathroom accessible from the outside. Wifi reaches about a third of the way across the meadow.
We were there August and September, and it usually was quiet, also on weekends; sometimes, there is a neighbor who plays music too loudly for a few hours but not late at night. While we were there, no tent campers showed up, but people came to rent the glamping cabins; they all were quiet.
The last two kilometers to the site can be a bit bumpy, but locals drive it in small cars. There is a nice walk, also about 2 km, down to the village of Los Santos.
Esther is usually there, but it may be best to call/WhatsApp ahead.

name: Estadero Paisaje ( Río Humadea)
description:
It is a place near the river that allows camping, spending the day and spending the night with mobile homes. Its owners are very friendly people and the place is very quiet. There are bathrooms and you can bathe in the river. Highly recommended if you pass through the area. They charged us $ 10,000 a day. 

Es un lugar cercano al río que permite acampar, pasar el día y pernoctar con casas rodantes. Sus dueños son personas muy amables y el lugar es muy tranquilo. Hay baños y te puedes bañar en el río. Altamente recomendado si pasas por la zona. A nosotros nos cobraron $10.000 el día.

name: Estadero La corraleja
description:
Translation: The Estadero La Corraleja offers multiple services. You can enjoy an environment with a swimming pool and large spaces, bathrooms, showers and WiFi. it also offers spacious rooms and camping areas. Its owner Don Guillermo is very friendly. a super recommended place in Granada.
El estadero la Corraleja ofrece múltiples servicios. Puedes disfrutar de un ambiente con piscina y espacios amplios, baños, duchas y WiFi. también ofrece amplias habitaciones y zonas de camping. Su dueño Don Guillermo es muy amable. un lugar super recomendado en Granada.

name: Playa río Guejar, vereda Monserrate bajo
description:
They are the beaches of the river Guejar. Warning: keep in mind that it is a river and there may be floods, find the way to leave the camper and camping in a higher part, safe and quiet place, we spent five nights.
===
Son las playas del río Guejar. Advertencia: tener en cuenta que es un río y pueden haber crecientes, buscar el camino para dejar el camper y camping en una parte más alta, lugar seguro y tranquilo, pasamos cinco noches.

name: LAVA EN HAPPY LAUNDRY
description:
Wash, Dry & Fold service. (Same day)
Drop off and PickUp
Pay by Load

name: El Queremal, Dagua, church parking lot
description: Beside Queremal Church there is a place where you can park your motor home, is a calm and safe street, with some music noise on weekends.

name: Lago Calima Entrada 4
description: This is a camping place, where you can pay for a tent or bring your own tent. There is a beatiful view of the Lake, which is close to the camping. You can also go there with your motor home and parking there. I highly recommend visit this place from Monday to friday, because on weekends there is a lot of noise. The site offers water, showers and toilets.

name: Terpel Oro Negro Fuel Station
description: This is a Fuel station. They allow motor homes to stay there and passed night. In this place you can find toilets and running water. Is safe because it is open 24 hours. We passed there two nights because we had a mechanical problem and the guys were very kind with us.

name: Restaurante El Peñon
description: This is a restaurante with a big parking lot near to the river, ubicated in Cañón del Cobeima. It is quite and safe, and at night there is a security guard. They offered us a site where we could park if we bought something in their restaurant or paid a small fee for the parking service. They also gave us water. We stayed at this place for four days and everything was perfect. Sometimes we left our motor home there and went to know other places and nothing bad happend.

name: Parque Alfonso López Monterrey
description:
Beside the park there is an area where you can park in front of the church. It is a quite neighborhood and safe. We passed there one night and nothing bad happend.

Al lado del parque hay un área donde se puede parquear al frente de la iglesia. Es una zona residencial calmada y segura. Pasamos allí una noche y nada malo pasó.

name: Biomax Gas Station
description: This is a gas station where you can park and stay at night. There is security 24 hours, is not too close to the road so you can sleep well. There is showers and toilets, and also they offer water.

name: Tuco Carts Parking
description:
This is a parking lot in the entrance of the town, it is very wide and has a comfortable field. At night is closed and the person in charge lives in front. We stayed there two nights and everything was perfect. The cost was 5.000 COP per night. Felt safe.


Es un parqueadero a la entrada del pueblo, tiene un campo amplio con un pasto muy cómodo. En las noches se cierra el parqueadero y la persona a cargo vive al frente. Nos sentimos muy seguros y pasamos dos noches muy tranquilas. El costo fue de 5.000 pesos por noche.

name: La Miga Agua Potable
description: Right on the corner of the panaderia. There’s a parking lot too you can park while you fill up for a while. It’s very slow but it’s free and I couldn’t find garrafones in the stores.

name: Restaurante donde Tavo
description: This is a restaurant close to the main road, we asked the manager for a place where we could stay at night and he offered us a place at the back of his restaurant for free. It is a little noise but for one night is ok. The restaurant opens 24 hours.

name: Río Don Diego
description:
Translation:Nice place to stay for a few days,
It is a large parking lot next to the restaurants and is a few steps from the river, the owner of the parking lot allowed us to sell and spend the night on the weekend. You can float from the river to the sea.
the cost of parking is 5000 pesos a day and at night you can stay right here.
very quiet and safe place
Agradable sitio para estar unos días,
es un parqueadero grande junto a los restaurantes y está a pocos pasos del río, la dueña del parqueadero nos permitió vender y pernoctar el fin de semana. Se puede ir en flotador desde el río hasta el mar.
el costo del parqueadero es 5000 pesos día y en la noche puede quedarse aquí mismo.
lugar muy tranquilo y seguro

name: Parque principal San Martín
description:
Translation:We spent five days in this place. It is relatively quiet, except on Fridays and Saturdays where there is a bit of noise from some neighboring places, however it is spacious with some shade. We recommend going to Caño Camoa which is very close.
Pasamos cinco días en este lugar. Es relativamente tranquilo, exceptuando los viernes y sábados donde hay un poco de ruido de algunos locales vecinos, sin embargo es espacioso con algo de sombra. Recomendamos ir a Caño Camoa que es muy cerca.

name: Hotel Parque la Casona
description:
Most beatuful hotel finca ever known in Colombia. you have path trekking, lots of animals, horse riding, 9 artificial lakes, beautiful weather, and an incredible swiming pool. there are 4 pools. Big parking. Great restaurant. choose rooms whit internal view. 
prices for double room 250.000 COP. or 215000 from tuesday to thursday. Pool 15000 per person.
You can also spend the day: 50.000 COP with lunch. pool apart. Not allowed to sleep in the van. Reservations 318601195

name: High altitude roadside with a view
description:
This spot is the closest parking to the turn off for the sketchy road to walk up to Cerro Kennedy (or you can 4x4/moto up that road but we only have 2WD). the view is sweet, a sliver of Santa Marta and the ocean, mountains, and a great view of Ciénaga, the long spit, and even the lights of Barranquilla at night. You can get a little bit of cell service at the big rock from Ciénaga direction. 

There's a bar at the turnoff to Cerro Kennedy with a bathroom and porch with beers and a pool table. the owner says this is technically his parking too, so we paid 5.000 for the day. He had asked 10, but wasn't there when I paid, and I also got some beers. 

It's just a pull off on the side of the road, above a coffee plantation. But the views and weather are perfect.

Down the road a little farther is a restaurant open on the weekends. pretty sleepy up here but definitely busier on the weekends.

name: Hotel Guaicaramo
description:
Parking is small so nothing bigger than a van or pickup camper. 
They lock the gate at night and have security guard. 
The best thing is the price. Queen bed room with A/C, fast WiFi, good TV, and warm shower is only 45,000 pesos. Oh, and a nice little pool.

name: Chocolate Artesanal XUE
description:
Artesan chocolate shop where you can enjoy delicious chocolate in different presentations. Adriana is the very friendly owner. Additionally, they offer parking to spend the night.
---
chocolatería artesanal dónde puedes disfrutar de un delicioso chocolate en diferentes presentaciones. Adriana la dueña muy amable.
Adicional le ofrecen parqueadero para pasar la noche.

name: Cheap hotel
description: Not a lot of hotel options between Villavicencio and Bogota. We found this one to be OK. Get a room in the back and it’s dark and quiet. Full size beds only. It’s clean with hot showers. Only 35K pesos.

name: Ghl hotel
description: If you want a little luxury after sweating it out in the desert, this is the place. Right next door to Centro Comercial San Pedro Plaza you’ll have lots of bars/restaurants. Parking in back for big rigs too.

name: Super narrow bridge
description: Barely made it through with our truck camper. Caused quite the traffic jamb for a while. Only route we saw south so we went for it. No height restriction, but if you’re a little wide forget it!

name: Hotel balcones de la pradera
description: Nice looking hotel with swimming pool and good restaurant. 30K pesos per person. Didn’t stay. Just ate lunch. This is a lonely stretch of road from Neiva to Tierra Adentro. Not a lot of options for gas, eating, or hotels.

name: Hotel D’Mary
description: Friendly host (though a man not called Mary..) basic double room w bathroom & WiFi, parking inside gated lobby for motorbike, & coffee in the morning for 50,000COP. Good base for a pitstop. Had good dinner at local restaurant recommended by host. Near bakery, fuel station and shops. Went to see the lake (15 mins away), looked lovely for boat tours etc but busy car park and didn’t want to leave the bike. Took the road from Prado to Baraya and on to the Tatacoa Desert, which was amazing.

name: Panadería panes y Galletas
description:
We are a family with this local business that wants to help passing travelers, we can help them with water, wifi, lodging, shower, washing clothes and whatever they require.
---
Somos una familia con este negocio local que desea ayudar a los viajeros de paso, les podemos ayudar con agua, wifi, hospedaje, ducha, lavar ropa y lo que requieran.

name: Parque principal
description: Pasamos una noche en el parque principal de Mesetas y resultó ser un sitio muy tranquilo y seguro. la recomendación de la policía es no hacerse muy cerca de ellos

name: Hotel  El cortijo
description: Hotel con amplio parqueadero. Aceptan motorhome, precios cómodos, agua, servicios sanitarios, Internet, servicio de restaurante, piscinas juegos infantiles, aceptan mascotas

name: agua san juan puente nacional
description:
Very good point to fill up waterbottles
---
3103038067 agua puritu casa en botellón muy buena

name: Home Center - Propane
description: We found small propane cylinders here for our camp stove that usually uses the green Coleman’s. Refilling our normal tank in Bucaramanga was unsuccessful but at least we can cook until we get to another city.

name: Mirador CANOAS
description: Mirador restaurante with gorgeous view. Menu with lots of dishes, fruit juices, alcohol drinks, cafe and lots chorizos just off the grill; so good! Perfect place for breakfast or lunch

name: Camping at former restaurant
description:
Big covered building where the folks who live just in front let you camp for 10,000 pp. It’s the only place around to hide from the rain. This is the place to camp and then hike to Laguna Otun the next morning (5hr hike round trip).

The area for camping is a big building under construction - it is fully covered, has a concrete floor (dry floor!), plenty of electrical sockets (all of them worked!!), no lightbulbs, bathrooms with running water, a sink to do dishes/prepare food/refill water to drink, and lots of chairs and bird poop...

The workers who lived in the house in front (the people you pay to camp) told us they hope the place is done and ready to offer lodging and restaurant services by January 2022. In the meantime you can camp here and scape the rain...

To keep in mind: This is the only camping spot in the area; the Potosi Camping (at the park entrance) is no longer taking people - they will send you here. It is absurdly cold during the night so bring a good sleeping bag and many layers; it is brutal.

We rode our bikes from Santa Rosa de Cabal (going towards Manizales) and came prepared to cook since there is ***absolutely*** nothing around here. 

The hike to Otun was gorgeous. Be prepared for rain up there ! You can hike all the way to the Laguna (11km - 22km round trip). Bring snacks and a rain layers. We only hiked to the mirador (6km) where you can see Nevado Santa Isabel and the laguna, it’s was beautiful! Very recommended. Foreigners pay $47.500 to enter the park and do the hike.

name: Cajica,
description:
Agua Fortaleza
20l Garafones, just water 7500
friendly and fast

name: La Rana
description:
Country house owned by a lovely family of bird and nature lovers. Yaqui, Oscar and the kids make everyone feel at home. Amazing landscapes, friendly neighborhood, full of grandma's eager to feed everyone with delicious local cuisine. Ideal for families with kids, looking for a quiet place to enjoy nature and warm company. No party allowed. Paid COP$20.000 P/p night.

Access through a dirt road, not too bad, like 15 minutes from the town "Fomeque". Check the tourist attraction entry for details about bird watching. Maximum height 2.75mts. Call before you go, cell: 310 8838037.

Finca propiedad de amantes de los pájaros. Yaqui, Oscar y los niños te hacen sentir en casa. Paisajes asombrosos, un vecindario muy amigable, lleno de abuilitas ansiosas por alimentarte con la deliciosa cocina local. Ideal para familias con niños, o buscando un lugar tranquilo para disfrutar de la naturaleza y compañía cálida. No sé permiten fiestas. Pague COP $20.000 P/p noche.

A 15 minutos del pueblo "Fomeque", por una carretera destapada, pero no muy mala. Ver la atracción turística para detalles de la observación de aves. Altura máxima 2.75mts. llamar antes de ir al cel: 310 8838037.

name: La Rana - Bird Watching - Aves
description:
Yaqui, Oscar and the kids work tirelessly for the conservation of local birds and the ecosystem. Oscar is an ornitologist and photographer. He can guide you on sessions of Bird watching and feeding, and trekking in the area. They lead multiple conservationist programs.
A session of bird watching in their place location costs COP$40.000 P/P. A trekking day with bird watching costs COP$150.000 P/P.  Call first to: 310 8151695.
Yaqui also offers culinary tours with the neighbors whit amazing and delicious local traditional food.

Yaqui, Oscar y sus niños trabajan constantemente en diferentes programas de conservación ambiental y de aves de la zona. Oscar es un Ornitologo y fotógrafo, que puede hacer sesiones de observación de aves, alimentación de colibríes, y caminatas. La sesión de observación de aves en su finca cuesta COP$40.000 P/p. Y el día de caminata con observación de aves COP $150.000 p/p.
Llamar primero al cel: 310 8151695.
Yaqui también ofrece tours culinarios con los vecinos del área, con comida local traditional deliciosa.

name: Reef Shepherd Dive Center
description:
Is an excellent dive center! They are very professional and doesn’t matter if you are an experienced or new diver, they take care of you and your equipment and that make me feel safe in all of the dives. I went with a big group but they split them in small groups by instructor. They took me wonderful pictures diving! 
Book your dives with Santiago Estrada 300 8286273. He is one of the most experienced divers specialized in underwater photography!!!

name: On street parking
description: Piece of street without forbidden parking signal, can park 4 or 5 cars.

name: Hostal Vida Tranquila
description:
Nice hostal with heated swimmingpool overlooking the valley and the town Charala. They offer biljart, running toilets, sauna, relaxing chairs and cool beers. There is music ofcourse, but not too loud. 
We asked and we could pitch our tent for 20.000 in total for 1 night with 2 persons on the big grassfield.
Enough spots for several cars. The gate is locked at night.

name: Fabrica de Arepas Buenas Aires
description: Almost on top of the road you will find this gem. Nothing better then a fat arepa with cheese and coffee when cold from the wind up there. The place is very popular by locals to stop by. During weekends this is the goal for many bicyclists climbing up from Duitama.

name: Casa Movida Hostel
description:
Wrong location. It's on Calle 35, between Carrera 7 and Diagonal 35.
Probably the best hostel in town.
Spotless, large sleeping capsules, new slower/toilets. Café bar, pool, roof bar. Great location within the town walls.
SIM cards from supermarket around the corner. 40k pesos per night including eggs, coffee, toast, fruit for breakfast.

name: Old school
description: Parking near an old school beside route 55, approximately 4 kms outside Tipacoque town.

name: El manantial (vegetarian)
description: Small restaurant with lots of vegetarian options. It’s open until 4pm. It was a great stop! We had the menu Del día for 10,000

name: Sakana sushi & ramen
description: This is a great sushi spot. Vegan and vegetarian options as well. It’s a very cute, small, well-staffed spot. I celebrated my bday here and it was a great place to eat, drink and enjoy a nice night. The staff is wonderful and their sushi is as well.

name: Place with beans for breakfast (vegan)
description:
Asadero de Los Gatos
We are vegan and had a hard time finding something from breakfast in this beautiful town. We are used to looking around :) so it was fun. 

We walked around town and this was the only place that offered a veganish breakfast in the whole town.

We got beans (nobody else had:), plantains, rice, a big salad, and limonada. Sounds like lunch but it was delicious.

This place is cute and offers a lot of grilled meat - so if you like meat, this is your spot too.

name: Villa Cecilia
description:
Simple but very comfy rooms. 
AC double room is 80,000 (40 each person)
No AC double room is 70,000 (35 each)

Breakfast not included but 6,000 (arepa, huevo and coffee)

Wifi was pretty good.
Lots of mosquitos so it was nice to have the AC and the windows shut.

name: cafe mael (coffee and wifi:)
description:
This is a nice coffe shop with a very large shaded patio. Their coffee is good and their wifi is strong. They have some food, fruit juices and beer.

I appreciated the space. It’s very quiet and it has a lot of space if you are coming with kids. 

This is also the spot to come get some work done on wifi, it’s a super comfy place and the staff is very chilled and kind. We parked our bikes inside and chilled here for 2-3hrs. It was relaxing

name: Paramo del Almorzadero
description: Safe place with cabanas, a laguna, waterfall and restaurant. We didn’t try the restaurant but when we arrived we were offered agua panela. The campsite is okay, in a dirt parking spot but the owner let us use the shower and bathroom in a cute cabana with a view of the laguna. It’s a nice spot to wander the paramo a bit. No cell service. 20,000cop a night. The restaurant has wifi but we didn’t try it

name: Corrales y Peroles restaurante
description: Good restaurant with a small zoo in the back..

name: Tacos del Mundo
description: Good fusion food. Tacos, schwarma, pita, etc.. Good option if you’re tired of Colombian food. Good prices too..

name: Hotel Kantaranna
description: Nice little hotel right where you turn for Cabañas La Isla. 140K pesos for 2 people with breakfast. A little overpriced for Colombia, but so is everything else in this tourist town. Hot showers, clean room. Bus stops by every hour to take you into town. Very quiet and parking for a large motorhome unlike La Isla. Worth it if you want to treat yourself..

name: Mostaza y Hierbabuena
description: seems to be the local eatery. basic food but fun to see the scene. 2 ppl lunch for 14k

name: Hotel el Mirador
description: Simple hotel, decent wifi, cold shower, centrally located, allowed to take bike into room - steep stairs though. Don't think there is parking

name: Prashanti - Vegan/Vegeterian restaurant
description:
This was such a treat. This restaurant is a full vegan/vegetarian place with desserts and lots of other healthy products.

We had breakfast here on a Saturday morning and it was very yummy. Lunch is delicious too; they have a menu Del día. After 3pm you can order from their bigger menu. I ordered oysters mushroom with fried rice and it was delicious.

So nice to take a break from arepas and fried food.

There is wifi, lots of juices and the place is well ventilated. Cold Kombucha for sell as well:)

name: Hospedaje
description:
Not many lodging options in this town. This is one of two.

A very simple hospedaje in the house of an old couple. They are well known for hosting people in their house. There are 4-5 rooms with single or double beds. We stayed in the first room (facing the road) with two single beds, an old tv that worked perfectly; room had a private bathroom. We each paid 15K.

The beds were very simple but the place was mostly clean and with earplugs we slept more than wonderfully. It’s a pretty chilled town but the night before there was a bit of noise, nothing terrible.

The other rooms are way quieter, they just don’t have their own bathroom. I guess you have to pick.

The old couple is very sweet. We brought our bikes inside the room and felt pretty safe.

No wifi.

name: Hostel Campestre los Duraznos
description:
Cosy hostel with spaces for tent camping with a nice view overlooking the valley. The hostel has a small entry road with height restriction so it is not suitable for vans.
Tent camping is 20k with basic breakfast included.
Wifi, warm shower and potable water available. They also have rooms available.
Friendly owners who only speak Spanish.

name: Small tienda
description: Small town with a few tiendas and places to eat empanadas, simple lunches and pan with tintos.

name: hospedaje el principe
description:
Very nice and clean hotel with indoors parking for motorcycles or bikes. Street parking otherwise. Hotel is located in a very quiet street. 

They have three types of room; all of them have their own shower/bathroom, and tv. Wifi is strong. 

Double for 30K 
Double for 45K
Double for 50K

The only difference in the rooms is the size. We stayed in the 45K and were very comfy. The 30K is totally fine, it just had an older TV. 

They are all the main floor so no stairs. We parked our bicycles right in front of our room and it was very safe.

Staff was very kind and friendly. They have a cover garage with chairs where you can chill. It was very nice.

name: William Toyota
description: This young man was trained by Toyota and worked for them for over 20 years. He found an opportunity to take over a shop and exclusively works on Toyota. He has worked on my lexus and my Troop Carrier and he does fantastic work with only Toyota parts. His contacts with Toyota run deep and he can get hard to find parts. He is honest to a fault.

name: Autollanta Goodyear Nutibara
description: Good place to buy tires. What makes these guys stand out is that they do excellent alignment and suspension inspection. They check everything and they are good. They also do good business and not try to sell you stuff you don't need. I highly recommend them as my experience was above average.

name: Hotel Santagueda #3202421519
description: Nice modern hotel on the way into Fresno. Parking downstairs. Decent WiFi, cold showers. 30k for single room

name: salto de Versalles
description: aprox 6 km from Guaduas you can find a very nice 30m waterfall. During rainy season it is impressive, plenty of brown water

name: Hostal el Caminante
description: Nice, Super friendly and helpful staff… beautiful place, colonial house, located in the historic center of Cocuy. 1 block from the park.  the house has different environments, fireplace, kitchen, terrace.  They also organize tours to the Sierra Nevada de El Cocoy. Double rooms for 40-50.000 Cop a night. they offer breakfast service for $10,000 Cop

name: El Taurete
description: Camping area with restaurant and public bath.  next to the Guatape River, with a very large green area.

name: El Muele
description:
At the far end of the seafront, a civilised beachfront location, on two floors open to the cooling sea breeze.
Good food, classy, relaxed atmosphere. 80k COP for  chicken Caesar salad, fries, dessert and three beers.

name: Parking place close to the field
description:
Hear you can park your motor home for free, is very close to the beach, safe and calm at nights. During the day there is music from the restaurant but they close early at nights. We asked to the local people and they say that we wont have problem to stay here. There are showers and toilets available for 2.000 pesos  in the restaurant.
---
En este lugar se puede parquear y pasar la noche, es gratis, seguro y calmado en las noches. Está muy cerca de la playa y en el restaurante más cercano hay duchas y baño disponible por 2.000 pesos. En el día hay música pero en la noche todo es muy tranquilo.

name: view of the canon, place to sleep
description: I had here a rest at daytime,levelled and enough space for 2-3 cars.a little bit traffic noise,because the street is 200 meters away,loved it

name: guatapé
description:
'agua fresca alto verde'
 they fill your garafons.
the house is inbetween new constructions, bit tricky to find

name: Parquing lot with Bathrooms
description:
"This is a nice neighborhood with a good percentage of Bogotas top eateries."

We came to park for the ramen around the corner (super tasty), and the attendant said we could sleep in the van here for 20k total for 2 ppl. Bathroom is nice and clean. It's up a hill and around some buildings from the street so not too noisy and kind of nice actually once you head up the slightly steep incline. some height restriction at the entrance but we made it in no problem with our 10ft tall van.

name: Lavaseco Supratex
description: They charge COP $6000 per pound. But ask for the service without ironing.

name: El Balcón del Huila
description: Nice finca with great view of the Quimbo dam. You can spend the day here eat, drink, relax and take nice pictures. Entrance 5000 per person. you can also spend the night here, in the cabaña 220.000 or in the van 10.000 extra. The parking is big, of ground and sand. the way Is a bit narrow in the end. Could be difficult if you run into  another vehicle. ok for our Sprinter.

name: Quimbo dam
description: place where you can do aquatic sports like jet sky, boat, and others. 50.000COP for 4 people 12 minutes. it is not regulated so it is precarious. Parking not flat, but nice to see the dam, the bridge and do aquatic sports.

name: gutmans road side stop with running water
description: nice spot. with running water from the river and a safe place for one rig max 2 to stop

name: Comedores
description:
There are a few basic comedores here. We had lunch and they made it with no meat. They have natural juices and tinto.

You could ask to camp in one of the empty comedores once it’s dark. The road does not have a lot of traffic.

name: Ride Bike
description:
Bike workshop, excellent service.
The mechanic is Rubén and he is very knowledgeable.
---

Taller de bicis, excelente atención. 
El mecánico es Rubén y es muy conocedor.
This is a nice shop. It’s small and run by Ruben. Don’t underestimate the quality of the work, it’s really good :)

name: Puerta del Sol
description:
Very popular side of the road restaurant. We stopped here for a cup of coffee. Truckers were having breakfast w chicken rice and soup. Recommended!

They also sell energy drinks

name: Restaurante Isabelita
description:
Comedor w breakfast, lunch and dinner. We got here after a whole day of biking from
Mocoa. It was around 7:30pm and the lady running the place was very kind and offered us a vegetarian dinner w rice soup; main dish has rice, salad and papas. The foos was delicious. She serves food all day long! We came back the next morning for juices. 

Very nice place ; what we needed after such a long day.

name: river side camping next to the road
description:
next to the road and also to the bridge waterfalls right next to the parking place. very load river. 
trucks passing on the road can see you and honk but the river sound demps it all

name: Empanadas y hojaldres
description:
Small little spot with 3-4 tables. Delicious empanadas and hojaldres for breakfast or the afternoon craving. Saw kids and other folks having their morning tinto and empanadas and told us this was “the spot”

We are vegan and kindly asked the lady running the place if she could prepare some empanadas “sin carne” no meat. The lady was a bit surprised but said yes and told us to come by 2-3hrs later. The empanadas were super yummy.

name: Hotel Almirante
description:
Very clean, spacious, comfy rooms with a big bed, private bathroom w hot shower and cable tv. We really enjoyed our time here ! We traveled by bike and we stored our bikes in the hotels garage, felt very safe. 

Fast wifi 

Recommended!

35K per couple

name: Small tiendas
description: Fruit and veggies and basic things. There is a hotel in this town too

name: Chagras Naturalia
description:
Delicious food here. Highly recommended!

The food was all very fresh, the soup had Andean roots (ollucos, and others I forget), the main was delicious too - the salad had pickled and fresh veggies; the best salad we have had in 3 months in Colombia.

The restaurant supports indigenous communities and local campesinos/as growing veggies that are very unique to this region. 

The chef has represented Nariño/Colombia in international food festivales. We had no idea about this place just stopped here because we loved the big murals they have.

They serve Colombian traditional food focused on the Nariño cultivos - meat options too. We had a vegan fest here and the desert “chilacuan” was exquisite; we bought an extra to go! (They have them for sell).

Highly recommend this place

name: mirador camping amazing morning view
description: this place is flat and can host 4 big rigs. amazing morning view of cocran mountains. not so windy as it is a bit protected. cold at night because of the 3880 alt.  but worth it

name: Tacama Camping
description:
Hello, we are Tacama Camping, come and enjoy a delimited camping areas and an alpine type cabin with comfortable, quiet and safe spaces. Located at 5 mins from the center of Paipa, 13 mins from the ITP thermal baths and from Bogota just 2hrs and 30mins. We have bathrooms in perfect condition with everything you need, showers with hot water (two spacious and independent showers), parking, WiFi in some areas, fire pit area in each spot with grill included and two social areas. Our areas are ideal for children. we are waiting for you! 

Pet Friendly. Campers also welcome.

*********

Hola, somos Tacama Camping, ven y disfruta de unas zonas de camping delimitadas y una cabaña tipo alpina con espacios cómodos, tranquilos y seguros. Ubicados a 5 mins del centro de Paipa, a 13 mins de las reconocidas termales ITP y de Bogotá a solo 2hrs y 30mins. Contamos con baños en perfecto estado con todo lo que necesitas , duchas con agua caliente (dos duchas amplias e independientes), parqueadero, WiFi en algunas zonas, zona de fogata propia en cada parcela con parrilla incluida y dos áreas sociales. Nuestras zonas son ideales para niños. ¡te esperamos! 

Aceptamos peluditos sin costo adicional.
Disponemos también de zona para camper.

*******

Oi, somos Tacama Camping, venha e desfrute de uma área de camping delimitada e uma cabine tipo alpina com espaços confortáveis, silenciosos e seguros. Localizado a 5 minutos do centro de Paipa, 13 minutos dos famosos banhos térmicos do ITP e apenas 2hrs e 30mins de Bogotá. Temos banheiros em perfeito estado com tudo que você precisa , chuveiros com água quente  (dois chuveiros espaçosos e independentes), parking, WiFi em algumas áreas, área própria de fogueira em cada lote com churrasqueira incluida e duas áreas sociais. Nossas áreas são ideais para crianças. Bemvindos! Aceitamos animais. Temos também áreas para campers.

name: super finca big ground
description:
this is a new spot. the owner just came and invited us to stay at his place free, he is building the place so it is new. 
big open ground mostly flat. he is opening a road for big rigs to enter.
has animals on the farm. building a kitchen and showers. when we where there it was just the beginning but  the owner has the hospitality mentality to make this place amazing. great location within walking distance from mongui so you can leave the rig here and walk to the town ( 5 minutes walk)

name: La Cabaña restaurante
description: Nice comedor with menus Del dia. We had a vegetarian platter for 6K. There are tiendas in the same streets in case you need to purchase food for the road ahead

name: Terpel station and hotel
description:
Small but functional rooms. 20k ppp
Comedor and bathrooms next door

name: BicIpiales - bike store/mechanic
description:
Bike shop with mechanic service. They helped us with our bottom bracket and they were very knowledgeable. The shop also sells other stuff like bike sealant for tubeless tires (stans, dry wax y finish lines brands).

Really good store!

name: Great spot for cyclists, possibly motorbikes
description: A large, relatively flat area within a bend. There are lots of bushes to hide from the road. Very little traffic in the evening, practically none after dark (Friday night) with great views of the sky. Felt perfectly safe as a solo camper

name: Lubricantes El Porvenir
description:
Here I did the oil change in my motor home.
They serve heavy vehicles and it is advisable to be patient on the waiting list.
Very professional 

Aquí hice el cambio de aceite de mi casita rodante.
Atienden vehículos pesados y conviene tener paciencia en la lista de espera. 
Muy profesionales, pregunten por Carlos

name: Bus terminal
description:
Land borders are still closed with Ecuador. We biked to the border and were told that we could not cross. The options are: taking dirt roads to Tulcan or taking a bus to a big city to then fly to Quito.

1. Dirt road (trocha): we were told there are many robberies along these back roads. Robberies target anybody who might “stick out”. We were told this by local Colombians, ecuatorians in Tulcan whom we had been in touch, people at the bike shops we went, cyclist friends in Ipiales, and migrants who had recently taken the road in which unfortunately they got robbed.

2. Bus: we decided to load our bikes on a bus and go to Cali to catch a flight to Quito. There are many companies but we needed a bus with enough storage space for our bikes. We were recommended Transipiales or Boliviariano. We came to the terminal and got tickets (bring cash; there is also Bancolombia ATM inside the station) for the next day. We recommend buying 12hrs in advance.

Boliviano bus charged 50k pp from Ipiales to Cali, 12hrs. We caught the 8am bus; arrived at 7:15 to make sure we would be ready to load the bikes securely.

Bikes have an extra charge of 30k; you could negotiate this. We did not.

name: Tierradentro Café Restaurant
description:
Very nice coffee shop-restaurant. Great brunch during the weekends. They serve mimosas as well. For vegans they have the avocado toast and fruit bowls. Most breakfasts include eggs, fruit, bacon, and coffee. It’s a nice place for cyber nomads looking for a good place w coffee, jugos and strong wifi. 

Covid: the place is very well ventilated and tables are placed under covered spaces in the patio or a big terrace. Staff wear masks at all times, there is hand sanitizer at the entrance. Important: we were asked to show our Covid vaccination card with both shots. This can be the actual card or a photo of it clearly showing your name, both shots. This is a new part of the protocol and many restaurants/cafes now have it as an entry requirement - Tierradentro is doing it.

name: Bosque del Descanso
description: Campsite with cabins and Glamping. Access to the Jordan river and bonfire at night. Opens again January 2022. Price 150.000 per rigs with 2 persons. Contact first 3146572849

name: HOTEL CHUIRA
description:
Decent place with secure gated area to store bike/moto.
Rooms with airco or fan.
Paid 40k for 1 with fan down from 50k.
There is WiFi.
Very pleasant little town

name: Terpel fuel and park
description:
Brand new, still under construction. Perfect concrete parking for trucks and cars. Facilities under construction, lavatory at truck fuel section.
paid nothing.

name: Flor de Loto - vegan restaurant.
description:
Small and nice vegan restaurant. It’s open Tuesday to Sunday (Monday is closed) from 4-10pm. The whole menu is vegan. They have choripanes, burguers and other fast vegan food. 

We heard they might be relocating by the end of December/2021. So they recommended to check out their social media (Instagram) for updates. If you are looking for lunch then check out their lunch spot at San Antonio called MadreSelva (included here in iO)

The Yupanqui burger or the Choripan are exquisite. Their burgers are quiet massive btw! 

It was delicious !

name: Cayetano ApartaEstudio
description:
We wanted to have access to a kitchen and found this place on Booking.

We paid 58k a night for a small studio with a double bed, a two-burner stove, a fridge, private bathroom w hot water, a closet, a plastic table with two chairs (good if you need to work), cable t.v, and a closed garage to leave our bikes safely. Our room was on the 3 floor and it had a big window facing the street w a great view of the neighborhood. It’s on a relatively quiet street, it was comfy. 

It’s a 3 story building with a narrow staircase and there is a big terrace (nothing fancy just a few chairs/tables with a nice view of the Cali and San Antonio) to chill. 

You can find it on booking as “apartastudios Cayetano” 

We were previously staying in San Antonio (just few streets up) and found San Cayetano to be more lively during the week; a lot of restaurants/cafes/stores/eateries are open *only* during the weekend in San Antonio because it’s more touristy. San Cayetano has more of a local vibe, streets at night are full of locals eating food, hanging out and there are more groceries, local bakeries, and food stands available. D1, supermarkets, fruvers, and tiendas are in every corner. It’s all 2 streets down from this location. Safe at night and folks at the other apartments are kind and keep to themselves, so it feels very private.

name: Falafel y Más (inside Chipichape mall)
description:
This was such a gem to find. It’s a Mediterranean food kiosk inside the chipichape mall (we were told this is an upscale mall). It’s in the first floor by the BBVA bank. 

Their menu is fantastic! We got the vegetarian platter with hummus, lentils, salad and really crispy falafel. Their menu includes platters w kibbes, chontaduro ceviche (!!), babaganoush, shawarma, salads, almond rice, jatafim, majadra, and schnitzel. They have limonada w mint and freshly squeezed mandarina juice; coffee and sodas available as well.

Really good !

The mall has a lot of clothing stores, restaurants and other services.

name: Hotel Santa Laura
description:
Nice big brand new semi economical hotel just a few blocks from centro. If you don’t mind taking your rig through town they even have parking for 2 big rigs. 140K a night with breakfast. We left our rig at Ecoland for a few days. Jacuzzi on the roof at night. It was a nice break from the road and Jerico is a nice little relaxed town during the week. Weekend was busier.

Update: Came back for a second stay here and decided to park at the hotel after checking out the route. Be careful or you’ll get caught going through some tight streets and very steep hills. Google should take you up to the mirador and above the town a bit and then down behind the church. A few tight turns but not too bad. Go just past the hotel front door and parking entrance is on your left. No height restriction, but may be a tight turn for anything over 7 meters long. You can turn around at the bottom. Bit of a steep driveway.

name: LifeRider Motorcycle
description: Very competent and helpful Motorcycle Mecanic. Good experience here.

name: SAC Montagas Ipiales
description:
GAS-truck.
—-
At the Teleferico in Las Lajas (highly recommendable, amazing helpful people) we ran out of propan gas. The Teleferico guys called a GAS-truck in that recharged our tank. MONTAGAS is located in Ipiales and they are flexible with the truck. US connection for the tank.

name: Dynamax Fuel Station
description:
New station, huge flat gravel parking 
nice people, no charge, gave the guy a cold beer and apple!
I was the only vehicle parked up

name: Wild Camping by a stream
description:
Beautiful spot near a small road, off the town of Florian (Santander).
Located on a small farm, owned by extremely nice people who were happy to let us stay there. They showed us the surroundings and discovered the most amazing view of the Tisquizoque waterfall right next to where we parked. 
Please contact @somosecoflorian on IG
Local phone 3106252439
Yeison, the best and nicest guide in town

name: BC coffee(fantastic pastries/coffee)
description:
Very delicious coffee, bread, cakes, etc. Their cinnamon roll/cheesecake roll is delicious.

This is an artisanal bakery/cafe and it is worth the visit. Sourdough, kefir, kombucha, etc. This is a place where you can come drink, chill, get some work done and get some treats/food. It’s gorgeous! 

Everyday 9am-10pm. Monday is closed

Coffee in grain, sourdough bread, tea, baked goods, chocolate and other goodies to go as well.

name: Crepes and Waffles Flora
description:
Very nice restaurant with waffles, crepes, saladas and a great vegetarian, vegan menu. They also have vegan ice cream and regular ice cream.

This place is known for being a restaurant that only hires women. It’s pretty amazing the whole place ran by women employees! 

Delicious food.

name: Decathlon
description: Good outdoor gear store. It's pretty big with lots of gear ranging from affordable to a bit more upscale. Very recommended!

name: Large vegan/vegetarian food store
description:
Great vegan vegetarian products.
They have a lot of seeds, spices, cheeses (imitations!) and vegan meats like the beyond burger and other meat imitations made in Colombia. I don’t think I have seen a store like this since we were in the US, and by that I mean there were 1-2 !

Ice cream, popsicles, dried fruit, powered milk, coconut oil, oats, honey, agave, beauty products, bread loafs, and LOTS of chocolate bars from Colombia, 

Vegan/vegetarian friends, check it out!

name: Cascada Las Golondrinas
description:
A beautiful waterfall surrounded by a lush forest.
A 45 minutes hike from where we camp. 
The closest town is called Jesus Maria (Santander)

name: Entrance to Las Golondrinas waterfall
description:
A very beautiful place at the entrance path to the Las Golondrinas waterfall. Only 4x4 during rainy season as it gets quite muddy. 
Very peaceful and has a amazing 360 degrees view. 
There is a wire fence gate but ask the family that lives there, they will let you in. They are very friendly.
From here to the waterfall is a 45 minutes hike and it is open all year without a fee.

name: Restaurant Noa Barichara
description: Great lunch stp. friendly staff and excellent food. wrap based menus. Good veggie options. recommended

name: Small Tienda and Bar
description: we parked in the large bit of waste ground next the Tienda late at night. The owner arrived the next morning and he was more than happy we stayed. he didn't ask for money but we paid him 10000 peso to say thank you. Nice and flat no facilities

name: Pozo Azul
description:
A very beautiful river with natural pools, surrounded by huge rock formations and a very big tropical forest.
There are many butterflies with amazing bright colors.
Be prepared for a rough, steep and muddy hike of about 1 1/2 to 2 hours.  Totally worth it!

Updated the exact location. Use Maps.Me for navigation. The trail is marked there.

name: Fuerte de San Sebastian del Pastilillo
description: very nice waterfront restaurant . Fantastic Sea food and views. not the cheapest but excellent food and feel. Put a nice shirt on and treat yourself

name: Car park big rig
description:
Just after the mall take the first right on Calle 7, then 50 metres and right into the car park. 
220cop per hour

name: Wild Camping Extreme 4x4
description:
What a great discovery! About an 1 1/2 hours drive from Chima (Santander). A small flat spot by the most  beautiful red rock river, with natural pools up the stream. Very quiet and peaceful if you enjoy the sound of running water.
It is a very tough road, only 4x4 vehicles!
The whole way there, the scenery  is breathtaking… Mountains, mountains and more mountains.
The most beautiful spot we have ever seen. Very few local people, really kind and friendly.
Highly recomended for those who like adventure, have the right rig and don’t mind being in the middle of nowhere without cell phone signal.

name: Pesca y coma finca
description: A friend recommended us this place, since he knew the owner. There is no name at the entrance but two big Colombian flags. Fernando and his family were very friendly and always happy to help us. Days were hot so we spent the afternoons by the river near by. Fernando father has a private access at his land which is 15min from the camping spot.

name: Wild Camping above the clouds
description:
This place is at the end of a mountain road and ends right here. Start from Galan (Santander) and ask for directions to Siberia.
The view is outstanding and in the morning you feel like you are flying above the clouds.
Only 4x4

name: Herbívoro (excellent vegan restaurant)
description:
This place smells amazing! All vegan, with many options including Menu of the Day, Pizza, rice plates, pasta, soups, breakfast, dessert and all of high quality. 

we were able to park with our 6m van but it's tricky, although the parking lot employee helped a lot!

this place is doing solid business! people in and out constantly

name: Parking near center, Big Rigs fit
description:
It's not the best area but it's hard to park down here. for the skatepark it's the closest best parking I could find! tercer milenio skatepark is huge. 

2k cop / hr
20k cop / night

name: WabiSabi
description:
Great sushi in Tulcan !
10 piece-Rolls for 5-7$
Really nice place with artisanal beer, juices and wine. Small, not the most ventilated place but very nice sushi

name: General Mechanic
description:
Basic mechanics workshop, they made us change the springs, Rolo is a very friendly and helpful mechanic 

ESPANOL
un taller de mecánica básica, nos hicieron cambio de los muelles, el Rolo un mecánico muy amable y servicial

name: Don Jorge Mechanic
description:
Don Jorge and his son Juan José were very kind and diligent, after repairing the suspension, they allowed us to stay for the night in their workshop.
a highly recommended workshop for basic mechanics.

Don Jorge y su hijo  Juan José muy amables y diligentes, nos permitieron después de repararnos la suspensión quedarnos para pasar la noche en su taller.
un taller muy recomendado para mecánica básica.

name: Sport Stadium
description:
A place to spend the night, you can go hiking, sport fishing.
the town is very quiet, and with good supplies

ESPANOL
un lugar para pasar la noche, se puede realizar senderismo,pesca deportiva.
el pueblo muy tranquilo, y con buenos suministros para mercar.

name: Mirador El Ventiadero
description: Superb views - simple but delicious food - rooms situated between coffee tree farms- exceptional views to the Cauca River Canyon.

name: Rio Elemento Hostel w/ Camping
description:
Friends of mine were staying here in the dorms and when I arrived I saw that they had a nice and even parking lot. I asked if I could camp in it and they said yes. First two nights I payed the same price as a dorm but the two last nights I payed 40,000COP/night including breakfast. 

The place is super beautiful, check hostel world or google for pictures. The road up is okay in dry season for most vehicles but I think a big rig could have problems (low hanging wires and narrow between overhanging roofs) . Not far from the center so if you have a big rig just walk and make your own conclusions. I can also imagine it being more tricky with some rain (4x4 required). 

I recommend this place if you are traveling through minca :)

name: Medellin: Acondicionar GAS Todo en Inoxidable
description: a recomendable place for chrome steel welding. we are very satisfied. Wilfer is very helpful and a nice guy

name: Dentist
description:
Open in the afternoon Monday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday
Female dental surgeon. Very good
I had a big hole at the back of a front tooth, difficult job.

name: Mirador de Montegrande
description:
An amazing place to camp with a stunning view of the Sierra Nevada. 
They have a large area where you can easily put your tent or park your car/camping van. 
They also have a very nice waterfall -5min walk from the mirador-.


The mirador is 10km from the tradition Pueblo Bello -village of the indígena community of the Sierra-. 
The road to reach the Mirador and the village is in good condition (for motocycle, bike cycle or car/camping van). 
Pueblo Bello is still very traditional, has an active industry (the mochila is very famous) and very close to the authentical indígenas village (currently closed but should open again in January 2022). 

We paid 20.000 pesos per night for 2 for our tent. 

Rosa and Luis are a very friendly, chatty (in Spanish), helpful. 
They offer a number of services : beers, food, washing clothing ...

+573105097156 Rosa (spanish only) 

They plan to build up the place by putting kitchen, wifi, shower, billard... 
It's very nice !!

name: San Gil Parapente
description:
Translation: Live the experience of flying in one of the most incredible places in the world !! This is what they say when we contact them ... and I don't know if it is the best incredible of the world but it worth it !!!
200kCOP per flight with instructor (20 to 25 minutes of flight)
incredible experience for us

Vive la experiencia de volar en uno de los sitios mas increibles del Mundo !! 
this is what they say when we contact them ... and I don't know if it is the best incredible of the world but it worth it !!!
200kCOP per flight with instructor (20 to 25 minutes of flight)
incredible experience for us  

Contact of Laura from San Gil parapente 
+57 322 713 23 38

name: Ice cream shop
description: Best ice cream in town! Many different fruit flavors to choose from

name: Hotel del Parque
description:
Decent hotel with hot water, good WiFi and friendly staff. Located a stone's throw from the Plaza and in an interesting, lively little town.
Allowed to store bike in hallway. 30k Single traveller

name: Mirador El Encanto
description: A good spot to spend a night. It is upon Sámana River. Nice lookout

name: Bancolombia ATM
description: Two ATM machines in the square. Bancolombia charges 26k cop, the Agrario charges 16k cop, take your pick!

name: Hotel Restaurant Orence
description: Decent small hotel and restaurant, cold water, no wifi. 25k single person. could bring bike into room

name: Tractoservices del café sas
description:
Big rig mechanics. Big truck, semis tractor units professional simple service through to serious, complex repairs.
Three separate truck service businesses.
Ask for Juan, left hand corner at the back of the compound. Totally helpful, very experienced.
Recommended.
3104973197

name: Bosque antes del parque Guàtika
description: quiet and beautiful place, from where you can see the pueblo. --- lugar tranquilo y bonito, desde donde se ve el pueblo.

name: Hotel Boutique Mendoza
description:
Moto Friendly. This small hotel is just a few doors down from cargo rider and about 10’ drive or ride from the airport. Rooms are very nice, price is very competitive in the low $20s at time of writing and it has secure undercover parking for motos. free
Restaurants nearby and safe area.
I highly recommend this place as a first stop when clearing in or to prep for departure.

name: Ecolodge La buena Vida
description:
The Ecolodge La Buena Vida * has two sustainable cabins overlooking the valley of the sun located in Iza - Boyacá, a heritage town in Colombia
The privileged surroundings provide a relaxing atmosphere that favors contact with nature and wellness tourism experiences.
The cabins combine comfort and harmony with the environment, as they were built under bioconstruction and minimalism parameters to rest comfortably as a family and partner, while enjoying the enchanting landscape of Boyacá, each cabin has a king size bed, down laying, wifi, fireplace, kitchen, terrace, BBQ, parking, green areas ...
Info: 3133641428 - 3202226293

name: Al lado de la carretera Via a Chivata
description: Ample space to park, very quiet place with a beautiful view.

name: Camping spot in a good location next to the river.
description:
Camping spot in a good location next to the river. The infrastructure of the place is with bathroom, shower and energy.
It is possible to enjoy swimming pools with thermal water and also offer breakfast (I think it costs 2.5 USD)

Cost: 15,000 COP per person (4 USD)

How to get there: Before passing the entrance portal to the city (Road Cajamarca-Toche) there is a gate on the right side, if the gate is closed you can open it and follow the path to the farmhouse. The path is approximately 500 meters.

WiFi: There is no cell phone signal in the region, but the owners of the site have satellite internet, in case they need it.

name: Hospedaje Amanecer Llareno
description: This is a ‘Balneario’ with cheap rooms and a restaurant attached. Super friendly local hosts, happy to prepare us food or drinks, and serve by the pool, gave us a complementary limonada jug on arrival. 70k COP for two people per night, private bathroom. Secure parking. Family run and laid back. Two large clean swimming pools. I’d be surprised if they turned overlanders in vans away. Take Calle 7 to get here, last few kms is fairly narrow gravel. Can get loud at night however, dogs and rooster about.

name: Pozo El Pino
description:
A very beautiful simple campground, next to a natural pool and two amazing waterfalls.
The owners live on the premises  and sometimes put loud music on but not at night. If you are near the water you won’t hear it.
Owners are very nice, they charge COP $ 4000 entrance and $ 8000 pp/pn.
We recomend visiting during week days and off season.
Please contact Gerardo García at 3152758028. / 3154586873
They can cook for you if you ask in advance and sell beer/ soda and snacks.

name: Camping Requira El Molino
description:
Within 15’ walk or 2’ drive from the village Center this nice campground is perfectly located. The family is super friendly, the place is very nice, suitable for anything from tents to big rigs. Hot showers, power, kitchen undercover dining area… everything you might want. We pitched our tent in the shade of the little trees and slept better than in any Colombian hotel thus far.
Highly recommend, at times of writing price is COP 18,000 pp/pn

name: Bomba primax
description:
Translation:Good place to sleep, without danger, very safe, there is a bathroom, they do not charge, excellent option.

Buen lugar para dormir, sin peligro muy seguro, hay baño, no cobran, excelente opción.

name: Ciénaga
description: i'm travelling on bike,and I put my tent hère one nigth... quite ,alone, m'y and stars..and sea.....

name: Terpel Fuel Station
description:
Brand new fuel station, full range supermarket, bicycle shop, 24 hours cafe, super clean new washrooms, large parking area.
I paid the armed guard 20k cop and stayed four nights! Totally safe, easy walking to town square, Mirador, shops.

name: Restaurante los lagos
description:
It is a roadside restaurant, absolutely delicious, and cheap. You will find the typical food, I recommend to try the mondongo, sancocho, chorizo and empanadas.
And you will find a big parking area, grosieris and hotel

name: Portal de la cascada
description:
Just 10’ walk from center square this place offers a quiet, clean, comfortable place to stay while visiting Monguí. Also includes secure gated parking (undercover for motos) a kitchen and drinking water / coffee.
We paid COP 80,000 for a king bed with private bath, I believe shared bath is 70,000.
Highly recommend if you want value for money.

name: Colonial Altiko’s
description:
Best place in town, 70,000 for a queen bed, they let us park the motos in the little garage for the night.
It’s an ok place if splitting the trip from Monguí to El Cocuy (stunning ride, an must for anyone traveling 4x4 or on adv bikes, can be done with any vehicle but would be slow)
Owner of the hotel was super accommodating, village doesn’t have much to offer but it’s a resting place on an amazing road.

name: Mountain pass
description: Amazing road for anyone looking for views and solitude. It’s a dirt road but passable with most vehicles, ideal for ADV bikes and 4x4. If you really want to be blown away do the whole road (Monguí to El Cocuy via socota and Chita) it’s breathtaking! Options to wild camp along the way or small hotels in the pueblos.

name: roldanillo, parqueadero
description: safe parking lot. closed between 11pm and 4am. toilet very basic. 10'000 night/car.

name: Mirador Salto de Mico
description: Parked our van on the road next to the mirador Salto de Mico. The police said nothing would happen and they were right. Safe and overall quiet spot.

name: Mirador de la Sierra
description:
Small hostel with options to camp in either tent or van. The views are amazing and it’s very quiet at night. At 3500 meters the temps are fresh but not ridiculous, 
The owners of the place are very friendly and accommodating, we pitched our tent across the road in the paddock (less wind, better views) and were able to use their bathrooms in the restaurant.
We paid 15,000 for the 2 of us, our motos were parked in their car park… the serenity and vistas are second to none, probably one of the nicer places to wake up in!

name: Gran Plaza mall
description:
We spent 3 days. Just for parking from 8 am to 10 pm. Safe, toilet, water.

Hemos estado parqueados 3 días. Puedes parqueadero de 8 am a 10  pm. Seguro, baño, agua.

name: Plaza Major
description:
Decent restaurant with good food (no menu but they have several options) friendly staff,
24,000COP for the both of us…

name: Colibri Campestre
description:
Big open grass field at a restaurant, Big rig friendly, no height restriction, water toilet, quiet, crossing from Ecuador, first street right, to Ecuador direct before the border, left street, very recommended.

30k per night in a Van.

name: Balneario Oasis
description: On the street to the airport, fine level parking, secure, restaurant, 20k parking per night, big rig friendly

name: Parquadero
description: big parking behind a small bar, direct behind the beach, no height restrictions, could connect to electricity, calm at night, recommend

name: Hotel New York
description:
A Hospedaje around the corner was closed and a friendly local directed me here.
Decent hotel, decent wifi (in lobby), cold shower, fan in room. There's a big parking garage and a store room for my bike.
An "economical" room cost 30k for a single traveller.

name: Primax gas station
description:
Translation:It is a parking lot at the entrance of ipiales, we have stayed 4 nights, very safe. Free / free

Free and secure parking ( gas station ) es un parqueadero a la entradas de ipiales , nos hemos quedado 4 noches , muy seguro . Gratis / free

name: around thé river
description:
MODERATORS NOTICE:We could not confirm if this site is suitable for all types of vehicles.

Nice place quiet.i put my tent y middle of rover ..excellent nigth..

name: In river
description:
MODERATORS NOTICE:Not suitable for cars
ok place excellent one nigth ,tent. no car. is for bike....donne thé stars


una noche exelente lugar vecinos amigables en el río no para autos, para ciclo viajeros o mochileros.

name: Mirador Serranía los Santos
description:
A mirador with space for a handful of tents and a parking place for vehicles. There's no restaurant but they have snacks and cold drinks. 
The people are very friendly and the views are spectacular. Sitting atop a ridge there's a view to two valleys. Awesome.
There's a rough, steep road up to the parking places and from there a steepish walk to the viewing platform and tent camping area. Bloody hard work on a bike but worth it. 
There's WiFi at least while it's open) and bathrooms (with paper) and cold showers. Bring food and it's a great place to stay. The tent camping spot isn't exactly flat but the views compensate.
There's no security but local houses are close, people very friendly and I felt totally safe as a solo camper.
Cost for cyclist plus tent 10k.
Also listed on Google Maps

name: Alvarado
description: Nice place, close to river .. safe site, You can find clean water, Wood for fire and Nice people,  friendly.

name: Hotel Mirador Santana, Anserma
description: Modern hotel located in a small shopping mall. 30k for a single traveller including breakfast. Good Wifi. Warm shower. Bike stored in breakfast room - secure. Two flights of easy stairs

name: Clinizad lab PCR test
description:
The address is San Felipe, cra4, number 14-05 B./ San Felipe
GPS is very unreliable here, there is a military base near by jamming the signal.
I walked in, filled the forms, showed passport and 2x AZ vaccine vaccine proof.
160000cop

name: La Estancia Hotel Boutique
description:
Salamina, Colombia

We highly recommend La Estancia Hotel Botique for your stay in the area. We loved it so much we circled back to stay again!

Jamie and Patricia, the owners are native Colombians who lived in the United States for a long time.  They are bilingual.  A huge help for the gringos with very limited Spanish. Loving care was given to this 130-year-old house.  Restoration done keeping the original charm. 

They have eight rooms available, secure parking on site for motorcycles.  Breakfast is included. 

We were covered in mud the second time we came. Jamie arranged to have our bikes washed, the sole of my boot reglued, and everyone’s boots polished!

Each room has a private bathroom and on site laundry service is available. A dry sauna and a rooftop patio with hammocks await. Adult beverages await you at their private bar. 1.5 blocks from the plaza

Good wifi, good cell service

name: Xantico Hostal
description:
Clean, modern hostel with comfortable beds in the town center of Ipiales. Common kitchen and washing machines. Dorm beds are big and have lots of privacy. Hot showers. Dorm bed is $35,000 COL. 

Security guard at entrance helped push my motorcycle through the long entry hallway into the center common area for safe parking! Really nice people and a great find for the night before crossing into Ecuador.

name: Cocina Traditional
description: The best lunch we’ve had in ages. And this place is out in the boonies! This is the place to stop if your doing this dirt road. Served a hot soup on arrival, followed by a generous lunch portion, and refilling fresh juice.

name: Hotel Madre Selva
description: Very cool, airy hotel with a dedicated motorcycle parking. I paid about $20 for a none AC room but now I would recommend do get AC. Walkable to the town center. Super safe everywhere.

name: Via Ferrera
description:
If you like adventure, you have the right vehicle for it (4x4, small van or ADV bike) you owe it to yourself to take a trip down this ex-railway track… for those looking for YouTube content, this might get you some views!
I am not going to add any photos to this post, you just got to come and see!!! If you are scared of heights or not comfortable with sketchy roads, maybe best you pass! NO BIG RIGS  or anything wider that a land cruiser! Height restriction to be considered but anything under 3meters should be fine… enjoy!

name: La Estancia Hacienda Hotel Boutique
description:
Salamina, Colombia

We highly recommend La Estancia Hotel Botique for your stay in the area. We loved it so much we circled back to stay again!

Jaime and Patricia, the owners are native Colombians who lived in the United States for a long time.  They are bilingual.  A huge help for the gringos with very limited Spanish. Loving care was give to this 130 year old house.  A restoration done keeping the original charm. 

They have eight rooms available, secure parking on site for motorcycles.  Breakfast is included. 

We were covered in mud the second time we came. Jaime arrange to have our bikes washed, the sole of my boot reglued, and everyone’s boots polished!

Each room has a private bathroom and on site laundry service is available. A dry sauna and a rooftop patio with hammocks await. Adult beverages at their private bar. 1.5 blocks from the plaza.    Very clean!

name: ATM caja Davivienda in Sm Exito
description:
free ATM 2.000.000 cop possible may be more.
in the supermarket Exito. left side from banjos. NO FEE! red sign caja.

coordinates are from outside supermarket because our motorhome didn't fit in the parking area 

But don't accept the exchange rate. say no and you get a better one.

name: 574 Hotel
description: a smal nice hotel in a very good neighbourhood. rooms are small but very clean. The price-performance ratio is right. Good breakfast. and 5 minutes walking from the metro station Poblado.

name: Donde SAM
description:
Restaurant where you can get typical Mexican, Indian, Italian food.
We tried twice the Indian food and it is the  best outside of India. The Chef Sam is from Agra.
You  can't compare it with the normal food around in the other restaurants. Taste is much higher.

name: trinkingwater north of urbate
description: we slept at the terpel station with new toilets. in the south close to the fence and direct at the parqueadero there is a tape with water from the mountains. Best quality. at the other side you can buy cheas.

name: big free Parking lot at the mercado alternativo
description: it seems that from time to time there will be a mercado there. but at the edge of the town .

name: La casa de socorro
description: one of the better Restaurants in Cartagena with moderat prices. cazuela with lobster or shrimps are delicious. price about 45000 cop. At 12:00 a.m. you will get a table easy without reservation. don't come after 00:30 p.m. then you have to wait.

name: Parcerito's Hostel
description:
A beautiful hostel in the heart of the zona cafeteria, with prices ranging from COP 30 000 for a tent to 115 000 on weekdays for a large private with ensuite bathroom. Situated only 5 minutes by foot from the main town square of Jericó with a chill environment, a lovely garden, free breakfast, super fast wi-fi and shared spaces. Kitchen on site and outdoor lounge area. Hot water (electric heater).  Can be seen on Booking, Hostelworld and Google Maps.
Secure parking for a few motos,  bikes, or one SUV.
Parcerito's Hostel 
+57 3194554129

name: End of pavement
description: This road connection Malaga to Curos in only paved (more or less) for the 1st 20 or so kms on either end… it’s also paved between Guaca and San Andrew and then in a few random areas with paved sections ranging a few hounded meters to maybe 1.5 kms. The rest, yeah, nah… not so much! Mostly dust / gravel / rock with some less than comfortable sections. Lots of narrow sections too and of course the odd truck / bus (yes full size ones!) taking up the whole road with complete disregard to other road users. No 4x4 required but decent suspension helps! Allow at least 4 hours to make the trip. The views are amazing though!!!

name: La Tapa
description:
Probably one of the better place we have eaten at in the “off the beaten path” pueblos of Colombia! Nice restaurant, quite upmarket for a non-touristy place, our burgers were delicious (sooooo many options to chose from!) reasonable prices from 15k to 20k.
Glad we found this place!

name: Hotel Casa Campestre La Cascada
description:
This beautiful old hotel can host up to 35 people. Delightful balconies, gardens and seating areas. 

The water falls with swimming holes below the falls are right out side their gates. 

There is a restaurant on site. We had the best fish we have had on this trip tonight. Francisco and his sister Gabriella run the hotel and speak good English. 

Great value for what we received. 

Huge property behind a locked gare. We paid 220,000 pesos for one bed two people. That price included two meals for two people. You can choose breakfast and dinner or breakfast and lunch. 

I contacted them through what’sapp. +57 311 6172522

name: Mandala
description: Nice little coffee / lunch spot. Didn’t have much in the ways of breakfast but lots of good coffee options, juices etc…

name: Hostal Las Flores
description: Convenient, cheap hotel close to the centre, 60,000COP p night for two of us. Large rooms. Set up more like a hotel, private bathrooms etc but there is a small kitchen you can use and full sized fridge. Large gated parking next door, no height restrictions. Abit loud at night as your right next to a main road.

name: Alternative road
description:
We were suggested this alternate (shorter) route as an option instead of the 55.
Standard dirt road not worse than others ;-). Pretty narrow but, hardly anyone on it and the views are AMAZING! Glad we took it, we had a lot of fun. If you are with a 4x4 or decent truck and especially with an ADV moto, you should definitely consider this road.

name: La Pacha Eco-Glamping
description: An ecological and affordable glamping hostel with yurts, hobbit house and geodesic domes plus campsite with plenty of parking space and electricity. Run by lovely Anglo Colombian family on their 4 acre organic farm. It has panoramic views, a natural swimming pool, Indian and vegetarian restaurant (amazing food) , campfires, a movie bus (!) and lots of spaces to chill out. 2 hour walk to Barichara or San Gil, 20 mins by car. Heaven!

name: Pozo Azul
description: Beautiful swimming spot in a rocky mountain stream, not very flat but with various spaces for camping in 4-man tent. Popular with locals at weekends but should have the place to yourself by 6pm. Two minute walk from the tarmac road and a small museum, where you can park a car overnight or mid-size camper.
