Phone Don Jairo the owner +57 311 8488524.He will arrange for someone to let you in. He charged us $5.000 to park the car overnight but we also gave a donation to the museum. Campervan stay with access to museum and toilets costs $15.000 per person  negotiable.

name: Cascada El Tigre
description: Beautiful waterfall right off the road, maybe a two minute walk. If it’s hot enough it would be a good swimming hole but too cold for us. Nice stop on the way to the hot spring!

name: Hotel Mision Santa Bárbara
description:
The first hotel in BarichAra. A beautiful old home restored to an old hotel. Pool, HOT WATER!, breakfast included secure parking for many motorcycles or cars. Close to the square. 
+57 313 423 1129
Www. Hotelmisionsantabarbara.com

name: Dubai moto racing
description: The only place we found that had batteries for large motos… there  are a number of other shops around that sell various parts for local style motos (lights, plugs oils etc…)

name: Hostal Villa Flores
description: Hotel in a tiny town of Santiago along the river, 80,000COP for a double room p night(2people). Large room. Big courtyard with a swimming pool in the middle, meals available  if you ask. Gated parking lot around the back. We broke down on the side of the road and this was the closest thing, lucky the hosts are friendly and they had space. A bit expensive for what it is but it’s the only choice around.

name: Terranat restaurante
description: Wonderful food. Beef stroganoff and baby beef were excellent. Baby beef was cooked perfect medium. East to cut and flavorful!  We would come  back

name: Finca Frecuencia
description:
Amazing place amidst Mountains and Cloud Forest. We stayed in a Bamboo House which was spectacular - hammocks, nice beds with mosquito nets, unbelievable terasse from which you got a superb view & there is even a fantastic temple to medidate, do yoga and calm down (also made of bamboo).
Food and stuff great as well.

Plan some time here, you will for sure love it!

name: Kutú Panaderia
description: Bakery run by a very nice young couple who offers ball or baguette bread made with different flours. It also offers various desserts including black brioches stuffed with candied fruit and really good caramel sauce.

name: Hostal Espiñolete
description:
Lovely little hostel run by Danielle, the frendliest and most helpful colombian we met in out 4 weeks colombia trip. 

Hostel has everything you need such as kitchen, air-con, fans, free water, good bathrooms. For some extra comfort take the 4-bed family room. Location is also nice, in a quiet street, not far off the city center. 

Hostel has a 9+ rating on booking and i can highly recommend it.

name: Free showers at “Club Nautico Colsubsidio”
description:
Walk through the “club nautico de Colsubsidio” as if you were going to rent a boat, there are two bathrooms both with free showers! Also the bathrooms are very clean 

Camina por el club nautico de Colsubsidio hasta dónde se rentan los botes, allí hay baños con duchas gratis. También los baños son bastante limpios. 

Km 1 vía lago sochagota, club náutico Colsubsidio

name: Hotel Abadías
description: Wonder clean big hotel close to the square with a huge private parkadero. Breakfast included. Very helpful staff. Hot water

name: Allí no más
description: A really excellent breakfast spot run by two sisters and their daughter. I ate here several times. Breakfast includes a pour over coffee, house made yogurt and fresh fruit as well as a breakfast entree of your choosing. The pancakes are delicious and wonderfully presented.

name: CJS Automotriz-Mechanic
description:
Big place that fixes all types of cars and trucks.
Julian the owner is a nice guy and also an engineer.
Our Kia Sportage 2000 diésel, broke the engine, and here we were very welcome. They searched for spare parts. 
The place is always full. Have patience. 
Good place to solve your mechanical problems.

name: Casa Hotel La Mansión
description: Great hotel close to the hospital with air conditioning, a pool, their private parking across the street and breakfast included. We paid 100k for two people one bed in a huge room. The pool was clean and a nice way to end a day of motorcycle riding!

name: Green hostal Popayan
description:
We are the first "overlander with motorhome » clients on the Green Hostal Popayan.
As indicated in the name, this is firstly an hostel with 5 rooms (from 2 to 5 persons) but it could be also a place for 1 or 2 motorhomes.
It could be difficult for big rigs to turn around but feasible because we did it with a trailer. 

Located 15’ road from Popayan in a Finca that the owners (a family) will make you discover surrounded by the sound of the nature. 
Excellent communication with the owner, it is a pleasure to stay here. 

All commodities are present for you to have an excellent stay including a restaurant and breakfast. 
Very good place to visit Popayan and the area. 

Telephone number Sofia (Spanish / English speaking)
+57 319 3970 062

Instagram for more pictures 
@greenhostalpopayan

name: Clinizad Laboratorio, Ipiales
description:
this is the right locacion to get your PCR-Test:
Clinizad Laboratorio de Especialidades
open mo to fr 07am-06pm/
sa  08am-12am/su closed
165'000k 
fast, serious, very good
get the PCR-proof inbetween 24hrs if you are there early

name: Clinizad Laboratory in Ipiales - Great Covid 19 PCR test center
description:
If you need to get a Covid 19 PCR test to cross the border into Ecuador, this is the only private laboratory in Ipiales. 165.000 Cops per person. Results per email within 24 hours. Paperwork before the swab takes about an hour. Bring passport and vaccination pass. There are 2 test centers in the same street. Very friendly staff.
If you travel in a motorhome or van it's hard to park in front here - it's a narrow oneway street. We found a large parking garage just around the corner (see separate iOverlander place)

name: Ipiales - Large indoor parking garage to do PCR test at Clinizad
description:
We needed to do a PCR test around the corner at Clinizad and because the streets are narrow here and it's hard to park a van, we went to this large parking garage. Nice staff. Safe parking. 2000 Cops/hour. The entry door is really big and you have to park in the back, otherwise the parking spaces in the front will be blocked (see photo). 
If you can't fit in here, there is another open parqueadero one block further to the east on the left hand side.

name: Migraciones - Cartagena
description:
You are certainly going to use this place.
Make any appointment before through internet..
In Covid times, you need a Sita. Appointment.
We just made the extention of our Visas.
Cost: P$ 105.000,00(U$ 27,00) for extra 3 months.
We needed to make it because our car had mechanical problems and are now fixing it.
The staff here is very kind and very helpful.
You can prepare your extention through internet and come here only to pick up your documents and pay.

name: estacionamiento
description: large secure parking for trucks, very large space, close to shops, noisy, people are very nice.  the bus passes in front for the center of Santa Marta.  very practical with a big rig.  5000 Cop for the night and 10000 for 24 hours

name: Casa Tara
description:
I stayed 10 days here, Andres was very friendly and allowed me to stay with my pet in a room with walking path to the garden (Very convenient for my dog). They cleaned the room every day. My pet waited in the house while I was outside during my scuba diving sessions. I payed $46000 per night. Single room with bathroom. Kitchen, living room and garden. Is 4 blocks to the beach. 

Andrés mobile +57 (316) 574-4227

name: Juan Sebastián Hotel
description: Really glad I found this hotel! Secure, private parking garage, wonderfully hot showers, comfortable bed, clean rooms, decent wifi, walking distance to central Pasto, yet in a quiet area near the river. I paid 85,000COP including parking and breakfast.

name: Casa Gregorio
description:
Casa Gregorio is run by the Dutch Heike her husband José and his family. This is the place where you should be for a unique jungle experience with and by local people. The accommodation is located in the San Martin de Amacayacu community. There are workshops and tours to book and Heike is a great hostess. She speaks Dutch, Spanish and English. The only way to come here is by boat via Leticia. If you make a booking you get a very clear description how you can come.
The contact for the accomodation is:
casagregorio@outlook.com
www.casagregoriolodge.com

name: Restaurante La Cabaña
description: Popular lunch spot for locals for delicious inexpensive food. They have 4 or 5 plate choices, with soup and a juice for 7,500COP. Tables upstairs too.

name: Sucre ( calle cerrada)
description:
Translation:Sucre is a town that is not usually very touristy but it is beautiful. It is a quiet place to spend a couple of days. We stayed three nights in this place, it's safe, the people are friendly and we didn't have any problems. if you come from the West do not stop coming to this place. Nearby you have the "El Salto" waterfall, a place to cool off.

Sucre es un pueblo que no suele ser muy turístico pero que es hermoso. Es un lugar tranquilo para pasar un par de días. Nosotros estuvimos tres noches en este lugar, es seguro, la gente es amable y no tuvimos ningún problema. si vienes por el Occidente no dejes de venir a este lugar. Muy cerca tienes la cascada "El Salto" sitio para refrescarse.

name: La Catedral Café
description: Wonderful coffee! Baked goods and food also looked tasty. Incredible garden out back with tables, very nice ambience throughout the cafe. Great service. Only wish I had found this place sooner, it is a sanctuary in the city. Since it is old town area, there is no parking, better to walk to it or find a parking garage nearby.

name: Parking Santa Fe
description:
Big parking lot, accomodating all sorts of RV.
Paid 25 000 cop for 24 hours. Quiet a night, eventhough some buses or trucks leave eraly in the morning.
Within walking distance to town center.
Had  a carafon of agua purificada delivered to our camper from supermaket ( the guardian requested it for us).
Don't try to go to town center with your rig !

name: Reserva Meremberg
description: Nice nature reserve to visit with waterfall and native forest.They have rooms to rent.

name: La Cafetera Hospedaje
description:
Cheap, cheerful, ground floor access a couple of blocks from the Plaza. Single traveller 20k for shared bathroom, 30k private. Allowed take bike into room. Very weak wifi. No.parking as far as I know and you wouldn't want to park on the street.
Cold showers but clean and very friendly hostess

name: Restaurante Marianza
description:
Translation:Don Ivan allowed us to park in the restaurant's parking lot. It is a very safe and quiet place next to the road. You have access to bathrooms which is very important.

Don Ivan nos permitió estacionar en el parqueadero del Restaurante. Es un lugar al lado del camino muy seguro y tranquilo. tienes acceso que baños lo cual es muy importante.

name: Mesón de la Tatacoa
description: Established campground and restaurant on the quiet north road. Friendly owner, were quoted 20k pp to camp inc. use of the pool. May be able to negotiate down if don’t use pool. Small but packed fossil museum, included if camping, 5k pp if not. We had lunch there for around 20k pp (soup, large main, lemonades) but carried on to another place because there was virtually no shade options for tent camping. Valle de las Constelaciones was closed on this day.

name: isaza
description:
Translation:We stayed next to the police station, Commander Omar, who was very attentive and helpful, gave us water and guided us around the area. a very quiet night.

nos quedamos al lado de la estación de policía, el comandante Omar muy atento y servicial nos regaló agua y nos orientó por la zona. una noche muy tranquila.

name: laguna San Diego
description:
Translation:a quiet place to spend the night, the parking lot is not very flat, there is a restaurant and a hotel.
You can take the tour of the lagoon by boat to reach some hot springs with little hot water. The boy's name is Jorge, super formal, he sold us fresh fish for 10,000 kg Cop. Parking costs 10,000 Cop per night.
We arrived at the hot spring by a path that goes around the lagoon.
4x4 vehicles or tall cars enter as you have to go through some difficult sections.

un lugar tranquilo para pasar la noche , el parqueadero no es muy plano, hay restaurante y hotel.
puedes hacer el recorrido por la laguna en lancha para llegar a unos termales de agua poco caliente. el Chico se llama Jorge súper formal nos vendió pescado fresco en 10.000kg Cop.el estacionamiento cuesta 10000 Cop noche.
nosotros hicimos la llegada al termal por un sendero que le da la vuelta a la laguna.
entran vehículos 4x4 o carros altos ya que hay que pasar unos tramos difíciles.

name: Palmar Plaza
description: beautiful village between Socorro and Galan.  very peaceful and quiet during the week.  Sunday can be a bit busy during the day, but everyone leaves.  two restaurants nearby.  The plaza has the biggest tree we've ever seen.... absolutely picturesque.  Police are on the plaza and gave us permission to spend the night.  very safe and even worth a pass through if not stopping for the night.

name: Hotel Morfeo
description: Simple, very clean hotel a couple of blocks from the Plaza with ample ground floor parking for bikes & motos - other vehicles get free use of nearby parquedero. Poor wifi and cold showers. 31500 for solo traveller

name: Restaurante Campestre San Vincente
description: Just at the beginning of the road down to Laguna de la Cocha. Big flat area. Gigantic rigs could park here if they can pass the wooden bridge. Restaurant closes at 6:30pm. In the back of the building is another toilet and shower. Beware of „perros bravos“! This place has something very unique. The owner provides cages to „lock up“ your beloved pet, so it does not get torn into pieces by his dogs (NO joke). It is very quiet here and you get a nice view of the lake and the mountain range. Price was 20k pp.

name: San Geronimo
description: Swimming pool, possibilty to camp with tent on site or with your car in the parking lot.Loud music on Sunday at the pool amd from a Bar near by until 12pm. 5000 pesos per person for pool and use of the banos and showers in the camping area (clean).

name: Hotel Jacinto Plaza
description: Very decent place, ground floor access, store room for a bike, parking next door. 40k single traveller, cold water, fan, excellent WiFi

name: Casona Tabecal
description:
Very quaint hotel with eclectic decorations and relaxing shared space. Host is very attentive.  May need to call when you arrive in town.  Luz Dairi at 3108613184. Rooms are 70 for fan and 80 for A/C.  Mattresses
 hard but we had a good night. we couldn't find the other posada...

name: Cepita Municipal Pool
description: refreshing dip when it's 33degrees out!  Best of all...3pesos!!  Beautiful cabanas (shared).

name: Alto de Aguacate
description: More burial caves, not quite as colourful and elaborate as the ones in Alto de Segovia but the view on the hike getting here make up for it. Well worth it.

name: Hospedaje Mi Casita
description: Family run hospedaje just a few metres from the park entrance. They have rooms with private bath, shared bath, and family rooms. Private room for the two of us was 50,000p night. Breakfast 8,000 pp, inc coffee and juice. Small rooms but clean, hot water shower, plenty of blankets. Parking space for a few vehicles, height restriction(see photo). They were very kind, did our washing for 12k, nice backyard with lots of plants, small cooking area and table we could use. Overall nice experience here for several days while hiking the surrounding trials.

name: Hotel Las Garzas
description: Roadside hotel on the outskirts of Sibundoy. Surprisingly lovely (although dusty) rooms, with wifi and hot showers for 50,000 COP. Also there is a water heater/cooler available, great for filling your thermos with hot tea. I was the only one staying here on a Saturday night! Plenty of parking, friendly staff.

name: Gasolinera Terpel
description:
Gas station, three water faucets available. Good price of gasoline.

Estación de gasolina, tres llaves de agua disponible. Buen precio de la gasolina.

name: La Guaca Hostel
description:
Nice hostel with good dorms and secure parking for motos. 35.000COP for dorm, breakfast included. Nice kitchen, AC in dorms, comfy beds with privacy curtains, cold shower but you don't need a warm one in Santa Marta. Dorms also have huge closets for lockers instead your typical tiny one that can barely fit your helmet. I was able to lock away both panniers and my tail bag and hang up my riding jacket.

Great staff and clean and secure. not the cheapest in town but a great deal for what you get. private rooms as well but not sure on the price.

name: Quinta Av lavanderia
description: lavenderria very close to the Macarena car park, price by weight, work done during the day, very well inventoried, washed, folded and packed.  we paid 50,000 cop for 6.5 kg of laundry.  (next door, there is a very good panaderia)

name: Mirador del Diamante
description:
This is a great place during the week and it gets a little busy during weekends. We had it all to ourselves on a Tuesday night. It has cold showers, good bathrooms, you can buy firewood for a few dollars, charcoal, they have a grill and you can have a fire on the ground. Also sell beer and snacks. The ground keeper is a really nice guy who lives close buy so if you need anything just ring the owner and this chap will appear. We will be going back soon.

Whatsapp contact: +57 300 5878282 to let them know you are coming so you don't have to find the caretakers on their nearby farm.

name: Trucker pull off
description: Very large dirt parking lot behind a couple of homes and a restaurant on the main road. Semi-trucks park here though it was not very full the night we stayed. No public restroom. Some hotels around, too. Big rigs, easily. Tents, possibly (depends if you’re comfortable with the semi-trucks). Pleasant view. Roadside noise. Simple and works for a night if you run out of daylight!

name: Laguna del Cacique Guatavita
description: Stayed in the parking lot at the laguna’s entrance. Asked for permission from the night guard and all was well! Level and good for one night. Wifi and restrooms available at the admissions. Wifi connection is spotty at best from the parking lot.

name: Laguna del Cacique Guatavita
description: Entrance to the historically sacred Laguna. You must go with a guide - short walk to the Laguna. Closed on Mondays

name: Deep ruts
description: Some deep ruts in this section. Nothing impassable currently, but worth a mention for those anticipating a drive along this road! 2wd just fine. High clearance would make it easy, but an average van will be fine. Stunning views!!

name: FABRIEXOSTOS J.V.
description:
Translation:Parking and mechanical and welding workshop. friendly and hospitable. It has water and a rustic bathroom.

Parqueadero y taller mecánico y de soldadura. amigables y hospitalarios. Tiene agua y baño rústico.

name: Estación de servicio terpel
description:
We stayed one night. We slept very well and it is very quiet. In the morning there is some movement because it is a bus parking lot so the drivers arrive to report their route. But it is very quiet. There is a bathroom, they can carry water and gasoline. It is a completely free place, just talk to the administrator and he will give you the authorization.
----------------
Nos quedamos una noche. Dormimos muy bien y es muy tranquilo. En la mañana hay algo de movimiento porque es un parqueadero de buses así que los conductores llegan a reportar su ruta. Pero es muy tranquilo. Hay baño, pueden cargar agua y gasolina. Es un lugar completamente gratis, basta con hablar con el administrador y el te dará la autorización.

name: Quebrada La Elsa
description: Sweet 2 tier waterfall, could be busy on the weekends but on a Tuesday we had the place to ourselves… stopped for a picnic lunch, option for a refreshing shower

name: Restaurante La Delicia
description: Restaurant with rooms upstairs. Basic, not the cleanest but for cold, wet cyclists a good hot shower!! No wifi, no parking. My bike overnighted in the restaurant. 30k single traveller

name: Sendero la sirena
description:
La Sirena is quite a spectacular place to go for a swim, not really because of the waterfall itself but more because of the surrounding forest. It’s in a deep slot canyon lush trees and vegetation, butterflies, birds… i think it was worth the trip up and the COP 10,000 for the guide which you get from the nearby tienda (you can probably make it without one if no one sees you but for the sake of helping the local economy a bit… $2.5 isn’t going to break the bank!)
Things to know before you go:
It’s a wet hike, you’ll have to cross the river a couple of times and it’s deep enough to get wet to your neck (and I am 2 meters / 6’7”) they didn’t mention that so didn’t bring a drybag… made it happen but best to know! You’ll definitely want decent shoes as it’s rocky, wet, slippery all those things…
Also, access to the village, as marked by my partner along the road, there is no access from the Buenaventura side passed aguaclara (road collapsed / no maintenance) and the road from the east side has partially collapsed 3 kms from El Danubio only allowing pedestrians and motos through. The locals are hoping for the government to fix the road but I have the feeling the rest will collapse long before there is any repairs being done!
Anyway, the ride down here is pretty spectacular and for that alone we are glad we came. Shame we couldn’t carry on as planned all the way to Buenaventura.

name: Ipiales: Road to the border
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: WARNING! Theft reported in this location. Please use caution.

Attacked by four guys, pulled off bike and phone stolen. This was in broad daylight, about 5pm with slow moving traffic alongside. Nobody stopped to help, during or after.
All they wanted was the phone. 
(Trying to access online accounts on a new phone is frustrating! Think about proper backups separate to your phone!!)

name: Hotel Real Centro
description: Clean rooms, cold water showers, no WiFi, 40'000 COP. Talk to Hotel Los Almendros in other part of town for contact.

name: Machine shop
description:
Small shop but very capable guys. We sheared a bolt on our pannier rack and they got it out within 10 minutes perfectly done. I am not easily impressed but these guy impressed me! They have drill press, lathe, welding equipment…
Across the road is a shop that sells all sorts of nuts and bolts in metric and footric, picked up the new bolt right there. Very successful morning!

name: Bendito Rancho
description:
A very cozy place near Buga, with a delicious restaurant and beautiful little houses to rest by the river, where you can also see sloths.
They are adapting the place for campers and camping area.
The price per cabin is 200,000 pesos for a couple with breakfast included and some have a jacuzzi!

You can trek to the Miraculous Waterfall and different places!
The owner, Juan David is very friendly and very nice! Definitely worth a stop! Highly recommended!

--

Un lugar muy acogedor cerca de Buga, con un delicioso restaurante y casitas hermosas para descansar al lado del río, donde además se pueden ver osos perezosos.
Están adecuando el lugar para campers y zona de camping.
El precio por cabaña es de 200.000 pesos la pareja con  desayuno incluido y algunas tiene  jacuzzi! 
Se pueden hacer trekings hasta la Cascada del Milagroso y distintos lugares! 
El dueño , Juan David es muy amable y muy simpático! sin duda merece la pena hacer una parada!muy recomendable !

name: Hostal Café  Aquí me quedo
description:
The hostel is a beautiful place where they are super colorful and very cozy! They serve delicious slushies and coffees, with sweets made daily and delicious cookies! It is open from Friday afternoon to Sunday! if you want to book the owner is called Amparo, very friendly, her phone is +5316 347 2835 Super recommended to visit and have a delicious coffee!
.....
El hostel es un lugar hermoso donde los hay! Súper colorido y muy acogedor!
Sirven deliciosos granizados y cafés,  con dulces hechos a diario y deliciosas galletas! 
Está abierto de viernes en la tarde a domingo! si quieren reservar la dueña se llama Amparo, muy amable, su teléfono es el +5316 347 2835 Súper recomendable visitar y tomar un delicioso café!

name: punto de servicio la pintada
description:
It is a quiet place and trucks stop to spend the night. They have water, bathrooms, dining room, parking lots, they still don't have showers but they will add them in the future. A very complete place.
------
E Sun lugar tranquilos y paran camiones a pasar la noche. Tienen agua, baños, comedor, estacionamientos, aun no tienen duchas pero a futuro las pondrán. Un lugar muy completo.

name: Pipe & Maguie's house
description:
Pipe and Maguie are a couple who are about to travel and they welcomed us into their home... They have a safe place to park, offer their Wi-Fi, water and washing machine in exchange for good vibes and good anecdotes... Please contact them before to arrive... IG: @vivirparacontarlaco.  Phone Pipe (whatsapp only) +573014648792
.....
Pipe y Maguie son una pareja que están próximos a viajar y nos recibieron en su casa... Tienen lugar seguro para parquear, ofrece su wifi, agua y lavadora a cambio de buena vibra y buenas anécdotas... Por favor comunicarse con ellos antes de llegar... IG: @vivirparacontarlaco. Tel Pipe (solo whatsapp) +573014648792

name: Los Hermanos restaurant & hotel
description: The best Sancocho (chicken soup) I had so far in Colombia. It was a nice stop for lunch long drive from north to south. They also have rooms with AC, they were really nice so if you ask them maybe let you sleep on their parking lot.

name: La Sazón de Rosita
description: Wonderful lunch served by a friendly grandma. Fish, chicken, beef, and mutton (regional specialty). One of the best meat dishes we’ve had here in Colombia so far.

name: Cascade de cocorá / Lumbre
description: Not worth the effort in our opinion! They charge COP 15k per person (extortion) the trails are poorly maintained, lots of very low branches, fallen trees across the trails, we never made it to the big fall as the trail was impassable due to downed tree, the vista point shelter was full of cow dung… we hid from there rain in there treading poop… we spoke to the hotel staff about it but they really didn’t seem to care. No refund not even partial! I have no doubt there are much better waterfalls around.

name: parque principal
description:
a quiet place to spend the night, you find shops, restaurants and hotels.
the people is so kind --- un lugar tranquilo para pasar la noche, encuentras tiendas, restaurantes y hoteles.
la gente es muy amable

name: Exito Pastro
description: very large area ideal for shopping before or after the equator.  you can park easily with a big rig on the Pan-American side.

name: Finca hotel la Manuela
description:
A perfect place for a pleasant stay. The owners Sergio and Luz Ma are very kind people, you can talk to them to arrange the price.
located next to the sea, near the mud volcano and with all the facilities for your car. Highly recommended.
---
Un lugar perfecto para una agradable estancia. Los dueños Sergio y Luz Ma son personas muy amables, puedes hablar con ellos para concertar el precio. 
ubicado al lado del mar, cerca al volcán de lodo y con todas las facilidades para tu carro. Altamente recomendado.

name: Almacén juancho fibras
description:
We just got our motorcycles back from the boat ride provided by the stalhratte. 30kms out of Turbo one of our motos breaks down. 

Thankfully it’s right in front of this place that assists us in sussing out the issue. At first we thought water was in the fuel line, now we see it’s an electronic issue involving the fuel line. 

These guys were very nice but we also had others from the local moto community reach out and tell us this is not a safe area for tourists. So far everything seems ok but we hope the issue is resolved soon so we can continue on our way. 

These are good folks but be weary in this area. If possible try to make it up to Necocli.

name: Restaurant parking
description:
A very quiet place to spend the night, there is a restaurant with a shop.
They gave us water.
Free parking.

un lugar muy tranquilo para pasar la noche, hay un restaurante con tienda.
nos regalaron agua.
Gratis el estacionamiento.

name: Hotel San Cristobal
description: Hotel on the port by the river.  Entrance is on the river front.  Parking for 2 motorcycles in their laundry room.  Great place to stay after the long dirt road from Guatape.  We payed 40k for a triple room.

name: Dantayaco Ecotourism
description: Pulled into this place with our fingers crossed for a campsite! The workers/family were kind... offered us great parking for 5 nights. Showers, flushing toilets, restaurant onsite that is open for dinner. Parking was level. No problem for our 22' long and 10' high sprinter. Room for 2 or maybe 3 vans. Wifi ALMOST reached the van, but you would likely need to go to the sitting area  We were not charged any money, but we ate at the restaurant multiple times and we paid for staff to do our laundry.... and we tipped the staff as we left. The FUN FUN FUN part of this place is the monkeys that come to visit! Maybe 30 squirrel monkeys come to the trees right by the sitting area! Several waterfall hikes within walking distance!

name: Piscina Naturales
description: Piscina Naturales.A pleasant place with 4 little pools just off the road. In a very natural setting but the terraces of the pools are man made . Still a nice spot. No one there when I visited I guess it may get busy at weekends

name: Donde doña Gloria
description:
Mrs. Gloria allowed us to spend a few days in her patio.  You must come and arrange with her the stay and the payment of her.  It is a great place to spend a few days in the Port.  It is close to the pier and the beaches.  Mrs. Gloria and her family are extremely kind. 

————————————————————————————

La señora Gloria nos permitió pasar unos días en su patio. Debes venir y concertar con ella la estadía y el pago. Es un sitio genial para pasar unos días en el Puerto. Está cerca al muelle y las playas. La señora Gloria y su familia son supremamente amables.

name: Mirador Laguna Otùn
description:
I will give some facts to help decide if you want to come up here, but first let me say, we are glad we came… just a few things to know:

1/ The road to get up here is not smooth or relaxing! We did in on motos but no doubt in a 4x4 camper or truck you’ll get bounced around… it’s not challenging just 40 kms of rough get tiring after a while.

Like I said, glad we came, we spent 2 nights at the restaurant / soon to be hotel camping in one of there rooms.

2/ you have to leave your vehicle at the ranger station and from there it’s a 5.5km walk to the base of the mirador hill. It’s not an exciting or particularly scenic walk. It’s an all beat up access road, slippery in certain section when it rains, lots of lose pebble type rocks, not particularly pleasant, and that 11ams return!

3/ the hike up to the mirador is steep and you are at 4000 meters. The view however (if the weather plays nice) is stunning! But in my opinion the mirrador views alone don’t warrant the 11kms hike HOWEVER… if you have a few more kms left in you and you want to get adventurous there are some amazing trails up here (see photos) we ended up hiking a total of 17kms and 6 of those made it worth while. The trails aren’t super obvious or marked but, with a gps or a decent app on your phone you can do great things here!

4/ the weather… it all hinges on the weather. Most mornings are clear from sunrise to about 9:30 then the fog rolls in and well, there goes your lake views! And then around mid day we got rain. Talking to the locals that seems to be the trend (at least for the last 2 years) we started our hike at 0700 and headed back when it started to rain around 12:30… back at camp by 14:00.
So yeah, plan on going early which means, either start driving up at about 3:30am or sleeping up here (which we did) but consider temps at night are close to or just below freezing. There is only one sleeping option up here right now (see other post)

That’s about the extent of its, it’s a shame that 1- access road is so beat up and 2 that you can’t drive to the lake and start hiking from there (where it gets really good) walking 11 kms to get to the start of a good hiking spot with about 7 hours of decent weather window seems a bit of a waste but, doesn’t seem that park people have much interest in it all… shame really.
Also, no shelter, the mirador itself is falling apart (probably shouldn’t go up it) and when it starts to rain, it gets cold real quick so plan for all seasons up here!

name: Hotel Dulces Sueños
description:
Cheap, convenient hotel 5 blocks from main square, gated parking for at least 8 cars on ground floor of building, so height restriction to get in.
Paid 60,000 for a double room, (2 people) private bathroom, hot water.

name: Casa Campo Emaus
description:
Sofie and her husband David welcomed us on their enormous property.
There's a natural pond where you can fish, small hiking trails through the woods, an exterior bath, a very nice gym, a football field, exterior kitchen and bathrooms, mango trees among other fruit trees are scattered along the garden.
They recently opened this place up as a hotel, it used to be their vacation home, so there are room upgrades.
It's all gated, it's gotta be a couple of hectars easily. There's two entries, one which has a sign hanging at about 2.45m, the other is big rig friendly.
Located 500m from the main road, 6km from Caucasia center, perfect for overlanders.
Bonus, star gazing is well nice.
It's a very nice place.

name: Camping Oasis del roble
description: Excellent camping area very close to Villa de Leyva. Very friendly staff and very clean facilities. Easy access and space for large and small campers. It has electrical points, bathrooms and shower.

name: Lavandería
description:
Monday - Friday: open all day
Saturday: only open in the morning

name: Forest
description: The rarest of places, a quiet spot in Colombia. Completely surrounded by forest, with some nice little walks, perfect for dogs. Minimal cell service. Flat parking, not too much waste. 2800m, so chilly nights. The first bit is narrow, you need to push through (I managed with 2m35) then take the right track for a steep little climb. I would say 4x4, but I've seen people do more challenging stuff with a standard van. Some other camp spots available without the climb.

name: Barba blanca
description: In San Basilio de Palenque, Barba Blanca is such a nice guy with his own house with a big backyard. Barba Blanca make you instantly feel like part of town and can tell you everything about it. He can cook for you, give you a mattress or a hammock or just give you your space in the backyard. I really appreciate this guy.

name: Replica El Peñol sank town
description: Nice replica of the original town El Peñol that was sank

name: Tony's Spot
description:
This one is on the ring road around the Tatacoa desert. Having seen all of the other ioverlander places, I settled for this place. On a cliff, so maximum wind for cooling. Almost no traffic, although right next to the road, still very quiet. The nicest place I think is a bit further in the valley of constellations, but, this spot has fast internet! (only area in Tatacoa with Claro reception) 
Coming from the west, no problem with 2wd. Coming from the east there's a few muddy little river crossings, may be difficult after the rain.

name: Hotel Le Biciclette
description: New, very comfortable rooms and secure parking for my motorcycle and many cars. Not sure if clearance allows for vans, certainly not big rigs. Hot water, bteakfast included. No AC or fan, but not needed at this altitude. Restaurant on the 2nd floor. Grocery store nearby. 40km from El Peñol rock and Guatape. Roberto and Rita are awesome hosts.

name: Casadulce
description: Super yummy tropical fruits cakes! (Maracuya, guanabana, uchuva etc)They are not too sweet and perfect for a little coffee break after walking in the town.

name: Finca Integral Suelo Nativo
description: Finca Integral is very close to the historical municipality of Guaduas, on the national Highway Villeta-Guaduas/ RN 50-08.  We have a beautiful view  over the mountains, where you can connect with nature, listen to the birds singing and admire a unique landscape.  We have capacity up to  six motor home. The electricity is 110 volts. Cell phone  is  +57 3175354484, Whatsapp +57 3156280911.

name: Hotel Las Mulas
description: Simple, clean, economic hotel by a Terpel gas station. Fenced parking (though without a closing gate), attached restaurant, AC and fan, cold shower (nice, it's always hot here). Not pet friendly. Lots of space for big rigs. 7.2 US for the room and 2.5 US for a nice meal with a beer and a water. A good stop between Guatape and Cartagena. Hotel accepts credit cards, restaurant only cash.

name: Sagrado Hotel
description:
This is a great place to stay .
Near the the main road  ,air conditioned units, very clean, flat screen with cable, fast wifi, super clean bathroom ,pet friendly,
And good price  ,they charge us 63000 pesos!
Open parking  great for big rigs. AC 110 power available.
.....
Este es un gran sitio para descansar al lado de la carretera cuartos muy limpios con aire acondicionado , cable ,buen wifi, conexion AC110,
Baños muy limpios muy amables con el viajero!

name: Villa Corinigua
description:
Family Hostel with plenty of space to host 9 persons. 
The space has an small swimming pool, Big gardens with fruits, good wifi connection and it is located on a safe place with many country houses.

name: Finca El Paraiso
description:
Superb rural farm, 10
Hectares. Simple but clean rooms, beautiful views. Coffe trees, sugar cane, near Florian and the magnificent Ventanas de Tisquizoque Waterfalls. Food is delicious, made in wood oven. Contact Neyber Gonzalez +57 311 210 0417. He can guide you around the region.

name: bomberos Cajamarca
description:
we asked at the fire department
 and they let us park in front of the office.
 half a block away is the police 

—————————-

preguntamos en la oficina de bomberos 
y ellos nos dejaron parquear alfrente de la oficina.
a media cuadra está la policía

name: Hotel Sol Y Mar
description:
Nice quiet spot off the main road.  Secure parking and friendly owner.  Sent him a WhatsApp when we were a few hours out and he gave me a slightly lower price than booking.  50k pesos gets you secure parking, air con and a plethora of Spanish television.  
Only downside was that they lock the front door, which is also a positive.  But someone returned after midnight and made a racquet to get inside.  Maybe ask for a room away from the front towards the back and you’ll be fine.

name: La casa de Barro, El Gran Tesoro.
description: La casita de Barro El Gran Tesoro it’s a local grocery Store located by Park Arvie Santa Elena. they have vegetables, fruits and basic groceries.

name: Short Term Vehicle Parking in Guatap
description: Fenced and secured parking. 30.000 COP a day, 84 COP a month. The only parking with security in the town. Have to explain to them a bit why we would like to park there as they are mainly oriented towards long-term parking for locals. But the it was ok.

name: Arreboles del Caribe
description:
Clean, with AC and fan hotel with plenty of room to park many motorcycles inside (you cross the lobby). 16 US$ a room with breakfast.
Very close to the beach, you can hear some music coming from the restaurants. It didn't bother me, and they stopped by 7pm on a Sunday.

name: Parque la Colina
description: We stayed one night in this Large flat parking lot at the top of the hill. Parking lot of a cemetery, very quite at night, not busy. The road coming up is a little narrow and steep but plenty of room at the top for most rigs. A few people using the park throughout the night and morning. Nobody bothered us or seemed to mind we were there.

name: Taller de Repuestos ElectroLagos
description: Super professional , fast service, we got our diagnosis in about an hour, and the problem was fixed shortly after that. Everyone was so friendly and willing to help. Very fair pricing.

name: Doña iris
description:
Translation:The Doña Iris parking lot is very comfortable. Large cars can enter. They offer you shower and bath. she and her family are caring and helpful. A highly recommended place. we spent three nights here

El parqueadero de Doña Iris es muy cómodo. pueden entrar carros grandes. te ofrecen ducha y baño. ella y su familia son atentos y serviciales. Un lugar muy recomendado. Pasamos tres noches aquí

name: Finca Akila
description:
Finca Akila horse tours. Dan and Kristell are warm and friendly hosts, offering a range of different tours, for beginner to advance riders. They love and look after the horses. Cabañas are currently under construction, one is ready for guests to stay in, more on the way. Active coffee farm also, absolutely stunning views. Very peaceful spot. Google maps location is accurate, narrow road from La India veers to the left around a house, fairly steep last section but concreted tyre tracks.
Call/msg Dan on +57 312 2266488 (whatsapp)

name: Taller Tolosa
description: Very good mechanic in Barichara. He helped a lot with our T3 Volkswagen van. He is such a kind and patience man, also his prices were pretty fair.

name: Hotel El Crucero
description:
Parking, for a fee, with access to energy, water and wifi.
.....
Parqueo pñpor vaññorze 30000 con acceso a energía y Agua

name: Balcones del Ayer
description: Lovely little hotel.  Most comfortable bed we’ve had since Mexico.  Great view and close to the city square.  Gated parking for the motorcycles, could probably get a small camper into the lot, nothing too tall though.  $25usd / night got you a super comfy bed, HOT showers, cable, fast WiFi and free breakfast (pancakes are bomb).  Also, Gloria who runs the spot is fantabulous.

name: El Totumo
description:
El Totumo is an active mud volcano. You have to take a bath in the mud, we had a blast! We paid 4'500 COP per Person. 
Price now (28 May 24) 20,000 cop per person

name: Río Magdalena, La Dorada, Caldas
description:
Place on the edge of the Magdalena River to rest, spend the night and park the mobile home.
....
Lugar al borde del Río Magdalena para descansar, pernoctar y parquear la casa rodante.

name: Vereda Gallinazo
description:
Place on the edge of the road and next to a ravine.
There is no sign at the point, but 200 meters away
Very quiet, several houses 50 meters away
.....
Lugar al margen de ella carretera y al lado de una quebrada.
No hay señal en el punto, pero si a 200 metros
Muy tranquilo, varias viviendas a 50 metros

name: Delicias del Paramo
description: Restaurant, famous for its corn arepas with cheese and guava (guayaba)

name: Carrera 7 x calle 6
description: Parking place next to the main park, during the week it is quiet, on weekends it is somewhat noisy there is a night watchman.

name: Hotel Boutique Casa Farallones
description: Superb location with a secure parking garage. Luis is a great concierge and the rooms are pretty large. Queen bedroom for $122,000, includes breakfast and there is a pool. Grocery, the river walk, the art museum, rio de Gato statue, and Calle 8 with many restaurants are all within a 5 minute walk.

name: Colombian mobile providers: Foreign phones banned after 1 month without registration
description:
Something we didn't know before entering Colombia: If you plan to stay longer than 1 month, you need to register your phone (not SIM card) with it's IMEI number with a Colombian provider, otherwise it will be banned and completely useless within Colombia (apparently, there is no way to unlock it once it is locked either).

You will get warning messages like this if you don't do it:

Tu equipo no esta registrado, hazlo ahora y evita sea bloqueado en 20 dias. Llama al *300 opcion 2 y sigue los pasos o ingresa a b.tigo.com/registrar

It's supposed to help against theft, but sounds BS to me. Anyway, the easiest way to avoid it is buying a Tigo SIM and activating it through their app or website. You can log in with your phone number and then go to Servicios -> Consulta tu dispositivos to activate it (the SIM card must be in the phone).

Select cédula extranjera and enter any 6 or 7 digit number, they don't check it. Once the process is complete, you get the following text:

 EL IMEI FUE REGISTRADO EXITOSAMENTE.

You can do it for multiple devices by swapping the SIM card around and repeating the process.

You can use the phone with any provider afterward.

name: Quimver - Alcohol industrial 96° for marine cooker
description: We went to the parfumeria first, but they were closed. this place sells alcohol industrial/ ethylic alcohol with 96°, too. ~80.000 for 12 liters, so a really good price.

name: Frontino - La Esperanza
description: Good place with a big garden where to put your tent or camper

name: Sibundoy
description:
Place to sleep, flat, in front of police station.
.....
lugar para dormir plano, na frente de posto policial .

name: Estadero los Arrieros Hotel & Restaurant
description:
Hotel and restaurant outside the city center. I ended up here because I arrived in Jardin on Easter weekend and literally the entire town was booked. Actually quite a nice place. Plenty of parking with no size restrictions and covered motorcycle parking behind the building. I did not ask about sleeping in your vehicle, but Julian the manager is a very nice guy and they have plenty of room, I'm sure he could be talked into it. At first he was going to let me tent camp because all their rooms were full but as I was eating dinner and resting before setting up he told me he had a cancelation and I could take a room. 100.000cop for 1 person for a nice private room and bathroom with hot shower. A bit expensive but Jardin is expensive in general and I think I got their best room and it was also Easter weekend so prices may have been higher than usual. I believe they also have a dorm but it was full.

Restaurant is basic menu ejuctivo type food but good and cheap. Full service bar open til 10 and if you want something later you can knock on Julian's door. Wifi only in the restaurant but fast.

name: Quinta la Soñada Macanal
description:
Beautiful spot, spectacular views, overlooking the Represa de Chivor, known for its kite surfing (when the water is high enough, not when we were there). 
Good flat camping areas, clean bathroom and shower (cold), even tiny pool with natural water, possibility to connect to electricity. No catering. 
Lovely couple running the place, including three cabañas. 
The road leading to this side of the lake is rather rough but doable and beautiful. 

Owner Osmar Salguero +57 (312) 386-7216

name: al lado de la iglesia
description: We parked five nights here. It is a very quiet and even safe place. The town is small so there is not much movement. maybe a little bit in the morning with some cars but then they go away. --- Parqueamos cinco noches acá. Es un lugar muy tranquilo y hasta seguro. El pueblo es pequeño por lo que no hay mucho movimiento. tal vez un poco en la mañana con algunos carros pero luego se van.

name: Brisas del Caribe Hotel Restaurant
description:
It is in front of the beach and next to the hotel.  Elicer and her family gave us energy, water and toilets.  They were very nice to us.  We agreed to give him whatever we wanted and we gave 5k per car per day. We stayed for a week.  Very good food and very nice place.
Esta al frente de la playa y al lado del hotel. Elicer y su famila nos dieron energía agua y sanitarios. Fueron muy amables con nosotros. Acorsamis sarle lo que quisieramos y dimos 5k  por carro dia Estuvimos una semana. Muy buena comida y muy agradable el sitio
Movil +57 3122997356

name: Estación de gasolina Ecos
description:
El encargado me dejó acampar con mi perro bajo el techo de un quiosco que tienen en desuso y me dió la clave del wifi: [wifi passwords not allowed]. 
Es muy ruidoso porque está junto a la avenida.
Los baños están muy sucios y no hay lugar para ducharse. Pero está bien para pasar una noche.

The manager let me camp with my dog ​​under the roof of a disused kiosk and gave me the wifi password: [wifi passwords not allowed]. It is very noisy because it is next to the avenue. The bathrooms are very dirty and there is no place to shower. But it's ok for one night.

name: San Miguel hostal
description:
clean, nice big rooms, large w/c warm shower, breakfast included, variable speed wifi
25k per person for a 24 hr. stay
across from the church

name: Hotel Aguablanca
description: Nice spot on the edge of La Mesa.  15 min walk to the center, cab is about 2$us. Has gated and secure parking, fast WiFi, private rooms and cold showers (no hot water here).  Was a good spot to stop before making our way into bogota tomorrow.    100k for two people with two motorcycles.

name: Reserva Natural Hato Berlin
description:
If you like to be connected to the nature and the Llanos it ist the perfect place. It is not a campground, it is a nice Farm, but they offer all you need. If you ask, they will also offer food. 
Here you can see a lot of birds, monceys, caimans ect. That place is  is realy quiet and "Tranquilo". Señor Heiler offers tours. You can have a look to his  web site, or you can explore the  surroundings by yourselfes. It ist better to call Señor Heiler ( 3143319158) some hours before you arrive, otherwhise the gate could be closed.

name: Alto de Letras
description:
Fantastic spot to stay overnight for
Free, with a lovely view of Nevado del Ruiz. several places for parking  .cbaside the road in a little town, nice people tell you where to go. We parked behind a house in ruins next to police station. Very safe and quiet. You can see the Nevado del Ruiz very early in the morning (6 am) just by a short walk/climb uphill (we got fumarolas wow!) No services but few restaurants/coffee shop where you can ask to use toilets. There is a place called TierrAlta where there is artisanal cheese made with European techniques.  The owner Julio is a nice guy that shows you the processing, great experience!

name: TierrAlta coffee shop
description: Nice place to stop for agua de panela with cheese, chocolate or coffee. Also, it is an artisanal cheese factory using european techniques.

name: Magma EcoHotel
description: EcoHotel in middle of Nature and wonderfull landscapes

name: La posada de Ceci
description:
Translation:Super cozy place with wonderful owners, Yanira and her husband Hernando are a lovely couple and very good hosts! They have rooms for 50,000 pesos for a couple with private bathroom and hot shower. Very close to tourist places! if you want to reserve your phone is +573103450751. The views are wonderful to the Western mountain range! highly recommended!

Lugar súper acogedor con dueños maravillosos,  Yanira y su marido Hernando son un pareja encantadora y muy buenos anfitriones! Disponen de habitaciones 50.000 pesos la pareja con baño privado y ducha caliente. Muy cerca de lugares turísticos! si desean reservar su teléfono es +573103450751. Las vistas son maravillosas a la cordillera Occidental! muy recomendado!

name: Raices
description:
Here is a restaurant with delicious and economical food, the Owners are very friendly and allowed us to spend two nights in this place, they gave us water. They have toilets and showers. made us feel at home The cabana has hot water and a bath! 
.....
Es un restaurante con comida deliciosa y económica, los Dueños son muy amables nos permitieron pasar dos noches en este lugar, nos regalaron agua. Tienen servicio de baños y ducha. nos hicieron sentir como en casa

name: Opposite police station
description:
The police picked us up at the Maggie shapely banks spot and told us it would not be safe there and we might get robbed. They were super friendly (quite the opposite of our experience in Mexico in a similar situation) and told us that it would be safer to park in front of the police station (this spot).

Not sure if it's really that dangerous or they just don't want anything to happen to tourists on their watch. Not sure how they found us either, we arrived quickly before sunset and only a few cars passed by at the other spot.

Anyways, a good place to stay and they even offered that we could use their restrooms.

name: Las Brisas
description:
I wanted to drive from Arboledas to Bochalema, but the street over the mountain was cut because of road work. On the way back I found this place.
 It is in a curve of a rocky steep road.
Access is at N 07°38`54.1" W 72°45`49.4"

name: Road cloesd Arboledas to Bochalema
description:
Road is closed due to road work.
Had to turn back to Arboledas at this point.

name: Tejo game ( at Gran Cacao restaurant)
description: You can play the traditional Colombian game of tejo for a small price here. The game includes explosives, although it is pretty hard to actually set them off (we managed once in the afternoon...) Still pretty fun though. You can buy drinks and food at the restaurant too. We got the rules of the game from here: https://impulsetravel.co/en/blog/98/how-to-play-tejo-a-guide-to-colombia-s-national-sport

name: Taller  y almacén de repuestos
description:
the owner very kind and diligent, you find everything in spare parts.
 Asdruba spare parts warehouse 

——————————————————

el dueño muy amable y diligente, encuentras todo en repuestos. 
Asdruba almacén de repuestos

name: Finca Hotel Pinares
description: Good overnight spot operated by a friendly family. Clean, refreshing pool for cooling off on the hot, sunny days here. Nice new bathrooms and cold private showers. They had us park in a gravel area near hotel maintenance/laundry so not very scenic but quiet, private and with late afternoon shade as well as option to use 110v electricity(long cord required). Front desk sells ice cream bars and cold drinks. Good wifi usable from the parking area. We had a quiet weekday night here for 50k, 2 people and van. They seem to own two properties next to one another with the same name. Perhaps there are other options for parking etc.

name: Altoque Terpel
description:
Terpel Altoque Service Station.  Good park area and free restrooms.  We spent the night.  They only ask us to consume something in the store or buy gas.

Estacion de Servicio Terpel Altoque. Buenas area de parque y sevicios sanitarios gratis. Pasamos la noche. Solo piden que consumamos algo en la tienda  o compremos gas

name: El Almirante
description:
Nice little finca in the middle of nowhere offering different camping options. I believe there are some really nice views here, but it was all cloudy when we arrived. They also offer food for a reasonable price (paid 20 000  for a tasty lunch).
Camping is 20 thousand per person, renting a tent is 50. There's also a simple 2-person cabin for 150. I guess there's also enough space for parking a mid-size motorhome.
The last 2.5 kms of the road aren't so good, so you might need a 4x4, or just walk leaving your vehicle at Escudo. There's no wifi, but a strong Claro signal instead.

name: next to the gravel road
description:
I spend the night next to the road and did the hike to the waterfall the next morning.
the night was quiet just the sound of the waterfall.

name: El Tronco
description:
Little Hospedaje in Encino. Simple and clean rooms. Not sure if they offer food, but there‘s a restaurant at the town square. 
30.000COP for two people.

name: Corioncoro Restaurant
description: Cheap place to eat local food which is very good. Few westeners, tourists, mostly local people or Colombian tourists. 11000 pesos for a menu with grilled fish served with a nice soup (fish or meat) and a fresh lemonade. Best deal we found downtown.

name: Aro Ford Motors
description: We had an engine mount on our Ford e350 repaired.  The diagnosis was very quick and correct. They  manufactured a new piece at another place and installed it, original parts are difficult to find.  Omar and Manuel were super nice and explained each step well.  Very professional and friendly. They even made a quick check of all the liquids and checked the brakes. Excellent wifi.

name: Centro Hostel Medellín
description: Brand New hostel!! Really nice and helpful staff, good price ($7dorm) and confortable, full equiped kitchen, breakfast included, right in town center

name: Hotel Milena
description:
Basic but Clean, inexpensive and perfect for a rest night between your route north or south the 45 highway. 
Really cheap we pay 55.000 COP for a double room super clean, small but works fine. It has air conditioning, TV , super clean toilets and rooms. Good parking space for any rig size. Good wifi connection too.

name: Robbery
description: As I was walking down the main street, during the day, surrounded by other people walking, a guy hopped off the passing motorbike, attacked me and stole my phone which was in my pocket. As told after the incident by locals, very dangerous neighborhood, although it looks like any other in Cartagena, shouldn't be there, shouldn't walk there, especially not alone. Better to take a taxi or something in that area.

name: Hotel Serrana
description: A great place that a local told us about. $31 USD per night for the best $30 hotel you have probably ever stayed in. They let us park our motocycles inside the courtyard area and they also have other secure parking available.  Breakfast was included. wifi is not great, nice pool area. Rooms are fantastic.

name: Hotel Gutier
description: Nice clean place at a great price right by the center of Rionegro. It saved me a bunch of money versus staying in Guatape. I paid $30usd for 2 nights. Wifi is decent. Private parking is right next door that cost extra but worked great for my motorcycle.

name: Hotel Boutique Sophia
description: Great place! We were recommended here by another hotel that was full. Can park in secured parking that is 2 blocks away. Great wifi, ac, breakfast for 50k cop a night.

name: Estación de servicio Bellavista
description: This place has place to sleep just for 30000 pesos colombianos and also you can sleep in your car.

name: Mirador del palmar
description:
I just put my car next to road. That road dosen't looks uesd very often There is a nice view to the laguna.
Super calm no one around here.

name: Hotel Monte Tauro
description: Very clean and comfy hotel for an affordable price (35000 for a double room). Place to store the bicycles in a garage. Manager very hospitable and helpful.Quiet place.

name: Terpel gas station
description: Gas station were you can stand with your van. The very helpful and friendly manager lives with his family in the house above the gas station. There is a bathroom with more or less clean toilets and a shower. We felt safe, welcomed and stayed for free.

name: Kokoa Sushi
description: Awesome sushi including lots of veggie options. Huge menu. Happy hour on cocktails 5-9 (30k for two). 8 sushi rolls around 30k. Mmmmmm

name: Balneario El Verano
description:
Located near San Pablo pueblo. A nice "finca", just beside the Highway 45A.
Place for campers, rooftent and tents. Has rooms to meet.
Nice and clean swimming pools. River, place to make meals and other facilities.
Josué, the owner and his wife run the place, and are very friendly.
You negotiate the prices for everything. We started with P$ 50.000, 00 and ended with P$ 30,000,00 to camp with our rooftent and 2 Pearsons.

name: banco agrario (ATM)
description:
24 hour secure ATM on the main road
. 
why do I need to enter 40 characters..!

name: aragut house
description:
quaint hotel on the main street, near main plaza surrounded by restaurant, bakery, grocery. no parking
30.000 cop room with two beds. private toilet with hot shower. 
can leave bicycles in the hallway

name: Termales La Portada de la Villa
description:
Nice place to relax and great service. Its not just a big pool like other hot springs. They have smaler pools where the sprig is bubbling from the bottom and a cold water one. there is a bar and they will serve you rigth at the pool, selling beers wine and ice cream.
The buildings are new opend a year ago and still some construction going on. You need to make a reservation posible for afternoon or nigth. 
I did not know that and just showed up at the gate, made a reservation fore tha same day and paid in advance.
They let the pepole in, in groups. We were abuot 20 not more and the time is limited to 2 hours.
Entrance fee is 30 cop per person.

name: 360 Views from the Plank
description:
We weren’t able to continue much past this point, getting stuck in the soft sand and then unstuck, but then seeing a much larger area of soft sand and mud. Hopefully if it was dry it would be passable. 

So we turned back to here, a spot up on a hill with great views and most commonly a great breeze. Not bad at all! Only 4 people drove by. Claro service (usable but not great)

name: Buena vista
description:
lovley area, some offroad fun, plenty of camp spots to chose, wood for camp fiers. 
A bit windy though.

name: Punta Faro
description: beautiful hotel 2 hours from Cartagena by boat, the main rule here is "no music, no speakers... enjoy the silence", so, the place is peaceful and you can really relax, the meals are great and the beach is a padise.

name: RC Air Conditioning
description: This is a very good AC technician. Lots of experience and special tools. He was slow and methodical about everything. If you want your AC fixed right, go to this guy..

name: Hotel la Madriguera
description:
Peaceful place, great view over the Guatape dam, excellent service and boundless friendliness. Excellent rooms, breakfast and free parking
--
Apacible lugar, muy buena vista sobre la represa de Guatape, excelente servicio y amabilidad sin límites. Habitaciones excelentes, desayuno y parqueo gratis

name: Nueves cada Bityn
description: Nice hospedaje in Puerto Nuevo. Simple rooms with fan & AC for 60.000 a night. Nice common area with 6 hammocks under a roof. They offer breakfast (8.000), lunch (15.000) and dinner. The owner is very nice and helpful. We stayed a night before and after our stay at Isla Fuerte. We could stored our bikes in one of their rooms for 4 nights while on the islands.

name: Centro poblado casibare
description:
It is a safe, reliable place, close to the Wi-Fi zone, people are friendly, in rural areas its population does not exceed more than 80 people, you can find some super landscapes, during the drive to get there
-----------------------
es un lugar seguro, confiable, cerca a zona wifi,la gente es amable, en zona rural su población no excede más de 80 personas, puedes encontrar unos súper paisajes, durante el recorrido al llegar al lugar

name: La Variante Frenos y Clutch
description: Garage mechanic very close to the port. We had a mechanic problem due to the shipping and we arrive to this very big and professional garage. We could sleep here, they took care of the problem, offering realistic and economic solutions. Very trustworthy company. Ask for John Colon, he will help you to with everything.

name: Hostal San Luis
description: Great hostel for an affordable price. Basic but clean. Hot shower, wifi and kitchen. Courtyard to store bicycles. Owners very friendly. Closeby the main square of the town.

name: gotas
description:
filtered water, refill or buy. 
5L 3.000 refill
20L "botellon" 27.000 new or 9.500 refill

they also do delivery

name: Hospedaje Cheo's
description: Simple hospedaje, different options from 20.000 $ (no windows, shared bathroom). I choose a small room with private bathroom for 25.000 $. Internet out of service. Electric shower. Small TV. Several options for eat and shops, in 10 minutes walking, next to the main square of Villapinzon, quite and safe village. Parking for bike. Other hotels very close but I didn't check.

name: Hotel Alcaraván
description:
Big parking lot with tables and chairs.
We parked our car with rooftent just beside the clean bathroom.
Has a little caffetteria.
Ana María, the manager was very friendly.

name: Camping at Gaitána Campestre
description:
It's a restaurant at the right side of the highway on the way south to the border with Ecuador.
We asked Dejanire, the manager if we could park and sleep at the big parking lot. She said we were welcome and even offered the bathroom and shower. Big restaurant with good and tasty food. 
There is a river were you can refresh yourself. 
Nice and grassy place. The highway stays quite silent at night.

name: Hotel Andre
description: Good, clean, single room with big confortable bed for 30.000 $. Private bathroom. TV. WiFi wasn't working when I have been there. I parked my bike in a corner inside the hotel.

name: Riverside Camp spot
description: Small lay by next to a quiet road and a river not far from the town  Not much traffic. Good 4G with Movistar.

name: Park lot Azul Profundo
description:
In the parking lot of the Azul Profundo restaurant.  We stayed 3 days.  We paid 5k per night per car.  Manuel owner of the restaurant is very friendly.  He has fresh water bathrooms shower and electricity


En el parqueadero de el restaurante Azul Profundo. Nos quedamos 3 dias. Pagamos 5k por noche por carro. Manuel dueño del restaurante es muy amable. Tiene agua dulce  baños ducha y ekectricidad

name: Servicio VOLKSWAGEN
description: Only for old VW (combo-cox) Fabio and his team are very good, and fare price. Thé garage is small, if you don’t have luck it will be full

name: Cerro las Tres aviejas
description: You can get here either by car or walking starting the trekking near town in Sesquilé following the signs. In this spot you can have great views of the valley. You can park safely to hike the final part of Las Tres Viejas trekking. It’s a potential camping spot. we didn’t ask but we are pretty sure locals here will let you stay a couple of nights.  Very friendly people.

name: Hacienda Vista Hermosa
description:
A beautiful Hacienda with a breathtaking view, very quiet. Has a few bedrooms, a lot of space on the property for tents and parking in front of the house for cars/campers. Kitchen is free to use as well as bathroom. Tents are 30.000 a night. The place is also on Google Maps including the phone number. They also offer food.

The road from Abejorral is all gravel/dirt and after Pantanillo, at times really muddy. 

Sebastian is a very nice guy, speaks English and grows his own coffee.

name: Street Parking
description: Street parking by the river. Quiet and safe.

name: La Elisa
description:
Very nice Camping with 3 options
1- You can install your tent under a shelter. 
2- You can Park an RV at the top camping area if you can manage with the climb (ok for my 74 combi), or in the bottom there is an other place. 
3- Room are available

The owner Dora-Lucia is so Welcoming. Water is clean.

40000cop for both of us without meal
150000cop including dinner, breakfast, tent
150000cop including dinner, breakfast, room

name: Finca Kataa
description: This is a place to always come back to. If you want to live a rural experience in La Guajira, do not hesitate to come here. Its owners María and Adolfo are charming people. The site is spacious, has a river to bathe and enjoy nature. You must previously contact Mrs. María on the cell phone: 3015123154. --- Este es un lugar para volver siempre. Si quieren vivir una experiencia rural en la Guajira no duden en venir acá. Sus dueños María y Adolfo son unas personas encantadoras. El sitio es amplio, cuenta con un río para bañarse y disfrutar de la naturaleza. Debes contactarte previamente con la señora María al celular: 3015123154.

name: Hotel Campamento La Tatacoa
description: Basic roadside hotel, clean rooms, great wifi, friendly staff, let me take my bycicle in the room, 35kCOP for one person and fan [didn't negotiate], plenty of restaurants around.

name: El Rodeo de La Laguna
description: This is a place side to lake, the site provide water and AC power, this have a pool, baths and shower. You can speak with Ricardo who is the owner. 20K pesos at night but every person. Near of this site its another site near to the lake by 15k at night.

name: Lago Tejar Ecoturismo Misak
description:
A nice and pacefull campsite. It is located over the silvia - totoro road (4 km). There is restaurant service.
.
.
.
.

 https://www.google.com/search?client=ms-android-samsung&sxsrf=ALiCzsY75-cn1Zj7KThsCrAyt_l2R9nYQg:1655042294744&q=Ecoturismo+Misak+Lago+Tejar&ludocid=14296317520931824377&gsas=1&client=ms-android-samsung&ibp=gwp;0,7&lsig=AB86z5WJRo7d8_dxEajJ1mt87ng8&kgs=a4db6237c5435359&shndl=-1&source=sh/x/kp/local/2&entrypoint=sh/x/kp/local

name: el cielo de tena
description: eco friendly hotel, restaurant and campsite

name: carulla @ centro chia
description: in the coffee shop there are  coworker stations. the mall patking cost us$1.00 aprox and a drink from us$1, meal from us3

name: Restaurant El Rubi
description: This place at the side of the road has a Terrace with an incredible view over The Valley. They sell coffee juices and food as well. 5000 pesos for a juice or granita. Food prices are reasonable. I did not eat but lots of locals eat here. Staff is friendly.

name: Almendros Hotel
description: Brand new hotel. Clean and cheap (25000 for a double room). Friendly staff. Big room with double bed (normal size for once!). Bicycles fit in the room. Room comes with bathroom and WC, fan, tv. Private parking.Quiet neighbourhood. Not on the main, busy road.

name: SOAT / Seguros Luna
description: SOAT issurance possible for foreigners and less than 1 year (but 3 months minimum). We serached in many offices before finding one that offers less than 1 year. Very friendly. We paid in a Bancocolombia (for us 60 dollars for a camper 4x4, 3 places) and received the SOAT per whatsapp in PDF.

name: Tunel de Oriente
description: Motorbikes are prohibited in the Tunel de Oriente. I missed the signs saying they're prohibited, and got pulled over.  the police told me the fine was $200 and they'd take my bike, which I'm not sure is true because I declined the offer to pay on the spot and said I'd prefer to pay in the police station and he let me go.  Better to not take a chance and detour around.

name: Brisas minca hostel
description: Nice rooms! Nice view. Just where the bus transport from santa marta stops. Good wifi. 62000 COPs a private room for two with bathroom. The owner is really nice...he gives us a post card and chocolates when he welcome us. Even if it rains it feels cozy. High recommended.

name: LA CANOA HOTEL CAMPING
description:
La Canoa Camping overlooking the Betania Yagura Huila dam
--------------
la canoa camping vista a la represa de Betania Yagura Huila

name: Murillo Plaza - Parque Principal
description: We slept 4 nights here, super calm (even on weekends), there's a water tap in the middle of the plaza. It is a SUPER SAFE town (we left our bicycle outside all day and nothing happened). People of the town are so nice. Highly recommend this town (super beautiful).

name: Sysqua Reserva Natural
description:
A calm and quiet camping space, very close to the Sisga Reservoir
----
Un espacio de camping tranquilo y silencioso, muy cerca al Embalse de Sisga.

name: Hotel Colombia Real
description: Hotel with great location. Stayed here while motorcycle touring and used this hotel as a base camp to visit Tayrona Park, beaches, etc. Paid 60 COP ($15 US) single bed. A/C Easy to get to, on side of highway but rooms are quiet. Fast wifi. Secure locked garage parking. Rooms are basic but clean. Can’t see from highway but can walk around corner to juice bars, bakery, restaurant, motorcycle shop, etc.

name: texaco
description: great place to stay for one night.bathrooms and gentle staff.

name: Mirador Los Altares
description: Really nice place with stunning views, good for relaxing and parking overnight, the place has restrooms, showers, restaurant, camping, good for big riggs, don't miss it

name: Hostal Tonito
description: Just before the bus terminal (20 meters). An incredible beautiful place. Small, cozy colonial house. You can view the mountain and hang out in an almost personal living room. In holidays is 100.000 COP a private room for two people with private bathroom, tv, wifi and hot water. But in common days is 80.000 cop. Also if is a day during the week you can offer 60.000 cop and they could accept. In our case we arrived really late at night, and we only had 50.000 Cop in cash...as the rooms were empty and was late, they accepted us that money. Staying here is part of the beauties of Villa de Leyva. They have a kitchen. Not sure if you can use it but at least we use it to boil water. High recommended.

name: 24-hour Parking Lot
description: Just got here. Clean and gated parking lot with a high clearance for taller rigs. Charged us 12,000 for 12 hours. Has washrooms and is near to a big park to walk dog and tons of restaurants. They lock the main gate at some point in night.

name: Hotel Colonial
description:
Nice old colonial style building with inner courtyard, ok to leave the bicycle there.
Single room 50k. Shower kinda warm.
Located very good for exploring the old city.
The only annoying thing is the bell, every guest needs to ring the bell to come back into the hotel so there are a lots of ding dongs 
They could sort it easily by why?
The building itself is very noisy anyway , like all this type of building. They got a Charme but better have the earplugs ready.

name: claro sales and service
description: giant claro store to buy SIM cards and get your phones registered. 40k for 12gigs or 100k for 80g. once your SIM card is working, don't forget to ask them to register the phone. it was an easy and fast process but they did not automatically offer that. there was a similar Tigo store like 2 blocks to the east if you prefer them.

name: San Fermín Bakery
description:
One of those food recommendations that make iOverlander worth it. 
Here is a 1974 founded bakery and pastry that also serve breakfast and lunches till 7pm.
Very traditional, one of the best places in town to taste traditional Bogotan breakfast ( tamal, queso con chocolate y almojábana, caldo , Changua y muchos panes) . Good prices only cash.

name: Isla del sueño
description:
You can camp on the island. It is flat inside and very quiet as soon as the boat go by the port.
To arrive there we rented a kayak 70 000cop for 24h
check the weather in order to avoid to be trapped by a thunderstorm.

name: Chocolo Colombia
description: Regional restaurant with delicious local Santanderian menu. Definitely try their arepa chocolo with Aji.

name: Soñarte coffee finca & campground
description: This place is amazing! Patricia and her family have different spots named „soñarte“. These coordinates are where it is possible to camp. Few campers fit and for big rigs it could be challenging. You can camp on the parking lot or in the courtyard but max. 3m20 high camper can pass. Breakfast is possible for 10‘000 pp and need to be informed one day before. Area with billiard and tables in a beautiful setting full of birds. There are also very nice room to rent. The best part was the coffee tour in the finca with Patricia, 4 hours, very authentic & interesting, incl. coffee & fruit tasting! They have a Restaurant 15min walk from the finca in a beautiful setting with view over the town. Or the restaurant „Ancestro“ from her brother with great view and good food 15min by car. She also organised us a tour in a Cacao finca for the next day. Patricia‘s coffee is part of a association of women having fincas and producing their own coffee and do a lot to develop and keep the region sustainable. Best experience we could have wished to experience in a truly authentic coffee finca in Colombia! Very very recommendable!

name: Hotel Restaurante La Piscina
description:
Stopped here after 8 hours of hard driving south from Cartagena. Unlike nearby restaurant parking this was flat and level. 
Supper for two and overnight parking was 28,000cop (~$7), we stayed for breakfast for 18,000cop (~$4), Sausage,eggs, cheese and coffee.
This whole road is narrow as it follows the mountains and the river, not many opportunities for level parking. at least this was level, and for a Friday night there was no party music which is a plus... 
Unfortunately the highway is a stone's throw away with typical truck traffic in the night...

name: Cinco Cacao Experience & Camping
description:
Wonderful experience in a Cacao finca of an adorable family! You can visit the finca in Spanish or English, then they show you how to make chocolate, you can try chocolate in all steps of the process and of course eat the best chocolate at the end. :-) incl. hot chocolate, as well as chocolate with fruit. 
There is a possibility to camp in their finca but this should be requested a few days before by Whatsapp/phone +57 318 876 23 47 Felipe. 
Absolutely recommendable and a truly authentic cacao experience with a lovely family!

Clean bathroom and outdoor shower.

name: Cinco cacao
description: Experience a Cacao finca visit with « Cinco Cacao »: visit the finca and then chocolate making, very authentic! See comments on « Informal Campsite » at the same spot.

name: Coffee Delicias
description:
Small panaderia serving a very good coffee (for panaderia standards in Colombia :)
Also other usual pastries, etc. Good shop and friendly service.

name: balneario piedras verdes
description: Incredible place near a beautiful river. It gets full during the day in weekends by locals but at night it is safe and alone. Highly recommended.

name: The HumpbackTurtle
description: This hostel is located on a very nice beach. 50k $ night in the dormitory. 120k $ the single room, with shared bathroom. No WiFi. No drinkable water and the bar is expensive. Lunch and dinner (20k $) very poor. Basic and small bed. Definitely not recommended.

name: Playa Warecuse
description:
It is a hostel on the shore of the beach. You can stay in the car park. Very friendly people. There is a restaurant and bathroom service

Espanol
Es un hostal a orilla de la playa. Se puede quedar en el parqueadero. Personas muy amigables. Hay restaurante y servicio de baños

name: Casa Jager - Casa de ciclistas
description:
UNSURE IF VEHICLE CAMPING IS ALSO POSSIBLE!

This is the right location, they moved here 2 years ago. Space for pitching your tent, kitchen, restrooms, shower, drinking water... perfect spot for relaxing and rest 
Donation is welcomed in order to pay gas, electricity, etc

name: Lavandería Lavatú
description: this place is advertised as being an American style coin operated laundry but when you get there it's quite obviously not self serve. charged a ridiculous 55k for one load. it was nice and new, but to expensive.

name: Centro de Servicios Ford
