description: We were looking for a place to install new shocks on our Ford F250 and were directed to this place by the supplier of the shocks. Great crew who seemed to genuinely care about doing the work right and well. We had them look at a few other things to make sure we were in tip top shape for the journey south.

name: Dan Brewery Cervecería Artesanal
description: little micro brewery run by 3 friends for the love of making beer. they are using state of the art equipment and literally traveled the world to find good recipes and get the ingredients from Yakima and Germany. they currently don't have a pub open to the public, they said they are hoping to get one open here in August, but if you reach out to them on Instagram or Facebook you can go to this pin and buy their beers and they can give you a quick tour of the facility. the Czech pilsner was incredible and their American pale ale was very tasty. 12 bottles to go with the tour was 75k.

name: Nuevo Mirador
description: Excellent hotel. Paid 70000 COP=$17 US very clean single room with balcony overlooking the lake, gorgeous view. Literally right next to Piedra del Peñol (behind). Covered parking for motorcycle or one vehicle if space available. Fast wifi. Very friendly owner and staff. Excellent on-site restaurant.

name: Texaco
description: A Texaco gas station across the street from the exit of the port with gas and diesel. there is a tiny tire shop in the parking lot if you need to air up after leaving the container but they don't have tools for any other repairs. they have a store here for refreshments while you wait for the SPRC office paperwork.

name: placita en curiti
description: We spent two nights in this place. Next to it you have a kiosk where you can take shelter if it rains. It is a very quiet place and they do not bother you at all. Be careful when you park because it is a place where very large cars travel.

name: Alma house
description:
Alma's house on the outskirts of Mogotes.  You find a place where you can spend a night in your Motorhome.  One step to follow the Cocuy.  Talk to Alma on WhatsApp 3153703047 before arriving.  Talk to her, she is very nice and generous.  arrange for your services

La casa de Alma a las afueras de Mogotes. Encuentras un lugar donde puedes pasar una noche es tu Motorhome. Un paso para seguir al Cocuy. Habla con Alma en el WhatsApp 3153703047 antes de llegar. Habla con ella que es muy agradable y generosa. llegar a un arreglo por sus servicios

name: Camp in the desert NO VEHICLE ACCESS
description:
On the grey desert
No one see u
Calm 
Unfortunately, you hear the road

name: Mirador en El Campano
description:
A roadside bay with great views. Permission is requested at the farm below, with Mr. Cachama.

Español
Una bahía a la orilla de la carretera con excelentes vistas. Se pide permiso en la finca de abajo, con el señor Cachama.

name: Arte y pasión Café: Escuela de baristas
description:
It is a school for baristas … or for the coffee drinker?
They have fantastic Colombian coffees from different regions. The coffees are all single origin and roasted by the café.
If you chose one of the filter methods, the coffee will be prepared at your table! You can choose between v60, chemex, aeropress etc

I had a coffee prepared for v60, 16 hrs coffee for 200gr water, from Nariño, and it was truly fabulous!

name: Hotel Mompox Real
description: Clean, inexpensive, spacious hotel in downtown Mompox. Indoor parking lot locked at night. Large rooms with large bathrooms. Well working wifi. Perfect for a stopover to visit Mompox. We paid 60,000 COP for 2 people in a 4 bed room which we had exclusive use of. Recommended.

name: Amor Perfecto
description:
If you are looking for a third wave coffee experience in Bogotá this is the place to go. Delicious Colombian offer and also cakes with Colombian ingredients.
They roast on site, do coffee cuppings. The barista let you sniff the beans before you make a choice for your pour over.

name: parquet arvi ATM
description: this is the only ATM up on this mountain and probably within 20km. located across the plaza from the tram down to Medellin.

name: bici pizza
description: a couple of hundred meters down this side road you will find incredible pizza! offered in Italian, french and Spanish styles. super thin almost cracker like crust loaded with fresh ingredients that really make this something special. pizzas only come in one size and although it's possible to finish one by yourself if your very hungry I would recommend splitting one. prices between 35-42k

name: PROCAM
description: I had to modify our van to get it into a shipping container. I needed a shop to put it back together. after contacting Hugo via a mechanic pin in the city he got me in touch with Carlos and his employee Christopher who work here. both speak English. we didn't get our van back until 7pm and needed a place to stay and they let us stay here in the gated lot for free with our dog and let us use the shower and bathroom. it's a huge outdoor shop with a roof so you can stay covered from the rain and out of the sun. these guys specialize in Defenders but work on all sorts of 4x4 stuff and were very fast putting our van back together. highly recommend these kind people. directions from the Cartagena are correct and the road is good to this pin but the road south from here was a dirt road in terrible condition with giant mud holes and requires high clearance.

name: La Cascada
description: Excellent clean hotel, secure covered  parking (great for motorbikes), swimming pool, restaurant, wifi. Centralized, walk to everything. Paid 60000 COP=$15 US.

name: San Lucas
description:
house of a very friendly family, there is space to camp or rooms to rent. It is a very beautiful place because there is a lot of nature, birds and a creek nearby. the sector is very safe, you must call to confirm the visit... the phone number is 3002118731 
---
casa de una familia muy amable, hay espacio para campar o habitaciones para alquilar. es un lugar muy hermoso por qué hay mucha naturaleza, aves y una quebrada cerca. el sector es muy seguro, se debe llamar para confirmar la visita... el teléfono es 3002118731

name: Hobu Hostal
description:
This place had a great vibe and I met a number of great people. The neighbourhood is quite safe and less touristic than Candelaria with some really nice options for eating or shopping for food. A giant supermarket is just two streets away so you can do your shopping and cook in the hostel if you like. I stayed only one night but I enjoyed the 'no frills but down to earth' hospitality. I even went climbing with some of the guys and girls I met there. The staff is also the nicest people I met in Bogotá. 
Also I recommend this place:)

name: Finca Agroturistica Maria Yislem
description:
A spacious campsite with a natural pond for swimming.
Good quiet location for a break on the way to the Ilanos. We were the only guests. Breakfast is served. The hosts are very nice and try to fulfill every wish.
phon: 310 2059210

name: wainani arena Supia Caldas
description:
Campsite Hotel Recreation park Pools Cabanas football courts and sites for rvs Vans cars motor homes
-----
Campsite Hotel Recreation park Piscines Cabanes futbol courts and sites for rvs Vans cars motor homes

name: Abya Yala Agroecological Cafe Finca & Hostel
description:
This is a serene and charming place run by passionate and kind people where you can learn about agroecological coffee and enjoy nature. 

There is good WiFi, you can use the well equipped kitchen to cook, a hot shower and toilet, and hammocks to relax in. 

The coffee and forest tour lasts approximately two hours and includes a drink at the end. The cost for the coffee and forest tour is 25 thousand pesos.

At the moment there is one room with two single beds and the cost per person is 25 thousand per night.

We had a wonderful experience with Oscar and Paola and ended up staying three nights. We hope to return! Please contact Oscar prior at +57 310 5692352 (uses WhatsApp).

name: Abya Yala Agroecological Cafe Finca & Hostel
description:
This is a serene and charming place run by passionate and kind people where you can learn about agroecological coffee and enjoy nature. 

There is good WiFi, you can use the well equipped kitchen to cook, a hot shower and toilet, and hammocks to relax in. 

The coffee and forest tour lasts approximately two hours and includes a drink at the end. The cost for the coffee and forest tour is 25 thousand pesos.

At the moment there is one room with two single beds and the cost per person is 25 thousand per night.

We had a wonderful tour experience with Oscar and Paola and ended up staying three nights. We hope to return! Please contact Oscar prior to visiting at +57 310 5692352 (uses WhatsApp).

name: Hotel Valjala
description: Clean hotel with hot water and secure parking. Motorcycles are parked behind the hotel, under shelter. Room at 13 US. Nice option if you don't want to stay in Manizales. Front desk has snacks and beverages. They can call restaurants for meals.

name: Estacionamiento para camiones frente a Primax
description:
Translation: Ample parking with a slight slope, don miguel attends, there is no problem sleeping in the motorhome, near the border crossing and near the center of Ipiales, quiet at night, good travel routes! 


amplio estacionamiento con desnivel suave, atiende don miguel, no hay problema en dormir en el motorhome, cerca del paso fronterizo y cerca del centro de Ipiales, tranquilo por la noche, buenas rutas viajero!

name: Cerro de los Venados
description: Start of the trail to hike up to this hilltop. Locals recommended we go up for sunset. Incredible view. Slippery after rain, it’s quite steep but short.

name: Hostal La estacion
description: Marta the administrator since 8 years ago is nice. We slept two in a private room with bathroom and tv and fan for 40000 COP. There is a street in front of the hostel  If you go 20 meters down there you can park your car for free asking for a beautiful family that lives next to the police station. And from the hostel balcony you can look at your car. We stopped here because we were tired at night and a storm was coming on our way to la Pintada before going to Salento. Good option.

name: Gas station-hostel-subway-restaurant
description: Great place. A private room for two people with bathroom, wifi, tv, a/c...for just 30000 COP. Excellent stop on our way from cartagena to medellin.

name: Free Camping
description: Flat paved area, big enough for two small vans, by some mainly disused stables. Electric point at the back of the stables and a water tap by the yellow troughs out front. There is a designated camping area opposite, with some facilities for 25.000 per vehicle, but the ground was way too wet for us to go in (contact local guide Emerxon if you want details for that or a shower, see photo). Stayed here three nights, quiet, friendly people. Walking distance to everything. Free Wi-Fi in town square. Restaurant a few metres up the road but we didn’t try the food. Quieter than town centre and a nicer view.

name: Riosucio Police Station
description:
It is a safe and quiet place located in front of the Riosucio police station. The policemen are very friendly. They accepted that we were in the place for several days.

Español
es un lugar seguro y tranquilo ubicado frente a la estación de policía de Riosucio. Los policías son muy amables. Aceptaron que estuviéramos en el lugar por varios días.

name: Hostal Find Land & A Rest, in Filandia
description: Comfortable, clean room with hot shower, for 19 US$. Window to the hall. Very kind and helpful people. Free parking next to the hostal, but covered space too rocky for my loaded bike. Parked at a paid parking 100 meters away, for 4 dollars a day/night. Breakfast included, 2 blocks away.

name: River spot
description: Just a small space off the side of the road. After a long drive we wanted a space for the night, the spots before this weren’t really suitable. Road is empty 10-6 and still not that busy the rest of the time. Ok for the night. No signal.

name: salto del hippie parking
description: parking site near to salto del hippie 400 mts

name: Mercagan
description:
Meat restaurant !!! Size gigantic and perfectly cook. Lots of parqueadero near it. 
price not so expensive 12/13$ for sirloin or other places. Recommend !!! Hard to finish the plate

name: Hostal Antonio
description: Nice hostel. 16000 cop a bed in a shared room (but we were only two). Good kitchen and nice place to eat there. Good wifi. Bathrooms clean. Just five blocks from the main square. Quiet and safe neighbourhood. Lizeth, the receptionist, is really kind and helpful. In front of the hostel is a parqueadero that charged us 8000 cop the night (and they washed cars if you want...paco is the owner, a great man).

name: Parque / Town Square
description: Boondocking at the Main Square with public wifi. Restaurant El Charquito has a shower, probably you can use it against a small fee. Spent a calm and safe night here.

name: Graphicar
description:
Excellent place if you want to make your own stickers. In only two hours they made ours and beautiful quality. Super recommended 80 stickers cop$25000. And in just 2 hours
---
Excelente servicio para hacer stickers a viajeros o en general, económico y recomendable!
80 stickers cop$25000. Y en tan solo 2 horas

name: Parador Rojo Morrison
description:
Good place to spend a night. The restaurant is open 24 hours and has toilets and showers.
------
Buen lugar para pasar una noche. El restaurante está abierto 24H y tiene baños y duchas

name: Driving Restrictions Bogotá
description:
Pico-y-Placa driving restrictions.
Although I haven't heard of any traveller having problems, please be aware of the driving restrictions in Bogota and that you risk a >100 dollar fine (460k COP) if you drive on the wrong days. Weekend and holidays anyone can drive. On odd-numbered weekdays, vehicles with license plates ending in odd numbers are restricted, on even days the ones ending in even numbers. 
Foreign license plates are NOT listed as exception to this rule. The restriction is for the whole day approx. 6am to 9pm (hard to get info on the most up-to date hours, as it changes) .


This does not apply for vehicles with foreign plates.

name: Charca de Guarinocito
description:
You can camp  and spend the night.
Free entrance, beautiful view of the pond, possibility of finding lunch in the place, canoe ride and hiking.
Se puede campar  y pernoctar 
Entrada libre, hermosa vista de la charca, posibilidad de encontrar almuerzo en el lugar, paseo en canoa y senderismo.

name: Autos Toyota
description: Mechanic that specializes in Toyotas. Many Land Cruisers, Hilux’s, etc. they do all kinds of work here.

name: Street Parking - Parque Principal Paramo
description:
On a park street.  Very calm and quiet, Next to the police office.  Near the Santuario de la Virgen. There are toilets in several Coffee Shops

En una calle del Parque. Es muy tranquilo, calmado y silencioso, al lado de la oficina de policia. Hay un Santuario de la Virgen.

name: Parque Principal de Confines
description: In the Principal Park of Confines.  A small town in Santander.  A place to spend the night and continue.  On one side of the park is the police station, we talked to them and everything was fine.  Very quiet and calm.  Very friendly and helpful people. Delicious Sausages ( Chorizos) with Panela

name: Orlando the Mechanic
description: Got our brake fixed here for our 1977 Dodge. Not easy for us to find a mechanic willing to work on our vintage van. These guys are great and efficient. They also do body work. Highly recommend.

name: Taller el Muelle
description: Ask for Giovanni. Works on all sorts of vehicles. Fixed our shocks in just a few minutes.

name: hotel don alfonso
description: great hotel in the zona rosa of Pereira. it has secure gated parking our back.

name: Terpel gas station
description: Big flat area next to Terpel, some trucks  parked around during the night. good for a night. noisy as any gas station. toilets out of service. free, safe and big enough for any rig.

name: Non-potable water
description: We stopped here at an former petrol station as it had sign for water. Asked the guy there and we could fil up our car tank with the water a the washing station (right hand).

name: Central Park - free WiFi
description: There isn’t much service in this town but you can get free WiFi in the Central Park. The WiFi name is Zona+Digital Mejor Pais.

name: Turn off to Cabo de la Vela
description: This is the turn-off to the easiest road to Cabo de la Vela. Dirt road, but perfectly doable in any 2WD.

name: Terra Verde
description: A very nice campground in the forest next to a small river. Natural pools, tables, some activities and a restaurant. Very helpful and friendly staff. The place has some hanging cabanas (built by an architect). You can not enter with a car!

name: Hotel La Cabana
description: Good hotel to stay overnight when it gets dark. 25000 COP for double room with bathroom. Cold shower and garage for our van.

name: Restaurant El Refugio
description:
I stopped here just as it was getting dark and they let me put my tent next to the restaurant. It was raining a lot and the area was not covered. They had another area that was partially covered and they let me put my tent there because I was alone but it did not help much. A few trucks at night with big headlights. Dogs kept howling and barking at my tent for an hour or two until they got tired. In the morning they open at 630. Breakfast is basically the same as you have in the evening with the chicken replaced by eggs :)
Not a bad place but the previous restaurant (was los Cristales?) would have been a better choice because they offered me a completely covered area
Here they had a good wifi.

name: Balneario Tranquilidad
description:
Super nice place like cano cristales with the macarena plant it's a balneario so they've got banos and camping.You can swin in the river too. You can leave the car just 1km before at the finca and walk (if you're not 4x4)for 4000 to park. The entrance it's 25 000 per pers if you're 2 but if you're more it's less. If you just want to make the river and just swin, not the sendero it's 10 000 per pers. 

The plant is only from june to November when you have rain so the plant can grown.

The guid is mandatory but it's so worth it (spanish one)

But it's beautiful and people are really friendly. 

The road to come to the finca it's possible if it's not too rainy without 4x4 because lots of holl. You can also go through the puerta of Orion where you have rocks formation too.

name: Carpinteria El Paysa
description:
Came here to make some wooden wheels to make my van fit in a container. They understood the task and started working on it right away.
Next to this place, there is a "Llanteria" and another carpenter ("muebles modernos"). I brought the plywood (bought at Homecenter). They charged me 12000 for each piece (I made a several extra just in case one broke or I needed to put double plywood on each wheel).
Took a morning to complete the work.

name: Playa el morro
description:
Public parking in front of the beach of "el morro" next to the hotel zone. The space is spacious and rural without infrastructure but close to several shops and restaurants in the neighborhood. The neighbors are friendly and secure. At 100 meters there is a small tourist police station that helps to know the tourist offer of the region. It's free. There is no bathroom service. But it has a privileged location in front of the most important beach in Tumaco.

￼

name: Llanteria
description:
Got ripped off at this llanteria. Came asking for another thing and ended up paying (very expensively) for a bad repair of a puncture that didn't exist before arriving to this place.

AVOID AVOID AVOID.

name: grassy field with shade
description: big grassy field with many big shade trees big enough to park the biggest of vehicles. completely flat. lots of birds. when we crossed in the end of July, the creek was dry and the river just to the north had a tiny trickle.

name: La María Cafés Especiales
description:
For those of you who like a good specialty coffee, this cafe roast their own beans and has a very good pour over. A bit pricy at 12k for 300ml. They say para compartir but for me it is one single cup ;)
I did not like the espresso though, which was with a coffee which was alcoholic fermented. Quite an experience but not for me. I like the espresso sweet with some acidity but not with wine notes
I tried the pink bourbon on v60 which was excellent. 
Fast wifi. Relaxed ambiance. Entrance is very small door around the corner from the plaza…

name: Moneta, café y memoria
description:
This is the first place you should try if you are looking for specialty coffee in Pasto. Really friendly welcome. Also great coffee and not expensive like La Maria. Atmosphere is great.
They roast their coffee but work with different coffee fincas or producers in Nariño which is one of the hubs of specialty coffee in Colombia. 80% of the coffee in Nariño is specialty and is mostly exported but thanks to the educational work of some coffee shops like this one, more people are trying specialty coffee, coffee which is delicate and sweet without needing sugar, far away from the bitter tinted which are sold on the streets which are cheap coffee, a mix of lower quality pasilla beans and imported robusta
Try their pour overs, really delicious coffee. If you like give the Vandals a try. It is like a chemex but with cloth and made of ceramic.

name: Restaurant parking area
description:
We drove to Escudo with our RV. The road is in very good condition (all tarmac). We had more difficulties with the low hanging trees and wires (our height is 3.2m).
We asked a guy in the village and he said we should not park on the parking lot overnight (because of other cars that need to turn). So we stayed on the grass in front of his restaurant. Payed him 30000 per night. 
There is a viewing tower 2 min away (costs 3000$).
The view should be good, but we had lots of fog.

name: Tominé Reservoir
description:
A very beautiful place overseeing the lake. Big flat space, surrounded by lush mountains. There are no neighbors, so it is very quiet and peaceful. 
Fabio, the owner is very friendly and you should contact him before coming to the campsite, so he can arrange opening the gate, as he does not live here. 
There are lots of activities in the area like hiking, biking and paragliding, which you can also arrange with Fabio.
During rainy season the entrance can be difficult if you don’t have a 4x4.
Cost is COP $15.000 pppn.
We love this place!!
Fabio Rodríguez 3132641115

name: Texaco Gas Station
description:
It's a good place to spend one night.  They have bathrooms, but we don't know if it's clean or if they have a shower, as we don't need them.  They have a convenience store.  Attendant was kind to us.  Other trucks also spent the night here, arrived late at night and left very early, but it's normal for a gas station, we didn't bother with that.  We think it was worth it to have slept here, as we feel that the mountains are dangerous to drive at night. Free.
--------------------
É um bom local para passar a noite. Possuem banheiros, mas não sabemos se é limpo ou se possuem ducha para banho, pois não precisamos. Possuem loja de conveniência. Atendente foi gentil conosco. Outros caminhões também passaram a noite aqui, chegaram tarde da noite e saíram bem cedo, mas é o normal de posto de combustível, não nos incomodamos com isso. Achamos que valeu muito termos dormido aqui, pois sentimos que a serra é perigosa para dirigir a noite. Não nos cobraram nada.

name: Balcones de Siatala
description: Bed & Breakfast. A cabin that offers all the comforts with Wi-Fi located in front of the Guavio Reservoir.  A viewpoint that offers an incredible view

name: Maria e Fabio
description: Beautiful safe spot in front of Maira's and Fabio's House directly at the beach. We spent 5 nights there and could use the clean toilet and shower as well as electricity. We paid 20'000/night for two people. They also have rooms for rent. An admirable, very warm and friendly family.

name: Tayrona
description:
Forget the “Mercer” restaurant close by, this is so much better. I had a absolutely delicious almuerzo (el plato del día) for 9k and it included the soup and juice. The two older people running this shop are also very nice 
They do also breakfast from 8am.
This was a tip from Liam, another cyclist staying at the Koala Inn ;)

name: Gas Station Primax
description: A few nights ago I ran out of battery going down the line tunnel.  the workers helped me to protect my camper in their facilities that are close to restaurants, workshops and hotels.  Great service and kindness

name: Posada Campestre el Bejuco
description: Family lodging, multiple rooms, panoramic view of the small city.  Camping Area

name: Mini Market Morita - Gama Bonita
description: Sale of food, toiletries, liquors, technological products and medicines

name: Acalypha hostal
description:
Translation: Quiet place in garden landscape swimming pool

Endroit calme dans jardin paysage piscine

name: Restaurante Parador llanero La Viuda Millonaria
description:
Translation:Between Timana and Pitalito, we find this country restaurant, where they offer typical dishes, a la carte and the specialty meat a la llanera, the food, attention and service are excellent with very good prices, all travelers and tourists are welcome, with the option of camping and lodging, the host Mrs. Sandra will attend you personally more information to WhatsApp +573106982434

Entre Timana y Pitalito, encontramos este restaurante campestre, donde ofrecen platos tipicos, a la carta y la especialidad carne a la llanera, la comida, atencion y servicio son excelentes con muy buenos precios, son bienvenidos todos los viajeros y turistas, con opción de camping y hospedaje, la anfitrióna señora Sandra los atendera personalmente mas información al WhatsApp +573106982434

name: Camping Restaurante La Viuda Millonaria
description:
Translation:Large green areas for campers and campers, it has all the services, a very quiet and safe place, an ideal place to spend a good night and rest, Mrs. Sandra receives travelers with all pleasure, super friendly.,

Amplias zonas verdes para camperistas y campistas, cuenta con todos los servicios, un lugar muy tranquilo y seguro, lugar ideal para pasar una buena noche y descansar, la señora sandra recibe viajeros con todo gusto, super amable

name: Acalypha Hostal
description:
Very nice bungalows (110.000 COP for two, including breakfast) set in a lovely garden, run by an adorable French couple. There is a secure parking lot, no height restrictions and the gate is closed at night.
There’s a small pool and the breakfast is delicious! Homemade French bread and marmalades, fruit from their own garden, fresh juice, coffee and eggs to your liking. 
Owners will give you information on what you can do in the surroundings, like visiting an indigenous village or hikes along the river. 
It is close to the road, which you will hear during the day, but very quiet at night. 
Comfy beds with mosquito nets and strong WiFi in the bungalow.
Highly recommended!

name: Acalypha hostal
description:
Translated:In the middle of nature wooded garden swimming pool secure parking ideal for recharging your batteries hiking along the rio Ancho village Kogui beach la Gaviota

Au milieu de la nature  jardin arboré piscine parking sécurisé idéal pour se ressourcer randonnée le long du rio Ancho village Kogui plage la Gaviota

name: Zeus station shower
description: Zeus station shower! Just before the bridge, at 500m from this point. There is the station Zeus and they had FREE shower. We didn't need gas so we just tip the guy. Clean and 2 different shower.

name: Parqueadero alto verde
description: Parking 3000 one hour, we arrived on Saturday and it was not possible to park on the street. So here it was 3000 per hour so really interesting and lots of place.

name: Pull out gravel
description: Like others said before about this road: it's slow going and only doable with a high clearance vehicle. But the scenery is absolutely amazing! As it started to get dark we were looking for a place to stay overnight. We found this small gravel pit right about 5 meters away from the road.

name: casa del viajero, Yeimy
description: resting place for every traveler, pleasant reception, kitchen, shower and comfortable bed. --- lugar de descanso para todo viajero, grato recibimiento cocina ducha y cama confortable.

name: Caño Cristales Tour -Agencia de Viajas y Turismo
description:
We did the Caño Cristales tour with this agency and were very happy. We paid 370'000 COP per person for a full day tour incl. everything (e.g. park fees), which was a good price comparatively. You can also ask for an English guide. Groups are max. 7 persons. You can contact Doris, the manager under the following number: +573134996038. 

You can also sleep at the hotel here (80k COP for a double room), but we opted for one 2 blocks further: Posada los Cristales: Clean, 50k COP per room, A/C, dogfriendly, place for one high rig in the roofed shelter.

name: Road No. 30 Neiva-San Vicente
description:
As it was not clear whether this road (No.30) from Neiva to San Vicente can be taken (our friends took the long detour over Florencia for example) I set a pin here: Yes you can take the road, we had about 7 hours, high clearance recommended. It is very scenic (giant waterfalls next to it for example) but steep and in bad condition and there is a toll of 5k COP in contrast to the other one (Road No. 65 over Florencia). It is less busy, some houses of some villages are all marked with FARC markings but the military is also present. On the way out we took the route over Florencia to the main road 45 which took us about the same amount of time or a little bit less and which was in better condition.

I would still take the No. 30 if approaching from the North as you save the drive from Neiva to Altamira.

name: Main Square Altamira
description: Good option for a night if its getting late. Free parking at the main square, seems safe, directly opposite a municipal building and in the street next to it leading to the square is the police located. There are some cameras. Public wifi, for the rest no facilities. Spent a calm night here.

name: Recinto del Pensamiento
description: Beautiful campground in the middle of the forest. There is also a mariposario, humble bird sanctuary and great forest and garden. Perfect place very close to the city of Manizales. Access to very clean toilets and hot showers. Full 4G Claro coverage. Water available.

name: another nice Terpel
description: Terpel about 5km from Florencia. small mechanic shop on site. not many over night truckers and the road quiets down after 8. restaurant with decent typical food and beer that let us bring our dogs in. 2 bathrooms, it's to the right and down the ramp of the sign visible from the parking lot. no seats... but there is a pipe coming out of the wall, which seems typical of this area, for a decent cold shower. there is a water spigot with potable water down in this lower area you can fill from. there is apparently a hotel in site, but did not inquire. stayed in the lot off to the side door free.

name: Finca Agroturística
description:
A hidden gem, a gorgeous place to camp. You’re surrounded by nature and animals, right next to two rivers on a big grassy spot with a lot of trees for shade. Very friendly people managing the finca. Very quiet and peaceful night, waking up to the sounds of the goats. Price is only 1000 (!) pesos per person per night.

They also offer food, have a little tienda, and offer horseback riding. You can swim in the river (the quebrada). Baños and showers available, but we did not check them out.

Plenty of space for several rigs and big rig friendly. Road is paved (with a lot of potholes) until you reach Rio Suarez, from there dirt road but doable for any vehicle. 

Highly recommended!

name: multigas de colombia
description:
gas company with 4 delivery trucks. I was in playa hawai for a campervan meeting. a truck that fill a gas tank in the restaurant of this company accept to fill my 2 US 20 lbs bottle. Also they filled a US type RV with fixed gas tank 
call them at 3103445393 to locate a truck. this company is based in Ibagué.

name: Terpel gas station very quiet close to Medellín
description: this Terpel station is a safe place overnight. the owner like overlanding. no trucks park here at night. it s close to Medellín with a bus. there is a D1 supermarket close by

name: Italian pizza
description: this little place is owned and operated by an Italian expat who makes authentic Italian style wood fired pizza. 15c for a personal and 25c for a family size. the small was at close to 15 inches across and easily filled me up. beers for 4.5c

name: Posada Los Cristales
description: we stayed here during our stay in this town because they let us bring our dogs inside. 50k per night for 2 adults and 2 dogs. cash only and there isn't an ATM in this town. nice newer looking rooms with AC. new memory foam mattress were very comfortable! they have a parking area for 1 vehicle no height or width requirements but probably no longer then 7 meters would fit without poking out into the street. it's not secured but at least it's off the street. we parked our van right in front of the hotel without any issue.

name: Street Parking
description: We slept in this end road for 3 nights, it was quiet. We slept at the end of the road (we even left the car there and went to the city to eat). Locals say it is safe.

name: Escuela Herbolaria
description:
Parking on the street is allowed safely for motorhomes and there is a room for rent, with bathroom services, laundry and water for refilling. Good Wi-Fi. In addition, medicinal plant extraction processes can be viewed with residents at the Herbal School.
.....
Se permite  el Parqueo  en la calle de forma segura para MotorHome y hay una habitación para rentar, con servicios de baño, lavandería y agua para recarga. Buen wifi. Además se pueden compartir con los residentes,  procesos de extracción de plantas medicinales en la Escuela Herbolaria.

name: Eco Parque Santa Rosita
description:
Great spot for camping, very beautiful and quiet (even on the weekend), right next to the river. The further you drive up, the more beautiful the places get. Very friendly people, ask for Carlos.

There is a little tienda, you can swim in the river. Big rig friendly. There are toilets and showers.

10000 pesos per vehicle per night. Follow the (easy) dirt road till the end, you’ll see the orange gate. Doable for any vehicle. Great for tent camping as well.
.....
Edit Sep 2022: You need to take the smaller-looking road to the south. See check-in below.

name: La plazuela - Cáqueza
description: Nice place to spend the night away from the highway and the noise.. Public WiFi and GYM and a nearby mini market

name: Posada Jasmina Place
description:
Jasmina is very attentive and makes you feel at home, the place is new and well cared for. The rooms are comfortable and clean. I paid $100,000/night including breakfast.
---
Jasmina es muy atenta y lo hace sentir a uno como en casa, el lugar está nuevo y bien cuidado. Las habitaciones son cómodas y limpias. Pagué $100.000/ noche incluyendo desayuno.

name: Near to Polideportivo
description:
Very quiet and safe place.  Near to the Polideportivo. One block above the market square.

Lugar muy tranquilo y seguro. Cerca de Polideportivo. Una cuadra arriba de la plaza de mercado

name: Los Cristales
description:
The arrival in Bogotá will take me very late and they have allowed me to have my vehicle safe inside a farm next to the Cristales hotel, owner Mr. Orlando Arroyave, everything very safe, I have slept inside my vehicle, the very kind owner has offered me the bathroom to take a shower and the next day continue my journey.
----
Me tomara muy tarde la llegada a Bogotá y me han permitido tener mi vehículo seguro dentro de una finca contigua al hotel cristales, propietario señor Orlando Arroyave, todo muy seguro, he dormido dentro de mi vehículo, el propietario muy amable me ha ofrecido el baño para tomar una ducha y al día siguiente continue mi viaje.

name: Restaurante Botalon
description:
Giant place where you can park your vehicle and sleep in it paying 5,000 Colombian pesos (1.5 USD), there is also a room for 25,000 Colombian pesos (6 USD), includes parking
----
Gigante lugar donde pueder estacionar tu vehículo y dormir en él pagando 5.000 pesos Colombianos (1.5 USD), También hay habitación por 25.000 pesos Colombianos (6 USD), incluye parking

name: Wild camping (Caracoli) next to rio
description:
From the dirt road you’ll see a giant sign “CARACOLI” and a small road on your right. There is a parking lot here for people who drives a van or a car next to what seems to be an abandoned chill area. We went a little bit further down with our bikes and set up camp next the rio. 
Although, we put the tent and the bike in the little path (on the right when you go down) instead of right next to the rio, because it rained really hard and we thought the level might get higher during the night. 
We saw no one, and no one asked us for anything. If you parked in the lot, someone might come, although I am not sure. 
Sand flies of course, but incense works pretty well.

name: parqueadero en santa fe de Antioquia
description: free big parking in Santa Fe de Antioquia, Little bit noisy for the road, but in the night is quiet.

name: La cascada
description:
only for 4x4
A beautiful place next to the river and waterfalls! Spectacular to relax
-------
Solo para 4x4 
Un lugar hermoso al lado del rio y cascadas! Espectacular para relajarse 

Alexandra  3113156440

name: Rapsodia Hostel Villa
description: It is a quiet and very clean place, it has a fairly wide entrance, hot water, it is inside the town but traffic jams are avoided. It has mechanical workshops and tire shops nearby.

name: Parking lot with excellent views
description: Parking lot with excellent views, safe and quiet for a night

name: Calle 63b
description: The entrance to Calle 63b, which is lined with motorcycle parts dealers and repair shops. The best place to start if you’re hunting down parts.

name: Mirador Alto de la Cruz Sevilla Valle
description: Nice and safe site. calm, in a parking lot .3m by night. Nice landscape. Gate with 2,5m height.

name: Taganga Laundry
description: Paid 5000/kg, brought our laundry in the afternoon and retreived it a day later.

name: plaza puerto Lleras
description: Nice place to spend the night away from the road.

name: Mirador de los Nogales
description:
El Mirador is an interesting tourist spot, where you can see the entire city of Barranquilla, from here you can enjoy a lot of the sunset, visiting mainly places to pass a pleasant mouse and at night, too, some people selling drinks and sweets. You are allowed to walk with pets and to park in front of the park to walk through the night and it is very safe.
---
El Mirador es un punto turístico interesante,  pues se puede ver toda la ciudad de Barranquilla,  desde aquí se disfruta mucho el atardecer,  llegan principalmente parejas para pasar un rato agradable y por la noche también llegan algunas personas a vender bebidas y dulces. Es permitido el paseo con mascotas y estacionar frente al parque para pasar la noche y es muy seguro.

name: Parque Mirador Lago del Cisne
description:
It is a beautiful park located next to Lago del Cisne. Usually. The guards ask the public to leave the place at 6 pm, without authorization, they allow the guests to stay here for free.
---
Es un hermoso parque ubicado junto al Lago del Cisne. Normalmente. Los vigilantes le piden al público que se retire del lugar a las 6 pm,  sin embargo si se pide autorización, ellos permiten que los viejeros se queden a dormir aquí de forma gratuita.

name: Parque Venezuela
description:
You will need to add a Colombian phone number and register, but it is free Wifi and with a good signal.
---
Necesitarás agregar un numero de teléfono colombiano y registrarte,  pero es Wifi gratuito y con buena señal.

name: EDS.Santiago
description:
it is the last station of the town, very small but right next to it they have parking space. Talking to the manager, he allowed us to spend the night and left the bathrooms open for us. we had a very quiet night
---
es la última estación del pueblo, muy pequeña pero justo al lado tienen espacio de estacionamiento. hablando con el encargado nos permitió pasar la noche y nos dejó abiertos los baños. pasamos una noche muy tranquila

name: Aqua lavanderia autoservicio
description: Here autoservicio is possible. Be careful its closed between 12h-14h but we clean it and went back to dry it. We had for 36 500 pesos for like 8kg, it's by pieces too.

name: Primax
description: Large parking lot, clean bathroom. Arrived late.  We asked to stay and they told us that there was no problem. the next day they charged us 5,000 for the night. A lot of traffic.

name: public área with roof and bathroom
description: this is a public área with chairs and tables make for the people stop by take a rest eat in here and go to the toilet, also next is a nurse office, here you can park  for the night, and for sure camp in here, we are bicycle travelers spending the night here safe and  protect by the rain and sun

name: Burata Haus
description:
This is a family owned complex that is being developed for tourism, up to date it has three cabins of different sizes and prices. We arrived at this sector looking for tranquility on the outskirts of  town where wey could set our tent and Camp for a couple of nights. We were welcomed to use a large flat and green area with no height restrictions. 
They are happy now to receive overlanders. They have a large flat and green space, with no height limit , any rigs sizes welcome. The road is not paved but is very well maintained even for small cars.  facilities are bathroom, shower, kitchen and other common areas that can be used. the host Ramon is very friendly and attentive. They charged us $20,000 pesos per person per night. Although it is the first time they have received overlanders, they are enthusiastic about the idea and plan to continue developing specific facilities for this area of ​​the farm. so each visit helps to make this place better and better. For reservations, inform Ramon prior your arrival +57 3188164284 If you want a more luxurious and private stay.

name: Parqueadero Ortiz
description:
Next to the Terpel service station. It costs 5,000 a night. the place is safe, quiet, surrounded by nature

Español
al lado de la estación de servicio Terpel. cuesta 5.000 la noche. el lugar es seguro, tranquilo, rodeado de naturaleza

name: RUTA 23 Moto and bike repair
description:
I'll help you with a mechanical problem!

I offer you accommodation! 

FREE !!

name: Texaco Gas Station
description:
New gas station in a region where it is not so easy to find fuel. Also, they have "gasolina plus" and diesel with techron (meaning: it has an additive that makes a little better than regular diesel where sulfur levels are high).

First we asked for water (another thing not so easy to find around here) and they showed us a tap where we could fill the water tank.

Nice people working there.

name: Parqueadero Luxury. Safe and Cheap.
description: Parking lot with bathroom and an improvised shower. We talked to the man in charge (Omar) and let us stay the night for 10.000 COP. safe and cheap.

name: Conflict zone
description: As soon as we arrived authorities came. They were just worried about who we were. After realizing we are travelers they said this is still a conflict zone, it's not safe to be here. It was about to be dark so we had no choice but to stay overnight close to the police. The next morning we just left. It doesn't even worth it the drive, there is nothing to see on the way and the dirt road is still in really bad conditions; they are just starting to build a new road.

name: Fabrica de Ríos
description: It is a GLAMPING site, located in a spectacular viewpoint from where you can see the Nevado del Ruiz, Nevado Santa Isabel, the city of Manizalez, Riosucio, Pereira (if the fog allows it)

name: Parque Central de San Angel,  Magdalena
description:
San Angel is a small town lost in the middle of nowhere, but just like we got here by accident, the town and its people are very warm, if you can park and walk through the night in any street, for example at rededor del parque en donde hay seguridad, Wifi and servicios sanitarios.
San Angel es una pequeño pueblo perdido en medio de la nada, pero si al igual que nosotros llega hasta aquí por accidente,  el pueblo y su gente son muy cálidos,  se puede estacionar y pasar la noche casi en cualquier calle,  por ejemplo al rededor del parque en donde hay seguridad, Wifi y servicios sanitarios.

name: Cascada El Mohan
description: Amazing spot near a cascade inside a cavern. Run by a super nice family. Open only on weekends. 5000 cop to visit + 10000 cop to camp. Accessible by car but the road is 1- 2 km in dirt road. Food is reaaaaally good. Quiet. There is no one after 5pm. No wifi but 4g connection is good.

name: Restaurante Campestre - Mi Pequeña Alemania
description:
Nice restaurant offers typical german food (Schweinehaxe, Rindergulasch, Apfelkuchen). Entertainment by Otmar Gutmann with german folk music (from Heino to Rammstein).
The restaurant is placed on a rock next to a river with wonderful view to the natural forest.
We enjoyed food and Otmars hospitality.

Open on Saturday and Sunday. Also on holiday Monday. 12:00 - 21:00 h

name: Tuku Ecopart
description: we are a beautiful farm that offers lodging service in a comfortable room with private bathroom and in a campsite with good lighting and fully equipped bathrooms, we have a river nearby, viewpoints, lagoons and many hammocks

name: Hotel Puerta al Llano
description: New hotel with A/C, private bath, flat screen TV, strong wifi & secure off-street parking. COP140,000 for a double.

name: Beach on the lake
description: Very nice and quiet spot on the lake. There is a family at 100m who are really nice and gave us the thumbs up to stay here. The access is okay by car but a little bumpy until +/- 50m before the beach (we came cycling so we didn't really pay attention). We were lucky to have little wind so the mosquitos weren't a problem but it could be. You can swim but the rocks are slippery. 4g signal okay. Amazing view on the sunset ! You may wake up with cows around your tent ^^

name: Access to the lake
description: +/- 300m from the road. Nice spot with an access for fishermen to the lake + a hidden space perfect for camping. Please note road is currently not accessible by car because rocks have fallen and block the access at +/-100m from the road. You can go through by foot or with bicycles. No one here - even on weekends. You can hear the road but not too much. 4g signal okay.

name: Brisas de Mirthayu
description:
a very nice house with an amazing viewpoint, the owner is very friendly. We paid 10,000 per person.
.....
una casa muy bonita con un mirador alucinante, la dueña es muy amable
 pagamos 10.000 por persona

name: Hotel Parque 97 Suites
description: Great value for a full-service hotel. US40.00 for a double with above-average breakfast. Luxury rooms with secure parking for large rigs. One of the better neighborhoods in town

name: Finca Paraiso
description:
Free parking. it is about 30 minutes down an uncovered road but in good condition (we did it with a bus). On the farm there is a spa with waterfalls (entrance 5000 per person) and the parking is free and very quiet in the middle of nature. There is also a restaurant and cabins but I didn't try them. There is no phone line. Very nice! To get there: passing the bridge of the dam on the right there is a police CAI.  From there, the uncovered road begins for half an hour, more or less.
.....
free parking. queda a unos 30 minutos por un camino destapado pero en buenas condiciones (lo hicimos con un bus) en la finca hay un balneario con cascadas (entrada 5000 por persona) y el parking es gratis y muy tranquilo al medio de la naturaleza. Hay también restaurante y cabañas pero no los probé. No hay línea telefonica. Muy lindo! Para llegar: pasando el puente de la represa a la derecha hay un CAI de la policía ahí empieza el camino destapado de media hora más o meno.

name: EL TABLAZO 5M7M+4J Riofrío, Valle del Cauca
description:
Quiet camping contact number +57 322 5078031 It has: bathroom with shower, electricity, large green areas, river, parking area. for two people they charged us $30,000 approximately $7 dollars
Camping tranquilo numero de contacto +57 322 5078031 Tiene: baño con ducha, electricidad, amplias zonas verdes, río, zona de parqueo. por dos personas nos cobraron $30.000 aproximadamente $7 dólares

name: La casa el Caballo
description: A place in case you have nowhere to go.  Although it is written as a camping zone, the place does not have basic conditions for camping.  The owner first wanted to charge me 30,000, and when I said that it was a lot, she reduced it to 20,000. Realistically, the price is 15,000. Shower and toilet in the owner's house.  It is very noisy from the highway, trucks rumble all night.  There are also 3-4 roosters that are very loud.  The village itself is very nice.

name: Hostal Finca Cardonales
description: Excellent hotel-style farm lodging. Beautiful views of town. Short walk to main square but avoids noise & traffic. Secure parking. No height restrictions but tight turns may be difficult for larger rigs. USD 30.00 for a large single with private bath, fast wifi, flat screen TV and hot water. Private, outdoor seating area for each room.

name: Casa hotel real cabañas
description:
nice place to stay for any kind of rig, friendly people and safe.
around 20.000 per rv

name: Lavandería Lavonet
description:
In front of Domino's Pizza.
They charge COP$6500 per Kg.
Good service.
Cel: 3206878166

name: Terpel petrol station
description:
Bare new Terpel petrol station with tiny grocery shop (milk, coffee, bread, yogurt, ...) and columbian fast food. 

Potable water next gas stalls.

name: Taller de COCINA
description:
Cooking workshop
15.000 pp from Monday to Friday -11,30 h to 15 h.
Recomendable

ESCUELA DE COCINA
15.000 pp. Abierto de lunes a viernes de 11,30 a 15 h.
Recomendable

name: San Antonio
description:
This is a new campsite designated for Overlanders. The owner is super friendly, welcoming and communicative. Located in a beautiful valley with amazing views. Only an hour away from Bogota. Clean toilets, showers and a great communal kitchen. We stayed here while “commuting” to experience Bogota and the surrounding area. 
Ana’s number: +573212042388

name: Reserva El Bosque
description:
Very nice campsite with permanent view of the lake from every spot. 
Showers and bathrooms available for campers no cost. 
Plenty of room to camp and hike. 
Offer some other activities. (slack lines, kayak, wall climbing lessons, guided tours, trail rides,  and more)
Wood cooking  spots available.
Pet Friendly.

name: el gualilo
description: the rain was pouring. the night was coming. we found this parador with a quite inclined parking and a nice tienda. we spent the evening and decided to stay for the night. very friendly people. there is banos that we can use. noisy early morning

name: Hotel Balcones del Oriente
description:
Dirt parking in front of the hotel. Asked the owner if we could stay for the night. We parked along the swimming pool, the only flat space.
A little bar opens very late an trucks stop there for a drink. It was a sunday night and loud music was on until 1 am.
Anyway, there were not many opportunities  on our way from Zapaquira to Medellin. We stayed for free.

name: Parqueadero
description:
Big dirt  parking lot for cars, trucks and buses. Asked if we could spend the night in our camper; First the man said he had to ask " el dueno" but after a few minutes told us that we could stay and only asked for 8000 cop for one night. arrived at 5 pm and left after visiting the historical center at 2 pm.
Quiet night.

name: Hôtel Karol
description: We wanted to camp at Hoyo del aire, but it rained pretty bad so we went on a hunt for a hotel to spend the night. We found this nice one in La Paz. 45 000 for a double room. Very nice room, clean, hot shower ( super nice bathroom ).

name: Parque La 65
description:
It is very close to the entrance to the city of Medellín. We parked in our van on the street, in front of some apartments, where they kindly provided us with water, laundry, Wifi and even invited us to bathe in their house.
---
Está muy cerca de la entrada de la ciudad de Medellín. Nosotros estacionamos nuestra van en la calle, frente a unos apartamentos, donde los vecinos amablemente nos ofrecieron agua, lavar ropa, Wifi y hasta nos invitaron a bañarnos en su casa.

name: Thysqua Refugio
description:
Amazing place with a view of the Cascade. Owned by a nice couple, they offered camping for 20 000 pesos, and cabañas for 85 000 for two people. We did both, the cabañas are really comfy, clean and the view is breath taking. For camping, there is a palapa to camp under, bathrooms and showers next to it.
There is a rough spot on the road to get here, not sure a regular car can get through but we had no problem with our bikes. The owner said they will build a bridge soon.

name: Lanas
description:
large space for parking Large Vehicle
gran espacio para estacionamiento de vehículos grandes

name: parador de la gallina
description: Arrived after dark, got some food, which filled a void, could park for the night for free, road not very busy during night, baños only open throughout opening hours of the resto.

name: Gasolinera Terpel
description:
We asked permission to sleep on a Tuesday, there was some noise but we managed to rest very well. The boys at the firestation allowed us to stay and when the police arrived to ask what we were doing there was no problem. It is next to the Florida Shopping Center.
.....
Pedimos permiso para dormir un martes, hubo algo de ruido pero logramos descansar muy bien. Los muchachos de la bomba nos autorizaron quedarnos y cuando llegó la Policía a preguntar que hacíamos no hubo ningún problema. Está a un costado del Centro Comercial Florida.

name: Beside Road
description: Not the fanciest, but a convenient spot if you’re in need of a place to spend the night. It’s an established campground with cabañas, a pool, and grass to set up your tent. It’s pretty dirty, the bathroom and shower are not great, but the guy working there, Daniel, is very very nice. There is a kitchen available on site as well. We paid 20 000 for two persons to set up our tent next to the chickens, but I am not going to lie, after thinking about it we figured it would have been best to keep going to the next camping spot 7km away.

name: Parqueadero Berlinas
description:
Parqueadero Berlinas - 25.000 COP - SHOWERS

Very nice parking lot, there's no height limit but it's not recommended for big rigs. You have to talk to the owner (Alex, very friendly) for the wifi and showers. He also rents small rooms (again, talk to Alex or Denis). Highly recommended.

name: sleep with sea view
description: I came here by bicycle with my dog. They let me spend a night camping on the terrace if I bought lunch here. It was much cheaper than paying for a hostel.

name: Collection point for milk
description: Fantastic view at 4000 meters at the milk collection point.  Costs 10,000 Colombian pesos

name: road closed until 12/2022
description: road closed due to construction work until december 2022! Road to steep for big rigs like our bus to go back up. HD to take very small pathes to go down with the help of a construction worker.

name: duncan
description: changed batteries here, effectivo is rey!

name: @Nuwabirdlife
description: We offer bird-watching activities, hiking, waterfall.  With the best experiences, with a professional guide expert in birds and nature.

name: Taller Vallejo
description: On our way from Bogota to Salento we had trouble with the breaks of our van. We found this mechanic on Google. He helped us immediatley and the pricing seemed fair to us.

name: Parquedero at Hotel el Milagro
description: A large enclosed gravel lot at the hotel for parking larger rigs. 10 foot tall vehicle no problem. We were traveling to the animal preserve nearby and when we arrived they said that we could not park there and that reservations were needed to take a tour (and they kindly helped us arrange that for the next day as they are volunteers and don’t have a lot of staff). This spot has slow (but available) Wi-Fi  and cellular 4G similar to much of Colombia, spotty. There’s also a single clothes washer they kindly let us use. An un-heated shower (nice temperature anyway) and toilet were also made available. The lot is guarded by two very friendly and well trained dogs. When the policia told our friends it was unsafe to stay in this town we spoke to the police and told them we were going to stay here and they said it was a very good and safe choice. We didn’t feel unsafe in the town, but North Santander still has it’s problems with extranjeros.

name: Primax fuel station
description: Free city water next to area to separate trash and recyclables.  Be sure to get fuel too.

name: Hotel Hontibon
description: Very nice hotel in the center of Pamplona, clean and spatious rooms, good shower and very friendly hosts. Private parking is on the premise, at least for motorcycles but there was also space for cars.

name: Balsas Paraiso natural
description:
If you like a quiet spot and refreshing water, you will find it here! Chill place next to the river with 2 big natural pools, toilet and shower. Pilar and her family are very welcoming - great place to relax.

Drive down the dirt road and cross the bridge, it’s the gate on your left.

Price 6kCOP/person/night

name: Piedra de Marial
description: Very safe place with spectacular views.  Is a place of pilgrimage.  Ideal for exploring the area (piedra Peñal) by car or boat.  Toilets available, but with coins.

name: Bumi cocina natural
description: Excellent new family run veg/vegan restaurant immediately outside of town - easy for parking for us iOverlanders ;) they also sell frozen veg burgers and sauces to go. Really recommend.

name: Cascada El Salado
description:
It is an area to park next to a river coming from the El Salado waterfall. It is totally free and we take the opportunity to bathe, wash the van and fill the water tank. We cooked and there was no problem. The water is fresh and clean. The road is paved, but it is quite steep.
---
Es un área para estacionar junto a un río proveniente de la cascada El Salado. Es totalmente gratuito y nosotros aprovechamos a bañarnos, lavar la van y llenar el tanque de agua. Cocinamos y no hubo ningún inconveniente. El agua es fresca y limpia. La carretera está asfaltada, pero es bastante inclinada.

name: Bigotes - Pizzería Artesanal Alemana
description:
The Cologne Bigote runs an excellent pizzeria with his brother Mike.
There are also German delicacies every Sunday from 9:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. (white sausage with pretzels, bratwurst, Bavarian potato salad, etc.) and of course good German beer. Enjoy it.

You can park here on the side of the road: +4.63321, -74.08795

name: Río Yarumales
description:
There is no bridge here. However, with small vehicles, the Río Yarumales can be crossed with the help of a pontóon.

The road from Vistahermosa to here is not paved. The road is only recommended during the dry season (the more southerly the road is, the worse it is). High ground clearance is helpful.

Note: The original User who poster did not cross here with a 4x4 sprinter. See comment below for video link.

Edit February 2024: Bridge is under construction and should open 20th of March 2024.

name: estacion Petromil
description:
Large gas station, not the nicest but with a very large parking area at the back.  We paid 6000 for the night to the montallantas. away from the noise of the road.
We stayed here  because all the other places that we saw were either closed or too small for our big rig

name: Paralelo Parking
description:
We parked here for three days while staying at a hostel
In downtown Medellin (poblado area). 80K for 24h. It is in the street but there are two people here 24x7

name: El Camping de Niko
description:
It is a beautiful campsite, with direct access to the river, restaurant, large area for tents or campers.
This campground does not exist in Medellin. It is located approx. 200 km to the west! (6.300522,-75.065733).
.....
Es un camping precioso, con acceso directo al río, restaurante, área amplia para carpas o campers.

name: Bioparque Los Ocarros
description: This is a small but very interesting Zoo. You'll get to see regional species like armadillo, tapir, capibara, anaconda, jaguar, cougar, monkeys and birds. Price is 15 000 COP per person (kids pay less). Parking is free and there is space for all kinds of vehicles. Restaurant and bathrooms inside. Very close to Villavicencio

name: Bay Watch
description: We camped for a night on the lifeguard tower, suggested by locals. Quite and safe, great place. Further down, passed the beach, you can find also a big grass area where to camp.

name: camping in an abandoned gas station
description: It's an abandoned gas station, it's not working. I asked the tire lifter if I could stay camping in that place and he told me that there was no problem. He took care of my bike during the night, he was very kind.

name: terrace of the restaurant Lindomar
description: we arrive at a restaurant and ask if we can stay camping on the seashore. They told us that we could camp on the terrace of the restaurant and that the place is very safe and quiet.

name: Quebrada Nueva
description:
Nice location on the village square people are very nice to avoid Friday Saturday Sunday big music at disco not far away.

Buena ubicación en la plaza del pueblo, la gente es muy agradable para evitar los viernes, sábados, domingos, música en la discoteca

name: Juan Jose Rendon Park
description: street next to nice park close to the police station, quiet night, locals said its a super safe town. we spend one night and home officed the next hole day. there is free wifi in the middle of the park. no facilities

name: parking in the street
description: We spent two nights parked in this street with a 7m van, it's safe, quiet, the neighbours are very nice, we asked them for permission to stay.

name: Mirador del Neusa
description: Overview of the entire Neusa Lake. Great place to see the sunset. By car, motorcycle or bicycle.

name: Punto Frenos
description:
Workshop specialized in brakes, suspension and bearings for heavy diesel lines. senor Wilson is the owner. I had a bad rear bearing and they were able to change the part and repair it. It has a large patio and we were able to spend the night here, while we waited for the service to be finished, which ended on Monday.
---
Oficina especializada em freios, suspensão e rolamentos para linha diesel pesada. señor Wilson é o proprietário. tive um rolamento traseiro estragado e eles conseguiram trocar a peça e repará-lo. tem um pátio grande e pudemos passar a noite aqui, enquanto aguardávamos a finalização do serviço que terminou na segunda-feira.

name: Very dangerous spot - don’t stop
description: Very dangerous! Stopped  for 20 seconds here (first place to stop for 20km) and four police motors with seven police/soldiers came to us from all directions (they were not on the road before, they were on some kind of ambush) guns blazing and firmly told us to leave immediately as this place was “muy peligroso” (VERY dangerous). This was 16:30. Don’t stop anywhere outside of a village in this stretch

name: La Posada Monte Real
description: Great place to stay in Vistahermosa. Friendly owner and shop + restaurant right next door.

name: Clusupol Beach
description:
I am Luis Barreto (e-mail: bkslmb@outlook.com), administrator of the Clusupol Becah site, I invite you to enjoy wonderful dream nights in front of our headquarters, where you can park your caravan on a flat site, with the peaceful sound of the waves and the refreshing wind of the sea, it is a pleasant, wonderful and clean place, on the beach of Santa Verónica (Atlántico), located between the cities of Cartagena and Barranquilla. Here you will have the careful attention of nice people, you can use WiFi, request a free cup of coffee when you wake up in the morning and make use of the bathroom, shower, cell phone recharge services; all for $10,000 COP per person (ppn).
---
Soy Luis Barreto (e-mail: bkslmb@outlook.com), administrador del sitio Clusupol Becah, te invito a disfrutar de noches maravillosas de ensueño en frente a nuestra sede, donde podrás aparcar tu caravana en un sitio plano, con el apacible sonido de las olas y el refrescante viento del mar, es un lugar agradable, maravilloso y limpio, en la playa de Santa Verónica (Atlántico), situado entre las ciudades de Cartagena y Barranquilla. Aquí contaras con la atención esmerada de personas agradables, podrás utilizar WiFi, solicitar una taza de café gratis al despertar por la mañana  y hacer uso de los servicios de baño, regadera, recarga de celular; todo por $10.000 COP por persona (ppn).

name: Parquedero by Las Gachas
description: Just a little earlier down the road from the other posted spot on iOverlander for camping in your rig. A mostly sloped lot, but we stayed at the top of the lot in a flat spot for several days. Great views. A little quieter because it’s not right across from the cafe down the road. The owner of the lot is an older woman, grandmother to the young guy who manages the day to day, Jon. He’s an architect trained and worked in Bogota. Came home to run the lot during Covid. He was so generous, and when we said we were going to try and grab a taxi into Guadalupe he volunteered to drive us and show us around, with no pressure. We paid him a small fee for the ride. He brought his little sister along too. He also drove us to show us a couple other places. We paid him 10,000cop a night. Well worth it if you can grab that flat spot at the top of the lot. It’s also a less steep entrance to his lot vs the one down the street. We walked from his place down to the swimming holes in the river.

name: Carnivoros Grill
description: We went here for lunch and got some starters and lemonade. Cheap and good food!

name: Hotel El Endrino
description: Good hotel, clean, hot water, spacious, very friendly staff, free secured parking nearby and restaurants and shops nearby. paid for one person 45.000 Colombian pesos for a night.

name: Taxaco gas station
description:
We were on our way to Bogotá and the gas stations on the way were not allowing us to spend the night, until we found this Texaco gas station.  They authorized us, but charged us 7,000cop.  Parking is a little sloping, but for an overnight stay, it's OK.  They have a hotel and restaurant. 

Estávamos a caminho de Bogotá e os postos de combustível do caminho não estavam nos autorizando a passar a noite, até que encontramos este posto Texaco. Eles nos autorizaram, porém nos cobraram 7.000cop. O estacionamento é um pouco inclinado, mas para passar uma noite, é OK. Possuem hotel e restaurante.

name: Library La Floresta
description:
In the surroundings of the square La Floresta is not a good place to sleep anymore, as the streets are narrow. So for three nights we slept down the street from the library, and on the fourth night we came to sleep in front of the library, because that way we were able to use both the public library space during the day, and use the 24-hour Wi-Fi, as it worked ok inside the motorhome.  The street is not very wide, but for our Renault Master van it was ok, however big rigs can have problems.  At both points we slept we felt very safe and we had no problems with the neighbours. 

Nos arredores da praça La Floresta não é mais um bom lugar para dormir, pois as ruas são estreitas.  Então, por três noites dormimos na rua abaixo da biblioteca, e na quarta noite fomos dormir em frente à biblioteca, porque assim pudemos usar tanto o espaço da biblioteca pública durante o dia quanto usar o Wi-Fi 24hs, pois funcionou bem dentro do motorhome.  A rua não é muito larga, mas para a nossa Van Renault Master estava OK, no entanto grandes motorhomes podem ter problemas.  Nos dois pontos em que dormimos nos sentimos muito seguros e não tivemos problemas com os vizinhos.

name: History Travelers Agency
description:
We did a 3 days and 2 nights tour to Punta Gallinas with this agency, and they allowed us to leave the van parked in front of the agency while we were on the tour.  The tour was amazing, our driver was excellent, the meals were delicious and plentiful, the rooms we stayed in were very good (we chose housing, but there is also the option of chinchorro - hammock).  As we were gone for a few days, we turned off the van's fridge, and Paola (the agency's owner) kept our food for us in her fridge.  She has a room that she rents to guests who will be taking the tour with her agency, and we stayed in this room before leaving for the tour, because it was too hot for us to stay inside the van, the room is very comfortable and the air conditioning worked. perfectly.  We recommend 100%. 

Fizemos um tour de 3 dias e 2 noites para Punta Gallinas com esta agência, e eles nos permitiram deixar a van estacionada na frente da agência enquanto estivemos fazendo o tour. O tour foi incrível, o nosso motorista era excelente, as refeições estavam deliciosas e fartas, os quartos que nos hospedamos eram muito bons (escolhemos habitação, mas também tem a opção de chinchorro - rede). Como ficamos fora por alguns dias, desligamos a geladeira da van, e a Paola(proprietária da agência) guardou pra gente os nossos alimentos na geladeira dela. Ela possui um quarto que aluga para hóspedes que irão fazer o passeio com a agência dela, e nós ficamos neste quarto antes de sair para o tour, porque estava muito quente para ficarmos dentro da van, o quarto é muito confortável e o ar condicionado funcionou perfeitamente. Recomendamos 100%.

name: Jose Epiayu - Camarones
description:
This place is a community of Wayuus Indians, where Jose is the leader.  We had an amazing experience with the locals. Jose saw us passing through town and offered to stay in his community (10,000 COP per night). He also offers a tour to see the flamingos (25,000 COP p/p). Everyone in this family is very kind and receptive, the children are very polite, we like to talk and play with them. The place has a beautiful landscape, but it is a simple place. They don't have running water, but they have energy. If you are open to having an authentic experience, we highly recommend this place. Jose number: +57 321 726 4461


Este local é uma comunidade de índios Wayuus, onde o Jose é o lider. Tivemos uma incrível experiência com os locais. Jose nos viu passando pela cidade e nos ofereceu nos hospedarmos na comunidade dele (10.000 COP p/ night). Ele também oferece tour para ver os flamingos (25.000 COP p/p). Todos da família são muito gentis e receptivos, as crianças são muito educadas, gostamos de conversar e brincar com elas. O local possui uma linda paisagem, mas é um local simples. Não possuem água corrente, mas possuem energia. Se estiver aberto a ter uma experiência autêntica, recomendamos muito este local. Telefone do Jose: +57 321 726 4461

name: safe and quiet spot
description: Quiet, safe parking, there are guards watching the buildings next door, no noise at night, very easy to park (we have a 7m van)

name: coonartax GLP station
description: the only one GLP station in Colombia ! If you have a fix tank you can charge it easely...

name: artiga
description:
Translation:Very nice cafe, with nice food, it is possible to park at night in the street with a mobile home

muy bonito café, con bonita comida, es posible de se quedar parquear por la noche en la calle con una casa rodante

name: Arma
description:
Small parking lot on the church square arrive before 5 p.m. because after you took yourself, they are very nice
El pequeño estacionamiento en la plaza de la iglesia llega antes de las 5 p.m. porque después de que te tomaste, son muy agradables

name: parador y hospedaje
description:
it got dark when we came here. nice restaurant with great mountain view. we asked if we could camp in our bus overnight if we eat dinner and they were okay with it. they have hotel rooms as well.
good unexpensive food, toilets outside available.

name: diagnosticar Alejandro constain
description:
We had a problem with our transmission leaving Popayan. They recommended Don Alejandro to us and he is a very honest and correct person in his work. Very helpful. RECOMMENDED

Español
Tuvimos un problema con nuestra transmisión saliendo de Popayán. Nos recomendaron a don Alejandro y es una persona muy honesta y correcta en su trabajo. Muy servicial. RECOMENDADO

name: Hotel del Prado - In Front of Pizzeria
description:
Parking in front of commercial premises across the street from the pizzeria of the hotel del Prado. level floor. No amenities. Pedestrian flow between 7:30 p.m. to 12:00 a.m. Commercial premises open at 7 a.m. from Monday to Saturday. There is no water or electricity service. Garbage dump less than 100 steps on the corner of the Mall.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Parqueadero frente a locales comerciales cruzando la calle de la pizeria del hotel del prado. Piso nivelado. No comodidades. Flujo de peatones entre las 7:30 p.m hasta las 12:00 a.m. Locales comerciales abren a las 7 a.m de lunes a Sabados. No hay Servicio de agua o electricidad. Basurero a menos de 100 pasos en la esquina del Mall.

name: In Front of the Beach - Puerto Colombia
description:
On the Highway - Malecón Puerto Colombia there are parking lots for vehicles on the left side of the road. Free of charge, in front of the beach of Puerto Colombia. Level ground, no rubbish. Vehicle flows until 6:30 p.m. from Monday to Sunday. Access to the beach from 5:30 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. Fine for people who enter the beach outside these hours. Multiple houses around, hostel less than 100 meters. A good spot to spend the night, with lighting and surveillance cameras. The police make rounds at night to verify that everything is alright.
---------------------------------------
Sobre la Carretera - Malecón Puerto Colombia se encuentran parqueaderos destinados para vehículos del lado Izquierdo de la vía. Sin cobro, frente a la playa de Puerto Colombia. Terreno nivelado, sin basuras. Flujo vehicular hasta las 6:30 p.m de Lunes a domingo. Acceso a la playa desde las 5:30 a.m hasta las 6:00p.m Multa para personas que ingresen fuera de ese horario a la playa. Múltiples casas al rededor, hostal a menos de 100 metros. Buen punto para pasar la noche, con iluminación y cámaras de vigilancia. Los policías hacen rondas en la noche para verificar que todo este bien.

name: Puerto Colombia Toll
description:
Puerto Colombia Toll- Via Cartagena / Barranquilla.
Service point, store, restrooms, parking lots, rest area.
----------------------------
Peaje Puerto Colombia- Via Cartagena / Barranquilla.
Punto de Servicio, tienda, Baños, Parqueaderos, Zona de Descanso.

name: Car Park Camping
description:
Park with vehicle parking on the road, a small bay to park without disturbing passers-by. level area. At night many vehicles are parked to spend the night. Enough space for cars, medium campers, trucks, vans, and vans. There is no room for large trailers. Park with green areas, basketball court, and exercise area. pet-friendly Water is available around the corner of minimarket. There are no nearby toilets or showers. Surrounded by houses and shops. Close to Hospital Zone and clinics.

-----
Parque con parqueadero vehicular en la vía, pequeña bahía para estacionar sin molestar a los transeúntes.  Zona nivelada. De noche se parquean muchos vehículos para pasar la noche. Espacio suficiente para Carros, campers medianos, camionetas, furgonetas, vans. No hay espacio para Trailers grandes. Parque con zonas verdes, cancha de basketball, zona de ejerció. Pet Friendly. Agua disponible en la casa del agua doblando la esquina de la tienda. No hay baños cerca o duchas. Rodeado de viviendas y comercio. Cercano a Zona Hospitalaria y clínicas.

name: Em Frente à Praia - Puerto Colombia
description:
Camping in vehicles in front of the beach. On the Puerto Colombia boardwalk in the area designated for parking, level ground, without garbage, close to the beach and surrounding homes. Vehicle flows until 6:30 p.m. from Monday to Friday, Saturdays until 9:00 p.m., Good lighting, and access to the beach from 5 a.m. to 6 p.m., after this they may incur a fine. Police patrol from time to time.
Car camping in front of the beach.
-----
Acampar en vehiculos frente a la playa. Sobre la via malecon de puerto Colombia en la zona designada para parqueadero, terreno nivelado, sin basuras, cerca a la playa y viviendas aledañas. Flujo vehicular hasta las 6:30 p.m de lunes a viernes, Sabados hasta las 9:00 p.m, Buena iluminación, Acceso a la playa desde las 5 a.m hasta las 6 p.m, posterior a esto pueden incurrir en multa. Patrulla de policias cada cierto tiempo.

name: Muelle  de Puerto Colombia
description:
The Puerto Colombia dock is a structure located in the municipality of Puerto Colombia, Atlántico, Colombia. Between 1893 and 1936 it served as Barranquilla's maritime terminal for the loading and unloading of goods and people, and until the 1920s it was considered the most important seaport in Colombia. Currently remodeled as a tourist attraction with a 300-meter pedestrian pier, plaza and restaurants on the outskirts.
----
El muelle de Puerto Colombia es una estructura ubicada en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, Atlántico, Colombia. Entre 1893 y 1936 funcionó como terminal marítimo de Barranquilla para el embarque y desembarque de mercancías y personas, y hasta los años 1920 fue considerado el más importante puerto marítimo de Colombia. Actualmente remodelada como atracción turistica con un muelle de 300 mts peatonales, plaza y restaurantes a las afueras.

name: Los piñares
description:
Nice campground with baños and cold showers. A little pricey ( 25k pp) for the amenities, but Ciro who runs the place is really nice. No kitchen available to cook your own meal but there’s a restaurant. 
They also offer cabañas for 180 000 which have hot showers.

name: parking of the chiflas restaurant
description: this guy from the national park didn't allow us to stay overnight we then drove back a couple of kilometers to land here, which is to my eyes a much better option: stunning view, Wi-Fi, toilets, running water, and all services

name: Estación petrodecol
description:
We arrived very late and spent the night here.  It is very quiet, there is plenty of parking and the people are very friendly.  Has a bathrom.
---
