Llegamos muy tarde y Pasamos la noche aquí. es muy tranquilo, hay mucho lugar para estacionar y las personas son muy amables. Tiene baño.

name: Reserva Rio Ñambi
description: Roadside. It was raining and getting dark, so we asked the very friendly ladies of the house to let us stay in their open yard, which they readily allowed us to. Some traffic during the night.  Entrance to the reserve (pedestrian!) right across the road, a small parking lot a few meters further uphill, but we felt safer in front of the house.

name: Hostal La Minita de Oro
description: Nice small and secure hostal in the center, but just out of the noisy blocks (walking distance 2 blocks). Hosts show good sense of hospitality. Rooms are large and clean, private bathroom. I paid about 63.000 pesos per night. Breakfast included. Secure parking one block away: 10.000 pesos for motorcycle per day.

name: Casa Aparicio Lopez
description: This is a beautiful casa and on arrival you are welcomed by the family. They provide you with all the information you want. Rooms are clean, breakfast is included and they have their own secured parking lot. In the centre of Barichara. Paid 80.000 pesos for a double room.

name: La Julita Parqueadero
description:
Ample parking located in a great neighborhood next to a shopping center and the cable car station that takes you to the center. There is water and a clean bathroom. Alberto is the manager (very kind) 3134801714. 

Oct/23 price is COP $12.000 per 12h (Day or night) or COP $24.000 complete day.
---
estacionamento amplo situado em um ótimo bairro ao lado de um centro comercial e da estação do teleférico que leva até o centro. tem água e banheiro limpo. Alberto é o administrador (muito amável) 3134801714. nos cobrou $10.000, pela noite. o preço normal custa $2.000, hora. passamos uma noite.

Atualização Outubro/23 - preço por turno COP $12.000 (dia ou noite)

name: Necocli
description:
Small parking lot in the noisy library parking lot until 10:30 in the evening but otherwise it's safe.
Pequeño estacionamiento en el ruidoso estacionamiento de la biblioteca hasta las 10:30 de la noche, pero por lo demás es seguro.

name: Road from Salento to Cajamarca
description: I put this warning in for people wanting to drive the wax palm dirt road from Salento to Cajamarca. We made it from Salento to Toche today before turning around. The locals in Toche said the road from there to Cajamarca is closed for repairs. No opening date yet. They said there’s another route but said it was for Jeeps only as it was very narrow. If you want to see the valley with the most wax palms you can still drive there, but you’ll have to return to Salento for now. It’s beautiful and totally worth it, but still a slow road. The other way to see the palms would be taking a bike tour or renting a Quad motorcycle in town.

name: El Guadual
description: Cute little restaurant with a waterfall view in back. Pizza and fast food as well as drinks. Really nice new spot.. try it..

name: Jerico’
description: Beautiful well preserved Colonial town surrounded by Coffee plantations. Lots of cheap hotels, restaurants, bars, and shops. Gets a little crowded and noisy on the weekend and holidays so if you like to sleep look for a place off the main plaza. It’s about a 30 minute climb off the main highway, but it’s well worth it even for one night. Enjoy!

name: Estación de servicio diagnosticentro
description:
We stayed one night. The gas station works until 10pm. There is security.
Nos quedamos una noche. La estación de gasolina funciona hasta las 10pm. Queda seguridad.

name: Isla Gorgona (snakeisland, old prison)
description:
National Park where you can explore nature. There is also a padi dive center. Between may and september very good whalewatching. Basic cabins. The old prison  can be visited also. Very interesting.
To get there: we booked a tour starting in Cali, fly to Guapi, 1.5 hrs with a small boat (only mon, wen, fri) to the island. No alcohol or drones, no warm water. A very unique experience.

name: Behind chapel
description: Parked here the night before our hike to paramo del oceta. Right behind the chapel, with amazing view over the canyon.

name: Ecolodge Chunzuá Tuche
description: If you want to do a hike in Paramo de Oceta or stay a couple of days in this beautiful area, this is the place to be! Hard to get here with a car (with 4x4 possible, but they don’t have much parking space - although I am sure Maria will help you out), but perfect for people travelling by motor or bicycle. During COVID Maria worked very very hard to built wonderful ecolodges. She runs this place completely by herself and is trying to improve the region by planting a permaculture garden and cutting the invasive eucalyptus. We got to know her as our guide in Paramo de Oceta (see other post) and she showed us around at her ecolodge after. Her family has lived in the mountains for ages and she tells passionately about the plants, herbs, climate and biosystem, as well as about her fight to protect the area. You get a magnificent view of Peña de Oti, a quiet night in a cozy lodge and a relaxing bath in the hot tub. These kind of projects should be supported, so if you want to visit this beautiful area, I really recommend contacting Maria and staying a couple of days at her lodge. +57 (313) 479-8492

name: María Tours
description: We hiked the Paramo de Oceta with Maria as our guide. Her family has lived here for ages and she knows everything about the region, the plants, herbs and animals. Due to the political situation access to the park is not guaranteed (there are some issues with local farmers who want to use the area for cow farming, but the cows destroy the paramo), so Maria is striving to save guard this precious piece of nature and doing whatever is in her power to restore or protect the paramo. She asks 50.000 COP pp and the tour takes all day. We can highly recommend her! 313 4798492

name: Parqueadero
description: We stayed at a large parqueadero )because the gas station didn't want us for the night). It cost us 10k. music all night ! but probably because we arrived on Friday night.

name: Centro Vacacional Lago Calima
description: The only free spot we could find a bit away from the road, right below the supermarket, two or three level spots with grass. Checked with the employees, very friendly, no problem using the space. Good for a night, quiet, we felt safe here.

name: Campo Alegre
description: Nice camping, with several different levels. Cold swimming pool, river access. Owners were very friendly. We felt better value for money than other options. Wifi available nearer the building. Hook up at sites depending on where you park. Has some seating areas available as well as sinks/bbqs/fire pits. Use maps.me for directions, road not on Google. 20kpp.

name: Camping & Glamping Salento
description: Beautiful campsite for tent camping, or you can rent one of their glamping cabins. Great view of the river and mountains. Quiet area just outside of Salento, great for resting after hiking Valle de cócora. Look for the mini golf course - the campsite is located behind that. We also enjoyed playing a round of mini golf here. The owners were very friendly and helpful!

name: Kataa - Turismo Rural
description:
Kataa-Rural Tourism, is located in the PR36 plus 700 meters, by the Caribbean trunk road via Palomino to Riohacha. Country place to rest and be in contact with nature;  for travelers of the camper culture,  makataa.com @kataa.turismorural to book.
.....
Kataa-Turismo rural, está ubicado en el PR36 mas 700 mts, por la carretera troncal del caribe via Palomino a Riohacha. Lugar campestre para descansar y estar en contacto con la naturaleza;  para viajeros de la cultura camper, en casa rodante. makataa.com o en Instagram @kataa.turismorural  para reservar.

name: Lavado y parquadero Marco
description: We had car trouble and our guide Martha (she also runs a hostel with her husband Alfredo, El Caminante) told us we could park at her parents place. Turns out he also has the perfect place to wash your car and has enough space to fix it or stay a couple of days while you go hiking. It’s behind a closed gate so very save. It’s best to contact Martha via WhatsApp : +57 311 5117363

name: Oak Tree Hostel
description: An excellent and  quiet hostel, 10 minute walk from the centre of Guatapé. Especially the hosts are super hospitable and welcome you wit coffee or tea. For motorcycles is a garage on the property. Not to expensive, paid 100.000 pesos for a double room with hot shower.

name: Susa central park
description:
This central square is very quiet and safe. The police station is right next to it. There are power points and Wifi. It seems enough space to park a vehicle overnight as well (next to where the police parks their cars). 
I have camped with my tent under the shelter at the "stage".
The options for accommodations are sparse and to me also overpriced. I preferred to hang out at this chilly and peaceful square at nighttime.

name: Catedral basilica de Nuestra Senora del Rosario
description:
The highest cathedral in Colombia. You can climb more than 400 steps up to the steeple top where you have 360° stunning view over the city, the nevado and vulcano ruiz (on clear days). The tour is guided and costs 13000 cop p.p, same price for all. 

There is a nice cafe on the second level, reachable with the elevator for free, with nice views and good cafe.

name: Santiago de Tolù
description:
We spent 3 days out of 7 small quiet and safe location
---
Pasamos 3 días de 7 pequeños lugares tranquilos y seguros.

name: Next to the reservoir
description: Lots of space, some is level. 4g claro. Police stopped by to check twice but didn’t say anything. There is a security guard through the gate. Very quiet at night in the week. Free!

name: Hotel Anauco
description: Cute little hotel with a rooftop lounge and kitchen. Cutely decorated and clean and quiet. Just down the street from bars, restaurants, shipping, etc. There’s secure parking across the street if you’re in a smaller vehicle shorter than about 3 meters. There’s also another parqueadero down the street with no height restrictions. A great value for this area at 120 K COP a night with breakfast..

name: MOTUS SAS KAWASAKI - KTM - parts
description: Sharing my good experience at a garage in Bogotá.  I needed some parts urgently and contacted motus within a few hours all the parts arrived at the garage and the team of mechanics started working.  Professional and thorough work.  In addition, there is a large selection of riding equipment and bags and the owners speak good English!  Highly recommend to anyone looking for a place to take care of a motorcycle.

name: ae servicio mecánicos
description: Very competent mechanic, works quickly with reasonable prices. He helped us a lot with the clutch and other problems on our Iveco. You can go there with your eyes closed.

name: Casa Cumbres
description:
A little natural paradise to discover Llanos and have a peaceful break. 
Wonderful family. 8 rooms (with all comfort - private WC, AC, hot water...). Fantastic pool in the middle of native plants, a lot of animals on the property (little lago with caïman, tortuga, fishs, blue iguana, aras...) forest around. Possible to do sendetod écologicos, bord watching... 
Double room with breakfast 315k. worth it!!! 
Possible to come with a van or Motorhome (all you need) but call before to find out if there is enough place (if the b&b is not full, they will receive you very well!!!) Maria Paula +573212407548

name: Chita Hilton
description: 5 stars meadow with shade and river access. Take the road next to the bridge. Great spot to rest near Chita.

name: Old Quarry
description: What looks like an old quarry with a nice view on the valley. Nicely leveled with room for many cars. We spent 2 nights here. Good starting point to hike Laguna Eucas, which is a very nice hike (could park even further up the dirt road eventually).

name: Ciclo Cauca (bike shop)
description: I had a major blowout of my bicycle tire on the road, and this bike shop got me rolling again with a 29 tire. Seems well stocked and skilled mechanics.

name: Somebody tried to enter in the van
description: We didn’t feel safe in the city, so my husband went to see the SOAT and I stayed in the van. Two guys, at 5pm, with people around tried to break in the van. I started to scream and they left. The door was close but if it was open they would probably steal me.

name: El Rosal Park- CarCamping
description:
Car camping next to El Rosal park.  Park with courts, gardens and a small mall with access to restrooms and parking.  Opposite is a non-neighbouring construction.  Around the park there are various residential complexes.  Very quiet area, level floor.  Park suitable for dogs, children and picnics.
----
Car camping al lado del parque El Rosal. Parque con canchas, jardines y pequeño mall con acceso a baños y parqueadero. Frente se encuentra una construcción no vecinos. Al rededor del parque hay diversos conjuntos residenciales. Área muy tranquila, piso nivelado. Parque apto para perros, niños y picnics.

name: Camping en Parque junto a Central Eléctrica.
description:
Park in front of Colegio San Jose and next to Central Eléctrica.  Remote site, without much traffic of private vehicles and motorcycles.  It is better to place a tent away from the road and under the safety of trees and shadows.  Perfect place for car camping while the vehicle is insured.  Transit zone for school entrance until 7:30 a.m. and from 2 p.m. to 3 p.m.
----
Parque frente a Colegió San Jose y Junto a Central Eléctrica. Citio remoto, sin mucho trafico de vehículos particulares y motos. Es mejor colocar carpa lejos de la vía y bajo seguridad de arboles y sombras. Lugar perfecto para car camping mientras se asegure el vehículo. Zona transitada por ingreso escolar hasta las 7:30 a.m y desde las 2 p.m hasta las 3 p.m

name: Parque Centro Internacional del Caribe
description:
International Caribbean Center Park.  Park with vehicular access and parking area.  With pedestrian, ecological trails, sports area, common areas.  In front of the residence complex, next to the Portoazul clinic with an emergency service and parking lot.  In front of recreation center.
 Picnics and car camping are allowed.  Level ground and access to all vehicles.
----
Parque Centro Internacional del Caribe. Parque con acceso vehicular y zona de parqueo. Con senderos peatonales, ecologicos, area de deporte zonas comunes. Frente a conjunto residencia, junto a clinica Portoazul con servicio de Urgencias y parqueadero. Frente a centro recreativo.
Se permite realizar picnics, car camping. Terreno nivelado y acceso a todo vehiculo.

name: Sutatausa church square
description: Quiet and safe place in a small village right next to church and police station. Checked with police, very friendly, allowed us to stay. Level parking with grass, everything very clean, friendly neighbours, too. Access might be a little difficult for big rigs, though, short steep and narrow turn. Small shops and restaurant close by.

name: Hospedaje Aliz
description:
very kind owner, kitchen, Wifi, cozy and comfortable rooms, view of the volcano.
Shower with electric heating, so just warm, but it can be ok if you shower before the night OR you can boil water in the kitchen and mix it in a bucket. The owners are completely fine with that.
They offered to help with transport to the hot springs too.

name: Free parking lot
description:
Free parking near to town center( 20 min walking), easy access, ok for any big rig, basketball playground near, lot of taxis around.
Do not know about safety, but seems to have light, and lots of buildings around.

name: Riverside
description: Nice little spot, although some trash around. Spent the night here. Next to a hostel near the river. a guy is digging some natural pools. it's free-public. No data signal.

name: SUMMIT CARGO - TOURIST ASSISTANCE
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Owner's contribution

We are Logistic company that for years have experience on temporary importation and exportation of tourist vehicles.
We advise on Maritime freight, Customs procedure, Terminal assistance, Insurances, Medical assistance, Mechanic and all related services that the tourists require during their stay in Colombia. 
We look forward to servicing your vehicle.

name: Propangas
description: On the opposite site of the offical gas refill. They refill our US bottle

name: SURAMERICANA Aguamarina
description:
Public parking near Aguamarina condominium. close to several services: market, gas station, greengrocer, restaurants. There are private security guards night and day. Safe and quiet. We stayed 7 days.

-------------------------------------------------

estacionamento público próximo condomínio Aguamarina. próximo de vários serviços: mercado, posto combustível, verdureira, restaurantes. Tem seguranças privado noite e dia. seguro e tranquilo. ficamos 7 dias.

name: Hotel Zeus
description: Typical hotel for this area. The owner was really enthusiastic about bicycle travelers and told me many have stayed here before. 45mil for one person.

name: Nice street in Filandia
description: Filandia is a very nice place to stop! Amazing coffee, colorful streets, good restaurants and friendly people. We felt safe in this small city. We parked for two nights here in the street, left the car during the day to walk around and have no problems. First night we stopped in front of a restaurant called Helena Adentro, and in the other night we parked here. No facilities.

name: Gasolinera La Maria
description: Clean cold showers at this gas station. There is a sign by the door with $1000, but they didn't charge anything.

name: Quebrada piedras blancas
description: outside the principal road ,before the bridge,turn right ,I'm travel on bike put my tent for one night,quiet the people say is safe,

name: Simona del Mar
description: Nice restaurant direct on waterfront Attended by the owner Simona personally Also cabins for rent

name: Cabanas simona Del Mar
description: In a tropic jungle you’ll find these cabins not directly on the border sea but in the jungle with a lot of animals like parrots . Also they have a very good restaurant with seafood

name: quiet street
description: We spent several nights parked at the back of the street, very quiet and safe. Very easy to park with a truck, ours is 7m long. There is a park next door, and the Milan district is a 20 minute walk away.

name: Best rated mechanic in San Gil, speaks fluently English!
description:
We found Andy on google, his 150 4.5/5 star reviews convinced us to text him. After sending him a text he gave us a call soon after and we were very happy to hear he spoke fluently English (first mechanic in South America I guess). He and his father helped us out and gave us many good tips and tricks to prevent future maintenance, we used a couple of hours of their time and he did not charge us for that. Tough we bought some beers to show our appreciation. They are knowledgable and honest people and can help with most cars. We could even use their shower/toilet and sleep in front of their garage (see other post on Ioverlander for more info). Overall super recommendable! 

You can reach Andy on: +57 (316) 271-3781

name: In front of Andy’s workshop. Calm, nice, free. Close to center o
description:
In front of Andy’s garage, safe and close to the center of San Gil. Andy (the English speaking mechanic) offered us to sleep in front of his shop in a calm and quiet neighborhood in San Gil (20 minutes walk to center). Smaller rigs could also park inside his shop! Water/toilet/shower/WiFi/electricity, all is available for free (however a donation is appreciated). Also shops for drinks/food are around the corner. 

Andy was a former tourist guide so knows a lot about area, super helpful! Neighborhood felt super safe and friendly! Overall super recommendable. You can call/whatsapp him: +57 316 271 3781

name: Plaza de las Luces - Gran Malecón
description: Plaza de las Luces - Gran Malecon del Rio

name: Dog Park - Malecon del Rio
description: Dog Park Malecón del Rio, junto a Jardin nativo.

name: réserva natural encanto de guanapalo
description:
very nice réserve, full or animals to discover Llanos landscape and culture. 
contact rancho de Mata Palma or Heiler to make a safari llanero. différents option (canoa, horse riding, walking, 4x4...) wonderfull place lovely people!!!

name: next to a river
description:
nice spot.theres a small tricky bridge to pass but if ur clever and plan upfront can pass it in diagonal no probs.u'll quickly arrive to a clearing almost flat and a suspended bridge.park. coming from Mocoa after a bigger bridge on main road ,turn right ,it s a small dirt road starting behind a house.owner told me to come here.it was a quiet night,but did cross my mind the thought...are these 'mule' tracks ?! i only see 3-5 farmers tho.
note:pls refrain writing "felt safe" on your posts..so naive!

name: Agua Rio
description: nice large grassy area near the river.wifi at the house also has rooms.cycling track..where I ended up driving on..with camper!!😅 some dogs around!20000cop x 1p+camper

name: Casa del Puerto Hostel & Suites
description:
This is a VERY nice place to stay if you are shipping your vehicle from or to Colombia - the DIAN office for signing the papers is in 10 min walking distance, and if you sail from / to Colombia from/ to Panamá, the marina is 3 minutes away. There are shared hostel rooms and also regular hotel rooms, all with en suite bathrooms. Breakfast is included in the price, as is a nice pool. They have a well stocked bar, lunch and dinner are available. There are several sister hostels around town, offering free Spanish classes, Salsa lessons and free coffee all day :-) 
We just walked in and got a free room, booked it for 5 nights. Then we got our camper out of customs 3 days earlier than expected - we parked right in front of the hostel, we were allowed to plug in for electricity and also to fill up our water tank. We didn’t need the last night which was already paid for, so they just deducted the amount from our bill for food and drinks - we will stay here again on our way back to Central America next year, VERY lovely, VERY helpful staff, and a „guard cat“, Señorita Bella.

name: fantastic overlook riverside
description: just a few hundred mt. down a dirt track u ll arrive to a nearly flat short grass spot .sunset-view is fantastic.spent a quiet night here.only a jung guy passed asking where the rd goes? it does go down to the river but is very rough.not worth it.

name: Rancho Llanerazo
description:
El Rancho Llanerazo is a wonderfull and must see place to discover Llanos culture !!! Seudiel is an authentic llanero, proud of their traditions. 
Seudiel and Diana (his wife) welcome you in their beautifull traditional palm house where they make you discover through many activities the Llanos customs. Traditional music, stories, workshop artisania, démonstration of horse riding across the river, very good lunch with home product, walking tour and animals observation, cacao atelier, discover archelogical site...) worst it so much!!! 
you can spend a full day, and/or spend the night in a wonderfull house. 
The road (24km from San Luis) is not easy (better in dry Season) but dodable (we made it in Motorhome). The landscape is very beautifull (différent from the other natural réserve) with lots of animals (so many mono aulladores, caïman, turtles, birds, anaconda, osso hormiguero 
if you prefer you can easely come by boat. 
contact Diana for organise +57 311 8531265
a must to go!!!

name: opposite San Francisc
description: there is a parking lot.I believe is a different owner.not the pools.paid 5000 x night.but I thijk they expect u to use the termas

name: Area de Servicio
description: New and spacious area, 24h attendance (toilets, self-service cafeteria - free coffee, water, etc, courtesy of concesionario!!!) We asked the very friendly staff for permission to stay, since it is a private area and were very welcome. Police came by to check, very courteous, too - place seems really safe! Excellent spot if you are caught by nightfall.

name: The Secret Buddha
description:
The owner of the Eco-lodge, Mariano, allows you to stay in his garden / parking. There is place for 1 or 2 vehicles. You enter by a steep path. 
The whole property is fenced and felt very secure. Mariano can cook like no other and you can have diner or lunch if you want. We stayed 4 nights. Very clean bathroom. Super fast internet. Nice patio to hang out with Mariano’s super cute and friendly dog! 
It is a perfect and save place to leave your vehicle while you go into the center of Medellin, metro is 5 minutes by bus. 

Price is  $18 per night including breakfast.

name: Parqueadeiro Tolu (Cláudia)
description:
Ample parking lot. In it there is a house that the owners live in. It's simple and safer, close to everything. We pay $20,000, for 24 hours and another $10,000, for the night. We stayed two nights and a day. Contact: 3104203102

estacionamento amplo. nele tem uma casa que moram os proprietários. é simples e mais seguro, próximo de tudo. pagamos $20.000, por 24h e mais $10.000, pelo noite. ficamos duas noites e um dia. contato: 3104203102

name: Traveller's Hostel/Home
description:
A very nice hostel next to the Rana hotel. 
(We first went to Rana, but they said there was no kitchen and it was 35,000 per person.)

here we paid 30,000 per person, the hotel is small and lovely and feels like a home, we can use the kitchen and leave our bicycles in the garden. There is space for one or two motocycles in the small entrance area.
The personnel are very friendly.

name: BRIO Gas Station
description: 24h big park free. You only need consume in this local. Have mini market food, water and beer. Quiet in the night friendly people.

name: Street Parking Near Police Station
description: Relatively quiet street by police station where truckers stay overnight. We stayed 2 nights and had no problems.

name: Terpel Station with DEF
description: Terpel Station with DEF available from a big tank next to the fill spots

name: little quiet street
description: We spent 3 nights parked in this street with our camiom of 7m of length. Very quiet, nice neighbors. Quite close to the center of salento. Easy to access.

name: el tigre de Marte acà!😅
description: el tigre only charge 10000 and has a couple od shaded spots.simple toilet showers.no wifi

name: Municipal Parking 24
description: Asked police for a secure place for the night, they sent us here, Safe, guarded, electricity available. Paid 8.000 for the night and the following morning, slept well. Toilet at the Alcaldia, accessible from the Parking.

name: Hotel Refugio del Lago
description: Very nice hotel. Large, gated parking area. 55k for a double room with a view of the lake. 45k for a ground floor room with no view. Breakfast available for 8k. About four blocks to the main square.

name: lavadero colon
description:
parking for big rigs. 
paid 40000 pesos for 24 h.
not sure if you can sleep there
not sure about toilets

name: Santa Elena
description: This is a very paceful site. We stay at parking. 30.000 cop per nigth.

name: Malecón del Rio Barranquilha
description:
It is a very beautiful and wide tourist boardwalk. safe, clean and super nice. it has clean restrooms, free electricity on the boardwalk, bars and restobar. the staff are all very attentive and friendly. great place to visit and sleep a night.
----
é um calçadão turístico muito lindo e amplo. seguro, limpo e super agradável. tem banheiros limpos, eletricidade gratuita no calçadão, bares e restobar. os funcionários são todos muito atenciosos e amigáveis. ótimo lugar para visitar e dormir uma noite.

name: TEXACO GAS STATION
description: Fuel station with good convenience store. A few stray dogs. We stayed one night in our 6m long motorhome with no problems at all. No wifi. They let us charge our batteries on the outlet outside the convenience store.

name: Estación de Bomberos
description:
After many unsuccessful attempts to find where to stay in Ipiales (because in other points registered in Ioverlander we were not allowed to park) we managed to find this station, the firefighters told us that there was no problem to stay here, there is silence and a gas station nearby. It's completely free
----
Luego de muchos intentos fallidos de buscar donde quedarnos en Ipiales(porque en otros puntos registrados en Ioverlander no nos permitieron estacionar) logramos encontrar esta estación, los bomberos nos dijeron que no había problema para quedarnos aquí, hay silencio y una gasolinera cercana. Es completamente gratuito

name: italian pizza
description: u will love pizza here .woodfired oven.excellent dough!

name: Lagos de Venecia
description: Espacio acondicionado para overlanding ya sea carpa, casa-carro, remolque. Muy bonito, seguro, natural, equipado con baños, duchas con agua caliente, llenado de agua limpia y descarga de aguas sucias, lavandería, wifi. Cuenta con muchas más opciones de entretenimiento y gastronomía. El costo es justo y el valor incluye impuestos y seguro, ademas segun el presupuesto o necesidad se puede elegir la tarifa con o sin desayuno. Lo recomiendo mucho para familia, pareja o amigos. Excelente servicio. se puede ver su oferta de servicios y tarifas en el catalogo de whatsapp 3155580367.

name: Road 64 Mongote - San Joaquin
description: Really, really, REALLY bad road, unpaved dirt road which our navigation showed as regular, paved road. Minimum traffic, minimum cell reception, mostly no cell reception at all, so if anything happens, you are on your own.

name: Cerro Tusa
description: 'la piramide natural mas alto del mundo' (the tallest natural pyramide).. At least that's what the sign on the top says. You can park at Finca la India. From there it's about 2h to the top on a steep and slippery trail. The first part through the muddy grassland is not too obvious, but when you reach the steep section it is straight up and easy to find. Nice view. There a gpx tracks available on wikiloc

name: Finca La India
description: Good place to park/ spend the night for the Cerro Tusa hike. Super friendly owner. Slept in our car in the parking lot - 40k for 2p,1car (but maybe you can negotiate). Showers (cold) and bathrooms clean, open at night. They also offer rooms for 50k pp, food and drinks. No wifi but LTE claro coverage

name: road to ferry
description: Don't pass here, there is mud on the road, only motorcycles can pass. There are other roads to take the ferry

name: Rapid carwash
description: very good carwash. for a Jeep Wrangler. very very dirty! for 40.000 COP. Inside, Outside and under the car.

name: Hostal Candillejas
description:
Hostel on the road from Medellin to Rio Magdalena.
Accepted us with a truck, no height or size limit 
we slept in the parking area. We had friends with us who slept in a room with A/C for 180000COP for 4 people.
We slept in the camper for 30000 COP.
Clean toilets, cold shower (but hot weather).
Noise from the road with few trucks in the night.
Restaurant and swimming pool on site.
Do not know about water or power (probably possible for both).
whatsapp (call before to check if it is ok for a camper alone) : +57 312 2353513.

name: Nice street in Poblado
description: Very nice street in El Poblado. We looked for a place to park for more than 1 hour and couldn’t find, so we parked here. It’s a paid street parking, costs COP4600 per hour from 8am to 1am, but the people who take care of the cars are very friendly and charged us less. Sundays it’s free (the lady who stays in the street on sundays is not oficial). The street is very calm and close to cools bars, restaurants and parties. The restaurant called Kaime, in the streeet, is amazing. For reggaeton night go to Perro Negro. We felt very safe. No facilities. At the end of the street is the best parking spot, that fit big cars (our van is 7m long).

name: Lava Express
description:
Laundry. Payed 15.000 for around 20/25 pieces
They will have it in more than 12 hours

name: Terpel gas station
description: Small Terpel gas station road side, 24/7; small gravel parking lot - max two campers or one big rig will fit. Minimum traffic during the night - rather quiet.

name: Terpel GLP / LPG Doña Manuela
description: This is the only GLP /LPG station in Cartagena, open since 2021. It is still so unique that I was welcomed by the manager himself. You need a disc adapter, preferably bring your own, because the adapter at the station has a very small thread. Also it is made of sheet metal, so my solid brass adapter needed some persevance, but it fits just as well. You can pay with credit card.

name: Restaurante Parrilla Típicos
description: We went to Piedra del Peñol yesterday and stopped here to sleep. Plenty of space, quiet, there is security overnight and restaurants and a gift shop. Don’t know about the facilities, but probably there is a restroom from the restaurant. We slept for one night. There’s Claro cell connection (4G). On the way to Piedra Peñol, there are other places to stop to sleep that seem good.

name: Hotel Bon Habitat
description: The only hostel in Yopal, just opened a year ago. Nice dorms with AC for 50k per night. space to park a couple of motorbikes inside. Looks like there's space to park a camper to the side too so definitely worth asking if you're looking for that.

name: soat seguro del estado
description:
We get our SOAT here at the second floor. 
after trying to buy it in 6 shop in ipiales, a guy told us to come here.
it took more than 1h because any of our french car data made an error in the soat system. 
got a 3 month (no possible less) for 53usd. not cheap but seems to be the only way/place around the border.

name: Lakeside next to Virgin Mary
description: Level parking, part grassy part asphalt, lake view. Only little traffic during the night, but almost every car, bus and motorcycle honk- to greet the Virgin Mary :-)

name: el Sifon termas
description: the place is fantastic but be aware there is loads of sulphur in the hot water! if it goes into your eyes it will hurt preaty bad!☠️u will instinctively close your eyes for at least 10-15seconds..this could be dangerous if ur scrambling throu the rocks around here.keep a towel handy to dry your face!beware also Altitude+ hotwater will give u a goood buzz when u stand u up to leave the water! stay 20 min in and try how it feels.ENJOY! the place is magik! (without clouds and rain..)

name: El Crist Alto
description:
Flat space for 3 vehicles. Paid $10usd per vehicle. 

Right off the highway but there is a creek flowing by that drowns out a lot of the
 noise. 5 resident dogs that are socialized and friendly. Not buggy. Cold showers across the footbridge. Clean restrooms, no tp. Covered picnic tables across footbridge. One or two bars of claro service. Not sure about Wi-Fi. 

Good spot for a night.

name: Hotel Las Olas Palermo
description: If you’re tired of choking on dust from the desert and need a good shower and A/C, we found this hotel a great value. 170K COP for 2 people with breakfast. It’s new and clean and has a huge pool. Neiva is not full of big hotels with big parking. It’s all little hostels downtown with tiny parking if any. This place is safe and easy for big rigs and right on the highway south out of town. Get here early or reserve because it fills up every night. Don’t let your Nav system take you over the tiny bridge crossing the Magdalena River unless you’re in a small vehicle. There’s a much bigger bridge to the south..

name: Sendero Valle de los Xilópalos
description: Nice little circular walk through the desert down some little canyons and the river bed. Probably not fun after a lot of rain. Camping opposite or potentially here but we didn’t stay. 2k pp for the trial, mostly flat, takes just over an hour.

name: El Fresal
description: Small paved parking lot in front of El Fresal, a shop and coffee stop (place was founded by a Croatian family who emigrated after WWII). No amenities, and at the highway, so traffic noise, but good for one night. Asked for permission to stay in the shop, and bought a lot of sweet treats :-)

name: Parking Lot
description:
This is secure parking for day use only. We parked here while our laundry was being done. Shaded. Left our dog in the car. There is a place right across the street that sells water in Garafons. 

Nice people. We paid 20000 per hour.

name: Punta Frio Metropolis
description: They sell water in garrafons. Secure parking across the street. We paid 25000 for two garrafons.

name: Very good car wash!
description: Adding this because sometimes a good one is hard to find. High height limit, friendly and accommodating. Did an incredibly thorough job of washing the desert off our car including doing underneath properly. Snacks/drinks and toilets on site too.

name: Hacienda Pisoje
description: An organic farm serving it's own coffee & honey in the middle of a eucalyptus forest. Not cheap, but definitely worth the stay in the house that was built in 1700. . All vehicles can reach it.

name: Xielo Skydive Hotel/Camping
description: Newly built hotel with 8 rooms, next to the beautifully located skydiving Center. Rooms with A/C  and private bathroom. Cold (actually medium-warm) water. Extremely comfortable beds. No breakfast, no restaurant. The next grocery store or restaurant is 10 km away. Beautiful pool, from where you can watch people jump out of an airplane. They also offer camping. There is a separate shower/toilet building. Very clean. Very secure place, even with a night guard on duty. Don't let things outside, though. The bloody dogs steal everything. Ripped my 200$ hiking shoes apart.  Very strong WiFi. Don't miss this place. It's a beauty.

name: down a quiet ally
description: next to the gas station there is a dead end rd. some trucks from the company parked there .I camouflaged with them.surprisingly quiet night!

name: Sol de Verano Alojamiento Campestre
description: Night fell and there was nothing on Ruta del Sol southwards - until we came by this small restaurant, behind which we could park and spend the night on the way to Bogotá. We had dinner here, simple but freshly prepared. Very friendly ladies.

name: posto TERPEL 24h
description:
Terpel station with ample parking and 24 hours. there are restrooms, water and Internet at the convenience store. good place to spend a night.
---
posto da Terpel com estacionamento amplo e 24h. tem banheiros, água e Internet na loja de conveniência. bom lugar para passar uma noite.

name: Peaje San Pedro on Route 21
description: Small place right after the toll station direction south, there was a construction site and some trucks parked there as well. Not too much traffic during the night but you hear every truck breaking for the toll station. It was midnight and we had no other option.

name: Paramo de Belmira
description: You are required to have a guide, and can hire one in town across the street from city hall. 3 hour steep muddy hike to an amazing landscape. The guide helped navigate some points where we would be lost. There's a waterfall on the way down. Belmira also has a basic hotel where you can stay the night and hike to the paramo the next morning when the sun is shining!

name: Trail to Las Gachas
description: This trail to Las Gachas leads through private properties. At each one you have to pay between 1000-2000 COP (4000pp in total). But be aware at the 2nd property we got attacked by several aggressive dogs and the owners didn't care at all they just want your money. So we highly recommend the other trail from Guadalupe, which is public and free.

name: Primax
description: Primax with free water hose and bathrooms. 1000.

name: Hotel Puntalarga
description: Traditional colonial-styled hotel. Very affordable rates and comfortable and cosy rooms breakfast included we pay $70.000 per person during week days.  Lovely gardens and it's pet friendly. around the area you have many things to visit. like Nobsa handcrafts. the Winery has amazing views over the valley. Totally worth it. clean and super friendly stuff. they went through hard times during the pandemic but they are getting back on their feet. highly recommend it.

name: Riverside
description: Not bad for a night. You turn around the trees twice to the river so in the night you are not visible. Bit of trash around.

name: Astromelia Hostal
description: Very nice and clean Hostal in the center of La Candelaria/Bogotá. We booked the Hostel in Booking.com. The price for one night in a double room is 64800$/ 13 US$. You have a kitchen to use and shared bathrooms. There is a parking area next to the hostel. Safe parking for Motorcycles 5000$/ 1 US$ per day

name: Park in Puerto Valencia
description: Street parking at the park, rather quiet at night, horses grazing in the park, some dogs barking, little traffic. No amenities. Had to stay here after a construction site and a broken down truck cost us almost 2 hours and it was dark. Felt safe, slept well.

name: Armed Robbery - Road R37 between Guadalejo and bridge
description: Had a run in with 5 armed guys blocking the street between Guadalejo and the bridge, on the way back from Tierradentro direction Puerto Valencia and La Plata. They claimed to be part of FARC. They didn’t ask for money, but asked for „tarjetas“ (don’t know if they meant credit cards or ID). Didn’t give them anything, and managed to escape unharmed with some minor damage on our camper including three holes from their pistols. Police told us that there are some dissident left-overs from FARC still active in Dept. Cauca. Be careful and if possible travel in groups of several cars.

name: La Casona Restaurant
description:
Great traditional Boyacense Cuisine with a nice gourmet twist. 
Give it a go. You won't regret it.

name: Beachfront Parquadero
description: A corner parking lot on the beach .10000 x 24 hr. noisy at night til 2-3am. as all along the malecon, bars are open, but I survived.

name: Roadside
description: Roadside wide corner with a fantastic view between Nemocon and Suesca

name: Pulled over
description: Some weird guys in uniform just before the curve! kind of pulled me over, I was already wary ..he shook my hand and introduced himself showing the badge. I said nothing and left!!

name: Parqueadero Arango
description: Safe parking for cars and motorcycles. We paid about 10000$ per bike for 2 nights.  There is a good cafeteria inside the parking area.

name: Camping Guadalitos
description: This finca is located at the side of Güéjar River, flat terrain that easily parks 20 or 30 rigs. A night costs $15.000 cop/person, they will try to charge for packages that cost $30 to $40 usd/person, but that is with food included (full pension). The entrance to the River cost $15.000  cop and you must pay a guide $50.000 if you want to see the up River and waterfalls. There is Wifi, bathrooms, restaurant and rooms. Bigs rigs can get here with no problem

name: Solar Panels and Equipment
description: A good spot to upgrade your Solar system! Message them ahead of time and they can order any size solar panel for you in two days. They also have all types of Anderson cables and solar charge controllers, they even designed a cool solar bracket system. Prices are cheaper then Mercado Libre and half the price of the USA. Great guys! +57 314 3011434

name: La Cosecha Parridilla
description: An institution! A must! Insanely delicious and always packed steakhouse. We keep coming back and ordering the Baby Beef. Around $10 USD per person

name: next to the water fall
description:
Wild campsite next to the road. 3 minutes away from the water fall.
We arrived at night so don't know the view.

name: Villa de Leyva dessert
description: Wild camping next to the rural road. Not very flat but it works for one night.

name: La Paz, Santander tour guide
description:
We met Jorge at this location and he provided a tour to the “ hole in the ground” Hoyo del Aire” and cave Cueva del Molino. 

You might find the hole on your own but it’s “very” doubtful you will find the caves and/ or it’s inner reaches. 

Jorge speaks passable English and is a delight to be around. Our tour lasted 3 hours and the cost was $30. Well worth the money.

Jorge +573222201516 WhatsApp. Instagram @jorgematsa14

name: Refugio del Neusa
description: Campsite with nice lake view, restrooms and wi-fi

name: Seguros del Estado
description:
Here you get your SOAT for Colombia. It’s important for foreigners to have a Seguros Estado.

You need your passport, driver license, papers from you vehicle and your DIAN.

We did our SOAT for 3 Month.

name: finca jardin des délices
description: Fabien and Ingrid - secure place for vehicle storage. Contact directly for the the price +573165068677

name: Baterias Punto de Energia
description: very good place for change battery. lot of choice with different price. Vehicle battery and cell solar panel battery. Very profesional and friendly staff. possible to park in front of the shop (even Big rig) open 7:30am to 21:30pm.

name: Laguna Guaitipan
description: Glamping by the side of a lagoon where you can hike, kayak and do canopy. very good infrastructure. We stayed in the parking lot close to the washrooms and the restaurant.

name: BIOHOTEL ECOHOUSE
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager.   
We are a Biohotel with 5 hectares of natural reserve, waterfalls, lots of flora and fauna, we are working to be the first sustainable hotel in Guarne, we implement bio-construction with art and friendly resources.
It is a retro hotel with vintage decoration at night everything comes alive with the lights. We have all kinds of accommodation for travelers and enough space to park your vehicle and camping

Somos un Biohotel con 5 hectáreas de reserva natural cascadas mucha flora y fauna estamos trabajando para ser el primer hotel sostenible de guarne implementamos la bio-construccion con arte y recursos amigables.
Es un hotel retro con decoración vintage en la noche todo cobra vida con las luces. Tenemos todo tipo de alojamiento para viajeros y suficiente espacio para parquear tu vehículo y camping

name: Acampada en la calle
description:
We have stayed 1 week and it is very quiet. One block from the main park.
There are vehicle guards, so far we have not paid. Here going up the block we follow who will charge us Gas in the 10Lb pipe.
We got showers at the Combi hostel half a block down.
Nos hemos quedado 1 semana y es muy tranquilo. A una cuadra del parque principal. 
Hay vigilantes de vehiculos, hasta ahora no hemos pagado. Aqui subiendo la cuadra co seguimos quien nos cargara Gas en la pipa de 10Lb. 
Conseguimos duchas en el hostal Combi a media cuadra bajando.

name: Santorini
description: These are not the exact coordinates but once you turn a right here (at the Santorini sign) just take the next left which will lead you to a beautiful little village full of white houses. It will remind you of Greece. There are a few little artisanal markets and ice cream parlours etc. Very pretty touristy place.

name: taller Beraca Jorge latoneria y pintura
description:
painting and latoneria for heavy or light vehicules.
Affordable price, to negotiate a bit.
Easy to go, communication is good.
and result too.
Painted chassis + all the irons accessories of my truck for 4 500 000 COP (900  $)  including the paint (1 million). 4 days of work.
whatsapp him a few days  (one week is best) before coming
Ten minutes frome town center in taxi, place closed with security cameras.
carwash too.
+57 3024551074 Jorge Grajales.

name: Contratación meadow
description: Two, maybe three spots for one 5m vehicle each. Close to the road, but not much traffic during day, none during the night. On the other side a small creek with clear water. You need to conquer a small ditch to get on the plot. But there are plenty of rocks. Barely cell phone reception.

name: Dona Ana's Finca
description: we wanted to go to Santa Rosita but the washout had gotten worse so there at the entrance to ecoparque we talked to a lady named Anna and she opened her little farm to us. room for 1 or to cars and good for a night or 2. really nice lady.

name: Dibulla
description:
A super large parking lot nice location near the sea very quiet and safe.

Estacionamiento súper grande buena ubicación cerca del mar muy tranquilo y seguro

name: la posada del viajero
description:
A nice hotel when waiting for a container loading with CONTECAR. 
It's a straight 500m walk to the entrance of the container storage. 
The hotel is clean and the beds are good. The pool is big and clean. 
There is well-secured parking at the back of the hotel, max 3m height to enter and there is a roof on almost all parking places (very nice to prepare your camper before shipment). Long crafter and sprinter type camper will have any problem parking in.
The fan and AC are working but the main problem with the hotel is the very noisy road. Try to get a room close to the parking lot. 
We didn't ask to sleep in the camper but it may be possible.
Breakfast was included in the price (coffee, juice, fruits salad, and 2 big eggs+cheese+ham sandwiches)
Taxi/Uber to the old city is 17000cop in November 2022

name: Roadside Wide Shoulder, Pantano de Vargas
description: Beautiful view next to the road, works for staying for one night. AMAZING view in the morning.

name: Playa Palo Blanco
description: Nice and quiet place between Coveñas and Tolu. At the end of a sandy track directly along the shore. Asked for permission from the very friendly couple living there, had a nice chat. Only the sound of the waves at night, no traffic.

name: Altoke La Portada en La Calera
description: It is a Gas station and its Altoke mini market.  It has good WiFi and good bathrooms.  no showers

name: Hotel Juanchito
description:
If you are in San Vicente del Caguan and need a hotel with Parking and safe and good in value for money, with a good restaurant, and a gas station just by hotel, this is the place. 
Whatsapp in advance to make reservation. 
+57 (312) 545-9385
2.2 km out of San Vicente del Caguan
With nice sunrise views!!!
No hot water but it is not needed in this climate!!!

name: Lavato Laundry & Cafe
description: AWESOME laundromat. You wash and dry your own clothes (25,000 for wash/dry for 1 load, includes soap). Bonus, the cafe has amazing food and a really nice leafy, relaxing vibe. Laundry heaven. Street parking out front of the cafe.

name: La Punta
description:
Small parking lot on the spot of the quiet and safe village on weekends there may be a little noise.
Pequeño estacionamiento en el lugar del pueblo tranquilo y seguro los fines de semana puede haber un poco de ruido.

name: Parking/ Estacionamiento
description: SaFe parking for Motorcycles and Cars. We park our motorcycles for 3 days here. Price is about 10$ Dollars per day.

name: Texaco gas station
description: Right on the highway, but little traffic, spent a quiet night here after asking the attendants. Clean bathrooms.

name: Huge fenced parking lot + garage
description:
Huge fenced and 24h guarded parking lot + parking garage suitable for all vehicles. No height restrictions for the outside lot, for the garage it’s 2.20m.

Parked our rig for 3 days and had no issues.

Cheap hourly rates and special overnight rate 15000$ per 24h. Area felt very safe, also at night.

name: Camping al Caravanas
description: An absolutely stunning campsite just on the outskirts of San Vincente de Chucuri. We paid 40,000 Colombian Pesos for our truckcamper for the night. There is wifi, beautiful outdoor showers (cold), sink, toilets, sheltered area with hammocks and an area to charge your devices. They have a huge field for tents too. Super quiet with just the usual farm animal noises. Horses and goats on the property and plenty of orange and mandarins for the taking. There is a waterfall nearby which we‘re going to check out. The nearby town is huge and has everything you need. Definitely recommend.

name: Panaderia artisanal
description:
This place is an excellent bakery. You'll find Sourdough bread, Brioches, Pan especial, cheese bread, Rosemary bread and much more. You can be served warm bread with coffee. 
Hernando is the owner and he is super nice! 
Open every day except Monday.

name: Quite campspot at seaside
description:
Beautiful place to spend the night, passing the bridge next to the Ciénaga de la caimanera, we arrived and asked the owner of the restaurant for permission and he had no problem letting us sleep here. The sea water looks like a swimming pool!


Hermoso lugar para pasar la noche, pasando el puente al lado de la Ciénaga de la caimanera, llegamos y pedimos permiso al dueño del restaurante y no tuvo ningún problema en dejarnos dormir acá. ¡El agua del mar parece piscina !

name: beautiful view between Mongua and Laguna Negra
description: Great spot near the road, amazing Landscapes in the day and night.

name: Restaurante El Paisa
description:
Good value for money colombian food- 
Delicious, many options, excelent and friendly service

name: Yellow fever vaccine
description: Yellow fever vaccine available for free here. Queue starts outside door 4. Expect a long wait since it's free, I waited 3 hours on a Saturday afternoon, probably not a good time to go. Bring your passport so they can put the right details on the vaccine card.

name: Hotel Rancho de Salento
description: Very nice and relaxing hotel near Salento. Wonderful views, hiking options and beautiful environment. They have fibra, high-quality and high speed internet, which makes it a perfect spot for digital nomad travelers. The price includes breakfast. The owner Alberto is very nice and he will help you to organize your stay in the Eje Cafetero.

name: family restaurants and activities
description: This is a very nice place to spend the weekend in a family environment. You have 4 different restaurants and activities for kids and adults: mini-golf, zip line, jumping, Toro loco...

name: Gas del Valle
description: They filled up our American 20lb bottles of gas. The access is tricky, take the dirty road just before the trail way. You can call Widmar and he will send you the GPS point. The number is on the picture.

name: Wild camping in the coffee hills of Jardín
description:
If you go up the road to Morro Amarillo almost to the top you will find a horse stable. Make a right turn and then left at the fork up a small dirt road. There’s a wide flat area to park. (If you go right at the fork, the road will lead you to the Cueva del Esplendor trailhead.)

We asked two locals who were fine with us camping there. “Muy tranquilo” at night. Great views over the mountains and Jardín. You share the space with some free running horses from the stable.

The road up to Morro Amarillo is very narrow and steep. We didn’t have to engage 4x4 but definitely not big rig friendly. 

One of the best wild camping spots we found so far in Colombia.

name: Hotel Puerto Azul
description: Nice, VERY clean hotel in the town center. Large Double room with A/C for 50.000 COP. They offer parking in a parquadero one block away. Don't think big rigs will fit. Includes breakfast for one person only ( no kidfing  :o). very friendly staff. excellent WiFi. Incredible value for little money.

name: La Resevera
description:
By the Güejar River-
EcoFarm. Bird watching. Rafting. Trecking.
Crowded on long weekends

name: Pie'Monte Eco Hotel
description:
New eco-cabins, camping, quiet, 1,5km out of Mesetas, farm environment.
Trees, birds, nature-
Friendly owner is a very helpful person
No hot water but it is not needed in this climate-
Delicious breakfasts- other meals you prepare or order from nearby Mesetas

name: Museo Guayupe
description:
Interesting archeological museum of ancient indigenous cultures - Guayupes- with pottery, funeral art and other pieces-
Worth the stop and visiting on the way to-from San Jose del Guaviare

name: Paragliding Fenixtreme
description: Here you have the chance to take a two-up paragliding flight over Chicamocha Canyon. approx. 15 min at 200.000 COP and 60.000 COP for fotos & videos. Very impressive!

name: moniquira
description:
You can park, here we sleep for 2 days, it's not the quietest place, but it's safe

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Se puede estacionar, aquí dormimos 2 días, no es el lugar más tranquilo, pero es seguro

name: Hotel Cachipay
description: Nice hotel with large semi-covered parking area, decent WiFi and hot showers. 30k per night for one person.

name: Riohacha Hostel /Parking
description:
Free parking, friendly people, allowed us to park in a guarded area, 3km from Riohacha.
.....
gente muy amable, nos permitieron parkear en esta área de descansa que tiene vigilancia, toda la noche a 3 km de riohacha.

name: Vulcanizadora - tyres repair
description: Tires repair with good structure, good service, Nice guys. In the Gas Station Terpel

name: Parquadero
description: almost empty large parking lot. surprisingly quiet night, after 11pm the traffic faded out. I parked at the very end of the lot, as far as I could (50m?) from the main road noise! it might have a bathroom(?) and offered me water from a large tank, but I did not use either. 8000pesos!

name: Gondola La Garrucha
description: Short 3 minute gondola ride to a viewpoint/cafe. This location is the top. Cute! Great view from the top. Bottom is on Google maps (La Garrucha). 10,000pp

name: Getsemani Parking
description: This is where we parked when our Jeep came out of the port at the last minute and we needed a safe place to put it. 24-hour parking attendant and security cameras, plus fairly easy to get in and out. We were charged COP 130.000 for 4 days. We did have to go in the next morning to sign a contract, since it was multi-day. Recommended spot.

name: Asadero y Restaurante Donde Juliana
description:
Delicious food
Carne a la llanera - typical roasted food-
Many dishes
Big and well ventilated place
Friendly service
Well located

name: Catumaré Comidas Amazonicas
description:
Delicious ethnic food
From the Amazon Rainforest Region
Their ingredients, recipes, flavors
In a good restaurant
Marta is very helpful and friendly

name: Petromil with def/adblue/urea
description:
One of the few service stations with adblue/Def/Urea that we saw from Cartagena (going up the coast and down here).

Une des rares stations service avec de l'adblue/Def/Urea que l'on a vu depuis Cartagene (en remontant par la côte et descendant par ici).

name: Paraiso Sportsground
description:
Football field and roofed basketball court. Nice place to spend the night.

You can enter with vehicles too but you'd have to ask for permission.
Neighbours are nice and gave me water to cook with.
Electrical points and Wifi available.

name: Hotel san marcos
description: This hotel has air conditioning, is cheap, neas by has a small restaurant… should be better if you call before

name: Finca Jardin des Délices
description:
The site offers you a room for 1 or 2 people in a rural environment. Including access to wifi and breakfast included. Toilets, showers and a small outdoor kitchen are shared with the camping area.
---
Le site vous propose, une chambre pour 1 ou 2 personnes dans un milieu campestre. Comportant l'acces au wifi et petit déjeuner inclus. Les toilettes, douches et une petite cuisine exterieure  sont communes á la partie camping.

name: Bomba Petromil / Car wash
description: Next to the fuel station, we can wash your van before your shipping. It will cost between $ 30.000 and $ 50.000 depend of the type of the vehicle.

name: El Gran Hotel
description: Basic but very clean double rooms with private bathroom for only 25000COP. Secure parking for all vehicles. Managed by a super friendly old lady. Recommended!

name: Pull-off by a stream
description: On the dirt road between Concepcion to San Roque there aren’t many pull-outs, but we found this one right when we needed it. We parked our van here overnight on a Sunday and only heard a few vehicles pass in the night. There’s a stream and a few small waterfalls here. A bit further back from the road, there’s a grassy patch suitable for 2–3 tents and not visible from the road. Would be perfect for cyclists or motos. We felt very safe.

name: Casa de don José Río Guachaca
description: Friendly family allowed us to park next to their house, which is just above the River. From the parking space its a two minute walk to the River where its fresh and with nice river beaches. You can use the bathroom and electricity, we paid 5 mil pesos per night (voluntarily). Suitable for two small or one big rig.

name: Supermarket Cajasan Los Andes
description:
Small car park guarded by a security guard and next to a small police station.  Calm.  We paid 5000 pesos for the security guard.  The car park is not suitable for RVs over 7 meters.

petit parking surveillé par un agent de sécurité et à côté d'un petit poste de police. calme. on a payé 5000 pesos l'agent de sécurité. le parking n'est pas adapté pour les rv plus de 7 mètres.

name: El Atico
description:
It is a beautiful farm, it has space for camping, it has cabins, a quiet space in contact with nature away from the noise of the city.

Miguel Caro is the owner and manager of the place. his phone number is 3112872753.

Thank you for visiting BOYACA...!
----------------------------
Es una granja bonita tiene espacio para acampar, tiene cabañas, espacio tranquilo en contacto con la naturaleza lejos del ruido de la ciudad.

Miguel Caro es el propietario y administrador del lugar. su número telefónico es 3112872753.

Gracias por visitar BOYACA...!

name: Hotel El Chalet
description:
Very kind owner, it is possible to use the kitchen. The rooms and all facilities are clean! Wifi works well in the lobby and it is possible to work there.
Beds can be more or less comfortable, depending on the room.
The downside for me was the noise level in the morning, because the building is "local style" and noisy neighbours are right next to the hotel.
Prize was about 35.000 Col Pesos per person if I remember correctly. But it was definetly the best prize for what you can get in Libano!

name: Estación de servicio Nueva Carolina
description:
-Terpel gas station perfect for spending the night, no cost, just tip the person on duty.

Estación de servicio Terpel perfecta para pasar la noche, no tiene costo, solo dar una propina a la persona de turno.

name: Plaza Pueblo Cabrera
description: Nice square at Cabrera Village, safe, quiet, surrounded by local restaurants. Good place to rest before taking the road to Ipiales or Popapyan. The people are very friendly. During the weekends, it is busy during the day when the restaurants receive a lot of visitors from Pastos, but it is quiet at night. You can have delicious local food for an affordable price. On Sunday also you can buy fruit and vegetables on the square. Public Wifi free. We spent 2 nights here.

name: Hacienda Santa Isabel
description: this is an old hacienda and camping area. I gave the entrance to the place or you would never find it. Google will not get you here. it's a steep with tight switchbacks and it is a climb. we did it in a truck with a small trailer. Big Rigs with tight turn radius and low low. once you are up top plenty of big rig space. getting there you may want to walk it out.

name: Arsenio parquadero
description: some space in the backyard .relatively quiet and the closest to the beach I could easily reach!! side rds are tight here!also probably cheapest and on a main st. he said there is a toilet and a shower back there(?) I didnt need it so did not check.at 12000x p x night .not bad at all

name: street food and SIM card
description: We arrived very early in the morning in Tabatinga and found this place where we had breakfast. It's street food and they offer fresh juice and empanadas, arepas and more. There is also a small kiosk where we could buy a prepaid SIM card and they even helped us to put money on it. Very firendly people.

name: The Fort Hostel
description: Hostel built the middle of jungle, affordable luxury, dorm and private cabin, bar with artisanal liqueurs and fully equipped kitchen.

name: La Pradera Casa Finca
description: We stored our car here for 3 weeks, felt very secure about it. Totally fine when we returned. The couple will happily send you photo updates, secure nice property (that also allows camping). See “La Pradera” official campground on iOverlander for contact details.  Tree shade, but uncovered. 16k per night (can negotiate for longer stays).

name: Panaderia
description: Small bakery, the baguette is very good. They also do juices and drinks and pizza. The store is at the main square of that charming little town but has no seats there.

name: Hotel Sun River
description: Allow camping in their parking lot, no height restriction, little bit slanted. 24h receptionist. A little bit of traffic noise, near a grocery store. You can use their wifi, basic bathroom and shower. 30K per night.

name: Posto Primax
description:
Tap with water to fill the water tanks. 
.....
Conseguimos uma torneira com água para encher as caixas de água.

name: Rastrojo Largo
description: Rastrojo Largo is an unique and quiet place, great for camping and overlanding. It was the only place I found in the area where I could camp with my Jeep and all my setup.  The place has plenty of room and you will be in contact with all the nature of the place.  It’s secure and you can enjoy your stay will all the calm.  Daniel and Tatiana are very kind and will help you with anything you want. The price is $30,000 COP x person x night.

name: Merendero Cumanday
description: Great place to stay in Murillo-Tolima.  If you are looking for a campground where you can establish with your car and all your equipment, this place has sufficient space for this.  It is located at the beginning of the town. Also if you are planning to go to the hot spring “termales de la cabaña”, the place is just away 30 minutes from this location.  The place is nice and secure, it has hot showers and toilets.  James, the owner, is very kind and will always offer you a hot drink for the cold weather.  Perfect place for overlanding!

name: FINCA Y CAMPING TINCAVITA
description:
One of the most beautiful places to stay for overlanding camping in Gambita.  Tincavita is a great place, nice, secure and peaceful. You can have your car near your camp setup.  You will be attended by Segundo. He is very nice and kind. Sure you will love this place. It’s also very close to La Cascada Manto de La Virgen (5mins in car).

See comments and photos about access with vehicles with long rear overhang. 

Aug 2023 - paid 25K pp/pn
Contact ahead! 
cell 3112286147 or 313433791 or 3142996036

Call

name: Represa la COPA
description: Beautiful place, very close to the lagoon, quiet and lonely!!!

name: Taller Don Carlos
description:
This is a place to fix vehicles or even sleep for days while the requested part arrives!!! It has electrical, mechanical and general services or consultancies for all types of light or heavy vehicles.

Es un lugar para arreglar los vehículos o inclusive dormir  por días mientras llega el repuesto solicitado!!! Cuenta con servicios o asesorías eléctricas, mecánica y en general para todo tipo de vehículos livianos o pesados.

name: Gas station/ estación de servicio
description:
Big and quite gas station, we parked on the grass and felt safe, police was passing by many times,  came to welcome us and said the place was safe! 
Not sure about the facilities, we just spent one night and haven’t used any! 
The weather became cool after 8pm until 7am, after that the place gets hot as hell! 
————————————
Posto de gasolina grande e tranquilo, estacionamos na grama e nos sentimos seguros, a polícia passou várias vezes, veio nos receber e disse que o lugar era seguro!
 Não tenho certeza sobre as instalações, passamos apenas uma noite e não usamos nenhuma!
 O clima ficou fresco depois das 20h até as 7h, depois disso o lugar fica quente pra caramba!

name: robinet derrière les lavabos
description:
a tap behind the sinks at the level of the entrance aisles. 8000 for parking at night and access to free wifi.
---
un robinet derrière les lavabos au niveau des allées d'entrée. 8000 pour le parking la nuit et accès au wifi gratuit.

name: Zamia Hostel
description: Really nice hostel with a kitchen, workout area, terrace. I was able to park my motorbike inside the cafe at the front between 9pm - 7:30am. 35k for a six person form. 40k for four bed dorm. Strong hot and cold showers.

name: Coliseo Santafe de Antioquia
description: safe leveled place next to football field and coliseum. can be noisy in the weekends. we had a good night. went to the town by tuktuk and left the caper here the hole day. locals said its safe. restrooms were open during day. potable water and kids playground

name: Perfect Spot on the Street
description:
Perfect and safe spot, it’s on the street but almost inside Caribbean Sea, warm and calm water under palm trees. 
The houses here has no gate and locals said this place is safe! We spent 3 very calm nights, people are friendly and very welcome. 
The lady from the hotel beside let us use her plug to charge our batteries for one night for free. 
There is also bathrooms and showers available on the hotels for COP 2.000.
Many bars and restaurants nearby, walk distance!

name: Hotel La Estancia
description: Overland camping in the small parking lot of a hotel (rooms also available). The owner, Don Miguel, is a beautiful person. There are bathrooms by the parking lot, and you could ask to use a shower in one of the hotel rooms. There is WiFi available, plus covered tables right by the parking lot in case of rain. The gate is closed at night. Hotel rooms are 50,000 COP/person. Camping is 50,000 COP/vehicle. It’s best to make a reservation in advance: 320-492-9198 (WhatsApp). Miguel does not speak English.

name: TORNEIRA COM ÁGUA NA POLÍCIA
description:
Translation: We managed to fill the water tank at the police checkpoint. The policeman was very kind and said that he could take as much as he wanted. Take.Towards

Conseguimos encher a caixa de água no posto de controle da polícia. O policial foi muito gentil e falou que poderia pegar o quanto quisesse. Tome.Rumo

name: Overland.Sally(Juan)
description:
Juan Varon can arrange anything you need. He's a mechanic and electrical engineer. He has a small company where they make all sorts of accessories for overlanders as well. From bags, nets, awnings, to anything you want. Also custom designs of very good quality.
He speaks good English and Spanish. 
Apart from mechanical stuff, he helped us with other stuff like sourcing a special UV lamp for our water filter, paperwork (for example TIP extension) and they helped us with a medical appointment as well. He has a lot of connections throughout Colombia in case he cannot help you, he knows someone who can!
Most important, they are overlanders themselves, so they know what people want and need! 
Can't recommend Juan enough. Best to give him a call or whatsapp beforehand. +57 319 7786600

name: Restaurante parqueadero Paola
description: We stayed here for one night, payed 20000 pesos for the van. They offer toilets and wifi. Also the family is very friendly, they loved checking out our van.

name: parqueadero El Tunal
description: parking for Big trucks. 5000 pesos for 12 hours for a van.

name: DUCHA GELADA PRIVADA
description:
We got a cold shower at this place where they rent boards. There is also a bar next door and if you consume something you can use the shower “for free” clean bathroom and good shower!
---
Conseguimos uma ducha gelada nesse lugar onde alugam pranchas. Tem um bar também ao lado é se você consumir alguma coisa pode usar a ducha “de graça “ banheiro limpo e ducha boa!

name: Riverside Spot
description: A nice spot by the side of a road, with grassy verge and river on one side, on the edge of town, quiet except for the river. Space for a big rig to park and turn around.

name: La Plaza Cafe
description: Lovely cafe with good WiFi, plenty of plugs for charging and great coffee.

name: Balneario caracolí
description:
The Caracolí spa is located in the municipality of stones tolima, it has a large place to park, it is free, however to use the booths it costs 10,000 Colombian pesos something like 2 American dollars, there are bathrooms not in the best conditions but in an emergency it works , the Opia River has a very good puddle in this place, at night it is quiet at least
——
El balneario caracolí se encuentra ubicado en el municipio de piedras tolima, tiene un amplio lugar para estacionar, es gratuito,sin embargo para usar las casetas tiene un costo de 10.000 pesos colombianos algo así como 2 dólares americanos, hay baños no en las mejores condiciones pero ante una emergencia sirve , el rio Opia tiene un charco muy bueno en este lugar, en la noche es tranquilo al menos la noche que estuvimos allí, hace algo de calor y hay jején así que traer repelente es una buena opción

name: Glamping Amazonas
description: Beatiful place, The Best experience into to The Amazonas jungle, glamping with star and trees views, The people is amazing, friendly. and you can do a interesting  day or night trekking guided

name: En la calle sin pagar
description:
Is a dirty road to a hotel, we just want sleep and not to pay. It was quiet and good! 
Es una calle de tierra que lleva a un hotel, solo queríamos parar a dormir y funcionó perfecto. Tranquilo y sin problemas.

name: MaCabañas/La Legua
description: This camping spot is located right on the walking trail to Las Gachas (30-min walk). It is also walkable to town in the other direction (15-min walk). Both walks can be a bit strenuous because of the hills, depending on your friendliness with the altitude (we’re above 5,000 ft). The camping spot is on stone next to the house. The entrance is low. We are 2.3m and only had a few inches to spare on the sides. Once you get in, there are no height issues. 40,000 COP for two adults and a child. Maintained bathhouse with cold showers. Right by the parking. There is a water spigot. I’m guessing they could run electricity from the house, but we didn’t ask. WiFi is available. The days are filled with squawks from their exotic birds. But the nights are quiet and dark. Incredibly beautiful walk to Las Gachas.

name: Hotel David
description:
Semi-double bed room, for two people, 40 thousand pesos, wifi, private bathroom, fan, a bit small but enough to spend the night. Parking with enough space for any vehicle. The fan makes a lot of noise.
With air conditioning it costs 60 thousand.
------------
Habitacion cama semidoble, para dos personas, 40mil pesos, wifi, baño privado, ventilador, un poco pequeña pero  suficiente para pasar la noche. Estacionamiento con espacio suficiente para cualquier vehículo.El ventilador hace mucho ruido.
Con aire acondicionado vale 60mil.

name: Lakeside Spot
description: Long paved road along edge of the Laguna de Sochagota in perfect condition, wide enough for traffic to pass easily. Forest on one side, Lake on the other. Quite a lot of passers by during the day, mostly dog walkers. Lots of cars at weekends and high season. They can drive quite fast. Fine for big rigs and there are also camping spots on the side of the lake. There were campers cooking on a fire and passing police ignored them. Boat club with restaurant at the end of the road.

name: restaurante camarita
description: came by had lunch paid and on the counter there was a gan-ja dish! I smelled it and he gave me a hand full from a bigger bucket. he told me "I don't sell it!"

name: Love Beach Hostel
description: Parked in front of hotel for 6000cop. not for big rigs.

name: Sonhando Acordado: Estacionamento no PetrodeCol
description:
We slept in the parking lot of this gas station.
Safe, quiet and free.
Dormimos no amplo estacionamento deste posto de gasolina.
Seguro, silencioso e gratuito.

name: Sonhando Acordado: Estacionamento no Primax
description:
After 12 hours driving we had been looking for some time for a place to rest before arriving in Medellín. We made the comeback and spent a safe night at this Primax.
Very friendly staff, safe, free, with clean bathroom and water. It's not very quiet because of the highway, but nothing that's going to be any.

Depois de 12 horas dirigindo procurávamos há algum tempo um lugar para descansar antes de chegar em Medellín. Fizemos o retorno e passamos uma noite segura neste Primax.
Funcionários muito amáveis, seguro, gratuito, com banheiro limpo e água. Não é muito silencioso por conta da rodovia, mas nada que incomode.

name: Roadside fruit & veg market
description: Nice roadside fruit and veg market, many stalls, great produce! Some unique fruits too!

name: Pietra Camping
description:
Very friendly people, showers, clean toilets, outside the town but close on foot
---
Gente muy amable, duchas, baños limpios, afuera del pueblo pero cerca a pie

name: Hotel Corozal Plaza
description:
A cute colonial type hotel at about $21/night right in the center of town across from the town square with Many ATMs close by. Use the ones with the longest lines. They charge the lowest fees :) 

A 3-4 hour drive from the Cartagena port helps get on the road once the car is released at the port usually allowing a post noon departure from Cartagena. Very courteous staff, secure inside parking. Small pool.

many nice restaurants within 100mts of the hotel.

name: Junto a las Estrellas
description:
A quiet place to spend the night at no cost, under a starry sky / Quiet and free place to pass the night under the sky full of stars
---
Un lugar tranquilo para pernoctar sin costo alguno, bajo un cielo estrellado / Quiet and free place to pass the night under the sky full of stars

name: Alojamiento Panamericano San Miguel
description: Hotel at the side of the road. Super clean, WiFi, swimming pool out back. Host is friendly, welcoming. Secure parking for the odd bike. Main Parking out front. Punching above its weight.

name: Juancho's Bar-Restaurant-Hotel
description:
Nice spot for a lunch break or dinner or just to hang out when driving to/from Tayrona. We had to work a little (cell reception is poor around Tayrona) and the WiFi is good enough for emails.

The upper deck has great seating and they have a little parking spot. The food is good and inexpensive (burger 18000, fish 35000). But the best is that there's a little path to a beautiful beach! Nicer than the beaches at the camp spots along this stretch of coast. Enjoy!

name: terpel with water
description:
great Terpel gas station with parking to sleep at night, water, WC, Urea/Def, shower.

super station-service terpel avec parking pour dormir la nuit, eau, WC, adblue/def/Urea, douches.

name: Tienda de Lucy - Parking
description:
They charged us $5,000 a night, they have bathrooms and a green area with tables and chairs. The spot is very wide and flat. The lady offered us to make a campfire, but we didn't. The store closes at 9 p.m.
