Paseamos durante el día en el teleférico y en el pueblo los santos, en el pueblo se  puede parquear en la plaza principal enfrente de la iglesia, es plano y ahí mismo está la estación de policía pero había un evento en el parque y la música a fondo iban a estar toda la noche (domingo) así que continuamos nuestro camino rumbo a  bucaramanga y vimos este parqueo, preguntamos y nos dijeron que si, nos cobraron $5,000 la noche, tienen baños y un área verde con mesas y sillas. El spot es muy amplio y plano. La señora nos ofreció hacer fogata, pero no hicimos. La tienda cierra a las 9 p.m.

name: entry road of ferry to Tatacoa
description:
The enter of the road to ferry. the road is bumpy and neary. 10-12 mins to the ferry, follow the panels. a child ask a tip for the door.

l'entrée de la route pour aller prendre le ferry. la route est en terre et il y a des trous, parfois étroite. 10-12 mins jusqu'à l'embarquement, en suivant les pancartes. un enfant nous ouvre le portail et demande un pourboire.

name: Texaco
description:
Large gravel lot around Texaco and hotel behind it. Let us stay in front of hotel while trucks could use the bigger spots. Clean toilets at gas station and a small shop/restaurant 
Quiet night. Free

name: Flamingos boat tour
description: You can do the boat tour on this lagoon also, on little homemade sailboats at sunrise or sunset. We went for sunset and besides being a stunning sunset behind the mountains, we saw lots of water birds! The scarlet ibises and flamingos were awesome! If you’re a bird-nerd, definitely a worthy trip! You can do it through the campground or walk to the town and there are guides there waiting. 25k pp

name: Guepsa, Santander
description:
Spacious place next to the sports complex. There are no facilities, but very quiet.

lugar amplio al lado del complejo deportivo. No hay facilidades pero muy tranquilo.

name: Meraki Ecoliving Campestre Ubaté
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Owners contribution, user confirmation needed

Rental of fully furnished country studio apartments, with access to large green areas and fully secure private parking.

We are located just 200 meters from the main road (route 45). Each studio apartment has a double bed, private bathroom with hot water, study for a workplace, full kitchen, washing machine, refrigerator, living room, dining room and large green areas that you can use. 

We have a bbq, bonfire area, hammock area and beautiful green spaces to work, live and be in contact with nature. 

Contact at +573102539797

name: HONDA DREAM BOGOTA
description:
Really good experience with these guys.
I am traveling from Alaska to Argentina on a Africa Twin and needed a place to do a valve check, and suspension maintenance.
They did a really good job and updated me with pictures of the maintenance.
Really happy with their work!

name: Montagas (GLP for fix tanks)
description: If you have a fix tank (USA or Canada, or the adapter) you can call #876 and make and appointment. If you call earlier in the morning maybe you can arrange it for the afternoon. They go were you are! Remember! if you are heading south! it will your last option until Peru ! In Ecuador is almost impossible to fill it up fix tank ! (of course you can buy and ecuatorian bottle and fill it up with a hose your self)

name: Bird watching spot
description: This is where you go with a birdwatching tour, but you can walk here yourself too! Beautiful spot, a few feeders. We saw hummingbirds, motmot, tucan and lots of very bright colored ones (I'm not a birdwatcher, sorry). Just drink a coffee and watch the birds.

name: Mecánica Oportuna
description: Land Cruiser service place. They have parts and experience. Also sell some OffRoad parts and distribute Ironman suspension components.

name: Gramalote Viejo
description:
We were camping with another couple in our two truck campers in front of the remains of the old church in Gramalote. It was Christmas Eve and this was our second night there.

Two men, in full masks, armed with a machete and a knife, attacked our group. We were able to de-escalate the situation and after a lot of talking and discussing, the two men finally left.  

None of us were hurt, and no items were taken. They claimed to be part of a "national defense" and were there to "protect us", after they attacked us, and wanted money.

We have a Colombian friend who helped via phone during the incident to notify the police. He has also said that this region of Colombia is the most dangerous place in the country currently, and would not recommend any tourists go to this area.

Proceed with caution, or visit during the day and sleep in Gramalote Nuevo.

name: Hotel/Hostel/Finca Tukawa
description:
hotel/hostel/farm run by 3 French people.  they offer individual cabanas with every comfort but also dormitories for separate men and women.  rooms with double bed with private bathroom and double rooms with shared bathroom.  restaurant for meals.  pool.  magnificent view of the plantations of coffee makers.  Wireless.  TV.  they offer horse riding.  visit to the coffee farm.  The prices are very correct.  contact Matias or Dimitri on +57 321 2205413 to book and get more info.  They speak French, English and Spanish.  they are very friendly.

hôtel/Hostel/ferme tenue par 3 français. ils proposent des cabanas individuelles avec tout confort mais aussi dortoirs pour hommes et femmes séparés. chambres avec lit double avec salle de bains privative et chambres doubles avec salle de bain partagée. restaurant pour les repas. piscine. magnifique vue sur les plantations de cafetières. wifi. TV. ils proposent des sorties chevaux. visite de la ferme de café. les prix sont très corrects. contactez Matias ou Dimitri au +57 321 2205413 pour réserver et avoir plus d'infos. Ils parlent français, anglais et espagnol. ils sont très sympatiques.

hotel/hostal/granja regentado por 3 franceses.  ofrecen cabañas individuales con todas las comodidades, pero también dormitorios para hombres y mujeres separados.  habitaciones con cama doble con baño privado y habitaciones dobles con baño compartido.  restaurante para comidas.  piscina.  Magnífica vista a las plantaciones de cafeteros.  Inalámbrico.  TELEVISOR.  ofrecen paseos a caballo.  visita a la finca cafetalera.  Los precios son muy correctos.  comuníquese con Matias o Dimitri al +57 321 2205413 para reservar y obtener más información.  Hablan francés, inglés y español.  ellos son muy amigables.

name: Really good map 2022
description: Here behind the white fence wall, between the arepa lady and the shop/bar, there is a really awesome updated 2022 map of Palomino. Very handy!

name: Via estaciamiento
description: Paid parking, 20,000 per night. Wi-Fi and water available on site

name: Hotel La Patrona
description:
Small basic hotel, very clean. 
Double room for 45.000 COP. Private bathroom. Air conditioning.
Secure parking in the backyard.

name: Chevere beach
description: A little place on the beach   You can sleep here near the hotel directely on the beach

name: Spices by weight/cakes - El Sembrador
description: Awesome little shop with spice refills by weight, lots of gluten free pastas and special sauces, and the best part — amazing cake slices! The cheesecake is awesome!

name: S.Sebastian camping
description: camping is here not at the hotel.shadwd area.toilets-shower(?) bit I did not venture...not bad at all for 7000 1p+camper.

name: behind the church
description:
Little grassy spot directly in front of a hedge which is more or less level. Enough space for our 6m car, just watch out not to block the exit on the right. 

We had to stop on our way to Ipiales, and we were happy when a local recommended this, because unlike the main road it is quiet during the night.

There are no facilities, but on the other side of the road there are are a few trees and bushes where you can do a Nr° one in piece.

name: Hotel Tayambe
description:
Nice hotel with secure parking and pool. 149,000 Col for double room with en-suite - cold shower.
No restaurant at the moment but she cooked us an evening meal and breakfast. Very nice people.

name: Hotel Oasis Pijao
description:
Newish hotel, lovely pool area and restaurant. Town centre with bars, shops and restaurant. 160 Col for extra large double with a/c including breakfast.
Very nice.

name: Nomada Hospedaje
description:
Basic hotel. Friendly people.
We paid 70.000 COP for two people. 
Double room own bathroom. Hot water.
They have secure motorcycle parking next door or in front of the hotel is also space for cars behind a gate. We paid 5.000 COP for the parking.

name: very steep, very rough
description: this is a very rough road all the way but at this point is more or less impassible unless you're an off-road expert.

name: Berlio Deluxe w/ Laundry!!
description: This is THE stop you want to make if you want to do some laundry admin! The little suites have private brand new washing machines AND DRYERS!! Such a luxury, we washed and dried everything we own. Super fancy, has kitchen, desk, 2 TVs, secure private parking (height around 3m, width is 2.8m in the little tunnel into the parking lot). 150/night per apartment.

name: Finca Villa Maria
description:
What a treat. This is an expansive coffee and Cacao growing farm, that welcomes campers of all varieties. 

Visitors are welcome to walk through the orchards that run a long way back from the house to a creek. You can learn about how they are processed, or feed the cooks, rabbits, and Guinea Pigs, or just kick back and relax in the shade. 

It’s far enough off the PanAm that there is no traffic noises, just your typical farm animal sounds. There are ice creams across the street at the neighbours house and plenty of small shops in the neighbouring houses, or a supermarket and restaurants in the plaza 2km away. 

They also have two rooms available, one with a bunk bed and the other has a double and en-suite. 

We camped for 10000p each. 

You can also see their location on google maps.

name: Casa Rosa Hostel
description: Nice hostel in the city center. Great location. Secure motorcycle parking available. Could park it inside the hostel. We paid 80.000 COP for a double room with private bathroom. Laundry available for 5.000 COP / kilogram. Really friendly lady who helped us.

name: Canyon Overlook
description: Good sized pullout off a paved section of road.  Large enough for two vehicles.  Can back up to the edge for a nice view.  Claro service comes and goes.  Quiet night.  Some traffic during the day.  View into canyon is very nice.  Some grass areas along road to take dogs out.

name: Refugio En El Bosque
description:
Very cozy ‘cabaña’ in the mountains. The owner is so friendly. It’s close to a viewpoint, just a few minutes walking. At the viewpoint there’s a nice bar where you can drink something and grab some food.
There’s secure parking at the accommodation. We put the motorcycle under a roof. We paid 110.000 COP for a double room, private bathroom. Hot shower. Breakfast is included.

name: Sendero del Fique
description: Nice short walk out of town and along a river with a few swimming opportunities.  Great for our dog.

name: Dura Gas
description: Perfect to fill a fixed LPG tank. The guy fills bottles too. If you have your own adaptor it's better but he has several. 16k/gallon. Open 7am to 5pm. Close saturdays.

name: Hotel Dos Quebradas Cascada Afrodita
description: Hotel that offers camping. Restaurant, waterfall, pool, billiards area, washrooms, and showers. Big rig friendly. COP 25,000 pp.

name: vía a Baru
description:
Unfortunately in Playa Blanca you can no longer camp or visit freely, the trade flooded the beach, so go straight on the road and take the Baru road on the right hand side. You will find some spaces for camping, they are areas that are nobody's, the indications of this place will indicate a place that has wires and fences, the owner is not supposed to be there, Motorcycle parking lot was going to remind us 100, we ended up negotiating in 70, it's a small beach with coral and thick sand, it has a small place to enter the sea and enjoy. However, he can give him drinking water, where he can charge his cell phone and even sell him food dishes and bring them to the camp.



lastimosamente en Playa Blanca ya no se puede acampar ni visitar libremente, el comercio inundó la playa, así que siga derecho por la carretera y tome a mano derecha en una trocha la vía Baru. va a encontrar algunos espacios para acampar, son zonas que no son de nadie, las indicaciones de este lugar le vana  señalar un lugar que tiene alambres y cercas, se supone que no está el dueño, es uno de los tantos lotes que los nativos se adueñaron y cobran por la bañada o la quedada, por acampar 2 días y 3 noches con 2 parqueaderos de motos nos iba a acordar 100, terminamos negociando en 70, es una pequeña playa con coral y arena gruesa, tiene un pequeño lugar para entrar al mar y disfrutar. Sin embargo él señor le puede brindar agua potable, donde cargar el celular y hasta le vende platos de comida y se los trae hasta el campamento.

name: La Golden
description: Very nice and welcoming family-run hotel. Basic but clean rooms, we paid 60k for a double room (with bathroom, fan), would be slightly more with air con. Short walk to the city center, lots of shops & restaurants around, yet quiet at night.

name: Piedra de Oti
description: Safe and quiet place to stay with a fantastic view

name: palominos
description: small parking lot for a vehicle near the quiet church and on the people are super nice

name: Orion campamento interestelar
description: Beautiful and quiet place in the gray desert, perfect for look the sky, Mario and Pals are super Host, you can contact at the telephone +573193601170. the road is unpaved.

name: Peaje Aburra Tunel
description: Tunel has 5 km Peaje Aburra cost $18,100 Route 62

name: En la calle
description:
When we arrived at the town there were a lot of traffic, after  much rounds we found this street. We asked if it's safe here and the man said yes. We stayed 1 night safe. 

-------------


Cuando llegamos al pueblo había mucho tráfico y no encontrábamos donde parquear cerca del centro. Dando tanta vuelta encontramos esta calle tranquila y estacionamos aquí. Preguntamos a un vecino si el lugar era tranquilo y nos dijo que si. Así que nos quedamos estacionados acá, mientras pasábamos por el centro, vimos que era tranquilo y nos quedamos 1 noche.

name: Casa Antigua
description: Nice hostel in the city. bike friendly and easy to enter. The inside of the place is really nice and the owners really kind. Big room for 2 people for 95000. easy to Park the bike and enjoy the swimming pool in the back of the house After a long day ride from Cali.

name: Federal Diesel Importaciones S.A.S.
description:
Service and repair. All kind of diesel engines. (DIESEL ONLY)

We had problems with our Turbo and Santiago, his father and the team fixed it quick and very professional. They also cleaned our diesel tank and pipes. Glad we came here. They have a Lab and they can repair any kind of diesel engines. Best place in town. They even let us camp in the garage while repairing the Turbo.
Thank you very much for the immediate help.

name: Solar+
description: We had a problem with our solar panel and Alberto helped us in 30min! Very friendly. If you have problems with your panel we recommend! He also sells panels and charge controller. His contact is 3013422806

name: Restaurante y Cafetería Punto Rojo
description: Had an excellent breakfast here, tasty and good value with friendly service. It was also open early which was why I ended up there.

name: Peaje Santagueda
description: Peaje Santagueda, autopistas del cafe $11,600 CO you have to keep the ticket, because it could be police man ask it.

name: Cabañas La Bolivariana
description:
This is one for bicycle and motorbike travellers because you won't fit anything bigger than a tuktuk down this road. The maps are misleading: if coming from the highway side turn left immediately after crossing the bridge, then turn right to go under the road to the right-hand side. If you pass the police station you've taken the wrong turn.

40,000 per night for one person for a double room with private bathroom overlooking the river (if you open the window). Beautiful spot. Cold water only but it's pretty hot in the valley. Place also has a small pool, a deck overlooking the river and bridge, and a small shop on site that sells cold drinks, ice-cream, and snacks. People were very friendly. The local restaurant  is a 5-10min walk over the bridge and does everything from breakfast to dinner. For fellow cyclists: you can wheel your bike through to the room.

name: Beautiful view
description: Absolutely stunning view, great place to wild camp. The road widens significantly here, there’s a little patch of grass. Less space than the wild camping spot up the road, but a better view here. Some cars and truck pass during the day, it was quiet at night. Police passed and waved. We’re in a pop-up, so not stealth at all. 4G claro comes and goes. Felt safe, no problems!

name: Cevichería Comvinatt
description:
Very delicious seafood rice, garlic octopus, shrimp paste, ceviche. We drank Berraquillo (contains borojó, wines, energizer...) all satisfied and happy! They take time to prepare, but it'se worth the wait!
See pics for menu

name: Sonhando Acordado: Estacionamento Próximo da Praia
description:
We spent 5 nights in this beachside parking lot in the back - COP20,000 per night. Safe, quiet and beautiful.
Because we stayed overnight we did not need to pay for the bath service that exists at the entrance to the beach, but we pay COP3,000 per person to shower (cold water).
Close to several restaurants and Lodgings, quiet beach but with plenty of waves. 5 minutes walk from the river.
Loved it! The only drawbacks are mosquitoes. 

Passamos 5 noites neste estacionamento ao lado da praia, na parte dos fundos - COP20.000 por noite. Seguro, silencioso e bonito.
Por estarmos pernoitando não precisamos pagar pelo serviço de banho que existe na entrada da praia, mas pagamos COP3.000 por pessoa para duchar (água fria).
Próximo de vários restaurantes e Hospedagens, praia tranquila sem muvuca, mas com bastante onda. à 5 minutos de caminha do rio.
Amamos! Único inconveniente são os mosquitos.

name: Sonhando Acordado: Rua Sem Saída Frente Mar
description:
We spent a night on this dead-end street near the beach. Quiet and safe. There was a night security guard at the very lovely corner house. 

Passamos uma noite nessa rua sem saída ao lado da praia. Silenciosa e segura. Havia um segurança noturno na casa da esquina muito amável.

name: Finca Hotel Alto Bonito
description: Beautiful and quiet place. Great view. We paid 100.000 COP for a double room. Breakfast included. There’s also a restaurant. People are very nice. Secure parking.

name: Hotel Portal Las Lajas
description: Hotel in walking distance to cathedral. Private double room with en-suite for 70,000 COP. Secure parking next door for 15,000 per Moto large vehicles arrive early.  Nice, very clean, room. Warm, good bed.

name: Villa Calasan
description:
Guest house run by delightful family (son speaks English). Nice rooms with mixture of private or shared bathrooms. Nice pool, jacuzzi and shared kitchen.
They will make a nice breakfast for you upon request which is good value. Also sell beers and snacks at shop prices.
Inside secure parking for motos and cars.
Nice little town with quality restaurants and Xmas festival.
Approx £20 per night - highly recommended.

name: Playa perdida
description:
Translation: It is a very complete hostel with accommodation in cabins, hammocks, camping and you can make a camper or enter with a mobile home.

On the last stretch of the road there are some small bushes that can scratch the vehicle a bit if it is very high, but otherwise the road is completely passable and they have good places to camp with a vehicle.

It has a beach, the bathrooms are with water that must be poured from a bucket and the ideal is to have a good supply of fresh water, which is scarce in this area, good food, not many vegetarian options.

Es un hostal muy completo con acomodación en cabañas, hamacas, camping y se puede hacer camper o entrar con una casa rodante.

En el último trayecto del camino hay unos arbustos pequeños que pueden rayar un poco el vehículo si es muy alto, pero por lo demás el camino es totalmente transitable y tienen buenos lugares para acampar con un vehículo.

Tiene playa, los baños son con agua que se debe vertir con balde y lo ideal es tener una buena provisión de agua dulce que es escasa en esta zona, buena comida no muchas opciones vegetarianas.

name: Safe and small parking
description:
Small parking a few meters entry town. 

parqueadero pequeño a unos pocos metros desde que entras al pueblo. Es seguro. 
$3,000 CO x hora.

name: Hostal Rolled
description:
Nice place to stay. Friendly owner. 
Paid 80.000 COP for a basic double room for 2 persons, no AC but there is a fan. Shared bathroom.
Breakfast for 8.000 COP per person is optional.
Motorcycle could be parked inside.

name: Primax station Urea/water
description:
nice service station with Urea adblue blueDef and a water tap for filling up the tank.

station service sympa avec Urea adblue blueDef et un robinet d'eau pour le plein du réservoir.

bonita estación de servicio con Urea adblue blueDef y grifo de agua para llenar el depósito.

name: Highway in repairing
description: the road is being repaired, we had to wait for 20 minutes.

name: Ibaque
description:
On our way from Salento to Toche, we had a lot of rain. we had to find an emergency spot and the wildcamp next to the  river was impossible to use. 
In this restaurant, there are rooms available. It's not recommended unless it's an emergency. Small rooms are not really clean with very old beds. The ladies are nice but a bit rough. 
Seems like there is a shower and internet but they didn't propose anything. 
we paid 15000 COP/pp. probably possible to camp with a tent.
In case of emergency, you will find a roof here !

name: Cañón de Combeima
description: Official parking lot in the forest. Soer and calm. Upon arrival at night, the gate can be opened (no castle) Police are from 8-16 at the entrance. Excellent for hiking tours ... Entrance to the national park approx. 1 hour walk through nature ... Recommended viewpoint "Silencio"

name: Lujos El Trapiche
description:
Installed a new car alarm system and a backup camera on our Troopy. We worked with Diomar (sales) and Johandry (installation). Top rate, extremely competent and we were very well treated and happy with the work. They also repaired a lock on a box and ran down some electrical issues we were having. 

This business also sells tires, lighting, warn winches, car stereos, etc. 

Great people and we highly recommend this company.

name: El Mirador Restaurant.
description:
Got to this place…..good food! 

Vegetarian option. Hot tea, some kind of great drink. Lentils, rice, beets, plantains (of course) French fries, beef. Filling and great. Clean restrooms and place. The store has beer, chips, etc. 

We paid 30k total for two meals.

name: Hotel Emerawaa
description:
Stay at this place! 

Secure parking behind a wall and gate. No height restriction. 

Shower gel, shampoo and conditioner in a hot water shower. Yeah, that kinda place. Cold ac. Super clean. Nice pool. 

We paid $30 usd cash for two people. Nice folks at the front counter with some English.

name: Eco Lodge Villa Laura & Travel By Nature
description:
It is a quiet and sustainable place to enjoy nature, we protect fauna and flora, we protect the habitat of birds and we preserve the forests of the mountains of Reserva Manantial, where the waters for our consumption and that of the inhabitants of the area are born. region; we are a hotspot in Bird Watching.

Incredible routes to appreciate nature. Nature and Peace Trails, the Gallito de Roca Emblematic Bird Route, Yerbabuena Waterfall Hiking, Nature and Coffee Tour, Finca El Manantial Nature Reserve, Mirador de la Virgen Sanctuary, discover the history of Colombia that is hidden under the magic of the Nature.

name: La Garrucha Start point
description:
the start point to the Garrucha. 10000 cop/p. the round trip.

le point de départ pour monter à la Garrucha (la poulie).

name: El Breton
description:
Real crepes from a French chef who is from Brittany.
Traditional crepes and also fusion of Colombian and French cuisine in the crepes !
All the family loved them, so tasty !

name: Puerto Tejada and surrounding area
description:
I am travelling by foot and was walking with a friend when we were given a police escort through this area organised by some locals in Guachené who were worried about our safe passage. 

You’ll see on google maps “PRECAUCION (Hurtos a mano armada ) Pandillas” -> CAUTION (Armed robberies) Gangs. 

This isn’t guerrilla activity, however it is serious. 

The police were with us along the PanAm from  the southern most entry to the northern most entry of the town (visible on my map image) and we were specifically told to stay out of the town, and not to use the back roads but rather stay on the PanAm. 

If you’re travelling through by bike or vehicle, do not stop in or along the parameter of the town and you should be ok. 

The police were comfortable with us continuing alone after point B on the map. 

The people from the town of Guachené where really warm and welcome but advised it’s better for travellers to stay in Caloto when heading south toward Silvia, or along the PanAm outside of the Puerto Tejada area.

name: Veterinario Dr Freckles
description:
Here we found a better service and a better price for issuing our dog's health certificate!  Doctor Maria Juliana, in addition to being very competent, is also very kind and patient. She helped us to understand all the procedures to travel to Panama with our dog, which is a bit complicated!  Especially regarding the dates, since in Colombia, the certificate can not be issued before 5 days of the travel date! 
It was COP 150.000 for the consult.

name: Terpel GLP LPG Pasto
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: This is a fuel station which offers vehicle LPG: bottles CANNOT be filled here.

At the moment this is one of the few automotive GLP stations in Colombia, and the only one south. Perfect to charge your fixed LPG tank if you arrive in Colombia or leave for Ecuador.

name: Mercado de Pescados y Mariscos
description: Very nice and clean fish market. You can buy fresh sea food and also have a lunch.

name: Clean showers @ truck stop
description: Really nice, clean cold showers. 2000k is the price on the wall, but I asked the lady and she said it was free. Really convenient if you’ve been wild camping!

name: Las Gachas Trail
description: There is room for a single vehicle to get level and park at the end of the road along the walking trail to Las Gachas. We asked the small tienda and the closest house if it was ok to park there and they said it was ok. We spent two nights here. We are in a truck camper and it was pretty tight to turn around, so would not recommend anything larger.

name: Alcohol shop Químicos Calima
description: shop that sells alcohol 96%.  it is not sold by supermarkets or farmaciad.

name: motorcycle parts and repairs
description: this street is full of motorcycle repair shops and parts.

name: Inaoska
description: Good place, small but clean and comfortable rooms.  There is a restaurant on site that opened especially for us in the evening.  Gated and secure parking.  Staff are lovely and friendly.  We paid 135,000 Colombian pesos for a room with breakfast included ($29USD at todays exchange rate).

name: Santuario de Fauna y Flora, Los Flamencos
description: Went to do some wild camping in the sanctuary, was informed by a park ranger that camping deep in the park isn't recommended because it's too remote and could be unsafe. redirected us to some options close to the game warden office that would be watched by a security guard all night. we could either go in some grass roof gazebos (one on the beach of the lagoon, one more in the woods) or a cabin where we would be able to charge our phones; all for FREE. we opted for the beach gazebo where we set up or hammocks. The sea breeze and view were amazing. the park ranger was so welcoming and generous. there are restaurants nearby if wanted but we brought our own food. highly recommend

name: Plaza
description: Small cute plaza with parking on one side. Police station on the plaza and they said it was fine to spend the night. Small little town with the basics. There is a waterfall we can see from town but could not figure out how to get to it. We spent a Sat night here, was quiet except for the church bells at 4:30am for 30 minutes. We are in a truck camper and had no issues with the streets. Probably would not enter town with anything bigger.  Would stay again, but prob not on a Sat night due to bells on top of us.

name: parkin oxxo groceries
description: the parking lot of the oxxo store open 24 hours, in the back part I spent the night, safe place, xon surveillance, some vehicle noise. free of charge.

name: Entrepan Gourmet Sandwiches!
description: Awesome sandwich restaurant, really cute garden area, great place to stop for lunch. The lamb tzatziki sandwich was out of this world.

name: notaria (poder)
description: (for shipping)Here you can do the poder to enter the port with the owner of your car, in case one person doesn't want to drive or need extra help to fit in the container. cost $6200cop

name: Pull off
description: Just a pull off on the dirt road from/to Gambita.  Big enough space to be off the road, and level.  Overlooking the river.  Not a single vehicle passed by overnight.  Some houses across the river.  Good for a night on this slow road.  Nice views of the mountains.  Claro service is barely appearing, but we did get some emails.

name: Nice secluded waterfall
description: A 10 minute hike from the Bibliotheca brings you to a very beautiful waterfall that you can walk right up to.  Likely you will be there by yourself.

name: Sonhando Acordado: Estacionamento no Parque Electrificadora
description:
Parking around the square with lots of spaces and no low trees or fruit. Busy square, with sports courts and police booth. Quiet residential neighborhood.
We spent two quite nights.  

Estacionamento ao redor da praça com muitas vagas e sem árvores baixas ou com frutos. Praça bem movimentada, com quadras esportivas e cabine da Polícia. Bairro residencial tranquilo.
Passamos duas noites calmas e sem barulho.

name: Between Hilton & Restaurant
description: Since we heard already about the negative possible way to park and overnight further into the park. We decide to park in the very beginning. Just when the parking from the restaurant finish. Grass area light and secured. Everyone around saying is safe and the cops pass by a couple of time and didn't say anything. Others overlanders were told that is forbidden to park next to the trees (is nicer and maybe more quiet). In this spot were we overnight is fairly quiet and doesn't smell pee like the formal parking lot 100m away were all the taxi drivers go to the toilet. Ps: if you go to the port from here be aware after 8am the traffic get really busy and you need extra time !!)

name: Barranquero
description:
Best place we've stayed at in Colombia so far (and we've travelled all the country for 5 months) !!!

The place is owned by Bruno and Laurence, a French couple who spent most of their life in Africa before they decided to build this place from the ground in the middle of the jungle.

It's a hotel, but being overlanders themselves they love to welcome other travelers like us. The place is incredibly beautiful and quiet, surrounded by nature and has direct access to the river with natural pools. Lots of space to camp on nice grassy area. Everything is very clean and well-arranged. No mosquitoes - which is rare in this area.

It is located just 5 minutes from the entrance of Tayrona Park but we saw more animals here than in the park (tons of birds, huge iguanas, monkeys, we even saw Cottontop Tamarins who are almost extinct!!). 

From here you can also hike in the jungle or until Las Cocos beach, rent horses, etc, just ask and they'll be pleased to help, there's a lot to do.

The food from the restaurant/bar was delicious, probably the best we've had in Colombia, including vegetarians/vegans options and cocktails.

Bruno knows everything about mechanics and has a big garage with lots of tools in case you need to work on your truck/car/bike.

To get there you'll need to cross the small village of San Rafael, there's a sign from the main road. Then head down the steep dirt road (4x4 mandatory during rain season) which leads to the first river to cross.The water level really depends of the rains but anyway you'll need high clearance. We crossed with motorbikes and it was okay. Then follow the signs and cross the second river (smaller) to get to the hotel.

They put up some drone shots showing how to access on their instagram account so people can figure out if its doable or not : @barranquero.hotel
I put a screenshot of the first river crossing (the river was low).

Last but not least : they have optical fiber so the internet is very fast and there is a super chill working space above the restaurant.

Price : 20.000 COP pp, definitely worth it. Very recommended.

name: Reserva Natural Finca El Manantial
description: Finca El Manantial Nature Reserve is a wildlife sanctuary under restoration. It is located in the Cordillera de Calarma between 1800 and 2900 masl. This area is conserved with the objective of protecting the fauna and flora of the region, it is part of a large private conservation area that we conserve the water that supplies the urban aqueducts of San Antonio and Ortega, Tolima. Endemic, vulnerable and endangered bird species have been located there, it is a hotspot for bird watching and a great natural viewpoint, since you can see the Central Cordillera, El Nevado del Huila, La Yerbabuena in Roncesvalles, Cuchilla la Siberia, La Sucia, the Cerros de Cumbarco and the municipality of San Antonio.

name: Parque Prinipal
description: Can spend the night on the perimeter of a large central park in this nice town. Very quiet overnight on a Tuesday. Some good restaurants around. and of course Feijoa treats.  We drove into town and parked with a truck camper with no issues.

name: La linterna
description:
an old-fashioned printing press of handmade posters.  super interesting.

une imprimerie à l'ancienne d'affiches faites main. super intéressant.

una antigua imprenta de carteles hechos a mano.  súper interesante

name: Street store
description:
Eliza is from a town in the south, Pedregal, home of Arepas Vientos… and she makes them here! Stop and try them, it’s worth it, its like eating something between a pancake or donut. 
Served with coffee, 2500COP

name: Osprey Ecolodge
description:
Ecolodge with cosy bamboo-style cabanas right at the river. Peaceful. Concerts of birds and animals. Excursions during the day possible via boat to e.g Laguna, Bird Watching etc.
Meals are provided. Friendly and helpful family. Paid 100k COP/night for the double bed cabana, one person. Parked motorbike next to cabana. Cold shower.
Can be reached by motorbike, car, potentially also larger rigs. Yet would check in re road condition, especially after rain. Detailed arrival route to be sent via WhatsApp.
Nathaly: +57 318 6678946

name: Hotel Oriente Real
description: Might be the best value place you'll find in Rio Negro, one block from the main plaza. Decent size room with private bathroom and hot water from a central geyser for 40,000COP (one person, might be the same for two but I'm not sure). Good for bike travellers because hardly any stairs if you take a room on the first floor. Some simple common areas to sit in. There is a parquadero next door for those in camper vans but not sure how much extra it might be to park there. Location on GoogleMaps is slightly wrong, I've tried to give better coordinates.

name: Previsora Seguros SOAT
description: This is the official place to receive a SOAT. Directly across the police station next to the grand Plaza.

name: pull off between San Roque and Santo Domingo
description: we were trying to get to another ioverlander site on this road and we got sick of navigating the terrible potholes. ended up parking in a pull off. beautiful spot: lovely view of the grassy mountains covered in cows. down the side of the hill there is a clean stream where we were able to wash up a little. other than dogs barking a little from a house nearby no one bothered us at all.

name: Casa Mr Wilson
description: Nice Campsite where you can put your tent or hammock. Access to toilet/bathroom. Ask for wifi. 15.000 pesos per person per day in high season.

name: Parqueadero El Chico
description:
Great little gem if you have your own toilet. It’s a 5 minute walk from all the hip and happening restaurants, malls and parks in El Chico and a 30 minute taxi ride to all the main attractions. We parked here for 4 nights. They close the gates around 8pm at night but give you a key so you can come and go as you please.
You have access to potable water so you can fill up your tank and there is even a sewer dump to empty your black tank!!!! The cost for 24hour stay is 35,000 Colombian pesos. There is no height restriction if your tall like us. Just a word of warning- they have license plate restrictions when driving in Bogotá, so check whether the last digit on your plate ends with odd or even and which day you can drive.

name: Finca La Florida
description:
Near the termales you will see signs for the campgroung/termales/restaurant Finca la Florida. you need to leave your car or bike up there (safe parking at the small tienda) and go down walking 1km (15 minutes) down there at the Finca. 
you will find a small house with a large Thermal swimming pool. Rooms available as weel as tent and camping spots. (70 for a room 40 rent a tent 30 to camp all per person) 
The food is also really good and around 20k per person. 
The termales are really hot and less crowded than the one up there. The view is stunning on the Valley. 
Really one of this magical place ! (despite the difficult Access that you forgot immediatly)

name: Hostal Yamboró
description: Very nice Hostal outside of Pitalito. Smaller and larger rooms available at COP 79000 (€15) for two. Private room with bathroom ( shower cold) Very friendly people. Biljart and table tennis available. Swimming pool on the other side of the road, to be used for free by guests. Breakfast available but not included. Kitchen available or restaurant service on weekdays. We parked our bikes next to our room in the game hall. Really quiet place!

name: parqueadero celito lindo
description: 24 hour secure parking impossible to park our Unimog here

name: Green energy - panel solar
description: We have a problem with the energy solar in our van. They found the problem in the controler and changed it. They resolved our problem in the moment. They had a second hand controler so it was cheeper $200.000 COP everything. Very nice people!!

name: palma azul
description: simple hotel on the waterfront.50k x night. enclosed parking space.good for motos.vehicle entrance from the back

name: Mi Casita
description:
It is a new camping, the name is Mi Casita. This place is wonderful, first because Angela and Jorge are very nice people, speak English, Spanish, and a little Portuguese too. Very quiet place.

The space is in the middle of nature, with many birds and plants.

It has electricity, Wi-Fi, water, washing machine (extra cost), bathroom.

Small Motorhomes, up to 2 people, 50,000 pesos total.  Add 15,000 per person extra.

Large motorhomes cost 70,000 pesos for 2 people, and 15,000 pesos per extra per person.

Dogs or cats are welcome! 

Please write to Angela before you arrive: + 57 314 2829022

Receives motorhome travelers, tents are not allowed (only roof tents).

name: Mi Casita
description:
Familiar and very quiet place.

Very clean, and very kind hosts.

Private rooms.

Please write to Angela for pricing and availability.
+ 57 314 2829022

name: Small local restaurant
description: We were cycling and discovered this beautiful place. Really creative, chilled and the food it's so delicious. It's run by local young family. It's a great place to stop on the road and relax from the heat

name: Balneario Casada San Juan
description: Nice spot on the brown river with small cascades and a restaurant. Road was dirt, not too bad but high clearance is a good idea. Signs of other people having camped here, but we did not.

name: Pueblo Bello
description: Beside the city park are big parking lots also for big campers. Quite and safe. facilities. wc. cold shower.

name: La Granja
description: Delicious food that comes with a large fresh salad, located on the top of a hill on a farm with private seating areas. One of the waitresses speaks fluent English and everyone is very welcoming. Prices are reasonable 15,000 for the menu and more for the special dishes.  Also really good wifi - I made a few video calls without issue.

name: Parqueo Cota Park
description: Good 24-hour parking spot to spend the night after or before visiting Juan (see mechanic icon nearby). It's nothing pretty, but it's a safe place with a surprisingly clean toilet. Just 10k a night. No height restriction.

name: Finca Alto Bonita Barbosa
description: Great place with 2 bedrooms and a little kitchen.  The people are so lovely. Secure parking for motorcycles on the farm and very quiet. We paid $25 USD plus $2 each for breakfast. +57 324 4431911

name: Roadside pull off
description: we were trying to get to another ioverlander site nearby and Google was giving us terrible directions. ended up parking in a pull off. Nice spot: walk down the road and you'd get an amazing view of the mountains. A little traffic going by on the road but no one bothered us at all. unfortunately no great place to go to the bathroom and no water source. parking spot would be big enough for an RV though.

name: Lodge Paraíso Verde
description:
Great and quiet lodge on the outside of Manizales.  Amazing views over the mountains and beautiful gardens with lots of birds.
There is a small kitchen that can be used and a games/reading room.  Lots of hot water and beds very comfy.  Good wifi.  Secure parking for motorcycles and a few cars but the drive down is steep. We paid $28USD for two of us and included a good breakfast

name: Jepiraichi Maliiwala camp
description: After being thrown from camp nearby which don’t accept campers anymore and have only cabanas I bump here by night and try  this day campsite. They accept I overnight. I only paid 25000 cp for diner (fish and patacones). Staff very friendly. Very quiet and safe. No light in the camp but don’t worry about that. Only toilet outside. No other amenities. Highly recommended place with flat and very large Sandy area.

name: Mirador & Restaurant Cocorna
description: Amazing views of the huge waterfall, paragliding, and a cafeteria style restaurant. Menu del dia was 18K and plenty, we shared 1 for 2 people. Plenty of parking space.

name: Parque de los fundadores
description:
a very quiet square, during the day and at night... we spent two nights without problems, the police frequently walk around and are very friendly, diagonally 50 meters away there is a 24-hour public parking lot and they charge 500 pesos for the use of bathrooms .
---
una plaza muy tranquila, en el día y en la noche..pasamos dos noches sin problemas, la policía pasa frecuentemente dando vueltas y son muy amables, diagonal a 50metros hay un parqueadero público de 24 horas y cobran 500 pesos por el uso de baños.

name: Trucker Stop
description: A Truck Stop Place with a Restaurant.  Not too loud at night. We felt safe. Parking 5000COP, Shower 5000 COP. Good enough for a night on the road.

name: Detailju Ecotourism Camping Ubaque
description: very steep road to get there beware. nice spot an hour away from Bogota. friendly host, has snacks and drinks. 15,000 in a tent.

name: Mirador Valle de la Tatacoa
description:
An amazing place in the heart of the Tatacoa desert. 
Chepe and his wife are very friendly, hopeful and welcoming. 
They rent out small houses with shared bathroom and private.
Also possible to camp.
We loved the camping, 3rd time we came here. It is a bit more windy some not so warm.
Direct access to the hike in the Valle de Xilopalos.

Camping - 20000 per person
Cabañas - 120000 with breakfast for 2

Chepe - 3117536337

name: Mirador Valle de la Tatacoa
description:
An amazing place in the heart of the Tatacoa desert. 
Chepe and his wife are very friendly, hopeful and welcoming. 
They rent out small houses with shared bathroom and private.
Also possible to camp.
We loved the camping, 3rd time we came here. It is a bit more windy some not so warm.
Direct access to the hike in the Valle de Xilopalos.

Camping - 20000 per person
Cabañas - 120000 with breakfast for 2

Chepe - 3117536337

name: road ripping
description:
start of the very rocky potholed dirt  road

début de la route gravière.

name: Fonda Paisa La Curva
description: Restaurant with clean facilities, simple but good food and nice refershing pool. Very good stop.

name: Hospedaje El Bambu
description:
A very nice hospedaje with rooms with private bathroom very close to the parc.
Very nice plants all over and nice house.
Mauricio and his family are very friendly.

We paid 60k for a room for 3. 
Parking possible in the back.

Mauricio +573214127098

name: Cafe Incluyente
description:
Great little stop at a cafe that facilitates deaf people with a job. After practicing your Spanish you can practice your Colombian sign language too! 

It's just a little foodtruck type cafe across the street from the church. They have some nice cakes and drinks.

name: Casa Lacambra Hostal
description: Beautiful place. Rooms around a courtyard. Big rooms with hot water. Place to park your bicycle or motorbike. Very helpful staff.

name: Restaurante museo estancia
description: Great restaurant in old house (1820); nice view over the city. The whole restaurant is a museum and restaurant at the same time

name: Koju Store
description:
If you’re looking for a place to build or re-design a luggage system for your motorcycle, this is definitely a place to go. This is an official Koju (google it) store, which is owned and managed by Billy - really knowledgeable an helpful pal (he’s also a motorcyclist). Here’s what he can help you with:

1. Since this is a Koju dealer, you can get both top and side aluminum cases and accessories (racks, internal bags etc.) for them. They aren’t as good, as the ones from, say, Givi, but overall it’s a really good price/quality ratio.
2. Billy has its own production of waterproof saddlebags, so you can order them here. You can choose the size, design etc. Might take a week or two to get them ready, but he can also send them to you across the country (I used this option, since didn’t want to wait).
3. Finally, you can order practically any kind of metalworks for your bike: side-racks, top rack, crash-bars etc. Billy organizes the whole process with one of the specialized nearby workshops, which includes the design, quality control etc.

I personally fulfilled all 3 points from above, and can’t recommend enough this service. Now, when I’m adding this place, I have more then 6 months of travelling with the new gear without any serios issues. If you’re curious about the prices: top rack + side racks + 47L top case + 2x 35L saddlebags costed me about $650 in total.

name: Cmplejo Tuiristico Patacoré
description: Right next to the “Patacoré” complex, there is a small hotel which can also accommodate vans/motorhomes. There are only one or 2 places but even big rigs can fit (ours is 7m40 long, 3m high which is the maximum to fit). There is a swimming pool, billiards, electricity, toilets, water, etc.). We paid 50,000 pesos per night for the vehicle. They also rent rooms if you need. It's smaller than Patacoré with a little fewer services (no restaurant but a fast food delivery service in the evening) but also more intimate (we were alone for 2 days)! You can choose now ! Juste à côté du complexe « Patacoré », il y a un petit hôtel qui peut également accueillir des vans/camping-car. Il n’y a qu’une ou 2 places mais même les grands camping-car peuvent rentrer (le notre fait 7m40 de long, 3m de haut ce qui est le max pour pouvoir rentrer). Il y a une piscine, un billard, de l’électricité, des toilettes, de l’eau, etc…). Nous avons payé 50.000 pesos par nuit pour le véhicule. Ils louent également des chambres. C’est plus petit que Patacoré avec un tout petit peu moins de services (pas de restaurant mais un service de livraison de fast food le soir) mais aussi plus intimiste (nous étions seuls pendant 2 jours)! A vous de de choisir!

name: El encanto Birdwarching
description: Don Luis runs a birdwatching site from his ranch and plants a shrub know as Cavendishia Quereme from which he extracts a perfume. The last 20m are very steep and tricky. There is place for max 2 vehicles.

name: Sleep 💤 for motorhome
description:
Very spacious place to park and sleep very safe. it is a Terpel station, it has bathrooms but there is no shower. it is a very quiet place. you pay only 7,000 pesos Colombia is (1.5 dollars) it has a beverage dispenser machine, nearby is the town of Cucaita 5 minutes away. you can order addresses

-------------------------------------------------------------

lugar muy amplio para estacionar y dormir muy seguro. es una estación de Terpel, tiene baños pero no hay ducha. es un lugar muy tranquilo. pagas solo 7.000 pesos Colombia is (1.5 dólares) tiene máquina dispensador de bebidas , cerca está el pueblo de Cucaita a 5 minutos. puedes pedir domicilios

name: Estación Terpel sleep motorhome
description:
Hello, I'm Ford Lady traveling the world in my motorhome. In this place I slept on January 29, 2023, it is a quiet and safe place where you can park your motorhome, Terpel gas station, it has very clean public toilets. you pay for your car all night for 7,000 pesos Colombia (1.5 dollars). you can ask for addresses. Nearby is the town of Cucaita Boyacá.

---------------------------------------------------------

Hola soy Ford Lady viajando por el mundo en mi motorhome. En este lugar dormí el 29-ene-2023, es un lugar tranquilo y seguro donde puedes estacionar tu motorhome, estación de gasolina Terpel, tiene baños públicos muy limpios. pagas por tu carro toda la noche por 7.000 pesos Colombia (1.5 dólares). puedes pedir domicilios. cerca está la población de Cucaita Boyacá.

name: Authentic Arabic Cuisine!
description: Rare find in Colombia! Lovely Moroccan owner and delicious food!

name: Rio El Queremal
description: Level place at the riverside of the cristal clear Queremal River. Wild camping. No facilites. Many local visitors on weekends.

name: Taquería Cuernavaca
description: If you’re missing those tacos from Mexico, you’ve got to stop in here! Their 'al pastor' tacos are legit, delicious! Margaritas are yummy too! 10/10!

name: Hacienda Origen
description: Really nice restaurant. Besides regular meals, there are Colombia traditional plates. Most plates are shareable, if you are traveling with kids/young teenagers. Plates from 25 to 35k cop. Desayuno also served.

name: Living Hostel
description: Parking available, no height restrictions and 2 double length spots, so should be fine for biggish rigs. Rooms are cheap, 75K on Booking, 90K in person - clean, private washroom & hot water. They were fully booked for our last day and said we could stay in the camper for free and use the toilet (no shower). Right next to the metro station is convenient.

name: Hotel Sapay
description:
Nice cheap hotel with big safe parking lot. We paid in total 40.000 cop for one room with fan and private bathroom. For 20.000 extra you can use the air-conditioning. The shower is only cold water, but that seems to be normal here in town. WiFi was average, but worked for us. 

Enjoy!

name: Kasama Hotel
description: Lovely place to stay overlooking the Magdelana Valley.  Secure parking for motorcycles. Very quiet and peaceful.  The owners are just lovely and went out of their way to help us and tell us what we could do in the area.  It’s a short 15 minute walk of 10 mil pesos for a taxi to town.  We paid 140 mil peso for two of us including breakfast.  Phone +57 315 2897552

name: Lili
description: nice rooms .newly decorated .lots of staff but lazy service! worth it for 60000cop

name: La Casa del Ciclista
description: Perfect place for cyclists. Manuel and his wife are very nice.

name: quiet street parking
description: came to have dinner around here and decided to go to sleep.since it looks like a decent neighbourhood.seen police patrolling around several times.quiet night

name: Free Parking
description: Free parking with surveillance and security.

name: truck stop
description: Trucks stop here. There is a Terpel and a small hotel. Relatively OK night.

name: Private House - Janet and Josué
description: Very nice family accepted us to stay in their home. Free of charge. However they said they could happily take other cyclists in the future for a small fee or donation. Really kind. They had business with the trucks, but due to landslide the route for the trucks was changed, they lost the business and the family would like to find another way to sustain themselves.

name: Hotel/Glamping/ Camping Sol Pintada
description:
We met owner of the place - Filipe, in the town  He has traveled 5 years throughout South America and invited us to stay for free in his hotel, which also offers camping and glamping (cabañas). The place is really nice. There is a small playground for kids, restaurant, swimming pool and a lot of trees and birds around it. There are many facilities. He said travelers with cars are also welcomed.
We stayed for free, but I think for the others coming there will be a cost. You can always ask and figure it out. 
You can see where we slept in our tents. The place is quite and safe. 
Filipe number is: +57 314 744 2384

name: Access to the Trail to Amazing Waterfall
description: This is a dirt road where you walk down to get to the entrance, from the main road.

name: La Vega, Cundinamarca
description:
Plaza principal del pueblo. 

Town main plaza.

name: La Martinica
description: I found this place on Airbnb. It is a beautiful secure place just on the outskirts of town. The host will help you and take care of everything for you. You're two bedrooms with a shared bath and the grounds or immaculate with colorful painted areas and flowers everywhere. very relaxing

name: Clube Camping Isla Mar
description:
Fantastic place for to stay! Private Beach. Cabanas too, but for 5, 14 people. 
Delicious restaurant, with good prices. 30.000/40.000 for plate p.p
Water and electricity. 
Mr Jorge is a nice person. 
The sunset is fantastic. 
Only for motorhome and roof tent. 

40.000 p.p

name: 1533 Restaurante Bar
description: Nice restaurant in the old town. Not as expensive as most of the others here. Shareable plates. 40-50k cops.

name: La Chavela Container Restaurant
description: A really beautiful restaurant with very nice people. We bought a beer and asked if we could park overnight in the very large parking lot and if it was safe and they said of course, no problem! Better option than the Terpel down the road. Free, nice view, potable tap on building around the side of the washroom. Washrooms closed from 11pm-10am. Road was quiet 10pm-5am.

name: El Palacio de los Frijoles
description: Great service, great food and nice location. Not too cheap but good quality. Parking right in front of the restaurant and directly on the highway. They even have vegetarian options! 😍

name: roadside pull off
description: after we were rejected by la Vaca que rie we drove to a river we saw on the map nearby. the road was a little too narrow by the river itself but a little before it there was a gravel patch we could park for the night with enough room for other cars to get past. very quiet, just a few farmers walking by. everyone ignored us. had a nice, restful night.

name: Texaco showers
description: This petrol station has showers! They’re located in the same room as the washrooms. Free from what I can tell!

name: Trailhead for Cueva del Esplendor
description:
This is where you park (8k) and the trailhead begins to walk to this AWESOME cave with an amazing waterfall inside (20k entry including mandatory guide). The road leading here is steep and narrow, no big rigs. You could probably do it without 4x4, the really steep sections are paved. 
We asked about overnighting in this parking lot and they said yes for 10k, the view is amazing.

name: Hotel Olga
description:
This hôtel is clean and well located.  
Double room with AC for 50 000.
Rooms are comfortable, private bathroom with shower. 
Our bikes were stored under the patio behind. Really calm place in the center. We got a place to wash and dry our clothes, access to kitchen. The entire hotel is secured.

name: Cafe de la Esquina
description: Best breakfast in Salento by far. Generous portions, crispy arepas, greasy spoon/diner vibes.

name: Élite Dental
description:
Very good dental clinic. They have English speaking doctors and did a great job fixing our teeth. The place is very professional, modern and clean. 
We are Swiss and have to say this place could be in Switzerland, too - with a 90% discount on Swiss prices.

name: hotel La Ceiba
description:
Really nice and clean hotel. $50.000 for a double bed for a sólo traveler, and a matrimonial is $110.000.

Good internet, hot water, fan, toilets have a toilet seat.

There is secure parking around the corner for a few thousand pesos, but the hotel is right across from the police station and the town is super tranquilo, so I just parked on the street.

You can contact them on 3022342244 or @HotelLaCeibaValparaiso

Tip: there's an excellent peruvian restaurant just off the main square!

name: La Primavera
description:
Pool and hotel with a big parking lot. We needed a spot and ended up here. If you pay for a day pass for the pool (20k pp) you can sleep in the parking lot (make sure to ask at the reception). 

Toilets, showers, pool and hot (warm) tubs available until 8/9pm. Little shop with drinks and snacks. Right next to the road, so some traffic noise. Great cell reception and fast 4G. Pets only on the parking lot. There's a height restriction, but we went in easily with 3m, I guess 3.5m should be fine.

The town has everything you need, local Tejo bar close by if you want a Colombian experience.

name: Finca Alto Bonito Glamping
description:
A very nice place to camp and there is also glamping, very affordable prices, they sell mecatos, drinks and breakfasts. The owners are very nice.
.....
un lugar muy bonito para acampar y también hay glamping, precios muy asequibles, venden mecatos, bebidas y desayunos. los dueños son muy agradables.

name: Frenos Sabaneta
description: These guys did a perfect job on our new brake rotors after another mechanic did a not-so-perfect job. They worked quickly and we’re super nice guys! Highly recommend for brake services! They did in an hour what the other guy took 2 days to do!

name: Mucura Hotel and Spa
description: Nice hotel to stay while you wait for shipping procedures. It’s a residential area, so you’ll find restaurants, drugstores, supermarkets, laundry, around. 5 minutes walk from the airport. Good Wi-Fi outside the bedrooms. Gentle employees.

name: Hostal Las Flores
description: Nice colourful hostel/hotel, close to town. They were happy to have us park and sleep in the truck. Has a kitchen & hot shower. There is room for 3 small-medium sized vehicles. No big rigs due to the power lines. Nice place that values quietness. Really great option for Jardin!

name: parking under the bridge
description: take the little access road next to the overpass/bridge only accessible if you're heading ready on route 40 from Buenaventura to Cali. Keep left and follow the dirt road under the bridge. some noise from the highway but otherwise very peaceful. a few people walked by but all left us alone

name: Centro Ecoturistico Kofan
description:
A nice place to relax. They have a swimming pool, a restaurant, a natural pond with an ice cream bar and a short trail (1 km). 
We went here to see the Spix's Night Monkeys resting in a tree on the trail during daytime. We paid 36.000 pesos in total for two persons. We didn't use the swimming pool. Not sure if that's included. We also saw other monkey species such as Ecuadorian Squirrel Monkey and Lesson's Saddle-back Tamarin :) They have cabins where you can sleep. We don't know if you can stay here overnight. There were dogs around the restaurant and a rescued Common Woolly Monkey.

Enjoy!

name: view point road to San Roque
description:
Road side wild camping amazing view.
You have to be careful with the mountain, it may fall apart some days

name: Peaje(overnight)
description: If you are tired in your way to Armenia, there is a zone to sleep (little noisy but ok). Free. Security 24hs. Some kioscos to buy food

name: Todomotor - highly recommend mechanics
description: William is really a genius when it comes to motors and mechanics. He fixed a lot of things in the motor and mechanical parts (starter, acceleration system, cooling system, air filer, gazoline filter, transfert oil, cardans...). He also helped with the painting, which had bad scratches, and also helped with the installation of a solar panel, including welding work. My Jeep is now like new, ready to take me for my South American adventures!!!

name: Swimming beach
description:
Under a bridge.  There is a small spot to park next to the bridge or drive back from the bridge some and drive through a small gravel pit that leads down to the river

There were small kids swimming and a sandy beach along the river. 

I had a nice bath here that was very needed

name: Next to a bridge
description:
There is space on either side of this bridge. You can get to the water for a quick dip and a shower but the current is fast.  I stayed next to the huge rocks and didn’t feel any pull. 

Slept great with the sound of the rapids.

name: Glamping Sumercé
description: This is Glamping site, reservation only. They provide you with the complete set-up, you just need to arrive at the agreed time. It has a nice tent, a full bathroom with hot water, mini-fridge, a coal BBQ and a full-sized bed. Its host Jaime is the loveliest man! He will make sure your stay is as perfect as can be, he will have breakfast cooked and served wherever you want it, all other meals are your responsibility. pet-friendly, awesome site-seeing and hiking areas. Find them on instagram as glampingsumerce. Rates vary depending on season. they can set-up other beds for up to 4-5 people families.

name: Corazón de Mujer
description: Cool little cafe with some good juices. It's run by a local association of women and is quite nice if anyone is passing through

name: Road from La Primavera to Puerto Gaitan
description:
The “road” is approximately 140 miles between carreno and primavera. In a Land Cruiser it took us 9.5 hours. He road was dry, very very dusty with huge holes and ruts. Brace yourself for this one. Can’t imagine what it would be like when wet. Gas up on both ends. 

Good luck.

name: Hotel
description: 45,000 for one person in a room. Basic, cold water and a fan in the room. Seems a bit expensive for what it is but the town itself is kind of cute

name: Virgin Mary camp
description:
I parked next to the Virgin Mary statue for the night.  I talked to a neighbor and they were ok with it.  It was quieter then it would have been near the square 

I also asked the neighbors near the cemetery and futbol field. They also said it would be good. At that spot there is a very nice look out.  

I only picked the Virgin Mary spot over the other because I was invited into one of the neighbors house for a café so I stayed there.  But both looked good and calm

They did say there is a camping place you can pay to stay at somewhere near. But I wasn’t sure where and it was already dark

They said there is a park that is above the town some that is nice but said sometimes people go there to smoke weed.

name: Hostel Amuya
description: Hostel with room for 20 persons, both bunk rooms and private rooms. Shared and ensuite baths. Common area for cooking with a refrigerator. Upper floor has a large common area with a bar, games and large smart TV. Nestor is the owner and will help with whatever your needs are. Groceries and restaurants are within walking distance. Private and secure motorcycle parking.

name: Potrero Grande, Municipio de Choachi
description:
This place is a large paddock, a spacious and safe place to spend the night with your car, a very large space suitable for giant motorhomes. Nearby you have a store to buy some things to eat or drink. I slept the night of February 4, 2023 without problems. Nice view and scenery. 
--
este lugar Potrero grande, lugar amplio y seguro para pasar la noche con tu carro, muy grande espacio apto para motorhome gigantes. Cerca tienes una tienda para comprar algunas cosas para comer o beber. dormí la noche del 4 de febrero 2023 sin problemas linda vista y escenario.

name: El Marqués
description:
This new hotel has rustic rooms with private bathroom, air conditioning and television (35.000 for one person, 50.000 for a couple). It is also possible to camp for free with food on site. You have all the necessary equipment to wash your clothes.
The restaurant offers cheap authentic Colombian cuisine (between 10,000 and 20,000 COB for a dish). The setting is very pleasant and perfect for relaxing.
The owner is very welcoming and eager to talk with travelers.

name: La Sarita hospedaje rural.
description: Wooden cabins, landscape, nature, family, wonderful experience.

name: Military control
description: Military control, they wanted to check our camper inside. We told them it is our house and so it is private and we could continue driving

name: Dios te salve
description:
Beautiful spot on the beach, covered with palms and a nice over most part of the day which is really important to survive the hot weather of the coast.
We stayed 3 days and we had the beach all for us 
Please make sure to have a 4x4 or a car able to go on sand. 
You have a restaurant very near.

Share your experience if you go!
@rutaplanc

name: Arreboles
description:
This is a wonderful tranquil property in the middle of the forest overlooking beautiful views. 
We were actually on our way to al Bosque, when we bumped into German, who suggested we stay here instead. 
 
He is in the process of starting up a space for overlanders with outdoor kitchen, shower, fast wifi etc. (which will be ready very soon)- but when we were there, we were offered the use of the Cabaña ‘Arreboles’ (which is beautiful) kitted with kitchen, living room, log fire and bathroom with hot shower.

The property is away from the main road, so the only noise you’re going to get is from the chickens and roosters pottering around and that’s not even too loud. The fresh free range eggs are worth ever crow anyway. 

German is a travel guide and one that we can personally recommend. If you want to go on the cable car and book a tour around ‘Comuna 13, he can book it for you and take you. If you prefer to go to Medellin by car- he’ll also do that. Not to mention shopping trips to nearby Santa Elena or Guarne. 

…and looking to improve your Spanish? German and his wife Elena can help you. In a patient and unthreatening way, they’ll have you conversing with them only in Spanish no matter your level. And they would be happy to offer classes too. 

We spent 2 weeks here and really were relaxed. We were able to experience the Antioquia culture as well as having the space and time to catch up on work etc.

***Please note that the drive is narrow so it’s not big rig friendly. We are however, a 3.7 m tall truck camper and got down no problems. ***

The price is 20‘000p/p plus 10‘000p/vehicle. If you prefer the cabaña instead of Camping it costs 125‘000/night incl. the vehicle. Price can be negotiated for longer stays. 

Don’t miss out on this super tranquil spot near Medellin with cooler temperatures and with a personal touch!

name: Muelles y Amortiguadores HD
description: We had two sets of leaf springs made to replace our broken one in our Sprinter. Took the part there in the morning, had two new sets by the end of the day. With all brackets, bolts, etc for less then 400usd. Harald from HD is easy to reach in WhatsApp. See details in the picture.  This area 'barrio triste' has anything you need in terms of parts.

name: escondite warm springs
description: such a nightmare to get here.expecially the last 4kms! huge roots rocks.broken road.4wd and high clearance a must.but I would not come back.the unkept 'pool' is neglected and looks and feel like a soup!?  the water comes out of this pipes already brown.of what looks like soil and iron powder mixed with leaves  .to top up there is an unintelligent 'caretaker'that does absolutely nothing ! +speaks misleading info and wanted to charge me extra parking$$ + 20000 for 'swimming'.said his boss told him..BS! owner is in Bogotà! sad the place is managed badly.

name: illegal blockade
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Indian private land 
This is the first of five tolls you need to pay to continue to Puerto Carreño. They are run by the indigenous families that live there and each barrier is pretty close to one another. It’s a cool cultural experience with them selling bow and arrows, handwoven hats and bags, and honey. They will want 10 mil pesos just to get through each barrier. So have plenty of loose change. We recommend buying the bow and arrows - they’re really well made.

name: Ivan El Cocuy Parque guide
description:
El Cocuy Parque is beautiful and well worth a visit IF you can figure out all of the logistics. It's incredibly difficult to get accurate information especially in English. The official park website offers inaccurate information, the biggest being that you need to register 30 days in advance, you don't.
What you need to know is this. There is no camping in the park. There are 3 hiking trails which you need a guide and have to register for ahead before entering the park. You have to register at a park office located in the town of El Cocuy or Guican and they are closed for lunch 11-2. In order to register you need daily insurance 9000/day/person (which you purchase across street a couple doors down, that's where it is in El Cocuy) and a guides name to put on the permit. Permit costs 85000/person good for 4 days. Where to find the guide is still a mystery to us. The website says there is a list on the wall we didn't see one and there wasn't any guides hanging around the office. You also have to watch a video on the park which is viewed via Google Meet twice a day once in the morning and afternoon, they will give the meeting details at the office. We were put in contact with Ivan after making many frustrating calls. Ivan is a park guide and speaks reasonable English. He was unable to actually guide us himself due to an injury but he did meet us at the park office to walk us through the insurance and registration process. He made all the arrangements for; guides for 2 days of hiking, transportation from town to La Esperanza lodge with our bikes, lodging and meals and transport for us and our bikes to the trailhead for the second hike. We tried for several frustrating days just trying to get info let alone make any progress on arrangements. He went on and above making our visit to the park happen and doing so for whatever commission he must make from the various services not his normal guide wage. He and his family are wonderful people and we literally couldn't have done it without him. You can reach Ivan at WhatsApp +57 310 7859943. 
We did 2 hikes which we highly recommend Laguna Grande de la Sierra and La Ritacyba. This website is also very helpful. 
 https://www.google.com/amp/s/thecurioustravel.com/blog/everything-you-need-to-know-about-hiking-in-el-cocuy%3fformat=amp

La Esperanza costs 80000 for lodging/dinner and breakfast or you can camp for 15000

name: Termales el Encanto de Guaicaramo
description:
Parking lot of the charm hot springs. We have stayed here for free for a couple of days. 
The entrance fee for the hot springs is Cop 10000 for the first day and for all the following days Cop 3000.
There is a lot to do in this area. Traveling the Upia river by boat, horse riding, rock climbing an of course the hot springs El Encanto.

name: Comfamiliar
description: It is a recreation center for companies in the region. But they accept outsiders. The place is incredible. It has many swimming pools, soccer fields and sports courts. It has a camping area and also has cabins for rent. The place is clean, safe and even with many guests it is very quiet.

name: Veterinaria Animalia
description: Very friendly staff, small veterinary office. They made us a health certificate for 30k.

name: balneario san Pedro
description: nice grassy area next to a river.at 7am lots of birds flying around-chatting .sounds like parrots!agreed with the woman-owner living in the house opposite the entrance for 15000  camper+1.she started at 30 but I replied there are no services.0.but nice spot! way better then the opposite Taku ,superlit up last night and not on the river

name: Heladería Parqueadero Las Vagas
description: A perfect Parqueadero with lots of flat, level space for all rig sizes. Lots of shady trees too and an ice cream café. Run by a sweet family who will present you with a cafe tinto in the morning. They charged us 15000 pesos for the night and offered electric and water. There is a baño and shower too. It’s walking distance to the river. We’re glad we stopped by here- wasn’t busy for a Saturday night and the people that stopped by were all really lovely and welcoming.

name: Finca Isla Margaritas
description: Nice place with pool and cabana. Arrived on Sunday, some locals were also here.

name: La Casona
description: Decent hotel that has parking space for cars, motos and bicycles. Cold showers, they probably have wifi but i forgot to ask. Clean rooms with a fan. Friendly owners and near the center

name: Hotel Colonial
description: Hotel just off the main street. Clean, hot shower and able to accommodate our bicycles on the street level floor. Basic accommodations, bed is comfortable but does have a bit of a swale to it. At 40,000 for 2 people, if you're more thrifty than particular, this place is the place for you.

name: Pacande finca
description:
Place with a nice pool and excellent suite. I’ll post a picture. 

They have a large parking that I don’t know for sure but I’m guessing they would be happy to let you park in.  

They have glamping with fans and a suite and room to rent with ac. 

Stayed 3 days for my bday here. Was great. 

Breakfast is light. 2 eggs and 2 Arepas 

Pool is amazing to have. We were in it each night and morning before doing our things for the day. 

It’s near aipe. The problem is the ferry to the desert is 6-6 so if you are late coming back it’s a long drive around to get across the river

In aipe we played tejo. Great game if you have not tried yet.  Just need to buy beer and you can play for free

name: Hotel Posada Camino Guanacas
description:
ADMIN NOTE: this entry appears to have been made by the owners/managers of this business - no independent traveller comments yet.

A charming stay where the difference is marked by a delicate balance between the traditional and the modern that is reflected in the entire infrastructure and in every detail that allows you to live the experience of accommodation with history, remembering your grandparents' house full of tranquility and harmony that invites rest and disconnection with the outside world.
The hotel posada camino guanacas is characterized by its philosophy of total satisfaction, which is based on offering customers a family atmosphere and meeting all their wishes if what is sought is a comprehensive rest.
The personalized attention makes every detail stand out together with a cuisine with a very traditional seasoning that reminds you of your grandmother's kitchen that you will find only in the hotel posada camino guanacas, it will make you long for a soon return.

name: Road restriction Mocoa - Pasto
description:
You can drive this road on Monday, Wednesday and Friday from Pasto -> Mocoa between 4:00am and 20:00pm. Tuesday, Thursday and Saturday it's from Mocoa -> Pasto between 4:00am and 20:00pm). On Sundays the road is closed for maintenance.

Good luck!

name: Gabcha Spot - El Nuevo Cielito Asadero
description: Cool finca on thé main Road to Mompox. 50000p/night for our motorhome with 2 kids and 2 adults. Small Playground for kids, restaurant there. Beautiful sunset.

name: Amazon Birds Nature Reserve
description:
A nice place with some cool monkey species. We saw the Pygmy Marmoset, Colombian Red  Howler monkeys and the Ecuadorian Squirrel Monkeys. They are open from 6:00-16:00. 
We paid 15.000 pp for the trails and 100.000 for a guide from 6:30-12:00. We reserved in advance via WhatsApp Fleyder Muriel +57 318 3559655. They have dogs at their place where you can leave yours if you have one;) And they offered us to spend the night there.

Enjoy!

name: Nice bakery
description:
We stopped on our way here to take some cash at the BBVA banco and saw this bakery. We really loved the banana cake. For Colombian standards it is not really cheap (1 piece was 8000) but in our opinion worth it. 
Enjoy! :)

name: Gachalá Camping
description:
ADMIN NOTE: this seems to have been posted by the owners/managers of this business - no independent traveller comments yet.

Beautiful place by the water. 100% natural and reforested environment.
Different options for camping on wooden platforms or on the meadown.
Bathroom service. Battery charging area.
Food service. WIFI zone. Laundry service. Pet friendly. Bonfire and Barbecue allowed. Bird Watching. 
$25.000 COP night per person
@GACHALA_CAMPING

name: Panamericana Parking Spot
description:
if you need a break or cool the breaks, use restroom, or even a car part, you can stop here and ask for help.
the secure guard just asked us our names and why we are parking.
safe place!!!
we don't know if is possible to overnight.

name: Agualinda
description: Close to the top of Apia village. Very nice place to walk with nice vegetation and garden of flowers you have never seen before ! We continue outside on the dirt road to the top where you can have a nice scenery above the valley. We came back on the forest !

name: La Planta Brewpub
description: This place is pretty cool! Massive brewery absolutely covered in amazing art, very funky! 5k entry, 12K beers, 20K to use the pool. They only had 2 beers available when we went, the spicy one is super interesting! Also sell food and other drinks. Free secure parking.

name: Parqueadero Galeras
description:
