there's two entrances. one small under a building and other one bigger in a open space. they accept big and tall cars. the only one that accept us.
6.000 COP for 4 hours

name: Fonda Mi Tierra
description: Very good Bandeja Paisa and Chorizo Santa Rosano neer from the thermas. The owners are super friendly and let us stay for the night in the parking.

name: Wild Camping by the water
description: A perfect wild camping place. Flat area, great weather, peaceful, amazing view. We love this place!

name: Wild Camping by El Guavio Reservoir
description: Wonderful and peaceful place near the water, full of vegetation and birds. Flat space at the end of a small dirt road.  The nearest neighbor is about 500 mts away, a very gentle and nice man, who was happy to see us enjoy this place. Walking down a small path, you can reach the edge of the water, with great views of the reservoir and the dam. Driving over the dam is a must and you need to go through two amazing tunnels.

name: Glamping la Perla, Finca la Perla
description:
Nice stay before we travel further to Deserto Tatacoa. Nice pool, cold showers, Internet. 
We paid 20.000 p.P. for one night. You can either rent a hut with all comfort, camp on the hill with a stunning few or stay with the camper next to the pool. Alexandros and his mother are very friendly hosts. Tel.: 3214406807

name: Rio amoya camping
description:
Coming from planadas after the bridge there is a dirt road to the right.  It’s not far.  You can turn down and gain access to the river bank with your vehicle.  

High clearance is needed because of the rock field. 

I drove from aipe to planadas then planadas north to here.  From aipe the road is ok. Very senic and great to be out of the heat of the desert  Didn’t need 4x4 but it was mostly dry.  There are big ruts so high clearance is needed.  This road is a favorite road so far

After planadas the road is paved mostly and you could return to road 45. But I turned off to get here. After the turn off the road gets really big ruts but I did see a bus and box truck on the road. 

The river is fast moving so great for sleeping. There are some areas to get in the river. I rinsed off before bed but it was a bird bath. Not to deep

name: camping by the river
description: was driving to town and see the camp-sign by the river.nice spot .just a caretacare here that was leaving.called the owner and first said 25k.but i dont see baños and do not need power so I offered 15k.only parking .ok. some tables chairs.3g signal.nice

name: Autocucuta
description: The place to be for all kind of electronics stuff. Nice and helpfull people

name: Puerto Arturo
description:
Very nice spot over the Guaiabero river gorge. There is a small settlement of fishermen, ho will take you  with our small boats troth the river gorge to any rock paintings from Indian tribes. You can see also Amazon river dolphins. The Tour  costs COP 250 000 for 2 Persons and includes the Boat trip, the guided Tour to the Pinturas Rupestres and the Dolphin sights. 
The Campsite is basic but free.
They have Starlink Internet which they sell for 5000 COP per 24 hours.
A couple of shops sell basic food and cold beverages.

name: Mirador Rio Upia
description: Parking loft by the road side with a spectacular view form the first mountain chain over the los Llanos flats.

name: Guayuriba River Bridge
description: Car parking by  side of the new river bridge. They let you park here over night for COP 3000.

name: quiet gas stop
description: late night.was tired and see this corner (on the dirt under some trees, at the end on the right side.nobody there .no trucks stop here! I asked and the attendant.he just replied at what time I was leaving?said "early".some cars filled up occasionally but one of the quietest gas st. ever !

name: Rio cucuana camp in playarrica
description:
In this small town there is a basket count and a road that leads to the river.  There is a large wall with grass that you can camp behind that is flat.  Lots of room.  The area by the basket court is paved but not very flat. 

The road continues out onto the river banks but the river is know to flood. 

In the morning there was a guy throwing rock into his truck. 

The place is nice and quiet a d close enough that I walked up to town for a beer and a papa before returning to camp for the night.

name: next to restaurant/beach/pools
description:
Next to Centro Vacational Ocasiones.
3 pools inside, we could park on the beach, use their tables and chairs, palapa, etc.
Very friendly.

We used one room (50k) for our parents and could camp for free if we had some drinks. Without room you can also camp for free, just take something from the bar / restaurant.
Might be busy in the weekends.

name: Puerto Chentico comunidad Wayuú
description:
If you want to be in contact with a Wayúu family and go for a boat trip to see the flamingos, you've come to the right place!  Yeiner and his family are very kind!  There is even a small restaurant to have dinner.

Si quieres ponerte en contacto con una familia Wayúu y dar un paseo en barco para ver los flamencos, ¡has venido al lugar indicado!  
¡Yeiner y su familia son muy amables!  Incluso hay un pequeño restaurante para cenar.

name: GABCHA SPOT
description: Found this place after the two others around was closed (Argentino restaurant and paragling). Ask to the owner of the restaurant told us ok for free. Good view.

name: CIOM Laboratorio Clínico
description:
we needed do some bloody test, and they do it for foreign people.
we paid 95.000 COP for 4 different things. 
of course it depends on your needs...
no prescription needed.
just say what you want

name: Mirador Matumbo
description: The view is one of the best we’ve had on this entire trip! It’s a massive property “selfie” park, they said we could park anywhere, so we went to the back far left behind the trees. A bit of road noise, but it’s not too bad, worth it for the view. Not many people coming in. There’s a clean bucket flush toilet, no shower. Bonus - you get to take some ridiculous photos. 10K per person to stay overnight.

name: Claro Store
description: If you are traveling in Colorado for more than 30 days you have to register your phone with the government. It's best to get your SIM at an actual Claro or Tigo store not a Tienda and make sure they register it and you get the official your phone is registered email. If you don't ask for it to be registered it probably won't happen. That's what happened to me. l got the 3 week warning email and was unable to complete the form by myself multiple times. We went to another cell store and thought he was making progress but they were unable to do it. Went to this official shop and they had me set up 8n 5 minutes and where able to confirm that my wife's phone was also registered. We only know about the registration because we met a couple that had a locked phone that they had tried and tried to get unlocked and were currently unsuccessful. Good luck.

name: Ozagua/Guatytua
description:
This is a Campground but they also have a park with plants, animals and a restaurant where they cook typical Colombian food and use the produce of their farm. The Owners are very nice, help you with everything and they teach the locals how to respect nature. He took the time to do a tour and explained every plant, bird and animal to us. They also have a treehouse where you can do some birdwatching.
The price is 12'000 per person per night, but you can also have some food (we had breakfast) and then it is 20'000 pppn.
There is a lot of space to camp on grass or concrete (big rig friendly). They have clean flush toilets and cold showers. You can also use the BBQ or just grab a chair and sit in nature and much more...

name: Laguna San Vicente
description: Beautiful place  on Laguna San Vicente beach. There is a lot of space in the shadow of trees, there is a bar  on weekends. You can swim in the lake, go fishing or just relax. On weekends may be crowded by locals. The entrance fee is COP 3000 p/P, Car parking COP 5000.

name: Hostel Casa de Campo Ruitoque
description:
Very nice place at Claudia and Willy’s house/hostal.
We came here by chance with a meeting with Willy who invited us to come to his home, offering hostal and camp with some services and a pool!!! 

Hostal is 4 rooms for a total of 13 beds (double and single) with kitchen, laundry, wifi, electricity, showers and toilets. 

Camp is ok up to 4 campers and for one big rig. Free access to the pool, free wifi, showers, free laundry machine, and toilets, free kitchen, games, big terrace…

The view is very nice, very close to a paragliding site  5min by car). Willy is a paragliding instructor and he will love to flight with you.

Price:
- Camper: 50000/p/n (kids free under 10)
- hostal room: 60000-70000/p/n
- paragliding: 140000P/pers for 15min with Willy 

Willy and Claudia are so nice and friendly! We recommend this place 100%!!!

name: Villa Claudia
description: Friendly hotel, able to use private cold showers by the pool for 2000 pesos. I imagine you could just buy a beer or something too, they were very chill.

name: Sisio Hostel and Camping
description: Hostel with space for campers on the grounds. 10,000 COP per person. Oscar is a traveler who will be happy to serve you and do everything to make you feel good. I recommend

name: Banco Union Wester Union Câmbio
description:
we had a lot of difficulty in Cartagena to withdraw in the western union, because the houses never have money.

in this place for being a small bank, it worked better.

name: Chili Peppers
description: We came passed here and stopped because next door is an Ara Groceries with spacious parking spots. At Chili's they have really good Burgers for a good price. Great spot if you are on the drive through and don't want to wander around and find parking. There is also a pretty nice looking butcher shop next door.

name: Terminal de transporte de Yarumal Antioquia
description:
At the entrance to the town of Yarumal, is the new transport terminal.  They allowed us to sleep on the outskirts of the shopping center, asking the security personnel, to get up early the next day to follow the route to the Atlantic coast.  there are public toilets.  very quiet night.

En la entrada al pueblo de Yarumal , está la nueva terminal de transporte. nos permitieron dormir en las afueras del centro comercial, preguntando al personal de seguridad,  para madrugar al otro día a seguir la ruta para la costa atlántica. hay baños públicos. noche muy tranquila.

name: La Barra de Chema
description:
Site in front of the sea, safe, there are showers, toilets, water, power, they charged us 20,000 for the car, there is food service.  very kind attention
.....
sitio en frente del mar, seguro, hay duchas, sanitarios, energía  agua, nos cobraron 20.000 por el carro, hay servicio de comida. atención muy amable

20 por vehículo

name: Chicamocha Vibes
description:
The best place to enjoy the Chicamocha Canyon. Spectacular view, very friendly hosts and a thousand activities to do: canyon walks, bird watching, history of the villages. You can recharge water and energy.

Esp. El mejor lugar para disfrutar del Cañón del Chicamocha. Vista espectacular, muy amables los anfitriones y mil actividades por hacer: caminatas por el cañón, avistamiento de aves, historia de los pueblos. Puedes recargar agua y energía.

name: The corner
description:
An open space in the corner to park your car. We stayed here the night to bird the road the next morning. Quiet during the night and Claro signal.
Enjoy!

name: In the forest
description:
We parked our Toyota 4Runner here to overnight. It is a small open area. You need a high clearance. It is not fancy but if you need to be here, this is a good option. It was a quiet and safe spot.

Enjoy!

name: Mirador Hato
description:
Viewpoint near Hato with great views down on the village Palmar and the Rio Suarez valley. Road from Palmar to Hato mostly paved, from Hato to the mirador dirt track but doable for almost any vehicle.
Most probably you could stay here with a campervan overnight, just ask the family that lives right at the mirador.

name: Fruit & Veg
description: Awesome fruit & vegetables shop, lots of fresh variety!

name: Andariegos
description:
Simijaca is not a very memorable town but it does have this great vegetarian restaurant. We are not vegetarians but it's always challenging to find good meals with vegetables. We had a large appetizer, ratatouille, ramen, an eggplant dish and beverages for 100,000, all amazing.

This was one of the best meals that we have had during our month of travel in Colombia. Highly recommend it.

name: Monkey Rainbow
description: We were looking for some ice cream, but weren't expecting this. Great frappes, ice cream, waffles, service and ambiance. We had a maracuyá and chai, both great. Frappes are 16,000-24,000, worth it.

name: Military Checkpoint
description: Not exact location, but here is a military checkpoint. They wanted to look in the Camper, looked under the car and knocked everywhere. Probably looking for drugs or money. They are friendly and everything was ok.

name: Juanchorizos gourmet
description: in front of this (good) food place there's space for 2-3 truck campers .out of the way, in a small plaza .but is st. parking ok for one night

name: Hotel La Posada
description: Clean, nice/ accommodating staff, a place for bicycles or moto on the ground level inside and quiet (if non-street side room). 60,000 for 2, room is small but big enough for a firm queen sized bed, a night stand and bathroom. Decent internet, hot on demand shower head. A couple blocks from the main square. We were allowed to use the kitchen to heat h20 for breakfast. Water filter in kitchen.

name: hôtel terrassas de Guadalupe
description: Unflated spot but ok with pool access. Easier access for long motorhome than Las Brisas.

name: Villa Yesenia
description:
This is a perfect alternative to the Mi Refugio which has closed down. It is a large grassy yard conveniently located two blocks from the centre. The entrance gate has a height of 4 meters. The place can accommodate any size rig, for very large vehicles it may be a challenge to reach the gate because of the narrow streets. 
The owner Jose is very welcoming and friendly. There are clean bathrooms and hot shower, electricity and wifi. There is also a kitchen which we did not check out as we don’t need it. We paid 60 kpn for a campervan with two adults including electricity. This was for a single night on Saturday, you can possibly negotiate it down if you stay longer. You may contact Jose by Whatsapp 311 200 5959.

name: Parador Cascada El Tambo
description: Very friendly family. Possible to put 2/3 tents. Big car/truck Park but not very flat. They ask us to give them the amont we want. We also bought very good corn from their garden. There is a fire place. The waterfall is beautiful, it’s a 20 min walk. At la tena we bought very good and cheap chicken that we grilled at the bbq.

name: Rio barbas
description: Nice spot next to the river. We stayed there 3 days and felt safe. We Parked our car on the right before the bridge when you come from Filandia. Made a fire camp, Swam in the river. We walked along/in the river up to the DCS Barbas-Bremen - Sendero Yarumal. During the hike we saw monkey.

name: Mara Camping
description: There is no sign at the gate. Ask locals. Irma is a very friendly person. We stayed 3 days at her place. Had tinto all day long. Her garden is nice and the view is stunning of the valley. 20 000 cop per person to camp. We were a big group and negotiated the price. Electricity if you recharge your campervan is 10mills per hour, not per day!

name: hotel villa maria
description: budget hotel run by a nice family.  pretty sure  it's the cheapest option in town. 35,000 COP per person.  a bit run down but clean, safe. and friendly.  hot showers bc the water is sitting in a resevoir on the roof.  seemingly sometimes the pool is full and other times not.

name: Pompas
description: Good service and quality, recommended xxxxx

name: Shell gas station
description: Shell petrol station next to the main road, hence it is noisy but safe. They have a handful of parking spaces where they may allow you to stay overnight in your campervan.

name: Soldador Welder and Mechanic - Pedro
description:
We needed a cracked steel suspension component welded and reinforced and were refered to this fellow by a local.

It's the typical cluttered workshop, but Pedro knew what we was doing, ground out the crack, layed down some nice looking welds, and reinforced the part with additional steel, boxing the section as I requested. 

He knew to grind out a weld that got contaminated with paint and do it over. Very professional work, wearing safety boots, hearing protection, and gloves... did a great job

Charged 80k (~$20) for an hours work... 

He even came out the next day to help me reinstall the part which needed a second set of hands...

WhatsApp +57 322 8775057

name: Tramicón Mercedes
description: Company specialized in service and repairs of Mercedes vans and trucks. We were directed to this place by the official Mercedes dealer in Bogota because we needed some special repair tasks to be done. They have a large stock with original spare parts. Top service, very professional. The staff, the managers and the owner are very friendly and helpful. As the repair took more than one day, they even let us sleep in our car, use their bathrooms

name: Yerbabuena
description:
Yerbabuena is a sweet and secure place to stay overnight. it has a restaurant, they prepare dinner or breakfast if you want. they offer bathrooms and cold shower. if you need there is also a little cabaña for up to 5 people (50.000 per person with breakfast) with hot showers! the gate is open from around 8 am to 5 pm. 12.000COP per person for camping.
 please let the owners know if you want to come in advance via WhatsApp: +57 3112620820 (Gloria)

name: Ticket Office
description: You are not allowed to camp on the right side of lake.day ticket 6500cop. the other side has camping

name: Volacanes hot springs
description: nice thermal complex.I slept in the parking lot for a tip to the night guard.ticket to the pools was 28k in afternoon @3pm.no 3g signal or wifi tho.only down to the pools with a steep 150m descent!

name: Parqueadero - Parking Lot  in front of Hotel La Rivera
description:
We came here because La Rivera is no longer receiving motorhome. they gave us the opportunity to stay here for $10.000 COP and use toilet, shower and common area of the Hotel for plus $10.000 COP
but without facilities is complicated to stay longer.
Good for stay one night to rest ou stop during the trip.
we stayed 5 days!
pay Berlis, the woman that sells corn empanadas in front of the Hotel.
we went to Sisio Hostal and Camping $10.000 COP/pp

name: Agua Pura La Gota Fria
description:
4.500 COL Pesos for 20L
Very friendly and helpful. They sell 20L garafones, and are willing to sanitize and fill your bottles. They also sell small single serve bags. Delivery is an option.

name: Hard Bike - Bicycle Shop
description: amazing service, very knowledgable shop. not just your average dude-in-a-garage.

name: Salamina Highs Hotel
description: Beautiful Hotel.  157,000 CPO/ about $28.00 US. Very elegant.  Has restaurant and small bar.  Only drawback is the noise from the motorcycles in the street, but gets better at night.  Private baths, no air conditioning.  Parked my motorcycle 3 blocks away in a secure lot for 10,000 CPO day.

name: Pasión4x4Aventura
description: Store and workshop focussed on 4x4 and overland travel - did an excellent job on preparing our vehicle for Australia.

name: Hôtel Campestre El Refugio
description:
Nice finca only 10min from Hacienda Napoles. No other iOverlander spots nearby, so we came there. We managed to get here with our 21ft rig but anything longer will have problems.

60000COP per night 2 adults 2childrens

name: Doña Emma Restaurant
description: Very friendly & fast Service, also clean and good food too. We had a menue (12000 COP), but they also have a la carte. Open 7 days a week from 8am, also here is a sign in the Restaurant which says, Servicio de Hospedaje con Parqueadero.

name: hotel angel boutique
description: very cute, high quality little hotel in a historic building.  the guy told us it'd be 170000COP.  Way out of our price range so we left.  he found us heading out to the gas station hotel and offered to charge us 70000.  might be worth a shot if youre feeling travel weary!  this town is ADORABLE.

name: Garzon using OsmAnd bike directions
description: The bicycle directions on the osmAnd app take you off the main route and have you go through other streets in the town.  A man on a motorcycle stopped us and told us it was very dangerous and had us follow him out of town.  When cycling through, put any GPS on car directions to stay on the main route.

name: antica parrilla
description: Local pizzeria. they also have hamburgers, BBQ ando burritos. the proceso are ver y reasonable. a personal pizza is around $2 and the burgers are at 3-4$. the owner plays rock music and the place is very cozy. highly recomend to try them out and support the local business.

name: Café Roma
description: Roma is a Café with little snacks and good drinks. We were offered to stay for the night in the parking lot, which is close to the street, but pretty quiet at night. At the moment, the family is building an official campground with cabañas, but might take some time until it is ready. For now, they have a big pool you can jump into (you will love it, because it is soo hot here) and bathrooms with shower, so there is everything you need! Perfect place to stay, also because it is way cooler than in Cimitarra. Super friendly family!

name: Kilote Restaurante
description: Very good restaurant with a wide variety of excellent food. Not the cheapest though. Excellent Italian restaurant located in the center of Mocoa. There’s not many good places in South America where you can eat authentic Italian food like pasta and pizza. Kilote is definitely one of them. We’ve been there 2 times eating different pasta menus and excellent dessert. The plates came with the food attractively arranged and all is very clean. The restaurant is known to be one of the best in Colombia mainly because of the wide variety of offered Italian and Colombian menus. The attention of the staff is immediate and friendly. The price range is a bit upper class though. The phone number for reservation is +57 316 4823442. On weekends and holidays it is recommended to reserve in advance. Enjoy!

name: Arca Viva
description: Beautiful country reserve where they have retreats and Wellness programmes. Easy access and very friendly couple Robin & Mel (she teaches English), they offer breakfast, bathroom facilites, and are kind-hearted and very knowledgeable.

name: zona gastronomica
description:
Translation: On the beaches of Punta Piedra, Coveñas, a quiet place to spend the night, it has a shower and bathroom service, as well as a restaurant.

En las playas de punta piedra, coveñas un lugar tranquilo para pasar la noche, tiene servicio de ducha y baño, asi como restaurante

name: Mansio Bahia Manga
description: Great house in Manga. Quiet neighbourhood close to water. 15 min walk to centre. Great wifi. Nice AC. You can use the kitchen and supermarket around the corner. Nice garden to sit and have breakfast. Hammock on the front veranda. Secure parking for motorcycle. Paid 190,000 per night. ( on Booking.com). This is more than our usual but a great place for Cartagena with parking , yet close enough that you can walk to all attractions . The owner speaks English very well.

name: Cambimbora
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager.  
The inmersion in tranquility begins when you lose the fear of conquering dreams together with the tranquility of a paradise. Breathing pure air to the harmonious sway of the waves and submerged in healing sand by the sea. A horizon framed between the vegetation and the  sunset of an infinite splendor. The danger lies in not wanting to leave, but with the hope of returning to the idyllic environment of happiness.  The main pier to Isla Fuerte is located in front of Cambimbora and enjoys having the natural volcano Bahía Rada just a mile away. Come and enjoy the best marine gastronomy. We will wait for you.

name: MAXI LUBRICANTES
description:
Excellent attention, we made the oil and filter change. cheap prices!
---
Excelente atención,hicimos el cambio de aceite y filtro. precios económicos!

name: Hotel Pacande
description:
hotel a block from the church in the main square.clean rooms, etc.  looks like it has a secure parking zone behind it.

paid 50.000COP for 2 ppl, but we are really bad at haggling so I'm sure you could go lower.

business card in photos

name: Parador Touristico Ruta 45
description:
Super lovely french-colombia couple.  it's a cafe, they sell trout too!  they have a cabin overlooking a river in the back and also secure flat parking for vehicles and a backyard or a spot under a roof to pitch a tent. they have wifi, washing machine, and it's not an official restaurant but they will cook for people staying over.  as long as your dog stays in the van, they are welcome but they do have a dog here as well.  chat with them about the price!

3153593110

name: Hotel Linda Palma
description: On our way to Medellin we were stopped by the blockades before Caucasia and had to turn back late afternoon. We found this hotel as a second choice. Paid 140,000(way more than we usually do) but it was getting late. Nice hotel with pool , restaurant and bar. Nice clean room. AC. Good Wifi. Includes breakfast. Large parking space on the side. Far from street but not gated.

name: Apartahotel La Villa Santa Fe de Antioquia
description: Newer small hotel meters from the center. Very friendly owner. Speaks some English. We had booked a 1 bedroom  with double bed for 100,000 but the owner upgraded us for the apartment. Secured parking. Good Wifi. Fan and the apartment had AC in the bedroom. Nice pool as a bonus. Lovely place. One of our great find. Highly recommend

name: La Playita Swimming Pool
description: New swimmingpool area a little outside of Mocoa. Nice walk.

name: Chingaza NP office
description:
This is an office of Chingaza NP. It is in the back with a big photo of a Spectacled Bear. We went to the gate to buy a entrance ticket there, but that's not possible. You have to arrange it 15 days in advance online or you can stop by at this office. They need some contact details and you need to pay at the Banco Colombia. They will give you the paying details. The bank ( 4.720094, -73.968573) is at the plaza of the church. They made an exception for us that we could enter the park the same day, but normally it takes 3 days. After the payment, you'll also need an insurance for in the park. We paid for it with cash. For four days it was 56.000 cop in total for 2pp. Entrance was 141.500 cop for 2pp. If you want to walk the trails you'll need a guide. Without guide you can only drive to the camping area. We weren't allowed to sleep in our car. We had to sleep in a tent outside or in a room. 
In the end we don't think it is worth it to enter. It took us a lot of time to arrange to enter. They are very strict inside the park. We asked the camping owner if we could sleep in our car and he was fine with it, but late in the evening the rangers told us that we had to move to a room or a tent. Although the paramo is beautiful, there are other places where you can enjoying it without paying this amount of money. 

If you still want to go. Enjoy! :)

name: Entrance Chingaza NP
description:
We went to the gate to buy a entrance ticket there, but that's not possible. You have to arrange it 15 days in advance online or you can stop by at the office in La Calera. They need some contact details and you need to pay at the Banco Colombia. They will give you the paying details. The bank ( 4.720094, -73.968573) is at the plaza of the church. They made an exception for us that we could enter the park the same day, but normally it takes 3 days. After the payment, you'll also need an insurance for in the park. We paid for it with cash. For four days it was 56.000 cop in total for 2pp. Entrance was 141.500 cop for 2pp. If you want to walk the trails you'll need a guide. Without guide you can only drive to the camping area. We weren't allowed to sleep in our car. We had to sleep in a tent outside or in a room. 
In the end we don't think it is worth it to enter. It took us a lot of time to arrange to enter. They are very strict inside the park. We asked the camping owner if we could sleep in our car and he was fine with it, but late in the evening the rangers told us that we had to move to a room or a tent. Although the paramo is beautiful, there are other places where you can enjoying it without paying this amount of money. 

If you still want to go. Enjoy! :)

name: Road towards NP Sumapaz
description:
Not a fancy place to overnight, but if you are here for birding like us then it is a safe and a quiet place to spend the night. It isn't totally hidden from the road, but flat and an open area. We birded the road and didn't enter the NP.

Enjoy!

name: Amazonico
description: Excellent restaurant with original amazon ingredients and exotic food and drinks. Nice service staff, not cheap but very fair price performance-ratio. We enjoyed it so much.

name: Cancha Ipira Pública
description:
The public football field of Ipira is a safe place within Roldanillo to camp for no more than 1 night without presenting inconveniences to the authorities. it should be noted that it does not have baths or connections of any kind but it is close to the police station of the municipality that in principle could facilitate a toilet and you can find stores and panaderías easily.
--------
La cancha de fútbol pública de la Ipira es un lugar seguro dentro de Roldanillo para realizar acampadas de no más de 1 noche sin presentar inconvenientes con las autoridades. cabe resaltar que no se cuenta con baños o conexiones de ningún tipo pero está cerca a la estación de Policía del municipio que en principio podría facilitar un sanitario y se pueden encontrar tiendas y panaderías fácilmente.

name: Hotel Casa Laureles
description: Excellent hotel in nice Laureles area. Great breakfast included. Secured parking. Very nice place if you want a bit of comfort in Medellin. Paid 165,000 per night. Nice neighborhood to walk. It is about 1.5 km to nearest metro station but we enjoyed the walk

name: Mario taller electric
description: First we tried Don Jaime nearby, he could not help. We were towed to Mario, could park and sleep there over sunday and on monday he fixed our Sprinter. With scanner! Place looks awful but he helped. Only spanish speaking.

name: Sabuesos Veterinaria
description:
A really nice and knowledgeable vet.  Mauricio speaks English and will do the whole procedure with the ICA for your dog at the clinic.  really recommended.  5 paws
They are open from 9-6 Monday-Saturday. Sunday from 9-3. No appointment needed. 
Note that the pet certificate will be good for five days.

name: Experiencia agricola
description:
At Guadalupe farm we offer a half tour day between crops, animal husbandry, in order to give tourists agricultural experiences, lodging, restaurant, leisure, native games call Jaime Orlando Gómez 3133482654
--------------
En la granja Guadalupe ofrecemos un recorrido de medio
 día por entre cultivos, cria de animales, con el fin de dar a los turistas experiencias del agro, hospedaje, restaurante, lúdicas, juegos autóctonos llamar a Jaime Orlando Gómez 3133482654

name: Posada Agroturistica Guadalupe
description:
Inn for up to 15 people, comfortable rooms, TV, Hot Water, Wifi, Restaurant, Trails, Agricultural Experiences, Autotone Games, Lunada, canelazo, Rumba or rest.
-----------------------
Posada hasta para 15 personas, habitaciones confortables, TV, Agua Caliente, Wify, Restaurante, Senderos, Experiencias Agricolas, Juegos autotonos, Lunada, canelazo, Rumba o descanso.

name: Tienda de Anita Reyes
description:
Sale of groceries, ranch and liquors to the retail and retail. agricultural products, surcharges to all operators.
----------------
Venta de Víveres, rancho y licores al por menor y detal. productos agricolas, rencargas a todos los operadores.

name: Parqueadero Maniguetto
description: Good mechanic!!! Good price! Fix all tipes of cars and trucks. There is a parking lot, you can sleep and eat at the Good restaurant upstairs.

name: Finca El Porvenir
description:
Incredible space where they produce the real Colombian coffee. 

We met by chance in our passage through canasgordas and we had to recommend it. 

It has affordable rooms and food and a breathtaking landscape. Pet Friendly. 

If you are looking for a place to rest in the middle of the mountains, you have found it.

Attention! Leave your van in a parking lot. No way people go up here with a Motorhome. Take a motorcycle taxi and enjoy the experience. I recomend the Zapata Parking

name: huasipungo
description:
very quiet country house, reserved surrounded by nature

casa de campo muy tranquila, reservado rodeado de naturaleza

name: Hotel Boutique Mendoza New Location
description: The hotel moved to this location (Sept22). They still offer motorcycle long term parking. 350.000 Peso per bike per month.

name: Graviarte - license plate copies
description:
In this small shop, they can print on plastic or aluminium. We got our license plate copy here.
Just show up and ask for what you need. Send them clear license plate picture and they can do it in a couple days - depending if they need to order the blanks.
They can also do document copies.
70k for the plate
9k for the document copy

name: Finca Los Alpes
description: Place to park, take a shower or stay in a country house, near Chingaza park, quiet place to relax away from the city. very close to the town of La Calera.

name: Hotel QUILICHAO
description: Newer hotel. Paid 85500 for double room with bathroom. Room with no window but very quiet. Secured parking for motorcycle. AC and very good wifi. Reception sells water pop and beer. Very nice staff. Good place for one night. For dinner we walked to Alfa Bistro. 5 min walk . Very good good

name: Shagra Positive Market and Restaurant
description: Tasty vegetarian and vegan food with a market inside as well. Not much in the market but useful if you’re looking for certain seeds, nuts, or flours.

name: Eds Santa Rosa
description: Fuel, clean water for supply tanks, and parking, car wash, open 5 am closed 9 pm

name: Dentist
description: Dental unit of the valley, Doctor Maria Camila Ruales, phone number 3146496059

name: Puente Rio de Miel
description:
There is a side road along the river that brings you to a little open area. We stayed one quiet night. The only sound was the flowing water of the river, but no problem for us. 
It could be more crowded in the weekend. In the afternoon only a fisherman was there with his motor. 

Enjoy!

name: Imecol Mercedes
description:
Warning: No more specialized Shop for Mercedes Sprinter!
Maybe bigger Trucks of Mercedes.  They have two good mechanics with broad experience and expertise in Sprinters. They stock some spare parts, but obviously only for the models that are common in Colombia. For example no spare parts for 6-cylinder diesel engines. The company is well-managed, all employees are friendly and helpful. They allowed us to sleep in our campervan just behind the workshop. We could use their wifi and bathrooms, get water and connect to electricity.
.....
Haben, wie alle in Südamerika, keine ersatzteile für unseren sechszylinder. they are competent and reasonably priced.

name: Ancestral servicio de lavanderia
description: small tienda, the old woman only has 1 machine and 1 dryer, but did our laundry within 3 hours! very cheap, we paid 20.000 COP for one big load washing, drying and folding! open from 8am.

name: Hotel Royal Class
description: Newer Hotel. 1 block from main square. Secured parking for motorcycle. Fast wifi. Large room and comfy bed. Very friendly staff. Paid 52000 for a double bed with bathroom. An excellent place to stay the night before crossing the border.

name: Los Almendros
description: Little restaurant on the beach with amazing seafood and friendly staff! We payed 40.000COP for each plate.

name: Cano Canoas
description:
Cano Canoas has 5 beautiful waterfalls contained in a community-run park. It's 100 COP per person which gives you access to 3 natural sites; Cano Canoas, Siete Machos and Cano Indeo. Mandatory guide is 100 COP per group. The hike is 2-3 hours long with several miradors, a hike behind the waterfall and swimming. The headquarters is also a restaurant with pescado frito 25 COP (delicious) 55 COP for a cabana or we camped on the front porch for 25 COP. The family was in the process of a major renovation and addition. It's a little expensive but beautiful, supports the community and has value added if you visit the other natural areas. Our guide Juan was wonderful. We visited during the low season and we had the place to ourselves.

It is closed during low/dry season until Semana Santa.

name: Siete Machos
description: The second community run waterfalls/ water feature. 10 miles south of Cano Canoas is Siete Machos said to be a mini Cano Cristales. The sandstone riverbed has beautiful folds, holes, water pots and waterfalls. We are visiting at the tale end of the dry season so the aquatic plant life that fills all of the nocks, crannies, folds in the sandstone and turns various colors was limited. The greens, reds and whites we saw today we saw today were beautiful. In season it's supposed to be amazing. There are several smaller waterfalls and pools to swim in. It's a nice 2-4 hike once on the trail. We are traveling by bicycle so we need a secure storage area and the office/ house were you pay and arrange for a guide is a 25-35 walk to the trailhead. You can drive and park to skip the road walk. 100 COP for the guide and a 100 per person enterance good for all of the community sites: Siete Machos, Cano Canoas and Cano Indeo. Wonderful scenary, nice hike, swim and you are supporting the community.

name: Merendero del kumanday
description:
Lugar de camping en Murillo Tolima 
Contacto James lozano +57 (313) 890-0617
Cerca al parque principal 
Duchas
Baños 
Muy buen espacio

name: Casa Lorenzo Bogotá
description: Newly renovated former private Villa provides spacious rooms from 32 USD onwards. Rooms are equipped with everything you need for a comfy stay. American breakfast available, fast wifi, secure parking for motos or 1-2 cars. Several food places around and a quick drive into the historic center. We felt very secure and comfy here, super friendly staff. Check booking for pictures and more info. Call or wa in advance and reserve directly for a better rate: +57 (323) 712-5827. The address is “Calle Avenida Caracas 46-69”. From outside it just looks like a nice private location not like a hotel.

name: George's
description:
Space for a few small campers or 4wd. Hot showers, toilet available. Shared laundry room. Family house open for every overlander looking for a peaceful and save environment.  Decent Wifi.

$20.000 per person per night.
WhatsApp 3057052201

name: la cabana parador
description: nice little bamboo place with 4 or 5 rooms, and a little restaurant below. nice and airy, great option in a somewhat limited area.  40 mil for a room.  nice energy.  plenty of parking,  no gate,  but you can park behind the hotel so it's out of sight.  they have bathrooms,  so would probably be fine with camping or parking a rig too. dog friendly.

name: Autronik-P&P motors
description: Javier and crew are Professionals. electric-mechanic service with tools,scanners etc.Fixed my silverado 2500 that had electronic issues.++ I spent last night here in the large gated parking

name: Road not passable
description: Coming from Minca this road is not passable according to a resident along the road. The road gets narrower and narrower until its just a single track (a few km further from this location). There I asked at one of the houses if it's possible to continue riding the track towards Cartagena. The guy chuckled and said no, it ends not much further down. So back towards Santa Marta is the only way out of Minca apparently

name: Pino Romeron
description: Here you find one of the oldest Colombian pines. It is a Pino Romeron, the only native pine species.

name: Cascada la 70
description: Perfect for one night in to de Nature, watergall and animals sounds.

name: Casa Cafe Hospedaje
description: A quaint guest accommodation with beautiful views of Santa Marta and Cienega. On a clear day you can see all the way to the ocean. The hosts are super kind and serve fresh local food.  It's far from everything but close to the el dorado nature reserve, which is a must see for birding. The place is very tranquil and there are just a couple of spots for camping. One that you can car camp, but the space is rather small, not for big rigs and the other is big enough for three backpacker tents, but not accessible by car. There are two friendly dogs onsite, a few cats and chickens. In the distance you can hear the howler monkeys and wake up to the sounds of birds. They have shared bathrooms and allowed us to use their fridge and freezer, though it's not common. They have 4 guest rooms, we decided to stay in one that was very reasonable, 80k pesos per night or $16 for 4 people. Each room has the shower-head of death that provides hot water, but you have to find the sweet spot or it will be mediocrely luke-warm. Beautiful spot, highly recommend either come and stay or just eat, drink and take in the view!

name: El Técnico Arias
description: Arias works on electric problems, starter, etc. Nice guy and efficient!

name: Texaco
description: Drinking water tap at the level of the building where the shower is located.  right next to the gas station.

name: Camping Equinoccio
description: no service. no internet. full of mosquitoes. not recommended. the name is not equinoccio. that was another site.

name: Reserva Juan Solito
description: The Juan Solito reserve held by Nelson is an idyllic place ... activities are offered to the big ones and the smallest (while boat to discover the Anaconda, Safari looking for the Jaguar, Horse Tour and many more) The site is known for its scientific research on fauna and flora. Do not hesitate to contact Nelson before coming it can pick you up in Yopal (+57 320 3426409)

name: Jhon Lavadero
description:
A nice and safe place! Jhon and his employees are lovely!
10000 COP / night
---
Un endroit sympa et sécurisé ! Jhon et ses employés sont adorables ! 
10000 COP / nuits 
Idéal pour visiter les llanos

name: FNC del Cauca
description:
Come and spot yourself in this dead end street, so more or less quiet, opposite the shopping center, go knock on the door of FNC del Cauca and you will be very pleasantly received! There is water, toilets and nice people who explain the coffee making process to you (all with tasting) go there with your eyes closed they are adorable!


Venez vous spoter dans cette rue sans issue donc plus ou moins au calme, en face du centre commercial, allez toquer à la porte de FNC del Cauca et vous serez très agréablement reçus ! Il y a de l’eau, des sanitaires et des gens sympas qui vous expliquent le processus de fabrication du café (le tout avec dégustation) allez y les yeux fermés ils sont adorables !

name: La Ranchita-Líbano
description: A beautiful hostel that receives mobile homes in front of the house and can use a bathroom and Wi-Fi. Call José first 3134617555 it depends on the availability and that the owners are in the hostal

name: Hotel Parque
description: Comfortable, clean and cheap, next to a park in a very quiet area

name: Arreboles- villa felicidad
description: Germán and Elena welcome overlanders to stay on their very tranquil property not far from Santa Elena, Guarne and the Parque Avi (and cable car to Medellin). They have two cabanas which they rent out, and plan to make a camping area on part of their land in the near future to accommodate travellers. In the meantime, they will open up the bathroom in one of the cabanas for your use. We stayed here for two weeks. Germàn is a wonderful tour guide and would be happy to drive you into Medellin or nearby Santa Elena/Guarne or even assist you on public transport. He will arrange tours for the communa 13 experience too. If you are looking to improve your Spanish he would be happy to teach you or just converse with you, in a slow and patient manner. Highly recommended. Word of warning: anything bigger than a truck camper might not make it down their drive way. Height is not an issue though. Do give German a call before arriving, he’d be happy to hear from you: +57 314 823 3938

name: noisy parking
description: for 10k .gated bit very noisy from also a side rd tht I didnt see at first! he said there was a baño..(?)

name: Virgen de la cascada mini trekking
description: In these coordinates we parked it's a possible nice wild camping space . you can start your trek here up to the waterfall through the bushes or continuing by the road up to the sanctuary. great views from here. Crystal puente paramo water.

name: Hotel Juanambu
description: Good value hotel with friendly staff about 10min walk from the centre of Pasto and near to the road heading south. Bicycles can be stored in a locked room on the ground floor with a reasonably wide entrance corridor. No parking for vehicles. Proper hot water, largeish rooms, small kitchen available by reception for basic cooking (but not large meals) with gas hob, fridge, microwave. Via Booking.com I paid only 50,000 for one person but they were happy to extend for the same amount in person.

name: D 1 with cheap wine
description: good wine from Chile and Argentina pretty cheap for Colombia (17000 to 22000), other products reasonable too.

name: Armed Robbery
description: We were wild camping at this site overlooking the lake.  About an hour after dark three men forced entry into our van.  One had a 9mm simi automatic pistol, and the others knives.  They had me outside of the van face down on the ground and my wife inside.  The stole $, wallets, phones, iPad, GoPro, my wedding ring, and many other items.  They escaped on two motorcycles.  We drove immediately to the police station.  They tried to help.  We spent the night parked next to the police station.  The commandant of the station said this town is very dangerous and should be avoided.

name: Parqueadora They
description: We stop here to go to comuna 13. Big area, no shadows.

name: Al lado de los testigos de Jheová
description:
We stayed three nights in this space that is a closed street. The neighbours were very kind to us and we didn't have any problems.

Estuvimos tres noches en este espacio que es una calle cerrada. Los vecinos fueron muy amables con nosotros y no tuvimos ningún problema.

name: al lado del asilo
description:
It is a super quiet street. We only spent one night. The neighbors are very friendly and curious. They gave us drinking water. This town is highly recommended to visit.

Es una calle super tranquila. Sólo pasamos una noche. los vecinos son muy amables y curiosos. Nos regalaron agua potable. Este pueblo es muy recomendado para visitar.

name: Parqueadero La Familia Astrid
description:
We needed a safe place for our motorhome until shipment to Europe. For 5 days, we were allowed to park our motorhome there. The family is very sweet and nice. We did not sleep there. In the end, we were able to fill our water tank. The price was 20,000 pesos per day. The mobile home must not be larger than: Max. Length: 6.5m Width: 2.1m Height: 3m Write a WhatsApp in advance or make calls via WhatsApp +573006799195

Necesitábamos un lugar seguro para nuestra casa rodante hasta el envío a Europa. Durante 5 días se nos permitió aparcar nuestra casa rodante allí. La familia es muy dulce y agradable. No dormimos allí. Al final pudimos llenarnos el tanco de agua. El precio era de 20000pesos por día. La casa rodante no debe ser más grande que: Máx. Longitud: 6.5m Ancho: 2.1m Altura: 3m Escribe un WhatsApp de antemano o haz llamadas vía WhatsApp +573006799195

name: aero de servicio
description:
Large parking area accessable for big rigs, in the midle of the highway.
Safety guards all night through.
Safe but a bit noisy.

name: Hospedaje Saladeno
description: This is a 1-2 star hotel. To the best of our knowledge there are 2 hotels in this town. This is the better of the 2 and cost 30,000 for 2 shared bathroom. As apposed to the gringo pricing were offered at Hospedaje Central for a not so nice room, big swail in the bed with thread bare sheets for 45,000 shared bathroom or 50,000 private. The owner is very nice and super accommodating. The mattress is reasonable comfortable, sheets and bathroom clean, no WiFi or hot water. It's a first floor with a roll in ramp for our bicycles, plenty of room outside the room and behind a locked door for storing them You could even fit them in the room. It's a big day from La Argentina 35 miles with 6600' of steep climbing and 6000 of descending so we were happy to find anything. What you expect for 30,000.

name: Hotel (no name)
description: Good, new hotel overlooking the plaza. Single room 30,000COP double 50,000 overlooking the square. Hot water from the showerhead was good. WiFi available but did go down when I was there - apparently a power outage. Some basic restaurants and shops around the plaza. Nice view if you pay for the double, or from the balcony. It is on one of the main through roads so can be a bit noisy at the front or if people are playing football or volleyball in the square. Parking outside is probably safe since the police station is nearby. Bikes can be taken into rooms but you'll have to carry them up the stairs.

name: neighborhood viewpoint with playground
description:
It is arriving at a closed street, a few houses to the right, a playground in front in the La Cumbre neighborhood, it was quiet, children and dogs until 7:00 pm, incredible view of the city.
---
Es llegando a una calle cerrada, unas pocas casas a la derecha un parque infantil en frente en el barrio la Cumbre, estuvo tranquilo, niños y perros hasta las 7:00 pm  hora, vista de la ciudad increible.

name: Autogas LPG station
description: New station for LPG Construction is completed, service should start soon.

name: Cascade los micos
description: Nice waterfall not to far from the road.  There is a clay trail down with a bamboo handrail.

name: Épice
description: Restaurant with Arabic food, very nice, good atmosphere, nice garden in de shadow, not overcrowded, super cute shop with all the spices your looking for during your whole trip through South America (and they also sell wine).

name: Pizzaria Italiano
description: Eat here, do it. New Yorker approved delicious wood fired, thin crust pizza, with actual pepperoni and tasty ingredients. Best Pizza we've had in our 3 months of bikepacking through Colombia. Cheap, the family size (which l would call a large) good size no leftovers 30,000, a legit pitcher of lemonade 5,000. Quick, we saw the chef throwing the dough and placing it in the oven and in what seemed like 10 minutes later it was being placed in front of us. Club Colombia Negra and other beers for your enjoyment. Nice ambiance, attentive staff and a wonderful dining experience. This is a pizzeria that serves only pizza, we think also a calzone. We also ate at Gato pizza which was good, this is GREAT. Enjoy

name: Lavanderia Rous
description:
Very good launderette: fast service (I dropped off clothes at 9am and collected at 2pm), cheaper than anywhere else I've used in Colombia. Save yourself time and come straight here: all the other places nearby only do dry cleaning, I tried 3 of them.

Unfortunately I don't know the exact hours but on a weekday it was open by 9am and they said they close at 7pm.

name: Don Evelio's place
description: Charming place in Villarica sponsored by Don Evelio

name: Agrituristico La Hinea
description: Camping place with a small river and a restaurant, just next to the road from Rovira to Ibagué, the cost of overnight is really cheap and there is a lot of place to move around

name: Simple restaurant.
description:
Nice normal small town. But I was offered and accepted a beer after only being here for 15 minutes.  Love that.  

Food was good. The lemonade was great I had a refill. 

The road here isn’t terrible. You go through a region of cacao trees.  

Just out of town I’m told there is a river. Going to take a dip after lunch

name: CAMPING BUENAVISTA
description: This is a hotel and also a campground near Buenavista Boyacá.  It’s a far and hidden place between the mountains. A very nice spot, warm weather and with an amazing view, surrounded by tall mountains.  As it’s an hotel, you can enjoy the swimming pool.  Broad space to establish your camp setup.

name: PARQUE MOTOR CAMALEÓN
description:
If you want to adventure in a 4x4 circuit + nice and camp campground, this is the place.
Motor Camaleon is an stablished campground and it’s main attractive are the different 4x4 circuits, for every level of difficulty.  The place is very organized and stablished.  You can enjoy all the day the circuits and finish camping in this wonderful place.  Call Danilo the owner in order to book your stay. +573148596396

name: Alcazaba Oficial
description: 6 km from the center of Villa de Leyva, a safe place, with enclosure, space for Campers, bathrooms with hot water, Nestor its owner, will receive you. 3132885079.

name: Potable water
description: local potable water station with hose. by the side of the road on a concrete platform opposite a house/ferreteria.

name: Cafe del Alto
description: A delicious surprise- Cafe del Alto- in a crossroad - if you are in the zone, come and enjoy- good cofee, delicious pastries, nice food- ans the owners, that is the best!!!

name: parking lot behind gas station
description: we stay here one night. very friendly persons. we gave the pump attendants col$10.000 tip

name: Terpel
description:
We spent one night at this service station on the route, quiet, and very friendly employees. 24 hours, very spacious parking
Restrooms and kiosk
--
Pasamos una noche en esta estación de servicio sobre la ruta, tranquilo, y los empleados muy amables. 24 hs ,parking muy amplio 
Baños y kiosco

name: Casa Matriz
description:
If you come to Filandia you must stay in this place. The first thing is that its owners Lorena and Esteban are a total love and have built this beautiful cultural space for everyone to enjoy. In the parking lot you have a spectacular view, a landscape to enjoy in the morning with the green of the mountains.
You can arrange with the owners the prices for the bathroom and food if you wish, they also have delicious coffee.
We totally recommend this place, away from the bustle of the town and in contact with nature. You can also enjoy the various cultural activities that are scheduled in the place.
---
Si usted viene a Filandia debe quedarse en este lugar. Lo primero es que sus dueños Lorena y Esteban son un total amor y han construido este bello espacio cultural para el disfrute de todos. En el parqueadero tienes una vista espectacular, un paisaje para disfrutar en la mañana con el verde de las montañas. 
Puedes concertar con los dueños los precios para el baño y la alimentación si lo deseas, además tienen un café delicioso.
Recomendamos totalmente este lugar, lejos del bullicio del pueblo y en contacto con la naturaleza. también puedes disfrutar de las variadas actividades culturales que se programan en el lugar.

name: Taller de bicicletas y motos
description: A very conscientious bike repairman. He also repairs motorcycles.

name: beside the rural road
description: some nice spots to park for a night, we did could not drive into Rincon (big Party), so without anything it was OK ...

name: Ecocenter
description:
Excellent place to get to know the area

It has capacity for campers and trucks to attend daily would be 5 cars, inside the park there are two routes for ecological walks, one hour and a half and one hour, if you want a bonfire, rent the stoves and sell firewood.
PET Friendly

Very close to the Santa Cruz Zoo
---
Excelente lugar para conocer la zona

Tiene capacidad para campers y camiones para atender diariamente sería de 5 carros, al interior del parque se tiene dos rutas para hacer caminatas ecológicas, de una hora y media y de una hora, si se desea fogata alquilan los fogones y se vende la leña. 

Tiene batería de baños cómoda, canopy, escalada,rapely circuito aereo.

PET Friendly

Muy cerca del zoologico santa cruz

name: Las Tangaras ProAves Reserva
description:
We visit this natural reserve from ProAves to do some bird watching. We overnight here with our motorhome. It is a flat corner. If you drive a bit further down the road you'll find a little shelter. We used it to sit under it while it was raining. You can pitch your tent under it. Locals were friendly and we had two quiet nights here. 

Enjoy!

name: ProAves Colibri del Sol Reserve
description:
We visit the ProAves Colibri del Sol Reserve to search for some nice bird species. There is a lodge in the reserve, but we stayed in our motorhome at this location. From here you have to walk +/- 2hours to the lodge. As day visitor we paid 50.000 cop per person to enter the reserve. Normally, they want it via bank deposit, but they made an exception that we could pay it with cash.

Enjoy!

name: Casa Bistro Pizza
description:
Nice pizza place. They were a bit slow, but the familiar pizza is worth the wait. See the photo for the menu. 
Enjoy!

name: Centro de interprétation Del Bejuco Al Canasto
description:
Here you can make your own basket in bejuco (wood liane) and learn about the whole process. Very interesting especially if you have kids. We add some photos ! 
Price 30.000 cop for 1h-1h30.

name: Super Giros - Hotel Peniel - Western Union
description: place to withdraw money via Western Union.  We went to the places that were in the app but none of them worked, this place was not in the WU App and it is possible to make withdrawals here.  (We were asked for a copy of the document)

name: SOAT - Seguro de Estado
description: We found a Seguro Del Estado office in Pereira. You need to go in the Torre Bolívar, floor number 11. We paid 206.000cop for 3 months (they cannot do it for less) for our Fiat Ducato. Quick and helpful

name: La Cueva
description:
Cool spot along the side of the road. Suitable for tent camping and vanparking. 

The ground is hardpack dirt, though there can be a muddy section along the road which you have to go through to get under the rock. I had no trouble with my motorcycle, a heavier vehicle may not be so easy.

Very spotty Claro signal. Lots of traffic until late in the night, but nobody bothered me, and I think most people didn't even see me.

name: Santa Rosa Bridge
description:
Two grassy flat spots along Quebrada Santa Rosa suitable for tent camping and vanparking. One on each side of the road.

There is a nearby store selling snacks and drinks. I asked inside if it was ok for me to set up a tent and the lady inside said it was no problem. 

Sound of the whitewater river nearby, if that bothers you... or maybe it helps you sleep. Locals use it as a swimming hole in the afternoon. 

Decent Claro signal. Fair number of vehicles passing until late, but nobody bothered me, and I was mostly out of view of the road. 

There is an actual campground with what looks like a restaurant, store, and a (very dirty) pool on the other side of the bridge. It looked closed when I was there.

name: Taminaka Hostel
description: It is a small hostel in a quiet neighborhood, but close to the city center, which makes it very convenient because it is close to government offices and all kinds of shops and services. Pets are accepted, clothes can be washed, there is a equipped kitchen available.

name: Hotel El Guayabito
description: Nice modern hotel with AC and WiFi (try to get a room nearer the main lobby for better speed). 67000 for a twin room with 2 beds. Easily space for bicycles in the room.

name: Restaurante las abejas
description:
Out of all the small town I eat in. This restaurant put some love into the meal of the day.  Mango on the salad. Fresh arepa and a patacone.  Very good
The hike la peña is near 
Area is different with pine trees and cafe trees. 
Road was a little muddy but no problem 
It’s off the plaza. If you can find a place to park and is down a long hallway to a inner courtyard. Was nice and quiet for the most part

name: Sutagaos Camping
description:
A beautiful place for camping. You feel like home. The lady can sell you lunch and she prepares great local snaks. 

100% recommended.

name: Hotel El Viajero
description: Was the only hotel we could see with rooms on the ground floor so we didn’t have to carry bikes upstairs. Cheap room (50000 for 2 people/2 beds), fan, TV, patchy WiFi.

name: Hotel San Luis Real
description: Really nice clean hotel, 50000 for 2 people + 2 beds. Good wifi. No AC. The lady working was super friendly. Lots of space in a locked garage/courtyard areas for bikes if you’re cycling. **Google Maps has the wrong location for the hotel**

name: Abandonado building
description:
Here is a old brick and tin building you can put 2 or 3 big tents inside of if rain. 
Also can camp under varander

also room to park car or van off the track

name: Hospedaje El Alfarero
description: Great hospedaje. Rooms with private bathrooms. Some rooms will sleep up to four people. I paid 35000 COP for a very comfortable room with double bed and bathroom with hot shower. Secure parking on premises an extra 5000 COP. Fine for motorcycles but vans and 4WDs may struggle with height. The owner Mercedes is a lovely lady - friendly and super helpful with tips on places to visit in the area.

name: ProAves Chestnut-capped Piha reserve
description:
We came here to bird the area. It is a small parking lot next to the road, but with our Toyota 4Runner we managed to place the car behind the road sign. It was a quiet night.

Enjoy!

name: San José Hotel Colonial
description:
Inexpensive room right on the plaza in the cute town of Concepción. I paid COP40,000.

Inside a colonial-style building are several rooms. I had a single with a private bathroom and a loft. There was space for one or two motorcycles inside the room, though I didn't ask if I could park there. I parked my bike inside the hotel entryway. There is a parking lot nearby also. 

24-hour staff. Electric hot water shower. Pretty good wifi. Courtyard with a small drink counter and several tables. Nearby restaurant will deliver food. Clean and quiet; very relaxing place. 

I saw two other hotels in town.

name: Terpel
description:
Terpel gas station, with showers, baths, drinking water, security with cameras and 24-hour service.  Caring people...Safe place to spend the night.
.....
Posto Terpel, com ducha, baños, água potável, seguro com câmeras e atendimento 24h. Pessoas atenciosas...Local seguro para passar a noite.

name: Had tire punctured by banditos
description: While stopped at the stoplight near this fuel station a motorcycle drove up to our front passenger tire and stuck a sharp metal tube into our tire. As soon as we drove on it, our tire was flat in 5 seconds. This is a 'thing' in Colombia, and it likely happens at this location regularly, so keep an eye out, especially if you see a moto with no license plate. We involved the police and made an ordeal of it. Maybe they will do something about it someday.

name: Parcela Hôtel Villa Maria
description: Nice place to stay and relax. With plenty of outside space, a small swimming pool and plenty of lounging chairs.  Rooms are very clean and comfortable.  The administrator (Lucho) is super nice and takes great care of the place.

name: Cabana ecologica
description:
Really nice place with a great owner. The cabanas are really nice and extremely clean!
The rooms have a small kitchen so you can prepare your own meal as well. 100.000 incl breakfast (1person). Motorcycles will be safe here.
The whole area is taken care of and they have a beautiful garden.
5 min walk from a nice restaurant. 
Definitely can recommend this place

name: Hostal Flor Tayrona
description: Hostal and Cacao Farm with nice accomodations and a wonderful staff. it's surrounded by a cacao and fruit plantation. You can reach it by 4x4 during the drier seasons where the river is lower.

name: Hotel Zaraya
description:
Found this place on booking.com for US$20 per night. It's very nice and in the heart of Cúcuta.

Secure parking. Hot water. Mini-fridge. Large room with a large bed. I have a small balcony looking over the street. Pool. Everything is very clean. Wifi is slow.

A few blocks away are some fancy hotels and a street full of trendy restaurants, bars, and clubs. 

The area directly around the hotel, and probably the whole city, isn't perfectly safe at night. There is a large homeless population. 

But if you're coming through, I can recommend this hotel. I can't compare it to anywhere else in the city, since this is the only place I know.

name: Agencia Lavanderia
description:
12 thousand Colombian per kilo l, if it is for the same day it is more expensive

12mil Colombiano por kilo l, se for para o mesmo dia é mais caro

name: parque la ermita
description:
We settled next to the church since it was raining too much when we arrived. The park could also be a good place to park since it is very wide. We didn't have any problems, and it's fine for one night.

Nos instalamos a un costado de la iglesia ya que estaba lloviendo demasiado cuando llegamos. El parque puede ser un buen lugar también para estacionar ya que es muy amplio. No tuvimos ningún problema y está bien para pasar una noche.

name: José Horse Riding.
description:
Just thought id share a wonderful horse riding experience with fellow overlanders. 

We stayed at La Casa François. 
José come and meet us here with his beautiful horses. 
He is also a tour guide for San Agustín and very knowledgeable man with indigenous background. 

Took us to the main sights of the town on horse back. 

4.5 hours cost from 80,000 paso to 100, 000  paso. 
His phone number is +57 320 5841246 on watsapp

name: Hotel Queen Magdalena
description: Really nice hotel in Garagoa. centrally located. Double room was 50,000COP with private bathroom, comfy bed, hot shower and secure parking for the moto.

name: Hotel, Parking, Car Wash, Oil Change
description:
Paid 35,000 for a single room with a fan. Basic room, only a bed and a small night stand. No hot water. Decent WiFi. 

Safe, secure parking garage. Also a place in back for oil changes, and guys who will wash your vehicle. 

Town is at 1400 meters, so the climate is better than going to Aguachica.

name: SOAT Previsora
description:
We got our SAOT at this place, because the other one next to this mark was already about to close.
Even better, because we could also choose only 1 month of SOAT although everybody was telling us, that a SOAT less than 3 months isn't possible in Colombia. So we only paid 60300$ instead of ~170000$+ for each motorcycle.

name: showers on the beach
description: 1000 pesos for a shower, 3 showers just on the beach

name: Florentino Estrada
description: We got to San Basilio  but Barba  Blanca wasn't there. Florentino approached us and told us we could stay at his place. We just parked outside his house, he took us on a really nice tour of the town. It was a memorable experience. Don't expect much though. We were just parked outside his house.

name: La Motoreria
description: Motorcycle service and repairs for all makes. Bike wash service and cafe. Friendly, helpful staff. Ask for Santiago - he speaks English and is super helpful.

name: Claro Store
description: We were able to register our Claro phones here. Just needed our passports.

name: Bamboo Views
description: A perfect flat spot on the side of a quiet road with awesome sunset views over Santa Marta. Only motorbikes and 4wd cars pass by. Birds, fireflies and mostly sounds of nature. High clearance is necessary.

name: Hostel Cafe San Bernabé
description:
Stayed here one night only. 
25,000 pesos per person in a dorm room
They also private rooms 70,000
It was fine for one night. 

It's a small house that is a hostel. 

Lady owner is friendly and nice. 

Clean and tidy. 

Nice neighbourhood. Not too noisy. 

I parked my motorcycle at the front. no problem overnight.

name: Centro Vacacional Caño Grande
description:
Famous Place to spend the night, work, there is Wi-Fi connection, showers, toilets and a lake place

Célebre Lugar para pasar la noche, trabajar, hay conexión wifi, duchas, baños y lugar  lago

name: Hotel Verano Azul
description:
Excellent hotel place, camping is allowed in the car and in a tent if desired, the attention, the best, the beach is in front and is quiet, it has showers and bathroom service, they offer a restaurant, they charged us 20 per car and breakfasts from 8 thousand, lunches from 12 thousand

Excelente lugar hotel, se permite acampar en el carro y en carpa si se desea, la atención, la mejor, la playa está frente y es tranquila, cuenta con duchas y servicio de baño, ofrecen restaurante, nos cobraron 20 por carro y desayunos desde 8 mil, almuerzos desde 12 mil

name: FoCa Camping
description:
FoCa Camping is nestled on a privately owned secluded montain, just 30 minutes away from Zipaquira and surrounded by panoramic mountain views. Its location is convenient to unwind and to explore the area, with Neusa lake nearby, Tausa, Sutatausa and Ubate. It´s a place for people who seek nature and tranquility.

After living in a big city like Bogota, we move to the country farmhouse and started several sustainable and regenerative projects. On-site we offer Internet access, electricity (110/220), municipal water and a BBQ space. Furthermore, there are a bathroom, a kitchen/social area, a washing machine and we also offer fresh vegetables from our orchard. Please note that toilets with chemicals cannot be emptied here, that no chemicals or cleaning products are used. Garbage must be separated for disposal. We speak english, french and spanish.

Camping 25.000 pesos pp/pn (from 12 years of age onward). Children 4-11 years old 10.000 pesos and children up to 3 years old free of charge. Electrical connection to RV 15.000 pesos pn.  There is no height restriction. WhatsApp/Phone: +57 3156480695

name: Parking lot Gas Neiva
description:
When we we’re refilling our gas bottle, a person open our van and stole our documents, money, cellphone. Be careful.

Cuando estábamos guardando la garrafa de gas en la parte de atrás del motorhome, una persona nos abrió la puerta de la camioneta y nos robó documentos, dinero, celular. Tengan cuidado.

name: Hostel Kongo
description:
Called ‘hostel’, but it’s only private rooms with shared bathrooms. Really nice place, hot showers, great WiFi, super friendly owners. Neighbourhood feels safe. We paid 85000 for 2 people/2 beds on booking.com
No obvious sign outside except a hotel icon, and it’s in the wrong location on Google maps.

name: Finca Aurora
description:
Private farm, very safe and easily accessible, in the area there are many tourist places, extreme sports and others, they have wifi, water, bathrooms, swimming pool, bbq, large green areas, energy in the main house and for only 2 usd energy 24 hr in your motorhome. Excellent place.
Entrance in the west, at the small lake. You have to call (WhatsApp ) in advance.

name: Condomínio Di Sole
description:
public parking in front of a condominium with 24h surveillance.  safe and peaceful.  a great spot to spend a night!  @bus.trada

estacionamento público em frente a condomínio com vigilância 24h.  seguro e tranquilo.  um ótimo local para passar uma noite!  @bus.trada

name: Mechanico Mane
description: We came here to fix our airconditioning, was not working anymore. They fixed it in 5 minutes! Business run by father and son, really friendly people.

name: Terpel
description:
We slept here one night. Very quiet. A lot of trucks.(But in the next morning we were stolen in Gas Neiva, very near to this point). Be careful.

Dormimos una noche acá, muy tranquilo, muchos camiones. (pero en la mañana siguiente nos robaron en Gas Neiva, que está muy cerquita de este punto). Tene cuidado.

name: Casa Grande Arbolito
description: Pacefull and relaxing Hotel locatet near to Barichara. Surrounded by beautifull landscapes and nice views.

name: javier's taller
description:
new location for the workshop just up the street.

Javier is a very friendly guy who has worked for overlanders before and tried to fix our oil leak. unfortunatly he came to the conclusion that our crankshaft is slightly damaged, to big of a job to take the whole thing out. But if you are in the neighborhood and need some work done deffitly a good option.

name: Bolivar Car Wash
description:
Super nice car washing service (even for mid size rigs). They washed our Defender for COP 40k. 
There are ramps for washing underneath and the entrance is ~3.5m high.

name: agua Sion
description: purificadora, i have bought little bags of water to go to cabo de la vela, 5000 for 50 packets also you can get garagon the agua and can refil your tank, very lively people

name: Parqueadero Parapente
description: There's an abundance of agencies to go paragliding in this neighborhood. This one is one of the bigger parking lots, we could spend the night here and do the flight the next morning. We chose the company "San Félix Parapente", a little further on the right but the parking situation is dramatic there so just park elsewhere. 260k for a 20min flight incl GoPro footage.

name: Salt trreatment of the bottom of the car
description: Gas station where they also do different kind of treatments to wask your car. After spending months at the coast the bottom of our car urgently needed a threatment against the salt. We payed 40.000

name: Comedor
description: Open air comedor surrounded by several bars and restaurants, nice place

name: Along the boardwalk
description:
We spent 3 nights on the boardwalk, next to the bus of a girl who sells food every day. The super friendly girls.
---------------------
Pasamos 3 noches sobre el malecon, al lado del bus de una chicas que venden comida todos los días. Las chicas super amables.

name: Hotel, restaurant and motorhome friendly
description:
We slept one night in our motorhome at the parking lot. It is a hotel. Single room is 25.000 cop. Double is 35.000 cop. We paid 10.000 cop for using the parking lot. 

Enjoy!

name: El Secreto
description: Natural place, next to river, in Cocora, WC and shower, you can ride horse, Coffeshop. Phone Móvil: 57-3107305274

name: Wide turnout with a view
description: Quiet fairly level parking spot on the side of a gravel road, about 15km off the main highway. Road is in good condition even after a rain. We leveled when we parked and the view down the river valley was nice. Very quiet at night. Just a few motorcycles in the morning. Three bars of extended Claro with a cell phone booster.

name: Hostal Casa Marina
description:
+573185342184 Julio 
Julio is a wonderful man we stayed with him for 2 nights. I could have stayed a week. It is such a nice location with beautiful balcony with excellent views of the nice green hills. 
The price was 45,000paso per person per night. Lovely big bids. He also made us breakfast. 
He  organised us the tickets to Thermals De Santa Rosa. 40,000paso form 5pm to 11pm. 
This was a wonderful experience. 
Sitting in the hot pools watching the waterfalls all lit up at night. Highly recommend this Hostel. Which in reality is a nice cute house. It is very comfortable.

name: Hospedaje Buenos Aires
description:
Translation: Excellent place to rest and spend time in front of the beach, the hostess treated us like at home, multiple rooms are offered (check the current value per person), the hostess offered us space for the van and a tent, there are showers, service toilet and kitchen. For 20 thousand per person. (For the van) Telephone +57 3194585435
.....
Excelente  lugar para descansar y pasar tiempo frente a la playa, la anfitriona nos atendió como en nuestro hogar , se ofrecen habitaciones múltiples (consultar el valor vigente por persona ), la anfitriona nos ofreció espacio para la van y una carpa, hay duchas, servicio sanitario y cocina. Por 20mil por persona. (Para la van) Telefono +57 3194585435

name: Taller automotriz la fe
description: Big workshop, friendly owner. We stopped here as the pipe of our turbo came loose and we couldn’t tighten the tube. He didn’t have the good tube to tighten it but he jumped on his bike to find it in town. Fast and friendly service.

name: fruit and veg shop+ best papa rellena and empanadas
description:
nice fruit and veg shop, really good prices and very honest guy, the best fruit I have found in this area.
next door a little tienda that sells Appa rellena and empanadas , very cheap and tasty 2500 cop

name: Quinta de Fagua
description: Nice campsite, very quiet. Clean toilets, warm water, wifi, selling beer and drink and pet friendly. Lots of rock climbing of all kind around: bouldering, sport and trad. The owner Jorge is very friendly and know about all the outdoor activities around Los Farallones. There is a slackline and even a highline rigged on site. Mirador near by too! Jorge speaks english, you can call or text him on Whatsapp +573212442548. He also rents cabanas.

name: Hostal Los Pinos
description: Nice little hostel with very friendly owner. We got a big room with 4 beds for 45000 COP with 2 people. WiFi, hot "suicide" shower and open parking in front of the hostel - area is safe though. There is a small restaurant in the building and a lot of food options in walking distance. Quiet and safe neighborhood.

name: Asistencia mecánica JyL
description:
Amazing Mechanic! Johnny and his crew are All Venezuelans and no problem is too hard for them. We stayed for more than 2 months at another mechanic who eventually still couldn’t solve our problem (which was recommended by Iguana 4x4). Johnny came and found the issue within 5 minutes! He’s specialized in Fords, but I see all branches standing on his property. Even his daughter is working here as a mechanic, the first female mechanic we’ve met all over the world!
They are very solution minded and I can’t recommend them more!

name: Offroad
description:
This is 60km of offroad. In our opinion 4x4 not required if you have clearance and if it does not rain. If it does rain forget it you’ll get stuck in the mud.
Otherwise it is a very nice drive, beautiful scenery but long. 2h+ for 60km

name: cascada de los caballeros
description: We spent one night parking in front of the waterfall. In the morning the lady of the house in front offered us some coffee, orange juice and then, as we spent more time with her, she cooked us something for lunch, everything for free.
