We went up to the waterfall, they charged us 1000 pesos, on the second entrance after the bridge. Amazing spot at the top of the waterfall. Very calm at night.

name: Terpel gas station
description: Slept there after being rejected on the truck stop. This is actually way better. Calm, with free toilets and showers. A restaurant is also here but we didn’t try it. There is a water tap next to the toilets

name: Hotel Zulia
description: We got ~200€ of COP stolen, while having breakfast the next morning for about an hour. We told one of them, that we would quickly leave for breakfast before checkout. There were no other people in the hotel that time and a camera facing towards our room door. They told us, that they can't check the video material and they would have to order a video technician, what would need ~3 hours. My wife got so angry, telling that we even would wait the whole day and also get the police involved, that they suddenly started negotiating the price to get out of the trouble. Finally, she got all the stolen money back + the price for the hotel room. You should definitely avoid this place.

name: Texaco Gas Station
description: A few parking spots for up to medium sized rigs, 24/7 security present, toilets of the gas station were clean and always open. Perfect for the night!

name: Hotel Hosteria La Gaitana
description: Quoted 70000 for 1 person and they were very reluctant to lower it, but managed to get it for 60000 when I was about to walk away. Nice large room with multiple beds, so a couple would find it better value for money. The WiFi didn’t reach my room (near the pool), so I wish I’d gone to the other place on iOverlander instead.

name: Dog Park
description: Street parking next to a dog park and near a big shopping mall. Legal to park on this street, and was ok for a night. It's a city, so don't expect it to be quiet all night, but there were police around from time to time and seemed fine to spend the night here. The dog park is great for your dog too! The mall has clean bathrooms that are open until 11pm.

name: la terraza
description: Simple hotel, clean, friendly family running the place, quite a lot of stairs to carry bicycle up! 45,000 pesos for the night. (bring ear plugs the town centre is noisy!)

name: Chorros Taparto Cáscaras
description:
Very beautiful waterfall 
About 9km from the town
The road to the water fall is a little rough with rocks but no problem. 
I arrived with my Yamaha Tenere motorcycle. 
You can park at the cafe and walk 10 min from here. 
It has 3 waterfalls with a miradore and 2 places you can swim. 

Also a small track you can climb all the way to the tow waterfall. 

Came on a Tuesday only 2 other people here.

name: Finca Aura Viva
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager.   
----------------
-Lots of shade under our exotic fruit trees.
-Plenty of fresh water
-Enjoy the sounds of exotic birds
-Learn to milk a cow and make your own fresh organic cheese. 
-Plenty of wood for bomb fires and BBQs
-Protective garage space for vehical maintanance. 
-Enjoy star gazing 
-Real Colombia coffee any time, all the time.
-Walking trails
-Beautiful clean, modern bathroom. 
-Learn advanced Breathwork techniques.
-Keep fit and healthy with our gym, yoga, Qigone and meditation outdoor studio. 
-Kid friendly.

name: Casa Hotel Lenden
description:
Nice hotel under/behind the little tienda and bakery. Friendly bunch of people that run it, good wifi, and there’s a little road that goes round to the back where there is lots of space for vehicles. 30000 for 1 person with TV/fan/private bathroom. Lots of street food and restaurants nearby. 

There is also a hotel 1km to the east but I didn’t check it out. The hospedaje to the south on Google maps doesn’t seem to exist.

name: Robbery Attempt - Magangue
description:
We had to slow down at this intersecrtion and someone (whom I saw noticed us coming from a distance) used the opportunity to jump on the side steps, lean inside the open windows and try to steal whatever he finds. He could not reach anything valuable so he demanded my phone. 
This all happened while we were in motion.
Arguing, asking, begging did not make him want to leave and get off of the truck so i accelerated which may have made him scared and finally he jumped off. He may have also concluded that we are not giving him anything.
It all happened very fast. 
A couple of times he reached down to his picket which retrospectively seemed like he had been reaching for a weapon of some sort. Luckily we never found out.

name: Garage Bike Medellin - Royal Enfield official services
description: small garage official services for Royal Enfield, no parts in stock you have to by them yourself . friendly guy quick job .I changed the chain kit after 6 months on the road .

name: CAFE LA MANCHURIA
description:
WOW!!! 
What a fantastic cafe. This is a proper cafe in the cafe region of Colombia that has everything to do with coffee in it. 
You can buy coffee, buy utensils to make coffee. 
Its fantastic, many different tyres of coffee flavours. 
A little expensive but good quality. 

I was so happy to find this place. 

Cake is great. the bananna cake was great

name: Pizza. Vede Oliva
description: Very good pizza between 20.000 and 28.000. Very pleasant on the beautiful main place with a fan, great with this temperature

name: hospedaje cutucumay
description: family run guest house, clean, bike storage in garage and even a hot shower! 40 cop 2 people in double room

name: Street next to the Church
description:
place next to the Basilica, to spend the night, arrive at 7 pm and leave early

lugar al lado de la Basilica, para pasar la noche, llegar a las 7 pm y salir temprano

name: Local  street food
description: Here you can eat very cheap. Empanadas, meat. We didn’t ask menu and we eat here because at 18.30 was not very people but 20.20 some locals

name: Family run - Restaurante y Fruteria
description: Nice family run restaurant with very kind service. Easy parking right in front (not for big rigs)

name: The flamingo guide’s house
description: Front yard of a guide, Raul Pusyna, who can get you to the flamingos when the water is low. After the tour he let us camp overnight. His English was good and his family was very nice. There are many restaurants nearby to get great seafood at low costs. Raul’s phone is +573233184361.

name: Comedor costino
description: Many local comes here to eat near by river. Look like good. Didn’t try. Nice for breakfast also

name: Cabana Milan
description: Villa 10 beds with swimming pool and air conditioning in two bedrooms. Booking on Booking or Airbnb. Very pleasant to rest from the extreme heat of the region (300,000 COP/night). Possibility to park campers in the garden. Washing machine and possibility to fill up with water

name: Llanero
description: very rustic Restaurant, pork from open fire- Grill. big portions, we shared one for two of us, was 25 k and rico! Nice View. Second Restaurant other side of the street.

name: high grass plateau
description: Flat area (not super flat) on the left side of the way, if you come from San Gil, with very high grass where you can find space for one or maybe two tents. You have to climb to the plateau on the left. Don't expect a nice spot, this is only useful for an overnight. But the surroundings are beautiful and it is not easily visible from the path.

name: Restaurante Sabor con Tradicion
description: We spent the night here. Basic with shady parking and clean toilets and adjacent to both the road and the restaurant. Once the sun went down, traffic on the road was very minimal. Food at the restaurant was very plain and very limited menu. Soup and eggs for breakfast. Fresh juice was excellent. Coffee was a sad example from a country that grows some of the best coffee in the world.

name: Riohacha
description: Very easy access for any type of vehicle.  Great place, wild and very spacious, fishermen right next door.  Calm night.  We stayed 2 nights.

name: Fuente de Café
description: Coffee place with excellent coffee and sweets. They offer a wide selection of coffee styles and prepare everything by hand. Very attentive and friendly. Paid 5$ for 2 Cappuccino and a delicious Maracuja cake. For more info check the pictures please.

name: Balneario La Union
description:
Natural place for camping and swim. Parking. Food and bathroom.
Cheap

name: Finca Mirador Ser Feliz
description:
Mirador Ser Feliz near to lejanías. Great place with a beautiful view of lejanías. You have the option to pay a tiny house or for the space to camping under rooftop. There is a pool and restaurant service. Simai us the owner, great person.

El Mirador Ser feliz está ubicado a unos kilómetros de lejanías. gran lugar con una hermosa vista de lejanías y el río. tienes la opción de alquilar una cabaña o pagar el espacio de camping. ofrecen servicio de piscina y restaurante. el señor simay es el propietario y una excelente persona.

name: Los pinos entrance and camping
description: You can camp here view on the village. You can walk after in the village to make a circle walking

name: Laundry and option to refill water
description:
Laundry by weight, they wash, dry and fold all your clothes at a very good price, for 10,000 COP you load your clean water tank
----------------------
Lavandería por peso , lavan secan y doblan toda tu ropa a muy buen precio , por 10.000 COP cargas  tu tanque de agua limpias

name: Beautiful River Access
description: Beautiful little place at the river. Plenty of shade from the surrounding trees. Very quite and peaceful. Level spot for one or two cars. We stayed for one night and saw nobody else. One of the better wild campspots in Colombia.

name: Taller El Molino
description: Many tallers here. We went to El Molino. We had problems with the alternator and they fixed it! Very sympathetic and very efficient! Thanks Miller (mecano electrico) for your help.

name: Road between El Carmen and San Vicente
description:
A really bad road. We drove it after it rained. It was very muddy and slippery. There were a lot of 'cleaned' landslides. If you want to go to San Vicente go via north (7.147691, -73.302571). That road is in way better condition. 

Good luck!

name: Taller Auto Adila - Toyota cars
description:
Freddy and his team helped us a lot. We had problems with our fuel pump. After two other mechanics (who couldn't solve our problem) Freddy could solve it. He worked for more than 10 years for an official Toyota dealer. So he has a lot of knowledge about Toyota cars. 

The neighborhood isn't the best to wait outside with your mobile phone in your hand. They have a waiting room upstairs with WiFi, coffee and potable water.

Highly recommended! Good luck!

name: Spot for one vehicle with river access
description: We were looking for a wild spot, which is close to the Highway 45A, and we found this beautiful spot. There is space for one vehicle direct at a small road (nothing bigger than a minivan). It seems to be the access to the river for the locals and it’s in between two properties. You are surrounded by Eukalyptus trees and meadows, it’s calm and beautiful. No overview or something really special, just nature. We arrived at 3pm and some locals were passing by until 8pm (car, bike, foot). Everyone besides one where really friendly. One seems to be not that amused. We asked him, if it’s ok when we stay for one night, and he said yes. We had a calm night. If you stay on weekdays, be aware that you park as far as possible away from the road. The school bus needs the corner for his turn.

name: Mayorca HomeStay
description: Mayorca HomeStay is a very quiet hostel. It has 3 rooms, each with its own bathroom.  It is in front of a park with many trees.  The room is 120k pesos per couple with breakfast.  Hugo and Stella are very good hosts

name: “Thysqua Refugio Florián”
description: Thysqua Refugio Florián offers 2 Cabañas with breathtaking view of the cascadas. We paid 100’ per night.  The place is not accessible with big rigs. Only bikes and 4x4 recommended, especially when it’s wet. Tents are also welcome. Theres a place under a round pavilion and also shower and a toilet. At this location you can easily blend into nature. We stayed 3 nights and visited the cave (ventana de Thisquizote) and the base pool (charco azul). From the cabanas You can hike directly to the base and do a loop via the village back to the place. Like 12 km and 3h absolute worth the effort. Sergio, his mom Rubiela and José are super friendly hosts. They help you with everything. We felt that this is a really special location in Colombia.

name: Parqueadero Los Angeles
description:
Quiet and very safe place. Parqueadero of a family that lives next door, super sweet and helpful. I got water and there's an outlet on site but we didn't use it.

Lugar tranquilo y muy seguro. Parqueadero de una familia que vive al lado, super dulce y servicial. Obtuve agua y hay una salida en el lugar, pero no la usamos.

Lugar tranquilo e bem seguro. Parqueadero de uma família que mora ao lado, super queridos e solícitos. Consegui água e tem uma tomada no local mas não usamos.

name: La Especial Campestre
description: A really nice spot for a coffee break. It’s a panderia & cafeteria with a lot of opportunities to sit in- and outside. Prices are reasonable (Americano 2500 COP). They have different breakfast options as well. A lot of local bikers stopped by when we were there.

name: Finca Casa Basan
description: Beautiful place for the enjoyment of coffee, landscape, very quiet, you can experience coffee life, good space, water, electricity and very friendly people.

name: Gravel/offroad to Jardin
description: This is a gravel road all the way to Jardin from Jerico. You save 45km instead of going back to the main road but def not time. Views are amazing as you drive through coffee culture and along a river. 4x4 recommended but no required when dry but clearance is better.

name: Swim in river
description: Here you can have access to the river from the road. Very refreshing cold water !

name: Eco Hostal Tierra de Aqua y Fuego
description:
nice small Hostal direct at the street between Guatape and San Rafael, they offer privat rooms, breakfast and dinner,
natural pool direct by the house, we stand for two nights with our camper (land rover with rooftent), the entrance is app. 2,5 meters! there is space for two campers, 
all is very clean.
the owners name is Perla. they offer hiking tours with different duration and grads into the mountains.

name: cocoa café francès
description: Great French cafe, where you can taste the best ice cream in Colombia for us.  They have an incredible variety of flavors and all the ice creams are homemade.  You can also enjoy excellent Breton crepes with the icing on the cake, salted butter caramel.  Vero and Matthieu the owners welcome you with a smile.  A delight!!!!

name: HOTEL AMARANTI
description:
Super good Hotel Amaranti next to the taller mecanico.
We needed to fix our campervan and this hotel was really a good spot for us as it was right next to the taller, so we could check easily the progress of our campervan.
As well they have a small secure parking but only for small car or motorbike. 
If not there is a parking right next to the hotel but it’s indépendant from the hotel for bigger car super secure with camera and guard.
The people who run the place are soooo lovely. 
The place is secure.
Private rooms with own bathroom and hot shower.
Room 1 matrimonial bed: 40.000 pesos
Room 2 matrimonial bed: 60.000 pesos
24h checkin 
Highly recommend !

name: Hostel Lake View
description:
Showers with : towel, hot water and soap.
Also, possible to use the bathroom.
5k pp

name: Rio Coffee Cafe
description: Nice cafe with good WiFi and plug sockets at all the tables. I spent a few hours working here when passing through the town.

name: Los Nopales
description:
I great please to stay, you can connect to energy, refill water, the don't have toilets yet, but the are making them. You can do bonfire and cook on a small BBQ. 
Is great for rest.
You can rent one a room for couples or families. Or you can stay in your trailer 
You can talk with the owners for the charge per night. They include the breakfast if you want.

name: Hostal Rocas del Río
description: Very nice spot in this hidden gem that is Mutatá. A place surrounded by deep blue rivers in the middle of the humid rainforest of Urabá. We camped by the house of Santiago that is about to start his hostel. He is also a tour guide that can take you to the different places around the village. Totally worths it because is an unexplored area that has much to offer!

name: Weight (5t) and height (2,90m) limit
description: This bridge is limited to 2,70m. This bridge is limited to around 5m and 5t. If that's not enough for your car you can take the bridge Enrique Santos instead, south of here.

name: Rosas next to the hospital
description: It is a quiet place next to the hospital in front there is a field that sometimes children from the school use. It is comfortable to park and quiet at night.

name: By local people
description:
Here a family of modest farmers welcome you to park for the night. Not big, but incredibly generous. It's the red-brick house on the left as you head towards Guadalupe. Place a vehicle. Big rig ok with a simple maneuver. Flat grassy area close to the road but not in the way. Network not great 
---
Ici une famille de fermiers modestes vous accueillent pour stationner pour la nuit. Ils n’ont pas grand mais d’une incroyable générosité. C’est la maison à gauche en brique rouge quand on va vers Guadalupe. Place un véhicule. Big rig ok avec une manœuvre simple. Terrain plat en herbe proche de la route mais ne gêne pas. Réseau pas terrible

name: Motos&Servitecas
description:
Best place to fix your BMW Motocycle here in Town. We was here to fix the suspension of our 650 GS. Takes us one hour. 
Best service 
Very friendly team

name: Truck Wheel Alignment - Autos Apolo 2000
description:
Wheel alignment for big trucks. They don’t worry about your truck not being in the system.
We came here with an Iveco Daily 4x4

name: La Casa de Gabo
description:
A family home, where we want to provide overlanders with a familiar environment. Looking to be a place where they feel comfortable staying, and receive hot chocolate, a comfortable bed, and hot water.

As said, it's a family house where you will find Wifi, breakfast, a garage, and a comfortable social area to talk, hang around, and ask for recommendations. Also, it's near to public transport stations and grocery stores

This idea comes from the love of a young man for Overlanding culture, trying to support them, make friends and learn more about their experiences. High English level to have a good chat. 

Also, we try to be present as an affordable option for overlanders, the night will cost you 75.000 cop night/person. This includes breakfast and the use of the different spaces of the house. Máx occupation: 2 people.

Contact info:
+57 3164516481 
Riveracamachog@gmail.com 

(I will post photos ASAP)

name: Chez Rémy
description: Excellent French restaurant. It feels good to find the flavors of our home after so much time traveling. We recommend the incredible quenelles! The wines are not French but very correct. Fully affordable prices.

name: Las Margaritas
description: Beautiful place next to a amazing waterfall, fresh vegetable and fruits garden onsite. Farm to table restaurant. Cold shower functioning, hot showers planned. Wi-fi available. Friendly people.

name: La cocha- Paramo Gordoncillo road
description: Wild camping next to river. Beautiful place.

name: ASHA bakery/coffee house
description: This place is an absolute gem. They have actual brown bread without a ton of sugar, with nuts and natural ingredients. Like real "European" bread. Best I've had after a year around South America. The coffee is also divine. They have a nice little patio to chill on, bring bug spray though. Coffee take away also available, along with the best brownies and some other delicious cakes. Not the cheapest, but seriously the best!

name: Kafe del Alma
description: this place is a must-see! smallest bar I have ever seen but a great vibe! the way they serve their coffee is awesome! a lot of care, love. also the cocktails are really nice! live music nights are the best! go here, you will love it!!!

name: Pasteleria Francesa
description:
Excellent French pastry. Better than in France (and it's French people who say it!). Pastries, pastry and possibility of lunch on site (coffee, hot chocolate, tea). We particularly recommend almond croissants, chocolate bread, quiche and lemon pie. Enjoy!

Only from Thursday to Sunday and sometimes Monday

name: Pizza 7 tigres
description: Waouw suce à good pizza! Good apetizer too! We love it.

name: De la tierra casa taller
description: Súper workshop du ring 2h ours you will do you own pintura or magnet with natural colour from land of Colombia Santander region. Enjoy and relax with a cup of coffee or wine. (Biscuit for kids). . Staff very friendly. Great experiences. We love it!

name: water tap in the garden
description:
water tap just in the garden! drinkable as I have seen locals drinking it! also we are at 3000 metre altitude a guess the water is fine!
possibility to hook up a pipe!

name: Pizza bari
description: Good oven pizza . Very small inside so try to come early or wait little bite. Just great.

name: Finca Hotel Oasis
description:
Secure Camping/Hotel by the entrance of the city.
- 30.000 pesos for 2 people in campervan
-Free pool ( Billard)
-Swimmingpool but have to pay an extra
- 1 min walking to the city, restaurant and 
small supermarket

THE BEST : waking up with huge Guacamayos !

name: Jhon R motor mechanic
description: Don't go here! This guy Jhon was not knowing what he was doing. He even lied about replacing our Toyota Fuel Pump for another original Toyota pump, but he replaced it for another cheap brand. Not recommended!!

name: Aventuras a motors
description: DON'T GO HERE!!! They have absolutely no idea what they are doing. They are really rude, didn't answer our questions and even ignored us many times. When we asked if they measured the pressure. They said yes but we knew they didn't. We wasted a lot of time and money here. They sold us a new fuel pump, that wasn't suitable for our car. When we went to another mechanic and bought the right fuel pump, they didn't want to give our money back. Overall, DON'T GO HERE!!!

name: Refill here! Cheaper!
description:
The fuel is cheaper at this gas station!! Going north you cross the department border (from Nariño to Cauca) and the fuel gets more expensive in Cauca. 
~
El combustible es más barato en esta estación de servicio!! Yendo al norte cruzás de departamento (de Nariño a Cauca) y el combustible se vuelve más caro en Cauca.

name: Free for women
description:
Texaco gas station. In lady's bathroom there is a clean and free shower, not too cold in sunny days. I took a shower with underwear because the shower had glass door (nobody got into the bathroom anyway). Shower for men costs 2k pesos they said. 
~ 
Estacion Texaco. En el baño de mujeres hay una ducha limpia y gratis, no tan fria en dias soleados. Me bañé con bikini porque la ducha tenia puertas de vidrio igualmente no entró nadie al baño. La ducha para hombres cuestan 2mil pesos dijeron.

name: Multiseguros Insurance Ipiales
description:
We bought our SOAT with Olga from MULTISEGUROS today. Easy process. Although the sign says you need copies of various documents, we didn't have to provide them. Olga made all required photocopies from our original documents. You need to bring:
- Passport 
- Driving Licence
- Vehicle Registration 
- TIP
!!! You can only pay in cash. They accept USD but add an extra charge for the conversion. 

We paid COP 391.000 (06/2024) for 3 months for a 7.5t truck. A lighter vehicle would have been approx. COP 90.000 to 100.000 less. 

The office is open Mondays to Fridays from 8:00am to 12:30pm and from 2:00pm to 6:00pm

See photos for more details.

name: MOLLE delicious pizza & friendly with travellers
description:
We were parked beside this restaurant and Freddy, the owner offered us 2 big portions of pizza, filled with ham, mushrooms and mozzarella on the top. You can buy an entire pizza or just one portion!! Don't know about prices because it was a gift for us :) Very delicious and also the dough, very tasty and crunchy. We also asked him for wifi (very fast)and refilled our water bottles in the restaurant!! super friendly. 
~
Estabamos estacionados al lado del restaurante y el dueño Fredy nos ofrecio unas porciones grandes de pizza rellena con jamon y hongos y muzzarela arriba. Podes comprar una piza entera o solo una porcion! No sabemos los precios porque fue un regalo para nosotros. Deliciosa y la masa tambien muy rica y crocante! Ademas nos prestaron wifi y llenamos nuestros bidones de agua en el restaurante. Super buena onda.

name: Restaurante Heladería VENEZIA
description: When we arrived in Cúcuta we were dying after a good coffee and delicious ice cream. We found this place after we learned that Cafe Tokyo doesn’t exist anymore. The coffee at Venezia is excellent and you’ll find an authentic italian ice cream. The “stratiatella” has big pieces of chocolate inside and tastes like you expect it from Italy. They also serve a wide range of Italian food. The owner is Iitalian and lives in Colombia since 60 years now.

name: Pizzeria Centro
description:
Best Pizza so far in Southamerica. 
Also the ambiance is very nice. 
If you stay more than 10 Month in Southamerica you can be happy to eat on of this pizzas.

name: Cabana Hamaca Grande
description: Amazing spot in the montagne, only 5km from the Tayrona park standard room with fan , very quiet ,swimming pool, Diner can be ordered, breakfast included for 50000cop  by booking.com Access by a small bridge and narrow track , not so easy Only 4x4 and motorcycle.Owners Leonard an Hubert are very friendly and helpful.they can pic you up at the bridge if you asked Tel +573234598456

name: Scamming ATM
description:
Today we went to this ATM to get 2.000.000 COP (about 400€/450$). The ATM asked if we accept the really bad change rate and we pressed NO like everytime. Nevertheless, the atm converted the currency and we hat to pay about 40€ / 45$ fees. Maybe its a Scam, maybe a broken touchpad, we dont know :/

After that we tried it again with a few dollars and the same happened.

name: direcciones hidráulica in bogota
description: nice, honest mechanic, 350k for revising the steering pump ! everything perfect, job done quick, they do all the models

name: Paraíso Tropical
description:
Translation : Allows tents, Hot water, Beds in shared room shared bathroom
Double bed and private bathroom, relaxation area
Spit,Jacuzzi
View of the reservoir and mountains
+57 311 2293983

Permite carpas 
Agua caliente 
Camas en habitación compartida baño compartido 
Cama matrimonial y baño privado 
Zona de relax 
Asador 
Jacuzzi
Vista al embalse y montañas
+57 311 2293983

name: hotel alferes
description: centrally located hotel, rooms clean and quiet (ask for room at back) owner super friendly and helpful with storing bikes. 55k pesos for 2 people

name: Hotel Brisas De San Francisco
description: a perfect hotel for motorcyclists. there is a large garage to safely store motorbikes. the rooms are simple but good. each room has a bathroom. there are rooms with air conditioning or with fan. the location of the hotel is very central but unfortunately not the nicest area. we reached the center on foot and easily reached the rest by Uber. we (two people) paid about 80000 per night via booking.

name: Posada Viajera-KeOs
description: Somos un grupo de apoyo con la disposición de brindar un lugar donde descansar para que puedan continuar su ruta o el destino ya sea de mochilero -biciviajero - motoviajero _ carhome así que esperemos compartir con ustedes al paso por la ciudad blanca POPAYÁN

name: Casa Monteadentro - Sopo (bicyclist camping)
description:
The Monteadentro Sopo house is the home of Jose. Prior to the pandemic, Monteadentro was a group of five adventurous friends who embarked on a thrilling journey across South America on their bicycles. However, while circumstances have changed, our passion for bikepacking and adventure remains unwavering. We now find joy in hosting fellow cycling enthusiasts who share the same love for exploration.

Our cozy farmhouse offers modern amenities such as Wi-Fi, a bathroom with hot water, and a small kitchen. To ensure a seamless experience, we kindly request that interested travelers reach out to us in advance through our Instagram account @monteadentro.cc. Please note that we exclusively accommodate long-distance bicycle travelers, as we value the spirit of endurance and perseverance that comes with this type of journey.

We are excited to continue our connection with the cycling community and provide a welcoming haven for those seeking a unique and fulfilling adventure.

name: Hotel Arizona Suites
description: Good hotel close to center. Secure parking for several cars and motos. 40$ for a spacious double or twin room incl rich excellent breakfast. We could well sort out a few things here and got organized for our entry into Venezuela. Just around the corner are many motorbike dealers and talleres, like Honda, Yamaha, KTM and more. The Restaurant of the hotel deserves a special remark as the food is really excellent. You can order a real steak here (lomo fino) prepared in different styles and get an excellent piece of meat in exactly the termination you order it.

name: Hotel Casobara
description:
very basic but clean hotel.

Room with an aircon and TV costs 60000 COP. Owners are friendly

name: Colombia to Venezuela Immigration
description: Want to leave with your vehicle, this is the correct boarder post. Here you’ll get your passport stamped.

name: DIAN
description: Here you can terminate your TIP from Colombia. Very friendly and correct agent. If you registered with your own email you’ll immediately get the confirmation send. There’s still cellphone signal from Claro/Movistar Colombia. If you can’t receive email make a photo from the paperwork and the comp screen with “finalizado” message.

name: FREE parking, toilets & WIFI
description:
Easy access! In front of the gas station shop!! fuel at good price, coffee, snacks. Clean bathrooms for free, water tap. There is also a free parking lot for trucks and clean grassy area for tents, you just should ask about it.
~
Facil acceso! Frente a la tienda de la estacion de servicio. Combustible a buen precio, café y snacks. Baños limpios y gratis, canilla de agua. Tambien hay estacionamiento gratis para camiones y lugar limpio con cesped para carpas, solo tendrian que preguntar si se puede.

name: Kite Addict Colombia
description: kite addict is a kite school located in Mayapo super frienly people

name: seda natural
description: Visit of the ruta de la seda. Local silk farm

name: Lobo Guerrero to Buenaventura
description: Was riding from Cali through the region, considering going to the pacific coast for a look. Refueling in Lobo Guerrero I asked about the safety of the road onwards due to the sudden presence of military and was warned that it's definitely not safe at night, and daytime was a fair risk. High cartel activity area, the pacific coast is pretty wild west.

name: Hostal Tatacoa
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner/manager. 

Tatacoa Hostel, located in Villavieja-Huila-Colombia. It offers accommodation in established Camping and informal Camping, with access to free Wi-Fi, bathroom and shower, private parking.
Guests of the accommodation can enjoy an optional American breakfast.

Guests can also relax in the garden.

The nearest airport is Benito Salas, 35 km from Hostal Tatacoa, and the property offers an airport shuttle service for a fee.
--------------
Hostal Tatacoa, situado en Villavieja- Huila-Colombia. Ofrece alojamiento en  Campin establecido y Campin informal, con acceso a wifi gratis, baño y ducha, parqueadero privado.
Los huéspedes del alojamiento pueden disfrutar de un desayuno americano opcional. 
Los huéspedes también pueden relajarse en el jardín.
El aeropuerto más cercano es Benito Salas, a 35 km del Hostal Tatacoa, y el establecimiento ofrece un servicio de enlace con el aeropuerto por un suplemento.

name: Hostal Tatacoa
description:
Tatacoa Hostel, located in Villavieja-Huila-Colombia. It offers accommodation in a dormitory, with access to free Wi-Fi, bathroom and shower, private parking.
Guests of the accommodation can enjoy an optional American breakfast.
Guests can also relax in the garden.
-----------------------------
Hostal Tatacoa, situado en Villavieja- Huila-Colombia. Ofrece alojamiento en dormitorio, con acceso a wifi gratis, baño y ducha, parqueadero privado.
Los huéspedes del alojamiento pueden disfrutar de un desayuno americano opcional.
Los huéspedes también pueden relajarse en el jardín.

name: Finca ecoturístico el paraiso
description: Beautiful and peaceful campsite near to Puerto de Tolima, lots of space to pitch tent, toilet facilities and restaurant, bathing area is in the river. They provided us wood for a campfire. Run by a very friendly family. Camping was 10,000 COP. Delicious trout dinner available (fish fresh from their trout farm)!

name: Next to the ostrich
description: Impossible to sleep in the park parking lot but we slept 3 nights with our 26-foot camper next to the ostrich sculpture on the access road between the ark and the park. No problem, from the passage until 9 p.m. and from 6:30 a.m. The coordinates are not accurate but you have to look for the ostrich because it's flat around. Network such very average. Nice view. Practical and free

name: donde brilla
description: set lunch for 10k COP including soup and drink. good cheap option

name: La escuela Taller
description: Nice restaurant where students learn cooking, wooden work. Cheap and very good food. You have to wait. Like all Bogotá eat her!

name: Bakery and cafe La escuela
description: Very good coffee and pastry like chocolate bread, almond croissant. Open 7h to 16h. Name taller el pan

name: San Basilio de Palenque
description: If you go to the main square and ask anyone for Ambrosia they will find him. He has small basic rooms but we just camped in the yard, there is running water and he let us use the shower. His wife cooked us a meal and the whole family were really friendly and helpful. Great for tents

name: At side of motel behind petrol station
description: Behind the petrol station there is a big parking area and a motel, we asked the owner if we could camp for one night so we camped on the side, it has a sink with tap, there are toilets and basic shower at the petrol station

name: La Vitrina
description: Small garden shop/centre 2km before Penalisa, there was a big storm so we stopped and asked if we could camp the night. Luis the owner was lovely, ended up letting us stay in one of his spare rooms with shower/toilet. Not sure if he would do it again but worth an ask if you’re passing and looking for somewhere

name: La Rochelle
description: Basic hotel behind petrol station, 50,000 cop for a double room, ground floor so we could bring the bikes in. A bit loud wort the trucks coming and going but we’re getting used to ‘loud’ everything in Colombia !

name: La Bonita
description: Decent restaurant , menu del dia etc , space for vehicles and tents but we just ate, owners helpful and friendly as ever

name: Estacion Potosi
description: The kind owner let us camp here, it’s an old station but is now a tienda. Concrete area with roof. Tap for water , WiFi, cafe nearby , quiet apart from the dogs and the cockerels!

name: Jardín Overlook
description: Small tiendita with snacks and drinks and empanadas with a fantastic view over the Jardin valley below.

name: Finca Kayui
description:
A traveler's site for travelers. It is a spectacular plain just before reaching Orocué. It is possible to park and there are bathroom services, running water. It is situated next to a forest and a river. Without a doubt, highly recommended Danilo and Yenny are super friendly. Voluntary contribution.
---
Un sitio de viajeros para viajeros. Es una planicie espectacular justo antes de llegar a Orocué. Es posible estacionar y hay servicios de baños, agua corriente. Está situado junto a un bosque y un río. Sin duda, muy recomendable  Danilo y Yenny son super amables. Contribución voluntaria.

name: Villa Alejandra
description:
Hotel with an excellent spa, ideal for motorhomes.  They have a large parking area completely flat.  It has swimming pools, nature and we highly recommend it.  We have spent two days with great comfort.  The bathrooms are very clean and the owners are very nice.
---
Hotel con excelente balneario, ideal para motorhomes. Tienen una amplia zona de parqueo completamente planas. Tiene piscinas, naturaleza y lo recomendamos mucho. Hemos estado dos días con muchísima comodidad. Los baños muy limpios y los dueños muy agradables

name: la montaña del quiyapura
description:
nice place in the mountains above the village before Salento, in direction of Salento close to the ofter camps on the river, turn left and drive up in the mountains, follow the road and at the sign turn left again, the road is steep! at the end you will arrive at the finca, Hector the owner is very nice and helpful 
the place is very nice, offers rooms and open places for small camper van
the place has to manage the situation after the pandemic, is starting again, but very nice and welcome

name: Escuela Los Mangos
description:
It is a school in the village of Los Mangos with enough space to camp. We spent one night there. The next day the children from the school and the teacher Rosalba arrived, they were very kind and helped us in everything we needed. The school has water and a kiosk, in the back a flat area for camping, although it is also possible to do it in the kiosk
---
Es una escuela en la vereda lo mangos con suficiente espacio para acampar, Pasamos allí una noche, Al día siguiente llegaron los niños de la escuela y la profesora Rosalba, muy amables  nos colaboraron en todo lo que necesitabamos.
La escuela cuenta con agua y un kiosko, en la parte de atrás una zona plana para acampar, aunque también es posible hacerlo en el kiosko

name: Gasoducto- PITAL 6
description:
Entrada la noche, encontramos este lugar que no encuentra con portón, fue posible buscar un espacio en el potrero del lado derecho, por donde hay un camino angosto.
La noche fue tranquila, en la mañana notamos la compañía de las vacas.

name: Laberinto
description:
Parallel to the main road that goes to La Plata-Huila, on the right side is the entrance to a farm, we follow the path and take the path that continues towards the river, a few meters later we find a red gate of a pasture on the left, just before the main gate, which was closed and with no one in the place.
We entered the pasture to some giant trees that gave good shade, we camped there, the night was very calm. In the morning no one attended the place either, we left without problems.
________________________________

Paralela a la via principal que va hacia la Plata-Huila, al costado derecho se encuentra la entrada a una finca, seguimos el camino y tomamos el camino que continua hacia el río, unos metros mas adelante nos encontramos con un portón rojo de un potrero a mano izquierda , justo antes del portón principal, el cual se encontraba cerrado y sin nadie en el lugar.
Nos adentramos en el potrero hasta unos arboles gigantes que daban buena sombra, allí acampamos, la noche fue muy tranquila. En la mañana tampoco asistió nadie al lugar, salimos sin problemas.

name: Canchas Sintéticas Fair Play Tijuana
description:
On the road in front of the gas station, a very kind lady parked to sell juices, we talked to her and she let us camp inside the soccer field.
____________________________

Sobre la vía frente a la estación de gasolina, se parquea una señora muy amable a vender jugos, hablamos con ella y nos dejo acampar dentro de la cancha de fútbol.

name: Ginásio Raquira
description:
Sports gym Public parking next to the sports gym and the river. flat, quiet and safe location 100 meters from the central square. we stayed here 2 nights. 

Ginásio desportivo Estacionamento público junto ao ginásio desportivo e ao rio. localização plana, tranquila e segura a 100 metros da praça central. ficamos aqui 2 noites.

name: Hospedaje Bellavista
description: Small Hospedaje on the main square/plaza of Murillo. Run by lovely family, the father will help organise tours to thermal pools. Rooms (double/matrimonial) with en-suite bathrooms, hot showers and wifi 50,000 pesos. Parking outside or on the plaza for overlanders/rigs. They let me park my motorbike securely in the cafe downstairs at night.

name: Easy access water tap at Primax Station
description: Right next to the air. Right after the entrance on the right

name: ZARPADO choris 🇦🇷
description:
Translation: For Argentine travelers who miss chorizo, in this place they are delicious, served with chimi and homemade mayo, the potatoes are also very tasty. The owner lived 10 years in bs as, super cool.

Para los viajeros argentinos que extrañan el chorizo, en este lugar son buenisimos, servido con chimi y mayo casera, las papas tambien muy ricas. La dueña vivio 10 años en bs as, super buena onda.

name: Free coffee class & degustation
description:
everyday at 3pm, in English or Spanish, cafe Eclipse.
Javier will show you how to roast and grind coffee beans, explaining all the process. he also will teach you about good and bad quality coffee, and where it comes from. You will taste different varieties of arabic high quality coffee. Interesting & free, about 40 minutes. Cup of coffee from $6k (like latte, espresso with condensate milk, double espresso), also cakes and food. 
~
todos los dias 15hs, en español o ingles, cafe Eclipse. Javier muestra como tostar y moler granos de café, explicando todo el proceso. Tambien enseña sobre café de buena y mala calidad, y de dónde proviene. Probarás distintas variedades de café arabigo de buena calidad. Interesante y gratis, alrededor de 40min. Taza de café desde $6mil (como cafe con leche, espresso con leche condensada, espresso doble), también tortas y comida.

name: Parque Pedro Pérez
description:
a quiet place to spend the night, close to the Basilica, you can walk to visit it.

um lugar tranquilo para passar a noite, perto da Basílica, você pode ir caminhando visitar.

name: Palimbala Camp and Hot Springs
description: This site has cabins and hot springs, we stayed here and got a guide for the following day to take us around, in our van. There was no charge to camp at the site but we did eat at the restaurant and had some beers. They have bathrooms and showers. Water if you need it I’m sure. It was a great place, the hot springs were diverted into pools were you could hang out. The guided tour was 40K, entrance, and maybe the camping, might have been 80K for two. It seemed to cover a few things. We paid this entrance fee at the indigenous center, not the ranger station. I got the lat/long off google so it could be a little off. Dinner was 35K for two.

name: Car Service Center
description:
Oil change, transmission fluid change, car wash, bar.

Very nice. Oil change for 30k pesos, I brought my own parts.

name: Presidente
description: We slept one night here. Good place for a night. It was a lot of noise because of the trucks crossing by the road and parking here. There is a restaurant and a hotel (and it has wifi). Also, there is 4G Claro signal.

name: El Edén hotel and restaurant
description: Amazing cheap accommodation overlooking an absolutely stunning gorge and mountain range. About $55k per night, great hosts and secure parking.

name: Hotel Boutique GAO
description: A really great place. Rooms have air conditioning and bathrooms. everything very clean and tidy. the staff is super friendly. we were able to park our motorcycles here in the large garage. we paid €20 or 97,800COP via Booking. In the immediate vicinity there is a large shopping center with a Western Union. here we exchanged COP to US Dollars for Venezuela.

name: Public Car Park
description:
ecological park with trails, bathroom and shower area, bbq area, electricity, wifi internet, vancamper area, climbing wall and kayak. contact to enter the park 3144806697 or 3192559800
---
Chegamos em Guatavita e começamos a ridar pela cidade. E encontramos um estacionamento público. perguntamos se o local era seguro e dusseram que si e que poderíamos passar a noite ai, tranquilos
estacionamos e ficamos.

name: Pepe Nero
description: Great food, basic Italian. Power went out during the dinner and they fixed us up with candles! This spot is close to the camping spot Gamcelot.

name: Hotel Kai
description: On very hot days we don't like to sleep in our van so we went to this cheap hotel. 11$ per night for 2 people, with AC and Wifi (40mbit) and you can park your van with ~3,5m height in their patio. It's 11$ for foreigners, because we didn't have to pay tax, don't know why, lol.

name: Palmero polideportivo
description:
Camped here for one night, really quiet and friendly town. We’re cyclists. 

We asked Diana at the green municipal building by the plaza whether it was fine, she rang her jefe and they said yes. No nighttime sports when we were here, got to sleep just after dark and were completely undisturbed. No facilities but if you’re here on a weekday someone opens up the school across the road at 6am and we were able to use the toilet. Joggers do laps first things so don’t pop your tent at the edge!

This was a perfect spot BUT i would say that the next 10km towards Gambita looked absolutely ideal for stealth camping. Either a spot by the river or I would ask someone to camp on their land. There was a church and shrine a couple of km down the road that had a little covered terrace, I bet that would be a goer. That road is one of the most beautiful we’ve ridden, if the weather is looking good I would keep going past this lovely town.

name: Parking
description:
Parking with no height restrictions at the entrance and parking spaces with and without a cover. There is a toilet and the owners wife also makes very delicious local deserts.
There is another parking right in front and another one with 3m entrance in the side street.

name: Ecohostel by IKY
description:
Big and comfortable place to park your caravan, rulot, trailer, mobile home or motor home.
Located in the city of Cali in a beautiful natural environment, perfect to refill clean water and discharge waste and sewage without generating contamination because in the place they recycle it.
Ideal for resting, also to recondition your vehicle, and you can also wash and dry your clothes and linens.
There is a kitchen for you.

name: Gas station - Altoque
description:
Here you can stay at the gas station for free, it's safe.
.....
aquí te puedes quedar en esta estación de gasolina gratuitamente, es seguro.

name: Buy SOAT in Éxito mall floor P
description: Here you can buy SOAT. Next to the lift on floor P. Two ladies at tables. I paid 158000 Cop for 3 months. For our small van

name: Finca Alejandría
description:
We came here to see the colibris and other birds and were warmly welcomed by Raul, the owner, who knows a lot about birds and does a very good Argentinian barbecue.
He told us that he is happy to receive overlanders and asked us to add the finca as a camping so that more travelers are aware that they can visit the birds, but also spend a safe quiet night here.
There are clean bathrooms and showers, a restaurant and a short trek in the forest, too.
We saw many colibris and some tucans, too.
The entrance is 25000 per person.
Last 5km is an unpaved uneven road but doable with any rig. The place to park is more of a parking lot than a meadow but quiet. He said on Sunday it’s the busiest because many people come but on other days it’s calm.

name: Hostel Solsticio Guajiro
description: Lovely, homely hotel with double rooms 90,000 COP, Air conditioning, private bathroom and good wifi. Breakfast included. Parking for motorcycles 20m across street.

name: free parking
description:
we spent 2 days and 1 night (Saturday/Sunday).  Quiet, shady place, with lots of lizards.  Very little vehicle traffic, people pass on foot to take a crossing. The police came twice to ask us if everything was fine.           
pasamos 2 días y 1 noche (sábado/domingo).  Lugar tranquilo, sombreado, con muchas lagartijas.  Muy poco tráfico de vehículos, la gente pasa a pie para tomar un cruce, la policía vino dos veces a preguntarnos si todo estaba bien.

name: delicious "obleas" typical Colombian sweet
description:
The oblea is a typical Colombian sweet, it's like a sandwich of crunchy and big cookies with arequipe, cream, berry sauce and cheese in the middle. Very tasty, 5k each, and you have tables outside with nice view of the main square. Right in the corner.
~
la oblea es un tipico dulce de Colombia. Es como un sandwich de galletas finitas (obleas) pero grandes y crocantes, rellenas con arequipe, crema batida, salsa de mora y queso. Muy ricas, 5mil cada una, y hay mesas afuera con linda vista a la plaza principal. Justo en la esquina.

name: D1 cheap supermarket
description:
so happy we found a D1 in a touristic place!! Is the cheapest in town. 
~
Felices de encontrar un supermercado D1 en un lugar tan turistico!! es el mas barato.

name: Hostal Oasis
description:
Small and cozy hostel in a tranquil mountain town. 

35,000 with private bathroom
32,000 with shared bathroom

Friendly town dogs. 

There are a couple restaurants, bars, and stores in the plaza.

High elevation, 2800 meters. Plenty of blankets are provided. Hot water shower. 

Street parking only, but it's a small town and the police station is next door. I was not worried about security. 

Ring the bell by the door.

name: Restaurante Hostal Las Cachos
description:
I didn't stay here but stopped for lunch. A popular place for locals to eat. 

Also, a few rooms are available. I didn't inquire about the price, but I guess they are very affordable.

Basic place. Cute and colorful. Very tranquil town. Scenic area, located along the Ruta Lana.

name: Finca Jerusalem
description: Beautiful place. Rafting Rio Negro. Sergio 311 4923255

name: Mega Partes de La Costa
description:
Replaced our front brakes of our 2021 Mercedes-Benz Sprinter. They had the parts in stock and they know what they are doing. Also helped me getting new tires for the van (BFGoodrich KO2) in less than  4 days. I recommend this shop better then the one in front which has terrible customer service. 

For more info call Carlos Pollazos 315-476-4013

Reemplazamos nuestros frenos delanteros de nuestro Mercedes-Benz Sprinter 2021. Tenían las piezas apiladas y saben lo que están haciendo. También me ayudó a conseguir neumáticos nuevos para la van (BFGoodrich KO2) en menos de 3 días. Recomiendo esta tienda mejor que la de enfrente que tiene un pésimo servicio al cliente.

name: Plan 18b
description:
Not to many wild camps in cartegena so I’ll add this one. 

18 b because it’s on Calle 18b. But I think the b stands for bats. Cause they fly by at night. 

I stayed here maybe 8-10 nights over the last 3 weeks. It’s a dead in road with a tree line in the middle of the road. The trees hang low but I was able to put my pop up between the trees and it was camouflage and shade. 

There isn’t a lot of breeze here. The neighbors are out at night and didn’t have any issue 

During the day there is a guy watching cars. I gave him change each time I left   He was nice. 

Not totally quiet but I slept ok here. It’s close enough to walk into town and there are stores close by 

I did have some ants on my truck if a branch was touching the roof. But it wasn’t bad. 

On the nights I wasn’t here there are Airbnb in the area with parking.  I went back and forth if I needed a real shower

name: Let’s Bike shop/repairs
description: Bike shop with a couple of guys that speak English which was very helpful with all the little problems I had. Cheap cleaning/repairs and they can source parts for you quite easily

name: Hospedaje Playa Arcoris
description: Hospedaje offering double rooms, en-suite bathrooms with fan. Breakfast included. Asked for 150,000 COP, paid 80,000 COP for single person. Place to park bike in alleyway. Can arrange a guide to Punta Gallinas or call Osnaldo on 314-7943713 who will charge you around 180,000 COP to negotiate the road and rope blocking on the route. Maybe worth calling ahead if you plan to go to Punta, there were rains which made the road impassable when I visited.

name: Banco de Bogota ATM
description: Skim camera in the Banco de Bogota ATM. Be careful!

name: Mirador frente a Parque para las artes
description:
The police told us that this is the right place to camp with a Motorhome. The view is beautiful, it is very quiet and there is a small market nearby. At Hostal Casa Barichara Boutique they let us shower in exchange for some tip.
----------
La policía nos indicó que este es el lugar adecuado para acampar con un Motorhome. La vista es hermosa, es muy tranquilo y hay un pequeño mercadito cerca. En el Hostal Casa Barichara Boutique nos dejaron duchar a cambio de algo de propina.

name: Mirador Encanto Galán
description:
We parked our camper van on the side of the road. Someone in town (Galan) told us that there was an “official” mirador and also an informal one. We parked the night at the informal one, which is just a little place on the side of the road with a bench to sit watching the beautiful mountains. 

From here you are able to see Barichara, Cabrera, I think Guane, and of course Galan. 
Quiet place, nice to stay one night and keep driving the next morning.

name: Parque del Café
description: Amusement park on the theme of coffee. Attractions for all ages and shows. We had a beautiful day there. 80,000 COP for those over 125cm. 5,000 COP the parking lot for the day. Impossible to stay at night. We spent the night in the parking lot of the Galandu restaurant a little further for 20,000 COP at night (see iOverlander spot)

name: Restaurant Gualandu
description:
We spent the night there after a day at the café park. Flat parking and Big rigs friendly with children's playground. Attention close to the road and noisy but to help out it does it. Guardian all night. 20,000 COP per vehicle for the night. Toilets but no other services 

Nous y avons passé la nuit après une journée au parc del café. Parking plat et Big rigs friendly avec parc de jeux pour enfants. Attention proche de la route et bruyant mais pour dépanner ça le fait. Gardien toute la nuit. 20 000 COP par véhicule pour la nuit. Toilettes mais pas d’autres services

name: Replacement Bolts - El Tornillo
description: This is the place to get replacement bolts etc. Got an engine mounting bolt for my Tenere 700 here that couldn’t be found at the dealership. There are many other ‘tornillo’s’ on this street.

name: Tap at Terpel Station
description:
Small Terpel station, the water tap is located at the building of the toilets. 
It’s possible to park next to it and fill up using your hose

name: Forex Cargo
description:
This company is dependable and reliable vehicle shiping agent serving between US, Panama and Colombia (Import and Export). There is a English speaking staff (Andres, +57 3022254806) is super kind and very responsive. 
Quote is very competitive to other agents in Cartagena. I hope they will serve iOverlander customers same as what they have done for me. If you are looking shipping solution between Darien Gap / US and Colombia, first thing you have to do is contact Andres via WhatApp. Highly recommend for their open-minded and apparent business manner.

name: terpel gas station
description:
Gas station, bathrooms shower, security guard all night, parking for free.
 A bit noisy

name: Mirador de los Yariguies
description: We spent the night just in front the view point, the street is pretty quiet at night and the guy from the Artesanias store told us the place is save to camp with our campervan. The picture looks kind of creepy but it was particularly foggy that night. Beautiful view from the Mountains.

name: road impassable
description: A bridge and a section of road were swept away by a mudslide

name: Real cheese Quindi-Anita
description:
The Saturday this street is only pedestrian and there are some artisanal stands. A very friendly woman sells her homemade cheese.
But it is not the usual Columbian tasteless cheese, she makes goat and cow cheese, very old and dried.
You can taste this kind of cheeses : parmesano (one year old), cheddar, cabra, blue cheese, camembert, cheese with pepper, cheese with coffee... Some of them are strong, like some French cheeses.
Price is 100000cop/kg. 
We came back on Sunday, nobody in this street, but you can contact her directly, the number is in the photo (310 389 0053)

Pour les Français en manque de bon fromage, c'est le paradis !

name: Terpel Altoque San Javier
description:
Terpel service station, with an area to spend the night, has no services but is the quietest in the area.  You can go to the showers in the terpel in front and come here to spend the night, it's less crowded.

estación de servicio terpel, con zona para pasar la noche, no tiene servicios pero es la más tranquila de la zona. puede ir a las duchas de la terpel del frente y venir a esta a pasar la noche, es menos concurrida.

name: Hotel Campestre Acantos
description: This is a hotel where the owner allows you to park your camper or car and set up your camp. Very nice place, safe and very quite. The name of the owner is Carlos Mario. We paid him $100.000 COP for the night with breakfast included.

name: Camping El Cairo
description:
Its a woderfull place, It’s an organized place, clean and really peaceful. It has divisions for each tent. It has full bathrooms, a pool, a restaurant zone and games area which includes ping pong, billiard, chess and parchis. 
You will be kindly received by one of its owners, Alexander Pinzon.(3144149507)
In here you can go on walks, ride your bicycle, go to a cascade

name: Davivienda Bank
description:
Here are 2 ATM where you can get Money ( COP). Max. 2.000.000 COPs per transaction but you can do several times.

EDIT 06/12/2023: There is now a fee of 15000COP.

name: Restaurant Bar El Lenazo
description: New Restaursnt, Almuerzo p. P. 15.000 col peso, Desayuno, Cena

name: Street parking university of art
description: Quiet street parking next to the university  of “Faculty of Arts and Humanities ITM”. We parked next to the entrance and asked the security guard if it’s alright, we could even use the toilet in the uni. The security guard was there the whole night. In the morning at about 7-8 am the students get to the uni and it’s a bit more noisy. Also possible for bigger cars.

name: ATMS
description: 3 ATMS inside the Carulla Supermarket (immediately inside and to the right) The green Servibanca ATM is the only one out of a dozen I found that allows over 600,000peso withdrawal (up to 2,000,000 for foreign cards). 22,500 withdrawal fee.

name: Beautiful 360° view
description: we parked here 2 nights. Beautiful view, quiet, safe and easy accesable with 2×4

name: Los Rosales
description: Popular place with a variety of meal options. Slightly on the pricier side but food was great. Opens 6:00 am and stays open till 10:00 pm. Recommended.

name: La Jagua City
description: Excellent, affordable restaurant. We had a lovely meal consisting of arepas con chorizo and cold beer. Very tasty food and a lovely owner. The place is new and super clean. Highly recommended.

name: Tinto Specialty Coffee
description: Excellent capuccino coffee and cakes. Best one we had in a while. Recommended.

name: Venezuela Embassy
description: This is the current location of the Venezuela Embassy if you need a visa to visit/travel through Venezuela. They are NOT processing any visas here for at least a month as of 14th June 2023) - they are in the process of relocating to another location, but they don’t know where yet. However, they told me that there is a Venezuela Embassy in Cucuta that will process visas for non-Venezuelan visitors in the meantime.

name: Museo Cafe Wifi
description: CAFE MUSEO pw 92975961. Museum with free tour about their handmade hats original from Aguadas. Cafe where they use local coffee, really tasty aswell as the coffee cake.

name: Hostal Faldas de Machín
description: Basic hostel with a restaurant and tienda. Great views of the mountains. A private room for one person was 30k. Cold showers. They also sell gasoline. You could probably sleep in a vehicle in front of the building if you ask them.

name: GOOD COFFE
description:
Toboso cafe, they use coffee from local farmers, no brand!  and it's really good, an espresso 4k and a large cappuccino 6k. they have wifi but I don't remember the key im sorry!the place is very nice and calm. 
~
Toboso cafe. Usan café de productores locales, no tiene marca! y es muy bueno. Un espresso 4mil y un cappuccino grande 6mil. Tienen wifi pero no recuerdo la clave perdon! El lugar es muy lindo y calmo.

name: CHEAP panaderia leo
description:
It's obviously a local bakery, not a french one. But it's the only one with non touristic prices. We tried a cheese bread and a little bread with guayaba marmalade, very tasty!! 0.25usd each. 
~
Obviamente es una panaderia local, no francesa. Pero la unica con precios no turista para tu merienda viajera. Probamos un pan de queso y un pancito con dulce de guayaba, muy ricos! mil pesos cada uno.

name: Balneario Restaurante LA ESPERANZA.
description: This is a very beautiful place and has 4 rooms that can accommodate up to 20 people. There is a restaurant and swimming pool. The views of the valley are wonderful. The price is 35k per person

name: La Finca de Gabo
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Owner's contribution, check-in for reviews

A french styled farm where you will find a quiet, secure and beautifull place to camp.

Sadly we cant offer our rooms when owners (we) are not there; but ther you will find security, water, restrooms and awesome views, having a look to the valley and the sorrounding mountains and being close to the village.

name: La montaña de Gabo
description:
A place with an AWESOME view just before reaching the Paramo; it's a private place so you must call, but you'll always receive a YES. You will only pay 25.000 cop per night.

This is not a remote place but isn't that easy to reach; phone signal is not that good; it's via the path to reach a mountain with a view to Boyacá and Santander. Also a great place to hike, to do Mountain Bike, jump in cold water, see some cattle and also make a fire. 

Contact info:
+57 3164516481
Riveracamachog@gmail.com

name: Gabriel Rivera
description:
A place so close to an empty and beautifull beach; there's also an a little house where you can find some services; if you want to lunche there, the owner can organize somethings to offer; You have full access to the beach, its safe, usually the police make a round in the area. 

Only 50.000 cop per night each person. By far a great option regarding the high prices in the city.

Its a little bit far from the city (30 min aprox) but is a really good quiet and cheap option in Cartagena to camp

 Contact info: riveracamachog@gmail.com
+57 3164516481

name: starting point cerro kennedy hike
description:
The Cerro Kennedy hike is a very popular hike offering incredible viewpoints  in the Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta.

The road from Minca to here is completly asphalt, no problem. you can park your car/van at the bar " La Y" for 5000 COP/day. The hike up is 15 km or 4 to 5 hours.

4×4 vehicles with high clearence or bikes might drive up to cerro kennedy or a hostal along the way. Deffitly not possible with our 2wd minivan

name: Restaurante - Hospedaje Suendry
description:
This is a perfect place to really feel the local vibe from Cabo de la Vela. Is full of kids of the family, with an amazing view of the caribbean coast.

Suendry's restaurant is run by a beautiful local family from Cabo de la Vela. Here you will find good food, fresh, rich, abundant and cheap and above all with a lot of love you will taste it here. There are vegetarian options too.

You can ask them if there is possibility to rent a hammock and spent the night there (they will let you use one of them amazing chinchorros (how they call it)), and it’s just in a quiet place, because the other ones near to the kite schools are really noisy at night.

This place feels like home and that is highly appreciated.
Special mention for Blanca's arepas and Andrés' lobsters.

Don't leave El Cabo without going through here!

name: La "Y"
description: This is a little tienda with a pool table and space to park anything up to a Sprinter. Right in front is the start to the Cerro Kennedy hike.

name: Casa de relajacion
description: Calle 11A 12-34 & 35 in La Dorada. Basic room with kitchen, private bathroom or shared, depending on your choice . Quiet street with mini market, parked my motorcycle in the bedroom or possible on the street (safe area). 600 ms from the center. Owner is friendly

name: Davivienda
description:
Inside the shopping mall on the right hand after entrance, you will find two Davivienda ATMs.
Inside the mall, you will find also different shops, but they were closed because of Sunday. Also some clean toilets are open.

name: First parking to the left
description: The first parking to the left, they charged us 12k for the night. There are some leveled spots. Cheapest place we could found. Good 4G Claro.

name: Agua Mia
description:
24h/7d self service automat. 3000 pesos (only coins) for 20L.

2L 500 COP
5L 1000 COP
10L 2000 COP
20L 3000 COP

name: Migra Campismo y Aventura
description: Migra is a perfect spot for nature lovers, where you can camp or stay in tiny cabins, it is sustainable and the owner can take you hiking, on a coffee/cocoa tour or you might as well take a mochila workshop and learn about Arhuaco indigenous culture.

name: Supergaz planta chapalito
description:
LPG (propane) depot with bulk delivery truck to fill fixed tanks (US/Canada type). We paid 120 000 COP for about 12 gallons. Very friendly staf.
To fill bottles I don't know.

name: balneario suzne
description: its a place wonderfull, with bathrooms, swimingpool, and drink, the host her name Carlos , nice person

name: Hotel Guadalupe
description:
Absolutely lovely hotel and fantastic value! 50k for two of us for a night. It is SPOTLESS and newly fitted out. A lot of pride in this place. The owner even made us a lemonade when we got in because we looked pretty wrecked after our big bike ride. 

A few other cyclists recommend it to us and we are so glad they did. Good wifi too. Only mild complaint is that the showers are freezing cold.

There is off-street parking available. We reckon any van should fit in the carport but big rigs could struggle. Maybe WhatsApp before you arrive if you’re worried, it’s (+57)3213348043.

It’s not clear from the outside it’s a hotel, but don’t worry, just knock and someone will come.

name: Hotel Agrado
description: Double rooms 40,000 COP, clean spacious. No hot water, no breakfast included. Secure, garaged parking available.

name: Culture Center with View Point over the City
description: You can enter the culture palace with a nice view point over the city for free, but you need to show your passport.

name: Govinda, modern vegetarian restaurant with a view
description: Very good and modern vegetarian and vegan restaurant with a nice view upstairs. The menu del dia is very cheap (3$), but the other food (lasagna, burgers, sandwiches…) also.

name: Taller diagnosticar
description: The best garage in the area for any engine, injection, suspension, brake problem. They can scan the engine and are very helpful and very decent price

name: Mirador La Cuchilla
description: We came with our camper van to this view point and parked the night on the side of the road. The road is pretty narrow, but here gets a bit wider so that other cars can pass through. We came at night, so no pictures yet, but you can see in both directions of the mountain to the towns near here.

name: Los Jagüeyes EcoFarm
description:
The Los Jagueyes ecotourism farm is a place where you can stay in a comfortable hotel or in your car near the Tatacoa Desert.  Their owners Homer and Gloria take care of them personally.  For your Motorhome it can be for 40,000 COP per car per night.  It has all the comforts
----
La finca eco turística Los Jagueyes es una sitio donde puedes estar en un comodo hotel o en su carro en las cercanias del Desierto de La Tatacoa. Sus propietaios Homer y Gloria los atienden peronalmente. Para su Motorhome puede estar por 40000 COP x carro x noche. Cuenta con todos las comodidades

name: 100 years old wall & handcrafts
description:
Dentro de un lindo local de artesanias, hay una pared de piedras de 100 años de antiguedad, fue descubierta x la dueña de este local, muy interesante de ver, bien decorada para tomar fotos. La dueña buena onda incluso nos compro nuestras artesanias para su local. 
~
inside of a nice handcrafts shop, there is a wall of rocks built 100 years ago, interesting to see and well decorated to take pictures, it was discovered by the owner of this shop,  who is kind and she even bought us our handcrafts.

name: N2 Suspension work
description: In this workshop are mainly made suspensions, but he is also very helpful in other matters around the motorcycle. I was really more than satisfied. He takes a lot of time, explains everything in detail and gives very good advice. He also gave me a few tips about Colombia. I can really recommend him. A super reputable workshop and in case you are not so good in Spanish, his son helps you out in English.

name: Sabor de Origen
description:
Beautiful place to camp for camper trailers and motorhomes. Secure, clean, bathrooms, restaurant.
.....
hermoso lugar para acampar o casas rodantes y motorhome, seguro, limpio, zona de baños, restaurante ,helados de arándanos y mucho más. lo mejor la amabilidad de sus anfitriones.

name: Rapilavadoras Loundry Neiva
description:
Washing Machines Laundry in Neiva.  Washing and drying clothes at $2500 COP per pound.  Ask for Maria +57313 868 89 67

Rapilavadoras Lavanderia en Neiva. Lavado y secado de ropa a $2500 COP x libras. Pregunar por Maria +57313 868 89 67

name: Toyota Garage
description: If you need Toyota parts in Bogota, this is the place. It was recommended to us by a local Toyota enthusiast and they had everything we needed including a new clutch assembly, air filters, and a stabilizer bar. David is super helpful and the prices were reasonable.

name: Casa Automotriz, Taller Multimarca
description:
Mr. Orley Sánchez, owner, is friendly with travelers and wants to help you with repairs, we repaired axles and it was very good. To communicate with him, he is on the cell phone 3166155889.
......
El señor Orley Sánchez propietario, es amigable con los viajeros y busca cómo ayudarte en la reparación, hicimos reparación de ejes y estuvo muy bien. 
para comunicarse con el es al celular 3166155889.

name: Balcones de la Casona Hostel
description:
Clean, (mostly) quiet, hostel with parking just outside of Guatapé.

Charged me COP85,000 per night. Comfortable bed. Hot water shower. Very good Wifi. Secure parking for my motorcycle (and smaller vehicles). Ten or fifteen minute walk to the downtown area of Guatapé. 

Can be loud during the day as there are a lot of buses and trucks and all of them like to honk the horn. At night, very dark and quiet. 

Small shared kitchenette. Relaxing patio with a few tables and chairs. 

Owner is very friendly and helpful and speaks some English. 

If you're looking for something cheaper, the owner told me that the hostel across the street offers rooms and secure parking for about COP35,000.

name: Ferry to Tatacoa
description:
Here is the only ferry to cross the river with a campervan, the other is only for moto.
The price was 25k for a 6m long camper.
The road until there is ok when it's dry but it can be muddy in rain season, but it is flat.
Very fast, only 10 minutes.
We only used it coming from Bogotá to avoid the gravel road, if you come from the south there is a paved road to Neiva.

name: Street parking
description:
In this area you can find some street parking spaces. Some streets are very calm during the night. We spent 3 nights without any problem. There are also a lot of good restaurants and bars.
Locals said that Envigado was super safe.
No facilities at all

name: Casita de piedra
description:
Nice play to stay, very clean, 35000 pesos for one people. Room 211 in the back, large one, you can put your bicycle inside.  
--
Un buen lugar para quedarse, habitacion grande, wifi, tv, parqueo. 
Un bel hôtel , employé sympathique, normes européennes,  chambres du fond plus tranquille.

name: Hostal de la montaña ecoturismo
description:
Simple little hostel; basic but clean and run by the most lovely people. Two of us in a double bed for one night cost 40k. The shower is warm. There’s a fantastic dog. We were given an aromática upon arrival. The view from the little terrace is stunning. Restaurant next door if you need it, but the owners were happy for us to set up our little camp stove and cook around the side of the house. The bed was very hard but we were thankful for it while the rain poured down.

There is space for one vehicle to park, I didn’t ask about camping.

name: Incredibly Beautiful waterfall
description: I forgot the name. 20 minute walk from Margarita campsite/farm-to-table restaurant. The waterfall itself is very scenic and the handmade “park” in front of it is so cute! Not overdone, but just the right amount. If you come down this way, it’s 100% worth the visit!

name: seguro del estado
description: office in Manizales! I renovate mi insurace of the bike(soat). Go with time , i spend all the morning here.

name: Lote 107 Mi Terruño
description:
1 Place for one casa rodante véhicule. Off Road Truck friendly, 4x4, van, camping-car
$150 000 / Noche
Se habla Frances y Español

Possibilty of fixing damaged vehicles.

name: Bastien's Repair Center
description:
If your vehicle has mechanical problems, do not hesitate to stop here, possibility to repair brakes/transmission/engine over several days with accommodation. Rates to be negotiated.
Located 45 minutes from Bucaramanga, it is possible to find a wide range of spare parts or to renovate your vehicle if parts not found. 
.....
Vous êtes Français ou vous parlez anglais, votre monture de voyage/exploration a des soucis mécanique, n'hésitez pas a vous arrêter chez Sébastien, possibilité de démontage et réparation freins/transmission/moteur sur plusieurs jours avec hébergement. Tarifs à négocier.
Possibilité d’installation de pare buffles, pares branches sur camions PL 4x4, installation d'éclairage Led longue portée, soudure MIG et peinture électro statique.

Situé à 45 minutes de Bucaramanga, il y est possible de trouver une vaste offre de pièces de rechange ou de rénover vos anciennes pièces si introuvable.

name: Volcan Machin
description: Near school, at entrance of Machin Parc near hot water swiming pool and very good wifi from school, friendly people around, very calm.

name: VIBE DE DOIS: Balneário Oasis
description:
the place is calm and quiet, the internet is bad, the shower is cold, but it's a good stop to sleep on this road, because we didn't think the area was very safe and it was getting dark. Charged 15,000 Colombian pesos per person

This is the correct location of Balneário Oásis which was marked in the wrong place


o lugar é calmo e tranquilo, a internet é ruim, o chuveiro é gelado, mas é uma boa parada pra dormir nessa estrada, porque não achamos muito seguro a região e estava anoitecendo. Cobrou 15.000 pesos colombianos por pessoa

Essa é a localização correta do Balneário Oásis que foi marcado no lugar incorreto

name: Hotel Boutique Patio Bonito
description:
Lovely hotel not far from the centre of Mocoa. Very clean and new. Warm showers, a little kitchen you can use (not lots of utensils, best if you have your own bits to supplement), good wifi, garrafon with drinking water, quiet part of town. Secure parking out back - room for a small van out there, but nothing too tall. We felt comfortable leaving our bikes there.

80k for a room for two with a fan, 90k if you want air con. These prices considerably less than what’s listed on booking.com. Felt worth it to us compared to the other options in town!

name: PN Tayrona Parking
description:
We left our motorhome here for one night for doing the trekking, inside the national park. We paid 17.500 COP (junio/2023). We didn’t ask if you could sleep here.
.....
Dejamos el motorhome acá una noche para ir hacer el trekking a Cabo San Juan. Es el parking dentro del parque. Pagamos 17.500 COP (junio/2023). No preguntamos si era posible pernoctar aquí.

name: Clap Burger
description:
Wifi at Clap Burger, beside Primax gas station. works very well. Smash burgers, very tasty, vegetarian option as well. Street free to park, but every Thursday night there is a very loud car meeting! other nights were very quiet for sleep. Free toilets at gas station. D1 supermarket 2 blocks away.
~
wifi en clapburguers, al lado de estacion de servicio primax.  funciona muy bien. smash burgers, muy ricas, opcion vegetariana tambien. Calle para estacionar gratis, pero los jueves a la noche hay encuentro muy ruidoso de autos! Las demás noches fueron tranquilas para dormir. Hay baños gratis en la estacion de servicio. Super D1 a 2 cuadras.

name: Parque La Floresta
description:
In the square, in front of Lucho Arepas, in the plants, there is a white water tap, not sure if it's potable but it tasted good.
~
En la plaza, en frente a lucho arepas, entre las plantas, hay una canilla blanca de agua, no se si es potable pero no tenia mal sabor.

name: Paisa Pan
description:
24hs local bakery! We loved the "buñuelos" for our tea time, they are very typical of Colombia. Very cheap (500 pesos each). 
~ 
Panaderia local 24hs! Amamos los buñuelos para la merienda, son tipicos de Colombia y muy baratos (500p cada uno).

name: The Friends Bakery
description:
"The Friends". We tried the "churros", the "bombas" with coconut and arequipe, and the breads. Everything very cheap and tasty if you wanna try local bakery. The girls working here are very friendly. We bought something here everyday we spent in Manizales.
~
"The friends". Probamos los churros, las bombas con arequipe y coco y los panes. Todo barato y muy rico si queres probar panaderia local. Las chicas que atienden son buena onda. Compramos la merienda aca todos los dias q estuvimos en manizales.

name: Woodshed
description: Unlocked, very dry woodshed by the road, space for a tent inside if you were in a pinch. Smells like pee but seems clean. The abandoned building a few kms towards mocoa is definitely a better spot but this is good for a break from the rain.

name: Aurora Asían Food
description:
