If you think a bowl, pad thai and ramen mean expensive hipster food, think again! 
The big bowl is the most expensive thing on the menu at 24k. The pad thai is 18k. Honest and fresh food with friendly service. And you can pay with card here sin extra tarifa. Provecho!

name: mirador
description:
It is a beautiful place, with very kind people willing to help in whatever you need. The host's name is Jesús, the beach is 50 meters away. the view is spectacular
---------
es un bello lugar, con personas muy amables dispuestas a ayudar en los que necesites. el nombre del anfitrión es Jesús, la playa está a 50 mts. la vista es espectacular

name: principal park
description:
quiet and peaceful place to spend the night, good lighting and friendly neighbors 
------------
lugar silencioso y tranquilo para pasar la noche, buena iluminacion y vecinos amables.

name: Refill Gases de Antioquia
description:
We filled gas here. We went with our own hose and adapter for Argentinian cilynder. It took just 10min. 18k pesos for 2kg (approx 4usd)
~
Cargamos gas acá. Fuimos con nuestra propia manguera y adaptador para nuestra garrafita argentina. Tardaron  10min. 2kilos 18mil pesos (4usd aprox).

name: NOT RECOMMENDED ELECTRICIANS
description:
This place was recommended by a local but we had a bad experience! They were very unfriendly to us, they charged 120k pesos just for change a little part which we had to go and buy it for ourselves, 8km away!! Not willing to help travelers. And the street where they work is very steep and narrow! Please find a better electrician and better person to fix your vehicle!!
~
Un local nos recomendo este taller pero tuvimos muy mala experiencia. Fueron muy maleducados todo el tiempo, nos cobraron 120mil solo por cambiar una piecita la cual tuvimos que ir a comprar nosotros mismos, a 8km de distancia!! No tienen intencion de ayudar a los viajeros. La calle donde trabajan es super empinada y angosta. Por favor busquen mejores electricistas y mejores personas para arreglar su vehiculo!!

name: Cheap water in 5 L bags
description: Here in a house you can buy 15L of water for 3000 Cop. Look for the very small sign on the fence.It is just a normal house. They sell 3 x 5l bags of 3000 Cop

name: Mocoa
description:
Riverside, close to the city, accessible for any vehicle. frequented swimming place, clear water. surrounded by trees

bord de rivière, proche de la ville, accessible pour tout véhicule. lieu de baignade fréquenté, eau claire. entouré d'arbres

name: Mirador
description: It's  a parking  of an abandoned bar, you have the view of the sea, a beach nearby, just to rest

name: Entrance to the Cocora Valley
description:
This is the entrance to the path through the Cocora Valley with 2 viewpoints. We paid 20k per person (children above 3 years old, pay also the same price). Come before 10 a.m. because after that the line for the tickets will be very long. Drones are forbidden.

The last parking is the cheapest one (10k for the day), but more expensive on weekends.

name: Water and free clean toilets at a nice Container City (Market and Restaurants)
description: The Container City is a market and Bars/Restaurants in different Container. Its worth a stop. There is a big parking lot in front with a water tap. Also there are clean free toilets (outside). I think you can stay here overnight, but we didnt try it.

name: La Cabaña de la Montaña
description:
Jorge has a hut, a modern prefab wooden house with a big garden, his family house is not far away (worths a visit) which offers a big garden.
Rather staying in Bogotá, this overlander friendly place will offer you to hang-out, walk around, rent a bike or simply grab arepas or coffee in Tabio or Chia.
I spend a night, had a great chat, and thought this place worths to be in an overlander stop.

name: Hostal Las Brisas
description:
Nice Restaurant with cabañas, camping and pool (a little further down a gravel road but drivable).
We (on bicycles) paid 25k for two.
Now the highlight...the owner offers horse riding trips. For 50k p.p. he took us on a 2hr horseback ride into the sunset. Spectacular. I guess we got it cheap because a Colombian friend who also went with us negotiated, but even if you end up paying more, it's still completely worth it.
Also, they have their own goats they serve you for lunch. 30k for a huge portion (possible for two to eat).

name: Hacienda san isidro
description:
If you want a really nice Colombian hotel, go here! It's an amazing, beautiful place with an extremely friendly family who are extremely proud of their amazing place!
We paid 35 USD pp for a night in a big clean room with great a great view incl delicious lunch and breakfast. 
we had a private coffee tour in English. The daughter, who was here, spoke perfectly English. They have a spa, a beautiful swimming pool and jacuzzi.
Best place I have been so far in Colombia!

name: Hotel campestre Mi cabaña
description: It is a Hotel, with a camping area, it has a restaurant and bathrooms in the camping area, it also has water for showering (it is not drinkable)

name: Lakeside
description: Absolutely beautiful spot! There’s a road off the main highway that leads down to the beach of a lake. Accessible by big rigs and everyone else too. Very peaceful and quiet, with amazing views. The spot is visible from the bridge, but you can follow the road farther to be hidden from the  highway if you want. There were some locals in the evening, but there’s tons of space for everyone. No one bothered us, a very quiet night. Would totally come back.

name: Al Toque / Terpel
description: This Gas station as every Al Toque in Colombia has all the facilities either for staying a night or just stop and go. facilities include hot free showers 24 hrs services, hot food and beverages and course fuel. big parking lot behind the main building safe to stay for a night inside your camper home.

name: EcoMunayki
description: nice, and friendly atmosphere. Is in the country side with neture all around.

name: primax
description: the gas-fuel and diesel acpm is cheaper here then near by places

name: Olimpica
description: This is a quality grocery store,  you can find fresh meats, fresh bread, fresh produce, Colombian coffee and chocolate,wines, real olive oil, every cleaning product imaginable, dog food. the list goes on. also Its not to big just very well stocked and organized,you will be in and out in 10 min. with easy parking on the side of building, or right in front. this town is also very safe.

name: Seguros del Estado Popayán
description: From January 2023, this is one of the few official places where you can get the SOAT for foreign vehicles. Bring all the papers (car title, DIAN email and owner passport) plus plenty of patience. It can take a while. Payment with debit/credit card only.

name: Hotel Casa Belle Epoque
description: Charming hotel in historical center of Honda, Tolima. Value for money.

name: Campamento Balconcitos
description:
This is a lovely place to spend time relaxing or fixing your camper van, since the weather is perfect for van life or tent camping. You can fill your water thanks if you ask. You can go to the bathrooms in the main house or the co-working space. The co-working area is located at the other site of the main campground/front of the house. 

They charged me $20k per person. 

They also have cabins for rent!!!!

For more information contact:

Leonar Barrera
+57(316)453-1768

Or 

Alberto Barrera
+57(319)572-7333

name: Balconcitos Cabañas Campestres
description:
Beautiful cabins in the mountains of Corrales “La Ciudad Luz”. We had a magnificent stay in one of the cabins!! The place is magical 😍

For more information contact:

Alberto Barrera
+57(319)572-7333

Or

Leonar Barrera
+57(316)453-1768

name: Plazamar Hotel
description: Really nice hotel with amazing staff. A large room with AC, a desk and view of the sea was 158,000 for one person. Breakfast included and free parking across the street. They stored my bags for a few days while I went to Pacífico Hostel by boat and the parking was 10k per day while I was gone (motorcycle).

name: BORA. Tu Espacio Fuera de Casa
description:
Cozy, furnished apartment, located in a quiet residential area.

___________________________

Acogedor, apartamento amoblados , ubicados en una zona residencial tranquila .

name: Faranda Bolivar Hotel
description: Good resort-style hotel at the border of the city center with 2 or 3 big swimming pools. You can park your car/Moto directly in front of the room. Very secure. Good restaurant, rich breakfast incl. Can be crowded on weekends. Rooms have aircon and are quite big. All very clean. We negotiated a big suite with king size bed for 42$ on weekdays. Friendly staff.

name: Gasolinera Pinar del Rio
description: Fill up whatever you need. Also Extra (98 oct) available. Conveniently located. Many food places and (grocery) stores attached. Fill up your vehicle here if you want to enter Venezuela and your good to go until Mérida or even farther with good quality gas.

name: Salem Fish
description: Restaurant and trout farm with a big parking lot and covered area next to the river. They let us stay the night for free next to the trout pond (we tent camped). There is a big water wheel that is a little noisy but it didn’t bother us. There’s a big parking lot and anyone could fit there. The buses stop at the restaurant. The restaurant food is decent, and there is WIFI and clean bathrooms. There is also a peacock strutting around which was cool.

name: Green and orange house
description: This family lets you camp next to their house. Ask for Antonio. They charged us 20,000 for one tent. They’ve got a shower, bathroom, and filtered drinking water and a little pool! They’ve got space for a tent and maybe a car or big rig.

name: Guatavita El bosque
description: ecological park with trails, bathroom and shower area, bbq area, electricity, wifi internet, vancamper area, climbing wall and kayak. contact to enter the park 3144806697 or 3192559800

name: Bakery with good sour dough bread
description: Really cheap bakery with lots of different breads invluding sour dough and whole grain, prices ranging from 8k to 15k. Has lots of cakes and coffees as well.

name: Hotel Saravita
description: Pleased with this hotel. Old colonial-style place with attractive courtyard to sit around in and rooms with old wooden doors and super thick walls ... like staying in a castle. 35'000 pesos for one person. Clean. Reasonable wifi. No parking, bicycle fine in room, motorbikes should be able to make it into the courtyard. In the centre of town and Socorro's actually a pretty nice place!

name: Ser Automotriz
description:
Really god and fast service. 
They do all kind of repairs. 

WhatsApp Alexander +57 318 7267103

name: Estacionamiento a lado del río
description:
they charge you 20,000 but you are near the river, and with a wonderful view of the mountains
--------
te cobran 20,000 pero estás cerca del río, y con una vista maravillosa de las montañas

name: Flying squirrel trampolie park
description: A great little place, located on the 8th floor of the Las Molinas mall. If you have kids and want something else to do besides the museums and other parks and let them get their energy out (or if you're a big kid yourself), bring them here to jump out the energy. Foam block pits, basketball, dodgeball, pugil sticks and a concession stand. Outside they have a rooftop terrace. Great for all ages and inexpensive. About 50k pesos for a few hours of fun.

name: Finca Hotel La Cascada
description:
This is a country hotel with natural pools and ecological paths, it has a restaurant and you also sell drinks, a large space, full of tranquility, with an excellent climate, we stayed 4 nights, they charged us COP$35,000 pp, includes breakfast, the people She is very kind and attentive, what we have needed
-----------
Este es un Hotel campestre con Piscinas naturales y Caminos ecológicos, tiene restaurante y te vendes también  bebidas,  un gran espacio, lleno de tranquilidad, con un excelente clima, nosotros nos quedamos 4 noches, nos cobraron COP$35.000 pp, incluye desayuno, la gente es muy amable y atenta lo que hemos necesitado

name: Hotel Los Geranios
description: A nice colourful place, very charming with really helpful owners. In total 14 Rooms, they also offer WIFI,  Breakfast , Cafeteria y Laundry. Open 7 days a week. WhatsApp from Sebastian  +57 3144160664. Secured parking in front of the Hotel.

name: Maquinmotos
description: Workshop for big Bikes. He is specialist for BMW Moto‘s.

name: the real location of the Hacienda
description: I put the entrance several months ago but plan to go back and felt it was worth showing the actual location. That way you can get a look at the route up the mountain

name: Finca Altos De La Paz
description: Nice save finca with cows, sheeps, dogs and other animals, very friendly caretakers. 15 min from the lot you can hike to some natural pools and water falls (take care when it rains). Parking lot and spaces for tents. 15.000 ppn. Free WIFI. Showers and bathroom free. 4 km from the main road, dirt road but no 4x4 needed.

name: Good gravel road passed wind farms 2 roadblocks
description: This is a good gravel road to Cabo de la Vela. But there are 2 roadblocks on this road. We did not pay just drove through one cable and at the next one told them to drop the cable. We did not want to support the behaviour.

name: Lady Mom Hostel
description:
Lady Mom Hostel is a nice place with an excellent location, close to shopping centers, shops, supermarkets, Parque del Poblado, Parque Lleras and Via Provenza, which are the most touristic places in the area. The Poblado metro station is 2 blocks away. You can park in front of the hostel without a problem, during the day it is busy but very quiet at night and on the weekend.

All the staff is very friendly, willing to help you with whatever you need.

You have access to Wi-Fi services, showers, common areas, work areas, electric charging and water tank filling... this is included in the price per night of $25k Colombian pesos if you are a single person, or if you travel with your partner or friends costs $20k per person each night.

Laundry is additional for a cost of $10k for the minimum load or $15k for the maximum load.

name: Campspot with amazing view over the valley (no vehicle access)
description: Next to the mirador there is a spot with PRIVATE land from a farmer. We asked the farmer if we could camp on his land. He lives in the house 700m downhill following the road. He replied like we were not the first one who asked. He charged us 10.000 pesos p.p. No facilities, but the view is Amazing!! One of our best spots so far in South America. At the “entrance” (a bent fence) you can enter, there is also a water tap running there if you need water. Walk down to the edge at the second plateau and there is a semi flat spot not visible from the road.

name: Silenciadores y Radiadores el Flaco
description: We can highly recommend this shop. They fixed our radiator in no time and for reasonable money. Very nice owner and crew.

name: Los Balcones
description:
Nice and quiet place with basic rooms with shared bathrooms, a kitchen, hammocks, laundry. Exotic birds in the backyard and sometimes monkeys. 
A nice place to rest, especially after Trampolin del Diablo! 
Wi-Fi is good. Nice people. 

Moto-friendly, campers are welcome to park in front of the house and pay to use facilities. 

Room is COP 35,000 per person.

name: Saboya-Jesus Maria Road. Jesus Maria to Florian
description: The Road is under construction. Several times per day it is closed. The road is gravel road and doable in a European standard RV like ours. Some parts are a bit tricky because of potholes.  See comment below for times. This is still the best route to Florian unless you are into serious 4x4 wheeling.

name: Fernando Mecanico
description:
We had problems on the breaks, the village send us to Fernando, friendly and good in what he does. Very recommended !
+57 3115236325

name: Mecanica + help border cross - Luis y Mercedes
description:
We arrived from Equador and crossed the border with their help (to avoid the transito, our vehicule had to pass the mecanical control... can only be done in Colombia but they still give you a ticket when you cross the border. but no transito on a sunday evening, so no ticket (not always right so Mercedes checked for us before crossing)).
After crossing, Luis as mecanic helped us for the technical control + did a complete revision of the steering box + give good contacts for different respuestos and car body builder. He helped us with the making of the Improntas (needed print of the motor and chasis number for the sell of a colombian car).
Mercedes did al the need papers for the transito (RUNT) + drove us everywhere in the city. 
A lovely family ! they invited us each time to eat almuerzo or a cafecito.
asked for 300.000 cop for all the work.

name: Toche
description: When arriving in Toche, we arrived in Paradise! A small village in the middle of the mountain. We slept here 3 nights. After the bridge on the right side (before entering to the village) there is a red gate, we park after the entrance and we walk the path to the house of Arleji (super friendly woman), where you can find a hot pool due to the Vulcan Macin. (free) There is also a way to go up to the Volcano, amazing! People super friendly !! Worth the way! We didn't have 4x4, but slowly we arrived. Also on the way to Toche there are many amazing waterfalls!

name: Misael - La Playita
description:
That's the point, where Misael is living. An extraordinaire tour guide of Rincon. He is a sympathetic and friendly guy and can arrange what ever you wish.
We booked him to get to the Island Múcura for a longer stay in a hotel.
He was fast in answer our messages and was on point at the meeting point. He brought us over and made us the offer to make a snorkel stop on our way back. He also brought gear for us.

No problem with crossing over with dog, he welcomed our dog on his boat without problems.

We parked our vans at "Doña Iris" but he told us after, he could also arrange a parking. So if you are travelling by van and plan a stay on one of the Islands - he is your man!
+57 324 4842913 (Whatsapp, too, Spanish)

(Isla Múcura 70'000COP per person - one way or a "one day tour". Doesn't matter because one way they have to go back empty - tours and taxi are the same)

name: Málaga, gas station Terpel
description: Secure gas station parking, close to the road but not much noise.  Good place to spend a night, the workers are very friendly.

name: Villavieja
description: Gas Station is quite expensive but there aren't any others nearby.

name: Very quiet street parking
description: This is a very quiet street parking spot in front of the grave yard. just a view dogs came in the morning. we felt very safe. 4G Claro.

name: free shower and toilets at terpel
description: free showers and toilets at terpel. also a water tap outside the toilets.

name: Restaurante Los Abuelos
description:
Nice Restaurant at the Highway to Medellin. 
The food was really delicious and cheap.
A good place to stop and rest. 
I think when you ask friendly you can sleep at the parking lot.

name: Baraya
description:
Not exact location. Warning of Guerilla roadblocks!

We exited the Tatacoa Desert round-trip via Baraya with the intention of taking the road via Tello to Neiva.
Made coffee and some food at the town square. The police arrived and were friendly, but told us to move on as it apparently isn't allowed to hang around there. They warned us that there was much Guerilla activity in the area (showed us pictures of arrests the previous evening) and if we happen to get stopped at a checkpoint on our intended route then it is probably Guerillas. Green Military camouflage uniform without Colombian flag on the arm. We should play dumb, speak only our own language, don't show our passports and generally act like we don't understand anything and they will let us pass.
Sure enough not 10 minutes outside of town there was such a roadblock with 4 armed men wearing the described uniforms. We did mostly as the police said we should, mostly saying over and over we didn't understand when they wanted us to get out of the vehicle for a pat down to check for arms and to open up and search the vehicle. We did show some vehicle documents which seemd to placate them somewhat. After enough of refusing to do anything they wanted by acting dumb they let us go. Without the warning from the police I am not sure we would have reacted as we did or have been aware that they were not real military. Do not recommend this route!

name: Catación Café
description: Looks like any typical gas station, but really beautiful café with really great coffee from their own finca next door. Wonderful view from the garden. The local police recommended it to us as the best in town :)

name: Hostel Luna Llena
description: Relatively large hostel 5-10mins outside of Mocoa. Beautiful, colorful house run by a sweet old man. Let me park my motorcycle inside their gate. Full kitchen, dorms, privates, cold showers. Water is not potable, 3,000 COP for a gallon. Beds were clean and comfortable. Free Wi-Fi, 30,000 COP for a dorm bed. No proper restaurant but owner will make you breakfast lunch or dinner. Hostel also offers excursions and connections for yage ceremonies.

name: KTM Neiva
description: Dealership and garage. We had a problem with a malfunctioning radiator fan. They found the problem quickly and we could continue traveling. Ask for Gregory the lead mechanic. +57 (316) 412-4094

name: Termas de Guican
description: Parking for the hot springs, a good place to spend the night, with no other services than the hot springs.

name: Calle al lado de la cancha
description:
Translation: If you go to Pasto and want to stop one night in Chachagüi this is a good place. The town is quiet and this street is wide as well as flat. Recommended.

Si vas para Pasto y deseas parar una noche en Chachagüi este es un buen lugar. El pueblo es tranquilo y está calle es amplia además de plana. Recomendado.

name: Parqueadero Lua
description:
We slept here in our roof tent the night before our trip to Isla Palma, and we left the car for one more night when we were at the island. We felt safe in the village, but we thought it best to park in the parking lot as the only street in the city is very tight.
We agreed on 10000 COP, but when we went to pay they wanted to charge us 15000COP per night - so leave it very well agreed beforehand and ask for the name of the person who gave the price.  We paid what we had agreed, even the lady was not very happy 
There are no facilities such as bathrooms, showers and water. There is no height restriction.


Dormimos aqui em nossa barraca de teto as na noite anterior à nossa viagem para Isla Palma e deixamos o carro por mais uma noite quando estávamos na ilha.  Nos sentimos seguros na vila, mas achamos melhor estacionar no estacionamento, pois a única rua da cidade é muito apertada.
 Combinamos 10000 COP, mas quando fomos pagar eles queriam nos cobrar 15000COP por noite - então deixe muito bem combinado antes e pergunte o nome da pessoa que deu o preço.  Pagamos o que havíamos combinado, mesmo que a senhora não tenha ficado muito feliz 
Não há nenhuma estrutura, como banheiros, duchas ou água. Não há restrição de altura.

name: cajero Davivienda en Olímpica
description: ATM in Olympic supermarket. next door there is a D1 supermarket as well.

name: Estacion Terpel El Sol
description:
Translation: Gas station and has a supermarket, hotel and parking. very central.

Estación de gasolina y tiene hotel supermemarket y parqueadero. muy central.

name: Estacion de Servicio Terpel San Francisco
description:
Translation: San Francisco service station It has parking, laundry, courts, parking lot and workshop

.Estación de servicio San Francisco Tiene estacionamiento, lavadero, canchas, parqueadero y taller.

name: Estación de Servicio Biomax Los Guacharos
description:
Translate: Biomax Los Guacharos Service Station, has a laundry, workshop and sale of oils.

Estación de Servicio Biomax Los Guacharos, tiene lavadero, taller y venta de aceites.

name: Centro Gastronómico y Turístico El tribuno del Pueblo
description:
Translation: Gastronomic and Tourist Center El tribuno del Pueblo. Container design where you will find restaurants, food, drinks, exercise spaces, a band shell, the central church, park and shopping center are nearby.

Centro Gastronómico y Turístico El tribuno del Pueblo. Diseño en container donde encontraras restaurantes, comidas bebidas espacios de ejercicio, concha acústica queda cerca la iglesia central, parce y el centro para compras.

name: Hospital San Francisco Javier Acevedo
description:
Translation: Hospital San Francisco Javier Acevedo complete hospital unit.

Hospital San Francisco Javier Acevedo unidad hospitalaria completa.

name: Estadero La Poira
description:
Translation: Estadero La Poira, open field site has a river, very large parking lot, green areas, cooking area, shop, bathrooms and many services.

Estadero La Poira, sitio a campo abierto tiene rio parqueadero muy amplio zonas verdes zona para cocinar tienda, baños y muchos servicios.

name: EL MIRADOR ANDAKI
description:
Translation: EL MIRADOR ANDAKI A place with an impressive height and an excellent view of the coffee zone and urban area, it has giant statues and very good food.

EL MIRADOR ANDAKI Un sitio con una altura impresionante y excelente vista de la zona cafetera y zona urbana tiene estatuas gigantes y muy buena comida.

name: TERMINAL ACEVEDO
description:
TERMINAL ACEVEDO Space within the urban area can be parked without problem.
___

TERMINAL ACEVEDO Espacio dentro de la zona urbana se puede estacionar sin problema.

name: Zona Talleres
description:
Zona Talleres you will find warehouses and places to make arrangements of any kind.
____
Zona Talleres encontraras almacenes y lugares para realizar arreglos de cualquier tipo.

name: Zona talleres Motos
description:
Motorcycle workshops area | You can find warehouses and motorcycle workshops for what you need.
______

Zona talleres Motos | encuentras almacenes y talleres de motos de lo que necesites.

name: Zona Veterinarias
description:
Veterinary Zone In this area you will find all the veterinary hospitals, doctors and pet and agricultural stores.
____

Zona Veterinarias en esta zona encontraras todas las hospitales veterinarios, médicos y tiendas de mascotas y agrarias.

name: Estacion de servicio Primax
description:
Primax service station, gasoline sales and parking.
_____
Estación de servicio Primax, venta de gasolina y estacionamiento.

name: ASESORIAS DE TRANSITO
description:
TRANSIT ADVICE Find insurance or accompaniment in terms of transit of your vehicle licenses etc.
_____

ASESORIAS DE TRANSITO Encuentras seguros o acompañamiento en cuanto a transito de tu vehículo licencias etc.

name: ZONA CENTRO COMERCIAL
description:
SHOPPING CENTER AREA You find supermarkets, pharmacies, vegetables, meats, clothing, footwear, electronic equipment, bakeries, casinos, restaurants, hotels, hairdressers, optometry, dentists, cafeterias, banks.
_____
ZONA CENTRO COMERCIAL Encuentras supermercados, farmacias, verduras, carnes, ropa, calzados, equipos electrónicos, panaderías, casinos, restaurantes, hoteles, peluquerías, optometrías, odontólogos, cafeterías, Bancos.

name: Parque Central
description:
Central Park, a spacious place with a lot of tourist and gastronomic coffee area. emblematic place of Cafe Especial for lovers of special imported coffee.
_____

Parque Central lugar amplio con mucha zona turística y gastronómica cafetera. lugar emblemático del Cafe Especial para los amantes del cafe especial tipo importación.

name: Lavadero VIP Car & Food
description: Good place to get your car cleaned before putting it on the ship. They take their time to clean everything properly. For 50.000 COP they will clean interior and outside and will take about 1,5h.

name: In Colombia Kitesurf
description: We rented Kiting Gear for 2 days an spend one night there. Alex and his team were super nice and when we asked them if we could stay he was super nice even cooked us dinner and didn't even charge us for parking there. We could even plug in our car and let the AC run. Our car is like 3,30m and we could enter under the tower to have some shade. for bigger riggs you have to stay in front of the building.

name: Best place to camp near Pasto
description: We had a wonderful quiet night in the mountains near Pasto. Its very quiet and dark, just two friendly dogs, who watched our van the whole night. Its on 2000m, so nice temperature.

name: 3DDISENO Wrapping, Stickers , TOP Service !
description: This is a very creative, high professional, fast and friendly team. They create for us a map from North and South America and Instagram Stickers for 20.000 COP.

name: Hostel Balcones de la Casona
description:
$ 5.000 pesos p/p. Hot shower and clean
___

$ 5.000 pesos por pessoa. Banho quente e limpo

name: Next to the road but quiet
description: we found that parking lot in the grass near a small river. its just 15m away from the main road but quiet at night

name: AdBlue/DEF/Urea
description: Terpel with DEF/AdBlue/Úrea pump in the back behind the last gas pump between shop and toilets. We were already kind of worried about not finding DEF before the border to Ecuador, so we were very happy to see this! Also very kind and helpful attendance. Price: 3900 COP per liter (18.07.2022). Clean free toilets as well. Paying with Credit Card was possible.

name: Texaco with AdBlue/Def
description: your last/first chance in colombia for adblue/def

name: taller Mazda service
description: Super garage nice welcome very serious work no problem, you can go there with confidence they are adorable and the prices are very very correct.

name: parque Venezuela
description: Square in a residential neighborhood. There are many sports activities and games for children. There is a police booth next to this punti (cai). It's quiet at night, but strange people still walk by and it's better to be attentive. People start doing sports from 5 am. you can take advantage

name: Sushi wok
description: Very good restaurant of sushi, wok and more! This is in the commercial center near Maloka museum

name: Private parking Spot with incredible view
description: Probably the best view you ll ever have. safe spot, with very nice family owners.  Pretty level. we haven't asked for any services, but they have electricity. We paid 20k for a van.

name: Hotel el dorado
description: Basic accommodations, cold water shower, quiet at night (at least when we were there). A/C is in the room but wasn't working, but the fan did fine keeping us cool overnight. Wifi is there, but best connected in the reception area. Connection and speeds, well, not so great. Claro 4g worked better and Tigo LTE was almost as mediocre as the wifi.  Nothing spectacular, but it will do in a pinch. They have parking at the Terpel gas station on the corner and fits any size rig. We paid 20k per person and 10k for parking.

name: Almacén y Taller Carmóvil
description: If you need work done before crossing the border, these guys can do it. We stopped for an emergency brake change and they got to it right away. They open between 8 and 8:30 am. They can do engine work, oil changes, brakes, electrical systems... So if you need something done on the way to or from Ecuador, stop here. The guys are super friendly and work fast. We needed new rotors and they didn't have them, so the owner took us in his car to Ecuador where they have the rotors and brought us back to the shop.

name: Le pandequeso
description: Delicious empanadas made with traditional yucca bread, including vegetarian options.   Naturally gluten free!!

name: Mitsubishi 4x4 Garage
description: Ivan is a Mitsubishi 4x4 specialist and really friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. Replaced our clutch and ball joints.

name: Superelectricos
description:
Fast and efficient service :) 
We went to another electrician near this one, which was indicated here at IOverlander, because we had a problem on our starter motor, but they could not fix it.
__________

Serviço rápido e eficiente :) fomos em outro auto elétrico próximo a esse, que estava indicado aqui no IOverlander, pois estávamos com um problema no motor de arranque, mas os mesmo não puderam mexer.

name: Vibe de Dois: Hostel
description:
Hostel. Hot shower. 5.000 pp 

Hostel sem nome. Banho quente. 5 mil por pessoa

name: Turn off to a better road
description:
Coming from the main road, turn left here to go to Cabo de la Vela. On maps.me you can follow the trail if you put it on walking.
Coming from Cabo de la Vela, turn right here on a smooth asphalted bit until the main road!
Saves at least half an hour. This road didn't appear on Maps.me nor Google Maps.
Enjoy!

name: Village waterfall reservoir
description:
It is the overflow of the water reservoir of the village. No water tap available. 
Best water quality.

name: Monta llanta - mecanic
description:
Fat tire near pinalito. I ask this lovely man and wife, change my tube of my motorbike! I can continue the day.
He have good tools for repair motorcycles !

name: pull off by the river
description: pull off near creek. friendly people live nearby and they tell us it's ok to overnight here. moderate claro connection

name: Mecanic
description: Great place mechanic for motorcycles!! Recomend 100%

name: Restaurante y Hotel Villa Juliana
description:
This is a really nice, safe, quiet option away from the highway! We found it listed on Google when driving from Cartagena to Medellin. “Hostel” is inside a big house where the owner Liliana also lives. She had family in town so there was only one non-air conditioned room available (there was a big fan) but normally has both double and single rooms with AC, private or shared bath, a nice big shared kitchen etc (prices on Expedia were $8-20 USD for a weeknight). We asked if we could camp and she was open to it - asked for $60K COP but accepted $50K. She opened up an outdoor bathroom for us with cold shower (no curtain) and welcomed us to use the big palapa area with hammocks. Liliana was very kind and welcoming and encouraged us to add this location to iOverlander. It has been a restaurant in the past and she is working on reopening the restaurant and pool. Be sure to message her on WhatsApp before coming as she’s not always in town and is new to the camping option. 

WhatsApp - Liliana - 57 314 6714508

name: Money exchange
description: Inside building you can find the money exchange

name: Multicar Cota bodywork and spray painting
description: Good place to fix rust, bodywork and spraypainting. Contact Juan from Overlandv Sally and he will make sure they do the work right.

name: poza de albeiro
description:
Spectacular place on the banks of Rioancho. Along the road there are several places where you can park to enjoy the river, but here is the most beautiful because it has a large pool where you can swim. The town is very quiet and away from all the tourists in Palomino. Do not miss it! The road is good, almost all paved. Not suitable for cars too big because it can be difficult to turn around. Leave the car in the street and then go down to the left by a small path.
Lugar espectacular a orilla de Rioancho. Por la carretera hay varios puntos en dónde se puede parquear para disfrutar del río, pero aquí está el más lindo porque tiene una poza grande en dónde se puede nadar. El pueblo es muy tranquilo y alejado de todos los turistas de Palomino. No sé lo pierdan! El camino está bueno, casi todo pavimentado. No apto para carros demasiado grande porque puede ser complicado dar la vuelta. Dejen el carro en la calle y luego bajen a mano izquierda por un pequeño sendero.

name: BORA. Tu Espacio Fuera de Casa
description:
Cozy apartment (#201), fully equipped for short and long-term stays.
......
ACOGEDOR APARTAMENTO TOTALMENTE EQUIPADO PARA ESTADIAS CORTAS Y LARGAS

name: Holy Water Ale Café
description: Surprise find of a brewpub/restaurant co-located with the hostel that's listed here. Broad selection of beers on tap. the Yolanada stout, for one, is rather good. Nice interior split into several rooms a little like a British pub!!!

name: Eco Hotel Valle de Samaria
Centro Turístico Pipolin
description: It's a place with a great view. There are plenty of places to place a tent. There is a swimming pool with natural water, restaurant and fishing is also possible

name: Mirador Mocca
description:
Mocca viewpoint, safe, pleasant and cozy place to camp and spend the night in the parking lot of the site. just 6 km from La Plata - Huila,
_________________________

Mirador mocca, lugar seguro,agradable y acogedor para campar y pernoctar en el parqueadero del sitio. a tan solo 6 km de la plata - Huila,

name: fabio and nelson
description:
our timing belt snapped near the little town of albania south form here. we got fabio's contact from overland sally from bogota.

we came here with our cilinder head and fabio helped us look for new parts. we payed about 200 usd for new valves, new belt and new gasket. the new valves were fitted at shop fabio knew for about 35 usd and looks like good work. would recomend if you need mechanical help around this area, many parts to found in this neighborhood. 
excact adres: calle 19c 11_26
fabio's number: +57 316 5287962
only spanish spoken

name: Ecohotel El Reposo
description: It’s a cute nice hotel that has green space for camping/ camper. It has nice pool, children playground , and clean toilet/ shower. The only downside is that where the space to camp is quite noisy by the main road. However this is one of the best camper place we could find in the zone. It’s on the route Melgar to Bogota, 20 mnts from Lagosol and piscilago. Ps. Speak with Lorena, she’ll help you +57 311 3679679

name: Beach at the airport
description:
quiet place close to the downtown
I arrived around 9pm and left 7am
parked close to the beach hearing the waves, there were some people walking at night and in the morning, nobody bother us. we felt safe

name: Finca La Hotelera
description:
Finca close to Lejanías, it has a natural swimming pool, restaurant, parking and a room for rent.

The owner is very friendly and will try to make your stay comfortable

name: La finca de germánico
description:
La finca de germánico is a place to camp or park a motor home. 
We provide weather an electricity.

name: Restaurante Los Jaunes
description: Really delicious food. No menu, platos del dia with beef, pork, or chicken accompanied by big bowl of soup and iced tea. Could make a vegetarian plate for one of us without batting an eye. No english, all in Spanish of course. 50,000 COP for plates for 3 of us and 3 beers

name: Villa gourmet
description: Nice place to eat local food. Menu del dia. Good food and cheap.

name: Refugio Munay
description:
Great spot for Overlanders looking for a relaxing and private setting near Florian. Less than 1/2 hr walk to upper Ventanas de Tisquizoque trail. To get to Lower trail or into town is much longer, around 4 km. 

Really well set up campground with big communal kitchen, bathrooms, showers. Flat area behind gate easily fit 2 rigs, probably 4 could squeeze. They mostly rent tent spots and a few small cabanas, but were happy to accommodate us and we had the place to ourselves. No-one lives onsite, Whatsapp owner Juliana at  +573016598773 before you get to Puente Nacional to arrange access. You can also contact her via their Instagram page or google. The local caretaker lives in Florian and will meet you and give you a key and a tour. Cell service spotty, works on one of our phones but not the other (Claro). 25,000 COP pp/night

Entrance is an unmarked large black gate. 2 story white house just before the gate is not associated.

name: Mirador en las manos de Dios
description: This pleasant viewing point at the outskirts of Salento is not a campground but has a large parking area where you can park for a symbolic fee and spend the night next to the cattle. We asked the local manager if we could park for the night and told us he would ask about his boss. Two minutes later he came back with his boss on hold and asked us how much we usually pay. Is it ok for 20.000 pesos - 5 us dollars? Agreed and we spent the night greatly. The place is 10’ walking distance from the central plaza and on the road to the coffee fincas downhill on the gravel road. Ideal spot to start your mountain bike tours in the area. The parking is a little bit inclined but large enough to accommodate XL RVs and expedition trucks. Very safe, as the door closes after dark but you can open it if you are coming from town.

name: Zeus's petrol station car repair
description: a car repair at the back of Zeuss petrol station. repair tyres and mechanic

name: Moto Guerrero
description:
a good place to repair your Motorcycle, very friendly.  Good prices. 
un bon endroit pour réparer son vélo.  personnel très sympathique. 
Un buen lugar para reparar su bici. Repuestos shimano.

name: Cámping zone near Magdalena river
description: Natural and quiet zone near to Magdalena river, relax and natural ambient. Is near to the 78 national rute.

name: Recuca Coffee Tour
description:
We can not recommend this place. 
The staff are friendly but it is more a comedian and entertainment tour than a authentic coffee tour.
You can make traditional dance with clothes and a short coffee tasting. The guide give you information about the process. 

We paid 40.000COP pp + 40.000 COP for a english guide. 

I think you will find better places like this.

name: Casa Hotel La Oculta
description: Tidy private appartment, owner is very helpful and friendly, gave a lot of tipps what to see in Medellin and he cooks a good breakfast every day. Fully equipped kitchen, cold shower. Safe place. Noisy at night, so bring earplugs with you. There is a parking lot round the corner with no high restriction but not suitable for big rigs. Book on booking.com or WhatsApp +57 300 8727353

name: Leon de Baviera /Bayerisches Wirtshaus
description: Very good restaurant with excellent, authentic Bavarian food and Paulaner wheat beer at normal prices. German boss Stefan is a very nice guy and is happy about the visit of overlanders. Directly opposite you find a secure, affordable 24 hour car park.

name: street parking close to library
description: surprisingly quiet street full of trees, close to lot of businesses, with a private security guard walking all night long

name: Honda Dream
description: I absolutely recommend! they have a good mechanic English spoken. wide range of tires, parts, clothes, boots and anything else you need!

name: Hotel el danubio
description:
nice hotel really friendly owner. 
rooms ok good with shared bathroom. 
this place is clean and very close to the beautiful waterfalls! 50.000 per night 2 people. 
we could park our bikes in the garage. 
next door is a mini market and a restaurant with local food.

name: Casa Willies
description:
We really liked this spot especially the view over the valley from the grass terrace! 
Small campsite, 23,000 pp, campervan included. Outdoor toilets and cold shower. Restaurant on site. Friendly and nice owners. To the left of toilets, grassy terrace with beautiful view over valley.

name: Proyecto Tewa - Incredible Veggie Arepas
description: Only open on Saturday's - small stand by the side of the road selling absolutely delicious organic corn and wheat arepas with cheese. If you are travelling this road and they are open you have to stop!

name: Very bad road! Come from the other side
description: We wanted to go to Termales San Ruiz, taking this road, but it is undrivable, even with our 4x4 ford transit with high clearance. we backed out midway. do yourself a favour, and enter from the other side. that road is mostly paved. only the last 5km or up to termales san ruiz are unpaved, but still very good. from there on it starts to get worse.

name: Parking spot on football field in Minca
description: It’s not easy to find a good spot for the night in Minca. This football-field at the end of the center is also officially used as a parking lot. We paid 25,000 per night for 1 truck with 2 people. no problem for big rigs either, large, flat spots, Perfect location, no other amenities. Highly recommended.

name: Potable water by the road
description: There is a water spigot right next to the road. Asked a few locals and all said it was potable.

name: Alegria Hostel Boutique
description: Parking lot in the back of the hostel-it's flat. No high restriction. You can use kitchen and bathroom inside the hostel. There is very nice terrace to hang out, bbq. Close to the dam- 50m, you can go through small camino and take a bath, chill on the coast but it's nothing fancy. Just ok after long journey. Hostel is nice, super clean. There is electric heater in the shower. They offer breakfast. We paid 20000cop/pppn without breakfast. Didn't negotiate. The atmosphere in the hostel is very comfy, we like the place very much.

name: Servitaxi SA. Workshop
description: Very organized workshop to service your car or truck, change oil, filters, tyres etc. if you need more serious mechanic works, Oscar can arrange one at spot. The workshop is very high and can accommodate RVs and expedition trucks despite its location next to historic city center. We paid 40.000 pesos -10 usd - for oil/filter change and they also controlled diff and gearbox valvolines. The owner is a great guy who will probably invite you to park and stay at his house. 15 kms from Popayan center.

name: Namaste Vegan food
description: Same name namaste but not the same resto. Menu is not many choice but looks like good and normal price. Also juice smoothie and extracted. Very small resto

name: between church and soccer field
description: quiet place between the church and a big soccer field, felt very safe. there are some small business around like small marker and street food

name: Tourist Information
description: After more than 2 hours of research we finally found the tourist office.  Useful to know how to get to the different point around Bogota.

name: Terra Dulce Bean to Bar Chocolate Tour
description: Paula is an inspiring entrepreneur who has started an artesan chocolate business. She has also started doing tours of the factory which was really fascinating to see how chocolate gets made from the bean through all the different processes until finally being made into a bar. We got to taste the cacao and chocolate at each stage of the process and of course the final product. Paula is really passionate about what she does. It was 50,000pp for 1.5/2 hour tour which included lots of delicious chocolate. We definitely recommend to visit and it was a nice contrast and a different side compared to the coffee tours. Paula also has excellent English. Call or WhatsApp ahead for a tour: 302 3136432. Parking at the cafe across the road

name: VPM Garage & Camping
description: Secure Storage for your camper (entrance 3.5m height). Angel and Jessica (#vamosporelmundo) are a very nice and helpful couple! 30k/d (5k/d extra if you'd like to camp here). Highly recommended. Please check availability. WA: +57 350 483 5419! Modern Multiplaza Shopping Center in 16 min walking distance (if you need to buy something special). Camping is possible. Maybe the only camping in Bogota. Gravel, shower and toilet, resto, small hotel with cheap rooms.

name: Vibe de Dois: next to the road
description:
Our plan was to arrive in Malaga, but it was getting dark and we found this setback on the road. We spent a quiet night and no one came. There are practically no cars passing by at night, so it was very quiet, with only the noise of the river below. Fickle Claro 4G signal, no other amenities.


Nosso plano era chegarmos em Málaga, mas estava anoitecendo e encontramos esse recuo na estrada. Passamos uma noite tranquila e ninguém apareceu. Praticamente não passam carros a noite, então foi bem silenciosa, apenas com o barulho do rio logo abaixo. Sinal de 4G da Claro inconstante, nenhuma outra amenidade.
_____

name: Central park negritos
description:
negritos central park Right next to the police, quiet town and close to some natural attractions on the beaches.

parque central de negritos Justo a la par de la policía, pueblo tranquilo y cerca de de algunos atractivos naturales en las playas.

name: Vibe de Dois: Terpel Gás Station
description:
Chegamos tarde da noite e o segurança nos permitiu dormir. Nos conduziu até uma vaga onde poderia nos observar a noite toda. O posto não é 24h, mas o segurança fica a noite toda. Muitos caminhões também estacionados. A noite é silenciosa, mas muito barulho começa antes das 6h da manhã. O segurança também nos ofereceu seu banheiro para tomarmos uma ducha. Banheiros limpos. Ótimo lugar! Não tentamos utilizar nenhuma facilidade.
_____

We arrived late at night and security allowed us to sleep. He led us to a spot where he could watch us all night. The post is not open 24 hours a day, but the security guard is there all night. Many trucks also parked. The night is silent, but a lot of noise starts before 6 am. The security guard also offered us his bathroom to take a shower. Clean restrooms. Great place! We don't try to use any facilities.

name: Chef Burger
description: It is a brand for delicious burger. Not so cheap.

name: shop with fruit vegetables and others stuff
description: Little shop with many fruits vegetables and others primary necessities

name: Many restaurants
description: You can eat many things here. Very safe place at night time.

name: Free parking Playa Cabo de La vela
description: Stayed 2 nights here on this beautiful beach on our way to Punta Gallina. Pass the kite-surf-school, then after the sign „Restaurant La Bendicion de Dios“ turn left, there‘s plenty of space for all kinds of cars. Nobody asked for payment. Water is great for swimming especially in the morning (when no Kiters are there). We had fantastic and cheap dinner in the restaurant close bye (whole fish, Pasta and 4 drinks 95.000 pesos) and good Party after with the kite surfers!(but spot is quiet). Day and night a very nice breeze. Very good Claro signal.

name: Lubricentro Tunja
description:
Great spot for oil change and to change the oil/air filters. The guy also filled up all the other fluids that could be put in. 
We were charged 358 mil cop which I think is fair price for 8L of oil and change of two filters.

name: Restaurant zodiaco
description: Very good restaurant with typical Colombian food. Many local people here. Very fast.

name: Water at Police Station
description:
It was very difficult to find water in the whole region but the police were very kind and allowed us to use the water.

Foi muito difícil encontrar água em toda a região mas a polícia foi muito gentil e nos liberou usar a água.

name: Trucheria montemare
description: Super tasted fried fish (thrushes) served with salad paracones salsas e juice. Very tasted. 27.000 pp

name: Bosque Pandora
description:
The Bosque Pandora is a great Geopark in the middle of nowhere, where you can join in great activities like exploring caves and the absolute stunning Pandora Forest. Usually they do two activities a day for 60.000 p.P. and activity. We were allowed to camp on their grounds for free. They also offer really good breakfast, lunch & dinner including vegetarian options. The drive in is on a very tiny road but should be doable in every kind of vehicle. The nature there is among the prettiest we have seen in Columbia and the people are incredibly friendly. Make sure to text them before to see if they have spots available and about the activities they offer. Also be prepared to get quite dirty, since it's often muddy and wet. We didn't know and ruined a shirt. Dogs are welcome and can join in some of the activities. 
The number is +57 314 322 210 6 (Jose)

name: popanova hotel
description: thought I'd add this as almost no options on ioverlander in this stretch of road. 60k per night for the cheapest rooms (singles). not sure price of bigger rooms. nice people

name: Departure for horse riding
description: Horse riding with Bernardo Lopez. Very friendly person. With did El Camino de la Herrera. With waterfalls and mirador. Go and back. About 2h30. We paid 60.000 pp. nice horses! Very nice landscape

name: Fruit and vegetables
description: Well many fresh fruits and vegetables. Also eggs. Good value

name: petrol station in construction
description: After getting turned away from the truchera I stopped here. looks to be a great spot - can drive round the back of the buildings to be completely hidden from the road. flat spots and hard sand that looks like it'll take a peg for my tent. spoke to a trout fisherman and he said there'll be absolutely no problem. will update if there's any issues

name: Saberes Ancestrales
description:
Don’t miss the vegetarien food from special plants in this region. Samuel and Paola are the lovely couple who runs this special restaurant. The owners explained us all the healthy ingredients. They even use a kind of yuka wood they fry for one hour including special red ‚pearl’ patatoes. Great experience in a laid-back atmosphere. You can also get tasty cakes here and an amazing tea.
Open: 12.00 until 18.00. We‘were too late and without reservation. They cocked us ‚Cazuales de Montaña‘ and we returned one hour later for our surprise-meal.
Enjoy this magic place here in San Augustin.

name: La Playa de Belén- Plaza
description:
Sleep in front of the Church. Prox to the army post. Toilets in nearby coffee shops. local

Dormi em frente a Igreja. Prx ao posto do exército. Banheiro nas cafeterias próximas. local

name: Bike house- bike boxes
description: The bike house is a really nice bike shop. They keep the bike boxes and sell them to cyclistas who need it for transport. They also leave the protection material inside the box. Boxes are from the brand Trek. We tried the Caribbean bike, but with no succes. So just go here and save yourself some time, stress and energy. They also have really nice Colombian bike shirts as a souvenir. We bought a shirt and he did not charge anything for the boxes. The location on google maps is wrong, it is on the other side of the road and a bit further south.

name: PNN Los Nevados
description:
In this point you can detour from Cocora Valley Loop into the Los Nevados. The park doesn’t really start here, but you kind of walk into the wild here. 

Status of the PNN as of August 2023 is “no one really knows”. Some people say just the north part is closed, some say the whole park is closed.

Anyway we just went in here and saw some beautiful views of the paramos, volcanos and the jungle. You can stay and eat at fincas: Argentina, Buenos Aires, Primavera (we had been at all three for food on the way - price is 15k COP per person) and La Playa. No payments anywhere for the park (except for the Cocora Valley if you go through the paid part). We met some Colombians who hiked one of the volcanoes - no one cares really. It is super cold and windy above 3800 m so be prepared. 

We had our tent with us and you can camp at fincas (usually around 7k per person) or in the wild in the park. We used the maps.me to look for the wild spots. Use MAPS.ME for navigating in the park, it shows all the paths, but you have to note that they are little bit longer and take more time than app indicates due to mud, elevation change and other factors. 

Good luck and have fun. Talk to the locals and people in fincas/campings and so on. If you really want a guide people usually go with a company Paramo Trek from Salento. But in our opinion it is not worth the money if you have some basic hiking knowledge and experience.

name: Parking lot of thermale
description: We asked security guard to sleep in parking lot of bus. Please confirm after 5pm with guard because they change turn a this time. All cars left at 23h. Flat and night very quiet near the river. Toilets near ticket counter. And cold shower and restaurant available in the therme

name: Thermes of Santa Rosa de canal.
description: Nice therme with hot swimming pool. 3 different temperature. Water is killer bite green but is ok and full of bicarbonate. Very nice waterfall. Nice place to relax but avoid WE many people.

name: Cocina de la loca
description: Very good food with many different tastes from many part of the world. Thaïlandais. Hamburger win a price. And was so good. Here he try to cook something different from Colombia but with local product and without sale. He likes to explain and he can do what you want if you don’t find your favorite plate.

name: Praça Triángulo
description:
Nice spot, safe, we stayed 3 nights and nobody bothered us, talked to the neighbors and it’s ok to park here. We tried to sleep at the Parque de Los Perros, but it was too noisy. Here is calm and there are a lot of good restaurants
---
Bonito lugar, seguro, nos quedamos 3 noches y nadie nos molestó. hablamos con los vecinos y nos dijeron que podíamos estacionar aquí. Intentamos dormir en el parque de los perros, pero era demasiado ruidoso. Aquí es tranquilo y hay muchos buenos restaurantes.

name: Sambal gastronomie
description: Super tasty restaurant! Like gastronomic! Little bit expensive but really good value! It could be stars in Michelin!!! We took with cocktails and it was an unique experience! Wow

name: aqua pura
description: Small water-shop on the corner, they fill your containers.

name: Pullout on quiet road
description:
Nice, but small pullout on a really quiet road. Only one car passed by.
Size up to sprinter should be no problem. The whole road has really nice views and more than this pullout. You will find a place for sure.
This pullout doesn't had views because of bushes and trees, but you are a bit protected.
Good Claro signal (4G).

name: Pullout. El Cocuy Guican
description:
Nice flat pullout with enough space. The street is quiet but has some traffic. in the morning some guys will drive up (tours etc.).

This place here is the nearest to get to the Mirador in the morning to enjoy the spectacular views. Worth it to get up early - clouds will come during the day.

name: Gas station Petromil
description:
A large and very quiet place. Gas vehicle station. bathrooms without showers. very small town around. It is safe. I stayed one night to avoid driving at night. there is a guard at the station that you can help with little money voluntarily if you wish.
---
un lugar amplio y muy tranquilo. Estación de gas vehicular. baños sin ducha. pueblo muy pequeño al rededor. Es seguro. estuve una noche para evitar conducir de noche. hay un vigilante en la estación que puedes ayudar con poco dinero voluntariamente si lo deseas.

name: Awesome Hike - Farallones De Sutatausa
description:
From this spot a really great hike goes up onto the cliffs. The hike is a moderately steep 1/2 hour from here up to the top of the cliff, then you have several KM of hiking right along the cliff with incredible views and photo-ops and really fascinating geology and botany. The trail is on Maps.me. 

We already were camping at Quinta La Fagua, but there is a restaurant right by this pin that has a camping sign, as well as parqueadoros. 

Hiking is one of our main activities, and this is one of the best hikes we have found in a while. Highly recommended!

name: Voluntariado en hostel nahimara
description:
We were a few days without our van, because we sent it from Colombia to Panamá, those days we stayed in Nahimara champeta hostel, we didn't pay with cash, we did a volunteering, helping with cleaning and tidying in exchange of our stay (bed, shower, AC, wifi, kitchen, etc.) The owners are travelers and very friendly, the hostel has a nice backyard with pool.

__________________________

Estuvimos varios dias sin nuestra van porque la cruzamos de Colombia a Panamá, en esos dias nos quedamos en el hostel Nahimara champeta, no pagamos con dinero, sino q hicimos un voluntariado ayudando con la limpieza y el orden a cambio de nuestro hospedaje (cama, ducha, aire acond, wifi, cocina, etc). Los dueños son viajeros y buena onda, el hostel tiene un patio muy lindo con pileta.
-

name: cuadra libre y tranquila
description:
a quiet place with little noise from the city, two blocks from the main square, few houses on this block and we did not have any problem in the several days we stayed.

___________________________

un lugar tranquilo con poco ruido de la ciudad, a dos cuadras de la plaza principal, pocas casas en esta cuadra y no tuvimos ningún inconveniente en los varios días que estuvimos.

name: Parque Guamal Magdalena Colombia
description:
It is a very safe place. Around there are different food sales and until 10pm there is music and many people in the park, after that it is a safe, quiet and pleasant place to spend the night

es un lugar muy seguro. Alrededor hay ventas diferentes de comida y hasta las 10pm hay música y muchas personas en el parque, después es un lugar seguro, silencioso y agradable para pasar la noche

name: Rumbos Hostel & Camping
description: very nice and cute little hostel and  campground, close to the Laguna Guatavita. You can pop your tent here and it also has a lot of space for campers. it's a bit muddy after rain but shouldn't be a problem. They have wifi and a bathroom with hot water. You can have breakfast here for a good price (between 8-10k). We paid 25k p.p.p.n. for a tent and a small car. The owner is very helpful and has traveled a lot through Colombia and south America. so he can give you good advices.

name: Gas Station Petromil
description:
good place to rest and spend the night. you can use the showers. It's on a main avenue so you're going to hear a lot of trucks go by. but you can be sure at all times
-----------------------
buen lugar para descansar y pasar la noche. puedes usar las duchas. está sobre una avenida principal entonces vas a escuchar muchos camiones pasar. pero puedes estar seguro en todo momento

name: Café Macondo
description: Very good coffee. You can have in any style in any method of extraction. One experience! Good pastry

name: Autoservicio Eléctrico Naranjo
description: This place was recommended by a local person in Sogamoso. We had an unexpected issue with our battery and had to find some help. Giovanny was extremely helpful. He quickly diagnosed the problem, took out the alternator and show me the issue. He offered me several possible solutions being the best one (considering my hurry) to buy a new alternator. He put me in contact with a spare part dealer in Bogotá and I was able to buy it and they send it through overnight delivery. Next day we had some fitting problems but he wisely found a solution. The owners of the place are great honest people and I was lucky to meet them. If you have alternator or battery problems don't hesitate in contacting them.

name: Planta de Agua Purificada
description: Water purifier place, they filled our jerry cans for free. not sure if they fill built-in water tanks.

name: Zunce Market Y Licorea
description: This place sells Garafones - 9K COP - in addition to beer and liquor.

name: Next to a Chapelthingy
description: Great place overlooking the valley, on the opposite side of the chapelthingy, you can pull up to a spot next to the road. Amazing view!

name: Mall Parking Lot
description: Off street seldom used mall parking lot, some shade, flat, good for tents or any size rig.  Free and safe.  Mall has A/C, large grocery store, and many restraunts, WIFI.  Major local attractions within walking distance.

name: La Hacienda el placer
description: Alfredo received me at his hacienda which is a small paradise in the beautiful canyon. Besides the campsite you have some natural pools and a beautiful little river that goes through his land. I could put my hammock covered for 15.000 COP and he served me fried fish for 20.000 COP. He is very friendly and also has rooms and is building cabañas which will be ready soon I guess.

name: Balneario EL CÓNDOR
description: Good place, very large parking lot, it is not camping but they allowed us to stay and provided bathrooms, electricity and water. Good and kind people. We recommend paying for the pool day and buying some food as a thank you

name: Valle Sagrado Barichara
description: Discover a breathtaking camping haven in Barichara, where stunning vistas abound. Immerse yourself in birdwatching, hiking, and daily activities. Engage in tranquil yoga sessions, bask in the serene beauty of nature, and relish the warmth of campfire gatherings. Indulge in therapeutic experiences that nurture the mind and body, surrounded by the natural wonders of this remarkable destination.

name: ATM - Banco Agrario
description:
ATM. Allows transactions of up to 2 million COP for foreign cards.

Both Cell and Internet data to this entire town was out for some of the time we were here though.

name: Terpel Station
description: Free, level, paved parking area, safe, at fuel station.

name: 2 water faucets here
description: The are 2 water faucets, 1st is outside the restaurant, right side, second is left side of the hotel building. Both seems tap.

name: Bike Park pasto
description: There is a bike park here. Here is the map. We didn’t go but on the map they explain level differente.

name: Hostal Cano Nevera
description:
We were directed to camp here by Doris, who organized our Cano Cristales tour. It is a restaurant (breakfast only?) and hostel, they have a few spaces to camp as well. Quiet, welcoming and simple. Basic bathrooms and nice cold shower (great after a hot day on a tour). 

Father and son Don Jorge and David also have their own tour agency and organize tours to the attractions in this area. They were very helpful with information. 

We paid 20K COP per person/night.

name: Road closure
description: On the way from Málaga there are several "siga y pare" stops, but everytime you can pass after few minutes. But here the road is closed for several hours - we came at 3pm and were said it is closed till 5pm! Maybe there are slots when you can go through as there was only 1 car waiting in front of us.

name: refrigerator & aircon repair
description:
repair of all refrigerators air conditioning washing machines
---------
reparación de todos los refris aire acondicionado  lavadoras

name: Caño Indio / Siete Machos
description:
This pin is the location of a peaje station where you can organize tours to Cano Canoas, Cano Indio, and Siete Machos. You also pay a community toll here of 15K COP, and a there is a restaurant/hospedaje across the street where we paid 30K COP for the two of us to camp in our truck. 

It appears to be quite rare that travellers make it this far on their own, most come on tours from La Macarena, however we were warmly welcomed by this community and were made to feel very safe and looked after. This is a 100% community-organized and run tourism operation managed by the small community of campesinos who live in this area. The fee to visit the sites is 100K COP per person for a wristband that allows access to the three sites. A guide is mandatory, the cost for the guide is 110K COP per site visited no matter the size of the group. We were told there are no guides who speak english, however they have interpreters available to hire. If you do not have space in your vehicle to transport the guide from here to the site, make that clear to the people who are finding the guide for you so they find one with a moto. 

We are a couple and visited 2 sites, so we paid 420K COP in total. While this is expensive, it is far cheaper than Cano Cristales, and all of the funds stay within this community that receives minimal support or resources from the government. 

See the Cano Canoas pin for details there. Siete Machos is close to this pin and is a beautiful canyon with many small to medium-sized waterfalls and large sections where the Macarena plant grows red yellow and green. The hike took us 3 ½ hours with several options to swim. The hiking is rough, a lot of slippery rocks and sketchy sections. While the hiking and access to the river is far less developed, we found Siete Machos as or more striking than Cano Cristales. It was high season and there we only saw one other group on this trail. 

Our guide Zenaida Zubieta studied tourism and started a tour agency. She can organize package tours with food and lodging if you want to try to pre-arrange your tour. She was excellent and can be contacted at +573144629547

It is closed during low/dry season and reopens in Semana Santa.

name: Route to Caño Canoas
description:
Made it all the way to La Macarena in your 4x4, and still want to go further? The incredible sites of Caño Canoas and Siete Machos, and other attractions lie 2 - 3 hours further. Things to know before you go: This is an independent community of campesinos who live with very little support from the government. The military or police are not present out there. There are community tolls on the roads as well as a community fee on visiting the attractions that go directly to support the maintenance of the roads, running of schools, and development of tourism. As participants in this tourism, we felt incredibly welcomed and invited in this community, but this is not a place to go to camp wild and try to avoid fees. We highly recommend getting current local information in La Macarena before driving this route. 

A high clearance 4x4 is required. In addition to the very rough and muddy state of the road depending on weather, the bridges are built by the community and must be evaluated individually, we needed to cross one muddy creek that was 40-60CM deep. (We had our guide with us for Cano Canoas at that point and she said the bridge is not safe for vehicles.)  

To get to Cano Indio and then to Cano Canoas, you must cross the Rio Guayabero on a ferry about 10KM east of La Macarena. Mapping apps will try to take you west of La Macarena, however this route is closed, it is only for the tourism operation to Cano Cristales. To get to the ferry, you want to drive through this pin. There is a large bridge well constructed bridge here, we were told the one over this river farther north is not in good shape. Then you want to drive toTres Esquinas and take a left, then the intersection located at 2.197584, -73.751518. We paid a toll of 10K COP there and carried on to the ferry over the Río Guayabero. The entry/exit to the ferry was a steep muddy slope where lumber was used to aid in getting on the ferry. From there  there is basically only one route north to Cano Canoas, where we stopped and returned, however it eventually goes to Vista Hermosa. Travel time is 2-3 hours La Macarena -Cano Canoas, and 4-5 hours Cano Canoas to Vista Hermosa. 

Have fun….

name: Hostal/Camping La Calera
description:
We are really excited to share this hidden gem. A great stop on the route to/from La Macarena, Hostal La Calera also could be a destination in its own right. 

At the entrance, there is a large open air restaurant with delicious food and views over the valley. The property is a decent sized finca that descends down to the Rio Hacha, with areas for camping and cabanas dispersed among fish ponds. Owner Dufrán owns a supercool old landrover with a pop-top and is very helpful with information about attractions in the area. They regularly host groups of Colombian campers on the weekend, though "there is always space" according to the owner. For our two stays during the week we had it to ourselves. The drive down to the camping area is paved with stones and concrete but very steep with a switchback in the middle. We used 4x4 low range to get out, if you have 2wd best to walk it first. There is also a height restriction, but it's pretty high, more than 3 m? 


The real gem is the access to the Rio Hacha. A 10 minute walk leads to a big sandy beach and giant pool in the river for swimming. A really beautiful spot for swimming, birdwatching, spending the afternoon in a hammock waiting for monkeys to come around. 

This is one of our best paid camp-spots in 7 months on the road! 

We paid 25K COP per person/night. 
Seems like you could show up anytime during daylight hours, but if you wish to contact ahead:
Whatsapp: +573102889948

name: La Finca de Don Mario
description: Camping on the hill, big grassy area, small swimming pool for extra cost, bathroom and sheltered place for cooking (just sink, no cooker). Beautiful view of the city. The road is quite steep and narrow but paved - not sure about RVs, height restriction at 3,5m on bridge.

name: Ibama Center
description: We have been here for 1 night, as we got lost in the darkness on our way to the emerald mines of Quipama and Muzo. Absolutely awesome people are living here. Offered us everything, a safe, flat place to park for the night, their private toilets, showers (didn’t use), food, drinks, their private wifi because there was no Claro signal,…. , and showed us the right way next day. I think no tourists coming here normally, so we were an attraction for the whole village. We really wished to speak better Spanish to talk more with them.

name: Pullout
description: There is a pullout on the lake side of the road that is pretty flat. We stayed here for about 24 hours since we did not want to pay at one of the spots closer to the water. No amenities and a bit of traffic, but it dies down overnight. We were here midweek so Calima Lake was pretty dead, not sure how this would be on a weekend.

name: Musichi pretty little village
description: Musichi Nice village bivouac quiet with the guide Luis Amilkar rosado Gonzales  you can see the flamands roses

name: Bucaramanga
description: the police told us that we can stay here Very quiet

name: Free Showers
description: Free public showers in large public sports complex.  Showers are in the Banos located under the viewing seats of the large indoor basketball and pickleball courts building, on the side away from the airport.  Multiple sources of drinking water available at this sports complex which has a large parking lot.

name: Finca la Chakira
description:
Safe and quiet place with contact with nature. recommended

Lugar seguro y tranquilo con contacto con la naturaleza. recomendado

name: Medellin
description:
The night costs between $25,000 to $30,000. the room is very simple, shared bathroom and kitchen, there are cockroaches in the place, but this is an option if you are on a low budget, you can leave your vehicle on the street without a problem, the lodging is in a pink building.

la noche vale entre $25.000 a $30.000 la habitación es muy simple,  baño y cocina compartido,  pero esta es una opción si esta con poco presupuesto,  en la calle puede dejar su vehículo sin problema, el hospedaje es un edificio de color rosado

name: Le Mani in Pasta (pizza, pasta, bread)
description:
this place has easily the best pizza we had in a couple of years. And we had many.

You'll be eating in their home, which makes the restaurant a bit hard to find (see pictures). Also usually they work on reservations as the place is quite small and the food fresh.

The guy's Italian and their handmade pasta is out of this world. I can't recommend this place enough :)

We asked if they bake bread and were told that we could preorder bread for the next day. Unfortunately we were on the run and therefore not able to test it. Although, I'm sure it's fantastic too.

prices for pizza/pasta at around 25000 - 35'000 cop.

This is their number: +573053282875

name: Scam in street of mechanics
description: Typical scam: Two guys on a motorbike tried to convince us that something was wrong with our van, by following us and repeatedly pointing on our tires. Don't fall for this trick in this area.

name: Previsora
description:
At Previsora, it was possible for us to renew a SOAT for a foreign-plated vehicle, and for as little as one month. 

However, the process of getting an appointment here is a bit complex! Apparently it’s been this way since 2022, so as the other SOAT entries in Cali are several years old, I thought it would be useful to share our experience.

Previsora give out 20 appointments each day, and in order to get one, you are supposed to queue up outside the office building before it opens. A security guard advised us that people usually arrive from 5am - we arrived shortly before 5 the next day, and several people were already there. I think they started around 4. At 7:30am someone came out and assigned everyone a number - the first 10 got an appointment in the morning, the other 10 in the afternoon (from 2pm). 

Besides this, the appointment itself was simple enough. We spoke to other insurance offices in the city, who seemed to have the same type of system - none were pre-booking any appointments. 

Maybe this will change at some point, but for now this seems the only way to get your insurance in Cali, so better to avoid doing it here if you have the option, and go to another city!

name: mirador público Tunja
description: It is a public place where you can see the entire city of Tunja, a very quiet place and few vehicles pass by, the nights are cold but very calm, it is behind the skating rink, we stayed for several days and it was very quiet.

name: Beach under bridge
description: Super sweet camping spot underneath the scenic bridge. If you are headed south, the road is to the right before you get to the bridge, then you head down a short but steep/not well maintained road before getting on a gravel path that leads down to the beach. We drove to the far end and had a very nice night without disruption. I would imagine you wouldn't want to sleep here if there is rain recently or in the forecast as it is a wash basin that likely could flood. The views are amazing though!

name: Metro
description: Great spot for grocery shopping! Has 3 atms, big open parking space. Good for tall vehicles we haven’t been to a big grocery store in so long that it was such a treat!

name: Gigante. El Recreo
description: Camping area and accommodation near Gigante

name: Hotel Villa Sara San Miguel
description:
Double room with ventilator for 60mil COP (third floor, nice view). safe parking. restaurant. very nice people. with pool, but we didnt use.
we came very late and needed something, happy to be here...

name: Tienda Granero Juanchito
description: There is a small shop here where we were able to buy Garafones of potable water to refill our tank.

name: Hotel Faro Azul
description:
Small hotel with a restaurant in Turbaco.
Rooms are simple but clean and have airco, tv, bathroom and cold shower. Wifi is ok.
We paid 80.000 for the two of us. 
Very friendly and helpful staff.

name: Plaza de Bolivar Restrictions
description:
On each corner of Plaza Bolivar are iron chains. It seems they are meant to restrict traffic flow, but there are no signs. Locals open and close the chains, but I have honestly no idea what the rules seem to be.
However, the risk is that Google maps or others may route you through Plaza Bolivar and three of four access roads are very steep. You may see the chains too late and/or get into a difficult maneuver situation. We just made it around one of the corners with our campervan (3.5 ton, 6 meters lomg). Bigger rigs may have real trouble.
