name: La Granja de Lia
description:
Spectacular and cozy place with natural pool.
--
Sitio espectacular y acogedor con piscina natural.

name: Entrance to the Cueva del Esplendor
description: The is a gate where you can enter cueva, but you need to pay first 20k pp. Kind of greedy, I've passed it. You can't avoid it.

name: Lubricentro
description: Very friendly guy changing and selling oil and filters. We had 11,5l and filter for 500000 cop. Instantly done. You can pay by card

name: Waterfall - El Cinco
description: Beautifull spot I found this place during my walk to the waterfalls El Cinco.

name: waterfalls lava
description:
absolutely nice waterfalls (same size as el Conco) and easy to reach. better then the El Cinco.
she is still building so it's free but in future she will ask a little money.
it's possible to sleep here as well with you camper,tent(you have to be flexible)or in 1 of the beautiful rooms!

name: Anolaima Travesia Extrema + Camping
description:
Fernando and his wife Adriana have a beautiful spot for camping and they also have small houses for rent (COP 175,000 PP), which includes breakfast in the morning. They also allow camping (COP 25,000 per night) Although they don’t have showers for campers yet, they are planning on building them in the future! They also have an amazing pizza restaurant where Fernando makes delicious Italian style pizza (some of the best we’ve had so far in Columbia)! They are such a sweet couple he would do whatever it takes to make you comfortable! We highly recommend staying here!! 

Fernando WhatsApp: +57 3108511999 (call before coming since they don’t live on property but live down the hill) 

They don’t speak English but want to learn! So bring your Spanish game! 

NOTE:  restaurant is only open on the weekends but ask them they might open if people are camping or staying in the casitas

For big rigs…camping is a big open grassy field but the turn in is a little tight, ask them before.

name: Jeep House
description: For us the best mechanic on our whole tour since Canada. Not only for Jeeps.They fixed everything  we needed from electric- to all other problems at our Unimog fast and perfectly. Very friendly crew. And the rate was the lowest ever! Highly recommended!

name: Flat terrain in El Tope
description: Nice large pace for picnics and parking next to a small store. We camped here for the night and it was a peaceful spot.

name: Hospedaje y Restaurante Donde Jose
description:
Very nice place along the road with a restaurant and new cabanas.
There is wifi in the restaurant.  Airco in the rooms.  One night for two persons is 40.000 cop
Friendly staff

name: Hotel Firenze
description:
Quite an expensive hotel for Colombian standards. We paid 168000 cop for a standard double room including breakfast. So it’s more luxurious than others. AC, wifi, TV fridge in your room.  There is a good restaurant in the hotel and they serve not only the colombian tipico food but also burgers, clubsandwiches etc. After a few days of cycling with eggs/patacones and rice we were craving for something different. 
There is a large secured parking and even a small gym. 

Right in front of the hotel is a shoppingcentre with a supermarket, dollarcity, ATM’s and some shops for clothes and shoes etc

We saw several hotels along the mainroad. More than iOverlander shows. 
The town is busy and is not very touristy.

name: Parking restaurant
description:
Super parking in face du lac. Passent taxis will return to the city. The terrain is not on the platform and is necessary for the streets.
--
Super parking en face du lac. Des taxis passent pour se rendre en ville. Le terrain n'est pas plat cela nécessite des cales.

name: Servifrenos Brakes Specialist
description:
Servifrenos Brake Specialist. 
Very clean and well organized workshop.
Is it possible to drive directly into the workshop, but please check width and height.

name: Hotel Casa Tres Cruses
description:
Nice boutique hotel in the centre with beautiful and cosy rooms.  We paid 125000 cop for a double room including breakfast. It was oke to take our bikes in the room.
Wifi, tv with netflix, airco.  Good bed !!

name: fogón de montaña
description:
a wonderful place on the way to Mocoa, the attention is excellent, the landscape spectacular

un sitio maravilloso en el camino a Mocoa , la atención es excelente, el paisaje espectacular

name: Terpel with potable Water
description: In front of the fuel bump (Diesel) you can find a tap to fill your tank with potable water.

name: Nalanda Campsite
description:
"The Valley of the Sylphs" is a private natural reserve 6km before the beautiful colonial village of Concepcion (national heritage site). It is a hidden gem if you love nature, absolutely quiet nights and incredible views of the mountains and valleys. 
There are waterfalls, pools and a natural forest to relax and swim. 
You still have to live with compromises at the moment, but there is a toilet and shower next to the eco lodge which is under construction, which is scheduled to go into operation mid-December 2023. 
You MUST call the owner in advance, Mariano is a wonderful host who also owns "The Secret Buddha Lodge" in Medellín (also on iOverlander. WA: +573128926521.)
To come here, 4x4 is recommended, big RVs can't go at the moment, road will be paved in 2024 ( so check with him for updates).

name: Beautiful Place, next to the sea
description:
We spent two nights here, beautiful, quiet and safe place. On weekends, especially on Sundays, there are many people. Good Claro signal. 
I recommend it.

———

Nos quedamos dos noches aquí, lugar hermoso, tranquilo y seguro. Los fines de semanas especialmente el domingo hay mucha gente. Buena señal de celular Claro. Se recomienda. 
Paramos abajo a 100 metros del final de la calle.

name: Aguachica, Hotel Nejaru
description:
Basic hotel in a nice and quiet neighborhood. Wifi is slow, AC, tv etc. Good shower and bed.
Hotel looks new and is very clean.

No window in the room.
Secure indoor parking. 
We paid 60.000 cop for a double.

name: la granja es lia
description:
excellent place, you can arrive by motorhome. It is recommended to call or write to Johan the owner at the number 3115306690. There is water, electricity and it is spectacular. The value is 10,000 per person per night.
---
excelente lugar, puedes llegar en motorhome. se recomienda llamar o escribirle a johan el propietario al numero 3115306690. hay agua, electricidad y es espectacular.  el valor es 10000 por persona las noche.

name: Ulucaho Hostel
description: A very cute hostel with friendly and caring people. Plus there's a little garden and cats.

name: Hotel royal
description: Hotel with everything you need to sleep and take a hot shower.

name: Hostal porvenir
description:
Good space with the possibility of dinner and breakfast.
Buen espacio con posibilidad de cenar y desayunar.

name: hostel de Sumapaz
description: Beb and breakfast. Great place to sleep for people passing through. Dinner and lunch available!

name: Tried Robbery
description:
Thre guys ond two motorbikes yelled at us that we are loosing Oil, then tried to stopp us. they wonted that we are stopping in a curve. I thold them that i will stop but just keept on driving. As we didnt stop one of the guys on the motorbike got realy angry, but i didnt take care and just keept driving. After that they turned around.
100% when you stopp they will rob you! Be careful!
of course there was not one drop of oil on my car...

name: Harmony Hotel
description: Hotel near border with secure garage parking and hot water. Free breakfast, dog friendly

name: Lavados Lavandería
description:
Excellent place for washing all kinds of clothing, they also wash all kinds of suitcases and briefcases as well as jackets, blankets and others, ask for the service you require since they have an attractive offer of cleaning services and even washing of vehicle upholstery, fast service and with a fair price. +573182747513
.....
Excelente sitio para el lavado de todo tipo de prendas de vestir, también lavan todo tipo de maletas y maletines así como chaquetas, cobijas y demás, pregunta por el servicio que requieras ya que tienen una atractiva oferta de servicios de limpieza e incluso lavado de tapiceria vehicular, servicio rápido y con un precio justo. +573182747513

name: Lavados Lavandería
description:
Translation: Excellent place to solve everything related to washing and drying all types of clothing, they also offer a suitcase and briefcase washing service as well as washing jackets and others.

Excelente sitio para resolver todo lo relacionado con el lavado y secado de todo tipo de ropa, también ofrecen servicio de lavado de maletas y maletines así como lavado de chaquetas y demas

name: EDS Terpel
description:
It is an EDS with an Altoque restaurant and has a faucet (key) available to fill water (water) of the RV. We fill 300 liters for free (free). We took the opportunity to tank diesel right there.

The key is next to the tire inflation point.

Es un EDS con un restaurante Altoque y tiene una llave (grifo) disponible para llenar agua (water) del RV. Nosotros llenamos 300 litros gratis (free). Aprovechamos para tanquear diesel ahí mismo. 
La llave está al lado del punto de inflado de llantas.

name: Parking Guadalupe
description: Opposite the Terpel gas station you can park and stay overnight. An older, nice man runs the place.

name: Restaurante La Alemana
description:
Restaurant and little tienda and they sell some bikeparts like tires and brakepads. Free cold water for cyclists.
Kind of Cafe de cyclista.

On the other side of the road is a supermarket.

name: Mirador del Chicamocha
description: Litttle restaurant with great view.  They also sell some artesanian bread and cookies.  Food is not really spectcular bit oke when you are a hungry cyclist climbing up this hill.

name: Alto de Aratoca
description: Good restaurant at the highest point of the route to San Gil. They serve delicious meals with fresh ingredients. Friendly staff.

name: Asados Doña Rosa
description: Huge restaurant with a big menu. Typical food, huge parking with lots of shade. There is also a drogueria right next to it. Food was delicious!

name: Edier‘s Workshop
description:
General mechanic fixing all type of problems on all types of cars. Very well equipped and huge network, for special tasks he includes colleagues or specialists. 
Edier has a great working manner. Very honest and transparent, kept us updated with videos and always kept in touch with us. Absolutely reasonable pricing. 
In total highly recommendable.

name: Cielo Parapente
description: Nice and safe Campground on the top of a hill. From here you have a wonderfull view to the Canyon del Río Magdalena. The owner offers Paragliding-Services. There is enough place for all kind of Overlanders. It is a must if you visit San Augustin.

name: Hospedaje beatriz
description: Very nice welcome, original environment, quiet and full of flowers.

name: Mogotes - Hotel La Casona
description:
Hotel/restaurant on the main square of Mogotes. Nice old colonial building in a friendly town.  We had a double room with own bathroom, tv, wifi for 70.000.  We could park our bicycles in the restaurant.

The restaurant wasn’t open when we were here but there are a few others next door.

Clean and friendly staff

name: El Rancherito
description:
A restaurant with a large parking lot. Park your car for free. The area is very quiet. there is a service station in front. Lunches from 18k COP, I slept one night without inconveniences, inside the restaurant there are bathrooms and you can work on your laptop, the people are generous.
.....
Es un restaurante con un gran Parquedero donde puedes ingresar Parquear tu auto sin valor, La zona es muy tranquila hay una Estación de servicio al frente Encuentras almuerzos desde 18k COP, Dormí una noche sin inconvenientes, dentro del restaurante hay baños y puedes trabajar en tu portátil, la gente es muy formal y generosa

name: Intento de estafa/robo
description:
On the road a motorcycle approaches with 2 men who tell us that we could not enter Armenia because they did not allow the circulation of cars or motorcycles that day (that was true), they put the motorcycle in front and we had to brake, one of them approaches. passenger side and tells us that one wheel was losing brake fluid. We decided to start and go the other way, we stopped at a Primax 2 blocks away, they followed us, they told us again about the fluid loss and that they had a workshop to check it. We didn't give it much importance and we told them that we were going to pay attention and they left. When we looked we had some fluid stained on the wheel but there are no traces of leakage from the brake system. It seems to be a common form of deception. Be careful

Sobre la ruta se acerca una moto con 2 hombres que nos dicen que no podíamos entrar a Armenia porque no permitían ese día circulación de carros o motos (eso era cierto), ponen la moto adelante y tuvimos que frenar, se acerca uno de ellos del lado del acompañante y nos dice que nos perdía líquido de freno una rueda. Decidimos arrancar e irnos hacia otro lado, paramos en una primax a 2 cuadras, nos siguen, nos vuelven a decir sobre la perdida del líquido y que tenían un taller para revisarlo. No le dimos mayor relevancia y le dijimos que nosotros nos íbamos a fijar y se fueron. 
Cuando miramos teníamos manchada la rueda con algún líquido pero no hay rastros de perdida desde el sistema de frenos.
Parece ser una forma frecuente de engaño. Tengan cuidado.

name: Entrance bosque de Pandora
description: This is the entrance to the trail of the pandora forests. The road to get here is small and all gravel. At the trailhead is enough space for 4 cars.

name: Checho's Place. Finca La Gloria
description: Nice and safe place to stay near Lejanias and Mesetas. Rio Güejar, rafting and sightseeing. Wonderful surroundings. Highly recommended.

name: Roadside opening
description:
Slightly overgrown small quarry site. Good to spent a night since not much is listed around here. Visible from road but quiet/cool/not a lot of bugs at night. 
Space for 2 medium sized rigs or 1 bigger rig. Along a typical dirt road, no 4x4 needed.

name: Garden of Hotel Agua Blanca
description:
We were the first overlander here, but they offered us to park in their garden next to the hotel. It’s a beautiful area next to the river and the garden also offers three trees for shade. 
The gate is quite narrow. We fit with a Fiat Ducato / Ram Promaster so every van should fit. The price is 25k ppn including use of the pool. It’s a beautiful place, check the photos.

name: parque principal belen
description: Quiet place next to the church, it has a mini blind block where any type of camper can fit, that is, the church rings the bells every hour, we believe, although nothing out of this world.

name: estación de gasolina Zeus
description:
At the back of the gas station there is a viewpoint, I asked for permission and without any problem I was able to stay one night with a great view, there are bathrooms, a restaurant and you can ask for water for whatever you need, it is a good place if you are passing through and need to rest for a while. evening. At 11:00 am the next day, the security guard asked me to please move the vehicle to another place because it is a commercial area. 

Al fondo de la estación de gasolina hay un mirador, pedí permiso y sin problema pude quedarme una noche con una gran vista, hay baños, restaurante y puedes pedir agua para lo que necesites, es un buen sitio si estás de paso y requieres descansar una noche. Siendo las 11:am del día siguiente, el guardia de seguridad me pidió el favor de mover el vehículo a otro lugar por que es una zona de comercio

name: Trailhead to Volcan Azufral/Laguna Verde
description:
You can park in front of the cabaña, which is actually an abandoned former ranger station. The parking lot is big enough for several rigs, but it's not that flat. But it's easy to level out your camper. The night was super quiet, we felt safe. No cellphone service.
The road up here is a dirt road and it get's a little narrow at the end. High clearance is recommended, but columbians drive in any kind of car.

Don't miss the hike to the Laguna (11km roundtrip). A sign on the other side of the entrance says its not allowed to walk to the volcano. We talked to locals and they said it's fine to hike to the laguna, we met about 15 other hikers on our way.

name: Horse Riding Salento Tour
description: here you can book wonderful horseback riding excursions. the horses are treated very well and are well trained. also highly recommended for beginners. there are different tours, we chose the 3 hour tour through the river for 90,000 cop ppn. it was an unforgettable experience, we can only recommend it. the family also owns the associated campsite

name: Robbery with knife at noon
description: Be careful in Tubarco. We were said it is safe to walk here if you don't have phone in hand. But the second day we were robbed by a guy with huge knife. He took a drone and phone from us and escaped with a friend on moto. Police told us it's not safe to walk in side streets. Only on the main shopping street in town.

name: Public Parking Minca
description: Daytime parking. No overnight staying allowed. Space for light vehicles or vans.

name: Taller Sanchez
description:
This garage (Taller) is a family business and can help you out with effectively any possible problem you might have with your car! They are specialized in Land Rover and 4x4 but can deal with any brand.

We got our 40 year old Land Rover Defender repaired by the Sanchez family and parts that are not available to buy they can get made locally! We stranded 500km away from Bogota but the family also arranged a semi-trailer to retrieve our car!

Extremely nice and helpful family run by father Armando, son Christian and uncle Alberto.
If they cannot fix it they know where to go and the same is true for any other business you might need to do or help you need in Bogota and surroundings!

We strongly recommend this garage and family!

To contact them you can use the WhatsApp of Christian Sanchez: +57 313 4727927

name: parque de soata
description:
quiet park and has a public water tap where you can get supplies, very quiet next to the police command
--------
parque tranquilo y cuenta con una llave de agua pública donde abastecerse, muy tranquilo al lado del Comando de policía

name: La Pintada
description: ATM struggle to find, but this on Calle 30A , a local.lady guided us!

name: Calle 51
description:
It is a large public space where you can park and sleep in a motorhome. There are a lot of motorcycles passing by, but it's pretty quiet. Diagonally, there is a business called Super, there they are very attentive to visitors and can help them with whatever they need in Bucaramanga.
---
Es un espacio público amplio dónde se puede parquear y dormir en motorhome. Pasan muchas motos, pero es bastante tranquilo. 
diagonal hay un negocio que se llama Súper, ahí son muy atentos con los visitantes y les pueden ayudar con lo que necesiten en Bucaramanga.

name: Space on the side of the road with view to the town
description: This is a space on the left side of the road, like 150 meters on the way up after the river. Pretty quiet, you hear the river sound from here and you are able to see the town.

name: Eco hotel Alazán
description:
Nice decent modern and clean hotel. I paid 60.000 for a single bed room (2p) airconditioning , a simular room with a ventilator is 50.000. I was alone so I don’t know if that affects the price.

Wifi works but cuts off frequently.

They have double bed rooms as well (4p).

I could park my bicycle in a safe common room, but with a bit of convincing I could park it in the room.

There is big safe parking for vehicles.

This town is full of hotels. I went for the best looking one and agreed with the price and I liked it. If you want to spend less, there are cheaper looking ones.

name: Bosque Pandora | tour and camping
description:
Pandora Forest when you see the sign, you have arrived  A place worth visiting. Remote and magnificent. 

Contact : Jose +57 314 322 210 6

The road to get here isn't the easiest, but we managed it without any issues with our Citroën Jumper, a 2WD. It's narrow and rugged, and even trucks and buses take the same route. We just had to take our time :)

The spot to park your vehicle is right along this small road with very little traffic. There's a small parking area in front of the sign. Edgard, the guide, will show you around the area, and you can enjoy the fantastic terrace and toilet/shower facilities.

They offer several outings:
- Vertical Hills: The Colombian Avatar. Unmissable and breathtaking.
- Cueva el Oro: The most famous one.
- Cueva La Trônera: Immense.

Each activity is around 60,000 pesos, and the price also depends on whether you choose to have a meal on-site or not.

The team is incredibly welcoming, accommodating, and lovely. We had one of our most beautiful moments here in Colombia.

name: Casa Las Abejas (Hotel Casa on Google)
description:
Central hotel with secure gated parking for motorcycles and cars (sorry, low garage door so not even small campers fit). Plus ok WiFi.
60,000 COP for double room, 2 persons/night.
Beautiful colonial Hotel that has most definitely seen better days. I love the rickety charm, but it's not for everyone. Totally clean though, desk, storage for clothes, hot suicide shower that actually gets real hot and was quiet at night. 
Plus playful cat that loves to be stroked.

name: Baloo motorcycle self wash
description: This is a selfwash place for motorcycles. For 3000 pesos you can wash your motorcycle. Really good and modern place.

name: Galeria Hopulus - German Brewery
description:
A real treat for those who like to enjoy a good German beer and a crunchy pretzel in a relaxed atmosphere.
In case the owner is on site, he may give you some valuable travel tips. He loves 4x4 off-road tours and is an excellent photographer (www.hopulus.co/pages/the-hopulus-experience)

name: Infront of a supermarket
description: I asked the owner David if it’s possible to park here for one night. No problem.for me it’s more safe and quite than on the Main Street to the park👍

name: Café de mi Tierra
description:
Cool colonial building with a coffeebar with really good Colombian coffee. In the evening there is a restaurant in the same courtyard with tasty “comidas rapidas” like pizza, hamburgers, hotdogs, fries and patacones with guacamole and pulled carne de res.  Very good and something different etc.

Wifi in the coffeebar is good

name: Greiautos Mecanica General
description:
AleJandro is a very nice, englisch speaking owner. He is very helpful and his mechanic guys do a really good job.
He made my front and rear brakes, oil & filter change and  Diesel filter. The whole for 760.000, while the oil was already 350.000
They made a really good job.

name: Hotel el Real
description:
Simple and clean hotel. Good WiFi. No parking. My room didn’t have aircon or a ventilator, but it was less warm as I thought at night.

The lady that helped me was nice, but she tried me out if I could pay more. I asked for the cheapest room and first she wanted to show me the 60.000 pesos room. I told here I was looking for something more cheap, then it turned out she had a 1 person room as well. First she said 40.000, but finally I paid 35.000. Which is the regular price I think. Just be careful what you pay.

My bicycle fitted inside the room. 

There are several other hotels in town as well. I didn’t checked them out.

name: poromana
description:
It is a Wayuu Indigenous community.

Where people are very cute and friendly

There's good shade and a lot of tranquility

Try to contact Professor Eli +573226044918

You can get energy and there's a river 500 meters away

The children are very friendly

There's Internet at school where you can connect

------------------------------

Es una comunidad Indígena Wayuu
donde la gente es muy linda y amigable 
hay buena sombra y mucha tranquilidad 
tratar de contactar al Profesor Eli +573226044918 
te pueden pasar energía y hay un río a 500 metros 
los niños son muy amigables 
tiene Internet en la escuela donde te puedes conectar

name: Doctor Guau
description:
To make the certificate of good health to travel to another country. It cost $180 thousand pesos. Done quickly, they provide a physical copy, a digital copy and also send the document on the ICA page. They give all the instructions for creating the document. You need to schedule an appointment. Telephone: +57 317 3420175

--------------------------------------

Para fazer o certificado de boa saúde para viajar para outro país. Custou $180 mil pesos. Feito rapidamente, dão cópia física, cópia digital e já enviam também o documento na página do ICA. Dão todas as orientações para fazer o documento. Precisa agendar horário. Telefone: +57 317 3420175

name: ATV Quad Bikes Tour
description:
Do you want to live a unique experience in San Agustín, Huila? Join our ATV adventure tour and discover the most impressive tourist sites in the region! Explore the natural and archaeological beauty of St. Augustine while having fun on an exciting ATV adventure. Visit the tourist sites of La Chaquira (sculptures in the canyon), La Pelota (mountain sculptures), El Purutal (colorful sculptures) and much more. The tour guide will take you along the safest paths and will provide you with interesting information at the tourist sites about the history and culture of the region. Don't miss this unique opportunity to explore St. Augustine in a different way! Book your ATV tour today.

Approximate tour duration: 3-4 hours 
ATVs: automatic, easy handling 
route difficulty: medium

includes: 
-Private guide 
-Medical insurance 
-helmets 
-parking lot 
-gasoline 
-ATV for 2 people

All-inclusive price: 250,000 COP (1 or 2 people in 1 ATV). 
Ask about the discount price for Overlanders

Location: Hotel & Camping La Cumbre Del Macizo San Agustin 
phone: +57 3204780261

www.cuatrimotossanagustin.com

name: Villa Margarita - Glife Apartments
description:
Several apartments of Glife, located in Villa Margarita complex.
Manga neighborhood has small shops, restaurants, car wash, etc. and seems safe, even at night. 
Taxi ride to the historic center is approx. 10 minutes.
It has one larger parking spot in front of the building, outside the gate. It can be useful for persons with a campervan who want to have their vehicle close to an apartment.

name: Ticket Office for Leticia  to Manaus
description:
Here you can buy the tickets for the fast and the slow ferry. It's all fairly easy. Tickets for the vehicle must be purchased directly at the vessel.
Take a Mototaxi to get here.
Deck passage 250real, cabin 750real for the slow ferry, plus 10% if you want to pay eith credit card. That includes meals, bring own dishes.

name: street parking
description: Quiet street next to a hotel, police around the corner, which we asked if it is ok. nothing fancy but we had a calm Saturday night

name: Hospedaje El Campanario
description:
Small hotel/hostel near the main square of a friendly little village.  
Hotel is very clean, good beds and the staff is very friendly.  We could store our bikes in the bar of the hotel, which was closed. We paid 80.000 for a room with a double bed with own bathroom. 
Wifi is good. 

Around and near the mainsquare there are coffeebars, tiendas, panaderia’s and little restaurants.

name: CONFORD CENTER Mecánico Ford
description: Mechanic specialised on Ford, very quick, very helpful, very friendly, professional work. Better ask for 1) price of "repuestos" (spare parts) and 2) price of "mano de obra"(working time) first. He first wanted to "gringoe" us with the "mano de obras", but we could talk to him and lower the price to a reasonable one. Right next to his workshop is a parking lot that fits for big rigs, there we could stay for the repair.

name: Hotel Maria Fernanda
description:
Quite a fancy hotel with swimming pools and luxury rooms. 
We treated ourselves after a long and heavy day on our bikes. 
We paid 80.000 per person after a bit of negotiation. A good breakfast is included. 
Wifi, tv, hot shower etc.

name: Solujer Llantas
description:
We changed the tires on our VW Kombi (185/70 r14) here, COP 270,000 each.  Excellent service, fast, friendly staff, accepts payment by credit card.  Contact Arturo +57 320 7202283

Trocamos os pneus da nossa VW Kombi (185/70r14) aqui, COP 270.000 cada. Atendimento excelente, serviço rápido, aceita pagamento com cartão de crédito. Contato Arturo +57 320 7202283

name: Banco Union - Western Union
description:
Place to get Colombian pesos via Western Union, super easy, great service.
---------
Local para saques em pesos colombianos pela Western Union, super fácil, ótimo atendimento.

name: near termales san vicente
description: Flat place close to the thermales san vicente . Safe, not to much noise .

name: Hotel campestre del Angel
description: The most lovely little hotel/ bed and breakfast with an amazing view. It is just of the main road, but since it is located high above it, you will barely notice it. The owner is very nice, and has decorated the place very cute.

name: Altamira biohotel
description: Great site, the owner are very friendly, good site for camping and overland, pool and water available, excellent site, contact 3174409510

name: Restaurant and Hotel El Bosque
description: A good hotel, clean, quiet and the people are friendly. 80000 pesos per room with double bed.

name: San Lucas Centro Veterinário y Diagnóstico
description:
Complete veterinary clinic, laboratory and imaging exams.  Great service, we brought our dog for a checkup and we really enjoyed it.  Very attentive veterinarians. 24h

Clínica veterinária completa, exames de laboratório e de imagem. Ótimo atendimento, trouxemos nossa cachorrinha para fazer um checkup e gostamos muito. Veterinários bastante atenciosos. 24h

name: EDS La Playita
description:
We stayed there for almost a week. We got a deal for $10,000 COP per night per car. It is possible to get a shower for $ 3.000 COP.

Even you can go to the town on a motorcycle for $ 8.000 COP round trip

Friendly people and quiet place

Oct. 23

name: Extrema aventura
description:
Extreme sport above an 860m canyon. Bungee jumping, zip line, bicicable…. Recommended
-----------
Sport extrême au dessus d’un canyon de 860m. Saut à l’élastique, tyrolienne, bicicable…. Recommanded

name: Treegana hostal
description:
Superb place run by Arnaud (a Frenchman) and his Colombian wife. A little paradise, with its natural swimming pool, its tree houses. His house with different bedrooms and shared bathroom. It is also possible to sleep in a tent or hammock. A kitchen area available and a restaurant. 1 km from the port. RECOMMENDED +++
--------
Superbe endroit tenu par Arnaud (un français) et sa femme colombienne. Un petit paradis, avec sa piscine naturelle, ses cabanes dans les arbres. Sa maison avec différentes chambres et salle de bain commune. Possibilité aussi de dormir en tente ou en hamac. Un espace cuisine à disposition et un restaurant. A 1 km du port. RECOMMANDED +++

name: Posada ecoturistica la mona
description:
Superb place by the sea, with pretty colorful cabins. Sandra is very welcoming. She organizes tours to see the leatherback turtles laying eggs as well as the baby turtles returning to the sea. Very good meal and breakfast. Accessible on foot or by boat RECOMMENDED+++
--------
Superbe endroit au bord de la mer, avec de jolies cabanes colorées. Sandra est très accueillante. Elle organise les tours pour voir la ponte des tortues luth ainsi que les bébés tortues qui rejoignent la mer. Très bon repas et petit dej. Accessible à pied ou en bateau RECOMMANDED+++

name: Hotel Orígenes
description: Fancy hotel on the mainsquare of Arcabuco. Luxury rooms. We had the cheapest room for 165.000 cop.  Breakfast included. Indoor parking, elevator

name: Trattoria Villa Venezia
description:
Italian restaurant with delicious home made products. The owner is an Italian and makes the artesian food.
Homemade ravioli, real tiramisu, espresso, limocello …… the perfect place for the real italian food lover

name: Hospedaje Linda Mariana
description: 30,000 pesos for a room with 2 beds, private bathroom, TV. There are rooms with one bed as well, but the lady at the desk was very kind and let me use a bigger room so that I can bring my bicycle into my room. Nothing fancy but  clean linen and a good night to rest.

name: Road from Alejandria to Santo Domingo
description: Road is closed with no prior warnings. There is a 'detour' which is a steep, slippery walking path that you can get through with a motorbike if it's light & you are confident on it.

name: Hotel San Luis Sachica
description:
Clean and good hotel on the main road through Sachica. Spacious rooms and nice bathroom with good showers. 
There is a little swimming pool/jacuzzi, indoors. We paid 180000 for a double room including breakfast.

name: Flat parking lot
description: I stayed here at a flat parking lot,I think it will be quite in the night,but the other campground I couldn’t find or it was closed…nice view here and the restaurant is close.

name: Hospedaje Santa Barbara
description:
In front of the monestry is a little square with a few little tienda’s and a kind of restaurant.  There are two hospedajes on the square. Sant Barbara was the only one which was open. It’s a beautiful house with modern and spacious rooms. Beautiful bathroom. Quite luxurious.  We had to pay 160000 for a double room. We could park our bicycles in the garage.

The lady of the house is very helpful.

We visited the monestry as well but it’s a long storytelling trip along the paintings.  It”s a kind of spiritual centre for people who wants a retreat or so.

name: Posadas Tashikewo
description: Posada in an old farmhouse. All kind of farm animals and cats and dogs play around on the property, very amusing to see. We stayed one night, and we were not cold at night altough the rooms were not heated here. Plenty of blankets were provided to keep warm. We had breakfast an dinner, which were both very simple and traditional, but that very much was in line with the surroundings. The host was also very nice, he greeted us with coffee when we arrived.

name: La casona de xué
description:
Translation: Family atmosphere, located in the lower part of the Sutatausa cliffs, large parking lot, bonfire, grills, restaurant, hot water, bar

Ambiente familiar, en ubicado en la parte baja de los farallones de sutatausa, estacionamiento grande, fogata, asadores, restaurante, agua caliente, bar

name: Área de Serviço/ Descanso
description:
Excellent support point on the alternative road to Medellin, good road, not busy, several parking spaces, clean bathrooms, restaurant, public Wi-Fi and incredible upload speed.  We were just going to stop for a coffee and decided to stay for the night.
.....
Excelente ponto de apoio na estrada alternativa para Medellin, estrada boa, sem movimento, várias vagas de estacionamento, banheiros limpos, restaurante, wi-fi público e com velocidade de uploads incrível. íamos parar apenas para tomar um café e decidimos ficar para passar a noite.

name: Plaza Principal
description: Stayed here for a very quiet night and left our car here during the hike to the Gachas. there is a restaurant/cafeteria and in the Museo Cultura there are toilets as well. there should also be public wifi but it didn't work when we were there.

name: Hostal Sol de Verano
description: Incredible place at the foot of the desert, good attention and services. There is a restaurant and rooms. Excellent place for campers

name: Casa de la Abuela
description:
Stayed here 1 night while traveling alone (woman) with my bike.
Paid 25k for shared bedroom, maybe can be negotiated better.
Wifi, bathroom, shower, access to kitchen, great views and nice location to do some trekking to Paso del Mango or others

name: La Zona Food Container
description:
Location that accepts travellers in trailers, camper van, motorcycle passengers, overlanders, etc. Price per vehicle per day $10. 000 Colombian pesos to the date of October 2023. Attended by John Claros and his working group including Ariel and his family from Argentina. It has a camping area, cabins, swimming pool, parking lot, gastrobar. Close to different tourist sites (Salto del Mortiño, San Agustin Archaeological Park, Magdalena Strait and much more).
.....
Lugar que acepta viajeros en casa rodante, camper van, motoviajeros, overlander, etc. Precio por vehiculo al dia $10.000 pesos Colombianos a la fecha de octubre 2023. Atendido por John Claros y su grupo de trabajo incluyendo Ariel y su familia Argentina. Cuenta con Zona de camping, Cabañas, piscina, parqueadero, gastrobar. Cerca a diferentes sitios turísticos (Salto del Mortiño, Parque arqueológico de San Agustín, estrecho del Magdalena y mucho mas)

name: Hotel Central
description:
30k for a simple room without a/c, with fan.
Everything ok, private room & bathroom.
They allow parking bikes and motorbikes inside the place.
Ok for women traveling alone

name: Posada de San Antonio - Raquirá
description:
A nice and clean hotel in the centre of Raquirá, run by a very friendly and welcoming family. They rent out a few apartments with a living, bedroom(s) kitchen and own bathroom.  TV, good wifi, secure parking available. We parked our bicycles inside. 

Andrés speaks good English and invited us to the pottery/factory of his parents.  
This pottery is what  Raquirá is famous for. 

There is also the possibility to do your laundry.
We payed 130.000 cop for the two of us for the whole appartment.

Close to restaurants, ATM and tienda’s/supermercado

name: Cou Cou - organic shop
description: Organic coffee, cake, chocolate and sandwiches

name: hospedaje Casa Eventos José
description: José's hospedaje is very pleasant, a warm place with a garden and good food. The room has sanitary facilities, a hot shower and is clean. Bikes can be brought into the room, and wifi works well. The price for a couple is around 50k. And José is very kind and caring.

name: Estación Primax
description:
Perfect to spend a night. There is a truckers' hotel, so they let us use the shower for COP $10,000. The parking is back from the main road, so we slept well. The manager's name is Luis

Perfecto para pasar una noche. Hay un hotel de camioneros, así que nos dejaron usar la ducha por COP $10.000 está retirado de la principal, así que dormimos bien. El encargado se llama Luis

name: PetroMil gas station
description:
Nice place to stay, quiet at night, big space for parking.
sofas in the inside, clean bathroom, wifi

Buen ligar para quedarse, tranquilo por la noche, gran espacio para estacionar
Sofas en el interior, baños limpios, wifi

name: La Florida Casona Hotel
description: Very nice, clean and spacious quality Hotel in the middle of Socha. Ideal for Motorcycle and Bicycle traveller. Safe parking in the locked hotel parking. Nice bathroom with hot shower. Payed 100k including breakfast as a solo traveler in the double room. Not cheap but worth the money.

name: Peñaflor Casa Campestre
description:
Beautiful colonial country house, a fantastic place where you can enjoy a pleasant stay overlooking the Guáitara River canyon, with large spaces full of energy that will allow you to rest and have the opportunity to visit the Majestic Sanctuary of Las Lajas just 2 km from distance, in addition to the proximity to regional gastronomic centers. 

Country, quiet environment, enjoy the sound of nature without interruptions. 

Breakfast can be requested from the host at an additional cost.

Contact Monica: +57 311 4646643

name: Hostal El Paujill
description:
The place has two little cabanas. The one we slept in has 3 rooms with queen size beds. We had to park our motorcycles on the other side of the river  under a roof at the house of the grandmother of the hosts. We had to cross the shallow river on foot, very cool experience. The family cooked a delicious meal for us and served a great breakfast as well. They also offered to show us the canyon the la Cristalina, but unfortunately we did not have time for that.

To get there take the path (not in Google maps) that is marked with a pretty big signpost in one of the corners of the main road.

name: Lavanderia Alejusa
description:
Nice lady! Very quick full service, took 2.5 hours for about 11 kg laundry, 56k for 11 kg. Highly recommended!

Address: Carrera 8c Calle 65b, Cra. 8, Ibagué, Tolima

Whatsapp: +57 3142678139

name: Hospedaje Aquel Almendro
description: 50,000 pesos for a single person. Very clean rooms and the staff are nice and professional. The owner was an amazing person as well. TV with NETFLIX, Amazon TV, etc., wifi, fan. I had to rest due to some illness but it was the perfect place to recover. Highly recommended.

name: Francisco, mechanic specialised on brakes
description:
Francisco is specialised on all kinds of brakes, he has been working in this field for 48 years. 
Quick and very helpful and friendly, we had a diagnosis + solution of the problem within some hours! Highly recommended! 

His wofkshop is in the back if a parking lot. There are no signs, jzst ask for Francisco.
Contact him on Whatsapp before going to see him, at the moment he has a temporary workshop and might move to another (permanent) place in Armenia soon.

Whatsapp: +57 320 6381500

name: Lubricantes Edward
description: We needed an oil change and then noticed we also needed a new battery. Excellent service. Super friendly and helpful people. Can totally recommend this place!

name: Motorcycle Tours (Adrenaline Addicts)
description:
Adrenaline Addicts in San Gil.

We booked the two day Mesa Santos motorcycle tour there and had the most amazing experience!!! 
With almost zero previous riding experience and no extra license we had such a good time driving up and down the Chicamocha Canyon on those Honda Navis. - There’s bigger bikes for those with a license as well ;)
We also have been able to ride quite a bit of off-road routes which led through the most beautiful landscapes. It was sooo fun!!! 

Our Guide Andy was just awesome and he totally customized the tour to our interests. So we drove a bit more off-road and also organized a climbing session for us the first day.
He took us to swimming places usually tourists don’t visit and got us really delicious food. 
He is genuinely excited himself about the places and foods he showed us which makes it even more legit ;)
Also Andy speaks English fluently and is happy to tell you more about Colombia and its culture!

For us it was a great way to experience Colombia! Since most of the people here are riding on two wheels, it gave us a different perspective from driving in our van all the time!

name: La Casona Camping
description:
Huge gravel park behind the hotel.
We were looking for a place with internet and we found this one. The owner asks for 20.000 per night. The place is suitable for any vehicle. Smaller ones (under 2.7 mt high) can also fit under the shade (which is very helpful since this part of Colombia is crazy hot). Internet is fast and water is available. Nothing fancy but quiet, convenient and secure (the place is gated).
They don't have a bathroom for vanlifers but they also have rooms available. Ask for Rodolfo.

name: Casa de Campo Los Cactus
description: It's a cliche but this is a fantastic oasis in the desert. coffee on tap, awesome home-cooked food. Buildings made from reclaimed items and it's worth visiting just for the dinosaur shower! Great value, 90 per night for 2 of us. food served 3 times a day and they have beer, sodas and jugo natuales. Friendly staff. 5 mins car/ 10 min walk to observatory. so many areas to chill here too, in the shade.

name: Scott Bicycle Shop
description: At lunchtime we arrived and asked if they could repair our bike today. they did,  we had our own bike specific parts which they happily fitted. very friendly and helpful. done same day

name: Hotel Boutique Albania
description:
Nice private Hotel with 4 double rooms. 
Pool is under construction. Safe parking for motorbikes and cars. 
Very nice owner how can also take you for an excursion to the emerald mine. 
Payed 8k for a night alone in the double room

name: Playa Divina
description:
Hotel with good facilities facing the beach, includes breakfast

___________________________

Hotel con buenas instalaciones frente a la playa, incluye desayuno

name: MJ Servicio Automotriz
description:
Miguel Ángel has his own mechanic store in Cali and he helped us a lot. On a Saturday he was able to arrange new break discs for our Renault Master. He installed them right away, filled up the break liquid again and did a test drive with us as well. 👍🏻 We can highly recommend him and we are more than thankful for his assistance.

Miguel es un mecánico en Cali con propio taller. Nos ayudaba mucho y encontró nuevos discos de freno en un sábado. Los instaló inmediatamente y dió una vuelta con nosotros para ver si todo funciona bien. 👍🏻

Su número de teléfono es: +57 (312) 891-9576

name: Hospedaje Puerta Grande - Motor Home
description:
Economical accommodation, you also receive a Home motor at a reasonable price of one dollar per day or two per 24 hours. Cell phone 3183172769 Erwin and 3182934716 Andrea are very friendly and coordinate all the tourist sites and also if you love fishing they will help you rent their boat.

___________________________

Hospedaje económico, además recibe motor Home a módico precio de un dólar por dia o dos por 24 horas. Celular 3183172769 Erwin y 3182934716 Andrea son muy amables y coordinan todos los sitios turísticos y además si amas la pesca ellos te ayudan para alquilar su barco.

name: La Patrona Restaurante
description:
A special place to eat, with good parking, suitable for RVs.  Although they do not usually offer it, they allow you to spend the night.  Hernan is a very nice host.  You can call him at cell phone 3132668326.
.....
Un sitio especial para comer, con un buen parqueadero, apto para casas rodantes. Aunque no lo ofrecen,  permiten pasar la noche. Hernan es un excelente anfitrión. Lo pueden llamar al celular 3132668326.

name: Bio Habitat Hotel
description: One of the best hotels we've visited in this region. A good experience. the hotel is immersed in lush tropical vegetation. A place to relax, enjoy delicious food and great views over the city and mountains. the whole place is an experience. highly recommend it. You could also book just for lunch dinner or even breakfast and enjoy a great moment on your way to Salento.

name: Frana Lodge
description:
Frana Home is an eco-boutique hotel with magical views over the tropical forest and the Tayrona Park.  The hotel is a 15-minute walk from the main road. They are surrounded by rivers, waterfalls and great biodiversity.  The best view in the area!

Accommodation
We offer four big rooms with spacious bathrooms which allows us to offer a personalized service, with comfort and food made with love for all tastes.  The common spaces are large, open and provide different views onto the rainforest and upto the Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta. Each room has very spacious bathrooms with hot water for cool nights, large and excellent quality beds, with mosquito net. Prices start at 300.000 pesos breakfast included. Check the booking App for more informations

name: Gigante Huila Gas Station
description: Wide camp ground With many options to have a nice night. 24 hours open. Safe and a little bit noisy.

name: Villa Meron
description:
Villa Meron 
Very comfortable cabins, for couples
---
Cabañas muy cómodas, para parejas

name: Cascada santa rita
description: Camping, hiking, waterfalls, bird watching, salento, cócora, Quindío

name: Santani Casa de Descanso
description:
Nice Airbnb loft that could be a great break for motorcycle travelers looking to recharge after hectic days in Medellin or Cartagena. Usually I wouldn’t add this type of place, it was about $50USD on Airbnb. But it’s special enough to warrant a look. The place is a ground floor loft style accommodation with two bedrooms, a huge master suite, and a secondary bedroom with 2 beds. It has a large kitchen, and a large outdoor area. The outdoor area has a fabulous private jacuzzi which is really the highlight. You feel like you’re in a super high end loft here, which for the price is pretty remarkable.

You could park up to 4 or 5 motos in the secure inner parking area, so this might be a great crash pad for a group of motos traveling together. You could probably fit a normal size Car or smaller 4x4 easily as well, but the gate might be a clearance issue. Look for it on Airbnb or possibly via WhatsApp: +57 323 3639951

name: Sra Mariana
description: Small place, under construction of a country hostel, safe, with hot water bath service, restaurant and camping site. Cost of 20 m per night, friendly, helpful people, wooden cabins and warm welcome that contrasts with the cold climate of the environment near Nevado del Ruiz. I advise it

name: Corrupt police
description: Police car stopped us on the highway and claimed we used the phone while driving. Checked all our documents. We pretended not to speak spanish, stayed friendly and patient. After 10 minutes he finally let us go.

name: San Andrés de Cuerquia, estación de bomberos
description:
Fire brigade station. Safe place to park. They offer water and WC.
No place for tents, just mobile home.

name: Jeeptours to Coffee Farms etc.
description:
Here is a little Touristoffice where you can buy tickets f.e. for all the coffee tours around Salento and much more.

The times and different farms are hanging on the outside of the little house. 

The prices are good (f.e. Coffee Tour to organic Las Acacias Coffee Farm incl. transfer around 7€ p.P.) 

You can also just ask for what you want and to where you want and they will help you. 

Enjoy :)

name: CampingOJardin
description:
Please call us to book +57 316 506 86 77 (phone / WhatsApp)

Our campsite, accessible directly from Cartagena de Indias (10 minutes from the enter 10kms ) , can accommodate tents or all kinds of vehicles.
Located in the countryside, you will have the opportunity to relax in peace and prepare your shipping in a big area, with 2 showers and 2 toilets.

Price per person for the night :
1 person : 25.000pesos
2 persons : 45.000pesos
additional person : 20.000pesos
Parking : 25.000pesos

Additional services:
Electricity  110v or 220v : 10.000pesos
Laundry service : 7.000pesos/kg
High-speed satellite internet.
Filling water
Outdoor kitchen.

Storage by day, week or month.
Room for 2 persons.
Taxi to Cartagena center/port/airport/provider/DIAN... available upon reservation.
Administrative assistance for shipping and customs procedures.

The campsite, upon reservation, offers meals. French family cuisine is on the menu.

For reasons of security and peace of mind for other travelers, we ask you to respect exit and arrival times.

We offer a DIY service to secure your vehicle for shipping. (Price on quote) 

We do not have a childcare service. 

Important recommendation ! 
if you don't like the heat, the rain, the insects, the tropical animals... Don't come to the Caribbean area. 
This pretext will not entitle you to a rebate.

name: Hotel San Agustin
description: Fantastic spot of cyclists. Massive locked area in front of our room to chill in, work on bikes, cook food. Room small, though they kept offering us a bigger room as people left, we'd arrived super early. We were happy tho. WiFi good, shower cool. Owners so kind, like a mom and pop. just used the washing machine, Tom working at a desk they found him, hammocks to relax in too. Quiet on a night, highly recommended

name: Mirador Laguna Tota
description:
A large viewpoint in the lagoon for several motorhomes. It's quite lonely, few people pass by, very quiet. The lake is next door and there is a great view. Free, there is no one around.
-------
Un mirador en la laguna amplio para varios motorhome. Es bastante solo, pasa poca gente, muy tranquilo. El lago queda al lado y hay una gran vista. Gratis, no hay nadie cerca.

name: Casa de Campo Agua Viva
description: Lovely country side house with good space for small to midsized vans, owners allow gated parking with access to bathrooms and they even have a swimming pool. We did it for $40,000 Colombian pesos per person for the night.

name: AutoVidrios
description:
Got a new windowshield (front) here. Paid 850.000COL (VW Crafter). 

Was recommended by Edier (very good mechanic in Pereira). 

Phone number for questions via WhatsApp - you can find it on the back of the guy in one of the pictures :)

name: Punctured Tire Scam
description: While we were waiting at a red traffic light, a guy on a moped moved by really close to our car and after the traffic light the air went out of our tire really quickly. Another really pushy guy came and wanted us to come with him. Our luck was, that we parked in front of a fire station and the men helped us. The fireman told us that these pushy guys puncture your tires and either want to have way too much money to repair the tires or rob you. They also said that we should call the police if something like that happens again.

name: agua potable
description:
At this point there is a supply of drinking water to tanker trucks, and individuals who come with their tanks. Very good pressure. We ask you to fill the motorhome tank without problem
----------
En este punto hay abastecimiento de agua potable a camiones cisterna, y particulares que vienen con sus tanques. Muy buena presión. pedimos llenar el tanque del motorhome sin problema

name: Tottos Pizza
description: a small cafe on the corner. pizza by the slice 7COP great coffee and cake. smaller choice than some but great quality,  also bread, ice cream and juices etc

name: San Cayetano gas Station Primax
description:
Very quiet and safe place. There're showers at the station. D1 Supermarket, very large and comfortable. Very close to the La Calera Municipality. 

Lugar muy tranquilo y seguro. hay duchas en la estación. supermercado D1, muy amplio y confortable. Muy cerca municipio de La Calera

name: Terpel Station
description: Good place on the route with bathrooms with energy service.

name: Êxito - Banco Union (Western union)
description:
Western Union inside the Êxito supermarket.

Agência Western Union dentro do supermercado Êxito.

name: Local Gym
description: Small gym with showers. The owner is lovely. Just a short walk from the main car park at the entry of the town and central plaza. 8000 COP for a day pass; 30,000 COP for a week. Weekdays open 5am - 10pm. Weekends closes at 1pm. Ideal for a morning workout and shower if you're vanlifing.

name: Bank of Colombia
description: Only ATM we could find that lets you withdraw a reasonable amount

name: Fix Moto Workshop
description:
This motorbike workshop is specialized in KTM and Husqvarna bikes, but also does Kawasaki, Yamaha and Honda.

They are also the workshop for the official KTM/Husky dealer in Chia (Bike Project Shop).

Larry, the mechanic, is a really nice guy and knows his stuff well. It is a new workshop (about 5 months as of November 23), it's a clean place and well equipped. They also have the KTM and Husqvarna diagnostics tool, which many places don't.

We had our two 701 Enduro LRs there. One got new piston rings, valves adjusted and a few small things, the other had the gear sensors recalibrated and valves as well. Manual labour cost for the first bike (piston rings, valves, small stuff) was 650.000 cop. So prices are fair for professional work like this. On top I was also allowed to "help" (meaning I got to learn from Larry while pestering him with questions.)

Larry does not speak english, but his business partner from the workshop does. He's also a really nice guy, very kind. Highly recommended. Say Hi from Tim when you go there.

contact info:

Larrys phone (whatsapp too): +57 321 5663219

https://maps.app.goo.gl/gc1V3hWuToVkNSZu8

https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100093348065337&mibextid=ZbWKwL

name: Terpel
description:
Translation: Terpel gas station, the only one not brought from El Leon.

Posto de gasolina Terpel, único no trajeto desde El Leon.

name: Peter’s Garage
description:
He helped me to fix a lot of stuff after I drove from USA to Colombia.
He is expert in fiat Ducato but also other brands.
Very friendly, he knows is job and the price is good.

name: La Roca Hotel
description:
Simple but decent hotel before Juanambú bridge. Next to the road (Panamericana, 25) so expect a traffic and some noise. There is a restaurant and small shop at the spot.

Price for a double room was 35k COP, there are towels, small soap and rooms are on 2nd floor. It has a 'terrace' with nice view on the valley.

name: Road works
description:
Road under construction, avoid driving at night, especially after rainy days.  We passed here after a night of heavy rain and it was very muddy, despite many employees working on the site we found it very dangerous.

Estrada em obras, evite dirigir a noite principalmente após dias chuvosos. Passamos aqui após uma noite de chuva intensa e estava muito lamacento, apesar de muitos funcionários trabalhando na obra achamos bem perigoso.

name: Road Works (finish)
description:
Road under construction, avoid driving at night, especially after rainy days.  We passed here after a night of heavy rain and it was very muddy, despite many employees working on the site we found it very dangerous.

Estrada em construção, evite dirigir à noite, principalmente após dias de chuva.  Passamos por aqui depois de uma noite de muita chuva e estava muito lamacento, apesar de muitos funcionários trabalharem no local achamos muito perigoso.

name: Parqueadero 24 horas
description: This is a 24hr open car park with guard. Each hour is 4000 COP with 12 hours capped at 25000 COP. Very central for going out but busy on the weekend, so go early if you want to park overnight. There is a toilet and the guards were happy to let us sleep in our camper. We gave them a little tip anyway. If you want to sleep it's quite loud until 1am (we were there on a Friday night). But during the week a lot quieter. Might be a bit tricky for big rigs (no height restriction) but if it's busy might be hard to manoeuvre around the cars. Recommend!

name: street parking
description:
It is a parking bay for cars, without paying in front of a complex of apartments, it is a very quiet area and there is some shade and some sports fields. The area seems safe, I spent 2 nights here, there were problems with my car, but there is space for large caravans, for me it is one of the best areas to sleep in a car in Bogotá. 200m away you can find a main road with plenty of shops and restaurants.
es una bahía de parqueo para autos, sin pagar frente a un conjunto de apartamentos, es una zona muy tranquila y hay algo de sombra y unas canchas para deportes. la zona se ve segura,  pase aquí 2 noches son problemas en mi auto, pero hay espacio para caravanas grandes, para mi es de las mejores zonas para dormir en auto en Bogotá. a 200m puede encontrar una vía principal con bastante y suficiente comercio y restaurantes

name: Quiet street in Envigado
description:
Staying here, because we have to wait for spare parts…

Checked out the other spots nearby before. For us, this street looked like the best option. 

D1 supermarket nearby, a rubbish-bin at the bigger road nearby and nice restaurants and bars are also close… which means, that there is some music… also until late sometimes, but with earplugs completely fine during the night (on a Saturday). 

We also asked the police about this place (drove by) and they said, it is safe to spend the night. We only should take our valuable stuff with us, when we leave the van, because rarely there are some thieves (like everywhere in the world…) 

But we feel very safe here!

name: Hostal El fin del Afán
description:
New and super decent small scale hostel. Nice and friendly couple that runs the place. Located in the city center. Well equipped kitchen, good bathroom, average WiFi. Paid breakfast and drinks available. The couple gives a course to make traditional Arepas, a good way to get know the Colombian kitchen and the other people in the hostel.

Bicycle friendly I could park my bicycle in the common area with a roof. Only need to carry it upstairs. There a bicycle shop in the next street. 

I paid 35.000 for a dorm.

name: Hotel Balcón Llanero
description: We paid 75000pesos for a matrimonial with bathroom, very clean (they clean the room every day), there is a locked parking space in the front. Breakfast is included (coffee and eggs with rice or arepas), there is potable water at reception. Not much around except for some street food and a mall 20 minutes walk but if you need a cheap night it's great. They don't accept payments by cards or dollars.

name: City Parking 24-hours
description:
Gated parking with several security guards. 4.5m max height.
Car 35,000 per 12 hours, 70k for 24 hours 
3-day pass, where you can come and go, is 120,000cop ($30)

Motorcycle are slightly less, and trucks sightly more.  See photos

name: Dieseltec laboratorio
description: We had a diesel fuel pump problem, they did all the correct tests and did not take advantage of the situation. All solved perfectly. We recommend you come here. The guys are clued up, very friendly and fix your problem pronto. They know what they're doing. Very efficient.

name: Hotel Mirador
description:
Hotel with basic rooms. The communal balcony has a nice view over the main square of the city centre. 

The exact location can differ a couple of meters.

I paid 35.000 for a room with bathroom. I don't if they have different prices for 2 persons.

I could park my bicycle in the room, you have to carry it upstairs.  I had the option to park it in a closed washing room,  but the communal space felt safe to put it as well.

Street parking in the village, but not next to the hotel. 

If you want to eat out at night, all the restaurants close quite early here.

name: Long Construction Stop 2023
description:
Construction for repairing a major landslide in this spot. I came through here 2 weeks apart and it was still the same, looks like it will continue a while. They seem to have time windows for letting traffic through, which can be up to 2 hours. I arrived at 10am the second time and they told me 12pm for the next wave. 
If you’re in a Moto you can head to the front and possibly squeeze through when an emergency vehicle (police/ambulance) is let through. 
Road on either side is paved and in excellent shape from RioSucio to Filadelfia

name: Estudio 18 - Diseño Grafico
description:
We passed through Armenia with the idea of ​​visiting the coffee axis.  Without realizing it, we stumbled upon a small business, run by a Venezuelan couple, where we made several stickers and where any job you are looking for in advertising and graphic design, without a doubt, will be very well attended to.  
.....
Super recommended.Pasamos por Armenia con la idea de hacer el eje cafetero. Sin darnos cuenta tropezamos con un pequeño negocio, regentado por un matrimonio venezolano, donde hicimos varios stikers y donde cualquier trabajo que uno busque sobre publicidad y diseño gráfico, sin lugar a dudas, va a ser muy bien atendido. Super recomendable

name: Café del Jardín - Tour Cafetero
description:
A really beautiful coffee tour at a local finca near Jardin. Wilson took us with his Jeep around finca for about 2 hours, showed us all plants, explained us everything. We collected some coffee, showed us the machinery for coffee processing, roasted the coffee on fire and prepare the freshest coffee for us. He doesn’t speak much English so knowledge of Spanish is needed. 

It was 50000 COP per person. Highly recommended!

name: Hostal El Fin del Afán
description:
We were desperate for a hot shower so asked this new hostel. 10k cop for a shower each. 

Clean and hot. Nice and friendly owners

name: Street Parking
description: Near plaza. We had a shower at the hostel near by and parked on this street. Very quiet at night as it is a dead end. Good option 1 block from the main square.

name: hotel inversiones napoles
description:
Hotel with swimming pool, bathrooms and a large parking lot, very friendly

hotel con piscina baños y un parqueadero amplio, muy amables

name: MAX PRO DIESEL - PRIMAX Station
description: This station has Max Pro Diesel, not just the regular diesel. Cost was 9.780 vs 9.272 for regular diesel

name: Laguna Negra
description:
A very beautiful place to visit.  It is a lagoon produced by the Ocetá moor, very close to Mongua.  Acceptable road when dry, I think it is suitable for any vehicle.  Better if you come in a 4x4.

Un sitio muy bello de visitar. Es una laguna producida por el páramo de Ocetá, muy cerca de Mongua. Carretera aceptable cuando está seca, pienso que apta para cualquier vehículo. Mejor si vienes en un 4x4

name: Hotel Guanes
description:
New hotel in the village square. We paid 60000 for a matrimonial, clean and with a very big and comfortable bed! No aircon but the fan on the ceiling was enough. The WiFi wasn't working when we were here.
We could park our motorbikes in the hall, you might need to take your panniers off if you have a big bike

name: Mirador piedras pintadas
description: A wonderful sight.  It is a viewpoint.  Possibly you can spend the night in this place.  It is flat and calm.

name: Hotel Daniels
description:
I stayed here for one night, in a 3 person room with very small bed. They have better rooms, but they weren’t available for me although I was the only guest in the hotel. 

The heater for warm water in the shower was not working. It took them hours to find the WiFi password and then it turned out it the internet connection was almost not existing. According to the owner the internet was very bad.

They asked 40.000 first for a gringo price, but they changed it easily to 30.000 when I told them it was expensive. Still a bit much for this place. 

Not the best place ever stayed in, but it is good to know to have an option in this village if you just need a place to sleep. It was quiet at night. If you want internet or a warm shower check it first.

There are at least 2 other hotels in the main streets of the main square.

name: Parking
description:
Lovely owners, and just about right height for our 2.30m Vehicle (would avoid it if you have a higher rig)

2000 per hour (2500 during the weekend) capped at 12000cop for every 12 hour). It is not 24/7 access but you can leave the vehicle here overnight if you are staying at a hostal. Hours are flexible as they are happy to let you in or out as long as you let them know with time. (Quite full during the weekdays)

name: Daniels Workshop
description: Daniel helped us to get the necessary parts for our cooling system (ordered them from Bogotá) for our VW Crafter. Very nice guy and he also fixed everything in the end!

name: US Embassy
description:
This pin is the entry gate for US Citizens. Obviously no knives, guns, etc. You check in at the gate. Walk into the compound and sit under the covered area before being invited in to the first scanning point. You’ll need a drivers license to leave at the desk (along with electronics). After that you’ll cross a small courtyard to another entry point and go through security once again. To your immediate left you’ll see a waiting room for US Citizens. 

Note: if you need an emergency passport it will be printed same day. You must make an appointment online. We had to wait about 45 days for the next available. The emergency passport is small… and only lasts 1 year max. For Bolivia, Ecuador, and Peru you need 6 months in your passport for entry. (We’ll post at the borders to see if they accept).

name: La cañada fishing and camping
description: Beautiful place for camping ,Mauricio Is the owner,also Is fishing restaurant

name: GLL Hotel
description: Nice hotel with secure motorcycle parking behind a gate. Clean room, 2 queensize beds, wifi, tv, private bathroom with hot water, communal kitchen. Paid 80k Cop for 2.

name: Parkinglot next to huge Church
description: Quiet and big Parkinglot next to a huge not really finished church (2023). In the morning there are children in the nearby school. You can hear the airplanes start and land from the near airport. But at night in general very quiet.

name: Reserva Natural El Tucan
description: beautiful campsite directly  at Rio Claro. Family friendly, quiet, big campground surrounded by beautiful nature.

name: Movet Chapinero
description:
Very nice vet office in Chapinero. Open 9am-7pm every day. Dr. Alejandra Moreno speaks excellent english. They can process an international health certificate to export your dog with ICA. I paid 160,000 COP (~$40 USD) for this. Probably best to schedule an appointment. I attempted to walk in on a Saturday and had to schedule an appointment for the next day. WhatsApp: +57 3238050982

Also note that this is a vet chain with other offices throughout Bogota and Colombia some of which are 24 hours. You can check their website for more info: https://movet.co/

name: Hostal Heliconias
description:
Simple Hostel with secure moto parking inside. Private room for 2 people with shared bathroom 60.000 cop per night.

kitchen and common area available. cold water shower only.

name: Hotel Campestre Maria Claudia
description: One of the best value hotels in Colombia so far. I got a room for 27,000 pesos for one person. They had no problem with me bringing my bicycle into the room. They even gave me a big room with 2 beds, and a window with a great view of the mountains. Private bathroom, TV, wifi, hot water, there is even a pool. The location is a little bit away from the town center so it is fairly quiet. Overall, very good value for the money you pay.

name: Parking lot next to the church
description: We spent the night here, is just a parking space on the end road next to the church and a park. It's quiet and there are cameras. It felt safe.

name: Hotel Real
description:
Big hotel, but I was the only guest. Simple room. Warmish shower. WiFi is shit, don’t expect internet connection.

I paid 30.000 for one person in a 2 person room.

They have a inside parking which fit a few cars or a small van. I parked my muddy bicycle here. 

There are several other hotels in Santa Isabel.

name: ICA Bogota Airport
description: This is where you get your certificate for exportation from ICA. Open 8am-4pm Mon-Fri and 8am-12pm Sat. You need to bring your pet, a health certificate, vaccine certificate, antiparasitic certificate, the pre-export exam CIS that was sent to your email after the vet, and proof of payment (~60,000 COP). The payment link they send you will not work if you don't have a Colombian bank account. You will need to log in to your SISPAP account with ICA and pay via credit card using the links at the top of the page. The ICA certificate is valid for 5 days and you really should start this process several days in advance. All documents need to be printed ahead of time. There is a printing kiosk on the second floor of the airport next to a money exchange that charges 3,000 COP per page printed. Also arrive early if you can. I arrived with my dog at 8:30am on a Tuesday after a holiday weekend and there were at least 20 people and pets in line.

name: San Joaquín Restaurant & Hotel
description: Nice Restaurant with plenty of options. Delicious food and drinks. Fish, meat, chicken and everything in between. fresh juices and cold beer and nice stop on your way Neiva o San Agustín. they also have accomodation in nice rooms if you are.

name: Makarena Hostel
description:
This is the only hostel we found in Bogotà that let us park our motorbikes inside (they have a gated part in the front), but check with them first. For a matrimonial with shared bathroom we paid 70000, they have dorms as well.
The hostel is small and it was a bit dead when we were there but it was clean. 
The area seemed okay, there's a few bakeries and restaurants around

name: Villa Sonia-Beautiful Eden Garden
description: We came across this beautiful place. it's truly a Eden garden. with hundreds of trees, flowers and lush vegetation. you wouldn't believe a place like this is hidden so close to the main road and also on the way to the Mano Gigante View point. We highly this place the serve delicious breakfast with hot chocolate they grow. Sonia is a lovely lady very passionate about nature. she gladly will show you around and explain you every plant. great place to relax for a couple of days. if you want to disconnect is perfect to or if you need to connect to work isn't also great . the place has great wifi and lots of perfect sport to relax or work, read, paint you name it. call Sonia for more info +573002721978

name: El Portal
description: Great little restaurant with typical food, parking on the side in a gravel lot. Fried chicken, grilled chicken, BBQ chicken and some pork dishes. The soup they came with our meal was very good, so was the juice! (The dishes also came with a carrot salsa that was really good)!

name: Restaurante Salsipuedes
description:
We tried 3 restaurants with vegan/vegetarian options and this one was the best. Great burger and rice. Fairly priced beer and jugos.
Opita Gourmet was also ok, Desert Garden was terrible (Imagine sweet vanilla flavoured yoghurt on your burger).

name: Salsipuedes Restaurant
description: Nice Restaurant with a good selection of different dishes including vegetarian options. fresh juices and drinks. well prepared food.

name: Hostal Cacique Guaicani
description:
Hostal with the view overlooking the town. they have rooms with a single and a bed room. two rooms are located with a porch and has a roofed outside kitchen. they have a restaurant as well. not all rooms have hot water so you can ask. I paid 40.000 soles including breakfast.

they also have s big garage directly in the building that fits at least two cars and space for motorbikes. I don't know the top clearance.

they are very accommodative and offered me to use the power washer to clean my bike.

name: Restaurante Costa Lara
description:
Our car broke down just in front of that restaurant. The owners (an older couple) were very friendly and helpful and let us stay. 
They also called mechanics, who repaired our car right there and didn‘t charge us any „tourist tax“. 
We talked to him, because we thought that place could be an Overlanderspot and he said ok. 
You‘ll find places to park, bathroom, shower, good wifi and a restaurant (easy, traditional food). The gate will be locked between 6pm and 7am. 
They also offer Ecological boat tours. 
They let their dogs out, as soon as the gate is locked - they are not aggressive, but not yet used to people staying overnight. 

We gave them 25.000 per night.

name: Los Colores del Colibrí
description:
Translation: It is a quiet and charming place surrounded by nature, it has wi-fi services, drinking water, bathrooms, swimming pool, and board games.
.....
Es un lugar seguro y encantador rodeado de naturaleza tiene servicios de wi-fi energía, agua potable, baños, piscina, juegos de mesa.

celular 3186613794.

name: Hotel Leandro
description:
Nice and cheap hotel for the night. It's 30k for 2 persons. clean, good wifi, secure motorcycle parking.
During lunch time they sell "comida corriente" for 12k.

name: Hotel Veraneras
description:
Simple hotel rooms with aircon 45.000 and with ventilator 35.000. I was alone that might’ve effect the price, but I think it was just the price for the room.

It’s bicycle and motorcycle friendly. You can put them in the communal area. I did put my bicycle in the room. 

There is a kitchen, I’m not sure you can use it. 

The water is not drinkable, but they sell bottles. They don’t drink it themselves.

Street parking for cars.

name: Truchera los muñoz
description: It Is also a fish restaurant,rústic and beautiful place wáter falls  AND Green nature

name: RAYOGAS
description: We came here and asked if they could refill our USA bottle. The security guy said no, but then he asked someone else, and he said yes, no problem. We went together to the finca, which was 5 minutes away and there he refilled our bottle without any problems the southamerican way. He was very friendly and we paid 10.000cop for 5 liters.

name: Ambiaku Hot Springs
description: There are a long row of parking spaces along the road for the guests of the thermal bath. Only few of them were occupied when we arrived. We stayed one night in our campervan, nobody bothered us. Quiet and safe neighborhood.

name: Hotel Bonanza
description: A surprisingly modern feel to the rooms with a decent bicycle/moto storage area on the back. 44000 gives you a room for two including a massive fan to cool you down if you wish. the busy street is right next door with a nightclub a bit further away playing Colombian classics. very satisfied overall.

name: Madoa SAS multiservicio
description:
Mechanics who fix cars in general. They specialize in alignment and balancing, brakes and discs. Juan Estevan is the owner, an enlightened person who likes to help travelers. They fixed the clutch discs on my car (Mercedes Sprinter) and the pulley on my friend's car (Land Rover), very fast service and an excellent price. I highly recommend it.

Mecânica que arruma carros em geral. São especializados em alinhamento e balanceamento, freios e discos. Juan Estevan é o dono, pessoa iluminada que gosta de ajudar viajantes. Arrumaram os discos de embreagem do meu carro (Mercedes Sprinter) e a polia do carro do meu amigo (land rover), serviço muito rápido e com um preço excelente. Super recomendo.

Mecánicos que reparan autos en general. Están especializados en alineación y equilibrado, frenos y discos. Juan Estevan es el dueño, una persona ilustrada a la que le gusta ayudar a los viajeros. Me arreglaron los discos de embrague de mi auto (Mercedes Sprinter) y la polea del auto de mi amigo (Land Rover), servicio muy rápido y excelente precio. Lo recomiendo altamente.

name: Fim do asfalto/ Finish good road
description:
here ended the good road. becareful with animals crossing way and try drive slowly 

Aqui termina a pavimentação da estrada e inicia o trajeto de terra. Alguns buracos e trechos piores que outros, precisa dirigir devagar e tomar cuidado pois há muitos animais cruzando a pista.

name: Bypass road piscinas
description: Google tells you to go on a road that is currently closed and we could not find another way around the closure so a local allowed us to follow them to this bypass road. It’s about 1km of rough dirt road with a little sketchy bridge. Then you get back onto the main road to the piscinas

name: Bicycle shop Ciclo Castillo
description: Good bicycle shop with lots of spare parts and good mechanics.

name: La Circasia farm
description: Camping spot,Héctor Is the owner very kind AND frienly

name: Euromarcas
description:
Bad mechanic - don’t go here!
