We visited this mechanic at the start of our trip, and in the months since have basically found out that everything they did was bad work that’s been damaging our van. The brake discs they serviced very quickly became warped and needed an expensive replacement. The clutch disc they serviced was replaced completely incorrectly, and has again caused a costly repair job. 
Avoid this place!! On this street with many mechanics, it’s the one with the black and red sign.

name: Juya Tour Embarcadero
description:
Embarcadero to Punta Gallinas when the road is closed, it is possible to travel by boat, round trip costs an average of $ COP $ 250,000 per person to spend the day there. The boat leaves at 4am, but we recommend taking the full tour with the History Travelers agency in Riohacha, it's really worth it and a unique experience.
---------
Embarcadero para Punta Gallinas quando a estrada esta interditada, é possível fazer o trajeto de lancha, ida e volta custa média $ COP $ 250.000 por pessoa para passar o dia por lá. O barco sai às 4am, mas recomendamos fazer o tour completo com a agência History Travelers de Riohacha, vale muito a pena e é uma experiência única.

name: Economic Manoa Hostel with breakfast
description:
Nice Hostal, friendly owners, you can hear street a bit depending on room, kichten with foodprocessor, breakfast included, 2nd floor but you can put a (1-3) bikes in 1st floor into their kitchen. More than one electrical soket and it was even near the bed! And free toploader washing machiene :)

Entrance hidden, there is just a bell with the Name Manoa. If they dont come shout to the trace or go to their shop continuing left of the entrance crossing the street.

Price was negotiated 50.000.

All in all seemed like the Perfect deal :)

name: Restaurante El Portal
description: Excellent restaurant with very good food in a nice environment. They mainly serve lunch (until 4pm) and if you like meat, go for the Filet Mignon! It was the best piece of meat we had in 16 months. But also their fish dishes and juices are really affordable. Menu price between 20k and 25k COP.

name: Finca Momota
description: A small scale (7ha) coffee farm offering 1-3 hour tours around their farm. 65000/pp for two hours gives you a good feeling for the coffee growing, the different variants common in the region, plants with symbiotic relation to the coffee, the benefit of the drink and its history. This finca does currently not have many workers (actually, they are not picking their fruit due to not having the manpower) so it feels like it might be closing down soon enough. I haven't been to other fincas around Quindío/Salento to compare. We two were alone with our guide so that certainly weighed up the experience, but maybe a more functioning finca would feel more alive.

name: Hospedaje y restaurante Pisimbala
description:
Also known as Hospedaje de Doña Libia. This place was recommended by another hostel in Neiva. 

Home stay hostal and restaurant with private rooms. 

Warm showers, I don’t know if it works because due to the heavy weather the village was out of electricity for while. There is WiFi but the speed changes. 

I paid 30.000 for one person in a two person room with two beds.

name: D1 Supermarket
description: Cheap D1 Supermarket in Barichara. Enjoy:)

name: Parque Principal Barcelona
description:
We spent one night here.  On Friday the square is very busy until late.  The people are very friendly and we felt safe.  We spent one night here.  On Friday the square is very busy until late.  The people are very friendly and we felt safe. There are many bars, kiosks and bakeries around the square. We do not recommend big rigs, see the photos.  Our car is a 515 sprinter.
......
Passamos uma noite aqui. Sexta-feira a praça fica bem movimentada até tarde. As pessoas são muito amigável e nos sentimos seguros.tem muitos bares, quiosques e padarias ao redor da praça. Não recomendamos big rigs, veja as fotos. Nosso carro é uma sprinter 515.

name: Terpel gas station
description: It was late so we parked here, ok for one night, we asked if it was possible to sleep here and the staff was very nice, didn't ask any money for it. Clean toilet, there is a shower but without door.

name: Hospejade Aqui Estoy Bien
description: The best shower we had in a long time. 8.000pP. Enjoy :)

name: plaza
description:
Quiet place to spend the night in Cucuta. There is surveillance and the neighbors are cool. Street with little traffic. Nice place for one nigth.

lugar tranquilo para pasar la noche en cucuta. hay vigilancia y los vecinos son buena onda. calle poco transitada

name: Access point to free campsite near by
description: This is the start point to access the free campsite near by, from main road. Don't trust OSM maps! Possible for all kind of vehicles, but would recommend 4x4 and high clearance!

name: Mirador del picará
description:
To sleep you can use Bonafont Square, right in front of the police station. Very quiet and the townspeople very friendly.

Para dormir se puede utilizar la plaza de bonafont, justo al frente de la estación de policía. Muy tranquila y la gente del pueblo muy amable.

name: Alegría Hostel
description: Hostel with dormitory and single rooms. 30.000 for dormitorios and 80.000 for single room. nice and clean with a kitchen and plenty of secure parking on premise. excellent wifi. you can also rent a kayak to use at the lake. they can also serve breakfast for payment if you order it in advance

name: Texaco gasstation
description: Spacious gasstation with super clean banos and a shower. It’s a gasstation and on the Panamericana so traffic noise but not too bad. Friendly staff.

name: Fuel Station with Adblue
description:
Gas Station / Truckstop. 

We filled up our Adblue here. 
11l for 40.000p.

name: Alhelí Café and School
description: Best coffee I have had in Colombia so far and the owners are some of the nicest you will ever meet! Do yourself a favor and stop by this place.

name: Finca Jerusalem Coveñas
description:
Great place to stay on the way to Cartagena. On the highway and 5 minutes from the beach. We stayed at the Camping for one day. Daniel is the owner and is super attentive and honest. The value is negotiable. Safe, spacious place with plenty of shade, electricity and showers. Perfect. It has space for large cars, bicycles and tents.
He also rents rooms, with private bathrooms.
Owner contact +57 3117700371

Ótimo lugar para ficar a caminho de Cartagena. Na rodovia e a 5 minutos da praia. Ficamos no Camping um dia. Daniel é o dono e super atencioso e honesto. O valor é negociável. Lugar seguro, amplo com bastante sombra, energia Eletrica e duchas. Perfeito. Tem espaço para carros grandes, bicicletas e barracas. 
Ele também aluga quartos, com banheiros privativos.
Contato do proprietário +57 3117700371

Gran lugar para alojarse de camino a Cartagena. En la autovía y a 5 minutos de la playa. Nos alojamos en el Camping por un día. Daniel es el dueño y es súper atento y honesto. El valor es negociable. Lugar seguro, espacioso con mucha sombra, electricidad y duchas. Perfecto. Hay espacio para coches grandes, bicicletas y carpas.

También alquila habitaciones, con baño privado. Contacto propietario +57 3117700371

name: Restaurant Rancho
description: Phenomenal restaurant with splendid view over the Rio del Cauca Valley. 19000 for menu del día and 14000 for the jarra de limonada that you'll probably get after cycling up the uphill ;). the menu options are slightly above average prices but since everything here is delicious it could very well be worth it!

name: NOBSA handcraft market
description: charming little town famous for it's traditional market of handcrafted goods made of wool.  perfect for buying some clothes if you are going high in the Andes mountains. very calm and safe to stay overnight. also have a couple of nice restaurants by the main square. We recommend ALTIPLANO restaurant. you can park safely just in front of the main square which is a beautiful spot too.  Smaller but similar sort of goods to those found in OTAVALO Ecuador.

name: Puerta del Sol
description:
good value/quality hotel, next to the main street. and walking distance to the town and it's center. with a playground and restaurant.

53.000 Pesos for a single room 
76.000 pesos for double
the rooms are spacious and well maintained.
the shower was actually hot

while the parking itself is not locked, there is no issue with security. 
overall good attention and complimentary coffee if you ask. 

the wifi itself is fast and works well, if you get a room close enough to the router.

name: Florian Construction
description:
This is where there is is a current road shut-down for construction. They only open it at specific times to let vehicles pass.
9:00, 12:00, 2:30, and after 5:00 until 7:00am.

name: Hotel San Antonio
description: Nice hotel, single room with private bathroom 35.000 COP including space in garage (fits 2 cars or a few motorcycles).

name: close to the church
description: a big area on the side of the church, very close to the park. it looks like a safe city, we parked here and there is a lot of space, not on the street so it's safer for the night. No facilities.

name: Camping next to clear river behind fence
description:
Best place to camp coming from Santa Barbara.
Clean River, bathing possible, grass, flat, no roof, no sun in the morning, no view, fishing prohibided.

If you continue in direction of Santa Barbara for 3.5 km with not much elevation (30min by bike) there would be also a abandoned school with a roof and view over the valley. : I ment Santa Rosa not santa barbara Includes crossing the river or climbing the fence

Both places no reception with WOM, this starts further down :)
Tiendas are verry rare further up

name: Hostal Bambu
description:
Nice hostel with nice vibes, cool people amazing views and sunsets from the roof terrace. Good beds, kind and helpful staff. Relaxed and quiet at night.

I paid 35.000 per night for a dorm. I could put my bicycle in a safe place inside. 

Breakfast available for 10.000

name: San Miguel Dairy Farm
description: It's a campground at a dairy farm with an artisanal cheese production plant where  you will learn the process of making artisanal cheeses locales very close to the town of San Miguel de Sema, 1 hour from villa de Leiva Boyaca.

name: Hostal La casona Don Juan
description:
good Hostel with good wifi and lots of activities such as rafting, and other tours. the wifi works well all over the hostel and the price includes breakfast, and complimentary coffee.
overall pretty clean Hostel

in the courtyard you can park you motorcycle if the handlebar fits through the door. they do provide a wooden ramp to help you getting in.

opposite of the street is a big garage for secure parking to the public 

25000 for a dorm
40000 for a single room

name: Poc Language School
description: we stayed in Pasto for 3 weeks and took a course of Spanish lessons here. The school is like a family and they welcomed us and made us feel at home.  We came away understanding so much more not just of the language but also of the people.

name: Hospedaje Las Brisas
description: 30k pesos for a room with private bathroom. Simple but kept very clean and the lady is nice and friendly. Also a little bit away from the town center so  very quiet. Initially she said 35k but agreed with 30k. Because there are limited rooms available, the lady does not show this place on Google Maps, but this is probably the better value hotel in this town.

name: La casita azul
description: We stayed one night in this hospedaje which is very nice ! We payed 40.000 pesos for 2 persons in a matrimonial room (nice local breakfast included). Toilet and electric shower are shared. Good wifi. The owners are very, very nice. The view from the place is incredible ! Lot of birds and the owners showed them to us with every name in the early morning. Super nice ! We are travelling by bicycles and could bring them upstairs with us for the night.

name: Hostal El Pino
description:
Nice family owned hostel in walking distance to all down town places. Good hot showers, everything very clean. Kitchen and laundry are for common use. Secure parking space for 2-3 cars (no big rigs). Secure parking also for motorcycles behind the house in the grassy area. 
We payed (low season) 60.000cop for a double room with shared bathroom.
The family also helps you to organizing your tours and have lots of tips for the whole area.

name: Casa Loca Guatavita
description:
'Casa Loca' is a complete house upside down which you can visit! 
Parking space available for all kind of vehicles. We didn't had to pay for parkibg.
Big bags/backpacks/helmets you have to leave at the restaurant (as pictures wouldn't work with them on). All safe, we didn't had problems.
We payed 20.000cop pP to go inside Casa Loca. 
Restaurant with also Austrian and German dishes on this property. Cafe, shops with local products are also here.

name: Parque Camino Real - Calle Carrera 51
description:
We found this place by chance while going to the other park that is marked nearby. It is perfect for sleeping. It is a dead end street that leads to a dog park. There is only room for two vehicles and since it is a dead end, the length doesn't matter! It's great because it is literally in front of the entrance to a gated community so there is 24-hour security next to the vehicle. In the area there are supermarkets, kiosks and restaurants. We came three nights to sleep and it was very quiet at night. The neighbors go out to walk their dogs and everyone is nice, some even wrote us messages to see if we needed anything.
--
encontramos este lugar de casualidad yendo al otro parque que sale marcado cerca. es perfecto para dormir. es una calle sin salida que da a un parque de perros. solo hay lugar para dos vehículos y como es sin salida no importa el largo! es genial porque está literalmente enfrente de la entrada de un barrio cerrado entonces hay seguridad 24h al lado del vehículo. en la zona hay supermercado, kioskos y restaurantes. vinimos tres noches a dormir y muy tranquilo por la noche. los vecinos salen a pasear perros y todos son agradables incluso algunos nos escribieron mensajes para ver si necesitábamos algo.

name: Moto & SUV overnight parking
description:
Secure and cozy parking in the heart of downtown, great for motos, cars, and SUVs -  Clearance for RTT.  Best to reverse in thru the opening. 12,000cop/24 hours. 
Entrance open 7am-8pm, and locked overnight.
WhatsApp +57 312 2783371
We stayed across the street in the Hotel Dorado, 100,000cop/nt for 2.
There's a bigger lot on the left just after the hotel with a wider entrance for a 4x4, 6.4m van, but it's for day parking only, no overnight parking as it belongs to another hotel.

name: Camping San Francisco
description:
Wonderful campground, really big and flat space. Beautiful views all around.
Quiet, peaceful especially during weekdays.
Highly recommended!
Very friendly owners.

name: playa cerca del rio
description: Quiet place to pitch the tent, very close to the river and with few people, far from the village and with indigenous communities nearby that let you camp without problems, everyone was friendly and greeted

name: Residencias El Encano
description:
The only have a green sign: Hotel
You have to call them, if there is nobody at reception. The number is on the sign. The owners live close by. 
I stayed here for one night, 40.000 for a one person room. I could put my bicycle inside in the ground floor room. Decent WiFi.
I could make it before night to Pasto, so I stayed here. 
Parking available, for motors with a roof. Bicycles can be parked at the balcony as well.

name: zeus gasolinera
description:
good place for a rest. is a big parking in the gas stacion. we stay one nigth. quiet and safe. a little noyse off the route but its ok.
the view is nice.
have shower free. Water potable. and wifi whit passwor, you can ask to worker.

estación de servicio ideal para descansar una noche. la vista es muy bonita. estacionamiento grande. duchas gratis, agua potable, y wifi si te dan la contraseña jeje

name: Tukawa camp-ground
description:
Camping for campers and converted trucks, hotel/hostel/farm run by 3 French people. 
There is a camping area for campers and trucks at 250 meters to the hostel under a large roof which protects against both rain and sun. There is a sink, a table in order to cook, toilets and a (cold) shower just next to the campers' location. You can enjoy the pool, board games, ping pong, bar and everything else the hostel has to offer in a quiet and secluded setting. 
The hostel has also individual cabanas with every comfort but also dormitories, rooms with double bed with private bathroom and double rooms with shared bathroom. Restaurant for meals, pool, magnificent view of the plantations of coffee, wireless and TV. They also offer horse riding, visit to the coffee farm and more activities. 
The prices are very correct (25.000 COP / person for the camping area). Contact Mathieu or Dimitri on +57 321 2205413 to book and get more info. They speak French, English and Spanish and are very friendly!

Camping pour camion aménagé et Van, hôtel, Hostel et ferme tenue par 3 français. 
Ils proposent un espace camping pour van/camions situé à 250m de l'espace hotel/hostel sous un grand toit qui protège de la pluie mais aussi du soleil, il y a un évier et une table pour cuisiner ainsi qu'un toilette et une douche (froide) à proximité immédiate de l'emplacement. Vous pouvez profiter de la piscine, des jeux de sociétés, ping-pong, bar et tout ce que propose la partie hôtel tout en étant dans un endroit calme et retiré.
L'hôtel quand à lui propose  des cabanas individuelles avec tout confort mais aussi dortoirs, chambres avec lit double avec salle de bains privative et chambres doubles avec salle de bain partagée. Restaurant pour les repas, piscine, magnifique vue sur les plantations de café, wifi, TV. Ils proposent des sorties chevaux, visite de la ferme de café. Les prix sont très corrects (25.000/pers pour l'emplacement camping). Contactez Mathieu ou Dimitri au +57 321 2205413 pour réserver et avoir plus d'infos. Ils parlent français, anglais et espagnol. Ils sont très sympatiques.

Zona para parquear una van bajo techo en una finca hotel administrada por 3 franceses. 
Proponen un zona de camping para van ubicada a 250m del espacio hotel/hostal debajo de un gran techo que protege de la lluvia y del sol. Hay un lavaplato, un meson para cocinar, un sanitario y una ducha (agua fria) muy cerca a ese espacio. Pueden disfrutar de la piscina, de los juegos de mesa, de la mesa de ping pong, del bar y de todo lo que propone la parte hotel estando en un lugar tranquilo y aislado. El hotel ofrece cabañas individuales con todas las comodidades, pero también dormitorios, habitaciones con cama doble con baño privado y habitaciones dobles con baño compartido. Restaurante para comidas, vista espectacular hacia los cafetales, wifi, televisor. Ofrecen paseos a caballo, visita de una finca cafetera entre otras actividades. Los precios son muy correctos (25.000/pers para parquear en la zona). Comuníquese con Mathieu o Dimitri al +57 321 2205413 para reservar y obtener más información. Hablan francés, inglés y español. Ellos son muy amigables.

name: Davivienda and Bancolombia
description:
ATM Davivienda and Bancolombia in front of a small Mall / Supermarket. Lots of parking lots. 

Seems like a very safe area here - perfect for getting money and get some groceries.

name: Hotel Letty
description: The best hotel in this town. 60k pesos for a room for one person but the lady was very very kind and let me stay with a more reasonable price, probably because I am on a bike from Alaska to Argentina. Very clean rooms with hot water and everything.

name: Tours Cielo Azul - Tourguide Cucuta
description:
A small family owned business called Tours Cielo Azul. Leidy and Saúl help you to find the perfect tour to discover Cúcuta and the surroundings. They are great tour guides for the city and all the attractions here. 
The prices depends on the tours - they organize it how you like it! 

You can reach them via www.somosconexion.net or via Instagram: @tourscieloazul !
+57 310 324 3155

We were very happy with them and would definitely come again to here!

name: Loma Balneario
description: This is a Hotel, a restaurant and a pool with a big waterslide. They allowed us to stay in their parking lot with our truck for price of the entrance to the Pool (10k) pp. A very good deal in these hot days.Pool, toilets and showers are very clean.  The night had a little sound from the street, Bit okay. We had no food from the restaurant, but it looked very good. People very friendly!

name: Bicicleteria Rafael
description:
Rafael is a very kind guy, a good neighborhood bike dealer, reliable and economical.
Highly recommended.
---
Rafael es un chico muy amable, buen bicicletero de barrio, confiable y económico.
Muy recomendable.

name: Mirador perfecto
description:
Place for a couple of vans next to a quiet road. Unbeatable views of the
lake. Going down an almost invisible path that leaves from the same point, you reach a beautiful solitary beach. Highly recommended to visit it.
---
Lugar para un par de vans al lado de una tranquila carretera. Vistas inmejorables del
lago. Bajando un sendero casi invisible que sale desde el mismo punto, se llega a una playita solitaria hermosa. Muy recomendable visitarla.

name: Casa de Mayerly
description:
Dining room inside the house. Economical and good. They only make a closed menu that varies every day. Generous, with juice, soup, main course and a small piece of fruit, only for 11,000.
They can also do laundry and it is economical.
---
Comedorcito dentro de la casa. Económico y bueno. Solo hacen un menú cerrado que varía cada día. Generoso, con zumo, sopa, segundo y postrecito pieza de fruta, solo por 11.000.
También pueden lavar la ropa y es económico.

name: Taganga Macabi hostel
description:
Nice new hostel with parking space (there's space for a few bikes and a small car, contact them in advance) 
We paid 90000pesos for a matrimonial with shared bathroom and breakfast included. The owner is super nice, she even offered us an amazing Sunday lunch!
There are a few hammocks and an open kitchen you can use

name: calle 59 con cr 50
description: there is more than ten car places outside of a residential sector where to park in a calm place, there is a guard, no need for permission but would be nice talk them  there is security cams and used to be a patrol parked. not bathrooms or services, just a quiet place to rest.

name: parking lot of the park
description: we slept one night in the park's parking lot, it was OK, the park look quite new, small city, quiet night, there are toilets at the park but they were closed.

name: Seguros Del Estado
description:
Here you can get insurance for your vehicle. You will need a Colombian phone number, passport and vehicle documents. There is a bank nearby to pay the contribution.

Av. Cra 19 #103-91, Usaquén, Bogotá, Kolumbien

name: tool both park
description: we asked the guard if we could sleep here, at first he said no and than he let us stay on the side, in the grassy area. calm night, it is very close to the road so it'll be a bit noise, bit not much. low traffic during the night, we felt safe as there is a guard 24hrs. We could use toilets and shower for free.

name: Julia
description: I am traveling South America for 14 month now, and confidently I can say that is the best and most authentic Napolitan pizza I have found so far. good ambiance and they serve beside pizza some other dishes as well. I highly recommend this place.

name: Parking Lot El oasis
description: We stayed here in our Truck in the dirty parking lot of the Hotel Oasis on our way to Venezuela. the friendly owner charged us 10k COP and offered us a toilet which we did not used. The night was very very noisy. Good claro 4g Signal

name: Bomberos
description:
Stop searching : the best bomberos we had in 5000km biketraveling. We could use the kitchen, the facilities, the pool table and even the swimming pool !! Staff is super friendly.
There's a wifi, but didn't ask for it.
Lots of light at night though.

name: Usaquen Station Hostel
description: nice and clean Hostel with dorm rooms and probably rooms. in the area with plenty of restaurants and bars and a big mall close by. 24 hours reception. I've spend 10 days here when I waited for my air lift. you can park multiple motorbikes securely there in the alley of the hostel. and there were garages nearby.

name: Macedonia: Barü
description: Awesome and cheap hotel and restaurant. There are a little community living around the area. Good food and water and excellent service.

name: Mirador al mar
description:
A nice space to park next to the main road with a nice, elevated view over the sea.
Good for a pause, all kinds of rigs.
Not too much garbage.

name: in front of the beach, just beautiful!!
description: the perfect place to start Caribbean,  the sea is warm and calm, it has wind so its not crazy hot, just perfect.  A lot of coconut trees to give you shadows, and grass area. Felt safe, loved. 4g tigo works fine

name: Total Energy Electricidad
description: Great place, good electricians, Oskar is a great guy, He found solutions for problems Mercedes-Benz Imecol could not solve. Big recommendation!!

name: Pubenza rest area| zona de descanso
description: It is a resting place for truckers or motor home drivers, or any car, for free. You can take showers and go to the bathroom. They also sell drinks and snacks. I arrived by bicycle, and asked if I could camp, They told me yes, back. Of course, for motor homes it is perfect But for tents, it is only as a last, emergency option, because the floor is uneven and there is a lot of noise because it is right on the road.

name: Place to change Col Pesos to USD
description:
In the mall "Centro Comercial Ventura Plaza" there are some Western Union agents and a lot ATMs.
On the 3rd floor there is also a little shop called 'Cambios Ventura - casa de cambio' (white sign) where you can change money into USD which you'll need for a trip to Venezuela as you can't get any money there! 

Other money changers are to find in downtown.

name: Hotel Chicoral
description:
Came here cycling. 25k pesos/night room with double bed, fan and TV. You get what you pay for. Not fancy but ok clean.
Take a room which is not at the street because there's some noise at night (music at cantina's).

name: Finca Turistica la Maria
description: great place with a very attentive couple! use of the finca, walk in the forest towards a laguna, cabaña restaurant in the trees everything! very recommendable!

name: Rua sem saída
description:
Translation: A place further away from the small center and with calm traffic. There are no facilities. There is a river 100m away

Um lugar mais distante do pequeno centro e com um transito tranquilo. Não tem facilidades. Tem um rio a 100m

name: ProSalud Vegan
description:
Great vegan restaurant with colombian food. You can find great bandeja paisa at 30k cop.
Also cheaper options and juice, breakfasts, burguers...

name: Bituima, Cundinamarca
description: The place is a restaurant. But at the same time a very nice place to stay for one night and then go. Secure and easy park for bikes.  The room was 40mil, but went down to 35mil.

name: Terpel la Bascula
description:
At this Terpel gas station, there is enough space for caravans where you can sleep as many nights as necessary, there are showers, water to take away or wash clothes if necessary, there are showers which is important, there is an Altoque restaurant with a variety of food and a mini market, the outside noise is normal for a truck stop but it is a good point.

en esta estación de gasolina Terpel, hay bastante espacio para auto caravaranas donde se puede dormir las noches que sean necesarias, hay duchas, agua para llevar o lavar ropa si es necesario, hay duchas que es algo importante, hay restaurante altoque con variedad de comida y un mini mercado, el ruido exterior es normal de una parada de camiones pero es un buen punto.

name: Primax Gas Station
description: Asked the attendant if I could use the hose to fill up my tank while he pumped gas. Claro que sí! Good water pressure and attendant said water is potable. Also has air to fill your tires. I sent 1000 peso coin. Set the desired tire pressure. The pump will beep when you get to the right pressure.

name: Carpintero Muebles Arte (carpenter for van shipping)
description:
we had a partition wall installed between the driver's cabin and the living area on 13/12/2023 in preparation for the transport of our motorhome.
Freddy helped us realise our ideas and took the measurements.
We procured the building material at Woodrecycling 10.405037, -75522340 (take one of Freddy's employees with you, otherwise you won't get a good price).
Then we went back to Freddy and he quickly installed the partition wall and skylight protection for us.
We received a very friendly welcome. Good service.
Coordinates: 10.406916, -75.522798
Phone: +57 300 315 46 96

name: Hotel Madrigal
description: a nice little hotel in the middle of town. air conditioned and with fan. the rooms have a small bathroom. There is a small yard to safely park motorcycles. we paid 80000COP for one night in a double room

name: Bam Bam
description:
Super nice place 
really good for breakfast and lunch

name: shower at altoque terpel
description: this place has a great cold shower inside the convenience store for free!

name: Finca Pilaju
description:
Alexa and her family welcome travellers. Accommodation
washing machine, water, toilets. 
30000 Colombian pesos the car
Washing machine 25000
Room rental can be arranged 
+573126031733
Large vehicles OK.
---
Alexa y su familia reciben viajeros.
Hospedaje
lavadora 
agua 
sanitarios 
30000 el carro
Lavadora 25000
Se puede organizar rentar habitación
+573126031733
Vehículos grandes

name: First boondock
description: First Option from Bucaramanga, big Flatrate area.

name: Posada Toche
description:
Camping, Hostel right next to the church. The lady (Elisenia or Norberto), very nice, owns a shop and behind some beds and a garden.
Camping: 10k/person/night.
Bed: 20k/person/night. I didn't sleep here but it seems nice.
Communal WiFi reaches the shop, don't know for garden and dormitorios.
You can wash your clothes too. 
I uploaded some pics.

name: MonAparté cienaga wild campsite
description:
Very nice flat spot at the end of a little track. Ideal to sleep or to stay during the day. 
No 4x4 needed but access reserved to “small” véhicule (van, 4x4) because of the trees.
Hot in summer if no wind but warm during winter. 
Very friendly people lives here, we felt very safe and very welcome. 
Say hello to Ander (farmer a little bit further) and his family from Chloe and Jérôme, they are an amazing family :-)
Only 3g movistar gsm

name: Charco
description:
River next to the road. Perfect to take a cold bath. You can get there through the small wooden door, there is a path.

Charco al lado de la carretera, perfecto para bañarse. Se puede entrar por la puerta de madera y bajar por un camino.

name: cafetería Murillo travel store
description:
t is a cafeteria on the main street of the town and it has Wi-Fi, it is not the fastest but for basic things it is more than enough considering that the telephone signal in the town is not very good.
---
es una cafetería en la calle principal del pueblo y tiene wifi , no es el más veloz pero para cosas básicas sirve de sobra teniendo en cuenta que la señal de teléfono en el pueblo no es muy buena.

name: DORILOKOS GUAVIARE
description:
This place a Xpress food, Nice place, owner Deysi Yurany cellphone 3222884641.

É um lugar a venda da comida rápida de Doritos com carne, frango, choclo e queijo.

name: Restaurante y Hospedaje
description: 15000 COP for a room with shared bathroom. It's a small place and they have a couple of rooms. Not a very clean place and the water that comes out of the faucet is kind of brown. But hey, it's super cheap! They can provide wifi as well.

name: wild camping for cyclists
description: A small area that is not as exposed as the other options along this road. Coming from Bogotá, it got dark and I had to stop somewhere and camp. There are some flat spaces by the road further up towards the National Park but is super visible and there is some traffic during the night. This spot is very close to the road but depending on where you pitch your tent, it could be mostly hidden. In the paramos and has some great views but still outside of the National Park.

name: Agua potable
description: Drinking water at the Terpel service station. The faucet is to the right of the pump along the wall

name: only 4x4 road
description: we came here to scape of another peaje (tool), only 4x4, we made it with our defender 110

name: beach
description:
tried to visit this beach bit decided not to as you have to pay
15000 COP for parking
6000 COP for insurance pp

if you want to sleep here more 15000 COP

beaches should be free...

name: mirador de Chipre monumento perro
description:
They wanted to open the truck while we were sleeping, we do not recommend sleeping here, it is a place where people gather to drink until very late. Better the spot near the fall Cai

nos quisieron abrir la camioneta estando durmiendo, no aconsejamos dormir acá, es un punto donde se junta a beber gente hasta muy tarde. mejor el spot cerca del caí.

name: Centro ecoturistico Kofan
description: We asked if we can stay overnight and they allowed us to stay. Very friendly hosts and a nice place because it is not close to road and you don’t need to squeeze. There is a swimming pool and a short but very nice walk. We saw 3 different kind of monkeys. They also have very fast internet….in this area it was the best place for us in a truck. We paid 70.000 COP for a truck with 4 persons and were allowed to use all amenities including pool.

name: Ukuku
description:
It is a wonderful place to camp. In the morning you can see the majestic snow-capped Tolima, as long as it is clear. It is attended by a couple of Biologists who make you fall in love with the great biodiversity of the area, in the morning countless beautiful birds arrive. There is Wi-Fi, water and electricity service, you can walk around or from the place take the trip to the snow-capped mountain. I will be back.

Fue un lugar maravilloso para acampar. Toda vez que en las mañanas se logra ver el majestuoso nevado del Tolima , siempre y cuando este despejado.  Es atendido por una pareja de Biologos que te hacen enamorar de la gran biodiversidad de la zona, en la mañana llegan un sin numero de aves preciosas. Hay servicio de wifi, agua y luz, se puede caminar por los alrededores o desde el lugar emprender el viaje hacia el nevado. volvere.

name: On the street
description:
On the street. Since we couldn't park in the Plaza del Ed. Fénix, we came here. Good for one night. The buildings have cameras and the neighborhood is quiet.

ES En la calle. Como no pudimos aparcar en la plaza del Ed. Fénix nos vinimos aquí. Bien para una noche. Los edificios tienen cámaras y el barrio tranquilo.

name: Rió Palomino
description: Pebble beach accessible to small vehicles (max height around 2.5m due to vegetation). The water from the Rio Palomino is fresh and transparent, it is very pleasant to bathe in it. The locals come to enjoy it and there are also groups that descend the river on large buoys. The shore is visible from the road, but at night it is very quiet. As a bonus in clear weather we see the snow-capped summit of the Sierra Nevada.

name: Gaz cylinders and autoparts
description: Carrera 38 is the street to find parts for cars. There are so many shops everywhere! Here we find a shop selling gaz cylinders, perfect to fix the door of my camper! The store is called "Carrvidrios", it is located at the crossroads of Carrera 38 and Calle 42.

name: Away from the palapas
description: Away from the palapas, you will find here a quiet place to sleep. The sea is very calm and the tides very low, so you can park very close to the water. Little surprise in the morning, a baby crocodile settled under our vehicle!

name: SIM Card Shop for Claro
description: Shop where you can buy and register your SIM card

name: Previsora - SOAT
description: There are 2 possibilities to obtain a SOAT: either go to Seguro del Estado (10.42395, -75.548452), or here at Previsora. For us, we went to Previsora. Obtaining the certificate was completed within 24 hours, which allowed us to take to the road the next day (the SOAT begins the day after obtaining the certificate). At Previsora ​​it is possible to buy a SOAT for 1 or 2 months. Please note that they cannot insure beyond the validity period of your TIP, knowing that the TIP begins on your date of arrival in Colombian territory and not on the date of arrival of your vehicle. From what I was able to glean as information from Seguro del Estado, it is 3 months minimum (so more expensive but at least it allows you to stay longer in Colombia), and it is just as quick to obtain. For payment we went through our agent Ana. The price was 197 200 COP for 2 months (price depends on your car).

name: Mercado de Bazurto
description: Here is the large market of Cartagena. If you want to discover the real Colombia far from the sanitized atmosphere of the old town, this is the place to come. It's lively and you can find really cheap fruits and vegetables there. The market is rustic and not very clean, but I didn't feel unsafe. You can also eat there but the atmosphere is oppressive, everyone wants you to go eat at their place.

name: Cascada del amor
description:
Great place to put the tent. At the base of the waterfall we prepared a 2m*2m square without rocks. It's a 5 minutes walk from the road but pretty hard to get there. We left our bycicles at the house nearby.

Espacio increible para armar la carpa. Limpiamos un trozo de 2 metros * 2 metros para poner la carpa justo al lado de la cascada.
Son 5 minutos caminando desde la calzada pero en un camino medio dificil. Nos guardaron la bici en la casa cercana.

name: Finca Ecoparaiso Ibagué
description: rooms on an incredible farm with a beautiful view of the mountains. double room with en suite 120,000 or bed in a shared 4 bed dorm is 50,000. each room has balcony overlooking mountains. dinner can be arranged and breakfast included. parking for motorcycles under cover in the farm. book in advance phone or booking.com

name: Costaguana Parking Camping Park Beach
description: Secure, private camping wooded area by the Caribbean Sea, suitable for large camper vans and tents. Shower facilities, 220v -110v electricity . Wifi ,  covered dinning and sitting area. Hammock camping  available

name: Frenoteca Break Specialist
description:
This is one of the best break specialist workshops for campers in the city. It has many break mechanics and 20 working bays, lots of spare parts for old vans and overlanding vehicles. 

No appointment is required and no height restrictions. 

We brought our Mitsubishi L300 from 1992 here and they had new hoses, new bleeder valves, new hose brackets, everything. 
 
They have a small reception with toilet, water and coffee. 

For super modern cars you might want to look also at Metrofrenos in Google. There are a few around the city but for 4x4s and older vehicles this is definitely the place to go.

name: Bomberos
description:
These bomberos are used to received cyclers (but nobody ever put a pin...).
You have access to WC, water, elec, complete kitchen with fridge and stove. We camped between the cars. We washed with bucket because they don't have a shower.
Friendly staff. Lots of light at night though.

name: Casa Castel
description:
Casa Castel is a small private guest house with large, well-equipped rooms. Wifi and breakfast included.
The location is good, 20min walk to the old town.
The breakfast is good, the service is courteous.
Casa Castel is a good place to survive the lengthy procedure of loading vehicles in hot Cartagena.

name: Parking along the street
description:
That is a beach street, Quiet, silent, only some people coming to stay on the beach.

We stayed for 3 days without problems, in the morning some cars parked on this street to go to the beach.

name: Cascada Oido del Mundo
description: Not too far from Minca, 30mn walk, you will find this nice waterfall. It is free and it is possible to swim. Water is fresh and transparent. When we came here the road was in construction but in normal time with a 4wd it is possible to park really close.

name: Pull out of a dirt road
description: Normally I do not put this kind of bivouac on iOverlander, but as there are very few possibilities to sleep around Minca, it is a solution. So here you will find a roadside where it is possible to park, the night is quiet and cool. There is a small "river" next door to get water. A little further down there is a beautiful view of the valley and a beautiful sunset. It is also possible to park a little higher at the edge of the main road, but it is less discreet.

name: Free Internet access by satellite
description: Here is a school with free Internet access by satellite. SSID is "MINTIC_CONECTA". On the authentication portal the simplest is to say that you are between 13 and 17 years old, otherwise it ask you lot of personal information. Connection is good.

name: Free Internet access by satellite
description:
Here is a free Internet access by satellite. SSID is "MINTIC_CONECTA". On the authentication portal the simplest is to say that you are between 13 and 17 years old, otherwise it ask you lot of personal information. Connection is good.

EDIT: When we returned this access no longer worked, but the one to the south worked.

name: Free Internet access by satellite
description:
Here is a free Internet access by satellite. SSID is "MINTIC_CONECTA". On the authentication portal the simplest is to say that you are between 13 and 17 years old, otherwise it ask you lot of personal information. Connection is good.

EDIT: When we returned this access no longer worked, but the one to the south worked.

name: Cerro Pilón de Azúcar
description: Nice view on the sea with incredible water color's, the rocky coast and the desert. There is also a nice beach. To come here a high clearance car is required.

name: Ojo del Agua
description: Incredible view on the sea with beautiful water color's, the rocky coast and the desert. There is also a nice beach. To come here a high clearance car is required. There is a nice walk until Piedra Tortuga rock.

name: Mirador de Utareo
description: Very nice view on the channel! It's really an amazing place. Only 5km to reach Punta Gallinas!

name: Sabores del campo
description:
Nice place to bring your tent and go camping, from this place you can see the Nevado del Ruiz very well in the mornings, cost per person 15,000 Colombian pesos, it also has a restaurant with delicious food

agradable sitio para traer tu carpa y hacer cámping, desde este lugar se ve muy bien el nevado del ruiz en las mañanas ,costo por personas 15.000 pesos colombianos , también tiene restaurante con deliciosa comida

name: Scam!!! License plate maker
description: Man here took our money to make a plate. Wasn’t there when we showed up at the agreed time. Avoid. Scam.

name: La trucha muisca
description:
Lovely campsite surrounded by different ponds where people come to fish trout.
The camping area has two small roof to pitch the tent under it and avoid the rain. Also there are plugs to charges devices and hot water.
There's small tienda with basic snacks and beer and a restaurant (didn't try it).
Campsite is 20k pesos p.p. but we ended up paying 10k each as there was nobody.
We travel by bike, but for sure possible to park a van and sleep too.

name: El Territorio Comunidad (Coliving Community)
description: El Territorio is a fully equipped retreat centre that has natural private cabins, fully equipped kitchen, steam room, yoga studio, gym and ample parking space.

name: Riverside
description: After an exhausting day with hours of traffic jam we found this place and we were so happy that we didn't have to stay near to the main road. A very good and wide gravel road leads down to the river to a big open space. It was very quiet and nobody around. We could even go down to the river and refresh ourselves in this heat. Perfect spot to spend the night on the way from Medellín to Bucaramanga.

name: Hotel Boutique El Poblado Désert
description: Nice hotel, new installations, very clean and quiet, with pool. Rooms with ventilator 60.000 COP. The host also offers the large terrace on the top to camp (40.000/30.000). Hotel 24H. Contact: +573133613270 (Don Geraldo).

name: Hospedaje Villa Rey
description: Doble or triple large rooms for 50.000COP with fan. Very quiet and clean. Parking for bikes and motos in the hôtel.

name: Raices Hotel
description: I got a spacious private room with shared bathroom for 31,500 COP through booking.com. If you want more than just a bed in a dorm room at a hostel, this hotel is the perfect place. The staff are kind and helpful. Hot shower with good water pressure, lots of bathrooms, there is a kitchen, everything is kept very clean. There is also a lot of shared space and some hammocks, quality breakfast is included. Very quiet at night. Depending on which room you get, wifi might not be as good. But overall, it's a great value. It felt very safe leaving my bicycle in the shared area where there is a covered space for bicycles and motorcycles.

name: The fossils hill
description: It is technically possible to stop everywhere in this desert, as long as it does not bother the Wayuu people. We stopped here one night, it was very quiet. As a bonus there is a small hill with thousands of superb fossils!

name: Hard roadblock
description: You will have lot of ropes before and after this point, but this rope was one of the most difficult to pass. This rope is run by a woman and these children, she asks for 20 000 COP to enter in the national park. We were able to pass after negotiation by giving 250g of rice.

name: Cactus hill
description: It is technically possible to stop everywhere in this desert, as long as it does not bother the Wayuu people. We stopped here one night on this little cactus hill, it was very quiet.

name: Chorrera
description: The location "El Silencio Next To Rio" was overcome with people on this Christmas day. On the other side of the river we found this location quieter. The river is pleasant for swimming, the water is fresh and transparent. At this location there is a large parking lot to park.

name: Tunja recarga de Gas
description:
In this place they recharge gas cylinders, my tank is from Mexico and I recharge it without any problem. Ask for Edgar at cell +57 311 2130130. 
---
En este lugar recargan los cilindros de gas, mi tanque es de México y me lo recargo sin problema. Preguntar por Edgar al cel +57 311 2130130.

name: Nice village of Atanquez
description: Do not hesitate to take a detour through this pretty little village surrounded by the mountains. Here lives the indigenous people Kankuamo, we also come across some Koguis. There are very few tourists, so the village is really authentic. Coffee and corn spikes dry on the floor. Do not hesitate to stop on the road to the Mina, the river has sculpted stone there, it is a beautiful aquatic playground.

name: Hospedaje
description: Hospedaje with the red sign. 25K COP for a room with private bathroom. Clean rooms, TV, wifi, cold shower. Bed is quite comfortable. No problem bringing my bike into the room.

name: Hotel Diamante Uraba
description: Hotel with special giant parking lot for campers, gas station, restaurant and showers.

name: The Dream Hostel
description:
Payd 55 for a 10 people dorm. No hot water. Very good kitchen. Very good area to chill (with tv).

Nice pool. No place to park the motorbike. It has to be parked on the street (the are look quite chill). 

I stayed here for only one night while the motorbike was on the Honda service.

name: Escape of lightning
description: We started the night at “wild camping in Valle de constellations” (which is very nice!). In the middle of the night a thunderstorm with lightning came…to avoid damage of a potential hit by lightning we moved here. This place is 60m lower and you will find higher surroundings (trees) - so the chance of getting hit by a lightning should be much smaller.

name: Autotronica_co Guarne - Medellín
description:
ES Taller especializado en coches europeos BMW, MB, Audi, etc. Nos solventaron un problema de rodamientos en nuestro diferencial trasero de nuestra MB Sprinter. Hemos podido dormir dentro del taller durante la reparación. Caro, 750 dólares cambiar los 4 rodamientos del diferencial.
EN Workshop specialised in European cars BMW, MB, Audi, etc. They solved a bearing problem in our rear differential of our MB Sprinter. We were able to sleep inside the workshop during the repair. Expensive, 700 dollars change the 4 differential bearings.

name: Pipe motos
description: The guy owning the shop is really nice and seemed competent. He has a good assortment of tools and sells some parts as well

name: Hotel Farallones
description:
Good value basic place with an underground Moto parking. Access is steep and and tight, so take off your luggage and you should be comfortable with steep gradients.

Price 40k cop for two in a double bed. Hot water and friendly owners

name: Estacion ESSO
description:
There is a treated water tap next to the station offices, ask the staff.

Hay una llave de agua tratada a un costado de las oficinas de la estación, preguntar al personal.

name: Honda (super motos del magdalena)
description:
I did my 40.000 kms service in my motorbike Honda XRE 300.

I arrived with no reservation. Leave the bike and go to pick it up the next day.

I payd 710.000 col (Uss 190 aprox).

name: Alegría hostel
description: Cute hostel just outside the old town..  shared room for 30k, private rooms available, hot shower, parking for a couple of motorbikes

name: Tienda and Restaurant
description: Small tienda that sells snacks and drinks, as well as very basic things. They also serve food, they had a menu with soup and a plate for 10K, 12K, 14K, depending on what you order. Good portions for a hungry cyclist. Very nice people.

name: Posada Viajera-KeOs
description:
We are a family that has the time and the best intention to support travelers who, as they pass through the white city of homeless POPAYÁN 🇨🇴, whatever their means of transit or travel, have the support that is possible to provide a space to rest and continue their route or adventure doing what we love most: travel the world.
.....
Somos una familia que dispone del tiempo y la mejor intención de apoyar a los viajeros que a su paso por la ciudad blanca POPAYÁN 🇨🇴 indigente cual sea su medio de transitar o viajar cuentan con el apoyo que gracias a Dios es posible brindar un espacio para descansar y continuar su ruta o aventura haciendo lo que más nos encanta viajar por el mundo

name: Madre Tierra (walk-in only)
description:
Beautiful location, in a quiet area of Minca, just 5 mins by walk to the main street.. view of santa marta and the sea, surrounded by nature.. possibility of camping (20k), dorm (30k) or private room (40k)..
the site is only reachable by walk, you can easily get by motorbike to a little open top area before the last downhill little path which I don't recommend cause it's steep and very narrow to turn back especially if you have big motos..

name: Hotel Emanuel
description: 35K pp for a spacious room with private bathroom. Hot shower, decent wifi, very friendly staff. TV with internet as well. No problem bringing my bicycle inside the room.

name: Finca Edmo
description:
It is an excellent place to relax and spend a day in contact with nature. The owner is super attentive, he was a traveler and knows the needs.

contact 573148135614

name: A Orilla del Topocoro
description: We stayed in there for three nights. It's a quiet and nice place to spend the night. No markets around so is recommended get supplies before to arrive it

name: Motoposada La Marina
description: New hotel for moto travelers, private or shared rooms, swimming pool, private parking, space and tools to wash and fix your motorcycle.

name: piccola Italia. Best Pizza!
description: The best homemade Pizza and Pasta in Town. The owner is from Napoli Italia. Don‘t miss it!

name: Parking Jardin
description: As Jardin is a very small town and not easy to find a spot for big rigs, we just parked here. Very easy. 24h guarded parking lot with nothing else than parking. For us just fine and very close to downtown. Price for campers 25.000 per 24h.

name: Gas station Biomax
description: Stranded here at night CYCLING (3 ppl + dog). There was nobody, but open shower and WC. We started to pitch our tent behind on an open field, and then came the guy which is in charge of the place. He lives next door and allowed us to camp here. We filtered the water from the WC. It was all ok and safe.

name: Gas station Penaliza
description: Right next to the bridge between the two hills, in the valley. Came CYCLING (3 ppl + dog). We could camp behind the trucks and use the hoose to shower and filter the water. WC open all night. The guy in charge told us we could not camp under the roof at the terrace and not use the kitchen. But we improvised a table and he gave us a chair. All ok and safe but lots of noise of the road.

name: Unimotos - Custom brake discs
description: We had our brake discs made here, they create discs and customise it to fit any bike! for a disc we spent between 180000 and 280000 pesos but depend on each bike. Mauricio, who works there, speaks a good English and he's super nice and helpful!

name: Rocco graficas
description: We printed some stickers here, really good quality and price (100000 pesos for more than 160 stickers - 7cm) we were really happy

name: Cascada Maracay
description: Cool waterfall, 4x4 required or at least high ground clearance. Definitely space here for a bigger vehicle. Can’t say if the area is safe or not because I didn’t talk with any locals but it seemed safe. Just a few friendly farmers walking by and no vehicles after 8pm. A little trail in the woods to go down to the waterfall. You can park a motorcycle in the woods there if you want to be stealthy. But vehicles have to park on the rock, I’ll add some pictures. Took me 18 min to get here from the road.

name: Cambio el opita
description: Situated at the corner of calle 8. and. carrera 11 this exchange office provides top notch rates between at least Peruvian soles, Colombian pesos and Brasilian reals. there's plenty of other cambios towards the port, but mostly with poorer rates.

name: Posada Portal del Sol
description:
How to get here? With a Bicycle or Motorcycle you can ride until this location via a single trail. With a car, it has to be parked at the main entrance (also secured) and the owner John is carrying the bags with his Enduro to this place. This is a totally remote place, away from town and full surrounded by nature. The rooms are open, beds covered with Moskitonet. A cozy place where you can wash your laundry, maintain the Bikes, eat very good food. Mostly grown in their own garden. Super friendly owners, but you should conect them before coming. 
Alexandra +573229439940 
There is a little Trail in the back of the House, lot of Birds & Monkeys can be seen.

name: Santana camping
description: The owner of this tiny shop repairs anything related to camping (he repaired my mattress for 30000pesos, also repaired our tents zips and our dry bag from the mosko moto luggage!). he can also repair backpacks and chairs, and he can make covers for tents, hammocks with mosquito nets from zero etc. He can also re-waterproof your tent! Very useful and the man is really nice! Be sure to contact him before hand as he's not always in the shop

name: Hotel Buenaventura
description: Comfortable and affordable hotel in the city of Pasto. It has a private covered parking area very close to the hotel facilities. The rooms are good for staying a night or two. It has hot water with good pressure. They offer breakfast at a very low cost.

name: Mi Bello Florian
description: hotel across from the police station. we stayed and parked the motorcycle next to the police station.  they offer rooms with multiple bunk beds, everyone pays, COP 70000 for me with hot water, COP 55,000 Cold water.  good for a night sleep.

name: Football field with view
description: Nice football field without habitations around. We din't slept here, just took our lunch, but it seems to be a nice place to camp according to us. All around there are some cactus.

name: Next to GYM
description:
Translation: Only for small cars, there is no facility. I got water from a neighbor

só pra carros pequenos, não tem nenhuma facilidade. consegui água com uma vizinha

name: TRIYU2024 Artesano con Armor
description: This is the new location from TRIYU Cafetería with a wide variety of sweets and excellent coffee. They also make homemade bread and Sandwiches. Open from 2-8pm, Tuesdays closed. The new place has a nice open space to sit and enjoy their food.

name: Hotel katio
description: Super clean/friendly/cheap hotel. They’re remodeling rn so I don’t know if they are dropping their prices for that, but we paid 35,000 for a room for two people, one bed with a/c. They also let us put our bike in the back room of the small grocery store run by the same owner. The hotel right next to this one was asking 90,000,

name: Restraurante Ronal
description: Wonderful delicious food, very inexpensive. very nice couple run.  skip the places by the hotels and walk up here for great food

name: Grass flat space under eucalyptus
description: Here is a nice place to camp on a grass space under eucalyptus and with a nice view. The owner of the field next door said us it was ok to sleep here. It is around 50m from the road but there is no traffic during the night.

name: Free WiFi
description: Here is a free WiFi, it is useful since with Mobistar you don't receive signal. The connection est good, so really fast, but it is ok.

name: Free WiFi
description: Here is a free WiFi, it is useful since with Mobistar you don't have signal. The connection is good, not really fast.

name: Centro de control Autopista Pacifico 2
description:
Very spacious, quiet and safe place to sleep, clean bathrooms, water taps to fill the pond, they have showers, Wi-Fi and a rest area (tables and electricity).

Lugar muy espacioso, tranquilo y seguro para dormir, baños limpios, llaves de agua para rellenar estanque, cuentan con duchas, wifi y area de descanso (mesas y electricidad).

name: Parking Lot next to cable car
description: At the cable car Station there is no official parking lot. This is the nearest one. Usually it closes at 5 pm but we asked the very nice lady that owns the place if we could stay overnight. You can find her at the kiosk next to the parking lot. We paid 25000 pesos per night and another 25000 for the day. So 50000 for 24 hours. We were not able to find a better spot in Medellin. The night was quiet and with the cable car you are in half hour in the city. Opening hours cable car: 9 am to 6 pm. On Sundays starts at 8:30 am.

name: Street parking
description:
It serves as a last resort, it is just a little-traveled street in an industrial neighborhood, so quiet, that in the morning we woke up to the singing of birds.  We arrived on a Saturday and during the night the police came to inspect who we were and warn us that it was a lonely place but that they still made rounds.  It has plenty of space for large vehicles.  There is a large supermarket (Exito Mayorca) 650 meters away, on the roundabout.

Sirve como ultimo recurso, es solo una calle poco transitada en un barrio industrial, tan tranquila que por la mañana despertamos con el canto de las aves. Llegamos un sábado y durante la noche policias llegaron a inspeccionar quienes eramos y advertirnos que era un lugar solitario pero que igual ellos daban rondas. Tiene buen espacio para vehiculos grandes. Hay supermercado grande (Exito Mayorca) a 650 metros, en la rotonda.

name: Sashii Hostel & Boutique
description:
Good option for you stay in Riohacha, multiple and private acccommodation, AC, WC, kitchen and parking with extra pay. Amazing location very close to beach and tourist spots. In this same place you can plan the alta guajira tour and punta gallinas. 

ES - Buena opción para tu estadía en Riohacha, alojamiento múltiple y privado, AA, WC, cocina y estacionamiento con pago extra. Increíble ubicación muy cerca de la playa y de lugares turísticos. en este mismo local puedes planificar el tour alta guajira y punta gallinas.

name: Las Colonas Hostel
description: Lovely Hostel Hotel with single and double beds, no dorm.  We parked on the street with the motorcycle and it was completely safe.  Most motorcycle are parking on street.  ATM about two blocks away. COP 140,000 Split between two riders was COP 75000 each, about $10USD

name: wifi at oro museum
description: a free museum to enter with AC, Wi-Fi and toilets.

name: Charcos de Santiago
description:
Natural pools next to the old train station.  Access to $2000 COP.  Ideal to cool off during a hot day.
--------
Piscinas naturales a un costado de la antigua estación de trenes. Acceso a $2000 COP. Ideal para refrescarse durante un dia caluroso.

name: Sueno del Rey
description: Came here cycling (3 ppl + dog). Slept all of us in one room with 2 beds (50.000 COP). WC and ICE cold shower in the hallway, shared. Everything clean. There's a balcony. WiFi available and good. Our bikes were stored in garage, downstairs.

name: Topaga. Mountaintop
description: Very nice and very quiet place on the top of the mountain. The 360° view is incredible! Access is via a small track between Monguí and Mongua, which are visible on Google Sat. The point is located between a telecom antenna and a large white cross. A 4wd is recommended to get here. It seems there is a track coming from the village of Tópaga, but we have not tested it. Mobistar/claro signal available.

name: Parqueadero Cajica
description:
Parking in Cajica with the possibility of sleeping if you have a vehicle, cost is 12,000 COP per day.

We were looking for a place to park our car (5.5 meters long, 3.2 meters high) and found this parking lot, managed by a very kind family that allowed us to park without any issues. It's even possible to spend a night or two in the camper at this location if you talk to them.

Nearby, there is a shopping center and supermarkets, making it a good option if you need to make a stop outside of Bogota to sleep or park in a quiet and safety place.

name: SOAT Office for Previsora in Edificio
description:
SOAT renewal with the Company Previsora.   it is in a tall Office building labeled Edificio (photo attached)  you will have to leave ID with security.
7th floor. exit elevator, turn right and sit in the chairs. someone will eventually come to help.  No English spoken.
Bring copies of current TIP, Licence, Passport, and old soat if you had one.
1 month 111,000 COP in Jan 2024.
They will do multiple months if you want as long as your TIP covers the entire time.
Show up early as it gets busy and it's slow.
Pay by credit card only, cash you have to go to a bank and come back with receipt.

name: Migración y Aduana
description:
🇺🇲
The immigration process to enter Colombia is quite simple and fast; once completed, one needs to go to the facilities opposite to process the vehicle.

The DIAN (Colombian customs) operates from 9 to 12 and from 14 to 16 hours (there is no service at night).



🇲🇽
El trámite migratorio para ingresar a Colombia es bastante sencillo y rápido; una vez realizado hay que ir a las instalaciones enfrente a realizar la gestión del vehículo. 

En la DIAN (aduana Colombia) el horario es de 9 a 12 y de 14 a 16 horas (por la noche no hay servicio).

name: tienda cabaña totumo
description:
December 28, 2023 place with cabin and parking for a camper less than 2mt 30 bathrooms showers beautiful beach food and store Alirio and Lucía the owners will assist you value of house car 50 thousand per night cabin 200 thousand pesos (3135090886)

diciembre 28 2023 lugar con cabaña  y parqueadero para camper de menos de 2mt 30  baños duchas playa hermosa alimentación y tienda alirio y Lucía los dueños te atienden valor de casa carro 50 mil noche cabaña 200 mil pesos (3135090886)

name: Charcos La Playita
description:
You can park on the side of the road because it is wide and very easy to access from the highway.  There is free access to the river with very clean spring water and lots of nature.  The place is very quiet, not so busy, just people from the town exercising or walking.  We slept one night and we felt very safe, there is public lighting.  4G coverage Claro very good.

Te puedes estacionar a un costado del camino porque es amplio y de muy facil acceso desde la autopista. Hay acceso gratis al río con agua de vertiente muy limpia y mucha naturaleza. El lugar es muy tranquilo, no tan concurrido, solo personas del pueblo ejercitando o paseando. Dormimos una noche y nos sentimos muy seguros, hay alumbrado publico. Cobertura 4G Claro muy bueno.

name: lago calima gate 5
description:
good place for spend a night close to the lake. we stay 4 nights. safe place. very noisy in the summer season but its ok, the parking is very big. you can make Fire.

buen lugar para pasar la noche cerca al lago. estuvimos 4 noches, es seguro. un poco ruidoso en temporada de verano pero como es muy grande el estacionamiento esta muy bien. se puede hacer fuego. y si trabajas con artesanías también se puede.

name: Hotel Porto Azul
description:
65000 (US $17) for a triple room w a/c.  Simple but clean, centrally located enough to walk to the supermarket, bakery, or the main square. Fenced and spacious parking. Friendly staff.

65000 (us $ 17 dlls) por una habitación triple con aire acondicionado. Sencillo pero limpio, suficientemente céntrico para caminar a supermercado, panadería o la propia plaza. Estacionamiento cerrado y amplio. Personal amable.

name: Vaca
description: Awesome burger joint!! The best veggie burger we’ve had in a while made with portobello mushrooms, grilled onions, pickles and two types of cheese. Just yummy!! Beautiful place as well surrounded by trees and nature. Super recommended!

name: estadio municipal
description:
calm night.  parking normally prohibited at night but the manager allowed us because travelers are welcome.  Thank you so much.
---
nuit calme. stationnement normalement interdit la nuit mais le responsable nous a autorisé car les voyageurs sont les bienvenus. Merci beaucoup

name: near lacteos andinos
description:
parking next to the lacteos andinos store.  we asked the security guard who told us that we could park without any problem.
---
parking a côté du magasin lacteos andinos. nous avons demandé à l'agent de sécurité qui nous a dit qu'on pouvait stationner sans problème.

name: Cafe Tour - women cooperative
description: Nice small town, with some cafe, restaurants, church, and nice central place. The road to get here are not the best, but the village is very relaxing.

name: Buenos Aires - village
description: Small town with a few cafes, restaurants, church and a pleasant central square. Not busy, but good for a stopover.

name: Previsora seguros SOAT
description:
Here you can purchase the SOAT for foreign vehicles.  In Maicao it was impossible to buy it, mainly, as we were told, because they don't sell it for motorcycles, so we had to come to Riohacha and there was no major problem. The validity is the same as the one stamped in your passport by obligation and on the DIAN permit.

Aquí se puede comprar el SOAT para vehículos extranjeros.
En Maicao fue imposible comprarlo, sobre todo, según nos dijeron,porque no lo venden para motocicleta, así que tuvimos que venir a Riohacha y aquí no hubo mayor problema. 
La vigencia es la misma que te estampan en el pasaporte obligatoriamente y en el permiso de la DIAN.

name: hotel de maluco
description: tem água, energia, espaço, ducha, wi-fi tudo no 0800

name: bomba de gasolina
description:
free space next to the gas pump, right at the entrance to the town, the gas station is only in operation during the day, at night there is no one, but it is a very quiet, quiet area to spend a quiet night.
________________________________

espacio libre al lado de la bomba de gasolina, justo en la entrada del pueblo, la gasolinera solo esta en funcionamiento en el día, en la noche no hay nadie, pero es un sector muy tranquilo, silencioso para pasar una noche tranquila.

name: La Virgen Piedra
description: Small parking lot above the road next to a Christian monument. The view of the surrounding mountains is nice. Calm, there is no traffic during the night.

name: On the top of the cactus hill
description: Superb location on the top of a hill and surrounded by cactus. The path to come here requires a 4x4, the path is steep and stony. There are many camping possibilities along this way, but it is particularly nice.

name: Territorio Kuyay
description:
Hostel and camping. Great views and services. Worker is super nice.
Camping for 15k per person with your own tent or 25k on their tents with matress.
I think there are shared and private bedrooms too.
There is a full equiped kitchen, shared bathrooms, good wifi...

Hostal super bonito con muy buen ambiente. El chico que trabaja allá es muy simpático.
15k por noche acampando con tu carpa, 25k con carpas que ellos tienen instaladas con colchón. También hay habitaciones.
Dispone de cocina y baños compartidos

name: Los Alpes
description:
Not so expensive hotel. 40k for 1 night with private bathroom and kitchen. (probably cheaper for 2 or 3 people)
Nice views. Maybe they allow to put a tent on the backyard too, not sure.

Un hotel no tan caro en la zona turistica. 40k para 1 persona (quizás más económico si van 2 o 3). Habitación con cocina y baño.
Vistas bonitas. Puede que permitan acampar también ya que tiene un jardin muy grande.

name: La Octava Maravilla
description: Beautiful restaurant with amazing views of Medellin as it’s located up on the mountain. Great food and service. We had the salmon and it was just delicious, although the main dishes are typical Colombian food. The night view is gorgeous and the restaurant decoration is fun and unique!

name: Mongui central square
description:
EN We slept one night without problems in the main square. The square is a little lit but it is quiet after 7pm
ES Dormimos una noche sin problemas en la plaza principal. La plaza esta un poco iluminada pero es tranquila despues de las 7pm

name: Cocoa Cafe Frances
description: Very good ice cream. They also sell waffles. For me it was the best ice cream in South America

name: Tatami Hostel
description: wonderfully place with modern rooms and very nice staff.   I paid 60,000 for single room. fast wifi, hot water, quite court yard.  outside parking for moto.  on outskirts of Bucaramonga on safe area.     walking distance to food and mall.   recommend this place

name: Hotel Royal Elim
description:
Nice hotel near the Airport with connected covered parking. There are long wheelbase sprinter sized vans parked in the covered area in the back of the lot and there’s a bit of an open lot on one side. The parking lot itself may be a little hard to navigate in a very large expedition style truck but aside from that it looks like they can accommodate anything. 

The hotel is very clean, there’s a large pool, and hotel provides a shuttle to the airport.

name: Quebrada Cachirime
description:
Ample space for free parking, good entrance, good shade, friendly people who confirmed that we can stay and it is safe, at night it is lit.  There is a drinks place with loud music during the day but at 7 p.m. it closes, the person serving can order food from a restaurant for 17,000 COP (soup, tray and juice).  The best thing is to be able to enjoy bathing in the "charcos" that are not very crowded, although just a little higher up you can be alone.

Amplio espacio para estacionar gratis, buena entrada, buena sombra, gente amigable que nos confirmó que podemos quedarnos y es seguro, por la noche esta alumbrado. Hay un local de bebidas con musica fuerte durante el dia pero a las 19 hrs se cierra, la persona que atiende puede pedir comida de un restaurante por 17000 COP (sopa, bandeja y jugo). Lo mejor es poder disfrutar de bañarse en los "charcos" poco concurridos aunque apenas un poco mas arriba se puede estar solo.

name: Quiet pullout on a dirt road
description: You will find here a quiet grassy pullout along a small dirt road. Some locals are going to work from 5AM, and walk or ride on this road. On our side we prefer this quieter location than the Hoyo del Aire car park. 4G Mobistar signal available.

name: Hotel Valparaiso
description: Nice little cheap hotel in city center. Came here cycling (3 ppl + dog). Owner is very flex. We slept the 3 of us and the dog in one room for 60kCOP per night (we negociate a bit) with banos and WC shared. Bicycles were downstairs in the central hallway. Shower is VERY hot, water not potable but we filtered it (still taste chloro). WiFi is ok.

name: Hotel Las Palmas Villa de Leyva
description: awesome brand new hotel.  we paid 80k pesos (about $19.50 USD) for an enormous room with a huge king size bed and a single bed, balcony, smart tv and private bath with good American breakfast included for 2 people.  mattresses and shower are amazing and a huge gated parking lot with a covered place for Motos.  big rigs won't fit if you need really high clearance but vans should.  top 3 hotels in south America after 2 years here and for a really good price.  they were full on our third night when we tried to extend so had to move across the street (also nice but without breakfast and not as new and huge).

name: hotel villa central
description: decent cheap hotel, right in the main square.  paid only 40,000 pesos for 2 people in a double bed with private bathroom.  no parking but they let me put my moto in the chicken shop downstairs overnight.  hotel 2 doors down also told me I can park the moto there for 7,000 pesos if needed.  basic room but big enough and clean

name: Laguna San Pablin
description: nice quick hike to a Laguna with amazing glacier view.  takes about 1.5 hours round trip if you're not used to the altitude and out of shape like us.   free.  you do go through 2 gates but don't worry locals all said it's fine.  we're told about this hike from our hostel owner.  hard to follow walking path but the trail is on maps.me

name: intense road
description: do you like really really steep roads covered in really really loose stones on top of soft sand?  if so this is the adv road for you.  some of the steepest roads I've ridden in South America and it's real loose with a good amount of sand underneath.  still doable, I didn't fall 2 up on my adv moto but I have new tires and was white knuckling it for a long time (I did make her walk the steepest loosest 100 meter bit).  it's only an 11 km road so if that's what you're into, have fun.  the views are amazing.  we also drove the dirt road along the river in the canyon from Jordan to here.  That road is much easier but still some steep loose dirt roads.  obviously these photos don't do the roads justice.

name: megamotos real parts
description: they have actual parts OEM and brand name stuff.  cheapest oem air filters I've found in Colombia for my xt660 and brand name brake pads and other things.  this whole area is nothing but moto shops, even official Yamaha, KTM, Honda and more.  if you don't find it here you probably have to go to bogota

name: gelato
description:
Best ice cream ever, italian owner, cozy small place. 7k cop for a nice amount of ice cream.

Mejor helado del mundo, el dueño es italiano y el local es muy acogedor y familiar. 7mil cop por 1 cono de 1 bola bastante grande

name: Casa Surff
description:
Hostel/surf-school/bar/restaurant.
Daniel, the owner, is a surfer. 
We met him at the beach, in front of his place and he invited us to come sleep on the parking. 
We could use the WC, shower (outside) and WiFi of the bar.

super friendly staff.
very good food ($30000-60000)
nice location to surf.

A bit noisy at night cause it's right next to the malecon but felt very safe as it's a private parking.

name: Petromil gas station
description:
Large, safe and quiet place.  We arrived just looking for tranquility since there was too much noise on the beach.  The bathrooms are very dirty.

Lugar amplio, seguro y tranquilo. Llegamos buscando solo tranquilidad ya que en la playa habia demasiado ruido. Los baños están muy sucios.

name: Güecha de La Quebrada
description:
It´s an enchanting and quite place surrounded by native forest with paramo water stream and fauna that will surprise bird watchers. Perfect for people who want  to escape the hustle and bustle of the city and reconnect with nature. 

Learn with its owners about Ecosystem Regeneration. During harvest season you can taste organic foods grown on the same farm. 

Cellphone reception is good, 110v electricity is available, all small and medium vehicles can arrive at location. Confirm availability in advance via WhatsApp +57 312 3975413.

name: Road close - detour starts/ends
description: The road to/from Florian is closed due to landslides. Here you need to leave the main road to a 17km detour. (Which is 12km more than main road).

name: Detour from/to Florian
description: The road to/from Florian is closed due to landslides. Here you need to leave the main road to a 17km detour. (Which is 12km more than main road).

name: Nomada Hotel
description: sweet little place with dorms and private beds, exceptionally clean, very nice couple runs.   parking for moto was next door.  COP 90,000 including the tax (advertised rate for private room is COP65,000 before tax.   one street up from waterfront.  fast wifi, hot showers and free coffee and tea during the day.

name: Acampemos
description: Camping store that repairs tents and camping gear.  My tent zipper broke and had it repaired here for 60k pesos.  They also sell the small propane canisters for camping stoves, which I've had trouble finding elsewhere.  Really nice guys that run the place as well

name: Balcones de Siatala
description:
It is an excellent place with an incredible view. It has everything, hot water, good internet, place for the motorhome. Nelson very friendly. WhatsApp 3227176117. Recommended.
----
Es un excelente lugar con una vista increíble. cuenta con todo agua caliente, buen internet, lugar para el motorhome. Nelson muy amable. WhatsApp 3227176117. recomendado.

name: Hotel Selva Verde
description: A very special place, it‘s right on the outskirts of town, super quiet but only a few steps to walk to the main square. Surrounded by green, bedded in a nice big garden. Space for small cars, Motorcycles and Bicycles, gated! Very secure. Also, the breakfast is rich and a lot! Never had so much to eat to start the day.
