Nice hosts, as far as we see, no better place in town. Highly recommended!

name: Vacant land/Terreno baldío
description:
Flat vacant land with a good entrance facing the beach, ideal for very large mobile homes.  Showers for $2000 COP next door.  Very quiet, perhaps due to low season.

Terreno baldío plano y con buena entrada frente a la playa, ideal para casas rodantes muy grandes. Duchas por $ 2000 COP al lado. Muy tranquilo, tal vez por temporada baja.

name: Casa Familiar Fela
description:
The Fela family house is the most welcoming place that can be found in the area. Fela and her family are charming and from the moment we arrived they made us feel like we were at home. It has been one of the most pleasant experiences we have had in Colombia. Furthermore, the location is perfect because the beach is a 10-minute drive away, there are islands that can be visited along the coast and there are many around the sea volcano. There are also supermarkets and everything you need.

La casa familiar fela es un lugar de lo más acogedor que se puede encontrar en loma de arena y alrededores. Fela y su familia son encantadores y desde que llegamos nos hicieron sentir como si estuviéramos en casa. Ha sido una de las experiencias más agradables que hemos vivido en Colombia.
 Además la ubicación es perfecta porque la playa está a 10 minutos caminando, hay islas que puedes visitar en lancha desde la costa y tienes muy cerca el volcán de lodo. También hay supermercados cerca y todo lo que puedas necesitar.

name: Parqueadero informal río pepino
description:
We parked our combi to take a swim in the river. When we came back, someone had broken in and robbed every electronic device we had. Laptop, phone, camera.
Lots of people park here their cars for a swim and in fact some people recommended us this place, but after our experience, in this area we recommend, never leave your van alone except in a really safe car park.

Parqueamos nuestra combi para bañarnos en el río. cuando regresamos alguien rompió la cerradura del copiloto y nos hurtaron todos los dispositivos electrónicos que teníamos... portátil, teléfono, cámara...
Mucha gente parque aquí motos y carros para ir a bañarse y de hecho nos recomendaron este lugar pero después de nuestra experiencia definitivamente recomendamos pagar un parqueadero seguro o no dejar la van sola.

name: Residencias la Marquesa 2
description: We paid 45000 pesos for a double room with private bathroom. The hotel is very simple and not the best looking, but in all fairness it was clean and has hot showers. It's okay for a couple of nights. Some rooms are incredibly tiny, so ask for a bigger room! WiFi works fine, there's a supermarket next door, a parking, and a couple of bakeries nearby!

name: On the street parking
description:
We slept on the street, 200 meters from the main square. A slightly noisy street but very well located.
----
ES Dormimos en la calle, a 200 metros de la plaza principal. Una calle un poco ruidosa pero muy bien ubicado.

name: La Greca Casa de paz
description: Nice Hostel-Hotel-Camping! For 2 until 3 Camper size like VW Caravan! Good place for Motorbikes too, place for 5 Tents, easy road! Not 4 x4 need! Warm Shower, Wifi! Tent price 15000, Caravan 20000! Breakfast, and Dinner possible! Very quit and clean! Room 2 Person 45000, Sharing Bathroom, 65000 inkl Bathroom

name: previsora insurance
description: Seems to be the only place around that delivers insurance for foreign vehicules. Sura has stopped giving them lately. Cost is around 208000 pesos for 3 months for a 650cc motorcycle. opens at 8h00 AM, arrive early there is a line up.

name: Casa del ciclista
description:
Bike mechanic and parts. Shimano and official brands. Very nice owners. They can also help travelers with advices and guidance.
-------
Taller de bicis y tienda de gran calidad. Shimano. Los dueños son muy amables y pueden ayudar también dando consejos a viajeros

name: Peaceful place with great view
description: On a small and steep dirtroad you can reach this small pullout. The view is great. Very quiet. We had a quiet night and felt safe. Only two friendly locals on bikes passing. Farm land around. Difficult for big rigs.

name: Finca Cabaña (coffee farm)
description:
We visited this finca to know more about the coffee process in San Agustín. We had a really good time with Alejandro.
We tried 3 different types of coffee, learned about the history of it and visited the plantations.
Very recommended! Alejandro took time to respond at all our questions. 
price is $40'000pp.
please write before to Alejandro +57 320 489 3876

name: Rodesmar - Panifigadora / Cafe
description: Bakery with small cafe. They do have different pastries / bread but only the local cafe „Tinto“ but for a non touristic place it’s fine.

name: El Rancho de Toño
description: Great restaurant with a good menu for 15k. They had trout as well for 18k and it was delicious!

name: 24 h parking
description:
A 24 h parking, very safe, big, very close to the beach, the city centre, nice restaurants, tours start nearby! We highly recommend this place, the two brothers Andres and Franklin are very helpful and welcoming.
We payed 40.000 for 24 h or 20000 overnight

name: Terpel Jamaica
description:
On one side of the bathrooms there is a faucet with a long hose that the very kind administrator gave us.

A un costado de los baños tiene llave con manguera larga que el administrador muy amable nos facilitó.

name: Public Parking
description: Perfect place to park if you rent an Airbnb in town ! We payed 10000cop/12h. And stayed 3 days. Very safe and close to everything

name: Gamcelat Hotel
description:
We stayed 4 nights at this nice hotel close to the city center and 2 kms from the archeological center. It's not perfectly flat so it's better to have levelers. 

We paid 60'000 per night (2 people and a campervan)  The cost per night for 2 people and a camper was reasonable. Overall, a middle-of-the-road option for those seeking basic amenities during their stay.

name: Casa Victoria Pijao
description: Delightful hostel with inside parking for motorcycle. breakfast and fast wifi, close to town square.  street parking for big rigs, clean hostel. private rooms, some with own showers  paid COP 60,000 for private room and breakfast. Very nice lady owner, Luz Mariana.  she has whatsApp contact on door. don't miss Piajo when touring coffee district

name: Hospedaje el Roma
description: They have 15k and 20k rooms with shared bathroom for the night. Not very clean but for the price, it's okay for a night. TV, cold shower, no wifi.

name: Donde remzo
description:
Might not be open to public, need to ask the owner.
This is a dogs rescue house and a camping. It's currently under remodelation but you can ask if they allow to put your tent somewhere or if they have available cabins. There is wifi, electricity, bathrooms and the river just next to the place.
instagram @remzo_y_noa_rescatan 

Puede que no esté abierto al público todavía, se encuentra en remodelación pero el dueño fue muy amable y nos permitió acampar aqui.
Es un refugio de perros y un proyecto de camping con cabañas de madera y espacio para acampar.
El espacio es muy bonito y el dueño realmente amable. Hay luz, wifi, baños y el rio al lado.

name: parking municipal
description:
Guatapé municipal parking, it is super large and you can sleep inside without a problem, it is super close to the center. 3000 per hour / 18,000 day and night (cars and vans) for trucks and buses 21,000 day and night. We stayed 2 nights and paid 36,000. highly recommended to stop in Guatapé where it is practically impossible to park on the street 

parking municipal de Guatapé, es súper grande y puedes dormir dentro sin problema, está súper cerca del centro. 3000 por hora / 18.000 día y noche (coches y furgonetas) para camiones y buses 21.000 día y noche. nosotros estuvimos 2 noches y pagamos 36.000. muy recomendable para parar en Guatapé donde prácticamente es imposible aparcar en la calle

name: Hidden in the forest
description: On a small path wind protected in the forest. Not much view. Only a few people by foot or bike passing. Quiet. 2800hm. Claro signal.

name: Villa Clarita Centro Recreacional
description:
Calle 8 N. 5A-24, Rivera, 410010, Kolumbien

+573105684008

name: Hotel Playa Mar
description:
Large site with numerous rooms right on the beach front. Parking is safe at night, staff friendly. 
Paid 80k for a room with ventilator. Asked 140k for air conditioning. 
Felt safe and great place. Food is great too. 
Cold drink available.

name: Auto lavado
description:
Interior exterior car wash center. I had my valve cleaned after leaving the cargo ship, it was full of dust, especially the bottom and salt from the boat trip. Very good service for $45,000COP exterior shampoo and perfect underneath

Centre de lavage auto intérieur extérieur. J’ai fais nettoyer mon vanne après la sortie du cargo il était plein de poussière surtout le dessous et le sel du voyage en bateau. Très bon service pour 45000$COP extérieur shampouiner et le dessous parfait

name: Gaz à domicile
description:
Luis Carlos came to my address to fill my propane gas bottle purchased in Canada (same model as in the USA) very nice with his friend, he came after 2 hours since I contacted him. He didn't know iOverlander but has already been of service to several travelers. Contact him by whatsapp +57 300 8636793

Luis Carlos est venu à mon adresse pour remplir ma bouteille de gaz propane acheté au Canada (même model qu’aux USA) très sympa avec son ami, il est venu au bout de 2h que je l’ai contacté. Il ne connaissait pas iOverlander mais a déjà rendu service à plusieurs voyageurs. Contactez le par whatsapp +57 300 8636793

name: Portal del Sur
description: We really enjoyed our stay with David (+57 3014208679) for 2 nights. parking for 2 cars aprox. big rig could be difficult. bathroom with hot shower and you can use the kitchen. there are also rooms available. Portal del Sur is a educative center with diverse activities. nice trails for trekking that David showed us. totally recommend.

name: Cañón de la Cristalina
description:
The most spectacular hike through the rainforest we ever did. You hike through a river bed and through three canyons. The third canyon is almost a slot canyon and around 1-2 meters wide and an estimated 20m high. In the canyon you have to wade through hip deep water (we were there during dry season, so after heavy rain it might not be passable). Guacharos living in the third canyon, so don't be afraid of the sounds that you will be hearing there. It's one of the most amazing birds. Do not point on them with a torch as they can't handle the light and will actually die from too much light. Just enjoy the sounds. Lots of other endemic species living there as well (there are some signs with information). 

Wear appropriate footwear as you have to walk through water and over rocks all the time. Also just wear clothes that can get wet. Multiple options to swim and cool off under waterfalls. The whole track there and back again took us 3,5 hours. You can do it quicker or spend even more time. 

You can camp at Hostal El Pauji at the trail head. They can either organize a guide or you just go alone for free (what we preferred). You can also take your dog on the hike (what we did). But your dog needs to be able to swim if you want to walk through the third canyon. Until the third canyon it's possible without swimming (during dry season). 

We were there on a Sunday during holiday season and still were completely alone. So chances are high that you have the place for your own. 

This hike is well worth the detour from Ruta 45!

name: Terpel El Bosque
description:
We asked one of the dispatchers and he immediately said yes.  They have a long hose.
-----------
Preguntamos a uno de los despachadores e inmediatamente nos dijo que si. Cuentan con manguera larga.

name: Eco Santo Domingo
description:
A very nice campground next to the Santo Domingo River with cristal clear water.
Good facilities, plenty of space for big rigs. 
Very crowded on weekends, be aware.
Strict noise rules at night.
There is a small and basic store and a restaurant not sure if it’s open during the week.
Entrance fee COP 15.000 pppn and COP 10.000 per car per day.
Highly recomended during week days!

name: Don Tiberio
description:
Amazing spot to camp, very close to Melcocho River, with crystal clear water and waterfalls.
There is a flat spot to camp with grass and some muddy areas.
There are some room rentals which are not pretty, but with a river like that, who cares!
Road is only accessible by 4x4 with low gear and good clearance. The road is very steep and narrow.
You must contact Don Tiberio before arriving at +57 3217518025 
There is a security check point and they will not let you in without proof of that call.
There is a small store with drinks and chips.
Bathrooms are not great.
Nevertheless it is a Spectacular place! It feels more like wild camping than a campground.
Cell phone signal is very weak.

name: Hotel Las Quinchas
description:
Stayed here for the night as I'm travelling west towards Medellin.
Place is okay and owners are friendly, paid 40k cop for the night.
No hot water, room comes with fan and tv.

There's only two buses a day going west to Puerto Boyaca. one at 5am and one at noon, both cost 50k.
I took the bus here from Chiquinquira and paid 25k

name: Hotel Casa Blanca Palace
description: Nice hotel in Puerto Boyaca, stayed for one night and paid 40k for a room with two queen sized beds + tv + AC + private bathroom. Shower wasn't hot, but definitely wasn't cold either. Staff was also very nice.

name: Hotel y Parqueadeiro Las Mulas
description:
Excellent parking for trucks and RVs, very secure, completely closed. If you wish, there are popular rooms, with a cost of 45,000 Colombian pesos per night (couple). We paid 10,000 Colombian pesos for parking for the motor home. Very safe and quiet.

Excelente estacionamiento para camiones y casa rodantes, muy seguro, completamente cerrado. Si lo deseas, hay habitaciones popular, con un costo de 45.000 pesos colombianos por noche (pareja). estacionamiento para la casa rodante pagamos la cantidad de 10.000 pesos colombianos. muy seguro y tranquilo.

name: Cabañas El Nova, place parking
description:
It’s a cabañas rental, we asked if it is possible to spend the night in the parking lot. The host Adriana is very pleasant and found the idea of hosting us for one night very good. The place is very nicely decorated, parking space on clay. There is no service. 50,000COP/night, we were able to recharge our 2 vehicles with water, a 6m sprinter and a 7m camper van

C’est une location de cabañas, nous avons demandé s’il est possible de passer la nuit sur le parking. L’hôte Adriana est très agréable est à trouvé l’idée de nous héberger pour une nuit très bien. L’endroit est très joliment décoré, place de parking sur terre battue. Il n’y a pas de service. 50.000COP/nuit, nous avons pu recharger en eau nos 2 véhicules, un sprinter de 6m et un camping car de 7m

name: Parking office tourisme
description:
A place in front of the tourist office, we parked with a 6m sprinter and a 7m camper van.

Une place devant l’office du tourisme, on s’est garé avec un van sprinter 6m et un camping car 7m

name: Small dead end track hidden from the road
description: Nice and quiet place to sleep. It is a small dead end path behind a hill, so you are hidden from the road. You can see the Nevado del Ruiz volcano and the Arenas crater. Please note that access to this path requires climbing a 25cm high sidewalk, so you need a high clearance vehicle. Very good Tigo signal. NB: this spot is just before the other one where you can be seen from the road.

name: Cascada Del Rio Azufrado
description: There are 2 waterfalls on the side of the road here, the first, the most impressive, falls from the top of the cliff and to see the second you have to pass the barbed wire and walk a hundred meters. It's worth a stop!

name: Hotel Dani
description:
The cost of the room for 1 person is 30,000 COP. The rooms are small, but the hotel has ample space to leave your bicycle.

El costo de la habitación para 1 persona es de 30000 COP. Las habitaciones son pequeñas pero el Hotel tiene un espacio amplio para dejar la bicicleta.

name: Lubricentro La Mona
description:
Good place to change oil and filters.  They also carry out greasing and checking the coolant fluid.
 Honest people and reasonable prices.

Buen lugar para realizar cambio de aceite y filtros. Tambien realizan engrasado y revision de liquido refrigerante.
Gente honesta y precios razonables

name: End of Carrera 5 street by the sea
description: End of Carrera 5 street by the sea. There was a neighbor who we asked if we could stay, they let us have no problems.

name: Water tap next to the street
description: 100m before is a water tap next to the street on the right when you come from Tora. Look for a wall with broken glass on top and a statue of saint. Locals use the water for cooking.

name: best gas station here
description:
the owner is very friendly. we sleep one nigth free! the parking is big. bathrooms clean. 
-------
el dueño es buena onda. dormimos una noche gratis. el estacionamiento es grande. baños limpios

name: Copacabana
description:
Very steep and narrow road up to 32%!
4.5t limited, heavy big rig not recommended. Did it with a Bremach low gear hardly made it. If you have to stop no chance to start again. Google leeds you there if you want to climb towards the top of Medellin or Guatape if you come from Bobosa. Avoid this road!

name: Park
description: Suitable for cyclists and motorcyclists (though vehicles also might be able to find a place to park in this area). Next to the iglesia is a park with a small building and a roof. There is enough space for multiple tents and it will be a nice cover when raining. Asked some locals and they all said it's fine to sleep here. Very quiet at night.

name: Farm in Crater Vulcan Machín
description:
You can camp in the crater of the volcano. There is a little farm house and the people sell cheese and water. Beautiful place.
No facilities. 
A little bit of claro reception but not the best.
15.000 COP per person.

You will definitely need high clearance to get here. If it has been raining, you will need 4x4 due to big and deep mud holes.

name: Taller de Carlos El Mariachi
description:
We were passing through Bucaramanga when the box of our Kombi was damaged.
We slept on Sunday night near this which would become our accommodation for a week.
Don Carlos “El Marichi” helped us a lot.
A very honest man who took us to all the spare parts stores (it is not easy to find Kombi spare parts) always looking for the best prices.
And the best thing: he allowed us to sleep with our truck in his workshop with a bathroom and electricity every day we were here.
We take the opportunity to do a more complete review before continuing our trip.
Super recommend.
Good price and loyalty.
Don't look for someone else
His name is Carlos Serrano and his contact is +57 3155921533

Estábamos de pasaje por Bucaramanga cuando la caja de nuestra Kombi se dañó. 
Dormimos el domingo a noche cerca de este que pasaría a ser nuestro alojamiento por una semana. 
Don Carlos “El Marichi” nos ayudó mucho. 
Un hombre muy honrado que nos llevó a todas las tiendas de repuestos (no es fácil encontrar repuestos de Kombi) siempre buscando los mejores precios. 
Y lo mejor: nos permitió dormir con nuestra camioneta en su taller con baño y electricidad todos los días en que pasamos aquí. 
Aprovechamos para hacer una revisión más completa antes de seguir viaje. 
Super recomiendo. 
Buen precio y lealtad. 
No busquen por otra persona
El se llama Carlos Serrano y su contacto es +57 3155921533

name: Fezal’s place near from port
description:
Great place to stay while you are preparing to ship your vehicle by container. It’s an apartment well equipped with a secure parking for two vehicles. 6 minutes by car to the port and 20 minutes waking. Fezal is great host and can help you with everything you need. WhatsApp +57 316 4946977

—————-

Ótimo lugar para ficar enquanto você se prepara para enviar seu veículo em contêiner. É um apartamento bem equipado com estacionamento seguro para dois veículos. 6 minutos de carro até o porto e 20 minutos a pé. Fezal é um ótimo anfitrião e pode ajudá-lo com tudo o que você precisa. WhatsApp +57 316 4946977

name: parking lot
description: It's really hard to find a good place in Bogota. This car park is open 24 hours a day and guarded.  You can spend the night in the van.  Unfortunately, I don't know whether this is possible for very long vehicles.  We at 6m were allowed to stand here. We paid 50.500 for 2 nights. With Uber it takes 30 minutes to get to the center and costs between €3 and €5.

name: Gazebos along the river
description: There are gazebos along the river where you can camp for a night. The hotels in El Retiro are all expensive (150K or more) for a budget traveller, and I asked at the police station for camping options and they took me to this location. There is a fair amount of traffic right in front, but this town is a place where rich people live, and the police said it's a safe place. Traffic calmed down after 10pm. You can cross small bridges to the other side of the river so only for bicycles and motorcycles.

name: Terpel La moneda 4
description:
Free showers, clean bathrooms, water tap and wifi.

Duchas gratis, baños limpios, llave de agua y wifi.

name: San Marco
description: At a beautiful huge tree, you can ask to stay the night. Gated, toilets, sink, lots of space, right off the highway.

name: Scott Cartagena
description: Bicycle shop sells bicycles, repairs bicycles and sells parts; they have torque wrenches!

name: La Choza de Chuchú
description:
Great place to visit, i think its 5000 cop.
Chuchú is a local artist who collected lots of valuable objects his whole life, painted  wrote poems and so many things. He loves his hometown and wants to keep its personality and culture.
If you are travelling by bike or have a special story he may want to drink some beers together or even host you.

Lugar muy interesante, creo que la visita son 5mil pesos.
Chuchú es un artista local, pintor, escritor y muchas otras cosas. Estuvo toda su vida coleccionando objetos y decorando su casa de forma especial en honor a su pueblo y sus costumbres. Si tenéis suerte quizás podáis tomaros unas cervezas con él o incluso os ofrezca acampar en su casa.

name: Parqueadero Grande
description:
It is a very strategic place in Armenia, to visit all the towns of the coffee region,
The place is very quiet and safe.
The owner's name is Julián 3008616057

es un lugar muy estratégico en Armenia,para visitar todos los pueblos del Eje cafetero,
el lugar es muy tranquilo y seguro.
el Dueño se llama Julián 3008616057

name: Mirador / iglesia El Reposo
description:
Nice, quiet place behind a small church, located on a promontory offering a magnificent view of the countryside. The terrain is flat and suitable for small vehicles. There is a trash can and a water tap, but I don't know if it is drinkable without filtration. The little hamlet is very cute.

Joli endroit au calme derrière une petite église, située sur un promontoire offrant une vue magnifique sur la campagne. Le terrain est plat et il convient à de petits véhicules. Il y a une poubelle et un robinet d'eau, mais je ne sais pas si elle est potable sans filtration. Le petit hameau est très mignon.


Nice, quiet place behind a small church, located on a promontory offering a magnificent view of the countryside.  The terrain is flat and suitable for small vehicles.  There is a trash can and a water tap, but I don't know if it is drinkable without filtration.  The little hamlet is very cute.

name: Hotel Cafelia
description: We originally wanted to stay at the Reserva Kaukita, across the road, but we didn't know we needed a reservation. As it was dusk we were in need of a place to stay and asked at this small hotel. We could stay at their premises for 30.000 COP (1 motorhome and 4 people). We could use showers and baños as well as the small pool (but for an extra 15.000 COP p.p. ) there is a little grassy area (maybe suitable for a tent?) and a playground. It was nice and secure for one night, and very welcoming staff on top :)

name: Suna Vito
description: Beautiful hotel with around 5 rooms with private bathroom (including a treehouse cabin) from 100.000 to 205.000 COP. Located next to a lagoon with a nice swimming pool it was very nice to relax from the heat.

name: Place to print new license plates
description: if you lost one of your license plates, here you can make new one

name: Golfzilla Machine
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: May have been added by owner/manager.

Automotive maintenance service, oil change, scanner service, suspension service, brakes, among others, sale of spare parts.
---
Servicio de mantenimiento automotriz ,cambio de aceite ,servicio de scanner ,servicio de suspensión ,frenos entre otros , venta de repuestos

name: Magia Fura y Tena
description: Breathtaking views on these mythical mountains. Truly amazing. This place has some affordable cabañas (50k to 80k) hanging on the side of a cliff with the best view, which is the main business, but i see amazing flat spots with a view and they say they would accept overlanders. There are a few artefacts / museum on site which is stuff that has been gathered by the family over the years. This zone is full of precious stones so lots of mining spots on the mountain. Homar owns this place, he's a super nice guy. Tipical food available.

name: In the middle of the pine forest
description: Since the wild camping spot a little bit further was not accessible with our 4wd camper of 2,5m height we stopped here for the night. This is a pull-out surrounded by pines. It is very quiet, we have seen nobody. No view (and no sun) since we are completely surrounded by pine forest. The spot is not level you will need some blocks.

name: Canos Inn
description: This hotel (Canoa Inn) is a hidden gem. Behind its surface are modern, very clean rooms with AC, ventilators, good mattress, very much space for me and my bicycle (there is enough space for a second one), friendly staff and wifi. I payed as a single 60k COP. Supermarket, atm, across the street.

name: Nariño parque principal
description:
nice quiet village, safe place to spend a night. many trees.
we could use toilet and wifi of the café next to the grocery store.

name: parking en El Poblado
description:
That was the only parking lot we found in the town to park large and tall vehicles. Our van is 2.7m high and 7m long and we had no problems parking. The hour is a little more expensive because it is the trendy area but there are practically no other options to park the motorhome and visit the area. It closes at night so I don't think you can sleep inside

ese fue el único parking que encontramos en el Poblado para aparcar vehículos grandes y altos. nuestra furgoneta mide 2'7m de alto y 7 de largo y no tuvimos problemas para aparcar. la hora es un poco más cara porque es la zona de moda pero practican no hay más opciones para aparcar el motorhome y visitar la zona. Cierra por la noche así que no creo que se pueda dormir dentro

name: Sierra Morena Restaurante - Hotel
description: Very clean rooms, good mattress, room with private shower (cold) and bathroom. Rooms with AC or ventilators. Stayed with my bicycle in a single room for 45k COP.

name: Several grassy areas
description: Here you will find several grassy areas along the canal. It's quiet. Be careful at the end of the afternoon there are sandflies until sunset then the mosquitoes take over for an hour, fortunately during the night we were quiet. Good signal with Mobistar.

name: Desierto de la Tatacoa Valle del Cardón
description:
Quiet and beautiful place, if you want to rest, this is the best, it also has a restaurant and a desert in the patio of the house.
____________________________

sitio tranquilo y hermoso, si quieres descansar este es el mejor sitio, además cuenta con restaurante tienen menú para todo paladar incluyendo vegetariano y vegano muy orgánico, todos sus alimentos lo hacen con mucho amor ,tiene desierto en el patio de la casa, su atención es muy especial, transmiten una gran energía. con solo  unos pocos meses (4)de funcionamiento el sitio es muy agradable.

name: Confort Hotel
description: Very clean hotel and friendly staff. Rooms with own shower (warm) and bathroom. Great value for money. I paid 30k COP for a single room. Enough space for my bicycle in the room.

name: Restaurante (Puerto Romero)
description:
Although we didn't stay here, the lady who owned the restaurant told us that we could stay and set up our tent in the restaurant room when she finished selling her food. He told us that several cyclists have stayed at his location.

Aunque no nos quedamos aquí, la señora dueña del restaurante nos dijo que podíamos quedarnos y armar nuestra carpa en el salón de restaurante cuando ella acabara de vender su comida. Nos comentó que varios ciclistas se han quedado en su local.

name: Mirador Popayán
description:
Mirador de Popayan has a restaurant, cabins, a camping area and a motorhome area. The route is paved and easily accessible. We have wi-fi, bathrooms, hot water, water to refill tanks, drainage for gray/black water. We are waiting for travelers, to receive them with the best attention. +57 316 8616015 

Mirador de Popayan tiene restaurante, cabañas, sector de camping y sector para motorhome. La ruta es pavimentada y de fácil accesibilidad. Tenemos wi-fi, Baños, agua caliente, agua para recargar tanques, desalojo para aguas grises/negras. Estamos esperando viajeros, para recibirlos con la mejor atención. +57 316 8616015

name: Restaurante Marlene
description: Nice restaurant, with cold drinks. We went there with a group of motorcycle. Muy rico

name: Hotel Torrado
description:
Small hotel, very clean and quiet. Large parking on the side of the hotel. 
25 000COB for a private room! 
I recommand

name: Puente Calicanto Mongui
description:
Vandalism
Sunday evening/night parking someone letting air out of both the front tyres. No other damages.
Better park at the main square and walk the distance.

name: Acuaparque Nacional del Chicamocha
description: The Aquapark has free showers in their changing rooms. You don't need to pay to use these as they are located before the entrance to the waterpark. The water is not warm but it's not exactly cold either. It's free so can't complain.

name: Ecobrisas del Guaguaqui (La Cristalina, Puerto Romero)
description:
This place offers rental cabins, however, we asked if we could set up our tents and they agreed. They charged us 10,000 COP per person with access to shower, bathroom, tables and river. The place is very nice and quiet. The person who manages it is called Evelio.

Este lugar ofrece Cabañas de alquiler, sin embargo, nosotros preguntamos si podíamos armar nuestras carpas y accedieron. Nos cobraron 10.000 COP por persona con acceso a ducha, baño, mesas y río. el lugar es muy bonito y tranquilo. La persona que lo administra se llama Evelio.

name: Peaje
description:
Water to fill the tank of the motorhome. Before crossing the toll. Road from Barranquilla to Cartagena

Agua para cargar el tanque del motorhome. Antes de cruzar el peaje. Camino de Barranquilla hacia cartagena

name: La Ye
description:
This is a small Hospedaje and shop. We arrived here at around 5pm on our way to La Macarena and asked if we could spend the night here. Super friendly woman. She sells beverages and prepares lunch and probably breakfast during the week for the farmworkers.
Toilets are available. She didn't know how much she should charge as we were obviously the first people who wanted to camp there, so we offered 15.000 COP and she accepted.

Good place to stay if it gets late.

name: Hotel El Jardín
description:
This Hotel has several Cabañas with private bathrooms available. We spent a night there camping in our Camper. They have a restaurant and they prepared us a vegetarian meal although we were the only guests, as it was low season.
There is not a lot of space on the property so we just parked on the street in front of the hotel. There is almost no traffic anyway. They said we could park wherever we want, even in the field with the cattle.

Fast Wi-Fi, clean toilets, showers, friendly people, restaurant, free coffee in the morning, everything you need. 
We paid 10.000 COP for two persons. Cabañas cost 80.000 COP.

name: Basketball court with roof
description: For cyclists and motorcyclists. A basketball court with a roof that provides a good cover when it's raining. Asked if I could camp here and everyone said no problem.

name: Punku Co-working
description: Co-working space with shared desks and private offices. Fast internet, good prices. You can pay by the hour, day, week or month. Closes for lunch which is a bit weird. Contact Andrea for detailed info. +57 317 2800044

name: Santa Maria del Rio
description:
Large place for camper vans on a very quiet restaurant parking.
You can fill water, lunch, dine.
we paid 5000 cop for one night.

name: Coello River
description:
Magnificent little beach near the Coello River. Delicious to rest and take a bath in these warm waters. We came in February. We recommend going to the Coello police and announcing yourself. They are very friendly. Come with water. Yes, there is a mobile signal with Claro data.
======================================
Magnifica playita cerca al río Coello. Delicioso para descansar y darse un baño en estas tibias aguas. Vinimos en febrero. Recomendamos ir a la policía de Coello y anunciarse. Ellos son muy amables. Llegad con agua. Sí hay señal móvil con datos de Claro.

name: Zona Parqueo Río Coello
description:
A place next to the road to rest in Camper. The place is very safe. There is a store on the corner and the people are very friendly. The Police arrived and told us that we could sleep peacefully. The Coello River can be heard and deafens the sound of traffic.
==========================================
Un lugar al lado de la carretera para descansar en Camper. El lugar es muy seguro. Hay una tienda en la esquina y las personas son muy amables. La Policía llegó y nos dijo que podíamos dormir tranquilos. El río Coello se escucha y ensordece el sonido del tráfico.

name: Los Balcones Hotel
description: Great value hotel in a safe area close to the airport. 64,000 cop for twin room (cheaper than a double) with en suite bathroom. Very clean, great service and free secure parking for a few cars and motorbikes (reserve before to make sure). Booked on Booking.com as it was cheaper than on site, and here you can request the parking. Highly recommended since it's hard to find good value hotels in Bogota.

name: Coffee Cupping
description:
We visited this place to learn about roasting coffee.

Javier is very friendly and take time to explain every steps. We learned how to use the V60 and tasted 4 different coffees.

Very recommandable visit. Road in good condition but if you need a Willys to come there, you could order one on the main place. Price is COP 55'000 p.p. (2 hours). Phone number of Javier +57 316 823 3722

name: Poterie
description:
Translation: Pottery class at Pablo Santa. 35,000/person. Pablo is great, the children and I did a pottery class with no time limit. Modeling by hand and on a lathe, decoration, painting... the children leave with all their creations

Cours de poterie chez Pablo Santa. 35000/personne. Pablo est génial les enfants et moi avons fait un cours de poterie sans limite de temps. Modelage à la main et sur tour, décoration, peinture… les enfants repartent avec toutes leurs créations

name: Dangerous dogs
description:
We were walking down the street with my girlfriend, not far from the El Paraiso restaurant which is at the end of the cul-de-sac.  One of the owners' dogs arrived suddenly and bit my girlfriend violently on the thigh, inflicting a serious injury.  According to neighbors, this is the 5th time that one of their dogs has bitten passers-by.  At mediation, the owners lied to try to avoid paying compensation.  In short, DON'T GO THERE!
---
Nous nous promenions dans la rue avec ma copine, pas très loin du restaurant El Paraiso qui est au bout de l'impasse. Un des chiens des propriétaires est arrivé brutalement et a mordu violemment ma copine à la cuisse, lui infligeant une grave blessure. D'après le voisinnage, c'est la 5ème fois qu'un de leurs chiens mord des passants. A la médiation, les propriétaires ont menti pour essayer de ne pas payer d'indemnisations. Bref, N'Y ALLEZ PAS!


Estábamos caminando por la calle con mi novia, no lejos del restaurante El Paraíso que está al final del callejón sin salida.  Uno de los perros de los dueños llegó de repente y mordió violentamente a mi novia en el muslo, causándole una herida grave.  Según los vecinos, esta es la quinta vez que uno de sus perros muerde a los transeúntes.  En la mediación, los propietarios mintieron para intentar evitar el pago de una indemnización.  En resumen, ¡NO VAYAS ALLÍ!

name: Old train station
description: Nice, safe and quite place to camp on the old railway station. We travel by bike but definitely there's place for medium and big rigs. Little tienda close by and all neighbours are friendly and willing to help with anything.

name: Bikexperts
description: Bicycle shop sells bicycles, parts and services

name: Villa Flores Hostal
description: Nice basic place to spend the night. Many orchids and plants, lots of colibris, friendly people. No wifi but Clare 3G. 50k for 2p.

name: Hostal de la montaña
description:
Gloria, the owner, is a very Kind Lady who offers  1 room with Double-bed in her House.
Very clean ! Very Beautiful View!
Next to her House is also a Restaurant.
Highly recommended for friendly people!

name: Lavanderia en libertadores
description: Don’t go in here. The lavandería was recommended to us by our hostel. We left a bag of clothes (btw max 5kg for 25k COP) and were told to come back the next day. After 24h, the clothes weren’t ready, the lady even struggled to find the right basket and when we checked the clothes, 5 of the shirts were still smelly. We left them there for another washing machine round (free ofc), but it’s really annoying.

name: La Cabaña Hostal
description: La Cabaña Hostal, simply and relax place for rest in your bicycle trip in La Alta Guajira just in front of Caribean sea, have hamacas and second floor for enjoy the view, Yepez is a really good kind guy, i pay 15cop pppn for a tent in a second floor, have private room option and camp in the beach. you can save the bicycle in to the hostel. WhatsApp Yepez +57 310 381 8710

name: Pacho Villa
description:
Great mountain campground. They offer meals at 15k cop, a bed in shared dorm for 20k cop or a place to camp. There is also potable water and bathroom.
From this place you can walk to pico pance or just visit the river and its natural pools

_________________________

Refugio de montaña pacho villa. Alberto es muy simpático y acoge a los caminantes. Ofrece comida abundante a 15k cop, cama a 20k cop la noche o zona donde acampar (no se el precio). En el refugio hay aislantes y cobijas.
También hay baño seco y agua potable. No hay señal.
Desde aqui se puede subir a balcones o pico pance, o visitar el rio y los charcos por ejemplo.

name: Bomberos La Hormiga
description: Big firefighter station with amazing friendly firefighters. You can sleep in the half open station under the big roof or pitch your tent or park your big vehicle in the secured backyard next to an old big firefighter truck. there is lots of space. you can use the cold shower (not really cold, nobody wants a warm shower here), kitchen, wifi. some of the bomberos were very interested to talk about foreign countries, politics in colombia,... the host a lot of travellers. i was waiting for friends and stayed two nights with them.

name: Grassy flat place
description: Nice flat grassy area on the heights of the lake. This place is accessible to all types of vehicles. It is possible to access the lake on foot and to swim there.

name: Colon riverbed
description: River bed accessible with a vehicle. 4wd recommended as the descent can be muddy but once in the river bed the ground is hard and stony. It is also possible to stop before if you prefer. Very beautiful place by the river and very quiet. The water is clean and transparent, however it is very cold. A few men work here collecting sand or stones. Like any river, be careful the water can rise quickly in the event of a storm.

name: Viajero Hostel Bogota
description: Great Hostel with private rooms and dormitories. I stayed some nights in a private room with air conditioning and own bathroom and shower for 120k and some nights in a dormitory (4beds) for 70k COP with own shower and bathroom. There is a spa as well and sauna included . Quite. Very good breakfast for reasonable price and restaurant. Located close to historic center and close to public transportation. Shuttle available as well. Very nice and helpful people. Highly recommend

name: Finca café Esmeralda
description:
Great place, warm and full of sharing with the hosts. Possibility of carrying out all the stages of the coffee yourself and taking care of the banana trees. Small Rio at the bottom of the property to cool off. A great time spent with Fernando and his wife.
We stayed 2 nights with our 6m sprinter valve. 40,000COP per day/person including night and 3 meals. Half price for children. Wc and hot shower, terrace, garden… there are rooms too, a corner of paradise.
To get there you have to continue 3km on the track (in good condition) and follow the direction of Esmeralda.

name: Cancha de Fútbol
description: It's a big soccer field. Asked at the police station in town if I could camp here and they said no problem. Pitched my tent in the corner. No facilities here but it's quiet and there is water at the town plaza.

name: Tacos Micos
description:
Fantastic Mexican food at a great price! 
Choose between chicken or mixed meat tacos (3 tacos for 10k cop)
or a burrito (15k cop.)
This shop just opened and is operated by a group of friends

name: Café- Colombianita Cafe
description: Nice little Café. Cafe, Frappés, cakes, empanadas … and Air condition but not too cold.

name: Parking in the centre, 2.8m entry hight
description:
parking with high entrance (2.8m approx) to be able to walk around the centre. 4.000 cop per hour
----
parking con entrada alta (2.8m aprox) para poder recorrer el centro. 4.000 cop la hora

name: Next to the Hotel Las Américas
description:
Good spot to park your motor home next to the Hotel Las Americas. Be careful not to park near the sea because the tide rises. We felt safe, we rested without any problem. Free Wifi from the hotel.
----
Buen punto para estacionar casa rodante al lado del hotel las Américas. Tener precaución de no estacionar cerca del mar porque sube la marea. Nos sentimos seguros, descansamos sin problema.
Wifi libre del hotel.

name: Lava Autos Emanuel
description: Had my 4Runner 4x4 cleaned here with an excellent job. Price not that cheap, this is because the car had a lot of mud underneath the car..

name: párking enfrente del puerto
description:
parking without height limit, perfect for exploring the Malecón and the city center
  It is in front of the DIAN so it is also perfect for parking and doing paperwork. 3,000 an hour. Super friendly people.

parking sin límite de altura, perfecto para recorrer el Malecón y el centro de la ciudad
 está enfrente de la DIAN así que también es perfecto para aparcar y hacer los trámites. 3.000 la hora. Gente super amable.

name: Gasolinera terpel
description:
Large, clean safe place to sleep, clean bathrooms and showers
---------------
Lugar seguro amplio y limpio para dormir, baños y duchas limpias

name: Mirador de Popayán
description:
I am José Luis, the owner. Mirador de Popayan has a restaurant, cabins, a camping area and a motorhome area. The route is paved and easily accessible. We have wi-fi, bathrooms, hot water, water to refill tanks, drainage for gray/black water. We are waiting for travelers, to receive them with the best attention. wasapp: +57 316 8616015 and
+57 321 2274969

*******
Yo soy José Luis y soy el dueño. Mirador de Popayan tiene restaurante, cabañas, sector de camping y sector para motorhome. La ruta es pavimentada y de fácil accesibilidad. Tenemos wi-fi, Baños, agua caliente, agua para recargar tanques, desalojo para aguas grises/negras. Estamos esperando viajeros, para recibirlos con la mejor atención. wasap: +57 316 8616015 y +57 321 2274969

name: Túnel Tesalia - no cyclists
description: Be aware that cyclists are not allowed to pass the tunel. We tried but were denied entry. We were lucky to get a transport through the tunel organized by a friendly and helpful local. You can try to get a ride with one of the trucks at peaje 1km down.

name: Cascadas la Clara
description:
Very beautiful campspot for tents directly at the first waterfall. Very friendly people in the quiet village. Water good to filter and for a bath. We got told mir up there are more waterfalls with even. Ore beautiful campspots, but we didn't check out those. Little tienda with drinks only 50m walking distance. Very safe, but might get busy on weekends. We are cyclists, so I am not sure if a big rig would fit more up at the second waterfall, but for a campervan it should work directly at the first waterfall.
Very beautiful firefly during the night.

name: Hotel La Casona de Viterbo
description: Very clean and friendly hotel in the cute town of Viterbo. We paid 70.000 Cop for a  double room with clean shower and toilet. Nice courtyard to sit, very quiet outside the center and very friendly and helpful staff plus a super sweet black.

name: Antojos y mas
description: Not as cheap as other places, but still really affordable. There was one super friendly English speaking waiter. The food was super delicious and they offer more than the usual rice, beans, plátanos and any meat dish. We had carrot soup, ceviche, a burger and 3 juices and paid 100.000 COP including tip.

name: La Casa Hostal
description: Nice clean and relatively new Hotel/Hostel. Very friendly owners. We could park the bicycles inside the house. Double room with private bathroom and van 55.000 COP for the two of us. Room with shared bathroom 40.000 COP. Everything is very clean. Wrong location on Googlemaps. It's actually Carretera 3, calle 10, 10-17.

name: Flamencamarones Hotel
description: Small hotel with air conditioned rooms with good WiFi  and a restaurant with ice cold beers. They have a large dirt parking area for RVs no facilities. They can organize flamingo tours which are well worthwhile.

name: Termales el ocho, villa de Santa Helena
description: Hot spring hotel with natural attractions around.  Offers parking for any size vehicle.  There are toilets and showers.  The hosts, Edilson and Sandra are fantastic.  Value per person $30,000.

name: Hotel Las Lajas Confort
description: small hotel and parking lot where we left our van whereas we where visiting the cathedral.

name: Finca de café La Esmeralda
description:
This is a great rural coffee farm where you can see all parts of the process. It's a family of farmers where the mom is a professional taster, the daughter is a professional coffee maker, so it's incredibly weird to see all this combination of knowdledge together.
They do a tour of the processes and coffee preparation process. They also sell their own coffee that costs almost the same than the one from the supermarket.
Besides, the route to get to the farm has some sculptures of a local artist (@angela_ipiart)
Very recommended!!
--------
Finca de café familiar con todos los procesos del café y marca propia. La madre es catadora profesional y la hija barista profesional.
La explicación y el conocimiento de esta familia son muy valiosos y muy recomendables. El café es riquísimo y de precio similar al del supermercado.
Además, la ruta para llegar a la finca desde el pueblo tiene unas esculturas sobre la región de una artista local (@angela_ipiart)

name: Hostal Las Flores Jardín
description: Wonderful, boutique hotel with the nicest owner. Martha and her sister take pride in their facility. Very clean, hot showers, pretty view, and very quiet location on the outskirts of town. 5 minute walk to the plaza and restaurants.

name: Lugar de acogida el olivo
description:
El Olivo reception area for Campervan- motorhome, motorhome,

We offer a place to rest, with an excellent view.

⁃	Electric power
⁃ Laundry area,
⁃ BBQ, grill area
⁃ Internet 🛜
⁃ Black and gray water discharge point.
⁃ Drinking water refill point
⁃ Pets allowed
⁃ Good safety conditions
⁃ E-coworking
⁃



Notices
⁃	Water. 30 x 30 centimeters
⁃ 110v power supply. 30 x 30 centimeters
⁃ Wastewater discharge area 30 high x 70 centimeters wide
⁃ Motorhomes, motorhomes and motorhomes 70 x 120 centimeters are accepted

name: Posada brisas del volcán
description:
Great hostel to spend few nights and visit the national park.
30k cop per night per person. It has restaurant and shared dorms. They are very nice too.

Muy buena posada para dormir y visitar el parque nacional. 30mil pesos por persona y noche. También tienen restaurante y son muy amables

name: Las delicias de Santa Maria
description:
Great food at good price. Local food for 9k cop or so.
Classic colombian menu: soup, meat, rice, beans...

Buen almuerzo a buen precio. 9mil por ejemplo el pollo, sin sopa.

name: MANA DULCE - Reserva Natural
description: This spot is very nice, into to the nature, good trekking  and totally peaceful on the route.

name: Mango feliz
description:
Campground, hammocks, bungalows.. secure parking for bikes and possibly van / bigger rigs. it's around 25 mins walk from the village, quiet though, with a lot of trees and shade. 
15 / 20k for the tent depending on the season, +5 for the bike which is a bummer but, pretty much everything is an extra, water 1k, tea/coffee 3k, use of kitchen (only low season 5k).
still, good overall, the owner/staff are friendly..

name: Café InCoffee
description:
Very nice coffee place on a garden with few tables. It has local organic coffee that you can drink or even buy a bag at good price.
Approximately 5k cop a nice cup of coffee or cheaper if it's a simple option. Approximately 15k cop 250gr of coffee.

Una pequeña cafeteria muy agradable en el jardín detrás de la estación antigua.
Preparan café de muchos tipos con café orgánico local y también venden el café. No recuerdo el precio pero no era costoso, unos 5mil pesos un café gourmet y más económicos el tinto o expresso. Más o menos 15mil media libra de café de calidad de la zona.

name: Villa San Rafael
description: Beautiful gated villa with 10 rooms, 10 min walk from the town center, has a common kitchen, plenty of space for parking. The owners are very welcoming.

name: Castillos del Lago
description:
Cabañas / Hostal with different rooms from 1 to 5 persona in each. Nice View on the Rock of Guatape. Nice Garden. Clean bathroom.
Price 50.000.- / Night for me in Cabaña 7.
Secure parking Inside locked Gate.

name: dirt road to chaguani
description:
small dirt road off main hwy. peaceful night with just the sounds of nature. rode a couple hundred meters down the road and there were 
spots to camp not visible from main hwy. traveling by bicycle but this would also work well for big rigs and car campers. great spot!

name: Aparta Hotel El Balcón del Tolima
description: good place for motorcycles, locked parking. nice clean rooms for good price with great view

name: El Regreso Hospedaje Rural
description: Hi! Welcome to our warm and cozy place in the middle of Cundinamarca mountains. This is an amazing spot for those who share love for nature and the great outdoors. You can rest and go to amazing places nearby. Just prepare yourself to have fun and bring your adventure spirit.

name: agua en estación de servicio
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: User does not mention that water is potable. Use caution.

they let us fill our water tank after refueling. friendly staff, they pull out a hose that they have connected to a tap inside a place.
---
nos dejaron cargar el tanque de agua después de repostar combustible. personal amable, ellos te sacan una manguera que tienen conectada a un grifo dentro de un lugar

name: Soccer Field
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: User does mention that water may not be potable. Use caution.

Next to the covered soccer/basketball court you will find a series of makeshift sinks, presumably so that the athletes can wash after a match. Not sure if it's potable or not but good for washing and cleaning. Each sink has a faucet that you can connect a hose to.

name: Al lado del hostal D'J
description:
It is a parking lot where trucks stop. There is a service station and next to it a hostel. We asked at the hostel if we could sleep there and they told us no problem but not near the tower because there are cameras and if they see the cameras they have to charge us. We slept in front of the bathroom.
There is a bathroom with a cool shower and it felt very safe. The one who takes care of the hostel makes rounds at night.
Good place to sleep if you go this route.

Es un parqueadero dónde paran camiones. hay una estación de servicio y al lado un hostal. Preguntamos en el hostal si podíamos dormir ahí y nos dijo q sin problema pero no cerca de la torre xq hay cámaras y si nos ven las cámaras nos tienen q cobrar. Dormimos en frente del baño.
Hay baño con ducha fresca y se sintió muy seguro. El que cuida el hostal da rondas por la noche.
Buen sitio para dormir si vas por esta ruta.

name: Restaurante Albacora
description: We only ate dinner here, but asked about camping.  They said it would be fine.  They have a small parking lot, which may have a little road noise, but there are very clean bathrooms, showers and a lovely pool.  The restaurant was delicious and the family very kind.  (Note the showers are intended to shower off before the pool, but they said they could be used if camping - they would be fine, but without privacy).  (Larger rigs may be limited by entrance)

name: OZIP Organizacion de Indigenas
description:
Cyclists: You can ask at the organization of the indigenos people of Putumayo if they let you sleep in their very big meetingroom. There are some members of the community who live upstairs and sometimes others come to sleep here too, when they come to town. There is no shower, but a big watertank and buckets in the staircase, that you can use to shower. So it's not private at all, but in general it was very quiet in the evening. The big hall where you can sleep has a lot of windows, you want to keep them open because it's hot. Therefore you hear all the noise from the street. Not much traffic, but colombia is not the most quiet country. There is a kind of kitchen with a sink, but no stove, use your own. When it rains heavily the town cuts off the water because it gets dirty and it can take half a day, till they turn it on again. So better be prepared and have some drinkingwater or you'll have to buy it. You can always use the water in the huge tank to shower and flush the toilet.
The people are very nice and relaxed. I stayed 5 nights and joined them two nights for an important indigenous fiesta. But be prepared that somebody might ask you for money or to "borough" money. You can always say, you don't have money right now. That's also what they do, even if it is obviously not true. Also watch your food, somebody ate all my chocolate that was in my open panniers. Nobody said thank you for anything, like invitations for lunch or a contribution for the community, so i wouldn't do that anymore. And you'll hear the same sexist, misogynistic talking like everywhereeldse.

name: Indigenous Community
description: Cyclists: The local community has a big roofed meeting place and if you ask, they will let you sleep here. There are toilets and a cold shower. You can ask them to open the door, if it is locker. Light, electricity. The people are very very nice and love to have a talk. The children are curious and love to see how you are cooking. Nearby you have a little restaurant.

name: Jardin del Condor
description:
Incredible hostel with the most beautiful views of the mountain.
We paid 30k per person per night with breakfast included after negotiating a little bit to get the best rooms.
There are some cheaper options but we got direct views to the valley.
Mireia let us use the kitchen as well.

Un hostal buenísimo con vistas increibles. Pagamos 30mil por persona y noche con desayuno incluido en unas habitaciones privadas preciosas con chimenea y vistas al valle. Hay alguna opción más económica también.
Mireia nos dejó utilizar la cocina también aunque no es de uso libre teóricamente.

name: estacionamiento
description:
Unlimited height parking on the Malecón, near the entire historic center (next to the marina). 3,000 cop per hour. We have been told that it is allowed to sleep in your vehicle and spend the night with a price of 25,000. at night they close the doors, it is not 24 hours

----------------------------------------------------------

estacionamiento sin límite de altura en el Malecón, cerca de todo el casco histórico (junto al puerto deportivo). 3.000 cop la hora. nos han dicho que está permitido dormir en tu vehículo y pasar la noche con un precio de 25.000. por la noche cierran las puertas, no es 24h

name: Arreglo de Heladera 12 v 110/220w
description:
César fixes different appliances. We arrived thanks to Pipe, a neighborhood resident and traveler.
Our 12v refrigerator was not cooling, César got the replacement parts and charged us a reasonable price.
__________________________

César arregla diferentes electrodomésticos. Llegamos gracias a Pipe, vecino del barrio y viajero. 
Nuestra nevera 12v no enfriaba, César consiguió los respuestos y nos cobró un precio razonable.

name: Paso del Toro
description: Jorge is a traveler and waits at his farm for other travelers, free. You should always contact him: +57 (310) 390-6402 The place is beautiful, Jorge is very friendly.

name: Next to the river
description: Lots of places to park next to the river. Seems really safe. Clear, clean water nice places to bathe in the river. Level and could accommodate several vehicles.

name: agua en casa surf
description:
We were in the Malecón and Simón (the owner) came to offer us his space to sleep, to fill up water, also to have a hostel? we were just leaving that day but we went to the bar to have a drink and filled up some water.
----
Estábamos en el Malecón y Simón ( el dueño) se acercó a ofrecernos su espacio para dormir, cargar agua, también tener un hostel... nosotros justo nos íbamos ese día pero fuimos a tomar algo al bar y cargamos agua

name: Hostal Alma Glamping
description: It is a nice hostel with a camping area, for tents, van or SUV or Pickup type vehicles.  There is no place for trucks.  It has a spectacular climate.  You can use the shared bathroom with hot water, you have good speed wifi, electricity point.  It is possible to use the shared kitchen as well.  It also has a hammock area and comfortable sofas.  Dreams are very kind

name: Camping la Amelia
description:
It is a campsite located 20 minutes from Manizales and Pereria and 15 minutes from Santa Rosa de Cabal. They offer parking, water, electricity and room service. The cost for the stay is $20,000 pesos per person and if you want a room it is $50,000 per couple. They offer laundry service $20,000 pesos
-----------
Es un camping ubicado a 20 minutos de Manizales y de Pereria y a 15 minutos de Santa Rosa de Cabal. Ofrecen servicio de parqueadero, agua, luz y habitaciones. El costo por la estadía es de $ 20.000 pesos por personas y  si desean habitacion es de $ 50.000 por parejas. Ofrecen servicio de lavanderia $ 20.000 pesos

name: Bautisterio
description: Located on the bank of the Zapatoca stream, it is a local rural spa, there is no infrastructure, it is approximately 2km from the urban area of Zapatoca, it is a beautiful place.

name: Terpel
description:
gas station with bathrooms, shower (in the men's room) restaurant, hotel
-----------
estación de gasolina con baños, ducha (en el baño de hombres ) restaurante, hotel

name: Cueva de la Vaca Cave
description: Beautiful cave with guided tours. Companies selling tickets (for guides) at this location - the cave is a 6 minute walk from here. We enjoyed it!

name: Hostal pura vida la 70
description:
hostal with secure parking inside for a two / three not too big bikes, as you have to pass through the door and hall.. 
27k dorm, 45/55k for private with private bathroom depending on how long you stay.. full kitchen, hot shower, in a good location for bar / restaurants and metro..

name: Hotel Parque Temático Aburraes
description: Parking for larger vehicles, tourist attraction. Good for motorhomes.

name: Fusagasuga Estación Texaxo
description:
Very safe and close to Bogota, is about an hour and a half away, has bathroom service, restaurant and hotel room at 60 thousand pesos per couple if you want to stay at the hotel.
----
Muy seguro y cerca de Bogotá, esta a una hora y media aproximadamente, tiene servicio de baño, restaurante y habitación en hotel a 60 mil pesos por pareja si desea quedarse en el hotel

name: Hotel Terrazas de Guadalupe Parking lot
description: This is the gravel parking lot of the hotel. A bit further down is another grassy field but super unlevel. We were allowed to park here. Gravel. Level. 25.000,-

name: Hostel Once Once
description: Showers and toilets at the hostel 4.000Cop per person. nice owner and clean facilities. water is heated current number is +57 316 6178961. we called

name: parking arepas como antes
description: A wide place for parking, camping, and spending the night. with public bathrooms, water, electricity, and pet friendly. with space for multiple motor homes. It is located next to the restaurant and the owner's house. in a nice neighborhood in the city, close to the gas station, supermarket, and famous city landmarks. The owner is also a passionate traveler and very welcoming.

name: Colibrí hostel
description:
nice hostel in a good price.
the owner and the stuff are very nice and they are dog friendly. 
payed 30k for a bed in the dorm.
they have swimming pool here and terrace with hammocks.
if you need a parking,they can direct you to a parking lot for 10k

name: El Gran Tomate Fruver
description:
Small water tap outside the little grocery store, just ask the person working there for permission. 
WATER IS LIKELY NOT POTABLE USE A FILTER

name: Finca Bellavista Ibague
description:
Excellent camping site in Ibague, we are served by Alex and Nini who are very good hosts, there are showers, bathrooms, laundry and water…
Refreshing pool and game tables.
You can camp at Motor Home or Camping, cabins are also available.
We had a great time.
Contact Alex via WhatsApp at +573174751823

Espectacular sitio camping en Ibague, nos atiende Alex y Nini quienes son muy buenos anfitriones, hay duchas, baño, lavandería y agua…
Piscina refrescante y mesas de juegos
Se puede acampar en Motor Home o Carpa, también hay cabañas disponibles 
La pasamos muy bien.
Contactar a Alex via WhatsApp en el +573174751823

name: Virgen de Guadalupe Sanctuary
description:
Coming from Libanó, right next to the road, a small sanctuary with a little flat, grasssy area suitable for small rigs etc, no facilities, weak claro mobile reception.
The merits of this place ? It exists! I didn't find any other spots in the area.
(Higher up, towards Murillo, there are more opportunities at pull-outs, but apparently nothing nice. )
When tired and on your way to Manizales, this is OK.
In the night, the traffic on the road dies down quickly.

name: Next to Mirador pull out
description:
A small, half secluded area surrounded by bushes with yellow flowers, garbage free but evidently bring used as a loo at times (nothing to write home about).
Zero mobile reception .
View on the mountain range, opposite to Inicio Sendero Termas.

name: parqueadero next to small lakes
description:
A lovely spot, a bit of hard shoulder road leading about 30m away from the main road.
A few small lakes (Laguna de Los Colores) just next to it.
No cell reception whatsoever .
Pretty high at 3800m.
Beautiful views when not cloudy.

name: rancho 27
description: a nice restaurant to eat and parking at night.  the owner is friendly and very nice. peaceful

name: Hostal del Cielo
description:
Hostal at the top of Colombia el Barrio. The nearest place from the escaleras electricas (Comuna 13). The Hostel has a panoramic rooftop bar on the whole city.

At time, the current cost if 50k pesos in dormitory, and 110k to 160k for a private rooms. Billard, hammocks, good vibes for all types of travelers ! Perfect for those who want to discover how local people really live here. 
Events and parties are organized on the site ! I really loved this place.

Please contact on instagram : hostal_del_cielo

name: Big Truck parking
description: We stayed here overnight with other parked trucks. Price for the night 13.000,- pesos. Quite protected from the street noise. Friendly people. Nice little town and park nearby.

name: Mitsubishi Cars
description:
Owners Francisco-father and Francisco-son seen knowledgeable, friendly and competent, trying to help and understand our "special" needs, given by our Overlanding activity.
A very positive exception as far as Mitsubishi dealerships go in South America .

name: Ekia Gas Station
description: This is a great place to stay before heading to Punta Gallinas. We were able to fill our tanks before heading north. They only accept cash and there is a little tienda with snacks and drinks. They allowed us to park in the back of their large lot before and after our trip.

name: Parqueadero 24 horas
description:
We slept one night in this parking lot. It was very quiet and safe. It works 24 hours and is very spacious, fitting any type of vehicle.

Dormimos uma noite neste estacionamente. Foi bem tranquilo e seguro. Funciona 24 horas e é bem amplo, cabendo qualquer tipo de veículo.

name: Gas station
description: This is a great place to stay before heading to Punta Gallinas. We were able to fill our tanks before heading north. They only accept cash and there is a little tienda with snacks and drinks. They allowed us to park in the back of their large lot before and after our trip.

name: Credit Card Fuel Station
description: It’s hard to find gas stations that have credit card machines. All the others are only cash but here is one we found that had one! The guys are super nice and are excited to see you!

name: Hotel simaro
description:
Very nice hotel at 50k for 2 people with air conditioner

Buen hotel a 50mil pesos para 2 personas, con aire

name: Sportsground and school
description: Cyclists: Big roofed sportsground and school. I asked the neighbours if it is ok, to camp here. No problem. The toilets were closed and they didn't know, who has the key. Can't be seen from the main road, the neighbours and their children are nice.

name: small parking lot in front of the laguna
description:
After a walk around the small lagunas we decided to stay for the night. although this is direct by the road there is no trafic at night and the night was very quiet (saturday night). At 7 am, first tourists came and stop  at the mirador. (the view is nice).
Not really good to pitch a tent here. 
No facilities, no mobile network.

name: Hospedaje
description:
There is a señora living here that has a bed for guests for 20.000 COL
fan, clean bathroom, good for one night

name: Palermo
description: Wild camping spot on flat grassy field next to the river and by the road. Not hidden but I asked a passing pedestrian if it would be ok to camp here and he said yes

name: Trampolin de la Muerte
description: Restaurante Buenos Aires welcomes everyone in need. we are cyclist and we arrived when i almost got dark. we asked if we could pitch our tent and were given a small room. really nice. Please order some food or drinks in return for their hospitality.

name: la esmeralda
description:
53,000 private bathroom
39,000 shared bathrooms
Big car park, covered and non-covered, very secure with night guard.
The city is nice too, set between mountains :-)

name: Primax Gas Station
description: There’s a hose tap with potable water at this gas station. I filled up my gas tank and asked if we could fill up on water. Attendant said sure and told us it was safe to drink.

name: Restaurante Pulpos y Camarones
description: We asked the owner of the restaurant if we can sleep behind these restaurants and bars. It’s a wide, flat area well protected from the noise of the street.

name: In front of the institute
description:
Good place to park and sleep!
We had parked at the cemetery gate but the police recommended that we move to this place! Very quiet during the day and night!
-------
Buen lugar para estacionar y dormir ! 
Nos habíamos estacionado en la puerta del cementerio pero la policía nos recomendó movernos a este lugar ! Muy tranquilo durante el día y la noche!

name: Terpel
description: There is water here but very weak pressure

name: Primax
description: Water tap at gas station. Good pressure. Next to the little garden

name: Lavalet, en Guarne, Antioquia
description: Great automatic laundry service. Street Parking

name: In front of the school
description:
Excellent place to spend the night, level and with beautiful views of the mountains. Very friendly people and much quieter than the plaza, which is only 3 blocks away. The police told us it was okay to stop here.
------------------
Excelente lugar para pasar la noche, nivelado y con vistas hermosas de las montañas. Gente muy amable y mucho más tranquilo que la plaza, que está a solo 3 cuadras. La policía nos dijo que estaba bien parar acá

name: On the street in front of the river
description:
We slept one night for free on the street. Without services but very quiet.
--------------------
Dormimos una noche gratis en la calle. Sin servicios pero muy tranquilo.

name: El Eden hotel y restaurante
description:
quiet and clean hotel in front of the main road. Nice owners. Even have a cheap but tasty restaurant. 
Rooms for 25000COP with fan / 35000 with AC

name: Posto Primax
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: User does not mention water is potable. Use caution.

We got water at this station to fill the motorhome's water tank. The tap has good pressure.
---
Conseguimos água neste posto para abastecer a caixa d'água do motorhome. A torneira tem uma boa pressão.

name: Cacao Finca Evelyza
description:
Finca Evelyza is a small family business run by David and his wife Karol. They bought the property 10 years ago and grow cacao, bananas, citrus trees, papaya and avocados on 7 hectares. 

We were picked up in Salento and travelled about an hour to the finca. The exciting and informative tour lasted 2 hours and we learnt a lot about production, fermentation, drying and processing. At the end we were allowed to taste the different products. For us it was a wonderful experience with very friendly and welcoming people. 

Tour in Spanish: 50'000 COP
Tour in English: 70'000 COP
Transport: 50'000 COP
Telephone number: +57 311 3107655

name: Veterinario Peludos
description:
Laura is a very friendly vet. They have loads of NexGard Spectra, Bravecto, Endogard, etc if you need to stock up. Medicinal soaps and creams for rashes. The appointment was 20,000 COP. 

We brought our dog in with a skin rash. They offered to take the blood of our dog and have results in 10 minutes but they didn’t think it was necessary. Definitely recommend.

Not sure about English. We spoke in (not so great) Spanish.

Hours: M-F 8am-12pm, 2-6pm
Saturday 8-12

name: Ferreteria Servimezclas
description: A very well-equipped large ferreterie where you can find everything. We had to completely reinstall our roof hatch and found the perfect Sika sealing adhesive here. Anyone who needs to repair something on their camper will find well-known brand tools here.

name: Hotel El Retorno
description:
Simple, cheap, but pretty nice hotel. I paid 35k for one person. Probably a cheaper option than anything in the town. 

Restaurant nearby has massive portions and was delicious. Also a small service station with drinks and snacks.

name: PRIMITIVA
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Added by site owner. Please update after checking in.
Welcome to Primitiva, your sanctuary amidst the wild nature of Colombia. Here, overlanders will find the perfect balance between adventure and comfort.

In Primitiva, you can explore lush forests, cool off in crystal-clear rivers, and marvel at breathtaking waterfalls. Wildlife and flora will surprise you at every turn, with colorful birds and playful animals.

For your convenience, we provide access to electricity and potable water. However, please note that the cellular signal may be limited in remote areas. Additionally, electrical voltage may vary, so make sure to have the necessary adapters.

It's important to mention that there are size restrictions for larger vehicles due to the terrain. We recommend checking restrictions and necessary permits before your visit.

In summary, Primitiva offers you a unique experience amidst Colombian nature. Come and discover all that we have to offer!

name: Texaco Gasstation
description: Cyclist: I could camp under the roof on the left end of the buildings. It's around the corner and protected by a little wall so normally nobody will see you. Traffic at night was ok. One of the very friendly workers gave me the wifi key. Toilets, no shower.

name: Mojarra Beach Container House
description:
We are glad to have you as a guest in our Beach house where you can park your camp car.
We are next to the best  KITE SPOT  Salinas del Rey Atlántico. At our container house, you can use the open kitchen, outdoor shower and outside bathroom.
Price per person US 10 phone: 321-313-97-57,  315-861-45-74

name: Mojarra Beach Container House
description:
We are glad to have you as a guest in our beach house, 
You can park your camping car here.
 We are next to the best  KITE SPOT, Salinas del Rey Atlántico. At our container house, you can use the open kitchen, outdoor shower and outside bathroom.
Price per person US $10. Phone:  321-313-97-57 o 315-8614574

name: Estación de Servicio Terpel
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: User does not mention water is potable. Use caution.

The gas station is near El Dorado International Airport. We spoke to an employee and he let us fill up the Motorhome's water tank. We filled up more than once and the staff were very attentive. The tap has excellent pressure.
---
O posto fica próximo ao Aeroporto Internacional El Dorado. Conversamos com um funcionário e ele nos deixou abastecer a caixa d'água do Motorhome. Abastecemos a caixa d'água mais de uma vez e os funcionários foram bem atenciosos. A torneira tem uma ótima pressão.

name: Mano Del Artesano - Ráquira
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: User describes exposition of large pottery pieces, as well as a restaurant and small shops. 

Surprisingly, this place isn't on iOverlander yet. The detour here and to the village is well worth it. Access to the site for 12COP pp. Access by small vehicle possible (track). 35-minute walk up from the village, with lovely views. Cabs available in town.

name: River Crossing
description:
Broken up road that goes from dirt to river rocks. Middle of dry season and had a tiny little water crossing, but I imagine it could get big in rainy season. Obviously nothing to even think about in dry season. 

The ‘road’ is simply the middle of a dry river bed. There is a sign that says ‘danger: rising current’ right before arriving.

name: Hacienda Nápoles
description:
Hacienda Nápoles (Spanish for "Naples Estate") was an estate built and owned by Colombian drug lord Pablo Escobar in Puerto Triunfo.

Today, it's an amusement park and zoo, as well as a museum. Visit: https://haciendanapoles.com

name: Éxito Suba
description: A large Éxito with no height restriction on parking

name: Hotel Casa Grande
description: This place your owner Erwin y Andrea they receive travelers, motorcycle traveleres and motor home. They ask for a little support. The place is near to the river. The place has the possibility of electrician and potable water

name: Lagos de Venecia
description:
Space equipped for overlanding, whether it be tent, camper, or trailer. Very nice, secure, natural, equipped with hot water showers, clean water refills, and dirty water disposal, laundry facilities, wifi. It offers many more entertainment and gastronomy options. The cost is fair and includes taxes and insurance. Additionally, depending on the budget or need, you can choose a rate with or without breakfast. I highly recommend it for families, couples, or friends. Excellent service. You can view the service offerings and rates in the WhatsApp catalog at 3155580367

Espacio acondicionado para overlanding ya sea carpa, casa carro, remolque. Muy bonito, seguro, natural, equipado con duchas con agua caliente, llenado de agua limpia y descarga de aguas sucias, lavanderia, wifi. Cuenta con muchas mas opciones de entretenimiento y gastronomia. El costo es justo y el valor incluye impuestos y seguro, ademas, segun el presupuesto o necesidad se puede elegir tarifa con o sin desayuno. Lo recomiendo mucho para familia, pareja o amigos.  Excelente serivicio. Se puede visualizar la oferta de servicios y tarifas en el catalogo de whatsapp 3155580367

name: 40 - Traffic stop for 2 hrs possible
description: When there is a lot of traffic the road will be blocked for a while in one direction. After a while the road will be opened for your direction and the other one will be stopped. We were told this happens every day.

name: Texaco gas station
description:
Place for one night, in front of gas station. Loud traffic as supposed. Talk to the guys before park. There are mini market, bakery and other business. Water is available to fill your tanks. Bathroom open 24h.

Posto de combustível para dormir por uma noite. Barulho da rodovia ao lado. Fale com os atendentes antes de estacionar. Junto ao posto tem mini mercado, padaria, entre outros negócios. Tem água disponível, além de banheiros, sem ducha.

name: Refresgueria El Faro
description: In front of El Faro little bar and restaurant . close to the light house on top of the hill. extraordinary view. 5 minutes walk to the Ojo del Agua ⛱️ normally desert. Well ventilated location during the day and fresh at night. Very friendly owners of the restaurant. Food, toilets and showers available. 5 Us per night per person.

name: Hermoso Palomino
description: A small bed and breakfast outside of the main touristy area. It’s run by a lovely family, very home-like feeling, beautiful garden, a few dogs and cats. Private room is 50.000 COP per night with delicious breakfast included. I could park my motorcycle inside.

name: Streetparking anywhere in this neighbourhood
