description: We parked here in this neighbourhood and where more than welcomed. Safe and quiet. East of the highway. Amazing place!

name: Primax
description:
Service station There was a road cut going to Cali so we asked if we could spend the night and there were no problems. Very friendly. Clean bathrooms and open 24hs. Some stores. Very large place to park.

Recommended to spend the night.
---
Estación de servicio 
 Había un corte de ruta yendo a Cali así que preguntamos si podíamos pasar la noche y no hubo problemas.
Muy amables.
Baños limpios y abiertos 24hs. Algunas tiendas. 
Lugar muy amplio para estacionar. 

Recomendable para pasar la noche.

name: Brisas de las gaviotas
description:
Great place with rooms to rent, pool, restaurant and amenities. 
For less than $15 dollars they let us park our Big-Rigs in camping ground inside the hotel. 
Restrooms available. 
Pool at extra cost ($4). 

Gran lugar con habitaciones para alquilar, piscina, restaurante y comodidades.

Por menos de 15 dólares nos permiten aparcar nuestro Truck Camper en el camping dentro del hotel.

Baños disponibles.

Piscina a un costo adicional (4 $).

name: Moscovita Piscinas Naturales
description:
Spa with natural pools that offers a very easily accessible camping area with flat land, bathroom, shower, parking. Near town and multiple tour sites. 

Balneario con piscinas naturales que ofrece área de camping de muy fácil acceso con terrenos planos, baño, ducha, estacionamiento. Cerca a la población y a múltiples atracciones.

name: Hotel Avion AeroHotel
description:
Incredible hotel inside of a plane, it has 4 rooms, every room has bathroom, one even has jacuzzi
You can camp here in your own car for 70.000 COP with acces to bathroom, pool 
Small bar where you can get water, cola, beer etc
Rooms are bit expensive (70-100$) but i think it’s worth it for experience
Owner is very friendly, Its a nice stop from/to San Gil

name: mechanic for automatic transmissions
description:
They rebuild the transmission for Chevrolet express. did a good job.
the entrance from the main road

name: Hotel y camping La Cumbre del Macizo
description: I camped 2 nights at this location and the surroundings and facilities were fantastic. I was able to view the rooms and they were very clean, comfortable and luxurious for a hostal. The host was extremely kind and helpful throughout the stay and was kind enough to let us use one of the showers in a bedroom for a hot shower. The showers and toilets at the campsite were clean and adequate but the water was very cold. I would highly recommend this place either for camping or hotel service as the prices were very reasonable considering the 10 minutes distance to the archeological park. And to end the note, we had three of their dogs accompany us through the evening. Awesome place!!!

name: Finca Villa Maria
description:
AgroFarm with rooms, camping area, parking for campers a few meters from the Lost City. It offers tours, horseback riding, interaction with animals, fishing and environmental education. Paula Reyes and her family attend the place +57 311 2751123. 
It`s perfect to visit this region and have the best views and locations to spend a few days connected with history and nature.

Finca Agroturística con habitaciones, zona de camping, parqueadero para casas rodantes a pocos metros de la Ciudad Perdida. Ofrece tours, paseos a caballo, interacción con animales, pesca y educación ambiental. Paula Reyes y su familia atienden el lugar +57 311 2751123.
Es perfecto para visitar esta región y tener las mejores vistas y ubicaciones para pasar unos días conectados con la historia y la naturaleza.

name: Ruta 66 Colombia
description: Very good motorcycle workshop for mainly KTM, Husqvarna and BMW. They do a very good job.

name: Hotel Giron Campestre
description:
Hotel and really nice swimming pool on hillside overlooking sweltering Giron.
Double room ....140,000COP
Day use of Pool.... 20,000COP per person.
Bar etc.
Price on 20 march 2024

name: Terpel
description: Water available. Easy access with big rigs.

name: Parque Nacional Enrique Olaya Herrera
description:
We slept here several nights. It's opposite the University of Colombia. It's a safe place, with police always present. Nearby there is a supermarket, pharmacy, restaurant, and laundry. There are many indigenous people camping in the park, so they don't disturb anyone. And if you're travelling with a pet, you can walk and play with them in the park.
----
Dormimos varias noches en este lugar.  Está enfrente de la Universidad de Colombia.  Es un lugar seguro, con policía siempre presente.  Cerca hay un supermercado, una farmacia, un restaurante y una lavandería.  Hay muchos indígenas acampando en el parque, no molestan a nadie.  Y para los que viajan con mascota, pueden pasear y jugar con ella en el parque.

name: Ayahuasca Casa Artistica
description:
Very hippiesh laidback hostel.. 
options are dorm (40k), private (80k), campground (20k).. hot water, possibly WiFi.. its a bit outside jardin, quite, with view.. 
the last bit of the road is steep and rocky..

name: DAUTO Diagnostics
description:
I took my 4Runner for a service and minor repairs. Juanes and the team at D'AUTO were really helpful and easy to deal with. Recommended.

From what I saw he know Toyotas well and is honest and transparent - he seemed genuinely pleased to helping us get ready for the second half of our trip. The price of the work was reasonable and he helped us avoid some unnecessary costs.

No English spoken but was happy to take the time to make sure I understood him clearly.  The car feels great after a full service and review of the suspension and brakes.

Although he's a Toyota specialist, they deal with all brands and can work on trucks too as long as they fit under the roof.

Contact Juanes on 57 314 7393660 or the office on 57 321 3733243

name: Parking Ana
description:
We parked here while staying on Isla Fuerte - 10,000 COP per night. Seemed secure. With a roofbox we wouldn't fit under the parking shades so she let us park in her house yard with higher clearance. Might not work for anything much higher though.

Anyone in town knows where it is and will direct you (and carry bags to the harbour).

name: Armed holdup in Purace National Park
description:
We were held up by two guys with guns in the national park. They made like it was a military check and asked for my papers, then asked me and my wife to get out of the car. They then demanded cash to let us carry on. Luckily they didn't take passports, cards or cameras.

The local indigenous guides in the park were shocked and said nothing like this had happened for many years. The then escorted us through the rest of the park with other groups and back down again. When I asked to make a "denuncio" for insurance purposes, we ended up in a meeting with the Governor and 10-15 other officials in the Purace community. They wanted to refund us half of the lost money which I refused.

Hopefully this isn't a sign of any future disturbance here as it's a lovely park and the community were wonderful with us. But the police gave us the good advice to never stop at a roadblock if there isn't an official army or police car there.

name: Toche town wifi
description: Community wifi, speed seemed ok for browsing, emails etc. Very useful when staying in the campsite down the valley (no wifi)

name: Camping Tayra
description:
Nice simple campground next to the river and walking distance to the coffee region town of Génova.
Simple facilities, composting toilet, kitchen, outdoor shower.

name: Gas Station Primax
description: You can find bathroom and shower here for free. Also there is a small shop selling groceries. They have rooms upstairs but i didnt ask for the price. Many trucks stay here for the night, but they let only room clients

name: Camping el NODO
description: very nice place to spend the night, possibility of having lunch in the restaurant, toilets and showers available, possibility of renting cabanas or tents!

name: Parqueadero Camping Valledupar Elvia
description: parking space and possibility to spend the night or a few days without problem! secure place and the family that welcomes you is really very nice! drinking water, electricity available!

name: ORPAT SOLUCIONES SAS
description:
ORPAT SOLUCIONES SAS

Profesionales en el embalaje y aseguramiento de carga


Professionals in packaging and cargo securing
These guys are certified to built crates for export and secure loads in containers. Friendly Camilo will makes sure everything goes according to plan. they are also professionals at securing industrial oversize loads. 2 days ago they were sending 5 old land rovers to the port.

they stored my motorcycle for 3 weeks on site. its dusty and apparently the dust is salty, so plan a cover tarp if you do so. Many friendly dogs on site.

whatsapp Camilo Mendez
+57 302 4207138

name: At the end of the town
description:
If you're facing difficult to find a place near the center you can stay here, in front of kids school. It's not leveled. We had a peaceful night.
-----------
Se você tiver dificuldade em encontrar lugar para ficar no centro esta pode ser uma opção, em frente a uma escola. A rua não é nivelada. Dormimos uma noite, tranquilo por aqui.

name: Cantera
description: It's a cantera on the road.. Chill place, it's safe...

name: Mundo Mascota Manga
description:
A small petshop - but special:
they sell the rarely found "Taste of Wild" brand. Very friendly and petlovely staff. Highly recommended.

Veterinarian is there, too,but we didn't need something medical.

MO-SAT 08:00-18:00h, SUN 09:00h-18:00h

name: Restaurante, hospedaje y parqueadero donde "José"
description:
A great alternative to parking overnight in super hot Mompox. Benjamin, the owner was a little confused by our request to spend a night here and sleep in our Campervan but ultimately he said yes and we negotiated 20,000 COP for 2 people  plus he gave us a key to room #1 so we could use the shower and toilet! Such a great deal. There’s a bit of a breeze and it’s much cooler here than Mompox a few hours away. Our friends are there and say it’s blazing hot and parking spaces are “dismal”. We are happy to have stopped here instead. 
The rooms here  are super clean and have A/C so that always an option if you decide not to sleep in your rig. We have  a lovely view of the countryside and some farm animals. There’s some music coming from the beer and  billiards shop across the field but we are hoping it doesn’t go on all night as Benjamin says it’s a family place. There’s a small restaurant on site here that serves breakfast and lunch only. 
There’s a water tap but not sure if it’s potable. We didn’t ask. 
There’s electrical outlets if you need to charge and have your own extension cord but unsure if there’s an extra charge for that. 
We have 3 bars of tigo service.

name: Ainoha cafe Zapatoca
description: Not an attraction per se but every tourist should visit. Adorable cafe with lots of shaded seating and a large selection of cakes and cookies. A very relaxed environment overlooking the plaza.

name: Parqueadero El Rio
description: We checked at Villa Linda but they wanted 60000 COP for the night so we came to this parqueadero close to downtown in Concepción. No height restriction for entry, but narrow streets and some tight corners approaching the entry probably restrict length to about 7m. The parking lot itself has lots of open parking area and some covered, depending on your needs. There are absolutely no services here so you must be completely self-contained and -supported. The lot itself is staffed from 8:00 am every day until 8pm M-F, 9pm Sat, 7pm Sun. Those are the official hours but our attendant left earlier on a Saturday night. This is important because the main gate is closed when they leave. Access to/from the lot after the attendant leaves is enabled by staff of the tienda (a round, pink building) in the roundabout outside the entrance to the lot until it 11:00 pm or when the tienda closes. We paid the 24 hour rate (16,500 COP) and spent the night, which was relatively quiet considering it was the opening weekend of Semana Santa. We appear to be the first to have spent the night in our vehicle and no one seemed to mind. The town itself is quite charming and prices were what might be expected of rural Colombia. People were very friendly and judging by the attention we garnered we may be the only foreign tourists in town. The drive from Barbosa is quite scenic, but be aware that about 1/4 of the distance is not paved and in very rough condition in spots. Still doable by 2WD vehicle when dry. We have had no Tigo cell service since leaving the main highway. Views of the surrounding hills and adjacent riverside park are quite nice.

name: Hotel LA Gran Esquina
description: Nice Hotel with parking across the main street, "cold" shower, private bathroom, AC, no breakfast

name: Palmira
description:
Diesel workshop and specialist in all brands of 4x4.  Mr. Carlos helped us on the eve of Samana Santa and we were able to get back on the road.  Super professional.  "recommended"


Taller de diesel y especialista en todas las marcas de 4x4. El Sr. Carlos nos atendió en visperas de Samana Santa y pudimos volver a la carretera. Super profesional. "recomendado"

name: Nomad Hostel
description: Just a relaxing place, lot of hammocks, nice bed, dorm and bungalow possible! About 10 km away from Barichara! Best food good price! 35000 Dorm bed, good Wifi, possible rent motorbikes! Good place to relax!!

name: Terpel gas station - water/agua
description:
Put some gas (good price) and ask for water, very good pressure.
------------
Abasteça seu veículo (ótimos preços) e peça pela água, tem otima pressão.

name: Calle BBQ
description: Come here at evening for a street of family-run stands, offering delicious BBQ chicken, sausages and fish, with rice and yuca. An authentic and tasty experience!

name: Parqueadero Joshua
description:
Short or long term parking and a fantastic option for visiting Medellin. You cannot sleep in your vehicle so you will need an Airbnb but there are plenty of cheap and great ones in the area. The main church and the plaza are 1/2 block from the parking. 
The 24 hr rate is $40,000 COP but the rate for up to 15 days is only $150,000 COP. 
This would be a good option if you wanted to take a quick flight to Leticia! 
There’s a bathroom on site for $500 pesos and also a car wash with undercarriage wash as well. 
We visited our van almost daily to pick up or drop off stuff and we were greeted with smiles each and every time. 
The metro station is about a 12 minute walk away and is easy to navigate. 
We were happy to return to the suburb of Saboneta each day where it was more pedestrian friendly and quiet.

name: Recortes y Metales SAS (metal worker/welder)
description: huge metal working shop.  came and had my aluminium motorcycle engine bash plate rewelded.  they did great work and also have a huge metal shop where they can make you anything you want.  paid 50,000 COP (US#12.50) for 2 guys to work for about an hour remaking it.

name: Olivanto Huerto de Olivas
description: A pleasant shady spot to sit outside sip a drink and snack on olives locally grown of course and an interesting line up of meats and cheeses.

name: Eurotaller Autotech Mechanic
description: We offer parking service for cars and motorcycles 6:00 to 0:00 L-S

name: Mirador/ Restaurante Herrereta
description:
An exceptional place for breakfast / lunch/ coffee or a natural juice. The views of town and the surrounding hills are outstanding. 
We stumbled upon this gem as we were following the Herrera Camino trail from town. Breakfast is either $10k, 12k or 15k and includes a coffee or chocolate con leche which comes served in a bowl. 
We were greatly entertained by the many varieties of hummingbirds and butterflies. 
We don’t recommend the tinto coffee.  It’s weak and served in a small French press and  is about the quantity of an espresso which is not enough for us for breakfast. Go for the chocolate!

Hours are 9am -6:30 pm
Closed Tuesdays.

name: Road to Florian
description: Parts of this road are in bad shape. When it's dry 4x4 is not needed, only high clearance is advisable. We had no issues with our 3.5m high truck camper. It took us 3.5 hours from Saboya to Florian. The road from Puente Nacional to Florian is better and it's a bit faster.

name: Olivianto Olive Orchard
description: Colombia’s only olive production. They offer drinks and snacks based on local produce, meats sad cheeses. Have a cheese plate and spend the night. Bathrooms available for anyone wanting to park overnight. Big rigs will fit as well pets welcome.

name: Posto Texaco
description:
We got water to fill the Motorhome's water tank.  The tap has good pressure and the staff are very attentive.
----
Conseguimos água para abastecer a caixa d'água do Motorhome. A torneira tem boa pressão e os funcionários são bem atenciosos.

name: Estacionamento ao lado da Igreja
description:
We slept a few nights in this parking lot next to the Nossa Senhora do Perpétuo Socorro Church, in the Bocagrande neighborhood.  It's free, safe and peaceful.  There are restaurants, pharmacy and supermarkets nearby.  In front there is the boardwalk to exercise.

Dormimos algumas noites neste estacionamento ao lado da Igreja Nossa Senhora do Perpétuo Socorro, no bairro Bocagrande. É gratuito, seguro e tranquilo. Nas proximidades tem restaurantes, farmácia e supermercados. Em frente tem o calçadão para praticar exercícios.

name: Mauricio place
description:
Beautiful place with lovely people. Large property with fruit trees. 

Enough place to park your van of put up your tent. Warm shower and if not rented a kitchen to cook. I the past it was used as a hotel. 

You can fill up your watertank with good pressure. It's located in a community park with a large swimming pool and playgarden. 

Possibility for breakfast for some small extra money. 

It was for us the best place to stay in Calima. Really close town and the lake. It's on the refugios de  Calima property. Place number 95. 

Mauricio and his wife are really helpful. Also possible to rent a room. 

35k per tent or vehicle for the night. 

Call of what's app Mauricio before coming. +573126557344

name: Tullanta Chia
description: Tire shop mostly for light trucks SUVs and cars but they took our Promaster/Ducato van and changed our tires even though we weigh 4400 kilos (9400 pounds) and did a good job. They balanced the new tires and tightened them by hand not with compressed air so they don’t cover tightened. I like this shop. BF Goodrich KO2s in stock.

name: Casa Agora
description: A really clean and well equipped apartment. Has hot shower, TV, kitchen, fridge, laundry and wifi. Walking distance from the centre and very quiet. Safe parking for motorcycles, dead-end street. No secured parking but not needed. Booking can be done via Airbnb. Very good restaurants in town. Terranato and Elvia.

name: CimaeXtreme - Tour NP El Cocoy
description: This a guiding company run by a couple. Incredibly nice people and they know what they are doing. The tour in NP EL Cocoy is really worth doing. Before go on the tour they do a kind of test run, to see if you don’t suffer altitude sickness or no capable of doing the hike. The guide knows a lot about nature and explains very well the different plant you see along the way.

name: Hotel Mahoma
description: Nothing special but clean and very friendly owners. You can have breakfast and dinner if you want and they also work together with the guiding company. Safe parking on the street.

name: Texaco
description:
We went to an iOverlander location at the skate park, but it was full of parked cars.  We looked for a police officer and asked where we could sleep and they told us that Bairro Morasurco was safe and showed us the location.  We found this gas station and they allowed us to stay the night for free.  We didn't use any resources, we just spent the night.
---
Fomos a um local do iOverlander na pista de skate, mas estava cheio de carros estacionados.  Procuramos um policial e perguntamos onde poderíamos dormir e nos disseram que o Bairro Morasurco era seguro e nos mostrou a localização. Encontramos este posto de gasolina e eles nos permitiram passar a noite gratuitamente. Não usamos nenhum recurso, só passamos a noite.

name: Café 472
description:
Very friendly place to stop for a coffee. The owner Thomas was a guide and just opened this speciality coffee. You can try different drinks and methods of extraction. 

He also offer coffee experiences. If interested, you should write to him and ask what you can do. His number +573145134352.

name: Tayrona NP parking lot
description:
It is possible to overnight park your van at the main parking lot of the park. 
You pay for your vehicle access (19.000 cop for small cars, 48.500cop for bigger rigs, more for buses etc) and your own entrance (different prices for high and low season and for locals and foreigners - we paid 73.500 cop each for low season) and mandatory insurance (6.000cop pp/day) and you can stay inside for up to 4 days. 
The toilets and showers are not located in this parking lot but if you walk 2 minutes to where the ambulance and medics tents are, there’s a building with toilets (bring your own toilet paper) and outdoor showers. 
The nearest beach where you can swim is an hour walking away but the hike is easy. 
It’s so quiet and not that hot overnight. We stayed two nights. 
The restaurants are located at the main beaches/campgrounds.

name: Villa Rosita
description: Several cabanas with possibility to cook your self. Garden is amazing and the kitchen is really complete with a couch and fireplace. Every cabana has showers and toilet and fireplace. Owners are again incredible friendly and Juan Carlos speaks a bit English. The Suesca cliffs are in walking distance also centre of the town.

name: Proyectar
description: This is a specialist in (electric) sliding doors. He fixed our sliding door. Because it was making a cracking sound. We wanted to readjust the door and he helped us perfect with that. Super nice and friendly guy!

name: Hotel bosque de la americas
description: Basic clean hotel. many rooms, ask to see another one if not happy. better rooms have windows giving on the steeet. around 55k pesos single. 15 min taxi to getsemani. the guy next door will guard your motorcycle in his backyard for 4k per night and 4k per day.

name: hotel Saussa
description: nice and clean with AC. my room is actualy brand new.  laundry service. close to the port to go ask the captains everyday if thay can take your motorcycle. 50k pesos a night for single room. 6k parking for motorcycle or small rigs across the street, at the left of gaz station. feels safe. restaurants and D1 shop 2 min walk.

name: cooking school - Vía Cocina
description:
We did a very interesting cookery course at vía cocina. The chef Brian is originally from Canada and has already collected a lot of experience all over the world. He came to Colombia in 2012 and started the cookery school as a community project. (More information on his website). We started the cookery lesson on his terrace, where he grows many herbs, vegetables and fruits himself. There we were able to taste the typical Colombian fruits. Afterwards, we cooked a three-course meal with him. We had a very interesting and instructive evening in the vía cocina.

Brian's telephone number: +57 300 483 8599
Website: viacocina.wordpress.com

name: Pietra Camping
description: Beautiful place, near the plaza mayor of Villa de Leyva. Perfect place to make camping with your tent, camper o to rent a tent. Too you can buy food and turist plans.

name: Pesca Tour y Aventura
description:
A local tour guide organization with the amazing Yamit Diaz. Here you can go hippo watching (in the wild, even though they're invasive), do 2 day bird watching tours or fishing tours. 

They also have a secured camping area that fits two/cars or two mid-sized campervans. Included are a clean cold shower and toilet and the area is right next to the river and HQ of the organization. Lots of wildlife in the area!

Yamit also runs a turtle rescue center with his parents nearby, which is free to visit. They show amazing passion for the care of wildlife. They're donation based, so more than welcome to donate some cash!

The town itself is adorable, clean and filled with kind people that love to chat. Everyone knows eachother so great sense of safety and community.

WhatsApp Yamit Diaz at: +57 312 7902422

name: Ecoboutique USA2 and 2 other second-hand clothing store
description:
A great second-hand clothing store, with lovely variety and cheap prices.
very close to 2 other second hand store:
• Según La Moda Store
• Súper Ropero (even cheaper!)
highly recommend!

name: parque escondido tierra blanca
description:
This is a place to pass through, you could stay a couple of nights, it's a quiet place! I knew it because I used to live in this area. It's safe, it's an unpaved road behind the Avenida Indumil.
----
este es un lugar de paso, podrías quedarte un par de noches, es un lugar tranquilo!   lo conocí por que antes vivía en esta zona. es seguro es una vía sin pavimentar detrás de la avenida indumil.

name: SOAT cucuta
description:
I was able to take out a SOAT for my motorcycle here. 3 months for 209,000 COP. Available for external travelers. 
La Previsora, Calle 14 No. 3- L 108 
Opening hours: 8 a.m. to 12 p.m. and 1 p.m. to 5 p.m. - SOAT issue 8:00 AM to 12:00 PM and 1 p.m. to 4 p.m. 
There is a side entrance.
You will need a copy of your passport, vehicle registration document and TIP. 
A copy shop is within sight. At the end of the street. (approx. 50 m). It is possible to send the data via WhatsApp. 
The insurance can be paid for by credit card or cash.

name: Hospedaje El Jeque
description: The rooms have been newly renovated and everything is clean. Typical truck stop. Ideal for an overnight stay. A restaurant that is well attended. I paid 30,000 COP for a room.

name: Hostal Cartagonova
description:
We stayed 10 days at this very welcoming family.
There are 3 different rooms with or without attached bathroom and one dormitory with 6 beds.
All the rooms are equipped with AC and have fans.
Communal clean kitchen, laundry, living room, fast internet, airport pickup and parking lot for small car.
Martha can provide breakfast and dinner if you want. Lovely coffee!
Little tienda just across the street and supermarket 10 minutes walk.

Martha and Jose helped us a lot while we had to visit the hospital unfortunately. Jose speaks English.

We paid 129.000 for room with attached bathroom. Discount for longer stays possible.

Telephone number: +57 324 667 3698

name: Start of Hiking loop to Cueva de Esplendor
description: We started our hike to Cueva de Esplendor here. It is ca. 8 km uphill, gaining 870 meters of altitude, 3 hours. At the Cueva you pay 20.000 pp for entrance, count 1 hour more or less with break. Then we continued the hike down the trail which is the official road up to the Cueva. That took us another 3 hours for ca. 10 km. So 7 hours in total, 18 km loop. Amazing scenery, great views, totally recommend. If you prefer less steep uphill walk, then do it the other way round. It’s just more km uphill then. They sell beverage and snacks at the Cueva, otherwise there is nothing on the way, so take water and food.

name: Taller Volante
description: We went there to check a strange sound in your Kombi VW. they were very serious and friendly. help us with others little staffs on the van. we didn't wait before they come to check the van.

name: Simankongo Hotel
description: Very simple, bear and clean accommodations. A full size bed, a chair, a shower, a toilet and a small sink. The best part is the air conditioning, as the town is very hot. Our room #7 looked at the street, so it was very noisy. We paid C60k for one night. We had asked people in town and everyone said we could sleep in our van for free in front of the main square, but we wanted the shower, and the AC.

name: Hospedaje Payende
description: A friendly site with six cabañas and places for pitching tents. The cabañas are 230k COP per night with use of the pool and breakfast included. Pitching a tent costs 20k per person per night, includes use of the pool and WiFi. Breakfast is 15k per person with plenty of coffee.

name: Cerca al criadero de trucha
description:
Place with a spectacular view. Very friendly people, and beautiful and quiet nights

--

Sitio con una espectacular vista. Gente muy amigable, y las noches bellas y tranquilas

name: condominio quintas del manantial
description:
Maria Fernanda receives you inside of a gated community in the outskirts of Cartagena (35 min to city center) and you can park in front of their house. the parking is not private but shared with the neighbors. you can use their bathroom. 
write Maria on Whatsapp at +57 300 5689836

name: Hotel Trujillo Plaza
description: Direkt on Square Place, beautyfull Hotel look really Luxory in Colombian Style! Hot Water big Beds so clean we paid 22 Dollar! Good Coffeeshop belong to Hotel with nice Espresso! I recomend it!!! Parking on Street, no Problem!! Or you ask Owner he let your bike park in Coffeeshop at 10 pm!

name: Hospedaje El Rosario
description:
Basic but clean hotel in Oporapa situated at the back of the petrol station . Only 4 rooms, I was charged 40,000 COP for one person for the night. The owners let me keep my bicycle in a garage attached to the petrol station overnight.
If full, there is another hotel around the corner

name: Polideportivo in El Salto de Bordones
description:
Covered area with concrete floor next to the polideportivo near the church close to the centre of town. I asked a couple of people if it was ok to camp here and they all said yes.
Very poor cell signal in the town. Quite noisy with loud music coming from a nearby bar as it is the weekend. There are also rooms available in the town if you ask around.

name: Aguachica
description:
Amazing mecànic!!!!! Ask for William (no others) really nice mecànic. They work hard until find the solution.
William: +57 314 6726217

He works at: Servicios mecanicos de Aguachica
Carrera 10 #9-11 205010, Cra. 40 #3-76, Aguachica, Cesar, Colòmbia

8C63+H5 Aguachica, Departament del Cesar, Colòmbia

name: Villa Dunia
description:
Big spot full of space for parking all size trucks and campers, you can put your tent, also. 

This is a private place manage for a colombian guy: Gerardo. He lives in small home with 2 dogs, 2 horses and chickens.  He was a traveler, too, and he wants that his land become a place of travelers. 

Wifi, watter, súper close to the Museum Fósil (you can go by foot), and there you can find a restaurant.
5/10 minuts to the center of the village by car.

Gerardo is super friendly and helpfull. 

You can do a Laundry leaving a tip, speak with Gerardo. 

You can contact directly at: (+57) 302 486 1053 by WhatsApp. Sorry, but Gerardo only speak Spanish

name: Canely's Club
description:
Restaurant with pool and small garden kids. Whe speend with our motorhome one night on the grass parking behind the main road. Quiet and safe. 
We take a beer and juice, but not food. 
They offer us the showers and toilets. 
All was really clean

Beer 4500cop
Mango juice 7000 cop
Swiminpool 7000 cop pp
Parking the night 30000 cop for 3 person

name: Parking Free Arvi
description:
Flat área shared by buses. 
You can park for free.
Fresh and quiet at night.

name: Mirador de Sebastián de Belalcázar
description:
Modern mirador where you can see a nice view of the city.
Here there are artisan and people walking the dog.

name: short  term parking
description: Indoor parking with high clearance. Access to walled city

name: THE IRISH Beer Garden & Pub
description: Nice Pub offering a variety of local and international beers nice atmosphere in between two marvelous YARUMO Tress and rock music

name: Restaurante y balneario la floresta
description: It is a restaurant next to the ravine, it looks like a castle, I stayed two nights in this place and it was quite safe, it is a little noisy because of the mules that pass by all night but you sleep peacefully, I did not pay anything because I talked to the manager to sleep in a tent, it has food, showers, electricity, and nice facilities.

name: Terrazza Monk
description: Cosy Place, looking more for young Lovers! But anyway, the food is delicious!! Come here, take the Tartare Colombian so nice taste! Cocktails even nice taste! Really recoment this place!!

name: Visa Services
description: We had trouble renewing our 90 day permit online. We found Jessica’s company and in a matter of hours she had our renewals (paid by credit card) making the process simple thanks to her contacts in the Immigration office. Highly recommended. +57-315-556-0314

name: Street Campsite
description:
We spent the night in the bay on the street; it was very quiet at night. During the day, many vehicles pass by, but it's very safe, especially being close to the police school. It's perfect for spending the night.
---
Pasamos la noche en la bahia en la calle, muy tranquilo en la noche, en el dia pasan muchos vehiculos, muy seguro, cerca a la escuela de policia. perfecto para pasar la noche

name: Labatodo laundry
description: Got my full service laundry here. They charge 9000 pesos per kilo. Drop off and pick up the next day. you cannot do it yourself. Little expensive  but great service

name: casa Común
description:
Natural shop
Selling products like sourdough bread. Ons Wednesday and Saturday fresh sourdough bread.
Coffee, lunch, clothes, some vegetables and other natural products like tahini.
A lot of community activities.

name: Road works
description: Paving the road. Long delays, depending on what time you arrive.

name: Camping Gamcelat
description: Camping Gamcelat is very nice place to visit San Augustín and the nearby archaeological sites. It’s close to town (5 min walk and 2 km to archaeological park).

name: Pátio ao lado da rodovia
description:
Translation: Patio in front of the dealership office, which also works as SOS and has a sleeping option.
We spent a very peaceful night here.

Pátio em frente à ao escritório concessionária, que também funciona como SOS e tem opção de dormir. 
Passamos uma noite aqui bem tranquila.

name: El Ramo
description: Very basic, 2 rooms with 7 beds, excellent dinner (nicely priced at 20 mil in comparison to the fancy, overpriced Eco-places around) and breakfast (10 mil). Perfect for a night as a base for Cerro Kennedy. Don't expect luxury.

name: Tyre repair and inflation
description:
Montallan. 
Lovely couple. No fuss. 30,000 to repair two tyres. 
+57 312 382 2345

name: Hospedaje y Restaurante Pisimbala
description:
What a welcoming family. They directed us to park next to the house/ hostel. The whole family were all fascinated with the campervan. Also, allowed us to use the bathrooms and water. 
We cooked into the campervan.

name: Hostel Musica & Art
description:
On Sunday afternoon we parked outside Hotel Musica and Art and woke up with our rear tyre purposefully punctured.
We discovered not all characters that associate with the hostel safe. Steven at the hostel was very welcoming and shared their wifi and allowed us to use the showers.

name: short term parking
description: It is indoor lot. You can park for 3500 pesos per hour. No problem  vehicle clearance. Secure lot closes at 6 pm

name: Bocas de Ceniza hike start
description: This is the place where you can park your car and start a 5 km hike one way to Bocas de Cenizas. It's a beautiful hike with Magadalena River on one side and ocean on the other side. You can hike or get a moto ride to the end. Make sure to carry water with you. Not many tiendas on the way there

name: 24 hrs parking
description: You can park here for w4 hors. They charged me 45000 pesos per night. It has camera and is attended by guard 24/7.

name: Ornella cono pizzas
description:
Excellent pizzeria! Big and good for a reasonable price! The boss is very friendly and helpful! It's a little difficult to find: you have to enter the patio passing through a café, go to the very back and climb the stairs!

Excellente pizzeria! Grandes et bonnes pour un prix raisonnable! Le patron est très sympathique et serviable! C’est un peu difficile à trouver : il faut rentrer dans le patio en passant dans un café, aller tout au fond et monter l’escalier!

name: Tourist information office - El Coca
description:
Here you can find the official tourist office.
They provide you with the latest information about events in the area and all the tours in the Amazonas! 
Go to here before going to the tours operators, so you have better knowledge of what/which tour you want to book!

The tour information you can also find on their website: http://www.elcocavivelo.com/informacion/

We got a lot of information what we can do in this area and they also help if you have only a smaller budget!

name: Hotel NES
description:
Nice simple hotel with secure parking for vans. no height limit. but not suitable for big rigs.

Paid 100.000Cop for two ppn. inclusive nice breakfast, wifi AC and parking. 

Claro, Atms and money exchange in walking distance.

name: Terpel
description:
We slept one night at this station, the staff was very kind and said we could sleep in a retreat that has a direction towards Medellín.  There is a lot of noise from the road, as it is next door.  It has a bathroom, but it closed for a period due to lack of water.  We don't pay anything, we just fill up the car in the morning.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Dormimos uma noite neste posto, o pessoal foi muito gentil e disse que poderíamos dormir num recuo que tem sentido Medellín. Tem bastante ruído da estrada, pois fica ao lado. Possui banheiro, mas fechou por um período por conta de falta de água. Não pagamos nada, somente abastecemos o carro pela manhã.

name: Gira el Sol - Veg Restaurant
description:
Vegetarian restaurant that offers a vegan lunch with vegetarian (cow’s milk/eggs) desserts. Lunch is 10k for a small and 12k for a large. This is a vegan’a paradise. You actually leave full after eating a healthy meal for a great price. You get a bowl of fruits or soup, the main lunch plate, and a juice. Definitely come here! 

They also sell tofu labeled as ‘queso de soya’.
Pet friendly.

name: Clandestino Hostal
description:
Came here cycling, two persons.
The owner is really friendly. They told us for the moment there is nothing to pay to camp here. Just to help him back for some stuff at the place.
So to pitch your tent it’s free (under a Tree, some grass) and if you want to sleep in a bed it’s 10k per person. He proposes a restaurant too.
Cell signal, wifi, water, electricity, kitchen, bathrooms, cold showers.
There are two dogs friendly.

name: En la plaza de los perros
description:
It is Benito Juárez Square, this is the place where it is possible to park. We felt safe the 3 nights we spent here. The police are in the square and the square is lively and quiet at night. In the central area to walk everywhere.

--

Es la plaza Benito Juárez este es el lugar donde es posible estacionar. Nos sentimos seguros las 3 noches que pasamos aquí. La policía está en la plaza y la plaza es animada y tranquila en la noche. En la zona céntrica para ir caminando a todos lados.

name: Cerro Montecillo
description: Beautiful hike up, views of the lake and town the whole way. 5km up and down, pretty much up hill the whole way up but not too steep and only short. Would recommend, no one else on the path and we went on a weekend, muy tranquilooooo! Also a spot to camp in a tent up here! Hike is on alltrails and maps me! Enjoyyy

name: Bad Road
description: Very bad Road condition, thousands of big potholes between Aportado and Necoccli

name: Hotel Alpa Indi, Santiago
description: Small friendly hotel with warm showers. Cost 30,000 COP for one person per night. Let me keep my bicycle in the corridor to the gym downstairs

name: Taller automotive San felipe
description: I needed bearing replaced on my 4runner.Talk to the Heje Sesa Cemenka. He got it done within 2 hours. Nice job.

name: Hostel Metro Floresta Alojamiento
description:
Beautiful host. Delivers a walking tour of La Floresta area around 10am daily. Contact him in advance to confirm timings. He grew up in the areas and talks through his experiences with Pablo Escobar and the various groups living area. His English is limited, but his learning and he is very apt with Google Translate. 
No sign on the hostel front to identify. Need to contact direct. 
The hostel has a social WhatsApp group you can join to meet others for activities. 
Free WiFi. Laundry next door. 
Floresta y Floresta plus 4131742metrofloresta

WhatsApp: +57 (314) 622-6559

name: el campesino
description: kind of pilgrim place. 20k for a single room. nothing fancy perfect for one night.

name: hostal casa Vicente
description: Hostal with private rooms 1st floor with nice view for 90k ground floor 80k COP. They have secure parking for motos and small cars. They also include coffee and arepa con mantequilla in the morning.

name: Merak hostel
description: nice place clean secure parking for moto fast internet hot shower private room for 70K

name: Sarab Arabie Restaurant
description:
The  best Mediterranean restaurant in Barranquilla. A must stop if you like Lebanese food. 
Tony the owner speaks great English. Have some Arak and Fateh for me.

name: Fan repairs.
description: My small fan had starting issues. The stall guy here fixed it. He knows what he is doing.

name: Restaurante Espíritu Santo
description: Great place to eat, clean, nice staff, huge portions of food, one dish can full 2 person easily and the best of all, cheap as f... 19.000 cop or USD5 pear meal.  Gran lugar, buena atención, gran comida, grandes grandes porciones (con un plato comen 2) y a un precio razonable 19.000 cop/5USD

name: Peaceful turn off between fields
description:
Peaceful place between fields, away from the main road. Small leveled turn-off with space for one car or two tents, the last 20m are a bit steep on loose gravel, might be difficult in a 2wd. Not suitable for big rigs.
There is a house near by they came and were really friendly and told us it's save place. 
We took the switch backs from the bottom. But also saw some cars coming from up.

name: Texaco
description: I parked where the trucks normally go. no one came to charge me. quiet night after 10ish. they have showers and baños but I did not use them

name: Los Rosales
description: Very nice Place for overlander´s , totally green and super quiet, nice and clean Pools, lots of animals to knuddle, our daughter really enjoyed this Place. We could use shower and toilet from one cabana. Paid 70k for us 2.5 and our Truck, a bit expensive but totally worth the Price. In front of properes is a small woodden bridge, no Problem for our 8t, but for heavier trucks??

name: Terpel gaz station
description:
Terpel station. We were able to refill water for free (200L) after filling up.

Station Terpel. Nous avons pu recharger gratuitement en eau (200L) après avoir fait le plein.

name: wild camping near Finca de La Candaleria
description:
Came last night to Finca. It was too late for the tour. they close at 4 pm. They did not allow us to use RTT on Finca. Instead we pulled in this spot as it was getting dark and the road is Hi 4x4. Peaceful and tranquil here. Tomorrow  we plan to go for chocolate tour at Finca at 9 am. 
Only 4x4 and high clearance vehicles can make it here.

name: Police checkpoint
description:
Police checkpoint checking for TIP and SOAK (insurance) 
They wanted to charge us 150$ for not having insurance and tow the car… would have been a nightmare. 
After an hour and a tow truck pulling up in front of us they send us back to Pasto to buy insurance, without a fine.

name: Pastelería Alemana
description:
Perfect bakery/restaurant/bar run by German lady. She has delicious strudels, lots of cakes, sandwiches and of course coffee and jugos. Very lovely, peaceful place, little oasis. 
Parking is on the street and she has camera so felt okay. 
She was very nice!

name: Taller mecánico de Segundo
description:
Segundo, who is a mechanic, and Jorge, who is an electrician, work here. We have experience with Segundo, he repaired the steering and the homokinetics of the Kombi, even without getting spare parts. The work was excellent and at a great price. He let us sleep inside the workshop. He is an excellent person and we highly recommend him.
---
Acá trabajan Segundo que es mecánico y Jorge que es eléctrico. Nosotros tenemos experiencia con segundo, nos reparo la dirección y la homocinética de la Kombi, aún sin conseguir repuestos. El trabajo fue excelente y a un precio bárbaro. Nos dejó dormír adentro del taller. Es una excelente persona.
Lo recomendamos mucho

name: Parqueadero
description: Parking in front of the monument of Pantano de Vargas.  Quiet and safe place.

name: Parquedero
description: If you are taking Tour of Punta Gallinas with history travel, you can park the car here. They charged me 8000pesos per day, 24000 pesos for 3 days. You park outside and your solar panel will have access to sun.  No height restrictions.

name: Parqueadero asociación comunal Palomino
description: It is a comfortable place, with drinking water, quiet and safe. You must pay 10,000 COP per night. We have been here for 3 weeks and everything is very good.

name: Photos location
description: All tours stop here for the photos. If overlander you can park here too and enjoy views  muy tranquilo

name: Posada toche
description:
posada Toche near the church.
20k for a bed
10 k for camping
10k breakfast.
wa 3142864022
fast wifi, cold shower.
very clean

restaurant in the street for 11k a meal

name: El pilon parking lot.
description: This is where you park and hike the El Pilon. You can also swim here in the Plata.

name: El Faro parking
description: This is the parking lot where all tours come for sunset. You could park here and enjoy tge views after everyone leaves.

name: JAL Dealer 4x4 Parts, Tires & Accessories
description:
This shop installed a rear view camera for us and also organised original Toyota coil springs for our Landcruiser HZJ78.
They also have lights, 4x4 Accessories, quality tires, car Hi-fi and electronics. Super friendly, easy and quick contact and process.

They don't have a workshop so they only sell the parts. But they do minor repairs and they do install the tires. Just contact them beforehand and ask if they will do the installation for you. 

You can contact them via Instagram @jal_dealer or via Whattsapp +57 322 9129 741.

name: Bogota football tour
description:
Charlie has been hosting football tours for over eight years. He shared heaps of information about the team and the game. 
We join him on a Sunday afternoon game Santa Fe v’s Tomlina. We paid 200,000 Cop for transport to and from the game and drinks. 
WhatsApp: +57 315233494

name: Rural San Remo
description:
A lovely place with lodges where we could stay with the van. We were the first that stayed here with the van and they want to attract more vans. The lodges are in booking if you want to see more info. Since our parents stayed at the lodge we didn’t have to pay for the van but you’ll have to negotiate a price if you’re here with the van. 

It’s close to the thermals. The path to the place is narrow so not suited for big rigs.

name: UPGRADE VAN DESIGN
description:
Specialized place in camperizacion maintenance of mobile homes, sale of accessories for your Motorhome, specialists in electrical systems, solar plumbing
---
Lugar especializado en camperizacion  mantenimiento de casas rodantes , venta de accesorios para su Motorhome , especialistas en sistemas eléctricos ,solares plomeria

name: Lechemiel parrilla bar
description:
Spa with natural water pool, sale of food and drinks, with parking space for a motor home. Parking cost COP 20,000 per vehicle
--
Balneario con piscina de agua natural, venta de comidas y bebidas, con espacio de parqueo para casa rodante. Costo de parqueo COP 20.000 por vehículo

name: Jhon Repuestos y Frenos
description: My 4runner brake pedal was applying brakes low. So I was brought in here by Oswaldo, driver of the History Tours that take visitors to Punta Gallinas. They have all Toyota Prados & Land Cruisers. They are in tip-top top conditions. I felt they know the best mechanics. Brought my car here. He thought the pas needed replacement but that was not the issue. He alternatively thought the pedal needed adjustment but tried to adjust it but could not. In reality it was Master cylinder gradually failing. Good for routine brake repairs.

name: Police check point
description:
Small/ informal police check point. 
Asked for vehicle details and passports. Seemed happy with them and let us continue.

name: Restaurante Piedra Colgada
description:
Awesome camping spot to head out to the hills for some hiking.

WhatsApp: +57 (313) 838-8165

PIEDRA COLGADA PARQUE ECOTURISTICO Adventure Park WhatsApp: +57 (311) 292-2954

name: ICA new location to legalise papers for exporting dog
description:
The ICA building on google maps is no longer correct. They moved to this place. Other than a poster it has no sign or whatsoever. We asked and they confirmed. You can park in front of the building. Beware of the steep ramp. 

It’s open during weekdays between 7.30 total 11.00 and from 14.00-17.00. Changes could be made since they’re undergoing changes currently. 

Here at ICA you can legalise your health certificate for the dog to leave Colombia.

name: PIEDRA COLGADA PARQUE ECOTURISTICO
description:
The family are so welcoming. Great activity with a view over the valley. 
Various costs for each of the different activities. 
We parked, used toilets and showers for free. 


WhatsApp: +57 314 226 9413

name: Viñedo Umaña Dajud wineyard tour
description:
Cute little winery, produces three different varieties of red and one rose wine.
European prices for glasses or a bottle.

name: Tailler el wicho and TCG Tapiceria carpas garcia (auto trimming/vehicle upholstery)
description: The Tailler el wicho (tel. 3026748641) does fantastic Carosserie works on Toyota, but also on other cars. If there is a problem with the seats or something interior works like that, there is shop just on the other side of the road. Good experience

name: Hostal El Triangulo
description: this is the hotel of the gas station. there is enough space in the room to put your bikes in. 60 000 pesos one night two persons with AC in the room. average wifi.

name: Taller El Mugre
description: One of the best garages I ever have seen. There are a lot of specialist for everything. And they have long time experience.  So if Toyota Landcruiser has a problem that will be the place for sure. They work very good and fast and with a high competence.

name: Sutamarchán - Quiet street parking
description:
Arrived into the town late at night. Good overnight spot walking distance of the cute town square. 
Good Claro signal
No amenities.

name: Grape Juice Tour - Viñedo Abarán
description:
Lovely father and son team.
We believed this was a winery and they kept insisting that we can try wines as well as juice. However, they don’t produce wine. It was from Chile!
25,000 pp for a tour.

name: La Marqueza cocina y coctelería
description: really good menu del día for 10000. very friendly owner. vegetarian friendly.

name: José Bodyshop
description: We hit our van in a tough spot to fix. Somebody in town recommended Jose. He did an incredible job, for an incredible price, all in half anday. His WhatsApp +57 320 2647115.

name: Teyuna Tours - Day 1 campsite
description: This is the site where the tour company makes you stay overnight for the first night of the 3 night trip. Great Accomodation and food is served here. All beds have mosquito nets.

name: hospedaje
description:
hospedaje without name close to the main square. Paid 25k for a room.
cold shower. wifi. place for bicycle, motorbike I guess

name: hostal zurumba
description:
good place to camp. 
15k per night to camp
10k breakfast
30k dorm

name: La Clarita
description: Nice flat green space next to the river. Clean bathrooms and showers. Weather is quite warm so no need for warm shower… We stayed Thursday to Saturday, the first night it was perfectly quiet, the second one not so much. Not recommended during weekend as it’s a very popular spot and people play loud music day and night. The River access is only a few meters away and the water is nice and clear. There was a big family of MONKEYS passing by very close to us early in the morning, this was a special and unexpected treat (pay attention to high pitch sounds) The owner (Doña Blanca) offered to prepare food so we had a fish plate which was good. Good place to relax next to the river for a day or two and enjoy nature.

name: Camping La Peña
description: Beautiful HUGE flat green area next to amazing Río Claro which has clear water and natural pools to swim and refresh yourself. Bathrooms and shower are basic but clean. They sell beverages and snacks on site. The surrounding area has mining activity so there’s some truck noise during the day. Make sure to take mosquito repellent as there are bugs early morning and evening. It’s quite hot so our rechargeable fan was perfect during the night. Crowded on weekends. Weekdays are the best! Love this place!

name: Zuagencia Beach resort
description: You can stay overnight or can have a day pass to enjoy the beautiful facilities  here. They charge $250,000 pesos for day pass of which 118,000 pesos is towards consumables. The resort is on the beach

name: Almacigo Food & Drinks
description: We came to this restaurant. We enjoyed all their food. We noticed they had rooms. We asked to use the showers. We were charged COP$20K for the 2 of us. A bit expensive, but very convenient. Showers were hot, but you need to make sure to ask for them to turn on the water heater...hahaha

name: Mechanic Richard
description:
Richard is very knowledgeable on cars. A local Shop owner from Aguacatera who owned a 4runner recommended Richard name. I came here and he was able to diagnose the brake issue immediately. He does not know English but we were able to communicate through translator. Highly recommend Richard for the car repairs
 He has adjacent hotel too where you could stay for the night. 
Since my brake Master cylinder needed the electrical repairs so he had his son take me to Louis Carlos shop, Taller Eurocar (pin added) so he can scan, diagnose and  repair the master cylinder. At the end of the day, he did not ask for labor but just said whatever proposal is worth to you. I gave him 27000 pesos.

name: Louis Carlo
description: Louis was recommended by Mechanic Richard. He is tge expert of Toyota electronic system. He is going to fix my 4runner Master Cylinder. He charged me $170 for rebuilding master cylinder. An additional $30,000 pesos to do the electronic scan on the brakes.

name: Casa Tamarindo
description:
A great little hostel with decent off street parking and well priced. Aircon, WiFi, reasonable rooms and a small communal kitchen. If you were prepping a sprinter van or similar for shipping you could even do that here instead of out at the popular fincas. See pic for parking space.

It is operated remotely so you need to book online (we did this on the day of arrival) and recieve access codes: @casatamarindo or WhatsApp +57 320 476 5431 

We think it is the same owners as Casa do Los Almendros but this one offers better parking space.  

Google will take you to the the above hostel so refer to pics for correct street number.

name: Hotel Casa Mishka
description:
A great place while waiting for you vehicle to arrive  at the port.
Good WiFI. New, clean, peaceful and nice boutique hotel with a parking space right in front.  24hrs security cam and reception. Common kitchen for light cooking. Walking distance to collect your TIP.  20 minutes walk to Old Town/Getsemani. Very helpful staffContact Roberto.

name: Pezetarian
description: Sushi/asian-ish place with interesting food and several vegetarian / vegan options, typical old-town prices.

name: Hostal Bogotá Real - correct location
description: THIS is the correct location. Nice hostel with 2 friendly hosts, Eduardo and Mauricio. Rooms (already a little run down) in 2nd floor are nice with a nice view to the parks around. We could use the (not very clean) kitchen for boiling water and preparing our breakfast. Eduardo is very helpful. 1 fenced parking lot, good for a car or 2-3 motos. Walking distance (5min) to Carulla Supermarket and other shops/banks/ATMs. Walking distance (30 min) to our garage (KTM Powershop). We left most of our luggage here to leave the country for about 2 months and payed 1 night extra(100000 cop) for the storage. Safe and very quiet place. +57 311 2121599

name: Primax Gas
description: We stay one night, this is part of the new road to Medellín, so need one place to sleep, we enter to Segovia, but is more caotic

name: Finca cafetera Boscafé San Juan
description:
A little bit up the hill from the main road (steep but possible to cycle for me). The gate entrance to the Place is directly at the main road, towards the east, quite visible with signs.

The place has a small parking lot.
A clean restaurant and bar.
They're renting a cabin (one cabin) with own bathroom and electricity.
Friendly staff and some dogs and chickens.
WiFi 4mb/s.

Around the restaurant and cabin, I couldn't hear the road, but I didn't pay special attention.

Seems kids and family friendly.

They grow and sell their own coffee.

The owner was very happy having a foreigner as a guest and told me very excited that once a couple from Europe rented a cabin.

I pitched up my tent somewhere on the property. They don't have fixed prices for tents. They said, if I want to give a small donation, I can.

Telephone: 3123835200

name: Río Ariporo cobble beach
description:
An incredible place at the end of a small dirt road. Surrounded by lush vegetation and a a lot of birds.
As this is rainy season, we camped a little far from the river, but we can see it and hear it.
Very peaceful… a couple of friendly fishermen came in the afternoon.
One of the best wild camps we have been so far.
It is very hot, but dipping in the river is truly refreshing.
4x4 recommended if you want to access the beach, otherwise you can stay at the end of the road

name: Parque ecoturístico Fabian Parra
description: A very special place with a truly unique landscape of mountain plateaus. At an altitude of 800 meters, you can escape the heat of the rest of the llanos. Nice and windy. Gorgeous 360 degree views. Several camp spots to choose from. On a clear day you can see Nevado del Cocuy on one side and the flat lands of the Llanos on the other side. Beautiful sunrises!!! You MUST CALL in advance to make a reservation otherwise the gate will be closed. 4x4 access only as the road is very steep and rocky. Contact +57 3132802980

name: End of cul-de-sac backing into woodland
description:
Decent spot for one night. Close to sports pitches. Locals were friendly. Couple of small shops within a couple of hundred metres. 
Good Claro signal.
No amenities.

name: Tyre place
description: Awesome team who kindly stayed late on a Saturday to change our tyres.

name: Manantial Tatacoa Pool
description: Nice pool - our camphosts told us they have the best water. All natural, running, no chlorine. We were there on a Tuesday afternoon shortly after noon and were the only guests. Unfortunately the restaurant was closed - we assume it might only be open on weekends and holidays. Still - a nice place to cool off in the desert. Entrance fee is 10.000 COP/p

name: Estación de Gasolina Puma
description: We had an appointment at a truck shop close by and asked the night before if we could overnight here, which they confirmed. We paid 5.000 COP for the night and stayed actually two nights more and we did our visit to Bogotá center from here via uber. The road passing by is pretty busy during the day but mostly quiet at night. The first activity at the airport starts around 5am.

name: Hotel Kastello
description: Cheap and clean hotel with safe gated parking. COP25k ($7) for a room with double bed and TV, toilet sharing. COP30k ($8) for room with ensuite toilet. The receptionist David can speak fair English.

name: panadería el sol laboyano
description: surprisingly good panaderia (for small town colombian standards) on the village main square.

name: redemption waterfall
description:
from here to hike down to the waterfall
 it is private waterfall. Cost 25000 pesos to go there. Go to central Hostel in Minca to take guide with you. It is 45 min. hike one way.

name: Redemption  waterfall hike starting point
description: This is the fork in road where you take right and follow tge trail to waterfall. 200m down the road is an open gate which you go through. You hike for half hour where there is a private property gate. You need to pay $25000 pesos/person to visit the fall. I took the tour from Central Hostel. The tour starts at 9 am if enough people and end at 1:00 pm. You should be able to park the car here. The whole town is safe for tourists.

name: View to represa La Copa
description: We went to the nearby spot but there was a potato plantation with lots of workers so we we went up a little further and found this secluded spot away from the road and hidden by trees. We can still see the lake and have a nice view of the mountain landscape. Quiet and safe place to spend the night.

name: Parque Tebaida
description:
Very quiet place, very welcoming people, we took very nice memories with us, there is no service, a lot of shops around.
---------
Lugar muy tranquilo, personas muy acogedoras nos llevamos muy lindos recuerdos, bueno para vender. no hay ningún servicio. mucho comercio al rededor

name: Big roof for camping, next to cancha and school
description:
Its a roof next to the football field ("cancha"). Easily big enough for two three tents and bicycles/bikes.

The football field itself is covered by a huge roof as well. Everyone we asked in the village for a spot to camp, told us the football field or the roof next to it is a great place to camp.

There is a tap with water.

There is a toilet, but because of the hygienic state of the toilet, I would say there is no toilet. During school time it is probably possible to use the school toilets.

The house east of the football field has two electricity plugs outside of the window.

If you travel by car/caravan, there is enough place around to park your vehicle. But we did not ask about cars.

Cellular connection (with claro) is between Okish and EDGE. There is a free WiFi where one has to register sign up to use it.

name: Next to Río Tibaná
description: Very pretty large flat green area right by the river and surrounded by nature. We stayed one night on a weekday and it was peaceful and quiet. A couple of people walked by in the afternoon. There’s a pedestrian bridge but seems only for neighbors to cross the river. Good claro signal. Very enjoyable spot.

name: Orquideas de Tolima
description: A family who created a natural reserve. They offer guided tours in their private park aswell as accomendation. It is a very special place! The owners are super friendly and will help you im any way possible. We are cycling through Colombia and were happy to find this oasis in Ibaque.

name: Hospedaje Palmar de Ensueño
description: Nice family run hospedaje. Private bedrooms and shared toilets with showers. We paid 50k for a room. It is clean, they store your bicycles and they have good wifi

name: La salamandra
description: Nice camp grounds with shelter and place for hanging hammock. 25’000 the night (with the hammock and a matelas) and 10’000 for breakfast. Helpful and really friendly owner ! Access to the beach and near of the city center.

name: Bar El Sotareno
description: Nice place, for good drinks and Salsa Music! Everything so clean and friendly! The owner Augustin, is lovley! Allready 90 Years young! Its is a bar to relax!

name: Terpel gas station
description:
Fine gas station and place for trucks. You can sleep in your car also, the guard was very nice. Clean toilets. 
It was quiet during the night but of course in the morning trucks are leaving. 
We first wanted to stay on the other gas station that is on iOverlander but it was closed and this looked better.

name: Luis Alberto
description:
He is a man who may be able to help with lodging, food, shower and electricity for electronic devices (among other things) all this in Piedecuesta.

I stayed here for several days and received all this help through him and that is why I recommend him, but he is in his right to refuse or not, however I suggest you get to ask.
---
Es un señor que quizás pueda ayudar con hospedaje, comida, ducha y electricidad para los dispositivos electrónicos (Entre otras cosas) todo esto en Piedecuesta. 

Yo permanecí acá varios días y recibí toda esta ayuda por medio de él y por eso lo recomiendo, pero el está en su derecho de negarse o no, sin embargo les sugiero llegar a preguntar.

name: R&R Restaurant
description: Good restaurant, very popular in this village, 12k peso menu compl. Nice open view from 3nd floor. Friendly owner Jaime.

name: Residencias los Helachos
description:
Great little hotel walking distance from Cartagena airport 
Nearby beach bars restaurant etc
Basic but cheap and family run. Very clean and secure.
Aircon room with private facilities c.100k

name: Central Hostel parking lot
description: You can park in the back of the hostel with access to all tge facilities. Sun access for solar panel may be an issue but you have access to the electric socket. Great place to stay. Staff and wifi is great. I paid 30000 pesos/ night. Half tge cost of a dorm. You may be able to negotiate the price. Lot of mangoes. Say Hi to Sanderine. The most friendly French you will meet.

name: Car Wash after the port (High Clearance)
description:
Auto Tokio 
High Clearance entrance, our van is 3.5meters and it had lots of room to enter.
this was our first stop after the port.  we wanted to clean our van off all the salt and ocean water after shipping.  one of the few car wash in town that can accept high clearance vehicles.
we paid 65000 cop for a Sprinter van.  washed inside and out, top to bottom.  did a great job!
a good stop after the port for a clean start in South America.

YOLO Family Vans (IG, YT, FB)

name: Primax parking lot
description:
Parking behind the service station
---------------

Parqueadero detrás de la estación de servicios

name: Sport field with roof
description:
Sport complex, next to the road. Open all night (2 gates towards the street, 1 gate to the other side, all open). Neighbors is another sport field and a women social center. And opposite road side a petrol station. Behind is meadows.

The people I met inside told me its public, always open and no problem to sleep one night.

Non of the electricity plugs worked when I was there.

If the door below the stands is open, there is Water and some dirty Toilets and showers. In the morning some people came, one by one, to use the toilets. Its a sign that the doors to the toilets is always open. Otherwise, ask the patrol station neighbors. Between the street and the sport building, there could be place for cars/caravan but I didn't ask.

name: Land Rover Importador
description:
Here you can get almost everything for your Land Rover. If they don't have it l, they can get it.

Alex and his team are super Land Rover fanatics and happy to help out!

Here is the contact:

+57 312 3033759

name: Odontología Dussan
description: Had trouble finding a dentist in San Agustin. Luckily I found this one ! You can go with or without appointment. Affordable and trustworthy ! I feel so much better now :D

name: Finca EL REMANSO
description:
In the backwater we offer temporary parking and accommodation in ecological domes (mud construction). Showers, toilets and WiFi service are offered.
You can also enjoy nature along with resting in natural waters on the banks of the river.
Restaurant service and typical Colombian foods are offered.

name: Kihicha - guide francophone à Bogota
description:
Private or group guided tours of Bogota in French, by an independent guide. 

In the program : 
- visit to Candelaria (half day) 
- visit to the historic heart (day) 
- visit to the steps (days) 
- Bogota tour over two days 
- Customizable tours.

Website: https://kihicha.com/
Whatsapp: +57 3107628036

Visites guidées privées ou en groupe de Bogota en Francais, par un guide indépendant. 

Au programme : 
- visite de la Candelaria (demie-journée) 
- visite du coeur historique (journée) 
- visite des marches (journées) 
- Tour de Bogota sur deux jours 
- Tours personnalisables.

Site internet : https://kihicha.com/
Whatsapp : +57 3107628036

name: Recarga de Gas / Gas Refill
description:
We were able to load the Argentine bottle without any problem, you just have to talk to Juan Carlos first by WhatsApp +57 324 2975322
.
Pudimos cargar la garrafa argentina sin problema, sólo hay que hablar con Juan Carlos antes por WhatsApp +57 324 2975322

name: Kanels
description: Carlos and Evelyn let us stay here at the parking of their future mirador café. The family was very welcoming and helpful. At the time of our stay they were close to open the café. As far as we could see until now it will be a relaxed place with a great view and good quality coffee from their own finca.

name: Migraciónes Colombia
description: A floating office of Migraciónes Colombia. If you come (or if you are about to leave) with a boat from Santa Rosa you can get your passport stamped here instead of going to the airport. Opens at 8am, closes at 4pm.

name: SOAT AXA COLPATRIA
description:
We went to the AXA COLPATRIA store inside the Novacentro shopping center and it was very fast. We did it during the day and there were almost no people.
This company is among those authorized to issue insurance.
He took our information, we paid at a Bancolombia correspondent half a block away (Pasteur pharmacy) and when we returned he already issued the policy.
super friendly and willing.
For our kombi model (81) we paid about 279,000 COP.
The only thing was finding the model right within their system because it asks for data that does not appear in our ID, but we were able to do it without problems for 3 months.
State insurance quoted us 310,000 so we chose this one because it was cheaper. recommendable.

Fuimos al local de AXA COLPATRIA dentro del shopping Novacentro y fue rapidísimo. lo hicimos en el día y casi no había gente.
ésta empresa está dentro de las habilitadas para emitir el seguro.
nos tomó los datos, pagamos en un corresponsal del Bancolombia a media cuadra (farmacia Pasteur) y cuando volvimos ya emitió la póliza.
súper amables y predispuestos.
por el modelo de nuestra kombi (81) pagamos unos 279.000 COP.
lo único fue encontrar el modelo justo dentro de su sistema porque te pide datos que no figuran en mí nuestra cedula, pero lo pudimos hacer sin problemas por 3 meses.
seguros del estado nos cotizo 310.000 así que elegimos este por ser más barato.
recomendable.

name: Red Aval ATM
description: You can withdraw  upto 1,500,000 pesos here. Other ATM had a limit of 300,000.

name: Football field with dry open space under the stands
description:
The football field is just next (south and down) to the main road of Potosí. Almost out of town. It doesn't have any gates and is open.

Under the stands, there is a an open space, 4 x 5 meters. It's dry and a good spot for cyclists.
This side of the stands points towards the town. The other side is more quite but less sheltered.

The doors to enter inside the stands were all closed when I was there. But the windows were all demolished. Inside is no water. Inside are toilets and showers, but water doesn't work. So they haven't been flushed for quite a while.

Non of the electricity plugs worked when I was there. Lights neither.

Before I went to the football field, I asked at the alcaldía for water. There are outside tabs. I was surrounded there by friendly people. They told me its totally alright to sleep at the football field, but they suggested me to sleep in the open sports complex just above the alcaldia. They said its saver and has toilets and showers. But its louder and more people, since it is surrounded by streets and town.... But good to know they allow people to sleep there

name: good mecanic for tyres and bearings
description: we came here after one of our bearings completely break down. We had spares with us and they mounted it very professionally.

name: La Brasa restaurant
description: The most popular and best restaurant in Colombians on the Pacific Coast. Their ships, pollo, carne n Cerro is a must. You will see full of locals. Must stop and enjoy food. My local friend rec. this restaurant  in Barranquilla. I stopped on the way to Bogota

name: North side of Jardín
Quiet place at Residencial Street
Paraiso Del Oriente - Glamping
description: This glamping place, while offering a restaurant, "extreme" sports and accomodations, is welcoming overlanders. The parking area is level gravel but access is somewhat steep. Good wifi in and around the building, but does not reach the parking. Clean toilets and shower. Water not potable. Within easy reach of Icononzo, a small typical lively city outside the main road with great views.

name: corbeau pan artesanal (masa madre)
description: good french style bakery - very good sourdough bread and baguette, pastry 6/10

name: La Riviera - Posada Campestre
description:
Accommodation with several rooms and a flat parking. The place is simple but very nice, very clean, you have everything you need to feel comfortable. 

Delfina and her husband are very helpful people. They can also help you organise tours.

Price doble room: 60'000 $
Price diner per Person: 15'000$

Telephone number: +57 318 571 9103

name: Mirador Pozos
description: This is a campsite called Glamping Cuiriti. You can park and campout for the night here. They charge 10,000 pesos per person. They have Banos and water for shower. Baleanaro is only 10 min down.

name: camping
description:
is a quiet place to rest surrounded by nature,
-----------
es un lugar tranquilo para descansar rodeado de naturaleza ,

name: La Gruta waterfall street park
description: This is the point where you park your car and walk to Mirador La Gruta. Do not drive the street to the left at this point. It is narrow and you can only come in reverse. Once you park the car, La Gruta is only 5 min. uphill walk. Beautiful  views of San Gil from La Gruta. Should see Sunrisr or sunset at La Gruta.

name: Bolo La Isla
description: This is one of tge restaurant where you play Bolo. We came at 7 pm on Saturday  but no one was playing. They demonstrated the game for us. They play everyday at 2 pm. It is a fun game

name: Thorough car wash
description:
40,000 for a complete exterior clean including the underneath.
Only place we found that had power/ electricity with a ramp to clean the underside of the campervan. They did a thorough job.
You can go around the corner for a 20,000 exterior, but no power or ramps.

name: Hostel Girasoles
description: nice place i stayed at i believe I was the first. you camp in the parking lot which is pretty flat. not huge but you could probably fit a big rig. nice patio with excellent view. 30kpp which includes breakfast they also have bikes and motorcycles to rent. i drove one to valle de cocora

name: Parador La Sazon
description:
A good, cheap and simple restaurant. We stopped to eat in the road to Bogotá. A good lunch for two, with soup and limonade, 34k.

Restaurante simples, bom e barato. Paramos pra comer antes de seguir para Bogotá. Bem servido, almoço pra 2 com sopa e limonada 34k.

name: Artesanía / food market
description:
little market area, quite hidden from the street. the entrance is just in front of D1 supermarket.

arts, artesanías and cafeterias. really chill place. we had good specialty coffee, hot chocolate and really good brownie and banana bread at Bogaty cafeteria.

name: La Riviera - Posada Campestre
description:
Next to the accommodation they also have a parking space (no big rigs).

The place is simple but very nice, very clean, you have everything you need to feel comfortable. Delfina and her husband are very helpful people. 

They can also help you organise tours.

Telephone number: +57 318 571 9103

name: Chiflas Restaurant
description: Highly recommended  local food where all the local comes to eat. Try their famous Caldo de Juevos soap or Punta de Anca steak. Prices are great to

name: Mirador Cerra La Cruz
description:
This is where you park to walk 5 min. to Mirador. Great views of the city. Mirador La Gruta has better views though. Cross is lighted at night. 
You coukd park and possibly campout in a van here too. Widw and safe streets.

name: Balin Motor's
description: Good small mechanic, for my Suzuki! Repairs everything exept Electronic!! Very professionell, and good conection! The Streit you find all Parts for your Motorbike

name: Bigger Terpel with water tap and good pressure
description: just added this spot as we were happy to find a place to fill our water tank after the Tatacoa desert. We just asked them and they indicated us the right water tap (no water coming from another one)

name: answer motos
description: fixed my tenere 700 clutch in 2 days, good for large motorbikes

name: Kimaná Hostal
description:
A nice little hostel just a few blocks from the main plaza. Andres who runs the offer is super helpful. 
We arrived on our tandem and he helped carry it up the stairs. 
Paid 65cop for a double, private room. 
It has a reasonably well equipped kitchen. Also has a nice covered, outdoor seating area. 
There is a studio for doing yoga and mats are available. 
Coffee foc in the morning.

name: Overnight at little Restaurant
description:
We were late after the bad road from San Augustin and stopped here to ask if we could overnight here. The woman at the restaurant had no problem and let us stay. In front of the restaurant is levelled space for two or three Campers. I think even one or two big rigs could stay there.
There were some loud trucks passing during the night, but all in all it was quiet.

name: petro mil la gran vía santa rosa
description:
It's a gas station
they park carts and mules
They provide the bathroom and there is a shower
There is a very good restaurant and it is inexpensive, around 13 thousand Colombian pesos

name: Hotel Las Olas Mamonal
description: It's a hotel mainly for truckers that park their rigs on the truck parking next door. It is close to the container/flat-rack port and at the outskirts of the city, which is why we chose it, since we did not want to drive with our truck through Cartagena. The rooms are clean and large, they also have a pool and a cafeteria and a canteen style restaurant on site - rather basic but acceptable for one or two days.
