After some discussion they allowed us to park our truck in the gated car parking in front of the hotel which made packing and getting ready to continue our drive a lot easier.

name: Truck parking
description: It's only a truck parking and simple trucker hostel beside the street, but good place for one night and nice view over the valley. We paid 10.000 COP including the cold but clean showers and toilets. There was some noise in the night but not very much.

name: Servifrenos Mijitayo, brakes and suspensions
description: We had a problem with our brakes when we passed Pasto. We found this workshop in Google and they helped us immediately. They did a very good job and they worked very accurately. Can recommend them for every problem with brakes.

name: Cabaña San José Beach
description:
What a beautiful place to stay - we certainly didn’t expect such a cute little oasis. Only a couple of hundred metres from the beach. Super clean, well presented. We were able to park the campervan in the drive behind the gate. Access to a newly installed kitchen. 
100,000 cop for three people for one night. 
+57 312 8430798

name: Hotel Abril
description:
Hotel with indoor secure parking (entrance is  around 2.7m high and 2,3m wide).

Super nice clean rooms with ceiling fan, warm shower and fast wifi. Coffee in the morning and very close to the center and all the exptreme sports agencies and more.

Paid 80.000COP per night for a double room.

Totally recommend.

name: Airport Parking
description: They allowed us to park our truck (9m long, 4m high) here during our 3-day trip to Medellin. Since they blocked on parking spot to make sure we were able to leave at the time of our return, we had to pay for two parking spots, but that was fine with us. Staff was very helpful and accommodating. The parking across the street did not allow us to enter.

name: Medellin Tours with Diego from SAT Tours
description:
We did a combined Escobar & Comuna 13 tour with Diego and it was great - we had a super interesting day with him and can only recommend to take a tour with him. Diego was a member of the Escobar Cartel, working in the US, so he definitely knows what he is talking about. He is also involved in some community projects in Comuna 13 and it seems everyone there knows him.
His WhatsApp contact is +1-201-708-7354
He offers other activities and tours in and around Medellin as well.

name: Cancha la Profe Nury "Sevilla"
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Overnighting is at the discretion of management, please ask permission before overnighting

It is a sports court located near the church Ntra Sra de la Macarena and the instituto del oriente sede Sevilla. 

In the court there are toilets, showers and wifi (all free).

But you must get permission from the person in charge of the place. 

The recommendation is to wrap up very well because the place is quite cold, especially at night. Otherwise it is fine for camping for one or two nights.

name: Primax Peaje
description:
it's a quite and safe spot. there's water and a store. free. 
--passamos uma noite tranquila e segura, tem água e uma loja. gratuito

name: La Casablanca
description: A family place manage by Juan. It offers variety of accommodation, informal campsite, restaurant and a great swimming pool. The rooms have AC and are very spacious. Only 8’ walk to the “hiking” entrance ( Calabazos) of the Tayrona Park. On the main road, public bus from Santa Marta only 25’ away. Natural walks, quiet finca, in the middle of nature and fantastic and helpful host! We left our motorhome here for 4 days to visit the park. Contact Juan on +573192467919

name: Dr Alfonso practice
description: Had some issue, got recommended  here. Very professional  place. Nice and clean.

name: Lavanderia express service
description: Laundry express service that you could use.

name: Iguaque National Park
description: This is the parking for Iguaque NP. The trail is closed. There are signs posted here. I did see three hikers with dogs walk back. Not sure what to trust.

name: Parking for Mirador Villa de Leyva
description: This is where you park your car if you are hiking the Mirador. Locals told me it was very safe to park tge car here. Tge trail goes behind the shed.

name: Rio Claro (parking and camping)
description:
A great alternative to the national park.  Hugh level parking lots just beside the river for a swim.  we paid 14k COP for parking and could stay overnight for 4 people..  restaurant, shower and washroom just beside the parking.
to get here, drive pass the rafting place on the road.  drive down the driveway.
we had a great swim and played in the rapids.  so much fun. clean water in the river.  perfect temperature.

name: Cul-de-sac Street by park.
description: Please us this location to park instead of the adjacent park location identified on ioverlander. The owner of tge restaurant  recommended it as it is quiet and no passing traffic. It is nice & quiet and secure. Park is adjacent to it.

name: Portal de la Marquesa
description: Lovely and wonderfully equipped place directly at river front, lovely staff, excellent breakfast included. 130k per night for a large double with 2 beds, big bathroom. Only downside there’s no private parking but 1 1/2 blocks away we found a secure parking for 10k per night per moto.

name: Lots Pinchos
description:
Best Chorizo BBQ in the world.  Great stop on the way to Guatape.  They allowed us to sleep in their parking lot (also an option to sleep across the street).
We liked their BBQ sausage so much, we ate here for 2 days in and out of Guatape.  they also have good breakfast and coffee in the morning.

name: Finca hotel Fátima
description:
Monica and Omar welcomed us to their super estate, surrounded by coffee and banana plantations and birds of all kinds.
Possibility of sleeping in a dome or cabaña. 
-------------
Monica et Omar nous ont accueilli dans leur super domaine au milieu des plantations de café et bananes et des oiseaux en tous genres.
Possibilite de dormir dans un dôme ou cabaña. 

Whatapp:+573007744964

name: Turpel Petrol Station
description:
Appears brand new. Clean big showers and toilets. Portable water.
Heaps of room for big rigs.
Attendant was friendly.
Competitively prices diesel.

name: lavanderia
description: nice place to drop off the clothes. They return the same day.

name: auto servicio lavandaria
description: You can do your self laundry here. They charge 20k to use washer and 20k to use dryer.

name: Totoro.cauca
description:
It is a space in the rural area just 20 minutes and 8 kilometers away from the city of Popayán, we offer parking services for RVs, camping, Wi-Fi, cold water shower, kitchen service, campfire area and exercise area. It is a quiet and safe place perfect to rest. We handle parking costs of $20,000 per couple or single person, $40,000 per family. If you want to camp, it costs $15,000 if you bring a tent, $30,000 if you don't bring a tent. Private room rental for $50,000 per night.

Es un espacio en la zona rural a sólo 20 minutos y 8 kilómetros de la ciudad de Popayán, ofrecemos servicios de estacionamiento para vehículos recreativos, camping, wifi, ducha de agua fría, servicio de cocina, área de fogata y área de ejercicios. Es un lugar tranquilo y seguro perfecto para descansar. Manejamos costos de estacionamiento de $20.000 por pareja o persona sola, $40.000 por familia. Si quieres acampar, cuesta $15.000 si traes tienda de campaña, $30.000 si no traes tienda de campaña. Alquiler de habitación privada por $50.000 por noche.

name: Cabañas El mirador Toche Tolima
description: A quiet place although we were the first to arrive at the cabins, but the managers say that they are going to provide a camper service, a recommendation to get to Toche by off-road vehicle. by calling or writing in advance to open the parking doors (57 3167098660)

name: Yetasoul
description:
It is a place on the outskirts of the city of Popayán, it has space for parking campers, camping, wifi, cold water shower, ecological trail, pets are not allowed, energy voltage 110v, daily price for parking $20,000 pesos per couple or single person, $40,000 pesos per family camper.
If you want to camp, the value if you bring the tent is $15,000 pesos, if we provide the campsite with blankets, sheets and mat, the value per couple is $30,000 pesos, we have private room service worth $50,000 pesos per night.
---------
Es un lugar a las fueras de la ciudad de Popayán cuenta con espacio para parking  de campers, camping, wifi ducha agua fría sendero ecológico no se admiten mascotas energía voltaje 110v, precio del día por estacionamiento $20.000 pesos por pareja o persona sola, $40.000 pesos por camper familiar.
Si desean acampar el valor si traen la carpa es de $15.000 pesos, si nosotros prestamos el camping con cobijas sabanas y colchoneta el valor por pareja es de $30.000 pesos, tenemos el servicio de habitación privada por valor de $50.000 pesos la noche.

name: Monserat trailhead
description: This is tge gate where you start the hike to the top of Monserat. It takes one hour to hike up. You have to show your ticket to hike. Buy your ticket at the Taquilla.

name: Semillas de Agua
description: This private nature reserve has level field for small and mid size rigs. You can visit the amazing Highlands that they protect, from the visitors center. Contact Brenda before arriving ‪+57 316 3063550‬. 15k per person per night with bathroom access. Kitchen use and food extra.

name: Parking lot
description:
We spent a beautiful weekend in front of the lake without any inconvenience. Gerardo, who manages horseback riding and the parking lot, allowed us to stay here as long as we needed and also provided us with electricity since we had to work with our network content.
the place is very quiet and crowded on weekends. we were able to sell our handicrafts at the entrance to the park, on the other side of where we slept.
highly recommended!
a neighbor who sells strawberries and cream provided us with water. the people are very friendly!
----------------
Pasamos un hermoso fin de semana frente al lago son ningún inconveniente. Gerardo, quien administra paseos a caballos y el estacionamiento, nos permitió quedarnos aquí el tiempo que necesitemos y además nos proveyó de electricidad ya que debíamos trabajar con nuestro contenido de las redes.
el lugar es muy tranquilo y los fines de semana de llena de gente. pudimos vender nuestras artesanías en la entrada al parque, al otro lado de donde dormimos.
súper recomendable!
una vecina que vende fresas con crema nos facilitó agua. la gente es muy amable!

name: Terpel Gas Station
description:
We asked at the police station where we can stay for tonight.
They guided us to a Parking lot behind a gas station .
We paid 10000.
No service.
Some restaurants around.

name: Playa El Totumo
description: I’ve spent a night here and it is a very calm and safe place. You can park on the beach with a beautiful view.

name: Hotel Hiervabuena
description:
Translation: Hotel located in a central area of ​​the city of Pasto where there are facilities close at hand.

Hotel ubicado en una zona central de la ciudad de pasto donde hay facilidades cerca a la mano.

name: culture Center of El Retiro
description:
Close to the center we found this place with parking lots (is dificult found where parking) is quiet and have free bathrooms. We spent two nights here.
Cerca del centro encontramos este espacio con espacios para estacionar (es difícil encontrar donde hacerlo cerca del centro). Es un lugar tranquilo y seguro. Hay baños en la plaza donde se encuentran varios salones dedicados a la cultura. Pasamos dos noches aquí y todo estuvo bien.

name: MINIfinca La Comarca
description: Is a house that have a backyard. This place is a Litle farm that have a Green área especially for camping.

name: Sonson center
description: We stay one week in this place. Is a nice place to stay, the people in town is very friendly.

name: Estacionamento e Ducha
description:
There is a hostal in this car park, and they also sell only the hot shower for 4,000 Colombian pesos per person. very clean place.


Nesse estacionamento existe um hostal, e eles também vendem somente a ducha quente por 4mil pesos colombianos por pessoa. lugar muito limpo.

name: refill gas carrera 64
description:
Refill gas here, very nice and fast (10 min)
argentina bottle 10 kgs (20 livras for them) 60.000 pesos.

name: Mirador Piedra Capira
description: This is the turn of Mirador. If you are coming from Guadas, here you make left turn. Mirador is 2 km from this point. You can easily miss it.

name: Mirador Piedra crossing
description: At this junction, please go straight rather than making a rt turn. There is a sign on the wall here.

name: Miradoe piedra Capira parking lot
description:
This is where you will park the car to hike to tge Mirador. It is 10 min uphill hike from here. 
I did not see tge sign and headed downhill here. Do not make tgat mistake. Beautiful  views of Magdalena River valley.

name: Para flying - Parapente
description:
Here you can do the para sailing. The 15 min. flying time is 195K pesos. They have various options available. 
Instead of going to Mirador I would come here even if you are not flying. They have a restaurant and great views.

name: Parqueadero Marbella
description:
There is a parking, restaurant, laundry, soccer zone, car wash and more. It's small but is ok, and so nice staff. Change us 20000 by day and we get energy in barber shop with Fernando.

É um local pequeno, com estacionamento, restaurante, lavanderia, quadra de futebol, lava car. O pessoal foi muito querido, nos cobraram 20 mil por dia e conseguimos energia pra recarregar a bateria na barbearia com o Fernando.

name: Mirador La Pena
description: Great place to spend the sunset. Great views of Honda. They were closed when I visited but the neighbors  told me I can walk and see the sunset views.

name: Between the church and the playground
description: There is a park with a covered area for one tent and two bikes, no more between the church and the football covered playground. Militaries told us that we could put the tent here and that we can even use the toilets of the playground but it was closed. Still, there is some water, WiFi and plenty of places to put more tents if you don't mind not being covered.

name: Hotel el Amigo
description:
Very basic hotel. Fans in rooms. Looks tired and is very basic but it was pretty cheap. Lots of restaurants in town. Shower cold and just out of a pipe. Unsure on parking as we arrived on bicycles. Bikes just about fit in room or can be put on balcony.  30,000 for a single room or 40,000 for a double as of 12th June 2024 
Took 2 single rooms as they do not have 2 bed rooms

name: AudioLine
description:
Very nice and professional team. We had our cell air conditioning (Autoclima) repaired and put UV films on the windows of the truck. Boss and team efficient and friendly. 
They have real expertise in audio and video for vehicles as well 
We highly recommend!

name: Secure Parqueadero
description: Large dirt parking lot used mostly by trucks. Good for a night. Security is here 24/7. We paid 5000

name: Magdalena River Boat tours
description: You can take the boat tours here. The small lynch 45 min. tour is $15-20K. All narration is in Spanish. You can park the car at the boat launch.

name: Cueva del Oro - beautiful cave (only with guide)
description:
We visited 3 spots near el Peñon, Cueva del Oro impressed us the most. Our guide Sleyder was excellent, knowledgeable and very patient (leaving us time to take as many pictures as we wanted).
His contact data: Sleyder +57 312 5337194

Note: the coordinates of the spot are approximative.

name: Nice Cave, La Tronera
description:
We visited 3 spots near el Peñon, Cueva La Tronera was also very nice although we preferred Cueva del Oro. Our guide Sleyder was excellent, knowledgeable and very patient (leaving us time to take as many pictures as we wanted). He even took us a bit further to the underground river.
His contact data: Sleyder +57 312 5337194

Note: the coordinates of the spot are approximative.

name: Hotel Dubai
description: Secure parking for small vehicles and motorcycles. I stopped here on my way to Santa Marta from Bucaramanga. Good half way rest point.

name: Modou panaderia
description: Are selling very nice sourdough breads, croissant, cannelé, … possibility to eat and drink on their terrasse. Recommended :-) . Opened from 9:30am to 5:00pm

name: Dulces Suenos n2
description: Nice little hotel. Owner very friendly woman. We sent a message via WhatsApp earlier in the day and she responded quickly. Asked for a 2 bed and was quoted 50,000. When we arrived she said 60,000 but then let us have it for 50,000. Decent room, can fit bikes in. Shower with warm water. Fan in room. Comfy bed. Pretty nice little place for the price. Right in the town close to panaderia, D1 supermarket and restaurants.

name: Multitienda for SOAT, fotocopias, payments…
description:
We found this place on recomendation after all other offices in the area weren’t open on Satudays. 
For the SOAT the guy works together with an office in Impeales. No long queing. He charged us 265000 for 1 month for a Jeep. We could pay in cash, Dollars might be all right. It took us about 1 hour there, because it was a bit complicated with our foreign car. We had to wait an hour until we got the confirmation by SMS with a link. Then we  returned to the shop for the printout with a stamp at the back. 
Opening hours: 
Monday to Saturday 7-7, if I understood their Spanish correctly

name: La Casa del Profe
description:
Parking Space at a very nice Hostel, very calm & quiet, very friendly owner, good place in Palomino. 40mil (10€) for 2 Persons & Van. Cold and very clean showers & toilets. Rooms available. 
High restriction about 3m.

name: NO MOTORCYCLES ALLOWED
description: Attention: No access for motorcycles. There’s 1 traffic sign which we ignored and we were stopped by police after the “Peaje” Station, which would have been the last chance to turn around safely. Policemen were friendly but firm and obviously were looking for some pocket money. We could talk our way out of it and were reminded that in Barranquilla there are some stricter traffic restrictions for motos in effect. To cross the Magdalena river you should use Calle 17 and then turn left onto Carrera 9 instead. Take care.

name: Freno Motos
description: Motorcycle brake specialist.  I've been having some trouble with my brakes, one side wearing unevenly.  Found this place on goodle with tons of good reviews.  When I arrived they were working on an Africa Twin and they have tons of BMW parts on display so seems they know big biges and small.  Paid 68k for a full maintenance of my rear brakes and changing fluid.  Really professional and they have parts for all bikes as well.

name: Chez Kimberley
description: Nice flat place on grass. It’s a restaurant and you can stay here. Kimberly is very friendly woman. She doesn’t ask you money but better to order something. Could be noisy during the day because of road. Near Raquira and on the way to go Villa de Leiva. Also possible to sleep with tent. No high or length restrictions. Be careful Saturday she organize some BBQ and dance. So you can dance or go another quiet place.

name: Laundary Service
description: Laundery Service just around the corner of Makoka Boutique Hostel. With in one day. 10.000 Cop per Kilo

name: MotorCar pintu express
description:
paint and body shop. john fredy is very competent, he repaired the rear part of our chassis for only 100000cop.

he was able to do it in the day and quite quickly

In addition it is very nice and we could fill up with water

name: bakery astral - taller de pan artesanal
description: i didn't see the other french bakery before but i found this one with baguette and intégral bread,

name: Hotel los corales
description:
Not a bad hotel. Rooms were fine. Clean. Spaces to store bikes in hotel. Secure, manned desk and they lock the door in the evenings. Paid £11 or $14usd or 58,000cop at the time of writing june 2024 for a twin room which had 2 double beds. Triple room is also available. Found it on booking.com so it’s easy to see current prices and book. 
Don’t recall seeing a card machine so think it is cash payment. 
Showers were cold unfortunately. Good, powerful fan. Free wifi. In lobby there is a water dispenser that does hot water too. Instant coffee and cups there too for you to use. Overall pretty decent place for the money. Would recommend

name: John Doe Motorsports
description: Big motorcycle and accessory dealer.  I just happened to drive by and saw a sign for "everything you need for your motorcycle trip".  It's a triumph dealership and sell good quality jackets gloves pants and all that stuff.  Tons of bikers hanging out at the cafe on a Sunday afternoon.  Cool stop if your passing by.

name: Backyard of Hospedaje Villa de Sol
description:
Señora Rosa offers camping in the yard of her place. It’s a big flat area with a big gate. Therefore accessible for all kind of rigs. The amenities are relatively basic, just a toilet and a hot shower (seems to be the one of her home, too).  The site is 200 meters up the road from the archeological site Tierradentro on the left. 
We paid COP 10.000 per person per night. Not sure if and how much she charges for kids. 

There is free Wifi from the community.

name: Notario por overland rig
description: Here is the notary for stamp your documents from the agent for importing you car

name: Soldadura Aluminium
description: The only place in Santa Marta to weld aluminum.

name: HOTEL RÁQUIRA SILVESTRE
description:
Good signal from all cell phone operators, no parking restriction for larger vehicles.

Buena señal de todos los operadores de telefonía celular, sin restricción de estacionamiento para vehículos más grandes.

name: Cocina De Dalila
description: Incredible Colombian restaurant service typical Colombian foods. Very fresh and very tasty.

name: EcoHotel Los Mikos
description: Beautiful and peaceful EcoHotel on the La Meil River in a protected nature reserve. Accessible by boat from Norcasia Caldas, Colombia

name: coliseo de Ubaté / Ubate's Coliseum
description: We arrived at Ubaté and asked first at the fire station but they said we couldn't spend the night there. then we went to the sports center and talked with Alejandro, the boss, he was pretty interested in our trip and after a few questions, he authorized us to go to the coliseum, there they allowed us to stay in a room on the second floor. you just need to ask nicely. no kitchen nor restaurants inside but some nearby. there are bathrooms but water supply is intermittent.

name: Parcelación la Aldea
description: This place is private, it has a pleasant view, it coordinates with the owner to park there and spend the nights that are needed, the best cell phone signal is that of the company Tigo. There is Wi-Fi which you must ask the owner for permission to connect. In the area you can go on walks, buy vegetables from farmers and eggs as well. Quiet area to rest. 11 minutes from the municipality of Carmen de Viboral, 15 minutes from the municipality of La Ceja, 12 minutes from the municipality of Rio Negro. The owners are very friendly. It has a security camera, main door and enclosure.

name: Coffee Hacienda - Hacienda Boutique Santa Rosa
description:
Amazing amazing. Authentic coffee hacienda experience in a stunning location. Highly recommend as a stop on the drive from Medellín to Salento. Guests are treated like royalty by the lovely hosts. They will make dinner for you if you ask, the coffe tour is hours long, personal, and includes picking, tasting, lunch etc.

- ~70 USD for double room for the night (Booking.com with discount)
- ~35 USD pp for a tour with lunch, coffee tasting, and several hour experience
- Dinner 18 USD pp

name: Cabana, Cyclists only
description: Covered cabana in between a nice families house and their shop where they sell jugo de Cana. 10-15k pesos to spend the night. Food available for 5-10k pesos. Just ask the family.

name: Finca Santa Marta
description:
A quiet place to camp and enjoy a pleasant game of shuffleboard, the national sport.  Doña Marta can prepare breakfast or lunch to order and also arepas.
--
Un tranquilo lugar para acampar y disfrutar de una agradable partida de tejo, el deporte nacional. Doña Marta te puede preparar el desayuno o el almuerzo por encargo y también arepas.

name: Indigo
description:
good food, spacious place with a lot of plants and the possibility to paint or draw, also for families a very good opportunity. also good veggie or vegan options

they also run a hotel here, but we can't comment it as we didn't stay here

name: Cafe de Muro
description: Very nice and quite place to have wonderful cake and coffee. Its behind the wall. Have a look inside, very nice interior. It opens 3 p.m

name: Dentist and other  medical specialists
description:
We had a dential problem and my sister in low recomended Dr. Oscar. He has great equipement, outstanding  manual dexterity and resonable prices.  He speaks some English, too. 
Highly recomended. For details see picture.

name: Bicicletas garces
description: Very comprehensive bike shop selling lots of modern parts a tourer might need. Much better than the local type places that stock parts from 40 years ago. Very helpful. Rims in stock and pads for brakes you may have

name: Alex Parrilla
description:
Alex Parrilla 
This is the place to park! Alex is so nice and the multiple restaurants give you dining options. We paid $30.000. Price is $20.000-$30.000 depending on size of vehicle. Google Maps will bring you here if you search for Alex Parrilla Restaurant. 
There are bathrooms when the restaurants are open. $1000
It was quiet by 10pm, not much traffic on the road until around 7:30am. Perfect place to walk to El Penol, and you can take a TukTuk to the Guatape Zocolo. Stay multiple days is ok too. 
Alex owns the property and there will be a hotel soon and grocery store.
Down by the lake is where you can take a private or group boat tour of the lake.

name: Eco Finca Salento
description: Nice hostel/campground in town, we paid $25k per person per night to use bathroom and shower. Nice bathrooms, warm water with electric shower. They also have shared kitchen but that will be $35k per person per night.

name: Los Containers
description: Great place to have a family lunch or dinner with stands offering different dishes: pizza, hamburger, grills, etc... The restaurant is a large outdoor room covered by a thatched roof. Many animals for children: pony, rabbits, goat. A huge pool in repair when we were there.very friendly staff. Fast service

name: Selvatika Cabana
description:
Beautiful  Cabanas in natural setting with pool & accommodations. The Cabana rents for $160,000 pesos a night of weekday and 180K on the weekend. It includes pool, food & drinks. 
If you just need to use swimming  pool it is 30k for the day. 
Beautiful  place, really popular  with locals.

name: Alto de la virgen Mirador
description: Great views of concepcion  from this Mirador. 15 min. hike to the top.Must visit if in concepcion

name: Cascada Matasano
description:
A beautiful  Cascada. Just a 5 min. hike to Cascada from the roadside. Just park on the road, it is quite safe. 
When coming from Concepción take a right on the main road. Stay right all the way to this point.

name: Darle la vuelta: Parque principal Pamplona
description:
Quiet town, we slept in front of the town hall in the main square. We had to level our van because it is inclined, but it sleeps well. There is free wifi and water nearby. The people are friendly and it is very safe.

Pueblo tranquilo, dormimos frente a la alcadia en la plaza principal. Tuvimos que nivelar nuestra van porque esta inclinado, pero se duerme bien. Hay wifi libre y agua cerca. La gente es amable y es muy seguro.

name: Terpel Gas Station next to the road
description: On the Road Side, 5k pesos to sleep in the parking lot. Pay inside the restaurant. Trucks coming in and out during the night. Safe. Not the best but not the worst either. Probably best to stay at the place with the view place a few km close to Popayan which is free, quiet and beautiful.

name: Hostal Don Gabo
description: A new hostal and a restaurant run by a super friendly local family, located just next to Bahía Hondita. You can sleep in hamacas (around 20/25.000 cop p.p.) or set your tent (20.000 for a two person tent). You can also walk from here to playa Punta Agujas (the boys will show you the way), they said they could even organize a transport but we didn't use. The fish we ate here was delicious. Whatsapp: (+57)3218454732

name: Hostal Casa Torres
description:
We slept in this hostel for 10 nights while we waited for our camper/container to arrive.
Very cheap but still clean and well equipped, breakfast is included in the price.
Very good located, ideal for exploring the city.
34‘000 COP per Person

No parking facilities.
Good cellphone reception.

name: Parqueadero Climax
description:
Ficamos 4 noites neste estacionameto para caminhões, tivemos que aguardar o final de semana e uma segunda-feira de feriado até o SENAIT na Venezuela estar aberto para documentação da kombi.  Super seguro, por ser fim de semana um pouco de barulho até mais tarde. Tem tomada mas só utilizamos para carregar o celular, tem agua e wifi. 10.000 COL por noite. Tem quartos com ar-condicionado mas não perguntamos o valor.

We stayed 4 nights in this truck parking lot, we had to wait for the weekend and a holiday Monday until SENAIT in Venezuela was open for the kombi's documentation.  Super safe, as it's a weekend a little noisy until later. There is energy but we only use it to charge our cell phones, there is water and wifi. 10.000 COL per night. There are rooms with air conditioning but we didn't ask how much.

name: Terribly steep paved street.
description: This is a paved street that gets to 20+ degrees steep. Its very narrow with tight steep switchbacks and oncoming traffic. It required 4WD to get up as our rear wheels would just spin. Another route is advised.

name: Sol de Minca
description:
Hotel and Hostel near Minca.

A very quiet place with incredible views of Santa Marta, surrounded by nature, very friendly staff, a good option to stay near Minca and enjoy nature.

------------------------------------------------------------------

Hotel y Hostal cerca a Minca.

Un lugar muy tranquilo con vistas increíbles a Santa Marta, rodeado de naturaleza, el staff muy amable, una buena opción para quedarse en cerca a Minca y disfrutar de la naturaleza.

name: Charco El Aguacate
description: This is tge entrance to the Charco. It opens from 9 am to 6 pm. The fee is $5

name: Cascada Escalera Trailhead.
description:
You park your car here and hike to tge Cascada. It is safe to park the car.  
Cascadas are 10-15 min uphill hike from here

name: Cascada Escalera
description: This is where the beautiful  Cascadas are.

name: Montana Llantas
description: Had a new tire burst by rock on major highway. The tire was too gone. Found a used spare for 50k pesos. Guy is really good.

name: Beto tiki tiki - chivas bus paint
description: Beto is your man if you want your car painted like a chiva bus. It will take him 2 weeks to paint my 4runner. I will post before and after photos.

name: Coffee Tour Luger
description:
There are multiple fincas that provide coffee tours in this area. 
We did a roughly 2 hrs tour covering the whole process
Harvesting - Peeling - Washing - Drying - Grinding - Brewing
We learned a lot about the different steps and what is important to conserve the quality of the beans. 
We can highly recommend this tour. 
Price is COP 45,000 pp. You can pay by credit card but then they’ll add a 5% extra charge.

However, be aware that the road leading there is very narrow and bumpy and currently (06/2024) is closed from/to Salento - you need to take a detour. There are collectivos running between Salento and the fincas regularly. Better take one of these.

name: VW KOMBI MECHANICS - VIBE DE DOIS
description:
A great Kombi mechanic in Cartagena. Marlon is a fair person.

Um otimo mecanico de Kombi em Cartagena. Marlon é uma pessoa justa.

name: Lavan Lavanderia
description:
24h service. Nice young ladies. 
COP 2.800 per libra.

name: Jose López Sombrero
description: Jorge makes and gives tour of the hat making process. His hat are half the price you will find at the shop. A really nice guy

name: Talbot Land Rover
description:
Land Eover specialized mecanic. 

We had our bearrings and brakediscs changed. We also noticed a broken bake line and they immediatly organised a new one. 

Fair prices aswell.

Totally recommend.

name: Cold fresh water / centro de medicine ancestral
description:
Cold, fresh, water on the side of the road. Tap. 

Parking for many rigs. On the site of the centro de medicine natural ancestral

name: Restaurante y Hospedaje DIAL
description:
Basic rooms. Totally fine. Wifi, cold shower. Bike in room. 30,000 per person per room. Don’t think they had twin rooms so we got separate rooms. Not sure price to share the double bed. Cheap. Tried to go to the one at Terpel up the road. Attendant said you needed a reservation but didn’t explain how to get one and that it was full (was nobody there) so we had to cycle back here. Go to this one. 
Not sure on food but think they sell some snacks in the office like crisps and drinks

name: Taller Mecanico Los Pibes
description: A mechanic for travelers from Argentina and Chile, for travelers. They know our needs and have great knowledge to solve any problem with our motorhomes, of any size and any brand.

name: Fotocopias Don Hector
description:
If you need to have anything copied or printed for DIAN  This shop can do it for you. You can email or WhatsApp him information. Contact information  photo attached. 
just a block from centeo

name: LUCIA Caney Restaurante
description: BEST ITALIAN FOOD HERE! We‘ve been traveling for 1 year now and we were blown away by this cuisine. Loved the vibes and the (fresh hand made) pasta has a good price. Can recommend this 100%!

name: Parking, can fit tall rigs
description:
10,000 COP per night. Very lovely lady and her family running. My rig is 2.25m tall / roughly 7 feet 4 inches and the roof is maybe 4-5 feet taller than my rig

Located one block from the river where it’s pedestrian walking only 

Easy access open all day and night. Space for 32 vehicles.

name: Nomada Café Parking.
description: Parqueadero cerrado con cafeteria, baños y wifi. Alejandra y Christian, los jovenes anfitriones, son muy amables y conocen las mejores rutas de mountain bike en Villa de Leyva y alrededores. Son expertos en la preparacion de una buena tasa de café colombiano y lo acompañan con deliciosas empanadas. Nos quedamos 2 semanas en este comodo lugar. ubicado a solo 2 cuadras de la plaza principal del pueblo. Muy recomendado !!!

name: La mina alojamiento rural
description:
It's a great place. You can enjoy a very quiet campsite.  Set up your campsite with a mountain view.  Its owners are very friendly and will guide you on the hikes.

Also you have restaurant in the place. It's very cheap.

You can make a bonfire

Contact: Call and WhatsApp 

+57 3115014507
+57 3107657897

name: Brisas del mar
description: Playa punta astilleros contactar con José al celular 3135036425. Amplio parqueo pero espacio para motorhome pequeño y camping.

name: Previous Seguro (SOAT insurance)
description:
This is the insurance office where you get the SOAT insurance. It is at Mezzanine level. If you stand in front of DIAN office you can see their office sign. 
You will need valid SOAT to get your TIP extended. So get your SOAT extended. For 3 months  extension I paid $464,400 pesos. 
They need to see copy of car title, registeration, passport, driver license, DIAN paper and visa extension paper. They accept cash & credit card.

name: Hotel Naisca 47
description: Great value hotel, clean, hot water with high pressure, pet friendly! We paid $60k for two per night + dog. Parking is limited and only for small cars or motorcycles, but you can park in front of the hotel on the street, the neighborhood feels safe, it’s right across from a big police station.

name: Doña Rosa Campestre
description:
As it was getting dark and we could not make it all the qay to medellin we stopped here at the restaurant.

we asked the lady if we can stay here in our car for the night and would eat here of course. 
waitress asked the boss who said immediately that this is totally fine.

we had a good dinner...kids enjoyed the play/climbing house a lot and at night we even jumped into the pool which was really nice and cozy!

so... all perfect and sometimes it is nice to just ask yourself at some place and not only check Ioverlander... that is part of the game!

name: Alegria
description: Spectacular space to park any type of motorhome or caraban with a private beach.  Ask for Orlando Espinosa who is very kind.  With his family they prepare the best Caribbean meals.  We went for a day and stayed for a week.  Widely recommended.

name: Primax Petrol Station
description:
Asked for portable water without filling up the petrol. They pointed to one and we filled up water for free.

Looks like an 1-inch socket.

Water is clean.

name: Morros City
description:
Excellent apartment complex to wait for your vehicle to be shipped in. Right at the beach (good swimming), view from the balcony (each apartment has one) to the sea. You can see the big container ships pass by in far distance.

Apartments have a kitchen, living room and bed room. Outdoor pool and good gym in the house and free of charge. Very western (American) and like a 5 star hotel.

Good to pack your vehicle after picking it up as you can park it right in front of the lobby. Guarded 24/7 and felt very safe as only apartment holders can get in. You can fill up the water at the parking, not sure about electricity.
Big rigs might have a problem due to length (height is not an issue at all). Parking is free of your stay there.

Good WiFi in both apartments we stayed in for remote working. Good claro signal as well. Free WiFi at pool/gym.

10 Mins drive into old town. But a lot of restaurants and shops around but less annoying people trying to sell you something.

For more pictures use the Google Maps link or search for "Morros City". To book look on the map on Airbnb or Booking. In June plenty apartments were available and it was easy to extend day by day when waiting. Once we had to move to another apartment on another floor.

name: parqueadero
description: They kindly allowed us to park and sleep for $10,000 for 24 hours.  It is a closed, safe and quiet place

name: Posto Terpel
description: Posto de Gasolina com amplo estacionamento para caminhões, conversamos com a frentista e ela disse que poderíamos pernoitar sem problemas. Possui água, e banheiros. Tem um hotel que vendem duchas quentes por 10mil pesos colombianos. E no restaurante tem wifi e mesas. Comida boa e preço um pouco mais alto que em outros lugares que fomos.

name: Wild Camping - Vereda Piedras, La Ceja
description: Wild Camping near the Piedras river in La Ceja, Antioquía. There are a bunch of spots where you can park your rig and have a wonderful stay.
